Comments: Easy class. Some of the assignments were pretty easy because I do them already (such as creating a newsletter), and some of the assignments were new and I learned a lot.  Whenever I had a question about an assignment or asked him to look it over before I turned it in, he did it no problem and pretty quickly.

This professer makes too many excuses for curriculm accountability. He is old school and teaches 2003-2004 activities. Dr. Abate doesn't even present to his own student teachers the current APA standards. You will get nothing but excuses from this professor. The curriculum is not worth paying for, because it is extremely out of date.
He is a real person.  Ask him about surfing and you will learn some good stuff.  Very good knowledge about teaching with technology.
No Comments
Dr. Abate is one of the few profs who knew my name when I was at CSU.  He was always very knowledgeable and helpful.
one of the best professors i've ever had. knows technology AND education - a rare combination

This class was not bad at all! I dont know what all these negative reviews are about. He is a theater critic after all so any feedback he gives is to make you a better writer on the material. His class is not bad at all! Do not let the reviews scare you.

I agree with the other raters. The quizzes are easy but his grading of papers made no sense. When I fixed one thing he complained about, he would then complain about something else. I have no problem being intellectually challenged but I felt that there was no consistency in his grading. It feels like he wants to find something wrong in your essay.

This class was not bad at all! I dont know what all these negative reviews are about. He is a theater critic after all so any feedback he gives is to make you a better writer on the material. His class is not bad at all! Do not let the reviews scare you.
Not the best

Robert wants 750 word papers, but what he's expecting of you goes far beyond 750 words. Contacting him for feedback is an overwhelmingly negative experience with little actual feedback. Skip his classes if you can, not worth the hassle.

It is clear this guy does not want his students to succeed. No matter what, he will never feel satisfied with your work. Good luck, because I know this class is required for many communications students.

The most defeating and least caring professor I have ever experienced. Coming from a straight A student, who is a communication major I can say I hated this class. I reached out to him so many times for feedback and it's terrible and all he does is puts you down while grading. Honestly, worst professor I had in college.

Horrible professor. The only reason I took his class because he was the only one teaching it and I needed it. He is never satisfied with the work you give in. He wants you to write like him. I rewrote my papers before submitting and attempted to write what I thought would be acceptable. He kept giving me a low score and harsh feedback.

Almost dropped Abelmans class at the beginning of the semester bc of all the negative ratings, but I'm so glad I didn't. He gives you a writing assignment and quiz, due at the end of two, sometimes three weeks. Writing is a 750 word minimum based off your critique of a movie, play, etc. Quizzes based off of his online lectures. Try, you'll pass.

Felt like he graded very harshly and expected A LOT from his students. I managed to get decent grades on papers. However, I believe I got less than what I deserved. With that being said, he has no office hours and will only help you through email. For a class of this difficulty, it would make sense to get in person guidance.

Dr. Abelman is a very tough grader. Sometimes can get a little too critical in his responses (I've been called lazy and careless plenty of time). He knows his stuff though. One of few CSU profs to actually work as a journalist, so take advantage of that.

He was one of the worst professors I ever had, he was rude and argumentative. He does not care for others opinions or suggestions. His tests were almost impossible and they were very specific. He made attendance mandatory and if you missed a day it felt like you missed two weeks. And tons of READING, it was miserable.

Abelman test seem like they are set up for you to fail. The study guide is very unclear and he does not go into detail about specific material you need to know. Also he includes many things that were not discussed in lecture so make sure you READ,READ,READ. Can be quite rude at times, unavailable and opinionated.

Didn't answer questions whenever I asked or made me too confused. Expected too much from students with such little time. He was funny here and there but I didnt enjoy his teaching style. Kinda a hypocrite

He's extremely picky on papers and is a tough grader. Don't take this if you're looking for an easy WAC class. It's not easy. You have to read the book thoroughly in order to have a chance on the tests.

His classes were very fun because he kept them upbeat and somewhat humorous, but he was really unclear with his tests. Usually the quizzes and tests had nothing to do with the material covered in class/reading. The papers were short and graded easily.

This was one of the more frustrating classes I've been in. The tests were not over the covered material in the class and were usually random footnotes in the book. The papers were unclear in direction and didn't help make up for the faulty test set up. Most of the lectures are full of tangents and remain unclear. Difficult course and professor.

Abelman is a great professor. If you expect a high school level class, or fail to keep an open mind, you may do poorly. He is a tough grader because unlike some other professors, he pushes his students to be their best. I learned more struggling through his classes than i have in any other course. He is very helpful & wants his students to succeed.

Get as far as you can!!! There is no study guide. He does not give clear answers. Hard grader and you have to attend plays outside of class. If your not one of his favorites drop this class ASAP! This class was a waste of time and money!
Great professor...stop whining about him being a tough grader. Do the necessary work and you'll succeed in his class. Great guy.
He was challenging yet very interesting. He was a tough grader but that's life. The one BIG issue I had was he cannot keep his political beliefs out of a nonpolitical class.
Test are extremely hard, and lectures are not clear. Hardest professor I have ever had.

My first impression of this teacher was terrible. He humiliated a student for walking into the wrong classroom while the entire class laughed. Ive never had a professor who is so self absorbed. He doesn't have a rubric for class projects, a prompt for projects, no study guides, and the book doesn't help. His expectations are so ambitious. WORST GUY
very enthusiastic teacher

Professor does not explain assignments well. The class text book is useless when taking the class. He is not a good teacher and very self-absorbed. Several students dropped this class before mid-terms due to teach style.
Just not a very good instructor. Very self absorbed. The required text book is one written by himself which is a poorly written book.

Honestly I was terrified taking this course with him because I have heard so many bad things. But he turned out to be a very nice and approachable professor. He's a very tough professor but if you put the time in it will definitely work in your favor. Really read the material and really be a critical thinker in his class.

He is a good teacher. He will give quizes often and both his quizes and tests are questions that are out of your notes and in the textbook. Some of the questions are very detailed so it is important to read your book. He sometimes tries to trick you with questions by wording them differnetly. When writing a paper or doing a project he is a very ver
This guy needs to be replicated and hired at every college. His knowledge is unbounding in the subject matter.
This guy needs to be replicated and hired at every college. His knowledge is unbounding in the subject matter.

Honestly, the material was really difficult in this class but the professor didn't make it much easier to learn. Clear grading criteria but pretty much your grade comes down to the final. Went into the Final with an A and finished with a B. Midterm and Final are very difficult and NO other grade boosters. Entire class failed the quizzes. Meh!

I recommend taking his differential Equations class only if you have taken differential equations before and want to get it over with. He only has two grades in the class. Midterm(the total of two tests throughout the semester)(60%) and the final (40%). Do not take the class if you are a lazy student, for you will not learn during the lectures

If you show up for every class and have a good understanding of the material you can pass this class. Best professor of this subject at CSU in my opinion. The only grades in this class are exams but he curves and gave a chance to redeem points missed on the exam.
A good lecturer who definitely understands the material inside and out. Kind of arrogant in his attitude/teaching style. If you really want to learn the material in the class he will teach it well.

If you really want to enter in the world of networking, than this is the best professor who can introduce you to this field. His lectures were very interesting. You have to think logically in exams. He is tough grader and cool guy.
Very knowledgeable professor. He should teach more and more graduate level courses so that he can share most of us will be benefited. He is having his own curve. so don't worry about grades.
Best Prof in Washkewicz College
He's very helpful and has  a huge curve to help

He is a gifted teacher who really knows the material well. If you pay attention in class and participate you will do fine. It is a difficult subject, but he make it clear, so, show up to class. The class is some work. Take this guy if you really want to learn it. He does have a curve.
Excellent teacher! Test are challenging, but are graded very fair. Is always willing to help a student and explains everything in great detail.

Professor is great he helps you if you need it in class or in office, heck even on saturdays he has met with me. Very fair on grading but very challenging tests. If you work for your grade there is no reason a high B or A is not in store.
Good professor. Very laid back. Examples in class were very similar to the test. Tests were open book open notes. If you went to class everyday and wrote down the example problems you got an A.

Funny guy, tests open book and open note. Doesn't connect with students but as above thats not a bad thing. He gives help when you need it, may give a problem not covered in notes or class. Not a bad teacher though

Easy A if you take the time to participate in discussion boards. Two quizzes and disc. board each week, midterm, final, and 2000 word paper. Very doable A if you dont procrastinate. Super responsive to emails. Easy class.

Easy A if you take the time to participate in discussion boards. Two quizzes and disc. board each week, midterm, final, and 2000 word paper. Very doable A if you dont procrastinate. Super responsive to emails. Easy class.

Her class was so easy. We only had a discussion board post each week and responded to two students. The exam wasn't too difficult and neither was the paper. There was no lectures or anything, just assignments. She barely even communicated with us. It is an easy A class.

Sarah is an excellent professor. She is very caring and understanding. The assignments help ensure a successful transition into college. She can be easily reached outside of class and responds quickly. This is a pass/ fail class that doesn't count towards your GPA.

He is one of the best.  Heavy on lectures, but his lectures are interesting and he lets the students "take over" the lectures via discussions.  He chose to use all novels and historical articles for this class... no textbooks.  There was a lot of work but I genuinely enjoyed the work.  For the final I got to watch and write about Ferris Bueller!

Prof. Adams is a great instructor. He gives lively lectures and is interested and informed on the subject matter. It is important that you attend every class because Adams gives a lot of notes and the mid-term and final are based on his lectures.

He is very passionate about history, and has a wide array of entertaining stories that helps keep the otherwise boring class slightly interesting. Grading is pretty hard, this class is definitely no easy A. If I could do  it over again, I probably would not have taken this class

Great professor! Very well prepared, makes class interesting. Tells stories that go along with his topics. In class mid-term wasn't too bad, final will be take-home exam. Too many papers for my liking, especially since it isn't a WAC course, but they aren't too hard to do. Generally a very good teacher, definitely passionate about the topic.
Great with choice of textbooks

Professor Adams is interesting and sometimes funny and very knowledgeable about the topic. However, he gives A LOT of pop quizzes which are EXTREMELY detail oriented. Interesting material in class and in reading. Gives you the opportunity for extra credit. Not very approachable, but is very open & lenient with essay topics. Not a bad class.
Outstanding! best history prof I have had so far in my college education. makes the material come alive. overall great guy. If your interested in history take his class.

I took History of the American West with prof Adams.  He is one of the very best Profs I have ever had.  In fact, he inspired me to become a teacher myself.  His book is also worth reading (Education for Extinction)
Preofessor Adams was defenitally one of my favorite professors of all!  He was passionate about the content of the History of the USA West class I took, and defenitally inspired great learning.

Dr. Adams is an inspiration.  He has taught every doctoral student at CSU ans is truly a wealth of knowledge.  He expects you to be able to write.....this is definitely a fair expectation of graduate students.  Take his class...he is awesome.
No Comments
Wealth of knowledge, difficult grader if you are not a very good writer
Terrfic educational historian!

I really enjoyed his class.  He made the law very interesting.  He didn't do a hood job of setting up blackboard support for the class and as a result during the first three weeks of class it was a distraction because people couldn't get the right passwords from him to take the required quizzes that were due prior to each class.
Great guy, you will enjoy his experience and subject knowledge. Read your text. Test are essays.

He is ridiculous...gave out 1 "A" in the whole class. And was a jerk about giving me a "B". I attended every class and handed in all the homework. It doesn't matter. He weights the grades- so the test is the only thing that really matters. Avoid him if at all possible.
His tests are all written...which is kind of contrary to the purpose of the class.
He is just trying to be funny...and the Microsoft suites is easy, i dont think business students HAVE to take it.
Actually, one of the most average professors I've ever had.  Not too good, not too bad.

Lectures: he reads the book aloud and adds anecdotes.  Attendance Mandatory. Tests: short-answer essay format, straight from lecture.  Read the chapter before class (<10 pp each), pay attn in class. Presentation=easy.  Reasonable expecatations. He cares about the students. MAKE SURE YOUR CLASS NEGOTIATES W/ HIM SO YOU CAN USE CHEAT SHEETS FOR TESTS

Class is only mandatory for attendence points which makes a big difference in grade, other than that, expect to take a nice nap and do some other work, class lectures useless. You can use notes on tests, very helpful. Try and take class with a friend so when its project time you work together easily. B in class.
Refuses to admit he is wrong, will mark test questions as incorrect and refuse to change them when shown the answer from the text matches yours. If at all possible stay away.
Not a hard class.
point blank,  He CAN'T TEACH!   Tells personal storys and then tests on material that was not covered. Changes his mind often.  seriously good luck staying away and learning something.
Easy class...terrible professor.

One of the most boring professors I've ever had.  I wasn't for the fact that I got an A, I would be real mad that we didn't learn squat in 15 weeks.  If you want to learn something, choose another prof.

Easy homework and tests. Find a computer that he cannot blank the screen on and the semester will be more fun, cause then you can surf the net while he lectures. I only went to class to turn in homework and surf the net.
Boring class, guy seems out of touch with modern computers.
As long as you do all the Homework you'll be fine in that class
No Comments
lots of homework  but its easy    good class

Easy tests and easy homework.  He seems like a very odd guy, but turns out to be a nice and helpful professor.  I recommend him... It's an easy A if you do the homework (which takes like 5 minutes, you can do it in class)

He tries to make his Word Class impossible to pass.  Won't answer any questions.  what he says won't be on the test, will be.  he laughs when the class does poorly on tests due to his bad info. He said "#?@@ happens", I lost my last job, too bad.  If you want to pass word, DON"T Take his class!

Had him for group lab experiments for Intro to Engineering Design. Very well respected, smart, and always offering to help. Experiment each week until the end of the semester, you work on a project and powerpoint for it for a couple weeks then present it with your group the last day. You must participate. Do the work and you'll get a good grade

Professor Adams is a quirky dude that is super passionate about the material he teaches.  Vibrations is a tough and often boring class but he uses his broad range of experiences to apply the material to the real world which is cool.   He doesn't take attendance but you don't want to get behind in his class.  Online tests and quizzes every week.
If you go to class and pay attention and put forth the effort he's a great professor

The material is presented well and professor Adams makes it clear what he wants you to know, and what is important to learn from each section. He is very willing to help outside of class, and responded to emailed questions pretty quickly even when I had sent questions later in the day. The lectures are long, but he keeps it entertaining.

Assigned no homework. Did very few in class examples. Didn't have time to cover the last 2 chapters worth of material but tested students on it anyway. He offers no way to gauge if you're actually understanding the material. Very frustrating.

he is a really good professor. I got B+ in his class. He is funny and is always ready to help. He cares about how students perform on his tests and wants to help by giving extra credits for easy doable extra work. I am currently taking 3 classes with him and doing great.

As my advisor, he forgot to remove my holds after I met with him about this. I was unable to schedule some of my classes as they became full. He always rushed people out of his office when they went for help as if he did not want to be there. His lectures sometimes became very scattered and off topic. Many times he moved quickly, skipping details.

Dynamics is a tough class, but Dr. Adams makes it enjoyable. He sometimes works problems out too fast but if you ask him to explain a problem, he will. If you show up and do all of the assignments, you'll find this class easy.

Dr. Adams is straight-forward when it comes to his lectures.  Just because his assignments or exams can be tough at times doesn't mean he's a bad professor, this is mechanical engineering after all and you better learn your material.
I started the class just finishing a year hiatus from school. He helped me after class with examples and was very easy to get a hold of. He is there for the students not for his paycheck.

He loves Dynamics and wants the students to know the material so he takes the proper time and methods to teach it which makes the class much more interesting. Can go off on tangents sometimes but they are bound to make you laugh one way or another by the end. And he really understands what position the students are in and cooperates well with that.
Great teacher, really learned a lot about dynamics, and relates it to real world use
Pretty good Professor. Knows his stuff and can relate to real world experience. He is very fond of giving 35 minute long speaches.

I had Dr. Adams for both Vibrations and Machine Design. He is by far the best prof. I have had in my 7-year college career. He is very clear and conveys what you need to know and how to use it. His teaching style is excellent! I have nothing but great things to say, I hope CSU realizes what they have before he takes a better job somewhere else.
Best Professor Ive ever had. A+

I don't know where to start with a guy like Mike.  I graduated from CSU but did most of my undergrad at OSU.  I have been taught by people who wrote top tier texts, formulated original ideas and created multi-million dollar companies but Mike has always been my favorite, most passionate and inspiring professor.  He lives and breathes engineering.
One of the best professors I've ever had.  It isn't an easy class but he tries to make it as easy as possible for you. Show to class and do your homework. Very good professor.
Dr. Adams was fine as a lecture prof but as our Sr design advisor pulled some of the most dishonest moves that I've seen from a teacher. Threatens students with dropped letter grades over any matter.

Helpful professor that often times goes on tangent. If you really enjoy the subject material then you would probably the tangents more. For me I found them deviating from the textbook yet interesting.

I loved vibrations class with him, probably one of the best Professors in the Mechanical Dept. I wish I had him for Machine Design. Show up to class, ask questions, do your HW stick with this an you will get an A.
He knows about everything there is to know about dynamics.  He really likes teaching and will help you if you need help. Has some pretty great engineering stories about what he did before teaching

He is one of the best teachers I've ever had. He loves Dynamics and he know it's not an easy class but he tries to make it as easy as possible. Participation matters so show to class and do your homework.

Professor Adams was a decent professor. She doesn't use email, so she is inaccessible outside of class. There are a ton of papers, which she doesn't grade until the very end of the semester. This class wasn't difficult, but the grading criteria can be very unclear.

If you want a super easy class take this one. Professor Adams is very nice and can make lectures fun. We work as teams on a final project for the whole semester. Also  do not buy the expensive book, I bought an old version of the book and it was just as good for the online quizzes. If you participate in group work you'll pass no problem.

Very unclear in her expectations. Does not believe in giving out rubrics so we never know what she really wants. Unorganized and I feel like I haven't actually learned anything. Spent the whole semester watching videos and working on a final presentation. Don't recommend taking her.

I took BADM 1020 in an 8 week session online. In the first week of class,  this professor expected us to read four chapters of the book, as well as do 464 practice questions online (116 per chapter). I ended up dropping this class and finding an alternative as expectations were set incredibly too high for an introductory business class.

Sometimes she'll give you assignments and then forgets about it or forgets her own instructions. Still if you show up to class and do the work you can get a good grade. She's a good speaker which made her lectures interesting.

Do not take this instructor. Completely unprofessional. Makes many false promises. Forgets her own instructions. Grades off how she feels that day. Rambles on about details and forgets main points. Vague. Just dont.

Professor Adams is one of the most unclear professors at Cleveland State. She constantly changes what she actually wants our final project to be like, and will deny ever saying the incorrect expectations. Class time is also the most pointless thing ever because all we do is watch videos. The bottom line is she's not a good professor.

The vast majority of class time is spent watching YouTube videos--something I could  be doing at home for FREE. The materials have proven nearly useless and I see little evidence of her experience in the field of marketing. I do appreciate that we involve real corporations in the final project, but that is the only upside of this course.

I took a class with this professor at Cuyahoga Community College. She was unresponsive to the online course questions of her students, and would not log in for weeks at a time to check in with the class. Assignments were very unclear at times, and students had to actually call the campus and talk to the Business office in order to get any response.
Although it was unclear in the beginning of the term it all came together for the good. I will take another couse with her!

She has a unique way of teaching the classroom. Some may not like it but if you can bite the bullet she's actually an easy pass. She cares for her students but there's a lot to be left desired with her. She's a nice person one on one but can be intimidating slightly when speaking to the class which makes approaching her hard

I'm a straight A student! She was the worst professor, I had to drop her class when I should have graduated that semester. She is horrible and of course she is one of the few professors teaching mark 2020

Her grasp of the English language is terrible. Her grading criteria are non-existant, and when she deducts points it is for arbitrary reasons that she doesn't justify clearly. Check over APA formatting when writing papers, she uses goofy guidelines and applies them as rules for grading. She was very disorganized and it showed.

Possibly the worst teacher I have ever had. She is not clear with assignments, she doesn't grade correctly. She will hardly if ever respond to your emails. She is the laziest professor ever and should not teach at all. AVOID AT ALL COSTS
Grading criteria not clear. Assignments not clear. Didn't need the book for this class, but you had to buy an online tutorial game ($45).
SUPER EASY

Worst professor I've had. Online class, but no lectures or virtual meetings were done. Very vague with instruction and very little communication. Relies solely on the book to do all the teaching, and uses an online program to do most of the grading for him. Only grades papers, and gives basically no feedback. Learned nothing. He shouldn't teach.

He is very knowledgeable, but not good in a lecture setting. The tests are extremely difficult and the only way to succeed is 100% reading the text. The written assignments have no real guidelines and he took 2 months to grade our first paper. Would not recommend to anyone looking for an elective

The average on the first test was a 50; the high was a 70. Very unclear about test and paper expectations. One heck of a learning curve for those with no past law experience. Lectures are not helpful, he doesn't answer questions very well, and you pretty much have to teach yourself everything. It worked out in the end. Very stressful class though.

He knows a lot about law but lectures are boring. A lot of the class dropped given the average test 1 score was a 50%. Tricky and confusing multiple choice tests but he curves them. 4% increase of extra credit available at the end of semester.. 2 papers to write with little guidance or expectations.

4 tests 1 project. Tests are extremely difficult. A lot more questions come from book not lectures OR powerpoints. Some definitions on test are never mentioned in class. Very difficult / confusing /tricky questions on tests. Did not give clear instructions/expectations for project.

Adams is a very knowledgeable professor who gives an interesting lecture--and he's a great guy. You'll have to attend class and takes notes to be successful. His test are combination MC/TF/short answer, and he gives partial credit on the Short Ans. Curves when needed. This is a W.A.C course so be prepared to do an assignment or two. Study hard!
tough grader
Well spoken professor.  Outline the chapters and listen to what he goes over in class.  Tests are not that difficult.  Understands the law, and wants his students to have a basic understanding.

This guy is a great professor. You have to attend because he gives pop quizes a lot, but you can drop 2. Tests are tough but he is fair on the short answer grading. Watch the wording on some questions. Write up assignments aren't too hard and he gives good feedback. If you had no interest in law prior to this class, you will learn a lot. He's good.

Good lawyer and teacher, but many people dropped due to grades.  I considered it after the first exam (D), but kept at it and grades got progressively better (C, B, A). Some exam questions could be thought of as trick questions. You have to put in the study time, no exceptions.  Tough, but very useful course, glad I took it as an elective.

Adams is most disorganized.  Never responds to email.  Makes mistakes and tries to weasel out of them.  Does not commit to promisses.  In grading assignments does not comment on his expectations.  Final is comprehensive 23 chapters of LAW which is a mixed essay / mult choise.  No guidance other then "I might ask you something from those chapters"
Not super easy to understand, but I was never one for finance.  Curves like crazy.  Nice guy, will help if you ask.  Beware the comprehensive final!

Her class was a bit boring but what do you expect, it's an intro class. She seemed like a very nice, sweet, lady. If you show up and do the homework, which is easy by the way, you will do fine. The tests were very straight forward. She sometimes seemed to get confused in class but it never effected my understanding of the material.

Her class was a bit boring but what do you expect, it's an intro class. She seemed like a very nice, sweet, lady. If you show up and do the homework, which is easy by the way, you will do fine. The tests were very straight forward. She sometimes seemed to get confused in class but it never effected my understanding of the material.

Disorganized and unprepared. Takes forever to grade and gives unspecific feedback. Doesnt present course material clearly, and does half of the example problems incorrectly without showing students how NOT to make those same mistakes. Does very little teaching, but does a lot of example problems instead. Her teaching style wont work for everybody

She is a nice enough lady, but not a great professor. She relies very heavily on MyStatLab, an outdated, buggy, slow, and EXPENSIVE online homework and quiz portal. She never gives feedback or posts grades, and her lecture style is often confusing and she doesn't seem to have a mastery of the content she teaches. If you're patient you'll be ok.

she is literally learning the material with the students as she reads it word for word off the powerpoints. don't as questions she won't know the answer and it'll turn into a 15-minute discussion on her trying to answer the question. she takes off stupid points and doesn't put in a single grade so you wont know what grade you have all semester

This "instructor" should not be allowed to teach this class. I am quite concerned with how she is properly licensed or has received proper credentials in order to teach. She does not update grades, provides no feedback, takes off points for stupid things, uses terrible notes, not knowledgable on the subject itself, and this class is hard due to her

Ms. Adams read directly off the slides during class. Lots of in-class group work. The group assignment sheets were not proofed before class and had errors. She is not knowledgeable in the subject area and the class corrected her multiple times while working out in-class examples. After midterm, got no grades back on anything until after final.

I have no idea how this professor got a degree. She doesn't know how to do 80% of the problems herself. She admitted to taking the Lab and homework assignments from another professor. Clearly didn't even read assignments before she handed them out. SO bad. RUN.
This is by far the worst instructor i have ever had, it's like pulling teeth having to go to class.
Probably the worst Math teacher I have ever had. I took Statistics in high school and I'm pretty sure I unlearned stats in this class. Good Luck kids.

1 worksheet every class done in groups and then she reads off of a power point. You wont pass if you dont show up because the in class worksheets count for points, and she takes attendance every class. All homework is online there are 4 assignments a week due at 11:59 the night before class. Dont ask questions she wont know the answer.

Although I feel like she was not very good at teaching and would often visibly confuse other students, I was getting 100% on her tests and would definitely recommend taking her only if you already know a bit about statistics (in which case hers is the easiest class to glide by in).
She isnt organized when she comes to class. Lots of pop quizzes

Nice person, horrible professor. Directions are unclear. She is always unorganized and is easily confused. Relies heavily on stat labs using a website that crashes constantly. Loves to gives pop quizzes. Never gives clear answers to student questions. Take the class with a different professor if you have the chance
WD immediately if you have her. Horrible teacher, but a cool person.
Nice person, terrible professor. I found my grade out on the last day of the semester. I feel like she rarely ever knows what shes doing and expects us to figure it out. Would not take again.

BEWARE OF RANDOM QUIZES. I had to WD from her class because of her random tests and irrelevant tests. She gives a test at the beginning of class and expects that you have mastered the information. The online stat lab is weird too, not a huge fan of it. She did however let me retake a test because i had a doctors note, which shows she has some care.
Does not go into depth about work. Rarely shows care or compassion for her students. Relies on "StatLab" site that always crashes. Regret taking this class over MTH116,

Awful. She does not even know what she is teaching and is always making mistakes and is corrected by the students. It's super boring and she honestly has no passion about her job. If you have her, switch professors.

A good professor if you do not understand statistics well (if you do, it's kind of boring). She is very detailed with her explanations and gives out homework that helps but is not too time consuming. She is very nice and will be flexible, especially if you have personal things going on. Doesn't really penalize for late work.
Such a great person and professor! She is passionate about what she teaches, can not recommend this class more!
Such a great person and professor! She is passionate about what she teaches, can not recommend this class more!

If you show up, pay attention there is no reason this class should not be an easy A. Dr. A cares more about her students walking away with something from the class than being a hard grader and making her students lives miserable.

Took her for REL 101, her class was extremely informative!! Make sure you read the assigned books, most of the class is used to discuss the material from the chapters you're told to read. The vocab terms you go over a few days before the exam make up most of the test, which is multiple choice, so take notes!! Very good professor, showed many videos
Best Prof this semester! Very helpful, gives a lot of "Freebies" in quizzes and exams. Generous grading scale. Attendance is worth 15 of your grade (allowing  3 absences). Would take her again!

Her class is super easy, so easy that you don't even NEED to go to class, but you have to otherwise the good scores on tests and quizzes won't mean anything. I aced everything and ended with a 82% cause I missed a couple classes. I'd recommend her, just go to class.
Ok professor but she doesn't take crap from students when it comes to having casual conversations in class.  Grading  is at her leisure but often times she is fair.

She is constantly confused and disorganized. Never once followed the syllabus one of the worst professors i have ever had. Lowest grade i ever recieved on any test/paper was 96, yet i got only an 86% in class due to my lack of attendence. All that was accomplished in class was redisscussing what we had already been assigned to do on our own. WORST

Well structured class requiring nightly readings supplemented with class lecture notes and discussions. Midterm had 25 MCQ and 1 essay. Final grade can be optionally substituted with Midterm grade. Requires an 8+ page paper based on a personally taken visit to a Buddhist temple. Don't let the class number scare you, just as easy as a 100 level.

Excellently paced for a religious introduction course. The professor allows up to four unexplained absences before taking points away. Nightly readings are supplemented with lecture notes and discussions. Course has two multiple choice (50Q) exams and five papers (lowest paper grade is dropped). Also requires participation. Highly recommended.

I really liked this professor, but she will take no crap from you, you cannot slide by in any of her classes.  If you plan to talk in her class, she will know your name and she will call you out.  Otherwise, she's really great.

Really great guy... As a professor, however, not so great. It's hard to understand him sometimes, especially if you're not use to having foreign professors. Doing the homework before class was more helpful than the class itself.
Goes to fast does not explain things clearly.. you wont even have enough time to keep up with him when he is writing on the board
If you don't understand something,he will not explain it to you so you can. He just repeats what he says! He expect you to know they answer. Not a very good teacher for this class at all!

He's an awesome teacher. He's so nice, and understanding. He'll help you out with anything, just ask. Has a thick accent, but is fun to talk with. Dresses nice everyday and gives extra points. I'd take every math class with him
i like it i learned
i like him... he is so nice and understanding.. sure he has a heavy accent but he is really nice
Be prepared to teach yourself. I don't think he is even aware of what is in the text book. Also ineffective at answering questions because he is incapable of listening.
I think he's a decent teacher...

Knew his topic very well. Explained things very clearly. Tests were very short and easy. English is not his first language, but if you can get over his accent and just pay attention, you'll do very well. Highly recommend.

sometimes writes in russian. can't speak english.  possibly worst class experience of my entire life
EASYIEST TEACHER EVER!!!!

I hated this class. I loved poetry before taking this class and even tho her teaching sucked, I'm not going to give up on poetry because its beautiful. She honestly needs to get it together. She never tells you when an assignment is due, she's so picky and a tough grader, I've never gotten a C before her class. And her lectures are way too long.

I absolutely hated this class, I'm on average a B English student, with somewhat of a love for poetry, no longer am I that person. I hate poetry and failing this class. There was a paper every week and if you didn't have your syllabus you probably missed them. She never says in class when assignments are due so if you have a busy schedule, AVOID

She's not as bad as some of these reviews, however, I love poetry. I actually found the class to be really easy and did very well, grade-wise. If you're horrible at English, you're probably going to struggle in a poetry class regardless, so the people that did badly may just be bad at English.

dr ahearn is such a ncie person, always happy and joking around. her poetry class was really difficult for me, someone who doesn't like poetry nor english. she was really good at explaining things. the hard parts were when you had to interpret a poet by yourself. if you come to class and do the papers you'll do fine.

While occasionally a little scatterbrained, Prof Ahearn is very kind, intelligent as well as knowledgeable about the subject matter, in this case Renaissance Literature. YES sometimes the work is difficult and YES she expects you to care about the work, but it is to foster a strong learning environment, something that I feel she is very good at.

After reading reviews I was scared to take her class. However, she is so helpful and nice & I had absolutely no problems in her classes. We moved through material kind of quickly, but if you keep up you'll be fine. Only complaint: takes a bit longer to grade papers. I would absolutely recommend her to others and would def. take her classes again.

The class isn't hard if you keep up. We moved through the material very quickly. She does have a habit of interrupting students explaining their point of view and taking it in a different direction than intended and then the student needs to explain again. Sometimes we had to explain basic tenants of pop literary culture. Not good for a lit prof.
I had her for two classes, Intro to Poetry (240) and Brit Lit I (321). She has high expectations but not unreasonable ones. She is always willing to help if needed and she is a very nice professor.

I was shocked to see neg. reviews on here.  Prof. Ahearn is a sweetheart, very intelligent, and helpful.  Yes, she likes grammar, but its basic stuff you need to know in an English class anyways.  Lots of reading and the research paper is a big chunk, but she took time to meet students and help them one on one.

I've found that the way she grades depends on her mood.  She's extremely intelligent and very nice, but it doesn't quite translate to proper teaching ability.  I suggest taking her if you're really into the course material and have knowledge of the time period prior to the class, as there isn't much history in the books, nor does she give any.
Tough grader but if you do the work and answer with some semblance of what she's asking you'll get a perfect.  Do the work and readings before class or you'll be lost.

HARSH GRADER, IF YOUR NOT PERFECT AT GRAMMAR YOU WONT GET AN A OR PASS HER CLASS. RESEARCH PAPER WORTH 200 POINTS, SHE DOESNT HELP YOU UNDERSTAND WHAT SHE WANTS, SHES HARSH STAY AWAY FROM HER CLASS!!!!! All her class is about is papers so if you don't excell in your english grammar skills you will have extremely difficult time she's VERY PICKY!

She has no teaching ability, and she never lectures.  The class time is just students voicing their opinions.  If you are not familiar with christian theology (or any religion) and philosophy, you will be lost when she does attempt to teach.  You will have to do a lot of research on your own time.  Easy grader, but not worth it at all.  AVOID.

In this introduction to Poetry, we learned a good amount about each era. She was nice and knowledgeable (although forgetting some things that would connect nicely to the material). But a lot of discussion about the poetry so kept my interest! Only complaint pop quizzes. I would still recommend.
Great teacher! You must meet with her one on one to get the maximum out of this class. This class is tough to learn in a group setting, but she is extremely friendly and helpful.

1L Legal Writing class.  A little rough around the edges and unorganized at times as she is a new professor, but very helpful with problems/questions and easy to talk to.  Overall she's ok, and I'm sure she will get better with time.
Professor Aitken is very friendly and approachable.  However, sometimes her help can be confusing or unclear.  But, she's beautiful.

Friendly person, but not a good teacher at all!!!

Great Professor.. Really learned alot. I usually hate English but she made it enjoyable.
She is just great and fun to be around. She is always willing to help you. Pretty easy class.

She's very knowledgeable, caring, and understanding. She's also just as busy as you are and the original syllabus dates for exams and things change. I highly suggest going to class. Personally, didn't use the book once. 2 exams, weekly journals on posted readings, a paper [book report]. She can be a tough grader on the journals.

Dr. Alexander is one of the best teachers I've had all through my academic career. Her tests are rough, but she grades study guides (glossaries) the day of the test, so if you put effort into your studying, you'll get a good grade on that and the test. She is a clinical psychologist, so if you ever have any issues, she's understanding & kind.
She is a decent person and professor.  definitely must keep up with  reading in this class, hated doing the glossaries. She curses like a sailor though...
She is a decent person and professor.  definitely must keep up with  reading in this class, hated doing the glossaries. She curses like a sailor though...

Dr. A is the best professor I have ever had. I learned so much from her during my undergraduate days. Now I am in graduate school and I have to say I still hear her voice in my head saying "you have to meet your client where they are at". Had no idea how true this was until I got into my practicum. I would highly recommend her!

I took one course for every semester for 2008/2009 school terms with this professor. her tests aren't the easiest. She's down to earth and easy going. it's important to attend class and take notes for tests. every course she teaches is taught differently, like Death Dying & Bereavement course was mainly talking w/1 another.
Most of the test questions are way to difficult for a 400 level course.
i think she gave everyone an A

Best professor I've ever had! She goes through material very thoroughly. She does drawing and anything she can to communicate the material. I recommend her to everyone I can! Material is though, but she makes it easy and interesting.

Getting an A and love her class.She uses real life examples and never takes attendence. Always answers questions even if their off topic. Love her class...never bored! Wish she was teaching in Spring on campus.
I HEART DR. ALEXANDER! SHE'S THE BEST!
awful
she will answer any questions you have, but the material on the tests is not from the class lectures. she also takes attendance and treats you like a 3rd grader

very hard tests. Don't expect to get an "a" or

Very knowledgeable in circuits but he never prepares for lectures. you need to ask him about everything you want to understand. Extremely tough grader.

News Flash: Dr. Alexander is doing everyone a favor by forcing us to learn on our own. When we acquire a job we will be required to learn on our own. In the beginning i felt hopeless. This course was my excalibur. Without a deep understanding of this material you will not become or it will be extremely difficult to become an Electrical Engineer.

Well respected in his field, but not the best professor. Very hands off. If he sees you doing something wrong hell just watch and not say much when you ask for help. Friday lecture complete waste of time. Groups are randomly assigned and I was stuck with a bad group that didnt want to do anything, so unfortunately one person does all the work.

Beginning of semester thought I was doomed. By the end I felt pretty reassured. Don't let that fool you though. YOU WILL BE ON YOUR OWN THE ENTIRE SEMESTER. The beginning will seem like a nightmare I Failed the first exam. Second exam was easy if you know what you did wrong on the first exam.

Here's a dirty little secret: there's no other way to do well in circuits than to build your skills on your own by working a ton of problems. I went to tutoring, studied in groups, worked old problems, and emailed the teacher or went to office hours when I got stuck. It's frustrating, I get it, but I gritted my teeth and got 2 A's. You can, too.

While this prof is very respected in his field, he's not a very good professor. Even though he wants us to understand the subject, he doesn't explain the ideas very well. He expects us to read the book,1 he wrote in the 1 place, and understand it fully. Its hard to read, nor does he explain why. if u want 2 pass, get a tutor asap, they WILL help.

You have to read the book or you will fail. He doesn't actually teach you and only goes over examples that students ask him but doesn't really explain things much. Very nice guy but I wish he would do actual lectures explaining the concepts considering the class is almost 2 hours. Also the only circuits professor sadly.

I just had this professor for EEC310. Very difficult class if you do not study on your own. If you are struggling, meet with him after class to show that you care about what you are doing and you will pass (not even joking, went from a D to a B). Be sure to get previous exams in order to know what to expect on exam day. They won't be the same tho.

This class can be very intimidating, the first day of class he passed back some papers to about 10 students only, i was wondering why i did not get a paper, then he  says " This is your final from last semester". Kind of funny kind of not. Make sure to do practice problems out of the book and ask questions in class on what you don't understand

Condescending. Writes notes in a way that's hard to copy into notebook. Tells everyone it's easy when it's definitely not. Has a big dumb smile. I do not like him at all but he's the only one who teaches circuits 2. Find old copies of his tests or there's no way you'll know what to study to pass.

Everyone says he's a fair grader but each weekly quiz seems like pass or fail. He gives no homework problems that are worth credit, they are there if want to do them but won't directly help grade. Gives quizzes every week but grades very hard. He will help you but you MUST do problems in book . You will feel like your all on your own.

Alexander is awesome. His circuits book is the gold standard nation(world?)-wide. Go to class, get a lecture. Work some problems at home, get stuck, and ask him to show you how to do them in class. He also prepares you for electronics II, emec, and power.
he went through 3 chapter and gave us two quizzes in just two lectures. Beside, he doesn't explain anything, u gotta read from the book and find out sources.
He is very helpful. And will try to make the class easir for you. Make sure you ask questions , That well make him very happy and well help you a lot when it comes to undrstanding the class martial.
Excellent teacher, very experienced in the field and enjoys being here. Very influential person, will make you feel good about engineering  and the future.

Dr Alexander is an amazing professor although his teaching style is a bit different than most. Read the book and do the problems. For extra practice, try solving them with Pspice. He rarely lectures so come to class with questions! Go to his office hours if you aren't understanding the material. He wants his students to succeed. Also, join IEEE.

He knows this stuff and can answer any questions you have, which is what most of the class is based. You teach your self mostly from the book. You go to class and he polishes you off by showing exactly what is needed in the field. very fair grader. He has very different style of teaching

Shows techniques which are more efficient than conventional circuit-solving methods. As mentioned by other reviewers, concentrates on the bigger picture. Wants to prepare you for your future career in engineering. Overall a great professor, although is blatantly overconfident and will brag constantly.

Professor doesn?t waste time on little details but focuses on the whole topic in general. He tries to make students understand the material not by memorization but pushes individuals to develop a feel for the topic deep within.He really understands the fact when you learn something with your heart details can then be easily derived from within. I.R

Wont teach you a thing all semester. Fair grader. Class will be hard if you expect to learn something in the lecture. I'd rather classify him as an experienced TA than a professor. People comment about his personality and I agree but this isn't a social club. I expected him to teach something which he didn't. Is a little bit self obsessed.

She really cares about her students and their college experience. Made the boring subject of research methods seem interesting. She is a true representative of the millennial generation, and understands us and our challenges very well. She can be hilarious at times!

Besides being an excellent teacher, Professor Alexander truly embraces the concept of engaged learning. In her class, you likely are going to do a real research project with community members and organizations in a team setting. Her lectures on participatory action research are the most interesting.  I wish we had more professors like her at CSU.
Uses different way of classroom teaching. Does not lecture, instead waits for students to ask questions. If students don't have questions, he will just flip through the textbook at random.
He was an excellent teacher, I had him for intro to engineering and the class was so easy. He is also super nice and loves talking to his students. I would take any class that he taught.

She was a really tough grader... Some of the clinical group struggled to pass the course with C's. It was very unfair on all the students.   Nice things about her though... She cares about each of her students and wants us all treated the way we should be, and she takes appropriate actions if people are rude to us or what not.

This professor is socially conscious! The course material is very relevant to the times we are living in, therefore really meaningful. The lectures are interesting. The professor is extremely passionate and enthusiastic on the given subject matter!

She is a very good and respectful professor. Her slides are what you need to study from to do well on the exams. Her HWs and discussions are interesting and easy grades as long as you do them. The HWs and discussion requirements are maximum to write a paragraph. Three exams total and either an HW or discussion weekly.

This professor is socially conscious! The course material is very relevant to the times we are living in, therefore really meaningful. The lectures are interesting. The professor is extremely passionate and enthusiastic on the given subject matter!
I absolutely loved Dawn, her lectures were always so interesting and there was never a time that I was not excited about going to her class. Such an amazing professor!! :)

I loved going to her class and hearing all of her stories. There is no textbook, so it is important to take notes and use the study guide. The study guides are basically the same as the exams, and all the answers are easy to find in the powerpoints. She keeps class interesting and I'd recommend her to anyone!
Took this class in the summer. It is a lot of memorization but if you prepare adequately and attend class, you will pass. Extra credit opportunities are available in class only.
Amazing professor, great stories, exams are straightforward.

Prof. Aliberti is an amazing professor. She presents the material in a clear way and is clearly passionate about the subject. The homework assignment is super easy and the exams are also simple as long as you do the study guide.

Dr. Aliberti has intriguing stories about herself and others that are relevant to lectures. She is approachable and easygoing. The benefits of her being chill: 1. you wont have to make up lies about absences or late work. 2. Timewasters dont feel obligated to talk or show up, so discussions are enhanced.

I can't recommend her enough. Her class was beyond enjoyable to attend. Exams are based off of the study guide she MAKES you. Comes to class, listen, and enjoy the fact that you get to hear from this inspirational person. This class is FAR from difficult. I would take it again if I could.

Dawn is a really cool person. Her class is super chill, but it was almost so chill that I forgot that I needed to show up for class. She does take attendance even though she never went over it in the syllabus. There are only a few assignments and for the most part, they were pretty easy.

Dawn gives inspirational lectures and has great stories relating to the topics in class. Allows students to give feedback in class and grades assignments gingerly. Dawn understands that we all have other classes to focus on.

Dawn is the bomb, she does not require a textbook for the class all powerpoints are on bb. She gives out study guides that you fill in from notes and they are the test. She takes attendance once and a while to fulfill her participation requirement. Great teacher/class easy A
Its a pleasure taking another one of her classes again. Her lectures are rich with knowledge and she shares many of her experiences.

Professor Dawn is an awesome professor to have. The stories she told were very entertaining. Her lectures were amazing. She is a very easy going professor. She is very understanding. She gave one paper in class. We had three exams in her class. I would definitely recommend her as a professor.

Inspirational&so genuine in her lectures. She has so much experience from traveling&I find everything she says to be interesting. The class can get pretty intense/graphic w/the issues we discuss but it has opened my eyes&I have a whole new appreciation for life. going to the lectures is worth it because of the knowledge you gain. Highly recommend:)
hands down one of the best teacher here at school she cares so much about you as a student specially if you show her that you care about the class

Amazing prof, although attendance isn't mandatory, extra credit is offered once in awhile for days with low attendance and if you show up most of the time and are on the cusp of a different letter grade, she'll round up. Always teaches interesting material, very kind, gives study guides for tests, so study, and you'll most likely get an A.

Awesome teacher. She understands that kids mainly focus on other classes for their majors and she makes her classes enjoyable. Ive skipped many many classes and it hasn't penalized me at all. Her study guides are 99% the same to her test, so I usually study the night before. Hard to get an A in the class when its out of 200 points, but great class.

You do not have many grades in the class. Attendance is optional and her whole class is lecture-based. Had four total grades the whole year: Exam 1, Exam 2, Paper and Final Exam. Posts her notes on Blackboard.

She was amazing! Literally got 100% on the first test! If you're looking for a teacher whose lectures aren't boring this is your class! She has so much experience and it really makes you interested in the class. She is extremely lenient on grading & her tests are literally the study guide. I'm definitely looking to take another one of her classes.

Taking Dr. Allard's class my freshman year was a good choice. His lectures are interesting, he is super nice and he is doing a good job through his online classes and feedback to us students. I respect him and enjoyed his class!

PSY 101 was recommended as an simple first course and thats all it was simple. After a while Ive slowly stopped attending the live zoom lectures cuz in my opinion it was a waste of my time cuz it was just a deep review of what was in the text book Packback, mini labs easy points still got good gradieven though I did poorly on all my chapter exams

Taking Dr. Allard's class my freshman year was a good choice. His lectures are interesting, he is super nice and he is doing a good job through his online classes and feedback to us students. I respect him and enjoyed his class!

Dr. Allard will be the most boring and most monotone professor you will have, however he will also be one of the easiest. The exams were solely based on the powerpoint slides, so you don't need to go to class just memorize the slides. The exams were multiple choice (3 choices :)) overall easy class

Dr. Allard is wonderful. I have him for social psychology, and he is easy to approach, and willing to help you out if you need it. The quizzes are listed on the syllabus, but you need to keep track of them, they are on black board. He also gives you all the texts on BB so you don't have to buy anything for his class.

This class has no participation involved at all. So, get ready to fall asleep from the unenthusiastic lecturing. Make your own study guide because the ones provided are useless for the exams. Way to butcher one of my favorite branches of psychology. Even if you think you understand the material the exam questions will show you otherwise.
Dr. Allard was a great professor. His lectures were interesting and easy to understand. If you miss a class, everything is online. Read all of the lecture slides and the class is easily passible.

PowerPoints that are accessible on BlackBoard. Not very hard exams as long as you read the PowerPoints. Uses clickers to get feedback in class. Has "mini-lab" assignments that go along with the lectures. Really easy to do, basically free points because it is unlimited attempts. No quizzes. Would take again
He is a good teacher, tells you what you need to know for the tests. You don't really use the textbook for anything, all test questions are from the lectures.

Pretty good, didn't explain all the biology part of the class correctly or as in depth as I would've liked. Exams & quizzes are extremely fair. Questions are mostly recall, with multiple choice & short answer. I was grateful there was a study guide. Read the textbook & study, ask questions, go to office hours, you will be fine. Theres extra credit.

Lectures were only 50minutes and they were very informative. He tells lots of stories and uses modern day references to help you make sense of the material. He's always available outside class and generally responds to emails fairly quickly.  Great Professor but don't skip class!! Test questions do come from his lectures!
Research studies with SONA lab are annoying. overall great teacher, sense of humor in lectures is great

Lectures are long, the study guides are extremely vague and the review days do not reflect the content on the exams so there is a lot of studying to be had. You need to be in class or you won't pass and there are also short quizzes given out that are based off of the textbook. He's a nice guy but don't have him for this class if you can help it.

The material was easy and so were the 3 assignments but the test were terrible they were super hard & if you got lower than a C it drops you a letter grade & it's hard to make up those points. I had to neglect other classes when studying for his test to get a B attendance is graded and no textbook uses online materials, wouldn't take him again

He teaches students on a P.H.D level. Exams are extremely difficult.  Lectures are long and boring. Study Guides and power points are vague. Miss class you won't pass. This was the worst class I've had throughout my college journey.  If you want to pass and keep a good G.P.A. I Don't advise taking  this class you will definitely struggle.

My honest opinion, he is a great instructor, knows what he is talking about, clear about subjects, the problem with his class is that is all based on Exam and it is really a difficult exam. The final exam is crazy commutative. Take his class if you want challenge,  he does grade fairly but if you are someone need increase GPA don't take his class.

If you can study on your own you don't need to go to class.  All the powerpoints he goes over are on blackboard and contain all the material you need which is great. Don't buy the textbook. Only four noncumulative, all multiple choice tests. Final is one of those four tests and it's easy if you study. Allard is a nice guy and he is pretty funny too
He is a great guy, looks like Jamiy from Mythbusters. He is a fair grader and is generally very entertaining

Only 3 tests for the semester, including the final. Extremely complex and tough tests, tricky multiple choice questions. If you miss class, you'll have a hard time on the tests. Everything on the tests is based on his lectures. Lecture slides are broad. I do not recommend taking this professor.

This was one of the worst classes that I have ever taken at CSU. The exams are beyond difficult and consist of multiple essay and tricky multiple choice questions.  Also, the final exam is a cumulative nightmare. I would rather have a root canal without Novocaine than suffer through another boring lecture with this professor.

He only gave 4 tests throughout the year and they were non-cumulative which was awesome. He gives an outline of the things that will be on the test. As long as you study that, then it's an easy A. You should probably go to this class because a lot that's on the study guide is based off his lectures.
Don't pass up a chance to be in her class

AWFUL!!! DO NOT TAKE HER!

She was so horrible

She only talks about herself. We had 14 logs to turn in and she only graded 7 of them. Grades are due today and she still has not submitted them . The class was a complete waste of time. not good i will pass her up

Unfortunately, the class was a time for her to share her "war" stories when it should have been about the students internships. She grades with ridiculous standards and for the work that must be done, one would think it was a 4 credit hour class.

Best workshop teacher, imo. We go through one person's fiction piece each class, meaning you get a full, in-depth critique of your work. Very good feedback and meets with everybody 1-on-1.

He is amazing I have not known him as a professor but have known him in Financial aid and he takes care of everything for me if you need help in financial aid he is the one and only

Professor Aloi is one of the most helpful math professors I have ever had. In high school, I struggled with math and had a hard time understanding concepts.
