Professor Aloi is a good teacher that cares about his students. He makes sure all material is covered and gives clear explanations. There is a good amount of homework, but nothing too bad if you pace yourself. Tests/quizzes are taken from homework. Great class!
Though he can be passive aggressive overall a good teacher. he does care about his students even when it doesn't seem like it. Ask questions and he will help ALWAYS.

Lets you work in groups for pop quizzes and can be annoying with how much he goes over things and how slow he can go sometimes but you can tell its because he wants to make sure everyone knows what theyre doing.
Always has jokes and good stories

Don't take him if you can help it, if you can't then he is fine. Gives very easy examples in class, homework is TOUGH. Doesn't go over homework fully, will only show you how to do half the problem. Won't go over homework if you don't ask. A bit of a pain, otherwise okay I guess.
Great easy professor, helps you when you need help, answers your questions, and really laid back and chill professor.

Professor Aloi was the greatest math teacher I've ever had. His daily humor always gave me a chuckle but annoyed some students. His lectures are literally the homework assignments so if you want to know how to do the homework, go to class! He is very transparent and has your best interest in mind.
Amazing teacher, he goes through the homework in class and makes sure you know what you're doing.

Honestly, one of the best math professors I've taken so far. He has a great sense of humor and explains the material in a way I can understand. I usually struggle with math but he made showing up to class enjoyable. He is strict with no phones out during class or tests, but that's for obvious reasons.

took Prof Aloi for summer 6 week course. Course was very fast pace but not too bad. He was very generous /lenient in his grading and very caring for his students. He has sense of humor unlike many professors. Had it not been a 6 week course in the summer of Cleveland aka good weather comes 3 months out the year my grade would have been better lol

Great and funny guy. Really looks at things from the students perspective and is very understanding. Is very strict with no phones during test but its for students benefits. Excellent teacher and explains material well.
THE BEST PROFESSOR EVERRRRRR
Its very strict

Prof. Aloi is a great teacher. He made the material easy to understand. Classes went smoothly and steady. He does an excellent job of explaining and teaching lessons. Go to class and keep up with the weekly homeworks and you should do well in the class.

Such a great professor. Makes things easy to understand and willing to help if necessary. He also is a funny guy so it lightens the mood! homework is online and easy. He gives 2 question "group quizzes" and also reviews for exams. You should not struggle with this class, but if you do he'll help! Overall a very easy class and a wonderful prof!! :)

One of the best professors Ive ever had. Havent rated a professor on here before but felt like I needed to for him. Hes so kind and takes his time to help you out if you are struggling (which you probably wont be). He doesnt ever make you feel stupid and hes just an all around fantastic professor and person. I love this man! Hes so joyful.

Professor Aloi is by far the best teacher I have ever had. I am usually not very good at math and I passed with an A. He explains everything very well and you can tell he really cares about his students. He is also quite funny and cracks jokes all the time. I recommend him for any math class you take!

This is my first semester at CSU and Professor Aloi is my favorite professor. He has a sense of humor and prepares you for the test. Do homework, unit reviews and you'll do great in his class. I want to take him for MTH149 but apparently he wont be teaching the class coming up semester:(.

Book and online code are essential. If you have questions/need help he'll help but is not good at sensing that certain students don't understand. When asked for further explanation, he usually just repeats the same thing he just said. Tests are fair but difficult. Fair grader. I'm proud of the grade I got b/c I had to work for it. Friendly enough.

I took the class this past summer in 5 weeks. Yes, the material is tough but Sameer is always there to help and cares for his students. Be sure to participate and develop a relationship with him and he will make sure you pass. Over all, great professor, explains topics clearly, and wants his students to pass!!

I took a 5 wk accelerated class & it is by far one of the worst class. He was mad with us  for taking the accelerated course.  He was angry when we asked for practice problems online or in class. He always left early and gave no office hour. Strangely he never gave an evaluation form.  AVOID him if you are interested in an accelerated class.

He is a great prof. I took two courses with him and wish I could take more with this prof. He is confident and knows the material so u will do well if u attended the class and do what he is expecting from u + he responds quickly to emails and cares about his students doing well. I hope CSU can have other professors like him.

You need to make sure you're there, communicate, participate, and make your presence felt. Throw a joke here and there, and stand out from the crowd for a good grade, like an A. if B works for you then just be there.
Will never take any class with him again if I can.

This professor is AWESOME. He is so understanding, funny, knowledgeable, doesn't load you down with work..I wish he taught more than just accounting. I can't believe I finally found such a great professor in the MBA program! You don't HAVE to attend class but it helps your grade at the end.

This prof. is a man! Quiz and homework every week. Exam questions are pretty much similar with the problem in the quizzes. Exam questions are 50 multiple choices+10 True or False. Study from the quiz and McGrawHill Learning, those would be helpful!Take with him! i highly recommend this guy!

Although his class is little bit boring, but he presents materials clearly and his grading is really fair. He also very open and re There will be homework and online quiz every week. The exams are not really difficult as long as you be familiar with the problems in the quiz and practice in connectplus. I highly recommend him!

This professor was on the part-time faculty and was not much help during semester. I took it online, which is probably the best option if are going to take this. The professor took forever to give you grades back and has really no explanation for the discussion posts that are due every week. If I did not take this online, it would have been worse.

lots of work, bought the book and didnt touch it all semester, only used the online stuff. he grades way too tough, takes off points for the smallest things, also the final grade is weighted in a way thats stupid so point wise you could think ur gonna finish w an A+ but after he does his dumb math youll have a B. hate that fr

Go to lectures. He gives you notes and you fill them out along with him while he explains everything. Great teacher. Great class. Easy grade. You have to go to class. HW is online. Quizzes and test in class

Altiere's Calculus 1 class is by far one of the easiest math classes I've ever had in school. He explains things so clearly and if you have any questions he will gladly answer them after class or during office hours. He's a calm dude and gives out reasonable extra credit
Professor Altiere is the guy to have for math 147, all quizzes and tests are open note! And he actually teaches and makes sure the class understands the material.

This guy is the GOAT. He is great. I love his notes. Man you will never feel lost because he is so clear. He lets you know what is up kyle. No what'd you say? You can just ask him and he will explain it better. Does a great job of giving you materials to succeed. Be sure to use them. Definitely, recommend.
If you show up to class and follow along with the notes, it's an easy A. All homework, quizzes, midterm, and final are open note and basically the same problems from the notes.

This guy is a great professor. Theres a quiz about once a week, but he will tell you what to expect. Theres four tests and one final. He has notes ready for you every day and you can just follow along and do the problems provided. He makes sure you arent lost in the weeds. Homework might seem cumbersome, but its easy points. 10/10 recommend.

John has a meaning for every lecture, and is fair with time, never extending class or starting early. Tests are easier than the "Cumbersome" homework you're assigned, as he always says. You can get extra credit if you complete the hw 2 days early than due, completely worth it, do the extra credit and the hw. I never spoke a word in his class.
Altiere makes every minute count in his class. He wastes no time from the second class starts, to when it ends. Has a great sense of humor. Also, gives great tips on prep days for exams.

The best teacher Ive ever had. You need to show up to class or you will fall behind. Straight to the point helps prepare for the test very well. His students do the best on the tests compared to the other sections. He has a unique sense of humor that I like, but not everyone is in love with. If you want to learn Calc and do well, take his class

He teaches very quickly and is easily annoyed with questions, so if math is not your strong suit I would suggest looking for another professor. If you can keep up, his lectures are very entertaining. His note handouts are easy to follow with plenty of examples and he does a great job of explaining the material.
if you know a professor better than him , take it ! he gets mad when ask him some questions after the class eventhough he says I'm glad if a student asks me !!! really !!
Strait forward teacher, helpful and kind

GO TO CLASS, hard to catch up if you don't. Exams aren't difficult, but he does take points off for the smallest things. Quizzes are usually 3-4 questions and open note. STRONGLY suggest taking notes in a notebook and leaving his handouts blank. For the test, review the blank handouts and try to solve them, checking answers from notes in notebook.

Professor Altiere is a good professor but he has an attitude sometimes when you ask him questions. He lets you use all of your notes and previous tests on quizzes and other exams. His class is an easy A if you show up and pay attention.
Loved the class, and the professor was really great, and funny sometimes.

Take this class if you want to REVIEW and not learn. Not recommended for those who are moderate to average or low on math skills. He teaches fast and doesn't go over problems after being asked questions. He tells the class to ask questions, but when you do, he gets mad. Wow, Really?

Everything is  open note and open book and he makes sure you understands his class and the topics he goes over. But when he gives out exams he tests you on things that he goes over very breifly in class, but on the test he expects you to know that topic in great detail. Also his tests are like 4 pg. long front/back (8 pages)and you only 1hr

Painful experience. I had to study with different tutors every week to figure what was going on in class. Provided no guidance and teaching is not his first priority. It seems like he wants to get through the material really fast instead of actually teaching it to the students.

MTH 181 is part of a coordinated course, meaning one person designs the coursework for all the sections. Altiere DOES teach fast but has to to get through all the material. I went to him several times after class or in his office and he was always very helpful with questions. This class is hard but its not because he is a bad teacher.
I wish he teaches 200 and higher levels, he's a really good Professor, don't let him go back to Mex!

Excellent prof, hilarious, lively and fun, makes it fun to learn! As long as you go to class (and you will want to) and do the homework you'll do great. There are lots of opportunities for extra credit. He uses personal experience to teach about culture, which makes it interesting. Absolutely awesome, if you have a choice, take him!
He is a wonderful professor. if you take spanish at CSU you have to have the David experience

Lectures were boring but professor is helpful and clear with his assignments. 5 exams-which he tells u what will be on it. Lowest exam score gets dropped or if u have an A before the final, you don't have to take it. Little homework assignments from the book, and a semester long HR plan on any business- He breaks it up into little sections.

I liked this class this semester however I felt like he is a knit picky grader.  The class is overall easy and he is easy going. We have 5 quizzes which were multiple choice and 1 quiz gets dropped, a semester long project of making an HR plan which was easy because we submitted the project in small sections, and a couple of homework assignments
DR.A is a very nice guy, this class was very easy to earn points, try to attend every class, do all the work and you should be fine. and don't give up on doing your presentation. This class is worthy

Very interesting class. A coupe homework assignments, all questions from the book. One group project which was super easy. Didn't even have to take the final, because I already had an A.  Highly recommend him.
Enjoyed this class. He tried to make it interesting. 1 Group project was not that bad. Study the power points, do the homework assignments and listen to lectures guarantees an A.

Professor Amsden is very knowledgable and always ready to teach. She is a little tough at times and makes you work for your grade, but it is worth it in the end when you realize how much you learned at the end of your rotation.  She provides her students with great learning opportunities and makes your clinical experience worth the effort spent.
She is a very interesting professor and knows what she is talking about. As long as you pay attention in class you will do well. She makes class discussion fun and enjoyable.

Great person and an excellent professor. I did not know anything about Biology before her classes. Everything is straightforward and pretty easy. I passed with my A without paying much attention to textbook. I enjoyed her way of teaching, and definitely would take BIO lab with her.

Kristy Amy is a really nice lady who obviously knows her stuff and you can really learn a lot from her but the class is kind of a mess. The expectations for some homeworks and the group project were sometimes unclear so you have to always ask her what exactly to do. Shes new though, so Im sure this will improve.

Joe is a really nice guy who cares about his students. No group projects or discussion boards which I think is a plus for online courses. Recorded lectures are detailed. There are lots of assignments due for this class. A good grade is attainable, but will require time and effort. Uses lockdown browser.

Joe is a really nice guy who cares about his students. No group projects or discussion boards which I think is a plus for online courses. Recorded lectures are detailed. There are lots of assignments due for this class. A good grade is attainable, but will require time and effort. Uses lockdown browser.

Very straight forward class with clear requirements. Semi-difficult material. Gives tips on what to study for midterm and final. Quizzes and exams are open book open note with ample time but requires lockdown browser so be prepared to have mic, webcam and another laptop or a tablet available if you use an ebook. Has speedy email replies.

He runs a standard online class how it should be. Lays out a clear weekly schedule, usually consisting of a DB and quiz unless its an exam week. He offers a good amount of extra credit at the end, enough to raise your grade almost a whole letter grade. Only negative is the quizzes and exams require a webcam and lockdown browser. I'd take him again.

3 tests, 100 points each. Graded on a curve. No assignments. Lecture was long and could get boring. He takes attendance, which counts towards your final grade. You must read your textbook and study hard! If you don't, you will have a very difficult time in his class. It's a grad level course, treat it as such. Good prof, just difficult material.
Dr. Anderson is the standard for professors. One word, Awesome. More than fair and he's on point with everything he does.

Avoid if possible Tough Grader. Curve is only 7% if you had a complete attendance, which  doesn't  really add anything to your final grade Super long test in such a short time. Pointless to have such a long test for such subject This is not from a bad experience, that is just the way it is.
Avoid if possible. He goes over only graphs in class (which are not on tests). Tests are hard and he asks for stuff that wasn't even discussed in class.

He is a super sweet man! His class is a little boring, but it adds to your grade so it's worth going. Just go to class and study for the exams and you should do well. He curves exams and adds 5% for attendance.

Anderson is super chill, he just lectures the entire time. Would've had a low B w/out the curve but ended with a solid A, so his curve on the tests and the 5% he adds to your final grade for attendance really helps out. Material itself is pretty boring, but near the end of the course it gets better. Review the book for exams. Highly recommend him!

Class is a little boring, but attending adds 5% to your final grade, so GO! He also added 12%-14% to everyone's exams. Such a nice guy, and if you read the book and slides, you will get a great grade. Wish I could take him again.

Read the book and attend all classes - you should do fine on the tests.  You will need to know the information stone cold.  Lot of memorization and application type questions.  He is very knowledgeable and you will like his class.  He is old school and writes notes on chalk board rather than using pwpt. or on line blackboard.

Structure of the class as follows: 3 tests, no extra credit or homework other than 4% bonus added for attendance at the end of the year. Would probably have been easier to sit through if I didnt have this class once a week for 3 hours, he seems to get carried away sometimes with stories. Overall though, a moderately easy course.

Jerry worked for the Federal Reserve before he retired, and knows how things really work.  He's a very interesting guy, and has a real passion for the Economics.  If you want to learn something, take his class.
Great guy and easy class
He is very knowlegdeable.

An absolutely fantastic professor. One of the VERY FEW professors at CSU, who actually know the material and explain it clearly. Tests are EASY and VERY FAIR (no stupid tricky questions). Also, has a VERY LENIENT grading system + curves a lot. EXCELLENT PROFESSOR!!!

He's very good at explaining the material but his tests are very difficult.  There is a curve, however, it's still difficult to earn a good grade even after reading each chapter and studying all the material.

This is the BEST professor in the Economics department! You couldn't have asked for better explanation of the material! Very clear, very straighforward, funny and very enthusiastic about the class. His exams are VERY fair and VERY easy. He also has a VERY easy grading system.

Dont listen to all these negative reviews. I would recommend taking Dr. Anderson!!! This professor is so unbelievably kind and caring. I always went to his help/tutoring sessions that he holds after class. He is so patient and truly explains the material exquisitely. One of the best professors I have ever had.

Dont listen to all these negative reviews. I would recommend taking Dr. Anderson!!! This professor is so unbelievably kind and caring. I always went to his help/tutoring sessions that he holds after class. He is so patient and truly explains the material exquisitely. One of the best professors I have ever had.

Dr. Anderson is the best chemistry professor youll have the pleasure of encountering. Everyone on here saying its hard or his lectures are confusing etc is merely lazy. If you're confused ask him for help and that's what got me an A. My tip to you is take notes, do all the practice problems and the online homework since those are the exam question

Puts too much time on one topic and loses you and doesn't tell you there's more than one way to do a problem but just put it all in one and also. its literally you do good on exams or you will fail the class!

He jumps from subject to subject in his lectures. Sample exams and study guides are nothing like the actual tests. The only time I understood some of the material was when i would go to his study sessions and work with him one on one. I would not want him as a professor again
His teaching is so confusing and half of the stuff on the homework and exams he doesnt teach in the lecture. I reccomend if you take this class go to the SI sessions or get tutoring.

Only PhD course at the whole university that's truly advanced. Hardest class I've ever taken but worth it. Exams require lots of memorization and he grades super harsh. Doesn't use traditional grading scale though so you'll pass. He put a lot of effort into the course and wrote the book for it. Has open office hours and always willing to explain.

Dr. Anderson is too smart to teach this freshmen level course, it makes it really hard for him to describe whats happening, his tests are hard but if you stay for his review before the test and do the pretest you will be good.

Dr Anderson is a great guy but he isn't a good professor. He's everywhere in his lectures & if he doesn't get to where he wants to be at the end of his 50 mins he rushes through the rest of the slides. There are 4 tests with study guides but they don't help, & an optional final, but you'll take it anyway since the class avgs on the tests are 60%

You need to work hard in this class to get a good grade, you can't just study the night before. He is very helpful if you ask him questions after hours. Also, every test he gives a 25-30 pg study guide which has everything you need to know. STUDY IT. You will pass if you do. Final is optional, so I suggest passing the 4 tests and skip the final.

Dr. Anderson was very helpful while I was in his class. He stayed late after class and held study sessions prior to test days. I really appreciated his help to go along with the tutors.. He did not brush me off. His assistance is what made me pass his course. Thank Dr. Anderson for your support.

AWESOME! CHM 251, Dr. Anderson gave comprehensive study guides for every exam (5). They were a life saver. Chem isn't my strongest subject, but his study guides literally spelled out everything you needed to know and how to do it. Go to class, the occasional SI session, do study guide, and do homework and you should do well. Lectures are a bit dull
Slow lectures. Confusing showing how to do work. Makes the test very hard. 5 exams, online hw, 1 final that drops 2 exams including hw (whichever is the lowest grade).

Just by looking at him you can tell he is a chemistry teacher. He is so sweet and always there for you. He is available when you need him and always gives you feedback. He also responds to emails quickly.

His study guides are much appreciated, since they contain all the material that will be on the test in depth. I also like how he spends two days reviewing before the exam. He cares about his students, and sometimes I think he over explains the material, which doesn't hurt. His exams are straight forward and never confusing. Si  sessions also help.
Dr. Anderson thoroughly discusses each topic. He almost explains things too much, but is extremely helpful. The final is optional, but can replace your lowest test score.

Lectures are long and painful. Exam days are the same, complete with yelling over seating arrangements and a bunch of different versions of the same test. The average grade is a D, and he will not curve any tests. Doing the homework is a great study tool, as is the practice test and extensive study guides he makes. Many SI sessions also

I respect Dr. Anderson a lot. His class was very difficult for me and he's an avid powerpoint user. He gives a lot of difficult online homework that is time sensitive, so be organized. The exams are pretty challenging. BUT he gives awesome study guides/ practice problems AND holds review sessions on his own time. He is really nice and approachable.

Dr. Anderson is very nice and helpful if you go directly to him.  His exams are hard, with averages in the 50-60 range. He does not curve exams. Homework is online with set due dates, and they are hard and confusing.  I advise attending all after class study groups or getting a personal tutor. If you do not attend class you will fall far behind.

Anderson is HORRIBLE professor. This is an INTRO to organicbio chemistry. We were taught and tested on AP concepts. Half the class dropped half way through. Average Scores on exams are 54-highest 67. He is okay with that too. Does not care if you understand the material. Hardest class ever taken; pick another teacher or another school.

The lectures can sometimes be dull, becauseThe concepts are kind of difficult. However, Anderson is a GREAT teacher. Always helping. Pay attention in class and should have no problem getting a B. Stays after class to answer questions, and will take your questions and make sure you are satisfied. Cares deeply.

She may lecture slow, but that is life. Some people speak fast and go fast while others value the essence of time and UNDERSTANDING. If you do not understand she is ALWAYS there to get a clear understanding.  She works with each of her students to the best fit and I would say, she is one of the best/perfect professors.
She talks at you for an hour and a half and doesnt help you know what to study and gets mad when you dont know the material. Horrible class!!!
Just okay, somewhat boring
She is great; was very helpful to me. She helped me to get through the classes.

A nightmare.  Does not return assignments in a timely manner.  Grades randomly.  Unclear instructions.  Rambles.  Does not reply to emails/doesn't check her email.  No one should have to put up with this.
Unclear assignments, becomes easily agitated with students who attempt to get clarification regarding projects, lectures are hard to follow, the most frustrating grad school experience I've had.
No Comments

Dr. Anderson is a wonderful professor. His soft voice does throw you off at first but he is very knowledgable and interesting. Don't take this class if you aren't interesting in Literature. I would recommend him. He is willing to make exceptions for students as long as they have a good reason.

I think he's a great professor. Yes, he does talk very softly and it can get really boring if you're not interested in the subject. But he knows so much! He has bent over backwards for me - emailing me his notes on a lecture when I was sick and giving extensions. He grades easily too!

Aw, I actually really like him.  I find that his facts enhance the material and bring a better understanding to the texts.  He has a good sense of humor and he definitely knows his stuff, down to word origins et al.  He will take questions, you just have to sit in front and ask.  He tends to trail off in a quiet voice, but he tries once he knows.

Useless professor, this guy knows his stuff but has NO idea how to bring it down to the student's level. Instead of helping us through the text, he lectures & spouts off fancy terms and historical references- none of which appear on the test. Don't take his class if you enjoy literature, because by the end, you won't any more!
Do yourself a favor and take her class. As an elective or requirement, IT DOESN'T MATTER. Her classes are the easiest and super low maintenance. Little to no work.
Do yourself a favor and take her class. As an elective or requirement, IT DOESN'T MATTER. Her classes are the easiest and super low maintenance. Little to no work.

Gretchen is a great professor! You can tell that she really cares about her students. She makes sure that everyone understands what is being taught and is available to assist anyone at any time during the day. She's a great professor!
Just take her class. Thank me later. Easiest A at CSU (tests online, extra credit in class essays, hates essays over 1 page, no hw). Amazing.

Being online during the pandemic has been hard, but professor Andreani went above and beyond for her students. She gives very clear and concise homework and papers, and is always available to answer questions and help out if you need it. She kept blackboard updated and communicated with us on a regular basis. I wish all my professors were like her.

Being online during the pandemic has been hard, but professor Andreani went above and beyond for her students. She gives very clear and concise homework and papers, and is always available to answer questions and help out if you need it. She kept blackboard updated and communicated with us on a regular basis. I wish all my professors were like her.

When I say Teresa is the best professor I have had in my time at CSU I am not over exaggerating. Not only is the topic interesting, she makes the class extremely enjoyable and fun. Not only does she care about class she cares about each and every one of her students. She memorizes everyone's names and is always available to meet outside of class.

She is amazing for Psych of Women and she has some great lectures in Social Psych too although it is more text and exam driven but I enjoy all the material and the way she presents it all. She is such a gem and kind person, I do not think there was not a class that she didn't make the class smile or laugh!

Amazing professor, she was having a rough time during the semester I took her, but she took into considerations her issues as well as those of the students. She takes attendance but the class is interesting, so why skip? Overall do what is asked and you will be fine.
awesome professor, very understanding and nice. Has awesome guest speakers that come in. Its an overall interesting course because of her.

Professor Andreani may in fact be the best professor I have ever had. She care about her students and it passionate about what she teaches. I would take any class she teaches. I took so much away from her class.

Teresa is hands down my favorite professor EVER and not just because she is in my field of major. She is genuinely funny, nice, caring, and helpful to ALL. She does assign papers but they are easy if you give a good and thoughtful reflection. She does class activities but they are engaging and FUN! She has some guest speakers that come in!

Great teacher. Very laid back and funny. Material was only semi-interesting but I liked to go to class because I enjoyed it. Attendance is not completely necessary. You can skip a few times. Easy assignments and she honestly cares about her students. She attends their plays and volleyball games. Really nice person.

Overall great experience with professor Andreani. Laid back, cool teacher that doesn't want to pressure students. Only assigns a few assignments throughout the semester along with two midterms and a final, which she gives power point study guides for. Very easy class. If you want a class where you can chill, take her.

I love her! She cares about what's going on in your life and she explains concepts in everyday language. She gives 4 response pages over the course of the semester, 1-2 pages in length each. Her tests are straightforward and she hates when you call her anything other than Teresa. Highly recommended! I got an A in her class
Teresa is a wonderful professor! She creates an engaging learning environment and wants you to pass. You have to seriously try in order to fail this class.   Highly recommend!
I took child development psych with her.  Extremely easy class- she wants you to pass.  Attendance not mandatory, tests are easy.  She helps you review the important stuff.
Probably the best professor I've had.  She is extremely nice and easy going - she obviously loves her students and wants everyone to have a fair chance at an A.  I'm taking her again this fall!

Great Teacher! Her classes are full of information as well as 2 great guest speakers that really added to the semesters subjects.  She makes the tests pretty easy as long as you pay attention and study a little.

Professor Andreani is one of the most helpful teachers I have ever had. She makes it clear what she expects from you as a student and is always available when you need her. She is hilarious and tries her best to make the class exciting and enjoyable. I would highly recommend her as a professor.
Great professor! Very helpful and is always there for you. Loved her class and her lectures! Would definitely take a class with her again.

She is an excellent teacher and very likable. She is very understanding and supportive. I really enjoyed her class and thought it was interesting. The tests and papers are incredibly easy. Don't bother buying the book. Class isn't mandatory, but it's worth going to. I got an A easily.

Amazing Professor! Is very understanding and gives a lot of chances for extra credit on the tests. Super laid back but she still teaches you the information that you need to know. Attendance isn't mandatory but she asks a lot of questions right from the lectures! I got a B. All i did was attend class and review the study guide that she gives us!

Teresa is a very understanding professor who cares about all of her students. Lectures are interesting, assignments  and tests are (for the most part) very straightforward, and she is always willing to help.
Teresa is a great teacher. She is very helpful and enjoys what she does. The class was very easy and also enjoyable. I recommend her as an instructor. She is hard not to like.
I took Dr. Andrei for 406 and 408 online. She is simply an amazing instructor. Participation truly does matter in her class. She is so caring as well. I will defiantly be taking more classes of hers.

Dr. Andrei is a great prof! She's very knowledgeable about TESOL and answers any questions in detail. Class is laid out well, but there are only discussion boards + 3 other assignments. Do the reading and you'll be fine. There is a partner project, but it isn't bad and doesn't have to be done face to face. Looking forward to taking her class again!
Very clear expectations and great feedback. Really tries to connect with students, even through online format. Enjoys being available to students in person as well.
A teacher of teachers! She is extremely clear as to expectations and gives lots of excellent feedback. I learned a lot from her and can't wait to take another class with her.
She was awesome. Take her class!
She is an amazing lecturers but you have to work hard with her and submit the assignment in time.

LOVE Rachel. I had her for both pop bio lab and animal bio lab, she is extraordinary. By far one of the only TAs at CSU that actually helps the students succeed in both the lab and the course! She answers emails very quickly, and is always willing to help outside of class. Make sure you takes notes, what she says is very important for the quizzes.

Rachel is the only TA at Cleveland State who has ever helped me with classes. She answers every single email almost immediately, answers every question in class, makes lectures fun, and will do anything to help you pass. Show up to class, do your assignments, and you will pass.

Rachel is a lab TA at CSU. She's well versed in the Biology department, and is willing to help you with anything lab related. BIO305 is an easy A, as long as you're doing your lab reports and studying (mildly) for your quizzes. Would definitely recommend her.

Its a research methods class, it will be dry, and he tries to make jokes. Overall, he means well, offers a lot of extra credit on exams, however there are not to many grades, reading is suggested but is not necessary.
Easy class for the most part, but she is an attendance and participation nazi. Be prepared to be treated like a kid, even though your in a 300-level college class.
very good professor

This class in known to be difficult and she makes it way more difficult. She is very very disrespectful and doesnt care at all about if you understand or not you are basically on your own. She grade homework and exams with so much details that you would lose many points for little things that doesnt actually matter. Take it with someone else.

Gave us one day to complete a five hour homework assignment and was confused as to why nobody finished it. Nobody asks questions in class because they know they will just get disrespected by her during the answers. Audibly sighs when people don't answer her vague questions during lectures

I learned more from chegg than lecture. Speeds thru lecture/slides. "I go fast so you learn to take notes fast"-Ao. This counterproductive to learning. Withdrew once, C next semester, no teaching improvement. First time I withdrew due to uncertainty. The TA's weren't helpful. She seem frustrated w/ me @ office hours. Exams tip; equations > answers
very good professor
terrible professor. Required extremely perfection in homework or she will take out your point. Would never take her again

Avoid if possible. Her grading system is wack. You can get the right answer doing the problem a different way and you will still lose points. She gives examples in class, but she won't go over them, so you have no clear examples in your notes. For exams, pay attention to homework problems and the class examples she gives you, look it up on Chegg.

The class is hard, she answers questions VERY well. Grading on tests is rough though but that's why the grading scale is skewed, there is no curve. Yes, 55% is a C but you have to earn every bit of that C trust me. Out class averages were in the 50-60's one time it was 64 and she said we did so well. ALSO 1 quiz every week. EVERY WEEK.

Geyou Ao is too smart to teach fluid mechanics. Most of the lectures are spent wasting time on pointless derivations of formulas and equations and never any time spent on meaningful examples. I've never had to use Chegg before in my life until I took her fluid mechanics class. The tests are nearly impossible as well. A 55% is still a C though.

A very good professor. The course material was somewhat difficult but she made it easier to understand. Yes, there are pop quizzes but she usually tells you what they're going to cover at the beginning of class, and she is a fair grader.

Basically just puts textbook notes on the board. The concepts behind equations are not explained well, as well as how we got there mathematically. I feel I have learned nothing from the course, yet received a B grade. A 55% in the course is still a C. So you can absolutely get through it, but be ready to Chegg and learn nothing in the process.

This women is the best in a tough major she is a silver lining she knows A LOT &her courses are fair I hate when people complain because they have to do work like what did you expect? when you look at classes &college in general the best profs are the ones that are fair graders, passionate about their work and caring she is like a mom shes a gem

She knows her stuff but my god does she go fast. If you lose focus for even a second you could miss important information. She teaches off of slides but doesn't actually project them so print them out or pull them up. She teaches the class assuming everyone has database experience even though database isn't a prereq. Lots of group work.

Dr. Appan is probably one of the most understanding professors I have had in the IT Dept. I missed an exam due to my own incompetency and she worked with me to make it up. She even rounded my grade 2 percentage points which gave me an A at the end of the semester. There was a lot of homework, but this is a summer online class so that's expected.
it is hard to get good grades almost every one in the class have same grades

Online classes tend to be easy, and Dr. Appan's class was no different. Read the chapters, answer questions from the book in the discussion board, tests/quizzes answers are all from the book. Very fair grader, easy A but the textbook is very informative and you learn a lot. Recommend, at least for this class.

I took an online class where she presided, and I had to attend office hours for her to actually teach me the material for Business Analysis.  Things are radically different with an in-class setting, though.  I attend every class, and I am learning the material and I'm getting an "A. " in Systems Analysis.  The semester is not over yet.
The class has too much information to pass along to students to be offered in an online session during a compressed summer half-semester.

Basically you have 2 tests, a quiz for each chapter, and must talk a bit in the discussion forum for each chapter with your classmates. There's a few short writing assignments and a couple longer ones. Its not a thrilling subject, but the class wasn't too hard.

Pretty straight forward class. Complete assignments, make discussion posts and take the exams on time. Group project is time consuming but not bad if you have a good group. Horrible textbook but that is not his fault I guess.
I really enjoyed her class. Dr. Apan is well prepared for her class and makes the class interesting and hands on. Not an easy A but one of the best classes I took at CSU.
Talks too fast. Very research oriented. I was so lost in this class.

Took this class online. Group project was a pain, but she grades pretty easy. Material was awful, but I guess that's not her fault. She was a very helpful, understanding teacher. If you had a problem with your group she'd take care of it. Tests were pretty basic. If you're "forced" to take this class for your major, she's probably your best bet.

This class was online & pretty easy, but I could see it being awful if your group isn't on top of the ball since Appan gets much of the points from group work. Luckily the group I was in was solid. I recommend getting into a group early, as those people tend to be the most on top of things and proactive. The tests and discussions werent bad either.

I gave her a 3 on easiness bc of the tests and amount of papers. Theres only a midterm and a final w/out a study guide which makes it a little hard. Also there were 3 written assignments you have to do with your group. Theyre not hard but its not a WAC class. You can get away with not reading for the discussions but youll pay the price on the tests
Fairly easy class. A little to much group work for a online class. The big project is a little tough but the test weren't to bad.

I took this class over the summer online. Very easy. Just post at least 2 comments for full credit of the hw. Tests were MC and easy, right out of the textbook. Project took some time but not to hard. Passed the class with an A. Recommended!
I took an online class with her and it was extremely easy. Just do your work and have it done when it is due and you should not have a problem getting a passing grade.
A pleasant enough professor but she really does not have grasp on what happens in the real IT world.  Very academic and research orientated.

Had this professor for online class.  Grades pretty easy.  The end of class project was hard and although a sample was provided, students had to travel to campus to view on site only and were not permitted to photo copy.  Kind of defeats the purpose of taking course online if I have to drive to campus anyway.

Very interesting professor. Alway prompt to class and always well prepared.Her knowledge of Business and the IT industry along with her organized structure teaching methods presents the classroom materials in such a way that we can be successful in setup and guiding a business to be successful in the 21st centrury. Well worth the classroom experien

This class is incredibly easy but just just as difficult to get through because of all the redundant information and pointless lectures. Not only is Appleton one of the most pretentious entry level professors at Cleveland State, but his blatant disrespect shown for students is evident from the first day of class. Easy A, but youll be bored.

Very easy class if you  have the right professor. I missed class all the time and managed to pass with a B+. He gives study guides and is very helpful. I never used the book so don't bother buying it .He also give alot of extra credit

His class is so easy. The discussions will show up on the test. The quizzes are super easy. I recommend studying the study guide and using the online notes as an aid. Read before class so that you can take part in the discussions. This will help you incase you need a curve or favour. You do not need the notes and there are tones of EC opportunities

Although the class is some what interesting I wouldn't call it a psychology class. Talk abut a lot of controversial topics but never get down the psychology behind them. We have to get together in "thinking pairs" which I don't like. As long as you show up you can get at least a B. Take notes on his lectures for quizes.

I really liked this professor and enjoyed his class. It's only journal entries and 4 quizzes, so it's pretty easy. The only downsides were having the group conversatioms, if you are shy it is not the class for you. Attendance is mandatory if you want an A. Also, don't buy the book I never even opened it and received an A...

Class was interesting to say the least. Professor Appleton is funny and passionate about the course content. Showing up to class and paying attention will get you a good grade, taking notes and preparing for tests will get you an A for sure. No textbook is also a big plus!

Challenging and eye opening topics covered. there is a lot of self reflecting with journal entries. lots of interesting group discussions don't be shy or afraid to speak up. instructor is very helpful, knowledgeable, and definitely enthusiastic about the subject. I thoroughly enjoyed the class and I highly recommend it to any Psychology   student.

Certainly a great class to enroll if you are looking for light course work. Attendance and participation are 90% of your grade. If you are quiet and dobn't like speaking in large groups might be the wrong class to attend.

Simple & easy class. Must attend. Class is 98% discussion based off book & postings on BB. Two out-of-class assignments/papers. No exams. You write a daily journal. Nice & easy going guy but I was disappointed he wouldn't bump my 89.98 to a 90. Controversial topics were covered, very interesting class! All you have to do is skim articles & show up.

Great class, interesting subject matter, wonderful instructor. There are a lot of articles, great group discussions, and two 'cultural excursions' that are required. Professor is very helpful, understanding, and laid-back. I highly recommend this class!

He is a very laid back guy and easy to approach if you have questions, comments, concerns. The class was great. The topics covered are very interesting, there were plenty of group discussions and there were two outside class assignments.

Was a difficult class in regards to topics. With that being said he was a the right teacher to teach it. I like that it was hard to tell some of his political leanings. I would suggest this class for those who just want to explore other cultures (class,sex/gender,status, and etc) so if you don't want to go there don't take this class.

Laid back class with tons of group discussions. Uses text book and also assigns readings on BB. Most importantly he asks us what we think and not just what we know. Wrote 2 papers and did a short presentation. I though it was a GREAT CLASS!

Intro to psych is a class you definitely need to work for, but its totally worth it.  Prof Arendt gives you all the tools and you just have to choose to use them.  She even teaches the class  how to study at the beginning of the semester.

Annoying! Shes too opinionated & will talk for 1 minute on a concept, then 10 minutes on her personal beliefs on it. She lectures on the WRONG chapter almost every class. she forgot when our paper was due. (We all still turned it in) and she contradicts herself with the teaching practices she teaches, and what she actually does!
great teacher with wonderful experiences to share

she is an amazing prof, wants to reach every student she has. It is only mid way though and already learned a great deal of how to be prepared for my classroom and praxis. Would take any class possible with her.
tough, fair, cares
Expects us to read to much. keep track of our own stuff. Could have been worse. She seems to care but is to into school.
Very tough but cares. Fair. Wants you to learn. Expects you to be a serious students but tries to have some fun.

She always pronounces "Persepolis" incorrectly, which is annoying. Constantly stresses the importance of organization but is not very organized. Rarely hands work back. She can be funny and tells some stories.

A nice woman, but a terrible teacher.  She frequently was unfamiliar with the material we were covering.  Also disorganized.  Maybe she just needs more practice.  I did think she had a sense of humor and respect for her students.
Not a bad class, a lot of group work, she is nice but can be boring!
A caring teacher
Awful and pointless class. Make sure you try and test out if possible
Very disorganized! She gave assignments and wasn't clear on the directions which made the class more confusing and stressful than it had to be!
Norma is an exceptional instructor, with a genuine concern for her students.  I considered this class to be well worth the time, despite my lack of love for the multi-site distance learning format.

The class is required and boring but she made it tolerable.  Let us do some on line, no busy work. Prof.Arendt helped anyone that needed help otherwise left you alone.  The way college should be!  Great teacher.
Great instructor.  Makes you work but you learn alot!  She needs to teach more classes.
Yikes! Not organized.  Get it together honey, you're making us look bad.

Has no idea what she is talking about. Always blames someone else when technology doesn't work (she doesn't know how to use it.) Giving CSU a very bad reputation. Not a people person. Should not be a teacher
Professor was a bit strict with grading final paper that was 65% of grade. Responds to emails, assignments are pretty easy. Whole class is surrounded by final paper. Not hard for an online class.
Show up to class, do 4 easy assignments, one final paper and that it you will get an A. Dr. Arendt is by far my favorite professor in CSU

One of the best HSC professors in CSU, this class was very flexible and stress-free because of professor Arendt unique teaching style. if you show up to the class and do the work there is no reason to get any lower grade than A-. highly recommended I have taken two courses with her and by far  she is the best professor I had.

Hopefully she got fired. She was extremely rude and condescending. She was consistently late to clinical. She was extremely unorganized. She also didn't have an ounce of knowledge (did't even know how to take a blood pressure). I fell behind quickly with peers. Thanks for nothing but a worthless semester.
Good luck.

I really enjoyed having professor Arko. I took her online EDL 301 class and it was a little overwhelming at times with all the activities we had, but she gives you a week to complete all assignments. She always responds to emails immediately and she gives great feedback on all graded assignments

I really enjoyed having professor Arko. I took her online EDL 301 class and it was a little overwhelming at times with all the activities we had, but she gives you a week to complete all assignments. She always responds to emails immediately and she gives great feedback on all graded assignments

Professor Arko is one of the best professors I've ever had. I was failing her class because I was going through personal issues and after reaching out to her, she made every effort and then some to see that I pass. I would love to have her again and I wish all professors were like her! I can tell she really cares about my performance! 10/10!!!

Pulls all his questions from books and power point word for word the problem is he will pull questions from the book he didnt cover in the power point he expects you to memorize each page of the book in order to do well on his quiz. Lastly another comment was right he trys to pull a fast one on the first hw assignment do the end review for credit

This guy is the worst professor i have taken including my time at community college. This guy has the worst structure of a course i have ever seen. Firstly pay attention on the labs bc the very first lab everyone loses at least 20% make sure you do the review at the end of the lab and dont miss a single question. And his quizzes are impossible

Get ready to read. When you think you've read the chapter well enough, read it again. Literally all of the exams are from the chapter and power points, so it's really up to you whether you do well or not.

Absolutely bewildering how he hasn't been canned yet. Each class consists of a mindless lecture reciting the slides, but don't worry; even if you pay attention, it won't help come time for his "anything goes" style "quizzes" that consist of 30+ questions. You're better off just reading the book, but of course attendance is part of the grade..

Arndt is awful, but he is the only professor teaching this class for the foreseeable future, so here's how to pass: read every chapter word-for-word. Twice. His lectures are 75 minutes of monotonous slide-reading and are of no help in digesting the material. "Quizzes" are an absurd 50 questions long. Attendance is now 10% of your grade as well.

This guy is a piece of work let me tell you. his 4 "quizzes" are 50 question each and he doesn't give you anything specific to study just read. his final is 100 questions DON'T go to his class he is monotone and very very quite you cant hear a word he says &he grades with how he likes students so if you ever challenge him youll drop a letter grade
Very Strong in Knowledge. Opt his course if and only if you have good C language skills.
Let's put it this way: you arndt a good teacher.
Kind and understanding. Powerpoint-based classes.

Very inconsistent tests. Learn about images, audio, and video, questions on test about who invented the internet. PowerPoints are not helpful, they're structured poorly, even have misspelled words. Tough assignments with no help. Boring class, feels like the teacher doesn't really want to be there.
It is hard to guess what kind of questions he may ask, it is all surprise. His class is boring
So complicated, his exams are test, you can not know where those questions comes from. Such a boring lectures.

Recited from PowerPoint. Knowledgeable about the subject (graduate Computer Architecture), but not very effectual at transferring his knowledge to the class. He was vague when telling us what would be on tests, often telling us they would not have math and they would have math anyway (and I didn't copy the formulas to my note card).

only goes over ppt, and keep you responsible from text books which he never opened it during the class and ppt slides that he skipped. very poor grading, and hard confusing test, give assignments which he never teach, it is your responsibility to rearch and do it.
You would learn nothing from this professor. Refused to give any credits for solving a problem using my own method. Avoid taking this class with this professor at all costs
Just reciting from PPTs. No knowledge of the Subject undertaking. Totally incompatible with the subject.
a useless class
not helpful
A very nice professor.
Excellent instructor, challenging homework, very interesting class.

For the amount of timed weekly quizzes there was you'd think it was an online course. Lectures were so dull. Lecture slides are brief. Adds unnecessarily info that confused most. She gives you a study guide for exams (midterm & final) and yet still makes certain Q's unnecessariy confusing . Also 2 easy papers. Interesting material made boring.
Lectures are horribly boring and his outlines don't make sense. Expects you to take your own notes but doesn't hint what's important. His midterm and final were absurdly hard for an intro class.
Gives a lot of details. Tends to jump ahead or get off topic.

Talks about current events in the beginning of every class. Hard core democrat, loves to make fun of Bush and republicans. Lectures are very dry, and I ended up studying for tests not with my notes, but by reading the assigned text multiple times. I wouldn't recommend, but if you do take it, read the book!

Good guy overall, but a poor instructor. Claims background as an Economic Historian and routinely gets dates and events wrong or switched up. Went over entire Civil War in one class period. Essays were fun, but his teaching skills are negligible and military overviews during the wars are almost nil. Very disappointing.
Good professor, but I'm not taking history classes to debate political standings.  Everyday he starts the class complaining about President Bush and how horrible Republicans are.
Good guy, but bad teacher.  His tests are in essay form, but he is fair when it comes to grading.  If you take him, just stick it out and you will do better than expected.

Really knowledgable prof., but I think you have to like History to enjoy the class.  Talks about current events before starting class.  Midterm and final are both short answers and essays.  I'd take a class he was teaching again for sure!
Very knowledgable. Good teachingability. Class relatively easy but informative and informal. Highly recommend. He actually jumbles dates and numbers.

Dan is an awesome professor. Quizes and Exam are right from the notes. He loves to talk about current events for the first part of class and the rest of the lecture is more of a story. You can tell he loves what he does and actually cares.
funny liberal who lectures like he is telling a story. nice guy though
Extremely bright and knowledgeable, but comes across dry and a little uneasy.  Thank God for coffee!

He is interesting and knowledgable about his subject matter.  His lectures reflect heavily his background in labor history but that is not to say that he omits political and cultural history in his lectures.  He is open to discussion, especially about the assigned books, and his political commentary, though sarcastic, is pretty much right on point.

Lectures were kind of boring. He gets off topic sometimes. Tests are easy if you listen in class and read book. Used overheads as guidelines. Midterm and final difficult as they are 4 mini essays and one big essay.

She can be very kind, but definitely was not my favorite professor. She's extremely confusing and fumbles over her words. She grades tough and is sort of rude when you ask for help but she does indeed help out. The books in this class aren't really necessary. You have the internet for all that.

Media Writing definitely should not be called Media Writing. It's more about news reporting and journalism. Lori Ashyk is very knowledgeable but can be very confusing. She sometimes contradicts the lessons and it's hard to follow her when she speaks in a very monotone voice.  She is a caring teacher who wants you to do well. read and pay attention.
Good teacher...Wish more teachers would relax and just talk to the students like people. It's hard to fai his class! limitless extra credit avaliable. Will be missed when he retires :(
Dr. Aspelin will be retiring next year so if you have a chance to take one of classes before then, do.  He is a very kind, knowledgeable, enthusiastic, and helpful professor.   A+

Great teacher! Very nice, and informative. Lectures occasionally dragged on, but issued 5 quizzes throughout the semester and that was it - no midterm/final. Has actually studied and lived with the tribes he talked about, and did a good job doing it. Would recommend.

I've taken a couple of different classes with him. He's so nice, and is willing to work with you if you are absent or need some sort of accommodation. He treats his students like adults, and understands that we have lives besides class.
Dr. Aspelin is one of the kindest, calmest, and most intelligent professors CSU has to offer. Definitely take one of his classes. Loved Native South Americans!

He has no sense of time at all.  Our first test was given five weeks into the semester which was fine. However when our second test was pushed back more than a month it became too much information to learn/keep straight. Would not recommend to other students.
Dr.Aspelin,U are awesome!!Your mom did a great job!! She is awesome!!

I took his 4.5 hour Saturday class of ANT 351 this past summer and it was an adventure to say the least! Aspelin is very friendly, funny and knowledgeable, but can be a bit dry as all Anthropology professors and Anthropology can be. The class was definitely a benefit to my knowledge and interest, though. I learned A LOT about Native North Americans
hes a nice guy, but dont count on the extra credit to boost your grade that much. doing well on the exams is what really counts!

Compassionate academic.  True scholar and educator.  Five stars.  Native North and So. Americans are both exceptional classes.  Cool film(s), live lectures, decades of experience, little debate, open line of communication.  Caring and considerate.  Extra credit is unlimited.  Nothing but love.

one of the nicest teachers ever. very smart guy too. no homework, 7 30 pt quizzes based on readings (which you have to do because the readings can be difficult). no papers. offers tons of EC, and the pts count as % pts. onto your final grade. so you can do well if you give some effort. overall he is a great guy with a lot of experience

Aspelin was great, very entertaining if you dont mind anthropolofy in the first place. Attendance doesnt count but will help because you watch a lot of videos, and those are heavy on the exams. Read the chapters and do one of the big extra credit projects (i wrote about my garbage for four days!) and you will get an A. lots of little e.credit too
Nice guy. Makes multiple choice exams very difficult...does not show your true knowledge of the course material. He will help you if you take the iniative come to him.
If you don't mind a person who rambles and goes off on tangents then Asplin makes old dead things really fun

Class consists of going over slides and is basically pointless because you still won't know what is going on. When you ask her questions she tries her best to explain herself but if you don't get it she'll move on. She talks so fast you don't even know what you don't know. Tests are very hard and she adds so many questions so you wont even finish.

Does not take attendance, but is is pretty much mandatory in order to pass. Each class is her going over the slides, + at the end she hands out a worksheet that you do together + will very much help you on the exams! She lets you have a one sided cheat sheet for the first 2 exams + a double sided one for the Final, which is all multiple choice.

I had her for both business statistics. She makes sure you learn the material well with her powerpoints in class. She goes over many examples in class to make sure you understand. She lets you use a cheat sheet on all the exams, even the final. Final is multiple choice while all other exams are not.

Prof is very nice and cheery. She a good job at explaining material. Does not take attendance. No extra credit. I would definitely recommend taking this class for BUS 201. The materials is complicated as expected. You need the access code.

Used Megastat in class but not allowed on tests? Don't understand that, but her reviews somewhat helped with tests. She allows cheat sheets for them which was nice, but tests were still pretty difficult in my opinion. She gives pop quizzes instead of taking attendance, but literally gives everyone an A if you try.
Shes an okay professor, if your looking for an easy A this is not the professor for you. Mike is the easiest and the best IMO

She's the best stats professor i've had. Her lectures for the first 30 minutes of class are boring; however, she does an example for everything. She does a review day before the test and goes over all the problems that will be on it. Her accent is hot too

Easy professor. She gives handouts to students, and a review too. If you study handout and review very well and practice them few times, you can easily get an A. The handouts and the review are considered short in length. Most people in my class were not happy with her because she came as a substitute for the original professor, but she was EASY!!

Explains well, but an oxy moronic sys.. In class labs are taught on mega stat,that you cant not use for exams? Nothing is taught on a calculator. Calc allowed for exams but if u dont show work you dont get credit. HW/labs  20% (i had B/A avg) of grade. So, if you dont do well on exams (80% of grade) you will not pass!

This class can be tough if you are not good at math because 70-80% of it is math based. But she will curved the test if she has to and she allows you to use a formula sheet on the test so thats a plus. She is also easy to understand and she brung us some candy for the final, so thats a winner in my book, lol.
Amazing funny and very easy to understand. Although attendance is not mandatory, she gives pop up quizzes. She'd be easier on you if you attend. Great person. I'd go out of my way to take her again

Ataseven is a fine professor. She's kind, and does her best to explain the material. She always makes sure the entire class is following along before she moves on to new material. Not much homework, so the exams mean alot. Overall I'd recommend her.

Professor Ataseven is an excellent professor that wants to see everyone understand her lectures. She does get frustrated when people ask for extra credit or about curving the exams, but I don't blame her for that. She doesn't take attendance but she has random labs that are really good to boost your grade.  Work hard and study outside of class!
Very nice professor! She goes over the material many times to make sure everyone understands it. Stats is hard but she is there for you. As long as you make an effort, she'll help you.

She allows you to use a formula sheet and she is an attractive teacher (only 34). But does she moves too fast and lose her temper to often when you ask questions. If you take her you will have to work on your own bigtime outside of class to get an A in her class. But she is still the second best teacher (after Dr. Johnson) for Stats.

this class is a very hard class and ms. Ataseven is a nice professor but she moves very fast across a lot of the material so just make sure to keep up. compared to the other professors everyone said she was one of the better ones but the class still isn't easy. she gives reviews before the test that are very helpful make sure to be there.

She is a great Prof and loves the material! Lectures are long but involve a lot of examples and great power points! She allows a self-made cheat sheet for every exam that are manageable. You don't need the book! Took her this semester again for Osm202! Absolutely recommend her!
Good Professor, Gives Studyguides (Lengthy)

Good professor. The material starts pretty easy but be ready to work later on. Attendance not taken but lectures will help very much & she gives a handout for each chapter that isn't posted online. I didn't use the book once during the semester because she provides slides & explains them in detail during class. Very nice & reasonable.

The professor uses Mindtap with the book. Its a good way to learn the material needed for tests and quizzes. Study the quizzes for the tests. She will help out if you need it. I hope all my professors at CSU are this good.
She is knowledgeable of the subject. Clear with what to expect in tests.

This teacher is awful. You basically will need to teach yourself if you take her class. She doesn't explain anything, she never responds to any email questions ever, and her tests are worded in a way that set you up for failure. Not a good or helpful professor at all!! And everything is done through McGraw Hill-she doesn't grade or write a thing!
She is helpful and understands that some students need extra help when it comes to the material
Dr. Athari is very knowledgeable of the subject. She takes time in class to go over examples and questions so students have a better understanding of material.
Very good professor. Uses a lot of youtube in his lectures

This guy rocks!  I had him for Differential Equations and he made the class a real cakewalk.  Pay attention and do practice problems when you can.  His exams closely mirror the quizzes so study those when he passes them back to you.  He gives out an answer formula when he passes them back so keep them for the final!  Recommend 9/10!

lost all our homework. gave everyone in the class an incomplete. never in his office. doesnt answer emails. doesnt make due dates for homework and projects clear. was looking forward to this class and ended up extremely disappointed because of the lackadaisical attitude of the professor
Very helpful with a very approachable personality.  Very interesting lectures and fields all questions very professionally.
Awesome professor must keep up with the work assignments.  Ver easy going prof
very easy going

I love Jet Force Gemini. That example he included in lecture was awesome.

When I went to take my midterm and it cut out on me, so I emailed her and she told me that she would open it up for me one time. I decided that I would try a different spot that would have better wifi, and it still cut out, and I was using the same program and everything for all of my other homework and quizzes and didn't have any problem.

This is one of those professors that I would never take again. The prof makes or breaks the class for me and Dr. Ausherman makes this class unbearable. Not only is the workload insanely heavy but I felt like she didn't care about my performance as a student AT ALL. I had to drop to spare my transcript the inevitable F. I recommend someone else.

What on earth even is this class. Basically a waltz through holistic medicine without ever looking at a real data set. The curriculum is based off of youtube clips of "readers-digest" medicine news that is all for-profit nonsense, and then expects us to write THOUSANDS of words weekly on it. Utter nonsense.

I am taking HED Health Lifestyle Choices Section 504. This a lvl 100 health class, and I do not understand why the workload is so much. This class takes so much time out of me that I am not able to do work for other classes. Kind of funny how we are talking about stress this week when her class is the main reason I'm stressing out than normal.

Even if you do every assignment just like the directions, odds are she will find the smallest thing to mark you down on. She comes off as very rude when you email her. Every time I emailed her asking why I got marked down on an assignment, she would tell me I left something out that I was not even supposed to do in the first place. Very poor.

Assigns way to much work per week. She takes off points for everything. She does not have clear grading criteria. Sometimes rude through email. Will not ever take a class with her again. One of the worst profs I have had.

This professor is not ideal if you like clear directions and organization. Directions are unclear, way too much repetitive work, takes points off for anything she can, does not answer emails or questions in a timely manner. The material is interesting but the stress of the unknown with the class is overwhelming.
I feel like I'm in 4th grade again. Video after video with worksheets to do. I don't need busy work for a graduate level class, I read and watch the material - I'm paying enough for it.
Too much homework for an entry level Health Class. Takes points off for everything
Way too much work for a Personal Health class. Useless busy work. Don't take unless you have to for your major. Interesting content but ridiculous workload for what it is- a 200  level health class.
This class takes up so much time! There is a TON of work to do.  instructions are unclear. Many videos to watch in a week multiple assignments and quizzes do every week.  BEWARE.
There is a lot of work to be done for this class. Way more than a 300/400/500 level course - which is odd. The amount of material she expects you to go over weekly is overwhelming.

The lectures are very fun and interesting to listen to. There isn't a lot of homework for the class, but there are discussions and assessments due weekly. The professor is always willing to help her students and give feedback.
Always appered like she is rushing through everything.  Doesn't take the time to let discusion devolop
Great teacher. This class actually taught me a lot. Dr. Ausherman was enthusiastic about teaching and makes the class very enjoyable. I'm heading on to the final test tomorrow.
No Comments

Took her Pre_calc II class over the summer. Definitely cares about her students and always willing to stay extra to help you understand a topic. Explains the material very well. Wish She taught Calc II!
The best of my professors. Would highly recommend. Goes threw everything clearly and the class is set up very well. The only people who struggle are people who don't show up or do homework.

Shes probably the most caring math teacher I have ever met. She truly cares about her students and will do whatever possible to see them succeed. Her motto and goal is to help people not hate math. Shes so understanding and will teach a topic 10 different ways if it means youll get it eventually. Highly recommend!!!!

Victoria is one of the cooler people you will meet during your time at school.  She is deeply interested in sustainability and has a passion for what she does.  She likes having open discussions with all students participating, so try and speak up because she will appreciate it.  Take whatever she's teaching.

I had zero interest in this class, but it fit in my schedule so I took it.  It was by far my favorite course in business school.  Made me think of topics that previously did not occur to me.  The real world hands on experience was also a bonus.  It really helps that she is also very hot. I don't know if she teaches any other courses...I hope..:)

She is a good professor, helpful and reasonable. However, she is young and needs more experience in OSM. Her knowledge in sustainability is tremendous however, when it comes to OSM she does know less. No Exams but presentation and project is really tough.

She's nice prof, has a strong passion for sustainability. Presents materials with different kind of methods like discussions, tours, guest speaker, & videos. NO EXAM! we only had to do a group presentation and report. She is hot looking as well hehe
Very helpful and enthusiastic about the subject. Made class interesting even at slow times. Used a variety of teaching methods for learning. And is a hot looking professor!

Great Instructor, makes for a great learning experience. Had a bunch of research papers that were quite a task to write but the instructor provided the needed help and was very generous in her grading. Learned a lot from this class and got a good grade to top it off- couldn't ask for anything else!!

I did not expect this course to be informative and understandable, but Dr. Avram was always ready to explain everything she responds to the emails everyday during weekends and nights. She is a NICE person and soooooo sweet.

I did not expect this course to be informative and understandable, but Dr. Avram was always ready to explain everything she responds to the emails everyday during weekends and nights. She is a NICE person and soooooo sweet.

There is zero reason not to like Dr. Avram. When I read all the negative reviews I was nervous about her class, and have spent the semester utterly confused as to how people dont like her. She is approachable, kind, has detailed rubrics for every assignment, and even makes review games for her exams. Im happy I'll have her for 2 more semesters

This of course is difficult class, but Dr. Avram was always available to answer any questions. Her lecture videos were super helpful and the way she explains the content is super clear! I would absolutely recommend her for chemistry!

She's a very hard teacher but is really sweet and nice. There are a lot of practice problems in class so if you do those, you will understand the material better. She is there to help you in her office hours of you need, and I would recommend going to her. Her tests are really hard and don't really really reflect what the homework questions.

Obviously she isn't a good professor, she had to curve the WHOLE class because everyone is failing, and if you fail this semester with her than you get to take it for free next semester. The day i withdrew from this class was the best day of my life. When i withdrew my advisor said about 20 other ppl dropped that same day. GOOD LUCK CHARLIE!!!

Avram was one of the worst professors Ive ever had. The homework is worth 5 points takes about 5 hours to do. The exams are extremely hard doesnt really follow with homework. Ive spent just about 3-4 hours a week with a tutor alone and 3 hours on my own and Ill be lucky to pass with a C.

Dr. Avram is overall a good professor if you decide yourself to put in the work. If you only go to lecture and dont study or take notes then you wont get the grade you want. The homework is very annoying and takes a lot of time but in the end can be very helpful. The exams are hard but it is possible to get good grades on them.
Somewhat mean. Does not go over concepts thoroughly, very test heavy. Grades on very little and no chance for extra credit.

I will never be taking another Chemistry with her. Homework takes hours upon hours for only 5 points, and you get points taken off for wrong answers submitted. Lectures are rushed and heavy, she does NOT take time to fully explain. She makes the class unnecessarily hard. Avoid her if possible.

This professor is terrible. She is rude and unapproachable. Very few in class problems explained. You are expected to learn the material on your own. Homework is intense, 3+ hours per 25 questions for 5 pts. In class problems and homework do not match up to what is on exams. I attend tutoring sessions 2x a week & I doubt Ill pass this class. AVOID

Here is a list of things that make this INTRO TO CHEMISTRY course harder than it needs to be: Hw's take 6+ hours (worth 5 points), in-class examples are easier than the homework ?'s & what's on exams, she gives you points based on in-class ?'s for ATTENDANCE-wrong ans0 pts that day, & she skips many slides when she's running out of class time

You will struggle if you have Dr. Avram. I attend her office hours, I spend probably 6+ hours on the hws which are due weekly, & I also receive help for hours upon hours from an honors college friend who has an extensive chemistry background, & I will be lucky to end w/ a B in the class. I can kiss my future goodbye if I get a C, thanks Dr. A! <3
