She asks for ways to improve her class but NEVER takes what the students say seriously. If you do not have a good chemistry background, you will struggle even more than normal. The homework assignments are worth a whole 5 points and are a lot of work. She does not offer any extra credit so good luck and RIP.

Goodluck passing with this professor. She speeds through chapters, doesnt bother to explain most things, reads directly off the slide. 25 or so question exams worth 100 pts, so if you miss 2-3 questions, you can kiss an A goodbye. Not helpful in office hours. Doesnt offer extra credit even though a majority of the class is struggling.

Dr. Avram is a rude, uncaring professor. She does not care about her students in the class. Attendance is mandatory and you will lose points for attendance even if you are there that day in class. Instead of teaching she puts a question on the board and walks around expecting us to know what to do. if you have her, GOOD LUCK CHARLIE!

Dr. Avram is an example of a bad professor. Shes young and acts likes shes better than all of the students. Her tests are impossible and her way of teaching is giving example questions while she walks around class chatting with students. Attendance grade is for accuracy, so if you dont know the material she marks you absent... worst prof ever.

Shes young, full of energy and enthusiasm and super relatable! The material she teaches is pretty advanced and there no way of getting around it without really knowing it. Super challenging class but rewarding when you put the hard work in.

Terrible professor. she literally just read from the slide. she also flies thru examples. The homework on mastering is more like exam questions than homework. you'll spend hours on 1 question and only get three attempts. she also have a bad attitude. WOULD NOT RECOMMEND

Dr. Avram made this class absolutely miserable for me. More than half of the class bombed the second exam which led me to withdraw from the class. For being a first year college professor she does not like constructive criticism and its important to learn from your mistakes especially in her situation. Would avoid at all costs.

She is very lecture heavy, goes through slides very fast. Everyone bombed the very first exam, so she had to save herself by giving us clean up quizzes. The homework can take up to 3 hours and is not worth the credit received. Clearly the good reviews were written by Avram herself. Do not recommend to anyone, stay clear from getting this professor.
Your only grades are tests but they are easy?? A lot of people say they are confusing or tricky but I bet those are the students who didn't even bother to try.

He was very thorough with his notes and made sure he gave students time to copy. He pretty much tells you what is going to be on the quizzes & they're all pretty fair. Great professor! I would highly recommend him.

Phd abbed is one of the best prof. He explains the concepts pretty well, and he does care about his students whether they understand or not u just have to go to his lecture ,get notes , you are done with good grade

The best way to be successful is to go to class, takes additional notes, and then study them.  I do not think that his questions are to trick you, but instead truly test your understanding of a topic or concept instead of just memorizing slides or vocab.  Overall, I think he is a great professor and I would recommend him!!

I loved taking GEO with Dr. Babaei. He was a riot, really funny, and his class was nice and simple. Didn't need the book, awesome. But you do have to go to class. All the test questions come from the notes and if you don't have them, you won't get the ??s. I didn't ever see any trick questions, you just have to read carefully I guess.
As long as you go to class you will get an easy A.

GOOD LORD.  He says his exams are on his notes but when exam time came along it was like his exams were in a different language. I visited him in his office to get help but he never made anything clear.  don't take this professor.

Be careful, when he says the answers to the test are from his notes, thats true, but his tests contain A LOT of trick questions. Some questions i don't remember going over, and i payed attention and attended every class session.

He's a nice guy and a bright guy, but not a great teacher, and his tests contain a lot of trick questions. At least they're multiple choice. And when students ask questions in class, his answers often have nothing to do with the questions asked.

Rather boring class. You take notes every class and that?s it. Final grade is based off of 4 exams. Exams are hard/tricky even if you study. His review sessions consist of him reading what is already in your notes WORD FOR WORD. He's a nice guy, but if I could go back in time I would've taken a different class.

Certainly a class i.d NEVER take again. Class was boring, all slides only. Tons of notes. Tests were too intricate and detailed. Nearly impossible to pass with an A. Decent prof. at best. You.ve been warned!
The perfect professor that anyone could ask for. Very understanding and makes sure everyone understands Geology!!I would love to have him again.

Very good professor.  Very intelligent. Tests are easy if you study and he is accessible if needed for extra help. he spends an entire class period reviewing before every test and gives a lot of info during reviews. overall a great teacher

Excellent professor with a clear enthusiasm for his subject. text recommended but not required, which was a nice break. as long as you show up and take notes (i realize this is a radical idea for many), you should do just fine

his class is impossible. the average for our final this semester was a D. no one got above a B-. no matter how hard you study you're still going to see things on his test that he never taught. he's very smart, throws in a few funny comments every once in awhile... but don't take him if you're not good at science/not a GEO major.
Awesome
Very good Prof.  I don't know why people are leaving him bad comments.  Easy class just study a little and you will do fine.

I don't know why everyone is leaving him good comments, he put too much stuff on his test that he forgets to teach. His test might be straight forward, but you have to study by yourself because you can't understand him.
Not bad at all..he took attendance sporadically, but you need to be there for notes anyways.  Better than buying a book!!

Loved this class!  No book for this class.  As long as you go to class and take notes you'll do fine!  The tests come straight from the notes and he has a review before each exam.  Great professor and really cares about the students.
Hmm if you dont agree with her opinions on what a family is in terms of LGBT she will take a 4.0 student and try to fail them. I have proof

I agree with the first comment.  Teacher has an insanely strict attendance policy and she'd flip out if you weren't paying attention 100% all the time for two hours straight.  She has some sort of napoleon complex, which I wasn't really aware women could have.  I feel she's fresh out of grad school by how she treats others.
I think she did a great job and was very helpful. Yes your expected to do work, but it is college!

I couldn't disagree with the first comment more! Beth knows her stuff and is more than willing to spend time helping students understand the material.  I submitted several papers to her early and she gave me a lot of comments to help me improve it. I put in the time and energy and got an A+ in her class.

Basically this teacher starts out very nice and is helpful in the beginning of the semester, but by about half way through she's over it and it reflects in how she helps the students. Became rude, condescending, and refused to cut students slack. Beware!

Instructor is the hardest I have ever had & I have many degrees & years of school.   Assigns group project for online class wpoor communication. Does not allow any room for opinions & it shows in her attitude & tone that she lets her "Doctor" role go to her head.  Try being humble, the best instructors are! Grading is harsh! AVOID THIS "DOCTOR"

This is a Health Communication course and the professor knows little, if anything, about health. While her background is in communication, it seems important that she should know something about health if she's the instructor for a health communication course. In addition, all her examples are about HERSELF and her disdain for healthcare/medicine.

COM 380: weekly discussion board & respond to classmate and a 7 question quiz. One big film analysis paper at end of semester. Dr Babin is VERY particular. You must follow her instructions to the letter in order to get credit for assignments. She also grades tough. She will help you understand material. You must be mature smart & deep thinker for A

Dr. B. is an assertive teacher most people will see as a little too strict but that just shows that she cares about the success of her students. The only advice I have for you is start your end of the year projects early and use the writing center as much as needed because she is a real stickler on formatting and grammar.

Can only miss 2 classes then docked 5 pts per absence. Explains what is expected of you, great review sheet for exams, practice tests, extra help available.30 pts of extra credit available. Projects can be done alone and not that hard. Gives you sample papers and willing to help you. Just ask. Highly recommended.

This teacher has an insane attendance policy.  I don't go to the doctor every time I get sick.  So I went to class with strep throat while I was still contagious (before I went to the doctor).  She's on some sort of insane power trip; I'm guessing it's because she's about 4 feet tall.  I wrote a letter to the dean about how horrid she is.

Dr. Babin is a excellent professor. She expects you to learn, and to put forth an honest effort. This class was very difficult, partly because of the required group project, but I learned more and achieved more than I thought was possible. Very responsive and supportive. If you plan to go on to grad school, take her. She'll prepare you very well.
She's nice, but her classes are really hard.
Straightforward. Take the class if you see her name.
Straightforward. Take the class if you see her name.
Instructor Pask is involved in students work and reads everything that they do. She sets up very clear guidelines on what to do in order to do well in her course.

Of course with most online you don't get to interact with professor often. However, she participated in discussion board posts, and you could tell she read people's responses. Overall grading in the course was cool, as long as you posted something in weekly discussion you got credit. The final paper was fairly easy and straight forward, got an A

Dr. Backer was an amazing professor. Though it was online, I feel as though I really got to know him and he gave great feedback on papers. Everything was well organized. I took this course over the summer, so it was more work than usual. Having the opportunity to reflect on your own experiences was the best part! I would definitely recommend him!

Online class was very interesting. We read one article a week (kinda long) and wrote a short paper on it. The articles can be confusing, but they're not terrible and there are lecture videos posted to help understand the readings. Other than the weekly papers, we had to submit 2 videos discussing intersectionality.
Such a great class. Handsome too.

Get ready to use your brain! Very challenging class, but also very worth your time. Lots to read and analyze. Lots of discussions. I've left this class changed as a person and as a professional. I absolutely recommend Dr. Backer.

Dr. Bagakas is an example of what a professor should be. He is demanding of his students, but is willing to help each student succeed. He challenges you to think. Failure is not an option. You will learn the material (although it may take some time and repeated testing!)
Awesome!!!!
Fantastic instructor!!  Very patient and helpful.  Made a huge difference in how I view statistics - I now have a much higher confidence level.
Great professor and Dept Chair. Too bad he's not a qualitative prof as well. His subjects come very natural to him. Much respect for him. I felt supported as a humble grad student.

Professor Bagakas is an excellent professor. He is willing to spend extra time explaining concepts to students. He is also very interested in student success. I highly recommend Dr. Bagaka's as a professor. He is also an excellent chair if you are in the doctoral program. You will not regret working with him in any capacity.
He is very inteligent and helpful. I learnt so much from him. I had fun, and learnt alot about statistics and about kenya. (he's kenyan!!)

Dr B is very knowledgable about statistics.  He can easily explain difficult topics and is more than willing to take the time in and out of class to work with students.  He genuinely cares for students.  I highly recommend him for statistics.
Professor Baghersad is a great professor. He explains the material well, and attempts to make the exams fair. I would highly recommend taking him.
Professor Baghersad is a great professor. He explains the material well, and attempts to make the exams fair. I would highly recommend taking him.
Best instructor I had in the college.

I had privilege to attend Professor Bailey's class in Spring 2011. He is one of the best teachers I have ever had. He is max professional, knows how to explain the most complicated materials, always available for students and great expert in his field of business. Also, he organized several CFA events for students from Cleveland, Akron, Kent,...

Professor Bailey will break down complex ideas that are easily understandable for the students. His knowledge and expertise within the industry gets translated into the classroom.  Have a question, just ask.  James will honestly and accurately answer all questions.  Professor Bailey is fair and the students will earn the grade that they deserve.

Take this class if you want to learn something. If your lazy and not a hard worker, stay away. He is very helpful and actually wants you to learn. Great class and best finance teacher I've had at CSU.

James Bailey is the MAN!! I learned so much every single class.  A must for finance majors...especially if you had a lousy intro prof.  Works in the business and has his CFA.  Super nice guy and goes out of his way to make sure u learn the material.  CSU needs more like James

This guy ROCKS.  After a lousy intro 351 prof. he made up for everything.  I have learned so much.  Works in the industry and applies the material too it.  I really think he is the best in the whole department.  Prepares you well for the test and he is very interesting to listen too.  Thank you James Bailey!!

First time ever teaching...and he's Awesome.  young guy who works at Keybank and brings a lot of practical knowledge into the classroom.  Knows his stuff and does a great job teaching the material.  Always willing to provide extra help.  Some students may say he's too hard but screw that, I have learned so much from this guy. Thank you James!!

His first time ever teaching...Awesome!  I look forward to going to class b/c I learn so much everytime.  He works at Key Bank and has his CFA...brings in a lot of real world experience.  Great guy, very through in anwsering questions. Department needs more guys like James!

First semestar ever teaching...Awesome.  Works for KeyBank as a Derivatives Trader and really knows his stuff about financial markets.  Great job explaining the material...I look forward to going to class b/c I learn something new every time.  Weekly quiz (not bad), 3 exams (takes best 50 outta 55!), and a project.  We need more like James!

A great professor! I didn't major in music, but he was incredibly helpful and respectful anyway! He makes rehearsals enjoyable and worth going to. He makes sure to only bring out the best sound out of the group.

What a great guy! I had him for choir, and enjoyed going there every day. He's really quirky and funny, and promotes musicianship in everyone. Grade gets dropped by a letter if you miss more than 3 rehearsals unexcused, so attendance is pretty mandatory. He reignited my passion for singing, and if you enjoy it too I recommend you join his choir.
Doesn't care about students and their safety health.

Dr. Bailey is one of the few professors that genuinely cares about his students.  I have never admired a teacher so much.  Choir is one of the many classes he teaches and if I was a music major I would take every single one of his classes.  My all time favorite professor at CSU.

Absolutely wonderful math teacher.  Extremely patient and really wants each student to do well.  Before taking this class I was afraid of math.  Now I enjoy it, thanks to Dr. Baker.  Highly recommended!

Ms. Irina Baker is a great teacher! She IS foreign (Russian, actually) but she's a sweetheart and it doesn't take long before you understand what she's saying. She explains things clearly and easily and is very laid back and lenient. Always willing to help students that need it, you can get an A with little effort. She does take daily attendance.

The class is easy, and your grade is determined on many things. Get a good group in the beginning or you will be screwed bc you have the same group the whole semester. Tests aren't that hard but she likes the short answer questions at the end of them. I didn't study at all for the tests and got A's every time.

Had a terrible time in professor Bakke's class. Outdated information and an archaic use of exam time by writing out problems on a piece of paper taking a picture to submit makes these tests way harder than need be. A lot of group work and paper due as well.

Gives out a crazy amount of work along with countless group projects. You will have about 3 assignments due a week that are huge in scale. Groups are supposed to do everything on their own and she is not readily available to answer questions.

Since switching to online classes Professor Bakke's courses have been incredibly unorganized. We are given groups for countless projects, with very short time constraints for tests that make them difficult. Dates are changed constantly and be ready to write 7 page papers on top of it.

The class is easy, and your grade is determined on many things. Get a good group in the beginning or you will be screwed bc you have the same group the whole semester. Tests aren't that hard but she likes the short answer questions at the end of them. I didn't study at all for the tests and got A's every time.

She gives you A LOT of work. You will be doing repeated work and assignments for 2 to 4 times easily in a semester. She's a tough grader and will take off points often. Overall had a bad learning experience.

She gives you A LOT of work. Also teaches this class like everyone is an IS major and already knows what she is talking about. Too many assignments and group projects and her lectures/notes don't really explain anything. She's a tough grader and will take off points often. Overall had a bad learning experience.

I wouldn't recommend her to anyone. She does not care about concerns or complaints at all, just goes on with her business. Sometimes answers in a few mins, sometimes takes 3 weeks. I passed with a good grade but all I wanted was to just pass so I wouldn't have to deal with it again.

Receiving an A would have meant $2,000 scholarship and the ability to attend graduate school. Professor told this and refused to round up by .47 of a point. Wonder what Cleveland State would say knowing that .47 points cost them a graduate student that would have brought in thousands. Grade depends on everyone in group, your effort does not matter.

She is very unprofessional in the way she conducts herself with students. Will speak negatively about one student to another. Expected the class to know how to use Microsoft Project and some of it's extensive features, without even teaching us how to use half of them. You can't avoid her at CSU if you're an IS major, which is a shame. Good luck.

She is crazy!!! Something is wrong with her and the way she interacts with her students. It was basically supposed to be an introduction to IST in business class and I learned nothing. Too many homework assignments that are very easy to lose track of.

Professor Bakke is excellent, but be prepared to work, the class is no easy A. Lectures were pretty boring for me, overall a very passionate and knowledgeable professor. She cares a lot about her students and their lives after graduation.

This class has more homework than most, but assignments are actually useful at reinforcing the material and not just busywork. Tests are reasonable and she's clear on what you should study. Worksheets in class on some topics are great practice. Very organized, friendly and positive professor!

By far THE WOOORST professor in cleveland state. DO NOT take this women I REPEAT DO NOT take this women. So much busy unnecessary work, like does she not understand we are college students? She is absolutely no help to the students either.
I honestly think that this woman is a mental disorder. Something wrong with her behavior towards students. CSU should seriously review her teaching!

There is a lot of work in this class, many homework assignments, challenging testsquizzes, large group project with presentation.  Not the easiest professor at CSU but she is there for students and willing to help.  She re-did my entire resume for me and helped me get an internship during the semester.  Would definitely recommend.

Only had three quizzes for the whole semester, no real midterm or final, and only used the book for the quizzes. Lots of discussion board posting and group work and an assignment was due every week,  quite a bit of work and mandatory group activity for an online class.

Lots of discussion posts and quizzes.  Some assignments were super easy and some you didn't even know where to start.  7 page paper at the end of the semester.  For an online class it was a good amount of work.
Class requires a lot of work. Most of the information presented is useless. Professor is disrespectful toward students.

Yes a lot of requirement, but she is an easy grader. I did every thing she asked for, i present it in professional way, and I got an A.there are 10 assignments, 5 quizzes, 8 discussions, 1 mid term, 7 pages paper, and a final! if you did what she asked for, you will get an A. as i said, easy grader but a lot of work!

I really enjoyed taking this class. Although she is very particular and picky about work, she does a nice job teaching. When taking this class on campus, attendance is mandatory, you miss a day, you miss a ton! She does require a lot of work and effort, you just have to stay on top of everything. If you do that, it shouldn't be too bad.

Dr. Ball is a good lecturer. He made the concepts easy to understand. His tests and exams came from material discussed in lecture, however the exams and quizzes were hard. There were definitely trick questions. Downside to the class is there are not a lot of pts. You can only lose 45 before you go to an B. Overall, would recommend him. He's good.

Dr. Ball is a good lecturer. He made the concepts easy to understand. His tests and exams came from material discussed in lecture, however the exams and quizzes were hard. There were definitely trick questions. Downside to the class is there are not a lot of pts. You can only lose 45 before you go to an B. Overall, would recommend him. He's good.

Dr. Ball was an amazing professor. I'm not a big Chemistry fan, but he does a great job of holding your attention. He assigns homework that isn't graded, but I would recommend doing the problems and asking questions about them because they help prepare you for exams and quizzes. He does a great job of answering questions. Definitely recommend!

Dr. Ball's amazing. He doesn't require you to have the book, come to class, or do the homework, but all 3 will help you to understand the material much better. He doesn't teach from the book; he uses his notes & he makes the topics understandable to those who may be confused. He encourages questions. 6 quizzes (1 is dropped), 2 tests, & a final.

Dr. Ball is by far the best chemistry professor I've ever had. He legitimately cares how his students do, wants to teach, and wants to answer questions. His lectures are very engaging, he relates chemistry to real world applications, and as a bonus, he's hilarious! I would definitely take one of his classes again.

This will be one of the best intro chemistry course you will ever be able to take. The course is difficult, yes, but you will learn a lot from Dr. Ball. If you read and attend lecture consistently, you should not have any issues with passing this course. The lectures are incredibly important and will better help you understand the material.

Dr. Ball is a wonderful professor. His physical chemistry class was by no means easy, but if you kept up with the reading and homework you were generally prepared for the weekly quizzes. Tests are tough - definitely have to work for your grade - but he's a fair grader. Definitely the best physical chemistry prof at Cleveland State.
Great chemistry professor!
A professor who is tough but always clear on what he expects. His lectures are really easy to understand, but reviewing notes often is good because the tests are pretty hard!

Dr. Ball is great. If you have to take chem get Dr. Ball. He requires you to know alot but he explains it very well. Tests are rough if you dont study. Homework isnt mandatory but it helps a lot, especially for the tests.  Only downside is there isnt alot of points available in the class, only like 200 points before the final.

Very engaging professor, class was never boring so it was easy to pay attention and stay involved.  He encourages participation and questions.  Homework is not mandatory but highly recommended.  This class is challenging and requires a lot of time studying- the professor makes it clear through his hard, strictly graded tests and quizzes.
His lectures are fun and I learn a lot.
Great professor! Wished I had him as a teacher when I was first introduced to chemistry!
great professor! knows his stuff. he's like charlie from its always sunny in philidelphia but way smarter! lol

Great professor. Had him for college chem I. I opened my textbook about 4 times just to find some charts, thats all. He only puts concepts on the quizzes/tests that he goes over in class. Nothing else. His explanations are very good and encourages his students to "ASK". Chem is a hard subject, and I did have to study a little bit, but I got an A.

Great Professor. Knows how to teach his lectures and very enthusiastic. Attendance is not mandatory but definitely recommend coming to class. Grades fairly but tests can be difficult. Willing to help if you ask for it. Grade is made up of 5 quizzes, midterm, and a final.

awesome teacher, somewhat difficult tests. attendance not required, but you'll fail if you don't go for the notes. homework isn't required, but do it anyway-it helps! he doesn't curve, but his tests and quizes are fair. definitely would take him again!

I just finished up my semester with him as my College Chem I professor. Excellent teacher. Very prepared for class, always encouraged students to be proactive and "Ask!" questions(even though the class had about 150 students). His class was tough: all of your grade depended on two midterms, a final, and 5 quizzes. I personally anticipate a high B.
Tests are rough but overall good teacher!
This guy is phenomenal, one of the best teachers i ever had. Will take ANY classes i might need with him again.

He is an excellent teacher.  Everything that is on his tests he has gone over in class.  Very fair, but you must put in a decent amount of effort to do well.  I took the class over the summer, and I think it would have been a better choice to take it during the regular semester.
Fun guy, awful planner and arbitrary grader. Online, his class time and location is sporadic and students are notified last-minute. Never again.
very helpful and very friendly.

John made learning fun and gave me opportunities in several classes to do real world projects. Projects that helped me learn as well as help the group I was working with to create a video project that complemented my portfolio. Classes laid back at times and stressful at others based on how you work. By far, my favorite teacher at CSU.
John is great. He knows his stuff. If you come to class and participate in your projects, he will recognize your hard work. He's a good guy and he cares about his students.

John has a lot in common with his style of teaching, that being both are a mess and not helpful. He likes to favor his favorite students that think the world of him and then make jokes about the others. Disrespectful and non humorous. John says how great he is yet has failed all his other jobs and now teaches. it's sad...

I liked him for other classes (if you're a DM major you'll be seeing a lot of him) but com 400 was kind of messy. The business proposal assignment had no real guidelines, and for a class of students who have never studied business, it wasn't easy.
Had a lot of fun in his class. Projects were the majority of our grade.  John Ban is very cool and funny and has a lot of experience in the field and has a lot of good stories.

Very good professor, exams were oly 11% of our grade, while projects were a huge chunk of our grade, WHICH IT SHOULD BE. He's very funny and i enjoyed his class, the only thing i didn't like was the class was at 8:00 a.m, nothing about the professor.

He has so much experience in the film world and is so cool to get to know. This class is some BS class about set management and stuff but he wants to have fun so we go and do film projects and zombie activities at halloween stores and he is great. Highly recommend him!!

She is nice but a terrible teacher. Don't take her. There is only four parts to the grading scale she uses, so if you do poorly on one thing you're kind of screwed. Her tests are really hard and don't really match with what she reviews. She is very unenthusiastic and doesn't enjoy explaining or helping her students when they have questions.

She was a very motivated professor. She goes through the material fast but only if no one asks questions. If you express unclarity, she will take the time to answer your questions. Reading the book outside of class is also helpful. Mandatory online Aplia homework, I recommend trying on this because it can boost your grade in the end.

She is very motivated and knowledgeable about the material.  Helpful outside of class and covers material in class well.  Reading is required and the textbook is very helpful.  Material is covered in depth.

She does move quickly but is more than helpful outside of the classroom. If you find yourself in need of slowing down simply ask questions for greater clarity.  She will take the time and it does slow things down. Growth and Development students will be pushed hard on their writing as it is a WAC course and she does not take that lightly.

She does move fast but goes well out of her way to help with problems. Always willing to slow down the pace when questions prompt the need. Great attitude, excited about the material. Her writing based course, growth and development, really pushes students to use the tools of the core courses and regression.
She tries her best, very helpful. Often she was going to fast through the material. I think she just needs more teaching experience since it was her first semester teaching this course.

Dr. Banerjee is very enthusiastic and interested in economics-this adds to her teaching quality. She is very willing to help students learn.  If you are having trouble in class or on homework, she will go the extra mile outside class to make sure you understand.  She can speak quickly sometimes during lectures, but overall she is very good.

Dr.Swag, as we called him all year, was an amazing teacher.  He is very knowledgeable and funny.  He is easy to get along with and is a great advisor.  His class was lecture based and you read a chapter every week or so. Not hard. I enjoyed it very much.
I loved this professor. I enjoyed his teaching style, clear instructions and clarity of the subject. He is research oriented and very helpful. His class made me ready for graduate programs.
VERY NICE TEACHER AND MADE THE CLASS VERY USEFUL. SOME OF THE STUDENTS IN THE CLASS WERE DIFFICULT TO DEAL WITH.

He was not prepared for class at all.  He was corrected by the class on many occasions. He has one method of teaching, and if you need him to clarify, he has a very hard time giving other examples or teaching it another way. It is more than likely, you will be teaching yourself by using the text. Didn't get through the chapters.
HORRIBLE!!!!!

One Word: "Incompetent" He is the worse Professor I have ever had. No joke, he is totally incomprehensible. He does not have the necessary skills to teach in English successfully. If don't want to have to teach yourself the material, take the class with a different instructor.
If more professors were like him, then I would actually look forward to going to class. He really makes you feel like he cares and he's there to help you.

This is a great class. Dr. Banik teaches the class with great depth of knowledge and clarity. Although the class has a major emphasis on writing, trust me it is helpful. I am taking the EUC course now, and my grade is sky roketting in that course due to Dr. Banik's coaching in PSY221.
I enjoyed his class very much. He knows the subject well and is very helpful

CSU needs more professors  like him. His command on the subject is excellent. He motivates students to think critically about the subject or about an issue. He is really an enjoyable professor to work with and to learn from.
GREAT TEACHER

He is very knowledgeable on subjects but needs a better way to teach it. If you don't go to class it's o.k. but final is cumulative so make sure to find out what's going on in class. It's hard to understand him at times and needs power point to give lectures from so less writing on board, and less trying to figure out what he's saying.

Good teacher. Book wasn't very useful, so we got lots of hand-outs instead. Very interesting topics & had different ways of learning such as guest speakers, movies, poster board project, and lecture. Overall good class except he needed to speak clearer & have more structured notes in an outline style. Very nice guy, and willing to help you.

His strength is that he takes the time to explain things to those who don't understand.  His weaknesses are the time spent writing problems on the board and no sense of urgency.  Our class never got to ANOVA, chi squared or anything else, finished about chapter 11 of 16? in the book.  So, you should pass the class, but its usefullness afterwords...

I am the slacker of most slackers, at first I thought I needed to drop his class but I stuck with it. He is tough to understand but there is a lot of curves. I never went to class, but he lets you use a note card on the test so I used the summary reviews and formulas. I am getting a B and hopefully an A..but never went to class.

Dr. Banik is a very intelligent man, and if you're speaking to him, his accent isn't that bad...but I'm not sure he knows how to teach in an English-speaking environment. He gives one sentence explanations for VERY hard to understand concepts in broken English. The topic and book are hard enough to understand...I had to drop the class.

Online curriculum is out of date. Current APA is not even being taught. This professor makes a lot of excuses for accountability. I would not ever recommend a course from this program or professor. Activities in module two were from 2003-04. Dont' bother addressing any concerns, you will get tossed around. The Ed Tech program is very out of date!!!

Best Online Class I ever took. Totally helpful, immediate response. Very supportive. Completely prompt. Very fair grader, very clear. Awesome lady, super class. It's a modle for what an online class should be.I'd take her again in a heartbeat. I recommend her for anyone with a bad online experience; Dr. Banks is really great.

Whoever wrote the first rating is completely inaccurate. I've taken a number of online classes. Dr. Banks' was the MOST organized, very predictable set up and manageable to accomplish the class goals. She responded immediately with emails and graded every single assignment, returned with copious comments, by the next day. I totally recommend her.
She is highly unhelpful and does mostly online classes.  She never responds to emails for weeks and her set up is very confusing to navigate the class.
One of the best professors I have experienced so far at CSU. Interesting lectures and lots of class interaction. I would definitely take additional classes with him.

Weekly quizzes and cumulative final online. 2 presentation projects and a 3rd project for grad students. Grading is not clear. He will refer you to the grading criteria in the syllabus if you ask questions on missed points. You will have practice oral speaking presentations every class. Don't take the class if you are afraid of presentations.

Professor Baran is engaging, hilarious, and a great mentor for everything HR. MGT 661 made the MLRHR program worth it and wrapped a bow on everything learned. He uses a combination of books, case studies, group discussions, individual papers, and presentations. You will walk away really understanding HR concepts, instead of just memorizing them.

Bad test questions (MC: "Which of the following is the MOST important? when all options are important/Short answer:"List a few reasons" when he means list every possible reason). No feedback on exams or assignments. Point deductions feel arbitrary. No clear grading criteria. Grades on a curve. Wish professors understood the value of good feedback.
Too much work and expects perfection out of every student.  Lighten up@

One of the only profs that taught in addition to prerecorded lectures during my online semester. With any higher level class, let alone one in engineering, one should expect to put in work. If you read the text, do the HW, and study you'll be good. The test is open book. He'll roast you if you don't know your stuff which cracks me up. He means well

This is a tough class and he is a tough professor, but he means well and has good intentions, Professor Barbari wants all his students to genuinely understand the material they are being taught. If you attend all the classes and actually participate, you will pass his class. Professor Barbari really is not a bad a Professor as people make him seem.
Take the test online, get a solid B. He factors in your hand-written work for partial credit, then somehow finds ways to remove points from your grade.

worst professor ever, his teaching skills are pathetic and his grading is worst he will never give u good grades no matter how much you try you will always receive grades below 50% I failed the class even i tried my best never take his class. If you read this ellie give up teaching it will help students atleast.

The only Engineering Statistics professor at CSU. Homework assignments average 10+ pages of math, and there is one assignments a week. Lecture is him reading the book verbatim, and spending the entire class cold calling people in hopes of them getting questions wrong so he can make fun of them. Extremely condescending and rude.

Barbari is not too bad. He's very particular in the way he likes things done on hw and exams, but if you follow his directions, you will be fine and you dont even have to get the correct answers to get credit. There is a lot of hw though (show ur work for every problem), but just do it the way he wants and you will get 100s on everything

If you don't talk during zoom meetings you most likely won't pass, I started participating in the class the last month of the semester my grades on homework and exams went up. Make sure you do the homework material the way he wants it with the worksheets he gives, if you don't follow his style you will be given a much lower grade.

One of the only profs that taught in addition to prerecorded lectures during my online semester. With any higher level class, let alone one in engineering, one should expect to put in work. If you read the text, do the HW, and study you'll be good. The test is open book. He'll roast you if you don't know your stuff which cracks me up. He means well

He isn't that hard of a professor, but do you like enormous amounts of weekly busywork that will mostly just serve to waste time? Being required to watch 6 credit hours a week worth of lectures for a 3 credit hour class? This might be a good course then. He isn't that hard of a professor, but the workload is just exhausting. Avoid if you can.

You might be reading the other reviews and trying to convince yourself that it's not that bad. It is that bad. Barbari, at best, is an ineffective mouthpiece for the book. You will quickly learn to succeed you should 1) Read the chapter 2) Skip the powerpoint (just regurgitation) 3) Stay low and hope to evade Barbari's in-class ridicule. Have fun!

I would say avoid him but you can't he is the only one teaching this class. He will cold call you without warning and ask a question that is vague and when you don't know the question he belittles you. He then moves on the next kid and repeats this until someone is correct. He takes hard subjects and makes it harder for the students. Get a Tutor!!

Has hard tests, and his lectures are extremely boring and slow. Gets side tracked a lot, and also picks on students and makes fun of them for not knowing stuff. He is also a tough grader, and overall it just feels like he wants his students to fail. Definitely avoid.

ESC 282 was one of the most difficult classes I have taken due to the subject material. Make sure to get the textbook ASAP and start on that project early. Tests are open note/open text, but you must show up to class to know what the topics mean.

He is a very nice professor. He cares about his students a lot. That is why he is little strict. Go to class everyday, do the homework, study well for the test and you will be fine. Whoever failed his class is just because they did not come to the class everyday and did not do all the work.

Avoid him at all costs. Do not underestimate the first test. The project isnt bad, but start it early. Dont let his insults get under your skin. I finished this class out of sheer spite and will do so for econ with him too.

Out of all the classes I have taken at CSU, this guy is by far the worst "teacher" I have ever had. Rather than using available resources, get ready to pay extra to use his unnecessary online codes. Does not make his own power points, and will ridicule you in front of class if questions are asked. Beware, please do not take him for your own sake.

Barbari is a jokester so it makes up for the class that's a drag. He's hard on the students, but he's just trying to prepare you for the real world. Do the homework, get the book, and study and you will do just fine.

This course is not difficult. The professor can be a bit much at times. And sometimes makes the course frustrating and difficult. Homeworks are assigned every week. His first exam BEWARE!!!!!. There is not enough time to complete 100 plus data points to analyze on multiple problems.
One cant even here what he is saying. And dont teach properly just read the book out loud thats it. Never gonna take his class again
He is the worst professor i have ever seen. He is awful

I took with him a class on the first week. I noticed that he is not respectful or showing a respect for students,so I decided to drop the class and take it in summer because the other guy who teaches ESC282 is better than Elie Barbari. Stay away from him and you will be get good grade
He's like awesome, and on top of that, cool beyond belief.  I don't have any more adjectives in my vocabulary...

Gave weekly quizzes but you got 3 tries on each. No HW for the class. All lectures were recorded and you didn't have to be present at time of the class. Honestly this class was an easy A with very little effort.

Gave weekly quizzes but you got 3 tries on each. No HW for the class. All lectures were recorded and you didn't have to be present at time of the class. Honestly this class was an easy A with very little effort.
ok
The test  material came exactly from the power points. Test are easy if you know the power points well. Love this class. I think most people got a A or mid B .
Dr. Barik is very knowledgeable on Virology and Biology overall. Made some of the more dry material more interesting with stories and helpful concepts.

I took Virology with Dr. Barik.  The lectures and content is very interesting.  The lectures are long though and he went over the class time almost every day.  You need to pay attention in class and ask if you don't understand something in order to do well. He is very helpful and a nice guy if you need to go to him for help.
Not very helpful. Plays favorites with students, and constantly criticizes others. Uses intimidation and lying seemingly to just mess with us. Slightly unprofessional.
Debbie is great if you learn to adapt to her style of teaching. Definitely learn alot but can be hard at times.
Debbie was an awsome teacher for health assessment lab. You learn a lot, and don;t be afraid to ask any questions.  Study hard for midterm and final.
Great professor for lab, midterm and final are not difficult if prepared. If you get nervous infront of people get over it quickly.

This was all computer simulation done during class. All quizzes and tests were outside class on line. Just discussion in class on current events and the effect on business and society. Really enjoyed the Prof

This was all computer simulation done during class. All quizzes and tests were outside class on line. Just discussion in class on current events and the effect on business and society. Really enjoyed the Prof

The project details are ambiguous for a reason, she wants you to think critically VS following a rubric. The project forces you to apply everything you learned from various classes. There are 2 opportunities to practice the presentation before the official one- these practices help! The final presentation provides you with experience for real life.

Dr. Barnes is the best professor I had in grad school. She is an asset to the school! I felt like I REALLY did learn something in all my MBA classes. After each class you realize how little you know about what is going on in the world, and how difficult it is for businesses to strategize for the changing future.

By far the most interesting course I have ever taken. Susan made the class what it is.  She is by far the biggest asset the college of business has. If you have the chance to take her make sure you participate you will end up leaving the class a more well rounded individual.  The class always goes the full length, every second is worth it.
the best professor ever

There is not a question that Prof. Barnes is smart.   But many times she exaggerates the importance of an issue or even tells half truths to support her point.  I believe at heart she is well meaning, and can be caring, but sometimes will talk about other students and professors behind their backs right in class.  She is a good strategic thinker, y

She really cares about her students.  Available all the time to answer any questions you may have.  AS previously stated, her project is a bit vague by design but you are a better student after this class is over.  This class has provided more knowledge than the majority of my other classes.  Take her class, you wont be disappointed.
Great prof. Wish all of them put as much effort into teaching as she does. I know my career will be better for having had her class.

I didn't care for Dr. Barnes.  She's not a bad person, but I feel as though I learned little in this class that I didn't already know.  The hardest part about the group project is how vague it is (she admits at the end that that is intentional to get people to all do different things).  You MUST participate in lectures, but easy A and she's funny.
Great Professor who really cares about her Students. Participate in class discussions and put fourth a reasonable amount of efforts towards your final project and you will pass.

Susan is a fantastic professor  that actually cares about you truly learning something in your MBA. The class project will make you work, but you'll come out on the other side as a better business professional. If you are really getting your degree to advance your knowledge and your career take Susans class. She is the best professor at CSU!
She is a good instructor. First time I felt I was in the MBA program. She is a bit flaky though.

She constantly changed the assignments and due dates.  She was terribly unorganized and passed down ambiguous information.  The final project was a joke and so was the rest of this class.  I learned absolutely nothing and ended up with an A.  Good luck if you take her.

She's a strategist. She will challenge you, teach you, and by the end, you will leave her classroom feeling like a different person--brighter, wiser, prepared. She is the BEST, most valuable asset at Cleveland State University. She deserves nothing but the best!

This was the best professor that I have ever taken.  She pushes you to your full potential and works late hours to help you with your final project.  The final project is very tough, but the end result is well worth it.  She genuinely cares about her students and she is an asset to CSU.

The best professor ever! Had to work hard on the project, but it was well worth it! I would suggest taking her class to everybody who takes their education serious, because you won't have time to joke around. Well, you might a little bit in the class.

THE BEST PROFESSOR I HAVE EVER HAD! She expects so much from her students bc she really cares! really rare to see a Prof. care as much as she does! TAKE HER!!!!!! She is exactly what CSU needs! LOVE YOU DR. BARNES!!!!! DONCO GROUP

She knows how to entertain a class, but also knows how to put pressure on you.  There were times when she gave inconsistent or unclear messages.  Be sure to thoroughly communicate and develop a clear understanding of the stuff she assigns.

Highly recommended.  Class was enjoyable.   We did a 5-person group project and a presentation.  The project was graded leniently, but she was a lot more strict when grading the presentation.  Active participation in class a must.

She made the class very interesting.  She applied business topics to politics: (like health care; is it worth paying $100,000 to help someone live 6 months longer?)  and She believes in equality for all people; Women in the Military Draft, Same Sex Marriage rights.  She has decent values and a fun personality.

Curves like mad. Changes schedule. Tests often do not match textbook, lecture, or the ridiculous amount of supplemental material, seems completely overwhelmed during midterms and leading up to finals - the times students really need answers and clarity. A nice guy, but an ineffective teacher.

Barnes is a great guy & has a great sense of humor. Unfortunately he's not as good of a teacher as he is funny. The material itself is inherently hard but the fact that he's unorganized adds to the difficultly of the class. However, if you show up regularly, he'll help you at the end w/ a VERY generous curve. Failed 3 exams & still got a C+

The class itself has way too much material to cover. We covered almost the entire book. He's a nice guy but unorganized probably from all the material. Class participation is key and he calls on everyone all the time. The important thing to remember is that he IS FAIR at the end with the curve so don't be intimidated by the hard material.

I highly recommend him! He is enthusiastic about Finance, and truly wants his students to succeed. He will go out of his way to ensure you understand the material and help you outside of class. The class itself is difficult, but he always tries to help his class. Moreover, he wants you to connect Finance to real business world.
Hard class but good teacher. He's very fair and is always trying to help the class. True OG

This class is simple. There are modules every week with discussions, quizzes, reflection papers, and other things. However, this class is very and I mean very with a capital v demanding. If you have a heavy load of work already I would suggest a different class. If you have a lot of free time then go for it.

This class is split into two parts. The first half of the semester is health, the second is physical education. A lot of projects, but they aren't that difficult. I personally liked the health half of the class versus the PE half but it was okay. She is a very nice women, and if you need help she will.

I took this class because it is required by my major. If it was not required, I would never have taken it. Although we do a lot of fun activities during the PE section. During lectures, she gets off topic very easily, often about the same thing each time. Very lenient grading due dates weren't enforced. Cool lady, but wouldn't take again.

This class is terrible . She expects way too much out of an online class. It is sport diversity which would be interesting but the amount of busy work she gives takes away from the content. If she even responds to emails at all it takes days. She doesn't seem to know how to work blackboard and  changes the form of the quizzes and the time you have.

Easy class. You have weekly readings, online discussion posts, journal entries, and you have to write a one page or less commentary on 2 videos. Not too much work and she was very clear about the work and dates due. She didn't answer emails very quickly. First half was much more interesting. Cannot work ahead in this class so plan accordingly.

Dr. Baskind is one of the best professors that I've had at my university! Her lectures are very informative and fun. She provides feedback quickly on assignments and presentations. I hope that I can take another one of her classes before I graduate!

If you take your notes and come to class, you will pass. The textbook is not 100% necessary but it helps. The extra readings she will ask about so read them. She gives you respect if you respect her. Passionate about the subject and doesn't take it too seriously.

You get the grade that you deserve. I thought she was too harsh at first but I realized that she just has clear rules/assignments. The lectures are always interesting and Dr. Baskind is pretty funny so you're never bored in class. There's a lot of memorization involved and it is tough so don't enroll if you know you're not gonna take it seriously.

The best professor I have ever had. Dr. Baskind is probably the smartest, most interesting, and engaging people I have ever met. She is so passionate about her discipline and definitely works hard to share her passion. I would highly recommend any of Dr Baskind's classes for anyone who loves art history and wants to improve as a student and person!

If you want an A, you're gonna have to work for it. It was hard if you're not an Art major, which I'm not. But Professor Baskind's enthusiasm and knowledge made this class bearable. There's a lot of studying for tests and she's a tough grader when it come's to museum papers. First class I worked hard for. You get the grade you deserve.

This course was a seminar on Jewish American Art and Culture. Dr. Baskind was extraordinarily knowledgeable and enjoyed sharing information. She even allowed me to continue my research with an independent study the following semester. I was then able to use this research and her assistance to get into grad school. Couldn't ask for a better prof!

Great professor! As long as you are willing to put in the work you will do well. She is very knowledgeable and enthusiastic!!She takes time to help students who are interested in the subject or who are struggling. All around fantastic professor!

I do not like her as a person or a teacher. I felt extremely left out in her class. She spoke to the class as if we were all art majors (many of them were). I was completely lost & she expected way too much from the writing assignments. I would avoid her if u are not an art major!

I didn't have much interest in this class before I took it. Dr. Baskind was wonderful, she always made it clear what she expected of us and made sure everyone understood before moving on.  You have a lot of studying to do, as long as you do that, you'll be fine in her class!
Love her.

She is a phenomenal teacher who is really passionate about art history. I want into this class with zero interest; I thought i would dread it.  I ended up loving the class, and I want to take more art history now. She is absolutely wonderful! Incredibly well-spoken and more than fair.  You do have to study a ton, but it's completely worth it!
She is quite demanding and requires your full attention. Hard work definitely will pay off. She is also pretty hot.

This was my first Art History class. She is tough, but a great lecturer. You cannot slide in this class. She forces you to write and your writing will improve. I loved it. If you are not willing to work hard, do not take it.
great class. 20th century art. learned so much. baskind will push you to work hard. your writing will get better.

I love this class. I'm now taking another with Baskind. Sure she expects a lot but no pain, no gain. if you are lazy don't take it. If you want an easy A don't take it. But if you really want to learn about art history and want to be a better student and writer then this is the best class I can recommend.
This was a great class. I didn't know much about art history before I took it and now I'm thinking of becoming an art history minor.
unless you are an art history **** do NOT take this class!!!!!!!!!!! she will eat you alive. she is so stuck on herself a huge snob! she acts like she is doing you a favor by being there.

She's a total feminist and has no problem reminding everyone and she loves the sycophants to no end. Constantly calls herself a scholar because she wrote one book-big deal, get over yourself!  If you're a guy or a non art major forget it, she'll make your life miserable. Does not like non art people asking her questions-she gets very belligerent.
No textbook required and she seems like the nicest person alive. Only the first day, but seems pretty likable

Finally a professor who gets it! Excellent in teaching the material yet understanding the plight of the college student. If you show up, you will get an A guaranteed, but she makes the class so much more enjoyable. Quick lectures, group activities are fun, she will keep it light and keep you interested. Best teacher at CSU hands down.
Professor Baszuk is a national treasure and deserves the highest award society can give her and it still wouldnt be enough. 10/10 would recommend taking her course
Due diligence. Hard work responsibility. Keys to life given by Bathala
OMG - if he's the department's best, that's not saying much for the department. He is better than a TA or tutor. Worst arrogant talentless prof I ever had. Period.

Best Finance teacher at CSU. Very hard class but prepares students for real world experiences. I easily learned the most in the class compared to any other course taken at CSU. Does not rely on textbooks and expects the student to do independent learning.

Extremely hard and expects you to already know the material as if his class was simply a refresher.  But I must say you will learn a lot, to bad your grade will not reflect it.  If the other CSU finance teachers were not so ridiculously easy  he would be ok.
x
He's quick to take credit, and quick to place blame. No feedback. Good class. Terrible teacher. You'll never know where you stand and will be surprised with final grade.  You'll worry for nothing.

Longest and busiest class i've ever taken- dont expect any favors from him.. He doesnt always communicate clearly where you stand, he sends blast emails when really his issue is only with one or two individuals. Uses Blackboard 100% of the time but is not always current with updating it which is frustrating because of last minute work/meetings..

His classes was a base for my career& gave a strong conceptual base for my CFA & now I am level III candidate in just 1&1/2yrs.He is v.helpful & if you r a serious student he would goto extra length2offer help.His exams r tough but a curve can easily put u from C 2 A!His class is 4 any1 who is serious about learning & not just want2get it over with

Amount of course work is impossible. More quizzes and Tests and homework and assignments than you would wish on your worst enemy. The multiple choice questions are long and VERY VERY difficult. Made me hate the world of finance. Check the reviews for other CSU finance professors if you want to be saved! But... if you love finance, he is your man.

If you are a finance wiz and have a very solid background in the subject, then you might find this instructor and his coursework,um, how can I be PC, an interesting challenge...otherwise, forget this guy and find a professor who can teach this subject matter to the avg person.  He flies thru the topics, and communication and tact are not his forte.

Dr. Bathala is honest and always answer e-mails and questions in class.  He presents a lot of slides that can be intimidating, but only a small portion of them are used for assignments and exams.  His assignments are very tough, but exams are largely made up of the same questions and therefore easy.  His initial handout on FIN 501 summary is great.
he felt that undergraduates should be able to teach themselves advanced investments... he did not like to explain things or to answer questions from students.
No Comments
CSU would be Harvard if all the teachers were like Bathala.  He genuinely cares about the students and thier well being.
No Comments

Ann Bauer, contrary to the other review, was a very helpful professor for me! She cares if her students do well and is thorough in regards to what she is covering and what her students understand.  It was her first time teaching this course and I honestly learned a lot about writing a research paper and feel better prepared for the future.

How this woman is the Department of the Chair boggles my mind. Though this class is the only one Counselors will receive on Assessment before their licensure and entering the work force, Dr. Bauer spends 100% of her time chit-chatting with her assistant and students and 0% of the time explaining difficult concepts in statistics or assessment.

Good class.  There is one paper that you must complete which is anywhere between 15-30 pages (as long as you cover everything you'll get a good grade).  There is group work every class.  There are 2 tests (the first one is hard because there is so much information) & the final is made up of the 2 tests (just memorization).  He is a good guy & answers emails and questions whenever he can.  For a class that I HAD to take, I'm glad it was with him.
Awesome Professor. Really knows business and has real business back ground. Down to earth and keeps your attention through every class.
Good professor. Was actually interested in getting you ready for the real world. Fair and helpful. Take him if you get the chance.
High energy professor who obviously loves business.  Very fair grader.  His tests are hard, but the final is an easy A.
Great real life experience from an instructor.  He tries to keep the class active and interesting with non-txt book scenarios.  Easy "A' if you do the work.  I Graduated!
This is undoubtedly the most boring class I have ever taken.

Dr. Baumer is a knowledgeable person but a horrible teacher.  His lectures are long and boring, he switches topics so often that you have no idea where you are, and he loves to go on tangents about things that don't matter.  However, he's an easy grader so if you're a decent writer and if you keep up with the reading, you'll pass with an A easily.

Professor Baumer is basically the reincarnation of father time. He's very interested in the material but unless you take an initiative to participate in class discussions, you will get bored. The students who actually read the class materials will enjoy his class.

Everything was easy, like study questions and essays, but I got a bad grade on attendance because it was so hard to go since it was long and boring. I did get away with not reading any of the books though and got a pretty decent grade. Take him as long as you have time and dedication. He's incredibly smart but digresses often.

I thought that Philosophy of Fantasy and Science Fiction would be interesting, but unfortunately it's been rather boring. Dr. Baumer is nice and very interested in the subjects, but I just wish we weren't so behind. Essays are easy to get an A on, as well as study questions.

Talked about tons of random topics. Got really behind on what we were actually supposed to be covering in class. I actually found him to be quite boring, but a few in the class seemed to think otherwise.

Very intelligent, but very scatterbrained. Had a hard time following what he was talking about in class and simply gave up. The class is super easy to do well in if you do the readings and turn in assignments, but don't expect to have any clue what he is actually talking about in class half the time. Also he's amusing if you're a big SciFi nerd.
a great guy, but really absentminded. will break off mid sentence and change topics completely. interesting class and good reading
Absent-minded professor. Couldn't decide what to include/discuss. Very nice, will explain ANYTHING (even if not on topic). Easy going.
Would highly recommend him for the logic class.
Disorganized
Brillant man.
No Comments
Best Professor ever. Highly recommend taking his class. He makes Calc 2 easy

Nick is one of the best (if not the best) instructors at CSU!!! He is very understanding and answers every question I had throughout the semester. He made Calc 1 a class I will never forget. Even when we had to move to remote learning (due to COVID-19), he was still acceptable and exceeded my expectations with the delivery of the material.

Nick is one of the best (if not the best) instructors at CSU!!! He is very understanding and answers every question I had throughout the semester. He made Calc 1 a class I will never forget. Even when we had to move to remote learning (due to COVID-19), he was still acceptable and exceeded my expectations with the delivery of the material.

Baumgartner is an excellent prof who really cares for his students and will do whatever he can to help you learn material. He reviews a lot, goes over homework questions, and much more. He is the most powerful tool that CSU's math department has and I highly recommend his courses.

The system at CSU is more fun by the department, so the tests and homework isnt written by Nicky, and Calc 2 is the most difficult class Ive ever taken in math. But he cares, so much, and wants you to succeed despite the system. If you have to take Calc 2 do it with Nicky

Best professor there is at CSU, made the hardest class I've ever taken into a piece of cake. Really funny and personable, and really cares about his students. He may be only a grad student is but one of the smartest people I've ever met

A really good teacher, helpful and easy to understand. Hard to get one on one time outside of office hours and class, but is definitely worth getting extra help if you can. He is funny and easy to understand in class. Attendance is mandatory or you will fail.

Professor Baumgartner stands alone at the top of the mountain that is the CSU Math Department. He is the King. He makes Calc II seem like basic arithmetic. He is impossibly knowledgeable, knowing of all the major mathematical developments to happen over the next century, yet remaining silent as to not spoil them. He gives good examples, too.

Pros: he's very nice, very eager to help, easy to get a hold of. Cons: will call you out for not opening the resources he posted on blackboard, expects you to check emails over the weekend, will call on people, expects you to do a lot of work I've taken him twice: CHM 301 and 310. He's a generous grader, so he's an easy A if you show up.

Pros: he's very nice, very eager to help, easy to get a hold of. Cons: will call you out for not opening the resources he posted on blackboard, expects you to check emails over the weekend, will call on people, expects you to do a lot of work I've taken him twice: CHM 301 and 310. He's a generous grader, so he's an easy A if you show up.

I like Dr. Bayachou. You will have to work for your grade, but he's very reasonable when grading. If you don't understand something, speak up and he will help you figure it out. What ever you do, DO NOT ask him "will this be on the test," because it ticks him off. He likes students who are in class to learn chemistry, and he has no time for lazy.

Very fast paced. Expects you to have read entire chapter before coming to class but you can slide by without reading anything. Lectures aren't very clear but if you ask questions he will be happy to go over material with you again. Is not afraid to put you on the spot. Often did random attendance checks and used those as 10 point quiz grades.

At first, I didn't like him at all. He is extremely intimidating. But it turns out that he is a really great guy who genuinely cares about his students. While he is rather unorganized, he tried hard and takes his time to explain difficult topics. He also gives extra credit and easy pop quizzes. He is also quite intelligent and knows his chemistry!

Not my favorite by any means.. He expects you to do all the work of a normal class even though this is a survey class. He also expects you to know everything before coming to class. AND he calls people to the board like it's fifth grade. I hate this class.
Excellent professor! Really cares about hios students learning chemistry. Goes out of his way to make sure you get the concept. One of the greatest professors I have had in many years.

Professor Mekki is a great teacher! If you pay attention to him in class you should be able to grasp every concept. His power point presentations give examples that will correspond with the tests he gives, and he can be a lenient grader as long as he sees you are putting the effort in!

I liked him. I had him in summer session so things were a bit fast paced and he didn't cut anything out (2 chapters a week), but he explains things well and is willing to stay after and answer questions even for his large class size. Coming to class is important. Tests are ACS format.
He's very helpful,explains the materials in a very simple manner.Tests are simple,You miss a little if you don't go to class. Fairly graded,want everyone to pass.

Excellent teacher!  outstanding knowledge and makes difficult concept extremely clear even for the the novice in the field. If you are ready to study and learn chemistry.. then Bayachou's Gen chem is the class for you. If you are among those who want to cut corners then the class is not for you so you don't have to revenge with low rating. bk 2 wk!

He is trash Really just for the fact that he is never on time for class also He suck @ lecture. I passed the class with my knowledge of high school chemistry . Also he give these online tests because he is lazy to test you in class which you can cheat on all day long enjoy
He's very helpful, cares about his students so much, very clear to understand, a very knowledgable professor that would make you love chemistry

I didn't enjoy this class at all, people would stop coming to class but still get A's on the test so he got  mad and made two question quizzes every class. People still wouldn't come and those who did would fail the quizzes so it was pointless to go to class. He doesn't explain concepts clearly and actually makes them more confusing.
just great

He was very difficult to understand. His teaching leaves something to be desired. He points to a powerpoint (the book on the big screen) that is not his and does not teach. To get an A, stay home from lecture and study your text. No mattr what he says, his tests have nothing to do with lecture; they are based off the ACS exam.

He is a very learned person, and expects you to work very hard in his class to really learn the material. If you study a lot, and really understand the material, you will do well on the tests. If you don't like working hard for your grade, then you will probably do poorly in his class. He's an approachable person, and is helpful.
Excellent, caring, outstanding knowledge
nevermind previous post, he is a good professor, and will help you if you have any questions, and is fairly easy.
not very good prof, hard to understand sometimes, and makes everything diffcult.  and unorganized.
awful
Mert is a wonderful professor!  I only had him for an easy class, but he was extremely helpful and really put an effort into his teaching.  And he wasn't too bad to look at either
A+++++++++++++ GRADE YOU WANT TO BE
Great teacher will always help with anything
She is extremely nice and openly admits that the material is hard. I like her a lot as a person and she is very funny but the material was very unclear and I had to get supplements just to pull a C.
Great professor. Very clear. On tough subjects, she will make SURE you understand the material. She makes an extremely boring topic, fun and exciting.
Excellent teacher. She expects a lot from you, but she explains everything clearly and makes herself available for questions. I highly recommend taking any class from her.

Great professor.  Loved visual teaching methodology and blackboard use with lively lectures.  Gave us great overview on first day as to what would be covered in future classes.  I was well prepared for Civ Pro on bar exam because of her class.  Great professor, great person, great subject. One of a handful of profs at C-M worth taking for anything!

Great professor.  Gave me great understanding of Civil Procedure for bar exam.  Loved the class, material, and Professor.  Wish all profs at C-M were as well prepared, creative, thoughtful, and caring.  Totally well worth the time and money.  Wish I could have taken a few more classes with her.  Fed Courts if she teaches it would be A DREAM!

Professor Becker is an overall good professor.  However, she is slavishly formalistic with grading and attendance policies. For instance, she only recently stopped docking students whole letter grades for going over space limits on written exams (if this doesn't seem illogical to you, consider how large letters can vary from one person to another).
Great Prof. She taught our night section in '02 and was one of my favorite profs.

Prof. Becker is one of the best at CM!!!!! U must take her class.  Very clear, nice, compassionate and FAIR!!!! she treats students with respect!!!! Love her....Will sign up for any class she teaches..just makes the class fun and u learn a lot!!! Not partial at all..though was frustrated by the students since they were not prepared...but still she
very fair, clear, helpful, funny
Best teacher I have had at CM! Fair, honest, clear, willing to do anything to help a student out.
No Comments

LOVE LOVE LOVE HER! She's clear, fair, concise and just a downright good person. She doesn't treat 1L's like the trash they are, and has an amazing background of real world experience. (RARE!) Won me over when she put up a picture of her cat to explain standing. I just love her. If all Prof's @ CM were like Becker, I might not be so disillusioned!
she's a really good professor.  she kept the class fast-paced and tried to make it fun.  her exam was very fair.

Professor Becker is one of the best professors i've ever had. She's challenging, interesting and really cares that her students learn the material. I would sign up for any class she's teaching. Thanks to her, i'm ready for the civ pro portion of the bar exam.
Really cares about students and helping them - I wish I could have taken more classes with her.

THIS CLASS WAS THE BEST. Dr. Begovic is the nicest human alive. She is understanding and gives great grades depending on how you work. There is a writing assignment due each week and no exams. TAKE THIS CLASS WITH HER
She is the nicest teacher I have ever had! She is very helpful and all her test are online.
I took the web class and it was simple. Every week you had to email in the questions she sends out (appx 5-7 ?s a week) and an 1 page journal about one of the articles. Final paper was simple too!

Dr. Begovic-Juhant is passionate about what she is teaching. She is one my favorite professors so far. If you complete all of the assignments and pay attention during lectures, you will do fine. She also helps students in any way possible, which makes her so great. I suggest you take her for your capstone class if you are a health science major.
Absolutely love Dr. Begovic. She is so sweet and genuinely loves to teach. Must participate in class discussions though.

I had her for Culture and Healthcare. She was a very personable teacher who truely cared about her students. She was an easy grader. Journal (1 page) every week. About 6 or 7 projects. No tests!! Sometimes instructions were confusing. Overall very nice teacher.
She wants you to do well. Offers extra credit and curves tests. She kinda stinks with classroom management so occasionally discussion got off topic. Use the study guides, they are wicked helpful!
professor begovic is phenomenal. she will bend over backwards to make sure you understand the class. she's kind and very fun to listen to.

Hard hard class, but she makes it easy. Croatian accent can be hard to understand at first, but she bends over backwards for her sutdents. Take the notes, do the work, read the book. Even if the paper (the biggest part of the class) isn't great. She takes into account attendance, participation, and effort.
The German accent is hard to understand once and a while, but she is extremely helpful and giving of her time. She uses personal examples of her kids to help better understand concepts.

very very nice professor. Knows her material and gives awesome lecture notes. If you come to class and study her notes you dont need to read the book and will pass the tests with A's. Extra credit is always and abundantly available
Best psychology professor I have had yet. Gives great study guides and extra credit is offered constantly. Some dry material, but great professor.

Very caring teacher always there for help. Makes Learning math fun for all students and breaks down challenging math problems so that anyone could understand them. She gives you practice exams for homework that she goes over in class before the real exam, which is very helpful. I wish she taught other subjects.

Professor Behr-Jerome is a down-to-earth math teacher, which makes her class interesting. She is very understanding and cares about her students, making an older student like myself fit in to the class. She is an exceptional individual, as well as an outstanding teacher and an asset to the CSU community.
