Professor Behr-Jerome cares about her students. She is very understanding and flexible in trying different ways for students to learn - which is important for an older student like myself. She is an exceptional individual, as well as an outstanding teacher, who "really" cares about the students with no put on.

Professor Behr-Jerome cares about her students and really wants them to do well. She is very understanding and flexible in trying different ways for students to learn - which is important for an older student like myself. She is an exceptional individual, as well as an outstanding teacher, who "really" cares about the students with no put on.

By the far the most helpful & entertaining instructor I've ever had. I HATE Math, but somehow I was always excited for her class. She's funny, kind, helpful, & incredibly understanding. Going to her class was a blast and she was ALWAYS available for help. She's really great about getting tests graded quickly, too. I will definitely miss her class.
This lady is wonderful. She is the most helpful professor I've ever had.

This woman helped me with math in a way id NEVER thought id could be helped.  Even in high school for me, my teachers didn't get close to explaining math to me the way she does.  She is THE BEST Math teacher! (no exaggeration)
she was the best, I think coming from a high school, her teaching style made it easier to learn the material. Very helpful she almost made learning math fun.
Great professor!  Super helpful, she made a hard subject easy.

I loved this class with mrs.jeerome. She was so helpful when it came to exams, homework and projects. She was very caring and understanding. Easy A as long as you do all assignments and homework. Best math teacher i have had thus far at cleveland state and ive had alot! :)

She is such a sweet lady. I had a large class size and she always remembered my name and talked with me. The class is mostly do on your own, but when you do need help she is there for you. She is a very good teacher.
She truly cares whether or not you do well in her class!

Excellent instructor! She breaks down all concepts and really works with students to help them understand what she is teaching. She also understands that most students are only taking her class to fulfill requirements so she speaks in terms that all students can understand. The only way you can fail her classes is if you do not apply yourself.
She is the best ever ,,

She's a caring teacher with maternal instincts. Always takes care of the students and gives projects as well as tests. Supposedly no one has ever failed her class and its near impossible to get lower than a C

Prof Bell knows his subject matter and explains it well. He prepares you for his 2 exams and will re-explain any concepts to you that you're having trouble with. Attendence isn't mandatory, but I would recommend it because the info you receive from his lectures will help you on the exams. He also grades on a curve, which helps!
Prof. Bellis a really nice guy. Very helpful; explains things 2 or 3 times. Tests are Multiple choice. Pretty easy class if you pay attention or read the text.

Loved his teaching style. He made a difficult and uninteresting subject like econ. become relevant and interesting. He has a way of relating it to concrete and simple things when he gives examples. His tests are simple; the sample questions he gives are a BIG help when preparing for his tests.

Prof. Bell made what could have been a boring topic interesting.  He obviously enjoys the subject and teaching.  He would explain concepts in multiple ways to increase student understanding.  He puts students on the spot, asking questions and expecting them to defend answers, which can be uncomfortable.  He also used a huge curve to help grades.
This professor made a difficult subject easy to understand.
Good lecture.Two exams and they multiple choice..so if you screw up you can't make up..no assignments. Enjoyed his class

I could never figure out what the value in attending class actually was. But Bell repeatedly convinces me there is value in doing so. He paints a picture in your mind of the concepts that are important, which few professors can do. The more you listen, the less you need to study.

Bell is one of the three best business profs at CSU (the others are Polomsky and Dunegan). He's funny, extremely sarcastic, and makes the class interesting. Tests are only 30 questions so be careful. If you try hard and study, you will do fine.

At 67 credits, Bell is only the 2nd example I've run into of a professor whose lectures actually matter! (The other was Dr. Modney, BIO.) And they're very entertaining too! I'm a book person, but you can master the material in Bell's class entirely from the lectures--he's that good!

I really enjoyed his class. So far he is the best professor I've run into at CSU, he's very funny and he knows how to keep the class interesting. You have to go to his class to do well on tests, but he tells you what's going to be on them. Better than any

Great teacher.  Enthusiastic about material, keeps your attention.  Taking good notes during lecture is more important than course book.  Tests are challenging but you should do okay if you pay attention.
Excellent teacher, best in the department

Great teacher.  Funny, fun, and knows how to teach! Very good at what he does, probably the best.  He does have hard tests, but if you stay with him and study you will get an A.  oh yea, taub is horrible, dont waste your time with him.
Bell is a tough teacher but at least he respects his students

Be prepared to work!  Long homework assigned every class.  Taught me a valuable lesson about working hard.  Grading is more than fair though and you CAN get an A if you actually put in real effort.  They recommend 3 hours independent study per week per credit hour and with this class its close to literal. OK professor, subtle sense of humor

Terrible professor... Avoid at all costs. Tests are extremely tough for time given, closed everything except for calculator. Test averages are well below 50%. Curve did little for me, although I was around the average. Worst I have taken.

His class is certain tough, no doubt about that, but it's certainly doable.  Granted, I was one of the people who did well in his class, but I wasn't the only one.  Despite what others say, he is genuinely interested in helping you and he provides you with a lot of real-world applications. Go into it knowing you need to work, and you'll be fine.
The name of the game is survival.  Do better than the class average and you have a chance to pass. Good luck.
Try your best to stay away from this awful professor

I don't know how to start but its better that you go to a WAR and not to take a class with him. you will be studying 100 hours a week and you will get 'F' just stay away and don't make mistakes in your life that you have to pay for. Exams are too hard, he gives 4 problems and each one has 4-5 sub questions and expect you to finish the exam within 1
not the best prof. rediculous exam Q?

The worst professor.  He is too old to be teaching because his techniques and styles are ancient.  His exams require 3 hours, but he gives you only 1hr...makes no sense.  Homework problems take 8hours, but there are now computer programs that can do it in 5 min.  the course needs to concentrate more on today's technology instead of 50 yrs ago!

You will learn to love her sense of humor. She does care deeply about her students and really is only looking for the bare minimum. Although I will admit she is one of the most deeply incoherent people I've ever met. She knows about math and literally nothing else. For our midterm she sent us to a room that didn't exist. Still got an A though

Worst professor ever, disorganized, rude, spends class punching numbers in a calculator for the class. I didn't learn anything, all the homework is online. Easy to get an A but not worth having her as a professor, awful.

Spends half the class showing the class how to do the most basic things on the graphing calculator. Tells us annoying jokes. Does problems on the board wrong and will just say kidding or do you guys think I did that to see if youre paying attention? Teaches the class like we are 5th graders. Cant wait till this class is over.

such an awful professor. I never understood anything she was explaining & I had to teach myself EVERYTHING. She's rudely sarcastic & treats her students like they're dumb even though she is one of the dumbest people on the earth. Don't take her class, it's so boring to sit through since attendance is mandatory yet I never learned a single thing.

Bellini has a personality you have to be ready for. I was not, and I found her very bluntly sarcastic. Her style of teaching is just doing hw problems on the board. You'll have a quiz every other Fri. I taught myself the material and passed fine, make sure you do ALL hw. She gives extra credit for simple things like putting your bday on your test.

Mrs. Bellini is a good professor with a great sense of humor. She goes over the homework in class, and the material will make much more sense if you follow along. Be sure to do all of the homework, as it can really boost your grade. Tests and quizzes closely resemble the homework. Her funny jokes and sayings make the class more enjoyable.

Very rude to students and will often make fun of you if you are late to her class. Never knows the anwser to your questions and asks you to go to the tutoring center instead. Please run if you get this teacher.

Professor Bellini is great. If you don't understand something, you can ask during or outside of class and she will help you figure it out. Also, she keeps things light by making fun of herself when she (either on purpose or not) makes mistakes in a problem.  NO PENALTY FOR SKIPPING, EVEN THOUGH SHE SAYS YOU ONLY GET 3 ABSENCES.

Class was a bore. I would have never chosen to show up if not for mandatory attendance. Takes points off on tests and quizzes for the most asinine things. Taught myself most of the material, class wasn't helpful.
I'm really good at MATH, but I don't like her class so I skip this sometimes. She told me that I won't get A because my absences.

Whatever you do, don't take her hour and 50 minute TuesdayThursday class. It is by far the most mentally exhausting class ever. The online homework blows, but that's not really her fault. She's just bad at explaining things. For my first time ever doing calculus, I wish I had a better teacher.

And for the dummy making cracks about people having an IQ of 5 for not understanding her, you have the IQ of 5 since you had to take "MTH 118" with her and that's not even a course at CSU. We have a MTH 117-a developmental math course for people like you who are too dumb to be in college math.

For the love of God, Allah, Buddha, a tree, or whoever you worship or don't worship, DO NOT TAKE HER CLASS! She doesn't explain the problems & you'll spend a lot of time in tutoring or self learning the material. This is an easy F course-that's how bad she is. She lost 3240 students this semester. I'm in the honors program & didn't understand her.
the worst teacher I've had

Seriously this is the in the top 10 worst classes I have ever been enrolled in at Cleveland State. Bellini is a HORRIBLE professor. She rambles on about things that have nothing to do with the topic of math. She treats students as if they were in 3rd grade, not on a college level. Uses annoying phrases and you learn nothing. DO NOT TAKE HER CLASS.

her lectures are BORING and literally all she did was write on the board and type numbers into her calculator and displayed it on the wall. having the work be due online i literally taught myself all the material with some help from the SLA and her. the material is difficult and i spent a lot of time doing the work but it wasn't difficult to handle

Pretty nice lady but hardly teaches the material. Spends more time making jokes and talking about her family than she actually does going over material. The book is a must and if you do the homework you can basically pass the class. Also gives in class homework that counts towards your grade.

she doesnt care about the students that much. she isnt helpful at all. she wont do anything to boost the students grade. she has annoying sayings. in my opinion dont take the class because half the people do show up and test scores are low and she doesnt care about what the students get on test and stay away from her class!!

Annoying sense of humor, tends to show no interest in us our the material. When describing a problem she usually says " bla bla bla" which is very annoying. Overall an old and very cold professor who does not care about her students success. Usually half of my class did not show up and the average grades on the exams were 60-65%. Stay away!!!!!!!

Funny sense of humor but useless professor who expected you to know everything without being taught.  Take a different class with a different professor if you'd like to know how to actually use the math she should be teaching.
Dr. Belovich is a great Professor, She is professional, knowledgeable, and is a very kind Professor
She expects you to work for your grade and if you do that, you will do fine in the class. Her grading is very fair and the homework is always harder than the exams.

A great professor! She is very good at taking the complicated topics and explaining them in plain English. Her quizzes are fair for the most part, and she grades very fairly. The only thing I'd say is the homework is way harder than the class examples, and is graded harshly. Also I didn't get much out of the recitations. I definitely recommend!

Best Professor I have ever had. You earn your grade no matter the class (CHE300,306).  No doubt that the grade was EARNED at the end of the semester! Begin working on HW and ask questions ASAP. She truly has the innate ability to teach well, difficult topics still feel like she's "holding your hand" but loosening the grip as the semester progresses

dr belovich is a good teacher just be ready to work. there is alot of material to cover & she goes fast so dont miss any days or you will be lost. tests arent that bad and she never tests you on something she didnt cover in class. she is always around for extra help. as long as you arent lazy, you should do fine.
Best Professor in engineering

I had her for bioreactors and tissue engineering.  She is an excellent professor.  Everything is explained clearly, difficult concepts are broken down and she cares about how students are doing.  Her classes are difficult but fair and you will learn a lot.

Dr. Belovich has a true passion for the research she involves herself with at CSU. She makes herself readily available to her research students. She is very helpful, yet challenges you to get investigate and create in the research project you undertake. If you are working with her, you will have an awesome project and a good time.
She is the great theacher I have ever seen. She teaches the subject very well and cares about you...I am looking forward to take class from her again...Got A from this class...

He's genuinely caring and wants to make his students great engineers! As long as you come to class and take notes you'll be okay. She was really boring.  Monotone voice sometimes and the class was long however she did teach us alot about the information.  Saturday classes were not awfull since the "field trip" Lab classes were good ways to get out of the classroom. Overall very good course.

Professor Bentkowski is probably the most interesting lecturer I've ever had. He's a guy with great real world experience, teaching things that matter.

Mr. Bentkowski is one of the best professors at CSU! Hes funny while giving real life examples of business law. He makes the class fun and engaging. He gives you a study guide before the exams. Bentkowski is an amazing professor. He truly cares about his students and wants them to enjoy the class. Although this was an 8:30am class i did not mind waking up to attend! overall recommend taking business law with David Bentkowski

Mr. Bentkowski if you ever read this I want to thank you. I had a lot of life changing events occur while taking your class and your positive attitude, kindness, and teaching style have really stuck with me. CSU is prob more respected because David teaches there. Attendance is 25% of your grade, but, for an 8:30 am class I always looked forward going. He has the rare skill to take a boring topic and make it fun and interesting. Because he has had real world experience before becoming a professor, I never left class without learning something new.

Best class I have ever taken. This man is amazing, he is the breath of fresh air you need in college courses - you know, he is not out to get you or wanting to give you a bad grade. All-in-all the class is very easy to follow and you can finish it in a week. He is amazing, I cannot stress this enough.

This professor is awesome! He makes you want to come to class everyday. His lectures resemble his vast experience in the field of business and law. Study guide NO surprises
Great teach and awesome dude. Makes it worth actually going to class although it is not mandatory. Just go for a good laugh and learn how to talk about current topics.

Professor Bentkowski is an absolute professional in law that teaches from real world experiences. He truly made this class a blast to learn and understand how the different parts of law relate to the Business world.

Too much expected out of students.  If this were the only class it would be douable.  The instructor acts as this course is the only one being taken when most students are taking 15 cr. hours or more plus being in shows or backstage.

Dr. G is an excellent professor. As long as you do the work, you should be able to easily get an A, considering how much extra credit he gives. Amazing professor, always helpful during office hours. It is clear he truely cares for his students and wants them to do well.

It is obvious that Dr. G is very passionate about chem. He's a great professor, but his tangents when giving examples are over the top lol. Dr. G's class was one of the easiest. He is extremely hard to understand and makes you learn the long way. If you can teach yourself this class is a joke. His exams are just like the reviews he posts before. Study those and you will get an A. I would highly recommend taking him for as many classes.

Dr. G is very passionate about chemistry and happy to meet with students outside of class to help you understand his lessons. If you do the homework and take the quizzes, they are excellent practice for his exams, which are fair. He also provides helpful review questions. Attendance is not mandatory, but his in class lectures are important.
Good teacher, only problem is he uses strange references.

He does not get to know his students, but that doesn't affect his teaching abilities. Good at elaborating chemistry in order for students to understand. He is not lenient on due dates of homework and quizzes. Would not recommend taking this professor. He does not give good feedback on assignments and is not willing to understand your situation

Dr. Bhandal really cares about this students and wants to make sure you understand the topics. Quiz every week on materials covered week before. Exams are problems but the same ones he covers in class, just different numbers. I wish I had to take college physics 2 just so I could have him again as my professor.
he's the best
One of the most caring professors I've had, gives timely feedback, very accessible. Wish I could take next PHY course with him, but unfortunately, he seems to be only teaching 221.

Dr. Bhandal is everything youd want in a professor, especially if youre weak in the topic. He really cares about his students and motivates you to do well. Show up to class and focus on the in-class problems and youll be more than okay. He is very considerate and knows who is trying and who isnt... so try! Take him if you can!

Dr. Bhandal is wonderful! You definitely need to attend class. He covers everything in class and uses real-life applications. Physics was made easy. The exams use similar problems to what he goes over in class, so make sure you understand them. He cares about his students and wants them to succeed & gives opportunities to make up quizzes and hw.

Dr. Bhandal makes the concepts very clear and there are no surprises on his exams. If you come to class, take good notes, review the problems he does in class, do the WileyPlus homework, you should do fine. He is completely accessible outside of class and truly wants his students to do well. I think he's fantastic! Just wish he taught 222 as well!

Dr. Bhandal cares about his students. Attend all of his lectures, take notes, and review them for your upcoming quizzes and exams. Allows one cheat sheet per exam! (front and back). He really knows what he's talking about, and applies real-life examples throughout the lectures so you have a better feel of the topics. Do not miss any lectures!

Dr. Bhandal made physics very interesting. There are A LOT of notes. Attend class and be prepared. Quiz every week. Final is heavily weighted, but you are allowed a cheat sheet for every exam. Relatively easy class, and you will actually enjoy learning physics!

Dr. Bhandal made physics easy to understand an apply, if you go to class and pay attention then you will be guaranteed an A. He allows one full page of notes for the exams/quizzes which are basically reworded problems from his lectures. All he cares about is you understanding physics and succeeding, so he will always give the benefit of the doubt.

Dr. Bhandal's the sweetest man! Physics is my new favorite subject because of him. Don't buy the book, he lectures from his notes. Just buy the WileyPlus he requires for the 10 HW assignments & you can easily get an A. There are 10 quizzes, 4 exams, & a final. You'll learn awesome real-world applications of physics that you never thought of before!

The best professor ive had so far. Physics is a hard subject but he makes it clear and easy to understand. Cares so much about his students. His classes are important to go to because he gives quizzes over what he discussed and all the material is over his notes from class. I would recommend him to anybody that thinks physics may be challenging.

Dr. Bhandal really cares about this students and wants to make sure you understand the topics. Quiz every week on materials covered week before. Exams are problems but the same ones he covers in class, just different numbers. I wish I had to take college physics 2 just so I could have him again as my professor.

4 exams and a quiz every week & writes all notes on the chalkboard for students to copy down. It seems like a lot at first, but what he says in class & the examples he gives are almost word for word questions on the exams. He had to leave half way through the semester, but I recommend taking him if he returns. He really cares about students.

HE IS PHENOMENAL. Quizzes every Monday regarding the previous lecture only. The exams are questions from class but restated concepts with different numbers. He doesn't curve but rumor has it he curves at end of the semester though he won't admit to it so you keep working hard. He is inspiring, intelligent, and wants his students to succeed.

Dr. Bhandal was a great professor. Started every day with a quiz from last weeks material. Make sure to attend class, as the exams are mainly formed from class examples. He makes the subject very clear and is easy to follow. Very nice and caring, always willing to help during office hours.

Wonderful professor, makes it very easy to get an A if you take time to learn material & show up for class. He doesnt use Blackboard so all notes have to be taken in class. I did not use textbook, since all you have to do to do well on exams is redo the problems from lecture and make a good formula sheet (he allows full pg of paper)

Lots of HW-- just like every other physics class. Physics is hard in general, but Dr. Bickel does an amazing job to give everyone a chance to succeed. So warm and inviting! She's so accessible during office hours and over email. She's also very flexible. The best, most caring professor I've had.

Lots of HW-- just like every other physics class. Physics is hard in general, but Dr. Bickel does an amazing job to give everyone a chance to succeed. So warm and inviting! She's so accessible during office hours and over email. She's also very flexible. The best, most caring professor I've had.

I have no idea why Bickel has such bad reviews she is a great teacher! Physics is just hard in general so you will have to work for it but she helps you so much! She will do the homework with you, on test as long as you write out what you're thinking (especially if you have no idea) she will give you points, and always answers emails and cares alot

She is very disorganized, most of class is focused on discussing answers for problems in groups which causes confusion and is completely unhelpful. Physics doesn't have to be difficult, but a disorganized professor makes it so. Don't take this class if you don't like solving problems in groups because that is what 25% of class time is spent on. She may seem like a bad choice to many, but if you actually put time into homework and ask questions, you can come out with an A. A lot of people in this class don't really try outside of class and then complain that it's the professor's fault.

Teaches very backwards, making it hard to learn the material on your own. assigns a lot of reading based homework on the next chapter and lightly goes over it in class. Homework is almost impossible due to the fact that the website is not good and the type of problems, Take Physics at Tri-c.
If you can read her handwriting, you're lucky. expects you to teach yourself from readings, and then come to class where she would explain the lesson very very poorly. terrible....
she's very sloppy in her explanations, unorganized when doing a problem, and definitely gives hard exams. Do not take her !!!

VERY EASY

Hands down the best professor I've ever had. He has a great sense of humor and makes you look forward to going to class each day.
