Funniest professor I've ever had, his lectures are the best, he tells the best stories and always put me in the best mood. He told our class once that he did read his rate my professor so if you're reading this frank, you're the best thank you for an awesome semester, most memorable professor of my college career

Mr. Bilaver was an amazing professor. His class was very accessible, his lectures made sense, he relates to his students very well, and is an overall good person. He shares his personal life with us and is very genuine. His class requires a lot of reading and writing, but his personality definitely makes it worth it!

Took class for my major,ended up being my favorite class I have ever had in my college career. Frank is extremely wise beyond his years & HILARIOUS. The lectures are never boring. Discussions in that class make me feel smarter every time I walk out of that room. Tough paper grader but it makes you better in the end. Would recommend in a heartbeat!

This is my first semester at CSU and Frank has set the bar high for future professors. His lectures are funny, informative, and gave great perspective into current events. It was my earliest class this semester, but I was happy to go to class every week and was sad when I had to miss. Highly recommend him to other students and he's very cute ;)
The best professor I have had at CSU and I have been there four years. The discussions are interesting and fun. Professor Bilaver is an all around great guy who makes you enjoy going to class!
He is a very excellent professor. I enjoy and look forward to class every week. Keep up the good work.
The professor is awesome at teaching. Very funny with great lectures. Very interesting subject and easy to understand. Very fun class
Good Class and very easy to follow along.  Good group discussions!
The professor is great. He is actually there to teach and educate the students. Definitely an inspiration. Makes the class very easy. You will not want to miss class.
Professor Bilaver is funny to be around and all the lectures and topics are very interesting
No feedback, assignments not returned before next assignment due.
The only good thing is you don't have to go to class its basically an online class. But he's a jerk and wont help you.

Ben Blake is the worst professor I've had at CSU in my 4 years. Very sarcastic and does not come prepared to lecture. Currently in his class, and he has legitimately only lectured maybe 3 or 4 times out of the 6 weeks school's been in session. He will just assign a group homework everyday and expect you to know it. Avoid if you can, it's just awful
Very unapproachable. Whenever you need to ask him a question in class or through email, he is very harsh and rude.
Worst Prof. I've ever had. Basically had to teach myself how to code C# which is not an easy task. Does an awful job explaining or teaching. DO NOT TAKE if you honestly want to learn code.
Worst professor i've ever had

Not a very good instructor, and although this is an ENTRY level programming course, his teaching would show otherwise. He is very sarcastic and unhelpful and doesn't explain the code well enough for anyone to understand. He shows up late to class and his lesson plans seem like they're thought of thirty minutes before the class begins

Not a fan of Professor Blake, like at all.... he simply just does not teach very well. He teaches his class like you already know about programming when in reality this is a introductory level course. If you are completely new to coding, expect to struggle with this course. He does a very poor job of explaining the concepts. Also a tough grader.

Very condescending and unhelpful. He calls this class an easy A, but the work is so tedious and frustrating and he was very unsympathetic, giving useless advice like "Don't waste your time" without specifying how. He walked away from me while I was asking for help. He makes it clear he doesn't enjoy helping students or answering their questions.
The best

The group project that he has you do at the end of the semester is tragic. Beware of that. Other than that he let's you take this class online at home if you want, which is really great depending on your schedule. He responds to emails within 24 hours, his tegrity videos are very useful if you choose to do the work at home, and the work is easy.

Ben is a mediocre professor. His assistance in class is somewhat helpful, but not as beneficial as it could've been. Some assignments in the class are easy, but some can be extremely difficult.  Attendance isn't mandatory. There is a tutoring center if Ben isn't reachable.

I enjoyed his class. He has a sarcastic attitude which is funny. He isn't rude or anything. There really isn't a need to be guided by him, the instructions on what to do are given to you, it's a matter of knowing how to follow directions. He gives you extra tries to better your score. He walks around answering questions so he tries to help you.

Easy A, but he is not helpful. If you ask him something, he will either not know or just tell you to google it. No need to show up to class, he even tells you that. He is very snippy and condescending when contacting him through email for help. Didn't really learn anything.

Easily the worst professors Ive ever had between the two institutions i have gone to. Emailing him about the class and having a problem is an absolute no. He does not reply with kindness and does not help you solve your problem. Very hard to understand his final. Makes very unorganized due dates. Please, take my word, Take it with a diff professor

I have had Blake as a professor for a few classes now. He usually shows up to class late and he's not a good lecturer. Sending him emails is pointless because he makes smart remarks and avoids actually solving your problem. Blake likes to have the class assign grades to their peers, which sucks. You can skip class and still get a decent grade.

I was hoping for an "invitation to computing," but what I received was "Programming shoved down my throat."  Class consisted of I'll only talk for a minute so you can get started on your programs."  Developed his own Language, called BLAKE...Basic Language for Acquiring Key Programming Essentials.  Most frustrating programming language EVER!!!
AVOID AT ALL COST. He does not have the ability to nor teach. I'm not gonna have him again even if i had to drop a semester.

AWFUL class, took CIS151, he used his own programming langusge, if possible, take CIS151 with a different prof.  His Powerpoints crashed my Power Point software completely.  I would try, sincerely to get a different prof, if I were you.  Check out other comments about Prof. Blake first.

This class has been awful. Professor Blake utilizes his own code called Blake. If you try to get help from the tutoring center, good luck because they don't understand Blake at all! He doesn't answer questions very well either.. He actually answers with another question.  If at all possible, DON'T take his class! Try to get a different professor!!!

Worst professor i have ever had. I've had nothing but issues with him. He doesn't teach at all. He gives no explanation as to why your program is wrong. If he knows his stuff he doesn't show it. I could probably have a better chance learning programming from the Amish. Hands down worst professor of all time. AVOID AT ALL COSTS!!!
this professor was very confusing and unclear in his lectures.
Great professor. He is all too willing to help you with any questions you may have!

Dr Blake is a great guy. He has a sense of humor :P, I enjoyed learning in his class. Just follow his lectures and textbook. Participate and prepare on Computational Lab before each test, you will do just fine. it's easy to get an B, i guess, for me! H. SI Section is extremely helpful. Martha is one of the best. Dr Blake curves every test :D GREAT!

Homework and attendance count toward the grade. For me, it's a 2 hour class that should be 50 minutes. Math isn't hard for me, though. However, if it was... I would hate this class even more than I do. It's math and it's boring. Late homework isn't accepted. His tests aren't that easy, either. If you have to take the class, he's a nice enough guy.

Teacher is not orgaized in his structure of teaching.Does not offer clear examples. Makes test extremely hard then curves them so everyone can pass. Which is riduculous. All in all had it not been for the SI instructor assigned to the class I would not have learned much.

The class is a math class and is somewhat difficult for some. Dr Blake truly wants to see his students do well, and if you go to class and participate it is huge to him.  Computational labs the class before the test are identical to the test, if you can do these problems without issue, you can get an A

Tests have huge curves because professor is a poor instructor and does not use clear examples. Understand the textbook alone or suffer. He also tells you to go to tutoring, but says the tutors are wrong in the way they teach- when they can teach clearly out of the text without an hour of unnecessary and unrelated background info.
Class is very boring...tests are long and hard but he does curve every test.

Dr. Blake was an a great teacher. Took stats before, but now I actually understadn the material. But, time is needed outside of class, plenty. If you can do the work at the end of the chapter then you ae preapred for the exams. Remember this is college, one must work outside of class for the grade

I took his class though it was not mandatory. his classes are very informative but his exams were the toughest ones, but made me learn lot of things, which i never imagined. this class has created interest for me to persuade a specialization in consumer psychology.
Every test is curved. On our first test, anyone that got a 72% or higher got an A on the test.
Take Ms Blankenship. You will learn a lot and won't regret it.
she wont give you better grade

Professor bleeke(blake-ee) is an effective lecturer and I enjoyed her class. Her grades are based on her opinion(she actually said that) so don't get on her bad side. If you are an art major she will give you a better grade but if you aren't it is extremely difficult to get an a on any assignment.

I really enjoyed her class and I felt like I learned a lot from her lectures. However, I found that it was extremely difficult to complete assignments as she worded the handouts vaguely. Be very cautious about taking her class for a grade as her assignments tend to be grouped together and difficult to understand.

Do not take any classes with her if you care about your grades. She's a fine teacher except for her assignments and grading. She gives no assignments then assigns like 5 in a week. In addition she has a tendency to be vague on the rubrics for assignments so it's impossible to know what to do. She would've been 5/5 but her assignments are awful.

Do not take this class with this professor; if there is another choice- take it. Unclear expectations, short time frames given for large amounts of work, does not answer questions with a clear cut answer, leaving you confused. The class is unorganized and lecture can be quite boring. Feedback given on papers is nonexistent.

Prof. Bleeke was absolutely no help in our online class. Just from the way she talked in her recorded lectures, you could tell that she was full of herself. While grading papers, instead of giving constructive feedback, she just used a lot of "????" type comments. I took this class over the summer and it has been the most stressful class yet.

This professor is very unhelpful when it comes to online course work. She takes days to respond to an email, making your assignment late if you have questions that need to be answered by her, and she is bitter and selfish and unwilling to help you succeed. Has no sympathy for online students trying to accommodate both school and work.

My all time favorite professor, very passionate and knowledgeable. I won't deny it requires a lot of effort and excess information but the class is very informative and her study guides are always strait forward. Lots of writing but the in class assignments you always get an a plus and if you do bad on a paper she'll let you redo it. Great teacher

This class is the worst. You spend half the class learning about the religion of Islam, not the actual art. She thinks she's an English professor and put so much effort into grading formatting, grammar, etc. Also, you have to write a 3, 5, and 8 page papers. She is so rude with her comments that she writes on the assignments. God speed.

Her class is easy if you pay attention. There is a lot of memorization. As a teacher, she is pretty annoying and repeats everything at least three times, but it's not that bad when it comes to work. It is pretty important that you go to class, though.

Dr. Bleeke is the best! Her lectures and PowerPoints are clear and concise with a ton of interesting information. Even her study guides and tests are given before. There aren't too many images to memorize. Altogether, I recommend her classes to everyone.

As a person I do not like her. As a teacher I like her even less. It's not because her class is "hard," I'm used to that. Her "feedback" is non-existent. She's never around and never responds to emails. She grades arbitrarily and is not at all clear on her expectations. She's full of herself. Don't take her if you don't have to. Save your sanity.

If you don't want a life for a semester, I suggest taking her class!! 4 reports due, each week you have to read 2 20 page reports and talk about them along with quizzes, reading reports and more goodies. I think I have done more work this semester than all year in other classes.

I have taken 5 art history courses, and they are all challenging, however, Dr. Bleeke was my favorite teacher. She gives opportunity to improve your grade simply by re-submitting your corrected paper via her suggestions. Her study guides were more helpful than my other art history professors, and she is very clear about her expectations.
If you want to learn something and improve your writing, take this class.

Unneccessarily hard.  The teacher is rather tedious in explaining everything and does not make the class fun or exciting.  She does not relate well to students and grades rough and seems to look for ways to deduct points unneccessarily.  If I didn't need this I would not have stayed in this class.  Avoid this teacher if possible.

Dr. Bleeke doesn't deserve the bad reviews she's getting.  Yes, her classes are HARD, but if you are dedicated to the subject they are very rewarding and she is very helpful and kind.  She expects you to work for your grade, and come on--this is college, what did you expect?
This teacher is unnecessarily tough.  The class isn't fun, and she spits out so many facts it's boring and tedious.  If I didn't need it to graduate I would have dropped it. Avoid this professor.
She is a very hard teacher.  Her class was the hardest class I have taken at CSU.  Literally wants you to study this stuff every day for hours to get it.  Heavy recall on test.  Avoid.
No Comments

Literally worst professor ever. He never teaches, he makes students present in groups every class period all semester, 3 hour and 15 minute long presentations for each group. Grades papers not according to content but according to grammar errors. Would never suggest him to anyone

Extremely helpful professor. If you like hard work and research, he is the one for you. But if you are a slacker that wants your professor to clean the SHIT off your backside after going to the toilet ~ then take a LONG WALK. He is extremely helpful and has a great wealth of knowledge. Prof Blue YOU ROCK!

Great Professor. He is very much into group projects, so if you love working with groups, this is the guy for you. You must attend class; your grade is pretty much based on your attendance and participation. Punctuality is a must with this guy !!!!!!!!

She seemed very separated from the course that I took with her. She was a medium for information, as she only provided it to us in the form of uploaded scans/articles, no lectures. I was a bit put off as we covered material focused on feminism, yet our course was supposed to teach us gender communication. Material heavy, weekly essays, easy grader.
Super disorganized, late to reply to emails, and overall expects too much for a short online course
Online class was a bit unorganized. But the articles and reading for this course were amazing!

I can't say if Professor Bly is a good or bad teacher. It seems she was all over the place during the semester. The only work we had was a few disscussion board posts, a mid term, and final paper. She didn't stick to her syllabus at all and gave us less work than the syllabus. I read none of the textbook because we had no work related to it. Easy A
AWESOME

Completely disorganized & posts wrong info on BB. Gives little to no feedback & is rude when responding to emails for clarification. For the final project that is 2/3 of the class grade, she gives little instruction and the class itself doesn't give any assistance to being successful on the project. The class has no course content to work off of.

I took Professor B's online course. She has been all over the place the entire semester. Her instructions were very confusing which lead to many emails that she never responds to. She also doesn't regularly show up to her office hours. There were a couple times that she posted one of her other classes assignments in BB and it took days to clarify.

I am an international student at CSU. I have been studying for ten years and I have not seen a teacher like her. she respects and helps me a lot. She enforces you to get A. She made the class easier than you think.

Dr Bly is very insightful and purposeful in her lectures. She always makes sure to check in with the class about how they're feeling on the topics being discussed. Provides great feedback and values course discussion beyond a grading system purely centralized on tests.

Absolutely love the way that the class is so discussion-based for the students. She facilitates regularly, but for the most part it is students doing the talking. This is a great way to talk about historical perspectives and issues. Love that despite her liberal views, she doesn't shame anyone for their personal beliefs. 10/10 would take again
This professor stood up for what she believes in.. Other students that posted about her "infighting hate" and making them feel "unsafe"  should stop being so dramatic.
Absolutely rediculous that this professor can't keep their liberal bias out of the classroom.

"We are striking today ... Women and brown and black people are unsafe now more than ever" is what she said once trump got elected to be the president, but the only time I ever felt unsafe as a woman was when I got these emails and realized my professor doesn't accept my right to think for myself
No
Insights  hate on campus

Very enthusiastic about class. She sets up a very casual atmosphere which makes class discussions less likely to explode. Brings a fresh perspective on herstory, feminism, and intersectionality. If you actually do the reading and allow for self-exploration of one's own opinion of gender/race/class, this class will be most beneficial to you!
Aweeesome professor! Absolutely loved her class. She brings up interesting topics and has no problem voicing her opinion and letting others argue hers. Great discussions. Fair grader.

I absolutely loved this class. Dr. Bly is very passionate about her work. She does get upset if the class doesn't do the readings, but that is understandable. Attendance is mandatory. She deducts from your overall grade if you miss more than 3 classes. I would highly recommend her. It's an easy A if you do your work!

This professor was okay. The topics covered were interesting, but as far as her ways of being oragnized, not so great. Most of the time, we had to remind her of projects coming up and midterms and finals. Other than that, class was cool.

She's a pretty good teacher. Allows each student to get their opinions out. We did have group meetings almost every Friday which didn't last long so Friday was almost like a free day. Attendance is mandatory. After a few absences she will take points off your grade. I didn't receive my grade yet but it's not hard to get an A

Excellent instructor who gives great feedback and is always available to answer questions and assist you. Due to the pandemic, this class was held virtually this year. Participation in class is important; however, she gives you multiple ways to interact.

Excellent instructor who gives great feedback and is always available to answer questions and assist you. Due to the pandemic, this class was held virtually this year. Participation in class is important; however, she gives you multiple ways to interact.

Genetics is hard, but Dr. Boerner's lectures make it unnecessarily so. He seems like a nice guy but I didn't find his lectures or powerpoints to be very coherent. It's not the accent, which is mild, it's just the way he explains information. I ended up not going to lecture and studying from my book instead.

This class is really hard, but Dr Boerner doesn't make it any easier. His lectures were okay at best, but he would jump around and make it hard to follow. Luckily his tests were easier than expected, but that doesn't mean you don't have try. If you were to ask him a question after class, he would only listen to half of the question and not answer

He taught half the semester, but was the clearer of the lecturers. Nevertheless, it's a difficult subject and he expects students to treat the information like it's their life's blood. Doesn't believe in study guides. With confusing TAs handling the recitation, it's mostly on the students to know the material.

Dr. Boerner is funny and interacts well with his students.  While a difficult tester, if you read the material prior to lecture it will help a lot. Attendance isn't mandatory, but it will count in your favor if your grade is borderline.  Recording lectures is also helpful.

GREAT TEACHER.  He interacts with students during lecture and asks questions all the time, it is very effective teaching.  At times, he can be a difficult lecturer to follow but if you read the material before class, it's easier  Hard test questions but fair grading. Loved his class, would happily take a class with him again.

Bogus wasn't necessarily a bad teacher, he was a little all over the place with his grading. He wasn't consistent with what his syllabus stated and made last minute changes to assignment requirements the week of and didn't say so in class but via email. So check your email. A lot of the students didn't like him but I didn't have too many issues.

Mr. Bogus knows what he's doing.  He has relevant experience and is very technical.  He will teach you the foundations of composition and production to position you for beyond.  Incredibly meticulous, but at the same time he can be sloppy.  Bottom line, he wants to help and make sure that you won't look like a fool in the field.
Most interesting class ever!! He knows his stuff.
Bogus lives up to his name

Excellent Technical instructor.  Very good experience and real world knowledge, translates fairly well into classroom setting. Conserned primarily with your actaul hands-on ability & desire to learn.  Show him you want to learn & he will teach you.
She is very helpful! Please don't worry for her classes!
Hilarius and keeps you engaged.

I took a lower level history class and he was my professor. I honestly regret this; he is very hard. I cannot understand a word he says and he honestly jumps from topic to topic. You might as well take an online class because you will need to attend class and then re-read your book for information. The power points he uses are also useless.

Boia is a mediocre teacher at best.  When the whole class is failing tests you need to add a curve. It's a required class to fulfill credits and Boia makes it out to be a class for early history graduate students! Not pleasant.

Horrible teacher. Must read the book and attend every class otherwise a passing grade is impossible. Pay attention to everything. You must print all documents in case of pop quizzes. Switch teachers NOW if you have him. (you have been warned)

His class is very hard. You have to read the textbook from cover to cover because the test questions are from assigned readings and pages in the book that were not assigned to you. He structures the class to accommodate history buffs, not students who are merely there for the General Education credits. I recommend this class for history majors only

This class I felt was hard.Took it with a friend and we studied almost every night. Quizes and paper are easy, tests are hard. I some how managed to get a B and was extreamly surprised by that!!youll have to work really hard to get an A. slides and readings were not very helpful.
begining of class he said everything that you need for the test is in the book. ive read the book, but still did poorley on tests. this guy is old fashoned. would not recommend him to anyone.

Do not take this course in the summer with this professor. He will try to cram in a whole semester's worth of material into the 6 weeks you have. We had 10 students in our summer class and 9 of us were getting a failing grade. Lots of reading, lots of work, hard to keep up with him. You need to devote 100% of your time to probably get at least a C.

Hard tests, I got D's on both of them after HOURS of studying. But I saved my grade with the quizzes (easy) and paper (easy). I ended up with a B but I didn't go the first few weeks cause I thought I didn't have to. But I recommend you go. He is actually a funny guy and by the end of the semester he had our entire classroom cracking up.

You can tell he loves what he teaches.  Very fair grader, and very willing to work with you if you show up for class and word hard.  Loved his dry humor.  Great professor, I wish I could take all his classes because he makes history interesting.

Tests are hard if you dont read. His projector notes are worhtless and class is boring. he's kanda awkward but I thought he was funny.  I thought he was a bad teacher until I realized that I'd been slacking off and when I studied harder I got better grades.  Very Fair Grader!  Really no reason to avoid him -- 3.3 out of 5 I'd say
Decent teacher. Lectures are very tedious as its pretty much the same thing every class. However if you come to class and do the readings you will do fine. Helpful if you ask questions too.

He is a very nice guy and loves what he teaches. He is willing to help if you ask. He is also a fair grader. I did not use the books, but make sure to take good notes based on what he says, rather than what he puts up on the projector.

He's probably better at teaching upper level courses. You must have the books! Read on your own! AND DO NOT USE ELECTRONIC DEVICES OR "BLUEBERRIES" as he'd call them. Overall I'd give him a 3 out of 5 he knows his stuff.

Extremely hard to understand. Must read the books to even consider passing the class. Lectures go off topic alot.  Spends alot of time re-capping what he did last class and finally gets to the new information half way through the days class. Wouldn't recommend to anyone.
BORING. BORING. BORING. total waste of my time. ended up teaching myself everything and not going to class. got a C over all, but still HATED the class. boring boring boring.
Very good, interesting. Requires a bit of reading outside of class though, not terrible though.
DON'T TAKE THIS COURSE WITH THIS PROFESSOR!!!
he grades the test awful my friend copied off me the entire time and he gave me a D and her a B all because she wrote him a note in his first language
Very interesting speaker.

Professor Bolt is one of the best comm teachers at CSU. I took him for both COM 226 and COM 303. He is engaging, makes lectures interesting, and is straightforward about expectations. He is also understanding when it comes to personal matters and was very helpful to me this semester when I had to take time off for bereavement. Def recommend!

do not like professor. he reads from the book, he doesn't want to help students, he wants to trick us and make our lives more difficult and it sucks. I enjoyed learning until it became a game for him. I wish the administration did something because he is not for student success. get him out of CSU and teaching. you can read the text. he is useless

He's one of the worst teachers I have ever had. His speaking voice is grinding and he takes questions directly from the book. He presents outdated figures and ideas as if they the cutting edge. You can tell he is in it purely for the money, and considering he has a TA and re-uses the same stuff year after year he is very lazy.

Professor Bolt is one of the best comm teachers at CSU. I took him for both COM 226 and COM 303. He is engaging, makes lectures interesting, and is straightforward about expectations. He is also understanding when it comes to personal matters and was very helpful to me this semester when I had to take time off for bereavement. Def recommend!

Sure he's funny, but that comedy gets put in hush mode when you start seeing the grade book. For someone who talks about semantics.... he chooses how hard he grades you based on what he feels like. You better not have any life altering events as he won't find the compassion to let you off and turn something in once the date is due, so get ready.

He reads directly from the book, so going to his class is not needed, however it is mandatory. When I had him he specifically told my class he likes to trick students when it comes to tests which is super annoying considering he teaches a class you have to get a C in to pass. He could make it more enjoyable but chooses to make it more difficult.

Pretty hard teacher, a lot of lectures be sure to record he gets off topic and rambles for half the class. Wasn't very helpful in office hours. Not a hard grader, but has unclear grading expectations. Pretty confusing because he uses trick questions on the test extremely different from how he presents the information in class. Would not recommend.

Prof. Bolt is amazing. He is super knowledgeable about the material he teaches and genuinely cares about his students. He is super funny and makes is class fun to take. However, he is a rather harsh grader so coming to class and learning and understanding is key to passing his class. But he is understanding and wants to help you pass the class.
Funny teacher, but a tough class. Get ready to work for your grade. Still a great teacher though.

Be sure to record the lectures for the first and ESPECIALLY the last research project. He gives you NO HELP for the last project. He's a great prof and is fun to listen to. But be sure to take notes. The average grade in this class is about a 78. Definitely one of the hardest courses in my major.

Prof. Bolt is one of the most down to earth professors I've had. Don't be fooled, his class is difficult, but extremely helpful especially if you want to go onto grad school. Also, i agree with whoever said he was hot. HMU Jeff.

He is one of the most amazing communications professors at Cleveland State! Show up to every class and ACTUALLY pay attention to lectures and it's an easy A. Don't waste your money on the book because it was never opened. Chances for extra credit, I got 80% on the final and I ended the class with 98%. Plus he's kind of hot

Prof. Bolt is a really charismatic and cool guy, but this class is NOT a typical COM class. If you are bad at math or don't like Stats, DO NOT take this class. It is essentially a Stats class made for COM majors, but that doesn't make it any less a math class.

I had him in an online class and he is a tough grader, but gives amazing feedback. When I started failing he really worked with me to get things back together and raise my grade. Very nice and always around the Communications building easy to find and always willing to help.

This course is definitely doable, but it isn't easy. Make sure to read the chapter, watch the lecture and take VERY detailed notes for each quiz. I would study for a few hours before taking each 8-10 minute quiz. And be sure to turn in everything on time, nothing is accepted past the due date.

Dr. Bolt is extremely funny and a very cool guy. The class is boring but he tries his best to keep the lectures interesting. The tests are pretty difficult so study for them. The only complaint I have is that he did not prepare us much for the second research project. Otherwise, good professor and a boring class.

He's a really funny guy and will make sure you understand the material. He lectures everything on the exam, and showing up for an hour twice a week at ten in the morning isn't bad at all. Really great guy and a really great teacher.

Hard class that was essentially a stats course disguised as a comm course. He's a tough grader and is sometimes unclear with his expectations, so ask questions. Showing up to class is MANDATORY. Tests are tough. Material can be confusing.  Read the book and take as many notes as you can. He's a nice and funny guy otherwise.
Great professor

His tests are tough but his lectures are very fun and interesting. Make sure you study and attend class.  I would say these are the ultimate tips to passing this class- it isn't easy. He LOVED when students asked questions and this engaged the class more. Definitely ask questions about the research projects. He faith in his students to do well.

Prof. Bolt failed to properly define & post the requirements & desired configuration of our major writing assignment.  Since attendance was not ID'd as mandatory, not formally documenting how he wanted us to speak to 'emerging themes' in our informational interview paper was wrong.  My paper grade was amended & my final grade higher than I earned.

Truly wonderful. She knows what she's teaching, and does well to explain topics so that they are easy to understand. Slight language barrier, but nothing that you cannot easily figure out what is being said. A little too much group work and assignments, but  I would take again in a heartbeat. Well organized course.
horrible, hard to understand. Just a bad idea. stay away.
One of the best instructors I've ever had!

Attendance wasn't mandatory but if you want participation points , just go. Read the book and you'll do good on the tests. Lab is the easiest part of the class. Virtual wasn't that bad. I had a good team and we communicated well with each other. Overall the class isn't that hard. 4 tests, 2 video presentations, and 1 final project for the virtual.

Class material was presented in a clear and entertaining manner.  Lots of reading (textbook and additional articles).  If you keep up with the reading and pay attention in class, tests aren't too bad.  References are obscure and he is definitely quarky but it adds to the appeal and entertainment of the class.
Bommer brings A game every week. Not a boring guy, great subject to get ExMBA underway. If you're bring you might not like him so much, if you like the show Lost - you'll love him.

Excellent Professor.  I went into the class with low expectations, and left very happy I'd taken it.  It has even helped my career by improving my understanding of human behavior.  I would take him again.
Bill was very interesting and a great teacher. He could care less to use the book and has his own way of teaching.  All professor should learn from him! Take his class!

Kind of a good mix,  but not perfect.  He's a combo of comedian, real life story teller, phd, professor, realist, drinker, and researcher.  He knows his stuff well, gives difficult exams but tells you ahead of time what to expect.  I would defenitally take him again, although not with many other very difficulot classes at the same time
His lectures are interesting and fun. I learned a lot from him. The OB mod project was easy, but the tests are tricky. I would take him again.

Never really got to know prof, but class is straight forward. DB posts every week & 2 responses, 1 quiz, 2 small papers, midterm & final. LOTS&LOTS of article reading. take good notes on readings b/c she asks VERY specific questions on exams. B's on both exams but A in class b/c of papers and participation. keep up w/ reading. overall doable course

She is a hard one to please and "does not believe" in extra credit or study guides. Her exam questions are VERY specific and mainly come from specific wording in research articles. Two weeks into the course I got a university flag from her  on starfish stating academic concerns of  solid B work...  good luck!

Taking HSC 426 with Bonder was an awful decision. The course was recommended to me but a different professor taught it. Dr. Bonder literally wrote the book for the course so expect test questions to be very specific curve balls. She expects a lot out of students and makes it that clear but if you want an A you will need to far exceed her guidelines

LOVED this class! a lot of work for an online class but just put the time into it and you will get the grade you deserve. Provides so many sources relating to the chapters. There is a 8-10 paper  due in this class, but gives students PLENTY of time to get it done. (lets you know about it first week of class and is due finals week.) Highly recommend

Kim was an amazing professor! Even though the lectures were VERY long (it's hard to stay awake sometimes) her powerpoints are very clear and thorough and can be used to help you study what you need to know for the exams. However if you hate group work that's what all of the in class assignments are.

Kim was an excellent professor. She's approachable and her lectures are very informative. Her exams can be difficult, but the PowerPoints are helpful studying tools. Make sure to do every online exercise, because they can be real grade savers. I learned a lot from this course.

For BUS 151 all of the information is presented in power point presentations and videos. Group work for a grade is given most classes and she is a picky grader. She has difficulty answering high level questions, only knows book information.

I will never take this professor again. She was so nit picky with everything. The 10 paged paper she assigns, don't bother doing your best work because she'll just give you a C on it anyways even though you follow the rubric. She will never give you full credit for anything. Makes me think she doesn't want anyone to succeed.

Very tough grader. She points out every little thing wrong and does not like to give you full credit for any assignments. She's helpful but a tough grader, so as long as you are a good writer and will take the time on discussion boards you should pass the class.

Awesome professor! She gives a lot of assignments but is very fair with grading and provides lots of feedback when you need it. I really enjoyed this class - even with all of the work. If you do the work, it isn't that hard. The final paper at the end is for most of your grade.

She was very easy to me. We had 6 discussion boards which were more like short essays, 1 position paper and small tests and quizzes on coursemate that you have to buy for this class. She is very nice and expects professional work. She can expect too much out of one assignment such as the discussion boards but overall good teacher. Highly recommend

I took this class online, and it was a really good class. Interesting material too. And Prof Bonsky always answered e-mails in a timely manner and was very helpful. She is a tough grader but if you are a good writer you will be fine. Do discussion boards, take the quizzes, and spend some time on the papers so they are quality and you will get an A.

This teacher has a very specific grading criteria for everything, including discussion boards, which en up being short essays. She does not like to give full credit for any assignment, and won't budge on what could be a subjective question. She wants it done her way! This class is pointless, but she makes you work  hard for your grade.

Very harsh grader. Do not take her class unless you are a supreme writer. Not helpful, sort of a high and might attitude. The info was interesting, but she wanted you to connect dots that she didn't want to present herself. It's an undergrad class, not an MBA course.
Pretty easy class. I took it online and the worst part was the paper because there was no tests just quizzes and discussion boards. Discussion boards were surprisingly enjoyable. Grades fairly.

This class is basically a fancy title for "Business Ethics". Easy online class. No exams, just quizzes and discussion board each week plus one position paper. Quizzes are simple with open book (didn't have to read beforehand). Very easy grader. Definitely recommend taking it as a 6-week summer class. Don't waste a whole semester.

Took class online, definitely recomend. She is very clear and helpful. Fair grader and very organized. Theres a quiz every week and disscussion assignments every week to every other week. No tests. I really liked her teaching style and organization. From what I heard about ppl that took this class on campus, taking it online def makes it better.

If you hate group projects, avoid her. Her tests are difficult, and have little if anything to do with lectures. Attendance is mandatory, which is probably because no one would show up otherwise. Her directions from group projects   are nonsensical and demands unrealistic things from her students.

This Profeessor is a Woman. She is an ex marketer bases class on a 580 point system in order to achieve "A" grade. She is difficult because the quizes and tests are not really based on the text book althought the final is based on the text book and her quizes and tests in class combined. Forces a group member participation assignment businessplan
Very friendly.
nnice
Not the most informative teacher. But also doesn't demand too much from students. Friendly and on-time.

Professor Borden is one of the nicest professors you will ever get to meet or have in class. However, his teaching style is a little all over the place. He respects you as a student in the classroom, which is nice, but could lead to discussions on content that is not necessary for the class. Nice man. Work hard to understand and you will be fine.

Highly narcissistic, rude, and should be avoided at all costs. Gets mad when questioned, blames students for his mistakes, and is extremely unclear about exam expectations. The way he says it should be approached and what you learn in your classes, and what he really wants are completely contradictory. Worst teacher I have ever had.

Borden is by far the best teacher ive ever had. His balance of material, real discussion, and teaching things beyond contracts to help understand the real world application was amazing. He is humorous, energetic, and genuinely caring. Take his class over anyone else if you can. You'll have to read, but you'll come out of class knowing so much!

Borden is super smart, really kind, and a really cool guy. Unfortunately, my experience was negative. We asked what the format of the final would be. He told us 40 questions and an essay. What we got was 25 poorly-written/ambiguous questions that touched on very few relevant topics and no essay. Regardless of what grade I get, I say don't take him.

Borden is very knowledgeable about Contracts, but he is a little too philosophical on the subject. Was slow in the beginning, which caused some serious crunch time at the end of the semester. Be prepared to learn contracts outside of class, and use class-time as an opportunity to clarify issues. Subject is fluid, so I get why it's hard to teach.

He is the sweetest guy, and really means well, but he is too over the top for first year contracts course.  He is so smart, and gets too philosophical rather than clearly teaching the rules.  I feel slighted to have had him as a contracts professor. Hopefully he is a better corporations teacher.

Professor Borden is probably the smartest person I have ever met. He has to dumb down the material but has a hard time doing it. He really cares about students and it frustrates him when he can't dumb it down enough. He is an awesome guy but should be teaching lawyers looking to further their education beyond a JD.
The best!! Engaging, practical & philosophical class discussions; clear to understand; personable; makes you like Contracts; exams are difficult but good grades are possible!!

Incorporates understanding of interpersonal relations and intangible rewards into occasionally highly philosophical discussion of contracts.  Blurs the line between what it legal and what is moral but that is refreshing.  Very difficult multiple choice exam questions, and he was going easy on us.
clear, energetic, respectful, and has a good sense of humor.  Excellent first year prof- he really helps you figure out what is important in the cases.

This guy is so smart he has to take it down a few notches so we can follow. He can explain stuff like nobody's business and is always willing to make sure you understand the underlying issues.  Looking for an easy A? Look elsewhere. If you want to thoroughly understand contracts and ace it on the Bar, he's your man.Great prof and a great guy.

This guy is so smart he has to take it down a few notches so we can follow. He can explain stuff like nobody's business and is always willing to make sure you understand the underlying issues. Great prof and a great guy. Looking for an easy A? Look elsewhere. If you want to thoroughly understand contracts and ace it on the Bar, he's your man.
Great Professor.  Very willing to help make things clear, very concerned about students "getting it".  Class is much more interesting than expected.
I did NOT enjoy his class.  He was always jumping around with the material, was never organized and made contracts a lot harder and more confusing then it really is.
i completely disagree...i thought he made everything more difficult
-thought he was somewhat confusing with extremely difficult tests for contracts, but liked him more for corporations. he is extremely happy to help though.
No Comments

Makes complex material very clear.  He teaches the practical side of business associations.  His classes have already proved very helpful in my clerkships.  Indeed, more than any professor at CM, his classes have had the most real-world legal application.  If you don't want to waste your time in law school, take Mike Bordon.

Absolutely wonderful. Make's Agency and Parthership palatablel, when it could be made much harder. EXTREEMLY CLEAR! A rarity at Marshall! Helpful, very kind and personable. Hilarious and down to earth. I recommend taking him for any class that looks awful on the schedule, Borden will make everything clear and concise. In as many words, he rocks.

Very funny and approachable. Don't let his speech about the difficulty of the class at the beginning fool you, you will do just fine as long as you seek help if you have problems. The material is difficult, and there is a LOT of homework. However, the homework really helps you to understand the material, so make sure you complete it.

This is the worst professor at CSU what ever you do do not take him. I am a smart student that has taken physics before in high school and he completely ruined it for me. He gives hundreds of homework questions before he even teaches you the material. He does not do enough problems for you to understand what is going on. DONT TAKE HIS CLASS!!!!!!!

Very funny and approachable. Don't let his speech about the difficulty of the class at the beginning fool you, you will do just fine as long as you seek help if you have problems. The material is difficult, and there is a LOT of homework. However, the homework really helps you to understand the material, so make sure you complete it.

Took Dr B for phy 325. His lectures are very boring and do not offer much clarity. He left a lot of key ideas and methods unexplained or under explained. Seems to curve tests for this class and homework is graded on if a solid attempt was given and not accuracy. Can be condescending in office hours. Okay overall. Would avoid again if I can.

Loved this guy. Very entertaining and somewhat nerdy professor; a whole lot of fun to talk to both about physics and other topics. Not very difficult, exams are pretty easy if you've been keeping up with the work. The hardest part of the class is frankly the actual homework aspect, but that's more of a timesink than anything. 100% recommend.
Great professor who knows how to teach and is very knowledgeable in the subject. Tests are decently easy, with 1 extended response and the rest multiple choice. Get ready to do a lot of Wiley though.

I like him a lot. Though you should expect to work hard. There is a program called Orion included in the books online software that you need to do to do well on the exams. There was 6 exams plus final so prepare to do a lot of work

Dr. Borisov gave so much homework it made me hate physics. All semester I never stopped doing homework or studying because there were 6 exams throughout the semester! You have to put in a lot of work but it is doable just not very enjoyable. Overall he was boring in lecture but we did a lot of group class work figuring out problems which helps.
Great professor. Do your work outside of class, and you will get an A

Dr. Borisov gives short lectures and occasionally he will work out a tough homework problem. Half the class was spent in groups answering questions. If you plan on doing well you have to spend the time doing the assignments. He was very helpful in his office hours, so take advantage of that. It's a hard class, but he wants you to succeed.

Extremely boring lectures, 6 long and difficult tests. His slide presentations can be 70 slides long for a single chapter, and in order to do well in his class you need to be extremely familiar with each slide, the 30 ish question study guide, and the book. Not the class to take unless you are very interested in astronomy or a science major.

I had this professor for lecture and lab. Lab went great. He gives you a paper and a computer and you are on your own. Lecture was awful. Dull presentations, random quizzes with those clickers, he is condescending and hard to understand at times

He is a great teacher, but if you want an A in Physics 2, you really need to put in the work. You cannot glide by like you may have in other classes. Although the work may be long and sometimes difficult, once you finish it you really do know the information and can apply it to the exams he provides. Taking his class was worthwhile for my future.
Not an extremely hard class, just go over study guides and you will do fine. Really a good guy, kinda awkward but he actually does care about students

Truly one of the worst professors I ever had. Not understanding and does not clarify at all. I took this class to fill a science thinking it would be interesting. Definitely would not recommend taking this class whatsoever or if you want to do not choose him as your professor. Believe me, you'll regret it.
His class is very hard if you're not prepared, but if you find astronomy fascinating, you will love the depth of this class.  In addition his comments are witty and it really lightens up the class.

If you read the book and show up for class, you'll get an A in Astonomy. This is college and that is or should be expected of all college science classes. He's not going to hold your hand or feed you the answers, but as professors go this one is pretty good.  He's funny and smart, and I always enjoyed going to his class.

This class is AWFUL. and so is this prof! Avoid this astronomy class, it's not a gen Ed, it's very hard! Many tests and the prof is not very understanding. Not being a science related major, I wouldn't suggest this prof or class for anyone other than physics majors.

Definitely one of the better science electives at CSU. The tests are almost exactly the study guides he gives for homework. I never bothered getting the book.  Attend every class & you'll do fine. He gives great lectures and has a great sense of humor.  I don't see how people could get less than a B in the class, an easy A in my opinion.

He actually seems like a really nice, funny guy during his lectures. Unfortunately, he is an astronomer and particle physicist, which means his lectures are WAY too in depth for a 200 level class. He makes it extremely difficult to succeed by refusing to mark which answers are wrong on tests and will only give you answer keys with office visits.

Amazing professor. A  difficult professor in the sense that he truly makes yo work for your grade. He is very helpful during his abundant office hours, and he really wants yo to succeed. I don't understand how people are giving him less that great scores because difficulty and challenging professors are the ones whom you persevere from.

Dr. Borkar is one of the best professor in Mechanical department. He is an amazing professor and really care for students. He has thorough knowledge of this course. He answers pretty much all questions I and other students have asked. He has always accommodated me irrespective of his office hours . I will highly recommend for taking his courses.
He does not explain well, and his tests are so difficult

Dr. Borkar is one of the best professor in Mechanical department. He is an amazing professor and really care for students. He has thorough knowledge of this course. He answers pretty much all questions I and other students have asked. He has always accommodated me irrespective of his office hours . I will highly recommend for taking his courses.

Mixed feelings on borkar. He obviously cares about a good teaching experience but the quizzes sometimes left me feeling rage. If you participate in class he gives you good extra credit. The first two tests create a page for each chapter and a description for everything he puts on the powerpoint, then go into the book to expand upon. Final semi diff

ask him about the lecture he repeats what is written is the slides withou any explantion. he gives alot of general material and ask specfic details in test. he just copies from the textbook into the slides, but doesnt acutally know the actual process of manf or machining. in class his voice is low and you cant understand, even if you set in front.
the best professor, so far. easy to understand. Just attend the lectures and complete the homework and you will get A. I would seriously recommend his classes.

Unorganized. He's in his own world. Try to take the class somewhere else or wait for another professor to teach. Him and Severson teach. Unfortunately Borner taught majority of the course. You're guaranteed to fall asleep. It doesn't matter if you're straight A student or not. If anything take the class in the Spring when it's earlier in day.

Took for genetics, he taught the first half of the class. I'm pretty sure he's German so he has an accent but he's not too hard to understand. It's a tough class and you can't get by without studying. Grading scale is easier because 60% is still a C. If you study and go to class and pay attention you can pass!

Excellent instructor.  Willing to answer questions.  There is  quiz every week.  I actually found it easier this way because you only have to concentrate on one chapter at a time instead of trying to remember seven for a midterm or final.

I think most people who think his classes are hard have issues with algebra. I took my first EVER finance class with Dr Borokhovich and loved it. quiz every week works out b/c it keeps you interested in every lecture. there were some twists in some quizzes but if you pay attention in class you'll be fine. now I took another class with him :)

Nice professor, I liked the way he taught. He kept his lectures interesting. His quizzes were mostly easy but threw in a bit of twist here and there, you'll score maximum if u get it but lose a couple points if you don't. Only part I didn't like was that we had a quiz every week, so we had to be on our toes each class.

Do not take his class. I hated the way he did not understand students's level. He thinks all students are same his level. The way he teaches is SUCK. DO NOT TAKE HIM otherwise you waisted your time and dissappointed.

great professor! keeps class interesting by doping cute financial jokes. there is a quiz every week (1 problem each), but you can miss 2. the booklet he provides is very helpful. there is homework assigned from the textbook but never checked/collected. it helps doing the hwk since quiz problems are very similar.
Extremely difficult class!Do not take if you are not interested in FIN. The quizzes start from the 2nd class - you have to take 15 out of 18 quizzes or take 10 and do a paper.

Do not take him. He is very strick about giving a chance to make up your quiz, and his quizes are not easy. If you have not done in FIN field, you will have a hard time to earn an A or B in his class. Only people have already done in Finance, they like him. DO NOT TAKE HIM. I regetted taking his class, spent too much time but did not get what I exp

Do not take him. He is very straightforward, NO makeup or curve at all. You will not be getting A in his class if you do not have experiences in Finance. I made my mistake taking his class. Stressful! He won't care what students get grade.
DON'T TAKE HIM. RISKY! YOU COULD FALSE OR GET A C EASILY.
Taking his class very risky. You could false or get C easily. If you are not good at FIN, don't take him?. Tests were not easy like people said, there were 3 test ok, rest were tricky!

Great professor!  Possibly the best in the CSU Finance Department. Grades are determined by weekly quizzes, which for the most part are easy if you study.  He is very clear on what is expected, so there are no surprises. I would highly recommend taking this class with this professor.

The grade is determined entirely by weekly quizzes.  13 total quizzes, but you only take 11 of them.  Each quiz only contains ONE question.      The quiz should hopefully cover the same material covered in class.     Overall I think this was straight forward....but be careful and alert.

The cutest little guy I have ever had.  Cute jokes and mannerisms...really knowledgable - don't buy the book - use his handout manual...extremely helpful and concerned for students learning.  Loves Thanksgiving b/c you get to eat all day!
good.

Fantastic professor. A breath of fresh air in an otherwise unbearable class. Outstanding amount of patience even with the most repetitive questions. Very clear about expectations. His manual is the best thing I've ever received from an instructor - anywhere. Very funny. Brings real world experience/knowledge. Totally hot! Love the suit! Very sharp!

He is a brilliant professor who shows a great deal of patience with his class. He seems like a warm person who is passionate about finance. Oh, and I had to rate him as "hot" because he is. in many ways.
Very good professor, goes over everything you need to know for tests in class. Able to explain concepts very clearly and give real world examples. Would take him again.

Phenominal teacher! His workbook that he provides the first day of class is very useful. He loves to teach and will explain subjects until everyone understands. Quirky and tells jokes. Finance is not my best subject and I did not feel stupid.

Actually, I gotta agree with everything the last post said.  Take him!  Not super easy, but very doable and not very hard.  You really know what to expect.  Much of his humor is cute and cheesy, but he knows it, and does it to throw many needed breaks in the material of finance.  Well done.

This teacher is the abolute bomb.  To contradict what one student said about not using the book:  on the first day of class this prof hands out a supplemental handbook with notes and problems that pretty much was my bible throughout the entire class.  He is also very hilarious and extremely helpful.  Material difficult, but doable!
Annoyingly cliquey with students he has taught for in the past. Very aggressive and condescending to students he's not familiar with or who are inexperienced with whatever he's teaching.

Professor Bort definitely knows her stuff when it comes to OB. The staff knows her so that gave us more opportunities to see and do things. This was by far the most I have learned in any clinical, so If you know your stuff and come to class prepared there is no way you can get a bad grade.

For this semester, professor Bort was amazing!!! She gave us 10 modules (all usually 10 points each) which werent bad at all. They were due every Sunday at 5pm so I never had to stress about it. Take her if you can! She is a full time RN so I am impressed that she has time to also teach this class. Definitely a GPA booster!

Professor Bort definitely knows her stuff when it comes to OB. The staff knows her so that gave us more opportunities to see and do things. This was by far the most I have learned in any clinical, so If you know your stuff and come to class prepared there is no way you can get a bad grade.

I see a side to her that's intimidating and she can also be very sweet. I don't think questions are welcomed and they should be! I appreciate how much I learned in the class but I would like to learn without feeling so intimidated. I have mixed feelings but I did well. I hope Bort is doing okay. Maybe she is going through something.

She told my entire class that were all stupid and will never be nurses. She doesnt tell you how to get better or what she expects. She also wont tell you your grade so you not know youre failing until it is too late.

As hard as I worked this semester, this professor STILL didn't give me the grade I deserved. She messed me up from getting on the deans list. Horrible feedback. Pretends to be too busy with other things to help. Avoid taking this class if you can. It's pretty pointless anyways. Starting to realize college professors don't really care about you.

10 Modules of Assignments (some spread throughout different weeks). Pretty straight forward, some assignments not so clear. Professor does not get back to emails efficiently. Class, as long as you know basics of computers, was easy. She cares about students and does all she can to make sure you do well.

Dr. Bostwick is just lovely. Modules last a few weeks, discussion post plus quiz. Lectures prerecorded plus pwpt slides on BB for download to follow along. Need the textbk! Two papers that aren't too hard and actually teach you something. She's extremely understanding about personal life stuff, wants to help you. So genuine, kind, and sweet. :)

Dr. Bostwick is just lovely. Modules last a few weeks, discussion post plus quiz. Lectures prerecorded plus pwpt slides on BB for download to follow along. Need the textbk! Two papers that aren't too hard and actually teach you something. She's extremely understanding about personal life stuff, wants to help you. So genuine, kind, and sweet. :)

She goes above and beyond the "I am here if you need anything". She accepts late assignments (with a penalty). I thanked her for letting me turn in an assignment a day late stating I had a hectic week, and she was extremely consoling and understanding. Passionate about the subject and about being a good person. Shes one of the good ones, you know.

She is hands down one of my favorite professors. She truly cares about her students and wants everyone to succeed. You are not just a number or a face, you are a person with a name. I had her during COVID19 and she looked out for all of us, weekly emails checking in. Everything she did she prepared us for success, literally love her.

One of the best professors I have ever had. She gives so much to help set up students for success. Show up to class to hear her fun and relatable lectures! Class was never dull or boring. She gives clear study guides and tools. She is so dedicated and it is telling! Wish she taught all of my classes!

She is, hands down, my favorite professor I've ever had. She's understanding, fair, funny, and makes her classes interesting. In most of her classes, it is a lot of information but she makes sure she explains the material in full detail so you understand it. I love taking any one of her classes !

Hands down the best professor I've had throughout my entire college experience. If only all professors were like her. She knows her material and doesn't just read off of powerpoints, gives real life examples, and is relatable. Papers are graded fairly. Tests based off of lectures. No surprises, go to class and you will be golden.

Eryn is a great professor. I have taken many of her classes. She teaches and explains well, gives good feedback, is understanding, realistic. And she makes the subject relatable and easy to learn. Group projects and points along the way to keep you on track. Everything is very clear, no surprises, well organized.
Easily one of the best instructors I've ever had. She cares, she's intelligent, and she's honest. Also, she's a Dr. now!!
Pretty good teacher. I would definitely recommend anyone taking her class!

Professor Bostwick is THE best. Hands down the most kind and caring professor I've ever had. Always amazed by her dedication to her students getting the most out of her classes and genuinely wanting them to succeed. Definitely take her!

I took Prof. Bostwick online and the course was awesome. She provides interesting lectures for the chapters, quiz reviews, and practice quizzes. She frequently send out reminders for due dates which is helpful when stressing about other courses. Responds quickly. Lowest discussion and quiz grades dropped. Overall, great class!
I was always very good at math until I took his class. The material he tested on had nothing to do with the notes he gave or the homework that he assigned. I would not recommend him to anyone.
You are completely on your own. I wouldn't recommend this teacher.
satisfied

Going into the class I was only taking it for WAC credit. I enjoyed it more than I thought I would. Going to class is a must. Her lectures are her test so take good notes. She also takes attendence. Dr. Bow treats you like college students and expects a lot. Sometimes she seems intimidating but can actually be really cool. I think she is fair.

Attendance, participation and assigned readings a must. Tests multiple choice-if you know info from study sheets you will get an A. TAPE LECTURES if you don't know shorthand. She has a dry demeanor, is irritated by interruptions, but if you're a good student, you will pass her class with ease. Not my favorite, but would take her again-earned alot.

LOVE HER! She is an old-school academic, so be prepared for TONS of reading, heavy writing, and long class lectures. She does have an intimidating demeanor LOL, but she is actually really approachable. She doesn't take sass from slackers, and she gets offended if you come to class unprepared. But I loved her class, I will try to take her again.
She seems kind of mean at first but as long as you do your work you will pass...she's actually funny because she laughs at nothing lol.

Dr. Bow was a great professor. She definitely expects the students to do the work and read the assignments, but she gives review sheets for tests, which are all multiple choice. I think she is open to help her students despite her intimidating demeanor. This is definitely not a teacher to take if you want to slick through.

I like to give people the benefit of the doubt, but she was by far the most boring, unhelpful, unfriendly professor I've had at CSU. Read straight from her notes with a monotone voice, seemed annoyed by student interaction, and was actually downright rude to students. She might be intelligent but she should not be an educator.

I have taken 90% of Prof. Bow's courses. They are challenging and I had to work very hard to get the grades I got. She is a tough woman, but this makes her one of the best professors I have ever studied under. If you don't take her classes seriously, she won't waste her time with you. She's highly academic and no nonsense.

I didnt really like this teacher. It was hard to understand the readings and she went really fast in class. So I had to record the session. Not very intresting either, liked to read from the book or her notes so it wasnt very original. Yelled at our class once for asking to many questions.

It's been 2 years since I had Dr. Bow and I still remember her as being the worst professor I've had at CSU. She taught WORD-FOR-WORD what the book said, but made attendance mandatory. No outside knowledge or material to keep class interesting. Very mean as well. Not a HARD class to pass, but you will regret signing up for it because of Dr. Bow.

Class material was interesting but all she does is read from notes. you have to try and copy her word for word. difficult teacher who isnt very nice either. will make you feel kind of dumb if you get a question wrong.

Interesting class, good teacher. I went to class, took notes, paid attention, did my share on a group project and got a B. Hardest part for me was having Judaism, Christianity and Islam all on the same test. Overall, I would say good instructor.
i think that last post, the really positive one was made by her. ive been in school long enough to separate the difficult teachers from the easy ones, and my GPA proves i work hard.

People are pansies.  This prof. just makes sure that good students are getting a great understanding of the coursework.  How much easier can it get than to simply read the book, take notes, and take the tests?
very stupid teacher, i think she's one of those who has a degree and think she's too good, all she really is, is a airhead frog.haha

Not very nice at all.  Makes fun of students and makes students feel really stupid if they don't know an answer during a review session. At the beginning of the semester, I ran into her in a stairwell and said hello, just to be nice, and she just looks at me and says nothing. You have to read A LOT and memorize almost every word you read

Professor Bowen is committed to making the world a better place and to engaging students in real life conversations. There are many small group discussions followed by analysis of the group process. I have learned a lot about leadership and the world of nonprofits. Tough on writing mechanics, easy on thoughtful content.

Professor Bowen is committed to making the world a better place and to engaging students in real life conversations. There are many small group discussions followed by analysis of the group process. I have learned a lot about leadership and the world of nonprofits. Tough on writing mechanics, easy on thoughtful content.

Goes on very lengthy tangents during lecture. Says he's very understanding and accommodating, and he is, but also kind of passive aggressive. Toots his own horn sometimes and you kind of just have to go with it. Much of class is discussion-based, expect groupwork.

The professor doesn't use blackboard to post grades. He claims that you should keep track of your own percentage/grade. Also doesn't let you know when assignments are due. Overall it was a disorganized course.

I really enjoyed this class and learned a lot about nonprofits that I never knew before. Gives back positive feedback. Just watch your grades and make sure you get credit for some of the discussion boards. I didn't receive a grade for two of them, but i still got an A in the class, so I'm fine. Just do all the work and turn in on time.

Lectures are boring and class setup isn't the best. Does not allow electronic in class which can make class even more boring. Make sure to bring an extra notebook to doodle in cause you will need it. I think this class is a waste of money. Most of the material can be self taught.

Bowen is a true nonprofit professional with years of experience, and really has his heart in making the world a better place! He draws students out, and both maximizes participation, and develops content based on our own real world experiences. Also very approachable and cares about his students.

This was a capstone class. It was extremely easy. There were 3 papers, a midterm exam, and a final group paper. The only downfall is that he uses every drop of class time which can seem like a drag especially towards the end of a long day. Overall, great professor. Very knowledgeable about materials and course topic.
Hes awesome. As long as you participate in blackboard and do the work then easy A

Professor Bowen is the single greatest professor I have encountered at CSU. He wants to see you do well and is a genuine person. If you need help, flexibility on an assignment or just someone to talk to about Nonprofits then this is your guy! HE wants to make sure you succeed and I am disappointed he doesn't teach my final course for UST. Thank you

Honestly the best professor I have ever had. I've taken every single one of his classes and have always gotten an A. Just show up and try and he will recognize that. Very down to earth and understanding professor. Takes time to get to know you and care for you as a person.

Professor Bowen is probably the nicest professor. As long as you participate you with easily get an A, there are a lot of discussions and a capstone project with two papers and one test. He grades super easy so just do the work and an easy A

I have taken him for a third time this semester! He is the greatest and I will miss being in his class because he provided me with a lot of the tools I will need. This class like his others has a midterm, 3 papers and a capstone project. The project is simple because he gives you all semester. Do your work and you will be just fine!Highly recommend
Professor Bowen gives great feedback and lays out a solid curriculum.

This class was my first in the urban college for a minor. If you put in the effort then you will accomplish an A! He brings in some incredible experience and shares it with us as young NP professionals. Greatly appreciate everything he has given me and fellow students. Highly, Highly recommend.

He is a long time nonprofit professional fundraiser and executive director and brings lots of real life experience into the classroom.  He really cares about making the world a better place and it shows in the way that he teaches the material and encourages his students. If you come to class and do the work you can get an A!

Jeffrey Bowen is extremely knowledgeable in what he teaches, he is by far, the best of the best. He can be pretty longwinded in his lectures, especially if you take his 3 hour courses. My suggestion would be to take his online classes, they are great! But as long as you show up to class and turn in the work you are guaranteed an A!

Dr. Bowen is a deeply intellectual professor with so much knowledge to offer. He is hands down the most influential professor I have ever had. I have had him for 2 courses now (UST 301 & UST 259) . He cares about his students and challenges them to think about things differently. Ignore the poor reviews (unless you are a lazy student). He is a gem.

Dr. Bowen is a deeply intellectual professor with so much knowledge to offer. He is hands down the most influential professor I have ever had. I have had him for 2 courses now (UST 301 & UST 259) . He cares about his students and challenges them to think about things differently. Ignore the poor reviews (unless you are a lazy student). He is a gem.

First let me say, I have never learned so much from a single course. Bowen is an amazing professor with so much knowledge and passion for his topic. He made a big impact on my appreciation for the CSU staff. He definitely observes who actually pays attention and participates, and if you do, the odds are definitely in your favor
Total of 200 points in class divided by two test, does not tell you what to expect on test. Tells you to review slides but there are way too many to memorize. Good luck bro youll need it

Dr. Bowen has an antsy personality; he sometimes spends too much time recapping old material, and sometimes he's clear-headed and up to speed. Despite this, he is a good professor. He's willing to help whenever someone needs it. His lectures don't stray too far from the textbook material, and his tests are fairly easy and lenient.

Dr. Bowen is knowledgeable in his area of expertise, and his knowledge of Statistics, but he goes over EACH and EVERY point in lecture instead of focusing on what the class really needs to know about Statistics.  He can be forgetful and disorganized.  He must find a way to improve the way he teaches Statistics, or stick to his area of expertise.

Dr. Bowen is a very knowledgeable and dedicated professor.  This class is an excellent class to take for someone who wants to gain quick familiarity with urban policy literature in general. It is mostly student-led discussions, and student presentations.

Dr. Bowen is one the most dedicated professors in the department. Student success is one of his priorities. His lectures are long, but this is while he wants to make sure every single important point is covered. He expects students to take responsibility of their performance.

I know you have to take this class so as a tip, write down all the due dates because he won't remind you until the day it's due and just make sure to do all the extra assignments. You basically have manage it all on your own (college) but it's annoying to have to put all that extra work in with all your other classes. Try to pass and you will!
This man will redefine boredom. He is not lenient at all, and his instructions are very unclear. Find a different teacher if you can

Very easy class, but unbearably boring lectures.  Only uses lectures and likes has a strong ego.  Enjoys talking about himself and accomplishments.  Takes attendance randomly, so have to show up to get those points.

Took PSY 317 after taking the pre req (stat 147) . Expected students to teach themselves/did not offer any help to students struggling. If you want to pay to teach yourself/be degraded and talked down to on a daily basis - sign up for her class. Otherwise check out Prof Rowlett. I was lucky enough to switch to her class. Passed with an A+ there.

Do yourself a favor and do not take her, she was the worst professor I have ever had. I ended up taking STA347 (take it with Andrew Toth, he's amazing) and it was so much easier than suffering through this class not knowing what was going on because she wouldn't answer questions if she already covered something.

I had a death in my family, and the professor was very insensitive, actually asked for proof of relation and death. If you have a disability that affects your writing and have accommodations that allow you to use a scribe, utilize it! Be sure to pay attention during lectures; the professor is difficult to follow.
She's a tough teacher, very serious about her class. But, if you show up, do the work, and study a little bit, you'll be fine.

Dumps a lot of info and makes you choose between writing notes and paying attention to whatever else she's doing. Will need to pay attention to everything for good grades on exams, especially the SPSS material. Not great with answering questions. Prefers to try and lead you the answer which can be frustrating if you've been trying with no luck.
