Dr. Bowen writes her own book for the course, so she definitely knows the material she's covering. The course alone is pretty difficult, but she does a really good job explaining and answering uncertain questions.

If you read the textbook, attend class, and do the HW You'll be prepared. She reviews the material over & over in class, Especially right before a quiz. Some exam questions were about info I didn't deem important but they were not exceedingly difficult.  Ask questions when confused, if needed meet with her in office hours.

Sometimes she does go too fast in the lecture but if you raise your hand in class she will definitely try to help you understand or ask that you see her after. i am by far not the best at math but when i went to her office hours she really went out of her way to help me understand and I appreciate that.

Dr. Bowen is a great teacher. She can go too fast at times but just call her on it and she'll slow down. You can tell that she honestly wants you to learn and is proud when you do. You have to study, or you won't pass.  You have to attend every class because there's lots of pop quizzes.  Homework after every chapter.  But you'll learn it if you try

Was really worried about this class before the semester but Bowen is great.  She really wamts you to do well and provides several opportunities to do so. The best thing you can do is go to the supplemental instruction classes when you're feeling behind or confused. Hope to take her again for psy317.

Nice person, don't get me wrong. Just a horrible professor. She would rush over things sometimes missing concepts and then put them in the test. The test wasn't long, but if you missed one thing the entire question would be wrong even if you got everything else right. Homework wasn't bad. We would get pop quizzes constantly.

She is a very tough teacher and does not do well at explaining concepts she also does not answer questions. She will just re-ask  you the question in a answer form pretty much. She does not respect students at all, i did not enjoy her as a teacher. She also will take forever to answer back to emails and when she does her answers are not helpful.

Dr. Bowen is a really good teacher, you'll do good only if you ask questions and go to class. If you do crappy on homework, she lets you correct it and turn it in again. She gives quizzes alot which helps prepare you for the tests.

I personally feel people are a little to hard on Dr. Bowen. Her class isn't exactly easy but it's not exactly hard. The examples used in her class are simple and are often single digit numbers. That said, if you attend class and pay attention you'll do fine.

Very helpful 1 on 1. Took a while for her to get what's in the classes best interests about the structure of the course. It's important if you don't understand, tell her to slow down. Only take her if it's absolutely necessary. Unless you are very good at math.

AMAZING PROFESSOR! I have a love of stats thanks to her! she was the most clear professor I have ever had for stats (and I have had ) if you get the opportunity to take her class you should! come to class, take the quizzes, do your homework and you will get an A!

Dr. Bowen is an outspoken advocate for CSU student success & a competent instructor. She does not hold back opinions on anything. Sometimes she is quite funny. BE WARNED - engage in chit chat during class or mess with your phone and you will be SORRY.  She does NOT play! Come to class prepared on time and you should do fine. Straight up stats.

I took Psychology of Women with her this past semester. Overall good class. Multiple choice tests were the primary means of assessment... which were difficult for many if you didn't study or do the readings. Class was difficult, but if you put in the honest effort, you well come out with a decent grade. Cute sense of humor... down to earth.

She is my favorite professor ever. She does make some of the jokes people said...but they're jokes. She sarcastic and its hillarious. I hope to do an internship for her or work with her on my graduate degree. She's awesome. Material is right outa book and she explains what you don't Understand. Loved her

THE WORST PROFESSOR I HAVE HAD IN MY THREE YEARS OF BEING A COLLEGE STUDENT. She knows what shes talking about but CANNOT communicate it AT ALL. No study guides, ever. tests were always confusing with multiple answers for one question. She is very condescending and rude. No heart. not understanding WORST PROFESSOR AT CSU BY FAR.

One of the best teachers I ever had!  Extremely smart yet not arrogant and more than willing to fully explain and keep the entire class engaged and entertained.  I wish she would teach more classes at CSU.

Prof Boyd's class was relatively easy to pass. Homework was not mandatory, the only grades came from tests. I probably went to less classes than I skipped, study the lecture slides he puts on blackboard and you will be fine. The final was entirely questions from previous tests and he posts lengthy study guides on blackboard to study from.

Overall nice guy but lectures are super boring. He reads word for word from his slides and does not answer questions well. The final was comprised of questions from the previous three exams. Do the homework problems. Don't need the book.

Professor Boyd would do much better teaching only advance chemistry courses. Everything I learned was just by reading his powerpoints. His lectures are not helpful for beginners. However, he curves his tests/grading standards and provides extensive study guides for every test. Always willing to answer questions.

Very intelligent guy! He loves the subject and is more than willing to help you @ his office hours. The tests are a mix of math problems and conceptual based questions. Lecture is a long and boring but you wont regret not going. Easy A if you study.

From day one I knew his class was going to stick with me forever. I loved his lectures and even though others may find them boring they're very informative, he's also very passionate about the subject and is very happy to help students who are having trouble. His tests are a lot easier if you do the homework and get help if you need it. He's great.

Good professor, super intelligent And maybe too smart for his own good sometimes, making the material hard to learn because he has trouble simplifying things. Overall he is very caring and wants his students to do well. His tests were relatively easy compared to homework (hw not graded) and he is willing to manipulate grading scale if needed.

At first I didn't like Dr. Boyd because i didn't understand his lectures. He makes powerpoints based of the chapters & just reads them off lecture. It's hard to understand at first but once you get used to it, its easy. Tests are very easy, gives practice homework for chapters (not for points). Show up, pay attention, go to SI, an A is very doable

Extremely inconsistent across the board: Does not follow rubric in grading. Does not display consistency in responses to student behavior. Does not follow course schedule. Routinely runs over allotted class time. Displays knowledge of course content, and simultaneous inability to apply that knowledge. 0/10 would not take again.

AVOID.  Do not take her online COM 260 class.  She is horrible at giving directions and is very rude when asked for feedback.  I received an A in the class, but would never recommend her as a professor.  Knows what she is talking about as far as content, but definitely does not understand how to teach.

Good professor! Very laid back and easy to talk to. The class is assignment-based and there are no exams. Assignments are very straight forward as long as you follow along with the lecture slides in class. Never opened the required texts and got an A.

Dr. Bracken is a great teacher, and loves the subject matter. If you go to class, and engage in the topics, you will do well. She is not very organized and you do have to bear with her along those lines. But if you need help, she will help you. The book was NEVER opened and I got an A.
Excellent teacher. Very informative and returns emails promptly. I really enjoyed her class and class set up.

Do not bother taking her classes.  Very unclear about notes and directions and all we ever did was talk about facbook and texting and social media.  Waste of time.  Assignments seemd easy but grading was harsh, as I got As on the midterm and final and a B on the only class project and somehow ended up with a B minus

She is very nice person but she is a total loon. She never was prepared and canceled class without notice. The class is difficult because you have to teach yourself without any resource, as she doesn't use the text book.

Mrs Bracken is not scatter brained at all. People who complain about stuff being on the test that is not on the study guide is hilarious. You have to come to class every day and take notes and also read the book,and listen to her notes. You just can't study a couple of power points and expect to pass. A great teacher and she cares about students.

Really disorganized! And very borring sometimes. Makes you think like everything it's very easy and gives you study guid but when the test comes half of stuff wasn't on the study guide and test turns out to be much harder then you would expected. Woudnt recomend her, waste of time and didn't get any knowledge in the subject area.
She's a little scatter brained and loves to talk, sometimes off subject. Overall a very nice lady, who comes down to your level to help you understand. I would recommend her to anyone.
She is a nice lady but does not explain theories well and seems to be very distracted and scatter brained

Overall, an easy class and subject matter.  However, she was late a lot to class, when she finally arrived it took her a while to focus(it was in the a.m.).  She was very scattered brain and easily distracted.  Ok for an 'A' but wouldn't take again.
Nice lady. She means well is very scattered brained. overall an enjoyable class.
She was very confussing and had trouble giving examples and explaining them clearly.
Dr. Bracken not only knows about Com theory, but keeps up on all the new media, especially HDTV.
Did a good job teaching hard & boring material, very nice & helpful.
the best female professor in the department.  she's really down to earth and makes you feel like you matter.
She's the best!!!

She always made the work pretty easy to understand and her expectations. It is an intro class but she gives lots of opportunities to understand the material with not just exams but a study guide, extra credit jeopardy, and the book she uses is very easy to understand. She doesn't normally go over tests and homework if you ask and need it she will

She always made the work pretty easy to understand and her expectations. It is an intro class but she gives lots of opportunities to understand the material with not just exams but a study guide, extra credit jeopardy, and the book she uses is very easy to understand. She doesn't normally go over tests and homework if you ask and need it she will
She takes so long to grade assignments. And exams are all straight out of the book.
Takes forever to grade things, class is just lecturing a lot which is hard to follow, quizzes are never from powerpoints which she says they are.

As a person, she is an amazing person, highly educated, and overall sweet person. As a professor, not easy to follow, what she teaches in class isn't on the test, basically her class is reading the book and hope you can remember everything you read. She provides study guides but all questions are straight out the book. She creates her own examples.

Professor Braden is very sweet and caring and she is always in a good mood! Make sure you study a lot for this class as she gives quizzes every two weeks. She also gives A LOT of extra credit so make sure you come to class daily!
Professor Braden is a very kind, strong, and smart individual who cares very much about her students, as well as her job. This is shown when even when she was very sick she came to school.

Prof. Braden is a student herself so she's pretty busy and grades slowly, but overall she's very sweet and knows a lot. She walked in every day with a big smile greeting us as beautiful people! If you ever have a problem in or out of school, she's willing to talk about it and work with you.

He is such a great professor. Really interesting guy with some cool stories. The class could be pretty interesting. Easy as long as you show up and do what he asks. Both tests are online and open note. There is one group project but it isn't bad. Pretty good class.
Took this online and there are a lot of discussion questions plus you have to read three books. Interesting class but a lot of work.

He is such a great professor. Really interesting guy with some cool stories. The class could be pretty interesting. Easy as long as you show up and do what he asks. Both tests are online and open note. There is one group project but it isn't bad. Pretty good class.

Bragg was one of the most easy going professors Ive ever had. Lectures were strewn with personal anecdotes, some may say this is distracting or not helpful, but I thought they were very useful in understanding concepts and to have a good laugh. Although, there is a heavy reliance on group projects in the later parts of the semester, only complaint

Real nice guy. Willing to go above and beyond to ensure his students succeed - just gotta put in a little effort for a couple papers and a final group project. Only 2 tests (midterm and final) both online!! Most test questions were from lecture but there were a couple that were from the textbook. Takes random attendance for points so go to class!

Spends too much time on personal stories rather than actual class content. An unprepared lecturer who reads from the powerpoint slides. He has a "pretest" almost every class that wastes time as it's not for a grade nor over any topics we've covered. I would never take a class with him again and am sorely disappointed with his performance.

Bragg is very charming and accessible to his students. He clearly explains assignments during class to make sure his students know what is expected, & his lectures are great, too! Only real downside was that he has a group project at the end of the semester that he groups random people together for--but you can work on it in class, which made it ok

Told us we HAD to buy 2 textbooks, but I didn't open either of them once & the bookstore won't buy them back bc they're so obscure. For the final project, he makes you pick your group members from a lecture hall of people you've never met. His Powerpoints are clearly made by his TA & it's obvious that he reads them for the first time during class.

Professor Branch is thorough and replies to students quickly. Class DBs every Wednesday, 3 replies by Saturday. Midterm and Final, plus one final paper. Simple & organized class, lots of information that is useful for being in health care. Midterm and Final ?'s from PP slides and some from book. Great professor, would recommend class to HSC majors!

Dr. Branch is a good professor. He assigns a copious amount of reading through textbook and ECR. The first test covered half the semester, and the final was comprehensive. Remember to exhibit effort when participating in the discussion boards and on additional assignments, as he provides very good feedback. I would recommend taking the course!

Dr. B is great! This was my second time having her as a professor. She gave all of us mini heart attacks on the first day when she showed us what our final capstone projects would look like. However, she walked us through everything with mostly soft deadlines but the additional course work definitely helped in preparing us for our case studies.

I had Dr. B. twice and plan on taking one of her courses again! She is easy to talk to and as long as you participate and show you care about your grade, you'll get the grade you want. She's detailed in her lectures and sometimes her tests are a bit tricky but they are all online. She's personally one of my favorite professors at CSU!
Excellent Professor
Good Professor
Great professor

Dr. B was a pretty cool professor. She gave 3 exams and 2 writing assignments. You do need the book for the class . Her lectures at times were a little boring but you can keep up with the power points which she post before class. Dr. B also gave out extra credit surveys. Overall, Dr. B class was not hard. Its all up to the person to pass her class.

Online class, so it was all reading, no lecture. A LOT of reading. One textbook required, but also many chapters from others required reading as well (provided online). Online "discussions" were a joke - just have the minimum number of words and quote the text and you get full credit (for both original post and 2 feedback posts).

If you can take a class with anyone else but her, do so. She was horrible. Worst professor I have ever had. Not nice, not friendly, not approachable, rude. Class was boring and you never used the book. I didn't learn anything. Doesn't help she doesn't speak good English even though she's teaching a communication class.

It's an 100 level class but she treats it as if it is a 300/400 level course. Attendance is mandatory. Class reminded me a lot like elementary school. She is well educated on her subject, but lectures can be long and boring.

Extremely organized and prepares students well for exams. Available for questions / concerns and very encouraging. If you put in the effort, you should do well. She takes teaching seriously and has great presentations for class.
just terrible. this is a 100 level course and she makes it like its a class in medical school, that hard. just avoid this class if your trying to get an A or B

She's big on participation and reminds me a lot of a middle school teacher who can't seem to get her class under control. Don't get me wrong, she is a REALLY good lecturer but ends up making them a little to drawn out and boring. Her class is decently easy to pass, but wouldn't recommend for anything other than COM 101.
Dr. B was a fine professor, she does get a little lecture heavy but all in all not bad.

She has very high expectations for the group project which she never expresses nor explains what she is looking for. She will also straight up tell you how your group did even if it isn't positive. Essentially it seems she is expecting you to cram as much info as possible into a 40-50 minute presentation. This applies to all the classes she teaches

He is a great professor who truly cares about his students. He does assign quite a bit of reading and lives for a good class discussion. His class is one that I never dreaded. Very respectful and understanding person.

He is a great professor who truly cares about his students. He does assign quite a bit of reading and lives for a good class discussion. His class is one that I never dreaded. Very respectful and understanding person.
Best professor
Good guy. Highly recommend

I took ENG102H, which was basically a Reacting to the Past course, so it was very paper- and speech-heavy. Despite the workload, I looked forward to doing my assignments and going to class. Dr. Breeze is a real joy to debate with, funny, kind, cares about his students, and good at emailing back. 10/10, would take any course he taught in the future.
Good teacher and professor. 8/10. 9/10 with rice.

One of the best teachers I have ever had in college! I wish I could take another class with him, but he doesn't teach what i need to graduate next semester! I would most definitely recommend Professor Breeze as your teacher. He is the most amazing, caring, generous, feedback giving, honest teacher.
Great teacher. Engaging and really loves English. May be a bit difficult for lower level english courses but nothing that cannot be handled. A pleasure to have as a teacher.
Awesome

Breeze has clear-cut expectations--as all instructors should--and relies on the class discussion to lead towards meaning. If you're looking for a class that is lecture-based, then this class is not for you;though, who honestly likes those kinds of classes? Thoughtful, dedicated, and creates connections with his students--would take him again.
The Best, that all there is to say
Best class I've ever taken, and an incredible professor! I wish I could take another one of his classes again!

If you are shy and have Dr. Breeze you will immediately feel insecure. If you do decide to say something he will rebuttal and make you feel embarrassed. My suggestion is to keep him on your schedule- because he is the best professor CSU has in their English department- but go to class, do your work, and sit there. If he doesn't like you watch out.

Great Professor! Explains things clearly. Creates interest in class that hold student's attention. Explores the importance of writing and how it applies to the real world. Best writing professor at CSU(probably why he is the head of the first year writing program).

This guy is a very good teacher. He is also the Director of First Year Writing, and he only teaches one class a semester. If you get him you are lucky. He grades fairly and tells you things you need to work on on your writing and is not mean about it. There are pop quizzes though, so study the books. If you are respectful to him you're fine.

I graduated CSU in 1991 with a duel BA in Pysch and Religion. Dr Brennan was the reason I get the REL. He was my advisor but became a mentor and a friend. This man went to Seminary at the Vatican and worked there as well. He could have landed anywhere in the world. CSU was lucky -on a different path he would have been pope.

I graduated CSU in 1991 with a duel BA in Pysch and Religion. Dr Brennan was the reason I get the REL. He was my advisor but became a mentor and a friend. This man went to Seminary at the Vatican and worked there as well. He could have landed anywhere in the world. CSU was lucky -on a different path he would have been pope.

This man is amazing! I learned alot from him and not just knowledge im gonna throw out the window...stuff that was actually helpful and important in life ...theres a few papers and tests but it count for a higher level course and religion and maybe non western. not sure..never the less it was really interesting anyway so sign up!!!
Dr. Brennan is a great professor. He is out to try and not only teah you but help your life have less suffering. Take his class!

Very interesting class.  He is full of wisdom and very enthusiastic about the subject matter. I wasn't very good about reading the book, but just by paying attention in class I got A's on the tests. highly recommend

An amazing Prof. Truely a man with Widsom. He is retiring but lets hopes he decides to change his mind. Everything about this prof is terrific, from who is he, to how he teaches, to what he teaches and Prof Brennan if you read this, you taught me so much, thank you!!!!!
Good guy, good professor. This is the second class I've had with him and he really cares and wants everyone to succeed.
he's an awesoem professor!!!! shows alot of good movies. and buddhism is an awesome sbject... and theology or wat have you... to follow, abide by, think about... etc...
Wonderful, insightful man.  His courses and style of teaching forces you to think differently.
No Comments
Professor Brennan is fantastic.  He truly knows the topic and makes difficult material easier.  He forces students to think for themselves.

Kate gave us a reading each night for homework and we had to write reflections or answer an easy 10 question paper on each reading. She will give you great feedback if you ask for it. understanding and will help if you go to her and ask. Gives many step by step tutorials in class on how to format correctly. Can be odd at times . many class debates
Professor Brentar was not bad just be ready to for it because it is not super easy and if you dont attend class you wont pass.
Professor Brentar was not bad just be ready to for it because it is not super easy and if you dont attend class you wont pass.

This professor is one of the few that actually makes me WANT to write research essays. He actually bothers to treat the subject like an art form (the equivalent of a "literary documentary") and thus encourages you to create an arc of ideas like you would in any work of writing. He is devoted to helping you master and practice writing as a skill.
I LOVE Instructor Brentar. He is truly so passionate about his students and bettering their education and understanding of writing. If you are trying to decide between professors, chose him!

With the coronavirus, all classes got switched to being online. I got really worried because I've never taken one before. But Mr. Brentar has been really really helpful. I usually ask a lot of questions in class. Since the switch, I've emailed him a lot with questions, sometimes 3 or 4 times a day. He always answers right away and is always helpful

On the papers I put some effort into, I got a B+. On the papers I did the bare minimum on, I got a B-. He has his own rules that he plays by, insults any other English professor's who teach different, and refuses to acknowledge that he makes mistakes with word use. Insults those of us who use APA format because our degree requires APA.

Professor Brentar was a great teacher. He is very helpful with students who have questions about the papers he assigns. He always is up to extend due dates at his own leisure or if you ask him too. Other than 4 papers during the semester he assigns about 6 short and easy writing assignments. Definately would take his class again.

He's a fair teacher. His personality is very unique. Don't miss more than four classes or he will lower your grade. If you're like me and English is not your strong suit, then I recommend him, he cancels class before papers are due so that he can meet with his students individually to discuss the paper I had no idea someone could love MLA so much!

There are 4 papers in his classes, 101 has a portfolio at the end and 102 just a longer paper. I took both 101 and 102 with him. He is really helpful and I feel like I have become a better writer. Do NOT skip class.

Instructor Brentar is a great choice for students scheduling first-year English courses, allows up to 4 absences without penalty, specifically for ENG102 it is 4 papers throughout the semester with maybe a couple Informal Writing Assignments for homework,  class is very laid back and chill has conferences for papers, so there aren't as many classes

He's a thorough instructor, very willing to help in person or through email. Please go to class, even though the majority of the info you'll need is online, the extra things he goes over in class are very helpful. Otherwise, he's funny and relatively laid back. If you work hard, you'll be able to get a good grade.

Instructor Brentar gives lots of informal writing assignments, which are fairly important to your grade. They give you extra room with your essay scores. His conferences are helpful. I ended up with the grade I wanted but I think he played mind games with my grade, I was always about .5 below the grade I wanted through the semester. Go to class.

Gives good feedback - I was busy so often that I would go to him when I had time and he saved my buns by helping me with the papers he assigned over the semester. There for you: He was always available to me Assigns long papers: By long I mean several and only 7 pages max.

Took the online ENG 102 class. Responds to all emails quickly, offered me extra feedback when I requested it, and goes the extra mile when you have a prob. For example, with my MLA citations, he literally rewrote for me the citations I had gotten wrong on my draft.  Fix errors on your draft and you get an 'A'. Only need to buy Engaged Reader

I was going through a rough time in my personal life, and I dug myself a huge hole in the class.  I think I was like two papers behind.  I was to the point where I was going to say screw it and take the failing grade, but Instructor Brentar helped me get back on my feet and finish the class successfully.  Not every instructor would do that.
Appalling online class; probably fine in person.
Excellent professor who will teach you the essentials for college writing. Would recommend this class prior to taking any WAC's at CSU. Not sure I would've done well without this class.
He is one of the most amazing professors. He one time played guitar for me during a conference. He regularly keeps blackboard updated. TAKE HIS CLASS.
Boring and awkward but learned a lot. Work was easy.

Instructor Brentar is extremely helpful and all around funny guy. He keeps class interesting and is caring towards his students. He helps students out and gives great feedback. Would love to have him as a instructor again.

Best teacher ever! he gives amazing feedback and will try and answer all questions.  He breaks everything down so the students can relate.  Next semester i will be taking another course by him just because i love the way he teachers!!! If you have him you will for sure get and A or B!!

It's the lowest math you can take. He was a very organized instructor. He broke every chapter down into simple form and made you feel comfortable with every lesson, before moving on. He is very approachable and willing to answer any questions you may have in or out of class. he was easy!!!!!!!!!!
It's the lowest math you could take. All homework is online and it's pretty simple. He's pretty clear when teaching but he is so monotone you could easily fall asleep. He is good though.
His class is easy and all your homework is online. His lecturing makes me very tired. But, if you want to know how to do the work then you should attend class.

I actually had Mr. Brinkman at Tri-C for Inorganic Chemistry.  His lectures are interesting and I really liked the practice tests he posted online.  Gives lots of extra credit.  Very helpful and I ended up enjoying Chemistry much more than I would have thought!  I highly recommend this instructor.
This class is extremely easy, the tests are only 20 questions, and most of the work you do you can do right from your computer at home.  Half of the things in this class I learned in 6th grade.
No Comments

She's always willing to put in extra time with students outside of class.  Study hard for quizzes. They are very tricky and detail oriented. You'll leave this class a better writer, but be prepared to work.
She weighed her class too much on citation and not enough on the actual quality of the writing.

she was a good professor overall, very focused on grammar and proper english.  we had numerous assignments due all the time.  she does grade more harshly than other legal writing and other law professors overall.

She seems to grade with "favorites" in the class. This is supported by comparing assignments and seeing grades lowered by eraser marks after the initial grade seemed to be entered. Also, not very respectful to students and not helpful outside of class. Do not recommended this professor.

What an amazing professor! Helpful to students in every way possible: academically, emotionally, socially, etc... I have never had a professor that cared so much for their students and can't imagine having a comparable one in the future. I am a better person because of her. Thank God for Denise Brown-Triolo: the saving grace of many CSU students.

She is a wonderful professor! I had her for Psy 220 spring12 semester and I enjoyed it very much. Her ways of explaining the topics are very comprehensible. Liked her so much that I have two more psych classes scheduled with her next school year :) I highly recommend her!

She is a fabulous teacher! She makes things very understandable and is a very organized teacher. She really knows what she is talking about and is passionate about it. She offers tons of extra credit opportunities and is a very fair grader. If you listen and do extra credit, there's no way you'll get lower then an A.
Looooove her. Best prof ive ever had
Nice teacher. Lots of extra credit, study guide before the test, just be there when she does it. Random attendence sheets. Interesting class. Bring a recorder during.

AMAZING TEACHER!! I wish she taught more of the classes I need to take! her powerpoint outlines keep notes organized and she only tests you on information that she goes over, so attend class and it is an easy A! she provides ALOT of opportunties for extra credit! they are packets but they will help prepare you for the exam! TAKE HER CLASS!!
LOVE HER! I WOULD TAKE HER OVER AND OVER AGAIN! She is very fair grader, offers a lot of bonus, her tests are what she covers and she is overall just an amazing person.

Easy to understand and clear in expectations. Does require several small assignments and two medium size projects. Lots of easy extra credit points. I am taking her again for another class and I am looking forward to it.

Reads off the powerpoint, it's very boring. Class discussions can be fun though. Grades papers with no feedback, writes "good" with a grade ranging from 7-10/10 with no explanation as to what students could do to improve. Take if you want the class for the degree and an A doesn't matter. If you want your grade to reflect your work, not this prof.
Really does not make the material applicable.

Brown is a nice, approachable professor. She is passionate about her career and loves research. She is always willing to take questions and makes lectures easy to follow. There is a large project that constitutes the majority of this class work load.

Dr. Brown is a very intelligent, hardworking professor at CSU. She knows her stuff, and wants you to as well! This class gets graduate students ready for their dissertation/thesis paper etc. She does an excellent job of making sure you're understanding the material, and she has a unique and engaging teaching style that I really enjoyed.

She gives good feedback, and she also points out what you have missed. You will learn a lot because you have to research. Weekly discussion boards and must respond to two classmates for a full credit. Discussion boards must have at least 300 words with two scholarly references. Responses to classmates should be at least 50 words. 5 easy quizzes .

She gives good feedback, and she also points out what you have missed. You will learn a lot because you have to research. Weekly discussion boards and must respond to two classmates for a full credit. Discussion boards must have at least 300 words with two scholarly references. Responses to classmates should be at least 50 words. 5 easy quizzes .
A very good professor keeps lectures interesting, very funny and relatable. Information is easy to understand. No testing, quite a few writing assignments that are very easy if you read the book.
A very good professor keeps lectures interesting, very funny and relatable. Information is easy to understand. No testing, quite a few writing assignments that are very easy if you read the book.
Just no.

Very unorganized! Browning assigned multiple papers and other particulars that, in order for the student to benefit from, needed his response. Throughout the entire semester, there was not a single reply from him, nor was anything graded. Another project was assigned after the semester had ended, quite shocking for those who already graduated...

Incredibly unorganized and ill prepared for class. There was zero grading of assignments throughout the semester and assignments were dropped off the syllabus because of how far behind we were. Class ended up being a severe waste of time and money.
Extremely unorganized professor who uses ''his'' textbook. The class is a series of tangents and regurgitated information that gets very old, very fast.
Very unorganized, has a striking lack of integrity. Not someone to model as a teacher. Has no time because he is consumed by self-admiration. Very poor quality...
No Comments
Obviously interested in his subject, but arrogant. Very helpful and somewhat understanding.

Taken this class as a online lecture. She explains things very confusing and doesnt like to be asked for help. She doesnt take student concerns seriously. All the test and homework is on math lab. If youll need additional help with math, this is not the Professor for you
Dr. Bruce was an incredible professor. The class consists of three essays and a portfolio. She lets you revise papers and really helps you get the score you deserve.
Dr. Bruce was an incredible professor. The class consists of three essays and a portfolio. She lets you revise papers and really helps you get the score you deserve.

Dr. Bruce was an incredible English professor and completely helped me advance my writing. She is a tough grader, but you get many chances to make your paper perfect to get the grade you want. She is very knowledgable and communicates with each student personally. Clearly knows her stuff and is passionate.

Dr. Bruce is one of the greatest professors/teachers I've come across. She makes an effort to help you succeed and truly wants the best for her students. The class was all essays, no tests, with clear guidelines and class periods going over expectations.

Bruckman was an EXCELLENT professor! The class was extremely laid back and we went on quite a few field trips. He is very good at communicating the topics we need to know and the midterm and final were pretty easy. Definitely one of my favorite professors!

EXCELLENT professor - pulls out all the cool info out of the book and teaches that, takes us on field trips and makes them incredibly fun - TAKE THIS CLASS WITH BRUCKMAN!!  Its a science class and a lab together, and very easy because its SO MUCH FUN!  Tests are very easy, he gives review notes prior to them - TAKE THIS CLASS!!

Suuuper boring classes. Almost zero engagement between students. Asking a question in class will get you an irrelevant and nonhelpful answer. Every class is reading straight from a black and white powerpoint.

Probably the worst class ive ever had. makes you show up to the same boring lectures every day & was only based on 4 tests and 3 writing assignments. we had another professor take over towards the end of the semester & that was the only thing that saved my grade.

Professor Bruner is probably the most boring, lifeless, and clueless professor I've had. Every single class is the same. Lecture for 45 minutes, has a the same white PowerPoint with black text - there are no pictures or diagrams- he also tends to go on tangents and goes over what he has already talked about in previous classes. He doesn't engage

If u are looking for a psych 487 class, take Bruners. He doesnt take attendance for a grade and I barely went. He is very clear about what he expects on his papers/ tests. He is very boring and awkward but his class is VERY easy

One of the worst professors I have ever had. Lectures are based on powerpoints that have no information on them. He is very monotone and makes you want to fall asleep. If you ask questions, you probably won't get the answer you are looking for. Quizzes are harder than tests and if you miss one question, you drop two letter grades.

Dr. Bruner is nice enough, but is not a very good professor. Twice he forgot to pick up my exams from the testing center and in the beginning told me most of his students didn't feel the need to use accommodations. His lectures are very dull and the slides give little to no information. He uses models that are not used in the field of psychology

The content of the course was fascinating and I loved learning it. The lectures were very well done. Unfortunately, Bruner was not understanding about disability accommodations. In fact, he could be downright rude. Also, as a female, I felt oddly uncomfortable around him when I went to his office alone. I won't be taking any more of his courses.

If you want to pay for a very uncomfortable place to sleep for an hour and 15 minutes twice a week, this is your class. Dr. Bruner is a great guy, and professor, very knowledgeable, however, he's the most boring professor. He speaks in a low tone of voice. His PowerPoints are black lettering on a white background with minimal information.

He uploads the lectures to Blackboard regularly, along with various readings that students may find helpful. Seemed really knowledgeable, kinda goes off the top of his head then will refer back to the PowerPoint. He's understanding. If you know you're gonna miss class let him know & he'll make an arrangement with you. But his lectures are monotone

His lectures can be boring & he often reads straight from power points as well as ventures off into rants that will make you snooze but honestly, very easy class. If you study the power points, you'll ace his tests. A few easy essays to write that he grades easy on as well. The final had questions from past exams, verbatim. Recommended prof

I feel that this review may be unjust, as Dr. Bruner was not my professor for the entire semester. My original professor quit on us half way through, and he agree to teach the remainder. Things became quite disorganized from that point forward, and he tends to not provide grades on time. His lectures are pretty basic and leave much to be desired.

Dr. Bruner does have some monotonous, boring lectures but he is very direct with the information that you need to know for test and quizzes. I barely used the book, just notes and handouts. His grading is pretty fair and he offers extra credit on correcting your own tests. The material is very easy to understand if you pay attention.

I have no idea how he has so many good reviews. He is the most monotonous, boring and confused professors I've ever had. This class was the WORST. Good luck hearing him and paying attention. Ask a question, get a completely irrelevant response. His tests are HARD. Made so that if u miss 1 question, u could be dropped a letter grade. So much work.

It was great to take this class with Dr. Bruner. I would recommend to everyone. It is easy and very enjoyable. You will learn a lot if your putting effort in. The lectures can sometimes feel super long. He tells you what to study for exams and his exams are straight forward. I would take every psych class with Dr. Bruner  if it were possible.

Dr. Bruner's class was a joy to be in. Although the man can be a bit monotone and his examples are outdated, his information is correct and his teaching methods are good. The tests are long and tedious and he does assign quite a few papers, but they are fun to write. I would take another class with Dr. Bruner if I needed another psych elective.

This by far has been my favorite class at CSU. Dr Bruner is very fair with grading, and to me is the king of second chances. There are 3 test which consist of 2 midterms and a final. The test are hard but if you study, you can score an A! He also has 5 quizzes which again if you study for, you can score an A. He gives extra credit for scoring 100%

Prof. Bruner runs my online writing in psych class. He has been absolutely wonderful and helpful all semester. The papers are easy to write, IF you keep up with the workload. He has been very understanding with a few due dates I've needed changed. Would absolutely take him again!

Dr. Bruner is an incredible instructor. His experience in the field makes him extremely credible and very knowledgable. He is VERY understanding and very easy to talk to. If anyone complains about dry lectures, its because he talks in a psychitrist's voice, very soft and monotone as to show objectivity. His lectures are good if you pay attention.

Easy A. Really slow lectures. Write 6+ papers based on case studies, really good application of subject. Exams were essay exams that he prepares you for very well. Do not need the text book. Posts all lecture notes, hand-outs, etc. online.

Professor Bruner is one of the nicest most understanding professors out there.  His class is extremely easy if you attend lecture and study off of his study guide.  He does make one write like 6 papers but they're enjoyable papers....Definitely an easy A.

Does not teach well. Relies way to much on in class group work. Homework online is average if you do it, but lack of examples and good book makes it hard at times. Many students dropped him. I would not recommend without knowing calculus before his taking class.
Nice prof, difficult class. Lots of homework, needed to use math tutoring center many times.

Hey this was an easy class. Yes you have to study and do the homework, but it was still easy. You'll be fine if you are a generally smart person. He explains things well and doesn't use big confusing lingo (thank God). He likes to give group work. Take that time to apply what he taught and try to understand the material and ask questions. I got a A
His Calc 2 class was pretty hard, I had to use the math tutoring center quite a bit.
Cute Professor...
=D
Alot of homework, pointless student presentations, okay maple labs, reasonable tests.  Plenty of bounus questions that can actually boost you a whole grade letter!!!
Explanation was just OK but tests were hard.

Oh! His tests tested us almost everything he just mentioned without good explanation. it's bad he did not give points reasonably. When I wrote cool steps he just saw it as wrong answer although it was very good try.  tough tests!   I did only one test well but I am very good at math since I got all A's in Math before this class
No Comments
Very hard exams.  Only good thing is the homework grade.
Very entertaining and eager to help students once he feels comfortable with a class.  Makes dry material interesting.
Caffiene.  Not having 8 Starbucks Doubleshots before this class is like not bringing your casebook.
Professor Buckley is very respectful to students and makes class very enjoyable.
Not a bad professor.  Non-confrontational.  Stands and lectures--whats wrong with that?
collects a paycheck

Took her Race, Racism, and the Law; a tough and touchy subject that she is obviously passionate about. Wants to make a difference. Made me think and re-evaluate concepts of social constructs. Very reasonable final exam. You don't have to parrot her views, but know your audience. May be best advocate of Critical Race Theory in US academia today.

She is never prepared for class and simply wings it. This would be fine if she could maintain focus on the relevant issues, but she cannot and tangential conversations abuse our attentiveness. The worst is that we consistently have make-up classes out of our own time because she cancels regular class. Terrible experience, limited teaching ability.

The most ineffective professor I have ever encountered. Her exam was the exact opposite of what she explicitly told the class we would be tested on. She cancelled several classes and held the make-up sessions (4 of them) 1 week prior to the exam. She consistently extends classes by 10-15 minutes. Her teaching techinique is awful and ineffective.
Took her for Race, Racism and Law; fantastic class, intriguing.  Not good for people who think all is well in the world regarding race--it is eye-opening, challenges notions of white privilege.
At first I thought I would fail this course for sure. But I ended up leaving this course loving her and the class. Passed it with a B+ and loved it.
Brings a very unique teaching style to law school.  First years tend to have a hard time getting used to that.
A property law genius, and an equally talented teacher. Her exams are grueling, but she went out of her way to make sure we were prepared for them.

GREAT prof; I'm annoyed that she's on sabbatical in '05 and I can't take her other classes. Knuckleheads accustomed to getting over on spouting empty rhetoric won't like her.  Going to class is key, as is doing the reading.  She's really helpful in office hours, and will often spend a lot of time after class answering questions.

Absolutely the worst teacher that I have ever had at any level of education.  Extremely arrogant.  Refuses to answer questions.  She is unable to explain her grading.  Very difficult to contact out of class because she is always too busy.  Avoid her class like the plague.
very knowledgeable !! That first paper is very tough !! Test was straight from notes !! learned a lot, but I dropped the class !!

Lloyd is extremely knowledgeable in the subject matter.  He has real world experience which keeps the class interesting.  The class is not an easy A, but if you attend and read the book you will be fine.  Grading is fair.  The power points are a good guide to what the tests will cover, but he did had a few random questions on each of the tests.

You have to basically memorize the entire book to get a good grade on his tests. The class is a TON of open discussion, and then the tests are random questions from any section in the book--the questions are like, "gottcha" questions. We had to do a huge group project that had NOTHING to do with what we were learning. He is very smart and a very ni
Lloyd is a true gem.  Kind, caring, knowledgeable, and zealous.  It was a pleasure, Lloyd.  Wherever I go, you will be with me.  L.L.L.B. (Long Live Lloyd Buckwell)

This guy is the worst, he is arrogant, self absorbed jerk. He gave stupid assignments and was constantly vague on his grading. He also regularly slipped in his personal political bias. Nothing good came from this class.
Lloyd is the man!  Knowledgeable, extremely friendly, and with decades of experience, you can tell he knows his stuff. I only hope I run into Lloyd in future classes at CSU.  Lloyyyyyyyyyyyyyd!
Good class, fun.

Amazing professor. My only regret was not taking any courses with her sooner. Her lectures are outstanding, enthusiastic,extremely knowledgeable.  I really learned so much through the  course of her class. The book is not needed as long as you attend class, fully pay attention and participate.  Caring, nice & easy to contact outside of class hours

Dr. Burant is very sweet and funny. The class is extremely easy and fun. Study a couple hours for the tests and you will be fine. Show up to class or you won't get a good grade because there are weekly group projects.

Patty classes are incredible, and Nonverbal Communication is possibly my favorite class I've taken as a Communication major. She fits a lot of information into lectures while still allowing it to be a dialogic experience for students. There is a group project that you will need the textbook for. Show up to class!!

Patty is easily my favorite teacher at CSU. She is super energetic and knowledgeable and you learn a lot from each class. Her tests do require significant studying, but she gives you everything you need to get an A. She puts everything on the review and gives extra credit for each test. She also takes attendance every day but definitely take her!

Dr. Patty is an outstanding professor. I strongly recommend taking any of her classes. I have taken four with her thus far. She is intelligent, courteous, and kind. Additionally, you will learn a lot.

Great professor! Dr. Burant gives study guides for tests and the info on that study guide is what is actually on the test. :) Participating in this class is needed and is easy to do in the class environment. Attendance is very important you must show up to class. Classes are entertaining, I recommend.
Her material for tests was way different then her lectures. Short answer questions on stuff we never covered in lectures. Never got out early in the summer, and I didn't learn very much.

She's nice, and courteous, but she lets her students dominate her lectures, and you have no idea what grade your getting the entire term. She only let's you look at your test results then takes them back. You don't know any of the grades you get from projects, or from assignments. She loads you up with handouts written in her own words. Beware
Dr. Burant is freaking awesome! Hands down. There is no better Professor. You should definitely take this course!
She's one of the best professors I've had. Good at her job, and a nice person

I absolutely love Patty. I had her for an 8 am class and honestly don't think I would've survived it with anyone else. Her paper was easy. Her tests aren't necessarily easy, but she does prepare you for them. She gives great lecture notes that tell you all that you need to know. However, you absolutely have to attend class to make it.

There isn't enough room in this comment space to let other students know how amazing Dr. Burant is. Take any of her classes and you will see. She deserves any and all the recognition for her research, knowledge, helpfulness and heart she teaches with. Truly an all-time favorite professor of mine and other students.

I absolutely loved this class, mainly because she is funny, down to earth, and engages the class, but also because I much prefer tests over papers. Grades are: participation/attendance, midterm, final, very short paper. Will only need book to study for the tests. Responds to email quickly, and is very clear about expectations.

Patty is an amazing teacher, I am so glad I had her. She is clear and an exciting lecturer. She genuinely cares about her students and is a fair grader. Only had two testes, the midterm and final, and also a group project. You definitely need to study for the tests, her study guides are wonderful and very helpful, make sure you attend class.
Patty made this class interesting. If it weren't for her this would have been one of the worse classes  that I've ever had. Brilliant professor, with an awesome personality and a huge heart!!
I've taken Patty for 3 different classes, and I will have her again next year. She's a great professor, and she really loves her students. Don't miss her lectures or you will struggle tremendously.

Patty is an awesome professor!! She's really down to earth and she spends most of her classes laughing. She's big on lectures, so if you skip class you will miss out on the notes you need to pass the class. She loves to help her students, but she won't put up with any crap. So make sure that you're putting you're best foot forward with her.

This has been one of my nicest professors to date! She cares about the material, and thoroughly goes through lectures. Lots of note taking, but only two exams. If you skip class, you'll be missing a lot of material. Book was only used to reference for the two exams.

Honestly the best professor I have ever had in my five years of college. She's very helpful and cares about her students. She also makes class fun and clearly lays out the things you need to know. I hate to call it an easy A, but if you study the notes she gives you, you'll do great. If I could go back, I'd take more classes with Patty for sure.

This is my third class with Patty and I have four more next year- needless to say if I had to retake them all again I would. If you plan on showing up to class, the book isn't even necessary. Write down EXACTLY what she says and make note of things "you may need in your future life". Because you will. Study guide is exact and no curveballs thrown.

I took her Intro Drama/African Am. Lit class. She is very relatable, understands student life balance, and is very sensitive to student identity. There is attendance and random quick pop quizzes. Participate well and she'll know you care about the class.I learned a lot about fascism, not sure if this was semester specific or a general focus.

I took her Intro Drama/African Am. Lit class. She is very relatable, understands student life balance, and is very sensitive to student identity. There is attendance and random quick pop quizzes. Participate well and she'll know you care about the class.I learned a lot about fascism, not sure if this was semester specific or a general focus.

literally so much reading, and almost daily quizzes to make sure you read (testing you on specifics). also, she doesn't let you make up quizzes if you aren't registered with disability services. honestly, don't take this class if you're looking for a good discussion relating to WGS bc it's so reading heavy that's really all that matters.

Dr. Burrell is a solid choice for senior seminar. However, the class was not what was expected topic-wise. She talked about what she wanted and what she thought was important and didn't take students' opinions into account. The way the 20pg paper is written makes it a breeze, and I really appreciated her feedback and time spent to help.
Worst professor for clear instructions and guidelines, very judge mental and condescending. She is just plain mean.

She actually wasn't bad, which is surprising when considering the other English professors I had at CSU. She was nice, knowledgeable, and cared about the subject matter. Her African American Lit was a little weird for me, as I think she took the whole idea a bit too far. But overall, not a bad professor and a pretty easy class.

This is my second class with Dr. Burrell and honestly I'd take anything that she taught! Her class is set up discussion style so participation matters. The readings are engaging and her assignments are not difficult. She just wants to see good ideas and support. Probably my favorite prof. at CSU. I've learned so much from her!
Fair and always there to help. Facilitated great class discussions, but very tough grader.
Professor Burrell was a nice, fun lady but an EXTREMELY harsh grader who had us write many papers
Great professor
Such a sweet lady! We had 2 papers and a take home final, attendance is mandatory but lecture was very enjoyable and she lets out early storm times :) highly recommend her!
Easy class. You don't need the book.

The WORST professor I have ever had. She gives you the work and provides no lectures, powerpoints, resources, or anything. You have to do homework every chapter that is mandatory but does NOT go towards your grade, although if you don't do ALL of the homework she takes 20% off of your final grade. Take this class at another school.
Easy class. You don't need the book.

Easy, self paced online class. Sends out plenty of reminders as to up coming due dates, so failure to complete assignments is no one but the students' fault. Do not buy textbook, just use online resources. Fair and easy class.

This course was conducted of four exams (25 points each) and that's it. No opportunity for extra credit, and she is rude when you go to her her with questions. Many exam questions are online, but some of them are trick questions. Self-paced course.

Make sure you do really well on the exams because she gives no extra credit if your leaning between to grades. She's kind of rude if you try to talk to her. Most of the answers you can find online, but her questions are tricky. class can be completed within four hours.

the book isn't required but it is recommended for use. I used it but you can use the internet if need be. quizzes are required to be taken but aren't part of the final grade but not taking them will hurt your grade. overall grade consists of 4 exams. very easy course. would recommend taking. professor is clear with grading criteria & assignments.

This class is entirely independent. You take quizzes at your leisure that are taken for completion, not part of the grade. There are four tests you have to take, which are taken as part of the grade. Easy A.  You don't have to buy the book, you could use the internet if you want.

I skipped a math class and went right into this one so for me it was difficult. It was a lot better in person. He makes it mandatory to attend class. So, you learn and focus better. When we went online I had no motivation and skipped class once and I ended up getting and F on that exam. Expects participation sit in the back & you wont be called on.

Worst professor ever. He does not teach properly and is very rude and unprofessional. He just yells at us during the whole class when no one answers him and calls us dumb when half the class fails his test because he can't teach properly. He belittled students multiple times asking why they are in his class or calling them slow. Avoid HIM

Do Not take him unless you like to teach yourself everything. He is very bad and doens't seem to know what hes doing. The whole class time he just goes over homework and then ends up asking students how they got the right answer because he can't figure it out himself. He is also very hard to understand because of his accent.
Made this class harder than it is. Hes rude and prepare to teach everything in this class back to yourself. He literally doesnt teach even though hes smart as hell

I had him for Math 149 this past semester. Make a friend or 2 in the class because that's what I did and during the group quizzes they will be very helpful. you will have 7 quizzes, all of them are group quizzes. The tests are actually the easiest problems from e/ unit. so YAY!! He cares alot about his students, trust me! I loved having him!

Professor Bushi really grew on me. At first it was hard to understand his accent and he seemed kind of mean. As time passed, he became more personable and was actually pretty funny. The class wasn't too hard. He could explain things a bit better though. If you have thin skin, maybe consider someone else. Do the homework, study, and you'll be fine.

At first he can be a little hard to understand, but it gets easier the more you're in class. He definitely wants students to participate and can get annoyed if no one does. If you do ask a question just know he'll probably give you a hard time. Overall, I enjoyed this class and I feel he grades pretty easily.

He is a nightmare. I get anxiety going to his class every week. Andon Bushi does not explain anything what so ever. You are basically teaching yourself. He is EXTREMELY rude and makes fun of everyone who does not understand when he is the one who does not explain . He's the worst I've had DO NOT TAKE HIM

He can be helpful when proving things, I've had a few "aha!" moments in his class. However if you are an introvert, don't DARE ask a question. He is rude and makes a fool out of everyone. He is constantly calling students out who look confused for not having an answer to a problem on the board, he will make you go up and try. And feel REAL dumb.

Great teacher! He really does his best to make sure everyone passes the classes. He does not grade very strictly on tests. Homework gives you many attempts to get it right. As long as you come to class, pay attention, and do the homework and tests, it's an easy A.

He cannot speak clear English but if you pay attention you will understand him complete.  He is an amazing teacher.  He is so kind and tries his best to make sure everyone passes his class with a C.  Hes and amazing teacher.  Make sure to take your book to class you can get extra credit for it!!

I find MTH 117 to be a very easy course, so this class seemed really easy  to me personally. Mr. Bushi always offers a lot of help to students who ask for it. Sometimes he goes off on weird stories that are hard to follow, but overall he is quirky and nice! I would recommend him.

Prof. Buttet is not for everyone.If you are self-motivated,ask questions, apply yourself you can get more out than many other teachers. Those that need more stucture, by the book, PowerPoint, HW, he may not be the best pick. He is laid back and approachable. His lecture style is to really ask you to think things through rather than just lecture.

Buttet is a horrible professor! He did not post midterm grades, so the class still has no idea what grade they have right now. He came to class every day asking someone if he could borrow their book. His handwriting is awful and writes as smallest amount of information possible on the board with the smallest handwriting so you can't even read the b

This guy is truly awesome.  You get that bubbly feeling in your stomach when he teaches...the kind that makes you come back for more.  His sense of humor can be cute and his teaching style is very relaxed.  He's always available to help after hours.  Highly recommended!  I only wish my schedule allowed me to take him again before graduation.

A very traditional-style lecture-based class and professor. I would say the majority of his tests were based on lecture material, but the textbook was relevant to the first half of the class and aided in studying. I will say that textbook sections that strayed from a historical focus (dates and famous people) weren't particularly relevant.

Dr. Bynum is a tough prof. For an introductory class, I was surprised by his decision against PowerPoints and study guides. You must follow his lectures. Although the book is not relevant through the semester, you will find many questions from the book on the final exam. Beware: the syllabus does not outline the true material/nature of the class.

Acting major here and I hated this man. This was FMA 333. I thought the reviews I saw from him were because we were on Zoom, but unfortunately, they are all true. Was suppose to be on-campus, but we stayed on Zoom for all of the semester (for no reason). Worthless lessons, same crap every class. I wish I didn't need to take his class for my track.

Byrne is good for teaching acting basics, but he is not a good film acting professor. This class was supposed to be an upper level Screen Actors Workshop. Byrne only taught theatre techniques and always told us to be bigger and over exaggerate our acting. These techniques DO NOT work on film. Calling this a screen acting class is a joke.

Took an acting class with him and was initially excited but slowly lost hope in him. He's mediocre and focuses too heavily on the beginning of Miesner. He'll talk excessively too. He's constantly critiquing and personally made me disinterested in performing unless I had to. Lastly, too much spoon-feeding, no room for personal creativity.
Very knowledgeable.

The class is fairly easy, but I felt like he didn't have a clear grading rubric. Kind of seemed like he made things up as he went along. Definitely had to use outside resources to understand the application techniques because failed to use clear examples. (ie demonstration)
Personable, Diciplined and great Role Model/Mentor. Good Fight!

Acting major here and I hated this man. I thought the reviews I saw from him were because we were on Zoom, but unfortunately they are all true. Was suppose to be on-campus, but we stayed on Zoom for all of the semester (for no reason). Worthless lessons, same crap every class. I wish I didn't need to take his class for my track.

She is a very kindhearted person but extremely boring professor. Her lectures are power points. Tests are 50 questions and can be confusing sometimes. Personally wasted my time. It was hard to find the motivation to go to class; there was nothing to look forward to.
Nice lady. Easy, but extremely boring class.

Dr. Callow is an interesting person, she's Greek too. The tests are literally info on power point slides made into questions. She makes it obvious what's gonna be on the test. Even if you're going to text or shop online the entire time, go to class. You will get extra credit. I didn't study AT ALL and passed w/ an A. Just come to class & listen.
Not too difficult. Just have to read the book, and go over the questions in them.

For this class, if you want to do good on the tests, look up the book online and there will be an online study guide. You will get an A if you use the site. Easy grader for papers, I doubt she writes her own tests though. Her powerpoints are not relevant to test material.

She is really sweet, I must say that. But, she just reads the powerpoints. You do group work a lot, but don't turn in assignments usually. The paper is an easy A. But, the tests were next to impossible!! Never in my life have I gotten an F on a test, especially psychology!! Ended up with a B in the class.
I absolutely hate this class! didn't do good on either test. Dr. Callos is very boring and unclear of material
Looks amazing. So easy
BORING. She does not know her material at all: she defers answers to questions to other students. Her tests are pretty easy. I actually wanted to learn something but I did not.

I thought she was a good teacher. Class was a little dry at times but psychology courses are all about what you make them. I would personally recommend her because she is nice, relatively easy, and slow paced.

Attendance not mandatory but will help a - or + grade.  She is not clear and gives random extra credit, show up to class even if you just text the whole time. She loves percents and Stats info for her test. She had a big case paper do and at the las minute added extra references for the paper. Overall take this class only if you have to.

Overall a very boring professor. She basically skims through  powerpoints for her lectures. For the Case Study assignment she is not very helpful, she basically talked around every question that students had for the assignment and constantly changed what she wanted. She was very unhelpful. I would not recommend her.
Dr. Callos is a brilliant professor. You must study to do well in her course. She knows what she is talking about! I feel lucky to have had her.

Easy A class. give extra credit when classes are not so "full" she gotcha didnt she? you skip class you miss. However, this is a FALL ASLEEP type of class. She is not pasionate and its sooooooo BORING!!!!! Study on your own exams are EASY. Get an A in class.

Professor Callos was a decent teacher. Her lectures weren't boring. Print your power points and read the chapters and you'll do fine. Also there is an SI session for this class. I found SI sessions very helpful as well. Not a bad teacher at all.

Did ALL of her course work from power points. This made it pointless to go to class because she ends up putting all of her power points online... Honestly felt like she was just regurgitating information from the book/power points, not to say she's isn't an intelligent professor.
Lectures are long, but interesting. Not an interactive class. Speaks very fast and sometimes hard to follow.

Very easy class. Though the lectures were boring, I liked her. The topics were really interesting. The tests were really easy. She curved them and even let the class retake the test the got the lowest grade on.

I had her for Life Span Development. She is not enthusiastic about her topic, but I never bought the book, I used her powerpoints and did fine on my tests. They are essay tests. She gave a 10 page paper at the end of the semester which was very stressful.

Rose to the occasion for Dr. Wilson's Psych of Personality course, but approached it the same way she always does-powerpoint slideshows!!!! She doesn't use any original material, strictly summaries of material. You learn next to nothing!
Claire is awesome! She is one of the most empathetic professors I've ever had. I took CNS620 with her. Highly recommended.

Never in my life did I think I would have to rate a prof but here I am WARNING YOU. I am an A+ student, so trust me when I say this class is hard. The material itself is fine, but her grading criteria is so unclear. She can be very condescending and I would NOT advise taking her unless absolutely necessary, save yourself

She is the worst professor I have ever had in my life. So unclear and hard to communicate with. All of her assignments include excessive and unnecessary work. She is a very smart woman, but she is so picky, strict, and rude. I took her class about teaching K-12 foreign languages; she was so unnecessarily harsh on my beginner student teaching skills

Took a four hour masters class training K-12 language teachers. It was appalling how unprepared she was to teach this class. Almost no "teaching" occurred in class-about 75% was group presentations about ed. articles and teaching demos. Never any clear criteria from which to succeed. Nothing learned, total waste of time. Very unqualified. Avoid.

This was a 1 credit class that she managed to turn into a 4 credit class with the amount of work she required. The readings were irrelevant and she was unable to relate them to the activities she wanted us to do. She made us very uncomfortable with her derogatory comments towards other languages. VERY arbitrary grading. Avoid at all costs.

She really makes you work for your grade. For a 300-level speaking class, this was a tough one. The presentations were supposed to be really detailed and she had almost every person in the class re-do at least one presentation over the course of the semester. I just found her really intimidating outside of class, but she's a funny woman.

Best writing professor at CSU! One of the best professors at the school period. Knows about the industry and gives firsthand advice. Really cool and actually cares about his students. He will teach you so much about writing, even if you hate writing you will know how to write after having Sal.

Excellent professor. Class can be passed easily, however the work you put into the work now can set you up for a successful career in writing in the future. I highly recommend taking this class seriously. Love this man and will definitely be taking another course soon. Sal will return every bit of energy you put into his class and then some.

This is the best class I've ever taken. Sal has such a good grasp on the content, and he wants you to succeed. I've learned so much about screenwriting, and it really shows in my writing compared to before, and after class. I'd recommend this class to everyone.
Really liked this class and this teacher!!! Compared to other online classes that I have had this year, this one was a good one. It was accessible, clear, and surprisingly interactive. Recommend!
Really liked this class and this teacher!!! Compared to other online classes that I have had this year, this one was a good one. It was accessible, clear, and surprisingly interactive. Recommend!

Wish all my teachers were like her! She made the class interesting. I took it online in the summer. There was alot of content to cover because it was a 6wk class, but I actually looked forward to doing everything each week. All the discussion and quizzes matter though (don't skip assignments if you want and A). Glad I took the class!

My advisor suggest this class & I didn't think I'd like it since I am not really a dancer, but it ended up being my favorite class!! It was interesting and the professor made it relatable. I actually looked forward doing the modules. Power points w videos, discussions, quizzes. We had to see a dance performance and discuss it, but it was fun!

She is such a rude and unprofessional teacher, she does not respond to her students. The only time she responds to her students is when she wants to be rude. She also doesnt put any grades in until the the end of the semester, so you never know how you are doing in the class. Avoid taking her at all cost, her class was very stressful.

One of this worst professors I have every taken. She does not care about her students and she told us not to email her cause she has to many students. She makes you do 8 discussion board post a week, and papers with very vague directions. I never had the unpleasant experience of having her in person, but Im sure she is just as bad as online.
She was always a mean professor. Also yelled at people during class for using the bathroom. She knows the material but shes just nasty as a person.

The class is not extremely difficult however it isn't super easy. She also tends to be rude to her students all the time. The classroom environment can be a bit toxic. She has unrealistic standards for a GenEd class. If you have to take any class for history make sure it is not with her.

She doesn't respond to emails and if she does it's days later. She blames it on her having 200 students. She doesn't post grades often so it's hard to know how you're doing. Avoid taking her classes if you can. She doesn't seem to care that students have other classes to take and doesn't give much insight ahead of time what the final form will be.
Dr. Carey uses most of her class time to lecture without a power point. She takes her sweet time when grading and grades pretty hard. Make sure to not procrastinate on any assignments.

Took this course as I have taken a few Religion classes in the past. Dr Carey is extremely knowledgeable in the entire field. In her classes she wants participation. This includes open discussions. She will literally stop and wait for a response. This is a wonderful thing. It encourages others to share their opinions and thoughts.
Bruh on god if you want to she told us not to email her because she has over 200 students like who the f*ck does that?

She is very knowledgeable about her class. She is a very fair grader but can and will come off as extremely condescending which can make the class challenging. I would recommend not taking her if you can avoid it.

She expects a lot out of her students which isnt really a bad thing, but can be frustrating when all she does is lecture every class and makes class boring. Only 3 papers, so you better make sure you do well on them. Tests are only essays and can be very hard as well. Do not skip class, your grade will drop!
Very detailed and enthusiastic lectures. Prof can answer all questions and is clearly passionate and knowledgeable about subject matter. Good-natured, friendly, approachable. Fair grading.

Her "lectures" are just her talking and occasionally writing something on the board. No power points. It was hard to pay attention for the whole class because she only stood and talked nonstop with no visuals (and I was in the front row!). Tests are only essays and she doesn't give clear directions on what to write about for the papers she assigns.
She was so passionate about the subject and all of her exams were very easy if you just paid attention and looked over your notes.

Should've been an easy A but she is a tough grader. The writing assignments killed me. Do not miss class or your grade will drop. This class was interesting, it was just too early. She's very intelligent and expects a lot out of her students.

Professor Karey is a nice lady, but her tests require a lot of effort. I can give you a secret to passing her classes. Make bullet points of the topics in Hines and make flashcards for the Identification terms for her tests. Also use the BP, you made for the Hines Text and match them to the essay questions. His 215+216, you can thank me later.

She assigned 3 books for the course that we didn't know we had to get til the first day of class. You'll have readings everyday. (She didn't use blackboard) We had a midterm, 2 papers, and a final; in that order (tests are 3-4 essay questions). She does give a study guide, fairly close to the test date, you MUST answer those questions to pass test
She was very passionate which helped me actually learn, it's a tough class and all the tests are essays but if you really want to learn and not take an easy way out this is a great class.

Dr. Carey is very passionate about history and teaching, made me respect her and want to do well in her class. Tests are hard, have to memorize a ton and barely have time to finish. She grades the papers really strict, only answer what she wants exactly. Don't take if you don't like history.
I love her class but I expected an A on every assignment/test but fell short on eveything. the tests are absolutely terrible I hated them so much. READ STUDY READ STUDY Before tests and essays.
