Get A's on the first 2 tests and don't take the final. Two papers, but she grades fairly. Tests are essays, but she gives you study guides that tell you exactly what will be on it. She takes off points if you miss too many classes. She lectures very well, she's very clear, and makes history interesting. DO NOT LET HER CATCH YOU WITH A CELL PHONE!

Great professor. She's nice but not a push over. You have to attend class or you'll fail. She gives participation points, so speak up, look interested and pay attention. Most of the class was just discussion, some lecture. Lots of paper, lots of reading. The papers aren't overly difficult, though and the novels we read were interesting.

Participation and attendance are very important. Accessible outside of class, and immediately before/after class. Clear grading rubrics, helpful in all aspects of the class, and very intelligent in anything relating to English. Everyone knew everyone's names by week 2 :D! Make eye contact and look interested. She is definitely my favorite ENG prof!

Dr. Carnell was far and away the best Professor I encountered as I earned my M.A. She actually explained and demonstrated with examples how to write the major paper for her class; most professors either do not do this, or they do not do it very well. In addition, she was there, both physically and mentally, for her office hours.

Dr. Carnell is a highly intelligent person who I do believe means well. With that said, she humiliated and belittled my writing within earshot of the entire class. I am an A student and a very sufficient writer. I did gain more writing skills in her class but it came at a cost.

Dr. Carnell is extremely knowledgeable, but very objective. There was very little room to share personal insight on our readings, just what she wanted to hear. She assigned nightly journals for our reading notes and she graded them. Her exams are long in class essays (about four). She assigns both a final paper and final exam. Wouldn't take again!

Prof Carnell is extremely knowledgeable in her area of English, but she speaks to her class as if they are as well. She knows her stuff, but doesn't understand how to communicate it to learners. She lectures a mile a minute and expects a lot of reading to be done. She's a nice person, and a decent grader, but high expectations and low clarity.

She is a nice lady, but she seems pretentious when it comes to her writing.  She is very picky when it comes to what words used and when, so a thesaurus is going to become your best friend. She likes a simplistic writing style, which is more difficult to achieve that one would think. Lastly, I'd say she is a VERY tough grader.

Mrs. Carnell is a tough but fair grader, she expects a lot and by the end of the semester she'll make an English mayor out of you.  She will tell you what she wants; don't do a lot to change that. Use a thesaurus in your papers, she appreciates colorful word choice.  Read the books assigned and make some good notes, keep them for papers. Nice lady.
She not only helps students develop their research and critical thinking skills, but also encourages style development.  She is incredibly helpful and understanding.  Take her for any of her classes.
he is confusing to his students. He will jump from one chapter to another without explaining all of the information in between. He should not teach math
Handsome guy but didn;t know his stuff.
Is lost half the time, and makes tests worth 60% of your grade, but only has 6 problems on the test. Has no real sense on how to teach and control a classroom.
very poor teacher, he doesn't know what ti teach in the class half of the time
Hard teacher, but good. He explains the problems in a helpfull way. I would recommend him.
No Comments
Very poor teaching.
No Comments

by far one of my worst professors, she just does not care at all about you. she laughs at her own unfunny jokes early in the morning, and she gave out random pop quizes that were worth alot of points.i wish i dropped but i did not know any better as a freshman
Meanest Pof ever! Can't teach for her life. Wears the same clothes everyday. Prolly has a FAKE degree. White Trash
avoid if u can

Worst, Teacher, Ever. She takes a basic business class and turns it into a nightmare of bad information. The tests and homework are run but a vendor company and she can't answer any questions about either the tests or the homework. She wastes time in class with useless group projects. Avoid her like the plague!

Tests are vey opinionated and she does not give you graded test back to know what you got wrong.  If someone cheats, she punishes the entire class.  "Sorry I can't discuss that" are her favorite words.  So many spelling errors on the tests.   She doesn't teach, she makes you read PP slides out loud to each other.  Group projects to take up time.
I took MTH168 with him in Spring 2016. His class was very informative. He makes math entertaining.
She was decent at best
Great teacher, I wish she was still at CSU... Explains everything very well.

THEE BEST accounting professor at CSU. Accounting can be very difficult, but she makes it easy because she knows how to teach the material and makes sure you understand it before moving on. I wish she was here to teach the upper level accounting courses and not these other terrible accounting professors CSU has to offer.
Best teacher I've had at Cleveland State or possibly in college in general. Clear, helpful, makes concepts easy to understand and simple. She's so sweet!

Professor Castrigano is seriously the best teacher at CSU. Even though this was her last summer teaching there, I would consider taking Accounting classes at whatever school she teaches at. She clearly explains the concepts and makes sure that you understand them. I took ACT 221 & 222 with her. I love her!!
Best Teacher at CSU

Really amazing and helpful professor. She is not easy but teaches so well that makes everything easy. She is willing to go over the stuff again and again until you understand. Must take this class with her if this is a requirement.
She is an amazing professor, YES you need to study. she explains every thing you need to know! highly recommended.

She very clear about explaining things ..tell you whats going to be on test and quizes so your only job is to study what she gives you... she tries her best to make sure you pass drops lowest quiz and homework grade She is very open if you need help and i recommend her she is GREAT !!!
Yes was the perfect teacher. I highly recommend taking on class with her!
The best teacher in my college.

One of the FEW profs in my college career who really ensures you know the material. I had never done anything with accounting prior to this class and I'm acing it, and I'm not a math person. She's kind, helpful, and fair with grades and procedures. A must to actually LEARN accounting. Awesome prof.
THE BEST TEACHER

She is the best. You can take tests directly from her notes. Made accounting do-able as long as you show up to class and try. You can't be late to class...must be on time. If you miss the beginning of a quiz you cannot take it. But fair.

If taking Intro to Accounting, make sure you get this professor.  She will bend over backwards to ensure everyone understands the material.  Also tells you everything that will be on the exams/quizzes, so no excuse for not preparing.  She also hands out lots of opportunity for extra credit, which is easily the difference between letter grades.
I haven't taken a math class since 2005, and she made this class incredibly easy to pass. Lots of extra credit available, doubles as a CPA so she has a solid background too
She is the best, I highly recommend her class
The best accounting instructor at CSU. She wants her students to understand and offer help for everyone on her office hours. Her exams are based on her lectures.

Probably the best accounting professor at CSU. She knows how to explain things in terms you understand, and makes class easier and enjoyable. She also makes sure the class understands the material before proceeding. Definitely recommend taking her classes if you want to learn and get a good grade!

Def was one of the best professors I've ever taken. I took Act 201 w/ Klaus and after taking Renee for 202 I wish I would have took her for one as well, would have saved alot of time doing homework and trying to teach myself. Very fair in grading-gives you as many points as possible. The tests are very easy if you study. It didn't take very long.

Melanie is extremely knowledgeable, however she does not share that knowledge well. Her classes have been some of the worst college level experiences I have ever had. She is the toughest grader and will nit pick every possible thing. Her feedback is always rude, snarky, and negative. This last class destroyed my mental health and confidence.

Professor Cavender worked alongside Douglas for health assessment lab. She truly just wants to help! Don't be afraid to ask questions and PRACTICE PRACTICE PRACTICE. Don't blame your bad grades on the professors if you won't practice.

Professor Cavender worked alongside Douglas for health assessment lab. She truly just wants to help! Don't be afraid to ask questions and PRACTICE PRACTICE PRACTICE. Don't blame your bad grades on the professors if you won't practice.

Very incoherent. Information was all over the place, said one thing during lecture and changed it the day of an exam. Not interested in students succeeding. Not working well with other professor teaching lecture so there was even more confusion. Glad to never have her again. Self study and asking credible sources  (aka any other professor) helped.
Very nice, helpful, knowledgeable.
Fun clinical, good site. Very nice and helpful instructor.

If you are like me and terrified of math, dont be afraid to take his class. Hes a really good teacher. He responds to emails within a few hours and his lectures wont put you to sleep. Homework assignments are short. I thought it was cool that he took the time to learn everyones name within a few classes  I definitely recommend him.

I honestly wish all my professors were as good as Corey! He is great at teaching the class and making it understandable for everyone. If someone has a question, he knows how to answer it right away and makes sure you understand the concept before continuing on. He made a difficult class easier for us to understand. He is very accessible as well.

Corey came prepared to each and every class. His lectures mirrored his quizzes and tests and all the lectures were available on blackboard. Homework was simple and he was quick to respond to emails.  reasonable office hours  could break down equations to make it easy to understand  pretty good looking so it was easy to pay attention

Honestly, shes not a bad professor. The weekly worksheets help prepare you for exams, but you have to study to truly understand what shell put on the exam. I met with her after all of my exams to discuss the wrong answers, which has helped me to think through NCLEX styled questions. Just read the book and do the assignments and youll be fine.

Honestly, shes not a bad professor. The weekly worksheets help prepare you for exams, but you have to study to truly understand what shell put on the exam. I met with her after all of my exams to discuss the wrong answers, which has helped me to think through NCLEX styled questions. Just read the book and do the assignments and youll be fine.

While lectures are often unorganized, Professor Cefo's exams and NCLEX quizzes do an amazing job at preparing you for the NCLEX, which means you should be prepared to study to understand the material. She will also meet with you outside of class to go over materials/past exams, and help with clinical paperwork and assignments.

I was surprised to see her ratings here. While I don't think she's amazing, she's definitely not as bad as these rating make her out to be. She's really nice and knows what she's talking about. However, her exams are difficult & more NCLEX style, and it seems you can't study enough for them. But she gives clear feedback and always offers to help

In my opinion this professor is HORRIBLE! she can be very rude and inconsiderate at times and she was also unorganized in lecture. Lots of grading errors in regards to exams and she will not admit when she has made an error. Im not sure how exactly how she holds her position, she needs to do better.

Cefo was very unorganized and changed her syllabus many times throughout the semester along with changing the style of her class. She did not make it clear what material she was testing over for her first test. She also was not willing to admit she was wrong when making mistakes on tests or creating bad questions. Her pride got in the way.
so unorganized and do not know how to teach

Cefo was my clinical instructor for MedSurg 1. She was absolutely AMAZING. She pushes you to be the absolute best nurse you can be and will not settle for less. She has high expectations but sets you up for success. If you work for it, apply book knowledge, and take the time to care, you will be surprised how much you know at the end of clinicals!

Kevin gives great lectures! When it comes down to the exams, he hands out a review with what you need to know. Homeworks can get annoying after a while and quizzes are about every other week but they drop lowest 2. Take this course with him if you want an easy A or B

This is an easy class! You don't need the book, but buy the online access for the homework which is due every week. If you do the homework you'll do good! He does unnanounced quizzes but they are super easy- as well as the exams! He does some math errors or forgets the signs 8+/-)on the board which may get confusing sometimes but overall he's great

I thought he was a good teacher, yes, he did seem new to teaching the class, but he got more confident as the semester went on. He is very nice and understanding to those who don't quite understand the material. He breaks down the math so it's easy for anyone to understand.  Definitely recommend!
Very little teaching experience. Sometimes wrong information was given, class challenged him many times. Lectures straight from the text. Course material is very easy.

He doesn't seem to have much teaching experience so he can be confusing at times. He is willing to help if you ask though. The course material is not very difficult. You have to buy an access code to do the homework online and this comes with a digital copy of the text book.

As I go through her ratings I am baffled. I had prof Chan for an online class and she gave a reasonable amount of work and it was all fairly easy. She provides very positive feedback. The only issue is communication. She is not good and responding to emails or office calls but besides that she was nice and always accommodating.

As I go through her ratings I am baffled. I had prof Chan for an online class and she gave a reasonable amount of work and it was all fairly easy. She provides very positive feedback. The only issue is communication. She is not good and responding to emails or office calls but besides that she was nice and always accommodating.

So unclear in her expectations and gives absolutely no support when teaching. This was my Rotation 2 and I feel like I didn't learn anything about teaching. I basically had to teach myself all the methods in the book, and whenever we asked questions or were unsure about something, she made us feel dumb or like we weren't trying to learn. Atrocious.

Very difficult project focus of class. Instructions not always clear, but professor works consistently to be aware of issues, correct, and improve. Great class rapport and interactions. Very supportive, without compromising expectations.

She gives awesome feedback on assignments and is willing to help anyone during her office hours. Which I highly recommend! Her classes arent easy but she is very supportive. Not to mention shes just a fun teacher!

Chan is very unclear on assignments. Constantly says that she is here to help, but will never respond to your emails. Her tests are all essay questions. She will make comments throughout the semester like, "are you scared yet? You should be"..  extremely hard grader & doesn't have your best interest at heart. Get ready to work harder than ever.

Love love love her! I wish she taught psychology courses so I could have more classes with her. (psych major) I took rel217 to satisfy a gen ed course. She makes class fun and interesting. She gives pop quizzes so make sure you read the book and assignments! Overall she was awesome! Everyone should take a class with her.
Amazing class. She is a wonderful teacher and you can tell how passionate she is about teaching. Not a demanding class, but you do have a lot going on from time to time. Worth taking!!
Rev. Chaney is a wonderful lady that is excellent at what she does. As long as you are an honest and polite person, you will do fine.

Class was easy...all you have to do is attend and do the readings...took her for Rel 217 as well and it was just as easy. Great G.P.A. booster , but she does give pop quizzes and hates when students come late.

rev. glo is amazing if you don't take her classes you are truly missing out i was always excited to go to class she related to everyone and gave you more then enough time on assignments was fair and had her own unique style that you don't get very often at Cleveland state

The class was not at all what I expected. I took the class as a requirement but I ended up loving it! I have never in my life had a teacher like that. Yes her class was easy, but I attained a lot of information as well because she knows how to keep the students engaged. She is as nice and genuine as they come.

Rev. Chaney's class was so cool. It's basically the class you go to have fun. Very rare at CSU. Just attend class, show her that you have atleast half a brain, and you should be fine. Will miss her class for sure.
Rev Chaney is very helpful and nice. there was always ALOT of food during a test. plus she gives you some of the answers to the test. this class was not hard at all

Great teacher.  Very engaging. a little out there at times with her viewpoints, however, overall, I am glad I took this class and would definitely take her class again.  She made the class fun and I always looked forward to attending.
Amazing teacher!
It is super fun. She is really a great teacher. She is easy to talk to, and is very funny. There is work required, but it is not hard. You will find yourself looking forword to her class.

Friendly Professor. Two to three tests, plus two papers, and a few easy quizzes. Tardiness is not allowed, and attendance is taken. Tests are a bit confusing. Class is interesting, but one must read the books to be able to get at least a "B" on the tests.
Great Enthusiasm, Good teacher.

Great class.  Reverend Chaney is a sweet teacher.  Food at tests.  Multiple choice tests and on paper to write.  Paper is easy if you do what is required.  Was more than clear on what she expects from the paper and gives plenty of time to complete it.

determined, but very opinionated & scary.yells ALOT, and if your late, your not allowed in. I have not been late, but i figure if im paying the $ i should be able to come in whenever. I like her but 1 instance she was talking and disrespecting someone who left the classroom...I really don't think it was necessary. not sure what to think of her yet.

professor chaney did have a good heart for students she favored u can work ur ass off and shed give u a grade u dont deserve people who she favored who didnt work their ass's off got As for****. Shes a ****. The test were hard because she would put such random questions that u never knew and u need to read both books front to back. **** her
I THINK SHE IS A ****.  NOT UNDERSTANDING OF DIFFERENT VIEWPOINTS, CLASS WAS NO HELP AT ALL IT IS ALL ABOUT THE BOOK WHICH IS DRY AND UNINTERESTING

Professor Chaney was very very fun! Always had food for every test, kept class fun and interesting. Very caring about her students (sons and daughters). Attendance was mandatory and tests were kind of difficult if you didnt read the book. Highly recommended!
If the Easiness refers to the Professor, it is hard but I am not going to be harsh on him. I don't think he is a easy person to get along with. He often made mistakes on calculation.
I didn't learn anything from him. His teaching wasn't clear. The main problem: he made mistakes always. I did the exams well, but he said words to hurt my feeling. His personality is bad.

I am an A student, & I didn't offend him, but he insulted & underestimated me. He told me I would've a poor grade before he looked at my solution, but after graded, the grade was perfectly fine. He couldn't give help since he always made mistakes in class. He laughed at me when I got minor mistake. Chinese is good, but he's a shame to Chinese.
Very easy class. Helpful, but not authoritative enough.

Although his english isn't the best, he is still easy to understand. He teaches math, not english, and he speaks the language of math perfectly. If you don't understand him, raise your hand. This class might be an easy grade, but if you listen to him and go to class, you can and will learn alot. Don't skip class, his notes are priceless for tests.

Nice teacher, you can hardly understand a word he says. Expect to teach yourself out of the book or on internet sites, because you can't understand him and he can't understand anything you ask. On the bright side he pretty much lets you use notes on the tests because he doesn't notice.
He is somewhat hard to understand, but his class is really easy. Lets you use notes and the book on the test. I hardly went to class.
Hard to understand, makes a lot of mistakes. He always seems as if he's talking to himself instead of teaching.
IMPOSSIBLE to understand.  However... lets you use notes/books/whatever you want to use on the tests.  I never went to class, missed one test and still ended with a B+.
This was one of the easiest classes I've ever had.  He let us use our books, calculators, notes and even laptops on the tests.
73 year old Math teacher from China. A little hard to understand, but really goes overboard to help students. Short tests, open note, open book. Recommend.
Great professor for higher math. Keeps it simple and teaches concept. Accent is a bonus and keeps the listener interested compared to most math profs droning on.
Horrible English. Could not understand a word he said. Kept transposing numbers when working on board.  I stopped attending after 2 classes and learned it on my own from the book.

can't understand a word he says and he barely speaks english. he's a goofy, nice man - but if you are not good at math to begin with, do not take him!!! a lot of his material is taught on the calculator, so you don't actually learn how to do it on paper. everyone pretty much gives up after a month!
this guy cant speak english. its hard to ask him a question so he usually has you write it on the board yourself.
so fun to go to his class everyday- he is soooo funny!
hard to understand accent sometimes but he is a great teacher
He seems a little wierd at first, but he is really a great teacher. He is very smart and helpful. His class is actually pretty easy.
He has a Chinese accent but give him a couple classes you will understand him.  He helps his students out a lot.  Tests are open book

His English problem is a problem since when I attend his class his English annoyed me (hardly let me understand his lecture).  But I am fine in doing problems on my own, just think lecture is funny as he is funny on his facial expression and speaking. No offense.

Extremely knowledgeable and explains topics absolutely beautifully, if youre willing to give him your full attention all of class, you will feel like you learned a ton. Exams are not hard but SHORT so if you only get a few wrong, youre already at a B, but his grading system makes up for it! Overall amazing professor, best one Ive had at CSU.

Strict, difficult material, and he uses the chalkboard a lot which isn't an issue if you have a seat upfront. He never uses blackboard, hes very unforgiving (even with a valid excuse) I found his demeanor to be very stern, dry, and stuffy. He grades strictly on three exams. There's no cushion for mistakes. If you are late by even one min.  absent.

While the material is not easy professor Chang provides an excellent grading scale, and thoroughly goes through the material. I took it as a summer class and it was a lot in a short period of time but it was quite possibly my favorite class I have ever taken. I am not an Econ major.

very good teacher use the chalkboard a lot  "kinda and old fashion teacher" but i thought that was really good because he explains the materials as he writes them out unlike some professors that just read directly from the slides don't get me wrong the class is hard and you must pay attention and ask questions test are hard but he does curve at end

Very difficult class, but it was worth it. He is a phenomenal lecturer. This class will help you build your microeconomic intuition. He is a tough grader, and provides only a 4-8% curve on your overall grade, though he claims he provides no curve at all at the beginning of the course. The class average for the tests is usually 65% or so.

Very difficult class, but it was worth it. He is a phenomenal lecturer. This class will help you build your microeconomic intuition. He is a tough grader, and provides only a 2-5% curve on your overall grade, though he claims he provides no curve at all at the beginning of the course. The class average for the tests is usually 60% or so.

I was not a economics major,and found his class to be very confusing and tough. He is okay at teaching, but only for those who are economic majors, and have a basic knowledge of the material,his Tests are torture.
He is a very strong teacher. His class is by no means easy. But he is one of the better teachers at CSU. You will learn a lot in his class.

His lectures are very detailed but informative and organized. Has high expectations which is justified since it's a senior elective. Answers questions well, always available for consultation. His exams may be a bit harder than the average but you will learn a LOT. Must take him if you want a career out of economics.

definitely incredibly clear and precise with notes. the class can be a little overwhelming, and don't expect much feedback from the professor at all. studying a must. He definitely has style and a sense of humor. Quality class especially if you're interested in econ. He knows his stuff.
the best econ prof at csu.

One of the best professors I've had. Very articulate and easy to understand. He gives points for attendence and puctuality (so go to class and be early!!)Tests are fair and he has a generous grading scale. Definitely recommend:)
Excellent at explaining the material. Take good notes during lectures. Definitely recommended over any of the other econ professors.
explains topics clearly.  go to class and you'll do fine on the tests
Only the best professor I've ever had!!! He explains everything clearly and he has a good sense of humor as well.

Dr. Chang is hands down one of the best professors I have ever had. She knows the material inside and out and she really took the time to make sure everyone in the class understood the concepts clearly. I enjoyed this class very much. If I see an additional class that she offers I will absolutely sign up!

It's interesting to learn about all the legal aspects to the music industry, royalty payments across various platforms of music consumption, how various organizations are structured and why, how lawyers can serve the industry. Given her personal knowledge of the industry, the subject matter is covered in a comprehensive and practical manner.
I absolutely would recommend Professor Chang to other students. She's awesome.

I know my true potential is developing under Dr. chang. She encourages me to build on my individuality and strengths while working out my weaknesses. I've had teachers push musicality but I felt technically lacking to achieve it. Dr. Chang has given me the tools to figure things out and the confidence to express it.
THE reason to be at CSU
Not just a great teacher, but a great human being.
She's the best teacher i've ever had. I learn so much, including applying theory that i didn't understand from other classes.

Dr. Chang is the reason I chose CSU and it couldn't have been a better choice. She is caring and knows how to get results. You learn a lot about achieving ease in technique, great musicianship and life!
great prof. learned a lot.
Awesome.
Amazing.
Awesome. Dr. Chang rocks!
good
Dr. Chang is the most dedicated professor ever and cares about student progress.  She is flexible and understanding. She makes sure to get her point across and spends as much time as it takes.

Very ineffective teacher. Doesn't show up for lessons, doesn't make lessons up. Acts like it's the students fault when progress is not being made. Grades on her personal opinion of the student and not the quality of the work being done. You'll be fine if she likes you, but watch out if she doesn't.
She's an amazing pianist and teaches you how to become one. Her recitals are always packed and inspiring. She makes difficult passages easy. I can't believe how lucky I am to study with her.

Awesome! I've learned more in 2 months from Dr. Chang than I have in many years from other teachers. She is extremely patient and demanding at the same time. Because of Dr. Chang, I have even more appreciation of music and what goes into it. I  now have technical skills that I never dreamed possible. Plus, I hear a lot more musical connections.

A phenomenal teacher. I have improved more than I ever thought possible. She challenges your thinking and makes you think outside the box. At first I thought her approach seemed counter-intuitive until I saw the results. She is super efficient and effective. Although she's nice, sometimes it's intimidating because of her high  standards.

Very nice teacher, Seems to sometimes have a hard time expressing what she means. Doesn't recognize that students have different learning styles. Good if you can learn how she likes to teach, not so good if you have a different leaning style

I don't know if I am taking a different Alan Chapman than the other students who rated this guy, but I think he is terrible. Lectures are meaningless and uninteresting, he is unhelpful when asked questions, and he grades assignments tough and gives no feedback. Preparing for the exam, he was no help whatsoever. I would avoid this guy at all cost.
Take his class, you learn and will get very good grade. He is understandable professor.
TAKE HIS CLASS, PRETTY EASY. NO STRESS. YOU WILL GET A GOOD GRADE.
Good and easy.
Good and easy.
Good, easy!?

She absolutely sucks. Her grading systems makes no sense, every assignment no matter the length is worth only one point, so if you dont do it perfectly (no matter how much effort is put in) she gives you a zero. Not to mention she is rather unwilling to elaborate and explain exactly what she wants for assignments.

Dr. Charles is one of the best professors I have had so far at CSU. You can tell she is very passionate about what she teaches and is always willing to help you if you need it. As long as you put in effort and do the reading, you will be fine. She is an excellent professor -- she just makes you work for the grade you want!

This class was way harder than it needed to be. The way she grades makes little to no sense and when you ask her to clarify she will only confuse you more. Even asking for help in advance will get you nowhere. Good luck, you'll need it.

Dr. Charles makes her political views abundantly apparent.  Disagreeing with these views during class discussions or in written assignments will get you on her bad side.  If you find yourself at odds with Dr. Charles' views, just keep your head down and conform.

As an upper level class I already knew ahead of time that it would be rather difficult, and having had previous experience in taking other upper level classes too. However, I was not expecting how insane her grading techniques are and she does not seem to explain the kind of substance she is looking for very well, but will grade harshly anyway.
Very professional and not unreasonable.  If you do the work on time and put effort into your papers you will get a good grade.  Tests are straight off her study guides.

She likes handing out questions for you to do in groups a lot, and will only grade them, not too much feedback, but some. Shes cool, but she does NOT play with deadlines. turn in everything on time. Study the study guides and you WILL pass. buy the books cause they're used all the time and the most valuable info comes from being in class.
Dr. Charles is an amazing professor. PHL211 was by far my favorite class of the semester.

A decent professor. You read the material in the book, and she would go through it in class as well. Very clear cut. A few papers, but nothing too big. She does make you break off in groups to do "group projects" for participation points. Very specific on how she wants things worded, but if you ask her to look it over, she will, and it helps a lot.

This is my third time taking Dr. Charles' class and I really enjoyed it. She is very clear about expectations and gives you several opportunities to do well. There is a lot of reading and a lot of assignments, but this gives you plenty of opportunities to build and means if you do poorly on one assignment, you can still get a good grade. No text.
Prepare to read! After many emails, she won't clarify what she is looking for. Would NOT take again.
Despite constant emails for clarity as to context of what was to be desired with regard to topic content more vague after supposed clarification resulting in more confusion and clarity.

2 3-page papers, 1 8-page paper, 7 multiple choice reading quizzes, 1 blog entry, discussion board participation. Easy class if you can understand philosophical articles and know how to write papers. You have to read several articles. She is fair and gives feedback. I actually learned interesting things about ethics of human reproduction.

Be prepared to read and discuss! She is a very nice and intelligent teacher. No final, only a midterm and three short papers. Make sure you pick a group with smart people. And make sure you write down everything she writes on the board even if it seems unimportant because it will help with the papers. Easy class.
Very interesting class. We had a mid-term, but no final; only a final paper. She is very clear about instructions and enjoys what she does. Lots of great debates in this class.
Excellant teacher.  I took Ehtics of Human Reproduction with her as an online class.  She looked over everything I brought to her and graded very fairly.  Class was very interesting.

Ethics of Human Reproduction - Online Course. Loved Dr. Charles. Her online course is very organized so you can work ahead - 2 small papers and 1 final paper. Required journal articles and discussion questions are intriguing and really interesting. She is respectful towards all students. Loved this course! Recommended for ALL Women's Studies Majors

Loved this course and love Dr. Charles! Ethics of Human Reproduction is an amazing class if this topic interests you. If you are a Women's Studies Major, I highly recommend it.  The journal readings are challenging but really interesting, and the discussion questions open your mind.  2 short papers and 1 long paper. She's organized and helpful!

Online class-- journal entries, discussion posts, written assignments and a power point project. Overall not too bad, but it is time consuming. Papers can be tricky and the topics are a little difficut.
Clear and to the point. 3 papers with outlines with exactly what she wanted, 3 short answer test with study guides. Very helpful and very interesting videos, and fun discussions
He has a lot of creditability and experience in the field, I enjoyed his lectures and debates but feel that he is clearly a Communist.
Very cool

Very boring, and has an extreme liberal bias.  Teaches a lot of theory, doesn't seem to cover much reality.  One good thing is that while he's very liberal, he doesnt care what students think as long as they are willing to back up their arguments.

I took the class Power and Authority in Non-Western Cultures which was taught by him and Dr. Ramos. Dr. Ramos' part of the class was much more interesting than Dr. Charlick's, but he was still interesting. He sounds like Ben Stein in Ferris Bueller's day off, and he put me to sleep a couple of times.

Very knowledgeable and I really enjoyed listening to him lecture. To me he came across lazy though. I didn't find him too unorganized and he tried to encourage class participation. CSU students, however, being what they are, had trouble articulating thoughts between grunts. My favorite professor at Cleveland State (now that's sad).

Dr. Charlick is probably one of the best profs I?ve had at CSU. He?s not terrible tough but does demand reading. He?s got a global humanist perspective that is hard to find in CSU. Enjoy it for what it is, the exams are fair, and his door is always open.
No Comments
No Comments

I couldn't agree more with the previous rating.  He rarely allows any student imput.  He is very intelligent with the subject matter, but does not know how to teach it. It is nearly impossible to take notes because he jumps around so much. He also spends alot of time off subject.

He is very knowledgable on the topic but he cannot teach effectively.  His lectures are very unorganized in a bad way.  He doesn't really allow much class participation (normally continuing lecture without asking for comments/questions)  He comes off as rude by the way he talks down to students.
As long as you show up to class and do the in-class activities, there's no reason not to get an A.  Activities are step by step instructions in the book, and most tests are at-home online.

Worst professor I've ever had for anything. He was consistently late to class, never had a clear plan for lecture, and was wrong with most of the material he was teaching us according to the textbooks. I really liked the lab for this course, so it was unfortunate that the lectures were so pointless. A complete waste of my time. Avoid.

He is always all over the place. LOTS of errors during his lectures. Does not stick to his syllabus. Go to class or else you might miss a quiz. All homework typically comes from the textbook, but it's online and sometimes he'll post the questions. Homework is graded easily, but quizzes and tests are rough. You'll pass with a B, everyone did.

Glad I passed and will never have a class with this man again. The only purpose of attending lecture is to be there for assignments and quizzes, because you won't learn anything in that class. Not a day passed where he didn't make flagrant mathematical errors that were scribbled over in unreadable chalk smudges. NEVER take him if it's optional.

This professor is an absolute JOKE! Unclear, boring, and confusing lectures. Professor has NO clear notes or PowerPoints to reference material off of. Handwriting is chicken scratch and also makes constant math mistakes on the board. Some of the worst lectures I have attended, I retained no information. You will pass, but learn nothing!!!

George is genuinely a very nice guy. He is willing to work with you. Unfortunately, the switch to online schooling was a rough transition for him as his teaching style is tough for students in the online setting. He is also a very tough exam grader. If you work very hard, you'll pass. But you need to work extremely hard.

She's an awesome woman, funny sense of humor. Make sure you're serious about arabic because the subject matter involves way too much practice and critical thinking to blow off. She's a great teacher, always willing to help, and will challenge you in class and with the homework.

Isn't helpful at all. Strays from syllabus. Too sarcastic. Rude and disrespectful to students. Won't allow you to ask questions. Hypocritical. He told my class that he was "morally superior to all" of us. Made the  lessons much more difficult than they needed to be. Will never take a class from him again. Makes you do google forms for attendance.

I couldn't pay attention in her class, I just read the textbook. If you do all the homework assignments and quizzes, you will have a good idea about the concept and will do good on the exam. She allows students to used a cheat sheet on the exam.

Caring, but wasn't the greatest at explaining things. Her accent is heavy so that may hinder your understanding a bit. Her tests are TRICK QUESTIONS. I recommend tutoring after the first exam, whether you pass the test or not. The homework & quizzes are easy but the tests are hard. You need to be able to know all equations frontwards and backwards.

This class is tough! She works with you though throughout the semester to help you succeed. 3 tests, optional final, 12 quizzes(2 drop) and 10 homeworks. Just stay on top of the work and ask for assistance as needed. Never got above a 75% on the tests but worked hard on quizzes and homework to get me to a B+! Do not get discouraged by tests here!

Prof. Cai Chen is perhaps the best finance professor you'll ever have. She is very knowledgeable and teaches the material very well. She isn't very particular about attendance, but if I were you, I would go to class. Classes like finance and accounting require attendance. She is constantly reviewing the material to ensure that you understand.
Dr. Chen made the material super clear and applicable to what you will use every day in your career. Great teacher - I definitely recommend and would take again!
Dr. Chen made the material super clear and applicable to what you will use every day in your career. Great teacher - I definitely recommend and would take again!

Took this as a 6 week summer course. Very straight forward. Usually a quiz and a DB every week, with 2 case studies in between: 2 page papers. No exams. Quizzes go straight off the PP and WSJ articles. Quick grader and gives great feedback. As an OSM major I think he is as good as they come in the department. Easy A if you do the work on time

He tries really hard to be understood due to a language barrier.  He was all over the place and not very clear on some of the material. Many love his class because he is so laid back, but I felt it was too hard to study for his exams which is the majority of your grade.  He does have a big curve and very little homework.  Didn't learn much though.
Class wasn't bad.  Quizzes (2) and Tests (2) were open note and book.  Four online homework assignments on Connect.  Would take him again.
Very helpful professor, down to earth and honest about what is going to be useful in the real world and what won't.  I would definitely take another class with him.

Good instructor. Attendance is not a mandatory, but you won't make with only reading a book. Be in class, listen and you will get an A. Exams are not comprehensive, two quizzes, and four homework assignment. Exams and quizzes are open books. Recommended if you need to make with good grade.

Very helpful, clear instructions. Final exam in the middle of semester and the rest time you'll be spending with group projects, case analysis and presenttaion. I recommend his class. And try to pick good and reliable group  members

I can say from Chen's video lectures and our email correspondence that he is a solid choice. His lectures are very comprehensive and he makes the concepts relatively easy to grasp. He also is great with getting back to you over email, as I often would only have to wait an hour or two for a response from him that usually would be quite helpful.

I can say from Chen's video lectures and our email correspondence that he is a solid choice. His lectures are very comprehensive and he makes the concepts relatively easy to grasp. He also is great with getting back to you over email, as I often would only have to wait an hour or two for a response from him that usually would be quite helpful.

This class was supposed to be in person, but went remote. His video lectures are hard to follow and there is a language barrier. His exams are tough and have to be done over webcam with a weird picture method for submitting analytic problems. The exams are worth 75% of the grade. The best thing about him is he usually gives a favorable curve.

His remote course was a train wreck. He posted prerecorded lectures going over the powerpoint, which were extremely hard to understand with his heavy accent. You have 3 exams & 2 quizzes which are hard but not the worst. I wish he had more opportunities for extra credit points. I was struggling and he was not there to offer me with any assistance.
Insanely hard professor would not take again.

DO NOT take this professor if the course is offered online. He will barely provide the class with any content and guide us to study things not listed on the quiz/exams. It is incredibly hard to get a good grade as the test taking method and the questions are very odd. Other students constantly ask for curves as well. He will not give any.

Professor Chen is very knowledgeable on the subject he teaches but makes the online courses absolutely miserable with his insistent use of the lock down browser and weird photo methods for answers. Turning in test answers is a battle in itself and the setup is always very finicky. Grading is even weirder but he does a good job of providing lecture.

One of the best professors I have ever had. Knowledgeable, respectful, helpful, caring. You can tell he loves teaching, he gives amazing lectures and really creates a learning environment. When talking to friends and family I refer to him as pumpkin :) Prof. Chen is just great.

Very knowledgeable in the subject but this class is very difficult. Homework is not mandatory but you definitely should at least review it in order to understand the concepts covered in class. Very generous with partial credit but don't rely on that to pass the class.

Dr. Chen is a genuinely nice person and an extremely accredited professor; he really knows his stuff. I'm not entirely sure why he has such utterly stellar reviews, though. The material is incredibly bland and he spits it out lighting fast. It is a struggle to pay attention and note-take effectively. You must earn your grade in this class.
His exams are difficult but he never fails students (his exact words)

He was not a terrible professor, but I disliked the structure of his exams very much. I took away something from the class which is the most important part of the class, but also was hoping to perform better than I did. Oh well not an OSM major so I am done!

It is easy to find fact-based carrying great knowledge professors but Dr. Chen adds a twist by incorporating current issues of "real world" scenarios. I not only learnt about technical knowledge but also gained great understanding of why companies make certain decisions. His class is a bit tough but you will feel great afterward. Highly recommend i

10% of your grade is attendance. You are only graded on test (75%) and quizes (15%). HW is not graded. Geat lecturer knows his stuff, but this class for me was not as easy as Bus-201/Osm-202. He also offers extra credit on two of the three tests he gave.
Very caring and kind professor. He wants you to succeed. Excellent at explaining concepts.

He's a very nice guy and really tries to help students to do well. He always tries to answer questions as clearly as possible. You have to do the homework to do well in his class. Attendance isn't mandatory but he gives notes in class that you won't get from the power points alone. He curves.

Amazing professor with significant knowledge in Supply Chain. Willing to help students whenever needed and cares greatly for students success. I recommend Dr. Chen if you truly want to learn the material or if you are a Supply Chain major. Good luck.

I loved Dr. Chen's class.  I don't think I'll use the concepts much, but I;m definitely more knowlegeable for having taken the class.  Because of the RNC, we had a take at home test, and we also got a take home quiz.  I got a B in the class, and I'm smarter for knowing the information passed.  Dr. Chen is a wonderful Professor.

Amazing professor for OSM classes. Genuinely cares about students. Took a summer class and was fun. Experienced teacher, great knowledge. Go to his class, do his homework, quizzes and its an easy grade.

Amazing professor for OSM 311. Although I am not an OSM major, I enjoyed this class. Professor Chen is thorough about his knowledge. Makes the material easy to learn. His multiple choice questions in the test are a bit tricky. Fair grader.
One the best professors I have had at CSU. He teaches with a first hand experience and that makes the class a real pleasure.

Very difficult to understand but she has power point for you to follow. She goes over material very fast but if you ask after class she is more than willing to help. Read the book and you will do fine. It was an easy A for me.

You would think that after 30 people walked out of the lecture hall, the professor would catch on. Completely useless. Doesn't speak clear English. Just repeats the same thing, reads off notes, no explanation of anything. I wouldn't recommend.

22 people walked out of lecture within the first half hour! you think she would catch on. Good luck understanding her she is right off the boat! and  her english is terrible! i reccomend droping this class even before you start!

Professor Cheng structured the IST (Excel,Word,Powerpoint) class very well but, it can sometimes be difficult to achieve a good grade or understand the work. In order to do well in this class I recommend the following: 1) Always start the MYLABIT projects early 2) Set up meetings with him as often as possible

He will curve the tests thankfully if enough people are struggling, but man I really dont feel like I learned anything, he knows what he is doing but struggles teaching it. A real problem for a programming class.

The worst instructor ever!! He didn't grade anything all semester, so I went into finals not knowing my grade! Syllabus/assignment instructions are incredibly vague! Videos are useless because he is super difficult to understand! Beware of the final research paper, as it's worth half of the grade and will cause you to fail the class! DON'T TAKE!

Professor Cheng structured the IST (Excel,Word,Powerpoint) class very well but, it can sometimes be difficult to achieve a good grade or understand the work. In order to do well in this class I recommend the following: 1) Always start the MYLABIT projects early 2) Set up meetings with him as often as possible

He knows his stuff, but he is horrible at actually teaching it. You will be spending most of your time trying to teach yourself a lot of the material. He is the only prof at CSU that teaches this mandatory class, so good luck.

He literally just codes in front of the class and doesn't bother to explain a single thing he's coding. Then he proceeds to ask the class what he should do next and is shocked when its silent. Very difficult to understand him on top of the fact he doesn't teach. heavy accent and an overall bad professor. Stay Away!!!!

He is by far the worst professor I have had in my academic career. He does not teach anything, instead he reads directly from PowerPoint. He gives a ton of work, 53 homework assignments in total. Will give projects every 2 weeks w/o any clear directions. Im still baffled how he still has a job as a professor, shame on CSU. Dont take his classes!

He's one of the worst professors I've had. The class I took was completely online, and his expectations weren't made clear in the syllabus. There is a ton of homework and online assignments due each week, and he never responded clearly to questions I asked him. He didn't clearly tell us what his expectations were for the end of the semester project

Online class. Unless you need help you don't even need to talk to the guy, but good at email responses. TONS of hw, weekly modules of tedious & infuriating assignments. Beware of the research paper! IEEE format, word doc plus excel charts & pwpt presentation. Get it done early as you can, it's a lot! Not hard to pass but definitely brain melting.
Do NOT ever take his class, CRAZY PROFESSOR!
no cap this boy didnt say a single word in class he just sat on his ass and didnt help students made us learn evehtbjnt on our own class is very time consuming

The class is very hard, he informed us of that upfront. However his English speaking, writing and comprehension makes this class more difficult than it needs to be. Coursework, homework, "in class" assignments, quizzes, tests and readings are not communicated properly. Halfway through semester we find out that there's additional assignments online.

Information Systems is a great major to pick, but not at CSU. Wei Cheng is incredibly knowledgeable on c# and other code but his accent makes it impossible to understand 95% of what he says. Also he just does the coding assignments on the board and everyone copies it word for word. There is no actual learning its actually a big scam.

Professor does not give clear instructions. Will dock programs for things he says are fine in class. Does not have a clear curriculum. You spend most of the class teaching yourself. Would not take again.

Professor teaches the class by coding in the front of the room with barely any explanation and then gives an incredibly hard program to make about every two weeks. Says you can modify code but is not clear, will give you a zero and say you copied even though that wasn't that case and the identifiers are similar program to program. Needs set rules.
If you are interested in exploring racial identity politics, and not property law, this is the professor for you!

Professor Cherry is teaching you to think about the bigger picture of property rights and the law.  If your goal is to only take multistate multiple choice exams, then you are in law school for the wrong reasons.  Property rights and ownership don't happen in a vacuum.  The real world intervenes. Best first year class I had at Cleveland-Marshall.

Shocking that she has tenure.  She admitted to our class that she does not understand the rule against perpetuities, yet she teaches estates & trusts, as well as 1st year property. Could someone explain that?  Constantly messed up examples when trying to do them on the blackboard.  Shouldn't have to be corrected by students if you're tenured!!!

Her lectures were clear but sometimes she would mumble.  She cancelled class a lot but we always made it up by staying late.  We had to read a lot of material on race and discrimination which she didn't do a good job of tying it into property law.  Her class is very relaxed and she's open to discussing things off topic which made the class better.
she makes difficult topics easy to understand and she makes any topic more enjoyable
She is the best.  Best stories that help you remember the law.

Pros:  personable, funny, and quite clear on what she teaches.  Cons: cancels way too many classes without notice, spends too much time on race issues and too little on bar topics.  I would not take another course from this professor.

When she actually makes it to class she isn't that bad. The problem is she rarely makes it. She cancelled 8 classes in one semester with little or no notice. Very frustrating when it's the first class of the day. Also, she spend so much time talking about race I thought we were in  human diversity 101 instead of property.

By far the least helpful professor at CM.  Class deviates from the subjects,  is always weeks behind schedule, the professor cancels weeks worth of classes without notice, and the students are not prepared at all for the bar.  The class manages to completely deviate from the subject of property and focuses on racism and discrimination.  Avoid.

Easily one of the top ten best teachers at the law school. Its neither boring nor tedious. She injects her personality into the class. Even if its a subject your not interested in you feel like you want to participate.

Prof Cherry is one of the best professors at C-M.  I really appreciated that, notwithstanding the fact that C-M may not be on a par with Yale (where she studied), she refuses to devalue her students' intellects by teaching her class as if it were a bar review course. The analytical skills I learned will be invaluable when I prepare for the bar.
No Comments
She's a great teacher that can bring a diff prospective to the class. she isnt stuffy and despite her ive legue credentials she is very down to earth. I thought she was my best first year teacher.
Cherry was one of my favorite teachers at marshall.  She made everything interesting.  Her tangents give you a break from the sometimes boring material.
The most useless prof I've ever had. What is worse is that she teaches bar subjects, and does nothing to prepare you for the bar. The only prof I had at CM that I found to be subpar.
Prof Chesko is awesome!  She has been my voice teacher for quite sometime.  I have grown musically and emotionally every semester under her guidance.  She's a good egg so buzz off negative people.
Chesko is a little boring. I didn't feel like I improved that much in her singing class besides getting the opportunity to sing in front of others. Easy A.

Professor Chi has a great class. Challenging but not in places where it is not important to be challenged. Writes code in his lectures in front of you clearly explaining what he is doing. Answers questions with really good answers. Great response time to emails. You will walk away from this class a better programmer.

Professor Chi has a great class. Challenging but not in places where it is not important to be challenged. Writes code in his lectures in front of you clearly explaining what he is doing. Answers questions with really good answers. Great response time to emails. You will walk away from this class a better programmer.

Zicheng Chi is a great professor, he cares about students. If you can take him, take him. My only problem is that the class is lecture heavy, an example is that he will code and explain stuff in class but if you miss class, you won't get the information, the slides are next to useless, so make sure you show up if not, you have to learn on your own.

The professor really cares about the students, if you read the slides you will be able to get a good grade in the tests. there is no calculations in the tests or quizzes which is a good thing. You only do calculations in the homework so you are not missing anything in the course. Really great professor and person in general.

Look, in all honesty, she knows her stuff, but you simply cannot understand what she is saying behind her Asian accent!  It is very fortunate that she emails her students announcements and keeps announcements/notes on her website because honestly, I did not go to her class except for test days--oh, and I didn't even buy the book.  I got an A though
if you like the words actually,obviously, and essentially then this is the class for you. Other then that i didn't get much out of it.

The material wasn't difficult, but the instruction was very boring.  All she does is read power point slides, verbatim, and then repeat & rephrase each one.  She assigns very few practice problems, and her test problems are designed to trip you up.  On the plus side, her creative grading usually works in everyone's favor.
Econ is usually a tough subject but she made it as easy as possible. Probably the best choice offered

Doc C is the best math instructor I've ever had. I usually do well in school but math isn't my strong suit. But Doc C worked with me and was always there to answer any of my questions. She also pushed me to get two math classes, Math 87 and Math 116 finished none semester. It was a daunting task but she encouraged me and I passed with an A in both.

I personally thought she was biased against people of Indian descent. I asked a question and she acted as though I should know the answer. Seems more concerned with how students perceive her than how well she actually teaches. I strongly suggest you steer clear of this trainwreck of a "professor." 0/10 would not take again.

Doc C is the best math instructor I've ever had. I usually do well in school but math isn't my strong suit. But Doc C worked with me and was always there to answer any of my questions. She also pushed me to get two math classes, Math 87 and Math 116 finished none semester. It was a daunting task but she encouraged me and I passed with an A in both.
Excellent caring instructor who gives so much of herself to students.

I had Doc C for two of my math classes so far and the best word to describe her is phenomenal. She is a great teacher and she is always there to help you get through if you put in the work. I would 110% recommend taking your math classes with her.

Professor C was a great instructor who was caring and found time to help her students. She always returned emails and calls and would do what she could to help a student understand the material and succeed. Its not the easiest to take a math course online but she sure made it as clear cut and understandable as she could. Glad I had Prof C

Doc C was just so delightful and funny. She makes even people who hated math want to come to her class. The work got more difficult as the class progressed, but she was always there to guide you. She was the ultimate support when it came to wanting all of her students to succeed. Wish I had her as a permanent professor for all my classes!

Doc. C was ONE OF THE Best professors i have ever had! I never had any teacher or professor who was so caring and understanding! Doc C was always available no matter what time in the day or what she was doing! She reaches out a-lot to students as well!! Even thought it was online course I felt like I knew her. Im so thankful for Doc C!

doc.c is one of the best professors i met in my life. She is always there for her students even at night. i can remember messaging her at night if i have any problem with my exams. Gives extra points by considering your effort on a question. She is very considered of student personal problems and re-open exams and quizzes if you missed.

Definitely overloaded my schedule this semester and was completely overwhelmed with classes/work. Doc C worked with me to make sure I got the best possible grade I could. Would not have passed without her constant help. Does a lot for her students and cares about their success.

Best professor I have ever had. She cares so much for the students and always makes sure everybody's questions are answered. She gives great side stories, examples, and explanations. By the end of the semester she felt like another mom to me. If you're sick, she's totally understanding and excuses you. Just don't take advantage of that.
Best teacher ever! Super nice and explains the material very well. She's also always willing to help if you are confused!
Doc C had always been more than willing to help me with anything I need. She genuinely cares about her students and makes sure you have a plan for the future.
She is a skilled teacher and knows math well

Doc C is an excellent professor. She is very helpful with her feedback and patient. She was very flexible in her schedule to meet with me to discuss my project. She made things easy to understand that were otherwise confusing.
She did an excellent job explaining how the course is set up to me. Her guidance helped me pass the class. Shes one of the most caring professors at CSU.
She is an excellent professor. One of the best. She always gives helpful feedback. God bless her.

Doc C. did an exemplary job. She kept me motivated in the class to complete all of my assigned MOD's. She took the time and sat down to explain any math questions that I had. She showed me an easier way(s) of how to get the equation solved. She is truly compassionate, caring and understanding. She only wants what is best for the students.
One of the best math professors I have ever met! She was able to help someone like me who got Ds and Fs at Lakeland to be able to understand math so clearly that I finished the semester with an A!

She was an amazing professor. It was my first semester back in school after a two year break and I am not the greatest at math but she is AWESOME. She made taking an online math class a breeze. She gives study notes for each chapter and made it so easy to understand. She always answered any questions I had and really wants her students to succeed.
Without a doubt, the best teacher of all time.

Perhaps the best professor I have ever had. He is always professional, and incredibly prepared for class. Takes his job seriously, but definitely not without a sense of humor. Reads loads of news sources every day. Makes weekly commute from PA! Holds students to same high standards. If you work hard, it's an incredibly rewarding class.
Extremely knowledgable, holds a high standard for his students but an excellent teacher. You'll come away with a lot from his class.

I was in Cho's first class at CSU. He's obviously very enthusiastic about his topic and very knowledgeabel in his field. He was also the hardest grader I had in undergrad, which definitely prepped me for law school. If you have a passion for political science, definitely take his class. But be prepared to WORK. Not for those who want an easy A.

I was in one of prof Cho's first classes with him as a CSU professor. He was extremely knowledgeable about Internat'l politics, but he tended to be a little hard on people that did not know much about the subject. I liked the fact that he plit our class into lecture and mini presentations from students on current events.

Difficult. He always tries to show like he knows what he is talking about, but really I think he didn't.  And sometimes he would ask for openions on certain issues, once people tell him thier opinions he would say its wrong. How can an opinion be wrong???
Very intelligent. A bit difficult to understand but he's willing to sit down and explain difficult concepts. ATTEND CLASS. His tests force you to think for yourself.

One of the best professors in the Political Science department. Get ready to learn about INT politics, because he's going to get you very much involved. Learn English? How can you post that.. the whole class is about understanding the global community and finding what we have in common. Stop being ethnocentric, probably why you got a bad grade

TERRIBLE proffessor. Couldn't agree more with previous comment. He's nice, but I could not follow his "teaching"... very unclear, difficult to understand, probably the most annoying professors and classes I've ever taken.  Plus, He Capitalizes Every First Letter Of Every First Word On His Power Points Just Like This... LEARN ENGLISH GRAMMAR, CHO!

Cho is extremely difficult to understand, & even once you can understand what he's saying, he is not explaining the material clearly. The readings, tests, & amount of material are those of a 300/400 level class. It's ridiculous that this is a 200 level class & I regret enrolling. AVOID HIM. He should be spoken to about the difficulty of his class.

Intro to International Politics. Emphasis on INTRO. He teaches this course like a 400+ level course. Not to mention his accent is so heavy that you HAVE to sit in the front of the class to understand him, but catching up with him as he jumps from topic to topic to topic is a whole 'nother story. Not reccomended for lower level courses. :(
No Comments
He is great! The concepts of the class are a little difficult but he does his best at explaining. He has a great personality and sense of humor. I highly recommend him!!
gr8 prof !
Lots of busy work. The weekly discussions are a waste of time. He always figure out a way to take off points even if you answer the question perfectly. I would not recommend.
gr8 prof !

Standard online class. Took the 6 week summer version, so assignments were less spaced out. This led to having a 3-5 page paper due each week. Weekly DBs and quizzes as well, and then a final. Can be a stingy grader on papers and DBs (have to post at specific times). It's a lot of tedious work but if you turn things in on time you'll be fine.
useless very stingy when it comes to grade someone

One of the best professors so far! The class was overall easy, you have to choose your group members to do case studies and a final project that you have to present, there are 6 quizzes and 3 test, quizzes were super easy but his tests are really difficult and hard to understand and the questions are not direct, but u can easily get a B.

Because this is an online class, I don't know him personally, but it was a good class. The assignments were all relevant and the quizzes aren't bad. He posts everything for that week on Monday (including the quiz), an you have until Sunday to complete everything.
Loved this class and this professor. He emails back super fast and is always open to answering questions for students. Course was organized and straight forward.
I loved the assignments and case studies he assigned.  I cannot speak to his personality since it was an online course.
The best professor I have ever had a CSU.  Very passionate about what he talks about in class and is very knowledgeable.  I recommend anyone to take this class in my personal opinion.

The professor knows his stuff overall it was a good class. He mentioned he doesn't give out A's the first day of class and at the end of the semester I could see why. He will find a way to dock points usually from participation or the group project.  He breaks down the book for you nicely and only teaches what you need to know.

I wouldn't recommend taking the online course unless you have very few in-person classes. The grading system requires you to submit material/comments 3-4 days a week. If you post all of your comments on the same day, you will be penalized. If you miss one or two comments, you will lose substantial points as well.

He is the sweetest man ever. Super funny. Really likes to engage in conversation. He has an accent, and he is embarrassed about it, but you can understand him. His tests are hard, but he gives extra points. The day the homework assignments are due he cancels class. They are worth a lot of your grade. It is an overall good class. I enjoyed it.

Learned a great amount in this class because you actually had to read the book and participate. There is discussion board or 3-4 page paper due each week, as well as, a midterm and final exam. The book is essential. Easy class, great professor (wish he taught more classes!) I would definitely recommend.

Very funny, knows his stuff. Attendance is very important! There are quizzes but you have to attend the class prior in order to recieve the material for the quiz. Overall, I had a good experience. Would take him again.

Great course and super-nice guy. The lectures are always interesting and filled with examples. The grading block is broken up with various reading/HW assignments, nothing too difficult. There are many opportunities for extra credit. Prepares you well for tests and quizzes. Wonderful experience. It's time CSU gets more like him.
One of the best teacher's that I have ever had.

Can be extremely hard to understand when attempting English. Good luck knowing what is on the tests. Be sure to check through your answers on tests because she will mark correct answers incorrect, but your answers can be so obviously correct you may hesitate to point that out.  You will get called on to participate.

The worst professor I have ever had at Cleveland State, scattered in grading and awful lecturer. I am an art history major and got a very good grade, but her style of teaching is not in line with what Cleveland State should expect from their professors.

Dr. Chou is amazing.  She is difficult but VERY fair.  She tells you what she expects and wants you to do well.  The other students who say she is difficult or unfair are just lazy and not willing to put in the effort.  She is very passionate and knowledgeable about art history.  If you look her up she has written a book and many research papers!!

I thought Dr. Chou was a great teacher.  She is really passionate about her subject.  I felt like a kid in story time the entire semester and found the subject matter very fascinating.  She was strict but not too strict.  Just enough to keep everyone on their toes, which I personally like in a teacher.

As a senior in college-literally the worst teacher I've had.  No directions for the take-home exams, but a strict grading criteria nonetheless.  Average grade was a 60 in class on each exam (65% of our grade). Grading is subjective, based on how much you "participate," attend class, and 15% of grade is based on mandatory "extra credit" (art museum)

Avoid at all costs! Considering she is the only professor at this university who teaches art 281, I had no choice but to take her. She puts down the students, is not understanding, and does not seem to want to help anyone struggling. You only have three grades in the class, and she grades ridiculously hard. Do. Not. Take.

This professor does not give 1oo%. The info she gives you is not always correct. She does not give you all the info you need for the exams. she is a really hard grader and epects you to have everything and do it here way. I would not recommened this class to anyone.

Terrible terrible! I'm an Art History major and this class was terrible in every way. Not only did we receive the wrong information on pieces, if the correct information was used on the midterm or final it was marked wrong. Also, the participation grade (lecture class) was 25% of the total grade...

I loved Dr. Chou! Before taking her class I was never interested in Art History and now I'm thinking of majoring in it possibly. If you take good notes in class and study the material you will do fine in class. I took this as a high school student and did just fine. As long as you don't expect an easy A in this class you'll be a-okay!

While she expects you to work, showing up for class prepares you well for your midterms and finals. While I would have liked a higher grade, I think this professor has inspired a life long interest in the subject for me.

you have to work for your grade. it is not an easy class. the class is powerpoints and slides.you take notes for over 100 slide but on midterm and final only need to rembember 12 slides. even the study guide have over 45 slides in it, making you guess which ones will be on the test. make this class your top piroity and you will pass..with a B-
She's a very good professor who expects diligence and effort from students. Attendance counts towards the final grade, and she highlights exactly what to study for the exams.

cont. This teacher does not provide the students with what she is presenting in its entirety. On any topic she wants people to copy from the slides in class she starts to talk about other things that are important making it very hard to take good notes in class. She frequently says things in class that make no sense at all in terms of relevance.

Avoid this teach at all costs. She makes art history into a hard class. She does not have as strong an understanding of English as she thinks she does. Her test format is ridiculous as she expects 500 words in about 10 min...
Overall he can be kinda dry, but overall he's a great professor and teaches all his classes well
Overall he can be kinda dry, but overall he's a great professor and teaches all his classes well

Professor Chriss is a very tough grader, which he has a right to be, I understand. If he is going to grade that tough, then he should leave good critiques that will actually help students with the assignments. Just overall does not give helpful feedback, you'll have to work for your grade. I would not recommend him. I had to work hard for that B+.

His Social Control course is easily the best class I have ever taken at Cleveland State. I enjoyed learning and reading the textbook felt like reading for fun. His syllabus made his course laid out exactly clear and as long as you don't fall behind you will pass. The class was based on quizzes, exams, and essays. The info I learned is life changing

He was a very nice teacher and had a good lesson plan for COVID. But the majority of his book for the policing class is just a sociology textbook. You don't learn anything about being a cop, what it takes, how to do it, what it means, nothing. You learn about social dynamics, this should be a SOC class, not a CRIM.

He makes everything clear and easy to understand and provides extra credit for those who need it. While we have been remote I have felt like he has presented the information clearly and like if I do have questions they are either answered in the textbook after the powerpoint or by asking
Great, I was able to finish the class in just a few weeks online (3 weeks exactly), he is very organized and makes the work easy to understand. You can still pass without buying the book.
Professor Chriss is a great instructor. He is extremely knowledgable in what he teaches. His class was challenging and interesting. I enjoyed learning the content and I would take his class again.

Dr. Chriss cannot stay on topic for longer than ten minutes and regularly uses class time as a soap box to discuss his disappointment in what he believes to be the status of millennials and gen z. He frequently discusses clickbait articles he sees and punctuates his disappointment with lots of "come on!" and reminiscing about the good old days.

Professor Chriss is the author of the book required for this course. The text was a great in-depth read. There is A LOT of writing, which is expected for a WAC. He responds quickly to emails and is very welcoming for his office hours.

3 exams. Gives you the material you need to study for the essay questions, which is more than 50% of the grade. Master the essay questions and youll get a good grade. 8 pop quizzes that are difficult, but if you look over your notes before each class you should do well enough. 3 other assignments that he is a very lenient grader on. Easy A for me.

Great class! Love the material that is covered in the PowerPoints. Easy grader lectures a bit heavy but would take again. I was not stress at all in this class. Be aware with the quizzes that it is pop quizzes. If you dont take an effort to study you wont pass.

Im sure hes a nice person outside of work, but taking his class as a student is wretched. His lectures are boring and he will spend the entirety of class (1hr 15mins) on one maybe two slides out of a 8-10 slide PowerPoint. He drifts off and continues to blab about all kinds of things mostly having nothing to do with class material.

I didn't use the book and still got an A. Graded on 2 tests (midterm and final) multiple choice with 2 essays (he gives you the topics in the study guide). 8 pop quizzes each out of 5 points but it's all extra credit. Two papers but super easy. One is based on personal experience, the other is a short reaction paper.
