I didn't use the book and still got an A. Only graded on 6 tests but the last one is an optional final (the lowest score gets dropped). 8 pop quizzes each out of 5 points but it's all extra credit. Tests are three essay questions but only pick 2. He basically gives you the questions in the study guide & they match with the ppt slides to study from

Very interested in his field, which leads him to get off subject & rant extremely often. Very hard to follow because of this and he's vague. His study guides aren't specific which leads you to teach/learn everything on your own (not to mention the required textbook is his own written work). Take this course with caution.

2 papers (second not super relevant), 2 exams, 10 pop quizzes. Exams- doesn't give specifics for studying, just tells you too look over all chapters, asks about very specific & hard to remember things. super boring to sit in class. I could never follow what he was talking about. sometimes it would take him half the class to get through one slide
Cool professor. He can be a little boring and dry but if you pay attention in class there is no way you should fail his class.

Dr. Chriss is definitely a prof I would take again. Whole class is composed of 2 assignments and 2 exams. He does give pop quizzes, but they only account for 10 points total. He gives a study guide that is very clear along with a study guide powerpoint with all the info. He makes it impossible to fail. Definitely need the book

Pretty easy class if you're interested in it.  You can easily skip a day or two but make sure that it's the day after a pop quiz, so you don't miss it.  He's pretty funny and very laid back.  He likes to start debates.  He gets easily sidetracked though. Two essays and two exams, no big deal.

He's good professor but he does like to talk a lot about one topic for a long time. Pop quizzes are hard if you don't remember the material from the class before. It is a WAC course and you do have to write two papers. The papers aren't too hard but if you have a hard time writing papers then they can be difficult. You must read the book to pass.
Don is a good teacher - works hard, well prepared - I liked his class.

Other than the fact that he can't teach he is a really nice person. Take anybody off the street. send him to a classroom and tell him to read straight out of the book every class. Use any time left to go over T/F questions in the teachers guide. Thats what this guy is. The most interesting classes were when guest speakers came in to explain the law

There are a lot of lab projects that are graded easy but there is a final exam worth 20 percent that he has not given any guidelines on what the exam is about that can ruin any persons grade. He is a fine guy but super hard to reach at times and ignores emails sometimes.

Hands down one of my favorite professors. One of the few teachers that really care about his students and really want them to succeed. He's willing to help you unlike some professors I've come across. Do the work, like actually do the work and you'll be fine! 11/10 would recommend
one of the best professors! If you do the labs and actually work on them then the test themselves are easy. Explains concepts well and is a very nice guy! Highly recommend!
Dr. Chu is a very good teacher, and he will take the time to help any student who needs it.  I highly recommend his courses.
The course for me was very hard.  But he  will answer any questions  and he will try to explain it to you as easy as possible. Great professor tough course .

Very nice guy. He will help you if you ask for it. His tests are a bit too hard, and he isn't the best at explaining some of the more strange concepts. The class itself is relatively easy, but he makes it a little harder than it needs to be. Most lectures can be summed up in 20 minutes if explained better. Other than that, he's decent.

He's a character.   Gets off topic a lot but it makes the class fun.   He does diverge from the text quite a bit but I feel his style of teaching is much more effective.   As long as you attend class you'll do fine.   Exams and quizzes are pretty easy, and he's very fair in grading.

Difficult to understand, CANNOT STAY ON TOPIC-his jokes will seem funny at first but after 3 months it gets very frustrating. He repeats the same "I'm joking" speech every class. He has quizzes every week. Very hard to work with and is hard of hearing. The only plus to his class is that you get to have a formula sheet. AVOID.

his a great teacher, at first i though he was difficult to understand and teach the subject, but after i had polomsky for stats 2, Chung is definately better at teaching these courses. take Chung, avoid Polomsky, sure he has no accent but his boring, bland and makes this subject harder than it should be.
tried to be funny but never was...class was boring and he was so scatter brained you never knew what he was trying to say... avoid his class at all cost.
Best stats professor! Very nice!

Dr. Chung definitely knows Business Statistics very well. However, he tends to digress from the main topic of the discussion, and spends a lot of time joking around, which gets a bit overbearing at times. His accent is pretty thick, and at first you may have a difficult time understanding him. However, he's lenient on grading and a nice guy.
I had a little trouble with his accent, although it did not keep me from doing well. He is straight forward on what is on the test. I do well, but I wish I could learn the topics better.
Pretty good teacher some complain of a language barrier I didn't have any problem.  He's very silly but the fact that he explains material very well makes me tolerate his extreme silliness.

Overall he was helpful.     He's hard of hearing and speaks with a chinese accent, but you CAN understand him and you CAN communicate with him.    He cracks jokes during class to make it interesting because he's dealing with very dull material.      He gives quizes which prepare you for the unit exams.
I had a difficult time, simply because of the enormous language barrier.  Tests are fair, and he curves a ton!  If you can handle the whole not speaking English thing, take him.

Chung is a great teacher. There is NO language barrier. His tests are tough and the quizzes are easy. He covers the material in full and will always take time to help you out if you need it. Study and attend class and you'll get an A+. Very funny and jokes around a lot in class, keeps it interesting...
kept class loose and made lots of jokes while still covering all the required material on the tests thoroughly.
People take advantage of him being hard of hearing and it's annoying.  I like him, great guy!  Willing to work with students or at least find them tutors.

Terrible teacher..You will be frustrated every class when he goes on his tangents. I got a A+ in the class but I'm still ticked about having him as my teacher. His accent is almost unbearable. He is a good guy but can sometimes be rude to students. I would not take him again.
Very good professor - one of the best at CSU.  He has a way of making the material very manageable - while learning something along the way.
Awesome prof.! get to know him and get an A/
Not the prof to take is you want to LEARN the material. Lots of wasted class time. Big language barrier. But, its an easy ride and he thinks he's funny, which is funny.
Very great prof would recommend to those who really dont like math.

Good Teacher, I'm taking him again in summer.  People find him hard to understand, but he makes the class easy.  Just do homework and follow him along to know what he is and isn't teaching- makes the class real easy!
The quizzes are very helpful for the exams.

The nicest and most helpful professor I've had to date. I learned a lot from her class AND from other classes through her. She really loves what she does and is very given to her students. She gives really good feedback and returns all projects. I defitely want to take another class with her. You have to show up or you'll lose 10pts from chapter Qs
I thought he was a really nice and set up a nice schedule for how the class went. The videos and homework were really helpful in learning the content.
I thought he was a really nice and set up a nice schedule for how the class went. The videos and homework were really helpful in learning the content.

Moon is great. He's a younger professor and he tries his best to make examples and lectures relatable to students. The class is 3 exams worth 80% of your grade, and the other 20% is HW and in class participation. If you show up and put a little effort in, there is no reason you can't get at least a B. He also curves the exams pretty nicely.
She was the reason that I quit my CS major.

She keeps rambling about how you have to deal with more data in professional world. Every time she's teaching a tough topic, she'll spend more time in warning us that this is really tough than she'd spend on actually teaching that topic. Needless to say, you'll learn very little about actual subject.
She is horrible. Hard to understand. Worst at CSU.
A very poor lecturer. Extremely disorganized. Just look at the course website. She should be fired from CSU.

Lecture's are boring, people started not showing up so she made attendance mandatory. hard to understand. HW is fine, midterm sucks. Worst part, she will ASSUME and ACCUSE people of cheating WITHOUT even seeing code AND won't confront people about it. Just fails thems/reports them and moves on. sounds great right?
Avoid taking courses from her. Difficult to understand and extremely disorganized.
Better to avoid this professor at any cost. Her terrible english accent and her subject knowledge is very poor.

Nice lady, but oh man is the class disorganized. The class website has probably about 100 links to powerpoints, tutorials, and other random websites that she references in class. She bounces around between different resources in class, looking at a few pages/slides of one thing then jumping into the middle of another one. Very confusing.
worst professor in CSU

she's very disorganized and will spend the entire class speaking in broken English about irrelevant details instead of what students need to know like how to do hw or preparing for exams. she should gives royalties to stack overflow and code academy for doing her job.
her accent is terrible and her grammar is one of the worst that I have ever seen but overall she is not a bad professor. She is caring and knows her stuff.
The subjects were really great. Great professor ! She will make you work but I learned a lot from this course and I got a job because of it.
Great lectures and labs !

Hard to tell if some commenters here are being honest.  Here's my take on professor Chung:  -Strong accent & speaks fast  -Vague explanations & rambles about minor details  -Condescends   -Unclear assignments & assessments  -Late penalties & no extensions & no grade curve  +Extra Credit occasionally  +Cute (at this time) There, I have said it all.
She's very knowlegable in the field, but not great at communicating that knowlege. She will work with you and help when she can. Her tests are hard.
She dress nice and not bad on the eyes.  Ok, with that said, she's actually really good.  Her assignments are clear, here reviews reflects the exams.

Taking a class with Sunnie is always a good experience. Yes, she talks about databases a lot but she gives you beneficial material that will help you in the real world. She is one of the best professors in the department!

Very helpful when you ask for help.  Assignments weren't bad and she gives plenty of time to figure it out.  Most of the exams were pretty hard, but she does tell you what to focus on.  Do not waste your money on the book as I never opened it.  Accent is a little thick but it gets better the more you hear her.
Great Professor

She sometimes would ramble on and on really driving in a specific point and it didn't really matter because it didn't wind up on the tests or labs. The labs were relatively simple and the tests were based mostly based on the labs.

The class is not easy, but she  is always trying to help you. She listen to students  on how to make the class better. I really recommend her, she  will repeat the explanation  as much as students need.

If you score better than the class average on tests, then you will be fine.  Otherwise I do not recommend her, especially if you don't understand the material right away.  Her class is pointless but you need to be in attendance.  Not a good teacher.

Professor Cicero delivers inspirational lectures that truly align with Cleveland State's engaged learning initiatives. She clearly lays out the guidelines for the class and expects all students to follow them by consistently participating in class discussion. If the student participates and arrives to class, the student should do well.

This is one of the best professors I've ever had! She keeps class interesting and is really great with all of her students. She gives great feedback on papers and is really easy going about paper deadlines. I would love to have her as a professor again!

Best English prof you could ask for. She was very clear with grading and helps each student individually. Tells some funny stories and makes you feel at home in her class. If you have the option to take her class, DO IT.

She is the best English professor/ teacher I have ever had. She would have special days where you can go in and she will edit your papers for you. She is very interesting and talks about interesting articles with the whole class.
very knowledgeable, but does not explain concepts very well

His vast knowledge of GIS and computers sometimes makes it difficult for him to come down to a newbie's level. He "takes an interest in student's lives" which can make for awkward conversations. All of the taboo topics (sex, politics, religion). Weird but funny sense of humor. Be prepared for foul language.Lots. Will help you a lot if you ask.

Pretty straight forward grading.  Class has 2 exams and that is it for grades.  Lecture consist of him talking.  No powerpoints, but that makes it more interesting.  Shares real life stories and field experience which is awesome.

Don't take her class online, she isn't very good at structuring blackboard and the course material. She often forgets to put the deadlines and blames the students for not knowing when to turn in assignments. She's just not a good online professor and doesn't know how to use the internet and isn't open to constructive criticism.

She has absolutely no idea what she is doing. She is a communications professor and doesn't know how to communicate. She is unclear with directions and changes due dates frequently without any warning. Wouldn't recommend this professor for this class.

Even if you know the program she's teaching better than she does (which is likely because she doesn't really know or teach either of them), you'll get a bad grade. Your classmates' assignments might look like they came from 3rd graders, but your grade will be close to theirs even if you submit close to professional-level work.

The stater is tough because it is structured so poorly and some people are expected to do more than others without it having an impact on grades. Professor Clapp does not speak loud enough, is not clear with expectations, and is sometimes unreasonable with what she wants. Overall, it is an experience and required to graduate, so suffer through it.

You teach yourself. That's the best way to put it. I spent most class periods struggling to figure out what was going on and how to get projects done. She was so monotone and boring it was sometimes hard to listen to her. Very outdated way of teaching.

Wrote for the Cleveland Stater for 2 semesters with her.. it's a lot of work but she is very fair. If you put the work in you will be fine. If you get to layout late in the day when everything's practically done or you don't submit your stories by deadline then she may rightfully have a problem with you as it impacts the entire class.

Absolutely loved her and really enjoyed the class. You can tell she has a lot of experience and loves what she does, she really wants her students to do well. You'll write 5 formal news stories but can rewrite them to improve your grade. 60% of your grade is in class assignments that you can't make up if you miss so make sure you attend class!

I really liked Prof. Clapp this semester. She's totally cool and really cares about how well you do in her class. She offers re-writes if you do poorly on papers and she knows her stuff. She was a pleasure to have and I really learned in her class. (No final exam or midterm!)

Excellent professor! She knows her stuff and is happy to teach it to you. You respect her, you get it back 100%...you do the work, you get an A...One of the few profs left that actually cares about the success of her students!
She is my absolute favorite teacher ever! She is hysterical and so witty. Very qualified. Love her! Cant take enough of her classes! She even inspired me to switch my major!

Betty Clapp is amazing.  Had a really annoying kid in class who wanted to talk the whole time to show off his reading comprehension and she always called him out on it. She's hilarious and is only really mean to those who deserve it.

Write one essay per week. Final is a 2,000 word essay based on reading 10 books. Other reading as well. It's more work than a usual CSU class, but as long as you don't put off the books until the last minute, it's OK.
If you do the work, expect to learn in Professor Clapp's class.  She was the faculty advisor of my school newspaper and I learned the important aspects of being a good journalist from her.

Had her in Fall 2010 for this class and overall she's excellent professor, need to attend class to be able to follow where she is coming from.  One of the best when it comes to Journalism-project ideas are amazingly creative.  Sit close talks low. Had her several times before and this class was different and not on par with her usual excellence.

I took this class to fulfill a WAC.  She wasn't very nice.  She made fun of people for not knowing answers.  She neglected to mention in the course description that we would be required to go to events outside of class time.  I hated the class.

hard teacher but you learn. she wants you to do well and you can tell she loves what she teaches. you do have to work hard and come to class but she will help you succeed. you can re-do poor assignments for a higher grade.

This professor is very rude and her class is bland.  She seemed to go out of her way to poke fun at students for not knowing an answer.  She wasn't very helpful.  I don't feel like I learned anything from her at all.
Very good teacher, you will learn a lot. She is not easy, especially in the beginning.

Professor Clapp is one of the best professors I've ever had.  She doesn't let you get away with not doing your work and yes she can be a bit rough around the edges at times but her biggest mission is to make sure you understand that the field of journalism isn't all fun and games you have to work hard and sometimes go on assignments you don't want
Very unkind. Agreed about her *trying* to be a hardass. I was one of her best students but I feel she treated many students unkindly.

awful. she goes off on incomprehensible tangents that have nothing to do with the subject and grades all her quizzes and test very hard. she will say something in class and you could copy it down exactly; it would sometimes still be a wrong answer on the test. DROP THIS CLASS.
not a very approachable professor.

The single worst teacher I've ever had. She has no interest in making sure the students understand the material. I recorded what she said in class and then used her own words in a paper and she said it was wrong. She should not be teaching. She would be better off working at the cafeteria.

Comes in late, lectures the entire class and the leaves.  Does not know how to handle students with disablities (like pointing at blind people). Her tests are all short response and her lectures are not structered at all.  Just Plain TERRIBLE

honestly I can not believe that this is one a 300 level class two that they allow her to be responsible to teach a class or three that she even thinks she should teach future teachers. Its not just the subject either this professor goes off into tangents and just babbles I wrote down definitions in class then answered her questions and it was wrong
CSU is lucky that Dr. Clark is gone...I would have to suggest that all of the positive ratings here have been made by Dr. Clark herself or relatives or colleagues.

RUN! IF YOU HAVE HER DROP IT GET OUT WHILE YOU CAN. WORST TEACHER I HAVE EVER HAD IN MY LIFE. SHE SHOULD NOT BE AN PROF. SHE DOES NOT GO BY THE BOOK IF YOU DO NOT WRITE WHAT SHE THINKS YOU ARE WRONG. DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS

Dr. Clark is tough, but fair.  She pushes her students to think outside of the box.  Most of the students in my class were clueless, and were unable to question and re-analyze their previous misconceptions. Dr. Clark is great. She is also a well respected scholar, mentor, & educator.

I have every class on tape. The lectures are incoherent. She gave wrong formulas in class. Her grad assistant emailed us the night before the exam with right formula. Horrid teacher. I think she was denied tenure. I think she is biased for some students. Never returned a call or email. took 30 days to set up an appointment with me.

Warning!!! Do not take class with Dr. Clark if at all possible! Has her own agenda, isn't open to any views that go against hers, very unorganized, and class is an extreme bore! First day told a student that they were incapable of having an original thought! BEWARE, DO NOT TAKE CLASS WITH HER, YOU WILL BE MISERABLE!

Clark is a tenured teacher that has no business teaching. She doesnt meld her lectures with her quizzes then expects students to know word for word her definitions for the quiz.  I would recommend the university fire her. On the bright side for anyone able to stick out her course you get insight as to what a teacher should never be.
No Comments

I learned a great deal from her. I found her to be dedicated and truly the consumate professor!!! She is accessible and polite and truly cares about the learning of her students. YOu have to put some work into the class but it is so worth it. I think that a lot of students take her for granted. I know that I did originally. A+++++++++++++++++

Absolutely the worst Professor I have ever had at Cleveland State.  The students in the class are responsible for their own learning.  I have notes from one lecture and that was the only information she supplied.  Unavailable to help.  Did not respond to student email or telephone calls.

One of the worst teachers.  Not helpful to other students and not very understanding or willing to understand others questions/views.  We had these group presentations and she claimed one of our group members seemed arrogant while giving the presentation (like it couldn't have been nerves) and gave the whole group a lower score.  Nice

The reason some students haven't had trouble with her is that they agree with her extreme political views.  She is ****, and worse, incompetent at her job.  She is one of the most ill-informed people I have ever met, and a disgrace to her school.

In a word - horrible.  I actually unlearned stuff in her class!  She is unable to explain even the simplest topics to students.  I have no idea why she is still on the faculty.  She detracts from the other quality faculty members at CSU.
With Dr. Clark it is either her way or the highway.  She is not very open-minded to different opinions.  The sad part is, nothing I learned from her was on the Praxis - what a waste of time/money.

Had her for Soc. Foundations.  May be nice to doctoral students but not so to undergrads.  Likes to go off on her own political agenda.  Not very open to others views.  Thank god for the book or I would have learned nothing in that class.

I don't know why some people have such a hard time with Dr. Clark.  She is exceptional to those of us doctoral students who want to work and learn statistics...not just have things handed to us.  I think she is amazing and I am now a colleague.

I have never run across a colllege professor that was more interested in teaching you how smart he was versus teaching you. He fumbles at the board and he also goes to tutoring to help those who he likes. Heliked me but I guess I had too many questions. Hey Clark... If you would teach it in a finite manner in the first place I could learn something

The good: Very helpful, wants his students to do well and provides many practice exams. Make sure he gets to know you, it helps! Also, SHOW UP TO CLASS!! he may not take attendance but he reiterates that those who attend will do better i.e. more partial credit on tests! Bad: His tangents are horrible yet funny, often you'll wonder how he got there
Gives practice sheets and sample exams that are really helpful. Nice prof.

Mr. Clark will meet you outside of class and help you if you need it. He will not cut you any breaks on grading; even if the whole class struggled on something. The class can be difficult if you do not put in the effort outside of class.
Good teacher very easy to approach, but it seems like he grades on an all or nothing scale...

worst math professor I have ever had. Although he makes us seem he cares, he really doesn't. He taught way to fast and didn't even listen to what his students had to say.Disrespect. In my opinion he only says what you want to hear because no matter he still gets paid. Don't take him for any math classes!
Professor Clark has great sense of humor.

The version of the Math Lial, red cover textbook - do not bather buying it !! It sucks. Use You tube.com for instructions. Professor Clark is very smart, knows his stuff. Some times his explanations are too complicated. He will give you extra practice material if you ask.
This class was a joke. I only went once and got an A.

Prof. Clark teaches you exactly what you need to know to get good grades on your exams. He'll explain everything 20 times until everyone gets the lesson that he's teaching. Great teacher who truly loves his subject.

He has a lot of energy and personality, making his class a pleasure. He was very thorough when going over concepts in class (maybe too thorough sometimes). He was very easy to approach, and was always helpful . I would highly recommend him.

Great teacher with a nice personality! I never had to open the book. Just attend class and take notes and he'll make the real hard stuff seem real easy. I learned a lot. Some of the  test questions were tough but I was able to get through them. I highly recommend him.
Honestly, he is a really nice guy, but I know more than he does when it comes to math.  He should find another profession.  If you want to learn something, don't take his class.
excelent will help if you ask for it

Good teacher...takes time to explain everything...it's too bad that he has to put up with a lot students that do not pay attention, and then have to listen to them complain at the end of the semester that he never went over certain material.  I'd recommend taking any of his classes.
He is willing to help you if you need it.  He is a fair grader.
he is horrible, and he is very picky on students he likes
he sucks...he didnt like me for some odd reason...therefore gave me a bad grade...****
very good teacher.  will help you when ever he can.  he is listed as staff but try to get him if possible.  highly recommended
Energetic and refreshingly different. Hard tests. Lots of airplane and economics problems! Very fair grader. Has good potential for being funny but his jokes need some work.
Terry is extremely helpful and clear in his instruction. He is a very wise person a d seeks to not only improve your artistic ability but also for you to improve yourself.
He's sweet, and easy to talk to. He doesn't make you feel weird asking for help and he's pretty laid back. Just don't try to turn anything in late

Do ALL the HW it will be your study sheet for the tests, text books needed to do HW. Papers were hard, make time to go through the lengthy budget documents. DO NOT PLAGIARIZE, he kicks people out of the class every semester for plagiarism. Go to class and PARTICIPATE. Going to class is the best way to do well, he will elaborate on anything.

I found Dr. Clark to be educated in his area , but lacking to get the material across in a concise manner. Watch for plagiarism, he plays that card too often. Many students have had to repeat his class. I would reccommend any other class for the Urban Track.
His tests are heavy and so overwhelming and you won't have enough time to do all of them in time.

So bad at teaching that the entire class failed the second exam. Gave remediation, but did nothing to improve her teaching style. Pretty sure she just gives random grades on assignments and does not actually read them. The inconsistency and lack of feedback is strong in this one. Avoid at all cost

Let's start by saying she means well, she is very nice. But literally doesn't know what she's doing. 2 papers a week but only worth half a point each, no grade cushion. Exams are super super difficult even if you memorize the textbook. Entirety of lecture is her reading off her slides that don't even help prepare you for anything. 0/10 recommend

if you dont want to work but get an A, he's your guy unfortunately. I think he wanted to be cool rather than teach us things. Don't think he has enough experience being a nurse to teach students. Couldn't really answer any questions. Graded careplans strictly but didn't take clinical overall seriously, it was odd tbh

Professor Clouse is very personable, approachable, and friendly. Not especially tough, but you'll definitely learn a lot if you pay attention. She encourages participation and makes it rewarding to do so, because she respects students' ideas and questions.

I would take any class she teaches! Sessions are interesting and loaded with information, her lectures are amazing, and she's incredibly funny. Very approachable. There are 4 or 5 papers due, but the topics are clear and guided, and you have plenty of time to do them. Don't miss class because that's where she gets her extra credit questions.

Coach is a great professor. I didn't buy the textbook and he posts lectures with audio that is very clear. I'm not a music major and he made learning about jazz easy and fun. He gives short feedback, but his assignments are also very easy. The entire class was a set of questions with a powerpoint each week and occasionally a documentary.

Coach is a great professor. I didn't buy the textbook and he posts lectures with audio that is very clear. I'm not a music major and he made learning about jazz easy and fun. He gives short feedback, but his assignments are also very easy. The entire class was a set of questions with a powerpoint each week and occasionally a documentary.

Online class given in weekly modules. Each one (except for movie responses) shouldn't take you more than a half hour. Nice easy class to fill a random requirement, not much work. Didn't get textbook, did very well. Very nice man. No exams. You have to really try to fail this class, just turn in the week's work and you're good.

Took the 6 week summer course. Fulfills a humanity req in the easiest way. No exams or quizzes. Graded on DBs and a few video summaries. If you do the work on time you will get close to 100%. He really cares about the topics and gives great feedback. You have to go out of your way to not get an A in this class. I wish every professor was like him.

Very knowledgeable. In Ethno his lectures are sporadic with his slides, so I wouldn't recommend taking notes. He gives all of the questions on the tests in the review sheets and puts his slides on Blackboard, so as long as you study the material on the study guides you should be good. There's a couple of small papers but nothing too serious.

I would recommend his Jazz class to anyone looking to fill their arts and humanities requirement. He's a great guy. Very kind&easy going. He knows his stuff. You listen to a lot of music and he regularly cancels class (4 times) so you can watch documentaries about that week's topic. Easy assignments just be thoughtful and genuine and you'll do well

Took this online over the summer and it was the easiest class I have ever taken. Review questions are given every week and the answers are right in the powerpoint. No tests, quizzes, or papers. I got 100% in the class.

Great professor and a easy pass. Not alot of tests but for the ones we did have he would always provide a sheet to study from. Most of the work is answering questions from various movies about jazz. Would definitely take his class again if I could.
Easy class, tests were straight forward everything that was on the study guide was on the tests. However the lectures were boring. Likes to randomly call on people during class.
Cool professor. Very knowledgeable. Get ready to read and to write though. Hardest 200 level class out there but its manageable

Mr. Colbert is an easy professor to get along with. His lectures were generally engaging, not to mention that he is very attractive (makes Spanish a little easier). He'll present the information to you, but it's your job to take something from it.

Professor Cole was the most opinionated and radical prof I ever had, but unlike others he did listen to other people's opinions. Also has a very deep knowledge of Christianity, along with the other religions. For all of his racial politics he doesn't play favourites between students of different backgrounds, and he actually makes everyone work.

Great teacher!  He has a passion for the material and it shows.  But be prepared to hear some tough information when it comes to white / black relations.  His questions are thought provoking.  I took six classes this past semester and he was my favorite teacher.
You have to attend class its a must for him

Hands down the most inspirational professorsteachers I've ever had in my life. If you show him respect, it is for certain given back. Would love to take more if his classes but my major is far from his courses. Hope to see him around campus this semester to say hi.

Mr. Cole is a great professor. I have taken two classes with him. I really enjoyed his classes and learned  ALOT. The papers are a 600 word limit- but in order to write a good paper you will exceed the minimum requirement. He is knowledgable, inspirational and passionate about the subject!
Learned loys.  If you engage will come away with decent grade.

As long as you write the papers and do some extra credit you will be fine.  I failed the first paper (my fault) and still ended up with a B by the end of the semester.  He enjoys what he talks about. Critical thinking is what held me from an A though.

This is primarily a lecture class, so be ready to take notes. Lots of reading and paper writing, but nothing too crazy. It's a pretty dark class, but he teaches the subject matter with the honesty it requires. Helpful, gives good feedback. I'd take this class again - he really makes it a powerful class.

This is primarily a lecture class, so be ready to take notes. Lots of reading and paper writing, but nothing too crazy. It's a pretty dark class, but he teaches the subject matter with the honesty it requires. Helpful, gives good feedback. I'd take this class again - he really makes it a powerful class.

Tough class, but he's the right prof to teach it. Class is based on group discussions, led by the students. SO MUCH READING - be ready to make time for it. Generally very kind, helpful, replies to his emails. He's here to help, you just have to ask. Lots of paper writing, too. Not my favorite class I've ever taken, but he's a great professor.

Dr. Cole seemed to adjust his curriculum as a result of the pandemic. The quizzes are online and easy, possible to get 100% every time. He assigns readings almost weekly along with the quiz and a paper due every two to three weeks. Very personable during his office hours. Has even given multiple extensions to the entire class this past semester.

This man offers no grace WHATSOEVER. I'm reading comments of his attitude changing when you meet him for office hours, however in this pandemic that's not an option. I though that because of COVID more professors would be more understanding, helpful, and flexible, but that was not the case. He does not accept late work and the work load is brutal.

This professor is hard he has a lot of readings you have to do for each module. It takes me a couple of hours to get his homework done. Then you have a book you have to read and he does not tell you when you should start reading it and it isn't even in the syllabus. Everyone I know in this class all says they hated this class. Do not take it.

Prof. Cole was excellent for the History Capstone course. He is extremely knowledgeable and was very helpful throughout the process of writing the history capstone paper. Tough grader but if you put in effort youll do fine.
Very well versed in the subject.  Had a small party at end of course
Avoid at all cost, grade consists of 3 major grades midterm. final and an essay. he grades like an absolute Nazi.

He definitely lectures a lot. He gives powerpoint presentations as he lectures, so I recommend taking notes. Homework is mainly composed of reading the assigned chapters and doing the quizzes online (Revel, Pearson). He has a midterm and a final exam only. I would recommend writing a lot for his exams. Put in the effort and you're good!

For a 100 level class, I was expecting this to be a fairly fun and interesting class. I love history, however, this class with Dr. Cole has ruined that. Does not get back to emails quickly, if at all. Felt like a 500 level class. Would not recommend for Gen Ed requirement. Do not take online.

I took Dr. Cole's class as a gen ed, as many people do. It is a lot of work for a gen ed and 100 level, but it is very interesting. His lectures are amazing and inspiring; I would sometimes get upset that class was over. His tests are essay based and very difficult. If you study hard, you will earn a good grade. He knows his stuff. Recommended.

This class changed where it is less lecture, more discussion, with a LOT of reading and writing at home. Dr. Cole is more of a lecture-based professor but I always enjoy a class with him. Tough grader and seems arrogant, but he is very kind and cares about you learning (as long as you show that you care too!). Not a prof. to take a gen ed with!
A tough class especially for a gen ed. avoid if possible

I find Dr. Cole very arrogant and to be quite honest I learned absolutely nothing in my actual class with him. His teaching style very much bothers me, he assigns modules after modules and then expects us to come to class and sit around while he says a couple (sometimes completely unrelated) things in a poor attempt to engage discussion.

Dr. Cole is one of those professors that seems intimidating at first, but once you go to his office hours, it is still the same! Except, he is a very caring, almost father-figure , and whenever you have a problem, he is very insightful. He helped me understand material and even gave an extension when I was dealing with personal issues. Amazing.

He gives lots of notes that are not available online, so make sure to take notes in class. The only tests during the semester are a midterm and final. Both are written, and you must give heavy detail, he grades very strictly.

Dr. Cole is a great professor but his class is very time consuming &he's a tough grader. He only has two tests, a midterm& final but there is a lot of memorization involved and 80% of the info won't be on the test. You really need to study in order to pass the class unless you know a lot about history. He makes his lectures very interesting though.

Dr. Cole's lectures are powerpoint based and he doesn't post them online, hence the only way to get the information you need is to go to class. You have on big project that he assigns in the beginning of the semester. The mid term and final are okay, lots of terms you have to understand deeply in order to get a decent grade.

A bit of an ego. No, he has a massive ego and makes it clear every conversation. Lets just say he's so rude that every time you speak to him he has to be narcissistic. Completely avoid if possible teacher is not as knowledgeable as he may seem and there are no right answers with him.

An amazing professor all-in-all. His exams are not the easiest, in the sense that you would have to memorize an abundance of information and thoroughly understand the material to even get a B on an exam. This semester, he only have us two exams and one paper. Lectures are interesting. Pretty much the "weed out" class for History majors.
Dr. Coleman was great and the reason I entered the field of psych We need more like him. I had a wonderful career and will never forget him. Thank you Dr. Coleman for being strict but kind.

The syllabus was useless and he notified us of assignments via email several days before they were due. Those assignments were unnecessary (simple grammer and punctuation in a 400-level college course? with a 50-some%/F average grade?!)and graded based on his oppinion, which contradicted much of my formal writing education up until now. Steer clear

Save yourself, your gpa, and your stress. I took this class and wrote a report that I felt was really good (I have written many reports being a senor in psych) and this professor gave me a 'D'. I am an 'A' student and this killed my gpa. Please, dont take this guy!!!!!

This guy is a genius but he is so hard to understand, his teaching style is unlike anything I have ever experienced. I got an A in his class and I still haven't figured that out but apparently it is possible. If you want a professor that is clear and will help you understand the material better, DO NOT TAKE HIM!

He is by far the worst professor I've ever had. He asks about his own opinions on tests. Reading is a joke, because he assigns things that are never graded. I have As in every class that I take except his. I got a D, and I am not happy at all. He should be fired, I have no clue who let this fiend in there. RUN or he'll kill your GPA.

RUN....RUN....RUN....This man is a walking genius....he knows EVERYTHING!!!!!!! He corrects the book!!!!He will make all your hard work look like nothing. I had to do a paper for him on another teacher, the teacher, gave me an A+, he gave me a C. I dont get C's! You take him you want to. Thanks to the other, professor my grade combined as an B+.

Everyone in my class agrees that his lectures are pointless as you get about half a page of notes if you try. You do not even have the entire class to finish the exam he puts a time limit. In this class in particular his grades on exams are so brutal that a D- is a 35 percent. Many people dropped it and I am about to.

very confusing...cannot explain the simplest concepts well to himself or the class....very very very did i say very picky about the way he grades. do not expect to get an A unless you are perfect to his standards. Tests are tough and has a weird grading style...this class should be easy but he makes it difficult...
Gives you an excess amount of reading. Sometimes his flow of information can be hard to follow. Is nice professor but needs to work harder to make students interested in the course information.
Who in the world allowed this guy to teach. He has to be the worst prof. at CSU. He is very unclear in his style of teaching. Just AWFUL!

he is the worst teacher, he cant relate matters to ways of learning or understanding! he is retiring in a year, wait till then to take his class, and sandra webster is his protege, she is the same way. dont say i didnt warn you

do take you will be sorry. can not explain material well, does not like to answer questions, causes his self and student confusion. not helpful no extra credit, not enough time to take test, boring, homework long, will need tutoring for this class, if u had previous stat class will be ok. could not teach not a people person, stay away from,run away
VERY SMART PROFESSOR. CORRECTS THE BOOK MANY TIMES. TESTS ARE USUALLY COMPREHENSIVE. VERY HELPFUL. I'M RETAKING HIS CLASS BECAUSE HE IS THE SMARTEST STATISTICS PROFESSOR I MET.
Very cool professor with a great sense of humor. I learned a lot from him, and he is extremely approachable

Felt so bad reading the ratings many said she was horrible and selfish. She is an amazing person, and amazing teacher and I love her so much. Very easy going and full of personality willing to help and give as much as the student is willing to take.! Loved her and she doesn't flaunt her skills, she's an active participant. Don't let the rates dictate you building a bond with the prof.! everyone is a different type of person.!

I really love Amy. Her class is definitely not the most structured, but she is extremely passionate about dance and even if you have not danced before and show at least some interest she is more than willing to help you learn and grow. Fantastic class. If you're on the fence about taking it, I'd say go for it.

I also had her for DAN 146 as well. I'm a guy and also a punk rocker, she didn't care aout my gorry screamo band shirts I wore to class. Most dance teachers would be like o.o. shes also very helpful and cool with the students. if you show up and try you get an A after you had in the two papers. so yea she's awesome:) dont believe shes mean/rude lol
Not helpful at all, rather rude,will switch dance steps in the middle of explaining to the class how to do them.

Good teacher if you're looking for a workout.  The work was continuous as aerobics should be.  There?s also some reps of sit ups and such.  A ball's used a bit which is neat if you like variety.  She leads kind of poorly in my opinion and I got frustrated with her late instructions sometimes.  Doesn't take doctors' notes and I got screwed for that
I love Amy and would take any course taught by her. She is so inspiring.
For beg, ull Hav an a no matter what. Sometimes rude sometimes sweet. Sometimes helpfull sometimes not. Sometimes cool sometimes rude. Aw I'm glad it's over.
Ha, Must have some unresolved issues!
Helpful and encouraging. Definitely an inspirational person to dance with and learn from. Will be taking her classes again!
clueless teacher, has no system or ability to give good direction. just random movements and changing her mind all the time. not at all helpful when asked.

She is not rude. Her movements are not always clear, but if you ask her to repeat for you, she always does. Her classes maybe too easy for professional dancers, but they perfect for beginners. Your results will depend only on how much yours inputs will be, because she doesn't make you to do smth.You just have to listen to her and do what she says.
she is very professional. You really can learn a lot.
None.
She is a good dancer...but I also learned a lot from her as a teacher.  She is not really rude, just direct.  And I thought her style was real versatile.

Rude, doesn't seem to respect students at all. Although she is an amazing dance, she is not a very good teacher. A majority of her dances are modern, she seems to have an extream dislike of any other style.
she is a good dancer herself but a horrible teacher and thinks her moves are cool.... they are out dated by a lot....
Do NOT take this professor

Get ready to read a lot and one must know how to take good notes. He doesn't take attendance but if you don't come to class you miss the content because he doesn't upload anything online. He's a tough grader

I don't get why this professor has the reputation he's gotten. As long as you took good notes during the lecture and paid attention, you can get a good grade on the test. The papers are time consuming, but if you make sure to put your best effort into them, you can get a decent grade on them. The professor also has a pretty nice demeanor.

I don't get why this professor has the reputation he's gotten. As long as you took good notes during the lecture and paid attention, you can get a good grade on the test. The papers are time consuming, but if you make sure to put your best effort into them, you can get a decent grade on them. The professor also has a pretty nice demeanor.

I got a C+ HOWEVER i did miss the final exam by accident. His lectures are interesting but be ready to take notes on everything he says because his tests are very specific to what he says and what is in the book. Makes up own questions so it is important to understand the topic entirely. Very tough grader on papers, specific criteria and page #

Since CSU gave the pass fail option I took the opportunity because professor conerly is extremely specific and anal about everything. I took my paper to the writing center and did everything to make sure my paper was good and he still failed me. He makes this course unnecessarily hard. Also be ready to read 100 pages a week and talk twice per class

Probably the worst professor at Cleveland State. He was rude to me on may occasions when I was asking a simple question about the material. He made everyone seem like a moron and that we were getting under his skin for asking questions. Assignments are not clear and all over the place . Avoid at all costs.

Such a difficult course. His readings are long and repetitive. If you miss a reading you'll do bad on the quizzes which are oddly specific??? Talk more than twice per class or else he'll give you a low participation grade. Essay prompts are vague and he doesn't offer much explanation. Very easy to get off topic on unimportant things in class :(
Stay away from this professor. The comments about him being a very tough grader and rude to students is accurate.
Do not take this class with him. His lectures are hard to follow and his essays are tough to write about. He is disrespectful to students and does not care whether you pass or not.

I think a lot of people rate him poorly but I really don't think he is that bad. He gets a little carried away at times but I just think hes an interesting character. His class isn't very difficult and he certainly is not the worst professor.

All you do is read, discuss, and he quizzes you on small things from the 100 page weekly readings. Only grades are quizzes and two essays he grades tough and is anal about. Avoid him and this class at all costs.

DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS WITH HIM. His lectures are boring and all over the place, he only gives 5 grades the whole semester and grades on a weird scale with no clear reason behind it. 10/10 would NOT recommend to any students. Especially not CCP like I was when I took the class.

DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS WITH HIM. My other friends have taken this class with other profs and had a much better experience. Going to office hours does not help. Hard to understand and stammers most of the class. Class lectures and textbook do not always coordinate. Trust me, choose another professor.
He writes one thing on the board and talks about it for for the entirety of the class. Long story short, there is not much teaching going on this class.

While clearly passionate about the course and subject, Mr. Conerly is rather old fashioned which isn't the problem. The problem is that he puts nothing on Blackboard (no notes, syllabus, grades, etc.) and you have to ask him how you're doing. You cannot keep track. And he just talks the whole lecture. He never fosters participation so it's dull.

Probably the one of the worst teachers i've ever had in my entire educational history. As others said, his powerpoints have almost no useful information so you have to rely completely on his lectures but good luck with that, as he talks fast. Also Tough grader, and seemed unnecessarily rude to his students, even those just asking questions.

If I had a dollar for every time this guy said "circa" I wouldn't even need to go to college. He is extremely lecture heavy, rambles about a topic no one cares about, and grades like we are all history majors. A poorly articulated man, I wonder how he became a professor. Oh yeah, to fill the ridiculous gen ed that changes no ones life.

Horrendous. All he does in class is talk. If you can't keep up with his constant rambling you will fall behind and struggle. Power points are useless with no information. Only had 5 grades for the course and failing one of them will put you in a deep hole. Would not recommend.

Extremely extremely tough grader. Lectures are on the boring side but he seems interested in the material. Readings are long, about 90 pages per week. Will nitpick every little thing in your essays and will take points off for anything. Weekly quizzes have some tough questions. Unclear expectations.

Grade depends on 3 tests and 2 papers. Tests are difficult/detail-oriented and papers are harshly graded with vague guidelines. Powerpoints lack info and are mostly pictures and one word/phrase bulletpoints. Talks quickly so its hard to take notes in class. Students don't ask questions since he answers them in a way that is rude, mean, and abrupt.

I dropped the class before his grading would take away my scholarship. Only has 5 grades the entire semester: 3 exams & 2 essays. Essay criteria are misleading and entirely different from what he expects from his students. Doesn't like when students ask questions. You can't access his lectures online. Lectures are hard to follow & take notes on.

By far the worst prof I've ever had, his power-points give little to no information, he hates when people ask questions. You only have 5 grades (3 exams, 2 essays) and his grading is extremely tough. When he grades the papers he doesn't give any feedback and takes points off basically for no reason.

The homework was excessively difficult in this class and was not useful as a study tool for the tests. The professor didn't post any grades, feedback or study guides. As someone else said, she was more of a moderator. I would not recommend this class.

You really have to follow-up with her to respond to emails. Even then, I didn't have any luck getting help. You do a weekly homework assignment, answer a quiz for each chapter, take 4 tests and post comments about an ethical question each week. Not exciting for fun at all. She is more of a moderator than a professor.

Have a question that needs answered? Do not expect to receive a reply any time soon or at all. I have emailed this professor numerous times only to have not received a single reply. Communication is essential in an e-learning course, and there is none from her. I do not recommend her for an online class at all.

had her last semester. she has no business being a teacher. never answers emails until weeks later and is no help answering questions. i have no idea why she is working as a teacher- she needs to stick to a job that involved her putting numbers in a spreadsheet, because it seems like that's all she does here
She honestly seems like she has no desire to teach. Why bother? Easy class, but honestly NO value.

She makes you do the homework, but doesn't read it or provide feedback. Your homework is your study guide for up coming quizzes (5) and one final exam. I would say she occupies more of a data entry position.  This class is e-learning at it's worst., and I can only assume she has another full-time job.

Class is not difficult, however I've attempted to email, Message via Blackboard and call Prof. Conner multiple times to ask a couple of questions and I have  not been able to contact her and this has been going on for over 2 months. Weekly discussion boards and Homework assignments aren't overly time consuming, but you have to stay on top of them.
I would recommend taking her English class! Fair grading, good feedback and personable. Really no complaints.
I would recommend taking her English class! Fair grading, good feedback and personable. Really no complaints.

Dr. Conti is one of the most organized professors I have had, and her expectations are always clear. She gives you a lot of feedback on written work and tests, so if you aren't getting the grades you want, you know exactly how to get there. Participate in class and listen to her feedback and you'll be fine!

Dr. Conti is one of the most organized professors I have had, and her expectations are always clear. She gives you a lot of feedback on written work and tests, so if you aren't getting the grades you want, you know exactly how to get there. Participate in class and listen to her feedback and you'll be fine!
Dr. Conti is honestly the most amazing professor ever. She is so knowledgeable and professional-- I HIGHLY recommend her as a professor!!

This class was very organized with clear expectations for each week's workload. Participation in lectures and discussions is a large part of this class, so pipe up every once in a while and you'll be golden. The papers can seem daunting but she gives excellent feedback and often gives a chance for revisions and rewrites. Definitely recommend.

Dr. Conti is such a good professor and I would take her again. Shes incredibly intelligent and passionate about what shes teaching. Shes also the right balance between strict and understanding. I didnt think she was too tough of a grader, but she definitely expects you to try hard and write to your full potential.

Dr. Conti is very well organized, and it is clear that she is consistent with how she teaches this course. You definitely need to read the text to be able to receive participation credit and to do well on pop quizzes. Attendance is pretty mandatory, as she passes around a sign in sheet every class and records absences in Starfish.

Dr. Conti is a great teacher and good at leading discussion, but she's also a really tough grader. She gives good feedback so as long as you apply her critiques to your next paper you can definitely improve, but you definitely have to work for it. Her class is pretty fun and most of what we read was decent, considering the time period.
She presents all the information you need, in a very organized fashion.

Great Professor, and is willing to help but gives out busy work. Participation Activities every week, online text book with quiz (not for grade) at the end can be a lot of questions, plus homework. Also expects students to watch lecture video, before they watch the lecture.
She presents all the information you need, in a very organized fashion.

Dr. Corbett is amazing, if you have the opportunity to take any of her classes, she is so smart and LOVES biology. She'll make you fall in love with it too. Very witty and funny, she'll give you knowledge that you'll find yourself applying to everyday life. I'd definitely take her class again.

Professor Corbett is a very knowledgeable and caring professor. She wants you to know the material and understand it. Overall, this class wasn't too bad. It would have been much easier in person though. Tests usually have a good curve.

Professor Corbett is a very knowledgeable and caring professor. She wants you to know the material and understand it. Overall, this class wasn't too bad. It would have been much easier in person though. Tests usually have a good curve.

She's a decent professor but man is she a tough grader. She will take off a lot of points on the free response questions on the exams if you doing write every detail. That being said, BIO 300 Plant Bio is a terrible class. Do yourself a favor and take Animal Bio and/or Population Bio instead. Way less writing (if at all) and less strict profs.

She is really funny but kind of boring at times. I found myself falling asleep in her lectures a lot. Her PowerPoint notes are a start, but I recommend going to tutoring or SI to really learn and understand the material. Its a heavy class and not easy at all.
I think she was super funny and loved what she was teaching. I would love to have another lecture based class with her because she made the content interesting and engaging. Ps love her bio jokes.
She was funny. The material was tough but as long as you study youre good.
Shes an okay professor but, BIO 100 was not one of my favorite classes and you NEVER use the book.

Her class was lecture style and note taking was a must. I recommend you start tutoring early. There were three test throughout the semester two homework assignments and a few small one point assignments. She is very passionate about biology. She didn't take attendance unless there was a in class activity but if you skip chances of passing are slim.

Corbett is an amazing lecture giver! Unless you are an expert on biology, you will want to go to as many lectures as possible because it's pretty hard to teach yourself her material. The textbook helps, but you do not need it for class.

My friends who like biology love Dr. Corbett. However, if biology is not your strong suit, do not expect this class to be easy. She goes through lectures very quickly and it can be hard to keep up so record the lectures. Most of your grade is from the tests (there's 4 of them) and you need to study.

She's very nice, funny, accessible, and wants you to succeed! All you have to do is put in the work, which is considerable. I studied for a week solid and got a C. Very detailed, but she answers questions clearly. Highly recommend!
Tests are difficult. The powerpoints are helpful but taking notes that are not on there is highly recommended.

I studied for a solid week for each exam and walked in feeling amazing; didn't get above a C on any of the exams. She puts questions on the exam that she only mentioned in passing and nitpicks you to death. Her giant term paper you have to write barely affects your grade, and her TAs for the lab are lazy & don't help you at all. She curves a ton

She's much better than Modney, explains concepts better and doesn't shove info in your face as much. Still need to study & show up to class. Curves a little less than Modney since people do better on her exams. Make sure to print notes & write extra info she says! Show up, pay attention, study, go to SI, you'll be fine.

Had her for BIO100 and BIO200. She's very passionate but goes off on tangents about stuff thats science related but not on our exams. She puts a lot of stuff on her powerpoint that isnt on the test. She has good mnemonics for remembering info and will gladly answer any questions you have. You have to go to class or you'll miss important stuff

The BEST of all 3 professors for BIO 200. Not only is she funny but devoted to the topic she is teaching about. She is very clear in her lectures and she is always available to help during her office hours!

Best of all 3 professors. People tend to do best on her exams. She's very clear in lectures and points out funny but effective ways to remember certain things. Attend all her lectures and watch videos on youtube. She's very kind and she's there to help during office hours!

Do NOT take this prof if bio is not a strong suit for you, the exams are insanely hard and its all lectures with 50+ slide lectures. Although the final exam is all the exact questions from the previous exams. If you're in need of a nap, this lecture is the place to take it.

Worst class and professor, if you don't go to class there is absolutely no way to pass it. Tests are hard even when you study a week in advance, one of those professors that are out to get you. Could care less about your well-being, and grade and she shows it.

There is only 2 papers for the entire semester which is pretty cool. However, taking good notes and preparing for tests is key. The exams have about 50 questions every time around. A good thing about her class is that she puts all of the powerpoint on blackboard. Attending her class isn't necessarily mandatory but if i could rewind, i would've went

DO THESE THINGS FROM THE BEGINNING: go to ALL the SI Sessions, form study groups, get one-on-one tutoring, use Khan Academy/AK Lectures for materials covered in the class, stop by office hours, write your own practice questions, form flash cards and really put your all into this course!!! awesome teacher though, she really enjoys this subject!
He is always available to answer questions. Easy course with lots of reading.

Dr. Cory is experienced in his field, but is not well suited to be a professor in my opinion. The amount of reading he assigns per week is completely unreasonable as it is far too difficult to comprehend the amount of content he assigns per week, especially since most of the time we only discuss the primary sources rather than the textbook.
He is always available to answer questions. Easy course with lots of reading.
If this is your choice for elective, choose another course!!!!!

Dr. Cory is a super nice professor who knows his stuff when it comes to religion and history. He can be an awkward lecturer at times but if you put in the work and occasionally attend office hours you'll do well. I loved his case studies that got the entire class engaged.

This guy has good intentions but is an ineffective lecturer. The case study assignments and readings were actually very helpful, more so than the lectures in my opinion. "Muslim Societies" is a great topic for a class but the lecturing skills need work to make attendance worthwhile.

Very great professor! He has passion for his class! He was definitely not hard or ignorant and cares about us. He made an effort to make sure we understood instructions as they were user friendly and told us exactly what to do without any issues. He is really experienced in his field and brings up his experiences of living in the Middle East.
Enjoyed his class and learned a lot expect to read and participate but make information interesting
Very nice guy. I enjoyed his class. Very knowledgeable and inspirational.

I can assure you that he is not qualified for his position. His ways of teaching need to be changed by becoming clear with the information. More class interaction needed. He allows his personal beliefs to be added to the course's teachings. If anything, he should respect students before working on his teaching abilities. WOULD NOT RECOMMEND.
Requires a lot of reading, but very understanding and works with you.

I took this course as part of my Gen Ed requirements. Dr Cory assigns a TON of reading and writing-so much that it usually takes a month to get graded. By mid-terms, only 1 assignment had been graded. Slow to respond to messages, unless you privately email. Not recommended for working students. Must have a lot of free time to dedicate to this class

Took this class online this summer 2013. Its a WAC course but he makes you write (4) 4 -5 page papers, class discussions 1 page each plus you must respond to two classmates also one page each. The midterm and final are also writing assignments. He does not answer emails and takes forever to grade work because he gives more than he can handle.

Dr. Cory apparently knows a ton about Islamic studies. I'm in the middle of an online summer course, GenEd. Tons of writing, tons of reading - honestly pretty outrageous. I'm writing more in this freshman level intro course than I have in my two other WAC courses. He obviously can't give you a 100% on anything no matter how good. Would not suggest.

Tried taking his class online over the summer (12 weeks) and had to drop. He seems like a great professor. He was very involved and passionate about the subject. The reading assignments were way too much to handle, especially for an intro class. I might have been ok had this been my only class at the time. Discussion requirements also a bit much.

The man rocks and academia is all his life is about. He will kill you for not citing your work. Also, I took his REL 367 just for credits and I ended writting more in his class than I did in my core history majors. *He is also a history professors*.

Awesome professor. One of the gems of CSU. His reading assignments are too much, but you really do learn a lot from his class. He's crazy about writing assignments, his grading on them can be ridiculous, and he expects quotations with proper citations. He's a lot of work, but you will learn a lot from his class and might even have some fun too.
Dr. Cory is brilliant. He is by far one of the best professors I have ever had. He is nice to everyone even people who had stupid things to say. I highly recommend him for any student!

Professor Cory is very nice and helpful to all students. The reading materials is a bit much (even for religion). However, I think the idea behind assigning so much reading is so that students will at least try to read that much more than they usually would. I was impressed at the amount of knowledge he has about various religions.

He knew a lot about the subject matter, very open to discussions and debates (we even had scheduled debates) and the writing was not nearly as bad as I anticipated. If you are interested in learning about Islam/Judaism/Christianity it is really informative and field trips but there is quite a lot of reading

Cory's class was tough, but not impossible to get an A in. He is one of the most knowledgeable people I know, and yes there is a lot of reading! I only read about a fourth of the assignments though, and I got a C.

Lisa really was the best professor I had all semester, she is so caring and really cares about all of her students. she would always bring in candy and reassure all of us that we were doing a great job. take notes that will help on tests, she does give study guides which helps tremendously. overall, easy class and a great professor!

Lisa really was the best professor I had all semester, she is so caring and really cares about all of her students. she would always bring in candy and reassure all of us that we were doing a great job. take notes that will help on tests, she does give study guides which helps tremendously. overall, easy class and a great professor!

Prof Covington is the sweetest, she is truly passionate about what she is teaching and thoroughly enjoys teaching about religion. Practically no homework three easy exams. Projects take no longer than an hour. Easy grader and super understanding.

She is awesome, one of the best professors I have ever had. She has very good lectures easy grader, easy tests, very understanding, does take attendance but if you miss a few days no big deal. There are some assignments but super easy. Learned a ton about the different world religions.

DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME. she is the worst professor. Every week of this semester I had to email her in regards of our quiz bc her answers were wrong according to her powerpoints and the mandatory textbook. I have PLENTY of friends having the same issues. If you want to dedicate time correcting your ignorant prof take her class

This is my fourth graduate class with Dr. Cox. You will have to study in her classes, but if you pay attention in class, tests shouldnt be a problem. She is so funny and has a decently strong accent. She can sometimes be repetitive, but it slows down the pressure of keeping up with the important notes.

Dr. Cox is an excellent professor. She has a passion for anatomy and explains a very complex subject clearly. She will take the important information from the textbook and puts it all in powerpoint in a manner that makes it easier to understand. She is very professional and very personable as well. I highly recommend her.

Inherently hard class. She sometimes is confusing especially when you ask questions but she is always willing to help. If you can justify your answers on exams she will give you credit back. you can tell she wants her students to succeed but can still be confusing.
Made a class that's already hard and confusing even more difficult

This professor was VERY disorganized.  The course was online, and her responses to emails were sometimes slow, sometimes rude, and sometimes non-existent.  The material was easy, but the phrasing of questions was very confusing, and you had to fight with her to get back points.  Overall, one of the worst classes I've ever taken!

Professor cox was very enthusiastic.  We were able to use our notes for all of our tests because they were on BB; however, I was so well prepared from class that I rarely refered to my notes during a test.
I had Dr. Cox for 4 graduate courses.  She is energetic, passionate, knowledgeable, and engaging.  I felt well-prepared after each course.  I highly recommend her classes!

Not very hard material and workload. There are a few assignments weekly that are super quick and easy. The midterm and final was harder than anticipated and the questions are not clear at all and filled with errors which makes it hard to understand.

Not very hard material and workload. There are a few assignments weekly that are super quick and easy. The midterm and final was harder than anticipated and the questions are not clear at all and filled with errors which makes it hard to understand.

Prof. Crawley is an amazing professor. There are a reasonable number of assignments, and you are given a reasonable timeframe to complete them in. She returns grades promptly. I learned a lot about structuring worksite health programs during the Worksite Health Program course Prof. Crawley taught. I would recommend her as a teacher to any student.

Prof. Crawley is a great teacher. There are a reasonable number of assignments, and you are given a reasonable timeframe to complete them in. She returns grades promptly, and I always received high marks on my assignments. I would recommend her as a teacher to any student.

Overall great class and very informative. However be prepared to read and do weekly assignments. Assignments were fairly easy, and did allow for your own thoughts and opinions. The professor will work with you if you need assistance and also helps when needed. Great course!
Not a super easy class, but seriously an awesome professor. I would highly recommend her to anyone.
She gives out good material (powerpoints), has interesting class dicussionslectures, and is clear in her expectations and grading.
Best professor I have ever had. She's very caring and helpful.
She really doesn't seem to know much about Criminal Law. Had trouble answering many simple questions. Raging liberal as well.
I thought that she was a very fair grader and was very organized. She spends most of the time lecturing, if you enjoy that then you will enjoy this professor.
She is completely inept at answering off-the-cuff questions.  She cannot deviate from her prepared lecture, and she has a bad attitude in general.
Professor Crocker's class was more interesting than a lot of my other first year courses.

Men BEWARE!!! She is a Feminazi - she will ultimately stick it to you grade-wise if you are a hetero male. Her knowledge of rudimentary crim law was even more appaling, as on a regular basis she would  have to "get back" to students in the class who inquired on simple issues. AVIOD IF POSSIBLE (I sure couldn't - damn u NUSL!!!)
AWESOME... really cares about students learning and likes the subjects she teaches.
Took the class Fall 2012.  Group project and papers; Prof Crocker encouraged openness and honesty.  The class was very diverse, which led to some heated discussions that were well worth it.

Professor Crocker made the class fun by engaging the students.  We had a diverse group of students (an evening class).  There were weekly papers, but most were done in groups of 5 or 6, so this eased the assignment load.  All in all, a fun class. Would recommend!

Professor Crocker was engaging, encouraged open discussion, and made the class fun!  There was a lot of group work, so the weekly writing requirement was made easier.  My evening class was an interesting mix of diverse individuals, which enhanced the idea of the class.  Would recommend!!

I have never hated a class like this 1!Learned absolutly nothing, every class turned into people talking endlessly about nothing @ the teacher allowing it.She doesnt tell you how she grades,she doesnt get assignments back to you timely and as much writing as we had it should have been a WAC class. dont expect to learn anything about urban diversity

Very interesting guy to listen to. He just really knows how to deliver information. His lectures are engaging because he brings so many of his personal experiences to the classroom and integrates it  with the content. Always has a sound explanation to questions. Really brilliant man. He's a well of knowledge- field exp and reads plenty of books.
DC was a good professor and cared about his students and really knew the material.  If you go to class and study the power points you should be able to get a B.

D.C. Was one of the hardest teachers I have had at CSU, treats his 100 level course like a 300-400 level course, That being said - he is by far the best teacher I have ever had. The dude knows his stuff, He really cares about his class who is there and what is going on inside the class. Very helpful powerpoints that he puts on blackboard.

D.C. is the best teacher I have ever had!  If you get a chance to take a class with him, his tests are not that easy, but he actually cares about us and gives so much of his time to make sure we understand.  I got a B- on my midterm, but not because of him (I did not study that hard).  BTW - Great eye candy, but think he's engaged
She always took time to give each student feedback on drafts and explained things pretty well. She was always enthusiastic and excited to teach. It was refreshing to have a professor like her.
We had online quizzes for each module. 10 minutes to do 20 questions. This is completely unfair as this gives only 30ish seconds per question.

She is very knowledgeable and you will learn a lot, but she takes a while to respond to emails or sometimes just does not respond. This is a problem because it is an online class, so email is the only way to contact her. She also has a lot of content missing from her online courses so you have to regularly email her to upload things you need.

. The amount of homework and lectures is on another level, not to mention the tedious, impossible research we have to do. I am so lost. I have taken difficult courses but this is probably the worst one. Don't get me wrong she knows her stuff, but I personally am not going to school to study African Art and she acts like this is your major. Beware!

This professor seems like a nice lady but for an online summer class, youve got to be joking. She needs to understand that not every student can 100% dedicate their lives to know EVERYTHING about African art. The million hour long video lectures are ridiculous & the syllabus is legitimately a novel. I wish I could drop this class. Beware....

Be ready to listen to over 10-15+ hours worth of lectures per module. Most of the lectures are outdated- recorded in the early 2000's and more then half of the lectures are irrelevant in terms of what is needed for the test. Hard to decipher if this is a history course or visual literacy based on lecture rambles.

Took her African art class online, there is a lot of reading but the class is easy if you listen to her lectures and TAKE NOTES!! The notes will take you far. She is very understanding, I had a tragedy in the family and she was extremely understanding. She gave great feedback on my midterm, and dropped my lowest test!! Overall shes amazing!
