Coming from an A student, this is truly the most difficult course Ive ever taken. Extremely tough grader. Ive used all of the resources/tips given to study for the exams and still could not pass them. However, she does assign work to help boost & balance your final grade. If you dont want your gpa to be ruined, dont take this course.

She literally gives you every opportunity to pass this class with a good grade. Show up, do the minor online assignments, take the quizzes as many times as you want. It's a GenEd class and she has zero pretenses about it.

LOTS of reading on top of the research. Honestly, I spent a lot of time research obscure books and documents for the papers I had to write. However, she does help you find extra source material to read up on and is always ready to discuss your work and help you develop as a researcher, writer, and art historian. Just the right amount of challenging
The biggest thing lacking in this course is organization and clear instruction. Personally don't recommend.

This was the most lecture heavy, difficult to follow, and unorganized classes I've ever taken. You will need to dedicate approximately 15-20 hours a week to just this class. Very few people were able to follow what was going on, which is unfortunate. Take with a different professor.

She is one of the most genuine professors I've had in my four years as an undergrad. That being said expect to study hard for the tests. She does not give any study guides but does give a limit on what images may be used on tests. Flashcards are a must. Other than that it is a very laid back class other than test time.

The online class consists of modules which include several hour long videos and many pictures along with readings and an essay. My advice is to focus on the pictures alone to study for the quizzes. Then go back and find the pictures' descriptions in the videos to prepare for the exams (the exams are more like homework assignments you turn in later)

Professors who know their stuff try to impart as much as they can - thus, the long lectures, and high expectations for quantity and quality of work.  Go to class, do the H.W., take notes, and study images.  You will do well.  If you cant be bothered with attendance, long lectures, or the required investment of study time, choose another class.

Dr. Curnow is a very sweet lady and very knowledgeable on African Art, however, if you are not familiar on how to take art history courses, then you will have trouble.  She is rather scatterbrained and forgets to get to the point of why she shows each image.  The work is fairly regular for any 300-level art history course. But you MUST go to class!

She does not understand that not every student can dedicate their life to this course. For just 1 unit we have over 11 hours of videos plus blogs to write. Her quizzes and exams are extremely difficult and unclear. She gives terrible instructions and does not seem to realize not everyone already knows all the material. STAY AWAY!

I'll say right away that I was very interested in African Art prior to this course and I am an art major. This teacher is a nice person, however, I truly loathed this class. It was an overbearing amount of work. Cathy is very enthusiastic about the material and I appreciated that. But I believe her expectations were too high, even for an art major.

She's very nice, understanding, and helpful. With that being said her classes are AWFUL! She's all over the place, scatterbrained, and more interested in telling her life story than teaching. She's such an advocate for Africa that she forgets to actually teach!I feel like I wasted hours of my life along with thousands of dollars.

This has been an AWFUL course. The professor does not understand that African Art is not the centerfold of every student's life. She is not sympathetic, nor does she recognize students' honest efforts when they are not art majors, using the class for gen ed. She also needs to learn how to organize her 11pg syllabus to be comprehensible.

Dr. Curnow is a wonderfully caring and compassionate woman. The coursework is by no means a walk in the park. Her lectures include a massive amount of information for which you must pay close attention to. However, it is more important to her that you learn the material rather than fail. She works with you and is nothing but kind along the way!
Most helpful professor! Makes class interesting, though definitely have to be prepared and do the work.
Legal writing is boring, but this Professor is amazing.

I'm still taking this course, and it's quite frustrating as many students have told her that they have busy schedules. She'll claim she understands, but wants her 3-5 page essays due within 4 days. Now, if we didn't have busy schedules this wouldn't be a problem. along with that, she takes attendance although the lectures are 100% useless.
Professor DMello is very nice. She doesnt like for people to be absent too often, and she likes class participation. The assignments and tests are pretty simple.
Lectures are always pointless and the study guides never went with the test. I learned nothing all semester. She could be very rude at times as well.

Professor D'Mello was awesome. I wasn't truly interested in the class, since I was only taking the class for a Gen Ed. credit, but Professor D'Mello made it a lot more interesting. We were always talking about different cultural aspect to different societies. She always had a well prepared powerpoint, and shared lots of videos with the class
She doesn't actually teach any of the material, I only learned from doing the study guides before the exams.
Great person and caring

Not a great Journalism professor. I would not recommend her. Easy A, but she really doesn't know modern journalism. She doesn't understand that the journalism is primarily online now, not in newspapers. I did learn a little about AP style, but that's about it. Nothing about ethics or anything else I should've learned.

Dr. D'Mello is a very easy but also caring prof who wants to hear your opinion. Her class consists of very simple lectures, but the majority is her sharing links and videos about the real world that are related to what she's teaching. She's very kind and laid back. You WILL learn about East Asian culture; she knows what she's teaching.

Not very good at teaching. Most classes are spent figuring out what to take for a grade, or listening to her read an article and ask surface level questions. Due dates are either too soon to create anything of substance, or too fickle--often moved to the next class. Easy A, but please avoid. She's a better journalist than a professor.

She is amazing, helpful, friendly. If you have problems, she listens and try to help you, find a solution. She wants the students to love writing news articles. That's why she is not strict at all. Yes, she takes attendance. However, if you are not gonna be in class, all you need to do is letting her know. Easy A. Love her.

Prof. D'Mello is a wonderful person and a excellent professor.  She is  very concern with the success of the students.  I love how she brings all kinds of resources to the class to help with your success in her class as well as attending CSU. Yes,  attendance and partcipation are  important to her, I  would take another class with her. Easy "A"

Huge waste of time.  Attendance is taken, which is stupid, because we don't do anything useful in class. We watch Youtube videos and she reads articles she thinks are interesting.  Not a good professor; she doesn't know how to teach . You will not learn anything, but you will get an easy A.
He expects a lot from students, but gives real word examples and really wants students to succeed. I enjoyed his class.

I loved Mr. D' Orazio's class! He is one of the only professors I have had at CSU that genuinely cares about his students future. He is very knowledgeable about the topics discussed which makes the lectures more interesting. A lot of daily case study papers, but nothing extreme. Overall great guy and would definitely take him again.

Great professor, knows a lifetime of info abt Marketing. The tests are well-written in comparison to his lecture and he genuinely cares about the students that put effort into his class. Show up to class and engage in convo and you'll do well on the tests!

Professor D'Orazio is great. However, he is a tough grader and he truly gives you the grade you deserve. The man has so much experience in Marketing it's unbelievable. He relates class material to his own experiences which makes it easier to understand. Attendance is mandatory and a big part of your grade. BUY THE BOOK YOU WILL USE IT!

I loved Professor D'Orazio. He can be a little intemidiating at times, but thats just how he is. He gives a lot of work and he will challenge you. He will honestly give you the grade you deserve. If you are lazy and just want an easy A then switch to another professor. But if you are willing to learn and work hard then he is the best.
Takes too long to hand back papers. Doesn't grade papers based on your work. He doesn't lecture at a college level it was like high school.
Took weeks to get back papers. His lectures were a joke. I was expecting better from a college level professor.

(((((((TOO MANY PAPERS)))))), HE DOES NOT GIVE YOUR FEEDBACK IN THE EXAMS. HE GIVES GOOD GRADES TO THE STUDENTS THAT LIKES THE MOST. HE DOES NOT LIKE THE STUDENTS THAT COME LATE OR MISS CLASSES.I DID NOT LIKE THIS CLASS THAT ALL. I FELT LIKE HE STUDIES YOU THE WHOLE TIME YOU ARE IN CLASS.

I would say this class was pretty average. Professor D'Orazio definitely is very knowledgable on the topic of marketing. That being said, he is also very picky. Homework assignments are very easy and are done online. He does assign a few small projects that aren't too bad. Just make sure you study EVERYTHING because exams are tricky and lengthy.

Don't buy the book. Show up to class, I'm serious! And don't be late. He stares people down who are late. If you want an A on the exams I suggest literally memorizing his PowerPoint slides. Overall, good guy and knows what he is talking about.

i would not recommend this class with this teacher the tests are hard and not directly related to the material he presents in class. this teacher also has his favorite students if you are not one of them don't expect any respect from this teacher and he takes forever to get graded material back seriously its at least 3 weeks (DONT RECOMMEND)
Thoroughly explains everything, you really don't even need the book if you go to class. His tests are easy if you pay attention, do the quizzes and participate. He is very old school though!

J. D'Orazio is great. He has a lot of previous and current experience. He is very aware of current issues, trends, culture, business, etc. He knows his stuff and wants everyone to engage. I really respect him, understand the material, and find the assignments pretty easy to complete.
Avoid at all costs. Very poor instructor. Gives too much work and keeps cracking silly jokes

He is a really great teacher. Probably gave us (and himself) too much work. Most people did not like the class and couldn't wait for it to be over. However, if you do not study and read the material, you won't do well. That being said, participate in class and that will earn you some "bonus".
One of the greatest professors there is. If you show up to class, participate, and do the readings the class is easy. He truly cares about his students also.
Definitely a cool guy. He is a tough grader, but makes sure that you take something away from the class.  He is really helpful and personable.  Show up to class as he would really prefer you there.
Avoid if you have other classes or work. Bunch of work. You will get a good grade only if he likes you.

Jim's class is phenomenal, you'll learn real-world knowledge in a laid-back environment. On the flip side, he expects professional level work=unreasonable at times. Midterm and Final only, no tests. Bulk of grade from consulting plan. Overall, Jim's class=tons of new/usable knowledge, but bad for your GPA. Getting a B isn't too hard if you try.

D'Orazio is a fantastic guy with a true passion for marketing. He thrives off of students who are engaged and equally as passionate about learning. Attend class, participate, and really study for the tests and you should be fine. Definitely talk to him about internship opportunities; he wants nothing more than for his students to succeed.
Professor Daiker-Middaugh helped me through a really difficult time. She was amazing. CSU is lucky to have her.
I loved this class and this prof! Highly recommended.
Wonderful professor and great class.

LOVED Amy! By far one of the best professors at CSU. Kind woman with a spunky personality who truly cares about her students and their well-being. The material was clear and easily explained with PowerPoints in class. It's a shame she will not be returning to CSU, and she will be missed dearly. I highly recommend taking her if she does return.

Professor Dalessandro is an ok professor with an interesting subject. There are discussion postings and quizzes due every week. Then there is a midterm, a final, and a 10 pg term paper. Prepare to work hard.
class was easy. Learned basic principles. Dalisay was good, had great humor and review helped for tests!

Very nice, approachable, and clear. If you study for his tests, not much, but some, you can easily get an A in the class. And make sure you go to small group discussions, it's essential to get a passing grade
Good guy with a good heart.

I PRAY I get Dalisay again for another class. He is so funny and uses the class to interact with students to have them understand concepts. Gives great notes. If you go to class you will do fine on the test. Didn't use book, don't bother buying it. Very funny man, completely recommend.

Dr Dalisay is one of my favorite professors. Not because the material is easy, but because he is thorough and he sincerely cares about his students' success. Exams answers from lecture notes so make sure you attend class. Every Friday journals are due in a small group session where you participate in role play type activities. Highly recommend.

I no interest in COM101 but had to take it as a requirement. It ended up being my favorite class! Attend the lectures & do the reading & there is no reason not to get an A. Could do w/o the book and still pass, but an A grade pretty much requires the book. Very nice guy, willing to give extra help. Loves his job & wants his students to do well.
I'm not a comm major, but I thought his class was well organized and his lectures were informative.  He seems to like what he does.  He gave me some good advice.  I would recommend him.

Simple teacher, just do his study guide and you should be ok. He's a nice guy, be sure to go to class cause there's stuff in the notes that isn't on the study guides (he tells you what will be on the test). Also, every Friday we meet with teaching assistants for a group discussion. (EASY points)

I had him for 101 so I decided to take another class with him since he's a very easy professor. He's not the best professor but he uses a lot of media and takes his notes and exams straight from the book. Study his review sheet, and you'll be fine.

he was really helpful. he is nice to his students. not just for the class base, he was also a good life instructor. he has very good advises for me personally. also he is very knowladgeable and passionate about his lectures. i would reccomend him ton anyone who will take com 101 thank you

He was the first professor I had for my freshman year of college and I couldn't have been happier. He's very helpful and he seems like a really nice guy. He's very clear and seems to enjoy what he does. If you can, take a class with him. Can't go wrong.

Francis is a nice guy. He gives announcements and answers questions at the beginning of class before lecture. He seems to genuinely care about his students and gets everyone engaged in class discussions. His study guides were helpful. I would recommend him as a professor.

I LOVE this professor. He explained things so clearly and his study guides helped so much. I met him in his office a couple times and he helped me a lot, and he is very nice and you can talk to him about anything. he also has a good sense of humor.  Give the man a pay raise CSU.

He is very helpful, clear, and consistant. He gives announcements that are very helpful for those who easliy forget. He posts all study guides on BlackBoard, or any handouts. He is very great and easy to talk to. He tries to make things easier to understand and interesting. I like him very much.
Great class, great teacher.

Francis is very consistent. He gives announcements and outlines in the beginning of class before going over the lecture, and sticks to it. We had a lot of class discussions which made it easier to understand the information. And he made class even easier with study guides. I plan on taking him as much as I can.

This online class was harder than it had to be.  Any objections to methodology were met with "hey!  I'm not the bad guy" and "come to my office to discuss".  Throughout the class I wondered if my grade was going to be sabotaged as clarifications were not forthcoming.  The hard-to-understand directions were very frustrating.

Awesome Professor! Materials and assignments are well prepared and interesting.  Attend class, take notes, follow study guide and you're apt to do well on tests. Fair Grader. Take advantage of office hours, he's quite knowledgeable, willing to assist, and very much interested in his students succeeding.  Highly recommend.

I learned nothing, but common sense. Easy A, don't bother going to class! He threatens you material will be given in class, which won't be on study guide, but it's only worth 5 points. Easy skip class! Funny guy though.
Good Professor. Has a good sense of humor.

This web class was horrible-absolutely awful. There are 17 modules - all pre-recorded in 2017. He reviews case-by-case. You spend tons of hours reading . Then, on 2 addn'l days per week for 1 hr, you can meet with him online to ask questions. After a while, nobody, not even him, shows up for the weekly meetings. Take as a pass/fail. Terrible.

He was not a good teacher.  He didn't use the book at all, he didn't help students outside of class, he ignored student question, he would never finish a thought or rule of law.  Despite all of this, I did well, because I ignored him and taught myself.  His class was useless for me.  I don't like his style.  he tries to spoon feed, but again fails.
amusing classroom performance but doesn't teach. obviously just there for a paycheck
It doesn't get any better than this. Mickey D. is a rare talent and makes learning the law fun.
Anyone who doesn't like Mickey just doesn't get it and probably never will. For students who want a brilliant stand-up comic to really teach the law, he's the man.
Micky D. is about as good as it gets. You don't spend the class wondering where the ball is or learning useless information.

this guy doesn't teach anything, he replaced or old professor mid year and i thought i would never say these word but "i want professor Garlock back". Sure he may be entertaining and hilarious but that is not what i am paying for. I WOULD AT LEAST LIKE TO LEARN THE LAW
Has very little respect for students. Did not stick with the subject of law.  Although the text book was clear he quite often told us the text was wrong.
Davis is very smart.  Do as he says.  Very "black and white" in his answers.
No Comments
Great class! Hilarious professor.
I like Davis!  his class was fun and I feel like I learned a lot.  better than memorizing the UCC...

I love Mickey Davis!  Some people might get offended by his abrubt way of telling students how it is, but he's really effective.  He teaches the rules of law rather than focusing on every little fact of each case.  He is straight forward and very entertaining.  His exams are a little difficult.
davis is a great professor. Some people think that he just rambles on, but he teaches the real rules of law.
What a waste of life.  My life, ebbing away in his class.
Agree he's smarter than all of us combined.  Lectures are entertaining.  But, read the book and nutshells to get the actual law because he won't teach it.
Funny, but weird.  He certainly knows the in's and out's of IP law!  Only problem is he's more of the "let's write an amicus brief to the Supreme Court" type than a strictly classroom professor.

No professor is more entertaining than Mickey. Also, he presents the law in a clear manner, which is hardly the norm in law school. To the post who said Mickey loves himself: maybe, but he should. He's a genius, and hilarious to boot. My advice: take any class he's teaching.

No nonsense teacher. She is not going to coddle you, but she is accessible and fair. I enjoyed taking Torts with her. She doesn't pretend to know everything about how a result will turn out in Torts, she challenges you and walks through the possibilities. If you are someone who wants the "right" answers you better stick to math class.

Decent professor.  She was very clear and not to cryptic with what she wanted.  Her exam is more of an english paper then a law paper.  If you strength is in writing take her, if not you may want to avoid.  The exam was very easy which only leads to writing style and quality to seperate students.  Her grading distribuation was not kind to my class.

This professor demonstrates that she has absolutely no interest at all in the subject she teaches.  Her lack of interest is demonstrated by her lack of preparation.  For instance, this professor answered a great deal of questions with: "I don't know, that would be a terrific topic  for a law review article."
Excellent professor - accessible teaching style, interesting examples used... I'd definitely take Davis again. She's great.
unprepared for class, not helpful, rude to students
best professor i ever had really opened my eyes to tort law i recommend taking this class
Worst professor I have ever had- consistently unprepared for class and rude to students- enough said.
She was disrespectful to students, especially to male students.

Seems more interested in writing articles than teaching first years, but is willing to meet during office hours to discuss problems and questions and go over practice answers. Overall, a fair instructor.

The overall online class was not hard at all however make sure you read the syllabus several times. Unfortunately, I misunderstood her instructions on how discussions posted in class and missed many points.

Easy online summer class as far as workload. She weights the total points per assignment so even though I only missed two points, I got an A-. This was annoying. Also, she doesn't respond quickly to emails and actually never responded to a question I asked. She's kind of rude and doesn't seem to have a pleasant disposition.

Nice person that enjoys her job. Does not like to negotiate and takes it personally. Follows her plan like clock work. Expectations are clear and concise. Grade scale is a little tough. Class was hard to sit through because of loaded powerpoints that you don't need to do well in the class. Book is the savior.

Online class extremely easy. 1 Longer easy, about 7 page-long cases studies. Multiple choice quizzez, no exams. Discussion postings. Prof is helpful and grades fairly and easy. Do the assignments and youll have no trouble getting an A

She is particular with her syllabus, schedule and your attendance. Expect to read a great deal in order to participate in class discussion. If you have an evening class, she will leave a bit early because she gets sleepy about 7:30 PM. Do your best with your reports (support your arguments) because she reads everything and will comment.

I really like Pam. She is a great instructor. I would take her class again. She gives you so much information. Great information. You definitely have to show up to class to get the credit. She gives you time to take her exams and discussion board assignments. No multiple choice for her exams. Get ready to write.

I really like Pam. She is a great instructor. I would take her class again. She gives you so much information. Great information. You definitely have to show up to class to get the credit. She gives you time to take her exams and discussion board assignments. No multiple choice for her exams. Get ready to write.

Pam is absolutely a wonderful professor. She knows the material well. Her powerpoints are plentiful. Type notes on the slide and save them. She is difficult to take notes from because she moves through a huge amount of material.

Attendance is mandatory except for 2 excused absences. Pam is very knowledgeable and works full time in the topics that she teaches. Her assignments (mid-term, final) are take home, but do require a lot of time and effort using the textbooks and her powerpoints. Easy to do well if you go to class and take time with the assignments.

Very knowledgeable in the field and provides a lot of good insight. She inspires creative thinking that helps with the research paper she assigns. I learned a lot from her lectures, and while research papers are never fun, I learned a lot writing it as well.

I've taken a few classes taught by Pamela, and they've always been enjoyable. Pamela is really intelligent and bases her classes on critical-thinking and written response testing. Her methods require you to actually think about the subject, but it is incredibly helpful and, for the most part, very simple if you just do the work.
Great teacher, knows her stuff.  Lecture are interesting.  Gets a little bit jumbled during lectures but she works through it.  Throws a great deal of valuable information at you.

Lets just say this professor will really screw you on your grade. Whole time I thought I had a B in the class when really it was a C. Unfair. Dont miss a SINGLE assignment or your grade will suffer, only missed 2 little assignments the whole semester and got A C when i am an A student. way too harsh for a 100 level class when i just graduated.

Lets just say I avoided asking any questions because she was so rude about it. I took this class online and her tests were essay questions with little time. Extremely tough grader and she is extremely rude to her students. Provided 0 feedback on questions . Makes you feel dumb for asking for clarification on anything
Super petty . Mad at myself for taking her course considering I had plenty of other options to choose from. AVOID IF YOU CAN.

The homework for this online class was not difficult. The Mid-term and final are ridiculous for the online version of this class. She gives you 90 minutes to answer 5 200-800 word short essays. Its near impossible to provide good answers in the little time provided and I'm a good writer, spelling and grammar must be correct or points will be lost.

She is a tough grader. If you don't do all the discussion board posts you get a 0 (no partial credit). The case studies were a bit hard, but the mind taps are very easy. Overall, I world take er again.

One of the best professors I've had at CSU. She is very knowledgable on current events and knows what she is talking about. Her class may seem difficult at first, as she does not take late work and is a tough grader, but she is willing to work with students who put effort.
I took this class online Summer 2018. She provided excellent lecture videos and prepared you for the exams. I would recommend this professor.

Online class with 8 in class sessions. All you do in class is discuss cases that aren't related to the material. Gives participation points, but good luck getting them; you have to fight tooth and nail for her to call on you. Most weeks you have 2 chapters of assignments due, and the midterm and final are 10 chapters each. Paper criteria was vague.

She lectures about case studies during class but  none will actually be related to the exams. To do well on exams you have to read the book  and there are at least 9 chapters for the midterm and final. She's a  hard grader and it's not clear what she wants for the papers. If you don't speak during class you won't get any points for attendance.
Great teacher! Do what she asks of you and you'll be fine. Excellent at focusing on real world examples.

This professor was truly interested in what she was teaching. Every lecture was interesting and full of real life examples. Weekly homework but it is helpful towards the tests, (only two exams). One big project. Definitely recommend, she is awesome.

Donna really knows her stuff. She is worldly, experienced and willing to help students. She is no nonsense and hates to repeat herself. Work hard, pay attention and this beautiful lady will enlighten you.

Professor Davvison is one of a kind. She knows what she is talking about and would be more than happy to help you with any questions. 4 exams, multiple choice, and a long but fun marketing plan. Wish she taught more marketing courses! Pay attention to topics she talks about in class because they will be on the exams!

She can be intimidating at first but it's just her personality, she means well. 5 exams including the final but they're all MC so it isn't bad. The marketing plan project is lengthy but your effort will be worth it. Online HW is pretty easy so get the easy points. Overall a good professor.
She is a very good teacher. She knows her material and is very involved with the business world.

She's very knowledgeable and shows a great interest in the subject. She can seem a little intimidating at first but class is never boring and she's always available for help. She's a fair grader and she's really nice and helpful.

If this is your first class in the MBA (as it was mine), Donna can be kind of terrifying. However, once you get past her initial intimidation, learn from her anecdotes & experience. The slides and content are kind of boring, but she's extremely smart and extremely knowledgeable. She grades very fairly, and makes herself available to help.

Very knowledgable.  Make sure you attend class and pay attention.  There are 2 papers and a final exam.  Make sure you study power point slides for exam.  Papers are relatively easy if you follow the criteria she gives to you.  I would take her again.

Funny to read the negative reviews because not my experience or my class's experience in the least. Donna was straight forward with her expectations and made it clear she was there to help. She can be "brash" but she's just upfront, she might yell, but she gets over it. If you are having an issue with her, talk to her, and she works it out with you

Loved the class. She made it interesting by including real-world experience into the lectures. You get two case analyses to do: one if a group project; the other is an individual case study. You only get one exam; its comprehensive; its simple!
Had a lot of fun in her class she was very professional and easy to understand. Always went the extra mile to help her students succeed.

I love Dr.D. She is by far the best Professor I have ever had. This class is by no means easy but Dr.D makes it tolerable. She is very straight forward on her exams & what she expects you to know. Everything you need to know is talked about in lecture & on the Slides. Go to class & ask questions & you'll do great. PRACTICE PROBLEMS & ATTEND SI!!!

Arguably the best professor (or instructor, whatever) of Cleveland State University. OChem I and II with her were a great time, especially II. She's the real deal. She's nice and fair but not a pushover. She's busy too, so treat her with respect and she will do the same. People can be quick to be upset w/ her, but that's just Ochem, so suck it up.

Dr. De Paoli seems very knowledgeable in the course material, but does a very poor job teaching it to a class. A handful of chapters were skipped entirely in class, and we were told we would have to teach them to ourselves, due to time constraints. As a plus, she does teach her online class live, so that's nice.

I love Dr.D. She is by far the best Professor I have ever had. This class is by no means easy but Dr.D makes it tolerable. She is very straight forward on her exams & what she expects you to know. Everything you need to know is talked about in lecture & on the Slides. Go to class & ask questions & you'll do great. PRACTICE PROBLEMS & ATTEND SI!!!

The WORST teacher I have ever had. I know O chem is supposed to be hard but this class felt impossible to me. Her accent made it difficult to learn as well as she was never helpful when answering questions. She was straight rude to me because she doesn't know how to work BB so I couldn't find an assignment she had posted. Avoid her if you can.

Dr. D is a talented teacher who genuinely cares about students' learning; she is respectful and patient and makes you feel like your questions are valid. She adapted with flexibility and compassion to COVID conditions. She has a way of walking you through Ochem problems so you start to understand them intuitively - you just need to do the work!

- Thorough lectures - If you are struggling with material, she spends the extra time to help you - Material presented is relevant for MCAT and PCAT, and questions on exams are formatted to prepare you for the MCAT -Homework assignments for each chapter to help you stay on track - On occasion you have to learn material outside of class

she made us learn half of the material on our own & excepts us to understand it for the quizzes & exams. she makes it VERY CLEAR that there is no curve multiple times. there is 5 quizzes, 2 exams, & a bunch of HW that is only 20 points. exam was on lockdown but gave problems so she stopped using it & used zoom to monitor the exams. some EC offered

Dr. De Paoli is the best organic chemistry teacher I have had, she makes sure students understand the material on the slides before moving on. She is extremely understanding and supportive, I had to withdraw from her class because of personal issues and even after I withdrew, she still let me come to lectures, and would ask how I am doing.

Amazing professor. Ochem is a hard subject, and I feel that a lot of the negative reviews for her are based on people projecting their difficulty with the topic onto her; but as far as a professor for the course goes, there's none better at CSU. Incredibly kind, tests are fair as long as you keep up, and a good lecturer. What else could you want?

Accent is tough to understand and she can be slightly intimidating at first but Dr. D really does care about her students and wants to make sure that everyone is understanding the material. She tries to be as understanding toward her students as possible given the intensity of the material and really makes an attempt to answer every question.

She is the definition of a good professor. If you work hard it will pay off. She does a good job at understanding her students and takes the time to help students. She is one of the best professors Ive ever had. I Have so much respect for this professor! Also do a lot of practice problems.

Her accent can make lectures difficult. Tests have no curve, and when class average was 42%, she said we didn't study enough. Very sweet and caring if you go to her office hours, but be prepared to wait and hour or more in line outside her door. Don't lose hope if you do poorly on an exam, just meet with her! Buy supplemental textbooks!!

The material is hard, but De Paoli is an amazing professor and makes the class manageable. Pay attention in lecture and take notes on what she emphasizes. Study for the quizzes because the occasional bonus points help to boost your grade. She doesn't curve, but makes the exams fair- multiple choice that really tests your understanding of concepts.

3 exams + final and 11 quizzes. One exam and quiz are dropped. Pay attention in lecture and you'll be fine. The key is practice problems! She explains the material really well. Raise your hand if you don't understand something. The class isn't hard if you do the work. SI+tutoring are helpful. PAY ATTENTION TO WHAT SHE EMPHASIZES IN CLASS!

Dr. Depaoli is amazing. Shes tough, but pushes you to be an amazing student. You need to read the book and actually understand the concepts. Dont just memorize. Take notes from the book. Theres conceptual insight that can help with problems. Despite what people say, she cares so much. And NO she is not out to get you or anyone else in the class.

I should have gotten my Chemistry gen eds done at the community college because taking this course was actually a nightmare. She will wait until the night before a big exam to let you know what will be on it. Avoid if you can.

Doesn't curve and expects students to learn complex material in a short amount of time. Goodluck trying to see her for her office hours because her line is always long and she usually spends 30 minutes of her 60 minute office hour with one student and will rush through the rest. Heavy accent makes lectures hard to understand. Avoid if you can.

Quizzes every Thurs. which forces you to keep up with material. Attend lecture, she explains things in a way that makes more sense than teaching yourself. Use her resources: worksheets online, SI sessions, practice probs in the book. Doesn't give students nearly enough time to take quizzes so be sure to time yourself when doing problems at home.

Every week there is a quiz with 5-8 questions, usually 1 extra credit question. She is hard to get to outside of class because everyone goes to her office hours, but she really helps if you visit with questions. This class is HARD, but if you do the optional homework and use the textbook, you will pass.

Dr. D is a great Professor, she is always willing to help either in class or in your office. Her lectures can be a little hard to understand but she clarifies as lectures. Organic chem is definitely a hard subject and Dr. D is aware of that, And she tries her best to make sure you understand the material. I wish I took her the second time around.

This class was not great, to say the least. The lectures were interesting, but the exams were straight-up torture. Exams were all short answer/extended response, which is fine except they were impossible. You could write a novel answering the questions and it was never good enough. Would take off random points for no apparent reason as well.

I do not recommend this class at all. Your grade is based on 4 exams consisting of only essay questions. There is not a clear grading criterion. He purely grades based on HOW HE VIEWS your knowledge of the subject. However, no matter how much work you put in, you will never meet his standards. The averages for the exams were always in the 60s

Dr. Dean is very kind, but his lectures do not explain material enough. Exams are written responses, and he grades VERY TOUGH. Tell him what you know on the exams. You can gain back points by meeting in person and going over exams, which was more difficult to do. I would not recommend taking him even for as interesting as this class was.

HORRIBLE! all essay tests that ask about the smallest details in the book. gives you the option to meet for points back, but youll fail all the exams so it isnt really an option but a must to pass the course. no study guides or help towards whats on the test, so basically must know everything. if you take him, good luck. dont recommend at. all.

Excellent professor. Gives chances to make up for missed questions. Great lectures, most questions stem from discussions in class. If you go to class and read the book the class is fairly easy. I had him for animal bio as well and the class was structured the same.

Worst experience ever. Very smart but focuses only on finite details. Essay exams. Afterwards, you can meet with him to up your grade, but it involves one on one grilling for about 1-1.5 hours and it goes well into details you may not have learned from ppt's or the book. Get the online book for faster answer searching. All about membrane potential.

Some of these reviews had me a little apprehensive about class with Dr. Dean, but I found him to be one of the better ones out there. Very smart and interesting guy. Can be a tough grader, but for a 400 level class what do you expect? Gives great feedback, though his handwriting isn't the best. He's aware of it and will decipher if asked.

Dr. Dean is very intelligent and pretty laid back. He may sometimes come off as strict but is willing to work with you if you are a serious student and put in the time. Some of the assignments are repetitive, but overall his class definitely improves your scientific literacy and makes you a better scientific writer.

This was hands down the hardest class I have ever taken. For only two credits, he expects you to be at a scientific writing level of Ernest Hemingway. Takes points off for subject-verb distance, if he doesn't like the word you used, if he doesn't think a sentence is necessary, and if the sentences in your paragraph aren't in the "order" he wants.

Professor Dean is a very straightforward and honest professor.  I had a great time in his physiology and writing class.  He relates to the students well and will help you with material as long as you ask.

I took Dr. Dean for BIO 426526726 aka Neurobiology. This is a graduate undergrad COMBINED course. It is MEANT TO BE HARD. He is a very detailed professor who expects A LOT out of his students. If you are up to the challenge, then this course and prof is great. Don't expect any easy As. I aced his class (only undergrad to do so in fall14).

Knowledgable about writing but assignments are repetitive and don't pertain to the paper you have to write (made us underline nouns and circle verbs constantly). You have to show your work to other students. Waits until after assignment is due to tell you something important. Posts assignment 2 days before class. Always runs over 2 hour class time.

Claimed tests were multiple choice on syllabus but then told us in class they would be entirely short answeressay. Extremely critical on tests- wants explicit detail. Tests are also 6 pages  with only an hour to complete. 5 tests (including final) make up the grade. Comments on the graded tests illegible.

I am extremely frustrated by Dr. Dean. I had him for writing in Biology. Constantly went over time limit, repetitive exercises for no reason, was not helpful at all, and, worst of all, even if you did the best in the class, you still end up with a C. Unrealistic expectations for undergraduates. Do not recommend, keep clear.

I have no idea if these other reviewers had the same guy because the Jeff Dean i had was terrible. All the tests are short answer/essay for about 6 chps making it impossible to know all the info he's testing you on. No extra credit, always goes over class time limit, condescending if you dont know the answer, and NO study guides. dont take him!!!!!

At first, this seminar course with Dr. Dean seemed very tedious each week. However, by the end of the semester I was able to look back and see the vast improvement in my ability to review scientific articles. Dr. Dean gives great (and highly detailed) feedback and really puts a lot of effort into the course. I benefited greatly from this course.

Animal Behavior with Dr. Dean was a pretty interesting course. He likes to stay on track with the syllabus and will plow through a chapter each lecture, but it really doesn't feel too rushed. I enjoyed the discussions. Tests are short answer/essay and FYI he actually does read what you write so you had better know your stuff. Recommended class.
Funny.

She is very very nice and helpful. She is understanding and she's pretty chill. I liked her a lot. As long as you give effort in her class, you'll be fine. She likes those that make an effort.. I would definitely take her class again, wasn't too bad. Not too many papers. Just like 5 and they weren't too bad with her guidance. Please respect her.

The only thing you get graded on is your 4 papers and the portfolio at the end of the semester. She makes it clear what is to be in the papers so they're not hard to write and she loves to give A's. Very easy class.

Very nice and easy going professor! as long as you show effort and complete the easy essays she assigns you, you will receive A's. Sometimes class can be a little dull There is usually never assigned homework unless it is a reading. I would recommend this professor for everyone.

Very easy Eng102 professor. All you have to do is give effort on the papers and turn in on time and you receive an easy A. Doesn't want you to fail and always leaves nice little comments at the bottom of your essays. I stressed over every paper and received a 98% on every one. Cancelled class sometimes. Easy and sweet professor. YES TRY TO GET HER

She's really good at American Sign Language. After two semesters of taking her courses,. I'm completely fluent! That's how much effort and work you have to put into it. She's very kind and willing to help you achieve a good grade. There's a lot of memorization as there's well over 250 signs! Make sure your memory is excellent before signing up!

Wonderful professor. She is so enthusiastic and passionate about teaching sign to her students. She wants all of her students to succeed. A lot of memorization involved, but as long as you keep up you'll be fine. Rarely any homework and she gives out extra credit. Loved her class.

She is an excellent teacher. She knows sign language so well and is always entirely willing to help you if you need. Barely any homework, gives extra credit. Memorization can be tough, but she makes it really easy for you to succeed!

Very passionate about sign language. Good professor, but the class is hard because there's so much to learn. Barely any homework. Tests are easy if you keep up with the lessons and know the signs. Just go to class and pay attention, and you'll pass.

Awesome professor. Really loves Sign Language and enjoys teaching others about. Class is interesting...her teaching style is too. Very enthusiastic about the material. Attendence is mandatory only on the part of you actually wanting to learn or not. Tests are good as long as you practice!! That's a big thing...PRACTICE! Or you will do horrible!!
She was fairly helpful.

Fran is insanely enthusiastic about ASL.  Attendance is not mandatory, but you will need to keep up.  There isn't any daily homework or anything, but there are a lot of random things (quizzes, presentations, etc.)  She's fun and I liked the class but she didn't convert me to spending my life working with sign.

It was easy in the beginning but as you go on it gets a little tougher. She is pretty good at explaining things. She expects you to do well so pay attention. I missed 2 classes and felt like I missed weeks. Not a bad class.

Fran is very passionate about Sign language, and even though she knows that 90% of the people that take her class aren't gonna go on to pursue Sign anymore, she wants to pump you full of as much information as she can.  Her expectations are a little steep and she is a picky grader but none the less I really enjoyed having her as a teacher.
She is very understanding of a professor.  Alot of projects, test, quizes and homework.  She is very helpful and uses the book alot.  The final was hard as hell.

Expectations are high & somewhat unrealistic considering that you're not going to be fluent in ASL after 1 class. A LOT of work (quizzes, exams, presentations, projects). Sometimes grades with a fine-toothed comb. Interacting with other students required. She's fun and knowledgeable. If you're a SPH major, take her. If not, take someone else.
No Comments
No Comments

I think that Fran is one of the top two professors I have ever had. She was very helpful and extremely clear on what is was that we needed to know for her class. She is definitely the prof to chosse for American Sign Language.
OUTSTANDING Class! Prof DeCarlo is interesting, funny and full of information. The class is demanding but you walk away with incredible knowledge! One of the best classes I have ever taken!
Outstanding class! I learned a great deal this semester. Professor DeCarlo is a fair and enthusiastic instructor! I hope to take other classes he teaches.
Tough class, manageable but you need to stay on top of things. Tadz is very enthusiastic, fair and loves to teach. I learned a great deal this semester!
Great class! Great guy! Extremely helpful information...
He is outstanding! Great class in which I learn a tremendous amount of useful information.
Tadz is a great prof! He is funny, genuinely interested in his students, and very understanding. I learned a lot in his class and would take other classes he teaches!

Tadz is one of the best teachers. He cares so much about what he's teaching and about his students. He is so uplifting and inspiring. He does give a lot of work but its needed! Love Tadz and I hope I have more of his classes!!!
Heaviest workload and best professor I've ever had.

Decoulo is a really nice guy and happy to help when you need him. As long as you did the work and clearly put in the effort, you could pass his class. Oh, and participated in your group. Definitely show up and participate. He's very friendly, caring, and patient.
This has been the easiest class I've ever taken. Follow the directions and do the work and you'll get a 100%

Dr. Decoulo's online class was very easy, and it was extremely educational. He graded all the assignments quickly. Whenever I emailed him, he replied quickly and helped out tremendously. The only thing that was sort of a downer was having to make a PSA, but it was not difficult, just time consuming.

One of the best professors I have ever had. My friends and I call him "Dr. Dre" and he is totally okay with it. He's funny and one of the nicest people you could ever meet. His assignments are really fun and easy. One big project is making a film with a group. Would take this class again!

I took this class online. Easy A but he wasn't very good about keeping in touch with his students. I emailed him multiple times and received nothing back. One of the assignments had no drop box and it took 2 weeks for him to address the problem. I'm sure he's a good professor but in an online class you have to communicate regularly.
Definitely picks favorites, but this class was a lot of fun. Very easy and I skipped a few times. Overall grade was an A.

I love Decoulo, and would recommend him to anyone. This was a very interesting class. You do have to attend every class because all of the work you do is during the class period, but there is not any homework otherwise! All of our projects were things that we would actually do with children. Also- no textbook! He is such a nice guy.
This was an interesting class, fairly easy, no textbook required.

He is a great guy, and is helpful to teachers technologically, but more importantly, as people.  The Establishment has tarnished the essence of his nature; if he "let go" and just did what he believed, he would be remarkable.

All Dennis requires is that you show up and make an effort with the material assigned. He is extremely understanding, laid back and approachable with any type of problem you have. He is also flexible with turning in assignments past the due date. As long as you keep the lines of communication open, he will do what he can to help.
Really relaxed, laid-back professor. Approachable and nice. Love this guy. I'd take him again.
He the best
I TOOK THIS CLASS ONLINE IT WAS SO EASY EASY A GURANTEED AWESOME BEST PROFESSOR!!!!!
Good professor if you do the work you will get an A. Good guy,
He is the man! Do the work that is required and the A is easy. Great personality and always helpful.
Great professor, teaches future educators a lot about technology, even stuff they thought they already mastered.
Very easy going and helpful to students.

He is a great teacher an dhelpful. He is paptient especially when someone like me is illiterate in technology. He strives for excellence and gives you time to complete all assignments and if they get lost on blackboard he let's you resubmit it without an attitude.
Great teacher, took time and helped you.  Learned a lot in this class.  He kept the class fun, lot of hands on assignments.
LOVED this class and this educator!  He takes the time for every student's needs.  I hope to as good an educator.
One of the best professors Ive ever had. I wish all of my professors were like her.

This class is absolutely insane. The course load is ridiculous. This is a lower 200-level class and yet it requires more work than a 400-level Writing Across the Curriculum course. She expects far too much from you. Good luck

Prof. Deering is an excellent professor and person. She allowed me to register for the course when I explained it was a needed pre-req to graduate. The course was very interesting, as you learned about the history of dance. We learned how Africans enslaved in the  also U.S. were instrumental in originating today's popular dance. Take this course!
Helpful, articulate, experienced. She encourages your breakthroughs and meets you at your level. admirable ability to attend to the needs of a highly varied level class
Excellent dance instructor; only wants the best for her students.
she is changed my life in many ways and inspires you to express yourself through dance:)
This teacher is great. She is nice to her students and teaches you A LOT! She is a very skilled dancer. Nicest professor in the PE Dept.

You have 3 exams, a quiz for each chapter, questions to answer from Learnsmart (publisher) and 3 short essays to post on blackboard.  The syllabus is terrible!  I had to ask many times for clarification and then he responded with a ":)"  Sorry, I pay a lot of money for school and don't need your "humor" when I tell you your document is wrong.

He's gonna make you work hard. He really does care about his students and how they understand the subject. He teaches you to not worry about the grade your going to receive but instead understand the concepts and how to work hard. He's a unique teacher that truly has a passion for teaching. Take him if you want to learn.

Not a helpful professor at all. Material on quizzes is very different from what is gone over in class. Expects you to know how to use Excel, many people in my class (myself included) did not. Does not explain concepts completely and clearly, be prepared to teach yourself a lot of the material. Drops lowest grade on a quiz.

I learned a lot from Dr. De Groot and thought he was an excellent teacher.  He made slide presentations about the problem solving process and they were extremely helpful.  He makes you work hard but you will learn a lot.  I also really liked his sense of humor :)
well organized inflexible - two sides of the same coin.
Amazing professor !!
Amazing professor !!

Dr. DeGroot was wonderful! This was the first online class I have taken in my management major. I feel like I learned a lot and took away helpful resources from the course. There was a learnsmart and quiz for each chapter, midterm, final and then there were four discussion boards about a pressing topic from one of the chapters we had assignments on

Professor DeGroot is an excellent professor! I've taken him for several online classes and they're always the same format which makes it easy to work with as far as online classes go. He's a fair grader and gives great, uplifting feedback. It has a lot of work in the class, but it's not too terrible. I would take his classes again!

His bad handwriting on board to do problems every class = useless, not teaching any at all. Big problem: he has big discrimination on non-native English speaking students, underestimates their abilities, and often implies this as his so-called joke.  No need to attend the class as he just can write anything badly.

Everything he said was straight from the book because he taught STRAIGHT FROM THE BOOK everyday. No need to listen to lecture. Read book and takes notes on your own time. He's useless. lol. Nice guy but boring. Hideous laugh that wakes you up from your slumber. Takes attendance but doesn't record it or give you points. In other words, 4 no reason!
Do the homework, test prblems are just like them. Nice guy, laid back, easy class.
He is fine.  I could easily understand all straightforward problems but when it came to complicated problems, never since then.
ZUBETUBE FOREVER!!! LOL He is the best. If you want to get A, take Dr. Deissler. Everything is straight frwrd.
His explaination can be very confusing.  This course did not provide deeper information.
Tests were easy, only the most basic problems.  Follows the book exactly.  He can be a little confusing and doesn't answer questions very well but if you read the chapters everything is pretty clear.
He fairly grades the exams and he helps students in every way he can.
Studders and is so easy you can persuade him to give you a higher grade.  His tests are easy, and he is infatuated with his zubetube.

I don't understand the people that say he is a tough grader. He is more than fair! I've had him for 3 classes and he is a great professor. He really does care about his students and tries to help them in any way possible. Do the homeworks and you should be getting an A

I'm taking this class as a senior and I've had a couple of classes with him. Dr. Delatte is not a bad guy, he's not insulting, he genuinely will get out of his way to help students IF you show him you're hard working. He's not very clear but his notes help, if you do homework it's an easy A class. Expect to work hard, the lectures are very boring.
just do not take any classes with him if you don't have to.
Will lead you in the right direction, but won't give you the answer. 4 tests. Pop quizzes once a week (can't make them up if you miss). Group project worth 15%. LOTS OF READING AND NOTES

the rudest professor on the planet. very knowledgeable but expects you to be as interested in the subject as he is. attendance is mandatory there is a group project, pop quizzes, three midterms and final, and a lot of homework. you have to read and work really hard for your grade, he doesn't even give you an idea of what tests are like.
I found this class to be very easy. I showed up, paid attention, and read. It's as simple as that. But don't show up late you'll get chewed out.
no extra credit no study guide no practice exam. super rude when you talk to him in person. the class should be easy but he makes it very very difficult! would not recommend him at all.
he is a tough professor. need to do a lot of homework in his class. he do not give a extra credit, that's mean when you miss up in one exam ,you have no chance to fix it up.

Dr. Delgado was an engaging professor. Her assignment guidelines were clear. The course workload was very reasonable. The work allowed me to expand my understanding of nursing ethics. I would recommend Dr. Delgado to any student looking to engage in thoughtful discourse on nursing ethics.

Dr. Delgado was an engaging professor. Her assignment guidelines were clear. The course workload was very reasonable. The work allowed me to expand my understanding of nursing ethics. I would recommend Dr. Delgado to any student looking to engage in thoughtful discourse on nursing ethics.
She is a great online teacher to have! Gives you everything you need to pass and the assignments are very doable and easy. Can get the whole class done in 12 hours if you wanted.

She seems like she hates everyone. When I say "hi" to her when I walk past her, she looks like I offended her. She makes passive aggressive jokes that makes everyone uncomfortable. Sometimes she's a bit demeaning, so if you're sensitive or have anxiety, good luck. Doesn't write her own test so it's never on lecture material. I'd depend on the book.
Great Professor! I am excited to be in another one of her classes this upcoming semester! :)
Terrible experience. She is one of the worst instructors ever. Sub standard teacher, rude, and unprofessional. DO NOT TAKE HER!
She's not very understanding and not willing to help. Her assignment instructions aren't very clear. Take this course with another professor, you'll be happy that you did.
Terrible professor and always found a way to chip off points.

TERRIBLE PROFESSOR!!! She doesn't respond to emails in a timely manner and takes forever to grade assignments. She's very rude and not very helpful when I asked her for help. AVOID HER AT ALL COSTS!!!
I had Dr. DeMarco for the online portion of my Co-Op. I really enjoyed her. She gives great feedback and facilitates good conversation in discussion boards.

Jodi is amazing! I've never met her in person, yet, but she she seems really sweet and was a great professor. She is very passionate about her material and is very willing to help out.  AND the best part is that she responds to emails pretty quickly!

Assignment istructions were clear and she was always more than happy to help and very understanding. She grades fairly and offers feedback for improvement. She does take a while to respond to emails and grade work, but she is still a great proffesor.

She is a terrible professor. Despite very detailed posts, she always found ways to chip away at the points. Her delayed grading of the final assignment dropped my grade  took enough points away to keep me from a decent grade. She does not provide sound feedback or the chance to make constructive edits to the final paper. AVOID HER AT ALL COSTS!

Definitely within the top 3 best professors I have ever had. High reference to textbook but explains concepts in way that relates to real world healthcare system. Very knowledgeable and fair with regards to grading. Very positive attitude and great passion for health science. Definitely recommend as a professor!
Great professor. really cares about student success and is always willing to clarify information. This class taught me a lot about culture in the healthcare system.

Professor Deng is definitely a tough professor and makes you work for your grades. However, if you show up and put the effort in you'll definitely pass. A partner paper was assigned toward the end of the semester. Several presentations throughout the semester. The prof definitely knows his stuff and you'll likely learn alot in this class.

He's an easy grader in that, if you read and do the homework on time, he will make sure you get a good grade. Participating in class is important to him. He also takes attendance - never out loud though, so you won't know when he takes it. Very tough to understand the thick accent.

Sort of hard to understand what the professor was talking about due to his accent. Does not give homework., assigned two group projects which were not that bad and class participation is expected; he randomly calls on students. Test were multiple choice and we had a take home part of the test that was extended response in which he graded tough on.
He was a lot of fun and I loved having him for two of my classes this semester, always look forward to zoom calls in his class.
He was a lot of fun and I loved having him for two of my classes this semester, always look forward to zoom calls in his class.

He really is a true gem. He cares about his students and is very interactive with us. You dont really need the textbook unless you want extra information. He does take attendance and he also writes notes during class and doesnt put them online so either have a friend take them for you or attend class and get your points.

DENNY IS AN ANGEL SENT DOWN FROM HEAVEN BY GOD HIMSELF. He's great his love of films make you love it more. I would have gotten an A if it wasn't for the midterm which was hella hard. All you get graded on is midterm, essay, attendance, and final. easy to fall asleep during class but still great. I personally loved it.

Professor Denny is hands down the best professor I had at Cleveland State. I had him for Intro to Communications and Speech. He is one of the best people and professor you could ask for. I truly do not think I'd be graduating on time if it wasnt for his mind words of encouragement!
Great teacher. Amazing stories and lectures

Get ready to watch some seriously boring movies. If you can get past that then you'll be fine. There is only one paper throughout the whole course, but he's an easy grader. Make sure you prepare for the exams and show up because those are the only other things you're being graded on. As someone who hates history, this class wasn't that bad.

If you don't show up, don't expect to pass. We only had two assignments and the other grades were from exams and attendance. Even though the class is extremely long, it isn't completely unbearable. He tries his best to make it interesting and gives good feedback on papers. You can tell he's very passionate about what he teaches.

Denny is the most incredibly passionate and knowledgable professor I've had. His absolute love for film rubs off on you, making the class exciting. What could be a dry lecture course is made fun because of Denny's personality. He's just a great guy and I hope to have him again for future courses.

Denny is a great guy and a decent professor. His lectures are a bit heavy and there is a lot of information that is covered in this course, so be prepared to study. The class is very interesting and he takes the time to explain things to the best of his ability. The only grades we had were the midterm, final, a paper and extra credit.

James Denny for president 2020. The man, the myth, the legend. I wouldn't dream of missing this class. He is so excited about film and it's contagious. He left me fun facts about actors on an assignment I wrote. Don't bother with the textbook unless you usually need extra info aside from the notes he gives.

Professor Denny is everything a professor should be. He truly cares about his students and makes the lectures engaging. I had him for COM 101 took COM 242 the following year solely because I saw he was teaching it. He is the best professor in the COM department if not the university. He inspired me to be a COM major and never fails to make us laugh
Professor Denny was a wonderful professor. He gives great notes. I'll definitely recommend him to anyone.
Best professor I've had so far. Funny, understanding and an overall great person as far as I'm concerned.

Professor Denny is one of the most genuine professors I know. I learned so much more from him than just Public Speaking. Class mandatory, book not. take good notes and ask questions, even if they involve questions about JFK. :) 1000% would take one million classes with Denny. Built camaraderie between students and now I have three new best friends

Public speaking can be daunting, but Professor Denny made everyone feel comfortable. I did not buy the text book, but took good notes which was perfect for the relatively easy exams. The class is fun, because you get to peak in to peoples lives by listening to their speeches. On the last day of class professor Denny bought the whole class pizza!

I didn't need the book just go to class and that will be enough to understand the terms for the test. Another reason to go to class is because participation is part of your grade and there are impromptu speeches on randomly selected days that are worth 20points that you get just for doing it.
One of the best professors that out there.

Professor Denny needs to get a raise or something. He's the embodiment of what a professor should be, and the reason why I didn't drop out too. His grading/teaching criteria style is so genuine and amazing. Put the notes on index cards, trust me, I got that "A" just by doing that. No need for textbook either. Trust me, this guy is a role model man.

The "required" textbook is not necessary at all, don't bother buying it. If you just show up and take notes on the lecture and movies, this class is a breeze. One paper at the end of the semester that he outlines very clearly for you.

By far one of my favorite professors. He's big into freebie points - as long as you show up and put an effort into assignments you'll do fine. Gives extra credit. Goes through a LOT of vocab, but he's very good about telling you exactly what will be on tests (there's four). Uses a lot of humor/anecdotes to reinforce the material. Would take again!!

Prof. DeSantis is only prof I know who has made me cry during a lecture (in a good way). His legal process class is awesome and he is the backbone of LCOP. I can tell he wants to do more in his spring property class and honestly he is a better Prof than prof. Robertson which is saying a lot. Wish he was the lead teacher in that class!

Someone needs to clone this man! I have never had a teacher who could bring you to tears in a lecture just by being authentic and lovely. He cares more than anyone about your success and makes you care about it too! He goes the extra mile regarding feedback which is uncommon in law school. Desantis is the man!

Nick DeSantis is the best. He gives a lot of homework, but is very accessible outside of class and is always willing to help and look over your work with you even before it is due. You get what you put in with him. He gives AMAZING lectures and he's very caring about the success of his students.
Prof Desantis is always available to students.  Great guy!
There is no one at CM who cares more about students than Prof. DeSantis
This guy cares about his students. He works hard and expects you to as well. Really bad jokes but tries hard
really cares about students. goes above and beyond.

David is probably a nice guy outside class. In the classroom, he is very unhelpful. The class is 3 hours long, he takes unnecessarily long to explain the content. He is very unwilling to reiterate on an individual level after he explains so you need to pay attention. He does have a lot to share, but I would not recommend taking a class with him.

Strength of Materials lab. Usually papers are done by groups but if people don't pull their weight he'll make it an individual assignment and make it 1000 times harder. Doesn't like to give you help and will walk you around in circles and not give you information to understand it more clearly--it's really annoying.

The beginning of the semester was easy, but as it continued on he got less and less helpful and it got harder and harder. He's commutes from Indiana so don't expect help Friday-Sunday. Also one of his favorite quotes is "This is statics class not math class" when you ask to explain something. He also gets side tracked easily.
Severely hard grader, received little to no instruction andor help.
Don't take any classes with him. He is so terrible.
Don't recommended him, so keep out of him at all

Tests are difficult, but similar to homework problems. Usually there will be one very difficult question. When the whole class would bomb a question, I did notice he gave extra points. If you keep up, you can get an A or B.

this guy is something else... his exams are super hard and he doesnt give you enough time to finish. during an exam you cant ask any questions, he'll just tell you "make the best assumption". this guy is LAZY! he uses all his notes from pryer years and if you ask a question about them he'll most likely tell you "idk, its whats written on my notes"

Surveying class was ok, better due to instructor, his experience helps out a lot, the lap outside is awful though, depends weather, pay attention, take notes, do assignments, check off A or B for sure
don't expect an easy tests. don't know what to say about this guy. avoid if possible.

What can I say he was generally interested in the class, however he was very vague about what was on his tests. He is a smart guy but not the best at teaching. He loves the word "OK" and will say it about a thousand times a class. He often will give you a blank stare and expect you to understand what he is talking about. Avoid if possible
Super passionate about teaching and nursing. Awesome in clinical, just do what youre supposed to and youll get an A!
Super passionate about teaching and nursing. Awesome in clinical, just do what youre supposed to and youll get an A!

Prof. Deyo is an amazing nurse and very good at teaching. She is invested in her students, gives good constructive criticism, and is happy to help you in clinical. She is approachable and good at answering questions, too. Super kind. To get an A, just do the course work outlined in the syllabus and give it your all when you are in clinical.

I have taken 2 of professor Diamonds online nutrition classes and both were fantastic. She wants you to succeed and provides you with all the information you need. Her tests are based off lecture material. The flow and schedule of the class is great, if you are  organized you will be fine.
Very nice teacher...She doesnt take attendance. She's understanding and her class is extremely intresting if your a soc or crim major

very sweet lady and excellent biochem instructor. don't need book if you pay attention in lecture. exams arent easy but possible to do well if you study slides. Dibello cares about students getting to where they need to go. if you need a letter of rec or research, she's your girl. felt better prepared for mcat after her course.

she is the most amazing professor on this earth. not only does she treat all her students like her kids but she also is so helpful as a biochem teacher. she gives great advice and is very clear as to what she expects from her students. she doesn't take attendance but you're gonna want to attend from how amazing she is. :)

she was inconsiderate, unprofessional, has a bad attitude. Try to give excuses to deduct points from your grade. 5 exams altogether, not easy, only the 3rd or 4th exam was easy. She presents the movie moneyball, a good movie and that's pretty much it. She could improve on her teaching. Offer more extra credit!

Inconsiderate, her test were very hard. Even improving on each of my exams was not enough to get me a C. Literally, less than 1% away from a C in her class. Deducts point for coming in late on exam day, and gave little points for hwk. If you choose to have her, be prepare to work hard for your grade in there.
AVOID. AVOID. AVOID. Grade A+ Narcissist. Teaches and Grades as if she's teaching high level courses with graduate. AVOID.

5 exams and 1 final. Exams are worded very carefully and they are hard. You will have to study, pay attention in class, do the online homework AND show up to get a DECENT grade. She is a narcissist and doesn't care about excuses. Don't take this Professor if you aren't the dedicated student type.

Best Professor I've had at CSU so far! She is beyond intelligent in the topic of international business. I took her during the summer, with only 3 exams. I never missed a class and always took good notes. She doesn't try and trick you, what she says in class will be what's on the exam. I studied for a good 3-4 hours before each exam. Loves EC!

The GOOD: 1- She is very interesting and lovely. 2- Home works are easy 3- Usually offers extra credits with every test  The BAD: 1- Tests and quizzes are confusing and need more TIME You get anywhere from 4 to 5 multiple choice answers to every question, you have to answer around 47 questions or so in 55 minutes, and the answers can be confusing.

Christine is very smart and cares about her students. She will always help you if you ask questions and is very fair. We use an online homework website and homework is due every Saturday. Her lectures are the test and she has the lecture slides online to review before the test! Lots of extra credit opportunities! Super nice and wants you to succeed

She is a good professor and her classes are fairly simple and well laid out. But as a person she is awful to deal with. She does not tolerate any absences or make ups for any reason, no matter the situation or how far ahead you let her know. Incredibly rude and narcissistic, but ok teaching wise.

Go out of your way to take a class with her. She's been more of a mentor for me. She's amazing and willing to help if you show initiative. Teaches you real life skills and directs you in the right way to be successful. Her rich background in business is inspirational

Definitely a good professor to take. She is knowledgeable, passionate, and loves teaching. Her exams can be pretty difficult, but she does tell you exactly what to study for it. Just make sure you REALLY study what she tells you to. I enjoyed her lectures, she made the material interesting.

She is very passionate about what she teaches and its appreciated. Her reviews aren't helpful so don't rely on them usually she runs out of time. Sometimes I felt we were being treated like children, but its just her wanting you to succeed. The paper she assigns it seems like no big deal, but she rips it apart grading it so take it seriously.
Her lectures are amazing, very educational and inspirational. Would recommend her to everyone, and I wish she gave higher level courses.
She is one of the best professors Ive ever had. Always there to help and answer questions.

Great teacher and very helful. Tests are over the lecture notes which are on blackboard. A few class assignments will be given and will watch a film called money ball. 3-4 exams thorought semester. Study notes and you'll pass

She was fair and clear about what she expected and the tests were straight forward. Extra credit was given frequently. We used an online book software for homework and studying and even the extra credit and it included an online version of the book, making the textbook pointless. She's a nice person who wants students to do well. Highly recommend.

Great teacher. Gives clear lectures, without being cryptic, and lets you know exactly what material will be on exams. Has plenty of real life experience and qualifications to teach the class. She makes the lectures interesting with her sense of humor and ability to engage students. If you have the opportunity, take her class. You will be satisfied
Smoking hot teacher!! She is very helpful, knowledgeable in the subject. Just overall a good class to take because the teacher is just so wonderful and projects all the information with clarity.

A course by Christine is a course filled with value. Your Grade is made up of tests and in-class assignments. Bonuses are usually available as well. If you want to be prepared for the real world and gain valuable information, this course is for you. She has been there and back.

Great Teacher! Hopefully will have her again. I actually looked forward to Monday nights. Her expectations were straight forward, but she is also understanding when it comes to things happening outside of school. Recommend her for sure!

Work is not easy. You have to work moderately hard, and be there for class assignments, but she is a WONDERFUL professor and you will leave this course much smarter and more equipped for the business world.

Lectures cover everything you need to know, so they're great, but if you miss too much class, you'd better have someone to fill you in. She's a great teacher, passionate about what she teaches and very knowledgeable. I enjoyed the class and would definitely recommend her for art history.

There are three tests including the final. Memorize artist and dates. She grades tough on the papers you have to write so make sure you are specific. Doesn't keep you updated on your grades unless you email or go to office hours. Overall, I would not take this class again. A waste of my time.
