Extremely interesting and engaging course. She knows what she's talking about and is determined to help her students learn as well. Attendance to every lecture is essential for passing - admittedly I missed about 3 in a row but still studied for hours and received an A so not impossible. Much easier to attend every lecture and not be behind.

Very passionate about her subject. You must memorize paintings, titles, authors and dates. Extremely hard, but not impossible. Seems unapproachable, but that's her way of gaining students respect. Takes attendance every day and requires 2 trips to the Cleveland Museum of Art.

Most educated person I know. She definitely knows what she's talking about. Very passionate about art. A little tough on grading papers, but not terrible. Don't get the books; all test material is covered in class. Lectures are pretty interesting. Willing to help students who ask for it. Extra credit offered. Study in advance for her tests!!!

Class was not hard at all. Test were just(Artist, Title, and Date). The only thing to remember really is the title of the art piece and sometimes she would let you abbreviate, depending on the title length. The dates and artist are multiple choice  which makes remembering those 50+ art pieces a breeze. Just study the pieces and you should be fine.

Easy. Could only fail if you don't go/study. She DOES give a lot of art pieces to "memorize" (date, artist, title) but the only part you HAVE to memorize are titles...the artists and dates are multiple choice, and 1-2 of the choices are often absurdly easy to eliminate. Lots of bonus. Pretty friendly. Barely uses textbook. All around good teacher

I personally thought the lectures were very boring but then again I am not very interested in art history and 2 hours is a long time to sit and listen to someone talk about art. Just study for the exams and write your papers and you'll be fine
Very smart professor who will make sure you understand everything. Show up to class, study the slide lists and vocab, write your papers, and you will do great

Hands down the best art history teacher I have ever had. Extremely intelligent and definitely passionate about subject matter. Doesn't teach from her point view or opinions on art.Simply a wonderful professor. I recommend everyone take her.
She is very passionate about Art History and her class is both enjoyable and informative. 10/10, would take her class again.

This teacher isnt as hard as everyone makes it like, I was worried when reading all these comments but it was a fun easy class. Memorize the dates, titles, and the pictures of art. What I did to help me was cut them out into flashcards from her powerpoints. Just pay attention to her lectures mandatory attendance, she tells you whats on the tests!:)

Easily the best Art History teacher that I have ever had. She is very knowledgeable and very enthusiastic in her courses. I have had her multiple times and have love each class. She is very fair at grading but be prepared to read a lot and attendance is mandatory. As long as you do the readings and show up for class you're in for a great semester.
Other than such a high percent of our grade being dedicated to attendance she is awesome. Extremely fair at grading. Really enthusiastic about art history so she makes it more interesting.
Great job!

Teaches from Powerpoint, but was still not bored with the class.  Allowed to miss 4 classes without penalty and class participation is a big part of your grade which made for an engaging classroom setting while padding your grade at the same time. One of my favorite professors I've ever taken. Test were easy as long as you followed along.

Very helpful and an extremely smart woman. The two assignments are surprisngly helpful and makes the terms/concepts understandable. I enjoyed the guest speakers. Overall a great class! Would defintely take her again!
Her class was always very interesting. Only had a few assignments but they really helped tie all the material we learned together.

I can't speak much to her personality, as the course did not meet at regular times and only consisted of prerecorded lectures. Material, while dry, was taught effectively. The only grades are the three tests, which are open book. Easy if you don't blow it off.
If you do the homework you will be fine on the Exams, many mimic homework questions. I think she just had a bad transition to the online space, making the lectures very bad.

Her grading policy is god awful. Only tests are graded, with no curve. They are multiple choice, with a "None of the Above" on all of them. It's a very unfair system. That being said, I really love her teaching style. She goes through every step, which is redundant but helpful for people who need it. Test questions are HW and class examples.

In this class we were only graded on 4 exams each 25% of the grade. A quarter of all answers on the exams are "none of the above." She does not grade homework, will not except scratch work, and does not curve. I went to office hours to try and talk to her about a bad test grade and she would not help me instead she said "Just study more." AVOID HER

I can't speak much to her personality, as the course did not meet at regular times and only consisted of prerecorded lectures. Material, while dry, was taught effectively. The only grades are the three tests, which are open book. Easy if you don't blow it off.

Dimov's teaching style is different from the standard at CSU, but she does a good job. Class will be find as long as you follow her rules, especially the cell phone rules. her tests aren't super difficult, and if you don't understand in class her lecture follows the textbook closely so you can read that. The homework is very close to the test.

Professor Dimov is an expert at engineering economy, unlike when she taught dynamics. She makes the topic so easy to understand. Definitely get the textbook; the tests are open book. The group project is really easy as long as it looks like you put time into it. Definitely try to take her for engineering economy.
Worst Professor in my entire life in school.

At first, I heard my friends telling how they had hard times with Dr Dimov during Fall/Spring semesters. I took her class in the Summer and it surprisingly turned out well. Notes are posted on blackboard and homework are optional to help you prepare for test. You still need the book. So, either she improved or the class was made easier in summer.

Tests heavy, no enough time for the test, Tough grader , No Online notes and you will never feel comfortable to ask her a question. Most rough professor I have ever seen during 4 years. AVOID TAKING ANY COURSE WITH HER. SERIOUSLY

Avoid if possible. Her exams are near impossible, but she does let you use your book, so you can bs your way through an answer. Remember to write down units and box your answers because if you dont thats 20% of your grade. Go to class and do the homework. Shes not very approachable. She does not like when students go to her during office hours.

I ended up withdrawing halfway, and thank god. Best decision ever. She is unapproachable, has own lecture notes that she doesn't post online. No full class periods for tests. And test questions are challenging. Open book, but it was of no use. Her office hours are a waste. She will either insult you or give a poor explanation. if possible, avoid!
rough

Mina Dimov presents the material very clearly in lectures. The tests can be hard; she chooses problems from the in-class examples AND the optional homework, which of course no one does. I would advise you to do the homework that's optional as it will greatly enhance your odds of doing well on the tests.

Dr. Dimov, is in fact just a grumpy woman who lacks compassion. She gets irritated when she is questioned in any way and is honestly unapproachable. I would never take a class again with her. I think she lacks some basic human elements.

Dr. Dimov is a great teacher. Her lectures are very well done. When ever I did have a question she did a good job at explaining away the problem. Sometimes it'd be a few days later and she would come back with a new example to help me better understand. She does have a strict no phones policy.

She gives one hour for a test that has 4 questions, that really need about 30 minutes each even with copious practice beforehand. Tests are open text book, and all information is free game within the text only. she constantly yells about phones in lecture, and gets very defensive if you ask any form of question.

Great professor who gives clear lectures. Exams are open book and the final exam was open note so you really should have done better than I did on the exams. Homework is optional so all grades are on exams and quizzes. She is very friendly and listens to students. I would definitely recommend for ESC 211. If you want a 3.0 GPA, you need an 85%.

Professor. Dipko seems like he actually cares about his students. He's very understanding but can also be stickler, so be sure to complete assignments on time. Assignments can be lengthy in the beginning.

While 311 is a challenging class, Dipko does his best to explain concepts in an understandable format and gives real-world value throughout the semester. More coding in class would have been nice, but the assignments were very manageable. Tests were not too bad either provided that you studied.

This professor does an awful job of teaching this class! He mainly just lectures the entire class time. You only have 6 lab assignments (homework) in which he grades really tough. He does not do live code with you, which was really helpful in the previous course (IST 211). Only 2 Exams and he doesn't give good reviews for them.
Very knowledgeable professor. Very tough objective tests. Need to read if you wish to pass.

He was very incommunicative and never replied to emails/calls. I emailed him all semester and finally received a response the last week of the semester when his reply was null and void. His class is made up of 3 case analysis and a simulation. All of which he gives no feedback on and when grading doesn't explain his grading

Lectures were disorganized and not informative. But expect to be graded on participation. He gives unclear feedback on your papers as following the book and his suggestions lowered our grade. You will work in the same group all semester. So if you have dead weight in your group, be ready to write the group papers on your own.
Very knowledgeable professor. Very tough objective tests. Need to read if you wish to pass.
Lectures are long and boring. He is a really nice person but not a good professor. He doesn't really teach the class... but he is the only option for MKT431 at CSU.
avoid this professor at all costs
No structure to the class. He says hes going to put up work and it takes him two days before the due date to put up any form of direction
Covered marketing principles, marketing plan, several case studies and presentations. Exams are case based. Nice guy and very knowledgeable.

He is a very understanding, empathetic, knowledgeable professor. He always has very interesting stories and jokes, I highly recommend him. As long as you pay close attention in class, study and memorize his materials, and seriously prep for exams you will ace this class

Awesome and highly knowledgeable. Is a bit vague regarding project, however, did provide a good rubric for the later assignment. Attendance is mandatory and lectures and tests are derived from the book. Overall a very interesting course and learned a lot. Will take this professor again as goes in-depth in marketing research. Project was very good.

The guy is personable enough, however the class was boring. The exams are many chapters, but they're straight from the test banks online/ via quizlet. The group projects were vague, and thus stressful, but he grades those generously. Avoid him if you want an easy A or quality education.

He's a nice guy but is extremely unclear about what he wants for your projects or paper. You get a midterm and final about 9-10 chapters each. Very boring monotone lectures from slides. To do well you will need to read. He doesn't tell you whats on the exams. Lots of projects and papers.

Worst professor I have ever had in my entire career at CSU. Too many assignments with very little direction. Questions are vague and his grading is unpredictable. I took this class as an elective and it was the worst decision.

Never Again. Constantly changes requirements for papers. He is lenient, but the extra stress and worry doing the papers is ridiculous. Lectures are super boring. You'd be better off just reading the book while he lectures. Worst professor of my entire academic career.

Two individual papers and one group project. Two exams and possible extra credit. All and all he's a good professor. Very knowledgeable subject and is helpful, at times he can be vague on what he wants.
Good professor, do your work and you will be fine.  Assignments are long but very helpful.
What a professor!

It's not the worst class, but it could've been better. Two exams on campus, two assignments, but one was given to us at the last minute. At times he's vague in his explanations and doesn't give feedback on assignments. He didn't even post the grade for our final on blackboard.
The class took a 180 from the first day of the semester. I wish it was offered in a lecture setting as well.

I took this class online, at times he's vague on what he wants. Wasted money on one book and the program didn't even work. We were supposed to have an online lecture never happened.  The final exam was supposed to be scheduled on a Thursday evening, but was changed to the following day little notice was given.

Avoid at all costs!  NEVER responds to BB or emails. Does not give any explanations or feedback. 2 books required. 1 with outdated material. 1 with advanced material. Gives a 12 hour window to take quizzes. Takes 3-4 weeks to return grades. 2 exams held on campus (it was an online class).  Changed format of both exams a few hours before each began.

She worked really hard to make sure everyone did their best work. She helped me a lot more than any other teacher I've had. She expected the best from me, but helped me understand how to do it first so I could.

She's an AMAZING teacher. She's really helpful.We had quizzes every week, but they were really simple. We had to write a journal twice a week, easy points.And only 4 papers that we had to write then conferences after the rough draft was due. I highly recommend her, she helped me become a better writer.

Professor Dobbs really worked with everyone to try to help them. She was always available to ask questions to and run ideas by her. She made a class that could have been super boring fun because she was funny and had a lot of energy. She wanted everyone to do their best possible work.
Our class was early in the morning but fun. Professor Dobbs really cared about helping all of us do well and she went out of her way to help. I really liked her and would recommend her.
Im in an online class with him and hes very confused also is making us do a group project during COVID-19. Assigns things but blackboard isnt set up properly so we cant submit assignments.

Nice guy, but has no business teaching full time. He seems distracted and uninterested in teaching and doesn't have a clear syllabus and changes assignments and grading on a whim. Highly disappointing class and it was almost impossible to determine my grade because he doesn't update blackboard and seems to hand out grades arbitrarily.

Professor , doesn't care about his students , has no mercy for anyone, takes forever to respond to emails and will make you wait and  respond with useless  information. That's if he even reads it or he might ignore you like me.  I missed an exam and he would not show the slightest mercy not even an extra credit or anything to help boost grade.

Incredible professor. Only negative is that he is awful at emailing back so ask your questions in class. Hmwk was easy. Project is worth about half of your grade; it is a group project assessing an existing company and giving recommendations. We strayed from the syllabus which can get confusing but if you dont understand when something is due, ask.

I have never submitted reviews to this website before because I typically think students overreact when describing their professors. However, I can safely say this was the worst class I took in all six years of higher education. Haughty, unprepared, unclear expectations, condescending, and inconsistent are just some of the adjectives I would use
He's very unorganized, doesn't give students a clear guidance. This is confusing class. So bad it has 4 credit hours with this poor teaching.

Never prepared. Changes direction midstream on every project. We had half the time of other classes to complete a HUGE project-our capstone. But we spent 6 or 7 weeks on submitting to contests, guessing so he gets credit for it among his peers. If you want to learn something, don't take him. I got nothing from this and am disappointed by that.
I have never commented on a professor before, but this was a bad experience. The lack of organization was aweful and it made this class a joke.

Never take a class w/ this guy. Constantly unprepared. Never answers emails. Promises extra credit that we never got. I dropped a letter grade because our last assignment (peer evaluation...not even an assignment) worth 10% of grade, was available for <24 hrs online only. I couldn't complete it and he basically told me I was screwed. Nice guy, huh?

Professor Dobeck is awesome! Very knowledgeable about the business world. Always share his experiences with students, plus he has a great sense of humor.  I won't have an "A" in his class, but I have been learnig so much so its worth it.I highly recommend his class.
He was a great professor, he is highly knowledgeable, out of the other MBA 660 profs I have heard he is the best. Open note tests, and he gives plenty of time to work on capstone project.
Best class I ever had. I took it last summer and the project was well organized and helpful in preparing me for a job in the real world. Professor Dobeck is very competent and helped me a lot.
highly knowledgeable and skilled
Avoid at ALL costs. This Dobeck was terrible. 50 page paper in 2 weeks. Impossible A

This is the worst professor I have ever had. If you have ANY OTHER OPTION, avoid him. He will not grade you fairly, he will treat you like a child, he will change the assignment specifications EVERY CLASS! Your life will be so much better if you can avoid taking his class. Trust me, you will not learn anything in his class.

He's terrible, no other words to describe it. He treats graduate students like 2nd graders, and has no respect for anyone. He talks about "professionalism", but consistently shows up to class late and unprepared. Oh, and good luck with the project. He provides no guidance, his requirements are vague, and he will add on stuff at the last moment.

This professor seemed like he would be extremely hard at first, but he hasn't been so far.  I enjoy his class because we talk about current events and we're not forced to read the book.  We also have "quizzes" at the beginning of the class, to be used as study guides for our exam.  They are not graded!  I like the guy...

not that anyone of you readers have a choice cuz in CSU he is the only prof to teach(torment) that class. he is bitter and sarcastic if you ask him something. the work load is horribly hard and his rudeness makes it even harder. he would not even respond to your email and refuses to even acknowledge that he got the email.

The worst professor I have EVER had.  Mean, Sarcastic, RUDE, unclear...HORRIBLE!!! He treats graduate students like 6th graders, yet can't manage to be clear in his syllabus or expectations.  He is a pure waste of his intelligence and experience due to a cocky attitude and need to belittle students.

Not good with financial ratios.   Gave very unclear instructions about final project.  About to burst into a fit but holds it in on a regular basis if someone interrupts or seems smarter than him.  Not recommended.
Test are very hard but he does give a curve on them

Dr. Doerder taught my genetics class for half of the semester and he is a very interesting guy and very intelligent on the topic. He is a great professor and very willing to help. Only thing I can say about him is that I was amazed at how difficult he made our first exam. He did curve and I landed an A-. Overall not terrible. Worth taking

Doerder is super passionate about biology, which makes class interesting. His lectures feel LONG, but he's incredibly intelligent and cares about every word. Attendance is not mandatory, but definitely recommended. I didn't even get the textbook- tests were straight from the notes and occasionally the lecture.

Dr. Doerder is certainly highly expectant of students, but he goes out of his way to cover the necessary material as exhaustively as possible. His tests, (conjointly written with other BIO teachers), are similarly exhaustive, but he outlines all the important information and summarizes key testing points well.

Doerder is tough, but he is a great teacher. He's teaching a college level Bio course to  COLLEGE students (some people forget that). His exams are difficult, but he gives you all of the tools you need to succeed. Don't take these biology courses with more than two (maybe three) other courses because it requires a lot of time to prepare.

CSU's BIO 202 was undoubtedly one of the hardest classes I've ever taken, but Doerder was probably one of the best professors I've ever had. He always addressed class and subject issues and attempted to aptly address confusing concepts. Together with Dr. Gibson, his knowledge helped me learn more than I ever have for any other subject.

This class is nearly impossible. My best advice would be to take easy classes along with this one so you can completely focus on this class. This is not a class you can just study for the night before you need weeks to study. It's an overload of information and 10 answer choices for each question. Doerders test was the hardest for me.

the class is not easy and a lot of material is thrown at you but it is very interesting until it gets to evolution. His power points are unclear so attendance for taking notes is VERY important. His exams are tough to test your level of understanding. he gets too excited about what he teaches. i recommend going to class and write down what he says.
His lectures are incredibly disjointed. He is all over the place. Also, his Power Point presentations are unclear and do a terrible job explaining the material. Tough class, but an interesting one.

Dr. Doerder is a respectable and very understanding teacher. He knows his material. Tests are difficult, and yes, this is a weed out class...and thank God too because if you can't manage to learn how to study and do well in an intro level Bio class, you probably shouldn't be trying to go pre-med. Stick to business school losers. Work hard, do well

I liked his teaching style way better than the other two professors. His tests are super hard though! The only reason I recieved and A on his test was becuase a lot of people failed it and it was a huge curve! :)

Pretty interesting material, but far too much to squeeze into one course. The lab were awful and I really didn't get much from them. Dr. D is a very intelligent man and really loves biology. I despise, absolutely abhor the powerpoint 'run-throughs' he does. Basically just read the powerpoints a hundred times over and go to SLA.
This Class is a typical weed out.What makes it unbareable is the arrogance thses teachers carry.I guess we haven't evolved to to their level.They are more like social darwinist than biologist.

Took bio 200/202 with him. Talks to much. goes off subject. exams are: QUESTION:
 A. ONE
 B. TWO
 C. THREE
 D. A & B
 E. A & C
 F. C & B
 G. A & B & C
 YOU GET THE IDEA :(

This intro course for Bio majors is ridiculously difficult.  Exams have 20 point curves.  It's a weed-out class.  More like a Bio 400 level with amount of info covered weekly and 50 minute exams with 60 mult choice questions ABCDEF.  He might be a competent prof but how would you know in this class b/c you have to memorize 6 chapters a week...

WAC class. He was very nice and not too demanding.....he did give us hw each week when we shoulda just been working on the paper that the class is designated for to write. When I thought I was going to have to drop cuz of my workload he suggested an incomplete and helped me to complete the paper over the summer and still graded fairly. Got an A-

4 exams with lowest grade dropped.  The exams cover a lot! of material and are detailed and consist of all fill in the blank and short answer no mulitple choice and are therefore very hard he is passionate about the subject and his lectures are interesting.

He is a nice guy but tests are insane, even makes the simple questions hard. It's next to impossible to get an A or B before the curve you must study every day to do well in this class. The book might be the only thing that gets you through. WEED OUT CLASS! Good Luck!

Extremely helpful. The people who complained that he isn't helpful never sought his help. He has an open door policy and will even help you in the hallway. He always answers questions in class, and really gets into concepts. By far one of the best and most knowledgeable bio professors. tests may be hard but its an upper lvl course, deal with it!

Dr. Doerder is a great lecturer.  He has a way of presenting material that is very engaging, i loved his lectures!  His test questions are straightforward...  no tricks or word games, you either know it or you don't.   This is a hard class, mostly because the amount of material covered is huge.
Clear and concise. Enthusiastic about material. Prepares students well for exams.
Definitely a great teacher.  Willing to help and is constantly making sure everyone understands.  She does give a bit of work and I wouldn't say it was easy, but a good class is never easy.
Really knows her economics, very energetic and iteractive, very good teacher, very reasonable grading. offers lots of materials for the class. Very very easy A if you put in some effort.
Nice teacher.  Give lots of examples.  Test are VERY HARD. Even master level students had a hard time tutoring me on her exams.  Overall, take it with someone else if you can!
hard topic, lot of concept, makes you think, extremely helpful, gives tons of examples, very clear and structural explanations, gives you clear directions what she expects!
excellent teaching, with clear and structural explanation, tons of examples and lot of help.
great teacher!!!

She really knows her stuff. Makes class interesting with real-world examples, and the online program used for homework is great. This class really helped me understand the subject of economics, and anyone who struggles with the subject should take her class.
shes pretty funny and her lectures are interesting. the class was pretty easy.

She keeps the class interested.   You may get away with not using the book, she relies on web-based homework/textbook to save you money. Online homework can be annoying if you don't keep up with it.  She is funny and really tries to help if you ask.

I do not know if you will learn the course material or not, but I am sure you will learn how to procrastinate. He didn't have a clue about course material and kept saying that he is going to give a quiz, but never did. We only had 2 HWs, 1 midterm and 1 final in entire class. I didn't learn anything and still got an A.

For the entire course, we have only had 2 assignments, a midterm and a final exam.  Today is the day of the final and I have yet to receive grades for either assignments or the midterm (which we took 2 months ago), so I have no idea what my grade is going into the final.  I would say go with a diff. prof. but CSU's CIS department is notoriously bad

This guy is hilarious! Learned from him one guy just walked out of the class he was so bored. LMAO! Easy class if you do the work. Open book tests and quizzes. Does pop quizzes so need to attend the classes. Always avail to help. I got an A. He isn't the best at returning homework and tests. But I'd take him again. Learned alot. Thanks Dr Doleh

Very dry lectures. The PowerPoints are just Figure images from the book. "Some guy was so bored, he left." -Yaser Doleh, with perfect comedic timing.  His assignments are written with barebones grammar and punctuation, effectively increasing their difficulty. The tests aren't bad if you read the book. He is a nice person.
Very helpful. Best professor. Very humble. Does not judge you.
One of the best professor. His exams and quizzes are straight forward. I recommend him for easy A.
One of the best CIS professor. Easy A.

Easy class , tests open book, I learned a lot( it think) , slow at passing back quize. I have found out no programmer can efficiently communicate with humans...  but still if you read the book and read online it will be ok. Easy to get an A , but I think its more important to learn it than just get a good grade.

Take this professor only if you already know how to program. Only reads off of power point lectures and not very engaging. Very bad at grading and passing back quizzes and homework so it is hard to gauge how you are doing in the class. Class is not very hard to pass, tests are open book, but you'll have to teach it to yourself.
Good teacher, he gave hard homework but it made it challenging. Exams are open book and he gave some extra credit. He is also always available to help. I highly suggest taking him.

All he talked about was the fact that he graduated from Weatherhead. This does not automatically qualify a person to teach. He needs to work on his delivery and technique. He acted as if he put together the slides and homework answer keys but used the tools provided by the publisher. OK - if you're prepared to teach yourself from the text.

Mr. Dollinger is a nice guy who is very intelligent and knows his math but is NOT A TEACHER. Be prepared to teach yourself out of the book or from Youtube tutorials in order to do homework. Class time is Mr. Dollinger talking about himself, or going over 1-2 examples but writing the information incorrectly.

Eleanor is one of the most intellegent, punctual, and sweetest professors I have had the pleasure of having. She makes the class interesting, really cares about her students, and is willing to take the time necessary to see YOU succeed. Her class isnt a blow off class, but it is enjoyable and she* is the one who makes it so. Hope she stays at UT!

I attend the University of Toledo but Eleanor Dombrowski is a visiting professor. She's a sweet lady and is very knowledgeable of the material and subject. Do your presentations on time to present. Her exams are based off memorization and the study guide. The class does require time to study.

I love Eleanor! I go to Western Michigan University, where she transferred to as a visiting professor. I absolutely love her class, she is sweet and patient...work is your responsibility but there isn't much of it. I'm signed up for two more of her classes come this spring semester. She's such a cutie.
Such a doll. She loves teaching, as a student I could just tell. She is very very easy if you just review your nots and do the papers. She does not try to pull any punches, very straight foward.
I heard she is leaving you may want to check.. Just breaks my heart... She is so sweet and nice! we need more professors like her. She's not hot more like a mother.
very good teacher..highly recommended

Dombrowski is a great teacher. She makes class fun and interesting. Even if you are lazy as long as you study for the tests and do the papers; you will be fine. There are only four papers and class is not mandatory. But with her, it is good to show up. She tells you what will be on the test. SHE IS AMAZING!!! :)
Excellent Teacher!!! Makes it Interesting!!!
very nice professor, very good teaching skills, about 4 papers in the whole semester, Good luck! :)

Terrible teacher. Very unhelpful with giving feedback on your paper. Essay topics completely suck. I don't want to write about college football, shopping, and name brands all the time. I want to write about something that's actually interesting and I can express my opinion on, not the sociology of name brands or whatever. Don't take this class!!!!!

Requires the most boring readings. The essay topics were easy and I write well so I did complete them. The disappointing thing about her was that she was an stuck on attendance. Good writer is a good writer and why should a student fail because they don't attend class but completes every assignment and gets A on all. Disappointment!
Turned Eng 102 into essentially an essay-writing class. I'm very good at essay-writing, so I had an advantage there, but was rather frustrating at times.

I learned basically nothing in this class. Staying out of class discussions is probably for the better because they always become debates.. She talks about her daughter non-stop. Can't stay on topic. Thinks she knows everything. Entertaining, however.

This professor is the worst. He is really rude and unhelpful to students. Minimal assignments and they are all critiqued to the max even though he doesn't tell you what he wants from you to begin with. Take another professor.

Avoid this professor. His instructions are not clear and the entire class struggled with earning good grades because he was such a tough grader. Did not provide adequate instructions to be able to complete the work to "his standards".

The guy screwed me on female representations of Avalokiteshvara. Really bad idea/direction to have a paper due at the end of class and to make people give a presentation of said not fully researched/actualized paper halfway through course. Yielded crummy projects for obvious reasons, yet the presentation accounted for a large portion of the grade.

I like him a lot because he has a dull sense of humor. He makes the class interesting because of the mythical stories he talks about. However, I've just recieved my research paper and I went from a D to a C on it (I had H1N1). I made all the corrections he told me to do and the same corrections are wrong. How? All-n-all, he is cool. Final grade: B-
Easy. Fair. Straight Forward.

Best professor I've ever had. I can see where people may find him dull, but those must be the students only looking for credit, those who have no interest in the subject matter. Very knowledgeable and a very funny but dry sense of humor.
On the last day of class he told the class: Those of you who got strong A's on both of the 1st two exams don't have to take the final.

3 Exams.  On these exams, he shows you pictures on a slide show, and you just write down on paper a description of the picture.   All these pictures, along with a brief description below them, are in the textbook.      The ones you have to memorize are the ones that are both in the book and on the slide show in class.
Easy A. Traditional lecture guy.  I liked him.  Good teacher if all you are looking for is credit.   But he's kind a dull speaker.  Knowledgable but doens't make material interesting.

A hard class to follow but not hard to get an A. I'm in his Buddhist Art class. The trick is to draw quick slides and put notes beside them. Don't miss too many classes because all the information is in class and you get points for attendance. Not a bad class tho and the teacher is sort of funny. His dry humor is awesome but I have a tough skin.

Prof. is very knowledgeable but cannot teach a class. Degrading to student, so much so the class was afraid to ask questions. His tests were tough, because they were all based on slides; however, they were not available to study from

I'm having a difficult time following his class.  He's a straight up lecture guy- no helpful handouts (except the syllabus, which has info about time periods and the like on it), no references to where you might find help in the book.  Just read the chapters on the syllabus and come to class.  It's tough trying to memorize what artwork goes with what time period of what country without some kind of chart or reference.  Oh sure, he'll tell you what it is, and expect you to know it once he says it.

He was not helpful at all.  He is very knowledgable, but he cannot teach.  He can be sarcastic to students, and he is not very conducive to a learning atmosphere.  I was quite frustrated indeed when I spent hours studying only to get C's and D's on quizzes.  I though maybe it was just me, but the rest of the class was having a hard time too.
No Comments

She is very passionate about the subject she teaches. Her lectures were clear and she explains everything very well. I didn't use the book this semester because her notes are better than the book. I enjoyed her class even though we had a group project that was kind of stressful, though it wasn't hard at all. You can tell that she cares.

grades & expectations are clear. accessible outside of class, nice & will help you try to pass to the best of her abilities. 6 or 7 quizzes (lowest one is dropped), final paper, midterm grade & gives extra credit opportunity. answers all questions & responds to emails with clarity. very nice, would highly recommend taking her.

A lot of long papers in this class, but that is to be expected. A couple quizzes where you have to read an article and answer questions about it, not multiple choice. She's  very understanding and helpful if you have questions. Lectures can be a bit boring since it's usually right off the powerpoint but overall she is a pretty great professor.

This professor tends to use a lot of words in lecture but doesn't end up saying much of anything. It is easier to use the textbook to study for the weekly quizzes than her powerpoints. The textbook was very helpful and the online resources are useful for test prep. She takes surprise attendance and gives extra credit. Not that hard if you study.

IF YOU NEED AN EASY SCIENCE CREDIT YOU'VE PICKED THE RIGHT CLASS. Fun class. There are lots of lectures and trips. If you don't have a car though I suggest maybe not taking it. It was hard asking people for rides because they didn't want to but maybe that was just my class. Other than that Dan is great, he is very helpful and understanding

IF YOU NEED AN EASY SCIENCE CREDIT YOU'VE PICKED THE RIGHT CLASS. Fun class. There are lots of lectures and trips. If you don't have a car though I suggest maybe not taking it. It was hard asking people for rides because they didn't want to but maybe that was just my class. Other than that Dan is great, he is very helpful and understanding

Dan is an amazing person and prof. He is very knowledgeable and is always willing to help and takes you on amazing field trips, it is such a fun class and it is very simple work that he asks for! Enjoy! And no textbook fee, just field trip fees at a few places. But overall maybe $45 the whole semester which beats $100 textbook!

Loved this class! Awesome field trips around Cleveland, light reading, and only occasional papers. Learned a lot and didnt need to stress out about it. Professors Donaldson was helpful and very lenient. Would definitely recommend this class!

Professor Donaldson is one of my favorite professors at csu. You have like 3 assignments in total and a final. You go on field trips almost every class which count as your 'labs' you literally just have to attend the field trips and you get 100% he really cares about his students and doesn't not really have a due date for any of the assignments

LOVED LOVED LOVED this class and he is awesome!! Most classes are spent on field trips and there pretty interesting . You have a couple of short papers, one final paper and a final but he is an fair/easy grader. DEFINITELY take him, Favorite class by far!

Dr. Donaldson is one of those professors who understands that you take other classes and is very understanding and approachable. The semester long project is not fun I will admit, but she pushed back a lot of due dates for assignments we turned in for it. Lectures are very boring and she is hard to follow sometimes but her personality makesupforit.

Dr. Donaldson is one of those professors who understands that you take other classes and is very understanding and approachable. The semester long project is not fun I will admit, but she pushed back a lot of due dates for assignments we turned in for it. Lectures are very boring and she is hard to follow sometimes but her personality makesupforit.

Dr. Donaldson-Misener is a knowledgeable professor when it comes to teaching about statistics. She does not do many examples on the board but does a lot of work in excel. Exams are difficult but there is many other opportunities for points to make up for them.

Dr. Donaldson-Misener is awesome! Research Methods was a pretty boring class but she made it interesting. She also had many assignments that you are graded on, not just exams. Get ready for a lot of group projects!

Dr. Dong is the nicest, most reasonable human being I've met in the EECS dept. and is a top-tier professor. Every professor should strive to model her impeccable class format. She has the patience of a saint, and respects her students. If you ever have a problem for any reason, she will help, or reach out. Dr. Dong will forever have my respect.

Dr. Dong is the nicest, most reasonable human being I've met in the EECS dept. and is a top-tier professor. Every professor should strive to model her impeccable class format. She has the patience of a saint, and respects her students. If you ever have a problem for any reason, she will help, or reach out. Dr. Dong will forever have my respect.

Lili Dong is the best professor In electrical engineering department by far. Her grading scale is great you have no homework, 4 tests, 3 projects and a final. The tests are very basic questions to test if you know material or not, no surprises, and it is multiple choice. Very caring and wants you to succeed.

Great professor with clear expectations. Exams are challenging, but fair if you study. She definitely cares about your success as a student and would even email me when I forgot to turn in the extra credit . Would take again.

Dr. Dong absolutely wants to make sure that you are understanding what she is saying. She will always clarify if you ask and she is very quick to repond to student emails. She gives you all the tools you need to succeed, & makes expectations cleart. A real joy and I feel like I learned something that matched the efforts i put into the course.

Horrible teacher. Only reason people like her is because it's nearly impossible to fail her. She spent so much time saying how she cares about her students but doesn't back it up with actually teaching anything. Waste of time and money.

Finally, I learned something from a professor! Isn't it amazing? A lot of my friends say she is good. I took it as a grain of salt until I was in her class. OMG, Dr. Dong presents the best lecture! She goes extra miles to help us. She made the online experience a delight............. I'll come back to take all her classes.
She gives a lot of examples. Matlab practice is a plus.
She is the best professor at CSU.
Great professor
very good at teaching....
very good professor
very clear and organized. if you attend you would not need to study out of class
good professor

This class was supposed to be remote, but she just made it an online class because she had another job and didn't have time to make even video lectures, apparently. You're supposed to just read the text and write stuff about it. Having to read to supplement lectures is one thing, but this was a waste of tuition money.

So Prof. Donley would not have a clear outline with her grading system. She would constantly dock points for grammars errors, but won't show/tell you where and what the errors were. Her midterms and finals were easy though.

Dan's Intro Creative Workshop was awesome. Highlight of the semester was a group playwriting project, where we had to write a play based on a random grouping of childhood toys. The workshop environment was always fun, engaging, and encouraging.

Dan's Intro Creative Workshop was awesome. Highlight of the semester was a group playwriting project, where we had to write a play based on a random grouping of childhood toys. The workshop environment was always fun, engaging, and encouraging.
Super cool guy, always happy, will be happier if students actully read the assigned readings every week.
Awsome teacher, I've taken two of his history classes and got an A and a B.

Tough class if you don't pay attention, powerpoints aren't posted. short reading responses due every week. 2 quizzes, 2 papers. most assignments are A or fail, hard to get an A as most is "reading between the lines"
Mentor.

Really cool guy.  Very clear about what he wants.  He's definitely more serious than he comes off, though.  Do not come in late, do not miss class without contacting him, and do not forget your handouts.  Class will be great if you stay on top of your work (which isn't a lot).  He knows what he's doing and he has a lot of experience in the field.
OMG I just heard she is leaving CSU I'm gonna cry!!!!! I was hoping to have her for future classes.
OMG I just heard she is leaving CSU I'm gonna cry!!!!! I was hoping to have her for future classes.

She's intimidating, but she truly does care! Go to lab, PRACTICE, and ace your skills! If you do not practice, you will not pass. Don't be afraid to ask questions! Also, look at the information she provides on BB, it really does help.

This class is intimidating. I don't think it's the professor that are intimidating. I did very well! Come to class, pay attention and take notes! Practice practice practice. It helped to write out a script. Good luck. Angela really cares about her students. I felt uncomfortable asking questions... but overall she prepared us well.
I used my classmates book and took pictures of important pages. I got by just fine because I took good notes from Dr. Douglas' demonstrations
LOVE!!!!
I actually looked forward to clinical! She is a realist and knows exactly what we should know at the level we're at, but then pushes us for more. Very fair and treated us as individuals

I enjoyed this lab. She is very interactive and tells a lot of funny stories to help you remember the important stuff. The book was used for lecture class, but in lab she will tell you and demonstrate everything you need to know, so pay attention!
I loved his 303 class it was taught well during covid and i wasn't stressed at all
I loved his 303 class it was taught well during covid and i wasn't stressed at all

Dr. Dover is an amazing professor. I highly recommended taking him if you can. I took an 8 week summer course and I did not feel stressed at all. Assignments are due about two-three times a week with clear instructions. He was also very available and willing to talk via zoom for help, as this was an online course. Quick email response as well!

Highly recommend! He is lecture heavy, but his lectures are amazing! I learned so much! Expect to spend significant time, work hard, and write a lot (WAC course). He gives great feedback, grades quickly, and is always available for any questions you might have. Extra credit options. Final paper you work on throughout the semester instead of exam.

This professor always throws extra assignments at you every week, without including them in the syllabus, so you never even know it's coming. He is a very dedicated professor, but sometimes forgets that we have other classes besides his. I would not take one of his classes only because it is way too hard if you're taking other classes along with it

Prof Dover tries so hard.... but he is just so confusing. You can tell he cares about the topics and his students, but he ends up speaking about random topics that matter to him, and he never gets around to teaching you any of the course material....... Really sweet guy, but not a good professor.

Dr. Dover is an amazing individual. He is very knowledgeable and fully committed to the advancement of the social work profession, specifically, addressing human needs. His class does require much writing and reading. Despite the amount of work, I would take him again.

Professor Dover really cares about his students and he really wants you to understand the material and pursue social work. He goes off on rants all the time and is constantly going off topic and never really answers questions when you ask them. I really wanted to learn/do more in the class but he means well and he is a good professor.

The content seems overwhelming at first glance but I've had him for three classes and he's by far one of my favorite professors, you just have to give it a minute to get the routine down. Very caring, knowledgeable, and extremely flexible on assignments.

I learned nothing in his class because he does not teach. He is easily distracted and gets off topic. He gives little instruction on assignments and is obsessed with tinyurls and booknotesos. Attendance is counted and mandatory. All assignments are done online and he makes submitting assignments a pain in the butt.

Dover Dover Dover. He's all over the place but he is very understanding! If you need extra time on an assignment just talk to him and he will work with you. He doesn't really discuss material for the assignments in-class and definitely goes off topic for most of the class; but he's a good guy! I've had him for 2 different courses and love him!
Excellent teacher. He really cares about you passing and knowing the work.

Dr. Dover is someone who you can learn quality information from. Take advantage of this. His sometimes frantic demeanor and sporadic word salad can be trumped by the fact that this man is  a respectable genius. If you really care about social work, advocacy and community outreach, Dr. Dover will teach you real invaluable life skills for your major.
Professor Dover seemed to be a very fast grader and also a very easy grader for this particular class. I had no problem with him and he helped when I asked for it. He gave very fast feedback.
Good to have him, easy talk to
This class is easy and informative. If you take it online, you will jave weekly discussions and journals.

I've taken Professor Dover for SWK 200, 201, 300. I've never felt like i was doing anything worth wild towards my degree until l i took his classes. OK he can be a little confusing but if you're confused he emails back. He gives his honest opinions on instructor feedback via black board.  No test, give him a try totally worth it!

Professor Dover is the best I took him for SWK 200 AND SWK 201, I'll be taking him for SWK300 in the fall2015. He's passionate, although his online stuff can get a little confusing, he answers emails LIKE REALLY FAST! He loves his work, very kind to students. He wants you to learn and pass. You need to book. READ and respond well. Enjoy no test.

Dover is a good teacher, he wants you to pass. Reading his personal work I can see why he's a social worker, he cares for people all people regardless of race, or religion. Take the class it was easy, I hot an A. Do the work. Ask questions he can be confusing only the midterm this summer and no other test. Take him very honorable man.

Professor Dover was one of my favorite professors at CSU! I took SWK 201 last semester and was a little overwhelmed at first because his syllabus was a little confusing. After asking him questions about it through email (which he responds very quickly) he guided me in the right direction. Just keep up with the assignments and you will be fine!
He's a great teacher and is very nice! Great in class teacher and helps the best way he can. If you get a chance, take him!!!!!

Dr. Drcar will be one of the greatest and most well rounded professor you will ever have the pleasure of meeting. Her lectures are well set up, allowing for class, and group discussion along with documentaries. Her lectures are very powerful, everything she lectures will stick with you. She is also very attentive to students questions and concerns.

Drcar is a well spoken, well educated person, but she is way too heavy handed in many areas. The texts she gives are about as thick as concrete, and just as hard to write about, which was required each week. Additionally, her lecture seem very preachy and forced, kind of like an NPR broadcast with an attitude.

It is all clear and easy, but he will get you to read that book. Make an effort to read before class, and it will pay off. tests are hard, but put a good effort and it should be fair return. He does want students to work in groups during class, which helps build groups to study for the tests.

He really worked with us on how he built the exam, and also gave us class time to work on our group paper. He's the type of professor that is there to help, especially if you bring your questions and concerns to his attention. Study the book and slides. I took compensatiod/benefits and I would take another class by him.
Good professor, using textbook as guide to class. If you go to class and read you should do wel.l in the class
I was a good class, I would take him again.

Will someone please get this guy a belt so he stops messing with his pants in front of the class. Had him over the summer, really boring.  He just reads off the ppt slides the whole time.  Takes attendence and screws you over for skipping. Seems like he always tries to stall class by making people get into groups to lookup terms. "You've got mail!"

This class is very boring and hard to attend after the first one.  I didn't read the book, just used the online site and powerpoint.  There's an online powerpoint that he use for the test..study from that.  Find a good group to work on your paper..He does give you alot of time.
Great Professor, knows his subject. Will pass on valuable information from his experiences related to your career. A+ instructor
Not bad..I'm taking him again for a different class.  It can get kinda boring but just don't fall behind on readings..just studying on powerpoints won't get you an A.
Down to earth guy,  wont be the hardest class you have taken but you will learn. 1 public speaking assingment, a few case studies and 4 tests.  I reccomend him.

Professor Duda is very difficult. I swore I wouldn't take another class from her because of the amount of work required but used the material daily afterwards. I did end up taking another class because she challenged me and I utilize her material every year.
Very degrading.  This class was a complete waste of time, but she didn't seem to care that we thought so.  Our opinions, although we tried to discuss them, clearly did not matter.
Ridiculous amount of work!  I would not recommend this professor - she is absolutely terrible!

When I first entered the class, I found it intimidating because I did not possess a strong background in the material. He assured us that that does not matter as we'll all learn together. He grades easily but fairly. I asked him for help, he supplied me with a generous email littered with useful web links. I loved going to the class. READ the book!
Really great professor! Understanding, nice, and helpful. Highly recommended.

I was super nervous to take Duffy based on these other reviews, but there is really no reason to hate him this much. He grades super fairly, and pretty much tells you what will be on the exams before them. He has a bold personality, but is pretty friendly overall. This class is difficult, you will have to work for it. He is very passionate about it

I was super nervous to take Duffy based on these other reviews, but there is really no reason to hate him this much. He grades super fairly, and pretty much tells you what will be on the exams before them. He has a bold personality, but is pretty friendly overall. This class is difficult, you will have to work for it. He is very passionate about it

Very rude and not helpful. Uses terms and phrases that you would only know if you had a job as a steel worker for 30+ years. If you arent a teachers pet and he doesnt like you, good luck getting any help or sympathy from him. Has an unrealistic assumption that everyone is already familiar with the information you are supposed to be learning.

CVE is hard, structural eng is even harder. You have to work hard for your grade, go to his office with any questions and he will help you out even give helpful hints on what on the exam. Not the best professor but not as bad as everyone makes him seem. Engineering is hard work you expect to just pass

This is the harderst professor I've take so far. Lectures are useless and test are way too long and hard for only 50min time period. I barely passed even tho I got decent grades and above average. He does not curve at all. Whatever you get on the test that will be you grade. He passed people he likes though. Worst ever. Please retire.
Barely anyone in the class passed. This reflects how bad of a teacher he is. Take someone else.
avoid. transfer if you have to
What a revolutionary, amazing professor It's as if he is a teaching master
The best creative writing teacher I had at CSU. He had so much enthusiasm and energy, and he always had something interesting to say about everybody's poems. Changed the way I think about poetry.

He frequently comes to class late then he keeps class over by about 10 minutes.  He fails to provide timely feedback, and he also fails to show up for scheduled appointments.  Overall, he is not very helpful and seems more interested in his own work.  Does not seem interested in students other than those working in the Poetry Center.

He's kind of a genius. I've never had another class that made me this excited every week--he has a lot of interesting ideas about poetry. And he's really funny. The best class I've taken as an MFA student.

New wave CSU professor. Thinks he's more brilliant than he actually is. Not a star at all. Not a teacher. He's there to be a poet and to impress you with how much he knows and who he knows. Just teach.
CSU's shining star; take his class at all costs; this brilliant of an instructor comes around rarely if ever and who knows how long in such a humble abode.

I've taken two classes with her and enjoyed both. The first was intro to poetry, and the second intro to creative writing. If you're not into poetry and have to take the class, take it with her, she makes it fun and intresting.
Make the classes enjoyable.  Lots of reading and writing, but that's what the class is for to begin with.  Great class discussions.  Good professor, I'd take a class with her again.

I went into this class thinking I would hate it because I always thought poetry was stupid.  Prof Dumbrys taught me to appreciate and like it.  Class discussions were fun and interesting.  I highly recommend this class with this professor.

Truly wants to see you fail. Only opens the exams on Sundays and I cant even begin to explain the questions he gives you. They make no sense and tries to make them difficult and different but they just DO NOT MAKE ANY SENSE. Its one thing to make them challenging but to make them so confusing that he clearly wants you to fail is another.

Have you ever taken a test and not allowed to answer your right or wrong answers? This is the first time in my life. This class was the worst online class I have ever had. If he is the professor, do yourself a favor and drop this class. I had all A's and now my first C in a long while. Terrible.

He runs a pretty standard online class. OB is a dry subject and he doesn't try to make it interesting. He also invented a weird character that you have to "teach" when it comes to homework and exams. If you study and put the time in you'll be fine. I didn't notice the same harsh grading that some other comments suggest, maybe because it was online.

the material was understandable and useful but the professor was awful. you are expected to read the powerpoints, the chapters, listen to his powerpoint lecture, and read any other supplemental material. the extra credit was essentially the homework and was only worth 1 pt and there could be up to 50 questions sometimes. i dont recommend.

He needs to stop talking about himself in the third person, it's creepy. He also needs to take a chill pill, I don't understand how he grades. "you hit all the points but missed one" takes off ten points...... the assignment before that, I put random nonsensical information and got a better grade. one of the worst "teachers" ever.

Professor acts superior and arrogant. Requirements are clearly stated but ambiguous--expects all the written parts of the course to be understood by a fictional character, who is both somehow intelligent and clueless by my understanding. Doesn't provide feedback and only opens tests for 24 hrs on Sunday's defeating the purpose of an online course.
Dr. D. was a great professor. I learned a lot from him and had to work to get a good grade. He is very prepared and provides a lot of personalized notes/material.
do not recommend taking him.
Teacher has the worst attitude. Cant ask him anything without a snippy response. No extra credit. Doesnt care. Thinks hes gods gift because he has a Doc. Degree.

Professor Dunegan gives no appropriate feedback regarding online assignments or exams. For example I got one question wrong on an assignment and he gave me a 0. I emailed him about it and then he gave me half credit.. Homework is time consuming and worth 1 point. Exams are difficult and do not follow studyguides. Very disappointing.

Dr. Dunegan is a GREAT professor. His class requires a lot of work but you learn so much from it. Attendance is not mandatory but there are in-class pop quizzes. He will give you the grade you deserve!! Exams are open book and open notes, but do not assume that means you do not need to study because you will run out of time. Overall, excellent prof
Provides bad feedback: gave me a 95% on an assignment because I spelled ONE word wrong, says things like "didn't answer the question" but doesn't explain why he thinks that

This was a hard class! Make sure you prep for the exams by completing the study guides in advanced. You get 3 exams and lots of quizzes; but the exams make up most of the grade. He created videos to help with explaining the theories, but it was very hard! No feedback on exams and quizzes. Make sure to answer all parts of exam questions!

This professor expects a lot of work. You have to take an online quiz before every class just to go to class and maybe get surprised with a pop quiz. Tests are very hard but they are open note / open book, they're just very long- 8 extended response and 50 multiple choice.

He's very clear about what he expects from you starting on the first day of class.  I will admit that his study guides are lengthy, but he's a very knowledgeable professor that just wants his students to learn. His humor can be borderline offensive sometimes. Don't take him if you're looking for an easy A. You get the grade you deserve.
not good choice

This class can be an easy class but he is definitely a tough professor. Assigned seats the first day of class. if your late you have to wait outside the class with a written excuse on why. Class was 50 minutes so when it was time for test its like your rushing to complete it cause there so many questions. STUDY!MAKE SURE U UNDERSTAND THE THEORIES

The amount of resources this professor provides students with is above and beyond what I have experienced in college. He knows the material in and out and is extremely helpful if you care to seek help. He provides you with study guides that have all the questions from the exams on them!  And don't bother buying the textbook.

The Class was  very uninteresting and a waste of time. At one point everything starts   sounding the same. Refused to curve exams even though material was rushed and didn't  cover everything. If you want to do decent start the study guides as soon as he releases them.
Good overall, knowledgeable and helpful. But you have to work.

I took two courses with Dr. Dunham and he is a great guy, lots of wisdom and experience to bestow. Is genuinely interested in all of his students and learns all names. If you find the class topics interesting then you will enjoy the class and the tests are passable. The cultural awarness you get from him is irreplaceable!

I took two courses with Dr. Dunham and he is a great guy, lots of wisdom and experience to bestow. Is genuinely interested in all of his students and learns all names. If you find the class topics interesting then you will enjoy the class and the tests are passable. The cultural awarness you get from him is irreplaceable!

Extremely knowledgeable about the subject and does a fantastic job conveying it so that even students with no prior interest can easily grasp it. Caring and funny with a relaxed atmosphere. Don't completely blow the class off, as it is graded entirely by just 3 exams. Provides good study guides before exams. Overall pleasant and enjoyable.

He's someone who actually loves what he teaches and knows how to teach it. As long as you show up and pay attention to his stories and PowerPoints, you'll pass. Very clearly states the objectives and key concepts for every section so you know what to study for the exams. By far the fairest teacher I've come across. Only have to worry about 3 exams
One of the really good ones. Active, involved, inspired, passionate. I learned a tremendous amount from him on several levels.

Dr. Dunham is great. He knows what he is talking about and has a lot of experience in his field. He is more than willing to speak with and assist students. He lectures with PowerPoints that are easy to follow and contain almost all the information you need to know for tests. Lots of visual aids go along with the content as well!

Great professor that gives very interesting and eye-opening lectures. Make sure to study the powerpoints and readings before exams and you'll be fine. If you're one to skip class, he only allows two unexcused absenses and any more than that hurts your grade.

He's a pretty good professor. A little full of himself, and some students really eat that up. There were definitely a few teachers pets in my class. Attendance is mandatory, but it's not a boring class to sit through. He has a lot of enthusiasm which makes the class enjoyable. Grade is based solely on test scores, so you definitely need to study.

Dr. Dunham's class structure is well thought out and he uses engaging lectures as the medium for the course. He narrates through the slides and goes over the important topics which are going to be tested. Nobody should fail his course if everyone took advantage of his online power points and the ability for extra credit. MAKE SURE YOU ATTEND CLASS!

Phenomenal man, went to every class, even the option outside class field trip that was 2 hours away. It was totally worth it to hear the wealth of knowledge that he had. He is an understanding man and is willing to work with any student, would definitely take him again, 10/10, would pass again
This class was so much more incredible than I anticipated! I absolutely loved this class and would recommend everyone take it to fulfill their diversity gen ed requirement.

A kind man who definitely has a knack for rambling. If you have difficulty paying attention to long lectures, DO NOT take his classes. He gives all information in his tests within his lectures, and will review information minutes before the test if you still feel uneasy. I can't say I loved his classes, but it's a relaxed environment.

Very long lectures, have coffee. He uses every second of the class period. Not sure how he times it to be exactly 1 hr 15 min each time. Only 2 absences are permitted - 3 would be more reasonable bc life. Had to read an 800 page novel which is a pain if you work & have a huge course load. Other than that, he's good.

Great teacher and a fun class! All power points are on blackboard and the only grades are 3 multiple choice tests including the final. Super easy. Study the power points and you'll do fine. Plus he curves the tests!

ANT 100 was a wonderful course. The professor was always flexible and willing to work with you. Class material was fairly easy and interesting. As long as you do the readings or review the powerpoints youll be fine. Passed with an A!
It was a very interesting and easy class. If you want an A, just show up and read 2-4 page papers.

He's a decent prof - he mostly knows his stuff, but he's extremely full of himself. Be prepared to hear all about his accomplishments and how amazing he thinks he is. His shallowness gets pretty annoying after taking two classes with him. Show up to class and do the readings and you'll get an A.
Professor Dunham is overall an amazing teacher and person. He takes anthropology seriously and is passionate about it. He is inspiring, funny, and a reasonable teacher.

Absolutely loved Ancient Mysteries with Dunham! He is very straight forward and to the point. He makes his expectations clear and the material is fun! Exams are an easy A if you study. Read both the books and the PowerPoints. Dunham has an excellent, vibrant personality and makes the subject matter even more engaging. Highly recommend.

I took both ANT 100 & 275 with him in the same semester, he likes to talk a lot about himself and his accomplishments which is okay but can get old really quick. As long as you listen during lectures (which is every class) and do a bit of the reading before quizzes, it's an easy class. Interesting subjects for sure.

He reads straight off the pwp slides which is boring but he gives his life experiences as examples. He is funny sometimes and after test you can met up to have beers and burgers with him at a local bar called Becky's. He hand writes each test so you can not cheat & you need to know the models & the people or you will fail.

The movies you watch are very interesting and good. He is a bit of a tough graded, but I've had worse. He really knows what he is talking about and gives you good information. The assignments are based on the movies you watch in class.

Professor Dunn is a phenomenal professor. He is extremely knowledgable and passionate about his career. The class was very interesting, as we viewed the evolution of African American characters in films. The two tests can be a tad tricky, but he gives study guides. There is one extra credit opportunity for the semester.

Professor Dunn was very fair with me when I misread the due date for our final paper and allowed me to submit a day late without deduction.  Overall his class required more reading than my other classes, but it is more than doable.  I would recommend Professor Dunn.

DON'T take Ronnie Dunn unless you like being told you are a racist bigot who hates Black people because that's what he'll tell. Now he'll pretend to be all scholarly and smart about it, don't buy it. This guy just wants to take your ideas, use them in his own research and laugh about it.  DO NOT RECOMMEND.
This class was fairly easy of you; do the work expected of you and you will be fine.

Awesome class! He really helped me learn more about African American history and it's very interesting to learn through films. He is very receptive to student comments and he is very involved with matters pertaining to the African American community. This is a writing class, so no surprise there but he's a fair grader but, I am a good writer.

In this class, you need to have all the time in the world to read because you are going to participate in the class. Do you the homework on time and answer the review sheet and you will get an excellent grade.

I took the class because of all of the positive comments about him. However, the course wasn't as great as I expected. The films were fine but the class was only out of 100 points. So basically if you screwed up on one thing you were done.The class is fine if you like film but don't take the class if you're expecting an easy A.

I enjoyed the class. This is a film class so everyday except for exam dates, you are watching African American films. He kept the class interesting. Very helpful. I would recommend this professor for the course

Very interesting class and it provided a way to see films from a different perspective. Dunn is very knowledgeable on the topic and provided interesting starting points for class discussions after watching a movie. The points are from 2pg critiques of each movie, a 10pg paper, and 2 exams. Overall, really chill and interesting class.

Dunn is a nice guy. Not a great teacher. He's not bad, but not great. He always wants more out of your assignments. Every time you turn something in you will get a comment saying that he wants you to explain more about something. The tests end up being very difficult, and the class can get very boring. He reads off of PowerPoints quite a bit.
He's ok, but do not question things from the book or give thoughts on ways studies could have been conducted better.
Dr. Dunn is a legit dude.
Great teacher. Really cares about what he is teaching. Very knowledgeable about the subject. Very interesting to listen to in discussions

Professor Dunn, is cool and laid back all of the notes he provide will guide you through the midterm and exam and the weekly assignments, I learned a lot he is a great teacher, if you need your WAC TAKE THIS CLASS!
Dr. Dunn is engaging, knowledgeable, kind, and fair.  take this class!
I think Dr.Dunn is an awesome professor...he keeps class interesting and he is funny!!! TAKE HIM!!!
Very easy and interesting class. If you can take it on campus. Great class discussions and great guy. Assignments are straight out of the notes he provides. Take this class if you need it!

Really cool professor, you can pull all you need for the midterm/final from his handouts in class, just make sure to skim 21st century American city for the key bits, class was very interesting, highly recommended!

I took this class in a blended/online format.  Mostly online via blackboard, but had 5 mandatory in class sessions. Dr. Dunn is knowledgeable and friendly, and he responds to emails and answers questions.  The course was interesting and moderatly challenging, but I enjoyed it.  I recommend this course & instructor.

Easy A, but you'll learn barely anything. Most assignments (done in class) can be solved by using Chegg. Class is a joke. He's kind, smart, but not efficient at teaching. It will make future CIS classes harder. Lectures are all powerpoints from his projector and it can be very boring. An easy GPA booster though, which is not common in CIS classes

This professor needs to improve his communication and organization. Assignments were sometimes solely distributed in class versus posted on blackboard. Grades that were posted, often took 2-6 weeks. My advise is to get rid of the complex grading criteria. Keep the 4 tests (lowest dropped) and the final project ONLY.

I took General Chemistry with Dr. Duraj as an undergrad, and I enjoyed his classes. He was humorous and was ALWAYS willing to help. In addition, he never wanted to see students fail, so he was always giving opportunities for students to get better grades.

i liked duraj alot.. i had him for 2 chemistry classes and people like to complain. if u asked duraj to help you he is always more than willing, and if you are taking freshmen chemistry and study like u should then u should be fine and yes he is unorganized but that does not take away from his overall quailty. what u put in is what u get out
one of the worst professors at cleveland state university he will loose your papers and talk about pointless things during lecture you will not learn anything from him at all

Terrible teacher, easy class. i doubt he even keeps track off grades because some students didn't even have to make up exams and if you saw his office you know he's not keeping track  of that stuff.  he basically looks at the acs final and assigns grades. if u do decent you will not score lower than a B. BEST ADVICE-MAKE fREINDS WITH HIM.
Absolutely TERRIBLE

Bad teacher. You will not learn anything from him unless you go to is sessions. You will probably not do well on tests but he doesn't really care as long you do well on final. He told kids they didn't have to makeup tests if they thought they did well on finals.

His lectures consist of reading the text aloud to the class, which didn't contribute to my understanding the material at all & made the tests difficult. I ended up attending the SI sessions instead of class bc they were more helpful. BUT! He offers a ton of EC and curves the Final like crazy so it's an easy A. TBH I didn't learn much.

Funny guy but very scatter brained at times. Goes over everything possible and uses examples from the book, which can drag on. Need to actually come to class if you want to learn anything. Gives tons of extra credit. Can be easy if you put in the time.

There is no such thing as an easy A. Duraj is a great person but don't expect him to explain the math (aka backbone) behind the chemistry. He will just say "Do the math" bc he admits he doesn't use calculators. There's no way not to like him as he is VERY generous with EC and genuinely wants you to do well. Put in the work and you should do well.

You need to use your text for Duraj's Gen Chem classes. I had him for both semesters and got an A. Many people do because he teaches right out of the book, offers extra credit and curves the ACS final. He wants students to do well, and it shows. Students were irritated if he was late to class at times. If you want a strict teacher,choose another.

This is a lab. He showed up the first day when the lab director was around but then never made an appearance in class again. He taught nothing - he let the lab be entirely TA run, by a TA who barely speaks proper English or knows what she is doing.
He is the best profssor ever.He explains everything,exams are easy if u give some attention what he says during class lecture.He also give some bonus assigments,that is very helpfull.EASY A
Stanley's class is easy and fun.  You learn alot.  Mind you, he isn't actively publishing his own books that he requires you to buy to take his class.  Good guy!

If you are looking for an easy, EASY A then this is the professor for you.  If you are looking to learn a lot then this is not the professor for you.  He puts zero time into preparation for his lectures and basically copies notes exactly from the book, so class attendance is not necessary. Offers a ton of extra credit
GREATEST TEACHER EVER!!!!! IF I HAD MY WAY I WOULD TAKE HIM FOR EVERY SINGLE CHEM CLASS!!! ITS AN EASY A BUT I LEARNED SO SO MUCH!!! TAKE HIM!!!!!!!

He is easy going and laid back. He teaches the course based exactly out of the textbook and goes over every example in the book in class. His exams are easy because half of the exams are the examples out of the book. He hands out a mock exam before the real thing so you know what to look for on the exam. Very helpful and easy to understand.
Great teacher! Great accent! Take!
Love Dr. Duraj. He is straight forward, and cares if you care. Love his orange clogs and tropical shirts during summer class. Great professor, always in a good mood.
