Good teacher. Goes right by the book and tests are right out of notes and book. Gives the best extra credit on the day of the final. I highly recommend this professor!!
This guy is so boring in class. He basically reads right from the text. SO you are on your own to learn the stuff and the final, he does not even prepare you for it. BTW he is not hot!

Dural is super friendly and knows the subject really well. Her class note packets are super helpful and explain the information pretty well. She delivers the info well, but is not super engaging. But if you ask for help she will do her best to allow you to succeed.

Dural is super friendly and knows the subject really well. Her class note packets are super helpful and explain the information pretty well. She delivers the info well, but is not super engaging. But if you ask for help she will do her best to allow you to succeed.

Shes one of my best professors I really loved her and enjoyed her class. 3 tests, one Final, project and 5% for attendance. NO HOMEWORKS. Keep in mind its a really tough class but shes a great teacher and she makes it very understandable. She has notes for each chapter no need to write anything in class just highlighting. Fair grader

Very deep knowledge of content, and amazing presentation of materials. Packets are incredibly well made. Class can be kind of dry, but if you do all of the homework problems, you will do well on the exams (which are all of the grade.)

Do homeworks and study regularly. I went from a 40% on exam 1 and went to talk to her and ask how I could improve and ended up getting 90 and above the next two. Review her note packets and homework to study for exam and you will ace it! Book isn't even needed. DO NOT miss class, very useful. Can't teach yourself this stuff

Dr. Dural teaches the material very well. Best thing about her is that she provides hand-outs for most of her lectures that cover most of the subjects. However, She is very bad when it comes to dealing with students. She's always busy and sometimes won't talk to you unless you have an appointment. She's willing to yell at you in front of the class!

Dural is a great professor and very helpful. DO NOT TAKE YOUR PHONE OUT IN HER CLASS. 3 exams, a group project, and final. Homework assigned every class, but it really helps you understand the topic. I love her and  I wish I could take her again.

Dr Dural explains the material very clearly. She gives plenty of additional examples not found in the book. She gives HW after every class, and the test questions are exactly like the HW just different values. Extremely willing to help if you are struggling. She is very strict with her classroom policies. Wish she taught more of my classes.

Dr. Dural is a great professor! Some do not like her due to some of her strict policies, such as no cell phone use in class and attendance. Typical lecture is going over her handouts or taking notes and then example problem after example problem. She has by far some of the best hand writing.

Professor Dural is awesome!I go to Ohio University but took her class at CSU over the summer and now I wish she would transfer! If you care about the material, she will make sure you get a good grade in her class.
One of the best teachers I have EVER had! She is so knowledgeable! If you are struggling, go to her for help, she is very understanding and wants the best for her students.
One of the BEST professors I have ever had! She really cares about her students. If you need help, talk to her she is very understanding and wants the best for her students.
She is one of the best professors I have ever had. She actually cares about teaching and cares about the material.

Dr. Dural prepares you for the tests. She is interested in the material she teaches which makes the course enjoyable. She is extremely nice. If you keep up with the homeworks you will do very well in the class.
Dr. Dural is one of the only professor's i've had at Cleveland State that really cares about teaching and understands the subject very well.I learned a lot from her classes.
Dr. Dural is a very knowledgable and reliable professor. Always available to us and willing to help students learn. Persistent with material and does not put any surprises on her exams.

She requires lots of self-accountability and out of class studying. You will learn a ton if you keep up with the material and reading. Also, she's very nice, but doesn't like rude students who talk during class -- she gets mad about that.

I had a great learning experience in Dr. Dural's class.  She told us exactly what we needed to know, homework was similar to lecture examples, and tests were similar to homework.  Attendance is important and she is very willing to help you learn.  I would definitely recommend her to anyone.

Over half the class had to take it over.  I barely made it out alive, though it should be noted that as a person she is pleasant.  That being said, she did not know the material at all, and refuses to answer questions.  She would lecture from slides which were basically straight from the solutions manual and couldn't explain anything.
No Comments

Very vague on assignment details and if there is a problem on any thing he will not email to correct it. I had a technical issue were a video I submitted had no audio and instead of making me aware of the problem he gave me a zero in the grade book. Do not take a class with this professor if you do not check grades. If I could rate lower I would

Prof. Durbin is an okay choice to take. His test are not too difficult, but he ways your group project really heavy. He has a lot of knowledge on the material and makes the class pretty fun. He does understand how the world actually works, and he accommodates many people and their needs.
A good professor who showed me how social issues impact the news today.
Professor is very vague in project details. Test questions are way more complex than the material we learned in class.

Professor Durbin is a good professor. He based this class just like Dr. Perloff would teach it (he did write the book) which was great.  We had in-class activities that were long and it seemed like you had to put more effort into it than needed. Lectures were engaging and fun at times. He is willing to work with you.

Take Dr. Dussault at YOUR OWN RISK. Took him for Operations Supply Chain Management last semester and he missed about 1/4 of the classes for work. Further he did not teach Supply Chain or any material in the book, but rather forecasting accuracy through a complicated business case. IF YOU CAN TAKE A DIFFERENT PROFESSOR DO SO.

This class was okay. Not hard, but repetitive. Read the chapter, discussion board with 3 posts, and a 2 page reflection. Then for the final a 1- page paper. Don't even look at the due date, she wants it weeks in advance. She does respond quick if you have any questions. Participation points are doing the discussion board and responding to 3.

Grades easy, DOES NOT TAKE LATE WORK PERIOD! You will learn something from this class, if you do the required reading. Make sure you participate in the discussions, I would have gotten a better grade had I done that. Overall great class!
Graded through discussion boards mostly. One post, three replies. 2-4 page reflections are required too but those are easy. Just jot down your own thoughts on the chapter. Super easy class.

Christen was an absolutely fantastic professor. Her class was more interesting and fun than it was work (best way to learn about a subject IMO), although effort is always important. Very fair grader. I ended up getting 100% in the class! Made me a lot more aware about the social and political aspects of gender. Great Gen ed, great professor.

Not very interactive. Takes forever to respond to emails and isn't sympathetic when needed. Weekly reflection posts and a reflection of the chapter are required. Easy A if you try, but don't expect much help if you take this class online. Her explanation of the final project is poorly explained as well, but overall the material was interesting.

I loved this class. It was by far the best class I have ever taken. Prof. DuVernay is very educated on the material and she really cares about others learning the material. However, she is very opinionated, but she is respectful of opinions that do not match hers. Overall a wonderful professor.

This class was a great gen-ed. Weekly reflections that are opinion based. One interview and one final research paper. She is very nice, gives great lectures, and really gives you a different outlook on things.

She talks as if she knows everything even though she doesn't! She said, "I am great so if you have problems dealing with my class, there are problems on you!" She talks as if students are stupider than her!

If you want to enjoy university lives, don't take her classes! Her classes are ery boring! She doesn't explain what to know clearly! All she does is just reading her slides! It is wastful to take her classes if you want to enjoy in classes!
Her classes are very bad! She relys on other students to have lectures if she doesn't finish grading tests! I wasted a lot of time taking her class by hearing materials which I can't trust!
She makes full of students if their grades are not good!
She is vain. She thinks she is the best professor!
Compassionate, smart, great experience, understanding, highly reccomend any of her classes.

She discouraged me by telling me in front of students, "Special Education is not occupation for you. (I commented before. Not me, I mean you here)I don't want you to waste money by flanking this class!" When I asked her what is suitable, she said, "I don't know because I don't know you!" She is very irresponsible!

She was the worst professor whom I have ever had! She mentioned my grade in front of other students. She also discourages me by telling me in front of students, "Special Education is not occupation for you. I don't want you to waste money by flanking this class!" When I asked her what is suitable, she said, "I don't know because I don't know you!"

She said she was great because she gives her notes, but she doesn't care whether students pass her class or not! She discourages many students! Even I asked her for help, all she said was "just study hard!"

She was the worst professor whom I have ever had! She mentioned my grade in front of students! She also discouraged me by telling me in front of other students, "Special Education is not occupation for you!"

She was the worst professor whom I have ever had! She mentioned my grade in front of students! She also discouraged me by telling me in front of other students, "Special Education is not occupation for you!" When I asked her what is suitale, she said, "I don't know because I don't know about you!"

She was the worst professor whom I have ever had! She mentioned my grade in front of other students. She also discourages me by telling me in front of students, "Special Education is not occupation for me. I don't want you to waste money by flanking this class!" When I asked her what is suitable, she said, "I don't know because I don't know you!"

Honestly one of the better professors I've had. Very knowledgable about the material and encourages his students. He's big on class participation, but even if your answer is wrong, he'll work through it with you until you understand properly. He responds back to emails quickly and is willing to help, even out of class hours.

Honestly one of the better professors I've had. Very knowledgable about the material and encourages his students. He's big on class participation, but even if your answer is wrong, he'll work through it with you until you understand properly. He responds back to emails quickly and is willing to help, even out of class hours.

Taking an online Frankenstein course with him, I must say that I'm glad it is not in person. He does not know how to use blackboard, so our class consisted of daily EMAILS. He would typically email us around 2-3 pm and expected an assignment done by 11:59 that night. Extremely unprofessional and very snarky. Avoid this professor if possible.

Worst professor at CSU. Takes up class bragging about his "prestigious Eastern university degree" and expects students to know references that have nothing to do with the reading. DO NOT TAKE ANY CLASS WITH DYER.

prof dyer only talks to show off what he knows and that fact that he has a PHD. whenever he asks a question, if you dont form the answer right he wont accept it. BUT he will spend 10 minutes getting the angry even if no one obviously knows the exact answer he wants. ive learned nothing in his class.

He goes off on a tangent every class and consistently brings up topics that aren't from the 21st Century. He over analyzes a basic English class and gives anyone anxiety and limits their ability to understand the topics in his class effectively. He needs to make his lectures simpler and he's not relatable to his students. Worst class I've had.

This course was offered as an alternative to Brit Lit I. I thought this class would be interesting, but it's NOT. Avoid taking this course and/or professor, he expects you to know things about Law Literature and certain authors. He also takes FOREVER to respond to emails and doesn't input grades or utilize Blackboard. Worse class ever

Prof Dyer is as eccentric as they come. Let him go on his tangents, baseball, movie references, etc. Just enjoy the tangents as they come. Participate, and READ ALL THE INSTRUCTIONS FOR ASSIGNMENTS. He's very clear on that. Tough grader for sure, and read the poems, it's a must for sure. He looks for specific examples in quizzes and tests.

Goes on tangents about irrelevant topics for almost every class. Rarely teaches the construction of poetry and would rather just talk about what he personally thinks about the poetry. Does not initiate useful conversations in class. He takes forever to grade and you will probably have no idea of what your grade is until the very end.

Never gives students the credit when they answer a question correctly, it's not what HE wants exactly so it's wrong. He will ask "What do you mean by that?" when your answer is in the most basic form. Never calls anyone by name, doesn't bother learning names. Never emails back. It'll take him 3+ weeks to grade an essay. Ridiculous.

He asks you to answer questions and speak up in class but will find something wrong with everything you say. Never says exactly what he's looking for when grading so anything you do will end up not being the right thing. Wants you to turn in everything via email and never passes anything back. Terrible. Nice guy but worst professor I've ever had.

Not only does he treat this class as if it is his personal TEDtalk on every irrelevant topic, but he also is extremely rude to all students. He will openly make fun of students in the class for not answering a question the way he wants, even if you get the question right. Don't expect helpful feedback on your papers either. He will only insult you.

Dyer pays little attention to students, consistently shows his open disdain for their opinions and questions, and clearly does not put in effort to learn the names of students. The assignments (which are extremely few and far between) are unclear and very demanding. He assigns textbooks to buy, then discredits them in nearly every class. AVOID!

Although he is well known for his crazy off-topic tangents, his lectures are bland & he does not allow any room for varying opinions. He expects his students to know every bit of literature/film trivia there is, and gets upset when no one knows his useless info. Don't expect to know what your grade is, and he is EXTREMELY slow with grading.

One of the worst professors I've had yet. Most of the other reviews are correct - he often goes off on tangents during class rather than discuss any material. Asks ridiculous questions that have no real importance to the course and expects a certain answer that only he knows. Difficult to participate in this environment. Would not recommend.

While he knows what he's talking about when it comes to literature, he freely admits that he doesn't know much else. That doesn't stop him from trying to talk about it, though. He'll go off on class-long tangents and call students dumb repeatedly for not answering his questions the way he wants them answered. Impossible to contact outside of class.

Was difficult to reach over the course of the semester and frequently "didn't receive your paper" that you emailed. I was out of school for a few weeks being in the hospital and all of my teachers were willing to give me extensions and be helpful except for Dyer. Very narcissistic, will love to tell you about his colleagues at Penn & Villanova.

I would not recommend taking this class. He will teach you over 5 things per class and then give you a test only giving you 20 minutes with over 15 questions. He is very demeaning when we don't know the same arbitrary information he knows. I dropped his class.
There is a lot of reading in this class, and at times he can come off as egotistical and intimidating, but if you read, ask questions, and participate you will be absolutely fine.

Prof. Dyer is CLEARLY intelligent but can be intimidating.   He is well versed but is about as enjoyable as a deep cleaning at the dentist.  He is condescending and often grades harder if he disagrees with your approach.  He doesn't allow much of a choice of topic for papers. Would I take him again?  Yes, grinding my teeth the entire way.

Toughest grader there can possibly be. Lacks the temperament for helping students and answering questions in class. Would rather fail them than helping them succeed. Anyone other professor would be recommended for this class.

When I started this class I really didn't like professor Ebiana, but over the course of the semester, I started to realize how good he actually was. He made the lectures interesting and simplified the textbook a lot. He has frequent pop quizzes but also gives extra credit if you participate. Tests are very hard though so be sure to study.
I would not recommend taking ESC 250 with him, the class average on exams is usually in the 40s.

Ebiana will lecture about a major topic for ONE class - usually by way of a complex example (first example should ALWAYS be basic) - then spend the next five meetings doing example problems. Offers no conceptual explanation ever. Watch Prof. Leonard's YT playlist on DE's if you really want to learn the material. Michel Van Biezen is good as well.

Brutal Tester. Questions on tests and quizzes are much harder than any example problems you will do in class and homework. He's a very unfair grader and can straight up rude and to students. He doesn't care about you or your grades. He sees you as just another number rather than a person. Its a doable class but you won't have a good time.

He gives a lot of extra credit to compensate for 49 percent averages on exams. He teaches math from slides, and you should memorize all that's on them. You should do Khan academy to compensate from the lack of education you can get from this guy.

When I started this class I really didn't like professor Ebiana, but over the course of the semester, I started to realize how good he actually was. He made the lectures interesting and simplified the textbook a lot. He has frequent pop quizzes but also gives extra credit if you participate. Tests are very hard though so be sure to study.

Terrible Professor. Talks down to students, exams are very hard with only 2 problems. and expects you to know everything. He is very knowledgeable in the subject he teaches but has no idea how to convey it to students . The class average for every test was a 40%. Even though it was open book/notes..

Super funny guy. He makes a hard course more enjoyable. The project was a pain, but it was easier than the other professor's assignment. Ebiana's tests are difficult if you don't understand the concepts. Definitely try to take him; it may be difficult but you'll learn a lot and wont regret it.

The most important thing is that you attend his class and try your best to participate. Pop quizzes very often so don't miss class. You have the ability to earn a LOT of extra credit if you do well on quizzes and show up to class. Fair exams (he grades them easily), strict with technology.

He is a very good and strict professor. Class is 2 Tests + Final + Hmwk+PopQuiz+Cpu Proj. If you go to class alot he will help you out and he will throw extra credit for you on the tests. His pop quizzes are usually 1-2 lectures about a topic. Class may seem difficult at first but once you get a grip it isnt that bad at all. Take w/friends if possb
TOUGH professor but he will make sure you succeed if you really want it.

I enjoyed the class at times but it was very challenging. Attendance is mandatory and participation is the key to getting better test grades. Try to be ready for lecture so you can answer harder questions and earn extra credit. I have retained a decent amount of knowledge in the class. But be ready for very hard tests, hw and fast paced lectures.
Must Show up for extra credit and attendance. Dont take pictures of his power points or your gonna get called in front of everyone. Smart professor and wants students to learn. Have to study.

Free points for showing up, Impossible to understand at times, weird pop culture references, and bonus points for class participation (basically a free for all). Pretty crazy course, sucks that its required tbh.

Very difficult exams and there is only 2 all semester with 2 questions each. He makes one questions fairly simple and the other one very difficult (at least thats how i felt). But he gives a TON of extra credit quizes and for participation. I came in expecting to do better but got a B- but cannot blame anyone but myself.

He's nice, funny, and good at explaining things. However, he gives extra credit for answering questions in class (AKA only people in the front row), and gives extra credit quizzes which only benefit the top performers. No good calculators allowed on tests really hurt, so you better be good at your algebra. But he curves a TON, but only at the end!

Wonderful professor, only his exams consist of 2 questions and are 25% the final grade (Final is 30%).  He does this for a few different courses and for one like Differential Equations, it does not seem fair in the slightest.  With 3 exams and 6 questions in total that makes up 80% the final grade.  You mess one up its 12.5% off.  BEWARE!
Tough, fair teacher. He really wants you to pass, but you need to show up, study, ask questions. I took the summer section. Definitely recommend.

This is a really good class. You should participate, he is big on that. He grades his tests hard, but his grading scale is curves so its a wash. I was doing really poorly (not his fault) and I got a C+. I think if you participate and show effort he will give you an acceptable grade because I should have got a D based on my calculations.

This guy is really smart but his class is tough. Make sure you do the homework because those are pretty much the only points you're guaranteed. He does give pop quizzes so be prepared. Participation is really important to him and so is attending class so make sure you don't skip class!

He is one of the best professor CSU. very clear about his exams, homework, and project. Just show him yur trying, give your 70% in the class, he'll probably pass you if your on the edge, if he knows you tried your best and you understand the material.

Jenny has an undeniable passion for teaching dance as well as an unrivaled ability to connect with her class on a group & individual level. She is one of those people that are just pleasant to be around. Very respected, inspirational, and excellent at giving feedback. Highly recommended.
Loved the dance class I took with her! She is an amazing teacher and really cares for each individual student! I have really seen an improvment in my flexibility and dancing because of her!

Not realistic at all! even if you follow the guidelines set, he will say it was not. He will give you topics as examples on what to write about but, they make zero sense. Asked for a paper on perception and how the person may adjust due to this, then says you can not talk about perception, makes zero sense!

Dr. Eder is a horrible teacher. He is unapproachable, rude and demeaning to his students.  He is now teaching at Lakeland in Kirtland. 1/3 of his last class dropped without refunds because of his bizarre behavior. He called campus police to escort a lady out of his class. He said she impeded on his ability to teach by asking a question before class
I think he's just great!
Not a people person, crams much material in a small window of class time, thus creating problems on exams.  In other words, look up weasel in the dictionary, and there's his picture.

Dr. Eder is a newer professor, that being said, he is still very much learning his technique.This may cause your grade to suffer as there are no reviews and the tests are short(which gives a lot of weight to each question). I should also mention that there was a noticeable difference in the quality of teaching as the course went on.
Dr. Edwards is a excellent instructor, I wish I could have had him for all my social work classes!
He doesn't teach things clearly. I took notes went to class and I got a D in his class. Just read the book and don't bother with the notes at all.

I did not have a problem with Artley Edwards.If you show up, do the work like he asks, you will be fine. I got an A. Some students don't like  him, as he has his opinions, but take them for what they are-"opinions".Artley may come across as"condescending" but don't take it personal. He can be really sarcastic and witty, he's hilarious!

Professor Edwards is amazing as a professor; very resourceful and professional.  However, it's an extra bonus that he's attractive!!!  Even for an older gentleman its just something about him...so so hot!!!

Make sure you are there everyday and participate with material pertaining to class. He has papers not tests which is a major plus. His lectures are very interesting and fun. Times flys in class becuase you get sucked into lectures. A rare thing among Profs. I recommend him to everyone and anyone not even for a requirment but a great expereince
I really enjoyed Professor Edwards! Very straight and to the point with what is on exams and how you can do well. He takes attendance every class, so make sure you go!

He's a nice, soft spoken guy but he reads directly off the PowerPoints. 2 tests and a final, and 2 short papers and a final paper. Offers extra credit. The whole class was out of 550 points. He's an easy grader on essays-as long as you show you understand the concept and meet page length requirements. Final is comprehensive so it is kinda tough.

By far one of my favorite professors. I had him for an online class Com 211. He was really helpful when it comes to comments on papers. There is a quiz every week along with discussion. Super essay. Awesome Professor!

took his online class. Takes a couple days to get back to you if you e-mail him. Lots of material but more than enough time to read before an assignment. I didn't read through most of the material, took all the online tests and did the discussions within the first month of the semester and got an A (just barely tho). Online isnt hard

For a communications professor, he is very bad at communicating. He is very shy and quite and you can barely hear him. He isn't very clear about what he wants from you as far as participation, because he lectures the entire class and does NOT engage the class in his discussions.

This class is completely lecture with excessive amounts of note taking. There are only two tests, but they are over 6 chapters each on real world concepts that he barely goes over. If you skip class, this is not the class for you. For each absence, Edwards deducts 2-3 points in grading. There are no allotted absences,long lectures,and hard tests.

Easy professor. I missed several classes and still got an A. Offers retakes for some tests, so you can get a C on the test but then end up with an A if you take the retake. One term paper which is annoying, but he grades it very easy. Very boring class in my opinion, but he is such a nice guy and always there to help you if you go to his office!

Powerpoints have minimal information. His explanations in lecture are somewhat confusing. However one on one help was excellent. Barely used the book. Learned a lot but be prepared to work for your grade.
Very Helpful, and takes his time to make the students understand what's going on. Its better if you keep your Participation high. Textbooks were very helpful, not just to score good, but to learn.

Hes a nice guy but he is very confusing with his materials. Needs to be straight forward. Honestly I would avoid his class. His test are just as confusing as him. His reviews will not help you at all. His exams are fills in no word bank or multiple choice.

The class was boring and he made it more confuin. He talked about general things in the class but during the exam he asked all those conceptual craps. If you going to take this class write all of his words to study later because the thigs what he is going to give will not be enough for you to understand the class.

The guy is a good teeacher but the class was boring. That aside his tests are so conceptual and they are confusing. Moreover, slides are not helpful. You will have an idea if you study to the slides but definitely not enough. So you need the book and you need to keep writing in the class. Lastly, he doesn't curve.

The teacher is very helpful and excited about what he does.  The course, on the other hand, is a joke.  The book we use is british and outdated.  The teacher tries to engage the class, but it just turns into a "at my company we do this" story time.  I found the class a waste of time, but you can just study the book and ppts to do well on the final.

Very good instructor. Made everything possible to help students. Exams are based on homework plus had a retest for two out of three exams. Final is not comprehensive. Very easy to get A. Just do homework, excel part and you will easily make through exam. Very helpful. Always respond to emails fast. Fair grading. Recommended.

This class takes a lot of work.  He's very helpful in explaining the material, but stats is a difficult subject.  Take the time to do the homework and look over the materials he provides you.  He doesn't curve, but is very fair at grading and re-testing.

Instructor was good but the concept of this class was unbelievably boorriiinnggg. you can take this class but be sure that you have both books and ready to memorize a lot of things to answer the descriptive questions in exams.

AVOID! he is a very nice guy, but he just simply doesn't know HOW to teach. he knows the concepts pretty decently but as far as figuring out calculations, he's just as lost as we are and he always gets them wrong. there hasn't been one single hw assignment where i didn't want to set my computer on fire because i was teaching myself allthe material.

He is a nice guy. But his teaching style is very confusing. He will give you definitions from the book and doesn't do enough examples. His test are very confusing and the reviews do not help at all. You'll have to rely on the book!

Really nice guy. Very helpful and wants students to learn the material. 3 tests including final, all w/an in class and excel portion. We had a retest covering difficult questions from the first 2 on the in class stuff. The homework took a few hours, but it helped me learn the material better. He's tough, but fair. Interesting class, lots of stats.

Super nice guy and pretty funny too. Class was fun b/c we built Legos for an hour every time. A lot of groupwork and work outside of class at times. Tests are fairly difficult but he did have a retest of the midterm over parts people didn't do so well on. He's always willing to answer questions and really does want you to learn the material.

Nice guy. But has no idea how to teach. When you ask to go over a problem he actually does the problem wrong. You will have to rely on the book. Doesn't give enough examples and tests are just as confusing as him.

Professor Eichhorn's class was daunting at first, two major projects and demanding tests.  However, he was willing to hold your hand if you needed help and give us the opportunity to take an abbreviated make-up exam.  Very glad to have been in his class, he cares about teaching and deserves good feedback.

Is a nice Professor who is willing to help. But be prepared to struggle in this class. His reviews will not help you at all. Exams are 2 parts. First part is concept and 2nd part is calculations. He honestly has no idea what he is doing. When solving solutions he will get the calculations wrong.

This is the first semester this guy has taught a class (fall 12). He is seriously so nice, with a crony sense of humor. But, be prepared to teach yourself the material. I used the textbook all the time, I made my own study guides for exams too. He offers exam retakes for students who do poorly.

Expect to do weekly engagement activities AND chapter questions that have to be 1 full page single space every week. Make sure to buy the latest edition of the book because the questions are different in every edition. If you have questions about anything use Google because she takes forever to respond & when she does she's not helpful

Was good as an online professor, but I also had her for EDL 301 in person, and she was very poor. Her assignments weren't clear, and wasn't helpful in explaining them. She also is just plain rude to her students.
Tough teacher . Not responding in timely matter. Not clarifying assignments . Lots of work required . Writing assigments every week

First day, she complains about her paycheck. Tacky.  Takes weeks to grade assignments with a single sentence of feedback. Grading makes no sense. Gives half credit to a paper missing one tiny detail. Fieldwork was helpful at least, unlike regular class days usually consisting of busy work.  Overall, not recommended.

Took Content Area Lit. online.  Overall, a very good course and she made it interesting. I could apply strategies discussed in my own class.  Downside: she could clarify assignments better when asked for help (although she is willing to help) but the response time to get back can be a bit long.  Otherwise, I'd take another course with her.

Terrible! Unwilling to help students. Couldn't offer feedback. Changed assignments at her leisure. Took off points when she felt like it, someone could have made the same mistake you did but only one of you get's deducted. Boring! Gave 6 assignments at the end of the semester all due within 2 weeks of each other. Weekly Reflections ontop of papers.
I took it in summer and there were so many assignments. I didn't have time to rest.

Professora El-Attar was very helpful and nice. She really strived to ensure each student's success in the classroom. As long as you came to class, participated, and showed effort, she graded you very well. Great class, hope I have her again.

She is a very good professor and willing to work with you. She is very nice, and if you go to her office she is willing to help you. As the other comment said, just make an effort and she will grade you well!

I loved her, if you show some effort, volunteer every now and then, see her in her office like once, attend most if not all your classes, you'll pass easy with probably a B or A.  She'll grade you very tolerantly if you show SOME type of effort.
Best professor ever! Would recommend to anyone. A++++
One of the greatest professors I have had at CSU. So sad he is going to teach at Yale next year. CSU will miss him greatly
Great Professor Really Want His Students To Pass And Understand The Material. I Recommend Him If You Have To Take Chemistry 251/256
She is great. Learned a lot!
I learned a lot in this class.  She is a very nice teacher and very knowledgeable.  She knows her stuff.  If you do your assignments, you should be fine.

This class was ridiculous. I've never had to work so hard for a 100 class. His exams are very hard. He goes over the average when we take them and told us it was a D and still gave no curve! I studied and when I went to the exam it was like I studied for the wrong thing. He gives no study guide either. So be prepared for those exams, yikes.

Dr. Elkins is very witty and very smart. Data analysis is never going to be a "fun" class, but he makes it bearable enough. His lectures move VERY FAST. First half of the class is decently simple. Once you get into the stats portion, find a friend and teach each other. You can't learn it from his lectures. I'm horrible at math but did okay.

One of the toughest graders i'v encountered. The lectures are super dry and very quick. The material needs to be explained better, he often asks "Are there any questions?" after flying through confusing topics but doesn't explain/answer very thoroughly. He's knowledgeable on the course but doesn't explain in layman's terms.

PSC111 is somewhat of a difficult class when David teaches it, and being passionate about the subject is certainly key to getting a good grade. Reading the textbook, taking notes, and coming to class is important. He does kinda have high expectations, but putting in the work will allow you to meet them.

Strict, by the book professor. PSC251 covers a lot of ground, so he lectures fast. Make sure to ask questions and take notes. Dr. Elkins is happy to work with students outside of class. The second half of PSC251 deals with a lot of statistics and data analysis. Learn how to use Excel for assignments and get a loaner graphing calculator for class.

I would say that Professor Elkins is a little on the tough side, but he is by no means impossible. I really enjoyed his class. He's funny, and very knowledgeable. If he doesn't know that answer to a question he'll look it up and give you the answer in the next class. He tests are a little wordy and difficult, but overall I can't complain too much.

Dr. Elkins, while a tough grader grader, gives you useful feedback on every assignment. The material can be dry at times, and he doesn't exactly make it interesting. Still though, he has a great sense of humor and is always available to help students. Watch out for the final, you can study all you want, but it is still really difficult.

Professor Elkins is an extremely knowledgeable individual. However, his teaching style is a nightmare. I took two of his courses in the same semester, both of the courses required a handful of studying outside of class. Hardest teacher I've encountered. I must admit, Elkins is a fair grader and  he is willing to help you during his office hours.

The class is impossibly hard and he is not always the best at explaining the material but he does try. I used YouTube to teach me the material I needed for the tests. He does give redos on assignments cause they are so lengthy. Make sure you give plenty of time to complete them as you won't be able to in one night. Not a bad guy just hard material.

Data Analysis is probably one of the toughest PSC classes your going to take. However, Elkins gives redo's on every single assignment and the midterm for 1/2 to full credit. Also, he gives so much extra credit that I went into my final with 20 extra pts. Do your assignments and the redo's and there's absolutely no reason you cannot get an A.
Worst professor I've ever had, he loves taking points off,  and does everything he can to prevent you from succeeding in his class.

His teaching in Data Analysis receives a lot of complaints from students, but I had no trouble with it. It's not a class you can take lightly, it requires time and effort. If you're good with numbers and concepts, you should get a High BLow A. He gives 4 assignments, and a re-do on each to score better, two tests, extra credit opportunities too.
Speaks way to fast and grades more strict than any professor I've ever had. If you're off by one letter you get zero points.

If you put in the time and effort in any of his classes you will pass.  Dr. Elkins was hands down my favorite professor in the Political Science Department.  He does not hold your hand through everything which is how it should be, after all it is a University.  He hold you to a higher standard and you need to rise up and meet that challenge!

Toughest class in the PSC field. He knows what he's talking about since he mastered research methods, but he expects a lot from his students. You will leave the class knowing what you learned. But you're not going to like how you're going to learn it.

You will not learn much, in this class, from the instructor. You have to get in groups and teach each other. This is the ONLY way you will pass. If you know someone who took this class ask them to explain things to you, because the instructor will not adequately explain concepts and withholds his power point examples. He should not be teaching.

You can not pass this class doing the work,re-do, on your own. Get in groups early or find a student who already took this class. Class is more a presentation of his knowledge than a learning environment. Talks over you and does not adequately explain concepts. Does not give usable examples. Tests are ridiculously long.

Elkins teaches the class like everyone in it has taken a stats course before ,and routinely rushes through material. What you actually learn in this class comes from doing the assignments.   Exams are  very hard with the final including material  we had not covered adequately.  You need to form a study group if you want to pass.

He does give a lot of make up assignments and most of the class brought their grades each assignment from an F to a C/B. But he was very bad explaining concepts in a simplified manner. His final took 2 hrs to complete and included equations we had neither practiced nor learned. If you must take his class, form a study group.
Seminar was tough, but worthwhile.  Read the material, expect your class size to shrink haha. He expects a lot from you but he wants to help you reach your potential.
Loved the Drumming Circle. Great Class.
great
No Comments

She cares about her students, she wants everyone to pass so she is available after class periods and accessible through email. But she is terrible at teaching. She will Power Point you to death and assign difficult homework. She doesn't give you an idea what is on a test. And when you ask for explanations she just confuses you even more.
No Comments

Yorki is the best!!! I was very nervous about taking his course because of his stern manner on the first day of class but in the end I retained most of my Spanish. He tries to help as much as possible. If you attend class and do the assigned homework, you will be fine. Yorki is a great person and an even better professor!!

Professor Encalada is great! he really wants you to learn and to be successful in this class.  I definitely recommend him. Its nice to hear about his country and his culture. In addition he can be funny and he is very  cute.
He's a great guy. Very good teacher. I would recommend him to friends.
Very enthusiastic and friendly. I'm taking his class this semester and I feel like I'm learning a lot. I love his accent. He's good looking too.

The worst professor ever.  Glad students at C-M do not have to take classes from her anymore.  Should have gotten paid to put up with this BS when I was in school at C-M.  Worthless when it comes to bar exam, makes hard stuff easy and simple stuff hard, totally biased and hates most men.  DO NOT TAKE
loved her
Poorly run class, confusing exam.
I would never take a class with her again, even with a free tuition.

Horrible professor.  Lets class get out of hand with hypotheticals.  Final grades are completely arbitrary based on 15% participation which she keeps no record of.  A B+ exam quickly becomes a C+ in the class if you didn't raise your hand because you didn't understand all of the time.
Engel is the most caring professor I have ever met.  She will cover a topic for weeks if necessary to make sure everyone understands.  She is always fair in graded assignments and work load.
Amazing professor interested in the success of students and comes to class prepared.
Her exams are unclear and bogus.  Don't take her.  From a practioneer's standpoint, she teaches irrelevant and contradictory information.

Not an effective professor for upper level students.  She runs the classroom like a 1L contracts class.  She poses stupid hypothetical after stupid hypothetical.  And she certainly has her favorites in class.  Oh, did I mention that her hairstyle comes from 1871 Victorian England?  She looks like she's wearing a dead tree sloth on her head.
Great teacher! Very clear and always available for extra help. An all around great professor who really cared about us as people.
engel is one of the best professor at the school. she was very fair, respectful, and helpful. her exam was trickier than necessary to prove we knew the material.

Pretty good professor. Seems interested in students success. Offers timely feedback on assignments. Very helpful in going over exam answers outside of class. Some of the ways she used to convey the material became somewhat confusing (to most of the class, not just me), but overall a good professor.

i suck at languages and honestly idk how i survived two semesters of french bc ive really just been guessing but Engelking is amazing and she wants her students to do well. the final project for 102 was way too hard for our level in my opinion but i still love her. definitely the prof im closest too
This is a very kind woman who is yet rigorous academically and creative. She is very stimulating, brilliant, and is a wonderful teacher. I highly recommend studying with her.
Great professor. She is passionate about the content area and will truly take the time to work with you. The classes are full of information, it just takes some effort.
She is a wonderful teacher to have for French. Her passion for the french language and culture is contagious. I highly recommend taking her class.

there is a lot of work in learning a foreign language and madame engelking really tries and makes it fun and easy for everyone, no matter your style of learning. a lot of in class examples and group practice, a good amount of homework but it helps a lot.

Dr. Engelking is a competent and helpful teacher.  She cares about her students, and tries her best to share with them her love of the French culture and the French language.  Additionally, there is something very humble about her, as she is open to discussions and exchanges with her students on the topics she teaches.  A very good teacher.
Dr. Engelking was a fantastic french teacher, very helpful and very fair. She got to know her students and clarified when it was needed. Highly recommend

I studied abroad with Madame Engelking and she was so helpful. She loves teaching grammar so if you ever have a question, go to her office hours and she'd love to explain it again. She is very passionate about teaching French and it shows in her student's progress.

She was the easiest teacher ever. I had her for two years and my progress in French really showed and so did the other students. I loved her class, I wish she could teach the upper level French course rather than Annie.
No Comments

Very, very nice woman and a caring teacher. She has a tendency to go off on tangents but they are usually interesting ones. She assigns a lot of work but is willing to cut it down if it seems necessary, and often offers extra credit too.

I have taken several classes with Dr. Engelking and I think she is a really great professor. She is very helpful and cares about her students genuinely. I wish CSU had a graduate program in French, but they only have 500 level courses for Education majors.

Took Freshman English from him in '84-'85.  He turned English around for this engineer -- took it out of my previous selfish train-of-thought brain no one else understood when put to paper and pointed it outward.  Made my writing target the intended reader -- every time, plus emphasis on the importance of every word.  I still remember "Bosselated".
He is a good professor, although the assignments are not very clear many times! And he does not give clear and precise instructions so basically you have to figure it out yourself. He's okay
Good teacher. Interesting reading assignments. Papers are okay. This class wasn't a total buzz kill, but he talks a lot.

Professor Engle is the MAN!  As an English major, I have run into way too many self-involved, pompous, arrogant teachers.  Prof. Engle was like a breath of fresh air; I genuinely enjoyed discussing literature with him.  He is incredibly intelligent, and his relaxed-style of teaching truly fosters intellectual discussion.  Best prof. I've ever had.

Professor Engle is incredibly smart and a genuinely nice guy.  Those people who find him unfriendly must not have really taken the time to speak with him.  He has his opinions... and he is open to our interpretations of the literature. Assignments are fairly straight-forward, just pay attention in class and take notes.  Great professor.

BRING YOUR PAPER AND PEN. TAKE NOTES THE WHOLE TIME (IT BOTH HELPS TO PASS THE TIME AS WELL AS WHEN IT COMES TO WRITING A PAPER OR TEACHING THE CONTENT LATER). THE MAN IS A SPONGE AND KNOWS A LOT ABOUT EVERYTHING. YOU WILL APPRECIATE HIM AFTER THE COURSE WHEN YOU REFER BACK TO ALL THAT YOU HAD LEARNED.

He is a good professor,he really knows his stuff,but sometimes it gets boring because all he does is talk he doesn't involve the students much in conversations. Also,be careful,he gives out assignments that he doesn't really talk about in class, so you are on your own(and if you don't understand the assign. too bad,figure it out!).But overall, good

Dr. Engle doesn't seem to like praise (he thinks you are "sucking up"). He also is, for lack of a better word, eccentric. However, he is very lenient and understanding and is a fair grader even if he doesn't agree with you. Honestly, I would recommend taking him just for the experience because he is a unique individual. Really knows his stuff too.

Extremely intelligent and friendly, Dr. Engle was always ready for a clear, precise lecture and presented every topic with an incredible amount of insight.  Definitely one of my favorite professors I've had in my three years in college! Don't tell him that, though, he doesn't seem to like praise.

intelligent, no doubt. but very antagonistic and unfriendly. very interested in hearing himself talk. i found him difficult to work with on a special project, and he was extremely hard to meet with. it was a disappointment. seemed like an edgy person, liable to get angry at any moment.
great class

Professor Engle is very intelligent and he knows how to use his intelligence to the benefit of his students.  He doesn't have an attendance policy but I never want to miss class.  I hope to be as good a teacher as he is to me.
He is one of the most intelligent professors at CSU.  I learn so much from him!!  That's all there is too say - he's amazing!
I loved this class, I looked forward to the time we spend in class.  His techniques were both orignal and fun!!

I enjoyed this professor.  There is something intense about him.  He created an ivy-league atmosphere in his classroom.  I hated his book choices:  David Foster Wallace, John Barth, Thomas Pynchon.  DIFFICULT stuff to read (but always impressive to tell people I read them!).
No Comments
No Comments
He is one of my favorite professors. He also does photography. Ocassionally his art gets displayed. You should ask to get on his mailing list.
I absolutely loved Dr. Engle and his class - I will definitely be taking other classes from him.  He is one of the best prof.s at CSU
Was very helpful and you can tell he really enjoys teaching and wants his students to succeed!
Great professor and a super nice guy. He tells you exactly what you need to do well in class. His tests are slightly hard but not too bad. Just attend class and study the slides.
Participation is very important. If you attend class and study based on his slides you will do great in his class.

Professor English is hands down one of the best professors I've had in my entire college career. His expectations are clear and easy to meet. Everything work related is cut and dry. No surprises. His lectures make going to class that much easier. He encourages peer-to-peer involvement, very laid back classroom environment. Definitely recommend!!

Professor's lectures are very good, inspiring excellent class discussion. Professor English is available for conversations at office hours and makes an effort to understand the personal circumstance of each student. The online section is very limited by CSU, and has flaws, but these are hardly attributable to Professor English.

His teaching style makes you want to learn more then that is expected for the class.  He enjoins students into his lectures, and his lectures are more like a conversation. I would not hesitate to take other classes with him.

Favorite class I've taken at CSU-Jeff English is a great prof! He has taught classes and worked/studied in many foreign countries for part of his career. He teaches you with real world perspectives because of his past experiences abroad. His insight and questioning allowed the students to connect and engage in class discussions. study for exams!

By far one of the best online courses I've taken. The professor offers timely, specific feedback on all assignments. He also utilizes relevant, current topics in the weekly discussions to encourage meaningful dialogue between students.  J. English is knowledgeable and passionate about education/subject matter; highly recommend any course with him!
Reading and assignments are applicable and valuable.

This was an online class. I had never taken Marketing before and found it very interesting! His power points were helpful and otherwise the course was relatively clear cut, discussion boards, 10 short quizzes, 1 exam (final), and a group paper that was actually fun and not hard at all! He's a great professor, definitely recommend!
Need the book. Lots of reading. Expects you to engage in lectures. Writings need to be well thought out and researched.

Very interesting class. Lectures of more of a discussion of the real world between the professor and the students. Online quizzes which were ok, discussion boards and a WAC paper. You don't have to come to class to pass. I rarely went to class and I passed with an A

Professor English is an amazing teacher. You will need the book for the quizzes and power points will not get you through the quizzes. Very knowledgeable about the material and relates it to the real world. The lectures are very interesting and you will find yourself participating in this class a lot. I would defiantly recommend him.

Caring and considerate, professor English wants to help you pass this course and actually learn the material along the way. Most of us take this course as a requirement, and he knows that, but he's still passionate about the material and about us having a greater understanding of it by the end of the semester. Thank you! My hard work paid off!

Professor English is very knowledgeable about the subject. I think that because the 4:3 conversion, a lot of material was rushed. He wants students to do well.  The book was very helpful - just read the book for the tests. 1 paper- you get to pick the topic. Group work which was easy & interesting.  Feedback takes forever, but all in all good class.

An enjoyable classroom experience. Very free form. Quizzes are online and rather tough even using the book. He's a kind grader on discussion boards and writing assignments though. Show up, do your work, and you will probably get an A.

Second class with this professor.  I enjoy the format of both online classes (MBA 500 and MKT 501) of essays, chapter responses and discussion board posts. Only complaint is that he can be slow to grade and give feedback in time for you to make adjustments on future assignments.

I recently took this class as an online summer course. There's a lot of work in this class. A 400 point paper, active participation in discussion board assignments and ten quizzes. Professor English is quick to respond to emails and answers any questions you might have. I would recommend him and I would take another class he teaches.

I was not looking forward to a summer business class but Jeffrey English is very organized and you know what to expect right from the beginning. He is also quick to respond to emails and more than willing to help you. You can tell that he wants you to succeed in his class.

You must be a serious and disciplined student who writes well to get a desirable grade. Professor English is a nice person, but VERY demanding and grades tough. The final exam was the most brutal exam I've ever taken. I'm a 3.70+ GPA entire college career. Weekly quizzes, discussions on Blackboard every other week, & two major research papers.
Very good teacher!!!! He is smart, and makes the topic fun and interesting to learn about.His tests are difficult and you need the book in order to pass this class, he uses it almost every class.
Easy class, Quizzes are pretty straight. Go through the chapter/slides, you will get an A.

Professor English is one of the best Professors you will run into your educational career. You will learn a lot from his class. Very organized, clear, easy going, flexible. Ive heard a lot of good things about him word to mouth and after I took his class, I can tell you consider yourself lucky to get in his class. Definitely recommended

He's a great teacher! Clear instructions on due date, and follows the syllabus! He was a fair grader, and set a perfect pace for the class. Overall, I learned a lot from his class and I would definitely recommend to other students! Great and clear instructor!

Probably the easiest WAC class there is.  About 5 discussion posts, 5 quizes (straight from book), and one 5,000 word paper.  You have to turn in a rough draft of the paper so you know what you need to fix. There is also a final exam.  It is very easy as long as you do you work on time and keep up with the class.
Good class

Changed the grading scale right after the drop add ended. No partial credit on homeworks, either all points or none. Constantly argued with students in class because his lectures were riddled with mistakes. He said that if ever makes a mistake in lecture and someone emails him, he will only tell that student the right answer. Avoid at all costs.

Had him for C/C++...worst teacher I ever had. It was basically just a programming class because all he taught was basic programming. I learned nothing from him about the C++ language, and he never once mentioned C.

Do not expect him to teach you, because he doesn't. He asked question that he never thought topic during the final. If you know C/C++ programming course will be easy for you, you don't need to come to class, just stop by during exams. His class is time consuming, it is better you to learn programming self study.

The professor was not helpful at all... He would teach math rather than programming. It did not prepare me for my next class which is CIS 345 (operating systems). He doesn't teach C++ or C. When you go to ask him a question, he doesn't know how to answer them.

Did not reference the book at all, email is hit or miss, and he does not show examples on a computer in real time... He sent me some code to test and it didn't work. I think he needs to get on the computer and not the black board. AVOID IF POSSIBLE.

Ridiculous professor. All he teaches is math concepts and basic concepts about programming that everyone learned in the prerequisites. I learned nothing from him about C++. The last hw had us using C, BUT HE NEVER TAUGHT US C!!! Horrible teacher. He should be fired. Emailed for help countless x's but never once responded!

Takes off too many points for stupid little errors. He will take off 50 percent of your grade for forgetting to do something that doesn't even impact your program. He needs to get over himself and stop testing on concepts...this isn't a concepts class. Teach us on the language...not how good we are at math. Get over yourself! It's a 2 credit class.

"Questions, comments, whatever:"  The 3 recommended textbooks are not referenced at all in class, and his many handouts (not tree-friendly) are riddled with errors. Focuses on solving math problems more than teaching code. Poor e-mail communication. Tries to impress by dressing nicely and using big words. Better off self-studying C++.

The class is overall not too difficult, but it is very boring. The lectures everyday are dragged on. However, she gives you almost all the questions and answers to the midterm and final so those are pretty easy. Attendance isn't mandatory, but it is worth 10% of your grade. Boring, but easy for a Gen Ed requirement.

She graded four things this semester (fall 2018).  Beware of the midterm and final, the questions have multiple correct answers according to the textbook and some are often vague or not phrased very well. But, shes a nice lady and helpful if you need anything.

She is a little boring however, we only had journals, a mid term, final and class points for showing up. Very easy teacher. DO THE STUDY GUIDES! They are the exact same questions for the mid term and final :)

Ummmmm No. Epuran was confusing and late all the time. I ended up trying to drop out of her SOC 210 class but couldn't and had to stick through the worst course EVER! She doesn't seem to even remember when her own tests are. She spends a lot of time guessing about certain things and is all around hard to understand.

I took her back in Spring 2013 during my second semester and I freaking love her class. There were on two tests one midterm and one final. There were 2 other quick assignments as well. Her classes are fun to be in, mainly because she is down to earth. She can be too easy-going at times, but overall a good professor.

I haven't been in school in over 14 years and found Ms. Epuran's class very insightful and a great way to return to college.  Her teaching style is relaxed which might have bothered some of the other people that rated her but she is clear about what she expects, very helpful, and approachable, which can't be said about many professors.
She is very funny, one of my favorite teachers. I highly recommend her.
Very good :)

She is a poor instructor. Her test writing is lazy and difficult only in that she's not testing concepts but your ability to memorize names and theory titles. Allows class to act out without chiding them. From day to day the direction of the course changes. Take a different gen-ed. If you have an interest in deviance read the book on your own.

Class is a joke. She changed the class structure halfway through the semester because she realized none of the students took it seriously. Constantly berated students for no reason. Gave pointless reading assignments. I would NOT recommend her to anyone.

If you are interested in a professor who is inspiring, makes you think, and challenges you to explore the nuances of an extremely complex and important subject, DO NOT take this course.  I was consistently frustrated with this course's pace. If you want a very very easy A, but don't care about the quality of the professor, this one may be for you.

Attendance is worth 10% of your grade but going to class is basically useless.  She kind of just repeats the same thing the entire class.  Tests are 20 questions multiple choice- some questions are ridiculously easy and others and pretty much irrelevant.  Take another prof if you want to gain something from lectures.

Two of the easiest courses offered by the University, if you take Epuran. No really long papers and exams are a joke. You can basically BS your way thru both of these courses. Professor is extremely helpful and nice.

Dr. Ergin actually made chemistry enjoyable which is something I never thought I would say. She gave weekly homework assignments rather than quizzes, but we had 3 attempts to get 15/15 so it was a real padding on the grade. She did review sessions for those of us who showed up to class, which was essentially the test. She's the best prof I've had.

Best chemistry professor at CSU by far. Go to class even though you don't have to because she explains it way better than the book does. She's a pretty difficult grader and I had to work for it, but this is the first time I've ever understood chemistry. I wish I could take every class from her.

She's great. 100% would take her again. Attendance isn't mandatory, but you should go because sometimes there are in-class bonus point opportunities, usually right before and after exams. A lot example problems she works out in class really help with homework and exams.

Theres an online weekly quiz, 2 tests, and one final. All worth 500 points. Theres not much room to boost your grade. Went to every lecture, but could barely hear her because shes so soft spoken. Never received old tests, so you never know what you did wrong. Show up to the lecture after the tests because sometimes shell give bonus quizzes.

The class is kind of boring. Dr. Ericson is nice enough but the class is often awkward. He randomly calls on people in class to share answers to complex questions. There is an 8 page paper, a 12 minute oral presentation, and the midterm and finals are take home but need to be 8 pages each. All of the work hits you at once and attendance matters

Dr. Ericson is awesome! He is always available and understanding. He will help you any way he can. If you show up to class you automatically get a 20% grade boost. There are no tests in this class just 4 papers that were 5 pages and a 15 page final paper. He loves discussions. If you come to class and participate it will be an easy A for you.

Dr. Ericson is awesome and an easy grader. He is always available and understanding. He will help you any way he can. If you show up to class you automatically get a 20% grade boost. Tests are generally 2 questions. The policy paper was an 8 page max. He loves discussions. If you come to class and participate it will be an easy A for you.

Pretty decent professor. Tests aren't to bad. No take home tests for the midterm or final. Policy paper was only six to eight pages. Uses Socratic method so always be prepared to add input to the discussions.

I like Prof. Ericson. Midterm and final were take-home but the term paper was long (15 pages). He's quite soft spoken and he teaches via the Socratic method as others have mentioned. He assigns 5 books which you will have to know for the exams. He's helpful though; I was confused on one of the final questions and he practically gave me the answer.
Nice guy, but very quiet. Hard to follow and since reading isn't my favorite, it was always last minute cramming for his exams.

Nice guy but very soft spoken, disorganized, and not helpful. Never ask questions bc you'll never get an answer, he'll in turn ask you the same question you asked him. He requires 5 books. He never goes over any material that's in the books. Tests are essay questions, just know a little bit about the topics he gives on study guides. Easy grader.

Professor Essa is fine, his lectures is what you expect, lots of powerpoints. For Software Engineering thats all you really can have because the class is all concepts. You really learn stuff during the Final Project which was great but wish I could have learned stuff in class that helped with it. Software Engineering is easy, read the powerpoint.

I could not understand a single thing he said during the entire semester. I doubt he knows what he is saying. Addition to that, I think he did not cover much of the course, which is needed for the subjects to which this course was a prerequisite. Despite not teaching anything, he is strict and expect much more from students.

We never took any feedback for our quizzes, assignments and exams other than our grade. We asked him for the answer key to know what we did wrong, but he ignored us and never provided them. He is inconsiderate and reckless with his students. It is just a horrible course with a horrible professor. Do not recommend at all.

The lectures are poorly explained. It is my first time taking with this professor but definitely the last time. His course is all over the place. We missed two lectures and he gave us two quizzes after that without even explaining anything. The lectures are not related to the quizzes and the assignments. Everything is different from each other.

You will have to work hard in this class to get an A. Dr. Essa's lectures are more pointless than a pencil without lead. He expresses no enthusiasm in his teaching, gives difficult coursework and causes confusion among students by continuously changing requirements in his coursework . Make sure to attend class (for points) and stay in the grind.

My thoughts: "what you just said is one of the most insanely idiotic things I have ever heard. At no point in your rambling, incoherent response, were you even close to anything that could be considered a rational thought. Everyone in this room is now dumber for having listened to it. I award you no points, and may God have mercy on your soul." -BM

Okay, professor eustace is a great guy! But he's been a physicist for so long he expects us to know and pick up physics easily. But if you into intelligent men like me trust and believe your not coming ( no pun intended) to really learn physics. He's a total hottie for his age.

This was an easy A. Tons of extra credit, if you get anything other than an A or B then you gave zero effort. The lectures do not help but the tests and quizzes are open notes/book. If you are a non-physics major then this is the right class for you. Note: HW is expensive but is where most extra credit is offered.
Tons of hw and extra quiz points. Material is tough if you don't like physics but he knows that and everything is open note. Don't email him - he will not respond!!

The professor you want for PHY221. Quizzes are sometimes in class and other times they are take-home. Open-note tests and quizzes. Lectures aren't very helpful, but gives LOTS of extra credit, makes for an easy A. Homework is difficult but most answers are on chegg. Final is optional if you already have enough points to get the grade you want.
Best professor I ever taken and makes the class easy to pass. Makes the class easy to get an A. Take home quiz&exams. Gives so much extra credit, that makes half the grade.

Take him to pass with an A. Not good with lectures, BUT OPEN BOOK & NOTES on quizzes/exams!!!! Alot of EXTRA CREDIT. all questions are on google. Doesnt pay much attn, so easy to cheat in class. Plenty of HW, get min. 70% and he gives you full credit on it. Take home quizzes/exams. Have an A or near it you can SKIP the FINAL, he HELPS you get it.

Professor Eustace is, unfortunately, not a very clear person. His power points are a jumble of badly written examples, and his lectures are similarly incoherent with no logical flow from one subject to another. The homework requires study and help, but is otherwise doable. One redeeming aspect of Eustace is ample extra credit.
Stay away. Terrible professor. Bad lecture. Bad notes. Not helpful. Not clear on anything.
By far the worst professor I've experienced. Terrible with lectures. Bad notes. Lots of assignments. No clarity. I belive this guy is out of touch with reality. Stay far away.

This teacher is the one to take for physics 221 and 222. This class is mostly bio and health science majors, which he understands. He makes it as simple as possible since we will not be using most of this material in the future. Most quizzes and tests are open note since there are so many equations to remember. Best physics professor!

If you ask questions he will gladly help. Not very clear during lecture, poor examples. BUT, homework and weekly quizzes are EASY. Tests based off quizzes and gives TONS of extra credit. He knows this class is mostly for other major requirements. If you put in the effort, you'll do just fine. Bases final grade off total points earned.

This guy is by far the worst professor I have ever had. His lectures are completely worthless and he is not available for office hours. During the recitations after class he helps individuals rather then addressing the class as a whole.

Never shows any good examples, mumbles to himself while he is lecturing, notes aren't very helpful. You'll be learning from the book and that only. I've never created a RMP but I thought it was important to warn people about this guy. Lazy personality, he even admits it.

Teacher is generally unprepared for class.  Teaches for about 70 minutes, then class is dismissed.  Better friend than teacher.  Not a good friend.  I was totally unprepared for PHY242 with another teacher.
She is an outstanding teacher who goes out of her way to facilitate learning, to make a so-called dead language accessible and even interesting.
She is an outstanding teacher who goes out of her way to facilitate learning, to make a so-called dead language accessible and even interesting.
Super sweet and understanding! Very interesting course and she is great at explaining everything. Doesn't mind when people ask questions.

Magistra is an exceptional instructor. You will not just breeze by this class, but if you do the homework and participate, you should have no problem getting a decent grade. She also is very willing to work with students outside of class.

Mrs Ewing was an excellent teacher. Shes willing to help if you act like you want it. Latin is very easy to get behind it so its important you come to class every time and stay focused even if you are clueless. If you put forward the effort, she will go out of her way to help you. Latin didnt fit my schedule but its a nice class and you learn alot.

I had not taken a foreign language before taking Latin, and Mrs Ewing shattered any expectation I had for a teacher. She is extremely realistic and helpful. She is willing to help you if you're struggling, if you are willing to be helped. I would recommend her to anyone.

Professors do NOT get better than Mrs. Ewing. I absolutely adore her! She will do practically anything to help people with the material. Latin isn't easy for most people, but she made it so much fun and she was so enthusiastic that even people who hated the subject stayed in the class. The class is real work, but she makes it more than bearable :)

Taking Latin for fun. After two years of terrible teachers at CSU i wasn't excepting much but she really is a wonderful teacher. She is very knowledgeable in language, culture, and history of the Roman people and she ties it into learning the language. She give a lot of work and a quiz almost every week but it really helps in the learning process.
Good teacher.
She's very helpful and actually wants everyone to do well.  She has a love for the subject that comes across in her teaching.

This teacher was great!  She covered a lot of material with relative ease and came up with several methods to help us establish memory devices.  She was very friendly and responsive, and very interested in the material at hand.  I highly recommend this professor!
No Comments

Very nice teacher. Her class is interesting and she was open to everyone's opinions. We had some great debates in her class. Only have to write 4 essays and a final essay (2 pages long) on interesting subjects. I would highly recommend her.

His clinical was an absolute blast. He is the best clinical instructor I've had. Get ready to learn a lot, he will teach you incredible things, DO NOT BE LAZY. Plenty of med passes. Tough w/ careplans but he is FAIR and CLEAR. Gives good feedback on everything so you can adjust. He'll quiz you on everything but helps you along to understand it all.

His clinical was an absolute blast. He is the best clinical instructor I've had. Get ready to learn a lot, he will teach you incredible things, DO NOT BE LAZY. Plenty of med passes. Tough w/ careplans but he is FAIR and CLEAR. Gives good feedback on everything so you can adjust. He'll quiz you on everything but helps you along to understand it all.

Professor Eyth is AMAZING!! He constantly quizzes us, but if you aren't sure the answer, he will give you hints, but make you work for them. He is very knowledgeable and loves teaching. He gave us a confidence that we didn't have before being his students. Great sense of humor, but a real stickler for the rules as well.
The class was easy. 3 tests and a group project. She is a very easy grader too, i think everyone in the calss got an A. She was very funny too, i thought. I liked her class!

She was a good teacher, likes to lecture alot, but tests are not too hard if you take notes. I like her how she would review for tests and give students an idea of what to expect. I would recommend her.
waste of my money

I thought the tests were easy until I got my grades afterwards. There are questions on the test about the books and the opinions of the authors. My best advice is to have a study group and compair notes before each test. The reviews for the test are not very helpful. I learned absolutely nothing from this class!!!

Very nice lady. Conversational style lectures - but can get boring. Class attendance does you good, but not part of grade. Didn't use the book. She doesnt prepare you well for tests - but a lot of it is common sense. test motto: no dates, no people, 50MC. Overall easy class and good professor.

Lectures are more of a conversation.  Interesting.  Didn't use the book.  No reason to.  Going to class helped a lot.  Some topics were stretched and but it proved the point she was trying to make.  Overall easy.  Go to class.

This class is very easy.  Lectures can go off on tangents and down memory lane - not always pertinent.  Easy A or B.  You do not even need to read/buy the text books.  Unfortunately, I think this class could be a lot more useful and challenging in a good way, but it's not.
This class is by far the easiest sociology course in the 300 level I have ever taken, or for that matter sociology course in general. Easy papers and exams; Easy credit for WAC also.
No Comments

This class was too easy.  Waste of time for me.  If you take this class and do not get an A there is something wrong.  The material is touchy and voicing your opinion usually gets you in trouble.  Boost your GPA with this one!
I like her style.  She tells you like it is.  I like that.  Doesn't take any BS.

The class is easy, it consists of lectures and labs .The lectures are a snooze but when you do a lab the class flies by.  You do SAP and are given a booklet with the step by step instructions.  The teacher was ok, just the lectures were pretty much pointless as were the exams.  He curves the exams because they are impossible.Overall the class wasOK
Excellent

I didn't have a problem with this class other than the fact that you recieve 200 labs over the course of the semester and don't know what you are doing the whole time. However whenever you hit a wall the teacher was willing to help you resolve your problems. The tests could have been better written and the book is not used.
No Comments
Terrible!
