Her exams are speed-typing contests instead of law-testing fair tests. With half class having "disability" granted time and a half on the final, it was impossible to get a good grade. Even with having the knowledge and being great at legal analysis. Very unfair professor.
Good professor in class and a nice person. However, her exams are essentially typing contests (unlimited points ceiling) and she likes to be kitchen sinked.
Love how organized this professor is. She tells you exactly what you need to know, but not in a boring way. Her exams are writing contests - unlimited points.
She stromed out of class because 3 people in a row couldn't give her the answer she wanted. Never mind the other 65 people in the room that pay her to teach. Great example of a dean.
Very approachable outside of class.  Helpful with academic and administrative difficulty's.
She's just great!  Very, very clear and knows Criminal Law very well.  She's a good lecturer and is super-approachable outside of class.  I would take any class that she teaches.

Very clear. Fair Exam. Great sense of humor, which some can take a little too personally, like when she laughs at what they say. But what they miss is that she's usually laughing at the pompous over eager daily hand raisers who always have some stupid nonsensical garbage to say just to hear themselves talk. (not at those struggling) She's great.

he is the best professor ever. Hes respectful and will try to help you as best he can. you may have to repeat your question but classmates may better explain your question. He will help you outside of class or after class. He is a model Prof

Tests are straight forward and he really wants you to learn. He provides a lot of extensions for homework and gives a lot of extra credit. ATTEND CLASS AND TAKE ALL THE QUIZZES! It's not a hard class but he's hard to understand sometimes. The homework is easy, the math learning center is your friend, and ask questions in class.
dont take this class unless you have to.. lectures are hard to understand, tests are difficult and homework is graded on being completely correct you will never get a good grade on an assignment
He gives quizzes unannounced, but encourages the use of office hours. He really wants to give you an A. Ask questions in class!!

Best professor I've had! He's so nice and helps you if you don't understand the topic, even on tests! There are some pop quizzes but if you attend all of them you get bonus at the end of the semester. I actually understand stats now, and he has the clearest notes of any professor I've ever had! I'd definitely take another class with Professor Fan!!

Professor fan appears intimidating and strict at first, do not be fooled. Professor Fan only wishes the best for his students and his notes & homework correlate directly to his quizzes and exams. NO NEED for textbook either. Nice guy, great professor!

Midway through my first semester and Richard is a great teacher. You have to get past his heavy Japanese accent and you will be fine. He grades extremely easy. He has the funniest laugh that makes everyone in the class absolutely loose it. Overall he is a great professor and I haven't really needed to study hard, just do the homework, and show up.

Richard himself was an awesome person as a professor... honestly I didn't pay attention to his lectures because he was impossible to understand. But since attendance was mandatory I was on twitter and IG most of the time. Homework and tests were super easy and on top of it he is a VERY VERY easy grader.
Great instructor.  Mildly attractive with a good personality.  You will get an A, just show up.
pretty easy class, nothing out of the ordinary. Professor always offered one on one help. I would recommend taking this class if you need to take chem.
Decent class. Very Boring, Professor seemed uninterested. I feel like he skateboarded to class

I go to the community college he teaches at. Very rude and doesnt help his students at all. Goes through things way too long, and wasters time ranting on how some students arent doing what HE wants. Yells at you in the middle of a test. He yelled at me for not having the homework done HIS way.

Honestly amazing teacher always helped me and very knowledgeable in math i got to know him first hand and learn about his past he would even call me on days i missed to make sure everything was okay and really was passionate about helping students

He really wants all of his students to pass. Sometimes he goes off on little rants but I took him for Math 87 which is completely online, and attendance is mandatory. He'll help any student that needs help but definitely show up everyday, even if it's just for attendance. A lot can be done at home.

Expecting to actually be taught? Better not have him as your prof. EVERYTHING is on your own. You're responsible for teaching yourself all the material, since it's basically an online class that you're required to physically show up to. There is SO much work. Tip: don't be like me and skip for 4 straight weeks so you stress yourself out.
Good professor. You can tell he genuinely wants students to do well. Also quite friendly and approachable.

Great professor! He has a genuine interest in teaching students, especially those who have difficulty with math. I'm thankful that I took this class with him because he gave me the confidence I needed to be successful in Algebra, Calculus and Statistics.  Wonderful teacher!

Though he can teach and will explain concepts well, his random rants are annoying and unnecessary. Also, doesn't go out of his way to help other students. Will just yell at you if you don't do what he wants. Pay for MyMathLab early or else he won't let you register for it. He will say you are irresponsible and yell at you every chance he gets.
Great teacher. Kind of has an accent, but you eventually get used to it. Perfect explanations of problems, concepts, etc. Can be kind of snappy at times but overall, a good teacher.
A little hard to understand with the accent, but a very good math teacher. Goes quickly, but explains things pretty well. Overall, good professor.
He is fine here, but this is not a community college, where I hear he teaches very poorly. He should remember the difference in schools. I would never take him again.
Wonderful, smart and a great teacher!

He was a great teacher. Tries to help those who don't understand math very well. goes out of his way to help people that are falling being, even people that don't show up half the time. Slight accent, but you get use to it. Overall pleasant guy. He has a tendency to go on rants about stuff not related to math, but it is funny to watch.

If you can't pass after him teaching, you might as well go back to high school. A 12-year old could understand Algebra after he taught it. Tests are exactly what he says they will be, very helpful. Extremely clear, son't be afraid to correct him, even he is wrong some times and he admits it. Defiantely take him!
Very helpful and caring.  Doesn't mind what you do in class as long as you're quiet.

He's very helpful and looks out for you. His tests are very easy, just study the test reviews  he gives you. If you like math this is the class for you. He's extremely nice and fun to joke around with.
No graded homework or additional assignments given in his class to assist students to improve their grade. The teacher is not flexible and not available to help his students.

Dan is a great teacher. He definitely understands the material and answers questions almost immediately. No office hours but email replies 24/7. Decent exam curves. Overall, the course is NOT easy, but he is competent at teaching it. If you want to actually learn finance, he's your guy.
Not very helpful. Lack use of the textbook and classroom hours. He has high expectations but does not provide resources and opportunities to meet them
Was extremely fair in grading and very helpful.  While class size was alrge, he condcted additional study sessions on the weekends.  Also helped with job searches.  I would recommend.

Gives out homework on things that have not yet been covered in class.  Makes lots of errors in his teaching, handouts, power points. etc.  Many people in the class rely on the internet to help with assignments.  However, if you email him a question, he emails back very quickly with a concise answer that makes sense.  Over all I DON'T recommend him.

By far the best math professor I've had. He tries to be engaging, and always works hard to make sure all his students understand what he is teaching. The only grades are quizzes (but they're usually in groups), the homework on Pearson (usually two a week, but super easy and he goes over it in class), and 3 exams on there too. Highly recommend!

By far the best math professor I've had. He tries to be engaging, and always works hard to make sure all his students understand what he is teaching. The only grades are quizzes (but they're usually in groups), the homework on Pearson (usually two a week, but super easy and he goes over it in class), and 3 exams on there too. Highly recommend!
Professor Fast was not bad. Just get ready for a lot of homework which isnt horrible since you can work ahead and the homework is a huge part of your grade.
Great and very helpful. might get frustrated sometimes but at the end, he always tries his best to make sure you absolutely know what is happening. Best grader!

Prof. Fast can be a bit dry, but he knows the material and he makes sure that he covers everyone's questions. Teaches by going through the homework and explaining concepts as they come up, which is a lengthy process but effective. If you show your work on quizzes and tests, you'll get partial credit even for a wrong answer. It's difficult to fail.

If you want to pass all you have to do is the homework(all online), show up for tests and quizzes, and have a solid understanding of basic math concepts. The professor was funny and engaging at times, but due to the course material he tried to drag out the class to the full hour and fifteen minutes. He's a nice teacher and very helpful overall.
Take him if you can! hes the best, and he really tries his best to help you understand. He works through every assignment he gives.
Such a great teacher. He will make sure that you know the material. Easy going and always willing to help! Take him if you have the opportunity
Always makes sure if someone needs help. Gives good feedback. Not a tough grader.  Gives plenty of extra material if needed.
Cool prof, talked with her for hours about what to do as a career. She cares about students. Wish I had her again. She's the real deal.

very sweet professor that's more than willing to go above & beyond to help you succeed in anyway possible. tests weren't bad at all everything is straight out the book, powerpoints & lectures. very easy & fun class. lectures are ok but mostly just stuff of powerpoints. would take again. clear grading scale. should be able to pass with no problems.

I love Dr. Faur! She listens to students and gives many chances for extra credit. She had interesting activities and discussion, did not just lecture. She didn't yell at students like someone said. Some students were very rude but she was nice to everyone. She is a bit soft spoken and some students take advantage....I learned a ton.

You never know what she wants. When we did a group project she yelled at the class for not being prepared but in reality she forgot to bring the material we needed to present with, such as the cord to connect the laptop to the projector. You will have to teach yourself for this class. The only reason I went to class was to get the extra credit.

I suggest not taking Faur, she only reads straight from her powerpoints and gives you little but expects more. Her test are 40 questions but is over 4-5 chapters of material. I understand teaching yourself some concepts, but not to this extent. So if you would like a teacher who can read PowerPoint she's it!

The entire course grade was based on homework and tests, I get tests but homework? In an upper division course? And it was only assigned in class? That is in my opinion ridiculous, attendance in upper division courses should never be mandatory. Furthermore the course material was psych 101 at best, Freud belongs in general psych.

Prof Faur was wonderful. I learned a lot this semester. I wasn't excited about adolescent psychology, but she made it enjoyable. I enjoyed the teaching style of asking many tough questions. We had many classroom debates. Exams were somewhat hard, get notes if you miss a day. Papers were easy, but must know APA format. Many extra credit points.

Dr. Faur is pretty great. She doesn't give her students more than they can handle, and she really takes student feedback seriously. Papers were easy. The material was interesting. A must take class, especially if you want to work with adolescents in your near future.

Dr. Faur is great. She went out of her way to help me when I was sick. She gave a chance to get my work in. I loved her lectures when I was able to come though i ended up missing a bunch due to health problems. I plan on taking more classes with her.  She knows her stuff and is down to earth and approachable.

Dr Faur  is a passionate prof. I loved her multicultural approach. She was generous, easy going and helpful. Lots of lively  discussion in the classroom. She grades tough on papers, get help. She  had lots of availability to meet with students even offered extra credit for meeting with her or going to writing center. Do it. She cares about students

Dr. Faur's class was cool! She taught outside the box. Had funny videos, activities and examples. I loved having powerpoints online. Her tests were fair, with option to drop lowest grade of first two. I didn't like the disrespectful class atmosphere by a handful of students who talked non-stop. She tried to stop it.I think she is too mild mannered.

Adriana is awesome! This was a fun course and I learned SO much! She kept us intrigued with different fun activities almost every class. I learned a TON. She gave lots of extra credit and an option to drop your lowest exam grade. You can tell she likes teaching and her students. I am fascinated with psychology now and thinking of changing my major.

Reading below is not right. Mrs. Faur did not throw out any exam for failure but b/c she have student option to drop an exam. She was amazing teacher even though there were immature people in class. I think they don't like foreigners. They picked on her accent, immitate her. It was distracting for everyone. I don't konw why she don't turn them in.
Basically taught myself.

I love Dr. Faur! She created an open atmosphere to discuss material. She gave tons of extra credit. She showed interesting videos and gave neat assignments, like doing the IAT test. Her tests were kind of by the book, but they were not too hard. She seemed to care what students thought. Even if she sometimes seemed a little nervous during lectures.

Adriana Faur class initially seemed enjoyable. Though she is a very well mannered and nice teacher I found that her teaching methods were poor, as well as her public speaking skills. She tended to say the word "um" frequently. She was also very unclear on her assignments and what her expectations were. I basically taught myself for this course.

Mrs. Faur  is avaialbe to students. She is fun and does lots of experiments and activities in the class. I love the class and am sad that it's almost over. I never knew psychology was so interesting. I change my major to psychology from science. There is lots to study and tests are hard but fair. She gives lot of extra credit in class if you show.

Faur's exams are not that difficult but psychology requires a lot of studying. I recommend the SI sessions highly. She also dropped our lowest exam grade so once I got to the last exam I had an A no mater what I did on it. Be prepared to read the book extensively and use that as your main study material.

Dr. Faur tried hard to engage the class. She had a lot of class discussion and thought provoking exercises. I loved her lectures. She was a passionate teacher.  She cared about how we did. She gave feedback on drafts of papers. The grading was not easy on the paper, but she gave lots of EC if you go to class. I learned a lot, and did good!

This was a hard psy course. Adriana was great and her classes were always interesting. Even though I didn't do as well as I hoped, I learned a lot and felt she tried to give her students as many points as possible. Do your research proposal ahead of time, and ask for extra help. She doesn't grade easily on it.

Jen was a great lab teacher. Very helpful with all of the material and made sure students knew what they would be tested on. This class you had to learn by being at the lab, no way around it. Textbooks will only give you an idea but being there is really what will help you. High recommendation for Jen she was great.
Jennifer is cool and offers extra credit.

Professor Federman's lectures are awesome! You must go to class to understand what is going on in the class because he does not post the lectures nor does he use any type of power point during his lectures.

Prof. Federman is great! I recommend everyone take this class, especially as early college students. His lectures are informative, engaging, and relatable. Always makes sure he involves the class in discussion. Grade based off of 4 exams (final not cumulative), possibly a paper, & if u show up and do end of class assignments, u get 5-10 points.

don't buy the book you wont use it. tests are off of lectures given in class. awesome lectures that keep you engaged, gives real life examples & lets class participates every chance he gets. miss class, it's okay get lecture notes from classmates. everyone is able to pass this course. will highly recommend taking this professor. i'd take again.

You definitely need to go to class but it will be well worth it. Easily one of the best professors I've ever experienced. By the end of the semester I felt I had drastically Increased my critical thinking skills as well as understood the concepts presented at a deeper level than most classes.
Alan is amazing!!!!! His class is very easy and you must show up in order to get a good grade!

This class is so easy! He cares about the students. He allows students to talk about their feelings. Even though there were 100+ students in the lecture hall,  he lets everyone voice their opinion or ask questions before moving on.  He's actually the best PSY teacher, IMO. It was a great group therapy.  Easiest A of my life.

The lectures are long, but they are highly informative. This is the best class, IMO, that I have ever taken, and he is the best professor, IMO, that I have ever had. Over a year ago I took the course, and I still think about his lectures. Tests are questions on APPLICATION of theories learned. Makes it harder, but tests knowledge not memorization.

While his lectures are generally rather dry, Federman really knows what he's talking about. In his off time he's a couple's counselor and adolescent psychologist which often means you'll have some really great examples given to you in class from his life's work. The only downside is his frequent assignment of group activities! DON'T BUY THE TEXT.

This class was 5050. I really liked the lectures because they were informative and very educational. He taught a lot of interesting theories and ideas. One thing that was tough was his exams; all application questions. You have to take his lectures, interpret them and then apply it. He doesn't go by the book and attendance is crucial to passing.

He's my favorite professor ever, and I'm not even a PSY major. You need to go to the lectures and take notes because that's where the test questions come from. His tests are a bit hard because he makes you apply the concepts to scenarios, but his grading scale is EXTREMELY curved so it evens out. Do not buy the book! Overall,I highly recommend him!

This was probably my favorite teacher I've ever had. This class really inspired me to continue in the major I am pursuing. If you care about this subject and have an interest in it, you will do great. I got an A and thought it was very easy.

Very easy class, with the grading scale being an 85%+ an A. He is kind of nerdy but overall cares about the students and is a smart guy. Show up to class, read over the notes he supplies, and you will do fine
Lectures are interesting and the papers make you think. Tests are fair. The book is really useless your a psy major.

Prof Federman is a competent instructor and is pretty laid back.  He ties in stories of his past clients with lecture material to give a real world example.  Exam material is straight from lecture notes but the book is interesting if you are a fan of this material. Grades are based on 3 or 4 multiple choice exams.
Class itself interesting, but tests and papers unclear. Don't buy the textbook-it was never used.
Don't buy the book unless you're a psych major. Great teacher(seriously great), very interesting class. Lectures are very interesting and well prepared. Fair tests.
Great professor so far, very engaging... concepts are presented and reviewed in a way that makes you remember. I recommend.

I learned a little in this class, but I feel like I had already learned most of the material in Ed. Psych.  His papers are annoying.  He did make an effort to learn names of people who spoke up in class, but the lecture seemed to actually serve more as a group therapy session.  It became annoying after a few weeks.

Loved him as a teacher, hardly ever had homework, only three test 50 questions multiple choice, very funny, showed interesting videos. HIGHLY recommend him and his class! Awesome guy!! very easy going with turning things in later.

By far my favorite teacher this semester. His lectures are always well-prepared, and it is obvious he has a deep interest level in what he teaches. Very relaxed and understanding guy. Easy to follow lectures, and his tests are based solely on the notes. This class helps you to understand yourself as well as the material. favorite class and prof.

He explains the notes clearly and at a good pace. He is always open to questions and explains things thoroughly. The homework is worth a lot and he will help with homework problems if there are questions. He did not have office hours but was available before and after class.

He explains the notes clearly and at a good pace. He is always open to questions and explains things thoroughly. The homework is worth a lot and he will help with homework problems if there are questions. He did not have office hours but was available before and after class.
He is a nice man knows very well and teaches very well . He is so organized so u dont lose anything always ready to answer questions and explain them if u study well u learn a lot in his class

Okay I am terrible at Calc, and the class was a mess bc it was in person but we had to bring computers in for tests. He didn't know what to do when anything would go wrong. The tests were tricky and there were 4. A lot of time spent doing homework. The class definitely would've been easier if tutoring was open. He was a nice professor though.

He was a really great Calc II prof, but you must be pretty good at your Calc I skills before taking. He goes pretty fast and skips over some steps that are basic from Calc I. Calculus sucks sometimes, so he might not be so great if you are very rusty in calculus, or in math in general. But if you're solid and hardworking, you'll be fine.

Dr. Feister seems to know the material well, but is in no way eager to help anyone pass. Liked to always tell the class about how many people failed his class in years prior. Was always unsympathetic about those numbers, and pinned it on the class every time. You'd think if less than half the people pass his class every year, he'd notice a pattern.

Feister has no understanding of pacing, he chooses to stick religiously to his schedule and skip parts whenever he deems needed. However in doing so he alienates the class since nobody knew what the hell was going on. Learning about how Physics works the day before the test, unrelated to class, while we had historically low scores was honestly sad.

I had a great semester with Professor Feister. He does a good job explaining some of the more confusing topics in Calc 2, and if you put in the work on your end, you will pass the class. He loves the math, which makes the experience that much more enjoyable. I definitely recommend taking the course with the SPT sessions, and doing HW in the MLC.

As a student, I expect the teacher to go in to full detail on how to do a specific problem, usually, you would expected more practice with problems that look like test questions. Yeah, he doesnt do that. AND HE IS ABSOLUTELY A TOUGH GRADER. You also can't miss more than two sessions or you instantly fail. Avoid if you can.

He is honest when it comes to algebra and trig: you MUST know them, there is no time to explain unit circle over and over. He provided 10-15 exercises for each section, and he was always available moments before and after class if you need help. Exam questions were fairly similar to practice problems, no impossible/unusual questions on the final.

Does not explain things. Just puts problems on the board and solves them with no calculator and expects you to know what's going on. There's no theory given or background on what you're learning. It's almost as if you have to already know calculus to understand this course. It's bad enough I'm a programming major having to learn this.
He gave clear instructions for learning and I just need to study and practice by myself, he made new concepts easy to understand and apply. Nice to work with him in Cal 2 and Discrete Math.

Took calc 3 with him. He does not care about his students or if they pass. He once made a comment to the class about how he expected more students to fail a test problem and was surprised at how many students did well. Sets his students up for failure and does not care about them passing or the effect on GPAs. Would not recommend. Awful teacher.
Need to be self practicing

By far the BEST lecturer in Mathematics I have had in college. His ability to teach complex concepts multiple ways in order to make sure each student understands the material is astounding. He makes the varying topics in discrete mathematics much more interesting than the average math professor. Absences affect your progress and thus your grade.

Professor Feister is an amazing teacher who is extremely effective and efficient at teaching conceptually difficult material. His lectures are at a good pace and expects students to ask question if necessary. I plan on taking Professor Feister for my future courses!

AVOID!!! I usually don't rate any professor as most of them were helpful in their own way but not prof. Brian. Does not curve any marks. You get what you get. Also exams are 150 points and 5-6 question. If you are not prepared you are done. Homework don't weigh that much in the final grade. Exams and grading are unreasonably tough. AVOID AVOID!!!!!

Prof. Feister is a great professor that's very knowledgeable in his field. Willing to help you outside of class if you ask. His lectures are very fast paced and it's understandable because of the amount of material in calc. Calc 2 is a hard class in general.

Very tough on students, as others have stated he seems to be anti-social and expects students to know the subject 100% before attending the class. Tests are only a couple problems but if one or two is missed you're basically done. Would not take again.
Great guy, great lectures, very willing to help you

Such a good Prof I purposely took him for Calc I, II, and III. He explains things in a way that is easy to understand and easy to pay attention to because he isn't a boring lecturer. He would stay for hours after class to help students on their homework problems. He is unlike any Professor I've ever had! Take Feister he's cool trust me.
Easy A. His lectures are long and boring. He's not the best teacher, but he's a great person.

He is wonderful as a person but as a professor I was disappoint. He is very smart, but he does not know how to transfer his knowledge to the students. Hopefully, his teaching style will improve, because as person, he is cool. I got an A, but I worked for it. Not easy A.

Ben is a really great guy but not a great professor. We had a lot of homework and quizzes so attendance is mandatory. I really want to give him a 3, but his tests were so brutal and most questions were ambiguous. Also, he constantly second guessed himself while lecturing. It was awful and the most confusing class I've ever taken. Avoid him!!!

Professor Feldman is a good guy. His class is interesting and required attendance. Going to class, participating in discussion and reading the text book will definitely help your grade. There's a quiz every other day and as long as you attend class, you'll do fine.

Professor Ben Feldman provided a lot of opportunity to do extra credit throughout the semester. He was always available to answer questions and helpful by providing examples in class. It would have been more appreciated if materials such as black board notes could be posted more timely however overall this was a good class.
Was extremely helpful by provide plenty of extra credit opportunities. However, the test question were a little confusing

He was a pretty good professor. Lots of extra credit opportunities and make sure to go to class, because he shows in class videos that are on the tests. Tests were mostly memorizing the details but they were multiple choice. Overall he was nice and a good professor and I recommend him.

This teacher was very inexperienced. I believe it may have been his first year teaching. He copied things directly out of the book which made having the book almost pointless. The text was confusing in itself. He's very nice though. Lots of extra credit opportunities.

He seems like a smart guy when it comes to math, but when it comes to teaching he is terrible. If students have questions or get lost in the lecture, he tells them that he needs to move on with the lecture instead of making sure that they understand it. He makes many mistakes with grading and lectures and students have to correct him. TERRIBLE!
He is a horrible Professor

Expectations are not clear, when asked what he expects or what you will be tested on he states he will need to ask another professor, due to the other professor writing all of his homeworks and tests. The content is not too difficult but he often makes mistakes so if you follow his examples you will often learn incorrectly. You will teach yourself.

Professor Feller is one of the worst educators I've had in my college history. He is very awkward, which relates through his teaching style. He is confused by his own lectures, and often the methods he is teaching turn out to be incorrect. Students have had to correct his mistakes numerous times. You end up teaching yourself.

Professor Fellows is one of the friendliest professors I have had and is always willing to provide help and guidance both with class work and student's career paths. While the lectures are not the most engaging and he did make a habit of becoming disorganized with addressing assignments, I would highly recommend Fellows.

Professor Fellows is one of the friendliest professors I have had and is always willing to provide help and guidance both with class work and student's career paths. While the lectures are not the most engaging and he did make a habit of becoming disorganized with addressing assignments, I would highly recommend Fellows.

The class is the usual business class, but Professor Fellows makes it fun! He really cares about his students and wants to see them do well. There are 2 group projects and a 10 page paper. There are 2 exams and a quiz for each chapter.

Homeboy takes the entire semester to reply to a single email. So if you happen to have any questions or concerns about the class you will have to email him multiple times before you get a generic response. Seems as if he forgets he has an online class to teach so he never communicates anything with the students, he sent out the wrong syllabus to us

Professor Fellows is an amazing professor, he is nice, very smart, and his lectures, he makes you think outside of the box, and the cases are going to be fun to do. He wants to see his students succeed and do great in life. I would not mind having him again. The class on zoom were fun too. Something to get use to . I recommend him for MKT 420.

He seems like a good guy and he's really passionate about what he teaches. 2 group projects (both PowerPoints) and a 10 page paper that he grades nicely. My only complaint is he runs a very unorganized online class: he changes due dates around often and you don't receive grades or updates on projects. He's probably a better professor in person.

He is an amazing professor. He is extremely helpful, the projects are interesting. I loved his class so much and I have so much respect for him. The tests aren't too bad, there are 2 projects and a 10-page paper. Overall, a great class.

Brad does a great job of applying real-world scenarios to the marketing world. He is really funny and easy going. He loves when the class participates, so just add your 2 cents in once in a while to earn those bonus points. Overall this guy is great, take him and you likely won't regret it.

Professor Fellows was a great professor for me. Had him for two classes this semester and earned A's for both. Brings real world experience to the classroom and is a good connection to make. Extremely well read and knowledgeable on current events and class topics. Found his classes interesting and engaging.

My favorite teacher at CSU by far. Take this class for marketing. His exams are all just memorization of the progress checks on the slides he provides to you in class. He cares about his students and make sure you participate in class! There is a group presentation but it is very easy. I enjoyed going to his class.

Professor Fellows is a great professor. His exams are tougher than most professors at CSU but he just makes sure you know the material. He really just wants to know he did his part in helping his students succeed. He is a very genuine guy and has his students best interest as a main focus. All in all, I loved going to class. He is great!

Professor Fellows is a great guy. He gives the class a lot of choice over the course which can be a double edged sword. Professor Fellows is a very caring guy who has a genuine interest in his students success and the well being of his students. It is fun going into his class everyday and would love to take his class again. The exams are lengthy but he does let you know the test material so put in the time and you'll do fine! Great guy and great teacher. 10/10!

Teacher signed in as zoom lecture started every day, not before. Then spends first 15 minutes every class trying to figure out the audio. Dr. Ferguson is an absolutely amazing instructor. His love of the subject is infectious. This is the most hands-on class I've had at CSU and I loved every minute. If you put in an honest effort, you will do fine.

Great class. I loved all the hands on stuff,  plus I never needed to read the text. Gets everyone very involved and is such an easygoing guy. Awesome professor, he has ruined me for my other professors.
This class is great!  He really gets you involved, and there is a lot of hands on work :)
He was really involved and loved teaching.  I would recommend him.  He gave a lot of homework but you really learn a lot.
Try to avoid the classes he is gonna teach by any way. you won't learn, and you won't pass!! you're  just wasting of time and a lot of pressure!!

this is a very fun class. u should take it!

The most engaged professor I had at CM. This guy actually cared more about his students and this school more than his own legacy. A rare find this law school.
The man clearly has a lot of knowledge, but he has suffered 2 strokes and it shows. He rambles a bit and can be very hard to follow. Be prepared to teach yourself.

I hate math and Fink made it fun and easy to understand. She is also really great one on one and is very approachable and willing to explain things so that you can really understand them.

Dr. Fisher is a great man. He teaches in the old-school style, requiring attendance and attention to lectures in order to flourish in his class. Terrible, avoid this guy! Textbook is inconsistent with his lectures. He always took the test questions directly from the books, but none from lecture.

DO NOT EVER TAKE HIM!!! He is the worst prof. I've ever had in every sense. He is rude and he's not afraid to tell you. His tests are ridiculous. He starts out very dry, tries to scare away people who want easy grades. Is very nice though. Class is mostly about homosexuality, even the in class movies. A nice guy but turned the class into most about Homosexuality. Got boring... But it's not impossible. His tests are kinda hard and he asks the most RANDOM things (but he DID mention them in class). Mediocre difficulty. It bugs me that he lectures from a different book than the one we are quizzed on.

Dr. Fisher is awesome  He really knows what he is talking about Those who feel he is too tough probably never attend class and just want an easy A  We are in college this man wants you to act like it, learn, & form your own opinion Material is interesting Class is not impossible or even tough not something that will take SO much time..intriuging

Good class.  At first you may feel overwhelmed there are a lot of notes, and when you get the first study guide its a lot of material. But the material is interesting and He makes the class interesting and very funny. Attendance is mandatory and you wont do well unless you attend and do the study guides.  I recommend it.

He starts out hard to see who wants an easy "A." He seems very crusty at first, but he's a generally cool guy. Show up to class, take the notes (there are a lot!), read the book. Do the work, it'll pay off.

Well... not a terrible class, but not a great one either.  On the up side, he's very funny, generally teaches what he says he will, and is not very difficult. never went to class and got a B+

just read what he teaches, the consepts are difficult but he does a good job explaing it his exams are not imposible if you are prepared, however you would fail the class if you don't read the book carefuly !!!

Lectures were simple and easy to understand. Great to talk to on individual basis with any questions one might have, very understanding. Didn't matter if you missed class. Definately need to take good notes though and understand theory applications.

definitely not hot. hes pretty weird, and a grumpy old man. I really liked Prof. Fisher.  He really knows what he's talking about.  It was good not having hw, and as long as you read the book the tests weren't too bad.  I'm still trying to figure out whether or not he's gay lol

Prof Fisher has been one of the best professors and clinical instructors I've had yet. She cares so much about her students and wants to see them succeed. She is super accessible and always willing to help. She's extremely knowledgable and teaches in a way where it's easy to understand. She is simply amazing, any student is lucky to have her.

Prof Fisher has been one of the best professors and clinical instructors I've had yet. She cares so much about her students and wants to see them succeed. heavy load of lectures. most difficult quizzes and homework. his TAs can not help you much. most stressful class. the most unpractical class I have ever had in my whole life.

Poor structure. It is a flexible, asynchronous class, and the course load is not high - therefore, it should not be a difficult course. But simple Java concepts are not explained well at all. not teaching organized. can not reply to quizzes or answer assignments based on what you are taught. you have to video record yourself for taking quizzes and it is difficult to upload them
Not teaching through lecture notes and classified information just some videos that can get difficult to understand sometimes . Complicated assignments and difficult quizzes .

Unless youre really good at coding, its really difficult to understand his teaching. The way he taught our online class simply taking screen recordings of his coding. Very unorganized. Made me realize how much I hate coding and I ended up switching majors.

Course was delivered in a very laid-back format. Assignment due dates are pretty flexible as long as you ask first, as his main focus is to get you to really learn what you're being taught. A genuinely enjoyable experience.

Fiske is an excellent professor. Very knowledgeable and easygoing. He responds to emails and discussion board posts almost instantly, any time of day. Longest it ever took was maybe ten minutes. Lenient with grading and deadlines. My only quibble is that his assignment instructions were sometimes unclear, but he is happy to clarify.

Overall good and chill Professor, very knowledgeable in the subject and is always willing to stay or have office hours to explain things you don't understand. Very easy going if you attend his class. Weekly quizzes and some computer projects. If you need extra time he will give it to you. Definitely cares about his students

Super laid back and nice guy. Weekly quizzes over material from the previous week. They test your knowledge without being too excessive. Lowest quiz scores are dropped. EXTREMELY generous when it comes to grading and is willing to put in a lot of time and effort if you need help. Overall an excellent experience! Would take again 100%

Ive learned so much about programming in this class and he is super easy going and if you need more time on a project, he will give you an extra week if you ask. His quizzes are easy if you pay attention in class and if you need more help, he is a great explainer if you go to his office hours.

Brian is a pretty cool guy. His classes are powerpoint-based but he is so personable that it makes them manageable. Still a bit boring but maybe that's the subject matter? I don't know. He's nice and helpful so the boredom-factor gets a pass.

Dr. Flack would show up every day with NASA gear and talk about his NASA aspirations for the first 15 minutes of class. The lectures were usually sprinkled with political comments about Ben Sasse. Also, the pop quizzes covered material we didn't have time to cover in class. It all came down to reading the textbook, apparently a hobby of his.

I had him for Spring semester 2020. Worst professor Ive ever had in my entire life, and this is my 2nd degree, so Ive had a lot of profs. I havent had anything but an A on a report card since middle school, and I had a C in his class. He was very confusing and made the material much harder and way outside the scope for this class.

He is one of the worst professors I have ever had! He only teaches concepts of math he does not show any examples that are straight forward. He is the worst transfer out immediately!

Professor Fluellen is thorough and educated on topic. Class set up is nice. Weekly quizzes from text book, due on Saturday nights. 5 discussion boards within entire semester. Big chapter paper due week 12. Must interview social worker for papers due (just once though). Final exam on code of ethics for social workers. Good class, clear-cut.
This class was no good. Flynn is a nice enough guy but he can't teach worth a hoot.

Really good professor. Curves final and second exam. Does all the problems that you ask him to do. Undestandable and easy going. Just do the problems from the book that he tells you to do come to class and you will do fine. Recomend him for everyone.

I love this prof,he was very helpful,he will go through any problems in the book,give u formula sheet,no attendance but if you want to PASS,you better attend all classes especially,when exams is very close. He's grading system is pretty simple. Expect make-up test if many people failed an exam.

He wasted a lot of class time getting started and wasn't the most helpful professor.. but it was a fairy easy ride. Lets you use 3 pages of notes/ exam. My advice to you is find a homework buddy and make sure you know how to do it. Curves the final so fairly easy ride.
Never take him, terrible teacher, cant explain anything to save his life nore does he have time. DO NOT TAKE!

Um, um, um, yeah.  Get ready to hear him say those words about 1,000 times each class.  His lectures are pretty boring.  He wastes too much time using powerpoint slides and Excel.  He will give the class a chance to add extra credit to your grade.  He's horrible at explaining things and going over examples that actually help you.  um, um, yeah.

would not recommend this guy.. never knew what he was saying.. yes you can have a ton on notes for your tests but you'll never be prepared for oms 202.. asked for help he acted like he didn't have time - every time!
Easy professor, lets you have tons of notes when taking his tests.

all tests are given online on excel/BB and out of class. gives examples of pretests that are very similar to exam. no homework, good personality, and relates the topics to real life examples. easy A and also gives extra credit. don't need textbook. doesn't take attendance. I would take another class of his

I'm glad I took this class with Professor Flynn. Our tests had real world applications and i'm grateful for that. Did not need to use the book/ don't recommend buying it. He is funny and very relaxed and easy going. Knows what he is talking about as he worked on Wall street before and has a lot of experience in the Financial field.

Fodor is a fair grader. His homeworks can be lengthy, but they are very helpful in learning the material. The tests are straightforward and fair, too. His lectures and notes are brief and easy to understand. If you do not understand something, he is usually available to answer any questions. Overall, he is a great professor and very amiable.

This guy is the way to go if you want a fair grade for physics 1 and 2, he grades as if it's your introduction to physics as it is in these courses. If you need someone to force you to learn it because your study habits are bad, take walker, he is tougher and your grade will be lower, but you'll understand more.
Very nice, helpful, smart and cute!! I LOVED this professor. I highly recommend taking any class of his.
Excellent teacher.  Extremely helpful and good at maintaining interest level of the class.

This professor does a lot for you as a student. Any help is always welcome. A power point is available online for every lecture. He is very knowledgeable in his field. If you get the chance, I recommend Prof. Fodor.

Ossian was a cool professor. Had him for 101 a year ago and he remembered me. Good grader, have papers back with notes and offered office hour appointments for extra help. Always happy to help and really passionate about his topic. Amazing professor who made the class fun
I enjoyed being in this class at first I didn't like the class but once I got use to the class it became much easier the professor is cool
while the class was easy  and fun, ossian hardly ever showed up to class. having a professor look like house m.d. was fun, though and I'd probably take his class again.

Foley is extremely unclear on his assignments. He came to class completely unprepared and would tell us so. Foley was a decent grader but I'm pretty sure he never actually read the assignments and just gave us random grades. Topics discussed in class were often irrelevant. This class was a waste of my time because Foley did not teach me one thing.

Dr. Foley is a very devoted instructor who worked hard to make sure all students felt included in the classroom. I learned a lot, especially about nursing priorities. I feel very well-prepared after taking this course.

Dr. Foley is very inspirational and is an amazing professor! His lectures are a little heavy due to how long the class time is, but he makes up for it with good stories. He is very approachable and is willing to help at all times. Listen to his tegrity lectures before the test and you will do well. Do not start the paper for this class last minute!

Craig is a very down-to-Earth guy despite his background. Brings plenty of experience and real-world knowledge into lecture that makes the subject less dry. Clear expectations and straight-forward multiple choice exams.

Craig is a very down-to-Earth guy despite his background. Brings plenty of experience and real-world knowledge into lecture that makes the subject less dry. Clear expectations and straight-forward multiple choice exams.

Dr. Foltin is a great professor and I highly recommend him. Intermediate accounting is one of the hardest courses in the university but he takes complex material, simplifies the subject, and makes it clear and easy to understand. Take him for 331 if you want to learn the most about accounting. A is tough but B is not hard to get if you understand

This is the hardest class for accounting majors. Foltin made that clear to us, but he did a great job preparing us to tackle the material and gave us advice for our future careers. This is my second time taking his class and I can say that he has been my favorite professor at CSU. He takes the time to learn the name of every student and respects us

Craig Foltin is one of the best professor's I've had in 3 years of higher education. He is extremely knowledgeable and his lectures are straight to the point. Take good notes and ask questions. He is willing to help with any questions and does a great job preparing you for what will be on the test. Lots of generous extra points and curves.

Professor Foltin was a pretty good professor, he lectured pretty much every class, but he did go over all of the homework in class. He is very laid back. The exams are hard and 85% of your overall grade, but if you make flashcards and take all the notes in class you'll be good. He really tries to get to know his students, which is very nice!

Craig is an amazing teacher and really cares about his class. Knows a lot about accountin considering he is an accountant. Wants you to do well in the class. Lots of homework but helps you understand the info. Three exams and are 33 multiple choice questions. Accounting is so hard and i wouldnt want to take it with any other professor.

It's hard to find a good accounting professor at Cleveland State but I must say Craig is the best. He's an awkwardly funny guy who really cares about his students. Accounting in general is challenging for me, but the homework and text really helped me through my exams. Make effort to be known and he wont let you fail.
Tough but fair.  Made a boring subject interesting.  Alot of real world examples helped me understand

I enjoyed this class and professor Foltin. He is funny, very social, rational with grading and ethical about business. His tests are directly related to his notes which means attendance is needed. After the class, I feel I have an excellent grip on the subject for a CPA reveiw.

good teacher, very clear, pretty easy if u pat attention, uses book sometimes has good notes to read from, tests are easy if u study what he gives u, I would def take him again very nice, kinda boring, but a good teacher
Great Professor. Can learn a lot from him. Energetic and motivating. He is very helpful.
Good examples.  Good knowledge.  A bit tough
boring but pretty easy id take him again

Kris is a great person and instructor. She makes waking up for a morning class worth it, and always has inspiring quotes to motivate her students. She's also very positive. I hope to be more like her someday.

Prof. Fondran is an amazing yoga instructor! I have learned so much from her class. One of my favorite things about her class is she does not throw you right into difficult poses, she eases you into them and works you up to be able to do it -- which is great for those who have little to no yoga experience.
Lectures are long and boring. I am an EC educator, so  the content of this coure is of little use.

Kris is an amazing yoga instructor. Every week when we met, she would be very loving and helpful. Since it was an Honor's Experience Course, we had to do practices at home and keep a journal. It was really helpful to incorporate it in my daily life.

She is very nice and easy to relate to. She understands that not everyone can do the yoga moves and she is extremly helpful and gives modifications that are easier to do. I really think you should take this class. you may even learn something about yourself.

Took the class online and it was not hard. Turn in the assignments on time and you will do well. Did have to post on message boards and stuff like that but it wasn't bad. Made me more health concious. Assignments and quizzes were graded fairly. Seems like a really nice person.
Great, useful class.

I had Dr. Ford many many years ago and I am so happy to be able to get a chance to praise him as a teacher and a scholar on this site.  There were no websites in my day!  But there was Dr. Ford and he taught a scholarly, clear and insightful Milton class and hope students appreciate him now as much as I did then!

Extremely intelligent, sometimes a little difficult to understand.  He is extremely friendly and helpful to students, and makes sure to be available whenever possible.  Certainly one of the smartest profs I've ever had.

Totally knows what she's doing. Really puts a ton of effort into everyone. Extremely meticulous grader & doesn't like mediocre papers, but makes you a better writer. Definitely not the class for you if you want to be lazy. Super approachable. We do several mini drafts to prepare for our finished papers, and it really helps for procrastinators.

lol people hating on this prof here only because of his conservative views in this very liberal law school. I personally like to see a different perspective on things... you know, something they should be introducing more to law students

lol people hating on this prof here only because of his conservative views in this very liberal law school. I personally like to see a different perspective on things... you know, something they should be introducing more to law students

He wears his politics on his sleeve but he wasn't the first professor I had who did.  That might bother some but part of law school is growing thick skin.

Although we are on opposite sides of the political spectrum, this didn't really matter, and it made for interesting discussions. Very knowledgeable. Helpful outside of class. Cares about students...yes, even the liberal ones. Enjoyed the year with Forte.

Professor Forte is an excellent teacher!  He pushes his students to exceed and expects them to respond to questions with intelligent answers, as they should...we are, after all, law students.  Most individuals who dislike his teaching method are usually those interested in working for legal aid  who haven't a clue about constutional law- scary!
He busts your balls in class, but you learn a lot.  The man is obviously sleeping with the Constitution and/or the Founding Fathers.
Brilliant man.  Good class.  A bit of a smart a**, but for the most part friendly.  Handsome.

That makes for an awful professor.  He is rude at times to students and likes to add and add to assignments on the syllabus throughout the semester with o

I've had Forte for 3 classes, and he is outstanding. Disregard any snide remarks made by 1L's disappointed in their C in Con Law. Get over it, you're a 1L. Forte is a certifiable genius, and contrary to what others say, tends to keep his lectures fair/unbiased. I'm a liberal and I adore, respect & admire the man. Take him for any perspective class.

If God were a law school professor...                He is simply the best our school has to offer.  Period.  People who say he's not a good teacher are usually the ones not treating Con Law like a 1L class as they should.
Probably the smartest professor at C-M, however not necessarily the BEST professor. Very right-wing. Tough to follow at times, but a generally captivating teacher.

Professor Forte is one of the best professors I have ever had.  He teaches difficult subject matters but he is more than responsive to questions and concerns. A real jerk!!!!
horribly inadequate, and he doesn't care about his students. Doesn't make the subject clear.
iew iew iew. thats all i have to say about that. The most ridiculously pompous, right wing, chauvinist person i've ever met.
Did not know the correct answers to his own quizzes. Was unprepared and unethical throughout.
Dr. Foster is everything good about teaching. The class will require work, but it's grad school, so that is to be expected. He's an incredible professor.

Dr. Foster was by far my favorite teacher thus far in the program. You will have to do some work for a good grade but he gives great feedback. Dr. Foster makes you think abstractly and is inspiring. He is knowledgeable in his field and has a beautiful soul. He is kind and understanding. Loved him!!

Hated the group projects and wish we had been able to do more individual work.  Great feedback on assignments and the class discussions were fabulous.  Paper expectations were clear in his mind but he had trouble communicating those expectations to students.  But I would still take him again...I learned  a lot!

Dr. Foster has been one of the best professors I have had in the Joint MSW Program--he is articulate, engaged, knowledgeable, empathetic, and he knows how to facilitate generative classroom discussion. He is a wonderful teacher, and it was an honor to be in his class.
A very brilliant mind and kind heart. Was a pleasure taking his class.
No Comments

This guy messed up the final so bad. The figures were all mixed up or not there at all and there was information missing from some of them. This was during the COVID-19 online learning but it shouldn't have been a problem because all the other quizzes and tests were online already.

The class is basically an online class because nobody wants to attend a 6pm lecture. His lectures dont make sense, so dont bother going to class. All the tests, quizes, and design problems are on blackboard, so just use chegg. You wont learn anything in his class. The final exam was even messed up; none of the images matched the problem.

Dr. France is a really laid back and funny guy. He is kind of monotone but his personality makes up for it. Tests are very straight forward and he gives out useful notes and study guides. He also likes to give extra credit but you have to be present in class to receive it most of the time.

Dr. France is a really laid back and funny guy. He is kind of monotone but his personality makes up for it. Tests are very straight forward and he gives out useful notes and study guides. He also likes to give extra credit but you have to be present in class to receive it most of the time.

Christopher France is also lecture heavy. However, they only let me pick 3 things so I had to put hilarious because the guy can tell some good jokes. He is always wanting people to participate, but only like three people do. You have to check blackboard for due dates because he doesn't mention them in class.
Really funny, not a stickler
PSY 101 is easy but, you never use the book!

Going to lecture will help you a LOT in this class. He will put stuff that he says in lectures on exams. Makes jokes throughout class, keeps it fun. Always plays music in the beginning of class! Participate and go to his office to look over your tests for extra points!
He was one of the best teachers I have ever had! Tests are easy and straight forward. Show up and study and you will be fine! He also has a good sense of humor.

the option to do studies instead of writing papers to get your credit is amazing and definitely makes this class easier. great lectures, pay attention to his outlines and add your own notes, pay attention to the figures in the textbook that he mentions, test questions come from there. no real homework, just quizzes for each chapter and a few exams.

Exam questions are multiple choice; if you know the definitions, you should be able to pass easily. Sometimes throws on questions of examples talked about in class but not in the notes/textbook. Gives occasional bonus point opportunities. He is also likes to crack jokes, Overall, I learned a lot without being stressed out and enjoyed the class!

Has a pretty dry sense of humor, but you get used to it. You don't necessarily need the textbook, but it is extremely helpful for the weekly quizzes and the tests. Takes attendance randomly throughout the semester, so you need to show up. He gives you the notes. As long as you show up and pay attention, you will be fine.
Fair quizzes; tests are straight forward from the lecture and lecture notes.

Dr. France is your typical lecture giving professor. Very hard to pay attention during class and I found it more beneficial to learn the material on my own rather than listen to his monotonous lectures. It is helpful that he puts all the notes online. Do the the study guide and review the quiz questions before exams and results should be fine.

He's pretty funny, but be prepared to zone out he has a chill voice. Overall, he's smart and well educated, i learned a lot. His exams weren't that bad, were pretty much straightforward and pulled out from the textbook

Dr. France doesn't grade by much, so if you miss even an attendance day (but you never know when they'll be) you could be in for some trouble. His lectures are survivable at best, be prepared to look out the window for a few hours every week, but if you do sign up, look forward to brain day! He will have another professor bring in real brains.
Good teacher, funny and pretty nice.  Definitely wants to make sure you know the material.  It's a WAC course, so there is a lot of writing but it's not hard if you actually try at it.

Had him for psy lab which is a WAC course so papers are mandatory but he was really easy going. Lenient  when possible if you ask him . Willing to help you improve your papers before they are due. Offers specific examples of assignment so you can see what the finished product should look like. Only had 4 papers and 2 exams like 15 questions each
He gave lots of extra credit, mostly he would randomly pick a day and if you were present in class he would have you write your name down and give you credit. Tests were pretty hard though

Dr. France is a great professor. He really cares about the information he is teaching, and he has a solid knowledge on said information. He does in-class grades every once in a while. All notes and quizzes are posted on Blackboard

He is knowledgeable about the subject but very boring. In addition to being boring he is sarcastic and not funny. He made a student cry during class with his insensitive comments. He uses unnecessary sarcasism when creating his test. He is a fare but tough grader on the papers. I would not suggest taking him.

He is kinda funny but tends to talk a bit monotone making his class hard to stay awake in. Bring snacks or drinks to keep you awake. Pay attention, READ, and study and you will be fine. I've barely read at all and I'm getting a B at the moment with extra credit! He gives lots of opportunities for extra credit, DO THEM.

Lots of extra credit in class just for going. Ended up with about 10 extra points because I always went to class. He's pretty funny, but like all lectures, his can be boring. A few online quizzes for easy points. Three exams, all had study guides. Make flashcards for the exams based on the study guides and you will do really well. Would take again.
Assigns a lot of reading but I didnt do any of it and still got an A. Tests were open note which was peachy. Gave good lectures and was very considerate.
Assigns a lot of reading but I didnt do any of it and still got an A. Tests were open note which was peachy. Gave good lectures and was very considerate.

She is one of the best professors I have had in college. I would take her again if I could. She was so caring and helpful with everything I ever asked her. She worked with me to get my grade up the whole semester. She's very nice.

Dr. Francis is a very knowledgeable, caring, and understanding instructor. Her teaching style consists of many lectures and some in-class activities. She requires much reading to be completed prior to class time, which is essential for quizzes and class discussion. However, she provides feedback needed to complete assignments and class success.

She reads off of all of her PowerPoints but tests are open book/note. She encourages participation, but her tests are a bit tricky. Make sure you come to class. It's easier to put the PowerPoints onto a word doc to search key terms during the test. The way she words test questions is a bit confusing. She's easy to talk to though and caring.

I really enjoy Professor Francis. She is very smart and knows her stuff HOWEVER while the topics are very interesting, she makes it kind of boring and bland. I know its her teaching style and she really cant change it but I wish she was less of a power point lecturer and more of an open lecturer. Overall shes great and very understanding

Loved Linda Francis! wonderful professor with great lectures and a fun project. As long as you come to class and participate in discussions you'll be fine. Some of the readings are optional and youll also get to watch some really good video clips in class! Got an A in the course.

Great teacher. She is very caring and her class was interesting. Only thing I would say is that she grades tough and her tests are difficult despite the fact that it is open note open book. Make sure you read and study and go to class because there are points for class attendance.
Best professor ever! She's always willing to help in any way she can. She is very assertive and knows her material. I took her 3 times. Amazing professor!

Prof. Francis is a really sweet and caring woman who genuinely wants her students to succeed. She gives open note/open book tests, so her projects are easier to focus on when not having to study for a test.

Instructor Francis is a very caring professor who cares about the outcomes of the students she teaches. The only grades are one paper and 4 tests so not many options to improve your grades. I would take her again since she is very nice and is straight-forward in her lectures
Not a bad class- A midterm, final, and a paper. Lectures can be very dry at times.
So much reading, very hard grader.  Tests on top of long papers for a WAC course is too much.  She reads right off the slides and does not make clear differences between topics.

She was very helpful and easy to listen to. It is a WAC class so your writing, but the information is interesting,  and you learn from each others papers too.  Tests are open book but know your information.  I would take a class taught by her again.

Reads directly off of slides during class, films ares shown but not often. Seems to know her material but when approached after class doesn't directly answer questions, rambles on and on about other topics. Attendance is a huge factor, sign in sheet every class. Very boring class even with great material. Wish she would get more involved with class
One of CSU's best professors. Professor Francis is approachable, helpful, intelligent, a fair grader, and she wants her students to do well. She does a great job presenting the course material.

This class is very informative. The Professor is very approachable, very helpful and very pleasant I would definitely take her again, I learned a lot.The writing was intense(13-16 pgs) but she guides you thru the process which makes me give her two thumbs up!!
Very interactive, to a fault. Class was usually student discussions about irrelevant topics, so we could never get through whole presentations. Very nice, thorough and helpful.

Professor Francis was decent. I had her during her first semester at CSU, so she was figuring out her own pace as the class was developing. No need for the book, and lets you use all notes for tests... but be prepared, because the tests questions were rather intricate. Pretty stable teacher if you're just trying to knock out electives, etc.

Dr Franklin just does not really teach. This was a graduate level class and I basically learned little of nothing. It's not that she doesn't know social work, its just that she doesn't teach it. Franklin did not teach us and did not grade our weekly reflections until the end of the semester, if she graded them at all. Every student I talked to got an A-. I am suspicious about if she actually graded our final papers because she submitted our grades at the last possible minute and did not give us a comprehensive breakdown of our grades.
Dr. Franklin was available and willing to give her time to students.  Gave some students opportunity to correct papers  to improve grades.

i just had this professor, i'm going to keep the book because i didn't really learn anything. The students helped each other out. She gave our grades the day we stopped coming to classes. Had students take turns to present chapters in each week. She never seemed to have anything prepared to present and basically did not teach. Not sure how she is a teacher here.

Professor Franklin was nice and kind, but the following were the primary issues:  1. Did not receive grades back until 5-6 weeks after it being submitted 2. I am at the Graduate level and knows she teaches undergrads and am terrified they will not proceed to the master's level because of the lack of preparation she provides and angst involving what grade to receive or what is expected. DO not take if you never took an online course. She never responds to emails, Im still waiting on responses from the beginning of the semester. never seen an awful and useless pro. like him...

Really great professor and cares about all of his student passing the class. I recommend taking him.

love this teacher took him for adolescent psychology, everything was clear and i got an a in the class! quizzes weekly but worth it.

Great instructor. Taught everything on point. Provided us with notes online, but expanded them more in class. Everything he went over in the notes was word for word on the tests. Excellent instructor. Class with 200 students yet did his best to keep eveyone engaged. Skim the assigned chapters b4 class and you'll be fine. Gives pop quizzes bi monthly, all exams are on bb and timed just use your time wisely. Awesome instructor.

Excellent Teacher.  She made the class interesting.  Not only did she lecture thoroughly but she invited relevent guests to class to talk and she incorporated movies to emphasize some lessons we were on.  She enjoyed teaching and it made me enjoy learning.  I'm hoping to take moer classes from her
nice, kind, amazing, inspiring, just really makes you want to learn. She is super passionate about what she teaches.

He is ok! He just talks alot about his past habits, family. He has those days where he just goes off for no good reason. He often acts alittle bi-polar at times. He's a pretty cool instructor. Freeman is a stain on the reputation of Cleveland State and an embarrassment to the deaf community. He teaches a combination of Signed English and ASL. He lets his class go early most of the time and doesn't practice signs more than once. You will learn absolutely nothing in his class.

Prof. Freeman is a good instructor who teaches the basics of sign. Go to class, study the book, learn the signs and you'll get an A and learn a lot in the process.

This teacher is REALLY REALLY BAD!!!  If you want to learn Sign Language, I would suggest getting a different teacher.  He talks about his personal life too much, he is not involved in the community, and he teaches you SIGNED ENGLISH!!  So if you really want to take an interest in ASL then CHANGE Teachers ASAP!!
I learned a lot in Dr. Freeman's class. Much more useful and interesting than any stupid spanish class. We interact with classmates to practice signing and reading the signs. Very helpful.
His class was the biggest waste of time EVER. If you are in the speech and hearing sciences, you will not learn a thing.  He is nice, but his class is worthless.

If you're looking for an easy-going class to fulfill Foreign Language requirements (and boost your GPA), take a course with Dr. Freeman.  He is nowhere near as demanding as the other ASL instructors.  Be sure to attend class/study the signs and you're good.  He gives a Pre-Test that makes the exams a BREEZE! It's the easiest "A" I've ever earned!
easy, but you dont learn****

He is very helpful the class itself isnt hard if you pay attention and go to class he can be a little bit unclear at times but if you have any questions he has no problem making sure that you understand the concept

Second time taking class. Professor very helpful. Provided open office hours for help. Tried to address homework issue although time limited. Tries to lighten moments with witty mathematical facts. Practice and use math lab for help very challenging class.

he was an ok teacher! very nice but wasn't clear and always did the examples the long way when there was a shorter way possible!reviews are basically the exact test and he helps you solve the review! his class is very boring and not really helpful! Decent teacher, goes over everything you ask. Homework is easy and tests are only 11 questions. Says attendance is mandatory, but if you show up on friday you can mark down monday and wednesday on the attendance sheet, he will never notice..I got an A.

THIS TEACHER IS GREAT! HE IS UNDERSTANDING, KNOWS WHAT HE TALKING ABOUT. SOMETIMES HE SAYS WEIRD THINGS. IF YOU TRY & DO YOUR WORK IT WILL BE AN EASY A!!! SOME PEOPLE SAY HE SUCKS BUT REMEBER ITS USUALLY FRESHMEN THAT TAKE THE CLASS THEY WANT AN A WITH NO WORK.

very good teacher, clear and tell you what to focus on for the exams. his exams are MC and short answeres. as long as you study from the book you will be fine. usually there is one group project and its not that hard. highly recommended :)

He's very passionate and opinionated. His quizzes are hard and is slightly hard (not too bad) when it comes to grading papers but he's a very nice guy. People didn't do well on quizzes so he did end up letting us bring them home. He tells you exactly exactly what will be on the exams.

Fred definitely knows his stuff. He's 88 years old so he's been practicing law since the dawn of man. He gave pop quizzes, but eventually started giving take homes instead since people did poorly. He gives you all the questions for the tests ahead of time too. Biggest complaint is that he's VERY politically opinionated.
He is very passionate and knows his stuff. There are quite a few quizzes but if you read the chapter prior, you should be fine!

Good class and professor.  Everything you need to know is covered in classes.  Pop quizzes most days so you have to read the chapter ahead of time.  Only complaint is he is VERY political and if you disagree with his views it can be uncomfortable while he's on a soapbox.  Overall though, he's a great professor.

Mr. Friend is more than just a teacher. Hes a role model to students of what to be like when we are older. He is a kind, caring man who values his students greatly. A pleasure to talk to and work with. Whenever I have a question he is always able to assist me. A great man. A great Teacher. A great Friend

Fabulous teacher....material is difficult but he communicates effectively.  do not skip class as attendance is taken...he is a character but a devoted teacher...loves ND, hates Ohio State....overall fantastic

haha, very nice.  ask him about Ohio state... he'll freak out.  he loves ND.  Gives quizes on blackboard, but still uses a typewriter. See if you can get him off on a tangent with one of these subjects.  Just do the work and pay attention to the test review questions and you'll be fine

Great instructor! I love his teaching style. You can use in-class-examination-reference guides for all ACT 600 exams, so basically you just have to understand material and know what formulas to use in any particular situation. Very nice guy!

3 exams, the 3rd is weighted heavier.  Mix of multiple choice and short answer.      He spends every class going over homework problems.   Homework makes up a small part of the grade.   On exams, he lets you use a "cheat sheet" of self-prepared notes.     At the end of every class he gives you a copy of the homework answers...use them to study!

Polite and pleasant gentleman.  Be prepared for long assignments weekly, about 12 to 18 hours worth, concepts from homework will not be broken down but homework answers will be provided. 99% of the class is the professor reading homework from textbook answer sheets. Not very helpful to learning material.

Good teacher and knows his stuff. Understand that this class was difficult material and not your run of the mill Tax Class. It requires some ability to think and reason on your own which no professor good  or bad can provide. But Gaffney was always helpful and tried to make sure you understood the  material. Would take him again in a heartbeat.
Please dont choose him if you are not from accounting background. He willnot teach anything,Just bring the copy of the problem solution and read in the class.
a very nice professor.  probably a little too nice.  dept. head, and he knows the stuff of course.
Great teacher teaching a tough to understand topic.  Will answer all questions and help you through the class.  Will take another class from him.

Prof. Gage is okay. He's not always clear about what he wants for the two papers (one short midterm and one 8-12 page final), but overall an easy class. Tries to be funny, but isn't actually. Lectures were honestly a waste of time, though he is knowledge about poetry and if you're a freshman, it's probably fine for you.

Great professor overall.  He is very passionate and knowledge about poetry.  He is laid back with reasonable expectations from your work, more so if a problem arises he is willing to work with you.  Expect to completely two weekly, one page journals that are for participation, though it benefits you to put effort into them to supplement your final.
Awesome professor for Intro to Poetry. The workload isn't that bad, and he's generally understanding and doesn't seek to destroy your GPA. Overall a nice guy and a great teacher.

Professor Gage has a great sense of humor! He is really understanding and will help you pass the class. Even though he is a tough grader, Professor Gage cares about his students and knows everything about poetry.

Professor Gage is a tough grader. He is really helpful and knows everything about poetry. He is very understanding teacher. He also has a great sense of humor. Final paper is any topic you want as long as it can be related to poetry. Only 2 short papers and the final paper. 2 journals are due each friday in class and are easy if you read each week.

On of my favorite professors! Yes he assigned quite a lot of work, but it is a WAC course so I was very grateful that there were mini assignments instead of a giant paper. Relatively hard grader but if you actually try you'll be fine. He's very understanding and will help if you need it and work with your schedule.
Good prof.
