Reasonable professor. Great class. You WILL actually have to put work into his class, compared to most CSU 200 level classes, he assigns a comparatively larger amount of work, and grades a little harder. But reasonable overall.

He's an overall good professor. Reasonable expectations, fair grader, and he's willing to work with you if you're having problems. But it is a fairly work intensive class comparative to other 200 level classes. Try to do at least some of the readings, for your own benefit. Also: deserves a lot more than what CSU is paying him.

Amazing prof. Crystal clear, outlines exactly what is expected of you. Humorous and energetic. Class was a bog until I realized that I could get away with not doing the readings. I still think I learned not only content, but how to become a better writer. Gage is the best. I was recommended to him by a friend, and I often recommend him to mine.

Brilliant professor, but the class is a very heavy reading class. About half don't do all the reading, but for those who did, like me, you'll be rewarded with not only a better understanding of poetry, but with much more. You'll end up reading anywhere from 200-600 pages of poetry/poetry related stuff a week. Slightly tough grader.

One of the few gems in the English department. Readings are required; initially they seemed mundane, but eventually made me legitimately like poetry. The poetry memorizations caused myself and a few others undue anxiety/ caused someone a legit panic attack following the end of class. Memorizations should have alt. assignments for some perhaps?

His sarcasm makes him delightful, his knowledge of what is expected in writing is inspiring. Very understanding teacher who will work with you and help while giving useful resources I still use semesters after. Books required but useful, grades fairly and highly recommended. Not bad on the eyes either.
He is very good teacher, very motivating. Prof. Gage makes the class fun.I would recommend this teacher.
Not too difficult; fair grader; clearly outlines what is expected for each essay; i recommend taking a class from him.
He is a great teacher that would do as much as he can to teach you how to write. He is very motivated and very patient. I would recommend.

Professor Gage is a very nice guy who makes class interesting.  Class is fairly easy.  Just make sure you stay on task with journals and projects.  If you have trouble getting something in on time, he is willing to work with you as long as you talk to him about it.
No Comments

Dr. Gagich overall was a great professor. There is a lot of work to do in the class, mostly just busywork. Don't get on her bad side. She was often contradictory with her remarks. She would say something was good when reviewing then change her mind and give you a bad score on the final grade.

The class itself wasn't hard, and she made the class enjoyable. Didn't really teach. , Her comments came off as rude. She would say you missed something or you shouldn't have added that when she never said anything about it earlier. Her opinion on what she wanted and what was good seemed to change from one student's paper to another

Dr. Gagich overall was a great professor. There is a lot of work to do in the class, mostly just busywork. Don't get on her bad side. She was often contradictory with her remarks. She would say something was good when reviewing then change her mind and give you a bad score on the final grade.

I took a writing class of hers. She gave great feedback, she also told us what we did well. She would give points for showing up to class with whatever the assignment was. You would have 3+ weeks to write a 4-page essay, and she helped with every step of the process. I highly recommend taking one of her classes.

Professor Gagich is a pretty nice teacher. She is not mean in any way and she definitely knows her stuff. So she is helpful to you in the class, but she gives A LOT of work. There are so many assignments in the class and a lot of them are VERY time-consuming. A lot of the assignments she has you do are just a waste of time.

There are a lot of assignments in this class. However, 80% of them are completion and not hard at all. Everything you need to do is super laid out in advance and straightforward. Not difficult, just time-consuming. There are tons of EC opportunities and she is willing to work with you. Grades were always uptodate.
Professor Gagich was extremely helpful and enthusiastic about her work and our success. English 102 is mandatory for graduation, its tough but Professor Gagich makes it bearable. Great prof.
She is super nice and explains everything really well. However, there have been quite a few mix ups in regards to projects. She also gives out a lot of homework. Like A lot.
she is a beautiful soul, keeping a smile on face. I like her

Just take my word, don't go looking around for your other english professors on rate my prof. If you can get into Mrs. Gagich's class, take the opportunity. She is very knowledgeable in her trade and provides every resource anyone would need to understand an assignment. Her unorthodox assignments made college writing enjoyable for me. Put in effort

Prof. Gagich is quite possibly the best professor I have ever had. She gives great feedback, will help you when you're stuck, and loves answering any questions you have. The topic of this class is new, but Prof. Gagich makes it easy to understand and such a fun class! Would definitely take again if I could.

Melanie is a decent teacher. At times her teaching style can be a little dry and she assigns a lot of "busy work". The work is really, at least to me, just to pad our grade, which is fine, but I feel like instead of busy work, there should be smaller projects that one cares about that are necessary for a good grade instead of three projects only.
Small class means you get to know her and she gets to know you. Very personable and fun.
LOTS OF HOMEWORK BUT you'll get awesome grades if you work hard for the class. Never skip class and never be late for the class. Never talk in class and always be attentive.
Papers take a lot of work, very tough grader. There are no exams but you need to do a lot of work outside the class to get a good grade.

Melanie Gagich is awesome! I had her for ENG 101 last year and she is one of the kindest most caring professors i've had at CSU. Super easy to talk to, gives great feedback and is always willing to lend a helping hand with the essays. She really cares about her students and wants them to do well in class and beyond. I 1000% recommend her.
Professor Gagich is amazing. She makes class to be easy going and fear with grading. Always willing to help.

Professor Gagich is awesome. She is so down to earth and willing to help with anything. I would email her for help and she would have great response times. She's super fun to have as a teacher and definitely makes the class more enjoyable. The only downside is that there is a decent of small homeworks every week, which get very annoying.
Professor Melanie is a very nice professor and gives great feedback. But she gives a lot of work.
Outside of the box english teacher, non traditional methods make it a really fun class.

Three essays are given in this course. They are 10  in-class writing and 5 reading responses. You may do infographics. The last paper is a research paper you fail this paper, you failed the class. This paper is the longest one in her class up to eight pages, you pick your own topic. Go to the writing center. BE ON TIME AND DONT MISS CLASS.

Sylvanus is a mediocre professor. You must attend class. He takes attendance everyday and is a big part of your grade. He lectures too much & calls people out for being on their phone. The one good thing is that he gives you study guides before each exam. Homework once a week that are submitted online that can be found on course hero and quizlet.

Took this class online. Easy A and a great GPA booster. It was an 8 week course and we had either a quiz or paper every week, and a weekly discussion board. That's it! The only bad thing I have to say is that he never replied to emails, so if you had questions, you had to figure it out for your self.

The exams & one essay are the only grades in the class. Hes a nice guy but doesnt give enough materials to prepare for exams. I would study for hours and use the notes/handouts/book while taking the exam & I would still be lucky to get a B. He is generous with the grading of the essay though. 3/5 for me. Couldve been better, couldve been worse.

took his class online and it is quite honestly ridiculous how much work he makes you do for a basic 101 class. taught myself everything, horrible teacher, workload is a literal weeks worth jammed packed. DO NOT TAKE HIM!

Took this class online. Easy A and a great GPA booster. It was an 8 week course and we had either a quiz or paper every week, and a weekly discussion board. That's it! The only bad thing I have to say is that he never replied to emails, so if you had questions, you had to figure it out for your self.
Hes a great professor, just show up to class and write the ONE paper he requires.

Such a nice teacher, really cares about his students. His humor made learning about different religions actually fun. Some of the material is tough and the "pop quizzes" toward the end of the semester are rough. but hes genuinely a really sweet guy. His exams are on online so you can use his notes to answer the questions. Def recommend to take!!
Good teacher

He is a nice enough professor but take a long time to respond through e-mail as well as to get assignments graded. There are two "major" assignments followed by discussions. Make sure you study the book to prepare you for the tests and you should do just fine.
Provides little to no feedback. Does not grade assignments in proper time. Provides very little study material besides textbook so make sure you get it!!

I loved this class! It was fun and entertaining. I actually looked forward to going to every class! He makes every thing so clear and easy to understand. Also, before every test he gives you a step by step study guide!

Fun class to take, needed it for my major. Lectures are clear and entertaining. Laid back style not strict at all. Class was interactive with back and forth communication. Attendance is semi mandatory.

Lectures and class notes give very interesting examples while presenting content in a way that makes otherwise esoteric concepts intuitive and digestible. Tests are easy as long as you do all the homework and suggested problems from the book. Suggested problems introduce cool concepts too. The way he writes curly braces will change your life.

Lectures and class notes give very interesting examples while presenting content in a way that makes otherwise esoteric concepts intuitive and digestible. Tests are easy as long as you do all the homework and suggested problems from the book. Suggested problems introduce cool concepts too. The way he writes curly braces will change your life.
The homework was very difficult and worth a large portion of your grade. He goes through the notes clearly. Exams are hard. The course material was difficult.
The test are nearly impossible and make up for 75% of the grade. Your answers must be perfect or he will take all the points off. Yeah he is nice and accessible but expects perfection.

The professor is clearly knowledgeable about the subject, however, he needs to fix his communication skills. The number of times I have missed assignments because instead of the hw being due at 11:59pm as usual, he randomly switches it to 6:00pm is unreal. He is an extremely thorough grader, so your answer better be perfect for all the points.

He is a nice, intelligent, easy-going professor. He records his lectures and is available for questions. Office hours are a go!! If you do not understand something he can clear it up. He has a very diverse teaching style.
Very easygoing and approachable. Great at explaining difficult subjects. Course was weighted very heavily towards tests, so make sure you are prepared! Optional final exam.

She was a great prof and very knowledgeable and logical. Her class is not difficult yet you still learn a lot of interesting information. Her lectures are easy to follow unless you get tired and zone out. I definitley reccomend her!

She was a great prof and very knowledgeable and logical. Her class is not difficult yet you still learn a lot of interesting information. Her lectures are easy to follow unless you get tired and zone out. I definitley reccomend her!

Dr. G is awesome!!! . I learned so much while taking her class - and she always kept her lectures interesting.  Not to sound cheesy, but she makes you excited about learning Geology. Couldn't ask for a better professor. As far as material, the blackboard notes are great. The book is needed, but not always necessary as her lectures cover a lot.
She's a good teacher but has some personal issues don't cross her haha.
She is very nice. Math is not my strongest subject, yet she was very helpful! I highly recommend her for someone who hates math like I do.
I found her to be helpful for a while. and then One day she accused me of texting in her class when I wasn't, then after that she told me not to come any more. I just don't think she's very nice.

Really cool teacher. Loves the content and teaches well. Enjoys discussions and lecture time with students. Do not need the book. All notes are put on the board and online. Go to class and you will do well. Get to know on personal level and she is fun and super helpful. Grades fairly and gives extra credit sometimes. Pushes students to do well.
Very enthusiastic, explains well uses language we can understand, great sense of humor, makes the subject very interesting.

geo 100 It's not an easy course with how she teaches it; we go over 5-6 chapters per test (total of 4 tests)and for each test she has online tests 60 questions per chapter w/ no answers= 360 questions. There are only 50 questions on the actual test test. She doesn't learn your name, just your face. She's barely ok but, I'd skip her if i were you.
Doesn't teach it like an intro course its a lot harder. You must study everything to pass her tests.
Not as funny as everyone thinks, but she is still cool and helpful.
best math teacher i ever had! wish she would teach more advanced sections.

I had her for Intro to geology and she was excellent. tests can be tricky, so read the textbook. Also, study the online questions she sets up because they will appear on the tests. Offered 25 pt EC just for going to natural history museum. Nice, and tries to help her students succeed.
I loved her. She was very helpful and WANTED you to pass. She was always showing shortcuts to help with math. She also keeps you smiling!

I loved Heather! She was a hoot, She really made the class fun and she actually helped you. She always gave students the benefit of the doubt. Yes, this is college and you have to show up. She really encourgaged me to continue on with my studies.
I got 100% on every assignment, but got a "B" due to her attendance policy.

Very disorganized and does not set clear expectations from students. All over the place with material, most of the material that is on the exam is from our readings and nothing is from what was 'taught' in class. When lecturing she only indicates her past experience so you will know all about her once you are done with the course.
Stay clear!! The worst professor I have encountered. Such a bummer having to waste a class with this professor.

I took Dr. Gallagher for the Internship course and she always got back to me quickly via email and made class expectations clear from the start. Was not a tough grader and i wish I could have had a real class with her based off her feedback, grading and quick responses.

Even though this class was an internship, Vickie was an excellent faculty advisor. She made sure everything was going well and provided valuable feedback for my internship report. I really appreciated her answering my emails in a timely manner. Would love to have her again for future classes! She is very caring of her student's success!
I took this class online. What you are graded on is as follows,  20% HW (unlimited attempts), 6% (DB's), 60% (test), 14% (quizes, 3 attempts to do).  Easy class if you read the material.

Dr. Gallagher was very friendly and made it clear what she was looking for. Not a lot of homework and tests were online. I thought she was very fair and made the lectures interesting. I would take a class with her again if given the opportunity.

First time teaching this particular class, very unprepared. Rather than focusing on teaching technical application of material, relies on you to teach yourself and apply it in a group project and presentation with others who may or may not have had stats before. Very smart professor, knows the subject well just not good at teaching it to others.

Absolutely the WORST professors I have encountered to date. She never took the time to review the course materials and it is obvious that she is flying by the seat of her pants. Asking her more than 1 questionclass leads to her obvious frustration no matter how clearly worded the question maybe. She only teaches instruction opposed to application!

Don't buy the book. Print the power points & study those. She gives a study guide for every exam. Follow that & you should do fine. I didn't like the whole group project aspect which is 25% of the grade, but it depends on what group you get. Attend class & participate whenever you can to boost your overall grade. Her class should get you an A.

One of the easiest class I ever taken. Begins the class with video. Assigns you to group most of the assignment are group bonding execrise. Didn't study or read the book and still recieved an A with little effort. Attendance is based based on grade and force you to say something once a week impossible to fail

She begins each class with music video. Gives points for attendance and class participation. Not allowed to miss more than 7 days. Class was pretty easy. Dont buy book just do the study guide and print power points. Received an A with little effort. Definitely take!

Attendance is a must! She also counts participation-loud students can reap the benefits of this grading category  while quieter students will suffer. Study guides are provided before each test. She is nice but has some strange grading practices. DO NOT BUY THE BOOK, POWERPOINTS ARE PROVIDED WITH ALL THE KEY INFO!!!

One of my favorite mechanical engineering professors. Lectures are laid back and interesting, but not mandatory. Professor constantly relates material being learned to real world engineering applications. Projects are a good challenge while homework can be time consuming. Test are challenging but he gives unlimited time and clear expectations.

Gallager is just an all around amazing mechanical engineer that actually can give students a good taste of what it's like to actually do mechanical engineering work. If you don't understand the material you can get in contact with him at any time for clarification. He goes out of his way to schedule great review sessions before every exam too.

Awesome professor. Classes are well structured and easy to follow. You can catch up if you miss one class. Very helpful on office hours and allows plenty of time to complete and turn in the homework. Test are challenging but he allows you to work on it for a good amount of time.

I've taken many classes with this guy and I've always felt that I was learning applicable stuff as opposed to just in order to pass an exam. He has been more then flexible to accommodate schedules and other needs. Some may not appreciate his style of teaching but I enjoy it. We get the chance to ask questions and discuss them during lecture.

Really enjoyed this class. He provides all his clear lecture notes to the class. Lectures are easygoing and laid back. Teacher also does a great job relating material to the actual engineering field. Quizzes are announced to class before hand. Textbook is used seldomly, but is allowed for tests. Always available to help with homework. Great!

Dr. Galletta is the best instructor because she uses engaging and thought provoking discussion techniques.  Anyone student who has made a negative comment on Dr. Galletta is most likely someone who wants to memorize and take tests. Students willing to read, use your thinking brain, write, and engage with other intellectuals will be blown away!

Dr. Galletta is the best professor I have ever had. If you have the chance to take her class, do it without hesitation! In fact, I recommend you seek out to take her class. She instills confidence in her students while providing a truly remarkable education... She is inspirational.
One of the best professors I have had. Very clear expectations. Engaging discussion. Kind, caring, and geniune.
prof galletta was an awesome teacher! you have to read a lot of articles in class and class discussion is important, but very nice lady who's so sweet and sincere.
Amazing course much better than the way other instructors create it.
She's legit...
Absolutely outstanding! Great researcher and scholar, but as kind as can be. She's an example of how one can be an erudite professor and a real human being. Highly recommend her.

This professor will kill you by being too nice to you. I do not even think that she can harm a fly. She is an easy grader yet informative and very keen about her students. She is smart and good looking for her age.

Excellent teacher. Extremely helpful, kind and fair grader. She really opened my eyes to a lot of new issues. I learned so much from this class. Take this class and definitley choose anne galletta. You will not be dissapointed!

Dr. Galletta does bring a wealth of information, however, she tends to be a dry speaker.  A 3 hr. class become very long when you have power point slides read to you one after another.  She tries to mix it up with some group work and other projects.  Lots of reading is involved with minimal work. (midterm, final, project, 1 paper)
She is a great professor. She has a passion for her subject and will go all out to help her students. She is relatively new, but she rocks

Prof. Galletta is a tremendous professor. She is knowledgeable, interesting, concerned for students' development, and a kind person. She gave really useful and significant assignments -- we read great primary sources and we wrote papers that let us discuss important topics deeply. She is one of the top professors I've had. You'll love her class.

Great teacher. She's very influential. Class is very interesting; discussion and dr. galletta does not have favorites. She grades fairly. She's a very sweet lady and an awesome teacher. Very good class.

Very influential teacher. Extremely nice, helpful teacher. Makes class very interesting. Works very hard to make sure everyone understands material. Awesome teacher and no regrets in taking the class!

Best teacher I ever had! Dr. Galletta is understanding, kind, and very fair grading. She works very hard to make sure the class is interactive (lots of discussion) and makes the clMass interesting. She's very lenient if you run into problems and she is an AMAZING teacher!I HIGHLY recommend her!
Just fine.  And grad students with bad grammar are not reliable sources of information.
I am a Graduate student, and this was the WORST instructor I have EVER encounter.
Horrible teacher

Sweet lady, not the most exciting class. Tests are often but if you complete homework and study efficiently its pretty simple. She gives extra credit often. participate and ask questions. Also keep up with syllabus and take notes to avoid any surprises, she sometimes doesn't emphasize upcoming assignments and test, i'd suggest a planner.
Stay Away
Very challenging course that moves at a fast pace. If you attend class, pay attention, and do all assignments your will pass. Galvan is tough, but if you can stick it out you will learn a lot.

She is a very interesting lady, she knows a lot and expects her students to be prepared in class, her quizzes are hard thou but still I think I have learned more with her than with any other teacher so far. People don't get her sometimes, but I think she intelectual oriented and most of the people are not. They just want to pass the class easily.

I was very interested in the material and enjoyed the class at the beginning of the semester. But, Dra. Galvn openly puts students down and is just plain rude. She lectures and expects the students to know everything... Hello, that's why we're in your class to learn!  She needs to get the boot.
Very high expectations.  Excellent and stimulating class discussions.  Exams and quizzes are extremely difficult and very detail oriented.

Never ever ever take a class with her. She is rude, puts you down in front of whole class. She has favorites, especially males. She is never prepared for class, does not read her materials. Her exams are trivial. She is not available to students even during office hours.She is not fair at grading. AVOID HER!
Demanding, difficult as a teacher and as a person, and rude to her students.
Too difficult.Teacher didn't work for me
AVOID HER BY ALL MEANS...she's not fair in grading and she's pretty dry. She can be nice, but in regards to education, she's pretty strict and biased to favorites.

Dra. Galvan has been the most influential professor I have come across at CSU.  She has a low tolerance for BS and I like that.  She gives all to her students and expects the same in return.  I actually learned something with her and I will carry that knowledge with me for a long time.

Dr. Galvan is a nice lady, but some of her coursework is extremely difficult. I think she has a hard time distinguishing between the difficulty level of say, an early 300 level course and a later 300 level or 400 level course. I majored in Spanish, but I never got better than a C from her...despite in that class having 96's and above on my papers.

AVOID! She clearly has her favorites and makes it known. She just passes along any questions you have to the TA and they both grade differently, so your grade is lower than what it should be. Grades are weighted so if you should have a C, you will end up with a low D. The worst I ever had in all my school years. Save yourself and avoid!

Interested in research more than teaching. Boasts about herself a lot more than is necessary. Class is very useful and you will learn a lot, but be prepared to work for it. She obviously has her favorites and makes it known. Will not take again
This was the hardest class I have ever taken. Not because of the material but because the professor was completely unprepared and would make information up as she went. Take with another if possible

She is a bad instructor. She does not adequately prepare for meaningful learning experiences. She does not guide lectures well and she provides absolutely no leadership for group projects. If you take her class,you will be scrambling to complete a mediocre project and will learn very little from it. She pats herself on the back during lectures.
Can't communicate with her. Leave her alone.
Rushed through the text book and did not make herself easily accessable.

Dr. Ganning seems to be more interested in research than teaching. She blows through the material at a fast pace and does not clearly answer questions. She does not make herself very accessible either. Avoid if possible!
I enjoyed this class. He's knowledgeable and understands the field. He's very passionate about what he teaches. Always looking out for the student's best interest.

Gao belongs in the philosophy department. Hardly covered any relevant material in class all semester, just rambled on about trivial historical information and his personal inspirations. This is problematic when his take-home quizzes demand 10+ pages of work. MATLAB assignments were also ridiculous and irrelevant. Seemingly nice guy, but bad prof.
I enjoyed this class. He's knowledgeable and understands the field. He's very passionate about what he teaches. Always looking out for the student's best interest.
Excellent professor I really recommend this teacher. He helped understanding how theory works in real world
Brilliant.  I learned more from Prof. Gard than any other professor.
Graduated 15 years ago. He was my favorite prof. Makes you think, challenging and interesting. Also took for Constitutional Law & First Amend Rights. I admire him.

Prof. Gard was extremely unhelpful in providing guidance on most everything. He should be avoided if at all possible. He has received many complaints this year to the Dean's office. Try a different professor.

Look, Gard might be funny and easy, etc., but this overlooks the most basic point - he simply doesn't teach anything in many classes.  If you actually want to learn torts, (besides totally on your own)this is not the professor to take.
Does a  J. Depp pirate swagger while he speaks (great voice). Excellent lecturer -- makes the material understandable and interesting. Off-the-wall humor -- a real treat.

The people who don't like Prof. Gard simply don't "get" him.  He uses outrageous examples that are irreverent, but are clearly designed to help students remember the material.  He lays out his expectations clearly; he wrote the commercial outline that he get you for free on the subject, and he expects you to know the material.  Highly recommend!
Spends the majority of classes condemning the government, ripping on capitalism, etc.  Really does not keep the class on point at all.  Don't intend to learn much from him.
Totally scary at first but really funny and laid back after the first few weeks.  Material is clearly laid out and what is expected in a good exam answer is expressly stated.

This guy is funny as hell.  His humor is witty but rarely superficial.  It's true that he doesn't explain things in detail and talks a lot about social and political context, but why go over cases in detail? You should have read and understood by the time class comes around?  You're in law school, so stop waiting for a professor to hold your hand.
Inadequate teaching skills, but the worst was he made  me feel unclean just listening to him.  Yuck.

Intimidating at first, kinda antagonistic throughout, but always straight forward.  At the end of the subject you will not be guessing at what he was saying. If you can sit through some of his personal soapboxes then you will learn the subject. I recommend Prof Gard.
Very interested in the subject, and always willing to discuss, but VERY hard to follow in class.

favorite teacher of all time. one of the most brilliant people i have ever met. He lectures off the top of his head. everything is memorized. Great person for advise. Halarious when he rips into 1st years. Scary as hell when you are a 1L, he cold calls all the way through law school. You learn more in his classes than any other. Definately take Con Law from this man. Teaches it better than anyone else in the country. Very sensible, does not dwell on the irrelevent.

The most unprofessional prof. I've ever seen. The way he insults students like they are dirt on his sole. He was hostile and refused to help to some while extremely warm to others. Can't tell how bright he is, but he is sure nasty sometimes. He always encourages drinking-- just one more problem we need! He completely ruined the class for me.

Scared the hell out of all the 1Ls for the first few weeks of class. Explains the material clearly, and will usually let you know what you need to do to do well in the class. Likes to make fun of the students, and when he does so it's hilarious, as long as it's not you he's making fun of.

Very knowledgeable about his subject. Too knowledgeable to be teaching. Exams notoriously difficult, with no one getting above 50%. Skips around the book so it's difficult to follow/review. You WILL get cold called, & he does hypos. Be prepared. Do the reading & answer the questions he sends out.
GARLOCK IS A DINOSAUR CSU NEEDS TO GET RID OF HIM!

Professor Garlock knows his subject, and is extremely academic. Does not get very buddy-buddy with his students, but he makes himself as available as he can if you have questions outside of class. He does send out extensive questions for each class, and I would highly recommend answering them before you step into his classroom. Very structured.
Class isn't what you would expect it to be. Do as many practice exams as you can and you'll do well. Don't get lost in the theory.

I read some reviews and it make me laugh so bad. The guy probably knows his material but his being teaching for so long that I believe he should be able to teach without helping materials. He constantly reads his notes in the class, so please give me a break about how smart this guy is and go and see a real professor teaching.

Garlock is one of the toughest professors to have during your 1st year. Advice: be prepared for every class, he gives new meaning to the socratic method (sink or swim). He is an extremely hard grader, you will NEVER finish one of his TOUGH exams (which I believe sets us up to fail). He gives arguably a 5hr exam to be taken in 2-3 hrs.

Garlock really wants students to learn the material. He prepares weekly study questions that clarify the reading. He really cares! Definitely old school though. Don't cut corners in his class. Exams are brutal b/c he expects you to think and write like an attorney. I would never call him "HOT," but I do think he's a very cute older man.

Very rigid although he relaxed a littel after the first semester...probably because he got slammed on reviews.  You'll never finish his exams and he grades on grammar and spelling because everyone knows the doctrine.
Brilliant man, but I don't think he likes the students or teaching
Traditional teaching style, stiff, control freak, cold calling. He'd be much better at legal history than torts, but I must admit we did learn a lot.

He's demanding and the class is rigorous.  You'd better have your briefs ready for class, and you'd better read every footnote in the casebook.  Despite being hard, he's an excellent criminal law prof.  He could lighten up a bit though.

Love/hate relationship with him because it was the HARDEST class of 1L year but I learned an incredible amount and his expectations are very high so its great if you can meet them at all!! However, will call on you in class more than other professors, exams are crazy hard, and he can be hard to follow in class and really grasp what is important.

Has a tremendous knowledge of the subjects he teaches.  Eager to help outside class and communicate in email.  His bark is worse than his bite.  He complains about technology but has a greater mastery of it than much of the rest of the faculty.  Will call on you if you are not paying attention and will not pass until he gets an answer.

I don't which is worse the teacher or the text.  He assigns a insane amount of material to read from a incomprehensible text.  He is very disrespectul to students (which can sometimes be entertaining, but not professional).  The worst exam of my 1L.  It is safe to say that only 20% of my class actually finished his exam.  Avoid with all costs!

Very "old school" type professor. His class was extremely difficult and a lot of work. While in school I couldn't stand his class, but when I was done with law school and started studying the bar I was surprised by how much I still remembered from torts.  As difficult as his class is, you will definitely learn a lot.
rude; pompous. more suited to research/writing than teaching/oral communication.
This guy is tough love at its worst.  But I gotta tell you: you KNOW Criminal law when you walk out of his class.

Obviously the people who have already rated this guy are the lucky few who earned an A. This guy is Hitler incarnate, but far more diabolical. He could care less about your welfare. He has the clarity of a deep sewer and the stench of a dead rat.  If you are a 1L and you see Warlock on your schedule I suggest you drop out immediately.
Disrespectful to students.

garlock is very strange, but he definitely cares about his students more than any other professor.  he would get genuinely concerned if you missed an assignment or didn't do well.  that said, some of his explanations were muddled and he's a difficult grade
Very easy class. Shes great and very clear and approachable.

Easiest Class I've ever had. The Online course required NO reading of the textbook, although it was interesting. You took quizzes online UNTIL YOU SCORED PERFECT- the midterm and final were composed of only the quiz questions.  Aside from this, there was a weekly discussion and a couple written assignments (that could be replaced with discussions)

Dr. Garmise is very clear in what she wants out of you, and is very easy to deal with should you go to her for help.  The online course is very thorough and while boring, is well worth it. Easy class if you put in the time, which is not a whole lot!
No Comments

Dr Gatica gives good and specific feedback , and showed that he cared how we did in his class. Definitely not the hardest grader, offered a lot of extra credit. He was knowledgeable with MATLAB and his lectures are a bit slow, but they do go through everything you're expected to know. The book was super helpful for me for figuring out assignments.

Dr Gatica gives good and specific feedback , and showed that he cared how we did in his class. Definitely not the hardest grader, offered a lot of extra credit. He was knowledgeable with MATLAB and his lectures are a bit slow, but they do go through everything you're expected to know. The book was super helpful for me for figuring out assignments.

I have taken 3 classes with him. He is the worst teacher I have ever had in my life like he doesn't teach anything.  I don't know how to got the  professor position. He wasted the time teaching softwares such as Games, and hint. Prepare to teach yourself and may God be with you.

Be sure to have hours a day to devote to this class because you need to teach yourself. Don't expect to know what your grades are either because projects will not be returned. Homeworks and projects are very extensive and sometimes unclear. Tests are very fair and most students end up doing well, this class will surely be a four month nightmare.

Dr. Gatica acted as a mentor for me throughout my B.S. and M.S. degrees.  His classes are difficult but fair and he is very concerned about how his students are doing.  Always very helpful.  He also single handedly made sure I got a full scholarship through the STEM program AND he made sure I was picked as a TA.  Great guy.
HARD!!!!!!!!!!!!DOESNT EXPLAIN ANYTHING!!!!!!!!!!!
Professor Geda cares for his students and their success in the class. He is a great professor and makes sure his students understand the course material.
Professor Geda cares for his students and their success in the class. He is a great professor and makes sure his students understand the course material.

Had a great time taking this class. Professor Geda always made himself available for his students. He makes the class easier by the way he teaches it. He is great with communicating with his students and he truly wants nothing but the best for his students. For this class, I would highly recommend having Professor Geda as your instructor.

I truly enjoyed BUS201 under Professor Geda's instruction. He goes above and beyond to be sure that the whole class is understanding of the material. Course layout is very easy to follow along; lectures, homeworks, and exams. Professor Geda gave thorough review packets before each exam, be sure to utilize those!

Professor Geda has been one of the best professors I have had in a long time. He made learning stats enjoyable. He does not take attendance but you would need to go to better understand the course material. He gives lectures that are easy to follow and makes sure everyone understands before moving ahead. You can tell he cares for his students.

He's a really great professor in my opinion. He's always available outside of class and does a great job at keeping the class caught up. Every class he typically goes around the room to review what was learned in the previous class and to clarify any questions. Overall he's a great professor.

The class was very straightforward with the homework and the exams. He worked hard to make sure we understood the subject material and did well on the exams and homework. He even showed up to one of our out of class study sessions the day off an exam. He has got to be one of the best professors I've had at CSU so far.

Honestly, he has been the worst professor I have had, if you have him I recommend you drop him and find someone else. He is not prepared to teach and honestly doesn't seem to know the material well enough to be teaching. I have never had a worse grade in any class, he offers no help and just sends you to tutoring. Do yourself a favor and stay away.

Awesome professor!!! He really cares about students and wants you to clearly understand the material. He also makes sure you are prepared for the exams with his test preps. Make sure you show up to class because its tough material and you will fall behind if you miss a lecture. Would 100% take his class again!!

Been at CSU for 3 semesters now and hes easily the worst professor Ive ever had had 4 homeworks the whole semester IN A MATH CLASS did not teach clearly would always offer cheat cheats to make up for his lack of teaching On exams and his favorite excuse whenever asking for help was go to the tutors or  I dont have time for that :(
Excellent professor, fair & kind. Provides practice exam before each test (MCQ), so no surprises. Responds promptly to emails. Won't find a better teacher to take Stats with.

He is not bad, but not the best instructor. The class is already tough as it is. I did pretty ok in there, but I left the class w/o knowing much. He should have gave out extra credit and been more helpful to other students and that would have made him better. If you take this class, he would be a neutral choice for you to pick.

If this guy taught ever accounting class I would be an accounting major in a heartbeat.  Unfortunetly for CSU there are too many duds in the bunch to put myself through such agony.  Geekie is a fantastic teacher.  really cares about his students well being.
He has great personality and his a good professor who cares about his students. If you show up and just do your work you'll do fine. He curves.
You do need to work for your grade, but if you read, show up, etc- you should do fine. Somewhere between "the usual" and "Easy A." He is great and I would take another class from him anytime.
All tests are multiple choice which is good and bad.  Must know the material for Exam 3.  That's the one that people bomb.

This guy could give a lecture describing paint dry and still hold your attention, which is helpful because he teaches tax. He is very personable, gives engaging lectures, and is an authority on tax. Try to schedule your intro or advanced tax classes with Geekie.

Great teacher, i learned a lot in his class, but his tests are confusing and hard. But he does help and tells you what's important and what to focus on the most before the test. Overall, I enjoyed his class. Would definitely take another class with him.
I absolutely freakin' love this guy. He's so awesome, funny and laid-back.
What a wonderful professor and man! If all CSU's professors were like him it would be a top rate school!
HE IS A REALLY GOOD TEACHER, EXPLAINS EVERYTHING YOU NEED TO KNOW AND I REALLY ENJOYED BEING IN HIS CLASS, BUT HE MADE MY LIFE MISERABLE WITH HIS TESTS. THEY WERE REALLY HARD.
eeeee
He is a very good teacher and will tell you exactly what you need to know. I learned a lot. I would take him for any class. He is funny and really cute!
He is awesome. Eassy to understand. Never boring, really funny, fair. I wish that he could teach   Intermediate accounting too:)
He is awesome. Great teacher, funny, and cute!

He gives handouts which are very helpful. Goes over the homework. Tests are straightforward and from the handout and book examples. However, Professor Geekie is so good-looking that it is extremely hard to pay attention in class. I would have done better if I was not daydreaming the whole time.
Amazing teacher, helpful nice understanding and funny would love to have him again someday.

He filled in for a sick professor at UAkron last semester.  Loved this guy.  Funny, smart and material driven.  CSU has a gem with this guy.  I wish I could have had him for more classes.  I believe he is a CPA and a lawyer!
Entertaining, friendly, MC quizzes, easiest WAC requirement @ csu. Quizzes can be difficult if not prepared.
Great
Funny, intelligent, and relaxed.  I could go to class with him all week long.  And hes hot.  Hes like my dream guy
The professor is easy because he knows how to explain the subject material in an easy/clear way. He is also sympathetic to the plight of students and wants them to succeed.

If you want to see a real professor, than you got to take some classes with prof. Geier, not only she is by far the best, but she should keep a seminar with the rest of the professors so they can learn how it gets done. P.S. maybe mr. Garlock will learn anything...

I went into this class with a negative attitude. I mean, c'mon, Tax? However, I was interested in estate planning and knew I should take it. After taking her class, I decided to get my LLM in tax. Not only did she get me interested, she wrote me recommendations! Very clear and nice. If you can, take her class - worst case scenario, you learn!
Very enthusiastic and helpful.
Great professor.  She makes the tax code seem like an interesting novel (well not like a novel, but she is great).  Highly recommended!

Cute professor. Very easy class if you put in the work. You will have to read some short articles. Class consists of 4 short responses to the articles you read, 4 main essays, and some pop quizzes. If you put in the work you will get an A.  Allows rewrites as well.
Pretty cool teacher, she allows you to turn in a re-write on a paper if you get a bad grade.
I have good grades
I have good grades

Mike encourages the class to expand their minds and think outside the box. He provides materials that show the possibilities and challenges you to stretch your creative thinking. Always has good constructive feedback and has the most awesome beard.

Great, engaging professor who really knows how to connect well with students.  Also, he is not afraid to teach shocking or controversial material which really makes the class more interesting and well-rounded.

Excellent teacher for first class in the morning,very funny,sometimes he gets a lot into his jokes and wastes class time,but it's fun.His midterms and finals are anoying,he gives a lot of questions that it's not possible to finish all in one hour, but not too bad, it's fun!

Excellent teacher.  Probably the best creative writing intro teacher at the school.  You'll spend time both studying existing, published works and then composing your own, and workshopping them in class.  It's an excellent, balanced approach that shows you not only how your own writing works but how it relates to literature in general.
The most helpful professor I have seen in my life.

Love this class. Mainly because an intelligent, articulate professor is leading the class. He's extremely funny and discussions are great. People actually want to take part in discussions! Definitely take any class you can with him.

Jeremy has a very structured, but innovative way of teaching. He has a wonderful way of inserting intellectual humor throughout his lectures. He makes a topic that doesn't pertain to everyone's interest a lot more entertaining than one would expect.

Dr. Genovese is a nice and knowledgeable man. However, he grades as if you were a master level English major. If you want to pass his class do not use contractions and make sure your papers are looked over by more than one person  because perfection isn't good enough for him.

Worse professor I've evee had in ny 4 years of college. He treats you like a child and grades you like you're an English major. His power points are detailed but half of it isn't even on the test. He doesn't try to help you get a good grade, do not take his class. I have an A in everyone one of my classes but this one.

Power points are very direct.  Ample opportunity to participate. You have one "case study" due every 2-3 weeks that are 400 words each. However, expect to get very low grades if you  split an infinitive or use one contraction. I've consistently gotten 60% on those even though the content was correct and I only had ONE mistake. I was not alone.

Very organizwed and direct professor. Great with answering questions and even has pretty good jokes.He always has examples and makes sure participation oppurtunities are available for every one. He can be a little  high strung sometimes but I really enjoyed his class. I would recommend him esp if you enjoy structured class time, no surprises.

Awesome professor, especially if you like an organized, informed discussion-based class. You can't ask him a question he doesn't have the most informed answer for, and he's very fair about the work load and the grading. Really enjoyable, engaging professor.

Knows the language of ASL, but does NOT know how to teach. Homework-a waste of time, she doesn't even read it, just gives a grade based on completion. No useful feedback as to performance and learning. Tests are a video which can be paused and replayed as much as you want, so aren't good assessments either. Worst teacher I've ever had.

Can't give her any higher of a rating. Hands down the best prof I have had at CSU. She genuinely cares about all of her students and understand how stressful work can be. Makes assignments easy and gives clear descriptions. She is always available to help her students. Loved her!!!
Shes sensitive and she lets her feelings get in the way of teaching

I loved how organized Dr. Gergis was! I also liked how she included lots of different ways and methods of learning. Dr. Gergis paid special attention to each specific learning style present in class and made it possible for every person to learn. I am grateful for the opportunity I had to learn nursing research with Dr. Gergis!

Dr. Gergis is an amazing professor who is very passionate about what she teaches and goes above and beyond to help her students. She really cared about us learning and taught the course in such a fun and enthusiastic way that made learning tough material interesting and fun. She is an excellent professor!!

Dr. Gergis truly cares about her student's success. I have met with Dr. Gergis multiple times throughout the semester. She took extra time to fully explain the material until I had a strong understanding. She is passionate about teaching and it shows through her dedication to students. She is very organized, knowledgeable, professional and caring!

Dr. Gergis is one of the best instructors I have had throughout my education at Cleveland State. I don't think I have had a professor that cares more about her students learning the material and being successful. She explains everything thoroughly and encourages us. She is excellent and would love if I had her again as an instructor!

Professor Gergis is incredibly knowledgeable of critical care and puts it into terms that we students can understand. I really enjoyed her excellent course. She was very thorough, caring, and knowledgeable. She explained things in depth and wanted everyone to do well. She is the best professor I've ever had!!

I enjoyed Dr. Gergis a lot! She was extremely knowledgeable about the subject, and she was ALWAYS available to help the students or answer any questions we may have had. You can tell Professor Gergis not only loved research but also cared about her students' success. I highly recommend Dr. Gergis class!!!

Professor Gergis is extremely knowledgeable about the material she is teaching. She is always willing to help students whenever they have questions. The material provided was very helpful along with all of her lectures and in class Kahoot quizzes. She is by far one of the best professors I have ever had!

I really enjoyed Dr. Gergis course. She was very thorough, caring and knowledgeable. She is always prepared for classes and answers questions very effectively. Dr. Gergis explained things in depth and wanted everyone to do well. Amazing class, amazing way to teach, amazing professor!

Dr. Gergis is an amazing person and educator. She has her students best interests at heart. She was extremely knowledgeable on the subject and willing to go out of her way to help her students understand and succeed.

I really enjoyed having Dr. Gergis as my NUR305 professor. She was very knowledgeable, caring, and very responsive to any questions and concerns we had. Her course was extremely well organized and easy to understand, and the work that was assigned for the course was relevant and helped me better understand the course material.

Professor Gergis was available to meet with us whenever we had questions. She was there to listen to any concerns and always provided excellent and positive feedback. She went above and beyond what was required of her to make sure each student had the opportunity to succeed. She is a GREAT professor and awesome human being!!!!!

I loved how organized Dr. Gergis was! I also liked how she included lots of different ways and methods of learning. Dr. Gergis paid special attention to each specific learning style present in class and made it possible for every person to learn. I am grateful for the opportunity I had to learn nursing research with Dr. Gergis!
I had Dr. Gergis in MedSurg II. She is AWESOME! goes above and beyond to support her students. LOVE HER!

She is a great professor. She was very fair grader and really took the time to listen to us. Unlike most instructors she went out her way to provide us with additional study tools. The interactive activities she used were very helpful to think about the material and study at the same time, reinforced what was taught in class and bump my GPA up

She is an amazing individual, and I am glad to have met her! It has been a long time since I have seen an instructor care so much about her students and their success. I felt very comfortable to approach her. She was always fair and saw things from my point of view as a student. She went above and beyond to make the class a good experience for us.

She is an awesome professor!!! I really enjoyed her class!!! Her availability, kindness, and knowledge were appreciated. She was extremely quick to respond to any questions we had, and the way she presented the materials was helpful to keep me engaged. Her willingness to help and take time out of her day to answer questions was extremely helpful.

Dr. Gergis showed genuine enthusiasm whenever she is teaching or discussing with her students. It was very evident that she enjoys teaching. She actively answered questions and did a great job presenting various materials that were helpful to all learning styles. I truly appreciate Dr. Gergis diligent work in supporting her students.
Dr. Gergis helped us and supported us all the time. She is a great professor!!
The way Dr Gergis runs her class is flawless. She is absolutely an amazing professor!!!!!

Dr. Gergis is the perfect example of what students need to become when we become nurses. She practices what she preaches. She acts professional, she's kind, shows compassion, enthusiasm for her job, respect to students, care towards patients, she values science and evidence. I've never met a professor who's so inspiring to her students!

Dr. Gergis is so kind, respectful and patient with her students. She was very supportive and did everything she can to help us succeed. Her class was very interactive and engaging and I learned a lot!

She was authoritarian, telling us where to sit and chose our groups. Course lacks content for a 3 credit hour course, so she fills it with discussion. You submit end of chapter questions weekly and discuss in class ad nauseam. No feedback received for any assignment and group work is impacted by peer review significantly more than any other course.

This professor is new to teaching. She is trying to find her way. There are weekly journals, 1 exam, class participation and a group presentation/report. Grading seems to be subjective - but unsure. she does take time to respond to assignments but this is because everything in the class is written.

Most incompetent professor. Unable to lead a class. I have not learned a single ounce of material. Instead of lecturing Susan has chosen to lead the course by open discussion. During these open discussion she constantly agrees with students who blatantly give false information. This among other things have created a harmful learning environment.

Should be reviewed b/c she does not have the capabilities to teach graduate level courses. Majority of each class is used to discuss the agenda and free-form discussions where even if the wrong answer is stated, she agrees and moves on - you learn nothing. It takes a minimum of 3-4 weeks to get an assignment graded. Horrible response to emails.

Loved the class and enjoyed the prof. She was very friendly and approachable. Any questions you had she was there to help. She made learning the material fun and interesting. Highly recommend this class with this prof. She's great.

The least helpful professor I have ever dealt with.  I am certain that she is interested in Bioethics. I am not certain, however, that she is interested in educating students. A good portion of your grade is based on submitted papers, yet she provides no rubric. Students have asked for an example of an "A" paper-she refuses. Avoid her course.

By far, worst professor I have had at CSU. Tried numerous times to get help but responses were that she could not meet at my available times. Instead of explaining why I am not doing well on papers, all she would write is "you do not seem to be getting the concept". Extremely picky with her grading, to a decimal. I recommend this class but not her!

I thought she was extremely unfair. I've taken a number of philosophy classes, and I've never had a professor who was so picky and critical. She challenged known philosophical definitions (like utilitarianism) that I cited in my paper as if I were presenting them as my own arguments. She was the worst philosophy prof. I ever had.
Dr. Gerrek is a wonderful professor. She wants her students to do well. She answers every question asked and is very helpful.

She is an amazing professor. She makes sure she repeats the concepts as many times as needed. Her classes are very interesting and she always has some real life experiences to share with the students. Just attend the classes, listen to her and you'd be fine. I loved the class.
Typical CSU teacher. Mostly True/false tests and a few short papers. Seemed more concerned with other things than students.

Very good teacher. Tests are sometimes difficult due to wording of the questions, all questions are true and false with some short answer. There are 4 short papers due at the end of the year. Overall I learned a lot and I really enjoyed the class
Terrible teacher. Very obvious that she reviewed herself (see first review).

Monica is a great prof, definitely wants her students to understand what she's teaching and generally do well. Very understanding and acommodating but you do have to read the assigned chapters. If you do, there will be no surprises, and you should generally be fine on the (most mc) exams. Overall, highly recommend taking her classes

I would not recommend this professor at all, I'm currently in Pysch 1010, she is a tough grader is not specific of papers and homework. Too much material is learned all at once and expectations are way too high does not seem to care that you have other classes.  Again I strongly advise not taking her class.

You go into class and shes nice, but goes through the material so quickly you're still trying to think through what she just said. Then you go on blackboard and you have a million assignments and you don't even know where to start. Later when you write a paper for her she cares more about grammar than content. Do not take her class whatever you do.

She is very demanding when it comes to homework and projects. She focuses more on grammar and structure rather than content when grading papers. It feels more like an English class! WOULD NOT RECOMMEND THIS TEACHER. Save yourself the trouble.

Makes class interesting, very good teacher and intelligent. Assigns wayyyyy too much work for an intro to psych class. Many many projects and papers, and RPS requirements through csu are crap. Take a less demanding intro to psych if possible. Tests are easy and she gives good study guides. Very strict with grading papers.

Pedro is cool. Very easy to talk to, super helpful, just a super tough class for over the summer in 6 weeks. 3 exams, 25% of your grade each and homework which is another 25%. not an easy to understand class, 6 weeks is not enough.

Pedro is cool. Very easy to talk to, super helpful, just a super tough class for over the summer in 6 weeks. 3 exams, 25% of your grade each and homework which is another 25%. not an easy to understand class, 6 weeks is not enough.

Dr. Gerum is a new professor and is still trying to figure out his teaching style. He is a bit confused at times but is always willing to listen and help. Never gave lower than a B grade on any homework or test even if the answers were clearly wrong. Highly recommended

Dr. Gerum is a new professor and while the beginning of the semester was chaotic, he quickly adapted well to online learning. His group exercises are based on real data, which I thought was really cool. He is very encouraging and reached out to me when I was struggling and that helped me get a better grade.

As a new profesor and victim of zoom university, Dr. Gerum's lectures were often rushed and unclear, but he got better through the semester. I struggled with stats 1 and this was no better but stats may be easier for you. Expect group work (excels), lecture questions, homeworks (mcgraw) all at inconsistent times. Exams are difficult. Nice person.

The worst teacher I've ever had. AVIOD! She doesn't use a textbook, just notes she prints out. Her accent is hard to understand. She's rude to students who ask questions. She doesn't assign HW which is actually bad b/c there's no text book to practice problems. She's unprepared for class. Tests filled with typos. You WILL rely on yourself to learn.
Math is very easy for me, so I am doing well in the class, but Ghatage is very confusing to understand. She is very enthusiastic about calculus but she doesn't deliver the information to us clearly.

this teacher has made my life a living hell! above the fact that her accent is so heavy each single day she decides to teach with candy in her mouth, also she has ZERO tolerance when asked a question, I asked her once and she almost threw me out of class, the material she teaches is NOTHING related to the exam, AVOID this teacher at all costs!

She is an absolutely useless professor. Even if you can manage to understand her heavy accent, she has 0 patience and lacks the ability to explain what she's doing. If you're stuck with her, plan on relying heavily on the textbok and tests questions that come out of left field.

Im not quite sure how this professor is still teaching. Very unclear and impatient. She called us a bunch of 5 year olds one day. She says "come on people" a lot like it's gonna help us understand or something. We all wrote super bad student reviews and it seems from the comments on here that other people have as well, but somehow she is still @CSU
Hard to understand what she is saying, has no structured teaching style and does not explain things. Avoid at all costs!!!

i would not recommend the class if you do not need it, my english was bad, the way she talk i'm clueless, her test is 180 to what she teach in class, the book is a waste of money and tuition for this class is a waste
Very nice professor. Had 2 take home midterms. Not hard @ all. Need to be a total idiot to get less than B in the class.

This professor is HORRIBLE. She can not teach at all. If the administration ever read the student reviews she would probably be canned!! She made Multivarible Calc hell! She is very hard to understand and her test are a complete 180 from what she goes over in class. Tuition is too high for such a bad professor!!

She is really nice teacher. often tries to complete the main parts of syllabus. test are really easy and she tells you the most of time what is gonna be there..so no need to worry. very less homework. overall helping if you give her response in class. definitely recommend her. all thumbs up

The book is expensive and is a waste for this class.  She doesn't follow the book and most of her teaching is from handouts (no background info or good examples).  The first test is easy - after that they get A LOT harder.  Even some Math majors had problems with her class.  The class style is rushed and  I would advise you to skip her if you can

I laughed so hard in this class I almost had a bowel movement. Man was I lucky to be in this interesting class. One of the best teachers I have ever had in my life. TTTTTTEEEEEEERRRRRRRRIIIIIIIIFFFFFFFIIIIIIIICCCCCCC.

Very hard to understand, and very unwilling to help students out with problems. She knows the material, but does not know how to teach it to people. She got mad every time you would ask her a question on something that you were not clear on. Easily the worst professor I have ever had.

I recieved A's in every math course, since HS and my freshman year at CSU. I was seriously thinking about a math major, since every math instructor recommended it to me, but this teacher not only failed to explain concepts, she graded completely ludacris, and was very unfriendly. I dropped the class b/c I didnt want to deal with her teaching.

This teacher needs to retire from the University. She has a very poor teaching skills, difficult to understand, and has a problem remaimbering what she wants to teach.  She is the most difficult maths teacher i have ever had in my life.

I didn't show work on a Q, she counted it wrong, even tho the A was right (and the instr didn't mention showing work).  Next Q, I did show work, got the A right, but some of the work wrong, and got that marked wrong as well.  She said it would be right if I hadn't shown shown the work!  Numerious students reported her. Then she lowered our grades.

I am still excited about Calculus but am convinced I will have to be like Isaac Newton and teach myself. This person is beyond useless. She is vague with a skill that should place her in politics not education. I will pass her class I believe but I wouldn't recommend anyone takes her class... ever!!!
very nice teacher.very helpful. in our class many students got an A grade.

I had her for Linear Algebra and she is just brutal! I already had Linear Algebra for Engineers and thought this would be an easy A-no way. She makes the material way too hard and is very confusing as to what she wants on homework and tests. I don't say this often, but avoid her if you can.

This is the most inconsiderate teacher I have ever had.  She actually laughs at you when you answer a question wrong!  Her favorite saying "Come on people!"  Very unclear in what she wants from you.  Another thing she said "I was playing word games with you."  Mind you she was taking about a test!  Avoid her if you can!

His syllabus is extremely thorough (15 pages), which can be intimidating, but it lays out exactly what you need to do in the class to succeed. Also has given great feedback on what he is looking for in discussion posts and gave us 1-pg explanation on how to improve our case analysis, which was helpful. Do the work and you'll be fine.

Online course that is made up of discussion boards, group case analysis, and two exams. The professor is an extremely hard grader and does not provide feedback on his reasoning. For discussion board I found myself not changing my format or depth of discussion but loosing points.

Professor is highly experienced. The course material is not that great and hence make sure you note down every point discussed in class. The lectures are close to real world. The expectations can be unclear at times. Might skip few topics coz of time constraints. He has 2 exams and 1 presentation. Exams are tricky but he is a fair grader.  I got A.

Very high quality instruction, very fast paced class with a lot to cover. Go to every class, do not buy or read the book, do ever assignment within days of getting the assignment, and study each slide after the lecture.

This class was difficult but if you put in an honest effort you'll get a good grade. There is a huge curve which makes it almost impossible to fail. If you show up to class you should have no problem. The project is worth 100 points, more than the final and midterm combined, so do a good job.

I didn't learn much in this class. I failed the midterm and the final and ended up with a C. The mid/final exams are based off the 6 assignments primarily. He is a nice guy but not very understanding and can't answer any questions with definite answers. If you do take this class, the main group project seems to be your grade at the end.
Talks in circles.  he may know about Marketing Research, but he doesn't know how to teach it.

Do not buy the book nothing he talks about is in there and you don't need it to study. Really did not know what to study everyone was worried about the midterm and final but he ends up curving it. a 50% was a C

AVOID. Horrible teacher, impossible to understand. His grading format is ridiculous, being mostly based on group work. You can ace the midterm, but it barely has any effect on your grade, as the group work is worth about 70%. Not very understanding either.

MKT 431 This course alone is very difficult since it is based on one project - group work.  Tests are extremely difficult, but he curves. Ask questions !! listen !! Take a lot of NOTES !!! You will be fine. Attendance of every class it is essential. Professor will value true effort.
Most of the class material cannot be found in the book, all from his lecture. Asking questions is tough because I do not think he knows how to clearly communicate what he is trying to say.
He's kind of confusing on expectations. But not a bad professor

Professor Ghosh is a mixed bag.  While he definitely knows his stuff, his expectations are quite ambiguous; in fact, going to each of the 2 exams, the class, as a whole, had no idea what was going to be on it.  Also, the Brands Simulation project is completely useless and subjective, yet it consists of 30% of your grade.
If you want to learn marketing, this is your man.  What I learned got me my job in a tough economic climate.  Pay attention, do the work, and you will excel--even after you graduate.

I wouldn't avoid taking him again, but I wouldn't look for him either.  He seemed to genuinely care about the students and material, but his feedback could have been better.  I didn't understand his grading, but it wasn't overly hard.

Nice guy, however he is slow at providing feedback on grades and progress. Going into the final only 1 of 5 grades was known with remainder.  Seems that his grading of Project and Presentation are more subjective then not subjective with no concrete approach at grading as no method was provided.

Had him for a 6 week summer MKT Research class and thought he did a good job of covering material at a fast paced. Likes to be tricky on homework and tests.  But if you attend class, study and see him if you have a question you can get an A.  Treats students as adults.  If you're not mature you will struggle.

He doesn't have that thick of an accent, and is quite pleasing to the ear.  I can't believe people are whining that he doesn't focus on a book that is only good for it's marketing success stories.  It is an easy book to read.  Marketing is not an incremental understanding, its  accumulative. grow up.
Don't need the book, is demanding of his students but isn't that hard. Do the work, you'll learn a lot and will do alright.
Don't you mean he doesn't use the textbook that he made you buy.  He made us buy the textbook and never used it, EVER.

Debbie has to be the worst professor at CSU. Her grading is unfair and harsh. She is very confusing. She does not know how to use Blackboard, MindTap, and Cengage. Debbie constantly forgets what assignment we are on and to grade our assignments. Debbie is also very rude with the way she speaks to some of the students. Horrible.

The class itself is not hard,but Debbie is not clear!you will not understand what she want or like,confusing person and no fair grading! No clear instructions or deadlines.   Yes she submitted our final grad without grading many assignments! You will learn nothing and loss a lot of points without reasons! I would not take class with her again

Debbis is the worst teacher that I have ever had No fair grading, no clear instructions ,the class is only for eating, make fun of some students and some accents. You will learn nothing , she confused us every time about assignments, deadline,and what we have to do She submitted the final grade without grading all assignments VERY disappointed

I LOVE Debbie.  She is the nicest Professor I have had, and If I had the ability to, I would take one of her classes again.  I went into the class thinking "Business communication?" I came out of the class with good knowledge, and another professor friend.  I recommend taking a class with her as the professor, sometimes she's a little ditzy, though

She's average. Very scatterbrained and chatty. Overall, not bad. Due to her being a bit disorganized its rather stressful as a student to be learning under her. But, she does seem to try her best to be thoughtful of her students. She really seems to want their success.

During the first lecture I was about 5 seconds away from walking out of the class. (one person actually did) BUT HANG IN THERE! Debbie is truly a great professor and cares about her students. If you just make the effort to participate in her class she will like you.

I am very confused by the other ratings on here. Debbie was the funniest, most down to earth, realistic professor I have ever had. All of the comments saying her due dates were unclear and always being moved YA, for YOUR benefit? She was not strict about anything in a good way. I thought it wold be stupid content but I actually learned so much

Debbie is very unprofessional, unorganized, and a disgrace to the MBA program.  She continuously changed due dates for all homework and projects; there is just no way to keep up with tasks.  This class is a waste of MONEY and time.
Do not even bother

I do not recommend this professor if you care about your grade.  You have no control of your grade.  She never even finished grading our assignments or giving feedback.  She tells you not to argue about your grade -- probably because she never finishes grading assignments and has nothing to back up her grades. Disgrace to an MBA program.

Very unorganized, not clear due dates, and no feedback.  Never finished grading our assignments but someone assigned everyone grades and then told us not to contact her with questions.  Strangely, there were 4 other poor reviews from others in my class and they have all been removed.

The class itself is not hard, but you won't be able to understand what she wants or likes! VERY disorganized,lazy on grading,no clear instructions or deadlines She submitted our final grade without grading all the assignments and without any feedback I don't know how she became a communication's professor while she is confusing and not clear!

This is the first professor I've had that cared so much about their students. This class is not an "easy A" but you will learn a lot, become friends with almost every classmate and have a talented professor on your side.

She will get to the top worst teachers you have in your life. honestly, avoid her. she is the lover of thesis statement and she will teach you NOTHING but boring and silly stories. Please don't take her class cos this is going to be the worst thing you have done to your self in your whole life.
AVOID. You will learn nothing. If you bring food for people in class, you get A.

AVOID. Never clear on exams and topics. The only thing she teaches is thesis statement in the entire semester. If you do make people laugh in class and bring food for people in class, you get A. You will learn nothing from this class. Waste of money.
VERY nice professor, she is kind of vague sometimes, but I really enjoyed the class.  A lot about communication and presentations

Not very clear in explaining the course objectives. Also you will be lost gussing what she wants and when. No clear deadlines and most of all not fair grading. She prefers far east students and males over others. You will not win an argument regarding you final grade

I really liked her.  She cares about the students and she knows the subject.  She does her best to make class interesting and offers lots of comments to help us improve.  I've never had another teacher who devoted so much effort to helping students learn.  Take the class if you get a chance.

Her lectures are very interesting. She is a funny lady, but when it comes to grading WATCH OUT!It is very difficult to get "A" in her class as she follows the rule that only 10% of class can get A. The half of class failed the 1st paper, so she had to give them back to rewrite.

She teaches a class that emphasizes writing, speeches, etc., yet if you are a foreigner who can't write or speak english, you will do better than those who can.  I was told by one of my professors at OSU that I was one of the best writers they had seen in their 30 years of teaching, yet Debbie found flaws in everything I did. I Ignored her feedback

Loved her as a professor. She is very helpful when it comes to editing a paper or preparing for a presentation. She also uses a lot of stories to get a point across that maybe confusing to some people. She interacts with her students at every chance. She is great for international students.

She is very good professor. There is usage of the book she mentions but you learn much more than the book. She is very helpful for international students in terms of helping them understand the Difference in the way of communication between Americans and rest of the world. Given a choice never ever miss her class..

Had her a few years ago, I still remember her class.It was different from every class I've taken at CSU, in a good way.Rarely ever do you take a teacher that wants everyone to succeed and will help you no matter what.You actually get to know everyone in the class when you sit in a circle.She doesn't hand back papers very fast, oh well.Take herClass

She was very helpful organized and right on point with the information she provided she shared personal exepriences that help the class understand the need of the families, student and the teacher.She help to clarify the role of an educator,the duties of the teachers, student,parents and the school district to ensure that students recieved the best
