Very cool instructor
Made a not-so-fun topic bearable!

Very knowledgeable about special needs.  Constantly sends worthwhile special needs information to students by e-mail.  Was very helpful throughout the course of the semester.  The only downside is her voice amplifier doesn't always work.  If you're in the back of the class, you might not hear her.

Amazing English teacher make sure you do all the required writing center workshop stuff. Also you don't really have to read the homework, just look over it just in case you talk about it in class but make sure you do your blackboard assignments and turn in your papers ON TIME !

Dr. Gibson is fantastic! I had her for 2 graduate level nursing classes. The set up of answering discussion questions and responding to 2 students is not bad! You have a full week to do all three items. You WILL use the books required for the papers and class. If you did poorly on a paper she will allow you to make corrections and resubmit!!

Dr. Gibson is fantastic! I had her for 2 graduate level nursing classes. The set up of answering discussion questions and responding to 2 students is not bad! You have a full week to do all three items. You WILL use the books required for the papers and class. If you did poorly on a paper she will allow you to make corrections and resubmit!!

Dr. Gibson was a great professor! His lectures could be a little boring, but that's expected for bio. He definitely listens to his students and adjusts; we had complaints that the extended responses on a quiz were graded too harshly, so he immediately reevaluated and gave us points back. His quizzes were easyish, but you do have to study for it.

Lectures were long but took the least time to complete, compared with the other 2 professors. He made sure to explain thoroughly what he wants you to remember. Speeding up the recording helped to get to the points he highlighted. Questions are exactly as he explained them in lectures. Most straightforward professor I've had.

Dr. Gibson's lectures were pretty boring but he seemed like a nice guy. His section was definitely the easiest out of the group. You still have to study though. You should also go to the study sessions. The quizzes were pretty straight forward and he was willing to work with the students when there were issues.

Dr. Gibson was a great professor! His lectures could be a little boring, but that's expected for bio. He definitely listens to his students and adjusts; we had complaints that the extended responses on a quiz were graded too harshly, so he immediately reevaluated and gave us points back. His quizzes were easyish, but you do have to study for it.

An absolute jerk. Does not understand the level of stress we are under. Decides to add short answers to the quizzes which literally bring down your grade by at least 2 letter grades. Beyond impossible to do well or get full points on those. They are not clear with what they are asking and everyone in this class is suffering.

Literally the worst prof ever. Does not answer emails. Does not care about you. He is on his HIGH HORSE thinking he is the smartest dude ever by making our lives harder since online. No curve, unnecessarily tough on quizzes. I hate his guts so much. I love bio and I do well in it but not with these profs for bio 202. They. Make it 100x harder.

the class was remote, his lectures were monotone and he would jump all over the place from one slide to another-- if you want an A or B, you really have to study like 20-30+ hours a week and quizzes are not based off powerpoints at all-- i definitely would not take it again, do not recommend, also don't expect him to answer your emails!

Gibson is fine, there's not much to complain about besides the fact that he is sometimes difficult to understand and somewhat boring . I think that people are asking too much of university profs, they are not high school teachers, so don't expect them to treat you like kids. Put in the work and pay attention, and you will see good results.
boring lecture-er, very very difficult tests (cumulative)... prepare yourselves

I had Gibson 2 years ago and I've been his SI leader for 3 semesters. My encounters with students from this class is that they're frustrated with the content and don't want to study for it/take notes in class, then they get mad when they do poorly. Just take notes on what he says, use the flashcards, AND STUDY AHEAD OF TIME NOT THE NIGHT BEFORE.

I won't say that he makes the subject easy, but he does lecture the information effectively if you're willing to listen. Many of the classmates I saw complaining about their grades were the same ones that were on their phones during lecture. Biology is a serious field and should be treated as such. Put in maximum effort and you'll be rewarded.

Theres no interaction, just slides and lots of talking. You get three professors and they all read off slides. If you love biology and want to know biology do not take this class. I wish I could get my money back...
Have to study a lot to earn a good grade. A lot of the information in the slideshows isn't on the exam so its really important to study/focus on the difficult stuff. Teaches at a slow pace.

Gibson is exactly what you would expect out of a university bio professor. Anything he says in lecture is fair game on an exam so if you study for an hour you aren't going to get an A. He does test on examples given in class but they're always relevant to the course material. Plus there is a curve. Every once in awhile lecture will be super boring.

Avoid if possible. His tests are based on lectures, not the book. Will test on the tiniest details in the PowerPoint slides. Will test on things he mentions in class but are not in PowerPoints. If he goes over an example for 20 minutes, know it!!! Go to class and record lectures. Extremely knowledgeable. not impossible to get an A, just very hard.

Dr. Gibson was not one of the best professors I had but he also wasn't the worst. Lectures can be very very boring at times sometimes I almost wanted to fall asleep. He is a very nice person outside of the classroom can just be boring at times.

The TA is hard to understand, and did not see him much in my last semester, he seems nice, but doesn't say much. I hate science so I wouldn't take again. It's really not that bad though. GO TO THE LAB, answer all the questions for the report, study for prequizzes, and enjoy the ride! Need cover page on report.
Be prepared for a lot of memorable one-liners! Dr. Gibson is really funny and smart! He essentially just lectures at us but he does try to make things interesting. He's a good dude.

Seems to know a lot about what he teaches, but he's insensitive, and contempt with students who don't come in knowing anything. Tests are very difficult if you don't study, to the point of ridiculous. He goes through lecture very fast, and gets upset when there are whispers. Classic doctor demanding respect and undivided attention at all times.

I am a post - graduate pre- medicine student. I have 7 years of education under my belt with 140 credits meaning I've had ALOT of professors. By far he is the rudest, worst, non specific professor I have ever had. You do not need the book as it is strictly notes from class and studying the slides given in class online. Study the SLIDES!!!

For his section, the slides are your best friend. Pay attention to his examples!! Youtube videos and the book will NOT help you as much as just reading and memorizing the slides. His lectures are boring but his exam questions are straight forward. He's very strict... DO NOT TALK DURING HIS LECTURES!
Write verbatim from the book. I get the feeling he doesnt like to anaylze your answers and just likes to check definitions off. This class is 80% vocab, 20% writing two essays.

very bad professor. the tests are hard, discussion boards every week and he gives low grades.... don't waste your time and money with him. he doesn't even answers his emails. annoying and no help. impossible to get a good grade.the worst professor that i ever had; i dropped the class because i don't want to get a bad GPA.

Very interesting teacher. Most classes are fun. Lecture all done on powerpoint, barely uses the book. Attendence is important because he goes over things that aren't on the powerpoint or in the book. Grade consists of 3 multiple choice and T/F exams, 2 quizzes, and 2 small homeworks, but he does curve the tests! And may give extra credit.

Great Professor, very helpful helps a lot by giving you extra credits to improve your grade. 3 exams during the semester, 80 multiple choice and t/f question on each exam. Very easy class. Attendance do count if you I attend everyday I guarantee you will pass his class!! but if you miss 3 days or less he will not penalized you. Overall great class
Pretty good teacher. Goes off topic at times, but has funny stories and makes class interesting. Tests are easy. Good class overall.

Great teacher! I don't know why not that many people like him. He's a great guy and makes sociology interesting! I had him for my summer class at Tri-C. The class was only 5 weeks long and he did an excellent job covering all of the material and making sure we remained at a pace were we were able to understand everything. Highly recommend him! =)
Goes off topic everyday. Spends to much time talking about the olympics, food and places to travel which is a good thing. Tests are too easy.

Professor Gigante always takes time to give students plenty of helpful feedback. Shes remained organized and understanding during the pandemic and has made class manageable, which is a lot more than other professors. Anyone can tell that she truly cares for her students and the work that we do. Highly recommend, especially for film production!

Professor Gigante always takes time to give students plenty of helpful feedback. Shes remained organized and understanding during the pandemic and has made class manageable, which is a lot more than other professors. Anyone can tell that she truly cares for her students and the work that we do. Highly recommend, especially for film production!
Great soul and easy to talk to. Can tell she gets offended by extensive absences.

The acting class is mandatory, so there were a lot of students that didn't want to be there. She understood that and tried spinning the class in a more useful perspective for film students. She shares a lot of valuable stories and experiences from her career. Great professor who made an awful class more bearable.
Took BUS151 as an elective. He is extremely knowledgeable in the course material. He absolutely is there to help you pass. He will give you every opportunity to pass his course.
Took BUS151 as an elective. He is extremely knowledgeable in the course material. He absolutely is there to help you pass. He will give you every opportunity to pass his course.

A very sweet dude. He tends to ramble, and I think he may believe he's the Dead Poets Society Robin Williams incarnation of a Spanish teacher, but if you pay attention he lays out all of the test information very clearly in lectures, and he grades more for effort than accuracy in many of the Spanish assignments.

Lots of readings, but I honestly found that my Spanish reading comprehension improved from this class alone. Covers the history and culture of every country in Latin America, so really content-heavy but the final is literally the first 2 exams combined so you know what to study. His study guides are also super comprehensive and you learn a ton!
Assigns way too much homework, course doesn't match description. THIS IS A EUROPEAN HISTORY CLASS not a film class. Not an easy A, takes 3% off final grade per day missed of class

Best professor in the Spanish department.  He makes things very clear and is helpful when you need him.  He assigns a lot of homework, but they're typically just daily assignments with a few questions.  Be prepared to write papers and take a few quizzes but he's a fair grader and gives good feedback. Also, he's easy on the eyes!
He gives absolutely TOO much homework. Wished he's spend more time teaching than assigning hw, it's as if you are an independent study student.

He gives A LOT of homework but for the most part it's easy and he's really a fair grader. He doesn't really teach though. He mostly gives you practice so if you have a firm grip of the material then you're in for an easy time. If you don't I'd suggest going to the tutoring office as often as possible.
he assigns a crazy amount of hw we have 3 classes a week and every class we would have at least one hw. and he is not an easy grader at all. i dont know what  grade i would get yet

Had him for Civilization and went on a five week study abroad trip in Spain. It was an amazing experience and he made sure we got the most out of it. Very fair and will negotiate deadlines for special circumstances. Very approachable!

Very good class.  Very helpful in writing methods, specifically how to integrate citations into a paper, expand on citations and how to build a good argument.  His affected Castillian accent can be distracting, but he is a great guy.  Very focused on peninsular studies, but that is to be expected.
Dr. Gingerich is the best!
Nice guy.  very understanding.  do your homework though- as long as you do your homework, he is lenient
He is very cute and has a great Spanish accent from Spain. I learned a lot with him.
He explains concepts and grammar rules very well.
Grading seems random,  not very engaging and relies too heavily on tests.

Such a great professor not only is the class Natural History of Cleveland unique he makes the lectures as interesting as possible and there are field trips like once a week so it is more convient to have a car but most people pair up and ride together. A really fun and intereting class I would definately take it again.

Ms. Glass talks a lot in class about the importance of teachers making a difference and being there for students. I have emailed her multiple times since taking the class for help and she's been there for me each time, often with better advice than my adviser. She's an amazing professor who doesn't stop caring about you after the semester is over!
Really great professor. Extremely kind and knowledgeable. Had her a few semesters ago and things I learned in class are really useful for my current experiences.

Excellent professor! She went into detail about many issues regarding education and caused me to have a lot more respect for the profession and understanding the whole child, as opposed to just what I am teaching them. She really helped me decide for sure that I wanted to be a teacher!
The worst professor i have ever came in contact with. Not many people could make you hate yourself quite as much.

Prof. Glass really loves teaching and does everything she can to prepare you for a great teaching career. I feel like I know so much more about what to expect and how to make a positive difference after taking her class last semester. But she makes you read a lot. She is one of the best professors I've ever had and I would take the class again!

Awful. He has "combined classes" almost every class and won't give you the time back by cancelling another one. He NEVER explains anything and it's useless going to his office hours. He told us in class absolutely not to do something on a brief and then took major points off when we followed that instruction. Use the T.A. or you will learn nothing.

Some students in my class were given multiple chance to "rewrite" while others had to just accept the grade they were given. By the end of the year I could tell who he favored. Somehow I got an A in Contract and Torts yet I got a C in this class. If he doesn't like you get the pleasure of a 6 credit hr. C. Thanks for killing my gpa!

Least favorite teachers at Marshall. He has his favorite students and if you aren't one of them you are screwed. Grading not anonymous- he knows your number. Always got the same crappy grade no matter how hard I tried. He would give me no help at conferences despite having full drafts- He would give others extensions and rewrite their papers.

Very nice guy...doesn't seem to get it.  Not accessible outside of class at all, not clear with feedback.  Lays out exactly how to write papers...just follow it and you'll be fine, you just may not learn much.

Did not like his class. Everytime I came to him with a question outside of class he would always answer back with "well what do you think?"  He was also rude to students in class. I'm glad I never have to take him again.

Not very helpful for 1st year legal writing. Class time was painful and I thought it would never end. Slow, painful and irrelevant.  Also, he was difficult to get in touch with outside of class. On more than one occasion he told me that he did not have time to talk with me. I am sure he is a great legal writer but teaching it is another issue.
great professor.  he knew all the material and was very friendly to students.  he had several guest speakers, and divided his grading between quizzes and the final.
No Comments

The professor doesnt seem to know the content and subject, so tries to compensate for it by giving over board large amounts of work. The students suffer and dont learn anything because they have so much work and dont have time to learn the material because theyre so occupied with the ridiculous amount of busy work. Multiple weekly essays.

WAY too much work! This was an elective in my final semester of my MBA and was hands down the most demanding class in my entire education. Final exam (comprehensive - recorded) - 180 questions, only 120 minutes 17+ page research paper with AT LEAST 100 citations Two Quizzes (record - 100 Qs, only 60 min 3-4 DBs every week More weekly essays
RUN!! She's rough and difficult in the most unfair ways.
90 Questions 60 minutes read whole book! 45 Seconds per question! insanity!

She wants you to log into blackboard and submit 4 things a week!!! Every Thursday she has one assignment due (sometimes its group). You will have two discussion boards which you have to a little bit at a time for three days! should atleast be three days! doesnt make sense right?Well it sounds crazy but its true! Read whole book! Give proctored test

A phenomenal knowledgeable professor who really encouraged you to understand the material inside out. As much as he assigned us to read (100s of pages per week), it was more about grasping the concepts as best as possible, while also being able to apply the learned concepts to our work. He also made it fun to write, which I despised doing before.

Speaks for the entire time in lecture with no clear direction or points . No agenda for each class session. Lectured for the entire 3 hours and 50 minutes for every class. Obviously a very smart person and well versed in subject matter but hes going to make sure you know it.

Don't take him as graduate research advisor!!! He cannot not advise properly at all because his knowledge of chemistry is so poor! I don't know how he is a professor in the chemistry department. He is an opportunistic parasite that uses his students to avoid teaching and keep his position at the Cleveland Clinic without working. Avoid at all costs!

Professor Gogonea should not be teaching General chemistry. He teaches one other 500-level chemistry class and what he thinks is simple is a foreign language to gen chem I students. Lectures are useless and far too complex, does not focus on example problems. His exams are unequally weighted leading to poor exam scores. Avoid him at all costs.

Professor Gogonea is a great guy who is amazingly good at chemistry. I think he is early in the teaching world and spends too much time on the complex conceptual side of chemistry instead of the examples that appear on test & quizzes. He grades fast and offers second chances but his teaching style makes his class VERY hard. Not the best teacher.

Really nice Professor and willing to help. But he will literally weight 3-4 questions to be worth 40%+ of your exam grade. For example I got a 13/16 on an exam, but because of how he weights I ended up with a 56%. Gives clean up quizzes (5-10pts). Homework is on ALEKS. Lectures are recorded and posted on Black Board. Over all, meh.

Very understandable, even though he has an accent. He consistently offers help and is superb at giving feedback when tutoring is needed. You have to study to understand, bottom line. If you give no effort it will show. It was an interesting course and I would take it again. It is time consuming but worth it if you love Chemistry.

Extremely difficult to understand. 3 questions on a 70 question midterm were worth 60% of the test grade. There is little to no curve on the tests and he has an extremely weird grading scale. AVOID AT ALL COSTS!!!
Hard to understand, not very helpful and difficult class.  Would take any other professor if you can.
the other posts pretty much say it all.

Worst teacher I have ever had.  His tests are almost impossible and does not go over them.  The tests are all multiple choice and he does not check your work for partial credit.  He does not give reviews for tests and it is almost impossible to get the solutions for the homework.  He does not care how hard you are trying he will not help you pass.
Last post is 100% correct!  Hard to understand, class out of 100 points and he is not helpful.  Stay away if you can!!!

Teaches straight from the book, offers no new insight during lectures. Be prepared to teach yourself from the book. Class is only out of ~100 points, no bonus, little or no curve. Exams are fairly difficult, good luck preparing. Professor will cancel class because of his research. Take professor at own risk.

Professor is hard to understand. still uses a chalk board for his notes that are difficult to see. hasn't upgraded to a powerpoint presentation. no extra credit. grades are only based on tests,final,and don't forget you have to teach yourself the last 5 chapters.
Nice guy, horrible professor.  Avoid if you can.  If you have him buy the homework solution guide from publisher
do not take this class. he cannot teach. his exams make no sense but the curve is so large you can do decent on them. it is a waste or energy and money.
I can't understand him...

You have to study the material yourself. 3 Tests are out of 27 only takes 24 points. Very nice, can't teach, however, her format is easy.
She is a very easy professor.  Her accent is not too bad. She is approachable.  However, all of my questions did not get answered completely.

Well,  all of the previous comments are correct about her accent and teaching style. Very thick accent to point that I couldn't understand her. Dr. Gogonea is absolutely wonderful. She is knowledgable, understanding and genuinely cares about her students. It's organic chemistry so obviously you have to put forth some effort.. Like some of the above comments, I'm sure she knows her chemistry but definitely does not know how to teach. When asked a question she tends to never answer the question, instead just repeat what she said last. She genuinely cares for her students. Definitely the best ochem professor at CSU. Obviously it is a higher level class so you have to study but Dr. Gogonea is great.
Had her for Ochem. Dry lectures, but she's helpful if you see her in person. Also, incredibly easy, most of her exam questions came right from practice exams, and very generous curves. Nice lady.

The previous rater may have been able to understand the professors english, but i can't and most of my class can't. she does ramble and is not good at explaining the info. she also says things  like its hard teaching such low level chemistry. i'm sure she knows her chemistry, but she does not teach it well.

My gosh, I can't stand being in here. I sorta understand her English, but that is NOT the problem. The problem is that she just talks, doesn't get us involved, doesn't ask questions other than "everyone understand?"... and she doesn't even give us time to say "no". ARGH!

She explains the topics really well but you have to read lot of things on your own which are not part of syllabus but connects the topics which are in syllabus. Worst professor Ive ever had. Never have done so bad in class and been worried about failing til this class. Tests averages were failing everytime and she doesnt even say what your errors are on tests So you dont know what you even did wrong. Avoid at all costs!!

Dr. Gold is honestly one of the worst professors I have and I truly believe that she is in no way fit to be teaching an INTRO level course. She rushes through material with little to no explanation and takes literal months to grade a simple assignment. If at all possible, take this class with another instructor, you'll be happy you did.

Save yourself some stress and choose another professor's section. Speds through materials and then expects you to know everything in the book just by reading. The class average score for tests was around 60 and she changed nothing about her teaching style nor offered any extra credit. Mind you, this was an intro course. DON'T TAKE HER CLASS!

I am a math major and have taken way more difficult courses than Discrete Math. From day 1 she sped through the material and when it came time to the first exam, more than half the class failed and this was apparently "normal". Doesn't get back to you through email and doesn't give partial credit on tests. So good luck if you decide to have her!

To start with she basically repeats the book. The first test in the class she says always has a low average, which majority of the class failed. This was an intro course.

She explains the topics really well but you have to read lot of things on your own which are not part of syllabus but connects the topics which are in syllabus. DO NOT TAKE THIS PROFESSOR. She does not explain, she assumes that you know most of this from Calc 1 so she flies through steps without teaching. Dr. Gold is a great professor! She is sometimes a little heavy on theory, but she will always give you enough example problems so you can finish the homework. All tests and quizzes are based off of homework problems. If you understand those, you will be fine on the exams. She also has a lot of office hours if you need help!!

Average. She says the tests and quizzes are based mostly on homework and suggested book practice problems, and they are for the most part. You should get a B on tests and quizzes if you can do the homework and practice problems. Make sure to know the bold definitions in the text and understand them, not just be able to repeat them

Dr. Gold is an intelligent lady, but doesn't care about your education. She goes through the course slowly and expects you to be able to prove anything set to her "higher" standards. There was a test average of 60 percent and didn't even curve it. These test scores are a reflection of her teaching methods not being optimal. DON'T TAKE HER CLASS !!!

Brutal tester. Doesn't go through the material in a clear manner so you can actually do her test problems. She says the problems are out of the homework which some of them were. But it would help if she actually showed us the proper examples. I will never take her again, ever ever ever.

She loves to spout theory but doesn't spend enough time actually teaching us how to do real problems. Like seriously, we aren't math phd's, not many people in your class will be. So be aware that she loves to give you theories and shows very few examples unless you like beg, half our class is failing because she doesn't curve tests.
Classes are boring and she is unclear with what she is talking about.

Solid professor, explains topics clearly and loves being asked good questions. Very quiet so try to sit up front. Sometimes she can make some mistakes in class causing you to erase  notes. She's also a very strict grader, but not unreasonable, and she will change a grade if you prove her grading was unjust. Good professor, not great, but good.

Dr. Gold over-complicates the simplest concepts.  Sometimes you're better off not listening to avoid confusion.  She is a sweet lady who seems to care deeply but she just can convey material very well.
Goes a little fast at times, but will explain patiently if we ask her questions. Good professor!

good teacher, sometimes she goes too fast. you need to know how to apply theorems.  its not a difficult class if you put in the work. tests are rough but the grad students write them so not her fault. go to class so you dont fall behind, alot of material is covered. be prepared for a quiz every week.
Easy A if you actually but work in. You can't just go to class and expect that to be it for Calculus. Dr. Gold is a good teacher, people are just lazy.

I see alot of negatives for her, but i'd like to say that I rather enjoyed her class. Not organized,constantly writes things wrong so you have to scribble out the things she messed up on in your notes, she always is teaching right up until the test, so there isn't a review class before the test, you feel like you are testing on things you've just learned without practicing them first. Very knowledgeable and interesting///made English and composition almost enjoyable

This class is non mandatory attendance as he does not take attendance but even if you read you will miss important tested material that is specific to lecture. Very knowlegeable, interesting lectures, very kind and caring.

Not the greatest professor. Yes, he lectures, but his lectures are horrible. He is all over the place. The information presented does not have a cohesive order, whatsoever. I would not take this class

I really cant understand the negative feedback.  Yes, he mostly lectures but he only teaches lecture courses!  He has firsthand knowledge and his lectures are great.  He is also a very sweet man and always willing to help if you're willing to ask.  he really cares about his students.

Very knowledgeable professor--especially in the fields of late 19th and early 20th century American history and American labor history. I can assure you that he is not qualified for his position. His ways of teaching need to be changed by becoming clear with the information. More class interaction needed. Limited knowledge, relies only on one text to explain world policies. grades tests very sloppy. Says so many wrong things in his lectures I've stopped even bothering to try and get him to clarify.

He seems to know history pretty well. Good teacher, but the class is somewhat difficult. It's a very basic lecture, no Powerpoint or notes or anything, just him talking. If you learn well that way, take his class, but if not then avoid it.

Great teacher. kept me interested in the material the whole semester. The books he had us read were great. Hes got a great accent which helps keep you entertained.

he gets an attitude with some

Dr. Goncy took difficult material and made it easy to understand! She had no problems stopping what she was doing to answer questions. Professor Goncy is a great professor. I recommend taking her class. Follow powerpoint notes that you need to come to class to be able to fill in the blank, great way to keep you active in class. Easy lecturer puts everything on exam reviews. Such an easy A, if you go to class. She talks about her kids ALOT but always for demonstration of concepts she is talking about. Easy and informational.
Dr. Goncy is a gem and is helpful 100%. Take her for Child Development or Adolescent Psych!! Standard exams and many hw and extra credit opportunities. Go to class and you'll pass!! :)

She is one of the best professors I have ever had! I took her PSY 220 and 221 classes. As long as you show up and study a little bit, here tests are easy. Dr. Goncy sets realistic expectations for her students and always explains the material very thoroughly. Her test questions can be hard, but as long as you study you'll be fine. Great professor. I also took PSY 220 and 312 with her. She is animated when she teaches and explains the material well. She gives study guides for the exams, if you only study what is on the study guide, you should get an A. Fair grader. 5 exams-do well on the 1st 4 don't have to take the cumulative final. I wish I could take more classes with her.

Prof. Goncy is an amazing professor. She's funny and although there is a lot of information I feel like I retained a lot of useful information. I definitely recommend! There were 3 tests and a final. If you do well on the tests you don't have to take the final because she drops the lowest test grade. She's a fair grader.

Prof. Goncy is super well-educated and really knows what she's talking about. Her lectures are very well organized and she explains things in a way that you understand. If you do the study guide and show up to class, you should have no problem passing. I would definitely take another class with her.
Professor Goncy is awesome! Her lectures may have been long, but she makes the best of the information she is presenting. I would forsure take another one of her classes.

I took this class online to go towards my psychology minor. The class was fine, you have an assignment due once a week with three tests. Is a great Prof. He missed classes but for VERY Valid reasons. (family illness) Helped me get a grade that I needed. Was very willing to work with you if you didn't understand the material. Also gave extra credit when you asked for it.

Prof didn't seem to be motivated for our class.  He missed a lot of classes and didn't seem very interested in teaching the material.  One good thing is that the class is super easy. Really cool teacher.  Was extremely helpful.  He was very interested in the material taught.  He has the ability to keep students awake.  Has real world experience to share.  Never liked finance before class, but this teacher made it interesting with different exercises given in class. Extremely Recommended.
This guy is phenomenal at explaining content and understanding exactly where his class is at ability wise. Would recommend.

This professor was a headache from the start. He didn't explain material very well. Exams were out in left field. He's very smart; not a great prof. Avoid if possible.
This guy is phenomenal at explaining content and understanding exactly where his class is at ability wise. Would recommend.

Very good professor, one of the best I've had so far. I'm leaving his class feeling like I have a solid grasp on linear algebra, and the process of learning it kept me interested in going to class. Overall enjoyed taking linear algebra either this professor. Explains the material pretty clearly and homework is good practice for tests. Dr. GP is one of the best professors Ive ever had! Her classes are tough but she is right there every step of the way to help students succeed! Cleveland state is so lucky to have her!!!!
Dr. GP is one of the best professors Ive ever had! Her classes are tough but she is right there every step of the way to help students succeed! Cleveland state is so lucky to have her!!!!

Dr. Gordon Pershey is VERY knowledgeable and provides students with an endless about of resources that can be used for years. She is very mindful of students time and is willing to adjust due dates if students make it known they extra stressed. Very organized BB course shell

Dr. Pershey is knowledgeable and a wonderful teacher. She elaborately explains complex concepts and offers endless opportunities for question/clarification. Her class is not easy, it requires work. Grading is very inconsistent amongst different students. Study guides are 75+ (ish) extended response questions for a 15 (extended response) exam.

not clear at all. Honestly even if you attend class you may not pass. I cannot tell if she's an SLP or not by the way she talks during class. her powerpoint don't seem to line up with the textbook and she makes you put off the big paper until the last few weeks of school. She is a a very nice professor who seems to care about her students and trying to help them understand, however, the style of how she teaches makes her class difficult. She tests/asks questions with a bunch of scenarios and diagnosing, as if we are already experienced professionals. Also, more than one answer will seem to be the right answer.

Dr. Gordon-Pershey is a professor who is always willing to help students. If you schedule an appointment with her, she'll give you all of the resources and guidance you need to be successful. That said, she's a very tough grader and she does give lots of info in her lectures. Definitely not an "easy A", but it's possible to do well in it.

Dr. Pershey has a unique teaching style. She truly believes that the material is presented in a clear way but it's confusing. She expects the undergraduate students to know clinical things without being taught and her tests are the kind where all the answers are good and you have to pick the best. She's a nice person but her class was tough.

The absolute worst teacher at Cleveland state university. Not clear at all. Need help? She's never there as a teacher. She supposed to be here to teach the students what she knows but she expect us to already know the material. Very very very bad . The worst!

I just think that for a class that is so essential to passing, she should have provided 4 class sessions for the students to meet and require the project to be completed in steps. 4 weeks into the semester, have 25% done. 8 weeks, 50%, 12 weeks, 75%, and by week 15, the finished product. Not just conferences.

Dr. Pershey isn't clear but the problem is that she tries to be overly clear. Her classes are confusing and she's very meticulous. You have to really warm up to her teaching style. Her classes aren't bad but they aren't great either.

She assigns a huge amount of work that she insanely believes to be easy & quick to complete. For instance, a 5-pt, 6-pg task that requires hours to complete that she states will only take 15 min. 3-pg. papers require 17 sources (all xeroxed). Tests are subjective-essay type, and graded by whim. You'll spend more time here than any other class.

She does expects participation or at least the attempt rather your answer is right or wrong, she admires it. The class and her discussion was enjoyable. She cares about the students. Tests are fair in regard to difficulty, if you study, it should be pretty easy. If you have to take BIO, pick her class, you will not regret it at all. She is great!

nice person, mediocre teacher. knowledgeable but lectures are kind of scattered. tests seem sloppy, mistakes and typos, poorly worded & confusing questions make it hard to tell what she is asking. whole class did worse on her tests than other two profs because of this. said she's not curving because she believes everyone cheats on online exams...

I came into class thinking she may not be as bad because reviews can be unfair. Extremely disrespectful to students when they ask questions, lectures are messy, over-complicated the material, always went over lecture time, never responded to emails on time. If you cannot explain your knowledge to 1st-year students, do not teach.

Dr. Panther's tests are different then the lecture videos she assigned to us during the pandemic. In addition, she purposely makes the questions on the test confusing and wordy while limiting us to a 30-minute time limit. She does not take responsibility for her poor ability to provide useful notes and blames her students for not be able to "read."

She was very nice and funny! Her lectures were interesting but there is a lot of material in her section, so you will have to study. GO TO THE STUDY SESSIONS! I know some people were struggling by the end but that could be because it was online. She was reasonable and I think if you put the work in, you will do well.
Dr. Shamone is one of the most relatable teachers. She understands but also expects you to be great. As long as you show effort, you will be good! Any questions ? Just ask and shell explain.

There's so much material to be covered in such a short amount of time, it's super unrealistic to believe we can retain that much along with 4 or 5 other classes, during a PANDEMIC. Dr. Gore Panter is very knowledgeable and a good professor. The material is hard, but if you work hard you should be fine. Steer clear if you value your mental sanity. She acts as if her class is the only one you're taking. One of the worst professors I've had. Exceptionally rude and unprofessional. Don't email her for information/concerns because she won't get back to you. This level of difficulty for a 200-level course is incomprehensible, esp. without a curve. She is the definition of never judge a book by its cover. We all thought she was cool at first but she is actually a rude and inconsiderate professor. They all are.

No matter how hard I studied for the exams I felt as if it was impossible to get a A. Luckily I have taken other biology classes so I knew a lot of the material already. She was very rude this whole semester. Almost every class where we met through zoom wasn't about the material. She does extra credit on the tests. The due dates for assignments aren't on a schedule, and most assignments only had a couple of days to complete. I don't recommend.
I can't believe I paid for this class.

For someone who is "always open to feedback from students" they sure do not listen. We are in a pandemic, times are stressful, and everything is 10xs harder. This class is already tough, but this semester it was way worse because of the Short answers and no more curve. The curve makes a difference and many students right now are getting 50s and 60s

She is awful. We all thought she was cool in the beginning but then once we were convinced, she became awful. She was beyond rude to me during office hours to the point I felt uncomfortable. This class was way harder than it should have been. I may have to repeat the course and I am terrified.

Dr. Panter is a very knowledgable, and expects a lot from her students. The course is very test heavy, and all tests are cumulative. Dr. Gore Panter is the most disorganized professor I have had at CSU. Other than being rude when approached for clarification, she regularly is unable to maintain a concise schedule for her students. Even if you put in hours of studying, she likes to add in trick questions to her quizzes. She lacks professionalism, respect, and time management.

Exams are cumulative and you need to put the work in! If you want an easy science class this might not be for you. Expects 9 hours of studying every week. Exams are also proctored. Lenient grader, just do well on your final project and/or the final exam. I had taken a 4 credit graduate class under him- not only I learned something from the class but also it was a cakewalk.

Nice guy. Really wants to help students. However, he has absolutely no rapport with the class. He does not teach. He just stands at the board with his back to the class and solves problem after problem after problem ... Buy a solutions manual and skip the class?

very helpful
So far my favorite professor! She is super nice and will help you with your work if needed. As long as you attend class and actually try you'll get a good grade.
She is a great teacher! She is very helpful in feedback on papers. Usually always a good discussion. She made English enjoyable.
great teacher. can only miss 4 classes. keeps class interesting. id recommend her!

The class was fairly easy but he gives few assignments so you must do well on most of them to pass. The test material isnt covered very well in the lecture videos but it comes straight from the book. Virtual tests are open book/open notes.

He does not tell you how to do any assignments, so it is hard to figure out what the sales exercises and presentation look like. He is an easy grader at least, and he has real world experience. The exams were very easy! Barely any work for this class, which was nice. Join a groupme, that helped me a lot! I suggest taking his class, it's an easy A.

The class was fairly easy but he gives few assignments so you must do well on most of them to pass. The test material isnt covered very well in the lecture videos but it comes straight from the book. Virtual tests are open book/open notes.

Took this remote over the summer and it was easy. 7 HWs lead into a sales presentation that is done over FaceTime. 3 Exams, all multiple choice and straight from lessons. He owns his own store and brings real world experience to the lessons. As long as you do everything on time, you will get an A. I would take him again if he taught other classes.
Easy class but be sure to attend to receive powerpoint handouts. Doesn't use Blackboard so he may not have handouts at other class times. Very easy going and understanding instructor.

He makes class fun, he tells stories when hes lecturing so that the information is easily understood. The class is based on 3 tests, 7 homework assignments, a sales presentation, and attendance. All assignments are easy, and hes not a tough grader at all. The presentation inst bad, you are only talking/ selling to one person, not the whole room.

This man was amazing! I loved his class and he drew experiences from his store into the classroom. He isn't into lecturing as much as story telling and relating to students. That all being said you will have to study to get the grade and put forth the effort to get anywhere. 3 tests and 3 assignments along with attendance grade. That is the just.

Had MKT 450.  He starts work at 10 so we never ran the full class time (scheduled until 9:45).  The last month + a few weeks are presentations which only ran a half hour then we were let out. He takes attendance so its pretty annoying to show up for only a half hour. Nice guy, project is fun, tests are tough
Took him for two classes. Very straightforward and excellent real life examples. He cares about his students. I learned a lot from him

I've had the pleasure of having Paul for two classes this semester and he was great! I was honestly scared to take this class at first because of the big sales project, but he really broke it down and made sure we were prepared for it. He gave many real life examples, which also made understanding the material much simpler.

Great class, actually learn very useful things from a guy who actually owns his own business, even if you need an elective you can easily pass with a C or B as long as you do the easy selling project that is worth half the grade

Fun Prof, goes over everything you'll need to know in class and gives out the power point ahead of time. Attendance is important but if you miss a few days it won't be the end of the world. Make sure to turn in and work on your Marketing project, it's really easy and it's a good part of the grade. Textbook is nice to have but not really needed.
He lectures and they are amazing. Probably one of my favorite professors at Cleveland State. Took him for multiple classes. He likes you to participate so definitely speak up!

Took him for Marketing 411. He expects class participation, however, he is very clear in his grading criteria. If you do your best and prepare for his exams he will meet you half way. Would recommend him to all marketing majors because he cares about his students success.

I'm not even a marketing major but I really enjoyed his class. Definitely read the chapters as they help prepare for his exams; he'll ask a few question pertaining to concepts not always specifically discussed in his powerpoint notes. I highly recommend going to class because his notes are pretty vague and he gives lots of info during lectures.

He is super nice and is a great lecturer. Class is interested even early in the morning. Tests, however, are straight from the book writer. So they can be tricky. He gives you lots of other ways to get points in his class through assignments. Almost one month is spent on student presentations, which is fun. You must go to class!

Great Professor! Make sure you show up to class for the lectures. His exams are more over his lectures then the book. Uses a lot of real life scenarios and his business he owns. You will learn a lot, and tests are somewhat easy. But if you want to know sales, this is the class to take.
Easy going guy explains the material very well. Likes to joke around and knows his students by name. I recommend anyone to take his class.

Professor Gorton was an amazing instructor.  He is such a nice guy and genuinely wants his student to succeed.  He brings in a lot of real world examples to help clarify anything.  He is also hilarious.  Absolutely recommend him.

Paul Gorton is an excellent teacher and keeps class interesting and exciting. Presents the material in a way that is easy for student to understand. Cover material needed for class and then lets the class out instead of dragging out the class. Brings excellent real life experience to his  classes because of his own experiences running a business.

Gorton is a nice guy and a good teacher. His notes can be pretty vague, just terms, not even the definitions really, so use them to get an idea of what you need to study in the book and you'll do fine. He has his own suit store, so he has plenty of retailing experience and gives a lot of real world examples of the material. Definitely recommend

I absolutely loved this class. Previous reviews about her being a bit unorganized are very true, but it always works in your favor. Our assignments were graded very easily and she actually didn't make us do half of the ones on the syllabus. With like 4 extra credit assignments of 10 points (The class was work like 150), there is no way not to pass

Probably the worst class I've ever taken. There's like 9 books to read, her lectures are all over the place (totally online bc COVID), grades everyone different, very disorganized, and all over the place. The class is also under ENG 547, but the class is boring. She requires you to participate and will pull you to the side if she notices that you don't. Never replies to emails, yet wants you to email her if you're going to miss class. A lot of class discussions that tend to be all over the place. Try to avoid taking this class with her.

She's nice, but very unorganized. Whatever you do, do not argue with her opinions. We had a class argument about not being able to use ANY adjectives that could have negative connotations. This bleeds into class material. Just show up and be nice to her. Expect deadlines to change on the fly and new assignments to pop out of the blue

My absolute favorite class! Loved everything about Ms. Gosselin! yes she doesn't always follow the syllabus, however if you show up to the classes you or your parents are paying for then you have no real reason to complain about this class. She is very caring and understanding if you communicate with her. I would take her, 10xs and then some!

Prof. Gosselin is one of the nicest professors. A little unorganized, but you figure it out. Be prepared to learn a lot about African American history and culture. She is an easy grader and African American literature is one of the easiest classes you can take at CSU.
Most unorganized, horrible class ever taken. Always late and nothing is clear. The syllabus is not followed and you have to agree with her political opinions or you will not pass.
Nothing to say.

Most of the texts can be found online or in the library. I stopped reading after midterms and still received an A in the class. Be nice to her, participate in class, and she'll like you. I didn't learn anything, but it's required for the ENG major so good luck. She teaches most of the Intro to Drama classes. Absolutely terrible, but easy class.

She is very scatterbrained, and constantly changes the syllabus. She has a hard time understanding things which frustrates her. You have like 8 books you need for this class, and you must read them all. There is a midterm paper, final project, and blackboard discussion for grades. Keep up on the work.

Professor Gosselin is a wonderful professor. I took this course for a gen ed, and as a minor elective. It takes some time to adjust to her style of teaching, but once you do, she is awesome! She is a little bit of an airhead, but she is very intelligent and caring towards her students. I would absolutely recommend taking a course with her.

The class is very unorganized and youre going to need to lean on your classmates for clarification. I explained how difficult a book we were reading in class is and she responded with this is book not for dummies. I felt very discouraged

She is an awful professor. She is never clear in any of her assignments, she's very forgetful and VERY disorganized. If you ask questions that you don't understand, she makes you feel stupid and like you shouldn't even be in school. She'll answer the question but she'll answer with shock because she thinks everyone already knows all the info. AVOID

Do not take any courses offered by this professor. I took an online course with her and she did not respond to emails, her syllabus did not match her reading assignments, and she would get offended if a student asked an honest question. Worst class I have taken, and Professor Gosselin is a terrible teacher. Her course was very unstructured.

You need to be VERY into the subject matter of the class in order to enjoy it. She is very knowledgeable on the topics she teaches but can be difficult to understand if you just took the class for an easy A. Participating helps TREMENDOUSLY but you gotta know what you are talking about. Her classes are highly opinion oriented on social issues.

If you're needing a class to fill in one of your electives take this class. Yes the teacher is a bit all over the place and crazy but don't let that keep you from taking this class. She is laid back so it makes the class a little easier. She is passionate about what she teaches so class might take a little longer.  Class is fun and interesting!

While some of these other rating have some merit, they are over dramatic. This class was easy if you can read and write. The syllabus clearly states every reading assignment due for the entire year, and if you keep up with the reading then the papers are easy. Her class is all over the place, but its an easy English class and you will learn a lot.

Very unclear with assignments, very disrespectful when anyone in the class would ask questions about the homework, the final, or even if we asked for a guideline for the group project that had nothing to do with the class. Please, save yourself a headache and do not take her.

You will read. A lot. And it's not fun. She'll rant and rave the entire class and confuse everyone. You'll have a few papers, but she refuses to tell you what on. Just write something appropriately. It's stressful but she's very lenient on grading.  I wouldn't recommend this prof to anyone.

This was the worst teacher I had ever had in my college career. She was highly disorganized and the class was just plain chaotic. Angry I wasted my time
Laidback class must attend pretty much every class tons of field trips very casual
Laidback class must attend pretty much every class tons of field trips very casual

Prof. Gotlieb teaches you about Planning & Zoning, Cleveland History, Urban Planning & Real Estate Development. Hes so awesome 10/10 recommend for a super fun adventurous class. Interesting material and cool field trips. He gives extra credit and wants his students to succeed. A very laid back class but attendance and effort is mandatory. If you do your work and participate you should receive an A.

Professor Gotlieb is upfront about the class, how he grades, and what is required. If you come to Lecture, and attend Field Trips you will pass. He is extremely caring and also Hilarious. Andrew is a great professor and makes the lectures and field trips very enjoyable. Sometimes he is a little disorganized and you don't always know what you're doing each week but it always ends up working out . Would definitely take the class again.
Great class! Professor is knowledgable and makes the class fun.
Class was an easy A. A bit unorganized but the field trips were fun

Professor Gotlieb is probably one of the best professors I have ever had. He is straight forward with his grading criteria and loves to make the learning environment fun. This Man; wow it is complex to articulate the mysticism of this class. Quite an extraordinary teacher, with wisdom of Cleveland that far surpasses any average joe.
such a great professor. he did a wonderful job helping people and teaching. 10/10 would recommend
THE Professor Andrew Gotlieb is probably going to be the best Professor you ever have. Show up to class and do the work and youll pass. 11/10.
Straight G, only the real onez kno

Professor Andrew Gotlieb is literally the G.O.A.T. Not only is he a fun professor who cares about what he does, but the field trips we go on are pretty fun as well. Take this class to explore Cleveland and have fun, and its an easy science credit that is better than anything else you'd have to take.

Professor Gotlieb, does a great job teaching if you care about the class and show interest he will help make sure you succeed. Fascinating, Knowledgeable, Amazing.

Latin American Politics class, 1997--Dr. Govea is fun, interesting, fair, and clear. And cool as heck.

If you are trying to understand Ethics and pass take this professor. She is the best, she is willing to help you with any question or problems you might face or have. This class is based on group work and there is about 5 modules and 3 exams . Show up participate and do your work you and you will have an A.

Professor Gracyk was the best teacher I had this semester. Her class is engaging and she makes lecture interesting. If you show up and pay attention, easy A

She is an amazing professor! There are 5 mods ( 1 personal quiz per mod) + group quiz. The class is team based, you will be put with a group to workout healthcare scenarios throughout the entire semester. 1 Midterm and final. A fun atmosphere that teaches you what you need to know.
group based course makes this class so much more enjoyable. you dont have to sit through a lecture and the content is a lot easier to understand this way.

Can use textbook in library for this course. No need to buy the book. Only technically need to be in class on exam/quiz days (peer evaluations though and group members may dock points if you dont show up). You get to have page, front and back, cheat sheets so that is really nice. Theres a bit of reading but nothing too bad.

group based class, but there's no work outside of class, just reading. really interesting for a philosophy class, be prepared for really good discussion. Prof. Gracyk is so awesome, shes really understanding about any problems you may have and is willing to talk outside of class if anything is unclear.

On the first day, she separates the class into groups of 5 usually based on specific questions she asks, then that's your group for the rest of the semester. Gives you one sheet of notes per each quiz and exam. Literally the only professor that can actually teach you material that you will never forget. It's an easy A if you pay attention in class.

She separates you into committees on day 1 and you really get to know your group and work with her and them every day. Bioethics was an amazing class and changed my perspective on many issues. Awful.

Professor Grafton is great at what she does. The content she teaches is going to be crucial to my career as a doctor. She is tough on her students but this is to better prepare them for what is to come. All in all, Professor Grafton is a great teacher and mentor.

Ms Grafton is the perfect Professor to teach this course. She is able to approach challenging topics in class that encourages class discussion. She is not good at teaching. Her course content is shallow, uninformative and unoriginal. Very fair, enthusiastic, and accommodating. She really does her best to help each student achieve a good grade.
Awesome teacher! Take her whenever possible. She grades easily and is very helpful and sweet.

Overall pretty good teacher. As long as you do her work, rough drafts included, the class is pretty smooth sailing. She didn't give any tests, but the papers' weren't very spaced out. But she makes the class pretty workable, especially with her odd sense of humor. Would recommend!
Don't be late. Be ready for over kill assignments and to be self taught! Very lame class.

Just took the 6wk accelerated online course. Self taught. Group case studies due once or twice a week, 3 pgs each. Midterm and final were case studies that you had to do on your own, ten pgs each. Ch summaries due weekly, 1 pg each. However,discussion posts are biggest chunk of your grade. My advice is POST DAILY. Post daily and you will get an A.

Without question one of the best professors in the online MBA program.   He responds to students quickly and works with you if you are having trouble.  The amount of work he assigns can at times be overwhelming, but he grades reasonably if it appears that you put the time in.  Great professor, but expect a ton of work in his classes.

Really great professor. Had a few marketing classes with him. Discussions were always helpful and he would chime in a lot. He made me appreciate marketing much more! I would love to take more of his classes
Great Professor.  Have had a couple online classes with him and has great interaction.  Learned a lot.

This was my second on-line course with this professor.  I highly recommend him for anyone taking a marketing course.  He replies quickly to any questions and uses the grade book for constructive feedback.  The syllabus is clear and easy to follow.

Highly recommend taking a course from this professor.  Dr. Granot provides an extremely clear and concise syllabus to follow.  This was an on-line course but he is able to form team work through introductions and group discussions.  Follow the syllabus; keep up with the reading and meet the deadlines and you will do well in this course.

Had his online class. Wow! Really packs in the info and gives a lot of assignments. But, I have learned so much about marketing and the way he treats students is the best. By far the best professor in the business school.

He is a decent guy to take a class with. I had taken an online class, so had no face to face interaction but all the interaction that we had over the email was prompt. It was like working on our own as online classes are. 50% of the grade was based on discussions, 40% on essays and 10% on quizzes which were very tough. He is an easy grader though.

He is fun to work with- gives nice constructive comments to improve your performance, easy grader but assigns a fair share of work. Very tech savvy, so unlike most profs is very quick to respond to your queries via emails. Better than most Marketing Profs in the Department.

I highly recommend this professor for Marketing. He has a wealth of knowledge and experience in this field. His expertise is in marketing luxury goods, which makes the class very interesting. He will make you work hard, but you learn a lot. He is also more than fair when grading assignments.

Good professor, hard work is a must in her class because of the difficulty of the tests. Know all of the material and be prepared to explain it in detail. She is unorganized but overall a good professor.
Extremely helpful, nice professor! Although I did not like the software used for this class, she was very considerate of the software issues. She is an easy grader.

Being from accounting major I did not have much knowledge of the technologies prior to this course. Learnt a lot in this class. Her exams are hard but as long as you pay attention in the class and follow the study guide, you will do fine. She was very helpful and provided feedback when I got stuck in the project. Very polite. Overall good teacher.

She teaches directly out of the book and uses PowerPoint slides directly from the publishing company.  I got a A easily, and anyone else should, as well.  Listen to the lectures, and study by the study guides, and you'll do well.

dont take her avoid her if u can its not worth the headache she takes easy concepts and turns it into rocket science and she's not an easy grader it's like she has a weird fetish for subtracting points

She reads off a power point do not take this in class avoid her if you can she is not good she might be a nice person but she's not a good professor/ teacher. A lot of HW and a HUGE group project with little to no real information about what to do precisely. The test are very hard. A lot of essay questions and she grades very tough& a 1 HR time cap

Her test.... Are awful and when I say awful I mean awful here's why. First and foremost its on 4 chapters of looooong texts and she expects you to know all of it worst part is she literally just smiles when u give her feedback on her awful test when the class average is 25/50 is a problem the course itself shouldn't be that hard she makes it hard

This was the easiest class I had in my entire MBA coursework. The instructor is a gem of a person. Being a part time instructor and working full time in the real world, he brought loads of practical examples to the class and made it a real learning experience than a traditional full time instructor would have. Take this class, no matter what!

she is also a professor at lakeland community college. Currently taking her Business stats 2 class. DO NOT TAKE HER!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! She refuses to help you, she expect a lot and doesn't care how long it takes to do the work. She expects 9 to 15 hours a week on her class alone!! Be prepared for a ridiculous term project too!  100 points.

She was great. She went over many code examples during class, and was available for questions. She made all code examples and assignments available via her website, which made it very easy to follow along. She did move very quickly through the course but ramped up the difficulty pretty well.  I would take her again for any Java course.

I can only assume Gray posted those glowing comments about himself. This man is a joke. He NEVER responded to students in his online class; many posted ON THE CLASS WEBSITE about how impossible it was to reach him. His syllabus was a disorganized mess. He let his on-campus students out HOURS early every class. He does not take teaching seriously.
He was very helpful! I will recommend others to take his classes!

I always recommend Dr. Gray to everyone. He is an AMAZNG professor. He is extremely knowledgable about many aspects of education as he has worked in a variety of positions in the field. He is funny, charismatic, and engaging. I wish I could take another class with him! Highly recommended!

Super laid back and super cool. Dr. Gray really knows his stuff from a real world perspective, he has been a teacher, superintendent, principal, you name it! A bit of writing but if you put in the work you will be rewarded. Great Prof.
GREAT teacher...if you must take this class, try and take it with Mr. Gray. Although there is a bit of writing, if you DO it, you should get an A. He's so helpful and sincerely enjoys his job!
If you show up and do the work, there is no reason not to get an A. He is very fair, and while there is a decent amount of writing, as long as you follow innstructions, you'll do well.
Great teacher!  Extremely helpful and takes the time to answer your questions.
Great teacher!  Always willing to help and answer questions.

The professors personal ability to teach is lacking in that I asked her for help multiple times and she referred me to the tutoring center instead of helping me directly. Sends very rude emails at times when you ask questions about class or grades. Is a harsh grader. Wont allow you access to correct answers on exams/quiz after your exam is graded

Dr. G is a great person and is very funny, which makes her class enjoyable. I do feel that she can be a hard grader, but that is to be expected in a grammar class, I presume. Keep on top of her assignments and you'll do well. She prepares you with due dates far in advance.

Dr. G is one of the best profs I've ever had! She's very caring toward her students, especially if you participate and get to know her. She really wants you to pass, offering extra credit opportunities. She does give pop quizzes at times when attendance is low, so I recommend going as much as possible. Enjoyable class and great prof!
Lots of writing but gives good feedback.

Very knowledgable about subject - her favorite Morphology & Syntax. Makes it understandable. Not only approachable and accessible during office hours, but comes in on her day off for extra practice sessions too. Really wants to help you comprehend and succeed.

Dr. Grebenyova is so incredibly passionate about her field. Shes a great professor, and genuinely cares about her students. She goes above and beyond to help all of her students, and Im excited to take more classes with her.

She is very rude and spiteful. Worst professor I've ever had which was really disappointing because the class material was interesting. I did not even feel comfortable going to class because she calls students out for nothing.

Shes a legend. Even if you dont need the class take it, just because shes great. All the quizzes are graded for participation and we go over it so you can fix it up. Very easy, great class and exams are very simple too. Plus, shes hilarious, take the class. Easy pass.
A great professor who really knows and is passionate about her field. I was dreading grammar and found that she actually made it interesting. I am looking forward to more classes with her.

I've taken 6 classes with Dr. G and I've loved them all. I feel like I've accomplished something after completing each of her courses. Although phonology is not her main course of study, she still did a great job. Reasonable amount of work, assignments were helpful, and she was considerate and fair. I will miss her when I graduate!

Dr. G is a really great professor. Really knowledgeable about the field of linguistics. She really encourages students to come to her office hours. Tests are pretty easy as long as you show up to class regularly. From what I could tell with my class everyone seemed to like her, the students that didn't like her class just didn't like linguistics.
Love to take Dr. G's classes. She has a true passion for language and linguistics that is always apparent in her teaching style and lectures. I will definitely miss her when I graduate!

Dr. Greb is very knowledgable and judging by my classmates reactions you either love her and her teaching style or you don't. I really enjoyed my classes with her and learned a lot. There is effort involved but as long as you pay attention and take notes, you should be fine. She is always willing to help and answer questions.

Overall a good professor. Fairly laid back. She loves English Grammar and is extremely knowledgeable and passionate about what she is teaching. Class is of average difficulty. A mid-term, final, paper, 6 homework assignments, and attendance grade. She's also witty and funny, and made our grammar class fun.

Extremely helpful but can be difficult. Her large classes are much easier all tests multiple choice but you learn more in the smaller ones never multiple choice. Only major problems is she gets sidetracked and will focus on one point for too long to make sure students understand leaving not enough time for the other material.

It depends which class you have with her, but this professor is overall useless. She gives very vague directions and then grades harshly and spends most of her time in class going off subject. She's looking to get published, and she will pressure and shame you into sharing your work with her so she can submit it. Stay far away from this one.

The worst teacher I have ever had at JCU. He doesn't know how to teach and just reads the slides word for word. If you ask questions he makes you feel stupid. He also won't print out the slides so you have to keep up. I would not recommend him at all.

One of the laziest people I have ever met. His classes are strictly him reading off his slides. He doesn't teach you anything so if you actually want to have an idea of what he's talking about, you'll have to read the book. You're basically your own teacher. Doesn't share power points and goes through them really fast. Gives some extra credit tho

Professor Green is one of the worst professors I've ever had. He refuses to use blackboard but during class makes you copy down his slides word for word. Gives study guides that have nothing on the test. Unfair grading and does not know how to teach! Would NOT recommend!
Really enjoys the subject she teaches. She has good stories (not super entertaining but relevant). The tests weren't hard and there was very little other work.

Diane is great! I had her for my lab TA and she is a pretty tough grader but she goes over every detail during lab so its almost impossible not to get a good grade. She loves her job and shes pretty funny. She really takes the time to help you understand!
Awesome teacher, as long as you show respect she is respectful back.

He is very understanding and easy for grading. Class is based off of group projects and participation. Students re-verse teach the course through PowerPoint presentations. Show up to class and turn material in on time and you will get an A.

Prof. Gregorich is an amazing professor, REALLY taught me the art of Health IT, and inspired me to want to go into that field once I graduate.  I got a pretty easy A, so I KNOW anyone else cold easily, too.

I LOVED his IST 352 class.  I found out I REALLY like Health IT, and would like to pursue a career in that field.  Prof. Gregorich made the topics interesting, and didn't just preach out of a book, he uses practical knowledge from a career of being an IT professional, and gives good hands-on knowledge to the students.

Prof. D'Alessio is extremely well-educated. He definitely knows what he's talking about. He seems kind of intimidating and is a really, really tough grader. You need to study A LOT if you want to pass his tests. He grades in comparison to other people in the class. You learn a lot in this class and it was really interesting material!
Don't make him angry.  He will throw paper at you.
Do not make him angry.  He will throw paper at you.
Another great composer, and very educated when it comes to analyzing music. Fun to be around, and intelligent to boot
very funny and makes things interesting--ties in all sorts of nonmusical stuff--for laughs and lernin.  possibly the best teacher ive had at csu

Professor D'Alessio is boring and has a very dry sense of humor.  He is unprepared with his presentations and wastes a lot of time attempting to use the internet.  This is probably the worst class I took at CSU.  Hi exams and quizzes are difficult.  The class is a waste of time and completely useless.
He is a great professor. The class material is pretty dry and rather boring, yet he finds a way to make it interesting and fun. He really has a passion for music and it shows.

I have Professor D'Alessio for one of my music classes.  He is knowledgeable on the subject at hand, comes to class prepares, and uses technology to make the class as interesting as possible.  I definitely suggest taking one of his classes.
No Comments

D'Alessio is somewhat entertaining in class and gives really good notes to the students which is helpful. I didn't have to study too much to understand. He will always answer any questions you have. I definitely learned a lot though it wasn't my favorite class.

Amy Gress is very knowledgeable in the field of supply chain management. She encourages you to network via LinkedIn for career opportunities. She is well known in operations management and teaches real world situations instead of academic. She is worth the waiting list. Learn from her and apply it.
Go to class for attendance points. Tests are right off the power points. Quizzes are open book, open note, open laptop! Just the quizzes! Class can be dry at times but its very helpful!
Great teacher. Easy to understand lectures. Quizzes and tests based on Powerpoints and a little bit on lecture. One group report and group presentation.
Amazing professor. Attend class you will be fine. Before her exams she will give you a review on what will be on the test. Study the ppt's and you will pass.

He grades test fair. Is wonderful explaining and breaking down material. He engages the class.Is well prepared with his material, and is passionate about psychology. He by far was the best teacher I have ever had at CSU. Highly recommended.

Dr. Gridley is one of the best professors you will ever have!  If you are looking to learn, sign up for all his classes.  If you are looking for an easy A, I feel sorry for you.  I learned more from Dr. Gridley than any other teacher I have ever had in my life.  He's simply awesome!!

Teacher is wonderful by far the best teacher I have had at CSU. The teacher made the material more than clear and the test were an accurate representation of the material covered. I highly suggest this instructor if you want to learn psychology.

I was so lost in this class. Unless you are a pre-med major, you will not understand a word he is saying. He assumes that everyone has a strong biology/chemistry background and will not explain his so called 'basics' twice. Thankfully he has a large curve, so my F actually turned out to be a B!
She'll make u LOL and is pretty cool

Mr. Griffin was exceptionally organized on blackboard. There were rubrics posted for each assignment and although the grading was tough, there was feedback given on how to make each assignment better. I loved being in the field for my first education course so I enjoyed making the he connection but tween theory and practice.

Horrible class. The field component was awful. Lack of communication, canceled class a lot, the final was extremely hard, learned nothing, just an awful class. Do not expect to learn anything from this class.

The professor was really into the material which helped me figure out who I was becoming as a student candidate. I particularly liked the lab approach. Keeping track of the assignments was confusion at first because this was a hybrid class but once I knew where to look, blackboard or the syllabus, it was easy. Wish the teaching assign was longer.

Not sure what the bad ratings are all about, I really enjoyed this class. Easy A if you do the work. 3 papers, a short teaching lesson, and 2 discussion boards a week. The class is about developing your own teaching philosophy but he gave positive, helpful feedback. Enjoyed the class overall.

Most confusing class I have ever taken. He gives almost no guidance and is very though when grading. You are on your own! Good luck learning anything that will help you with your career in the future. Well, good luck learning anything at all from him.

One of the easiest classes I ever took, other than two papers and a presentation there was hardly any work. He was constantly making assignments easier or getting rid of them altogether (ex- changing a 40 minute presentation to 10 minutes). His assignments were sometimes confusing but he was helpful when I talked to him.
