this was a hybrid class half online half in class but there were more days online than in class. when online days there was nothing to do but read test book. this class should have been very easy but because he did not explain the papers and you are left on your own too much it was very confusing. i ended up giving up i plan on retaking the class

Best psychology teacher at CSU! Yes, the courses are difficult but they are designed to prepare you for the world. I found Dr. Grilly's course extremely valuable and my only wish is that the course was split into two sections. There is much to learn from him.

wow... cool guy but good lord the class is hard.  it is difficult to follow along even if you go to class because of his extreme intelligence leading to difficulties explaining the info. to ppl not as inteligent.  He offers many curves but still do not expect an easy A, or study hard and maybe get a C+ or B unless your really smart
Nice guy... Horrible class. Terribly difficult. I should've dropped and just lost the money...

Dont take this class unless youre ready to devote your life to it. He's very, very tough and is not good at communicating the information. 4 hard multiple choice tests, 1 15 page paper. Very hard material though, and his study guides dont help. You need to know literally every detail!
Dr. Grill is very knowledgeable about the material (Psychopharmacology), but the class is not for everyone.  Exams are hard.

This class is rumored to be very difficult, but Dr. Grilly makes it interesting. As long as you keep up with the material, you should earn an A.  He tells good stories (ask him about his research with the chimps!)

EASY A!  I never showed up to class and I got an A.  You can study directly from the book and he offers a TON of extra credit.  Most of his extra credit will take you 3 minutes to complete and at the end of the semester I had almost 30 extra credit points.  RECOMMENDED!
Easy A if you go to class and read the book
I agree with the shirt comment, tests are not hard if you come to class and read the book, would take from him again
Very hard tests.  Speaks quickly and jumps around.  Somewhat interesting, but for 2 hours it got really boring.  I suggest someone else.
Two words: Hawaiian Shirts
HARD TESTS!

As long as you read your book you'll be fine on the tests. He'll tell you that half the test is on info he goes over in class to try and get you to go, but there is so much overlapping of material that it really doesnt matter.
very boring and tests are hard!
No Comments
No Comments
Definitely not what I was expecting after reading the comment. Tough grader and not the nicest either.

Fairly simple, straight forward class.  Quite a bit of writing in this class.  Writing assignments and presentations are primary grades.  Focus is business communication.  Attend class, complete the work and you will get an A.
Nice teacher, workload would be okay had it been spaced properly. Work is due often and is usually hard. Otherwise effort and tears will mean an A.

Im surprised to see the results on her are as good as they are. Going into her class I though it'd be an easy A for sure but after going through it I barely came out with a C. Might be just me, but her class had a lot of tedious projects and is more or less a waste of time. Didn't learn anything and it wasn't as easy as the rest say.

This is a basic course about business writing and communication. It is mostly common sense. it should have been a one unit class. Class lectures are boring but she really makes an effort to make it interesting.

Mostly busy work but if you listen in there are some pretty interesting things to pick up. A lot of what she teaches are mistakes that people will continue to make in business communications, even after taking her course and getting an A.
Boring!  I'm falling asleep thinking about it!

Takes attendance most of the time. Every assignment is a small fraction of your grade - i.e. midterm test worth 15% of grade. Emails notes before class - which makes class time boring. Hardly used book. Easy assignments and gives you lots of help. Overall easy class. GPA booster. Nice lady.

The class is boring as hell and i doubt the book is really needed. Its pretty much english in the business sense. The class is very easy though, very basic, presentations are the only problem I had with it
Boring class, but a nice teacher. I sat by the window so I could have something to look at...otherwise I'd have been asleep the whole time.
BEST teacher ever!!! She gives you the answers to all the tests the class b4!!! Grades easy!!!!
Very easy teacher. Im a horrible student, I never went to class and still got an easy A. If I were you I wouldnt even buy the book, just take notes if you want, most of the stuff is common sense.
Totally easy class. Tests and homework are easy. % writing assignments that are less then a page and one 7-10 minute presentation. Take it with her for the easy A.

Not helpful and unavailable. Treats students as though we are in middle school. Very disrespectful and stuck in her own mindset. Quizzes are good because they're just taken from the internet and the final is based on quizzes.  You do not need the book.
Lazy professor.  Not willing to help.  If you needed guidance, she made you feel like you were a burden and an inconvenience.  The only upside to the class was the final was based on prior quizzes.
Education Research...An interesting and good teacher...Shared personal insights and stories.  Fair on grading assignments. I would enjoy a class with her again.

Professor Grooms is quite literally the nicest, most understanding and caring professor that I have had in my 4 years at CSU. She is so accommodating and inspirational, really making sure that her main goal is for her students to learn and succeed. I would highly recommend.

Professor Grooms is quite literally the nicest, most understanding and caring professor that I have had in my 4 years at CSU. She is so accommodating and inspirational, really making sure that her main goal is for her students to learn and succeed. I would highly recommend.
Worst prof in csu history. Rude doesn't teach at all.

The class grading is split up from an individual presentation, midterm, group presentation, group paper, and final. Go to class. He believes that class is like work, you must show up.  People say he's rude, hard, etc. If you do the work, show up for class, and listen you will be fine. His lectures are different, and you will use it down the road.
You won't know how to take notes or which of the 3 books to study if any.  Grades attendance, 2 tests, and 2 oral presentations; one solo and one with group.  He is unpleasant.  Just don't take him.

Take the advise of this forum and DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS!!! He does not teach. There were A LOT of video tapes, and oral presentations by the students. When the class started there were about 40 people in it, the next section, there were 20. Don't make the same mistake I did... DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS!!

Went to one class at the beginning of the semester. Disliked him immediately (I don't out-and-out dislike profs). Rambled on and on and talked about how other countres are better than the US. Dropped the class and switched to an online section -- very glad I did.

unreasonable in regards to grad students professional outside lives.  unclear. rude. make completely inappropriate comments to students in front of classmates.  gives no clear instructions, gives notes completely in abbreviations(i know?), and uses the class as a forum to talk about himself

Hostile environment, non-constructive comments, has alot to offer (knowledge), but fails one of the 4 P's.  Don't bother studying the book, he won't ask anything specifically from it.  Bitter individual, communicates in parent to child format, not approachable.  Most students in class after finals are just glad to be done with him. Avoid
unresonable

Had Prof Gross for Int'l MKT- a lot is expected of the student (knowledge of foreign cultures, geography, etc) becore it is taught to them.  He has lowered my interest in this course significantly.  Tough (picky) grader- his way or the highway.  Attitude resembles a bitter old man always trying to prove himself, constantly giving his resume.

I can't believe he makes this elective class so difficult. He talks in circle so you really don't know what to study. Yes, he goes through the book but nothing on the test is directly related. Pay attention to the videos in class, outdated by you will be tested on it. Not a tough grader but expects a lot of little details.
Had Dr. Gross for EMBA trip and class. He does not teach! He only uses this forum to talk about himself and vague ideas not relating to the class. He needs to retire. Avoid him at all costs.

DONT TAKE THIS CLASS- this guy is on a head trip. don't bother asking him questions - you just get circular "answers" from him... guidlines are vague and he grades as if you are a grad student .. he very frequently forgets this is an undergrad ELECTIVE class...
Not the best teacher. He expects you do to ALOT! He talks about topics not related to the class. Be prepared to do projects and presentations... Good luck!

Never been in a class where a professor can be this worse. Worst prof. i have ever seen. doesnt give directions, if questions asked, he will ridicule you. try avoiding this prof. becoz you wont learn anything...most of the class he talks about his country (Hungary).

He is very unclear on the presentation guidelines.  He doesn't teach, he just criticizes everyone.  Everything I learned from the class I learned on my own from the text.  I would avoid him at all costs.

Dr. Gross is extremely vague, gives no guidelines, then gets mad when you do not do your projects the way he wants them. I considered dropping out of grad school because of this class, it was that bad. Avoid at all costs! Also, he abuses the small amount of power he has.
tough, no standard answer in exam
No Comments
He was a nice teacher and taught everything in the book. Exams have essays in them but as long as you touch the crucial points you will be OK. Had very cool guest speakers.

Very tough teacher. Unstructured course. Course based on group term paper and presentation. Ridicules students in front of the class. Doesn't care how hard you worked on your project, if it's not exactly what he wants you won't get a good grade. Midterm and Final Exam are composed of 6 essay questions. No curve. I'd avoid this class and teacher.
Miss Gross was very understanding and helpful.  She was very instumental inspiring me to want to give her much, much more, all day, everyday.
She is a great instructor. A bit softspoken and at times awkward but she knows what she's talking about. Very clear on assignments and material. Can't go wrong with her.
She puts the Teach in Teacher! I am so Glad I took her class! I wouldn't have missed it for the world! Thank You Clare Gross, your what a Professor should be!

This is a Professor who Actually knows how to Teach! She is a rare Gem! When you finish her class you will have learned a lot! You will be able to use this information all of your life! You definitely will get your money's worth out of her class, and it will be well worth your time and effort and energy. I Highly recomend her!

She is one of the Best Professors at C.S.U. she may be hard [by that I mean you had to do a lot of work] however she grades fair. She is Professional. She is soft spoken, that's important to me. She is reasonable, fair and her class was fun! Loved this Professor, I can't think of Any Professor who is any better. She's Great! I really, enjoyed it!

The only way I can describe the online course is an organized mess. The free online textbook is really just a bunch of links to articles and videos that don't really tell you what to focus on. Then the exam comes around and you are given a very vague study guide. The class is time consuming and confusing, but you can do well if you find shortcuts.

The only way I can describe the online course is an organized mess. The free online textbook is really just a bunch of links to articles and videos that don't really tell you what to focus on. Then the exam comes around and you are given a very vague study guide. The class is time consuming and confusing, but you can do well if you find shortcuts.
Multiple random in class discussions that are worth points. Show up to class in order to get points for discussions.

Professor Grossetti is so gentle, kind, and always tries to accommodate her students. Shes here for you and you can tell she cares, she has a passion for teaching and art. I really enjoyed her class and will miss her thoughtful, insightful voice!

This class is a breeze. Jeanne is very nice and sweet. The class is simple and straightforward. Tests are easy as long as you study the information about the art. Don't bother buying the textbooks unless you are seriously interested in African art and actually plan on doing the readings. Plenty of extra credit opportunties.
prof. grossetti is the best teacher i will ever have. she teaches very well and clear. she gives opportunity for assignments redo, and she is very caring and understanding.

This class is a breeze, sign your name in each class and you basically pass. Wish she would have cared more about teaching us interesting topics instead of making us remember the names, dates, and materials of over 50 art pieces. When will I ever need that in life? Don't bother buying textbook, everything in the textbook is uploaded to blackboard.
This was a great class, but I've heard he does not teach it anymore. I wish you all the best, professor Grozav, you helped me change my life!

Love This Guy, he wants his students to pass his class he really does. You have to work hard to make A good grade. Going to class is a must, read the book also, look over practice questions and ask questions, when you dont understand something DONT BE SCARED! His test are hard but his extra credit assignments make up for them and he curves good!

Dr. Grozav is really intelligent and passionate about Chemistry. Overall, this was not an easy course, but Dr. Grozav was willing to work with the students and provide every opportunity for them to do well in the class. He is also very understanding.

I can't begin to even explain my disappointment. He literally sets his students up for failure. He can't teach entry level classes, he expects everyone to be on his genius level. The tests have nothing to do with the material. I advice you not to take him if you want an A. Very very hard.

He's as good as OChem teachers get, I think. He's secretly a very nice guy, but you won't get that vibe in class. I would opt out of the two-hour lecture section if you can, but I think he does well. He's just very very very smart and doesn't always realize that we're not all as smart as him. He's also rather adorable with his Romanian accent.

Tough class, but I loved it. I had the chance to learn organic chemistry, I worked hard and got an A that I'm proud of. The instructor was very helpful and the exams had questions very similar to provided samples. I highly recommend him if you are committed to study. If not, take the online course.

He's an alright lecturer if you pay attention. However he did not do a good job with the pace of the course. way to much time on nomenclature and basically none on predicting reactants, which was most of ACS. Expect to work your butt off. There is no such thing as practice examples in class.

He may seem intimidating at first, however it's difficult material and he does his best to teach it. He is very helpful if you make the attempt to ask him. It's not an easy A and that's for sure, but he gives you every opportunity to do well. You just have to take those opportunities presented.

He makes OChm lectures fun, something I did not think was humanly possible.  Excellent explanations. A bit too much detail for this level so we rushed at the end to cover everything.  Hard tests.  The ACS was easy in comparison... we were well prepared.  Gives his students a chance to succeed but not patient with ppl who don't get it.
Great instructor, very knowledgeable. Exams are a bit tough, but there are plenty of bonus points.
His lectures were extremely useful for me and I have learned a lot. I totally recommend him.
His lectures aren't too helpful but he gives out so many bonus points to make up for his hard exams
He's a great guy. He's unintentionally funny and makes communist jokes since he's russian.  His class is by no means easy, but his slides and the OWL homework is very helpful.

Got an exam yesterday, so I'm on intense impressions. He has great slides, with detailed demonstrations. He doesn't do many applications but owl helps and he insists a lot to go through it. Exams are not easy, but you get multiple chances. He's available if you need his help and he understands you if you have personal problems. A good teacher.

I love the guy. He does a great job on explaining concepts giving you a good chance to improve. Nevertheless, there are always students that want a grade without work. They will always hate this class.

Great guy! So funny. His class requires actual work though, you can't just get by on going to lecture: read the book! I have previous 262 experience, but for those who don't, you may not want to take him. He curves a lot, but he thinks everyone easily understands chemistry concepts, when a lot of people don't, which leads to confusion.
Worst professor ever. Explains equations with word of mouth instead of doing them on the board. Terrible
For me this was a great teacher. In his office hours, he has helped me a lot with preparing my MCAT examination and I am indebted to Prof Grozav for this. Thank you for everything.
My grade for this teacher: A+++++

This is a great instructor. He is smart and funny. Indeed, his exams are not easy, but this is academia. I wouldn't like to be handed an A, I like to earn it. By the way, he has helped me tremendously with my application for medical school and yes, I got in.
Amazing teacher. She was so kind and knowledgeable about content. Passionate about what she does and cared so much about her students. Highly recommend! If you do your work, you will get an A
Amazing teacher. She was so kind and knowledgeable about content. Passionate about what she does and cared so much about her students. Highly recommend! If you do your work, you will get an A
She work really hard to provide the best instruction for the class. She is always available and is ready to help. She works hard to encourage group work and facilitate conversation in Spanish.

I'm really surprised by all the hate for Dr. Gubkin on here. He for sure wants you to figure stuff out on your own but sets you up for it very well. He's really nice and helpful but definitely wants you to be the one to arrive at the results. This is really what doing math is about. I learned so much from him this semester.
This class was based on standards so there were no tests or homework. The standards were difficult but he was always available for help. The lectures were confusing.

I'm really surprised by all the hate for Dr. Gubkin on here. He for sure wants you to figure stuff out on your own but sets you up for it very well. He's really nice and helpful but definitely wants you to be the one to arrive at the results. This is really what doing math is about. I learned so much from him this semester.
I had Dr. Gubkin for two semesters. Made me feel like I'm not smart at all despite working very hard in the class. If you can avoid him, please do.

Petty and very rude. Worked hard throughout the entire semester and tried my best. when reviewing my answers I noticed I had the answer correct but math was different from his way, continued to mark it wrong and didn't care. I was taught that there are many different ways to do math. VERY unprofessional. HIGHLY DONT recommend
As someone that registered for Cal II, I highly discourage anyone from taking this class. The content was not even hard, but he made it harder for no reason.

Dr. Gubkin is a nice guy, but his major flaw is that his lectures are well above the comprehension level of the average student, as he does not "dumb it down" and expects everyone to know what he's talking about. Even his notes are difficult to understand. Consider taking advantage of the math learning center if you wish to do well in his class.

His class is very confusing. When we go over notes, it seems that he has to explain every concept in the most confusing way possible, I do not understand his notes at all. We waste a lot of time going over 1 question, for example, he'll spend 30 min on 1 question, and then rushes through the rest. Good guy, but needs to work on his teaching.

I really like Dr. Gubkin. This is my second semester with him and he still makes the class easier than it could be. He's a pretty chill professor compared to most, but I recommend not skipping much class since he bases his quizzes mostly on his in-class notes and lecture. you're going to want those examples; they're often the exact test questions!!

Dr. Gubkin is such a fun professor! He is really free-flowing and casual with his classroom etiquette. I recommend a study partner for the class material, as exams are only a few questions but are likewise point heavy. He is easy to get in touch with outside of class and communicating. Looking forward to having him again this year!
He was terrible. Makes you read the chapter and do homework at home, then in class you go over homework and thats it. You do everything at home instead of at class. Basically teaching yourself.

Professor Gubkin is a really nice guy, but I feel that for early childhood education, this is not his strong suit. I went to his office hours twice a week and then noticed that the homework that WE as a team were doing, he would make sure that they were right as they were his words. I would then get the homework back and I was deducted points.

Dr. Gubkin was really good at helping our class through the tough stuff and making sure we all understood before we moved on. He really wanted to see us all pass so he took our feedback into consideration and rearranged the class in a way that worked for us. My experience may have been different since there was only 8 people in my class.
Great guy. Want to see you succeed.

Dr. Gubkin is a little geeky, but he is so passionate about what he teaches and it really shows. He is easily one of the best professors I have had at CSU. He really wants you to understand the material and work for the grade you want -- he isn't going to just hand it to you. I would love to take a class with him again!

Dr. Gubkin is one of the best professors CSU has to offer. MTH 358 is Abstract Algebra and a WAC course, so a lot of writing should be expected. 40% of your grade is homework, 40% is from quizzes, and the final 20% is from a final project. I would highly recommend him to anyone who has to take Abstract Algebra! Highly knowledgeable!

Arguably the best math teacher I've ever had. He does teach somewhat differently, but personally it helped a lot more. He teaches you the "why" it works instead of how to do a specific problem. This does help down the line since it involves less memorization which is helpful for someone like me who thinks more logically.

His teaching style is not for everyone. He tends to focus on making sure you understand the material rather than showing the steps to solving a problem. He's passionate about mathematics but sometimes gets in over his head. I definitely had to teach myself some of the materials. Make sure to put in a lot of work and effort if you want to pass

Dr Gubkin's teaching style might not be for everyone. His the type who names the topic and expects you to figure it out on your own. If your lucky and he doesn't run out of time he will solve the problem before class ends. Be ready to teach yourself.

Dr Gubkin is a very nice guy who cares about his students and is really funny. He's also a great professor ONLY if you are a fan of pure math and like to know the concepts and go in depth. His teaching style will wreck you if you are more of an applied mathematician like I am. Doesn't give "steps" to solve a problem. He wants YOU to figure it out

Professor is very disorganized. Does not convey material clearly. He confuses himself while giving lectures and cannot figure out how to finish problems. Does not do the homework before assigning it so assigns ridiculous problems. Sends out passive aggressive emails to class. Would avoid at all costs. Worst professor Ive ever had.

Prof. Gucik is a real teacher - w/chalk, illustrations, analogies and humor. He is an all around knowledgeable guy and makes physics fun and relatable. He only cares about you learning the material and being able to apply problem-solving skills, so no need to do any unnecessary memorization for tests. The amt of HW was very reasonable, even light.

Prof. Gucik is a real teacher - w/chalk, illustrations, analogies and humor. He is an all around knowledgeable guy and makes physics fun and relatable. He only cares about you learning the material and being able to apply problem-solving skills, so no need to do any unnecessary memorization for tests. The amt of HW was very reasonable, even light.
i absolutely adore this professor

Amy Guildoo is a phenomenal professor and really cares about her students. She takes time to get to know you and will meet with you and help you when you need it. She is flexible to meet with you out of class too and responds to emails promptly.

Amy Guildoo is my bff. I love her so much, she's a great teacher and she's taught me so much about myself as a student and as a person. If you need help, she'll help you. If you don't understand, she'll explain it to you. She's great. <3
Not bad, can take a joke as well as dishing them out. Pushes back due dates which is nice for papers.
This is a fantastic class.

Mrs. Guildoo is a phenomenal professor for English, she is compassionate and really cares for her students. She will give you solid feedback on your writing and gives you revision chances on papers. I had her for a reacting to the past role-play debate paired with the papers. This requires you to present and research, but is prep for the final.
Love this class!

I was a TA of hers not a student, but I saw how engaging she was with the class, used a wide variety of teaching techniques to keep things fresh and the creative juices flowing. BUT she'll push you, make you work--she ain't no babysitter. She's dynamic and energetic. Two thumbs up and a RHCP click. :)

If you love writing, you are seriously missing out if you do not take a class with Tamara. The class is fun, its not even like a traditional class, its more like a group of friends. She is hilarious and fun, She really cares about her students work and progress, and is just simply incredible.
A super easy class, she even allows you to work ahead so I got my work done weeks before the semester was over. The textbook can be rented out at the library, so I definitely recommend doing that.
A super easy class, she even allows you to work ahead so I got my work done weeks before the semester was over. The textbook can be rented out at the library, so I definitely recommend doing that.

Professor Gupta has clear weekly assignments. If you keep up with the assignments, the reading, and the weekly discussion boards you can do well in this class. Syllabus is very self-explanatory. She grades promptly, and responds to emails promptly as well.
Professor Gupta responds to emails promptly. She also grades assignment submissions quickly. Combine these with great feedback, and you have the recipe for success!

Class is not really hard but her directions and questions for the weekly assignments make me think she doesn't read the material she assigns herself. I feel like everyone in the class piggyback off of each others answers because were all confused together. She is not good at making her questions for the weekly assignments clear at all.

I took her for an online class. She is not easy nor is she hard. If you put in the work every week you should pass this class. A weekly quiz is given, make sure you study a little because theres a lot of tricky questions.
EASY A JUST TOOK IT ONLINE DISCUSSION EVERY WEEK, AND THREE ASSIGNMENTS FOR THE WHOLE SEMESTER EASY A ONLINE BEST PROFESSOR IT WAS GREAT!!!!!

He doesn't have a lot of say in this class since it's organized by one person and taught by several, but he's really passionate about math and anyone's ability to do it. If you don't do well on online tests but you show your work he will give you credit for your process. Lots of group work, sort of wish he lectured a bit more, but he cared a lot.

He doesn't have a lot of say in this class since it's organized by one person and taught by several, but he's really passionate about math and anyone's ability to do it. If you don't do well on online tests but you show your work he will give you credit for your process. Lots of group work, sort of wish he lectured a bit more, but he cared a lot.

Slow to grade, but he'll work with you when he gets to it. He didn't lecture much so pretty much learned most of this from the homework in MLP. Be prepared to constantly work in groups on your homework, but it's not necessarily a bad thing. He doesn't have much say in this class, but he wants you to pass it. Nice guy. Very patient.

Love her! Her class was from 6-7:50 and there were plenty of times I wished it was longer! Had so much fun in her class. Not a lot of work, just make sure you do the assignments. One of the greatest professors I've had. Really made learning fun.

Can't believe this class is being phased out. Hopefully Ms. Guzzo picks up some other classes so you can meet her. Seriously hilarious in her delivery. Makes you want to pay attention; makes you want to learn and listen. Years of teaching experience help us see how the real world will be. I learned so much that I can actually use. pretty rare.

Cool teacher. Really knows a about what she teaches. The art projects were fun. The assignments were overwhelming at first, but they were all spaced out good. She's really funny and easy to ask questions.
Very helpful and knowledgeable. Which she was here the whole semester. Try and get in her class if you can! She's awesome!!

I took this class online with Professor Karen and I can tell you that she is a very tough grader. There is 2 discussion board assignment and I have earned B+ on the First one and A+ on the second one. Also, there is about 3 more assignment including the final paper and she wouldn't round any small point for anything. It's a tough class.

Dr. Haely is an alright lecturer. I can't say I ever felt bored in her class. At the same time, she sometimes will censor tough questions that she feels are "unhelpful." I suppose that was alright in some cases, but in others, it just seemed like she was stumped and avoiding a question. Additionally, her grading is BAD. Very harsh and unclear.

Dr. Haelys Feedback is not consistent. For example, shell take issues with sections of a final paper that she left unperturbed on the draft. I tried getting clarification all semester long, but eventually my persistence put me on her bad side. She wrote dismissive and insulting emails in response to my respectful requests for clarification.

She is very funny and is a mom and understands when things come up. Attendance is taken everyday but you are able to miss class. Her lectures are not boring and she keeps you involved in the class. Homework assignments are light but you are able to do rewrites if you did not do too well on an assignment. Overall I enjoyed her class a lot.

I actually had her for 2 classes, and I would do it all over again. She is very nice. Refers to every student by their name,  answers questions thoroughly, responds to emails promptly, she even offers re-writes if you don't do so well on a paper.  I enjoyed her classes, only thing I would say is that sometimes her feedback on papers is very limited

Dr. Haely is an absolutely wonderful professor. She makes the class extremely interesting and engaging. Your grade will be affected if you miss more than 2 classes. Everything you need to know is from the powerpoints, although there are a few test questions from the book. Absolutely wonderful professor, definitely would recommend!

I took the online course and although it was hard she was always there for help! You had plenty of rewrites so there's no excuse to ever get below a C on a paper. Tough grader, a lot of reading BUT with the rewrites and constant emails you should not get below an overall B in the class.

Impossible grading. You can follow her instructions but she's still not satisfied. Plan on going to the writing center, they will not know how to help you either (I am not a bad writer, they said my papers were FINE). Had to rewrite all papers for 1-2% grade increase; very time consuming and frustrating. I'd change instructors ASAP.

4 1-page paper, 2 2-page journal, 2 discussion board participations, 1 8-page paper, 1 take home final exam with 4 short essay questions. Tough grader but really helpful if you ask questions. Write well-crafted papers based on the textbook and you will be fine.

Tough grader. She is very frank ( basically , if you say something off the mark, she will call you out on it). Can't deny, she know here stuff and for the most part it is a great topic to expand your knowledge on ethics. Would recommended, but forewarn you, she is very tough but fair ( she offers rewrites on one page papers).

Dr. Halasy was a very hypercritical grader who tended to nitpick the slightest inaccuracies. His pedantic critiques reflected in his harsh grading, as following his feedback generated more mistakes for him to mark off. I would only recommend taking his course if you already possess strong, previous expertise in the niceties of academic research.

Dr. Chambers is a very knowledgeable and respected professor at CSU. She has an online class for Child Development and the assignments are clearly stated in the syllabus and she tells you exactly what she expects. There are no tests, just two medium papers, many reflections, and weekly discussion boards. You will need the book for this class.

Dr Halloran is a very nice man but he has a lot of sass to him. He is definitely a hard professor, the textbook is not very confusing (not very helpful). Grading is ridiculously tough. This class is not very helpful without a matlab help session. One more month and the semester is over, i honestly cannot wait. This class is the worst.

This professor assigns graded HW on material he did not go over in class, and then explains it the next week. He even admits it, saying that students need to read the book and figure it out, and then discuss it in class. Even though the book is not clear at all, and you end up watching a bunch of youtube videos for one HW. Avoid if at all possible.
Dr. Halloran is a great professor. He explains things to convey the material clearly.

This professor is easy, lets you use your notes on the quizzes and the exams, you are more likely to do well in his class if you know how to use your sheet, and write all your formulas. he wants his students to understand the equations,and know how to apply it. GREAT PROFESSOR!!

Genuinely nice and helps ease the complexity of the course.  His unique testing technique doesn't overwhelm us with too much studying and memorizing, but I found that I ended up remembering more in the long run that way! He got his education at Harvard, so he is pretty brilliant.
It is impossible to not like this guy! The class is pretty interesting. Go to class, take notes, do good on hw's and it is very possible to get a good grade.

this man is weird...he copies stuff right out of the book and puts it into powerpoint do there is no point in gettin the book.  He gives u a booklet that u have to buy with all the hw for the semester&its easy bcuz it comes right out of notes which are on electronic reserve (so print em out) u dont need a notebook.  Just do hw n study for the tests
This class was not hard at all. I recommend it for anyone who just needs to fill science requirements.
Professor Hamilton is amazing. Very helpful, always answers emails in a timely manner. Would highly recommend her.
Professor Hamilton is amazing. Very helpful, always answers emails in a timely manner. Would highly recommend her.

Hamilton is easily one of the worst teachers I've ever had in my life. Her stories will make you cringe and her lack of professionalism is embarrassing to CSU. Learn the powerpoints and you'll be fine, although she will refuse to change exam grades even if your answer is correct and verbatim from her powerpoints. Truly don't get how she has a job.

The level of unprofessionalism... far too much. The lecture is a complete mess. Important information is given via email last minute too. The class is a joke, but unlike other joke courses in this program this one is brought down by the horrid in class experience. Not the worst professor I've ever had, but definitely in the bottom 3 no question.

Hamilton openly says her course evals are terrible every year, but yet she is still okay with it. She puts wrong answers in her Powerpoint questions for exams, ignores emails, has an attitude when you ask her a question, and doesnt seem to know much about what shes teaching... Shes unorganized and unwilling to help. Id give her a 0 if I could.

Run, literally run. This was by far the worst class I have taken. Professor Hamilton is so unorganized and her lectures make absolutely no sense. She doesn't give you credit even when your answer is correct, and she is very rude and disrespectful to students. All I can tell you is good luck because this was the equivalent to a dumpster fire

Okay, so it was a hot mess. The test formats were continuously changing without warning, she told us we needed to buy the book for the access code AND WE DID NOT EVEN USE IT, AND she is unapproachable. She would respond to questions in a rude manner and the lectures are all over the place. GOOD LUCK

It's a no from me. No structure in her teaching method. She kept changing the format for tests and if her answer is wrong won't go back and give credit even if your answer is right. Students tried to avoid asking questions because she would respond in a very aggressive and sarcastic manner. Good luck

Hamilton is the only professor I've ever disliked before. She is all over the place and her lectures are difficult to follow. When people ask questions, she gives sassy remarks and is unwilling to listen to concerns from her students and make changes to the course. The class is easy, but she is not a good professor and is unapproachable.

Professor Hamilton makes no sense in class. I have yet to learn anything that I can apply to the nursing field. Since classes are on zoom she gets very angry if your camera is off and she will call you out. She gets off topic very easily.
Horrible, awful, just so bad

Just buy the damn book and take it from there. She doesn't prepare you for the NCLEX, she prepares you for her exams. Her words, not mine. If you participate, she will get super excited.. like literally scream, and probably give you an extra point or something.

Professor Hamilton is a very caring and intelligent instructor that wants students to succeed. She is practical. Personally, the stories she shared in class during lecture helped me because it made it easy for me to remember and relate to the reading materials.

Professor Hamilton cares a lot about her students and really wants you to learn. She is very helpful and always willing to help. She encourages participation in class, and a lot of information that she says in class is on the test. She is very knowledgeable in the classroom and clinical setting.

Tests will seem easy but she pulls information from outside sources that contradicts the book, so good luck. Also it seems like she puts in the wrong keys for tests and won't go back in and check. So everyone could have gotten it wrong even though it was the right answer and you're screwed.

A majority of the points are from tests. My recommendation is to do the questions in the back of the book because she pulls a lot of them word for word. I did not read her study guides at all and still got A's on every test. She refuses to drop test questions. She says she was giving extra credit but put it online as an assignment grade.

Professor Hamilton is one of the best clinical instructors I've ever had! She is VERY PASSIONATE about teaching and she will do everything in her power for her students to do well. Know your meds before and what is going on with your patient to give her report before passing meds. LOVE LOVE LOVE :)

Great professor. Wants students to do well and is very helpful. Expects a lot and expects you to look things up first. Know your meds. Learned a lot. Pretty easy grader, just make sure you have all the components!!
awesome and fun
Knocked our grades down for not performing at a senior level; it was a sophomore class! Said that gave us room for improvement.
All online course. Very well put together, informative and concise lecture videos. Scared this was going to be my toughest class, and I loved her and how she presented BLEH research information.
All online course. Very well put together, informative and concise lecture videos. Scared this was going to be my toughest class, and I loved her and how she presented BLEH research information.
Uses scaffolding and guided practice well.  Responds promptly to emails.

Dr. Mike was hands down the BEST professor I have ever had. He sparked so many interests in me and gives the best advice/best lectures. Hes funny and very knowledgable. He records lectures, lets you know what you need to know, and really tests your abilities and knowledges in neuro. Seriously an awesome guy. 10/10 recommend

Dr. Mike was hands down the BEST professor I have ever had. He sparked so many interests in me and gives the best advice/best lectures. Hes funny and very knowledgable. He records lectures, lets you know what you need to know, and really tests your abilities and knowledges in neuro. Seriously an awesome guy. 10/10 recommend

Just an overall great professor. Had him 2 semesters ago for neuroscience and was just blown away by his class. It is very apparent that Dr. Mike loves his job, teaching, and his students as a whole. You hardly ever get professors who truly teach rather than just talking at you and reading off slides. I wish every professor were more like him!

Dr. Mike is one of the best profs at CSU! He truly loves teaching and wants to see his students succeed. His lectures were very interesting and he gave great examples to explain the tough concepts of neuroscience. There were 4 exams (lowest gets dropped), 5 quizzes, and tons of extra credit. Pay attention in lectures and STUDY. Highly recommend!
Great human being overall. Super flexible with schedules and really loves what he does. He's the happiest person you'll ever have teach a class.

Dr. Mike is by far my favorite professor I have had at CSU. He is so understanding and flexible if you have any issues. He gives great lectures and they are never boring. He also gives tons of extra credit, so show up to class so you do not miss those opportunities. I would take him for every Health Science course if I could, highly recommend.
It is obvious Dr. Mike cares a lot about each students success in the class as well as in their future careers. Easily my favorite professor.

Hammonds is honestly the BEST professor I have ever taken a class with. I had him for my neuroscience lab and my advanced research and writing class. He makes every effort to be understanding, empathetic, and willing to work with students. Extremely knowledgeable and care greatly about work and his students. I would recommend him in a heartbeat.

One of the best teachers out there. Does a great job of dumbing down hard material. Gives great lectures! Tells you what to pay extra attention to for the exams. You do have to study in order to do well in the class. Going to lecture is important but he records them and posts them in case life happens and you skip or miss a lecture.

Dr. Mike is a great professor. He gives case studies for extra credit that can add up to 20 points of extra credit if you do them all. He puts annotated notes and lecture recordings on blackboard for you and is very laid back on quizzes if you feel you need another week to study. Hard but interesting class and a great professor.

Class consists 4 exams, lowest of first 3 gets dropped, 4 tract quizzes, one beginning quiz, and extra credit clinical cases. Tests cover a lot of material, no study guide given. Go to class, he gives heads up on essay ?'s. Fun teacher, SO understanding, compassionate, and willing to help! More professors need to be like him. Hard class, good prof.

Dr. Mike is the best professor at CSU!! Classes are always so much fun, and he is really approachable and knowledgeable on the subject. Always gives extra credit and truly wants his students to succeed!

Best professor to ever have. He always helps, and gives ALOT of extra time on assignments. He gives so much extra credit. He's really funny. Easy grader. Wont give you midterm, unless you really request to have it. Gives extra credit at end of semester for presentation of your paper (100 points)!!!!
Dr. Mike is great. If you show you are trying he will help you A LOT. Very funny, very nice. Is very understanding if you need to reach out for any reason.

Fall 15 Semester (Hsc 305/505) Weekly journals - Usually 2-3 pages double spaced.  Nearly everyone received 100% on all of them (the few who did not wrote 1/2 page total and still were given partial credit) Also he's a professor that doesn't 'Just Read' his power points (He is a great story teller instead) Take this class when you can!

Dr. Hammonds is a great professor.  He's funny and keeps the classes entertaining.  He is lenient on due dates and also understands if you need more time to finish your  assignments.  He is very helpful! Definitely recommend taking a class with him!

Dr. Mike is the best professor at CSU.  He truly wants to see students succeed, and does anything he can to make this happen.  He records his lectures, and posts filled in powerpoints online to help students who study in different ways.  He is approachable, and showed me kindness and understanding when I came to him for help.  Amazing individual.

Tells you exactly what to expect on exams, so go to class. Lecture is boring and I feel like I would've learned loads more with another professor, but Dr. Mike is still a great guy and good prof. Only complaint is that he takes his good old time to grade tests and he doesn't always post lecture power points in a timely manner.

Dr. Hammonds is a wonderful professor :) This is my first semester at CSU and this Advanced Writing class will definitely prepare me for grad school.  He will go above and beyond to help you. Don't take his kindness for weakness! He's also funny too! Great class! I wish all my professors were just like him.

He is THE best professor at CSU! He will go out of his way to help you, as long as your willing to help yourself! He went above and beyond for me. I don't know what I would have done without him! Need more prof like him.

One of, if not the best professor that I have ever had. He is genuine, passionate, more than willing to help his students succeed, and is extremely straightforward when he teaches. I wish I could take more courses with Dr. Mike!
The absolute best teacher you will ever have caring considerate and will do anything to help you get a good grade
The absolute best teacher you will ever have caring considerate and will do anything to help you get a good grade
So so nice, he genuinely cares about each of his students

One of the best professors I have had throughout my college career! His classes are well structured and everything is made clear-cut. He is very kind and is more concerned about you learning the language and how you can use it in your future career rather than some term grade. The only gripe I have is that the class is maybe a little too easy.

Probably the best prof. i've had at Cleveland State by far. He really puts education over just grades, which I respect, as learning a new language can be difficult. A very caring and passionate guy, I would recommend him to anyone wanting to learn Arabic.
Best professor I've ever had! Amazing human, genuinely cares about his students. You'll learn a ton in the class. If I could rate him more than a 5/5 I would.

He is by far one of my favorite professors on campus. He really wants everyone to learn to the best of their abilities and he is very understanding of the struggles of learning a new language. Showing up to class is important because he goes over so much new material that missing a class or two may have an impact on how much you are able to retain

Hamo has perfected a language teaching strategy- he is by far the best language teacher I've ever had, probably in my top 3 teachers/professors of all time. He's funny and makes the class environment comfortable. He's helpful, thorough, and I had a better understanding of Arabic in one semester than I had of Spanish after several years.
Participation is mandatory, with lots of conversing with classmates. Class moved really slowly.

He offers so much help, if you use it you will succeed. he has office hrs, study groups, language table, in office hours, email. He's knowledgeable in teaching Arabic lang and sometimes it is hard to translate some things and grasp but he's always there to help. Just the class is too long but he offers a break.

Great professor! Always willing to help.  He's one of the few professors that wants to make sure you understand the material, rather than being worried about the grade.  He had study groups with us before and after class.  Very helpful, very kind and can be kind of funny.
Wonderful! Great energy always willing to help!

Very nice and helpful. If you do not have any prior Arabic experience, this class may be a little frustrating, as I had many Arabic speakers in my class. Not a very structured class, but very laid back.

He is a great teacher! I love his teaching style. He makes sure everyone understands thmaterial before he mves on to the next topic. I highly recommend taking this course! st don't plan on skipping! Attendance is a huge grade.

I am taking his 101 class at Akron. The course content is difficult to grasp for some but he is  very concerned with the individual students learning. He is extremely helpful with grades if you are suffering and will give up his time to help you.

Currently taking his Arabic class at Akron. He is very soft spoken and gentle man. His quizzes and homeworks are very easy. Class sometimes gets off track. He is not very challenging, which is disappointing for a language class. It is too easy to get an A without learning much. His classes are fun though and he is great to work with.

Really sweet guy. Reviewed things whenever needed, and really tried to help the class succeed. Liked to have the class work in groups, open and friendly classroom environment. Attendance is pretty necessary, he goes through a lot in one class.

He is so sweet and friendly! Loved having him as a professor. Only downfall is that he gets easily distracted which isn't good in a language class, but he is very helpful! He loves talking about the culture of the Middle East too!

Really good prof and class. As long as you put effort into the class you will be fine. I thought the material was interesting and was well organized. Everything that was on the exams was from the notes she provides. Good communication and accessibile for questions over email.

Really good prof and class. As long as you put effort into the class you will be fine. I thought the material was interesting and was well organized. Everything that was on the exams was from the notes she provides. Good communication and accessibile for questions over email.

She assigned us a few quite hefty assignments throughout the semester each hours of work, worth about 50pts. Then our final project which was almost 20pgs and very time consuming was worth 100pts... First time Ive turned in something incomplete bc I knew my time would be better spent elsewhere. She makes it very hard to get an A and stay sane.

Dr. Hanna was really good. I took her for a WAC class and you work in groups to work on the paper. Only two exams; one midterm and the final. Make sure you go to class bc if not, you will fail. I like that she does not take any nonsense from her students. Show up on time, do not miss class, study, and you will get an A.

Dr. Hanna is an amazing professor! Super interesting class and she helped make it that way. Her class is definitely difficult and she makes you work for a high grade overall. The paper prep assignments are super helpful and made writing the approx. 40 page final paper 10x easier. Lots of group work & you need to attend to class for labs & lectures.

Pretty easy class, just boring. A ton of notes and memorization, but if you do that and the rest of the work you'll be fine. She is a fine professor with some group work every once in awhile, but the lectures can get boring.

Her class is easy to follow, if you miss class you will fail. She hates phones and people on laptops. Enjoy learning in her class, take a lot from her class. She is fair and wants to see all her students pass

Fair amount of work for an online class but overall very simple and easy. Hanna sends out frequent and useful emails and is always available for questions. Textbook is needed to complete the course, but you can skim rather than fully read the chapters.

ive got very mixed feelings. shes annoying but im on her good side so i guess she could be more annoying. shes WAY too picky and she treats her students like theyre in elementary school. ive never had a professor who wastes my time and boils my blood the way she does. if you do things right though things go somewhat smoothly

Professor Hanna is one of the best professers I've ever had! She is truly caring and makes sure we understand the material. She doesn't have a book for the class, and if you don't go to class then you will miss out on the material she says in class that is on the exam. Be prepared to takes notes every class. She makes class fun by having group work

Professor Hanna is a wonderful instructor. She is knowledgeable, funny, and imparts material in a very clear and illustrative way. She addresses her expectations for all of the assignment at the beginning of the semester and at beginning of each class meeting. Would definitely take her again.

The way she talks is annoying, she tends to talk to us like we're still in grade school for some reason. Her class is easy, you don't even really have to take notes in class, she does an optional jeopardy before each test and gives you bonus points if you stay. Don't have to come to class when take home assignments are due which is sweet.

AMAZING professor and she really helped introduce me to general crim! She is really funny and nice and I really respect her as a professor and as a person. Will definitely take a course of hers again if I can! Take her classes, they aren't that bad and it is fun to take classes with her!!

She is so funny and easy. She has in class group work for easy points and you can't miss them. The out of class assignments include watching documentaries and answering questions, they were always interesting!! Her exams were easy and followed the notes very well. If you print the powerpoints and take notes on them, you will do great in her class!

By far the most intelligent professor that I have ever had the chance to witness. She is a great speaker and illustrates the difficult concepts in a very clear way. Due to the lecture heaviness in her course, total student engagement is key. Her tests are very simple if the student takes the time to review the material a few times over.
Overall a very good professor

Great teacher, very knowledgeable and relates the class material to real life situations making it easy to understand. There is group work for the most part every class. There is no textbook all her material is given via powerpoint and the lecture itself. Very easy and interesting class, just show up and pass

She's fantastic and hilarious but actually teaches the material. Attendance isn't required but you'll see yourself going to class just for the funny lectures. Powerpoints are usually posted online, but you should go to class and take notes to pass the class with an A

The assignments for this class are very involved. She takes off points for the smallest errors. The tests include questions that are difficult to find in the book. The book is not a great resource in of itself.

Professor Hanna is organized and gives very clear directions for class. Each week, there is an assignment due on Sat. at 11AM. After every 2 assignements, there is an exam. Can make up 1 quiz/exam during finals week if needed to replace another grade. Good professor with detailed and thorough directions.

Tests, reading quizzes, blended learning assignments and group activities. Not an overly hard class but you do have to attend. She bases her exams on lecture only, no textbooks. She uses powerpoints but a lot of them won't make sense unless you hear the lecture. Group activities are easy and you get out early. Blended learning is a day off.
Homework and attendance are a big part of grade.  Amazing professor.  Gives study guides for exams.  Come to class and do the homework and its a breeze.
Great teacher, would def take any class he is teaching. He great with explaining the material and good with keeping your attention. Easy A, but def show up for classes.

Dr. Hanson class are really  great he makes a difficult  subject understandable. I would  take another  class to anyone  who is  not  fin major and wants to learn fin. You can fail his class by not showing  up.

This guy is the best teacher I've probably ever had. Super clear about expectations, very good at teaching the material. I honestly would take any class he offers. An A is 100% possible for anyone who pays attention and gets help if they need it.   4 tests, homework and participation matter.

Dr Hanson is a rare breed of professors, especially of entry level courses. His enthusiasm, knowledge and patience made the material so much more approachable. Lots of points in the class, lots of opportunity to do well. Wish I could take more of his courses.

I feel so lucky to have had such a great professor for FIN351. I did not have any background in Finance and he made things easy, understandable, and actually interesting.  He is willing to go to far lengths to help his students. I would most definitely recommend this professor.
Best professor I've had at CSU yet! Recommend!!!!!!!!

I was definitely nervous going into FIN 351 but Dr. Hanson is a serious saint when it comes to this course. He provides the material with such clarity and in a way that non finance majors can easily understand. The dude is awesome. If you attend lecture, engage, do your connect assignments an A is definitely possible.

I was worried about taking this kind of a class online. Not to worry. This guy prepares an online video every week for every chapter. Also provides a video for how to do the problems you'll have to calculate for HW every week.  Didn't quite understand what he just said or calculated?  --  Just dial back and listen to the video again. Great guy!

Best Professor I have taken at CSU online. He truly cares about his craft and it shows. He provides amazing lectures, listens to feedback, provides study material for exams, and will even Skype if you need help! You will have weekly homework, discussion boards, and quizzes, which should be fairly easy if you did the work. 3 tests and 1 final.

Of course intermediate micro econ is a course for economics students! Should it be made easier for biz majors or poly sci majors? That's not too fair to us Econ students.  As for Harford; he is tough, fair and prefers a classroom that resembles a place where people come to learn, not to FB and text. Gadgets in class are distracting to real students
Teacher was very hard.Test are Hard. Do not come late to his class or use any electronics calculators included. Very Smart professor but he may be to smart.

I read all the other comments for this class and professor, and I throughly agree that it is a class for majors, and this prof teaches to majors. If  you're not trying to be an Economist, don't take his class!  If you are, go to every class, read every chapter and you'll be ok.

This was a grad math for econ class.  He likes hard tests. His tests always contain problems designed to trip you up.  No use of modern teaching methods - it's a chalk talk. Not tolerant input.  His way or the highway. But he is a smart guy with a lot of experience. Don't take him if you have the option and arent willing to learn on your own.

He is ridiculously strict, which is quite amusing. He is not a bad teacher, he just teaches to econ majors which can make class difficult to follow. He is also not very flexible and hates when your late. But he seems to have a huge curve b/c I failed every test and got a C in the class.

His strict approach is unbelievably funny. Watching him gaze at students arriving late is priceless. Going to every class and reading the book = mid B. Most did not do well in the course. Oh and no "gadgets" are allowed in his class!
He needs to stop petting his beard and be more clear

For every statement, there are 4 or 5 qualifications. No overall theme; no overarching concepts. No prioritizing of topics. You'll cover everything, and walk away with nothing. He'll make you hate economics.
Intelligent man, but he talks about the subject like you already know the material. If you read thouroughly before every class you should be able to keep up.

Unless you want to lose points for showing up late to class, using the restroom in the middle, or getting yelled at for eating, holding a cell phone or dozing off for a second or two, DON'T TAKE THIS CLASS!!

Those craving more rigor will be pleased with his approach. I prefer a more intuitive approach. But some fellow students said they would like to have seen more detail on the very topics I thought were overdone; so it's a matter of taste.

He does not know how to answer the students' questions with adequate responses; whenever I asked a question, he went off on an unrelated tangent and then moved on when I said I didn't understand.  He's pretty useless.
This is not an easy class to begin with regradless of who teaches it. He does a good job and they test are UNfair.

Worst Economics teacher, does not explain things well, concepts confusing, test questions are guessing game. Never went to class, got 18 and 19 on 2/3 tests and did Ok on final passed with a C+, HUGE CURVE in the class so it helps alot.

I think Mr. Harford is extremely knowledgable in the subject.  He isn't good at teaching it to students who do not share his love for Economics.  He is extremely boring, his tests are really hard, going to class doesn't help you at all.  Unless you love Econ, avoid this teacher!  The classaverage on the test was in the upper 50's maybe lower 60's!

Terrible teacer!  Learned absolutley nothing from the class and attendance was pointless.  All the material I learned was taught by myslelf using the book. Tests were nearly impossible.  DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS!

He is a A*!, he tries to make class hard. He takes Attendance for 7 classes and if you arent there it counts against your grade. You cant use calculators for the test, and the average grade for the class is a 60 to 65%. He acts like he is proud of that! DONT TAKE THIS CLASS!!!!

He is an a** and jumps around in the book alot. Tries to make the class hard, does not allow you to use calculators for the test. Only good thing is that he provides you with copies of the previous exams so that you can study.
Total Jerk. Resents the fact that his class is full of students rather than peers.
Try to avoid this professor if you can.  Not helpful at all!

Reza is new to CSU, and clearly improved as a teacher as the semester went on. His class notes are phenomenal. Tests are super hard, but he grades leniently. The homework is graded, but make sure you understand it too, as it is similar to the test.

His class was not meant to be taught online. There is a lot of material to go through and he flies through it, so there's a lot you have to go back and teach yourself. Homeworks and test reviews were very helpful. Very smart, but not the best at teaching the material, so ask questions and do the best you can. Answering questions means bonus points

Worst Professor I have had at CSU. He gives confusing lectures, doesn't explain anything, and expects you to piece it all together. His HWs are long and tedious. Exams are closed notes closed book. It sucks that he's teaching such an important class because he is horrible at it. He should not be a professor. Avoid him if possible.

Reza is new to CSU, and clearly improved as a teacher as the semester went on. His class notes are phenomenal. Tests are super hard, but he grades leniently. The homework is graded, but make sure you understand it too, as it is similar to the test.
Very understanding and attentive to students' needs if they need help! Nice flowing class and almost impossible to fail.
Very understanding and attentive to students' needs if they need help! Nice flowing class and almost impossible to fail.

Dr. Harless was okay. She doesnt really put much effort into the class. There is two quizzes a week and an assignment. Three midterms which the very first one is unnecessary and a final. She does drop two tests and a quiz or assignment that is the lowest grade which is nice but I dont like how she doesnt actually lecture.
Textbook not necessary after first week. Good at directing classroom discussion. Project-based learning major component of course. Content definitely applicable outside classroom.

Harper is fantastic. He's a really popular professor but can be hard to get ahold of outside of class, even by email. He's a really energetic, engaging lecturer and makes the content relatable. He also finds ways to have the class participate in his lesson in fun ways to get you to think critically. I highly recommend him!

Easy class.  We read a chapter a week, answered some questions and participated in discussions. Also worked on an annotated bibliography but he gave us plenty of time and broke it up into three parts to not give us too much work.  Gives good feedback on discussions and assignments!

I thought this class was very easy for a WAC course. The course consisted of discussion boards, quizzes, and a few 5 paragraph essays. He gives helpful feedback and discussion prompts that make you think and realize what kind of a teacher you want to be. I'd recommend this course & professor.

Dr. Harper started off great, his online course is set up very easily, each week you have a quiz and 1-2 discussion boards. However, after the first couple weeks he went completely off the grid, no one could get ahold of him, he didn't answer anyone's emails, ect I had a question about our big final paper that he didn't answer until a week before

Really harsh grading scale.   A 97-100%
 A- 93-96%
 B+ 91-92%
 B 88-90%
 B- 85-87%
 C 77-84%
 F <77%
I loved taking this class! It will help you not only to know what it means to be a teacher, but it will also help you to get a betterunderstanding of who you are as a person! Best professor ever!!!

He held additional classes on Saturdays for people that needed more help. What more can you say. The best/nicest prof ever. Take his class if you can. And the stories about his kids are pretty darn cute too.
Best teacher ive ever had
great guy!

Easily the best teacher I have ever had the pleasure of learning from. So much genuine learning, and so much fun doing it. He loves teaching, and it shows. He is so incredibly helpful. He is very understanding. I can't say enough good things about Harper, he's the best.
Great professor! Passed Praxis undoubtedly because I actually remembered what he taught us.

Dr. Harper is an awesome professor. I'm back in school after 20 years and this is my first semester. I was very apprehensive about this class, but this has turned out to be my favorite. Excellent lectures, good case studies, fabulous practice for the PLT. If you can't take him for a class, definitely sign up for his PLT review sessions
He is awesome, funny and one of the best teachers I have ever had.  He makes class go sooooo quick!  Any there are so many opportunities to get good grades in his class.  Take him.

Best Teacher at Cleveland State, no doubt about it! If you are an education major, you should have to take Harper and no one else for EDB 302. Goes out of his way to ensure students comprehend the material. Lectures are well organized and very insightful and entertaining, makes class fun and enjoyable. Nothing but high praise for him!
I agree with other comments. Go out of your way to take this class with him. He will get you ready to pass the plt.

Best professor ever!!! Seriously, it sounds like I am exaggerating, but he is definitly the best ever.  He is very helpful, and would go out of his way to help anyone.  He is the teacher that I inspire to be.

By far the BEST professor at CSU!  I would take any and every class that he teaches.  Not only is he brilliant, but he tries every method until the class gets the material.  He answers questions, gives study guides, and he tries to prepare you for the Praxis with case studies.  I would recommend him to anyone!
BBVB

Professor Harper was my first experience with a professor in the social work department at CSU. She is absolutely AMAZING! This turned out to be my favorite class. Even if you're not a social work major, the class is awesome. Good discussions, easy grading, all around fun. If you don't get a good grade, I would say you're doing something wrong.

jason is THE ACTUAL BEST professor I've ever had. 10/10 would recommend. one of the most genuine and understanding people and intelligent and respected teachers I know of. he's really funny and laid back but is also extremely intellectual and passionate about writing and English which only makes his class more enjoyable. great person & great prof!

Professor Harris understands research but not social work. As an instructor of research I learned a lot, but as a practitioner of interpersonal skills all i learned was how not to act. As the prior comment states he will not admit error. Avoid if you can, he's a waste of money if you want to practice social work.

Professor Harris is not a capable instructor. He has no concept of online learning. He is not accessible. Nor is he willing to admit an error on his part. I am so sorry I took this critical course online with Mr. Harris. I'm sorry for my classmates and myself.
Quizzes were impossible. You get a bad grade when you read the book and a bad grade when you do not. I did not feel like I learned anything in the class.
Down to earth, good professor who is caring and is also practical. I would definitely take a class offered by him again.

She means well but cannot teach calculus 2 to save her life. I've never struggled in a math class but was forced to withdraw from the class to save my GPA. Her notes are all over the place and only does examples in class. However, majority of the time she gets her own problems wrong and spend half the class trying to fix it. Do not take her.
She is as person good but as a teacher willing to teach you calculus 2 shes not good
Easy to understand and cool.  She wants everyone to do well.
She is a great teacher, and loves her job. She is very helpful, and a fair grader. She is very laid back, and understanding.
No Comments

Prof Hartmann was super chill, funny and caring about his students. His lectures were dry but it was an easy A as long as you showed up to class and actively listened to what he said because tests are off what he says and emphasizes in lectures

Prof Hartmann is a genuinely caring person who is passionate and knows what he is talking about. His lectures find a balance between being inspirational, hilarious, & theory driven complexity. He gives a few easy writing assignments, two exams, and a term paper (which you should take seriously). I love his class & would take again. He also hot af!

Professor Hartmann is good. I enjoyed him because all he does is lecture via slides, albeit the class was extremely boring. I often was falling asleep despite the class being something I genuinely cared about. I believe his soothing voice and accent plays a part but he's a nice guy. Midterm, Final and a couple papers is all the coursework.

taking for personality psychology. needs more organizational skills & better syllabus but knowledgeable about subject. 4 written assignments (4 pages), midterm, final exam, & final paper (6 pages). maybe extra credit opportunity depends on how he feels. interesting course, gives good feedback on papers, accommodates students if needed. would take.

taking health psychology. very passionate & knowledgeable about this subject. make learning fun & understandable. clear grading scale: 4 written assignments (4 pgs), midterm, final, final paper (6 pgs) & extra credit opportunity (2 pg written assignment). needs more organizational skills/more defined syllabus but would recommend taking. fun class.

I am having him for Health Psychology. He is engaging and gives examples a lot to make it easier. He is passionate Which is helping when the material is perhaps a little dry. Gives 4 exams but with tons of extra credit opportunities. More exams also means more points available, which helps with getting a better grade. I have to study but have an A

She's very knowledgeable about the subject. the book is required she goes through pretty much every chapter. There is two writing assignments and connect homework over all chapters. The test are not that bad pretty easy long as you study the material.  She gives a cheat sheet for the test on what might be on the test. Also she uses a curve!

Its a writing requirement class so you write papers. She takes awhile to get the papers back to you but otherwise, shes very straightforward, as are her tests. I went in thinking that business law would be awful. It wasnt too bad

For a 400 class it really isn't bad. She's a nice lady in general. There is a lot of material (40+ chapters, each with a Learnsmart HW due at end of semester) so the tests can be a challenge but focus on the main concepts that she gives you on her study guides. The papers are graded tough but she gave a chance to re-write them for additional credit

Professor Harwick is a good professor.  There is so much to learn and a lot of good fact about our justice system. It is CSU fault for switching this class to a 3 credit hour class. Professor Harwick has a lot of experience . I m an average student. I never miss her class and do all the work she assign. You will be happy with your hard work.

This was the worst class I have taken in college so far.  The amount of work was astonishing.  Participation and attendance was part of grade.  Homework was in connect and was about an hour per chapter (44 chapters).  There were two very long papers since this is a WAC class that were graded hard.  Take another class or prof.

Very boring class and she does not make it any more interesting. Tests are real tough as they cover a lot of information. You will have to put a lot of effort in for studying. Two papers which were pretty easy. Attendance is mandatory as she takes it every single class. Tough class that requires  effort, but over all not that bad of a professor.

This class is dense and boring. There is a lot of stuff to go over and none of it is very interesting. The class is not that bad, as long as you show effort. She really isn't a very tough grader, gives you extra chances to make up for poor work, and rewards effort.  Participation and attendance is mandatory. There are two papers. There are 3 tests.
Not an easy A but I recommend this class if you are a hard worker. She is very clear about requirements. Lectures are boring but she gives you a great cheat sheet for every test.

By far one of the worst instructors I have ever had. Reads from power points. No original idea or input. Would not advise taking a class she instructs. You would be better off taking with a more knowledgeable instructor. Not worth the time or money I spent on the class.

Everyone below is right, but things improved by the end of the semester. She got the gig a week before Fall '13 started. Early on it was rough with pop quizzes and awful lectures (save the notebook and use a highlighter). I hated the class, her and myself. Halfway, she changed quizzes to homework and included powerpoints. Prob much better now
Semester started of really bad and it was a tough course but it turned out to be a good class. You learn a lot. Come to class and do the assignments and youll be fine.

She is the worst teacher u can have soooo boring nobody was doing well in her class. not helpful and not fair asking for ways that might be helful for students and then refusing to do anything to help. I am sure I will drop this course at the end. she makes the course sooo tough even though the material is interesting.

She lectures verbatim out of the textbook.  Will give "pop" 10 point quizzes over 5 chapters at a time, one of which you have PROBABLY covered.  She has the inability to tie this law class to BUSINESS.  If you have feedback keep it to yourself, even if she asks for it, because she will roll her eyes at you.  Very abrasive personality.
Amazing professor who is passionate about his job. He is really great at making class fun as long as everyone reads and participates in discussion. Reasonable grader with clear rubrics.
He is a great professor and he is my advisor. I would recommend him to anyone.
No Comments

Good professor!  He offers a simulation in class that gives students practice at drafting bills.  Plus, if you are a girl taking his class...you'll probably like him...lots of the girls in my class said he was cute!
Knows the US Congress inside and out.  Really nice guy that lets the class control the agenda to an extent.  Very strict about deadlines, but get it in on time and you'll have no problems with him.
Takes forever to grade assignments. Contradicts herself all the time. Nitpicks smallest components of papers.

This professor did not respond to emails quickly. Posted exam questions with wrong answers in the key, then wouldnt admit they were wrong. Copies all questions from the textbook. Would assign 15 chapters to read in 2 days and then not provide even semi decent lectures. Was rude over emails and class discussion boards. Avoid if you can.

Although this is a writing class, timely feedback is NOT given, and she takes a while to grade. She is picky on APA format and does not answer questions directly, but rather restates what she has already said. Take a different professor for this class if you can.
She made herself available when needed. Text book was needed.
