She gave a chance for make up work at the end of class which I thought was very thoughtful. Her class was a pleasure to take. You will need the book for some things.

She was not a good professor in lecture, but I was pleasantly suprised when I had her for outpatient psych clinicals. She is always around and will diffuse a situation when a client is starting act up. It is nothing like lecture. She will help you with your clincal assignments and give you a chance to fix your mistakes before the final grade.
She acts like Jerry Spring: argues and insults students. Extra rude to disabled students. Tests are on book, although she thinks her tests are on her lectures. She does not write her tests.
Boring lectures. Doesn't teach material. Gets defensive over test questions you prove wrong. Try to avoid her.

I came in prepared to hate Statistics. Professor Hatch makes it easy to comprehend. And that's no easy task. Her lectures are very informative and she is readily available to help if you don't understand. I had a sick daughter(grade would've been better) and she was willing to help me get caught up with my material. Would highly recommend her.

I came in prepared to hate Statistics. Professor Hatch makes it easy to comprehend. And that's no easy task. Her lectures are very informative and she is readily available to help if you don't understand. I had a sick daughter(grade would've been better) and she was willing to help me get caught up with my material. Would highly recommend her.

I took Intro to PA for the Masters in Public Administration. Dr. Hatch is VERY knowledgeable and is an excellent resource if you have questions about anything PA related. She is tough and expects a lot of participation. There are a TON of readings, which is expected for Grad School, I thought the book we used was subpar and barely used it.

Intro course in that we discussed PA theory, but in no way should be considered intro in any other way. Incredibly tough grader on written work. Even good writers must meet with her to figure out what she wants. She is kind and super smart but may not the right person to teach an intro course for the major. Prepare to work HARD to get a B.

Dr. Hatch is pleasant and her syllabus clearly outlines her expectations from the get-go. There's an awful lot of reading required which is expected at the graduate level, but it's very theoretical. If you learn through application or are hoping to study practical public administration, this class won't fulfill that desire.

I dreaded this class. Prof Hatch was delightful. Lots of support, cheat sheets allowed during tests. All test topics clearly articulated to target study. I aced this class when I thought I would merely survive. And I actually learned how to do statistics. A Christmas miracle.

Very knowledgeable, yet horrible instructor.  Her lectures are verbatim her Powerpoint, which is all bullet points.  In lectures, there is little 2 no explanation of concepts & theories; mostly examples. For an Intro class, she does little to prepare students for upcoming classes.  Not the right person for this class. Perhaps a Ph.D. level class.
Great educator.
One of the toughest graders at Cleveland State. Made material horribly boring.
Honestly, I haven't learned anything. She is the wrong professor to teach this course. She gives us so much information and then wants us to regurgitate it back out. This is not learning

Grading is easy but prof is disorganized in the extreme. Says she'll return grades w/in 2 weeks, but in mid-December, as final grades were due, she had yet to grade the most recent 7 assignments going back a full 8 weeks. Group project designed to lighten her load, not to teach anything. Looking for an easy 4hr A? Take this class. Otherwise avoid.

Lectures a lot and yet you find yourself not really getting what she has to say.  Very disorganized, will take up class time to set up her laptop, paint her nails, text her kids.  Mandatory attendance, if you miss you will write a paper (allowed to miss two classes with a paper written). Won't get a grade on anything until midway through. AVOID

Professor Hatten is a great teacher! Lots of online discussions, and there is a proposal paper and a rough draft that are assigned to help with the final research paper. All of the assignments further your knowledge of the present-day urban issues. Responds back quickly, and she is a fair grader! Great online class, and would gladly take again!

Darlene is probably the best professor at CSU I have ever had. She is so nice, caring, and relatable which makes her class so much fun. Her tests are difficult but she offers SO much extra credit and open book quizzes to make up for lost points. If I could be friends with any professor, it would be her.

First of all, she is the sweetest person ever! Offers a lot of extra credit. Lectures are relatable and likes students to participant. Ensures everyone understands the email and will use relatable examples. Tests are difficult but again offers A LOT of extra credit. LOVE HER!

This was one of my favorite classes of all time, undergrad and grad. Matt Hawes is an excellent professor who tells it as it is, works in a lot of humor, and keeps things practical. This is a great class if you learn from applied concepts and I took it outside of the classroom. You still have to put forth a real effort, but it's fair and fun.

She's really cool and down to earth, however her projects were a little vague and if you didn't ask a lot of questions, she didn't teach too much in the class. Most time is spent working on projects which is nice because she's around to help and she's fun to talk to
The nicest and the sweetest woman you will ever meet.
The nicest and the sweetest woman you will ever meet.
A lot of things are online, and I don't feel like I actually learned a lot. The class just felt a bit messy, but she's still a super sweet lady.

She filled in for a different teacher of mine while he was on medical leave. She was an EXTREMELY NICE PERSON. She is clearly very intelligent. Her lectures though, weren't engaging, and definitely not thought provoking. Very soft-spoken and never was able to capture my attention. If you aren't super invested in the course material don't take her.

Dr. Hawthorne-Clay is genuinely a great professor. I had her for a short period of time when she filled in for Dr. Moore. She is extremely Intelligent, balanced, respectful, outgoing & cares about her students. In a class where people have different views, she encourages discussion, but at the end of the day, you should still respect everyone.
Very sweet professor, genuinely cares about her students and just wants to help us succeed. Great and interesting lectures. Would take again in a heartbeat. I'll definitely miss her.
The nicest lady on the face of Earth. Show up, do your assignments, easy A.
Easy class, but all the assignments are in class and we only learn by presentations from other students.
Dr. Clay is very knowledgable. Her calss is easy. If you attend the class regularly and do your assignments on time,  you will be fine.

Dr. Hawthorne-Clay is hands down an amazing professor and human being. Her class is very easy and assignments are helpful as future teachers. The class I took was 2 hours and 50 minutes, but she made the time meaningful. Love her and this class! Would take again!!

Very enjoyable class! Grade is based off of projects, discussions, quizzes, and field experiences. Professor Hawthorne-Clay is there for you, and wants you to succeed! I highly recommend her, and wish I can take more education classes with her!
Very easy class. If you attend regularly and participate, you'll do fine.

She's really nice and her class is easy. She has a natural talent for making the classroom a peaceful and non judgmental place. You will talk about things that you never thought would in a class. The only issue I have is that you gain a lot of knowledge, but don't learn how to apply it to your career. Students do all the talk in the class...

I had this Dr. Haymes only one time, and for an origins of words course. It was so interesting and he is quite knowledgeable. It is sort of like watching a history channel show, but with a teacher that is older, humble and funny. Also, he was wonderful enough to write me a recommendation letter for graduate school : )
First time teaching English.  Unfair Grading. Down-grades for missing class. Very educated, but frustrating. I will NEVER take him again.
He is a very nice teacher and very educated. That class was easy.

Dr. Haymes is awesome at explaining and teaching German. He has many factoids about the origin of words that is also very interesting. He is retiring this year, but if he ever returns make sure to take him. Overall he is very helpful, very funny, and very good at his job.

I was unsure of him for the first couple of weeks, but have come around. Very interesting and at times funny. Explains material to the point where studying is almost not needed. Not required, but you will get behind fast if you miss class. Only downside is you have to write a paper every 10 days or so, but he grades well. Looking forward to a B+/A-
He knew the material well; and had a good sense of humor
No Comments

Decent professor. She goes strictly off of her PowerPoint slides, which is nice. Theres only a couple assignments in the class, so make sure youre doing well on the exams. Shes more than willing to meet with anyone to discuss their questions! I enjoyed her.

Decent professor. She goes strictly off of her PowerPoint slides, which is nice. Theres only a couple assignments in the class, so make sure youre doing well on the exams. Shes more than willing to meet with anyone to discuss their questions! I enjoyed her.
All he did my entire semester was sit on his desk and talk to the class in a low, slow voice. He started to sound like the adults from Charlie Brown. We all had no Idea what he was saying.

Really nice guy. However anytime he takes attendance, he sounds like a mouse. He gets so quiet you don't hear him call your name. Class is SO boring and drags on, but if you make sure to do the study guide, you will pass the test.
Class is very boring . About a month into the semester half the class stopped showing up. He talks the entire time and no one knows what he is ever talking now about even when he's asked to explain
loved james
awesome professor
Worst class I have ever taken in my life. No one understands anything in this class and the tests are foreign to us. Seriously regret taking this class. I'm aiming for a C...........

This class required a lot of reading and sometimes the concepts were a little confusing but he explained most of them pretty well during lectures.  Graded papers pretty easy and gave a chance to rewrite and turn in a second time.
This guy teaches this class like it is a 300 or 400 level class. Avoid at all costs, or you will regret it. Very rude to students that dont understand sections of the readings assigned.
He horrible , if you don't need this class don't take it ,for this to be a 101 is feels like its a 300
Freakin Awesome

All this guy likes to do is listen to the sound of his own voice. It's fun to count the number of people that are asleep at the end of his boring lectures that make no sense whatsoever. Avoid taking this class at ALL COSTS!!!!!
Try to avoid taking his class!!!!

He's a great guy. gives great study guides. 2 exams and two 5 pg. papers. Two warnings however: 1)You must really like theology and philosophy to take this class. The material is some heavy stuff! "Concept of time and being" and "the ultimate concern" is studied. 2)He is very political. Makes political comments a lot.
Heaney lovers the sound of his own voice.  What should have been interesting material was presented in a haughty, dull and boring boring BORING way.

It's true that Heaney's lectures are confusing and some-what drawn out, but his tests are easy! Just show up to class to collect attendance points. He gives a review sheet before each test. Just look the terms up on the internet and study a bit. You have to write two short papers that are EASY points. Just write what he wants. Easy A w/ little work
No Comments

This professor is very confusing.  We don't have a textbook for this class, so we just have to go by what he says... and no one really knows what he's saying most of the time.  I really haven't learned much in this class yet.
This professor puts everyone to sleep, and makes himself laugh. Unfortunalty, the only benefactor of his dry humor is himself. Dont ever sign up for this man. Aweful.

An amazing professor. Especially for math. Very easy going. Course layout and hmwk very straightforward and manageable. Great exam reviews. I wish all professors graded like him! (Ps I'm terrible at math)
Excellent!!!

Professor Hearn is a great professor. The subject is tricky but he does a good job of helping you understand the material. My favorite part was that he always had a review session right before the test. Quizzes and homework are easy and tests are short and to the point. Would recommend.

Although the subject matter is challenging, mr. Hearn made everything clear and is willing to answer any questions. He is very helpful, my favorite thing he does in his class is have a review session right before the test. Overall I completely recommend this professor.

Professor Heath is a great choice for HCA 301. I hope she teaches my next HCA class. Weekly discussion boards, 1 paper, 1 power point project and 2 tests. The discussion boards are very interesting and fun real world topics. The paper and power point projects are simple if you follow directions. Tests are based on what you learned in the weekly DB

Professor Heath is a great choice for HCA 301. I hope she teaches my next HCA class. Weekly discussion boards, 1 paper, 1 power point project and 2 tests. The discussion boards are very interesting and fun real world topics. The paper and power point projects are simple if you follow directions. Tests are based on what you learned in the weekly DB

Relatively painless capstone class. Be prepared to work for your grade. Includes a large group project - time consuming but relatively easy. Be sure to ask questions and ask for requirement clarifications if unsure. She's very accessible by email and provides fast feedback. Overall would take another class with her.

Professor Heath is a great professor in and out of the classroom. She will push you to learn and encourage you to seek an internship. After taking HCA301, I learned a lot about healthcare and I was able to find a internship and she was more than willing to provide me a recommendation letter. I agree. She is one of best professors at Cleveland State

Awesome professor! She cares and will push you to learn and open your book. Professor Heath provides feedback and follow up with each student. She puts a lot of time and energy in our success. One of the best professors at Cleveland State. She is not the average professor.

Awesome teacher. She really cares about the students. Dr. Heath is always available to answer question. Please be prepare to do your work, read and ask questions. Her experience at Ernst & Young bring great practical examples.

IST 305 with Professor Heath wasn't too bad. As others have mentioned, almost everything is done in groups, including the weekly homework and 3 presentations. She's very nice and reasonable and teaches the class in a way that keeps the atmosphere relaxed. Her grading style isn't overly strict but she doesn't hand out A's like it's nothing.

Second time with Michele. She's a cool professor, very sociable with her students and doesn't tolerate cheating/frequent class skipping. This class is very group-centric, so make sure you select a group with people who appear to be hardworking. There are 3 presentations, so if you have anxiety, get it straightened out before the semester starts.

I took Professor Heath IST 305 this summer.  The class was very fast paced because it was six weeks. Professor Heath provided daily communication with dates and reminders.  She graded and provided helpful feedback promptly.  She always responded to emails immediately. Great professor.
I took IST305 online. Professor Heath always responded to my questions immediately.  My first IT class and I really enjoyed the material. She is a great professor and I recommend her class.

Very knowledgeable professor. Always engaged with students in a way that made you feel comfortable in a classroom setting. Also very understanding. But If you miss too many classes, you will not get the grade you're looking to. Also, give a good effort in the group projects. That's it.  Overall great experience. I would definitely take again.
I took this class twice. Professor Heath was a great teacher. You must keep up with the aggressive schedule to pass and attend class regularly.

I was sacred to talk the class at first. However Professor Heath explained all concepts and made the class tolerable. I was new to Excel but we had multiple assignment to reinforce the concepts. Great class. She makes learning new fun.

The class was very informative. The class provided an introduction to IT. The professor was fair and willing to answe question. There is a lot of group work so select your group wisely. Overall, great experience.
Professor Heath was a great professor.  She was always available to answer questions.  The material was useful.  As a marketing student, I learned alot about information technology.

She is an awful teacher. Her lectures are boring, she is very monotone, and I feel that I learned nothing from her class. She has case studies which are worthless, her study guides are ridiculous (One of them could be a study guide for an entire test, but there are four per test), and she is just awful
If you learn the vocabulary that she assigns for each unit and respond to her questions (even if your responses aren't perfect), you'll pass. An easy A.
Enjoyed the class, easy grader!

She was the worse Spanish teacher I have ever had. She didn't teach us anything she assumed we already knew the material. She is the rudest professor I have ever had. She made me feel stupid when I would ask questions. DO NOT take any of her classes. She's awful!
The best teacher i have had. very easy when it came to grading. Learned a lot from the class.

Hebat was one of the worst profs I've ever had. She was completely vague on directions for assignments, and outright rude when we had questions. Its a shame cuz the class itself was cool, but she ruined my experience entirely. Avoid her!

By far the worst teacher I've ever had. Seemed annoyed by our class. Had an attitude and was very snippy. Grading was unspecified. Test material was unspecified. Had to give 50 ex. cred points to our class so that we didn't all fail! Terrible experience for a measly gen ed. requirement! Avoid her at all costs!
At first I thought she was too laxed about everything, but she is actually pretty cool. She was a great prof she really wants you to learn and being on time is very important!

Wonderful teacher!! She is nice and very helpful, her arabic is great and she teaches in a very organized manner and teaches you the important basics to prepare you for the next level. Also she is very nice! I recommend taking her class!!

Excellent professor. She really cares about her students and their understanding of the language and the culture. She looks to take care of those who don't quite comprehend the language, and clarifies it in such a way where it is easier to understand. Highly recommended.
This educator ruined my aspirations for learning Spanish.

D-, The very epitomy of how NOT to teach. Prof. is condescending, vague, impersonal, impatient, "treats us like 5th graders". Her personal teaching experience is moot. Taking her course left me with a stale taste, and little gained. :(
Awesome professor! Extremely passionate about his subjects. As long as you work hard and participate, you will succeed!
Dr. Hedjazi made a great effort towards finding a middle ground between the needs of his course and the needs of his students.

Expects students to know the material front to back for the exams.  Mandatory attendance and tutoring outside class. Exams are heavily weighted.  I had no issues, until the final where he shorted us on time by 1 hour and did not inform us we would not get the full 2 hours... If you want a good grade, save your time and look for someone else

I took his online chemistry course. He did not communicate with us at all. After the first week we were on our own. Often times the homework site didn't work and it was frustrating. His lecture notes were hard to decipher. It's possible to do well if you have a solid foundation in chemistry prior to the class.

Took the online course with him assignments & instructions are very clear. Gave out practice exams before the test with a lot of the questions showing up on the actual exam. Responded quickly to questions. Really nice guy overall tests were easy as long as you study no tricks. Would def take again!

This professor was completely worthless! I took his course online.  The syllabus was vague only listing the chapters for each week-leaving out the grading scale not to mention what exactly was required of us (exams, quizzes, homework, etc).  Average email response, 8 days! Wanted us to do homework on pencil/paper and fax it in!

Okay teacher.  Not intellectually engaging.  After taking the class I heard through the grapevine that some of the girls were able to turn their C's or B's into C+'s and B+'s by sitting in his office and crying and not taking "no" for an answer.  Wish I would have known that because I would have taken advantage.  You should!

I took the course online and he does an excellent job managing it.  He always answers e-mails and questions on the discussion board promptly.  its a hard course and learing it online doesn't make it any earier, But Dr. H is very helpful to his students.  I would strongly you take his class

Well,if your taking any of your organic chemistry classes online they are pretty straight forward.Communication was horrible. If you leave him an email don't expect to get a response back for about two weeks. He is very hard to get in contact with. So, my suggestions would be to not take the classes online.

Dr. Hehemann is awesome but don't think that you can take this class and it will be a breeze...it's one of the hardest I've ever taken! If you're gonna put in the time and effort, then he's totally worth it, best Ochem prof I could've asked for!
Heheman is the man actually made the class interesting and was very concerned and helpful in making sure the students know the material
He is amazing! He cares about students' success greatly and made me have a greater appreciation of chemistry.
Very good teacher.  Explains organic very clearly.  The class is still hard but he is most likely the best teacher you could get.
Very hard class because of the material but he is an wonderful teacher. He's very open to questions and re- teaching if people dont understand.
Awsome professor. Don't be fooled though. You still need to work hard, but he makes it worth you're while. If you need this class, take it with him for sure.
Good professor...tests very challenging, so read and study a lot...but all around a really great professor

by far the best professor ive had in college, goes out of his way to ensure that people understand the information and genuinely cares that students are leaving with knowledge. very organized and makes the class as interesting as you can make chemistry.  excellent class
No Comments
No Comments
Prof. Hehemann is very helpful.  He gives you study guides before test that goes over everything going to be on that test and I think he explains everything clearly.  :-P
Very clear, and very organized. I look forward to going to class every Monday, Wednesday and Friday. Great professor!
EXCELLENT! He makes Organic Chemistry easy to understand. Very willing to help students.

if you need to take organic chem, take it with this professor. he is really clear and makes a VERY hard subject manageable. plus, he tells you exactly what will be on the test, gives study tips, tells some normal jokes...

How do you make a class about ethics interesting over the course of an entire semester? I don't know, but Dr. Heinlen does. Humorous, supportive, interesting, knowledgeable, and caring all describe her. She is awesome.
This professor is absolutely amazing!  She really cares about the material and her student's grasp of the material.

I think Dr. Helmy was great, with that being said our class was modified greatly due to COVID so it was all online. He answered every question I had in great detail each lecture. I did meet with him for office hours too and he was great in office hours as well. It is a difficult class, read the book!

The professor was mediocre for OCHEM, it wasn't that he was horrific, but it's very easy to pass OCHEM if you do the work, as you can see it's quite a few "A-" above, these guys didn't get those grades doing nothing. I earned a C, but solely due to my own faults which was neglecting homework, I earn an 89% on the final. But it's ALOT of homework!

I think Dr. Helmy was great, with that being said our class was modified greatly due to COVID so it was all online. He answered every question I had in great detail each lecture. I did meet with him for office hours too and he was great in office hours as well. It is a difficult class, read the book!
Dr. Helmy is a great professor who genuinely cares about teaching the material. His tests are fair if you do everything he suggests to help prepare for exams. I learned so much in this class!

The worst professor Ive ever seen. No tests, only homework assignments, grading criteria were unclear. He often hides his lack of teaching skills with cussing and profanity. Very disrespectful, he used the N word to describe one of his undergrads, and the word Boaters referring to international students. Knowledge and ethics cant be separated.

He explains the material well, but take my advice and DO NOT enroll in his course if you have the option to take another professor, seriously. His course compared to De Paoli is insanely more difficult. Will not show you what you get wrong on tests, and at the start did not let us use paper on tests. Other prof offered EC, and had MUCH easier tests
The organic chemistry tutor online does a better job than he does. I studied a lot for the class only to not have it show. TAKE DEPAOLI !!! She is more helpful than he is.

He is very difficult. I studied for Organic Chemistry non stop and practiced A LOT. I even went to the tutors. He doesn't allow scratch paper and pen on his quizzes and exams. He only gives a minute per question. He is NOT helpful at all. I have never had a professor who is not fair when it comes to exams and quizzes.

Dr. Helmy is an ok organic chemistry professor if you have taken the class before. He may seem like a mean professor in lecture but if you go to his office hours he is more than willing to help you understand the material. Don't bother arguing with me about your grades, he does not believe in curving, even if the class average is low.

Dr. Helmy is a great professor and explains things great for such a hard class. The material is already hard to begin with but his class lectures are great and straight to the point. He offers office hours which I take advantage of because although he seems unapproachable he is very kind in office hours and takes the time to help you understand.

Dr. Wishy-Washy will change his mind daily. He creates insane exams. He is non-approachable. He switches his expectations, claiming that we are too moronic for mechanisms. Only for those mechanisms and molecules, from his sick chemistry dreams, to appear on the final. If you have him, you better pray to the chemistry gods, it's your only hope.

Hes a good teacher, teaching a difficult class, but a fair grader. If he grades something wrong he is totally cool with you asking about it and he will fix it. He seems closed off at first but he really wants you to pass. You WILL need tutoring for this class. Go to all his office hours. Read the book and maybe you'll pass. you wont have a life tho

This was a really hard class! Dr. Helmy is great at lecturing and presents the material in a clear way. Do all of the problems in every chapter and go to tutoring. Write down any questions that come up while reading or doing problems then go to office hours. He will help explain tough concepts if you put the work in.

He's approachable and rude. Get ready to feel like you're always wrong. He gives no partial credit. He told the class that there is no sympathy and no extra credit. His office hours are not for explanatory help, you must bring questions or you have to come back. He explains things the second time like we are children. Just rude.

Dr. Helmy is a fantastic professor and person. He is incredibly knowledgeable about the subject matter and it is obvious that he has a passion for educating students. He is more than willing to meet outside of class to assist his students. You definitely need to put in work outside of the classroom to succeed, but will know the material.

Dr. Helmy is an excellent professor - passionate about what he is teaching and very good at explaining material. He genuinely cares about his students. That being said, prepare for some "tough love," he is tough. Read ahead of time for class, do A LOT of practice problems, and go to office hours. To succeed, you must really make an effort.

Hes very good at teaching but organic chemistry is a tough subject. Read ahead of class, do lots practice problems and watch his online videos. Hes very accessible outside of class to answer questions. He gives make up packets for quizzes but only for half credit so make sure to stay on top of the material. You have to work hard to do well.

Super rude and mean. His exams are nothing close to what he explains rather much harder. Makes the topic seem easy but when you study by your own it is much more difficult. He asks us to study from the book and gives bunch of practice problems but he hates the author and would never ever ever everrr bring questions from the book.

Comes across as mean, but is a great guy. Genuinely wants to see students do well. Is willing to help out as much as possible. You have to put the work in. It's a hard class. Dont ask if things will be on the exam he will put them on if you ask. Will get grades back to you fast. Best professor I've had at CSU. Not even a chem major.
Great orator great resources
No Comments

Definitely an unique person to say the least and she is a tough grader, but she is willing to work with you if you are willing to work for it. classes can get awfully silent and a bit lecture based, although no powerpoints. group papers are also used in this class, so be prepared to work a lot with others

Definitely an unique person to say the least and she is a tough grader, but she is willing to work with you if you are willing to work for it. classes can get awfully silent and a bit lecture based, although no powerpoints. group papers are also used in this class, so be prepared to work a lot with others

A great professor, I dont understand why the reviews are so harsh. Yes she is a tough grader but if you do what youre advised and use the handouts effectively she will see that you are trying and grade you based on that. Lots of opportunities to fix your grade.
Extremely unorganized. We never knew what was assigned and when it was due. She was never clear about anything and wasn't very nice if you asked for clarification. DO NOT TAKE HER CLASS!

If you have her, drop out immediately. Very unorganized, disrespectful and when you would ask a question for clarification, she would tell you to look as the syllabus or yell at you for not paying attention

She was extremely rude and disrespectful to students. Very disorganized and confusing, then would get mad at students who didn't know what was going on as a result of her own disorganization. Very tough grader, but also does not provide clear instructions on what she expects and poor feedback. 11/10 would withdrawal from class if I had her again.

Run, run as fast and as far as you can from this teacher. She is hellbent on pushing her own agenda through an English class. She doesn't have anything organized, always late on grading and telling students grades (because she refuses to use Blackboard), and has a nasty attitude towards students with who she disagrees. Very vindictive person.

Ms. Moore was one of my favorite professors! She's not a conventional teacher but she is really funny and most of her classes are very relaxed. She gives good feedback on papers and isn't very tough. Just be prepared to back up your topics since she wants to know specific sources you use. Overall, a really fun class and I learned a lot!!

This class is much harder than expected with Ms. Moore. Get ready to prove everything you say in your papers, no matter if it's common knowledge or not. She can be opinionated at times but always very respectful toward other students. Also lets you revise papers to help bring your grade up. Overall a tough professor but makes you a better writer.

Ms. Moore only stays on one specific topic that of which I strongly belive is because of her own personal vendetta. She is quick to share her personal options about a topic which as a professor should be left out of dicussion topics. She is quick to snap at students who may share an opposing view from hers.

Heavily opinionated to the point of seeming ignorant and stubborn. Very unorganized. First professor I had after transferring to CSU and she made me regret the decision and wonder if every English professor would be as awful as her. Avoid if you can.

Get ready to work hard and prove everything you say & write. She will make you a better writer and thinker, but it won't be easy. She gives & expects respect, so earn it. There are lots of in-class debates and discussions. There's homework/papers, reading, & a group paper. She is opinionated, but back up what you say and disagreeing is no problem.

Ms. Moore is the definition of a college professor that high school teachers warn you about. I say that with love. Ms. Moore is a tough and stern professor, but if you value the class and the work, you'll do fine. She is opinionated so if you disagree, make sure you have your evidence to back it up. If you struggle at first, it is okay. She helps!
You know, she grades you as a college student who should knows how to write papers. I wouldn't get on her bad side, or turn in garbage.

This class has been hell. Run far far away! The class has been more of a debate class than anything else. Also, she is a very opinionated meaning her grading style is just the same. She gets irritated easily and basically forces a students to believe what she believes.

Avoid at all costs. Doesn't tell you your grade in the class. Told students that even if they earned an A for a midterm grade, she would only give them a B to "motivate them". Not clear at all on assignment due dates. Assigns most work the night before.  If you write on a point of view that she doesn't agree with, prepare for a bad grade.

Assigns HW last minute most of the time through Email. Will require a lot of papers printed out and annotations of readings up to 50 pages long. Easily irritated by questions or mistakes. Not clear whatsoever on HW so expect a few low grades time to time. Even the best students struggle due to the professor and not the student.
She does not put grades in Blackboard. I have been an A student in English all my life and get good grades on papers, but she randomly made me rewrite three of mine for no reason.
Run away now, switch out while you can  She won't even tell you your grade
I wouldn't take this class with her. I dropped it a few weeks into the semester and got into a class with a way better instructor. Very unclear and disorganized.

She is great at teaching. However, she is disorganized, unclear, and sometimes is harsh when someone asks for help. She also grades tough, especially at the start of the year. If you pay attention, work hard, and you make sure any questions you ask are legitimate, you should do fine in her class.

He is a fantastic teacher by using personal anecdotes and humor.  He is flexible with his schedule and is willing to aid his students in any way; like changing due dates.  I am going to take another class from him because I learned a lot and four hours of class went by fast by the way he lectures!  I highly recommend him.
Nice and helpful!
She was a great prof for her first time teaching a class. I learned so much in this class

I've never learned so much in one semester.  She goes way beyond the book into more detail. Has extensive PDF slides (doesn't use PowerPoint) but I stopped printing them out because it was so much information. Instead, I take detailed notes in class. Hard class with lots of discussion. She explains material well and wants students to succeed.

Dr. Henry is a solid professor. He has a great sense of humor and makes corny 90's references. If he doesn't know the answer, he'll admit it and come back the next week with it. Non-cummulative tests, lectures from PowerPoints, gives decent feedback on HW. The two tests were very challenging, but curved. Reminds me of a smart Patton Oswalt.

Dr. Henry is a solid professor. He has a great sense of humor and makes corny 90's references. If he doesn't know the answer, he'll admit it and come back the next week with it. Non-cummulative tests, lectures from PowerPoints, gives decent feedback on HW. The two tests were very challenging, but curved. Reminds me of a smart Patton Oswalt.

I took this course in summer 15. Covers 3-4 chapters everyday. Emphasizes more on easy topics and just reads the PPT  for the tough ones. The PPT's were a copy of the textbook including the examples. Macro ECN was not explained properly. I had lot of expectations from the class, but I was not satisfied. Overall an average teacher.

He is very good at explaining difficult material. He curves the exams a lot, he works with students to make exams be more manageable. As long as you do the homework and go to class for the notes you will be fine. Used the online textbook for homework.

Midterm and final were not that hard, I never attended class and received a B+. Homework on Aplia was at times challenging, but he drops the lowest two. Looking back, I wish I would have gone to class more because I did enjoy the few lectures I attended. I just don't like when profs preach from the PowerPoints we are provided.

Good professor. Has you sign an attendance sheet everyday and you get points towards your grade. Understands that economics is a hard subject so he takes his time covering the material instead of rushing through it. Makes homework 50% of grade so if you due the homework and do good on it it will help. Also gives nice curve on the midterm and final.

Very nice chill guy and I thought he was a good teacher. Economics is usually boring but he is atleast younger and understands that it may be tricky and that you have a life and other things to do.  The homework is 50% of your grade so do that and you'll be fine.

Cool guy with a cheesy yet hilarious sense of humor.  Lecture pace is a little slow but I would recommend taking him.  Willing to explain things outside of class.  Generous curve as well. Good professor.

BAsically if you study the powerpoints and you go to class every day, you should do fine. I have a B in this class right now. The exams are not bad, you just have to study for them!Overall,he s a nice guy and has a corny sense of humor, but he does his best to be funny
Best professor ever! If I wasn't graduating I would take him again!

Great professor. Very helpful and really wants his students to do well. The powerpoints are great for studying and his tests are difficult but challenging. The only thing I didn't like about the class was Aplia. The questions were too hard and the homework at times took hours to do. But the professor makes the class fun and I enjoyed taking him.
Prof Henry deserves better ratings. I found myself understanding economics very well through his teaching. His tests are not as difficult as people are claiming and his lectures are worth attending.
He looks like Alex from the hangover.  Kind of tough but the class was alright - READ the book it really helps.

The homework is different than what was went over in class. Tests were very hard, but he curves. If you want to actually learn the topic, do not take him. I finished with an A, but I wish I got more out of the class.
Very fair teaching and grading in my opinion. Very helpful too.
Professor was actually very helpful and I feel that I learned a lot. Very interesting way for teaching some of the concepts through interactive games/play.

He would make a great drinking buddy, however he is quite useless as an economics professor.  I got an A because i find econ very easy, and most of our class was struggling so he really curved the grades.  Again, party yes, teach no.
curves like crazy or everyone would fail.  I had 68% on midterm and got a 91% after the curve...  However, if you want to actually learn something read the book and ask a friend not him.

Haha.. this dude is a huge prick, and arrogant. He wastes copiously amounts of time, and when he does do his boring powerpoints, he skips through them, not addressing some keypoints which are on the tests. However if you can suffer through his obnoxious personality, all of the info for the tests are on the powerpoints.
Too many quizzes and exams very heavy lectures and his exams are super tough

Professor Henry (goes by Ray) knows IT governance and the COBIT framework very well and does a nice job of explaining it to his students. His lectures are somewhat open forum which encourages you to ask questions if you have them. His tests are fair, but expect to study ALL material covered to receive an A.
Dr. Henry is an excellent professor, his lectures are thoughtful and designed to help you understand the basics of programming.  He explains concepts well and is patient with students.

Raymond is great teacher who has a lot of interest in Information Systems. Class is pretty simple if you have an information system background. Exams are long answered, but not very difficult if you have read the required readings during the semester

Dr. Henry will find a way to teach you what you need to learn.  If you are serious about the subject (I was) you will learn it.  His tests and assignments are comprehensive, but fair.  You will be prepared for them if you go to class, pay attention, and ask questions.

I'm surprised by how much I enjoyed this class. I took it online, and I found Dr. Henry to be helpful, and the readings and assignments to be useful, interesting, and relevant to my degree program. His grading is very fair, and if you read the book and articles, you'll do well.

I took Dr. Hersch for multiple classes. He can be tough at times, but always fair. He will make you work for your grade, but is always accessible if help is needed. He knows his materials. We disagreed, philosophically, in class, but he always showed respect for difference of opinion, as long as you could support it. One of my favorite professors!

I finished my JDMBA and wanted to stop back to tell everyone that Dr. Hersch is one of the best profs I've had. Trust the process. Do the work. He actually cares that you learn. Additionally, you WILL need the critical skills that he emphasizes in his classes. If you plan on going to law school, then you won't find a better man to prepare you.

If you are taking this class, you will be forced to participate. He calls on people at random to discuss the cases from the reading, so you HAVE TO READ. The tests are all in blue books and essay based. They're hard but I was used to this type of Law exam. He is accessible to help you. Study for 12+ hours for the exam; it is not easy to get an A.

This is the fourth time I've taken a class with Dr. Hersch. I like him and his teaching style. He is so informative and you learn a lot if you just do what is required on your half. It is a ton of reading but it's not difficult material. There are no tests in this class at all just 3 small papers that were 5 pages. Classes are just big discussions.

A dept. head who is mediocre at best. The only scholarly research he has done is two books about "Jazz & Politics." A strange character, Dr. Hersch has often discussed his passion for Philosophy and Music Theory and openly admitted that he would be more suited to teaching those subjects; he'd be correct.

This was a Summer course so it was condensed. Very fast pace but Dr. Hersch makes it nearly painless. A lot of reading, several easy questions to answer about reading, and only 3 papers. I wish all professors made summer classes like this one. Will definitely take him again and I highly recommend him to you.

You must show up to his class or you won't pass. Reading is a requirement with all the cases you will cover. Tests are tough but not impossible and he gives a good study guide to follow. He is also willing to meet if you don't understand something and tells you exactly what to fix on your briefs and papers to get a better grade.

The amount of knowledge you gain after one class with him is unbelievable! I have never taken a political science course before but after one class with him I am super excited to take more political science courses! You need to come prepared for each class day and PARTICIPATION is  a must! Case briefs and short essays were assigned. Study for EXAMS

Dr. Hersch is probably the best PSC professor at CSU. He's also probably the most challenging. He's an extremely intelligent man who is eager to engage with you and your ideas. I highly doubt anyone will come through one of his classes without having hisher mind sharpened. I highly recommend him, but be prepared to work hard.

If you are a PSC major, you should take Dr. Hersch. He loves the topics and knows his stuff. His lectures are great. I also think if you are interested in this subject you should take him. The book is a must, and he is tests are tough but he really cares if you do well. Attendance is also a must. Loved this class.
The lectures are interesting if you like PSC. Book is a must. Attendance matters. Tests are hard but class is usually fun.

Prof Hersch is passionate & knowledgeable.  I took Const Law.  I recommend if your major is law.  As an elective I suggest you choose soemthing else.  Class requires writing case briefs and the tests are essay style.  You need 2 know b ale to recall numerous details about law cases.
Strict grader but interesting lectures. I learned a lot in his courses and took him twice just because I enjoyed his classes.

Strict. I went for help so many times, but not much. When i asked him what i did wrong, he had no answer, basically did not know what was wrong. Tests are hard and very detailed. No matter how hard I tried he always gave the same grade, no way of improving. But made everybody be involved in discussions.

Very strict. My English is not so good, and I went to get help from him, but did not get much. No matter how hard I tried my grade was always thesame. I attended class regularly and turned in all the assignment, aslo I know that some students in my class changed majors after taking his class. Hard!!!

I had Dr. Hersch for both PSC 310 and 342.  Dr. Hersch isn't easy if you don't do what is asked of a typical student like (read, write, and attend class.)  But if you do those things you would be stupid not to get an A.  Great professor, helpful, and interesting!

Good professor...definitely forces you to think about the material and *engage* you.  Often, however, the grading was very difficult because his expectations were not always clear-cut.  And it would be nice if he had left out some of the liberal opinions that he always prefaced with "well I shouldn't be expressing this, but...".  But overall, good.

Professor Hersch is extremely intelligent and I was truly fascinated by his thought and teaching in this particular class. He is excellent at simplifying complex theories and making them truly interesting. He is sttrict but very fair. By FAR the best course Ive taken my entire college career.... and ive taken many classes! You Rock Prof. Hersch!!!!

I think he was a great professor and I learned a lot about Jazz and even got to hear him play which he is talented. I would say the negative is he takes things personal and sometimes that develops a poor relationship with some students.

Professor Hersch runs a tight ship but he makes his expectations absolutely clear. Even students who make an effort not to learn material will walk out of his classes a smarter person, and maybe a better citizen. Definitely a fair grader who is truly interested in educating his students.

Awesome professor that is extremely knowledgeable and has a ton of real world experience. He clearly notes that the grade you receive is the grade you earn. As long as your participate and ask questions when you do not understand something, you will learn from this professor and do well in his classes.

Awesome professor that is extremely knowledgeable and has a ton of real world experience. He clearly notes that the grade you receive is the grade you earn. As long as your participate and ask questions when you do not understand something, you will learn from this professor and do well in his classes.
Very understanding, takes the time to help make sure students know the material before moving on. Wants his students to do well and understand the material. Very caring and respectful.

Professor Heuer is passionate about what he teaches and his lectures are interesting. However, the material is very complex and the assignments are graded very tough. He does provide valid feedback which is helpful.

Professor Heuer is passionate about what he teaches and his lectures are interesting. However, the material is very complex and the assignments are graded very tough. He does provide valid feedback which is helpful.

He talks at you and does not care about your opinion. He just want you to regurgitate information. He does not want your actual thoughts on topics. If you can regurgitate and cite properly you'll be fine. Just regurgitation and no thinking. The class is harder than you think.
Heuer is a very smart guy. He is nice too, but is expectations for a 2 credit class are ridiculous. He's extremely harsh on grading. Ps, good luck on the research paper.... it's horrible.

Weekly discussions, written responses, and extensive paper. Professors expectation for the paper is absurd and does not give clear expectations. Rubric says one thing but expects us to know what he wants beyond that.

Professor Heuer is the worst professor I've ever had. He does not make expectations clear, and grades very tough. EDB 241 is a 2 credit course but it feels like 6 credits with the amount of work he gives. Prepare to have this class lower you GPA

He curves the tests but you still have to study and really work for the four tests and the final. SI didn't really help that much, but homework did. His practice tests do not resemble the real ones, but he does reuse some questions from previous tests on the final. He's a super cool guy!

Dr. Heus is a truly fantastic professor. He will help you if you are willing to put in the effort. Take advantage of his office hours and the T.A.'s sessions. Both are often like private tutoring sessions. He notices those who try, so pay attention in class. I would love to take his class for Phy 222 if he ends up teaching it when I take it.
Extremely tough homework and exams, but that's physics, isn't it?  Office hours visits were invaluable to getting a respectable grade.  Put in the work, and the results will come.

Dr. Heus is one of my favorite professors at CSU. He's very kind and funny, and available nearly all the time to help students. There's a lot of homework, but that's expected in PHY 243.   His tests are no joke. They will blow you out of the water if you're not prepared, however he curves hard and is a very generous grader if you show your work.
one of my best physics professor!

Isn't clear while teaching at all, in fact he doesn't really teach. He basically spends the whole class on one example. Homework due every mon, wed, and fri. Very long and difficult homework. quizzes every Wednesday and throws in difficult questions. He curves quizzes and exams but it doesn't help much. We have hw on lessons before he goes overthem

Professor Heus is awesome! He is so animated  that you can't help but be totally absorbed by his lectures. He knows his stuff well and knows how to convey it to the students. His grading scale is a bit strange but know your stuff and you wont have to rely on his grading at all. Definitely recommend him!
Wish I didn't take this course with him! His exams are difficult he curves a lot but once it comes to the final grade he will take your grades without the curve which is really weird! Stay away!!!
Really does a good job of explaining the material and doesn't bore you to death with lectures.
one of the best physics professor I have had yet.

I really liked this professor, he was especially good with doing examples in class, especially from the homework. Homework is long and hard and there's a lot of it, but it is very useful, mostly bug free (online), and you can still do it if it's late for half credit. Would strongly recommend going to office hours with any questions, very helpful.

Professor Heus is absolutely amazing, it is clear that he puts a lot of effort into preparing the lectures and really wants the students to succeed.  He puts such passion and brilliance into his topic that you cannot help but be drawn into his class.  A definite must for any Physics student.
Don't be scared of inquiry! Professor Hickey is super helpful and gives great immediate feedback. I really enjoyed his class and the Brief Science Demonstrations from other students.

Change your schedule or drop this class. Higgins provided NO feedback for the assignments.  Grades for the class are still not posted.  Global technology does not mean PowerPoint and Excel. Nothing of value in this course.

Terrible..change your schedule immediately.  Changes the coursework and criteria...never grades your work (we were in a 5 week course and he did not post a grade of one completed assignment throughout the entire course! for anyone!!!)....most work he gives is busywork, very time consuming but not meaningful.
Great online class. There was a lot of required readings, but the discussions and chats were fascinating. He was sometimes slow to answer emails but always willing to help.
No Comments

Professor Hilde was great. His lectures were interesting and he mixed them up with videos and discussions, hes funny and doesnt take himself too seriously, and hes a fair grader. I really enjoyed his class and found it to be helpful.

Dr Hilde is passionate about the topics he discusses but themes in the lectures become redundant. He emphasizes things that are common sense to people in the public policy/planning field and a lot of things are idealistic. If you show up and at least try on the group project assignments, you will get an A. I would of liked a challenge.

Professor Hilde was great. His lectures were interesting and he mixed them up with videos and discussions, hes funny and doesnt take himself too seriously, and hes a fair grader. I really enjoyed his class and found it to be helpful.
He knows his stuff. Blogs due every week

Mr Hill was very passionate about social work and he brought in great speakers that shed some insight to the chapters in the book.He gives u a intro understanding to commiting yourself to social work would love to have him in another class

I believe Mr. Hill was a very insightful professor. Also, given his background and all that he is recognized for, he is also very humble. He is nationally known and many should take full advantage of having him as a professor. Nothing about this class was difficult if you paid attention and read the material. The exams weren't rocket science.

This class very much became "The Paul Hill Show," or he would read directly from the text. He presents slanted views via guest speakers, videos, and the like. Be prepared to have numerous guest speakers (many of which are related to him) and to hear about the East End Neighborhood House constantly.

Just because one has been in the social work field for the past 30 years does not make one qualified as an instructor. Students walk away from class feeling frustrated. Unable to contact adjunct outside of class due to no email or phone provided. Mentions East End Neighborhood House at least 20 times per lecture. Provides one side of every issue.

Dr. Hill was cool to have as an ECE major.. I think she was good for a nice laugh and was pretty relatable. The only thing I didn't care for was the obvious lack of organization and communication with students. Would sometimes take a week or so for an email response post-COVID online.. I liked her, but I wouldn't take her again. Solid 6/10 for me.

Dr. Hill was cool to have as an ECE major.. I think she was good for a nice laugh and was pretty relatable. The only thing I didn't care for was the obvious lack of organization and communication with students. Would sometimes take a week or so for an email response post-COVID online.. I liked her, but I wouldn't take her again. Solid 6/10 for me.

sports and diversity class, simple powerpoint slides every week, discussion board, and journal. Final paper is the main focus, and don't bother buying either book. 6 week summer course, guy is cool but just was not very interesting class overall, overall like a 7.2/10
It is IMPOSSIBLE to get an A in this course unless you get 100% on every single assignment. Definitely avoid if you can. It is also a lot of work.

It is basically impossible to get an A in the course. It is also A TON of work. It is somewhat manageable given its online and professor permits using any sources but still too difficult. GPA dropper. Definitely avoid this class if you can.

Dr. Hilliard was an overall respectable professor, although he was difficult to communicate with. The class lectures were a little dull and I personally found it difficult to pay attention. There is a lot (A LOT) of online work, and the grading is true to the schedule. I recommend a study partner. I enjoyed the mood set in the room though. Fun guy.

Professor Hilliard is a great Professor, and you can tell that he really cares about his students and wants them to do well. Assignments are extremely easy, do them and you will receive at least a 90% on them. The final is a paper about a person of your choice who has suffered with drug abuse.
Humorous, gets the class engaged. Tests are open notes, HW assignments are tedious and have 1-3 per week. Swears on occasion. Absent a lot. Easy A.
He is great, I have learned a lot in his class. You can get easy A is his class if you show up and do your homework.

It's an easy class but he assigns a lot of homework. There are 2-3 assignments every week and sometimes they have 2-5 parts to them, which takes up a lot of time if you're taking this class as a general or elective class.

Professor Hilliard is a great professor. This was my first semester at Cleveland State, and I was nervous as to what to expect, but Hilliard made the class feel comfortable, joked with us, and always clarified what his expectations were for the class and homework. There is a lot of homework, but nothing too time consuming.
Its a very easy class, but a lot of homework each week. He also never responds to his emails. If you want a class that you don't have to think a lot about take this class

Easy and well constructed online course. Hilliard always responded in a timely manner to my emails and answered my questions efficiently. No final, just a final paper for a book you have to read. I would suggest this course to anyone who needs to take up random electives!

this class was really easy. if you need an elective, take this. he's understanding and knows that you have harder other classes, we sign an attendance sheet but if you miss class it's not a big deal. I take little to no notes in class and everything is basically common sense. he's a good teacher and he's cute too

There is a LOT of work for this class. 10 current events, 6 discussion boards, and a long paper on a biography you have to read. He expects a lot, but if you actually put effort in, it'll show in your grade.  Overall the class is really interesting and he gives great feedback. It's worth the work if you're looking for something interesting & easy.
Professor Hilliard is my absolute favorite teacher. His lectures weren't very long, and he is very clear and interesting to listen to. The class was simply a breeze. I would recommend to anyone!!

Interesting, but can turn very boring. 3 Quizzes (posted on Fri) due Sun -have 2hrs to write a 3 pg essay ea-, 6 Health Portfolios (use out sources to track diet, routine & exercise)*Essay format*, Discussions due every Wed (ppt presentations & textbook material)-200 wrds-, 2 Comments-100 wrds- due every Sun, 1 Final Exam. Points off for late work.

Dr. H is very knowledgeable about history and made this class super interesting! Her class consisted of a midterm, a final, and 4 papers. She also looks over drafts for the papers which is really helpful. Make sure you keep up with the readings, take good notes, and pay attention in lectures. If you have to take history at CSU, take it with her!

I took this class for fun my senior year and didn't find it too challenging. It may be a little more challenging for freshmen or sophomores. There's lots of writing, but she's willing to look over drafts, and also offers several opportunities for extra credit. I left the semester feeling as though I had learned a lot.
This is from a semester ago, but she is a really wonderful professor, would love to have her in the future.

Dr. H is THE BEST lecturer I had thus far. She makes info accessible for all disciplines! She is a very attractive woman, and her mannerisms are so cute! She is absolutely hilarious and the class is easy but it is because her lectures are info-filled and memorable. A professor to look for, especially for a gen. ed.
The class I have with her is a lot of discussion but it's pretty fun and interesting. She's really laid back and leads discussion well. I'd take her again if I had the opportunity.
She's very funny and her lectures were actually interesting. Very helpful and very accessible outside of class. A lot of readings and notes but nothing too difficult
Straight forward class and interesting. Dr. H knows the material and can answer your questions (she likes questions in class). Funny and interesting!
A very helpful professor.

So sweet. But she also has a sarcastic edge to her that makes her lectures interesting. She is not biased and respects your opinions whether you're liberal or conservative. One of the hottest professors I've had here.
Excellent professor. Makes the lectures very entertaining and easy to understand. Expresses herself in a very 'kinky' manner and is hilarious.
Online textbook which is free. Hot. Interesting class overall.
I ma so happy i had her for my history class. Her lectures were excellently organizeed and there were quite a few assignments but they werent too hard. Definitely take her for a U.S. history class.
Great class. I learned a lot about more recent history and also read some interesting things. A bit heavy on the readings but she chose good ones.
She is a fair grader and gives lots of extra attention to your papers if you need help. She's also very nice and easy-going and makes her lectures interesting with all the information she knows.
My favorite professor so far. There's some work but she'll help you if you try and she gave opportunities for rewrites. Funny too!
I loved her! She will always read over drafts and loves her subject!

Excellent Proffesor. Very Kind and passionate about what she teaches. There are a few papers to type. Shes not a hard grader, and if you ever need assistance she will help you. I wish i could have had her for lots of classes. The lectures are a joy to watch. -Fall 2016 His 112

She gives out papers every week midterm is a 5 page essay right after another 5 page paper is due. Same goes for the fine exam, lectures make you fall asleep..... If you have a choice get a different professor.
Terrible  teacher

Hirbawi was one of the best professors I have had since I've been in college. The class is really fast paced but that is going to be any college chem class. She does as many reviews as possible, after quizzes she even goes over the quiz and test review for the remainder of class. She cares a lot about students and their success!

Hirbawi was one of the best professors I have had since I've been in college. The class is really fast paced but that is going to be any college chem class. She does as many reviews as possible, after quizzes she even goes over the quiz and test review for the remainder of class. She cares a lot about students and their success!

Dr. Hirbawi is amazing! Her notes are all you need to pass the exams. She has a quiz and a review day before every exam so that everyone is prepared. She normally gives 5 extra credit questions on exams and 3-5 on quizzes! Do NOT be afraid to ask questions! Overall amazing professor!

Hirbawi was the bomb. The only negative is that she has very fast-paced lectures. But once you get past that, you'll understand everything really well despite the massive amount of content. She took the time to make sure everything made sense to everyone. Quizs/Exams were really easy with her grading structure. And she has a pet parrot... rad.

Jamila was phenomenal. If you dont go to class you will not pass, she writes down exactly whats on the quizzes and exams on the board so you do not have to search around for what you need to know. She lets you take a picture of the notes at the end of class she explains things extremely well and is very accessible. She gives a lot of extra credit

Would highly recommend her to anyone!! Especially people who aren't so good at chemistry. I had bad grades in chemistry all my life until I took her class. She teaches so fluidly. Show up to class and pay attention and you'll pass the class with ease. Also talked to her during office hours, she helped a whole lot and was super super nice.

Dr.H is the best professor you could have. She is always willing to work with you and truly wants her students to pass! She talks fast but teaches the class so well. As long as you go to her class you will pass. She is so sweet and awesome and you will love this class! I would take again.

Dr. Hirbawi is a great professor. She is very knowledgeable on the material she is teaching and she makes a point to explain things in more detail and she always points out what will surely be on the test. Before tests there are 2 review days were she goes over everything and answers any questions, and also gives the opportunity for extra credit!

She's very fast paced, but highlights important information that you need to know. She's very relatable to her students and pretty funny. She's relatively generous when it comes to grades, but it's really up to the individual student to keep up with her and with grades.

Believe we could miss 5 classes. Nice lady,I had previous interest in classical music. Found that she choose interesting and engaging music to listen to not "boring" classical music. 4 tests, 2 concert reviews, listening journal, all very manageable. Shes a bit opinionated and tends to ignore ignorant comments but she knows what shes talking about

Professor is unfair to students- bases your semester grade on ONE PAPER which she does not discuss in class. She may put off helping you with your paper until a later time, like after done advertising for her most recent book. Unfortunately, she teaches some of the required courses at CSU, so make sure your GPA is beefed up ahead of time!!
She's excellent! Just do the work, and you'll do well, but it's not necessarily easy!

Excellent professor.She's very passoinate about music. She admitted she wants every single student in her class  to get an A.She is awesome with the students and never makes them feel uncomfortable.As much as some answers are silly she will never tell you you're wrong,and somehow manage to link it with something relevant.She's also hot :P.

Dr. Hirsch is an easy professor if you go to class and take notes.  She gives a study guide and has a review session in class the day before the test.  As long as you pay attention in class it's an easy A.  She's passionate about music and that makes the class very interesting to go to. Very highly recommended.

I got over 100% in this class and I really didnt try, its that easy. Everything in the class comes from the reading assignments and is open book and it is very easy, impossible to fail if you complete the work. Clear criteria week to week and only a few questions needing done each week. Gave the class a 10pt curve at the end too! Super easy!

I got over 100% in this class and I really didnt try, its that easy. Everything in the class comes from the reading assignments and is open book and it is very easy, impossible to fail if you complete the work. Clear criteria week to week and only a few questions needing done each week. Gave the class a 10pt curve at the end too! Super easy!

My favorite professor so far. He is extremely caring, and wants his students to pass the course. I took this course online and he gave many chances for extra points throughout the semester. Would definitely take a course with him again!

Take this dude. Very helpful, gives a bunch of extra credit. If you want an A take him. Class was filled with either a discussion board or a quiz once a week, thats it. Funny, chill, intelligent. Makes the class fun. Literally can't say anything bad about this man. Cares about his students and grades.

Mr. Ho was the most fun professor I've ever had! He's a real energetic guy and doesn't just drone on and read from a slideshow, his lectures are really interesting and fun. He offers a good amount of extra credit and tests are pretty straightforward. Really fun class overall and would definitely take his classes again!!

Very amazing professor and would take again. You don't need to worry about the textbook, he is heavily lecture based and honestly the best teacher I could ask for, he is funny and witty, and tells you what is on the test, the exams can be difficult if you miss a day or what not so show up. TASC helped a lot as well.

Gives TONS of extra credit IN CLASS and curves tests to the max! If you show up,do ec assignments,and do adequate on tests,you will get an A. I learned little for a PSY course. His degree is in neuroscience,so that's what the class taught. If prerequisite, easy A! No textbook needed. Print out the slides! GO TO CLASS,slides confusing w/o attendance

I have taken two classes with Professor Ho, one in class and one online. Both were great and easy classes and I would recommend him to anyone. His lectures are straight to the point, he makes class expectations clear and his exams aren't difficult. Great professor and one of my favorites in the psychology department!

Alan Ho is a GREAT psych professor. He is very funny and he surprises you. For example, if you come to class there is a lot of extra credit opportunities involving himself, SO GO TO CLASS. His exams are quite easy and mostly comprehensive, just study HARD. SI sessions on exam day helped me prepare and to print out the slides. Good luck!

Professor Alan Ho was an easy grader for this online class. Honestly, it was ridiculously filled with endless amounts of homework. This online course is NOT one to forget about. Remember when the homework is due.  Otherwise, you might as well forget about your grade. Lastly, the online code is EXPENSIVE, but necessary to do the homework.
He's a solid teacher. Just do your work. You have to read the material & have an understanding of it. He is quick to fix any mistakes on his part & even offers extension & extra credit because of it.

The material can be hard to understand at times and this why you must go to class because he explains everything. Also he gives extra credit which helps a lot. Overall he is such a nice professor and understands how hard these classes can be and tries his best to explain the material.  Honestly one of the best professor yet.

I don't know why everyone keeps saying this class is easy, because it really isn't unless you're a neurology/neurobiology major. Ho is a nice guy who's really funny, but the material he gives is very overwhelming and technical. There are a lot of anatomical names and terms to remember.

He is really funny and friendly, but his slightly broken english can be hard to understand sometimes. As far as the class material, it can get VERY technical and confusing. He delves into the anatomical and biological aspect of everything and there is a lot of medical terminology. He gives tons of extra credit, but even THAT can be hard too.

I took both PSY 482 and PSY 487 with Alan and the courses worked very well together. If you can make it work take both of these classes together because the material is very similar. Alan is super understanding and helpful. The lectures are interesting and he grades each test with a curve.  He tells you exactly what to study before each test.
Awesome teacher! He will give some extra credit if needed. He has been so helpful and is easy to talk to. I would definitely recommend him to anyone!

Great prof! Funny, extremely knowledgeable, and very fair. He set clear expectations for his exams and there are never surprises. No text books! Go to class, pay attention, and you can easily get an A with little studying and no extra work. I loved the class and learned a lot from it.

Awesome guy! Funny. He gives 3 exams & a final, final is mandatory but he drops the lowest exam grade. Tests are mostly essay but he pretty much lets you know what you need to know. Very clear explanations & he gives a lot of extra credit. Class is interesting. As long as you show up no way not to get an A. Finished with 113% No textbook!

I enjoyed this class and wish it was for a full semester, not the summer. Dr. Hobby is down to earth and real. During the time of the riots for George Floyd, and Covid-19, she was very relatable, and sincere. She is honestly one of the best teachers I've had in my college career. I pray for more teachers like her to make this process easier.

I enjoyed this class and wish it was for a full semester, not the summer. Dr. Hobby is down to earth and real. During the time of the riots for George Floyd, and Covid-19, she was very relatable, and sincere. She is honestly one of the best teachers I've had in my college career. I pray for more teachers like her to make this process easier.

So, I was nervous about taking this course because 1) it was online and 2) I saw the amount of work that needed to be done for the class. However, Prof. Hobby made it a very smooth transition, especially with COVID-19. The work wasn't too much and she was very inspirational and fostered participation and great feedback throughout the course.

Amazing professor. You are graded only by two 6-8 page essays and some minor 1-2 page essays that she grades leniently. Her classes foster some really intriguing and informative discussions. She is also very understanding and is willing to help you whenever you need it. If you are reading this, do not even think twice about taking a class of hers.

One of my favorite professors at Cleveland state. Professor Hobby has an unconventional way of teacher where she lectures, then leaves most of the rest of the class for debate. Ive seen students share incredible stories, break down in tears, and create interesting debates. I would take Ms. Hobby over and over again if I could. Highly recommend.

I have to say this teacher is a very disrespectful person. I am a Democrat and voted for Hillary Clinton. However, my grandpa always taught me to be respectful to the office of the president and the person in it. While I dont always agree with the pres Trumo, I dont denigrate him. This woman pushes her own agenda. Agree with her craziness or lose

I had Dr. Hobby a few semesters ago and she's still one of my favorite professors. I had struggled in class at first but she encouraged me to try harder, even the slightest bit of effort on my part changed my grade completely. I appreciate her patience and kindness.

You must come to class to receive a good grade. The first 30 minutes are all pure lecture from the readings and the next 20 minutes are class discussion. There are weekly writing assignments that she grades very liberally and two 12 page papers. She is funny, sweet, and caring. I would definitely take a class with her again.
Was really fun!
A hot instructor and very fun in class.  She seems to be a globalist and pacifist, but she is open to hearing other viewpoints in class discussions, such as power politics.
Dr. Hobby is a wonderful professor. She is very understanding. I would love to have her as a professor again.

Professor Hobby is a nice person, she is usually kind to her students as well. Her lectures consist of reviewing the assigned reading material. I actually enjoyed the discussions held at the end of class. The only bad thing was her tough grading, she's very nit-picky. However, if she feels you're a hard working student, she will work with you.

20 points for participation with random writing assignments that you get credit for if you complete(as long as you're in class that day). Class has some great discussions. Bought all the books didn't keep up with readings but skimmed chapter before tests. Study guides are exactly like the tests

She's so cute and nice. Easy grader, easy A. Online assignments are easy and she always extends the deadlines. Her lectures get a little boring but if you engage with her it becomes very interesting. The writing assignments are easy A's too.

This class has a lot of reading but it's easy reading. There are only 4 tests and there's a 5 page paper on the one book not a final. She gives study guides that help you study for tests. She goes over reading content in like 20 minutes then the rest of the class was discussion. As long as you show up and participate you'll be fine.
Jeneen is extremely professional. She carries herself well and makes sure to get you an answer to your question no matter what. Very passionate professor.
She begins class by reading her own summary of the assigned readings - takes about 15 to 20 minutes. She then opens class up for discussion.

She's a good person but a terrible professor. Class consists of her reading a summary of the chapter before opening the floor to class discussion.  The class was an absolute waste of time - textbooks are idealistic at best, discussions are uncritical and undemanding, and actual learning is at a minimum. It's an easy class...I'll give her that.
She was very nice and helpful! Her lectures were slightly boring but her heart was in it.
