Dr. Hobby is a very knowledgeable and helpful. No homework assigned, subject was a little boring, but she tried to make as interesting as she could. I would take her again.

Dr. Hobby is a great professor if you choose to be an active student.  I have now taken two classes with her and both have been intellectually challenging discussion based classes.  Definitely take a class of hers if your not a shy person
Do not take this class.  Test are too hard.  Majority of that class is failing and he doesn't help at all.  Can't teach
not helpful nor nice
Very dry boring class. To intense for a 101 science class.  Needs to do a lot better. Try another professor. No one in the class was happy with him.
nice teacher, not happy with late people, very precise on test answers required tutoring for all points needed. only follows his lab time, others labs different. tests difficult

Dr. Hoffman is my favorite professor yet! He was very helpful when deciding to change my major. He tries to make class fun and the material is very clear cut. If you go to class there is no reason not to get an A/B.

Dr. Hoffman is my favorite professor yet! He was very helpful when deciding to change my major. He tries to make class fun and the material is very clear cut. If you go to class there is no reason not to get an A/B.

Professor Hoffman is super caring!! He is ready, willing, and able to help any of his students. Hated ACT 221, but had Professor Hoffman for ACT 222 and enjoyed it very much. Straight forward, tests were all online via Connect, and expectations were clear from the get.

100% the BEST professor I have had at CSU so far! Lectures are "mandatory" if you want to receive the attendance % but going to class is very helpful. He is very nice and respectful and doesn't berate you if you don't know the answer! 4/6 exams are online and homework is weekly but he sends out tons of emails reminding you of EVERYTHING that's due!

Ben was one of the best professors I have had at CSU. Very wholesome guy, likes to talk about his family and plays videos in class called "Wake up calls". He also makes the material easy to understand.

Although accounting can be a hard class I feel Dr. Hoffman does an amazing job teaching the class. There are weekly Learnsmarts and Connect homeworks but you get more than one attempt so they're not really that bad. Participation is part of your grade but he makes sure everyone answers questions. I liked him enough that I'm taking his 222 class too

Just as expected from an online course. Not very engaging but very easy - you have the whole week to do weekly assignments (mostly quizzes, few writing assignments) and 3 exams throughout the semester plus a final exam. Everything is open book. Dr. Hoffman was quick to respond by email to any questions or concerns. Easy A for GE requirements.

Just as expected from an online course. Not very engaging but very easy - you have the whole week to do weekly assignments (mostly quizzes, few writing assignments) and 3 exams throughout the semester plus a final exam. Everything is open book. Dr. Hoffman was quick to respond by email to any questions or concerns. Easy A for GE requirements.

Dr. Hoffman spells out in the syllabus what you have to do to succeed in this class. Its not an easy course bc THEORY but she finds ways to bring it down to a level we can get. Love her stories about fieldwork. Easily the most experienced prof in this program. Will take her classes again in the spring. Great lecturer! Wants students to succeed.

Very unclear grading criteria. When asking a question regarding grading, she directs to syllabus. She needs a class in how to properly assess students. All course information was straight from the text, she does not engage students.

I have taken a lot of online classes and this is by far the worst. Everything due for the week runs Tues-Thurs, not giving you the full week to work. The exams are only open 1 day and are 100 questions. She doesn't always respond to emails. Every week, you just read a chapter, take a quiz, and sometimes an extra assignment. I was not engaged at all

I was very disappointed with this professor. It was unclear what your grade would be in the class because she never posted a total, and she said things were weighted. I'm pretty sure she just makes up the grade. Everything had to be completed Tuesday-Thursday. The busiest days of the week. Would not recommend her.

She was very straightforward about what was expected and was open to discussion and feedback. The classes were interesting and she was very knowledgeable on the subject. She also had the best stories to tell about her career in anthropology.

She's a great professor! I learned so much in her class! The information is interesting enough, and then to have a great professor on top of that was spectacular.  You definitely have to read and show up to class, but as long as you try, it's pretty easy.

I taken a couple times now because she is the best online teacher I have ever had. The work load is not a lot, just do it by deadline and you will get an A. She was really involved for being online and the topics were cool to learn about. Take this class, easy gpa booster!

The lectures were lengthy, but I was 100% interested with what she had to say. Africa Map quizzes kinda sucked, but the exams and one paper were very easy. Just make sure to watch the videos. Don't need the book.

This class turned out to be blended, though it was listed as traditional. This is a shame, because the lectures are extremely interesting! The quizzes are occasionally difficult due to ambiguous wording. Overall, a very interesting class, but I would prefer more lectures and fewer articles.

took a hybrid class with her called sex, gender, and culture. Interesting topic and she is very knowledgable. Quizes and Tests were pretty tough, even being open note! print all the answers to her quizes and tests because that is what her midterm and final are.

Very difficult class. I took her hybrid online class. 1 extra credit opportunity presented. Quizzes are really hard but the midterm and final are basically all the quizzes put together. Hoffman is very interested in her subject. Made things interesting for me. Make sure you go to every class.

This ANT 100 course was taken over the Summer 2012 semester. Quizzes and Tests were all extremely easy - Term Matching/Multiple choice. A couple assignments required short essays to be written. The essays were graded fairly hard. The syllabus/instructions were NOT 100% succinct. An email sent to Dr. Hoffman asking for clarity went un-returned.
Easy class, 3 speeches and a few quizzes.attendance is mandatory. but she'll put you to sleep, she's is so MONOTONE and is very rude. would never recommend her as a professor
VERY DRY slept in half of her lectures then told me she marked me absent because I was not "mentally present" -_- attendance is mandatory takes note if your late as well

Class was easy overall, 3 presentations and a couple online quizzes, but Dr.Hoffman is VERY RUDE as well as stuck up. Did a presentation and she definitely graded me  unfairly. We did not need the book not once for this class, don't bother buying it.

Was very rude when asking a simple question on how to access the materials through the website. Maybe she wouldve been better in a class room setting instead of through an online class. Did not like teaching style at all!
Wonderful professor. Very fair in grading. I didn't expect to get so interetsed in class prior to semester. She turned my world around!
Wonderful professor. Lectures were very interesting. Class isn't hard and would recommend to others. Grade is based one paper, 3 exams, map quizzes, and attendance.

She is one of the Anthropology Dept's BEST PROFESSORS!  She finally offered Visual Anthropology and it was the best class I've ever taken! She even let us work with her personal research footage! Now trying to get her to expand this more and make Visual a big part of the program! EVERYONE SHOULD TAKE THIS COURSE AND SUPPORT HER!

Make sure you stay up with the homework and turn in every single assignment in on time and you will get an A. Professor Hogan gave me a 100% on every item I turned in. Just make sure that you read the resources and do the work. Easy A and no textbook required!
I enjoyed this class with Dr. Hogge. It was very helpful for me as a future counselor.
I enjoyed this class with Dr. Hogge. It was very helpful for me as a future counselor.

Dr. Hogge is an... interesting professor... This course was forced upon us and she did her best to teach it. I did not learn anything new, felt unappreciated in her course, and felt that if I did choose to participate she would belittle me. If I had the choice, I would NEVER take another course with her. Her lecture style was not interesting at all

This class was a joke. We spent the entire time discussing how you be weary of what you post on FB and what you search when using employer wifi. She was always cancelling class, and never actually got into relevant material. The second half of the semester, groups taught the class, and we never did receive our grades for the project. Avoid.

In my opinion she is not suited for teaching at least not 1Ls. She is all over the place most of the time and keeps us over to talk about herself. As a 1L all I want is the information I need to know clearly stated. Instead she assigns 30 pages and we go over maybe 3 of those due to her constant tangents. Very disorganized
don't like him at all

Dr. Holcomb is an excellent teacher. He really knows his stuff. He will review things 50 times if ne needs to. His tests are quick and easy & his review guides are essentially the test. He gives you his true opinion on things and doesn't care if you never come to class as long as you get an A.

Dr. Holcomb is great. a lot of times professors know the subject, but can't always teach it. Dr. Holcomb can teach. i have never so thoroughly understood any subject. no textbook. test quizes open notes.just do your assignments and show up he will make you understand. he is also a real great guy
This class was excellent...ESPECIALLY since Dr. Holcomb taught it!!!
As always, Dr. Holcomb is the way to go.

Dr. Holcomb is very awsome. His class can be very hard, but trust me he wants you to pass with an "A". He is always willing to help you. Plus there is no text book (at least mth 347). the best stat professor i ever had
Dr. Holcomb is an amazing professor! He really makes sure that you understand the material and applies it to every day life.

Very approachable & willing to help in and out of class. Keep up on your homework and you'll be fine. Doing homework everyday can get tedious but he quizzes you almost every class so be prepared! His projects can be extensive (15-20 pages) but you'll learn stats and that's the point right? Class is pretty informal & can be fun.
One of the best Math professor in CSU.

There needs to be more professors like him!  I have now taken him twice and hope I get to take him again!  Lots of work in the class but nothing that is not managable.  Do all your work and go to class and you will be ok.  Great guy in and out of the classroom!
he is an awesome professor and very funny, he gets you interested in the course and keeps you interested in the course.

The best math professor at CSU.  A very knowledgeable educator.  Also very funny.  CSU needs more math professors like Dr. Holcomb.  The material in the 493 course is difficult but Dr. Holcomb teaches everything thoroughly.  Tests are open book, open notes, and not difficult if you take notes.

CSU's best math professor by a large margin and the best instructor I've had at CSU.  He truly cares about each student's progress.  He goes into great detail on topics.  Very approachable.  An asset to CSU.

Dr. Hollinger was a great teacher, who not only taught the theoretical aspects, but how to apply that knowledge in the world. She was profession and yet caring, even after graduation. Largely because of her, I am still working in my field 34 years later.

I had Dr. Hollinger about 25 years ago from undergrad to advanced graduate study.  She remains my favorite prof ever.  She believed in me before I believed in myself.  I owe my wonderful career to her.

She's extremely interested in the topic she teaches and is very laid-back and easy going. She uses a lot of techniques to help you get a good grade. You can easily get an A if you go to class and put in some effort. I recommend this class to everyone because it is interesting and easy.

the content of her lectures can be very interesting, though they sometimes seem random and disconnected. easy class and you can do well if you attend most classes and skim through the book. the book for the class is really interesting. she always gives a review before the exams, which was incredibly helpful.

Holly was one of the many things making this class fun. While sometimes you have to deal with some tough love in her directions, she helps you to understand the concepts and give the best performance possible. Would recommend this class to anyone interested in acting.

Holly was one of the many things making this class fun. While sometimes you have to deal with some tough love in her directions, she helps you to understand the concepts and give the best performance possible. Would recommend this class to anyone interested in acting.

Holly is tough, but that is because she expects her students to respect her art and put forth a real effort. Don't take her personally, but she does push her students to do the best they can do. She clearly knows her stuff and has taught me so much about acting. If you respect her, she will respect you--plain and simple. Amazing teacher and class.

Holly for Voice and Movement class was amazing! I am not going to lie she is very serious, expects you to be professional,  and to push yourself farther than you've ever been pushed in your entire life. But her class will teach you all about exploration and imagination, and how far you can go. Holly is passionate and is an inspiration to me!

Holly is extremely talented and wise. She shows passion for her work and it is inspiring, but she tends to be a little high-strung and therefore commonly demands professionalism in her classes that some students may be unused tointimidated by. She does not usually take sass well and tends to make students self-conscious with her abrasiveness.

Holly is fantastic! She has the ability to bring out things in you as an actor that you didn't know where there. She works with you on breaking any bad habits that read as insincere on stage. You will learn how to be "present" as well as professional behavior. I would definitely recommend her class to anyone serious about acting.
Holly is extremely passionate about teaching and her field. She cares about how you do if you do. No matter how 'strange' some may find her methods, they undeniably work!
Very nice and helpful. She helped me grow a lot in my acting and she'll help you discover new things. Major rules are be on time and take it seriously.

Holly is amazing. She is passionate about what she does and it shows through her teaching. She truly cares about her students. She may have some "weird" rules, but in the end they help you grow as an actor and individual.

She knows her stuff, it might seem crazy but it works. Really fun class but be prepared for work. And don't be late and if you are just go because she won't let  you in and if she does you won't get credit.

she is nice, but has a set way of how you should act. If she thinks that is the way you would act, then that is the only way you can act. Don't be late on performance days, unless you're failing and magically that rule goes away. Suck up and always do what she says and you'll get a good grade. Sometimes really fun sometimes just so frustrating.

This was easily my favorite class! I had so much fun and it made me want to wake early on monday mornings. Holly has weird rules but they end up making sense. Be on time! That is one of her biggest rules but it makes sense also. Have fun, I know I'm going to take one of her other classes next semester!
Very fun professor, if you are interested in the topic you can learn a lot from her. Attendance is mandatory and she has strange rules that dont make sence at first but they will later...Great class!
Shes pretty cool teacher.

Easily one of the best classes I've ever taken.  Reading material (for once) had something to do with the class itself, plus all of it was tons of fun!  She's strict on punctuality, but given the nature of the class that's not so bad.  She's a great teacher, and willing to help out wherever she can.

Nice professor! I took her my first semester in college. Some work, not a lot. Her class is always fun. For those who likes to take a lot of notes and memorize it is not a good choice to take her. Otherwise she is a great professor.
best of luck to who takes this. Thats all I'll say.

Professor Holt is my favorite professor at Cleveland State. Your grade is made up of a midterm, two papers (pass or fail - easy!), and a final. The tests are over numerous chapters but if you read, she uses the exact examples from the book. Work in groups everyday, but it's not bad at all. I highly reccomend taking her if you can!

Tough class. Didn't like that there was only a midterm worth 30% of my grade and a final worth 50% of my grade which was cumulative. She was an okay professor, but she honestly didn't do much, told us what the assignment was and we'd work in groups for most of class then go over it at the end. Need to read the book and take good notes from it.

Great teacher.  She explains all the important points at the end of class.  You work in groups at the beginning of class to answer questions. If you read the chapters for each class and study the points discussed in class the 2 tests (midterm/final) are not too hard. The 2 papers are pass or fail so no stressing about them.

Thought is was a horrible experience at the time, but now that i've had other laws classes she's not that bad. worse part was 10+ chapter tests with only 30 ques. wow and the papers are simple she justs writes a check on them. i def didnt study for the tests but i recommend you read in order to pass the exams. she def doesnt want to fail anyone!

You basically come to class and do group work all semester long, while she sits on her ass and stares at the ceiling. And if u miss more then 3 classes she makes you write a 8 page paper.  And when it comes to the test "everything is fair game" meaning even small unimportant sections from the book were fair game on the test. Definitely stay away fr

awesome lady, just freakin' read and you'll have no probs.  Outline the main pts of the chapter yourself, when the tests comes your more than prepared.  Papers are a cinch.  And she's super nice.  if your a stoner or lazy the class is not for you.  aren't your other classes hard enuff?  so why bag on an easy teacher?

DO NOT TAKE HER!! She does NOTHING! Group work every day while she just sits up front. You do and learn nothing. THEN you only have a midterm and a final which are both over 13 chapters. Our test was 30 multiple choice questions... OVER 13 CHAPTERS!!! Would not tell us what to study.. basically here is a book.. now take a 30 questions test on it.
Very nice lady!  Easy class as long as you read

Super nice lady!!  There is a lot of group work in the class, but it keeps class interesting!   You have to read the book to do well on exams.  As long as you do the two papers, you get full credit.  Make sure to do the extra credit! She is very helpful when you have questions!  Good teacher!
BORING! 99% group work. She does next to nothing when it comes to teaching. Her tests are literally copied and pasted together, a total joke. Don't know why she is still employed at CSU.

As long as you attend class, scan the chapters, and do the vocab extra credit you should be fine. 2 papers were assigned and they were super easy as long as you listen to the main library librarian on how to do them. group participation is a big part.

It's a law class - expect to read.  She is fair and not as hard compared to the other teachers.  She explains things over and over to make sure you grasp the concept.  The groupwork is basically a review of the things you should have read - I had fun in this class.  If you're unsure of something, ask - she will clarify - I found her to be great.
No Comments

Way too much emphasis on group work. No review for exams. Final is comprehensive and there is no indication of what to study. You must read over 400 pages in book to prepare for. The class is based out of 100 points so there is no room for error. I recommend taking Friend or McClain.
One of the best Accounting professors at CSU. Reasonable amount of homework & challenging but fair exams. Highly recommend.
One of the best Accounting professors at CSU. Reasonable amount of homework & challenging but fair exams. Highly recommend.

Wonderful professor. Intermediate II is a tough class, but he does a great job of breaking down the material in a way that is easier to understand. His tests are really fair and he gives partial credit. High recommend!

Dr. Holtzblatt was very funny and kept the class entertaining through the term. There are no pluses and minuses in the class so beware of this. The material is not that hard, but there is a lot of homework and most of your grade comes from the test 85%, which are semi easy. He is the best accounting teacher I have taken so far at CSU.
He's a really nice guy. He's much nicer than most accounting profs. He is strict about being there one time, so please just come on time. Class isn't too difficult, just a lot of homework.

He is extremely knowledgeable about what he teaches. He tries to make the class as entertaining as possible with jokes and real world examples. Usually a written assignment due every class. Hands down my favorite professor at CSU.

Professor Holztblatt is a nice guy who makes class enjoyable with a sense of humor that's dry but is still refreshing in an accounting class. There's homework due every class which can be hard to keep up with. Exams are fairly easy, most of the class finished the final within 40 minutes.  He's passionate about accounting and cares about students.

Absolutely loved Professor Hood! She is the most caring and understanding professor I've ever had. She understands students have a life outside of school and is very lenient with late assignments/grades. She also tells a lot of stories about her teaching experiences and is very inspiring and motivating. Definitely recommend!

Absolutely loved Professor Hood! She is the most caring and understanding professor I've ever had. She understands students have a life outside of school and is very lenient with late assignments/grades. She also tells a lot of stories about her teaching experiences and is very inspiring and motivating. Definitely recommend!

Dr. Horowitz it hands down the best professor I've had. This opinion covers 3 separate colleges. He is engaging and really makes students feel cared for. I regret not being able to meet him in person as in-person classes had been cancelled due to COVID. Even in web-based classes, he made me feel involved. I can't wait to have him again this Fall :)

Dr. Horowitz it hands down the best professor I've had. This opinion covers 3 separate colleges. He is engaging and really makes students feel cared for. I regret not being able to meet him in person as in-person classes had been cancelled due to COVID. Even in web-based classes, he made me feel involved. I can't wait to have him again this Fall :)

He has been the best teacher for an online course I have ever had. He gives a voice recording every week giving some input on the assignments. Everything is very clear on expectations and the textbook for the class was only $10.

I cannot recommend Dr. Horowitz enough. He is easily the most engaging and organized professor I have had the pleasure of learning from at Cleveland State. Not only is good at teaching and keeping his students interested, but he really does seem to care about his students. If you want to succeed, he will go out of his way to help you do so.

Trust me, you want to take his class. Online or in person, I've never had a more organized or engaging professor. The feedback he gives for papers really shows how much he cares for the work you put in.

Great professor who puts pertinent material on the course content for the week and has clear expectations for the course. The material is a great learning tool for the class and balances between written assignments and exams.

Great guy and great professor. His lectures were very interesting and I actually looked forward to coming to class. Out of all the COM classes I have taken so far, I have learned the most from him. Definitely recommend taking this class. It's easy, fun, and entertaining.
One of my favorite professor, super caring and makes class very fun! You can tell he loves his job and that shows with his energy and excitement he brings to class every day, 10/10 great professor.

I enjoyed his online course. He did not make us purchase the book. He provided PDF's of the chapters online. I have learned so much information in the course. The material is so interesting and educational of course. I would take another online class with him again. Course is very organized.
Definitely a class/professor for someone who likes discussion! He makes class fun. I would 100% take another class with him.

Horowitz filled in for our normal professor because he got injured and could no longer teach. The class is easy if you show up and pay attention. I have had Horowitz for multiple classes and it is always the same--he is unorganized, moody, and sometimes funny.
Dr. Horowitz the professor is usually fine. Can be moody. Oftentimes lets outside issues dictate how he is in class. Don't get on his bad side.
Hes a good professor and all his quizzes and exams are online and he give you a good amount of time to take it
He really kept us engaged during the lectures and I enjoyed the projects we had to do.

Dr. Horowitz gives good feedback on your papers and in order to succeed, you must revise. He gives a lot of "busy work" for homework. It is fun to get to choose your own story ideas and write about something that interests you. You have to be in class and you have to participate, which is tough for being who are shy or have anxiety.
He's great, really gets in depth with the material and when you turn in an article he takes time to break it down with you and help you become a better writer.

Gives way too many pointless assingments. Acts like his class is the only one students are taking. The overall class is worth around 2,000 points, which is fine, but half of the assignments are petty and not helpful. Do not take as an elective. The class drags on and is not entertaining.

Dr. Horowitz was one of my favorite COM professors at CSU.. he has a way of engaging with the class and definitely knows what he is talking about. He can be kind of a tough grader on things you have written but is very open to meeting with you and discussing where you went wrong and how to not make the same mistakes. Take his classes if you can.

I loved Professor Horowitz & this class. He's beyond helpful, clear, fun, & educational. I've learned so much from him because he truly cares about his students & wants them all to succeed. His lectures are mostly entertaining & he's very lively & gets students involved with class discussion. I'm excited to take more classes with him!
i love professor horowitz, i've had him before and by far one of the better instructors in the journalismcomm department at CSU. knows what he's talking about and cares about everyone doing well.
Easy class because it is well organized. Very easy to follow directions b/c Horowitz is clear. You have to keep up on weekly work. Recommend this class.

GREAT PROFESSOR! if you get to know him. He has a great dry sense of humor I thought he was hilarious. I came to class late everyday because I commute, but he didn't hold it against me. He actually turned it into a joke. I personally loved this class. its not the easiest class but he does a great job using graphs and not math to explain. GREAT PROF

Very hard class. Cool guy but he's extremely hard to follow.  Reading book is the only way to help for tests.  He has a big grade curve so 80% is an A.  He let my class use a notecard on our tests and the final, which was the first time he ever did that.  This professor does make this class harder than it should be.

I really regret taking this professor. He never did a "real" lecture. His notes consisted of just random problems written out all across the board with no explanation. Hated the graphing caculator so he NEVER explaned it. showed ALL problems the long handed way. He was extremely impatient when you asked questions to be a professor. DO NOT TAKE HIM!
He's a cool and nice guy, but a very hard teacher. Most likely you will be working harder than you should be for this class and still not receiving the grade you want.

taking this guy for my mth 149 class was a big mistake. he is not helpful when it comes to questions we don't understand and his explanations are horrible. i learned more by just reading the book and doing the homework then showing up to class to hear him teach. we would spend almost the whole class time on ONE problem...don't take him!!

No reason to show up for class.  He is often unprepared, appears to not know the material beyond surface level, and is frequently incapable of answering the test questions he gives out.  His lectures barely related to test materials at all, tests are generic (and really hard) versions that the textbooks author created.  Worthless clas  Do not take

Pretty cool and funny guy, can be offensive at times though. His humor is dry. Nice guy, curves grades a lot so that 80% is an A is much needed. Gets progressively harder, my first test was my best. He drops 1 test of the first 5 and then there is a final which is just a regular test. Don't let him scare you the first few days. READ the book.

He is a cool guy but the class is very tough. He lectures on one thing but when it comes to the exams he will give you a standardized one from the book. If you read the chapters every time thoroughly you will be fine. If you just go to class and dont read... good luck

I would advise not to take his class if you want a passing grade. You will pretty much have to rely only on reading the book because his teaching style is horrible, and sometimes the book itself isn't enough. The exam questions are also very confusing and difficult even though they are multiple choice.

The topic matter of the class is interesting, but I think that more emphasis on applications of the concepts was needed, as well as more emphasis on real life case studies. Theory in itself is not enough to become a competent professional. Also, I looked at my watch and found out that we are in 2011. What about dumping the blackboard already?

If you want an easy A-then his class is NOT for you. I liked how he structured his exams: no easy questions, detailed and lots of graphs and few math problems. You will have to actually study to GET a good grade in his class. And btw he gives plenty info: study exams and answers 2 end of chapter questions.Dont you deserve anothe gyrus 4 your brain?

He is witty and approachable, yet is simply not your best option.I came to every class and took what I thought were good notes and failed.Class is based on 6 test scores and he drops the lowest of the 6. A good number of students drop the class by midterm. I thought that I could figure out his class and pass. I was wrong.
Looks like Clint Eastwood.  Hard subject and he doesn't teach that well but he has a adjusted grading scale.  Very smart man, just not the world's greatest teacher.

You should check this proffesor out. He knows the material well, has a good sense of humor and it is always inteesting to listen to him. If you listen to what he says, take your notes and read the book, you will have A. Helps a lot with the questions you have about economics, but his tests were a little bit lame-different from example tests a lot.
awesomee

Entertained class on regular basis.  The book for class was very easy to read.  Material was hard, but if you read book it becomes much easier to understand.  Horton was always willing to go over problems multiple times.  He may seem annoyed, but he isn't that's just his very out going personality.  He's very good, impossible to fail.

I would definitely take Horton again. He makes the class virtually impossible to fail. Our class was broken down into 6 quizzes, the last quiz being a noncomprehensive final. I also enjoyed his jokes.

Overall, he was a very entertaining professor (especially if you like dry humor). Tests are difficult, but not to the point where you cannot get a decent grade if you study. Econ is not supposed to be fun or easy. Prof. Horton prepared our class really well for the final exam...:)
He can't be that hard if a 50% is passing in his class.

An ok teacher, makes things a bit more complicated than they need to be. Definitely knows what he's talking about though. He's a fresh breath of conservatism in the bastion of liberalism that is academia!

Dr. Horvath is very passionate about his research and developing his students. He cares about being fair to his students and puts a lot of effort into that. Dr. Horvath teaches for comprehension and mastery. If you ask a question you should expect a thorough answer. If you're willing to work for that mastery you'll find he's well worth taking.

Dr. Horvath is very passionate about his research and developing his students. He cares about being fair to his students and puts a lot of effort into that. Dr. Horvath teaches for comprehension and mastery. If you ask a question you should expect a thorough answer. If you're willing to work for that mastery you'll find he's well worth taking.

easy intro class, and very dedicated teacher- always asking if we are engaged enough and did interactive activities. Allowed for a lot of extra credit opportunities for showing up. Showing up is not needed but such a good idea, because his lessons are well explained in person, and interesting conversations are always happening. Tests are easy!

This class was new just added as a core area for psychology students. Really enjoyed this class and gained knowledge on what to do with psychology degrees thru all levels. He really does want his students to pass. Participation and attendance is a part of your grade
I think if he didnt give homework back to back and actually make things more clear I would have passed bu

Easily one of the best professors I've ever had. He puts in so much time and effort into his students that you can't help but want to give that exact effort back into the class. He will always be there for you to answer a question, etc. I've never had a more fair professor that cared so much about getting his students where they need to be!!
Dr. Horvath is the rare professor who went the extra mile for me.  He took  the time to make sure I thoroughly  grasped the material.
Use his office hours . You can't go wrong if he sees you trying    This course can be hard if Stats is not your strength. But it can be accomplished

Horvath is an awesome professor. He has such a great way of explaining everything. He is also very patient and very willing to help those who need it. Gives 12 points extra credit. Great GREAT professor.

Dr. Horvath shows how compassionate he is about his work & students. I appreciate the level of priority he's shown over all. I've NEVER had a professor stay behind to tutor & make certain you get it. He's hopefulof your passing without any doubt. His corny jokes are funny, he's sarcastic, approachable and makes stats EASY to learn.
Dr. Mike is a great teacher! I am not the most mathmatical person and he managed to make stats easy and FUN! I never thought that I would find stats fun-ever.
He's AWESOME!!!!
he's great

Dr. Horvath is a fantastic professor. He is extremely passionate about his teaching and his research, and he make his class interesting and fun. He is willing to help you with anything you are struggling with and he is extremely patient. He is one of the nicest professors I have had.

Dr. Mike is an excellent professor who loves to teach, what a novel concept. He is always eager to help, and by far the most thrilled professor I?ve had yet. Not only will you walk out of his class having learned something, you will have a great experience while doing so.

Horvath is a really good prof.  Seems to genuinely enjoy teaching and is very helpful and clear.  That said,I sometimes found him a little arrogant,though I suppose it could have just been confidence.He definitely has favorites, it was really hard to come into a class nearly full of students he's had before, felt like I was late to the party.

Dr. Horvath is an AWESOME professor. He is really passionate about the subject and he definitely wants his students to understand the material. He DOES NOT ramble like the previous student says, he EXPLAINS the material. He DOES answer students questions, he also memorizes everyone's names. He is always there for help and he is a generous grader.

He's a great professor! Very willing to help and explains concepts until you understand them. Exams are a little tough and require studying. His office is always open during office hours if you have any questions.
Talkative, he rambles alot! Does not like to be enterupted and never prepared to answer some questions.
Amazing.  He is passionate about his subject and really wants you to learn.  He requires you to be an active participant in class. Extremely helpful and interested in his students!
No Comments

Dr. Hostutler was an engaging professor. Her course provided an interesting examination of the leadership issues affecting the nursing profession. Understanding of material is reinforced through group projects with other classmates. Feedback is given on course assignments to improve future performance. I would recommend Dr. Hostutler.

Class converted online from COVID and it was alright. It was a recorded lecture once/wk, zoom meeting, and weekly worksheet that you had to fill out. I think she tried her best w/ online class but was not tech savvy. Slow grader. Don't think she curved exams but they were also mediocre. Loves shock & resp on tests. Textbook sucks, I only used ppts!

Dr. Hostutler was an engaging professor. Her course provided an interesting examination of the leadership issues affecting the nursing profession. Understanding of material is reinforced through group projects with other classmates. Feedback is given on course assignments to improve future performance. I would recommend Dr. Hostutler.

Awful professor. The class work was very easy, however, it seems like she does not actually enjoy teaching and is very unclear in her instructions. I switched entire schools since I know I'd have to take another class with her and have never been happier!
She was available to help whenever needed. Grade things in a timely fashion. This was the easiest class I have ever had.

This was a tough graduate class for me. Dr.C presented material in a way that made it easy to understand and apply to my field practice. Taker her up on phone calls/office meetings as she will really break things down without making you feel silly for asking questions.
she teaches from TEDtalks only. I could watch TEDtalk as home for free.
would not recommend

Dr. Hovland is an insightful professor. Her teaching style consists of lectures, videos, and student presentations. The course was very educational and eye opening for those who plan to pursue the Social Work profession. Would definitely take her again.
Seriously rude to her students. Very unapproachable and uncomfortable. Does not like being questioned.
Dr. C was wonderful! She provided lectures which both educated, and inspired. I highly recommend taking any class she teaches! She is a gem at CSU.

Dr. C really relates course content to our field experience. She makes the readings applicable to actual practice. I am so grateful to have taken this Aging course in my last semester as an MSW student (wish I had taken her for more).  Classes are interactive and not boring. When she says she will partner with you in your learning she means it.
Cares about student success.

Cyndi was a fabulous teacher and was there for you and caring. She is a very nice person and her class was very discussion based. There are only 2 exams (midterm and final) and two projects which were fairly simple and straight-forward. She gives a good amount of extra credit. I would take her again.
Dr. C creates a class that is facilitated by the students.  This is a graduate course, so the work load is moderate  and conducive to personal and professional growth.
Dr. C's class was self-propelled by the participation of the students. This is a graduate course and it facilitates growth both academically and professionally.
Mrs. Howard is a wonderful professor she is knowledgeable about the social work field.  She is very personable . Her lectures are engaging. She adds great value to the Social Work Department!!!!

She is Awesome. She takes the time to listen to your ideas and if something is not right, she will let you do it over. There is some extra credit and little homework. She is tough on participation and does use the book, along with notes taken. Please read the assignments the night before because she will call on you and expect you to answer.
She's an easy A. I would take her class if you have more challenging classes to take that semester.
Great professor, very devoted to helping student be successful.  As long as you read every week and do the five papers, you're good.  Easy A
One of the best Professors I have ever had. She is very knowledgeable on Law, answers questions efficiently. Very friendly.

Professor Hrivnak is a wonderful professor. She is organized, and lectures with a view to clarity. She is also concerned with the well being of the students. Compassionate concerning her work. Her work ethic is impeccable. If she can't assist students, she provides resources to point them in the right direction. Once agin, it was my pleasure.
So far best professor I had in Cleveland State uni. Class is not easy and she is very strict. But well exam guide, kind grade. Good.

Best prof I have had yet. Dr. Hrivnak is the kind of teacher I wish I had for every class. Gives a very clear outlines, power points, readings, etc. She gives great examples of the material, encourages class participation, discussion and questions. Makes sure that you have all the tools to understand the subject. She was wonderful!

Let me just say that Prof Hrivnak is the kind of professor that you want to take multiple classes with.  She's helpful, knowledgeable, and an all around terrific person.  I'll actually miss her after I graduate.  She's one heck of a teacher, and she taught me the majority of the valuable information that I will ACTUALLY USE in my career.

She loves being helpful and nice to finally find a professor that tells you EXACTLY what they are looking for--she'll even look over your assignment before you turn it in. If you have to miss a test date, she'll reschedule with you. Talks a little fast, but so what-ask questions if you need to. no book used, this class is helpful if you took stats

Dr. Hrivnak is awesome. Very clear and knows her material. No textbook was used for this class but articles were posted online. Generally necessary to read the article and be able to discuss important points. Dr. Hrivnak is AWESOME!
My girlfriends and I love Dr. Hrivnak. She is so nice and helpful!! Very smart.

Really enjoyed the class. If you have to take this class, don't take it with anyone else. This class has all the attributes to make your life easy, especially if you are non-HR major. Attendance: NOT mandatory, Assignments: NONE, Projects/Papers: NONE, Exams (3): manageable (EASY for HR majors), Professor: lenient, fair, kind & extremely helpful.
I wish my schedule would allow me to take more classes with Dr. Hrivnak!  She is very passionate about the material and an excellent teacher.
Very nice professor. There are a total of 3 essay exams and a handful of assignments. Dr. Hrivnak is very fair with respect to grading and does everything she can to esure her students succeed.

I have enjoyed this class so far, the professor is nice and tries to make a boring subject interesting. Also, her tests are overall ok but the MCQ's are sometimes really intricate and tough to figure out and that's what ends up being the deciding factor between a good and a decent score. But, overall it seems to be a course worth taking with her.

I like this professor. I took two of her classes so far and dont have any complaints. She is extremely helpful. Lectures are somewhat fast paced and if people start asking questions she can get off track and you will get lost! however this doesnt happen too often. Be very detailed when writing the essay part of the test and you will do very well.

She is a good professor. She talks very fast, but she is funny and friendly and very accomodating. She follows up on questions students have and does not care whether or not you attend class. She covers all the lectures through PowerPoint and puts them on Blackboard as well, so you can review them if you miss class. She does not use the textbook...
She is a great Professor. She teaches fast in the class. Her exams are not that tough. She give grades beyond the expectation.  I am gonna take her class again..

So far Dr. Hrivnak has been the best professor I've had at CSU.  Very helpful, reasonable and friendly. One quiz and 3 exams that varied a little in degrees of difficulty as some covered more material then others.  Book is not mandatory, but I recommend buying it as she is a fast talker and lecture is based on the book.
highly recommended. easy to work with.  Exams were pretty much based on lectures covered in class.
exactly like 11.08 said.. extremely helpful with anything you need.. very knowledgeable about hr anything.. good nature in general.. take her !

Very good teacher.   Gives generous curves on exams when students don't do well.   20% of the grade was based on easy homework assignments from the book.    80% were 3 exams: (30%, 30%, 20%).  The day before each exam she does a review.  Pretty fair.   Highly recommended.

The class was very interesting and applicable to the field.  The case studies were very involved, but they were indicative of the real world work activitiy.  If you come to class, read, and study the class is very well woth taking!  At least with this class I know I got my money's worth!
I thought she was fair.  Good teacher

I took MGT 340 online. All of the work is easy and all online (obviously) with 1 homework and 1-2 quizzes or mini assignments due every week. I missed 1 homework and 1 mini assignment and she WOULD NOT let me do them for partial credit. I finished with an 89.55% and she WOULD NOT round me to an A. Easy class but shes by the book which is annoying

What can I say about Hruby.. His course demands a heavy work load, but if you show up to all the classes and participate and catch his attention you'll do fine. I should have by all means got a D or lower but walked out with a B- he's a nice guy for sure.

took 465 in the summer,good move. very demanding course. never uses text but tests are from the book. a lot of busy work. 2 major assignments and they are very important. most of the things ppl are saying are true, but i still liked him and the cousre def was not that bad. basically, try very hard on SERTC & LERTC (THE 2 MAJOR ASSIGNMENTS)

Obnoxious, incomprehensible, pompous professor. He can?t seem 2 remember anything aside from useless stories. Charges over $70 for book he made, although looks like it was a preschooler. Doesn?t give info u need 2 work ahead so u are always scrambling at the last minute. Course is a COMPLETE waste of time! (unless u want 2 be a financial analyst)

Professor Hruby is a really nice guy. The class is interesting but you will have a lot of homework and in class work. Attendance is very important. I do not recommend taking the class along with another class that demands a lot of your time. You will feel overwhelmed at times but will leave the class feeling like you learned a great deal.

Show up to class everyday, don't cut.  Humor the teacher and at least pretend like you care.  There is a lot of work dealing with analyzing companies and looking over financial statements.  Get in a good group for the last project, it's important.  Don't slack off just do all the annoying HW assignemnts.  Do all this and you'll be fine in his class

Professor Hruby is a very nice and interesting guy. The class is a ton of work but you learn a lot. I would not take another time consuming class along with this one. The homework is not hard, and as long as you do it you will get a decent grade in the class. The subject matter is very detailed yet interesting.
Tough class, fair minded Professor, makes you work very hard, but worth it in the end.
His exams were hard.....but exams only made up 40% the grade. There were also projects, participation, etc. that made up 60% of the grade.   He's not as bad as most of the comments on here say.
Seem to keep talking about nothing relevant to the topics.
Professor is very helpful and tends to give busy work. If you show up and try to understand the material you will do just fine.  Makes work sheets for all topics covered which are very helpful.

This class is completely waste your time and money. Work overloaded, he will keep you busy every day.The biggest problem, he graded students unfairly, if he likes you and you BS enough in the class, you will get a good grade, otherwise, good luck on you.

Full of himself.  Repeatedly says, "You will come back and thank him."  The only thing you'll be thankful of is when this useless class is over.  He has favorites and it shows when he is grading the SERTC and LERTC's.  I got an A and B on the two tests and a D for the class.  Not to mention his voice sounds like Barney from the Andy Griffith Show.

Highly recommend. His class is very easy if you come to class and do the work sheets it's really impossible to fail. He makes the material very easy to understand. My lowest grade was a C+. You won't need the book the entire semester he didn't even teach from it. Assigned some problems for the first month just to get you started but that's it.

He does a poor job of preparing students for exams. Exam questions were somewhat different from study guide. Exams make up 40% of the grade.The other 60% is a combination of stuff. He sends confusing emails containing too much info. And he gives assignments that aren't even on the syllabus.  Maybe tolerable, but I don't recommend him.He's an idiot.
very horrible experience

HORRIBLE, his voice is a nightmare, he thinks like if we live only to do work for his class like has nothing else in life but to make himself as annoying as possible terible very terible don't even try ignore this he's very terrible I have no idea why is he still teaching he should get fired
He is a great teacher...I really learned a lot in his class!

He's not as bad as what people make him out to be.  He is very dry and alot of "busy" work.  Overall the class is not very useful but not that terrible best to take in 6 weeks instead of 16 thats for sure!
The people below are not lying. He accuses people of cheating and will not hesitate to give you a flat out 0. Worst professor by far out of my 150+ credit hours.

By far the worst teacher I have ever had!!!! He doesn't know what he's talking about at all, He tries to act like he's some big shot, but when you google him there is nothing! He always interrupts, completely irrational- all around awful!!

Basically non-existant throughout the course of the class. Doesn't respond to emails or phone calls re: any questions. Entire class was very frustrated and many people dropped just to take it under someone else. Worst Prof I've had so far in the MBA program. Highly recommend you DON'T take ACT under this prof unless you are an acct whiz already.

Online class, NEVER emails back. Doesn't tell you what to expect on exams. Has hw & quizzes setup through textbook co. Don't know why university pays her, she's not helpful. Her grad assistant probably did all the work. If account is not your strong pt don't take her. Could tell the class was frusterated through group emailing & discussions.

Dr. Huang is great and can be good for a laugh from time to time. I enjoy her positive attitude and good energy. However, although she's an amazing person, the lectures can be very mundanely delivered. In the afternoon sessions I find myself falling asleep and by the time class is over I can't remember what we talked about. LOTS OF GROUP PROJECTS!!

Professor Huang is a nice person but her instructions for assignments are extremely confusing and don't really make sense. I also had to take this class remotely due to covid and she made us do several group projects over zoom which was a disaster. She does give a lot of extra credit opportunities though. She is a tough grader!

she can be nice but she's a very interesting grader and i do not mean that in a good way. she's so picky when she's grading. and directions for the projects have not been clear whatsoever, mainly just confusing and worded weirdly. i lowkey feel like i learned nothing in this class. big yikes.

Dr. Huang is great and can be good for a laugh from time to time. I enjoy her positive attitude and good energy. However, although she's an amazing person, the lectures can be very mundanely delivered. In the afternoon sessions I find myself falling asleep and by the time class is over I can't remember what we talked about. LOTS OF GROUP PROJECTS!!
very tough grader make sure to use the writing center because she's very picky on citations/plagiarism WAC course so check grammar critically

Make sure you choose good people to work with for your group projects or you won't pass. Also, take your focus paper to the writing center to be checked BEFORE you turn it in. Dr. Huang is  a good professor, but make sure to ask questions when something is unclear.

A lot of people say that Dr. Huang is a terrible professor, this is completely false. She is amazing at what she does. She is so knowledgeable about education and you can tell she has a lot of experience working in the field. Her assignments are hard, however, she expects the best from future teachers so if you apply yourself you will be fine.

She is the nicest lady ever, but don't let that trap you into thinking this will be easy. She is the toughest grader I have ever come across. The class is really long lectures and 2 big projects. Her tests are impossible to pass. She expects too much in your answers and expects you to have memorized all of the readings. Do not go full time

Two group projects are the majority of your class grade, so pick good people to work with! Put a lot of effort into your projects because she's a tough grader! Basically show up to class, participate, and put all your effort into your projects and you'll pass! She's so friendly and helpful, don't be afraid to ask for help!

Dr. Huang is not always clear in her directions. There are many group projects, but you get a peer evaluation sheet to let her know who did what. Not always clear criteria. If you participate, you will have a better chance of being on her good time. She's easy to reach out of class and is always willing to help even though it's not always helpful.

Basically two huge projects, choose your group members wisely. There is also quizs every week based on class or classmate presentations but you will get an A. As long as you when your in your group let her check the drafter first, and choose good people for the groups. Attendance is mandatory so go to every class and study for the quizs!:)

Dr. Hubbard is an inspiring professor. She is passionate about what she teaches. I felt the content of this class was helpful and meaningful for those of us pursuing a career in criminology and sociology as well as our personal lives. I would recommend taking her classes. She is fair and approachable. I look forward to my fall class with her.

Dr. Hubbard is an inspiring professor. She is passionate about what she teaches. I felt the content of this class was helpful and meaningful for those of us pursuing a career in criminology and sociology as well as our personal lives. I would recommend taking her classes. She is fair and approachable. I look forward to my fall class with her.

Dr. Hubbard is one of the only professors I have had that really cares about the opinion of her students. She is always asking us what we would like to learn more about or to participate in the many activities she organizes for the class. The homework we ever receive is always very do-able and done in a timely manner.

I read the other comments posted and I am confused by the students that complained about reading three chapter books (NOT textbooks) for the semester. This is a summer semester and you knew that and also, it is a junior level class - Dr. Hubbard is fair, knowledgeable and really makes the lectures interesting. I recommend taking Dr. Hubbard.

Professor Hubbard is an amazing teacher with vast knowledge of the criminal justice system. She is extremely helpfully and her lectures are very up to date and interesting You need to come to class to keep up but she does not make attendance mandatory. If you have a passion for the field of criminal justice her class is a must.

Really unorganized. Expects a lot out of you (read TWO books for summer semester) and on top of that its really hard to follow jumbled notes on what she wants from you that week. Worst professor I have had. Exam with 15 "essay" and extended response questions. Probably 2+ hours of work expected in under an hour. NO WONDER YOUR STUDENTS CANT KEEP UP

Dr. Hubbard is a great person except she is very unorganized. The class itself isn't very difficult, her disorganization just falls into the class. Her lectures are always interesting and she has amazing guest speakers just hard to understand when assignments are due and what part of the class they are on.

Dr. Hubbard is an amazing prof although she can take a minute to respond to emails and grade back papers. She has great discussions in class and if you go to class and take good notes its an A on the exams

Shes very disorganized and does a poor job at creating tests and group projects but she curves the tests (a lot!) and isnt a harsh grader on the group work. Shes aware of her tendency to be scatterbrained so shes pretty fair. Could probably get away w skipping class a lot but you might do really poorly on tests and shell show less mercy.
Basic grades are over the exams, not given much else, also write papers, however the class was not difficult. If you did what was asked there shouldn't be an issue with passing.
Communication is not good at all-- which makes assignments/test confusing. Grades are updated late each week. Fair grader!

I took her online summer class (6 weeks) and while I didn't need a textbook. I had to read 2 actual whole books. Which was a lot while also listening to a series of a podcast. But she was very unorganized and slightly confusing which didn't help me out at all. Her tests were very specific so you better know your stuff before the test.

Dr. Hubbard is such a great person so it makes it hard to say anything negative, but her lack of organization is stressful. This is one of the classes you will have to REALLY pay attention in class in order to be prepared for the tests. The class itself was interesting.

Dr. Hubbard is awesome as a person, however she is so unorganized so it makes her class a little tough. She tests straight from lectures so you have to attend class, and her notes are all over the place. She hops from one theory to the next, no one ever has any idea what's going on. Good luck getting ahold of her, she doesn't respond to emails.
She is so down to earth. If you want a teacher who wants you to pass and who actually cares, take her class. Beautiful person inside and out.

I loved Her women & crime class. She's very knowledgeable of the subject & makes it easy to understand. There are 3 test which are online & 1 short paper. I would take her again it's an easy class & it's very easy to get an A
She is unorganized, unprofessional, and her test questions can often be subjective.
not the best

Dr. Hubbard seems to be really nice, just not helpful at all. Two books were required at the beginning of the semester, only one was really used and then towards the end of the semester she began referencing a different book not listed, which confused the entire class. Doesn't post notes, so you need to go to  class or you'll miss a lot of info.

Ok, so she's a little all over the place as far as class structure goes, but she is very knowledgeable on the subject and a great lecturer. She's laid back and wants you to learn and succeed in the class. Easy A if you simply come to class and take notes. Gives 3 online tests, and has you write one simple reflection paper. Use  books on tests only.
Very good teacher, the more you get into the class, the tests become a little less clear but still extremely passable! Great  professor! Would take the class again!
funny guy and knows his stuff and is very passionate. classes can get very boring after a while and its hard to pay attention. does a good review before every test. only grades are three tests.

He is very knowledgeable and passionate about this topic. This class was mainly reading a chapter and completing a discussion post about it. There were some extra credit opportunities and several short essays to write, maximum 700 words. The other assignments were very interesting as well. I recommend taking one of his classes.

He is very knowledgeable and passionate about this topic. This class was mainly reading a chapter and completing a discussion post about it. There were some extra credit opportunities and several short essays to write, maximum 700 words. The other assignments were very interesting as well. I recommend taking one of his classes.

Took Huber for Intro to Native American studies. It was all online, overall he was a great professor in terms of feedback. Was a generous grader as well as gave students positive energy with his feedback. Fairly easy A as long as work is submitted, would take him again in a heartbeat.

Read specific chapters from 3-4 different assigned texts and write your thoughts on them in 3 paragraphs every week. He does not have recorded lectures, there is no instruction at all, and he gives basic feedback. It's easy, but you are not going to come out of his class actually retaining any information. He doesn't actually teach.

He is very enthusiastic and friendly. He clearly loves what he does and he is extremely knowledgeable in pre-European American history. He gives tons of extra credit both in and out of the tests, and the tests themselves are easy as long as you pay attention to the lectures. There is a novel you're supposed to read but you wont need it to pass.

This class gave so much information that I didn't have before. I'm grateful that I took a Native American class. This teacher always gives back positive feedback, and he's very understanding. If you do all the work, you definitely won't have a hard time passing. Great class to take.
BEST PROFESSOR THERE! Really tho.. he care about his students and wants every single one to get an A. Wonderful wonderful guy lots of opportunity for extra credit:)
Don't buy the book. I never opened it and got A's on all exams. It was a very easy class. Prof cares about his students and wants everyone to pass.

Profs lectures are attention-grabbing and interesting. A lot of the information tends to be gone over several times from different perspectives, providing in-depth analysis of the content. The textbook provides a good amount of supplementary reading, but isnt completely essential.

Professor Huber is the most amazing teacher I've had at the college level. He is very enthusiastic, always in a good mood, and really cares about his students. The course itself was pretty easy. A self reflection journal each week (1-2 pages) and he actually reads every one of them. Huber really cares about the students and I recommend him to all.
Being in the class alone gets you an A in the class. Taken him will save your life, no exams or finals. Easiest class you will ever take. Don't even bother to take notes.

Prof Huber is a terrific teacher who makes a relatively dry class interesting. He always has a good attitude and is very helpful. There is no final exam or tests, just journals and final group presentation. Definitely recommend this guy.
No exams no final if you dont want him, your crazy its a easy A class.
Professor Huber was good. He knew a lot about other cultures and their health care. Come to class, participate, and do your work and you should get a good grade. I recommend him.

Huber is a bad teacher. The 2 textbooks were awful. He rambled a lot about benefits of CAM medicine and unrelated Mayan drivel no one was interested in. Other topics got a little weird (claimed hearts can talk to one another). Teacher was intimidated by other students in the class. Would not recommend this teacher.
Really cool teacher. Knows her stuff and how to teach. Kinda tough at times, but nothing a dedicated student can't handle. Great class and to top it off, she is pretty good lookin. Hot! XD

Beat class I've taken so far. She is extremely interesting and as long as you pay attention all the answers for the test will be given to you in the lecture.  Show up to class everyday or you will miss something. Great class, great teacher.
Tough, but she knows her stuff and gets right to the point. If you study you should be alright.

Comes off as cold but just her way of drawing the most from the student. High expectations. Provides study guides for tests, test is slides, wants full name, statement of importance, year, medium. You "must" make flash cards to pass, the only way. She tends to talk down to students like a drill sarge. I loved/hated her class, at end glad I had her.
Very intresting lectures. EXTREMELY difficult class. A lot of information to memorize. Can be upset with students. Over all very clear but rough.
Her vast knowledge of critical care is unbelievable. Wants you to get it, makes you think
Her vast knowledge of critical care is unbelievable. Wants you to get it, makes you think
really makes you think. wants you to learn. very knowledgeable of critical care. her additional information provided in our clinical helped me be very successful in lecture exams.
Professor Huffman is a fabulous critical instructor that is extremely knowledgeable. She wants her students to learn and makes you critically think!
Professor Huffman is a wealth of knowledge. I wish I had half of her brain. She is extremely knowledgeable in regards to critical care. She makes you think. She wants you to get it!
Challenged students, knowledgeable Critical care clinical instructor
best clinical professor in nursing program. challenges students. knows her stuff
The most awesome critical care professor EVER. She knows her critical care stuff
best clinical professor EVER, really knowledgeable critical care nurse/professor.

Professor Hughes is great. As a lawyer, he's very knowledgeable on the subject matter. He's very laid back and used humor to make class interesting. There are only three assignments that you get graded for: a midterm, a presentation, and a final. You need the books in order to pass. He goes over everything that will be on exams. Great professor.

This is a professor wants you to learn the material and was always available to offer his assistance any way he could. He made the class interesting and was very knowledgeable about the course material. Attendance was mandatory. His laid-back style of teaching should be an example for a lot of professors at CSU.

Patient in explaining/re-explaining concepts, gave real world examples, and was respectful of the class members. Facilitated class discussion effectively and moved through the textbook at a reasonable pace. Tests were essay style, and not overly weighted in the grading. Not interested in memorization, but understanding of material/concepts.

BEWARE! BAD PROFESSOR!Does not show up prepared for class. She does not even teach the main points of class. Big part of the class was to learn how to write the ITP (transitional) section of the IEP. Didn't teach this section and was unable to provide examples or answers to questions. Doesn't grade according to her own set of criterion. Stay Away!
Excellent Professor! Make sure to show up to lecture, do all of the HW, and ask questions- you'll get an A for sure.
Excellent Professor! Make sure to show up to lecture, do all of the HW, and ask questions- you'll get an A for sure.

Huhnke is an absolute gem. My math skills were not that great but was still able to do everything in the class easily. Just show you understand the concept on the quiz and he will grade it generously. Do the homework, study the practice guides as they are extremely similar to the actual test, pay attention in class. Final was no sweat either

Huhnke is incredibly nice and super good at presenting the information. But his lectures get really boring really fast. He gives practice tests, which are the same as the real test just with different numbers. So you can get close to 100% if you study for all of them.

If ever you need to be eased into your third year engineering courses, Dr. H provides an excellent foundation. His use of real world examples helps to connect the student with the work. Just pay attention and do the work, and you'll get an A.

Professor Huhnke is hands down the best professor at CSU. He knows his stuff, and is always willing to answer questions related to the material or just engineering in general. He had his class set up like this: lecture on Monday with online homework due, lecture Wednesday with a quiz at the end of class, lab on Fridays. Exams were clear cut. 10/10

I really like the guy, but he is the slowest grader ever. We took the midterm about 3 weeks ago and still some of us do not have grades for it. This wouldn't be so bad if we got the quizzes back/graded that led up to the midterm. The test questions are very similar to quiz questions so it would be helpful to see how I am doing on the quizzes.

One of the best professors I've ever had. Showing up to lecture gets you an easy 25 points. He literally gives you the test beforehand to study, so there's no reason to get less than 100% on the tests. He is also very funny. Definitely try to take him if you can. Lastly, DO NOT get the book; you'll never use it, and neither does he.

Great professor! Class is based on only a mid-term and final. I was worried about this at first but there's nothing to be worried about. He gives a mid-term and study guide which is straight to the point. Didn't even need to study much since I came to class every time. Defiantly would recommend!

Great class.  He is a funny and straight forward prof who lectures in a way that everyone gets.  fair grader and gives out good study guides but if you simply show up and pay attention you will have no problem with this class.  I really learned a lot and am impressed by his teaching style.

Professor Humer knows his trade inside and out. He makes connections to real world examples and events, things that are relevant. He tries to do interactive things with the class but it ends up being the same people every time. He's super chill and is smokin' hot (I'm pretty sure he's a runner or marathoner) so show up, listen, and enjoy!

He creates very meaningful and enriching classes. The books are fantastic, although you will have to read a lot. I have had him twice over the summer and the shortened schedule calls for essentially double reading each week. Plus you have to write a paper review every week. You will learn a lot and gain a lot from his feedback. Great teacher.

He creates very meaningful and enriching classes. The books are fantastic, although you will have to read a lot. I have had him twice over the summer and the shortened schedule calls for essentially double reading each week. Plus you have to write a paper review every week. You will learn a lot and gain a lot from his feedback. Great teacher.

Ive had Dr. Humphrey for a number of classes. The guy can be tough, but he makes you a better writer and analyzer. He is clear in what he wants done. With the Covid19 pandemic, he still presented clear expectations for the class and he answered all questions I had via email. Take this professor. Its worth it.

Professor Humphrey is brutally tough, but FAIR, and his cynical sense of humor is refreshing, if not always appropriate.  Although he loads you up with reading and writing, you WILL come out a better writer for it.  Show up to class, read the assigned texts and write the assigned papers, and participate, and you'll do well.
He's very arrogant and self absorbed and doesn't care if you were a little bit late. He will lose it and threaten not to teach. Long boring lectures and I'm a history major!

Dr. Humphrey is currently interim Chair of the Dept of History at CSU. As such, his courseload is comparatively small. But the courses he DOES teach, such as the U-grad capstone HIS401, are well worth it. His knowledge, experience, and cynical sense of humor is SO worth it Ill make this simple. Show up to class. Work. Write the papers. You'll pass.

Humphrey is definitely one of a kind. I am a history major so I really enjoyed this class. He expects you to do the reading and come to class prepared to talk about it it. He can come off rude and arrogant a lot, but if you're someone like me that is sarcastic then you will enjoy his humor. He grades papers hard, but makes you a better writer.

He needs to understand that people have trouble participating in class because they are mezmorized by his hottness. Like God dang! But in all honesty he's a great professor that expects his students to actually do the assigned work. Would take again even tho his hatred for forest Gump is a little disturbing...

He is very opinionated and don't even ask to record his lectures because he will flip out.  Good professor.  Would of liked if he would have discussions on the papers earlier.  Do the identifications and you will be fine, only thing that is hard are the papers, extremely critical.  Had to take this for a gen ed requirement

Tries to get you to challenge all of your preconceived notions about the topics of his classes and is very funny in doing so. Holds his students to a high standard but holds himself to the same standard. Can seem like a jerk but will help you if you will put in the work. I got a B, but I feel I learned more then I have in any other class at CSU
High expectations, lots of reading, critical on writing - but best experience ever.  His sarcasm alone was worth every moment.  Don't let the required reading list dissuade you.  Well worth it.
Stickler for topnotch writing skills. All assignments were essay papers. Comes off a bit arrogant but just wants students to put in effort. Lectures were boring.
Hard, self obsessed, all lecture and papers, no tests

I took this class to fill in an upper class requirement. I am not a history major. This professor expected so much more than any other professor I have ever had. I thought I wrote satisfactory papers before. After taking this course, I feel as if I can write more efficiently. His motto is "You can do better". GREAT PROFESSOR!!

I had him for both Colonial America & Senior Seminar. He is a well known published Author and he is one of the best HIS professors in CSU. He is cynical, smart and Irrogent. However, he is helpful and realistic. I spent the semester freaking out about HIS 400 but he got me through with it. He grades papers with intense feed back Best HIS 400 Prof!
i am trying to listen to what is being said, but my gosh he is super fine it is very distracting!!!
This professor is hott.
Intense is an understatement.

A very intelligent and passionate teacher. Can be arrogant and rude, sometimes. Be prepared for class discussion, or you will be sorry! Withdrew due to illness- don't know how the entire semester went, but some students love him and others can't wait for the end of class. Interested in the little known of American Revolution- workers, slaves, etc

Intense but well worth the effort.  Don't expect him to carry you through your research.  He will get you there but he makes sure that you do the work.  And work you will do.  Definitely makes you see all aspects of your subject.  I would recommend him highly especially if you want to go further in your research.
Smart and funny
Great professor. Super helpful, liked him a lot.
Great professor. Super helpful, liked him a lot.
He was a bit strict but what I got out of it I will never forget.
Dr. Hung is excellent professor
Dr. Hung is the best professor at Cleveland State University. His lectures are very good and can be understood easily
A very good professor and advisor who is always ready to clear doubts and help students in whichever which he can
Good Professor, 2 exams and 1 final. Easy to get A.

Dr. Hung was not the best Professor but not the worst by any means. He is very intelligent and goes very fast with out realizing it. Lots of homework, quizzes and extremely tough exams.  Be respectful and follow his rules and he will be kind in return.

Basically if you show up you'll pass, however this becomes a real problem when its nearly impossible to stay in his class and listen to him the whole period. His teaching style is so poor that you won't learn anything if you don't read the book. He spends most of his time bringing students that he appoints to be the teachers for him.

I was a transfer student who had previously taken a staticsdynamics course, worked my butt off and got an A. I know what I am doing, and I still can't do well on his tests because he doesn't give partial credit. He uses multiple choice, and this is not the type of course that should be giving a multiple choice test.
Just a bad teacher and needs to retire. Doesn't do problems out on board and when students ask questions he just glosses over the problem. Easily the worst instructor I've had.

Steer clear-despite his extensive CV, this man cannot teach! He flies through the ppts w/out really explaining any concepts; almost 0 time on problem solving strategies; gives a ton of busy work that takes over your life w/out providing any real benefit. True, I got an A, but only cause the median was 45%, makes for super stressful semester!

I'm the same person who left a comment saying "Dr. Hung is nice to all kinds of students.." No, I finally realize he isn't nice to all kinds of students. He likes only some students but they dislike him &.. He judged something right as wrong. He judged & miscalculated things wrong. I must change Easiness to 2 from 4 -- His courses & he aren't easy.
Dr. Hung is nice to all kinds of students. He says "goodbye" every time he wants to end the class.  US-born students should be nice to him.  Don't judge him overly.
