He smiles for no reason.  He should cry for his bad way of teaching.  He does not teach.  His lecture is short and confusing.  He answered wrong unrelating to the question.  He doesn't write on the board to demonstrate solving problems.  No, he even doesn't solve problems.
You will learn very little

Notes are poor, lectures difficult to understand, and the book is poorly written.  Expect to teach yourself if you want to learn anything.  Passing relatively easy due to curve and high weighted attendance and homework.

He's a great teacher overall. Funny guy and he teaches the material very well. The class itself is pretty hard but Dr. Hung paces the material extremely well. Do the homework and attend class every day & you'll easily pass.
The required textbook is a workbook so don't buy an older edition or anything. You only need to attend a handful of classes to get credit for your workbook.
The required textbook is a workbook so don't buy an older edition or anything. You only need to attend a handful of classes to get credit for your workbook.

She is a wonderful professor! She is clearly passionate about the environment. She also understands that a lot of students take the class for a GenEd requirement, so she keeps the class content short and sweet. Quizzes are pretty easy and a study guide is made available for each one. Lectures with a PowerPoint presentation that is easy to follow.

Probably the best professor you could have for this course. She makes it simple and easy. Quizzed are no problem as long as you study and come to review days. Don't bother getting the textbook. I didn't use it once. Otherwise, would definitely recommend her class.

Professor Hunter was fair and very helpful. She knows her stuff and makes it easy to learn. I had her for a summer course we stuff 12 weeks into 6 and she got us through it together. She was always available and would call you back fairly quickly if you left her a message. Loved her class.

You are only graded on your tests so be ready to read the book, the lecture notes, and pay attention in her class. It can get a little boring so I recommend bringing a snack or drink to keep you awake. She is very knowledgeable and you can easily get an A if you study and show up to class.

I am not the biggest fan of science classes (especial labs) but Susan Hunter made it fun and painless. She really just wants you to have a decent understanding of the material and is there to assist you during labs. She answers all questions and is very clear in her teaching.

Professor Hurley overall wasnt a bad professor it it is just a hard class. Is based on 3 tests and two papers so you best make sure you have good study habits. He doesnt make study guides which is kind of annoying, but he curves tests pretty hard which is forgiving. He is very knowledgeable in this course.

Participation through passed around paper in class, also gives a lot of hints in class and definitely puts questions on exams you would only know from being in class. No textbook but make sure you know the slides exactly, asks specifics and tricky true or false questions. Great person though and makes fun jokes in lecture!

Professor Hurley overall wasnt a bad professor it it is just a hard class. Is based on 3 tests and two papers so you best make sure you have good study habits. He doesnt make study guides which is kind of annoying, but he curves tests pretty hard which is forgiving. He is very knowledgeable in this course.

Dr. Hurley is a good teacher and knows what he's talking about. However, his notes are very drawn out and hard to follow. The concepts aren't really difficult, he just makes it difficult. It doesn't help that he provides no study guide for his exams. But he curves heavily so it evens out slightly. But he is engaging and the class is interesting.

Dr. Hurley is a great professor and is super knowledgeable in the subject of Brain and Cognition. He does not post his powerpoints before class time so showing up to class is necessary. He also only excuses 3 absences for the semester. Grades are based off of 2 essays and 3 exams plus an optional final. Work for an A and it's easily achievable.

Dr. Hurley is awesome! Such a great professor and really cares about his students. Always available if you have questions. Makes class interesting and encourages everyone to engage. Kinda a goofy dude

She is a nice professor but super boring. Hard to stay awake through lectures since she just reads from PowerPoint slides. She gives out group activities pretty much weekly and expects you to work with different people every time. Homework online weekly (Must purchase an access code). Tests are easy if you use the study guides. Easy grader for sure

Dr. Hutcherson was an amazing professor. I took him for my Race, Class and Crime class. I ended the class with a 98.5%. The textbooks he uses are very useful. The only criticism is that grades take awhile to be put in. Other than that I cant say a single bad thing about him or his class. 100% would take another class with him!!!

I thought it was going to be a simple class with one midterm, powerpoint lectures and a final paper. It was all okay until the final paper. The instructions were super vague, and he wanted 18 pages (min) for a research proposal!? I have done research papers and data collection all semester long, and my papers would be up to 10 pages. 0/5

Dr. Hutcherson was an amazing professor. I took him for my Race, Class and Crime class. I ended the class with a 98.5%. The textbooks he uses are very useful. The only criticism is that grades take awhile to be put in. Other than that I cant say a single bad thing about him or his class. 100% would take another class with him!!!

Dr. Hutchinson was an awesome professor at CSU. I had him two semester Western Civilization and Geography. Great instructor, lazy students will suffer. He earned a fellow at the Naval War College . Will miss him, but good for him. Take his wife Dr. H, I hear she is freaking amazing just like him, maybe even better! History Power Couple
He communicates really well, if you email him we will likely respond in a few hours.

Very nice guy and understanding when it comes to issues in the class. I'm majoring in history so I find these sort of classes super interesting, but this class was so dry. It was an 8am which didn't help but make sure to attend because he does take regular attendance and you fail if you miss more than 20% of the class

I love this professor as a person, not as an instructor. He teaches very well but he tries way to hard to be funny and for a morning class it does not work to be funny in the morning it feels like you want to just go back to sleep. For me this class is ok, but it doesnt fit my needs for my criminology major

He assigns a lot of readings, but he is pretty easy. If you miss class he usually lets you make up the work if you have a good reason. You must do all of the assignments, or you won't pass, you will get an auto F. I loved his teaching style
he is difficult but nice

Dr. Hutchinson is one of my favorite professors I had last semester. He often rambles and talks fast, but he always ends up back on topic or with a witty remark. Tests were ID's and an essay question, but he tells you the question beforehand. He was very professional and extremely knowledgabIe in the topics discussed. I enjoyed his class.

If you need to take a gen ed, try your best to get Dr. Hutchinson. Not only does he know his stuff, he also makes lectures quite fun. I learned a lot in his class and you only have to write a few short papers and a book evaluation for homework, which are very easy if you follow the directions.

Professor Hutchinson is an amazing professor. He cares about what he is teaching and he expects you to take his class seriously, which isn't hard because it is clear he takes it serious. There is A LOT of reading to do, but it really helps for the weekly writing assignments and the tests later on. I would defiantly take another class taught by him.

He talks fast so if you choose to take it early, be alert. Short papers and a book review are assigned which really helps enforce class material. Buy the books- you will use them. It is clear he knows the material and well beyond. He is prepared for lectures. Very obvious he is passionate about history and has sparked my interest in history.
Great instructor.  Very happy to have experienced her class.  Very easy to understand and I feel like there was a lot of information that I learned throughout the semester.  Good job.

Very kind-hearted instructor. The class was easy because she is very thorough. She goes according to the syllabus. This class is easy only if you study. Would take her 10 times over. She made learning intestining and fun.

Very kind-hearted instructor. The class was easy because she is very thorough. She goes according to the syllabus. This class is easy only if you study. Would take her 10 times over. She made learning intestining and fun.

Prof. Iafelice was one of the best professors I've had at CSU! I was dreading the foreign language requirement, but I enjoyed both 101 and 102 immensely. She is so kind and really wants us to succeed. She does randomly call on people during class for answers, and we did group work/activities every class, but it's really painless work.

Probably the best foreign language professor I've ever had. She's so sweet and always helps you if you have difficulty with any of the material. The homework is a little tedious but the oral exams aren't bad but the online exams are a little harder. Iafelice is always really helpful and I'd recommend her to anyone taking early level Spanish.

Definitely a sweetheart. Elia's class was a little below the level I was currently practicing in Spanish so I can't speak much to the difficulty, but she is definitely invested in everyone's success. Be ready for daily (but fairly simple) homework.
She is a professor who is easy to approach if you do not understand the materials.
I loved her! She's so kind and humorous, and she really does her best to get everyone to learn the material.

One of the best professors I've had. If there's something you don't understand, she'll do her best to help. There's a lot of work but it's an easy class, if you pay attention & show up. She gives multiple extra credit opportunities.

No doubt about it, if you're going to take Italian, take it with her. Lectures were mostly fun activities, and she provided a lot of visual help for studying. Not to mention, she is really funny and approachable. I did get a little tired of studying Italian as the semester went on, but her class was always fun.

Prof. Elia is a native Italian speaker and therefore knows it backwards and forwards. She is funny, energetic, and helpful. One of her only downsides is that she occasionally misunderstands a situation and unintentionally makes a spectacle about it. She also will occasionally misunderstand a question and therefore not be able to answer it.

She bumped up the difficulty of the class with the second year classes of Italian. A mini-study guide to review how questions would be asked on the test would have been helpful(expecially when dealing with two+ verb tenses in one section of the test). Overall, kind and approachable though, but not an "easy A" especially for the second year coursess
Really nice and very approachable
Straightforward content, reasonable grader. Come to class(seriously; many people think that it's okay to skip, but that ends up screwing you over eventually).
Professoressa Elia is awesome. She is funny, delightful, and very knowledgeable. As long as you attend class, complete homework and exams, you grade will be high. I loved this class!
Straight forward class. Buy the book. Professor is okay. Easy class if you put in the effort.
Great teacher - available for help if you need it. Class can be either extremely difficult or breezy, depending on your study habits. Can seem mean/fake nice at first, but overall good teacher.
The class was hard for me, I struggled with grammar and pronnounciation, but the teacher was kind and willing to help me out during office hours if I felt that I needed it.

Took this class as a general education requirement and dreaded it because I'm terrible at learning language(I had to take French during summer school, I'm that bad). The teacher makes the material crystal clear and easy to learn(if you put effort in). Would recommend.

Good teacher, has good expectations of her students. Cute sense of humor and is very helpful. I really enjoyed taking her class, and I know a lot of others who did too. Would be great if CSU offered Italian 201 with her - there are a good amount of people who are interested in continuing with the language.
Great teacher! Helpful and fun. While you wont be penalized if you miss a couple of days, if you skip you'll miss out on a lot of info.

Professoressa Elia is an amazing teacher! She's crystal clear in her expectations, she teaches really well, also is available to help you when you need it. She teaches Italian and Spanish, and if you can - take your language with her - you won't regret it!

I took him online and it was a weird class. Easy for a capstone I guess.  Made us post these huge discussion board posts each week and was the strictest grader on them and would respond really harshly to any emails. The final project was a 30 page paper that was really annoying to do. I probably would take him again but hes still really annoying

For a capstone class it wasn't that bad. Both the midterm and final will come from the book. Three cases studies which are straight forward. The BSG is easy too, as long you have the right group members. His lectures are boring and an average of 12 people show up for class. He doesn't check attendance, but said he may add that in the fall. Easy A!

Easiest class. Did not expect the capstone to be so easy. There was 3 case studies, which were easy A's. The BSG game was easy, go with low prices and build right away, you will win. The midterm was curved like 15%  and the final was open book. I went to class all of maybe 4 times.

This professor is amazing. This was a capstone class and it was really easy. We had discussion boards every week, one paper which was not long and a midterm and final. This class was based off of the BSG(business strategy game) which was confusing and I could not really grasp. You do a project at the end of the semester for BSG, but its not hard.

Class was online and it was really easy. We had one midterm and then the final. We also had a paper on a case study assigned to us that was pretty simple. There were also quizzes in every module and they were multiple choice. The professor is really nice and helpful. I highly recommend him.

Dr. Ibrahim gave very interesting lectures.  Sometimes his exams were difficult but that's because I'm more of a controlsmachine design mechanical engineering student.  Dr. Ibrahim is one of the most respected professors in the college of engineering.
If you want to learn Thermodynamics properly take this guy, Knows the subject well and is very helpful when you run into problems.  Excellent professor
erratic grader
Very helpful professor! He really loves thermal sciences and it shows!

She does a lot of in class work so you don't have to worry about spending all your free time studying or doing busy work. Her exams are fair and will take out questions that a majority of the class missed. Her accent can be a little thick sometimes so you may have to ask her to repeat things but overall easy to understand.

I took two classes with this professor and enjoyed them.  She's passionate about what she is teaching. Yes there is a lot of homework but it's easy points. One class I knew exactly what would be test and another I didn't so the first test was tricky. the lectures always include something hands on or fun. Extra credit! I received an A- and B+

Sara is very nice and wants to help,  That being said her class isn't the easiest. Homework is do every class period and there are 4 tests, Also a mandatory group project. There is extra credit offered which is nice. If you don't like to talk in class don't take this class.
no study guide for exams :((((

I had this class on line and at first I had a lot of concerns, first of all, he doesn't respond as fast as I would like him to (it might take him 3 or 4 days) and sometimes he is not clear with his assignments. If you continue to call and email him, he will call you back and even meet with you. Towards the end of the class, everything turned out ok

Dr. I struggled to adjust to online teaching. He cancelled the midterm for no real reason and provided no feedback for our final project. I think Dr. I has a unique style and can teach well, but literally every lecture included a TED talk or video from a bad faith academic. First time I've ever worried about a professor's mental health.

He comes across as highly intelligent ( because he is). However, he also cares about his students. He has high expectations (pay attention to lectures and DO NOT play on your phone). If you come to class, have him explain difficult concepts, and simply pay attention- you will have no problems passing. I was also in 622 and would take him again
He was too all over the place for me, literally. I could not focus or understand his teaching style.
Excellent knowledge of the subjects and willing to share that knowledge. You will think about the lectures outside of class and find the class very relevant to the field.
Great class. Be prepared to work hard, and work THROUGH concepts. Will spend as much time as you need clarifying information if you just ask. Put in the work and you'll get the grade.

I am floored by other people's reviews- his lectures aren't "over your head," they're often just nonsensical. He has a good memory, but his reasoning ability is unimpressive and he lets class discussions just wander away aimlessly. As for class participation, he only likes personal anecdotes, not complex questions or class debates.I am not a fan.

Dr. Ingersoll is an extremely effective&motivating teacher, his involvement in counseling and at CSU make him the perfect mix of a practical but grounded perspective of counseling.Hands down the smartest &best prof, but adjusts for all levels of learning, which is rare at CSU.If you go to class&listen you'll do well, &get a real world view to boot.
great professor. lots of knowledge.  aloud lots of class discussion. highly recommend.

Dr. Ingersoll does speak about things at a very complex level that I am not always fully able to comprehend. However, he is always willing to re-explain and truly cares about his students and feedback to improve his teaching/course. I don't see the point in reading his own Integral book, though. Midterm & final are a breeze.

Hes very intelligent & interesting too.  Be aware first time students, his lectures will seem over your head!  As long as you try & find a study partner you will be fine; be ready to do a lot of work. He also appreciates participation & ask well thought questions. He rarely depends on texts but makes them a requirement; except the text he wrote.

Dr. Ingersoll is so interesting to listen to. He really has a lot to say. I did feel unprepared for his final exam, though. I am also unsure how well prepared I am to use the theories discussed. He is really nice though and willing to help.

Took her Race, Racism, and the Law; a tough and touchy subject that she is obviously passionate about. Wants to make a difference. Made me think and re-evaluate concepts of social constructs. Very reasonable final exam. You don't have to parrot her views, but know your audience. May be best advocate of Critical Race Theory in US academia today.
I learned a lot in Property, though it was pretty hard. Has a good method of giving overviews.
Terrible instructor!  Uses the "syllabus rule", i.e., had to come out of the text - no matter if it was correct or not.  What an idiot she is!
Very theoretical but useful.

She is very smart, but completely inept at transferring that knowledge to students. Constantly goes over class time, bulldozes through lecture without regard for feedback from  a clueless class. Unbelievably busy or lazy - doesn't bother to proofread exams or class materials, rarely prepares for class, and cancels class a lot. Worst experience ever

This professor was the WORST I have ever had.  Her lectures were TERRIBLE.  She didn't have control of the class.  She often cancelled class and frequently went 15-20 minutes over without any regard for our schedules.  Her exam was terrible - if you followed the instructions - you got knocked points for doing so.
This Proff does not care what you learned - only that you listen to her boring lectures.  Even the right answer can get you an "F" if it did not previously come out of her mouth.  Don't do it!

She is arguably the most ineffective instructor I have encountered in my entire academic career. Her exam for Crim Law was exactly the opposite of what she explicity emphasized to study for the final.  She almost always extends class by 5-15 minutes. She rescheduled five classes in one semester literally a week prior to the final.

Professor Isakin is friendly and knowledgeable about economics. Uses pearson, expect one homework (5-15mc) and one quiz (5-7mc) per week. Mid and final (30mc). Could probably get by without attending the meetings but you should definitely brush up before mid and final. Also, he offered dis. posts for EC which was really generous. Book provided.

Professor Isakin is friendly and knowledgeable about economics. Uses pearson, expect one homework (5-15mc) and one quiz (5-7mc) per week. Mid and final (30mc). Could probably get by without attending the meetings but you should definitely brush up before mid and final. Also, he offered dis. posts for EC which was really generous. Book provided.
One of the best courses that I took so far. Clear grading criteria and the course expectations. Definitely recommend if you like economics and ready to study.
The class is difficult, but professor is very good, accessible outside of the class and explain material very well.
Had to study a lot but it was rewarded. Interesting class with real-life examples. Great prof.

He is a TERRIBLE professor. Quite honestly, he doesnt know how to teach, like at all. He is so quite that you can barely understand him, even if you sit at the front of the room. And he has horrible grammar and is extremely bad at explaining concepts. He should not be teaching!

Most useless professor. I never understood a word he said and I only showed up to class because he took attendance. Didn't learn a single thing. Do not take him if you actually want to understand and learn economics. His class was basically a study hall for me. Doesn't help you out before the exams at all. He's a nice guy, but terrible teacher.
It wasn't easy class but very interesting, lots of real life examples. Professor Isakin was respectful and knowledgeable. Answered for all my emails super fast.

He is one of the most ineffective professors I have had a cleveland state to date. He lectures ontop of the slides with unrelated and generally confusing examples. He waits to ask questions and sits for around 20 seconds until he answers them himself. Basically he ruined economics for me. DO NOT TAKE HIM.

Extremely boring lectures with a thick accent that's hard to understand. Doesn't clearly explain things either. One of the worst clssses I've taken in 10 years. Stay away unless you vring your laptop to do other classes work.
Make sure to go to classes, read lectures,  do your homework and you will get an A.

For an online class, Megacities was convenient.  There was a fair amount of work which had to be put in to the class, it isn't something to just blow off since it's a required elective, you actually have to work to earn your grade.  The grading criteria are laid out extremely clearly, so you have step-by-step instructions to get an A.

Took this Megacities of Asia class as a required elective.  What a waste of $1200.  This class was online, and is the only convenient thing about the class.  The amount of work compared to a class required for your actual major is simply upside down.  13 weekly discussions, 3 papers, 1 final.  Syllabus was very solid, but amount of work ridiculous!

He is absolutely awful. His lectures are long, dry, difficult to understand. I only go to class for attendance points and I purposely tune him out so I can read the book later and actually understand. His assignments are unclear. I once asked him for a sample of a students paper. He posted a 30 page scholarly journal and told us to model after that

Although he lets you skip TEN classes before your grade drops, he still takes attendance. It's smart to start your own list and sent it around the room bc he often forgets to give out a sign in sheet. He is hard to understand and BORING AS HELL. Very unclear with directions as well. 0/10 would never recommend.

I cannot pay attention in this class for the life of me. He is so monotoned and boring. I can never understand what he is trying to say! He talks the whole class time and makes you wait in line( AFTER CLASS) to write your name down for attendance!! Basically drop your class if he's your prof.

Worst experience I have ever had with a professor. I love the subject matter, but with Urban Studies being so dry as it is, you need a dynamic teacher to make it exciting. This prof was hard to understand, did not answer questions properly, and didn't explain projects or prompts clearly at all even after asking many questions.

Does not answer questions well. Directions are not helpful are confusing. Relatively easy grader, nobody should do that bad if you try and put in some effort. Always go to class even though it is extremely boring. The Powerpoints are copied exactly from the book. Book is good to have for the open notebook tests. All tests are open booknote.

We have had one test thus far. The test had a 57% class average, now I would have been fine with this... if the test was actually hard. In place of difficulty, the test was confusing and poorly written,  with questions possessing no correct answers, questions with no incorrect choices, and questions that were not questions at all.

This professor is beyond needing replacement! I am in his class and his is unclear, hard to understand, does not understand too many student questions and has no consistency! He may sound great on paper, but is horrible at conveying and educating the materials to students! DONT WASTE YOUR TIME IN THIS CLASS!!!!!

Currently in his Megacities section. Makes you do too much work, opens the "weekly" discussions at the dumbest times for only 3 days, lists "suggested" books that are actually required to do the assignments in the syllabus, expects you to read ECR material but doesn't provide a password, and he apparently really doesn't like to answer emails. AVOID

Worst teacher I have ever had. The professor does not know what heshe is doing on online class. only way to get in contact was through email which was the wrong email. Doesn't clarify questions. VERY VERY unclear. the work load is fine not bad at all. Good luck if you get this professor. week 6 and still nothing is graded, so no idea of my grade

I can only echo what my classmate wrote in their review. He is a very kind and respectful professor. His class is very laid back and relaxed. It didn't even feel like a class in all honesty. He is very knowledgeable on Islam as well, which makes sense since he is an Imam. I just wish he taught more classes. I highly recommend taking a class of his.

I can only echo what my classmate wrote in their review. He is a very kind and respectful professor. His class is very laid back and relaxed. It didn't even feel like a class in all honesty. He is very knowledgeable on Islam as well, which makes sense since he is an Imam. I just wish he taught more classes. I highly recommend taking a class of his.

He makes the Islam very simple and enjoyable class. The most respectful professor I have had. If you are not happy with your grade, tell him he will tell you how to improve it and he will work with you on it. There will be 1 or 2 quizzes, midterm, final multiple chooses questions. No need for book.

Prof. Islambouli was very knowledgeable, and opened class discussions to encourage participation. He e-mails URL's for essays very late, which is frustrating. If you come to class and show interest, you will be rewarded with a good grade. He said there would not be class Thanksgiving Tuesday, and e-mailed Monday to tell us we had on Tuesday.
Good class. Good professor. Very helpful. Was a fairly easy class. Must do the readings and attend lectures to get a decent grade.

If you have to take Religion 101 @ CSU, take it with Islambouli! Coming to class and taking notes is the best way to get the best grade and know your material without reading the books. Great instructor, and he also teaches at Case. Laidback class with minimal out of class work! Easy A.
Great Professor, very knowledgeable about Islam and how to approach students to help them understand the misconceptions about Muslims that are at times ramped in the US culture.

Fun, interesting class, you will definitely learn a lot. He is really easy going, and relaxed. Goes off of topic sometimes, but still related to Islam in general. Loved this class, would take another one with him if he taught other classes. A few quizzes(3), and 2 exams, Short paper at the end. (3-4pgs)

I took an online sociology course with her. The tests were kind of hard. Homework was easy, but she doesn't put due dates online, she sends them in her emails, and if you do the assignments late, she gives you a zero.

Professor Issa is a cool instructor.  I had her for a 6 week class and she did not overload us with papers, etc.  She will be starting her PhD this fall, but if she comes back to teach at CSU take her, easy and fun class.

I really liked Professor Issa. She was extremely helpful if you approached her with questions, and was clear in what she expected out of students. She was always so nice, and easy to get along with. You can tell she is enthusiastic about the material she teaches to the class. Definitely recommend her! You won't be disappointed.

Reasonably easy, several small projects to do but they feel more like busy work. Forces students to get engaged-not always successfully. Heavy on material from the textbooks but covers most in Powerpoint. Fair grader. One big group project- was a pain in the behind because of group issues that weren't really addressed even with Issa's intervention
She is very interesting professor she helps you out attendance is not mandatory but she gives random quizzes so in a way you have to be there.

I enjoyed professor Iwuagwu's online class. She was very helpful when students were not understanding the material. Discussion boards were very interactive, and she even participated in them. Just make sure you keep up with the weekly assignments and the readings that are required. She's an inspiration to me :)
Great guy, pay attention to the requirements of the homework. If you listen you should get an A

He's really chill. His lectures were easy to follow, and he allows ample time for you to practice. However, he is a bit of a jerk sometimes to students who ask questions that are, in his opinion, dumb. If you have a very simple question, ask another student, not him. Do the homework and practice the program, and you'll do fine.
Great guy, pay attention to the requirements of the homework. If you listen you should get an A

Probably the most laid back class at Cleveland State. Show up, learn how to use Solidworks, repeat process on exams, and you are guaranteed to pass. Relates material to practical uses in the engineering world and class concludes with a fun 3-D printing group project. Recommended!
Great professor!  Recommend 100% as long as you do the homework, practice the techniques, and go in for help you will pass with flying colors.

Prof. Izadnegahdar definitely knows what he is doing. His lectures move too fast if you are a beginner, but if you pay attention and practice you will be fine.  He is always willing to help and can fix almost any problem you have. Open book mid-term/final, class is an easy A as long as you do the homework.
Very good Professor. Easy into to design class if you pay attention.

This guy was a former CSU student so he knows how it is.  He makes the class sooooo much easier than when I took it the semester before.  Easy A as long as you actually do the homework and pay attention during the power points.  Would recommend highly and will be taking him again for MCE 181.

If you're afraid of being challanged or in college just to coast through, don't take this professor. He pushes his students to be the best they can, and cares more than most. He is the most talked about teacher on campus and theres a reason for that. If you want to grab the industry by the balls take one of his classes, you wont regret it.
Show up, do the work, you pass.  Difficult to communicate with as he does not answer emails.

I had him for ENG 99 and he was the best. He's kind of a clown. We had homework everyday sometimes from books others were essays. sometimes picky when it comes to essays. DO NOT GO OVER THE AMOUNT HE TELLS YOU. other than that go to class and make sure you do all the homework correctly and you should pass his class.
JUST CHANGE YOUR PROFESSOR RIGHT NOW!
Kind of a clown, but knowledgeable and kind of funny. Stickler for stuff, makes adjustments in syllabus to help sometimes.

His tests are super easy. He gives you a study guide and takes the questions for the test right off of it. He's a horrible teacher. For a communications teacher he's horrible at communicating. He gave over half of the class a 0% on their papers for going 20 words over the word limit. He says one thing and then changes his mind after you turn it in.

Dr. Jackson is an amazing professor. She genuinely  cares about each of her students and takes the time to get to know each one of them.  Though the quizzes from the text book seem a little pointless, the dialogue from class was insightful and eyeopening. One of the best diversity credits you can get at CSU.

She's a very nice teacher, easy to get along with, she changes her schedule a lot as well. Kind of comes off as a fake nice though. The book doesn't really get discussed in class, you are just tested on the chapters. I don't really like the teaching style. Be ready to say three things you learned and one question you have about each chapter. Boo.
She is a fun teacher! She genuinely wants to help her students to get somewhere in life and to be the best teachers they can be.
She's cool, very easy to work with.

She did very well, considering this was the first class she ever taught. Some of her methods were a little boring, but she was very enthusiastic. As long as you show up and keep up with the material, its an easy A.
Great professor that gets the class engaged.

The professor was extremely knowledgable about him the material, and did a good job at cramming so much in such a small time. He is a very tough grader, but I feel like his grading is very reflective of what was earned. Participation is only 5% but I found that it ruined my A so definitely participate.

He's good at teaching the material, so take notes and actually listen, you won't have to even study for the test and you'll pass. He assigns an essay before midterms, and has quizzes that he announces the class before over the readings assigned. No homework except readings and case studies.

Dr. McCabe was an average professor. He gave a quiz in the beginning of class which was basically finding the main point or idea from the reading he assigned. The quizzes were usually 1 or 2 questions. They were easy if you read the given pages. There were a few writing assignments which he would give you feedback on. Also there were 3 exams.

Professor McCabe was a decent professor. I did not think his lectures were very clear  and I did not receive feedback that was beneficial. Attendance does matter. Be ready for quizzes and tests since that is a majority of your grade!

Dr. McCabe is amazing and cute! He is kind and his lectures make sense, especially if REL studies is not your major. Expect a lot of writing, but he is always willing to help in that sense. Answers questions clearly and gives a lot more info that is helpful! Would definitely take another class with him again. Did I mention that he's cute?!
Not only was he an amazing teacher but nice to look at as well. Class was easy and if I had tried harder back then I would have gotten an A for sure.

Wonderful professor I would recommend taking him. He makes his lectures interesting and relevant so that you can understand hem.  He usually assigns  A reading for each class  and then the following class you could have a two question PopQuiz. He is  clear about what he expects and what you need to do.

He's a great professor. If you go to class, pay attention and take notes, you'll do fine. Understanding his lecture material is essential for tests, so just go to class. This guy knows how to teach and he'll help you in any way possible. Material was interesting for the most part. Cool class and cool guy, would recommend to everyone.

He's a great professor. He is not expecting you to cram or memorize information. He wants you to understand.  His exams are straightforward. When lecturing,  he shows enthusiasm which enhanced my learning experience. I would recommend taking religion 101 with McCabe.

Ok, take notes. Lots of notes. Read the material, scan the selected texts, and listen to the lectures, you'll do fine. The tests are... easy enough, but you will earn your grade. But don't let that deter you; the class is enjoyable at many points. He has a sense of humor and is very understanding, will help you if you have problems.
He doesn't hand out notes. Take as many notes as you can as he lectures. He will make you earn your grade. Was a challenging class but I enjoyed it.

Great teacher. Very nice and will answer all your questions. His lectures are very interesting.There is a quite a few reading assignments but the books are very cheap. Tests are identical to the notes you take in class.

Fairly good, but sometimes contradicts himself. Funny at times. Definitely looks for you to join in with discussions. Tests and assignments are pretty straight forward, just take good notes and give him what he wants. Lots of writing; expected of WAC course. Interesting guy. Would consider taking him for another course.
Very good professor, runs class really well. Sometimes funny. Lots of reading to do, but at the very least go to class and take good notes. Makes the topic really interesting

Unlike other 101 classes, don't expect to sleep through this course and get an A. Quite a bit of reading and effort is required. If you're willing to do the work, you're going to learn a lot. However, lectures can be boring since he uses the entire hour and fifty minutes. That said, his tests are easy, and he's very helpful if you have an issue.

This professor is the chair of the department and you can tell that he has been in academia his whole life. The information was not clear and the basis of his grades was not clear. There was too much work for 101 level course. I would not take his REL 101 class. Find another instructor to teach the REL 101 class. You will not regret it.
Very helpful and easy going proff. Lots of reading, but worth it. 2 thumbs up!
Be prepared to read a lot. He is cool and interesting.
Go to class, take notes, and read assigned material and you will be fine. If you like the subject take him. He likes what he teaches and makes it interesting.
Very helpful in feedback. Very understanding. Gave helpful advice and really improved my writing in the class.
Very knowledgable and you can tell that he's passionate about what he teaches. Really good at explaining everything clearly.  I would love to take another class of his!
He's the best professor ever. He makes class interesting and I love to go. I would suggest for everyone to take at least one class that he teaches.

He is a great Prof. If you come to class and do his homeworks you will see that the test is extremely easy. The only way to really get on his bad side is if you cheat or use your phone during his class. His lectures always take the full class but they are never a waste of time.

Does a really great job making sure everybody learns the course material. Showing up to lecture isn't mandatory but highly recommended if you want a good grade. I wish he taught more classes because he is an excellent teacher.

M.J really wants you to learn the material. He put 110% into his class, this class was by far the only structural class that I learnt anything in. He's always ready to help you. Do the Homework's and pay attention you'll do more than OK. I wish he taught more classes, would definitely take more classes with him.
Great professor. Explains really well, and does go in detail for each lesson.

She is very knowledgeable and cares about her students grades. Statistics is a hard subject and she does her best to relate it to the students. You should not have a problem passing as long as you pay attention, take good notes and keep up on the cheat sheet she allows for each test.

DR. J was very helpful with making sure her students understood the material. She uses multiple examples to drive the point home. She is even available outside of class and cares if you care. make sure you review well for the exams because the exams are a bit rough.

If you're looking for an easy class, I wouldn't recommend taking her. It's as if you're in high school all over again. Skip a class you are not aloud to make up the in class assignments which really affects your grade. Grades on attendance and right or wrong on assignments. During tests she makes you put your bags and everything upfront.
She is tough but an amazing teacher. She knows the material very well and is always there to answer any questions. OSM202 is a hard course but she explains it such that everybody can understand
Challenging, but willing to help.  Very accomodating.  You will learn something from his course.

difficult class if your not Excel literate. Theres alot of work, the midterm was ok. slight language barrier, efficent responder to e-mails. attendance required alot of work and everything due around the same time as other classes.

Janosik is a unique professor from whom you can learn quite a bit if you can get past his blunt teaching style. He tells you exactly what will be on his exams so if you pay attention in class and take simple notes, you can do very well.

Jack is a interesting character. I personally didn't mind him. Although, his grading is inconsistent (Be short and sweet on a paper, but points off for brevity hurting the tone?) Tests are simple if you take a few notes in class and look at them 15mins before the test.

I felt the professor went out of his way to make his students feel stupid. He never missed a moment to talk highly of himself and it got to the point where it was ridiculous. The class itself is not hard as long as you keep up with the work he assigns. I recommend you avoid this teacher for the course though.
Overall, I did not like this professor. His grading is not fair and he expects you to know more than necessary. The tests are a lot of short answer and multiple choice.
Learned a lot in the class and professor had some interesting stories.  Is a very tough grader with few students getting an A.
Grading makes no sense. You can get a decent score if you take accurate notes.

Had him over the summer, he's a very weird dude.  We were supposed to do a 10-13 page marketing plan but he scrapped it.  His tests are all short answer questions, you really have to study to do good.  His grading will annoy you because you'll feel that you have the right answer but he barely gives you any credit for it. Good luck if you take him.
His classes are not bad.. Be prepared to hear a lot of "Thunderbird"- the school he attended . his tests arent bad but his grading is unpredictable.
Good info., Record lectures (summer/online), timely email response, awesome educator
Good info., Record lectures (summer/online), timely email response, awesome educator
Great guy and even better teacher. Very easy going and always has a smile on his face. Also very available for office hours. Overall best professor I have had at Skidmore.
This professor is very laid back and makes course work easy to do and at your own pace. He teaches material very clearly.

Amazing teacher! Layout of the class is completely flexible. You could do the assignments ahead of time if you want to. I learned so much from the recorded lectures and the assignments are very reasonable. You dont have to be scared to take biological basis of behavior anymore!

Ive taken an online class with Jardin previously. Because its an upper division class, studying would be a good idea. 6 dB 6 quizzes 3 article summaries. Clear understanding of what he expects from you. When needed, he responds in a prompt and timely matter vs. other professors. I would take him again!

First, this class is really interesting! He records lectures, has 6 db and 6 quizzes which the course content is up from the start of the semester. Although there are due dates, you can finish the class before the semester is over which is useful to focus on other classes. It is 100% clear he expects from you on the quizzes and article summaries.

Professor Jardin is awesome!! Really interesting class. Although it's online he does record lectures. The textbook is a great and easy read. Discussion board every week along with a quiz and a final. He does offer extra credit. Responds fast via email.
She is slow to grade. She sets an originality score for papers at 5% which is unrealistic especially when so much of the information is from the book and she uses cases that are widely used.

I love her. The class work is all group work. She does not take attendance, but there are group assignments every week. You have to write down the names of group members present, if you are not there you do not receive credit. Pretty easy class as long as you show up and make an effort in your group. I would 100% take her again.

Hard to listen to, lectures arent interesting. No phones or laptops. If you are caught she will be sure to pick on you throughout the semester. Semester long group project without clear expectations. In class assignments worth 25% of grade
Never take her She is the toughest professor You wont pass She takes all your time as she is the only thing you have to do Exams and presentations are very tough

She has very high expectations, but this will only help you in the longterm. Buy the book, read the cases, and pick a good group and you should do very well in the course. Midterm was a bit tricky so make sure you study applications of marketing concepts. Dr. Jayanti is very responsive to questions and e-mails.

I took an online course and the teacher did very little to actually teach. You read, do a homework or blackboard posting and then take tests.  There is a semester-long group project which i found strange for an online course.  Very lenient on the grading, but very little feedback is actually given.  Exam grades are arbitrarily assigned.
Tough but learnt a lot.

Dr. Jayanti is a very tough professor, but she grades leniently.  There was alot of work.  She probably has to been one of the best MBA instructors.  She really wants you to learn and understand the material.  She expects the best from her students and tries her best to get it from you.

The worst Professor in my MBA program! Lowers the grades tremendeously! Doesn't give clear and complete directions, gives a lot of work and then sais that it wasn't enought work , when we had a report due every week! Extremely unfair in grading! should not teach advertising!
She is an expert in services marketing. No doubt about it. The class was fun and demanding. I use the models and ideas discussed in class at work all the time. Very helpful.

This is the first class in my MBA program where we were challenged and graded like MBA's. Dr. Jayanti has high expectations and demands high quality work. I got a lot out of this class and recommend it highly to anyone interested in actually learning something in the MBA program.
Dr. Jayanti is a demanding professor. She challenges you to learn and think about issues that will help you later in life when you start working. I loved the class and will take again.

This professor has no business teaching.  She just writes out the textbook in a powerpoint and reads it in class.  Tends to get snippy when anyone asks a question and usually can not answer them.  She tends to let guys run the class and seems to not like assertive women too much, maybe its a cultural thing?  Unfortunately, its a required class!

Literally can not understand half the words that come out of her mouth. Tests are very unclear and her lectures will put you to sleep. If you do not force yourself to become familiar with the material from the book you are in trouble.

She does not seem to understand english.  Argumentative.  By end of semester, no one spoke because she argues with anything you say, even though she's obviously incorrect.  Lecture was her reading slides to you.  Complained constantly that she hated CSU and its administration.   Said she'd never send her son here.  STAY AWAY!!!

Completely worthless as an educator,copies/pastes book into powerpoint&reads it.Tests poorly written due,will not accept that the way she worded a question made it mean something other than what she intended,even if you diagram the sentence for her.Shows preference for male students,allows them to disrupt class.Got A,but too much busy work.Avoid!

I think most would agree that Jayanti is a tough, stern professor, yet shes also kind and among the few professors who actually want you to learn. If you're willing to put the effort in you can pull off an A. I would take her again because I learned a lot from the course, and that is all that matters. We're not here to have a blast.

This professor requires way to much work... you pretty much have to be dedicated to this class... about 3 group presentations in class... with a case preparation for every other group that presents, 3 exams with no studyguides she only gives u what the essay questions will be over... and the exams are pretty difficult.
Pretty laid back teacher and straight forward assignments. Just show up to class and read the material needed and you'll pass.

the lectures are so boring its almost painful. She doesn't give clear feedback on papers. I got C's on most of the papers and never really knew why or what I could improve on to do better for the next one. Deadliens are set for 11:59PM but if you turn it in CLOSE to (like the day of) the deadline she marks points off for being turned in too close??

The lectures can be dry but attendance is important because the paper prompts are often based on class discussions and if you miss them you may struggle. Grading isn't very clear but as long as you stay strictly on topic you should be ok, she doesn't like any extra fluff. The large papers are harder because there are no prompts.
Pretty laid back teacher and straight forward assignments. Just show up to class and read the material needed and you'll pass.

Got a B due to attendance. Those little pop quizzes add up, so attend class. Very dry lectures, but just keep an eye on which poems she picks from the readings. Those will be on the exams. Readings can be long depending on the poem/s assigned. This will be a standard, come to class, put in work, go home class. Nothing fancy, work class.

Jeffers can be very funny and enjoyable once you get used to her. This was the second semester that I've had her and I really enjoy her style, and I know what to expect of the class. There are many quizzes, but she often drops the lowest scores, which is appreciated. She is very straightforward with her expectations.

Dr. Jeffers is one of the best professors I've had at CSU. She's tough, but if you do the reading and put forth an effort, you'll do well. She's very intelligent, and sometimes she isn't the nicest, but she's better than others I have taken. She's knowledgeable on the subject (in this case gender performance), and I really enjoyed the class.

Prof. Jeffers did a good job selecting readings and posing discussion questions to the class. I liked that the assigned novels featured LGBT people. She kept us informed of the schedule. However, in my experience, she doesn't really offer much feedback on how to improve papers. I kept getting A- grades without any input on how to make it an A.

Awful teacher. Her classes are barely an education on drama, and often more of a tedious lecture of her espousing her own opinions about the play you are reviewing. Don't take this class if you don't want to spend your entire semester agreeing with whatever your professor says for an A.

Jeffers knows her stuff about her subjects. Unfortunately, she does not have a clear criteria and is not approachable. You read a lot in a short span, her papers are over critical without feedback. If you are interested in the subject, don't bother and look it up yourself. If you wanna write, taken a writing class.

Don't expect much direction, the only help she offers is giving you a 4 paragraph explanation of the weeks readings in a discussion post.  Too many papers and if your opinion doesn't match hers, you'll be wrong. Avoid this professor if you can, it definitely is not worth the hassle if you don't need this class for anything.

Professor Jeffers was extremely difficult - I have received A's my whole life and I received a B in her class.  She is opinionated, and it shows in lectures.  Difficult to communicate with.  Do not recommend.

Best word to dexcribe her: cynical. Her opinion matters and if you don't share it, then you're wrong. Rambles in lecture and never really gets to a point. Super boring and dull class. Very dry and boring personality as well.

Excellent professor. She does not hand hold. Some students complain that about a lack of guidance, but I disagree. She offers plenty when a student has a solid argument. The capstone seminar engages us to come up with our own theories. We are seniors. She will not hold our hand. It means I did all the work myself, and I should be proud of that.

Not sure if it is possible to teach Practical Criticism. Despite getting a good grade, still do not feel like I learned anything. She is a good professor but it is sometimes difficult to understand what she expects. If she brings up a topic or point, it's important and will be used again.  The sooner you learn it the easier it will be on you!

Extremely cynical.  Her opinion is the only opinion that counts.  Waste of money to purchase textbooks because if one uses material from the text to answer questions - the paper is given a poor grade.
She's boring and cynical.  And if you're looking for constructive criticism, get set for disappointment.  All you're going to receive is useless feedback, especially if you challenge her position.

Great professor; though not extrovertedly enthusiastic, it's very apparent that she cares very much for her subject matter and for the intellectual curiosity and creativity of her students.  She will quietly impress you, even if you are intimidated, too :)

Her classes are hard in terms of the subject matter, but she isn't out to fail anyone. She's helpful (goes over the exams so that there are no surprises, and also lets you rewrite the first paper) and  she knows her stuff. Class participation is key. Even though she is sarcastic, she is friendly and is one of my favorite professors at CSU.
Very intelligent and presents potentially dense and complex material in a very clear way.  Very cynical, but if you can get past that she's well worth the while.

Brillant, funny (in a dry sorta way), and very intersted in the subject matter. Dr. Jeffers' classes are tough because she expects alot from her students; however, they really aren't that bad. She can be very intimidating, but she loosens up when she gets to know you. Her classes were great.

I took Specialized Writing with him and really enjoyed the class.. he knows what he's talking about. This class had two main feature stories we had to write and had more than half the semester to do so. As long as you attend class and do what you're supposed to you will be fine. My one criticism would be sometimes he was unclear on due dates.

Dr. Jeffres  the worst professor you've ever had x652. If you're able to pass his 17 page TWO DAY exams with anything higher than a C- I applaud you. Oh and there's a HUGE research project worth 40% of your grade that he won't tell you about until the last day of class for you to finish OVER BREAK.   This class is a death sentence, enjoy!

Worst professor at CSU, maybe even the state of Ohio. This guy will turn easy topics into rocket science. Does not know how to relate to his students in any way and leaves everyone confused by the time class ends. He isnt very generous with grades either. One of the worst professors I've encountered and a definite waste of my time and money spent.
Requires you to think and explain and well as write well.
He was a great professor and I learned alot from his class and him!
ewww, this class was horrible. the midterm and final exams were hard (15-20 pages of all writing).
Dr. Jeffres is a cool guy. He is willing to go the extra mile to help his students be successful. The class is VERY BORING! Zzzzz  Don't buy the expensive book you won't use it.
He doesn't grade assignments, give feedback, or reply to emails. If you mention any of these things in class he will get annoyed and quickly change the subject.

I absolutely adored Professor Eric Jett's class, after taking statistics at Cleveland State University 2 times before and having trouble understanding the material fully, I decided to take Professor Jett's class, he explain the material amazingly and gives you a chance to actually succeed in the class rather than fail, just work hard you'll do it!

I absolutely adored Professor Eric Jett's class, after taking statistics at Cleveland State University 2 times before and having trouble understanding the material fully, I decided to take Professor Jett's class, he explain the material amazingly and gives you a chance to actually succeed in the class rather than fail, just work hard you'll do it!

Recorded all of his lecture since class was on zoom which made it very helpful to review for notes. Drops lowest grades for quizzes, labs, and exams. Also offers extra credit for exams and quizzes. Responds to emails and is actually available during office hours. Great at explaining material and tries to make the class interesting for everyone.

Professor Jia was great. Her lectures are extremely straightforward and she explains concepts in a crystal clear manner. This particular class had extra credit worth roughly 10% of the grade- tedious, but nothing too hard if you just pay attention and use the textbook.

Professor Jia was great. Her lectures are extremely straightforward and she explains concepts in a crystal clear manner. This particular class had extra credit worth roughly 10% of the grade- tedious, but nothing too hard if you just pay attention and use the textbook.

Great professor. She explained the material thoroughly and made it very easy to understand. She also gives lots of extra credit in and out of class. The homework was quite time-consuming, however, I'm sure that aspect was out of her control. As of this semester, she has implemented open-note online tests (even before the pandemic), making it easier

One of my favorite professors at Cleveland State! There are three huge extra credit opportunities through the connect homework, you can miss up to ten classes before points start to be deducted, and her exams are all multiple choice!

Professor Jia is AMAZING! There are weekly LearnSmarts and Hw but make sure to do them bc they will give you extra cushion points. I never got higher than a 75% on her 2 exams and failed the final exam and still ended the class with an A by doing all the hw, LS, extra credit and not to miss more than 5 classes cuz she gives extra credit

Class is simple if you keep up with connect assignment. Weshsi is very straight forward professor. She does a good job of explaining materials. Extra credit is available. Def recommend taking her for ACT 221!

Professor Weishi is so cute All the homework &quizzes were online and they were pretty easy, she offers SO MUCH extra credit (Over 200points). Replies to emails fast, can always talk to her after class, you have 3 exams which were not difficult. Highly highly recommend her. She also takes into consideration that not everyone is an accounting major
Dr. Weishi is a great professor. Her tone is very professional and does an excellent job teaching the subject. She cares about her students. Would take her again.

Dr. Jia was a great teacher especially for an introduction to accounting. She is incredibly organized, thoughtful and well-prepared. She not only prepares you for your homework during her lectures, but she gives extensive info about all exams including the final. She truly wants everyone to succeed. One of my favorite teachers of all time!

Really values you interjecting your life experience into your material. Which is a great way to engage students, although it put a stain on my grades as I was unaware of this. Covers great content that will be useful in real life situations.

Really values you interjecting your life experience into your material. Which is a great way to engage students, although it put a stain on my grades as I was unaware of this. Covers great content that will be useful in real life situations.

Wonderful man. Very relatable and engages his students in lectures. He seems to care about you as a human being which is especially welcome considering the state of society right now. Quite a bit of reading in the beginning of the semester, but it slowed down about halfway through.
Sweetest guy in the world. Always willing to help with anything you need.

Dr. Jian is an awesome professor. I feel like I learned so much and he described things well. The class consists of one paper, 3 exams, & lots of reading. There are also in class assignments so it's good to show up. The tests were kind of difficult but as long as you read you should be fine.

Dr. Jian is a very good professor. Coming into the class I had heard negative things about him. I learned that what I heard was wrong, and Professor Jian is an excellent teacher. You will be forced to learn and participate. He is the ideal college professor.

He's very clear and posts his power points online after class, books are needed for the paper and to study for tests. One midterm, a survey, a paper and then a final exam, which sucks for people who are terrible test takers like me, I just hoped to pass with a C.
Dr. Jian has very high standards. His class is challenging, but it is to the students benefit.I highly recommend.

Was not clear about what he wanted, then graded tough. When asked for clarification as to what was needed for assignment stated it was in the syllabus and wasn't. Horrible teacher for group class's. teach conflict management first not last dummy.

Dr. Jian is nearly an ideal professor. His exams and presentations are very challenging, thus preparing his students for our tough real world experiences. Hi lectures can sometimes be dry, but still engaging. He strongly encourages class participation and group discussions and team work (Chinese collectiveness culture). I highly recommend.
A great professor, very helpful. He pushes you to work harder and gives you as much help as you need along the way. He was more focused on understanding rather than memorization!

He expects a lot from his students, but that is not a bad thing.  He makes you rise to the challenge and learn what good field research is about.  Since you have to take the class if you are a com major, I reccommend taking it with Guowei.
Wasnt as bad as i thought it was going to be. The Test were fairly straight forward. There isnt a lot of math. Just read the chapters a week before and you should be fine.
Very difficult teacher.  Hard to understand.  Seems to have difficulty communicating with students.  Should be conducting research somewhere instead of teaching.  BOO!
She cares too much about something not important. A very old school professor.
Super easy professor for MBA 602 accelerated online class. As long as you do the work and follow the format for case studies listed in the syllabus, you'll do fine.

I took the online course and he expected you to post in the discussions EVERY DAY and if you didn't, he would deduct points. He is very particular about format and deducts points even if your material is valid. He is very strict compared to other MBA professors.

Read the textbook and the PowerPoints, you'll pass every quiz and the final exam. There will be a few cases, but it is easy to find what you need to answer each question as long as you read the cases and the chapter preceding the cases. A must take, even if you are in a regular MBA program as this online version is for accelerated students.

Nice guy, easy enough course. His tests were pretty much taken straight from the book and needed to be completed weekly in his online class.  The final exam was a lot of questions, but also easy.  Interesting course and I liked the integration of online discussion boards for current events and weekly class material.

Wonderful professor. He gives great feedback and coaches you through difficulties you may have in class. He takes his time, and helps you succeed. Really down to Earth and engaging. Highly recommended.

Wonderful professor. He gives great feedback and coaches you through difficulties you may have in class. He takes his time, and helps you succeed. Really down to Earth and engaging. Highly recommended.

I've taken several of his classes and he has made it very clear to me he cares about his students and their lives. He is very clearly experienced in his field and what he teaches, while he isn't the most organized he makes up for it in understanding difficulties students may experience at school, home, and work. Just really amazing!
I wish I could have selected more tabs. Professor Jirik is very kind, helpful, and REALLY wants the best for his students. He knows his stuff and he's a funny guy.

Professor Jirik is awesome! He is very passionate about journalism, he cares about his students and wants you to do well/your best. He also has a great sense of humor which is needed at times. I am taking another class with him this semester, I recommend 100%
Excellent teacher! The class itself was boring, but she was fun and interesting.
Very boring material, but she was, as always, articulate and engaging.  She really knows her stuff and expects us to know it as well.  Definitely one of the best professors I've ever had.

Very organized. Clear guidelines in syllabus for all assignments.  Not an easy grader, but lets students know what she wants and gives individualized feedback on how to improve.  One of my best professors!
Great teacher! My friend said this class was worthless, but Dr. Johnson really made it interesting and informative.  I learned a lot!
She rocks!!  Really interested in students and in good teaching.  Wish my other professors were like her.

Nice guy, but he tends to be low spoken and mumbles which makes it hard to understand when he's teaching. The material gets kind of ridiculous towards the end be he takes it into consideration as he gives you options to boost your grade.

At first you will think this class is horrible, but when you hear about the other profs who teach this class, you will appreciate Tom Johnson. If you do you're homework and review it in class, you will definitely get an A. Don't have any doubts - Take him for OSM 511 and you will get yourself an A!

Professor was very helpful and gave study guides for each exam which helped tremendously.  Also gave extra credit assignment which replaced a low test score.  I would highly recommend taking his class.

I Had him this fall for Stat 2 after and i the only reason i got a C was because i did not come to every class. H eis very patient and understanding. Excellent teacher. I took Stat 1 5 years ago and he made i easy to catch on.

This guy is great, he is funny in a very dry way.  His class is easy, you have to really screw up to not get at least a B, three words "Take Home Exams"  He is very approachable with any questions. Worth taking if you are not a stats major.
Very boring... But he gives you a study guide before the three tests that is word for word the tests... two words: TAKE HIM
Nice guy

This guy was NOT the devil.  He's not all that exciting either, but he was fair.  If you do your homework and read the book, you'll do well in this class.  He also put together some helpful handouts for us showing how to work out many of the problems.  He also doesn't make you come to class.  I say he's fair because he also offered extra credit.
He's the devil, unless you can teach yourself all the material. He'll try and fail you if he can... and he'll get joy out of it. Avoid him at all costs. nuff said.
Very nice guy and helps you with your grade.

He is super funny! Reading and annotating the reading are important for class discussions. He like students who are on time and participate. Rough drafts are turned in and are read aloud in small groups. He's a fair grader. Overall cool class. Id take him again.

Awesome teacher who gives great feedback. All you have to do is basically go to class you'll pass the class.  The class is fun a easy going, and writing informal essays for this class was always fun. There are no tests or midterms, just papers.
Awesome teacher, works well with students, helps students if they need it!! very fun and makes class interesting! gives very good feedback. go to class and youll pass with an A.
Great teacher ! Really funny, laid back and helpful.
Very fun teacher. Interested in helping everyone understand and be on the same page.
GREAT PROFESSOR. FUNNY AND LAID BACK. MUCH MORE INTERESTING THAN OTHER ENGLISH PROFESSORS. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED IF HE STILL IS TEACHING
The class is fine, the professor I could do without
shes a nice person in general but sometimes unwilling to help. her tests aren't that hard if you study. overall wouldn't recommend
Terri is an awesome professor. The material for our class was dry but she tried her best to make it interesting. If you participate and make the most of her class it is fun and you learn a lot!
Great Professor!!!! She's well versed in communications.She will keep the class engaged!
Great teacher. Super fun and bubbly. She keeps you engaged and focused on the topics. So glad I got to take a class with her!

If You want a Fair, Fun, easy way to learn this comm class,Highly recommend her! She's soo funny and has a way with her audience-us.. She bends over backwards to help you be successful if you put in the effort.  I wish I could get her for ALL my classes; Seriously! I learned a lot and stayed engaged,However-dont mistake her for a pushover!
Great teacher, very friendly whilst retaining control of class. Great sense of humor, very clear explanations. Content material was kinda boring, but that wasn't her fault.

The reading assignments are a little hefty, but he is an incredible professor. He genuinely wants his students to succeed and participation is key. DO the readings! Early American Lit is rough, but he makes it fun and interesting. His Transcendental lectures were hillarious! I would definitely take his class again! I wish he taught more.

Professor Johnson is one of the best professors I've had. He takes the time to go through the material at a reasonable pace and is able to explain the concepts very well. He also is very good at communicating what concepts are important to know before an exam, which as most students know can make all the difference.

He is a hard grader. Don't' expect that he will curve your exam even if you made a small mistake he will take away the points. He does gives you extra credit if you don't piss him off. This class in general is a hard course so you can't expect to pass if you don't put time and effort in it. I do think the way he explains the material is helpful.

I do not recommend this professor to anyone. He does not help students at all when they have questions. If a student says something to bother him he will threaten the whole class by taking away extra credit. This is the WORST class I have ever taken. Even if he is your last option do not take his class.
Please take great notice of the reviews and their ratings. Don't take his classes, EVEN IF HE'S THE ONLY INSTRUCTOR FOR THAT COURSE. You're better off spending that $1500 on one you can pass.

ATTENTION STUDENTS. Please! Please! Dont take any course with this professor. Hes very unprofessional, dont care if the whole class fail, and is soulless. I pass the class with the first C that I had gotten in my life, but the sad thing is that more than half of my class failed. So, if you take him, be ready to fail even if youre A Student.
Makes you buy his book and then never use it. Don't take this class.
Just don't take his class.

I took his class online due to covid. He doesnt use Connect, he uses mbius which doesnt give feedback for wrong answers so there is no way to find out how your response was wrong. The homework assignments are basically small tests with no help. The lectures and panopto vids are all you have to study with. Hes also a tough grader on tests.

Professor Johnson is one of the best professors I've had. He takes the time to go through the material at a reasonable pace and is able to explain the concepts very well. He also is very good at communicating what concepts are important to know before an exam, which as most students know can make all the difference.

DO NOT TAKE HIS COURSE REMOTELY!!!!! I did this summer and it was terrible! He is not prepared at all and the homework assigned has NOTHING to do with the exams. The exam format will be nothing like youve seen before for a math course, youre essentially typing in a word doc super confusing and he gives NOTHING to prepare with. I would give him a 0

Professor sucks. He gives you too much information that will not be on the test or homework. Homework is 25% of grade and is easy but test is very difficult. Said he will post formula on test and it was nowhere to be found. His summer class is almost impossible to pass and I took it twice in the summer. OSM department wont help!!! AVOID HIM!!!!

Not sure how he is in person, but he was not prepared to go remote at all. He made the zoom lessons sound optional but they are definitely not, and the tests have nothing to do with the homework assignments. Stats is tough as it is but you really have to be motivated and self taught to make it through this class. I'd avoid taking him if you can.
PLEASE AVOID THIS PROFESSOR, HE IS THE WORST PROFESSOR EVER !!!!!!!!!
Don't take him, he is the worst person/ professor ever.

Dr. Johnson's humor isn't for everyone. But he is VERY good at what he teaches. I've taken 2 stats classes with him and got amazing grades. He dumbs everything down so well and makes everything so clear. He expects respect and is the toughest grader you will ever have. But if you show up and pay attention in class there's no way you won't get an A

OSM 201 was supposed to be an easy A class, but the leaving of the current professor left Johnson as the replacement. This man does not conduct himself at all like someone with a phD. Talks like he's drunk, is not accessible outside of classroom, and will deduct massive points on tests for rounding an extra decimal. He made Calculus II seem easy.

AVOID THIS PROF esp if you are an athlete and miss some class due to travel. I had a 3.5+GPA and even with tutors I only got a D. If you miss an exam and take later, you will get a harder exam with stuff not covered in class. I retook with another prof and got A-. No extra credit, no curve, few or no points for partial credit.

As long as you come to class, the class is extremely easy. He really dumbs down the problem so that one can really understand them. He is always there to help if you need it and is very patient. Never play on your phone in class!

He is a very hard professor but ill make this easy Cons: he grades with a fine tooth comb one little mistake and hell take away points you have to give your undivided attention in class if you have your phone out he will embarrass you pros: all you have to do memorize your notes and you'll do amazing in this class just keep rewriting them

Overall he is not all that difficult as long as you show up to class and put in the effort. Stats is a difficult class for me but he really helped me to understand everything from his lectures. He wastes no time in teaching things we will not need and always tells his students what content will be used for the short answer questions on exams.

Absolutely the worst professor. DO NOT TAKE HIM FOR BUS STATS 1. I will save you from failing. First class that I will potentially fail in my academic career. He is not available outside or before class bc he does not have an office...? Test are really hard. He does not care for you and will not help you out to pass. Tests are hard.
Same as previous review. Class isn't too hard if you just follow her handouts. Give her what she asks for and you will get at least a B. She doesn't expect great reporting just the basics.

Class is not too bad. She is a full time reporter and teaches on the side so she is pretty good for a part time teacher. 225 has a lot of work for an intro class though. She gives you handouts with almost everything you need to know, I barely used the book and got an A-.

He is an excellent professor. The ones having problems with them are the ones that should not have been tested out of ENG 101 or lower and are horrible writers. I had no problem with his papers. As long as you follow OWL Purdue guidelines, you should be fine. I thought he was kinda funny-I get his dry sense of humor.

He's great! His online class was very easy. He's willing to give full credit as long as you put in the effort! Only 2 exams, 10 discussion boards and 1 paper due. All open book for all material covered in class. Gives good feedback and help when you need it. Read your email regularly, use the textbook, and you'll get an easy A.

Jones is the rudest professor I've ever exchanged emails with. Completely unprofessional; finishes every sentence with exclamation points! He simply does not like to communicate with the students. If you don't understand something from his emails, good luck to you. His response to your questions is always: "did you read my email!" Unobliging man.
I can't tell if he's just overly aggressive or if he should brush up on his online etiquette.  If you like to feel like you are being talked to like you are stupid, I would say he's really great.

Had Professor Jones for College Writing II. He'll challenge his students, but he really knows his stuff. He's funny, laid back, and genuinely cares. Nothing but positive things to say.
