You might have to put in more effort than you'd like, but it's worth it. I've always been a skilled writer, but he helped me improve even more. Highly recommended.

Contrary to the comments already on here, I really didn't like him. His personality is constantly sarcastic and you could say he "tells it like it is" but I think it was just outright rude. Will never take his class again.

I enjoyed this class.  Professor Jones knows his stuff and while his is a stickler at times with his grading - he is fair.  He goes over everything you will need to write an effective paper so there are no surprises.  Tells a lot of jokes, and is very laid back.

Professor Jones is one of the best teachers I've ever had. Although he is a tough grader he knows his stuff. Attendance is necessary to obtain a good grade. All the papers were straight forward. I wish I could take more classes with him!
Intellegent and smart. Easy going!
No Comments

Attendance was mandatory. There was a lot of material covered, but definitely worth it. Got confusing at times because he got ahead of the class, but when anyone asks a question, he's more than willing to answer and help. He loves his course material, and is really interested in making sure you learn. So worth the time.

Great teacher for this course. Sometimes he talks a little fast but if you ask he will slow it down. Very understanding and will not move on if someone doesn't understand a concept. I would take a class by him again if I could.

Robert Jones was a very nice person and he cared about helping his students. At times he made things more confusing than they had to be but overall he was a good teacher. Attendance isnt mandatory but Id recommend you go to class if you want to get a good grade.
Very organized and clear way of explaining concepts.
Robert S. Jones was an easy instructor who communicated well.  He took time to explain things.  He does not like to be wrong so don't bother pointing out obvious mistakes.  I would take him again.
He's an awful teacher! He made me stupid every class. He did not explain concepts well and when I asked questions he got upset.
Made sure everyone understood the material before moving on. Definitely worth taking one of his classes.
bob is an excellent professor, he really knows his calculus and is very helpful during his office hours! he explains everything clearly as well when teaching

Probably one of the worst professors I have ever had in my college experience. She is HORRIBLE with responding to emails, she is the worst grader, I am curious to know if she has ever gave anyone an A on a paper. I have never had issues with my writing style until her class. Very disappointed.

The most unorganized professor I have ever had. The due dates of posted assignments do not match the due dates on the syllabus. The syllabus is unclear and inconsistent. I was never sure what was due when. There is at least 1 paper due every week, and it often takes 3-4 weeks (if not more) until they are graded. Avoid if at all possible!

The worst I've ever had, and I've been in college 10 years. CSU has their own 'rate my professor' thats based off the reviews at the end of the semester- with 1.5 or lower rating, she's managed to not lose her job. Tenure failing students once again. -Grading isn't clear -Doesn't post new material on time -Takes forever to grade -tries to fail you
Dr. Mittie wasn't good with responding  in a timely manner, so that was a problem. She would apologize and make exceptions if her late response possibly harmed your grade.

Honestly save your self the stress if any way possible. For a 400 level class it's unacceptable how horrible this proffesor is. Response to emails? 3 weeks later or NONE at all. Have a ? Ask your classmate bc you wont get an answer. Was borderline close to getting an A in this class but received B for tough grading n questions that wernt answered.

You have approx. 3-4 assignments a week  that take about 1-2 hours to complete all of them. They aren't worth very many points so you really have to work for your grade. Not worth taking to satisfy a WAC requirement

Worst prof. I've ever had.  She almost seems to refuse to communicate with students.  I would e-mail her and leave voice mails at her office regarding homework and missing links only to never receive a reply.  9 weeks in to the class she had only graded up to the 4th week in assignments.  A final draft on a paper is due, but no first draft yet!

Based off of these comments going into her classroom I was EXTREMELY afraid for my life! Dr.Jones is not terse nor cold. She makes jokes and smiles. I agree her grading scale was a little absurd. I missed some classes and did well on majority of the papers and still got a B. Her midterm and finals weren't unbearable. Not that bad. Overall ok.

Not helpful at all.  She says that she will do things, and then she never follows through.  Seems detatched and disinterested.  Very disappointed in her class and her abilities as a teacher.  One of the worst teachers I've ever had.  Avoid!

Cold teacher. Does mainly online courses, unlike most CSU profs she will not go out of her way to help you understand concepts. Email her with a question and it will sound like you are getting an automated response as if written by a robot. I definetely do not recommend this teacher.

This dude is the OG spt. He explains things well and gets people engaged. If he wasnt my instructor I wouldnt know what to do. Easily one of the chillest people I have ever met. Talk about good vibes, but strict when needs be. What really matters is that he cares about his students. Team Marcus all the way.

Marcus is probably the main reason that I even passed Calculus let alone doing better than average.  He is almost always available for help. He even helped me when I saw him walking in the hall. Marcus does an amazing job at managing the students stress with his positivity and his jokes. I highly recommend him.
Marcus was very helpful when i was confused.  Great teacher to have.

Miss Jones was the best! I absolutely loved the class and learned so much. She is deaf so it may seem like there may be a barrier because of that but she makes communication so easy and comfortable. She makes learning super easy however it is really importnant to show up to class in order to learn and do well. Absolutely recommend her!!!

LOVE Miss Jones. She is such a sweet lady, and if you show up to learn it shouldn't be too hard to pass. Lots of fun activities done in class, and she did amazing for her first time teaching a class at CSU. She is actually deaf so she knows her stuff, if you are respectful and show that you are trying hard in her class, she'll like you.

Although I say lots of homework, it's to be expected from an online course. Professor Jones is EXTREMELY understanding and caring. If you miss assignments, you can turn them in late for -1 point. Overall a good class and a very understanding and caring professor. I will be looking to take her again. Weekly chapter summaries are required so, read.
This class was not a hard class if you do all the work.  She was an excellent teacher is always willing to help students out.
I was ready to give up after the first test...Until she reached out and made sure I had the help needed to pass...overall the best teacher I had all throughout college.
Explains concepts well. Very knowledgeable. Interacts extremely well with students. I would recommend this professor and course to all psychology, education and health science majors.

She's good, but she gives a lot of homework and it's barely worth it. I enjoyed the readings, but the discussions were difficult since nobody understood them and she didn't much help guide us. She doesn't use the blackboard site so if you want to know when things are go to class or office hours, (I took her in 2019 fall so might have changed)

She's good, but she gives a lot of homework and it's barely worth it. I enjoyed the readings, but the discussions were difficult since nobody understood them and she didn't much help guide us. She doesn't use the blackboard site so if you want to know when things are go to class or office hours, (I took her in 2019 fall so might have changed)

I love love love Professor Jouan-Westlund. She is a literal gem. I have experience will all 3 french teachers at CSU and Jouan-Westlund is the BEST. She makes the content clear and easy to understand but YOU need to put in the work to get a good grade. She is willing to help with literally anything and she is so so so sweet and funny.

I had her in French 301 and she was very difficult to understand. I don't think she meant to be a bad teacher but she didn't explain things carefully or till everyone understood them. Pop quizzes almost every week. Hard tests too. She does not use anything electronic which makes it hard to stay on top of assignments and classwork. extra book to buy

Dr. Westlund may appear as a knowlegeable teacher to American students, as she is a native, but she is not. Any educated French person will confirm this observation. She barely understands French grammar. She repeats what she reads in American textbooks without being able to identify mistakes, and she sees mistakes where there are none. Alarming.

Very helpful and always available when you need guidance, very much involved and shows passion for her job. However her classes are no easy A's, you'll have to put some work in and you should be ok, she is not really a tough grader but fare if anything.

She will make you feel stupid.  Hates America (she's a French native and she doesn't in any way like us).  Extremely difficult!  Handwriting is illegible. She's smart but very judgmental. Prides herself on crushing the soulsspirits of her students.  Pop quizzes given a lot.  Tests EXTREMELY difficult (even when she says they're easy).

The homework is relentless and there's an oral exam portion of the final that you're completely unprepared for because there is little to no dialogue in the class. However, she's French so she knows things that only a native speaker could tell you.
Simply the best!

No individual thought, just lectures and nonstop memorization of facts and vocab you will forget as soon as the class is over, kind of like high school all over again.  She is often harsh and short-tempered, gets mad when you ask her to clarify grammar points.  Sadly impossible to avoid her if you're a FRN major because she teaches everything.

This class was okay overall... you'll learn a lot about the differences between French and American cultures. You don't get to talk too much, but the presentations are really boring. She grades really hard because she's French. I'm good at French and had to work to get an A for sure.

It is a straight forward grammar course with reading. There are exams and essays that if you do your homework and study for them you will be rewarded. She has a vast knowledge of French and it also helps that she will help anytime. She is able to explain grammar concepts through words clearly on the board and in exercises. A  great revision class.
The students are sort of afraid of her.
No Comments

This was probably my favorite class that I took this semester. I loved that we didn't just sit around and listen to boring lectures, most of the class consisted of continual conversation and participation. We also did role plays and practiced the material we covered on a weekly basis. There was one test and a couple papers, easy A!

Professor Joyce is a good lecturer. He said he liked when the class participated and talked more than he did. I think our class learned more from his experiences being a professor mediator for 30+ years. Interesting guy and very funny. Papers aren't graded too harshly.

Fantastic professor. He creates a classroom where students have a great potential to learn. His class is different from most other classes I have been in. There is a role-playing scenario every class (one day a week). I would take another one of Dan's classes if I could. This was one of my favorite college courses, and I am a senior finance major.
I love Josh! He truly is helpful in the classroom and outside as well. I honestly am jealous if anyone gets him because he truly gives his all to his class and students.
Josh was one of the most inspirational professors I have ever had. He gives great feedback and is super helpful.

Dr. Judge is amazing and so knowledgeable in terms of psychology of aging. She is hilarious and makes the lectures fun when the topic we're discussing might not be super interesting. Her exams consist of multiple essay questions. She also only lectures and writes on the board so no powerpoints. Easily able to get an A if you apply yourself.

Dr. Judge is amazing and so knowledgeable in terms of psychology of aging. She is hilarious and makes the lectures fun when the topic we're discussing might not be super interesting. Her exams consist of multiple essay questions. She also only lectures and writes on the board so no powerpoints. Easily able to get an A if you apply yourself.

Very tough grader. My first B in a PSY class. You'll have to work for your grade. Lots of reading. Class consists of midterm, final, discussion boards every week, and lots of papers. If you don't like reading or writing then avoid this class. It can hurt your GPA. Very nice professor although, very helpful, just is a bit too tough for a 300 level.

Amazing professor for an intro course. The material takes some time to memorize but once you do, the exams are very easy. Exams are based on questions that make you apply what you learned by using certain scenarios, and are very straight forward. She is very legit, but makes the class fun and exciting to be in.

Dr. Judge is the BEST! She loves what she does and loves her students also. I highly suggest to take her, although she takes forever to grade tests. Make sure you go to lecture because she doesn't put any of her lectures online.

This was a great intro course for psychology! Dr. Judge made the lectures very interesting and fun, and encouraged class participation by being really funny and relatable. I'm usually shy in class but felt comfortable enough to ask questions about the material in a crowded lec hall. Study guides she posts on BB are very helpful for the tests.

Dr. Judge was by far my favorite professor last semester. She had a way of being so funny that it was really easy to pay attention in class because you never got bored. Just gave tests and minilabs, but never any homework, so as long as you studied for the test, you'll pass the class. Don't buy or rent the book, and show up to class for notes.

Dr. Judge is a really interesting and funny professor. She definitely knows her stuff. One thing to be prepared for is that she is not by any means a quick grader on assignments. The class consisted of short, weekly quizzes, a midterm, final, and 10 page paper which she spends a lot of time preparing you for. I enjoyed this class a lot.

Very enthusiastic about the subject and well-versed.  Be prepared to articulate and describe practical applications of theories discussed in class. If you show up and take detailed notes and STUDY your butt off, you will do well.  This is one class you definitely have to EARN your A.  I would highly recommend her.
Great teacher, very enthusiastic about Psychology! Very clear and helpful. The class is not easy to slide through...it requires a lot of studying and work, but very do-able. Great lady! :-)
Very fun and interesting.  Overall enjoyed the class.  Answered questions clearly.  Tests are off the notes, so make sure to take good notes from the lectures.
One of the best teachers I have ever had! She is really funny and interesting. Class is fun to go to. I learned so much in this class! TAKE HER!!!!

She's a good professor, overall. She knows her stuff and explains concepts well. If you ask for help or any type of assistance, she is willing to work with you. She is extremely annoying sometimes, though. She loves to tell lame jokes and talk about her kid.
Dr. Judge does not like to be bothered. She does not answer her telephone calls, voicemails, and emails. She needs to go back to college and enroll in a professional etiquette course.

Dr. Judge's teaching style was a welcomed break from other teachers. She's laid back, funny and easy going. I really enjoyed her class. She doesn't use the text much other than encouraging it as test preparation for students. She's very insightful and intelligent. I'd definitely recommend her!
I DID NOT LIKE HER AT ALL. SHE DID NOT EXPLAIN CONCEPTS WELL.
easy. makes class worth going too. she's very fun. take her!
Nice teacher. Dont need the book. Just used it three times for small parts. Just borrow the book from someone in class. FUN FUN FUN
AWESOME TEACHER!! Great Class. Easy A++++. All her tests are from the notes. SO TAKE A LOT OF NOTES
Dr. Judge is awesome! She def makes Psych class interesting and fun.
this teacher was amazing!! woot woot!!

Overall I dont think professor Kahana is the worst professor ive ever had but definitely shouldnt be teaching anymore. hard to understand him as he is very old & talks very quiet. get ready to teach yourself... luckily the class is super easy & almost a joke.

Dr. Kahana is a very intelligent person and I have respect for him, but he should not be lecturing anymore. He is in his eighties, and is very difficult to understand. His lectures are very dry and boring, even though the content of the class I took was not boring. His lecturing style did not help me so well in his class. The exams were tough.

You can tell he really cares about what he's talking about. He gives three exams and the final is optional. You need to take a lot of notes in class but he repeats a lot of things and reviews for exams so you don't miss anything. Offers extra credit for each exam as well. Lectures were sometimes boring as he's older and quiet but he is knowledgable

Dr. Kahana is a very respectable professor, but his lectures are extremely dry and hard to hear. His materials are very outdated. His tests are very tricky. You have to know the ins and outs of the book to do well in this class. I would recommend taking a different professor.

This professor was one of the worst professors I have ever had. He gets confused a lot and gets off topic very easily. He's very old and is very hard to hear. When enrolled in one of his classes be prepared to teach yourself ALL of the material. He will not teach you a thing. Be prepared to read and study a ton. I do not recommend that you have him

Very great professor , hard to understand him at times but if you go to him after class he will explain . Lots of reading and exam prep . Just 4 exams and optional final . I received an a in the course by using flash cards and preping atleast a week before exam . Very time consuming course

You can tell he loves his job but that doesn't make this class any easier. His tests are tricky. There are sometimes two right answers to a question. He wants you to know the "more correct one". Also, don't take the optional final. He told us to study material that wasn't on it and everyone I know got a C, which didn't raise our grades.

The textbook was awful, his assistants didn't know which end was up, the exams were tricky, and his lectures made most daydream. He taught this like a true science class which requires lots of studying and notecards. He's a good teacher but this class was a bore.

His class isn't too bad, but it is not great either. *NOTE: ALL tests give u choice A, choice B, C= both A & B & D= none of the above. The one time I actually read everything I got the lowest test score. His test are extremely TRICKY. However, I am taking another class with him next sem bc hes the only prof teaching it and its required.

He's a GREAT TEACHER, he's one of the best at CSU. If you are a psych major you MUST take a class with him. Don't miss a class and read the book and you'll at least get a B.  Can get boring though but that's why we have cell phones. If he doesn't use the MIc it can be hard to hear him.

He is a good prof. Attendance is mandatory and you must take good notes from his lectures. Also its in your best interest to read the book since he doesn't use any powerpoints. As long as you pay attention, take notes and study, you'll do great.

Try to sit in front because he is older and speaks quietly. Attendance is required because he shows movies and plays tapes that are always on the test. Read the book! Most of the material on the test is from the book, his videos and tapes. Some questions on are little bit tricky, but he curves. If you study, you will be fine. Overall great guy.

Take Abnormal Psych with Kahana!! Extremely interesting, but one may need to sit up front as he is hard to hear at times. Must read book as the tests are very much book heavy as well as the tapes and videos shown in class. If you take good notes (can write quickly), read the book, and study each night, you should get at least a B in the class.

TAKE HIS CLASS! if you read, go to class and pay attention and study you will get an A. As long as you keep up with the class and do your work you will get an easy A. He is very helpful and wants his students to do good on exams! Pay attention during his reviews and the movies!!
Great teacher!  He loves to teach and it shows.  Loved Abnormal with him and the tapes!

GREAT TEACHER!!! HE IS UNDERSTANDING BUT EXPECT YOU TO GET YOUR WORK DONE. WITH TIME AND DEDICATION THIS CLASS IS AN EASY A!!! MAKE SURE YOU COME TO CLASS HIS DISCUSSIONS AND VIDEOS ARE A BIG PART OF THE EXAMS! TAKE HIM!
A great teacher and very personable. Need notes for test because a lot of material he lectures on is not in book.
Dr. Kahana is great. He and his wife are known for their studies of th aging. He knows what he is talking about. Attend class and prepare for the exams and you will do well.

Great Professor ! His psychology of aging class consist of 4 exams, the final exam is optional, no presentations, no group work, no essays. Very interesting class, but you must read the book since he only outlines it in class. Exams are from book material. I took 2 classes with him and passed both times. Take notes, you'll do fine !

Kahana was amazing.  He really cares about his students, and tho he is hard to hear sometimes, he really knows what he is talking about, and has really been there and done that!  Take his class, you will learn a lot!

Dr.K is a great professor. He explains things well but you need to understand what he is saying, meaning you should read the book and learn concepts well (including details) to pass the extended response tests. Definitely a difficult class but worth it especially if you're taking the MCAT. I learned/retained a lot of useful information.

Dr.K is a great professor. He explains things well but you need to understand what he is saying, meaning you should read the book and learn concepts well (including details) to pass the extended response tests. Definitely a difficult class but worth it especially if you're taking the MCAT. I learned/retained a lot of useful information.

If you want to glide by, don't take him. Textbook is non-negotiable. You must memorize what he tells you to read and become a pro in it. My advice: buy a white-board. Hardest class of my life. Took 403 with him as well, but I'm so proud of what I achieved and know. Hardest class of my life, but my absolute favorite.

I cannot emphasize enough how important it is to read the textbook word for word & cover to cover for this class. Dr. Kalafatis is a good professor and he's extremely knowledgeable, but the class is more difficult than anything you might expect. If you are a responsible student you'll be fine, but if you slack off like me you'll end up failing!

Make sure you READ, READ, READ the book and what he specifies in class. I dedicated at least an hour a day just to read and used yt/khan academy/ AK lecture if i didn't understand. If you are putting in the time and effort, he will notice and you will pass with a good grade. Overall, I've learned more from this class than from any other.

The allotted characters for this review don't even permit for a true explanation of Dr. K. By far the hardest class I have ever taken in my life, but it was also the most rewarding. EXTREMELY helpful for the MCAT. Makes bio biochem look like a middle school science class. You NEED to read the book and then read it 3 more times. Great prof.

Hardest class i've had so far but also most interesting. Read, read and read again. He likes participation and effort. There is so much information in the chapters so he tells you what you need to know in lecture. Don't skip lecture. Also some test questions  come from lecture. His tests are really hard so KNOW the material. Book is mandatory.

You have to go to class every day, he is good at remembering who you are. I learn a lot from his class, and stuff learn from his class will be used again. He tells you what to study for. If you do not listen to what he has to say, then you will not pass. Studied two days before exams got B.

Dr Kalafatis is the hardest teacher I've ever had but the most knowledgable. I spent hours a day reading the book (absolutely necessary to pass). His tests are based on the book, barely on lectures. He knows everything and is a great teacher but you really have to commit to the class to pass. Class size was 45 and dropped to 18 by the end.

Dr. Kalafatis is extremely knowledgeable and passionate about Biochemistry and it shows in his lectures. He covers a lot of material and asks specific questions which require hardcore study time. Build an understanding of the material. He is excellent but challenges you to think! not an easy A but I highly recommend this class!!!

Dr. Kalafatis is truly a phenomenal asset to Cleveland State. He pushes students beyond reading the book (we are already literate!) Be ready to apply knowledge toward human disease. If you want to learn  at the university level, take this class.

I love his class! You really learn a lot if you keep an open mind! I took biochm 1 with him and it was a real eye opener. It may not seem like it, but he does give you a grade by your effort. His exam are all pretty much common sense thats why I love his class. You will not regret taking his class.

Dr. Kalafatis is...an experience. There is NO doubt that he knows his stuff, but he is not going to help you out. The key is to memorize just about everything from the book. He'll point out page numbers during lecture - TAKE NOTE. He's kind of funny, not very approachable, but his class is interesting, despite it all. Godspeed, if you're enrolled.
The most miserable 16 weeks of my life. If you take this class, sit in the back.
excellent

Very knowledgable, enthusiastic, and a Great Scientist and professor. You feel like you know a lot more things than just a text book; he helps you to see the scientific world out there. Whoever says it is a hard class is just expecting an easy A. I didn't have to take biochemistry 2 but I still took it with him because of the info that I can gain

Dr. Kalafatis was the most interesting professor that I have ever had a class with. He knows his stuff. By far my favorite professor of all time. He tells your the exact pages of the text to read. He expects a lot from his students, but I don't blame here. We are here to learn, aren't we?

I asked about where I should focus for the test, notes, book ect.. He said "focus on the student companion that came with the book"  First test, not one question was from the campanion, only from class and book. It's one thing to say know it all, as he often does with his reviews and it's another thing to stear a student the wrong way, as he did.
Very hard class but you will learn a lot more than just what the textbook if you pay attention. Class is definitly doable you just have to study a lot

One of the hardest classes I have taken as a Chem major, yet it was extremely interesting. Grades are based off of only exam scores, but he does give out a homework and quiz for each exam. These are not for points but the questions are similar to the exam questions so you can get a feel for what you may be asked. All exams have 20 points as well.

He is an awesome professor, I just love the knowledge he provide us. He is very hard and his grading is hard too one mistake and you get o. However, If you want a challenge course take him. Oh and I love this professor. Gettin A in his class is not easy But still you will like the experience of taking his class.
Awesome and very helpful
Great teacher with a positive attitude
awful
Solid teacher, cares about his students and ensuring they learn the material.

Participate!!!! He requires that you participate in the class. It'll be easier for you to understand the course if you get involved. Also, his lectures are easy to follow and are always followed up with the powerpoint on blackboard.
The material was tough, but he made it simple and easy to study. The homework that was assigned was very helpful when it came to studying. He really cares about how you progress in the course.

Mr. Kalil explains the criteria in so much detail and makes sure we understand what we are learning. Chemistry is hard for some of us and he is so understanding and goes above and beyond to help us learn. He is very passionate about this subject and it shows in his teaching
Dr. Kalil is very sweet. Chemistry is a very hard subject and this class is no exception. However, Dr. Kalil wants you to do well and will help you to succeed.

Dr. Kalil is a good teacher. He cares about whether we are learning and takes the time to explain things when we have questions. He appreciates the effort we put in and grades accordingly. If students put forth an HONEST effort to learn the material, he is more than willing to help. He is also very personable & approachable.
He is Awesome
Very nice and caring professor.
Dr. K is AMAZING
Nice
Awsome professor
I feel as if his method of teaching and the way he sets up his homework as well as his quizzes and tests are a great way to study and focus all the information in one place. Easiest chem class ever

He's a very kind professor. Presents Very useful material and amazing lectures. Gives extra credit. And easy A if you participate in group projects and do extra credits. I'm planning to take more classes with him )
Haitham is very knowledgeable and well prepared

Well, it is said that a genius is what makes the tough look easy. And that is exactly what this professor does! He gives you the simplest way possible in understanding the toughest of all questions or concepts.
He tough me a chemistry 2 in CSU and it was so easy and I got good grade.
Professor Kamath uses different methods to solve problems, and spent the first 6-hour lecture mocking us for having learned them differently.  ...it was downhill from there.

He knows what time he has and how much he has to teach, bottom line. Can be VERY funny, but usually lectures can be boring. However, at the end of the class you will take away real world applications and knowledge about buying insurance. He is clear about what is on test, has you highlight what is important. Don't miss class though. Great teacher.
Do not take!Class is a waste of time. Unless you need to learn how to use your calculator...get ready to burn some batteries.Add to this, his nasty attitude and you have it all.
Very Knowledgeable and very clear.  let's you know precisely what is important and what is not.  Very fair with grading, but challenging as well.

Easily the best finance professor I had at this school.  Maybe the best professor I've had here in any subject. He is very clear about his expectations. I managed to get an A in the class and barely ever cracked the book open.  There was a lot of material, but he goes through each chapter and every handout and tells you what to highlight.
GOOD TEACHER. IF YOU GO TO CLASS AND UNDERSTAND THE CONCEPTS THEN YOU SHOULD DO FINE. THE GRADES ARE SOLELY BASED ON QUIZ'S AND EXAMS. I WOULD RECOMMEND TO TAKE KAMATH.
Very good teacher, makes difficult concepts easy to understand.  very useful class with a great teacher.

When he's not being a jerk, he can be a good teacher. Knows his stuff but he gets mad at students who don't understand concepts right away and expects you to know much of the material already. If you ask a question, expect him to make you feel stupid by his response.
Very good instructor for students that actually want to learn.  Very fair and very clear.  Never tries to trick you on exams, very straight forward.
No Comments

One of my favourite professors at CSU, he really cares about the student and wanna make sure that they understand the material clearly. The midterm is very relatable to the class contents, answers questions effectively, and he does his best to help students out, even tho he met up with me once on a Saturday to help me with an assignment. Great prof

One of my favourite professors at CSU, he really cares about the student and wanna make sure that they understand the material clearly. Hands down one of my favorite professors at Cleveland State so far. I wish he taught more classes so I can have him as a professor again. Not only does he make the class enjoyable, but you also walk away having learned a lot. He helps out as much as he can and you can tell that he genuinely cares.

very nice Professor, at first seem like he was going at a fast pace, but afterwards, you pick up very quickly, exams are super related to material, very caring and answers every single question asked effectively, takes an extra mile for the successfulness of the students.
Helped out a bunch during outside meetings and with questions I had during the midterm/final. Really nice dude but was a TA at the time

Professor Ebraam is tough on himself sometimes, but i really like him. he was not an easy person to open up but once he did the subject was easier. he is a great communicator although sometimes its hard to tell what he is asking for. he makes the subject really fun for his students.
Such a caring professor! He tries to make himself available to help students as much as possible. He grades fairly and as long as you show that you're trying, he'll do his best to help you out!
very nice prof, but tough grader! knows the material and what he is doing.
Hes a really good professor, knows his students and he is caring!! show him that you care and you will pass

Absolutely awful. Didn't receive project grades despite asking for them. When emailing he doesn't really answer any questions and is VERY short. I was a straight A student before taking this class and I am not sure I learned anything.

He is hard to reach and not helpful. He lectures straight off the slides. I learned most everything from the McGraw Hill videos and homework. Be prepared to spend a lot of time teaching yourself and asking the ACT tutor for help. Expect him to call you out in class for answers. Nice guy but not very tech savvy.

I have had Kaminsky for ACT 321, ACT422, and now ACT 441. Cost 1 and 2 weren't that bad, and have tons of extra credit, BUT you will likely retain almost no information. He reads straight from PowerPoints and doesn't expand on literally anything. He gives tons of extra credit in cost 1 and 2, but not in advanced. Avoid if possible.
Haven't learned a thing from this professor, but thanks to his extra credit and chegg I got an A. Wouldn't recommend, but if he's your only option, you'll survive.

He will not teach you then ask you to do 5 hours of homework that is not including the practice problems that are worth nothing but are the only thing that might help you understand the class he barely teaches.
He will make you teach yourself and gives "extra credit" that is actually mandatory and counts as a homework grade.

One of my favorite professors here so far. He is incredibly knowledgeable about the material he teaches, and offers plenty of extra credit. He may go a little fast but if you stop him or ask him to explain something, he will have no problem with it.

He goes through all the material super fast and he doesn't really teach. So far, I feel like I haven't learned anything from him. I took an accounting class in high school and that's why I kind of knew what I was doing. Overall, don't take his class.

I truly feel like I learned nothing in this class. He goes through the material way too fast and skims the surface of the subject. Exams are nothing like the assigned homework problems and are way harder. However he assigns a ton of extra credit, so you can still pass if you fail an exam or two

I personally didn't learn much from him. I learned most of the material from the reading and homework assignments. Attendance is mandatory, and he will often call out students who arrive even 1 minute late. Although there are some tough tests, the class is fairly easy to do well in, especially if you do the extra credit work.

Before taking this class I was nervous but Kaminsky does a great job of teaching. One week is one chapter first day is going over chapter and next day is practice problems in which you will need the book. DO THE PRACTICE PROBLEMS BEFORE CLASS he will give you EC for doing them along with so many more extra credit points. GO TO CLASS!!!

Pretty solid professor. On a given chapter you get 1 class for lecture and two to practice problems. If you skip class, dont expect a good grade because the practice in those two days helps a ton for the exam. Allows a note sheet on exams and slightly curves on top of 16.5% bonus points possible through extra credit. Online homework sucks though.

I took him for Advanced Accounting over the summer after not passing with Lee. I passed and did better than imagined! GO TO CLASS! He gives extra credit for being there! Do the homework! He's giving you extra points that are easy to get a good grade/pass the class! He's super nice, one of the best in ACT department.

This class is tough.  I personally feel like he is a lazy grader.  Rather than really looking at your work he simply looks for the correct answer.  His exams are pretty straight forward though and the extra credit helps a lot.  The case study is big project. He takes attendance and hates tardiness.  This class will keep you busy.

Mr. Kaminsky is a stickler for attendance and tardiness.  The material is not difficult to understand. The exams are not difficult and follow the problems he does in class.  The difficult part is his grading.  He does not give partial credit.  Also, the case study is ridiculous and most of it does not follow what you learn in class. Lots of work!

Unless accounting comes easy to you or you're majoring in it, you will likely have a very hard time in this class. Thus far it's the worst class experience I've ever had. It requires a ridiculous amount of work and time to actually understand all of the material we are expected to know. There is nothing easy about this class at all.
I really liked Kaminsky he gave a good amount of homework.  He was a great teacher though his methods really worked.  I learned a lot from him because of his assignments and his teaching methods.

Very tough class.  Kaminsky is a great teacher though.  He has a good sense of humor, sarcastic and a bit dry.  The course itself is tough, the professor tried to make it manageable.  He is very honest about the difficulty level and is clear about what to study.  If you are a lazy student, good luck.  If you put effort into it you should do fine.

The course was frustrating, but Kaminsky was a pretty good professor overall. Gives a lot of extra credit, but you need to attend class to get it. Teaches well for the most part, but I'm not a fan of his homeworks. His exams were also short, but incredibly hard. He did allow us to take one of them home, however, which was surprising and nice.

I've had him before for Cost; once again, teaches material that is hardly covered on the exams. Doesn't even give partial credit; had to go to him afterwards to tell him I didn't agree with how he graded my exam. 50% off a problem b/c I forgot to divide this number by 2 yet everything else was correct? Yeah okay.
The worst professor. Begin class before the assigned class time. Tries to make you drop out. Make offense comments when you give wrong answer. Avoid!

Avoid at all cost. finds ways to purposely confuse class , changes grading scale& requirements at least 3 times a semester. will try to embarrass you. dose not really give partial credit on test.i could go on & on about this guy
Great teacher.  very fair.  everyone did very well in the class.

I personally didn't have a bad experience with the guy. Study the notes and problems. He tended to hype up his tests making you think that they were really hard but they had some of the exact problems we went over in class.

The worst accounting professor I had ever taken. He begins class before assigned time. No partial credit/extra credit. He hates answering questions. He is very knowledgeable about managerial accounting but not able to explain it to his students. Avoid at all cost!

Dropped his class because his breath smells like poo, and his butt smells like mint.  I thought it would be the other way around... he must have someone tending to the wrong ends... what a poo poo head.

Jacob is extremely hard. I have him right now and seek help from tutors and classmates everyday. There are 3 tests which are 50 points each and he doesn't give partical credit on them. We also have 3 exams in the class. He says the homework is easier than the exam questions but they aren't! DONT TAKE HIM!
He is very mean and get offend when you ask him a question. He doesn't believe in partical credit.Begins class before the class is set to start. Defintely a professor to avoid at all cost.

Wonderful professor, she is funny and wants you to suceed, she is very helpful. I will be taking her for calc 2 . It could be a tough class  but as long as you show up to class and not skip the class as long as the spt session. You will be fine. Once you miss class, you miss a lot of info that could be difficult to learn by yourself.
Professor Kan explains things in a way that you can understand them.  She answers every question that you have and really wants you to be successful.

Awesome teacher! Very smart! Shows great ways to learn math material. Be sure to take the tutoring session that goes with the course, it really makes a difference in your grade! Also, don't forget to show up and participate, do all your homework and practice test.

Professor Kan was an awesome teacher, she really cares about her students. She gives out a lot of handouts, which I personally prefer. She gives great lectures, and is very clear on what she's teaching. As long as you show up you should do just fine. No surprises show up on any test or quizzes, they are all pretty straight forward. 10/10 recommend

The material is very difficult, but Kan passes out multiple handouts everyday with consolidated information with only what you need to know. It's tough, but you'll never be guessing what you should or shouldn't study, and the equations and concepts are delivered clearly.
Great Professor.
Good Professor. +1
Professor Kan is a real gem. She knows what she is doing and she genuinely cares about each of her student's progress. Take the time to get to know her, she is awesome.

Now that I am taking calculus, I realized that I must rate my pre-calculus professor since it is now clear to me how AWESOME she is! Prof. Kan is good at teaching, very kind, and she makes math tolerable. With every other math teacher, I am not able to understand, and have to go home and teach myself. Prof. Kan actually was able to teach me math!

Professor Kan does not give exams other than the midterm and the final and they are both open note/open book. She also assigns quizzes and projects throughout the semester, and in-class labs about once a week. If you attend like every lecture and take notes, you will most likely succeed in this class.

Professor Kan explained trickier concepts in multiple ways to help as many students as possible understand the material.  If you keep up on the homework and go to class every day, there's no reason to not pass her class.  I would definitely take future math classes from her.
Loved her and the way she taught--would take a class from her in a heartbeat
Helpful and has a lot of support in this class. The homework website is the best and so is this professor
She is very clear and straight forward, gives homeworks in every class but won't require submission
She is very clear and straight forward

Mrs. Kan was very nice and it was very easy to talk to her for help. You have to go to class because it's a lot of in class assignments.  I thought the tests were a bit hard, and sometimes she was unclear on what was on it. I got a B in her class, and I was above the average on most assignments. Go to class and study. Exams are open book.
Amazing teacher! She is very calm, yet funny and witty at the same time. Calculus is generally a hard subject,  but she thoroughly answers questions if asked.
Dr. Kan was most helpful. She helped you step by step and made sure you understood the material.

Took three classes with this professor and is absolutely fantastic. Never gets upset when you have to ask questions, explains well and gives you different ways to approach problems. Highly recommend!!
She is very very nice. Don't take this class... Especially if you are a non-traditional student.
awesome prof, awesome guy
awesome prof, awesome guy
One of the best teachers I have ever had
Professor Kane is one of the best professors I have ever had. You can tell he genuinely likes to teach. If you put in effort, you will succeed!

Professor Kane was an amazing instructor. At the first day of class, he made the attendance policy very clear. He is very thorough in his lectures, passes out assignment sheets for every paper, and is very clear about his expectations of that assignment. The readings and discussion posts count towards the participation grade. Highly recommend!
Professor Kane is literally the best english professor i've ever had, he's insanely funny yet professional!

He was very clear about what he expected of everyone and if you had questions he was really good about getting back to you through e-mail or answering them in the next class session. He always made sure everyone knew what was expected of them for each paper we did and offered as much advice as he could and was always suggesting other resources

He was always very clear about what he expected, which was appreciated. The worst part about the class is the attendance being mandatory when it's often pointless. He loves talking about any topic and opens it up for discussion from everyone.
Professor Kane is incredibly approachable and knowledgeable! A solid choice if you are ever presented with the opportunity to take one of his courses.

Spent a lot of time working on papers. They are not hard if you follow the guidelines and show up for class. He likes to introduce class discussions by relating them to world events or ideas. Do not bother getting the book. You can easily check it out from the library. Overall, I enjoyed the class. Kane really cares about his students.

Good and chill professor, but wont let you slack off. Dont wait till the end to do your journals. Wrote about 3 papers, gave good feedback. Really allows you to express your thoughts and encourages creativity. Enjoyed going to his class. Also this guy was funny and connected well with his students.

I really liked Professor Kane. He was a really nice guy and he was very helpful. I thought he was a little harsh on his grading, but that's only because he wants you to be the best writer you can be. He makes himself readily available for anytime you need help and he also reserves partial class time so you can work on papers with him nearby.

He's a nice guy and funny. Very tough grader. I've usually always gotten A's on my papers yet Kane was VERY picky. My first paper I received a C! After that A's and B's. I swear you have to be Shakespeare to get a high A with him. Other than his grading classes aren't bad and neither is he.

Joe is one of my favorite professors thus far at CSU. He's really great during discussion, makes sure you understand the assignments, and is really great at lending a helping hand. I'm an English major, so I felt like he graded my papers a little bit harder, but it was totally worth it in the end. Would definitely take his classes again!
Great teacher and nice guy, a little quirky i would say. However his class was easy and clear cut for the most part.
He is the best professor hands down!

Professor Kane is hands down one of the best professors I have had thus far. He is extremely helpful, nice, and adds some humor to the lectures to make them way more tolerable. Only complaint would be some of the reading material is repetitive to books that have been read in many high school classes. Otherwise awesome teacher!

Great professor for Intro to Fiction. You must enjoy reading, you will need to read for every class but he is understanding and does not make you read a lot in one night. There are 3 papers but they were easy to write. Always willing to help and meet up if your schedule does not accommodate his office hours. Humor is hilarious, great guy to know!
He is one of the most organized EGL teacher I ever have. Kane's lecture are clear and very helpful. Great teaching skills!!! Amazing professor!
This class is not hard. However, don't expect to do nothing.
A lot of papers, explains a lot.

He asks a lot of his students. I have had him for a 574 level China class and 601 Research(gender and sexuality) and his feedback was useful in improving my work. His lectures are helpful but some find him difficult to track. Ask questions and participate and he is very helpful. Very smart. Great Readings. A lot of work but you will learn a lot.

He asks a lot of his students. I have had him for a 574 level China class and 601 Research(gender and sexuality) and his feedback was useful in improving my work. His lectures are helpful but some find him difficult to track. Ask questions and participate and he is very helpful. Very smart. Great Readings. A lot of work but you will learn a lot.

My favorite professor--so knowledgeable and engaging about gender and sexuality in China. Expects a high-level knowledge of the region, but always provides supplemental content and contextualizing lectures. I have no background in the history of East Asia, and still earned an A in the course.

Class was a difficult one that required A LOT of reading. The lectures were boring and felt very long but Professor Kang was genuinely a nice person. Just read the textbook, study and you'll do fine. If writing isn't your strongest suit, I would not recommend this class for you.

Class was indeed difficult, i did not keep up with the assigned readings and failed the mid term which was defining terms and essays, but if you actually read the material, you will be able to pass the class,for the two assigned papers, do NOT use other sources, just use your book, and you will pass

He treats this class like a 300 level course, and he's just not good at teaching it. He teaches like he expects you to already know about Asia. And there aren't many grades for the class. I studied so hard for the midterm and failed it. He doesn't provide anything besides a book. It's ridiculous.

I would take anything that Dr. Kang teaches. He is extremely intelligent, somewhat funny, and overall a nice person as well. He'll make you work, but honestly if you study for the midterm and are a decent writer, you wont have any trouble passing, if not acing the course.
Great lectures, encourages questions on difficult topics. There was a lot of reading but it was all useful and totally worth it.

I got through his entire class by never missing a class only taking lecture notes and never reading the book. There are no exams, only a midterm, a map quiz, a paper, and a final paper. I do better in a class where you dont have to study for exams so if that's you then this class is for you! I got an A easily. Study for the midterm tho!

Poor communication: He uses his Yahoo email account exclusively, so if you use gmail you're out of luck for getting assignments in a timely manner.  Make one mistake and you're through.  Often vague regarding expectations, and poor on feedback.  Avoid his courses if you can help it.

What can I say, really. Had him for three semesters, three different classes and levels. He is extremely tough, demanding on papers and lectures, seems to lack an understanding of advanced nuanced English parlance in writing  (papers, tests), got by with Bs each time. I wouldn't take him, but he's not terrible. Just be committed, show up, read, etc

Barely any grades for the semester:  one written test, a final paper, and a quiz. If you mess one up you are screwed for the semester. As a gen ed course, it was extremely difficult and nothing he wrote down pertained to the test. He expects you to have a previous understanding of Northeast Asia, and grades like you should know everything about it.

I thoroughly enjoyed his class. He's a very tough grader, and you especially need to make sure you word things carefully. This being said, he makes you work for your grade, and is willing to help you achieve that.  Lectures can also be lengthy, but they're important to pass this class, and he sprinkles them with some comedy every once in a while.

There were very few grades for the semester. He does not curve any grades or tests. His lectures are so boring. Also does not have any visuals. Not only was he the hardest teacher I have had, he is unreasonable. For a 100 level course, it was ridiculous, especially compounded with the fact that it was only 3 semester hours! RUN AWAY SCREAMING!

Took as a GenEd. Prof Approaches and grades this course as if every student has previous Asian history backgrounds. Notes from the board usually have little significance, listen closely to whatever he says. Study the book a lot.
Not a fan.  Can't keep a lecture in check, has no empathy, and good luck hearing him.  Toughest grader I have ever witnessed.  Do not take!
Hard Graders on papers.

If you want to know about History of East Asia, then Dr. Kang is your guy. He is a bit hard to understand, but sit towards the front and you will do ok. Super nice and willing to help. Requires a ton of reading for a 100 level class, and grades papers pretty hard. I struggled in the class but still landed with a B in the class.Ask lots of questions
Great teacher! He is very helpful in class and is very interested in helping students  understand the material. I would recommend this class to anyone.

An extremely knowledgeable and helpful teacher... this course does have a lot of assigned reading and may be a bit more difficult that other low-level classes but his ease of grading seems to make up for the large amount of content.
Don't take this class. Hes all over place!!!

Is condescending when asked questions. Grades will shrink for random nitpicking despite correct solutions ("No mistakes in industry"). Long nights studying and preparing for exams to tackle multi-part trick questions not reflective of the course material and lectures. This man has no respect or patience for anyone, even during COVID-19. Good luck.
Loved having Steven! The assignments were fun and helpful, he grades fairly and is overall lovely
Loved having Steven! The assignments were fun and helpful, he grades fairly and is overall lovely

He is an amazing teacher! I would highly recommend him! He really cares about his students and will check up on you if he notices you need some help! He understand if you are having trouble and will help you if you need it! His work is not super difficult just sometimes takes a while. The assignments are mostly fun and allow room for creativity!!

Professor Karaiskos is the best professor I have had! He genuinely cares about his students not only academically but also mentally. He shows a real respect for his students and you can tell how much he cares. Assignments are fun because you are able to use your own personality to put a unique twist to them. Highly recommend taking his classes!

Karaiskos makes it clear on what he expects from students and their work. Attend class so you know what's going on. Helped develop me into a great APA writer I am so glad I took psychology 412 with him. Have a conversation with him and you will be amazed at how intelligent he is.

This professor was extremely unclear. It was like he didn't know what he was saying or doing. He never kept our grades updated in some form of documentation. He constantly messed up problems and couldn't answer questions. You were better off reading the book. AVOID HIM AT ALL COSTS.

SELF STUDY!!!! can't teach, won't help, doesn't know what he's doing anyway.  Class CONSTANTLY correcting his errors on BOOK EXAMPLES! only reason to attend is quizzes. Other than that I think I actually felt brain cells dying while sitting in class. If you must take his section take a laptop to work on hw while waiting for the quiz.

Horrible "teacher"!!! Never really taught anything, just copied text examples, didn't seem like he knew what he was doing ever. Had to attend for Friday quizzes, that was on material never even covered. Had to teach myself everything! Waste of time and money!

I am in disbelief that a teacher like this exists. I have taught myself the entire course- I should have just studied the material and tested out of this money pit. Essentially, you are paying astronomical amounts of money to teach yourself.

Worst teacher I have ever had- Unclear when teaching, scattered thoughts, teaches from examples that are already completed in book, gives a "pop-quiz" once a week and sometimes doesn't even explain material, never provided contact information for help- when asked in class for help he directs students to the math lab. Do yourself a favor- STAY AWAY!

This guy is the worst professor I have ever had in my 5 years at 4 different colleges.  Sitting in his class makes me more stupid.  He offers no help and he is very difficult to understand.  He doesn't write his own exams so he has no idea what to prepare you for.  CSU should be ashamed of themselves.

Jeff is insanely nice and invested in his work. He cares about the books he assigns, but he assigns a lot. As a remote class it was difficult to keep up with reading (about 10 texts of different lengths), the discussion forums and his papers on top of my other classes. My grade reflected my struggle, but I did learn.

Jeff is insanely nice and invested in his work. He cares about the books he assigns, but he assigns a lot. As a remote class it was difficult to keep up with reading (about 10 texts of different lengths), the discussion forums and his papers on top of my other classes. My grade reflected my struggle, but I did learn.

This class was really fun and I actually really enjoyed all the books we read! Professor Karem was great and he made the class really interesting. He is funny and he does a good job to make sure that you learn something while also not being overcome with work. Only gave a few writing assignments and some journal posts. Very manageable work.

Prof Karem is awesome!!! He actually genuinely cares for his students. He is very knowledgeable and the class was fun. You do need to participate and show up, but that is expected for an English class. There aren't many assignments at all, and we only had two papers. Take one of his classes!!!!

This prof is really funny and relatable. But this class REQUIRES you to read quite a bit. A typical lecture would be just a deep discussion of the chapters you were supposed to read and thats about it. Attendance isn't a huge deal but don't skip TOO much because 10% of the grade is attendance and participation. Overall good class tho!

Professor Karem is the best English teacher I have had during my undergraduate studies. He has a unique gift of balancing the students. he challenges you and supports you at the same time. That's what I call love!

Though I wasn't excited to read all the works he assigned, he certainly gave plenty of pop culture references to keep his students involved and entertained. He had each student teach a lesson on different works so be prepared to give a presentation.
Probably one of my most favorite professors to date. Kind, funny and cares about his students. If you read and pay attention, you will pass.

Dr. Karem is one of the best professors that I have ever come across. He is extremely funny and easy going. He has very clear expectations and gives great feedback and ideas for papers. The discussions are always great and doesn't hold the text to one interpretation. I would take him again in a heartbeat.
I took this class online and loved it! He's hillarious, grades quickly, and gives helpful feedback. I would definitely recommend him!

Such a good professor. Made subject matter interesting and was easy to follow. Prepares you well for his midterm and final. Papers are easy and he will give you feedback prior to submission if you ask. Very nice guy. Funny. Would talk from him again in a heartbeat. Best English class I've taken at CSU.

His class was fine. He's funny. Need to buy multiple books for reading and discussing! he is a tough grader. Exams consist of a few true or false, short answers, long answers questions and mini essay question! Be prepared to write. Also don'r forget to buy a good penpencil :)
Funny, realistic, true, engaging. Great guy who is passionate about his subjects and keeps the class entertained :-)
What can I say? He knows his stuff.

A great professor, the best professor I've had. He's genuine, intelligent, has high but reasonable expectations. I had him for 2 classes, one of them being my Senior Sem. class. One of the requirements for the class is a 20 page paper. He made the paper seem not as overwhelming as some 8 page papers I have had to write for other lower level classes
Most excellent prof. He is capable of performing an hour-long free-form monologue of a lecture that keeps one interested and dare we say, spellbound. Highly knowledgeable, and... engaged?

Dr. Karem is by far the best college professor that I have ever encountered. He truly enjoys teaching and is incredibly smart. Makes pop culture references to allow the covered material to be more accessible. He is interested in the students' ideas and opinion on the given subject matter. Take the class if he is the professor!!
Makes the material interesting and makes a lot of pop culture references. Fun course.
One of the best professors in the department.  His classes are challenging, but they're also very rewarding.  And he has a great sense of humor; I really enjoyed all of the pop culture references.

Dr. Karem is amazing. Very excited to teach and talk about this subject. Great knowledge, concern and devotion to material and students. Learns every student's name even in a class of 70 or more. This man exemplifies what college and teaching is all about. Attendance is obviously mandatory but easy to get an A. Definitely take his classes!

He taught a survey course of American Lit. Okay. We can all agree Amer. Lit. is sort of, well... lack-luster. But he made it cool. This guy KNOWS his stuff. He helped me become a better writer. And it helps that he is fetching, but really, is that relevant? Well... okay. :)
Alex is the best TA, he explains concepts and labs clearly and really takes the time to help each individual students. I was having a hard time with lab and he really invested in me. Awesome guy!

I'd say avoid taking him at all costs, but unfortunately you can't. He's the only one that teaches it. Stan rambles on about the most unfinance-related material all class, grades all work based on his own personal preference, talks down on all students, and gives an unreasonable amount of work a week for an MBA class full of working students.

This class is not only mandatory but taught once a year by the same professor. If you take it be ready to give up your family, life, and work life to focus 100% on this class only because it required 3 classes work of homework and test prep with little guidance. It is the most insane class I have ever taken and I am disappointed in CSU for this.

Way too many homework assignments each week(average 3 lengthy assignments), even on exam weeks. Unorganized and sidetracked, doesn't actually get to lecture material until the 3rd hour of class and then goes over without ever giving us breaks and wonders why class test average was a D. Doesn't follow syllabus what-so-ever. Doesn't answer emails.

Literally the worst. Only take this class if it is the ONLY class you are taking that semester. So much work and so unclear in expectations. Never responds to emails. Ridicules people in class when they ask for help or ask why something is the way it is. Tests are totally bogus! Only good thing is the excel learning, but that's literally it.

Most disorganized class ever. Difficult to reach. Unclear instructions for assignments. Two large projects + weekly reading + weekly homework from text + weekly Excel homework (because he felt we needed to be good at it) + abstract extra assignments added in  much more time required than the average 3 credit hour class requires.
love this professor! some people don't like her, but i do! she's tough on the outside, but very very caring on the inside.

Bebe Katz was something else. One day she will be as happy as can be then the next day she will pretend like you are scum. She likes things her way and only her way not much room in the middle. Don't be the last one in the class she will talk you ear off, escape when you can.

Prof. Katz is a pretty good teacher. As long as you read and do the assignments then you should be fine. The book wasn't binded though so that was annoying. Discussions are terrible and awkward when no one speaks, then she gets annoyed and antsy.
If you like class discussions then you'll enjoy this class. NO FINAL EXAM, but two presentations to the class.
she is a great teacher but can have mood swings, you jus have to deal with them, if people have bad attendance she takes out on the people that do come, but other than that she is amazinggg!!

This teacher is all over the map. One day she is nice, helpful, and eager to teach, the next she is intolerable. On her bad days, she treats the class as if they are a burden and tends to take it out on them through additional work/exercises. But on her good days, classes can be really helpful and fun. Just depends on who shoes up that day.

Coming from a PHY major, Dr. Kauffman is one of the best professors in the PHY department. I have taken PHY 350, 474, 475, and 520 with him and I wish I could take more classes with him. He explains every step and is always willing to answer questions. That being said tests are tough because the topics are tough.

Bad, you will not learn anything in whatever course you take with him. He gives what he thinks is important for his exams. Do not expect to actually learn the material for future courses. Waste of time and money.  Text book is complete garbage.

Environmental Physics is not a hard class if you want to do physics. unfortunately it is also taught to students in the urban studies, education and graduate/undergraduate in the same class which, makes this class a train wreck.

Environmental physics.... to pass with flying colors, TAKE NOTES!!!!!! he lets you use open notes on tests and it is very helpful if yours are good.  The tests are 4-5 questions w/ multiple questions that rely on the previous answer... can be tough, and partial credit is hard to get.
Dr. Kaufman is nice and is always willing to help you.  He never makes you feel stupid.

Used lots of role playing in groups to reinforce concepts. Very interactive. Wish she would release powerpoint prior to class to use it to take notes on instead of after class is over

She doesn't speak loud enough. She has no control over the class whatsoever, so if people are having private conversations, she just tries to talk over them. I do not think I have learned anything from this class. Boring. Dry. Have left early numerous times because I can't stand it- this isn't like me at all! Avoid her!

she does not know what she is talking about and she is not helpful at all she needs to go back to school herself her teaching style is crazy and she should not be teaching anything she is a aweful instructor

Have to say, one of the worst classes I've ever taken.  If you can get her to upload her lecture outlines onto her website you can figure out what she is trying to convey.  Use the book, it's much clearer than Dr. Kaufman.
read the book and show up for class.  most of the grade is on attendance.  She is a good teacher, you'll learn something.

She will not teach you anything towards what you will be tested on.  Focus on outlining the chapters in the book and spend time with a tutor weekly.  This is survival - she has no business teaching this class.
Worst teacher I have ever had. Find out when the exams are and read the book.  She teaches you nothing.

My experience at CSU has been wonderful.  My experience with Dr. Kaufman has been the low point of my entire academic career.  It seemed that there was no one else to teach this course.  I cannot express, barring profanity, what a horrible teacher she is.
Hard.  Useless.  Incomprehensible.  That about sums up Dr. Sanda Kaufman.  She is an awful professor.

Dr. Kaufman is the worst professor I have ever had in my life - I have had some bad ones.  PAD 601 is a mandatory class for the MPA- it is an insult to have her "teach" it. You are on your own with her...
Long and boring classes!  'Games' were childish but broke up the monotony.  Her grading is strictly subjective so make a good impression!
Memorize the book and you'll be fine.  Don't expect any help and bring lots of coffee to class.  Dry and boring.
If you can get it from the book you will be OK... otherwise start praying now.
She loves her job and loves nursing. She was so helpful and really wanted all her students to succeed. She was intimidating at first but really turned out to be one of my favorite teachers.
She was the best instructor I ever had. At first I was intimidated but I gained so much knowledge from her at Metro for clinicals.
Linda really loves to teach. You can just tell this is her passion. But be prepared for class, and reaady to learn, and you will do great! She will answer any questions for you!

Easy fun class, and he's really easy going. two tests, two quizzes, one paper, and short response papers to be turned in at the end of each class, and plenty of extra credit opportunities. overall a good experience
Awesome class that was a lot of fun. Dan is genuinely interested in the material and it shows in his teaching.

Dr. Keating is amazing. I love his sarcastic tone for the future of Cleveland, but at the same time truly gives you information that could make a difference. Allows for professional conversation among students. He was really hands on sends info via email for research help. You have to work, but it's totally worth it. I loved coming to this class.
Top notch
Quick, to the point, willing to help, also answers emails within the days end.Pretty knowledgeable in his field...he is a vp at marymount hospital during the day

Prof. Keeney is excellent at explaining the course material and the course objectives.  With his stats classes, he provides ample examples and walks you through the steps to process difficult applications.  He's a locksmith as he unlocks the complexities of the dreaded statistics phenomena.
Great professor and very fair

This is an online course so attendance doesn't matter. He pretty much goes on and on and is hard to understand what he is talking about mostly in the readings that he requires that he wrote himself. I would pass or not take his class again in the future. Definitely harder than it should be.

Dr Keller was an excellent professor: inspirational, knowledgeable, passionate about his profession and if you are serious he WILL take the time for you. He did for me. I took 3 classes from him. Course work was not easy and requires you to THINK and he loves a good debate
He was very helpful.  Most of the guest speakers were wonderful.
I took this online. He was super helpful. The papers required a lot of independent thought. You cannot take this class if you can only spit out textbook knowledge.

I've never felt so stupid as I did trying to understand his lectures or writings. Yet I got an A in the class, which just shows how low the academic standards are in this college.  They'll do anything to keep students paying tuition.
 
 Very eggheaded and theoretical thinker.  He spends a lot of time talking about his theories about theories.
I have never met an individual so passionate about his field. An extrodinary human being, to say the least. A bit challenging, but worth the work!

Best Prof I've ever had. A true educator, learned more in this class than any other. Class is challenging though, and there is a lot of background reading. Tests focus on essay and terms, and require a real grasp of concepts to do well. Very interesting man with a lot to offer and good approachability, humor, and very friendly. Highly recommended!!

Dr. Keller was/ is the most influential professor I have ever had, bar none.  He is grossly underrated, except by his students -- they tend to want to keep a good thing to themselves!
