Difficult course - most of the class is lost. Participation is mandatory, not just showing up to class. I would take with another professor if one is available.
I would avoid at all costs, would rather watch paint dry.
Great class. Very straight forward.

I really enjoyed this class with Dr. Kellogg. She is smart and humorous and brought that to the classroom. No exams, but a long paper and two group projects. Her lectures were interesting and very discussion-based, which tends to hold my attention much better. I found her very approachable.

Plenty of reading and writing responses to her weighted questions. She gives questions that force you to agree with her side. Bogus. If you're not an urban studies major you won't get better than a B. Take it online in the summer if possible to lessen the frustration of being corned into her position. Can't imagine a full semester with her.
The lectures are not available online but are essentially about the readings and nothing else. If you show up to class and do the few assignments well, you should get an A.

Dr. Kent is AMAZING!!! Take as many classes with her as possible! Not only is the topic of policing extremely interesting she is extremely knowledgable in the topic and very willing to give advice and help breakdown difficult information within the class. My Blackboard logged me out during a test and she reopened it up for me, so caring and kind.

Dr. Kent is AMAZING!!! Take as many classes with her as possible! Not only is the topic of policing extremely interesting she is extremely knowledgable in the topic and very willing to give advice and help breakdown difficult information within the class. My Blackboard logged me out during a test and she reopened it up for me, so caring and kind.

I have taken three classes with Dr. Kent bc after the first class, I knew she was a great professor. She has extra credit videos to watch, grades the exams on a curve, makes the lectures interesting with comments from her own life. I wish she taught more classes - she is that good.
I have taken Dr. Kent for every class I could. She wants everyone to do well and pretty much gives out the test questions. Her teaching style works for me so no having to guess on expectations.

I love her as a professor. I'm a student who likes to stay busy. She provides all information you need to prepare for test. She cares about her students and wants to know if you are learning. She wants and takes pride in teaching. Light course load, easy to understand material, and don't judge a book by his cover. You apply what you learn everyday.

Dr. Kent's grade on this site should be higher than this, as she is easily one of my favorite professors I've ever taken. She makes you work for your grade, so its not an "easy A" but if you pay attention, show up, and write well, you will be fine. Also, she helped me long after I took her class with life crisis so she is awesome in my book!

If you think this class is an easy A, youre wrong. Youre grade is based on 4 exams and 3 papers. Shes a harsh grader & very unhelpful. Her lectures are boring & her exams are lecture based. No books! If you can avoid her.... do it. Trust me

For all of you that gave her a good review, you are the reason I took this class & I'm not happy about it. She was awful, her class was a joke, I stopped going towards the end of the semester because it was a waste of my time bc she did not teach a thing. She was rude & inappropriate. Also, refused to help a fellow student who was struggling.

Dr. Kent offers great resources as you are preparing for exams, as she basically gives you the questions before. She offers extra credit on every exam, over a known article or video. She makes herself available by phone or e-mail frequently. She is one of my favorite professors.

Exams were all online, we had reading assignments w questions to turn in on blackboard which were all easy. The class itself was fine at first but after a few weeks I couldnt pay attention during her lectures, she gets sidetracked but in a way thats not interesting. Ive never been so bored in a lecture course. Show up to fill out the outlines.

Dr. Kent will do anything in her power to help you. Took her for multiple courses and her expectations are clear. She always makes herself available for students. She'll provide you with the parts of the textbook that she is using via Blackboard so no need to purchase the book. Solid professor

She really seems like a genuine and knowledgeable person that knows her stuff. Her online class is pretty difficult but it is a WAC so it should be. She is very helpful and understanding. Again seems very nice and honest, just the workload of an exam weekly and a 10 page paper at the same time is a little much, especially with other courses.

Dr. Kent is one of the best professors at Cleveland State University. Her classes are easy As because she makes it easy to grasp the material. She consistently has group discussions to keep the class engaged and to inspire new ways of thinking about the criminal justice system Loved her and her class. Would definitely take again.

Dr. Kent is PHENOMENAL! Definitely take her course if you have a lot of other classes, work, or commitments. She is very organized and clear on expectations, and responds quickly and thoroughly to emails. I loved her class, very rarely do I actually learn from an online class. Would absolutely take again.

Dr. Kent has become my favorite professor at CSU. Her class is simple; just show up, take notes, and it's an easy A! All of her assignments and exams are online so that means she never hands you one piece of paper ever which is awesome. It is practically an online course if you ask me. She is super nice and understanding as well. HIGHLY recommend.

Amazing professor. Gives you an outline line of the notes and just have to show up and fill them out. She does give out assignment but it's not too bad.  Gives a review for the exam and it helps a lot. If you do everything for the class you'll get an A.

Tests were tough and were usually curved. This was one of her first semesters back teaching juvenile delinquency and the material wasn't that clear. She talked about her experiences working with juvenile delinquents which was interesting and her humor was great. I think if she lectured with that more the class would've been more engaging.

Absolute favorite professor thus far at CSU. Very helpful and entertaining for such dry material. Keeps class fun and everything is straight forward. Trying to take her for every SOC class I have remaining lol
if you go to class. You will do well on her test. Her examples are helpful on test. She's willing to meet anytime and one of my favorite professor -Jay Cleveland State Men's Volleyball
Very easy. I showed up on review days and test days and finished with an easy A.

One of the best sociology professors I've had. Goes over everything you need to know for the test clearly, and offers a lot of extra opportunities to boost your grade up. Always willing to talk after class about anything. Will miss her!
great professor! Really cares about her students! Most important class in law school! she will do everything to help you. So sweet and honest.

She is one of the best professors. She really cares about her students and really wants them to do well. She is picky but its really for the best. She is so helpful both in the class and out. i'd take her for anything. she is clear and the books, although they suck, really help. Best legal writing professor

Professor Kerber is extremely helpful--she cares about the students and it shows.  Always willing to meet and discuss assignments.  One of the best, if not THE best, LW profs at C-M.

Kerber is an awesome professor. She is incredibly helpful - more so than any other professor. She is fun in class and has a great sense of humor. More importantly, she is well respected in the community and you learn so much from meeting with her to discuss your assignments. Very approachable!

Absolutely amazing teacher. Understands the learning style of students. You will become a better writer in all types of essays because she mixes up types and topics. Highly recommended.
awesome teacher, very helpful. a lot of work but she is very flexible and understanding. helped me through the semester.

Prof Kerzner was a fabulous teacher. She is approachable, understanding and willing to help. The work is on par with the course level -as it should be- and she grades and teaches accordingly. I cannot say enough about this professor.

This Prof. was the worst one I have ever had in all my years in collage. He was not helpful and made you fill incompetent  and afraid to ask question for fear of being humiliated in class. He became unbearable and forced me to drop the class because of not getting clarification on different steps and his English and smell was awful. Stay away.
Seems to have only one way of explaining a problem, so if you ask him a question chances are that you wont understand it after he has explained it. And definitely doesnt believe in deoderant.
the only person who can put me to sleep...

wish I would of looked here first.  he is still late to class on a daily basis.  He still gets upset if you dont understand something.  Most of the time you cant even understand what the man says.  Our class is almost two hours long and most of us leave after the first hour.  You can only take so much.
I never went to class and never did homework and got a B+ what more could I ask for?
Overall I really did not like him as a precalculus teacher He did not explain anything very well and sometimes he was hard to understand

AVOID THIS MAN!  Both he and the book are a disservice to students.  Has difficulty explaining beyond theory and gets upset when students don't get it.  During a review on a Monday for a test that Wednesday, he added a section that we hadn't covered!  Expect the worst with him.

This guy was great He had given us all sample questions' answers so we might be able to understand all the questions at the end of the chapters he really wants you to learn something about finance it doesn't matter how you do it. But I had hated CENGAGE aaaarrgghh I hated it. It sucks it was a meanless stupid system.

It was difficult subject and teacher. He is very passionate about finance but, difficult to understand. Tests are very hard had to learn the subject by going to the tutor and finance dept.  It chapter builds on the next need a lot of free time to review. Do sample exams and reveiw.

Professor is genuinely interested in material he is teaching; however, has a hard time expressing material in a manner that is understandable at times.  Must be willing to work outside of class and come with focused questions to get the answers you expect.  Might be too smart to teach!

This class isn't easy, plain and simple.  The pace is set entirely too fast by the university, not the professor.  In addition, the book is confusing and nearly useless, another thing completely out of the hands of the professor.  Mr. Khan is a good instructor.  He makes everything as easy as possible for students, is fun, and helpful.

Awesome Professor and great person in general. He will make you work hard but is always willing to help you out outside of class. He provides study guides for exams and the exam grades and final grades are curved based on class performance. He is the best option for FIN 601 (do NOT take Roncagli).

Doesnt respond to emails, is also super strict about problem solving methods. You must solve them in the same process he does. If you use a different method, even from the textbook, hell mark it incorrect. Besides those, he is fine. Im pretty sure he curves. Do the homework and show up or it will be hard to pass.

Dr. Khan is a great professor. He is very knowledgeable, respected as well as respectful, and has high expectations. If you show you care, he will get you through this relatively tough class. Final was curved, exams were fair. He literally copied several homework problems (some of which he does in class) into the exam, so pay attention! I got a B.

Smart guy, good sense of humor, and usually very clear in his teaching methods. One of the best professors I have had in the civil department. Tests are similar to homework problems and very fair. He will test you on the core concepts and won't try to trip you up. Cares about his students really understanding the material and doing well.
Cares about students, grade based 80% on quizzes, no final, takes attendance, teaching hard to follow at times, but grades fairly and curves a little based on hw and attendance.
Dr. Khan was great. Had him for statics,geotech,and foundations. He was also my senior design mentor. great professor.
He's a good professor. Tests are average.

the best teacher in the civil department!  he is very intelligent and can clearly relay his message to students.  one of the few teachers who understands what a student is asking, and does not make the student feel dumb for asking the question.  he throws curve balls during exams, but grades fairly

No office hours. test problems were ridiculous. it seemed like he tried to make 10 problems into one test question. He is probably the cockiest professor i've ever had, with a real holier than thou attitude
Awesome professor - willing to help always.  I wish he taught more classes!
Amazing professor. Learned a lot from him. Makes the material enjoyable and easy to learn.

I really enjoyed his class, nothing but good things to say about the professor and the class, i am not a spanish major but am strongly considering it, he is an amazing and really knows how to teach this course, and is extremely helpful.

He is cute and extremely inteligent.  He speaks five languages and is humble about it.  Great professor!  I like Spanish now and feel I learned so much.  He is number one.  It is hard to get in his class because they get filled fast, so try to sign up soon.  Try him.  You won't regret!
Awful professor. Very condescending, wont listen to students on how he can help us do better. Half the class dropped after midterm. Avoid at all cost......
WORST TEACHER EVER. Our class averaged a D on our midterm, and he blamed us for not studying enough. avoid at all costs.

The book is required however, he will contradict what is written which makes it impossible to study if you miss a lecture. He's a tough grader, and you're grades come from 6 quizzes. We tried to talk to him about why the class isn't doing well and he responded with we need to study more. He seems like a nice person, but he isn't a good teacher
Quite literally the worst professor I have ever had at Cleveland State University.

The absolute worse professor that I ever had. I really really really encourage you to avoid this class. This guy changes the subject so much, his tests are based off of his lectures which are also terrible. I had to WD from this class. HIS. TESTS. ARE. HARD!!!

(For a class at BWU). Ed Kickel is an "old school" teacher, you will learn from him, but you have to put in the hours outside of class studying. He assigns no homework, and his tests are challenging, but with appropriate effort passable. He enforces his rules within his class (i.e., no cell phones or eating).

I love this professor, people might think he make gags, but I think it's funny. (He kinda pick on people and probably don't like kids) He requires book but I never read it because he lectures pretty well, so I never get to go over the book, but he sometimes test something thats on the book but only mentioned once in class, so be careful.

absolute worst decision I ever made with a teacher never have I had to drop a class till I had him, I've never wrote a review about anyone till now. I would HIGHLY recommend avoiding this guy, tests are extremely difficult no matter how hard you study, bland with discussions, rambles too much, he doesn't even like the book but forces you to get it.

I took Kickel for Micro this year and it was he biggest mistake. He gives no homework only 4 exams which are so difficult no matter how hard you study. If you dont show up you wont pass. Always contradicts the book so reading wont do you any good. More than half the class dropped by the 3rd exam.

Class is very difficult and he is not a very nice person. Will chastise you in front of the class of you screw up or ask a bad question. I am just happy to have completed this course. Feel sorry for the people in his current classes.
Worst professor I've had so far... Tough grader and very boring and unclear. Avoid him if you can!

Don't dislike him as a person, but his class is very difficult. I have tried several different ways to do better on his exams but no success. I would not suggest this class to someone who is just trying to get required credits for the class. Look elsewhere for an easy econ teacher. Book is often contradicted in class, difficult to know test answers
Terrible professor, he is VERY boring and does a bad job at explaining concepts. Exams are all short answer NO multiple choice. Expect to study and read the book...A LOT

Entire grade is based on 3 exams and 1 final exam. You have 5 exams before the final, then he drops 2. But don't let that fool you into thinking it will be easy! The word problems on the exams are SO difficult to understand. He disagrees w/ the textbook, so reading it hardly ever helps.  Got my first ever C from this class. VERY DIFFICULT, avoid!!

Probably the best professor I've had at CSU. Great lecturer and he's funny. While he is the least knowledgable economics teach I've had, he still knows his stuff and has a gift for teaching. Proves great teaching is not based on how much you know, but how you explain it.

Really hard class, dropped it halfway through to retake the next semester. Most of the class is failing. 5 tests, he drops 2 of them but have yet to meet someone in the class who passed even one test. Talks down to students and acts better then everyone else. DON'T TAKE

He is a very condescending professor. He uses the chalkboard and book to lecture, only 5 exams but can drop two making each exam that counts worth 20% and the final is 40%. No homework, but it hurts you in the long run. DO NOT TAKE THIS COURSE WITH THIS PROFESSOR. It is required for my major and I will be retaking it.. and trust me I TRIED.

This was a good class! He does quizzes every week which are 40% of your final grade. You can take a Midterm or just the final. You need to study for the quizzes and the exams, but if you take the notes what he's doing on the board you'll be fine. You need to put some effort in it but then it gets interesting and a lot easier! I recommend him!
Almost everyone is failing this class. He's not the worst professor but his teaching style is unhelpful

One of the worst classes I've ever taken. He talks to you like he's at an economics convention. It takes a LOT of effort to do well. It might as well be called ECN 93800. He quizzes every week, no multiple choice on either the quizzes nor the exams, and is also arrogant. The book was "required" but I never bought it and did fine. STAY AWAY.

Out of my 2 years in College so far, Beth has definitely been my favorite. Very intelligent professor and is knowledgeable about all content, but what is even better is that she is a business woman herself and can share real stories about the Business world and what she has learned and how to overcome obstacles. Im so glad I chose her as a prof!

She is very laid back and fun. The material is pretty easy but she makes it interesting and gives lots of great tips for the real world. I have probably used more skills from this class in the real world than any other, especially in job interviews. Likes having conversations with the class and getting to know people.

Great professor. Class seemed overwhelming at first, but it turned out to be the total opposite! Very clear with what she expects of you, and is also willing to help you if needed. Not much homework, just online work that you need the book for. Overall fun class and nice prof! Would definitely take again. P.S. - attendance is huge!!
Love her! She is amazing! A valuable asset to Cleveland State!

I'll start off by saying that she seems like an awesome person and probably a great professor in lower-level classes. However, in the capstone class for business majors, she seemed a bit out of place. We barely learned anything and practically taught ourselves how to do the semester-long group project. Exams and online HW were both easy.

I took an online with Professor Kilbane. I did not like it at all. She was not clear with her instructions and was not available very often to ask questions. I did learn from this class, but I would not take another class with her online ever.

She always shared some funny stories for the class. I liked the mock interviews they were helpful and made me realize what I need to work on. Out of all the "business" classes I took at Cleveland State, surprisingly with the resume and mock interviews this was one of the most helpful. She didn't pick favorites and treated everybody great.

She's a really great teacher and she knows what she's talking about.  The class is pretty easy but you need to show up because attendance is a big part of the grade. The work is really manageable and she was always willing to help or clarify.  I'd recommend her class to anyone!  The only downside is that I bought the book and didn't use it once.

Ms. Kilbane is such an awesome professor! She's really cool and makes lectures more fun.  This class was an easy A, but she does have required attendance.   She also loves to assign group projects, but makes sure everyone is involved and if they don't, they won't get the credit.  I would take another class that she teaches 200%.

Awesome teacher and awesome person! Interesting and funny to listen to. She knows her material and gives you every possible tool needed to succeed. Only one test- a mid term. I thought it was super easy. Some busy work (online homework- good for easy points) and a big group project. I hope to take her again! Attendance is 5pts per class

Group project that takes up majority of the semester. Attendance is mandatory (graded) and exams are over the exact material she goes over for the reviews. Show up, take notes during her reviews, pass with an A. Gave some opportunities for extra credit as well. Great professor and easy class!

Professor Kilbane is experienced in business. She teaches in a way that helps students understand complex concepts. There is group work that essentially takes all semester. Would not recommend this class unless you enjoy doing a lot of busy work.
Actually gives 'real world' advice and is knowledgeable about business. She is pretty  understanding and will work with you if you need accommodations. Very manageable workload.

She is a terrible teacher. Her class is very easy, but she doesnt know anything. If you ask her a question she has to give this long speech about it that has nothing to do with anything. Easy class and easy A. Just show up and do the work and your fine. But as a professor, one of the worst! Completely pointless.

Beth was pretty cool and very helpful.  The class was very easy.  The tests follow the book.  There was one short paper  and some online homework.  The hardest part of the class was a group project, which still wasn't bad.
Easy grader, if you read the book and keep up you'll be fine. Homework is online. Group project and presentation.

TAKE her she is very easy clear the only homework is flashcards she helpful understanding and makes the class as fun as possible She great and i recommend her the only way you can fail is by not going to class and not doing the homework

So helpful. Gives extra credit. Really wants you to succeed. The power points she gave were boring, but she is always trying to change the class up and asks for your feedback. The Business plan was a chunk of work, but it does all come together. Take her if you have to take this class!

I believe that she is a really good teacher she listens to you understand the concept very open for discussion and questions I will recommend that you take her the class itself is easy as long as you follow along and read the book

Has some trouble with the English language. Some of the things she says end up being very funny. Exams aren't too bad if you study, but I can see them being difficult for other people. Exams consist of 40 multiple choice questions. She is a very strict grader when it comes to other assignments. Doesn't round to the nearest whole point. Ex: 8.7/10

She is enthusiastic about the material and tries to make herself available and helpful, but sometimes she is confusing. There were only 6 quizes and a group project so if you bomb the quizzes, there aren't any other grades to make up for it. Her study guides help you learn but don't really help you for the quizzes. Read the book!!

Tests are multiple-choice but very thorough - don't skip the reading. There were five short writing assignments that were basically free points. One group project that wasn't too bad. Hasn't mastered English yet, which led to some funny moments. Study hard for the tests.

I had her for an online class. I found it amazing that a com teacher didn't have a discussion board. This is one of the hardest classes for com and we were all alone in it. She thought we'd use it to cheat? Really?!? She wasn't much help, she just emphasized the book. She grades slow too.
Professor is intelligent, well organized, and a good communicator. Her class is interesting and informative. Very good overall.

She is terrible! Its hard to understand her and her tests are hard. Her study guides doesn't help students at all. You have to make sure you memorize the whole book. I would not recommend this class for anybody!

I felt like I was in high school with this professor. Not only are we all adults, but some students are older than she is, and we're still all treated like children. She takes points of the grade for cell phone use during class, sleeping, going to the bathroom. She's compassionate enough to let it go if you're not feeling well, but sheesh.

I took COM 303 online with Prof. Kim. The experience was frustrating. The exams are very difficult and beyond what I hear the in-class exams are like. I agree with the previous poster, she does make frequent grammatical mistakes which is confusing from a professor who will be grading your papers. I suggest taking 303 in class lecture format.

I had Professor Kim for an online class (which I don't like much to begin with).  I can't recommend her.  She is a fairly slow grader, makes somewhat confusing lecture notes with plenty of typos, and her study guides are virtually useless.  They basically say "if you've read the chapter, you should be ok."
Not clear in what she wants AT ALL, deviates from syllabus, lectures without merit.
She is very interested in the class. She likes to put students in group work. I learned so many things from her. Highly recommended.
She is a very respectful professor. Fair grader. If you exert an effort in her classes, you will get a good grade. Attendance and participation are important. No tests. Just papers.

She expects too much for papers. Asking students to answer 8 questions and discuss those answers as well as talk about beliefs on teaching a second language before taking the class and how those beliefs have changed in three pages. And comments negatively if you go the full three pages allotted.
Dr. Kim is soft-spoken, at times it is difficult to hear what she is saying. But she is very knowledgeable in the field and a good professor

Dr. Kim is a great professor& very nice,but expects a fair amount of effort in her class.Come to class prepared,read before class &partake in discussions.Grading focuses on authentic method(presentations&projects) rather than paper&pen tests,but it's worth it! You'll have a solid understanding of the material&feel like you benefitted from the class

Dr. Kim is a good professor, and she is very nice. She is very consistant with her grading and her syllabus, expect to have work to do every week without fail. Focuses more on reading and writing instead of written tests, but grades fairly. If you are interested and put effort into the class & material you will be rewarded.

An extremely knowledgeable and smart professor, which will show in his lectures. Willing to go out of his way to help you understand the material, be it during class or office hours. A bit of a quiet speaker. However, if you listen well, you will pick up on everything just fine. Go to his office hours if you need clarification. Easily recommended.

Of the few things I understand from his accent and poor projection, I gain little from his lectures.  He does not explain concepts well and adds last minute random rules to assignments and quizzes.  One may find it better to read the textbook or look over the notes oneself while in class, as well as tuning in to see what changes he makes to them.

Ah yes, I remember Prof Kim quite fondly. I believe it was Chaucer, no wait, it was Kafka who famously said, "A poor teacher will give you knowledge, a good teacher will give you wisdom, but a great teacher, well a great teacher will give you life" Kim has given me that and more. When I look out the window today, I see tomorrow. Thank you, my lord.
He is very helpful when asked. But, during the lecture he is scattered and his accent is very hard decipher the information he is teaching.

Teacher seems nervous when speaking in class, which causes him to ramble and unable to convert ideas.  Frequently changing what is being taught so the class as a whole is lost. Learning more from Khan Academy and self teaching. Frustrating when it's 5000 for a full-time semster.

Very good hearted and has very good intentions, but honestly this is a teach yourself type of course. His english is not clear enough to understand the material, but the benefit of this course, is that the professor goes along with the book. This course is a must take for myself, but if it was not I would have drop this class on day one.

It is very hard to understand the professor. He is very soft spoken and often talks facing the bored. I think he should utilize a microphone to project his voice, so students could hear him. Many students are lost and there are a lot of students that have to explain the material to fellown classmates.
Very hard to follow

Does not explain concepts very well (as in he expects you to know this material before he teaches it). Doesn't explain material very well when you ask him questions and makes various changes to his  course requirements without really explaining fully what he expects of students.

Topic is easy, but trying to decipher what he is saying/explaining can be difficult. I attend class to take notes on what he highlights, then read the book to get a better explanation. He tends to bounce around a lot from slide to slide, making it even harder to follow in class. Check email night b4, he tends to post slides/hmwk last minute.

you can not Understand what he is saying. completely soft spoken and un able to be heard. Not clear on what he is doing because he talks to the board when doing examples and we cannot hear him in the first place.
He is very hard to understand, but if you email him with questions on your own time, he is there to help.
Very tough to understand what he is saying and he does not seem to know the material he is teaching very well
Can't understand a word he's saying he isn't clear at all in the way he teaches

Not a very good teacher. Not clear at all. Why would you hire someone that can barley speak English? He goes way to fast and has no patience for questions. He seems to mumble a lot of word to himself. Would not recommend him.

You could not understand any words in class and looks like speak with him self also, he did not prepare well and he ask student for help I did not believe he had  PH.D. This is first time in my life that prof. give us 2 more project after Final exam He might give you good grade but you will learn nothing  .  I have bad experience with him

He is very difficult to understand,  he very nice and willing to gone help but as he is hard to understand,  you won't be able to understand the help he is giving.  He had an amazing grading scale which many utilize.  He wouldn't be my first choice, but his grade scale keeps him from being my last choice

Professor Kim was all over the place with her lectures. A typical day in class was her talking about her personal experience, hyping herself up as the best SWKER & rambling on about other things. The lecture contained her own notes that she made up, that covered one topic from each chapter at most. We did not follow the syllabus at all. Dont take!

Probably one of the worst professors I've taken out of my 4 years of college. Half of the time she tells us useless stories that don't contribute to class. She acts like she is the best professor and more experienced than all the others. She is rude to her students when they are confused and basically tells us to figure it out. Do not take. a waste

Most of the time the lecture is just her going off on tangents that aren't even relevant. We finished her notes about a month and a half before class is actually supposed to end, and has nothing else planned. She also has no idea what shes talking about sometimes, for example on gender she contradicted herself many times & confused everyone.

Probably the most confusing class you'll ever take. Really does not follow the syllabus at all, got done with all material at week 9 or 10 and then said she was not going to take attendance anymore, and then flat out told us she lied and was still taking it. She tells stories all class, and expects us to understand the information. Do not take!

You'll learn a lot in this class for sure! She is very understanding and is willing to help you if you're struggling. She teaches from the textbook but as long as you take good notes in class you don't need to buy it. Class was always interesting and the projects and assignments weren't grueling. Definitely take her for SWK 305!!
He's a great professor and knows his stuff. He probably has the best personality in the department and is willing to help students.

I took 480 - Computer Architecture with him my final semester, and felt anxious the entire time. I knew several people who took his class before and claimed there was nothing to worry about, and they were right. I did all the homework, bomb'd the exams, and I ended up with an A-. As long as you try, there's nothing for you to worry about.

Go for this professor. He is best. He always inspires students to write research papers. He is the coolest professor of CSU. His exams are pretty much challenging. He is good grader. So, don't worry about grades.
Caring Professor. He provided Pizza, Donuts and some soft drinks on the last day of the class, sort of farewell party. I wish I could take more courses with him.

Had Dr. Kim for an online class and he was very well prepared. His lectures were recorded and he gives a lot of examples to work on. Homework is not difficult as long as you watch his lectures and check the notes he provides. Tests are not hard if you review the hw/notes.

Had Dr. Kim for an online class and he was very well prepared. His lectures were recorded and he gives a lot of examples to work on. Homework is not difficult as long as you watch his lectures and check the notes he provides. Tests are not hard if you review the hw/notes.

One of the most student-first teachers I've ever seen. He gives you every chance to do well, it seems like you would have to try to fail. His homework is graded lightly and was actually interesting to do. He also makes spreadsheets which are remarkable.

Dr. Kim is probably the most fair and reasonable professors you will find in the CivE department. Do your work, don't cheat, and study. He makes everything available to you and gives you a layout of what to expect on exams.
Best professor ever!

If you need to take a finance course I would highly recommend Prof King. Super knowledgeable and approachable. Grades fairly, and is willing to engage in discussions on the material during class. If you are taking this class while working full time he fully understands if you can't make class, just make sure you let him know if you need to miss.

Professor King is the man. He is a power hitter in the real world and he knows his stuff. I learned a lot from him. He even gave me advice for my personal financial situation. He is the best finance teacher that I've had.

I would advise to stay away from this one if you want to learn anything.  He reads the slides in class and does not engage students to learn material.  To top this off, he does not respond to emails in a timely manner.  Test scores are very low and he does not take any initiative to assist students in order to raise the average.   Just awful!!

Dr. K. is a very nice person, and his exams are reasonable.  Some of the lectures get off topic, and the section I was in had a number of complainers that also caused the class to go off topic.  He is helpful in office hours and wants you to succeed.

Super nice guy. His tests, notes and homework are really useful. He doesn't use trick questions or the most devilish examples from the book. Everything is straight-forward and he wants people to succeed in his class. Sometimes lectures get off-track or become less clear. Tests are open-note and multiple choice.
the best professor.
He doesn't teach at all. Super nice guy. 4 tests, non cumulative final. He's fair, just not a teacher.

Easy class online. The tests and quizzes are so easy, if you know where to find the answers. I missed a week and he actually emailed me reminding me and let me send in the answers to get full credit. Didn't even use my book for the online class. Do your weekly assignments and you will have an A

"Ok people..", he's alright. Not the best at teaching, but he's a nice guy. More than willing to give you extra help. Tests are not exactly close to what is discussed in class - read the textbook and you'll do fine. Curves tests, which are open note. Talks quietly & stands infront of the chalk board most of the lecture. Relatively easy for physics.
This guy is a boss! Done! :)
An awesome proffesor.helps the students everytime.
Not a physics major and the class was easy! I needed it for a gen ed requirement, and it easily fulfilled it. He is nice and fair! If you have questions, email him and he will help.
This guy will go out of his way to help the students understand. He will go over the topic repeatedly if necessary. Great Prof. if you want to learn the topic.

Really loved his class, goes over the same concepts more than once, his quizes and reviews are a lot like tests. First physics class i ever took and got an easy A. Looking forward to taking his physics 2 class.
102 is such an easy class. I doodled more than took actual notes. Slept a lot too. Got an A though. Tom is an ok teacher but a little soft spoken.
Talk louder!  Difficult to hear him speak. Stands in front of board, and notes are almost useless. Tests are open-note. Better off self-studying. Nice guy, though.

I was told he was a great teacher...HOWEVER he is very bad at getting concepts across! He is VERY boring and you can barely hear him most of the time! The pretests are hard as are the tests..b/c they have NOTHING to do w/ the lectures! He is a very bad teacher! He also stands in front of his notes! Who is he hiding them from?

Its not the fact that the material is hard, its the fact that he does not know physics material. He always say that the book is wrong when tutors and students have proven the book to be correct. He gives pretest that he cliams sometimes have the wrong answers if the problem does not work out in his favor. Then he says he did not create thepretest.

almost no interaction b/w him and the class. dull and slow-speaking. turned me off of what should have been a fascinating subject. tests are open note and mostly drawn from the homework so feel free to sleep in class (it's not like he notices).

He doesn't make the material particularly interesting, and it's hard to pay attention. Tests are multiple choice and don't contain enough questions (only 20) to give you a chance to show your actual knowledge, some of it is luck.  He is helpful and nice and wants to make sure everyone understands the material.

The class seems really easy, but when it comes to the homework and the tests, I stress myself out trying to figure out which questions are the "trick" questions. Some of the questions are vague and don't go off of the book (which is nice, because he tells you to read the book to pass the tests and understand the homework). Nice guy, but ugh!

He seems very caring and concerned with how everyone in the class is doing.  He always asks if anyone's tried the recent homework and if they're having any trouble even if no one brings it up.  It is very basic physics, so it can get pretty boring though, so your laptop/doodling can become your best friend. Just don't let it keep you from learning.

The guy was great.  Very interested in how well his students understand material.  Tests were easy--just do the homework and know how to do the example questions from the book. Extremely nice old man who really likes astrophysics.

Not sure if she had stuff going on this semester or not but she was pretty much absent and would forget to post our assignments on BB. The class is super easy but the discussion boards can be lengthy (but there's only 4). A lot of the quiz answers you can find online... easy A if ya need a buffer.

Hated this professor. One of her assignments was so intrusive I refused to do it. You can't ask your students when their last gyno appointment was or what medications they take. The actual class is super easy, I barely payed attention to it and I passed with an A. Some of her assignments shouldn't be allowed, though. Don't be afraid to tell her no.

This professor is fun and knowledgeable in her area of expertise. However, theres not much guidelines on what to do outside of class such as presentations, papers and or reflection. Also her grading criteria and feedback in nonexistent. Nonetheless, she is easily approachable and lectures are worthwhile & do help you understand the material.
For the subject matter of CNS517 Ethics I think she did a fantastic job keeping the students engaged.

Kirven was a very sweet and kind individual. His lectures were very discussion based and were usually quite interesting. I did not feel challenged in his class which made it hard in the long run with my other classes since I was not educated enough in the subject he was supposed to teach.

I enjoyed Professor Kirven as a human being, yet I felt like I did not learn much in this class. I did not feel engaged enough. It was a very easy class and I respect Professor Kirven deeply, just wish I would have learned more
New to CSU Social Work Department  . A good professor overall . Helpful to his students. I would  recommend students take his class .

He's funny and tries to make accounting fun for everyone. He likes to walk around and ask questions to get people involved. He gives extra credit and curves. Teaching wise not the most clear teacher. His teaching can be all over the place.

Dr. Klaus is upbeat and funny and does a great job of making the otherwise dry subject of accounting something that is interesting and applicable to everyday life. His use of real-world examples is extremely helpful and he is always willing to go out of his way to make sure we understand the course material.

For accounting 221 he made it very easy to get an A in the class test questions were literally exact questions from class worksheets and homework. If you pay attention in lecture and highlight the things he stresses you will know what he will ask about on the test.
Very forgetful. To ace his exams: Do the connect hw, and then before the test redo all the problems. PRACTICE PRACTICE PRACTICE. Funny Guy

Easy class. Attendance is mandatory (graded) and he gives reviews. Midterm and final only. Tiny homework assignments are for extra credit at the end of the semester. He truly wants all of his students to pass with an A or B. Highly recommend if you want an easy A.

Does not finish his sentences and words, which make it hard to understand him. First two tests are easy, final not that much. HW problems are totally different from what we do in class. If class ends at 9.45, he begins a new topic at 9.35. Pop Quizzes. Doesn't seem like he knows the structure of the class and CSU overall.

Great guy but not a great professor. Biggest problems: is "theory" based and not problem specific. He offers minimal help with homework options online such as "show hint" or even as simple as posting practice problems. Often he gets ahead of himself, mentions to the class he just did, than continues on with a different topic leaving confusion.

He's not a bad person but he is horrible as a professor. Some people weren't meant to teach. Confusing and talks way too fast. Everyone in class looks lost. Accounting is easy really but I shouldn't have to teach myself the material entirely or there isn't a point in paying to go to class. Waste of my time. Would not recommend.

He is the sweetest professor ever he is always trying his best to help his students however his teaching method is all over the place ... reading the book and going to tutoring was an mandatory thing for me to even understand the concepts....

Was a waste of a professor. Had to teach myself everything just to get out of the class with a B. He is rude when you ask questions, and doesn't even attempt to answer them for you. Tests are multiple choice and over topics never discussed in class. Avoid!

Frank Klaus is a very good professor who cares about the success of his students. The subject matter is slightly harder than other classes and hevtalks fast so you may feel lost in class sometimes. He highlights what you need to know for tests and nearly ball problems on tests are easy versions of the content in class. He also is funny!

Klaus was a fantastic professor. He is interested in the success of the student, has an impressive resume, and works through problems until everyone gets it. He has a sense of humor that makes a boring subject interesting, my only complaint with his is he is not very organized, but he will compensate by sticking to the syllabus.
Great guy, you will be using the textbook a lot for this class. Klaus is fair and reasonable. I would highly recommend him for this class.

HORRIBLE DO NOT TAKE! He is boring, makes fun of you if you ask a question, impossible to understand, tests are a pain and in general he's just a awful. Save yourself the trouble, don't take this awful class.

I am a great student (promise.) Business isn't my first major but I work hard. The teacher is sporatic and he doesn't answer students questions. Instead he answers part of the question and deflects part of it. I have spent a ton of time in tutoring and still feel lost when he talks. trouble understanding what hes saying and the class = headache

Best accounting class and professor I've had. He made hard material seem manageable and made the class extrememly engaging and interesting. Highly recommend taking  act 688 with him, it's so worth it!

I really don't recommend Klaus. His teaching was all over the place and not very clear. I learned more by just studying from the book by myself or with a study group. Outside of the classroom he's cool tho. But I deff wouldn't take him for a class, especially one as difficult as accounting.
Nice Guy with good sense of humor. fair grader sometimes a little confusing but I would take him again

Possibly the worst professor of my college career. His writing on the board is barely legible and his answer to student questions are often twisted and confusing. If possible, take the class with Castragano.

This guy is a horrible teacher.  His handwriting is non-legible. He stands at the boar and gets confused. Do not take this class. The online homework and quizzes are a joke and don't tell you what is wrong. He talks behind students backs making it seem like they were at fault when everyone does bad on his tests. What a joke of a teacher
I must say, my information goes back to ca. 1986. He was a favorite of many--if not all--students! "Hut ab" to "K-P"!
Changed my life
KP Hinze rocks.

Hardest class Ive taken to date. Nonetheless, couldnt be more greatful. Klee forces you to think, understand the concepts at its core. Great course if youre pursuing the CFA. Helped me outside of class with connections and on my project for another class. However, if youre not hardworking- turn around and run. This class isnt meant for everyone.

This is the hardest class to take in the finance department, and he is one of the worst professors. He does not like to elaborate or give help to his students, his lecture videos are long and confusing and doesn't explain how to do the assignments. He's unaccommodating and he grades like judge Judy. Try to avoid him, this was my hardest class. 4/10

Amid the COVID-19 pandemic, know that the mighty Roger Klee from Alabama led a merciless frontier upon his class where the homeworks were easy to look up the answers to, and deceivingly made your grade look good, only to find out they are worth nothing, and your grade hinges on a few mere guessing tests. Office hours were to no avail. Bad show smh.

We have 4 big assignments and your entire grade is based on those 4 assignments. He posts lecture videos, but he doesn't really do a good job explaining complex topics. I watch all the lecture videos and take notes, but I still sometimes have no idea what he is talking about. I would actually understand all the concepts if somebody explained it.

Professor Klee is probably one of the worst professors I have had outside my major. Hes overly critical of his assignments when he has such vague lectures. He asks way too much of you with the little information he provides. Dont take his class if you can avoid it.

Hardest class Ive taken to date. Nonetheless, couldnt be more greatful. Klee forces you to think, understand the concepts at its core. Great course if youre pursuing the CFA. Helped me outside of class with connections and on my project for another class. However, if youre not hardworking- turn around and run. This class isnt meant for everyone.

He's a great finance professor. He tells you what you have to do to get a good grade and its absolutely doable if you are willing to put in maybe 2-3 hours of work outside of class a week. He's not an easy A. He makes you work to understand rather than throwing you softballs. I definitely felt a lot more knowledgeable after his lectures.
hardest finance class I have ever taken. You literally have to watch 2 hour videos and then do the hw off those videos all semester! only 6 assignments and is a tough grader. Avoid him!

I have honestly never been so stressed about a beginner Finance class in my life. I had the displeasure of having Professor Klee this semester. He will go out of his way to deduct points a even if your answer is correct. He will also provide NO CLARITY on why your answer was wrong or show you the correct answer, Do not take if you like your GPA

The worst professor I've ever had. You have a lecture and connect HW for each chapter and then the exams, which are difficult. He was not accessible when I needed help and his test questions are worded in a way that makes you second guess if you are right, for every question. He does curve each exam but beware he is EXTREMELY DIFFICULT.

Never gives ANY feedback, won't answer your questions. On the last assignment I emailed questions after grading so I knew what I lost points for, he replied with "your final grade is an A" and said he wouldn't discuss the assignment with me any further. He is a jerk and obv doesn't care. Atrocious excuse for a professor. Do not take

Gives zero constructive criticism, marks things wrong and takes points off, and doesn't tell you why so you're making the same mistake, over and over all semester. If you ask him about it, he'll interrupt you while you're talking. Unclear expectations on grading criteria. He is the only professor who teaches finance so you have to deal with it.

Finance is tough and you have to work for your grade. He makes it as simple and straightforward as possible, and he gives you the formulas and everything you need to do. 4 exams and a HW grade, each worth 20% of your grade. He curves the exams. He can seem arrogant in lectures but you can tell he cares. You will probably struggle if you skip class.

If you looking for a FIN351 professor that actually teaches, Professor Klee is the guy to have. He is nice, some ppl would say he's awkward. He's helpful, he gave me good advice when I did bad on the 1st 2 exams and I did better on the last 2 exams. His exam are quite brutal, but if you study, it shouldn't be too bad. Going to his office hrs helps.

Prof. Klee comes off rude and weird at first. But he is hilarious, enthusiastic and a bit awkward. Lecture heavy; teaches off of his powerpoints. Tricky exam questions but he gives lots of hints and doesn't ask anything he didn't already talk about. Clear and straightforward teaching style, class was very easy for me.

I really liked this class during lectures. I thought it was really interesting, the girl next to me? not so much.. Participation is a must, you can't get through this class without being called on. Exams are absolutely horrendous. Purposely worded to be confusing, I failed every exam. I hate the finance calculator too, they don't always work right.

Knows finance. But is cocky and condescending. Will interrupt and talk over you in the middle of you asking him a question. Tough to get stuff answered due to that. Took FIN 201 and Fin 201 tests were rite off the power point and supplements. Know the slides and the simple calculations and you will get an easy A

Overall a pretty good professor. He is clear and concise with his class, and discussion among students is encouraged. He teaches a meaningful topic and his passion and knowledge for it is clear. From personal experience he will meet with you after class to discuss help in the class and with in your career search. Great guy I wish more were like him

It's obvious that he is very knowledgable about finance. He talks ALOT and will ignore students raising their hand to ask something. Something about his demeanor is slightly off-putting and awkward. The material is useful and I will use it going forward. Make sure to practice the calculation problems or you will miss huge points on the exam.

Not horrible, but not great. He understands finance & is approachable, but I don't think he's an exceptional teacher. Several students were struggling in this class & I don't think he explained concepts well or in depth. Not a gifted communicator & too academic. Needed a more innovative & creative approach to explaining big concepts in investments

I thought this class was going to be impossible, and his lectures are SO boring. All he does is talk about the power points and examples you already have in front of you. The tests are pretty hard, but as long as you do the homework and try you will be fine. He does curve the test scores though, so that's a plus!

He is a really nice understanding guy. 3 papers made up the grade. It really helps if you attend the zoom meetings but you can get by without going to every one. Isn't extremely strict on attendance but does love when people participate so he isn't the only one talking during class. It takes him a bit to grade papers but his feedback is helpful.

He is a really nice understanding guy. 3 papers made up the grade. It really helps if you attend the zoom meetings but you can get by without going to every one. Isn't extremely strict on attendance but does love when people participate so he isn't the only one talking during class. It takes him a bit to grade papers but his feedback is helpful.

I've attended three institutions & Dr. Kleidman is by far the worst professor I've ever had. He is highly disorganized & puts very little effort into his lectures. It almost seems like he makes them up on the spot. The syllabus constantly gets changed. He mostly lets documentaries do the teaching for him. Takes weeks to months to input grades.

Consistently unreliable. Changed the syllabus nearly a dozen times. He took weeks to grade assignments. And didn't answer his emails. Constantly went off-topic. Instead, went on Facebook, looked up funny videos on Youtube, etc. His lectures are extremely watered down and don't cover the material well enough. He's sincere but he's not a good teacher

He focuses mostly on off-subject topics with little to no emphasis on Sociology. There is a serious lack of substance in his courses. More often than not, he would spend the first ten to fifteen minutes of class completely unprepared, either taking the first ten to fifteen minutes of class to set up his computer or search comedy videos on Youtube.

He really goes off topic a ton, every 1 hour 15 minute class, he would spend 30 minutes of it talking about some random thing. Made me think, why am I paying for him just to talk? He also has you write in a style that doesn't exist (academically) so that threw me off. They were really long papers too. BUT He will make things extra credit if asked.

I just took him for my urban sociology class and he is the worst professor I have ever had. In order for me to graduate next May, I would have to take him again. I'm gladly waiting till next December's graduation. His grading is beyond tough and he will not help you. He is mean and he does not care. Please avoid him! He's that bad.
Terrible Person and horrible teacher. He talks about his life non-stop and interrupts students all the time. Choose another professor and class if you can.

Tried to take his Community Organization class. It was just him head-hunting students to send to some workshop in Florida being held by the Leadership organization he belongs to. Very sketchy, very unethical.  I ended up withdrawing because his grumpy attitude was not worth the easy class.  Toots own horn constantly, no structure, avoid if you can.

This class is honestly pointless. I have taken him FALL 2015 and I learned nothing but about his and his friends experiences being a community organizer. He need to focus more on the class. Also the final paper is pointless he don't grade it or anything. If you can avoid this class please do!!!!!
I've taken Kleidman for SOC305 and it was tough, but for SOC400 he was much easier than expected.

In the 15th week the professor told us that: weekly quizzes, short paper, & final exam - will not matter not affect our grade (Unless C or higher) but  the Long Paper assignment would be the majority of our grade.  He then went through the Long Paper Assignment's question by question. The bad thing is the long paper was due a week before this.. ya

This class is impossible, if you can avoid it do so! He rambles on and on about things that do not matter and when it comes time for a paper he is confused why no one understands anything. All he cares about is community organizing, so if you have no interest, I'd move right along.

I absolutely dreaded going to his class. He is a tough grader, but for unnecessary reasons. It seems as if he gets some type of pleasure out of making his students' life difficult. His quizzes are irrelevant.  His paper requirements are terrible; and it's so hard to get a good grade on anything he assigns. I will never take him classes again.

Professor Kleidman is passionate about making the world a better place and he isn't afraid to say so. I don't know how anyone could be surprised that a sociology professor is liberal. Conservative sociologist is an oxymoron! I enjoyed his classes thoroughly and I look at social issues differently because of them. My favorite professor.

Knowledgable, tries to be fair, easy tests, but exactly as described regarding organization and syllabus. A bit authoritarian and sensitive if he believes students aren't paying attention to him (cell phones, laptops). Acts friendly but it's an act. Provides a great argument against the tenure system or that top universities create top people.

Very boring, talks about his son, and his dog a lot. He is very opiionated, not helpful at all, will cut you off in the middle of speaking, he very rude. He talks about community organizing, and being a leader, he's in the wrong field, he's not a people person at all, he's very arrogant.

He will turn any Sociology course into a community organizing session.  He is extremely unorganized, and extremely boring. He is super liberal and will not tolerate any other opinions. I learned more from not attending his class than I did attending his useless class. Waste of money and time.

He was a decent teacher overall. While I agree he was extremely unorganized, changing the syllabus on an almost daily basis, he genuinely cared about the subject and wanted us to do well. Hard grader, but if you put the time in you'll get an A.

So unorganized its ridiculous. Grade is based on papers and one group project that is useless. He is extreme left wing politics and likes to put in his thoughts more than teach the class. I enjoy learning but not from him.

Totally unorganized!! He changed our syllabus atleast twice a week! Because of his lack of structure, he pushed papers and quizzes back until the last minute and still expected everything tobe done! Everything turned into community organizing! Waste of time and money!

His lectures come off as an old guy's ramblings about the good ol days but they're truly informative and valuable. He's respectful of all his students and understands a lot about his subject. Very approachable, very kind, very pleasant, and his grades will actually reflect how well you did. Very clear on his expectations and follows through.

I neverrrr rate professors on here, but I need to warn EVERYONE not to take this professor. It will be your biggest mistake ever. He lectures the entire class telling stories about his own boring life and expects you to remember it all for the test. This is by FAR the worst class I've ever taken at CSU. Please don't take him- you'll thank me later!

Good guy, great personality, but not the best in terms of teaching skills. Class is graded only by 2 exams and a paper which seems unfair. In addition, no powerpoints, notes, or in-class assignments to help with knowledge of the course material. The class involves him lecturing about his own Cleveland experiences, not anything like the description.

2 tests 1 paper. Grades outside his criteria for the paper and takes off points for not including things in your paper that weren't part of the criteria. Lectures, good luck. Exams come off of things he says in class and small details out of the book. This course should not be a requirement by any means, especially along those guidelines!!

Makes you go to class. Lectures entire period, no blackboard, no powerpoints. Tests are based upon the little things he thinks he discusses in class. 1 paper, 2 exams. Refuses to look over paper before turning it in-- bogus. Requirements of paper are vague and his grading is not clear. No structure. Knows little about the course.

The lectures were so long he does not use PowerPoint or blackboard at all. The lectures are based on his opinion of the subject & tests are tough he base them Off of what he thought he talked about during the class. If you can choose another professor for the course. He pay attention to the ones who don't come to class. U canUse notes during test

He is subjective about everything. The exams are multiple choice but it contains multiple correct answers and you have to select the one that agrees with his perspective, if not, he'll mark it wrong. It's impossible to write down every word he says because he speaks fast and copiously. I'm a straight A student yet I got a B in the class.  Avoid him

Worst Professor I have had in my entire life. Lectures off his own experience/stories the entire class. No power points or notes. Boring. Says that his experience is what you are paying for and he knows business better than the book.

He's a nice guy and seems to be pretty knowledgeable, However he should not be teaching an intro level business course. he gives one paper that is very long for this course level. his lectures are very boring an attendance is mandatory. Try not to take him unless he is your only option. He does however allow notes and the textbook for the two tests
This class was pretty easy; just do the work required of you and you will be fine.
BORING - CLASS IS SPENT WITH PROF LECTURING ON BOOKS HE HAS WRITTEN -  DON'T BUY THE BOOK USE HIS STUDY GUIDE NOTES AND GOOGLE ANSWERS - TESTS RE OPEN BOOK OPEN NOTES

This class was boring. Not based on what's in the textbook. Just personal stories. Even of the test was an open book, that didn't help. Rude at times. If there's an option for choosing another professor, pls take someone else. Total confusing, don't know what you would see on paper during tests, tough grader.

The City in Film.... Aka a tribute to Denzel Washington. I expected the class to be more focused on the urban environment but it's an African American experience course. I could have watched all those movies at home! I had already seen most of them. Waste of time . Test were open booknoteslaptop but difficult and you're pretty much on your own.
I believe this professor means well most of the time but his class is a snooze fest. His class is very boring and I do regret taking this course.

Do yourself a favor and do not take this class. He is the worst professor I think I've ever had. My advisor even warned me when she saw it on my schedule, and I should have listened. I worked so hard on the assignments and he gave me terrible grades. I didn't even do the term paper because there was no chance of passing anyways & it was worth 50pts

Avoid this prof for this class! Weekly assigned readings do not correspond with learning objectives listed. There are 6  3 pg essays and one 15 pg for final. Essay is based on readings yet the essay question topics arent covered in the readings! A nightmare! And he doesn't answer questions so good luck!

This is the worst class I've taken at CSU. He rambles on and on for 3 hours. Yells at you when you ask him aquestion he doesn't like and feels you should be grateful to him for teaching you. Very sad about this because its one of my last classes here. I pray for the newbies he retires. Avoid this classby any means necessary.

Class was Cleveland: An African American Experience and he barely focused on the subject of the class. It was more of a Cleveland History course. He gives assignments based on reading, but the information that he provides in readings do not coincide with the assignments.

The prof. just rambles for 3 hours - you have no idea what is important.  Yes, the exams are open notes, but that does not help. Very little is from the book.  The paper is annoying.  If you make above a certain grade, you cannot redo it like everyone else who did poorly.  Good and bad because you do not have a chance to raise your grade.

really nice & funny guy. completely different approach to teaching this class than any other teacher. tries to make class interesting by relating stuff to stories which sound like history lessons. just go to class and listen. midterm, final, paper. midterm and final are open book/notes/laptop.

You should DEFINITELY go out of your way to have this professor. He taught disabled kids for years, a lot of experience and real-life stories, very helpful and very easy. Little to no homework and take-home tests. Can easily get off topic but it's totally worth it. No textbook either. Overall, a great, easy, valuable class.

Take this guy if you can.  real life experiences discussed in class.  You can learn alot from his experience.  Class discussion with very little homework and all tests are take home.  An easy A with little effort but you will have learned some useful information.

Class consisted of 2 tests and a 10 page paper. Tests are open book, open note, and open laptop.  Class is entirely lecture. The prof never talks about anything directly from within the book. Instead he talks primarily about the books he's written, as well as stores and restaurant chains that no longer exist. Overall, a boring and pointless class.

Professor Klein's teaching style is very very lecture heavy and opinion based. The entire semester every class was him standing  in one spot talking. The only grades for the class is a midterm and final and a 6 page research paper . His tests are open laptop and book, although the answers are all correct and you have to pick the most correct one.
I had Rita for two levels of Kodaly.  She is knowledgeable, helpful, engaging, and passionate about the method.  I highly recommend her Kodaly classes.
Her class is boring and very hard!!!!!!
Felt like I was still in high school during the class, but definitely found it beneficial. She was personable and made the subject accessible and easy to learn.
No Comments

Rita can be really mean to you if she doesn't think you're a good student (don't be late or forget to work on the homework!) It's a pretty hard class because you have to really work at your ear training skills to be good. Practicing helps a lot but is very boring.

She's a fun, easy professor who's also in school so she knows the game. She explains concepts very well and tries to make class fun. The class, for me, was just a review and so the material was absurdly easy.
Really clear and easy to follow instructor. Takes confusing concepts and simplifies them in a way that is very easy to understand. Would definitely take another class with her.

Caroline has been the best professor. If you ever have the opportunity to take her class, take it!! You can tell she truly cares about her students and gives amazing feedback, as well as lets you explore your own creative writing process. She was my first professor in my first class here and it was an amazing way to start off the year!

Caroline is a wonderful teacher who really works hard to make sure her students succeed in her course. Caroline provides helpful and detailed comments on your papers and is always here for us to succeed. No such thing as stupid questions in her class. Caroline is amazing and I would 100% take her class and or another class of hers again.

Caroline has been the best professor. If you ever have the opportunity to take her class, take it!! You can tell she truly cares about her students and gives amazing feedback, as well as lets you explore your own creative writing process. She was my first professor in my first class here and it was an amazing way to start off the year!

Easiest class I've ever been in. Only grades are 3 exams and no attendance so you can just look at the syllabus and show up on exam days if you want. Exams are super easy, review the power point slides before the exam and you'll be fine. Extra credit homework and presentations are available and can add up to 5% to your final grade. Very easy A+

I thought Dr. Kocher was an excellent teacher.  He knows a lot, cares a lot, and has a lot to teach.  His style is calm and relaxed, which I really liked.  He speaks and explains things very well.  You can do well in his class, but don't mistake him for "easy".  I highly recommend him to anyone.

She responds quickly to emails and her tests are straightforward and follow the study guide example problems taken from previous hw and quizzes. Her lectures can be a tad boring but she is on the ball with organization and it is not difficult to pass this class

She responds quickly to emails and her tests are straightforward and follow the study guide example problems taken from previous hw and quizzes. Her lectures can be a tad boring but she is on the ball with organization and it is not difficult to pass this class

She got back to me quickly on all my emails. Her tests are straightforward and based off of the example problems in HW and quizzes. It is not hard to pass and she is on the ball. Very straightforward class all together. Her lectures are not the most exciting but that's okay because neither is the material.

Professor Koksal is very knowledgeable. Her classes are very lecture heavy. The exams aren't bad if you do the homework. There is a group project due at the end of the semester, and I would say that she is a tough grader, but gives good feedback.

She is easy! The homework assignments arent difficult and her tests are just like the homework questions and she makes her tests open book and open notes so she doesnt even need to curve the tests cause the class average is so high. She also reviews before the tests too so she does a really good job at making sure everyone does well on her tests!

Professor Koksal is very thorough, but you HAVE to pay attention. Her notes are very formula heavy, so you need to listen to make sure you understand the terms when looking back later. Homework is sparse, but you get one chance to get each problem right so your grade can tank quickly. You won't pass if you skip or get distracted during lecture.
Great Professor! She is thorough in going over material and always repeats herself to help students understand her accent. Her tests are fair and she always did a test review before exams.

Bad professor. Accent is incredibly hard to understand and she constantly tries to interject her political ideology into a statistics and economics course. Every practice problem is twisted into somehow defending her political views. A prime example of today's issues in academia. I recommend finding a different professor.

I don't know why she has good reviews. Almost everyone fails her tests so she curves a lot but it still doesn't get you a necessarily good grade. Read right from the slides and her voice annoyed the entire class by the end of the semester.
She speaks very good English but with a strong accent. She is pretty strict compared to most professors although most of it's reasonable and to avoid classroom disruption.

Prof. Koksal is very thorough during lectures and always stops to see if others are understanding. However, she takes way too much time to go over material in the previous lecture. Very few grades in her class, but her exams and homeworks are extremely easy as long as you pay attention in class. Curves her midterms and sometimes homeworks as well.

Aycan is extremely knowledgeable on all things econ. She thoroughly explains topics in her lectures and gives access to GREAT practice tests and generally takes most of her test questions from there. Her lectures tend to be a little monotone, but focus on understanding the material and you will be good.

A good professor overall and will teach you the material enough to understand it. 3 Exams and 2 online homework. If you aren't good at exams that's too bad. There isn't enough work that will help balance your grade and your only saving grace is that she curves a bit to get you a higher grade. To pass this class you need to be dedicated and study.

She gives 3 exams, and 2 10 point homework assignments. Nothing else. The tests are very very similar to the practice exams she posts on blackboard. But she changes some of the questions up. She curves quite a lot but still, it's hard to get an A with only 3 exams and two small assignments.

She is a very intelligent professor and expects you as the student to study and take responsibility to get a good grade. She wants to help but you must reach out to her, she'll respect you as long as you show the same respect to her.

Professor Koksal delivers information-filled lectures in a direct and defined manner.  She emphasized on attending class to "do well on exams"- this was true.  A student must also understand all of the information, as it all builds upon previous material.  That is what made the class very difficult, but she made it easy, in the "long-run" (ha!)

Very harsh accent that is hard to understand sometimes but a wel educated professor who cares about econ and her students. You will not do well in the class if you dont go to class. if you dont miss more than 3 classes she gives 3 extra credit points. Curves tests and gives you practice tests that help a lot!

I had Dr. Koksal for econometrics and health economics. She's very knowledgeable and will help if you have questions. She's a tough grader for sure, and if you have a paper she's very particular about grammar and and semantics. Tests can be difficult, but if you show up for the review you're usually seeing what will be on it. I'd take her again.

I had this professor for Micro and Macro economics. She's a very good teacher and she encourages you to ask questions if something is unclear. She does have an accent, but she tries her best to make herself sound clear. She has 0 tolerance for sleeping in class and being on your phone/computer.

She was a great professor I would for sure take a class of hers again. You have to really like math and economics to enjoy this class and her. She knows what she's teaching, just go to class and pay attention and you'll do fine on the tests. Usually she curves them too. Look over powerpoints before tests too
She's nice and cares about her students. She curves her test. Wasn't the hardest class.

Isn't very good at teaching. Fairly snarky and rude if you need help or are trying to help another student. You will need help passing the class if you do not have prior knowledge of Java, but I personally wouldn't seek that help from him. The material is fairly simple, but the quality of instruction just isn't there.

Unfortunately, you are forced to take him for CIS 151. He will call you out by name in class even if you are paying attention to ask if you have any questions. If you or any other students do have any questions, he will then take the next 20 minutes to lecture the previous topic. Konangi will make you feel dumb for your mistakes and not help you.

the tests have nothing to do with what you learned. the guy purposefully doesn't teach anything so that he can use the same exams every semester. there's a tip. ask someone that already took the course about the exams if you want to pass. this guy makes absolutely zero sense and doesn't teach you anything important at all.
avoid at all costs

Definitely do not go into this class without background knowledge in programming. As a 100 level class I was told I would be taught the basics (as said in course description and by my advisor). He would get upset when people would ask questions. Told multiple people to "shhh" when trying to ask questions. Extremely rude and does not help.
At first, I heard He was a very strict Professor. Later After taking the course, I learned that He expects students to make their work and give some time to his subjects.

Konangi was a professor I learned to appreciate after I took other classes by professors in the CIS department. He is very strict and likes his class run a certain way. However, he is extremely clear in his expectations and you can be successful if you are respectful and take the time to learn.
Difficult class, but he will answer questions though. Not mandatory, but when there are assignments you really should be in class, becuase both him and the TA will help you
