I'd like to remain conservative, but this prof just does not have a good method of teaching. The hardest part about his class is that he does not elaborate well. He give you the names of some variables but doesnt really explain how to use them. And I agree that he talks down to some students. Doesnt really answer questions properly. Do not take him

The worst professor I have EVER had. If you enjoy being told to "shhh" while asking him a question or even trying to approach him for a few minutes after class, it is nearly impossible. He clearly does NOT care about anyone in his class. It does not matter how polite you try to be, he is a horrible  educator.

Worst professor I have ever had. Unapproachable. Makes you second guess yourself constantly. Makes you feel stupid for asking questions. If i already didn't know how to program I probably wouldn't have passed this class.  DO NOT RECCOMANED

I've only been in the class for a couple days now, but  I can already tell that he is extremely unapproachable. When you ask him questions, he doesn't respond with an intelligent answer to better explain himself, but rather he makes statements and assumptions about you as a person and makes you feel extremely dumb for even asking the question.

One of the worst professor's I've ever had. He makes you feel stupid for not knowing what is wrong with your program, though the class requires no programming experience. He talks quietly and has an accent that sometimes you can't understand. He's always rude and always corrects everyone's answer so no reason to even ask (no one is right but him)

Do not take a class with this professor.  He is unapproachable and doesn't explain the material well at all. There wasn't a textbook or any readingstudy material for this class so all you have to study from are his powerpoint slides, which are not very clear to follow at all. Avoid this professor at all costs.

I thought he was an excellent professor.  He clearly cares about the students' learning, and will slow down to make sure the class as a whole is understanding the concepts. He engages the students well by initiating questions and discussion points. Tests and assignments are fair.  I would highly recommend him.

Things I learned about "invitation to computing": 1.  Hard assignments 2.  Lack of clarity 3.  Unapproachable 4.  Makes me question my major  If you see his name while registering for classes, avoid at all costs!
-This guy was not helpful at all. -Unapproachable. -If you are completely new to CIS, beware!!!!!!

Mindful of everyone on here who might mention anything about Dr. K's English, I have to say yeah, get over it people, because this is my teacher here we are talking about.  Professor Sundaresan was excellent to approach, concerned with students, genuinely helped, never made things seem out of time or anxious when it came to his expectations. Great
His English doesn't sound correctly.  It's most of the time I was hearing nothing.  I am good at math but just because he is not good at English at all, I paid for trying hard to hear him, didn't I?

His English so unclear makes me confused. He doesn't know the technology, so he can't show us the using of his calculator.  He is going deaf and didn't understand my meaning although I explained and explained again.  Though, he really will help students.

Taught the material very well, but had only three tests (INCLUDING the midterm and final) the whole semester. And the tests were graded pretty harshly. Still... he did teach the material well enough I guess.

Good professor, but teaches VERY slowly. His classes are easy, but he might not cover all of the material another professor would because of how slow the class is taught. Also, to make pronuciation easier just refer to him as 'Kenny Sanderson'. I like it better.

A good man. Genuinely cares about the progress of the student.  He takes it very much to heart when it seems someone is falling behind, and so he can be very blunt.  But he'll go above and beyond to help you catch up.

Sometimes it's difficult to understand what he's saying.  Gets into a lot of the theory of linear algebra vs. actual problem solving.  Can be boring since he teaches the same material over 2 or 3 class sessions.  A very slowly taught course.
Chill dude as the semester goes on. He has 6 grades for the entire semester, 5 exams and the final. He takes your best 5 scores and drops the lowest, also curves tests based on class performance.
His lectures are extremely boring! You can not understand him!
Very helpful and available. Honors class was challenging but far from impossible. Poor English, but very intelligent and nice.
BEST PROFESSOR OF ALL TIME! VERY UNDERSTANDING, CAN EASILY HELP YOU WITH YOUR GRADE IF YOU ARE ON THE VERGE. TESTS WERE BASICALLY THE HOMEWORK.  BEST PROFESSOR!
Do the homework. If you attend his lecture enough, you may begin to understand him eventually. The lab that goes along with this lecture is very helpful.
can't understand but very east test if you do the HW.

you have to do everything on your own when it comes to good ol' Roman!! you cannot understand one single word he says. ever. but every test question comes from the homework so print those out and study hem. and if you dont pan on using the book, save yourself 200 dollars and just go on coursecompass and just buy the acess for 35 dollars
Nice teacher. Tests are definitely that hard. questions taken directly from the homework. Much better than Gibson. Good class, much easier than I thought it was going to be.

Test grades in the 40's. Three tests in the semester. Ten ARIS assignments (online quizzes of about 50 Q's). Attendance not taken. Power point lectures which can be found on BlackBoard. Will review before test but not in detail. No real study guide. You must study VERY hard to do decent on tests. Roman is very nice and does not waste class time

Tests are INCREDIBLY hard, unless you study ALL THE TIME (literally) and I'm not even sure that would do justice.  Average test grade for first exam was high 40's/low 50's. Yes, terrible. The second exam wasn't much better. Overall though, the ARIS assignments were pretty easy - which is what saved my butt.
One of the best classes I have taken!
One of the best classes I have taken!

This class was very independent - professor Kosek posts every assignment at the beginning of the semester and you are expected to pay attention to due dates and complete everything on your own. The assignments are pretty simple though and she provides clear instructions. Also had no exams for this class!
She is an actual Elementary School teacher so she gives amazing tips how to be successful. I learned so much from Professor Kosek!
Shes a great teacher, just do the work and she gives you a A. So this is a wonderful class to take and that you dont have to worry about!:)

Professional role was online from COVID. All it was: zoom meetings and weekly guest speakers. You have 6 discussions for the semester and a few group papers (like 1 page) and create a resume. No textbook, no exam, no quizzes. Just go to class, she takes your attendance, and sit and listen. SHE is genuinely SO nice, just a stupid class unfortunately

Professional role was online from COVID. All it was: zoom meetings and weekly guest speakers. You have 6 discussions for the semester and a few group papers (like 1 page) and create a resume. No textbook, no exam, no quizzes. Just go to class, she takes your attendance, and sit and listen. SHE is genuinely SO nice, just a stupid class unfortunately

The most wonderful and honest professor I have ever had. She truly wants everyone to succeed and goes out of her way to help anyone with anything they need. She has a very bright personality and would love to have her for every class
She ruined the class by making us say a fact about ourselves. We've been in this program for 2 years. We all already know each other.
Decent. She gives clear feedback on papers and follows the rules and policies so she comes off as strict. If you listen and pay attention and read the syllabus you'll get an A. As simple as that.

Book is mandatory, if you want to pass you need to read. Pretty cool professor, it helps if you go in during her office hours.  Doesn't have real life experience other than being a parent but she makes it work. Lectures are straight from the book though.

Dr. Kostandy is awesome! Her rubrics are thorough and tell students exactly what to include in their papers. Shes always there if you need help, her office hours saved my grade and she is willing to move things around if you need, she is super understanding if you explain your situation. Lots of material from the book, so read when she says too!

The time spent in her class I would consider a huge waste of time. I gained no knowledge what so ever in her class. And don't bother asking questions because she wouldn't know the answers she would waste the class time looking the answer up in the book. She could relate nothing to nursing experience, could only give parenting examples.

If you're a student who got by without ever studying, don't push it. That said, if you participate and ask questions after class it will help you. The latter part of the course is much easier, as it deals with international finance. Don't give up, and use study groups. Don't simply wing it. This class is hard; Kosteas knows this.

I feel bad for anybody who has to take this class. He nitpicks every little detail on tests and when the class average on the first test was a D he had the audacity to blame the students instead of his teaching methods. He leaves most of his teaching to YouTube videos he prepared so he can teach less during class.

If you're a student who got by without ever studying, don't push it. That said, if you participate and ask questions after class it will help you. The latter part of the course is much easier, as it deals with international finance. Don't give up, and use study groups. Don't simply wing it. This class is hard; Kosteas knows this.
If you are an International Business major (like me), I have two words for you: Good Luck. Hardest class I have ever had to take in my life.

This class suck, especially if you're an IB major. It is tailored for ECN majors and you're expected to be on par with everything they know. The tests are hard but he curves. Billy as a prof is not bad. He's nice and tells interesting stories sometimes.

Dr. Kosteas is a one-of-a-kind professor at Cleveland State. The very first class session he tells every student what he expects from them, and how to achieve in not only his class but any other class in general. His exams are extremely challenging, but if you put in the time and work you will get a good grade in his class. Would recommend!

Professor Kosteas is one of the best professor I have ever had. He is very kind and cares so much about his students. He really pushes you to really learn the material, not just memorize it for exams. It is extremely difficult material, but he is always there to help with any questions or concerns. His Youtube videos are a great help too! The best!

Class composed of INB majors, ECN Majors, ECN MA students, and INTL studies grad students; obviously a mess. Mandatory for INB majors, but the professor teaches at a level way beyond our comprehension. Exam problems are more difficult than the homework and additional problems. Average grade for first 2 exams was a low F. Should've curved larger.

Prof. Kosteas is an amazing professor. He is really knowledgeable, kind, supportive, and always keeps the lecture interesting. I really learn a lot from his Econometric class and I have been so grateful for having his research advice.  His assignments are very reasonable and helps reinforce what I have learned from the class.

One of the hardest econ classes I have taken. But he is a very great professor. Attend class, take notes, don't miss quizzes and go over homework problems. Study all material before taking an exam and you should do well in the class. There's plenty of resources to study for this class. He also provides additional material on blackboard to use.

Yes, difficult prof. But he wants you to do well and will go to great lengths to help you achieve. success is simple. Go to class, study the chapter twice, use the online resources, study all the above before a quiz, and work every assigned problem or blackboard resource until it is second nature before an exam.  Best prof I had as an undergrad.
Dr. Kosteas is very, very good.  I rank him as one of the top professors at CSU.  Highly recommended-you will learn a lot.  Be prepared to put in some work for your grade though.

Very hard class. Can't use calculator. He doesn't grade your papers and homework. He has an assistance to do grading. That is a disadvantage because he doesn't follow the student on the process of understanding. I wouldn't take him again!
Hard professor but very fair. Genuinely wants you to understand. No calculators though.
Very easy teacher!! You must take him. Just do all the homework and study midterm and final sample test provided from teacher and you'll be fine.OH and dont miss a quiz.

Hes super hot!...its almost distracting! But he really knows what hes talking about. Its a hard class, but come to lecture and do the work and you'll be fine. Hes a nice guy too, just don't EVER text in his class!

This professor is very knowledgeable in econ.  His powerpoints are the ones straight from the book and he goes over all of them.  Jumped around chapters a bit but not too confusing.  Homework and quizzes are on myeconlab.com and have due dates.  Overall good teacher but gets super pissed if he sees someone with a cell phone

He is a fair teacher. Prepared. Tests are fair. Tough Grader on Essays. Study and come to lecture and you will be fine.  Has drive to improve the department.  Available for help if you need it. Definately a good pick.

He was by far the hardest teacher I have ever had at CSU. No calculators EVER ! He teaches straight from the textbook word for word. He is knowledgable about the subject matter but expects alot from his students. You can get a decent grade just be prepared to study every day for a couple of hours to do so. Will not take again!
Make sure you pay attention to problems done in class and homework for your exams.

Great prof., knows Econ like the back of his hand and fair grading. Offers a tutor (G.A. in Econ Dept.)who is great and extremely helpful if you struggle with Econ.  Just ignore his ego and dislike for America's short-comings in education and personal health management.

Dr. K is unlike many profs you have ever had before. I am good with calculus but to recall an obscure trig sub for a test from memory 4 years after calc 2 is ridiculous. If you practice the "suggested" HW and take your time and write your lab reports well to ensure a high grade. After taking his class I still seek his professional opinion.

I never seen an awful and useless pro like him...The Worst experience with a professor I've ever had. He does not care about the student at all.He gave us problems in the exam that we didn't cover in the class. For example, first problem was about chemical rector design, and we never took this class before.

Anne is an amazing professor. She cares for everybody in her class and will do whatever she can to help you succeed. She will make accommodations and give you options so you can get done what is required while still teaching you effectively. She is pretty funny and even brings the class food sometimes. She's great. Take her. You will not regret it.
Amazing professor. She made research methods way more interesting than it actually is. She was very sweet and wants everyone in her classes to do good.

I took took this class at 8am on MWF for my minor. Although it was an 8am Professor Kotynski made it worth it. Shes quirky, fun, and knowledgeable in Research Methods. You do have 1 homework assignment once a week, theyre pretty simple and wont take you long to finish. There are two exams, and a final project. I highly suggest taking her!

Super awesome Prof. She's really nice and helps you to learn the material the best way she can. She's really funny and a fun person all around, and tries to make lectures fun and relatable to psych and/or whatever you are interested in. TAKE HER CLASSES!!! I'll miss her.. Easy A if you put the work in for her class, which isn't too much. Good luck!

Her classes are awesome. She is a great teacher and makes learning the material fun. Her lectures are easy to follow and her quizzes help you to learn the test material. You must show up to class to learn the information or you will fall behind. She gives attendance points and a couple of opportunities for bonus points. She is the best!
She is a breath of fresh air. The best thing since grandma's freshly baked cookies. She made learning more fun. She brought in treats from time to time. Her lectures were to the point.

This Professor is a great educator. She is very detail in her lectures. She explains her assignments in great detail. Plus she is motivating and inspiring to her classes. This professor is the BEST choice! She is AWESOME!
She is my favorite professor! This class is a lot of fun! I can't wait to take another sculpture class!
She is the best! Wish every professor could be as cool as her!

Wasn't looking forward to this class, but she made it my favorite that semester. Very relaxed and fun. She will give great/helpful insight/advice on all your projects. She really felt like a "friend" by the end of the semester. Maybe sometimes a LITTLE unclear when she explains something but... if you need clarification, you need only ask!

Love love LOVE this professor! She is knowledgeable, helpful, caring, and genuine. Couldn't ask for a better professor. The assignments are interesting and you have endless possibilities of creations with the amount of tools this studio has to offer. Downside, you have to share space with the ceramics department.

She's very relaxed. Attendence is kinda mandatory. Shell get annoyed if you continue to show up really late or not at all. She's very nice. You have to go out of your way to get her attention. She's a little ADD. But she's a very nice lady.

Fantastic professor. She is very open minded and supportive of individual expression. She is always in a good mood and seems eager to see her students excel. Due dates are flexible (almost too flexible) and very easy to get an 'A' if all assignments are completed.

She is a fantastic teacher and really allows for individuality in her classroom. The assignments are interesting and she is very passionate that her students enjoy and improve in their work. Class attendance is "mandatory" and she allowed me to do alot of work outside of the classroom. Due dates are assigned but very relaxed. Very enjoyable class.

Learning a new language is hard but as long as you apply yourself and she sees you're trying, you'll do well. I'm glad my first language class was with her but I have some issues with her grading criteria. I participated to the point where sometimes I was the only one speaking/trying, and didn't get full points in that arena.

She is very caring and does her best. However, the language department is garbage and if you do not already know spanish, you won't get even a B. You start on day one with the alphabet and by the midterm you are expected to read, write, understand, and speak near fluency. The only A in this class is someone who took 4 years in high school.

Honestly, shes a very caring professor who gives good lectures. Heres the bad part, I did not receive credit for all my homework assignments it clearly showed on blackboard, I tried to contact her via email to no prevail. She expected me to be fluent in Spanish but yet, her English is not good at all. Finally, there was WAY too much homework.

Love love love her! I wish she was still teaching at CSU. If she ever does become a professor elsewhere, take her class. You won't regret it. She keeps the class engaged with various activities and is available for tutoring when you need her. She really cares about her students and wants you to succeed. Sweetest woman ever.

Smart guy not doubt, I don't give him a 5 only because he is very hard to read and can come across as rude and often seems contradictory. Other than that does a great job of explaining the course material in mostly layman's terms so its a good class for students who have no real world experience with the systems used in class.

Smart guy not doubt, I don't give him a 5 only because he is very hard to read and can come across as rude and often seems contradictory. Other than that does a great job of explaining the course material in mostly layman's terms so its a good class for students who have no real world experience with the systems used in class.

He is one of, perhaps the best professor Ive had in my college years. He isnt only a professor, but also a father, a brother, a mentor. I would love to see him outside class and chat with him. He likes to understand you and talk about pretty much anything you can imagine. Just give him the message that youre putting in effort. You will get an A.

EXCELLENT professor. People do not realize sometimes that he teaches really important stuff that will be used in real life problems. I have had him for a couple of classes and I have always had a good experience. Also, I have learned a lot of things that others don't when taking other professors. I really recommend him, but you need to participate

Professor Kozul is an excellent engineer. He really knows what he's talking about and cares about his students' success. Don't show up late or walk out early and expect him to not call you out. He makes the class interesting and explains things thoroughly if you ask for help.
Bogdan is an odd teacher, but you will learn if you work for it. Very interesting teacher if you give him the chance.

All she cares is her benefits and asks, "what can I do for you?" even though she is not planning to do anything. She changes her opinions all the time and says none sense things which are opposite to what she says earlier for her benefits.
Professor Kramer is very informational in the lab setting. She is very nice and always willing to help. She tells a lot of stories about her experience in the field.
All these one's really shock me. She is a phenomenal professor to have as a clinical instructor, and a role model.
Rude
She is mean.
God bless you if you have this woman as your clinical instructor.

This course was one of my more difficult courses but also very interesting. All exams were take-home exams with extended response questions, except the final which was multiple choice. He is quite generous with the curve at the end of the semester. Make sure to attend and pay attention to lectures and read the assigned readings and you'll do fine.

This course was one of my more difficult courses but also very interesting. All exams were take-home exams with extended response questions, except the final which was multiple choice. He is quite generous with the curve at the end of the semester. Make sure to attend and pay attention to lectures and read the assigned readings and you'll do fine.

All the Animal Bio people that are giving low ratings are the kids who took it to learn about pandas and other little cute mammals. Welcome to college kids, you actually have to make an effort to learn material. Krebs is enthusiastic and answers questions whenever asked. His tests are simple, dont listen to the people who just wanted an easy class

Really intelligent. Does not teach well though. All tests and quizzes are based on reading, nothing from his powerpoints or lectures. Testing is very quick with a lot of thinking. Interesting class, but he makes it harder than it has to be

You are graded on three exams and the final. I personally don't like this grading style, but I will say I really appreciated Dr. Krebs enthusiasm for the content. There is a lot of information to memorize, so you will have to work outside of lecture. I recommend going because he sometimes says that you won't be tested over certain slides.

You can get by without going to class, but only if you have outstanding studying skills. Very content heavy with a lot of memorization, and test typically do not feel very fair. The fairly generous curve helps make up for this though. Dr. Krebs is intelligent but a little standoff-ish in my experience. Some people love him though. Decent prof.

This class was the hardest class I've ever taken. Dr. Krebs knows his stuff and cares about you understanding the material. That being said you definitely have to teach yourself and read before class. It's VERY difficult so beware. He curves but do NOT relay on that because exams are hard & comparative . Most don't fail but do get C's.

Dr. Krebs is one of my favorite professors :) he is very passionate about what he teaches and really cares about how each of us does overall in the class. Earning the grade that I did was NOT EASY, THOUGH. I put in many many many hours of work to bring my grade up from a C to and A, but it is achievable. You got this as long as you put in effort!

Dr. Krebs is a very passionate professor!!! His class is very difficult, there is a lot of material to cover over the 32 phylum!!. I recorded his lectures on my phone and re-listened to them, that was very helpful. He says reading the book helps a lot, he actually pulls some exams questions from it directly. Just don't fall behind, read as you go!
Dr. Krebs is a nice guy, but his tests were very difficult since he would ask questions that he never talked about in lecture.
He is the most awful professor I have ever had! Avoid him and his class!!

I think Dr. Krebs is either the worst or 2nd worst prof. in the Biology dept. He takes very simple material and makes unnecessarily difficult exams out of it. Very typical of a professor who wants to glorify his boring class. Class is not clear on what to study for at all, exams are hard, and class is pointless. Don't take Animal Bio.

Way too difficult for a 100 level class. Fails to make anything interesting and tests are way too hard. He gives super detailed powerpoints but almost none of the information is actually on the exam. He does curve his tests and drops the lowest grade, which is the only thing that will save you. Studying as much as you can is still not enough.

He is a great professor and very passionate about biology. I had him for animal bio and per a friend's suggestion recorded and listened to the lectures in my free time. He takes 95% of his questions directly from the lectures so pay attention and it will be a easy A.

Dr. Krebs is extremely intelligent and lectures quickly and on a lot of content. His class his hard, but really it's just a lot of info. I was able to find him in his office even outside of office hours. If you go to class, he gives hints on what would make good test questions. Record lectures, TAKE NOTES, and just memorize, memorize, memorize!
He doesn't help at all.

It's all about taking tests so if you are not a good test taker do not sign up for this class. There's no homework, no extra credit but if you come to class everyday he definitely does notice. There were curves on every test and also a curve of our final grades. He is a nice guy but it tough. A lot of notes to study from as well.
Test except final wasnt material cover in class.

Kreb's BIO 302 course was incredibly fun to take given the man himself was incredibly nice and funny. He knew the subject really well, loved it, and made it interesting to learn. The class itself was no walk in the park, but I learned a lot from it. The tests are exhaustive and the material abundant, but apply yourself and you will do well.

Dr. Krebs is an exemplary professor & all-around great guy. His exams were very reasonable in length and difficulty, and he gives you plenty of time to complete them. Show up to lectures, he is brilliant to listen to. Biogeography is a fairly challenging course, but the knowledge you get from it & Dr. Krebs is worth the effort.

He relies solely on his power points but refers to the book every now and then. Exams are tough but he curves, he looks for comparative reasoning rather than simple definitions. Know latin names! Lectures are hard to sit through but I found comparing slides to the material in the book helpful with studying.

BORING/dull class. She just read off of her powerpoints which are posted online. Didn't really make class exciting, seemed like she was new to teaching. Tests were on the difficult side, you must know book material which was dry/boring to read through. There is also an online lab which was easy points. I wouldn't take unless mandatory.

Teaches from power points and posts them on Bb. Explains class concepts thoroughly with some humor. She makes test questions from the book material so you will need to read it. Random attendance and participation points awarded. All in all a great class.

Tough grading for no reason. Every week, you post on the discussion board and reply to 2 people. It's always the same question. It's not hard, just tedious. Make sure you follow the rubric precisely. Blog, final project and discussion boards are about it for assignments, though.

Same questions every single week. So boring. And she is a hard grader for no reason. There is a project that she did not mention at all other that the syllabus but for an online class there needs to be some sort of direction. I just happened to be reading through the syllabus and realized it was due the next day. Dont recommend taking.

Prof Krisch is a terrific professor! She provided interesting reading material, unrestrictive discussion topics to expand our class' understanding of class topics and an engaged with the students to reinforce understanding. This was my third Native American course with Prof Krisch and I would recommend her any subject matter she lectures on.

Might be a good professor in class but online she is an awful professor. Same discussion question every week, vague syllabus, tough final project, one extra credit opportunity, and a blog that nobody knew they were supposed to participate in until like week 4. I was minoring in Native American studies but I don't know if her classes are worth it.

Her syllabus is awful, leaving out a lot of information. Being that the class is online, obviously the syllabus is really all you have to be able to navigate blackboard and the online modules. I had to e-mail her several times about assignments that were vague or confusing and she REFUSED to help, she told me that the info was there and to look...

I would not choose this professor for an online class. The way it is set up is hard to follow. Every week there is a discussion and the question is the same for every single week.  Her feedback is either vague or nonexistent. She is also terrible at making announcements, updated the syllabus two weeks ago and didn't tell us until now. Not okay.

"Discuss three terms, concepts, articles, etc. that impacted you in some way. Why were they takeaways for you? Link your original post to the readings for this week." This is literally what you have to respond to every. single. week. She gives no direction on what she wants you to discuss and it just gets boring. I feel as though I am not learning
Great teacher
I love her teaching style and I don't see why anyone else would think otherwise.

I can honestly say I was excited about taking this class until it started. She does not give clear directions and not much feedback for assignments. I had to email her a few times for clarification, but she came off as very cold and uninterested. I cannot speak about her in-class teaching, but for her online class, I was very unimpressed.
Gives no feedback. Unclear directions. Too many expectations for such little explanation on assignments. Hasn't taught a thing; could just read the book alone. I wonder how she became a teacher.

The worst online prof I've ever taken. Lazy. Unclear. Unresponsive. Easily offended if asked for clarification. Weekly "What did you learn" DB & blog post, plus final "WDYL" project. Uh. I learned nothing. Could've bought the book and read it for same effect. Not a single course-specific question the whole semester. Syllabus is poorly written. BAD.

I took Prof. Krisch again for ANT 351 Native North Americans. Once again, I cannot continue to explicate on the degree to which I enjoyed my experience. I received perfect scores for each discussion and assignment, missing only a few points on the exams. Anyone looking to learn about American Indian life and culture should take this course!

I'm sure that she is a great teacher in class, but she cannot teach an online class to save her life. She grades too hard and expects too much from and online elective class. She takes points off for stupid things and gives vague feedback like needs  more. Needs more what!?  I took this class because I was interested in the topic, not anymore!

Prof. Krisch is a superb Cleveland State University professor! Her featured content illuminates new, forgotten perspectives! She allowed students to discuss their favorite topics on the subject, and provided excellent feedback. She is a wealth of knowledge on American Indian Studies. I look forward to her Spring 2015 ANT 351 Native North Americans!
This class is an easy grade but that doesn't mean you can get by with not knowing the material . Lots of reading , group discussions, and participation is a must because it's a grade.

I couldn't have asked  for a better teacher than Professor Candra Krisch. The class has been amazing and inspiring from the very beginning of the term, I wish that the class was longer to cover everything in class. In groups we really get to discuss and hear each others thoughts on the topics and then when we get lost or off track, she is there!

This class had the potential to be really interesting, but unfortunately with her teaching it, it is not. She doesn;t really teach much at all; its mostly group discussions for the whole class which isn't very productive to me. The topics could get very repetitive. I recommend the class but not with this teacher.

The professor definitely prepared herself very well prior to all of our class meeting times. Her lectures were always very interesting and she was very clear on what she was teaching. But she was a very big fan of group work and majority of the time her class consisted of powerpoint questions to be answered with a small group. BORING

This class was super easy and the material is all right in front of you in the textbook. The directions are straight forward. Post one discussion question a week explaining three things you learned then comment on other peoples, very simple. Only missed 5 points the whole semester.

Professor Krumholz & the Film class is the best for getting your African American Experience credits fulfilled. He is kind, intelligent, and an EASY professor! One 10 page paper-1 page for every film you watch. Pay attention to the few things he says in class, they WILL end up on the tests! Birth of a Nation is a boring movie the rest are fine. :)
great teacher as long as ou attended class you got everything you needed for the class. Great class learned alot
No Comments
No Comments
Awesome, awesome instructor, totally helpful and willing to acknowledge points of view that aren't his. Grading was very fair. Enjoyable in-class discussions.

The class is really easy. Some to most questions on quizzes will be on Quizlet. Slides are not that useful (2-3 questions per quiz). All of her materials are completely outdated.... Doesn't bother to update slides. Make sure to try and find a buddy for quizzes and attendance. Makes the class ALOT easier

She's really a lovely, relatable human who's there to help you! She teaches from slides, and they give you everything you need to know. I used the book only a few times. Her exams are easy if you study.
This class is easy, and I would take it again. She is an amazing teacher and is hilarious! She has all of her quizzes and tests online.

Pretty boring. Showing up to class gets you points for attendance. Bring something to do because all she does is read the slide verbatim pretty much. Easy weekly quizzes and our final and midterm tests were online

Gina is a very nice professor. She is a lecture heavy professor with PowerPoints accessible on Blackboard. Weekly online quizzes that use the book. If you do not have one, use Google Books and type in the question. Sometimes the book for that class does come up. Participation points for showing up to class so I recommend going. Would take again.

GINA IS A M A Z I N G. She is so motivational and her class is super duper easy. Her class is a no-brainer, just make sure that you show up for the attendance points. Other than that, the work is self-explanatory. You have one test a week which is understandable. She inspired me to change my major and look for jobs that pertained to my career!!!

The only reason to show up was to get the attendance points, make sure to bring a laptop so you have something to do during class because she just goes over her powerpoint which you have to read through again later anyways when you do her weekly online quizzes. All of the quizzes are online, never any other homework other than that.
She gives off more of a mom/friend vibe than professor.  Super easy class.  But you have to come to class to pass because you get points for showing up.
Class is really easy, and she is extremely understanding.

The class was ok. We didn't really cover any new ground. Outside of therapists, none of her guest speakers were nurses or doctors. Gina Kubec was slow to respond to e-mails, if at all. Her disposition for a teacher was also very poor. She also did not know how to cope with students who had more knowledge on a subject than she did.
Very easy class, if you show up and do the work.
One of the best profs in the whole department. She cares about what she is teaching and also cares about the students.
One of the best profs in the whole department. She cares about what she is teaching and also cares about the students.
Awesome

I was not sure what to expect before taking her class, but I'm glad I did! There were a lot of things I never knew about nutrition beyond surface level value. Overall, she's great at explaining the information and the work for the class is helpful even in daily fitness application.

3 Labs, Paper w/ Presentation, Midterm & Final,  & participation points are only grades.  Labs can be long (7-10 pages), but she gives you clear outline. Class involves lecture w/ slides & labs. Listen & do papers ahead of time, she overlooks rough drafts. Interesting class, FASTEST grading, easily email accessible. Hardest part are the long labs.
Dr. Kullman cares about her students and wants to share her passions with every student she teaches. Great professor and her tests are hard.
Dr. Kullman is a great professor

I found this class to be extremely easy because of my background in law. But, I know that some of my classmates struggled with it. Kumar is an extremely nice guy. His lectures can get boring. Some of the questions on the exam were hard to understand. The paper was a cake walk. He takes attendance. He is a lenient grader and wants you to succeed!

Took Media Law with Dr. Kumar.. he is a very good professor. Readings from the textbook were assigned for homework to discuss in the next class so make sure you do them. Tests and other assignments were fair. One of the nicest professors in the Communication department in my experience.

Dr. Kumar is an amazing professor! His blackboard for online classes can be a little unorganized, but once you get the hang of it, its easy to follow. He's a fair grader and always available by email. He also offers extra credit for showing improvement in AP Style quizzes. Would take any of his classes! Would take this one again!
Knows exactly what he's talking about. Helpful, in class and with advising. His biggest thing is AP style, need to know to pass. Comm majors must get B- to pass class.

I took Anup for COM225 and enjoyed it honestly. His lectures can be long, bu if you like to write you may find it enjoying. He's straight to the point about AP style writing and provide clear ppt's to improve writing. There are AP style quizzes along with capitalization and grammar quizzes throughout the semester and four writing assignments.

I had Kumar for two classes last semester and I love this man.  He's probably one of the most intelligent people I've ever met.  He's very serious, which makes it fun to say insane things to him to see how he'll respond.  I <3 KUMAR and his yak shirts!!

Professor Kumar is a great teacher and depending on what class you have him for hes not difficult. His accent can be hard to understand at first but getting used to him is easy. Hes very understanding and down to earth and even let me write a make-up paper to improve my grade

Kumar is the best addition to the School of Communication. As Stater advisor learned a lot from him.  He allowed me to explore different areas outside my comfort zone. He is available everyday to discuss story ideas, problems and has a wealth of topic ideas when you are stumped. While excellent prof, he is SERIOUS about journalism.

Professor Kumar is one of the better professors in the CSU school of Communications.  Extremely knowledgeable, fair, and easy to get along with.  Will listen to you and (within reason) allow students to make decisions that he may not agree with in the interest of learning.  I would highly recommend Dr. Kumar to any journalism major.

Professor Kumar is really awesome. I had him for the Cleveland Stater the second time and he is extremely helpful. I also have him for my independent study where I am creating my own online magazine for future use (and profit). I have never had a nicer teacher who actually became somewhat like a friend. I recommend him to anyone and everyone.

Prof. Kumar is a nice guy but a frustrating professor. His accent makes it difficult to follow his lecture and he does not provide a study guide for his exams (which are difficult). This was his first semester teaching so perhaps once he gets settled in he will improve. For now, I suggest taking another professor over him. : (
She is kind and helpful! She doesn't judge students by grades!
Pretty boring as a lecturer, great as clinical instructor. Very helpful, nice and informative.

Just reads from her power points. Must come to class to get the power point, can't get them online it's her way of getting you to class. ANyone can read, doesn't really answer questions, kind of walks around them. Needs to work in the field more or find a new place to work, doesn't know what goes on in the "real" world.

It was a pretty boring class..... Same thing everyday, go over powerpoints she made while listening to her talk and say "um, because" a lot.  I did no reading whatsoever and just studied the powerpoints and pulled off a B+. her tests are tricky tho.

All she does is give us power point slides and reades exactly what it says on them. She does not add any other useful information, even if you ask her a question. Her exams are ridiculous. Some of her questions are from nowhere that have nothing to do with the material. She seriously upset me with how incompetent she was.
She's really nice in lecture, but I heard she is tough in clinicals

It's only 3 assignments each with several weeks, though, so if you suck at time management, fix it. Some people feel he grades strictly on tests, but it's still fair.

He is really good at teaching the material and making it understandable. The homework is genuinely helpful (also test questions are from the homework with slight modification).
