3 homework assignments, closely corresponding to their own exam. Each homework was 30 problems. I personally did not give myself nearly enough time to complete them, as they can take some time. Make sure you complete the homework assignments with easy to follow solutions, as the homework helps GREATLY with the exam. A very understanding professor.

The sweetest professor I've ever had!!! She is always willing to help even though she is extremely busy. You can tell she genuinely cares about her students doing well and wants to prepare them properly for their future with writing.
Very sweet and funny prof. Wants everyone to more on to spn 201 and beyond. She's sometimes gives out extra credit work is good considering hw can be tricky (not her fault).
Profesora Elia is a great professor. She gives great feedback. I'll definitely recommend her.
Elia is one of the most dedicated and passionate professors I have ever had. She works hard to make the class enjoyable and educational. She succeeded at both every class. Highly recommend!

Ms. Laggan made the class very easy, despite how hard public speaking is for me. Class Typically involves 4 speeches and 2 quizzes. (Different format because of Covid-19) She was easy to get along with, super easy going. Take her!

Ms. Laggan made the class very easy, despite how hard public speaking is for me. Class Typically involves 4 speeches and 2 quizzes. (Different format because of Covid-19) She was easy to get along with, super easy going. Take her!
She is awesome! Very kind and wants to help the students learn. Always there when you need her. Struggles with tech but overall very good prof and very kind.
Very very nice

Easy A! Well actually it's a pass or fail Class here at Tri-C , I tooken her for Speach 1010. Her class is pretty engaging , I enjoyed it , she made us do a total of 4 speeches +an impromptu one. Her Test are insanely easy , I rented the book for her class, DONT DO IT , Not needed. Attendance matters if you want to know what's coming up.
Amazing Professor she is such a sweetheart very funny and understanding. highly recommend taking one of her classes.
Class was low pressure and enjoyable. Made public speaking less scary.

I have had her for a couple of classes. She is a very nice and sweet lady. She breaks down EVERYTHING so there is no reason to misunderstand her. Whatever class you want to take, if she is teaching, take it.
Very boring. She only reads from slides however understands little about computers. Her voice is very monotone and will put you to sleep.

Professor Laggan is above all a very kind woman.  Additionally, she's very comprehensive and patient as an instructor.  She's always prepared, explains everything clearly and is eager to answer questions.  Not difficult by any measure, particularly because she runs her class very efficiently and very fairly, interacting well with students.

She gives you all the notes you need on ECR and gives you everything you need to know for the test in class. Easy to folow and understand. Great teacher! Would recommend for anyone interested in taking Com in Personal Relationships.
she sucked

Speech class ws great with this professor!  The class was relatively easy and you learn alot.  I never minded going to this class!  She is very helpful and will make sure you know every concept before moving on.  Also a very fair grader.  Take this class!

Easy class. Go to class and take notes and you will get a good grade. His notes are very important because what you are quizzed on or tested on is information from his notes. Its a boring class but easy. He will help you if you come to him. We had open book exams, even the final! Just make sure you turn everything in and you will get a great grade.

Takes attendance w/ attendance sheet.Have to go cuz he'll drop u a letter grade after 4 abs. Writes notes on board right from the book. boring but a lot of quizzes or homework are right from notes. Quizzes worth alot but they were take home. Will drop lowest test score w/ your final test grade. Willing to help get grade up if u see his office hours
Classes are usually easy, but pointless

Dr. Lammers is awesome. Yes, his lectures are long, but I actually enjoyed his dry sense of humor. Everything on his exam came STRAIGHT out of his lectures. So if you do your due diligence by taking good notes and studying, there are NO surprises on the exams. Don't bother with the textbook - you don't need it! But you need to watch those lectures!

Dr. Lammers is awesome. Yes, his lectures are long, but I actually enjoyed his dry sense of humor. Everything on his exam came STRAIGHT out of his lectures. So if you do your due diligence by taking good notes and studying, there are NO surprises on the exams. Don't bother with the textbook - you don't need it! But you need to watch those lectures!

AVOID AT ALL COSTS. He is so unmotivated. Like dude the class is online, you barely have to work. He refuses to have any Zoom lectures and just uploads lecture videos the are duller than his personality. There is no curve or extra credit. I wish there was someone else at CSU that teaches Physiology. Maybe take the class at a different school?

Not a good professor. Your only opportunity to get points in the class are from quizzes and exams which he does not give you enough time for. I hear he is a good professor in person, but because he is teaching online now he is downright lazy. The class has something like 50 chapters. Prepare to teach yourself because he definitely won't.

Terrible and lazy Online class but no live lectures Not enough time given for exams/quizzes Grade depends entirely on exams/quizzes Too much material covered in the class, impossible to keep up, 43 chapters Impossible to find answers to questions on exams/quizzes Questions set up the same way, (which of the following are true) Not even fair

I was excited to have Lammers for anatomy but i was so disappointed with his online format. NONE of the TAs were ever on the same page, you rarely could reach him after class, we were tested on things that we never went over in class (or that other groups did and my group didnt). it was so unorganized and affected my grade negatively. frustrating.

Again, a lot of inconsistency. What we see on blackboard is not our final grade and I personally believe students should have access to their own grades and if they have any concerns about their grade, they can see it and ask about it. TA's were good & made do with online lab. Just wish we could see our final grade for exams/quizzes with the curve.

Do not take this course online with Lammers. I took physiology with Lammers & it was great but I made a huge mistake taking this with him. Posting of quizzes was inconsistent, sent us the wrong grade calculator which gave us false hope for final grades. Some of my emails still don't have a response. Don't have access to final grades with curve.

Textbook unnecessary, good lecture but monotone voice and long lectures can be sleep inducing. Tests are very different from study guides, so know the material through. Very pleasant guy, answers questions well and wants you to understand and succeed.

THEE professor to take for Anatomy. He explains everything thoroughly and even gives study guides for exams. He also gives practice exams from previous semesters. TRULY, he wants you to succeed and is always available for help. Continuously proves to have the ability to teach the toughest of courses so well. HIGHLY recommend for this HARD class.

I personally did not like the way he teaches. He gives you study guides and past exams to study but they look nothing like the exam he gives. Too much on exams, and tricky. Dropped the course half way through because wasn't going to pass with a decent grade. Taking again this summer with a different professor 10 week course and way better.

Professor Lammers makes lecture interesting & fun. There were 4 exams, each 100 pts., that is it. Do not need book, he explains in class and by drawings in class. His PowerPoints and study guides are keys to the class! A lot of studying. Professor responds to emails quickly and is always willing to answer questions! One of the greatest professors.

One of the best and most competent professors I've had at CSU- by far the best teacher I have had in the sciences. I can actually learn and pick up information in class. He also does not test on ridiculous details. It's not like he only gives questions on the broad, overall concepts, but what he tests on is always things that are important.

I love this man. I was really nervous taking Gross Anatomy and Human Physiology (I took them separately, he ended up teaching both). He explains concepts very clearly and welcomes questions. No attendance taken, you could get away with skipping a couple lectures here and there but I would recommend going to understand harder concepts. Best prof.
Loved him. Very helpful if you reach out to him. VERY funny if you actually talk to him in lab.
GREAT TEACHER!!!! WISH HE TAUGHT EVERY SCIENCE CLASS.... WOULD FOR SURE TAKE ALL OF THEM!
Genuinely nice and enthusiastic about Anatomy.  Receptive to students.
He is very nice! He was very helpful when I didn't know what to do! I improved my grade a lot due to him!

AWESOME professor! I wish he could teach all of the Health Science courses! He knows what he's talking about and explains hard concepts clearly. I looked forward to going to class to listen to him lecture. HIGHLY RECOMMEND!

He is the best professor I have ever had...presents info very clearly and easy to understand, always willing to help answer questions...no need to buy the book because the test questions are right off the slides...Again...Best professor ever!
Andy is one of the best teaches CSU has. You will be fine. However, there is a lot of info to remember but he will get you through it. He treats students as equals and is receptive to questions.
This man puts his heart into teaching. He has lots of experience and a rare sensitivity. There is a lot of work and he comments in a detailed way.

Involved as an educator, which is refreshing to me, but may initially seem overwhelming to some. Seeks to break down power imbalances between himself and the students with whom he works.  Students  should come prepared to engage in experiential activities. Clearly, the previous commenter wasn't paying attention during the lecture on "judging." A++

He has a "one size fits all" (Gestalt) approach to group work. He is by his own admissions: "judgmental." You may feel devalued by his comments, which include putting x's on top of your own words on logs. That speaks volume to me. Be well buffered (supported) when you take this. Quite confrontational.
This professor really cares about his students and their understanding of the material.  He goes above and beyond to make sure that his students learn the material.

Dr. Lamprecht has a unique teaching style and is VERY involved. He wants you to be involved, too! It was off-putting at first, but I warmed up to him. He is actually a GREAT guy who REALLY cares about each individual student and will assist in anything you need! Be prepared to work and keep your mind open!

Dr. Lamprecht is a kind, interesting guy who really cares about this field & his students. He goes above & beyond to help people out-- though he's a new prof & might get burnt out. He doesn't really take charge in class. I do appreciate that he responds to questions/emails right away. Grading is pretty easy as long as you turn in all assignments.

Very straight forward. Exams are open book, let's you use a cheat sheet on the second exam and the final. Does good example problems and writes out the steps in class. You should get a good grade if you pay attention in class. Would take him again for any class.
disaster !
DO not take a class with him if you can avoid it. Exams are not open book, they are harder than class material, and he barely teaches. 4.0 students have failed his class

Extreamly hard to understand. He never introduces the topic, and just copes what's on his notes to the board. No one in class understands him. He is very bad at teaching, and seems to be as confused as the students. He is smart, but not a good teacher. Don't take him of if you can, otherwise, you'll have to teach yourself. He is bad at explaining.

Dr. Landaverde likes to read out of the book. I believe this is his first time teaching fluid mechanics and hopefully his last. He seems just as confused as the students. Study guide? nope. Homework? You'll get it back whenever he feels like it. He gives all the formulas but cannot explain them. Says "um" and "err" 300 times a class, I've counted.

Very straight forward. Exams are open book, let's you use a cheat sheet on the second exam and the final. Does good example problems and writes out the steps in class. You should get a good grade if you pay attention in class. Would take him again for any class.
Study guides for all exams, attend labs, and follow feedback on all assignments and you will be fine!
One of the best classes I ever had, and the best professor.
This class is not weight training. It is all core. You will be doing abs every week. Probably life some weights 3 times the whole semester. Pass or fail class

Under no circumstances would I recommend taking Maxine Landers. Her course involved excessively long papers, long-winded discussions and replies with other students, vast point reduction, and vague feedback, all of which was perpetrated as a vicious cycle across the span of the semester. Find another course to satisfy degree requirement!
He is a horrible professor! Goes off on wild tangents and is completely unapproachable! Avoid him at all costs! Take Professor Hersch instead if given the opportunity!

His class lectures were useless and had nothing to do with the examination. You must have expert knowledge of law and the readings in order to do well in this class. He will not help you outside of class and he expects you to already know what he is teaching. Con Law is interesting, but don't take this guys class.
He is a great professor, who is extremely knowledgeable in this sublect area. He knows the book very well. You need to keep up with the reading to follow along with the lectures.

Mr. Landever is a horrible professor. He tends to go off on senile tangents, telling stories of the past that are completely unrelated to material. He lectures on useless materials and tests on materials that are completely unrelated to his lectures. He demands participation, by the lack of it, should show him know one knows what hes talking about.
Really nice professor I loved him when I was a freshmen and still love him. Great professor to learn from.
Mr.lanning is a great professor! I had  at tri-c metro campus and he always help me with my english homework I reccomend him to anyone! He always made the class fun.

He is an awesome professor! He is a hard greater but is willing to help you if you approach him. He takes attendance everyday and likes for students to be on time. Overall a great professor. I'd take him again!

He is a very helpful teacher and isn't rude or annoyed when you ask him for help a million times for clarification. He has a great sense of humor and makes corny funny jokes. Nice guy and great English teacher.

He was very helpful. The papers were pretty easy, and he will do anything to help you. He critiques rough drafts, which makes the final draft a lot easier. Lectures, however are dreadful. He's such a nice guy, but he is super boring. My class was 2 hours long, but it felt like so much longer. All he does it talk.
very annoying about attendance any being on time. class is boring but he'll go out of his way to make sure you understand things. pretty lenient grader.

He is very nice and if you go for help after you receive a paper you thought you could of done better on he will help you to the max! Lectures are kind of boring but he is passionate about what he does and if you work hard you will succeed! I had a great experience in his class and feel that I am 100% better of writer now!

He is very nice but doesn't like to accept other opinions. He is very knowledgeable and will teach you how to write amazing papers but the process is very frustrating. He is rather picky about how students write. HE NEVER STOPS TALKING...oh and his lectures are very boring.

Prof. Lanzo was a great teacher to take online. She genuinely cares about students and their grades. She does assign a lot of homework but it is a 400 level class. There is a lot of reading but you do learn a lot. She is a little slow to get grades back at times, but here feedback is great and she gives many opportunities to improve your grade.

I took her class in the fall and felt she did an amazing job. This is a WAC course, so be prepared to write!! Don't expect to be able to do your papers last minute as she will definitely notice! For the final paper, she helped to set it up very well through different course assignments. By the time it was due, you had a great outline for your paper

Going into Calc 2 I didn't think I was going to pass. I went to every class and worked outside of class a lot on the homework and studying. LaPlaca really was a great teacher for this difficult subject. I would totally recommend. He cares about his students a lot and actually wants you to pass unlike many other professors.

Going into Calc 2 I didn't think I was going to pass. I went to every class and worked outside of class a lot on the homework and studying. LaPlaca really was a great teacher for this difficult subject. I would totally recommend. He cares about his students a lot and actually wants you to pass unlike many other professors.

Greg is an excellent professor he is able to make difficult math concepts easy to understand. I actually enjoyed learning in his class. Anything that is confusing or difficult he is willing to go over again and explain. I would high recommend taking his courses for a good learning experience.

Greg is super helpful and easygoing. He is really good at explaining concepts that I found confusing. I would recommend writing out any hw questions you're having issues with and asking him to explain it. Having the visuals help with A LOT! I write out all the hw I struggled with

Let me say that Calc 2 is way harder then Clac 1 but LaPlaca takes it and makes it so easy that you feel confident on tests. He teaches late-night classes and is given full control over grading so he doesn't screw you like the other professors are forced to do. I wish he taught every math class at CSU because I would love to take him for other ones

Professor LaPlaca is one of the best math teachers ive had hands down. I have never been great with math but his class was exceptional at explaining it in a way everyone can understand. Anytime you are confused on a subject he is more than happy to help after class or work one on one with you out of class. Highly recommend taking class with him!

I really liked Professor LaPlaca, he was really nice and understanding. If you have trouble with hw, don't be afraid to ask for help. I recommend writing it down and bringing it to him, I always kept my hw notes to review for exams anyways. While he isn't a hard teacher, calculus isn't an easy class. Try to attend every class or you'll regret it.

Greg Laplaca is a fantastic professor. His grading system is fair, he is easy to talk to, very accessible outside of class, and his main priority is to make sure you learn the material he teaches. Unlike some professors, Greg is extremely knowledgeable in math. Laplaca truly goes above and beyond to not only teach you, but get you to enjoy math.

took him in the summer of 2018 and 2019 (cal 1 and 2). he is the best professor ever! he will answer any question you have, and he will work hard in order to make his students understand. he knows how to explain concepts, and is always prepared. everyone knows he is an amazing prof, so his classes get full really quickly. take his class if you can!

One of the best professors I've had at CSU. He really cares about his students and wants you to succeed. Very clear lectures and he's easily accessible outside of class. I recommend taking class with him whenever possible!
Literally the best math professor at CSU. Very clear examples, if you ask a question in class he explains it to you again. He's just awesome. If you have the option to take him its a NO BRAINIER!

Great. Had him for calc 3. He puts a lot of emphasis on critical thinking on calc 3 tests. If you just memorize how to do homework and the extra proactive problems, you will struggle on tests. Make sure to be able to connect dots between concepts and come up with some abstract parts to answer test problems. Easy grader, looks to give credit.
Very eccentric teacher. Can cover a lot of material in a single lecture so make sure you show up and pay attention.
The best!!
Professor Laplaca is surely the best teacher I've ever had, just practice the old tests and the samples for each test and you will pass with an easy A

Professor LaPlaca is the best professor Ive ever had! Calculus II is an extremely difficult class, but he tells you from day one what his expectations are. He teaches the material in a way that everyone can understand. If you take good notes and practice problems outside of class, you will do great. He is extremely helpful and caring of his class.

Best Professor I've had hands down. Laid back and very clear on directions and math is his second language. Cannot recommend highly enough and wouldn't of gotten though CALC I & II without him. P.S. if your reading this Greg teach Calc III!

An amazing professor! I never thought I'd be able to pass Calc 1 after some negative experiences in the class, but LaPlaca explained things incredibly well. I wish he would teach all my math classes from here on out!
Good teacher but not good for summer courses where an entire semester of coursework is crammed into a short 5/6 weeks of instruction.
great teacher and great teacher
THE BEST MATH PROF! no kidding just go to class and you will pass! always there to help you.

I took his Creative Non-Fiction class. Prof Lardner is very caring, and halfway through the semester, he just got rid of deadlines all together. You'll still need to submit assignments, but he gives you the option to do things at your own pace. It almost makes it tough because you're tempted to skip classes.

Ted encourages participation in his workshops and participation in his classes. He's very laid back, as long as you make an effort, he'll forgive lateness and give you great feedback. He really gave me a serious confidence boost when it comes to my writing when I needed it the most.

Imprecise to the point of rambling when it comes to establishing grading criteria and giving feedback. His old-fashionedness and avoidance of technology was bothersome at the beginning of the semester with the amount of handouts he gave out, and became ESPECIALLY cumbersome once the switch to online learning occurred.

I took his Creative Non-Fiction class. Prof Lardner is very caring, and halfway through the semester, he just got rid of deadlines all together. You'll still need to submit assignments, but he gives you the option to do things at your own pace. It almost makes it tough because you're tempted to skip classes.

Professor Lardner is a wonderful human being and professor. He takes a different approach to teaching, and it makes showing up to class more enjoyable. He picks great stories to have us read and his assignments require creativity, which is hard to find in college class, where most things are standardized.

Dr. Lardner is a godsend! He is funny, down-to-earth, cares about his students, and genuinely enjoys reading their work. Lenient on late work and is willing to excuse medical absences (though not often needed--he gave us the chance to miss four days). You can tell he loves what he does, and it made me look forward to getting up for each class.

Ted Lardner is one of the most quality professors you could ever have. He genuinely cares about his students, and will brighten your day when he walks in the classroom. He is kind and learns every one of his students names, which is rare for a professor at such a large university. If you have the chance to have him, do it!! you will not regret it!!
Coolest and greatest teacher ever! I love him!

Dr. Lardner is friendly, helpful, and genuinely wants his students to succeed. He also gives a lot of useful commentary and faciliative feedback with regard to assignments, and he is clearly very knowledgeable of his field. My only concern is that he might go a little too easy on people.

Professor Lardner is one of the best professors I have ever had. He genuinely cares about his students and their writing. He gives lots of great feedback and is always willing to help. He helps you get started and leaves room for your own creativity. He is also an all around nice guy. Great class and even better professor.

He is a great professor. His expectations are high but you want to strive to meet them because of how laid back, helpful, and passionate he is about what he teaches. The work load is typical for Comp Theory and Creative Writing. But he is always there to offer guidance and clarity. There is no reason not to complete work or meet his expectations.

Dr. Lardner is amazing. That's all I can really say. He helped me so much with my story and he is just a great person and a wonderful teacher. He has such a cool, down to earth personality, he's just so much fun.

Best teacher I've had so far, in life! He is not only "down to earth", but he's understanding and very passionate about writing and expressing. He can also be very animated :) You can tell that he really cares about his students and what he's teaching.

Ted is one of the most down to earth people in the world.  Really enjoyed taking his class.  Probably would take it again if I was allowed back in the university.  Anyway, Ted is the man.  He is very accommodating and is very smart.

Prof.Lardner is down to earth & super enthusiastic about the material.You'll spend a lot of time discussing reading in class.Only complaint is that the exams were often perfunctory, containing questions that required finding the word-for-word answer from one line in the novel.His reading picks were unconventional but interesting. Good lit teacher!

Really intelligent guy who is passionate about what he teaches and cares about his students.  If only he had challenged us...  All exams for Native American Lit consisted of going back in the text and finding out "what color the sand was in this passage."  He's a wonderful person and he picked some beautiful books, just needs to push students more!
Creative, interesting, and very nice. He is a laid-back, artsy, hippie, who is passionate about what he teaches.

Nicest guy, but I wouldn't recommend taking Lardner for a class if you're interested in critical analysis.  He's definitely more of a creative writing instructor.  Plus, the books he picks are so random and non-canonical no one has ever even heard of them.

BORING. MUNDANE. ALLOWED THE CLASS TO TAKE OVER DISCUSSION ALL OF THE TIME WHICH LED TO 2 HOURS OF OPINIONATED BS. DID NOT PRACTICE WHAT HE PREACHED REGARDING FINDING WAYS TO TEACH ALL STUDENTS- THE ONLY ONE'S WHO BENEFITED WERE THOSE WHO LIKED TO HEAR THEMSELVES TALK.
Awesome teacher, will really work with you in detail to make a paper successful. Has a good sense of humor, and makes class interesting. :)
Boring. lefty liberal

I have Larson right now. He is a good man. 7 books required for the semester. Lot's of reading. Novels & BIOs. 3 exams over the semester- primarily book analysis/ making connections. READ READ READ and pay attention. The answeres to connecting everything are in his lectures

One of the best professors I've ever had.  Dr. Larson took material I thought I would find boring and made it interesting and engaging.  If you have a passion for American Literature, he's the absolute best to have as a prof.
He's a great teacher  He is very generous with his attendance policy and with late papers.  He's very knowledgeable.  I really enjoyed his class.
A bit dry, but I wasn't interested in the material, so I might be biased.  Larson is kind, understanding, insightful and fair.

Whoo nelly.  Larson is an incredible professor who is extremely smart.  He expects a lot, but gives a lot.  He does a great job of assisting the conversation without controlling it.  Definitely, you have to do the reading, but a great professor if your loo
One of my best professors at CSU.

They don't come any better than Professor Larson. He has enthusiasm for the subject, and succeeds, as others do not, in passing it on to the students. He's also fair and nice, unlikely to penalize you for turning in a late paper. Far and away the best that CSU has to offer.

Was incredibly understanding this summer. Would not have made it without his understanding. Love to hear him read. He has a great speaking voice and sense of humor. Still don't like Jane Austen - sorry!
Great Discussions in class...just make sure you do the reading!

She's okay. Class was really easy. Just a midterm and a final which were both taken online. Then she assigned us grad students a PDP. I'd take her again because she's easy, but I don't think I learned anything from her class.
She's cool! Two presentations, two open book tests, and class attendance/participation points.

She was an ok professor. We had two oral presentations and two PDPs (personal development plans) during the semester and our only test was the final which was at the end of the semester. Due to only being tested at the end of the semester, she was very generous and curved the final.

The class was interesting, and the assignments given were easy. My big problem I had in this class however was that I needed to communicate with the professor, and being an on-line class, the only way was e-mail. However, he never responded to any of my e-mails, which was very frustrating.
I didn't take notes during class, but she tells you exactly what's on the test which makes everything easier! It helps if you do go to class though. Very easy class!

One of the greatest teachers I have ever had. She's not like the other art history teachers that force remote memorization for all the paintings and artist. She truly makes the history come to life and you only have to memorize specific movements and styles, not all the ridiculous dates, countries ect. If you go to class, you'll be fine. Loved her!

This class is easily the most gruesome class I have taken in my college career. Lectures go in random directions and if questions are asked then be prepared to wait 10 minutes for an answer. He expected students to be fluent in coding and linear algebra when neither are preqs for this class. He will laugh at students for not understanding material.

I don't know how I walked out with an A in this class. His just reads his notes for lecture and you have no idea what to expect for exams which are super difficult in their own right. Even though he curves the class quite a bit, it still doesn't make up for the gauntlet of stress I had to go through. Avoid him if you can.

Had this guy for 3 days then transfered into a different class.  Absolutely terrible...   He just sits there and reads directly from power points.  Moves way too fast through the material and is very soft spoken.  Refuses to do any practice problems as well.  Complete waste of time do not recommend!

Easily one of the best teachers I've ever had. You will definitely have to work for your grade, but the workload isn't too extreme. He is very understanding and will work with you to help you improve. I feel that my writing skills have really improved because of him. He is also just great to talk to and really wise and funny.

Easily one of the best teachers I've ever had. You will definitely have to work for your grade, but the workload isn't too extreme. He is very understanding and will work with you to help you improve. I feel that my writing skills have really improved because of him. He is also just great to talk to and really wise and funny.

Loved Professor Laurenty! Easily one of the best professors I've had as an English major at CSU. It probably helped that the topic of the class was graphic novels (which is fun anyway), but he did a great job with discussion and helping develop final papers.

Very nice guy and I enjoy coming to his class every day. However, very heavy on the papers and is a very hard grader. But, he is very easy to talk to and is always trying to answer any questions we may have and wants us to succeed. His lectures are very interesting and funny. Overall it is a tough class but he is very understanding and respectful.

Not a bad prof but if you missed 3 classes for my course, you instantly failed. Also doesn't matter if your papers are first rate, you will get poor grades if you're shy. He often goes on personal tangents and incorporates an insane amount of work as if his class is the only one that matters. Very tough to get an A. That said, he is a nice guy.

Prof. Laurenty was fantastic! This popular culture: graphic novel's course was different than other ENG classes. He makes you write a ridiculous amount, but I found it helped my writing. I enjoyed the class - he really cares about students, chooses reading material based on suggestions at times, and is really there to help you in any way.

Professor Laurenty is a very good teacher, but sometimes his syllabus directions were unclear. He's willing to help you along the way. Gives good detailed feedback. Class is always interesting. There's a lot of essays, my class had two due every week but they weren't that long and helps your writing improve a lot!

By far the best professor Ive ever had! At times the assignments could be hard but he is always there for help and for great feedback on the essays! Also a great caring person to talk to about anything!
He is the best professor I've ever had.

He is one of the hardest English teachers to please but he is a great teacher. He knows where all his students writing is and how to critique it. He is a teacher who wants to make English easy and will work with you.
This is one of my favorite Professors.  He would engage you if you were willing to learn.  can always count on him helping you if you needed it

Proffesor Laurenty started off very laid back but was sure to warn us that nothing about his class was easy. Im not trying to say he was extremely hard either. He gave weekly 500 word essays for practice, they definitely help boost your grade. I particularly did not like the way he explained projects. He didnt answer my questions very well.

Professor Laurenty Is probably the best English teacher I have had to date.  He has a paper due  almost every class, but it helps you grow as a writer. Attendance is MANDATORY if you don't show up you're not passing. if you're looking for an easy A with minimum work this professor is not for you. take this professor if you want to improve yourself
Great professor, can be challenging. He doesn't give you a grade, you clearly earn it. Always helps his students when needed, pushes them outside of the comfort zone and helps you grow as a person.

I cannot begin to describe how awful this professor was for my Writing About Music course (Eng102 equivalent). He would always talk about how he wanted to treat us like professionals but we felt more like high school students. I will say that he had decent life advice and gave clear feedback, but everything else about his teaching was atrocious.

Professor Laurenty is easily the best English professor I've had in my college experience. Not only does he give you advise towards being a better writer and critical thinker, but also advise toward life as well. He grades vary fairly and you can tell he wants the best out of his students. I would absolutely take him again if he had more classes.
Mr. Laux was such a great professor. If his Forensic Biology class is offered as an elective, I 100% recommend you take it. It is a lot of fun, is an easy A, and you will learn a lot.
Mr. Laux was such a great professor. If his Forensic Biology class is offered as an elective, I 100% recommend you take it. It is a lot of fun, is an easy A, and you will learn a lot.

best professor I've had in 4 years. He really does care about you learning the material more than grades, got 100% on all labs. his tangents are cool because they are about forensics and cases he's worked. you have to go to lecture even though it's not mandatory, and look at every slide fo the tests, but he always gives you the benefit of the doubt
Hands down one of the best professors.  Class was really interesting, the work was interesting and he graded very fairly. Really helped me post-grad as well. Take this forensics class! !

Professor Laux is the best biology professor I have ever had. Labs and lectures work well together and are so much fun. The material can be challenging but he is so good that you will be very prepared. We need professors that actually have real work ethic like his when it comes to teaching. Take this class!

Amazing teacher! Such a fun class. Pretty easy, because of the way he teachs. Tests are easy if you study the quizzes and prior essay questions. Take this class! It is the easiest Biology class that you will ever take!

Prof Lavelle provides an outline that you take notes directly on when watching the lectures. 3 exams that are cumulative, and one 10-12 page paper are the deliverables, which are all "mentoring" - you submit and he gives you feedback and a chance to resubmit for full credit. If you don't get an A, you're asleep at the wheel.

Prof Lavelle provides an outline that you take notes directly on when watching the lectures. 3 exams that are cumulative, and one 10-12 page paper are the deliverables, which are all "mentoring" - you submit and he gives you feedback and a chance to resubmit for full credit. If you don't get an A, you're asleep at the wheel.

The format of this class is terrible. He doesn't give quizzes/homework to prepare for exams. There are 3 exams all comprehensive 25% 35% 40%. Imagine doing bad on one of them. The format of the lectures is terrible. doesn't use PowerPoint. Uses word docs with a script to lecture as if it was a play. It was a complete mess. Would never recommend.
The class is only essay exams! Which are horrible. His lectures are all over the place and the way he sends documents and emails makes them hard to read and follow along. 10/10 would not reccommend.

I love this professor. He is really nice and is really there for his students. His tests are open notes and the final was take home. He does lecture for a long time the entire class and most is repetitive but he does have some funny jokes. If you want an easy MGT class, be sure to take him. Guaranteed A !!!!!

He is a great guy! Loves to talk, but he will answer any questions that you have. Don't bother to read the book but take notes in class for open note exams. Much of his lecture is repeated info, but he really cares about his students.

He's very nice. We got pizza after one group project. He teaches a lot about union labor law, which isn't really what the course is supposed to be about, but that's what he knows really well. I went to about 75% of the classes and passed with an A. Lectures are long, and can be redundant, but interesting enough. Tests are open notes, great guy.

His lectures are really long. He literally keeps you in class the whole time. This class met one day a week so it lasted for about 3 hours with a few breaks in between. He was an easy teacher, we had no book and no homework during the semester, just two tests and a final and we had a paper.

Overall I'd say she's a solid choice. I will say I found it hard to get really engaged in her lectures. But she is very helpful when it comes to asking questions and is good about responding to emails as soon as she can. Project might seem overwhelming at first but if you just talk with her she does a good job of explaining what she expects.

Overall I'd say she's a solid choice. I will say I found it hard to get really engaged in her lectures. But she is very helpful when it comes to asking questions and is good about responding to emails as soon as she can. Project might seem overwhelming at first but if you just talk with her she does a good job of explaining what she expects.

Great professor. Super nice lady. Project worth 40% and 3 exams worth 20% each. Will give feedback on project and walk you through exactly what you need to fix. Get 2 sheets front and back for exams. I highly recommend taking this class.

She is a sweet little lady. I didnt really learn much in her class but it was pretty easy and interesting. Gives you a test pool of all possible test questions so the tests are a breeze. Did learnsmarts and two papers. She is a tough grader on papers be warned. Other than that she was good

She's a sweet lady, definitely the grandma type.  The only grade was 4 tests which she curved.  You were able to use 2 sheets of computer paper front and back. The test questions are pulled straight from the book's publisher and you can print as small as you want so use your imagination on how you can get 100% without ever showing up to lectures.

Very nice and caring professor but she is extremely boring to listen to in lecture and since she deducts 1% of your grade for every class missed after the fourth youre pretty much stuck in here with her. Tests are very easy and so is connect and learnsmart and she literally gives you three tries to do your papers right. Minimal effort to get an A.

The project is now worth 35% not 20% of your grade and she is tough on the project, but she will help you through it if you are stuck on it but warning is it time consuming and  is not easy, but the rest of the class is though. 60% test, 5% homework. 2 page front and back cheat sheet. Most of the test questions come from the homework she gives, gl.
One of the must human professors I've ever had. Genuinely cares about students, would do anything to help us succeed.
One of the best at CSU!! Cares about her students like kids

Easiest Finance teacher at CSU, she gave us 2 hours to do the 12 quizes with 2 times to check the answer. She gave us unlimited times to do the homework with 2 times to check each answer and she allows you 3 pages of notes front and back for the tests. She is super helpful and cool to boot. I had close to an 100% in the class when I finish.

Good class and professor. Homework and quizzes will be done online. Three exams, but she'll give you a chance to use a study guide formula sheet.  Majority of the questions on the exams comes from the quizzes and sample test.
Very helpful and great professor.

So thankful I got her for my finance class. I hate finance and I'm a burned out grad student. I would have failed with anyone else. She isn't very clear but she is very accommodating and has REAL WORLD experience, unlike every other professor. Only made us know what was truly important. Didn't waste my time like every other class.
Great teacher!!

Man she is a great teacher.  She is very helpful and willing to go the extra miles for you. Do the homeworks and quizzes because she used some of the problems  in the exams. She make the course useful and easy for student and really care that you pass the course. Best Fin teacher ever at Cleveland State University

She was an excellent teacher. Very knowlegeable about Banking. She explained the material well. Her open book test are hard. It better to get the multiple choice test. But important to read the textbook. Ask her questions about the banking world she enjoys explaining the material. Excellent teacher.If willing to study and attend excellent teacher
No Comments

Professor Lawrence is a real gem. She truly cares about her students and wants them to succeed. The homework is on connect and easy to complete. There are 3 tests and she gives you a test pool. Wrote two papers. One reaction paper (1-2 pages), & a 5-6 paper on a case. She will let you turn in a draft, so you should receive a great final grade.

Professor Lawrence is a real gem. She truly cares about her students and wants them to succeed. The homework is on connect and easy to complete. There are 3 tests and she gives you a test pool. Wrote two papers. One reaction paper (1-2 pages), & a 5-6 paper on a case. She will let you turn in a draft, so you should receive a great final grade.

Gives you a test pool for exams-easy exams. go to class bc she takes attendance and does random call ons for points. lot of learn smarts but easy points. shes the best professor for this class for sure. easy.

3 exams but she gives you test pools that are the exact test. good teacher- wants you to pass. Don't need the book-no homework. Def take this class. One final paper that is long and hard but send in rough draft and she'll give you a better final grade. She offers random extra credit for hw problems.

She is a great professor and very helpful. She will not try to trick you about Exams because your exams are based on quizzes and homework that you do. Study quizzes and homework and you will be fine. Come to class so you can understand the material.  Could had an A but that was my fault. I planned to take her again.

Lazarus is a fantastic professor! He is great at explaining confusing topics and provides helpful quizzes throughout the semester to prepare you for the final. He is clearly very knowledgeable and willing to meet with students outside of class for additional help.

Lazarus is a fantastic professor! He is great at explaining confusing topics and provides helpful quizzes throughout the semester to prepare you for the final. He is clearly very knowledgeable and willing to meet with students outside of class for additional help.
Great professor. Gives quizzes which are hard but effective. Also, he will base the percentage that your quizzes count towards your final grade on how well you perform on them.

Professor Lazarus is an amazing teacher. Coming into your first year of law school is intimidating at best and he really makes class interesting and understandable! Study for the quizzes because they are hard but you'll be happy you had them =)
Greatest professor at CM! So nice, cares about his students, clear, wants to help you understand! take him for everything!

Class was interesting, I may not agree with all the other posts. His Quizzes are brutal in the sense that everyone does well, so the curve is tight, may even be a few points from a A to a C, because every one does so well.

He is an amazing professor.  He is crystal clear in his explanations.  He gives a quiz once every two weeks and although they are difficult, they really test your knowledge.  By the end of the semester you will have to study half as much for the final as you will for other classes because he keeps you thinking all semester! Best prof!
he is an amazing professor! thorough and on point. his bi-weekly quizzes are the best. i'd take him for anything!
I LOVE him! Ya the quizzes can be tough but you learn so much more. I am so glad I took him rather than another professor.

He teaches several classes. This one is Legal Profession, probably the most boring topic in his repertoire, but it turned out to be a great class. Sure the quizzes are aweful, but you will really learn the material. He is a sweet person and a pleasure to listen to.

hands down the most engaging man i've ever known.  he is the stereotypical brilliant educator who genuinely captivates his students. Because he teaches with such wit, charisma, and knowledge, though the material may be difficult, it becomes an  awesome experience. sometimes i feel like im at the theatre instead of learning evidence.

Yes, his quizzes cause ulcers - but in the end they are worth it. You end up learning more with him than anyone else. He is the BEST prof! He is crystal clear in his explanations, kind, and genuinely interested/concerned about how his students fare in law school and in life. TAKE EVERYTHING HE TEACHES!!!

Looks EXACTLY like Robert Duvall.  Having said that, he's really, really tough, but if you pay attention and know the cases, you'll do well and learn a lot.  His quizzes will make you want to rip your hair out.
good professor - really cares about his students.  but he is tough!

Took him for Con Law II and Civ Pro II. He has the most horrible quizzes imagineable, with averages of Ds and Fs! However, he is caring, compassionate, brilliant, and understanding. I really like the guy - but I would avoid his classes like the plague!
Smart, demanding, helpful
Three words: Stern but fair.
