Good mix of lecture and discussion.

i completely agree that he's a great guy, but not an effective professor.  other students think he's great, but i didn't find him clear at all.  i had to take the MPRE after this class and there was a SIGNIFICANT amount of material on it that he never even
Worst professor I've had at Marshall.. Nice guy, horrible teacher.

Professor Lazor truly cares about each and every one of his students. He doesn't teach from a place of authority which is really nice. The work isn't difficult as long as you do it and put the time in. Justin is also extremely understanding and accommodating.

Professor Lazor truly cares about each and every one of his students. He doesn't teach from a place of authority which is really nice. The work isn't difficult as long as you do it and put the time in. Justin is also extremely understanding and accommodating.

professor lazor is okay. he seems like he wants to care but i don't really think it's genuine. i think i might be missing out on something because he gives off a closet-arrogant vibe. i'm not sure i learned anything this semester, but that's fine.

Professor Lazor is an amazing professor. He cares about all of his students and wants them to succeed in life. He gives constructive critisism and works with students individually to help them get better at writing. Highly respected and highly recommended.

don't think i learned anything in this class, you don't really need the books to pass if you know what you're doing, class was kind of too relaxed, didn't really feel like a college setting sometimes. otherwise it was okay.
Nothing specific to say, thinks he's funnier than it is, didn't really learn a lot
not sure why there are so many glowing reviews, he was ok at best
Super cool dude! Both informative and super funny. I wish I could take all my classes from him.
My favorite teacher ever! I would totes give him a chili pepper if that was still a thing.

Good professor. Very accessible outside of class and responds to emails quickly. Gives very helpful feedback on essays and is always willing to help you revise your work. He is a very laid back and funny guy. The class is a very relaxed setting.

He was hard to understand when he lectured, if attendance wasn't mandatory I probably would have never gone to class. All his powerpoints are online and all the homeworks tests were also online. If it wasn't an easy class probably wouldn't have passed with an A. Very boring lectures and degrading when you asked questions

Has a very thick accent at times making it difficult to understand him. He also tells you to go back through the trainings to find out how to do something or another. It is frustrating! Rely on friends and learn the study yourself so you aren't screwed!
The class was pretty much a joke.  The textbook was a waste of money.  And there were a lot of assignments.  They weren't hard, but they were long
The only bad thing about him is his accent.  Nevertheless, his class was easy and you should pass it with ease
Fantastic course. He expects you a lot in class but also gives some good extra credits. Do good on assignments, projects and exams and you should be fine. I got B+ for this course. Highly recommend.
Too much mandatory work that isn't even graded...!
Worst professor if have ever had.

I really enjoyed taking this class. Although he is very particular and picky about work, he does a nice job teaching. When taking this class on campus, attendance is mandatory, you miss a day, you miss a ton! He does require a lot of work and effort, you just have to stay on top of everything. If you do that, it shouldn't be too bad.
Very helpul, nice professor! Highly reccommend! Many assignments but quite easy!
After this class and many others, I won't be recommending this guy!
Never again.

So much pointless work for this class. Three 12 page papers throughout the semester and two exams per week. If you ask for help he says he can't give you and help and you should've been paying attention.
Don't bother asking him for help because you won't get it. Don't bother asking him about your grade, he doesn't know. Don't bother taking him..you'll regret it, I promise!

I personally had a hard time understanding his accent but the class itself was pretty easy simply everyday basic computer functions with Microsoft applications... the test are the homework .. he does count attendance so it is mandatory
Good professor. Nice and kind. I can only get B in this class but I do appreciate his teaching. The course requires a lot of attention and hard-work.
He make you feel sin when you ask a question. For example, if you want know where is the online exam, he will say "check the descrption".

He, bilittles you when you ask questions. He does not let you ase anything even if it requires extra attention. If you are 1 sec late turning in the quizes he wont take it!! I never understood ne thing he every said. made me cry about twice this semester.
Awesome! I got an A for this class. Nice professor. But have to do a lot of assignments :(
Good: Helpful, friendly, interesting lectures; Bad: attendance, some quizzes are a bit difficult.Come and discuss with him if you don't understand.
Perhaps, one of the best and most interesting professors I have met at CSU. Very kind, helpful, and enthusiastic. Easy to approach him outside his class.
Hes an alright person but he doesnt always make sense and his lectures are very boring in my opinion. its hard to focus.
He was good professor. Easy A class.
Wonderful Teacher!

A really beautiful and intelligent young lady. An amazing teacher, who tackles tough subjects easily and makes them understandable. She gives alot of Extra Credit, but also alot of homework and quizzes.

Extremely easy! She gives so much extra credit and she goes over the text almost question for question the day before the test! You get extra credit for showing up to class and she is very interactive! Take her!

He was very helpful. I lost hope and i really did not want to continue taking this course until i asked for his help. He sat with me until i got the material. Just seek his help if you feel lost He will gladly assist you.

Dr. Ledebur is one of the best profs I've had at CSU.  He is very nice, and is an excellent teacher of the material.  The class is quite difficult, but if you attend you will do well.  He does numerous study sessions for tests, and basically tells you what is going to be on them, being able to assimilate and replicate it is the issue. A+++

Difficult class but worthwhile if you actually want to learn. He doesnt make it easy but Dr. Ledebur legitemetly cares about your class performance, as long as you care. Practice exams are very useful and essential to success in the class. Good guy.
Without question the hardest teacher/class I have EVER had.  But, the greatest teacher you can have.  An A in his class is an A earned with sweat, blood, and tears.  Great guy.

Ridiculously hard test, but the class LOVED this guy.  He will go out of his way to help, you just need to put in the effort.  Would recommend if you don't want an easy A and want to actually LEARN somethin.

TAKE THIS OVER THE SUMMER WITH KAMINSKY!!!! He even tells people to take the class with him! Don't waste your time with this professor! He's rude, laughs at people failing the class, laughs at you doing poorly, and believes you're not studying or doing the homework if you're struggling. He has no respect for the students.

I got A's in both Intermediate classes and struggled to get a C in this. His language barrier makes comprehension difficult, and not putting answers on Blackboard (like other classes) made this much more difficult than it had to be. Bragged about hard tests and failing kids multiple times in a row. TAKE THIS OVER THE SUMMER WITH KAMINSKY!

Just take advanced accounting with Kaminsky over the summer. All the profs say this is the easiest course, yet he makes it so difficult. He laughs at you for failing. It is not funny. I somehow passed the other classes but I'm barely passing this.

Take this course in the summer with Kaminsky. It will be a long 8 weeks unless you can understand broken English. Tests are "tricky" as he likes to brag about in class. You have to do it his way. So don't always bother reading the book. Try to participate and make sure he knows your name so he can consider your grade at the end.
Toughest class in accounting. P. Lee makes it even tougher.

Your only choice for Advanced Accounting at CSU and Prof Lee makes it difficult.  He's from Korea and there's a language barrier that doesn't help since Accounting is a very complex subject to begin with.  Tests are difficult.  Homework is not collected but he calls on everyone to make sure it's done.  Overall difficult class and professor.

WORST teacher Ive had. English language is extremely limited w frequent problems understanding & expressing complex concepts. No real communication except for basic information using isolated words, sometimes in an aggressive manner. "Lectures had  students do most of the work by presenting HW. It's a disappointment & waste of $.
Careless professor and doesn't explain problems on exams/quiz clearly.

Make sure you do your homework for this class because he will call on you and make you put your answers on the board. He also uses CPA questions on some of his tests. But he curves the grades at the end and takes your overall classroom participation into account.

I highly recommend him for this course.   Exams and quizzes are tricky, but he'll prepare you for the CPA exam.   I suggest doing the homework prior to class, as you'll be expected to present answers to the class and participation is 10% of your grade.   Be sure to ask questions if you have them, he's very responsive.

The professor does not explain the problems, he just copies them right from the solution manual. If a student ask him a question about a problem he usually doesn't know the answer. You have to self study for this subject, even though he says that the textbook assigned is bad. One of the worst professor I have ever seen.

He's a nice guy. But, he's a tough grader, on some questions it's all or nothing, which can make or break a grade. There's always a curve ball on the exams. What I didn't like was 2 of his exams he was not there, so you wouldn't be able to ask him a question if you had one. This past exam, he gave a hard problem which he didn't finish going over.

I learned a lot from this professor. Not just course material, plenty of real-life applications as well.  He is very respectful to students and doesn't expect too much. The homework is not graded, but be prepared to do it anyways, because you will have to put it on the board. The tests are fair and contain absolutely no surprises. A+ for Lee.

He gave alots of questions on the test and expect you to finish them in 1 1/2 hrs. If you are not experience in tax, you are not going to pass his class because he thinks you are graduate student and you are supposed to know everything already. I would not recommend you to take him! ?????
Professor Lee is very nice,kind and helpful instructor. However the subject itself is hard and in order to get a good grade you have to study a lot.

It looks like he never touch master courses in the past. He teaches act 621 this fall. He does not consider the time consuming. He put alots of questions on the test in 1:15 hrs class and expected you to know everything already. I did not like the way he teaches. He said grad students are supposed to know everything.

He is fun but being only fun is not what students are looking for. I do not think he should be teaching master courses level yet. He just throw alots of questions on the test without reconsider time consuming. He even throw questions that not even discussed in class on the test. He said grad students should have known everything. Yeah, rite!
only for students into self-teaching because you'll learn nothing
good teacher

I loved Paul Lee! Really comprehensive, funny, and easy to approach. He works with the class to make sure you really understand how to do problems. He does have a strong accent, but you get used to it quickly. The only thing I didn't like was his use of test-bank MC questions on exams, some were really hard/random, but if we bombed he curved. A+.

Dr. Lehfeldt is so sweet and funny. She is extremely approachable and down to earth. I had her for Intro to Honors and Honors College Social Media, and both courses were very simple and manageable with very light homework. I plan to take as many HON courses with her as I can.

Dr. Lehfeldt is so sweet and funny. She is extremely approachable and down to earth. I had her for Intro to Honors and Honors College Social Media, and both courses were very simple and manageable with very light homework. I plan to take as many HON courses with her as I can.

Lehfeldt is also the Dean of the Honors College, so she is super well respected. She definitely knows what she's talking about and seems like she really cares about her students. Class was very easy, just have keep on top of assignments.
Great professor, great human being! History has never been so interesting !

I am genuinely bummed that my last class in this HIS program was my first class with Dr. Lehfeldt. I not only learned new tools for examining historical works, but the open and inclusive environment she created as a facilitator, helped me create lasting friendships with classmates. I'm a better person and student of history for taking this course.
Not only is she a great professor but she's also smoking hot
I would like to complement her style in fashion and apperance. I would love to take her on a date if she was my age. Good lectures and great readings. Enjoy

Challenges students to read text critically and questions for exams are difficult. Keeping up with the reading is essential for understanding material presented in the lecture.  Fair with students as longs as they make an effort to engage in the class. Occasional group work that is ultimately helpful in understanding the material presented.
This was my second class with Professor Lehfeldt and as always what a great class. She knows her material and makes learning about the plague extremely interesting.

This professor was awesome!!!! She knows her material and is not offended if someone corrects her.  The reading is heavy at the beginning of class but by the last month there is hardly any. There is a midterm, final and paper but none of it was over taxing. I can not wait to take another class with her.

This Professor was fantastic and very knowledgeable on the subject matter. The class was a great class, reading load at times was a little heavy but nothing unmanageable and was able to keep the readers attention. Attendance and Participation are a MUST. Will take another class with her and encourages other to do so as well.

Excellent prof. Great lecture class, but included (and she expects) a lot of class discussion. Required really interesting reading material (although the book on Elizabeth was much too long in my opinion). If you are interested in Women's history THIS is definitely your kind of class.

Very good Prof, good lectures, engages and welcomes discussion. Grading is on the strict side, but fair. Responds to email and is helpful. There is an extremely high workload for the class (reading especially).

Professor is very knowledgeable about topic. Is extremely rough & strict when it comes to student's writing, though. Expects undergrads to be as knowledgeable as grads or she is. Tests are very easy and vague, not too detail oriented. Talks a lot about things that have nothing to do with the Bubonic plague near the last month or so of the course.

Took for European Women History (medieval to early modern) and she ROCKS!!!  Knows everything there is to know about everything and if she doesn't... admits it and looks it up.  Just fantastic and makes the class so fun.  Great dresser, too!!

I took European women's history. Awesome professor. She is on my dissertation committee. You will learn in an organized fashion. Would take more from her if I had the time. Read some of her writings and you will understand her passion.
very nice

I took both Western Civ 1 and Social History of the Black Death with Dr. Lehfeldt.  She was extremely intelligent and the lectures were crystal clear.  Tests were essay but very easy if you put forth effort.
She really isnt good at all....Takes her class too seriously and is extremly boring..No sense of humor
Awesome lectures. Quizzes and tests are a breeze if you paid attention in class.
great class
Best online professor!! I have taken her twice, and am already signed up for a third!! I have had HORRIBLE experiences with CSU online professors, however, Robin is NOT one of them.
I LOVE CAROL
Had to take a second language for major decided to take german. Loved the class. Carol is very helpfull and wants to help students succeed. Ill continue to take german classes. Recommend german!

oysh! Go to class or be punished several hundred different ways. Recorded lectures for study material to fail the exams anyway. I'm not sure what qualifies her to teach thisclass?Read Publications and Bio prior. I cant even say where the test material comes from?We all got last 3 assignment grades AFTER final & grade you "earned" for semester?

Run... seriously.... run. I don't understand how she hasn't been fired. I have a 3.65 GPA, graduating this semester, and would rather drop my minor than finish out this course. Went into midterm not knowing where I stand because she's only graded the syllabus quiz. Gives very little time for the midterm, but expects lengthy essay responses. AWFUL

This was an online class with an absurd workload. The first few weeks you do essentially nothing. She assigns a lot of papers and CANNOT keep up with the grading. This professor wants you to know that she is 'smart'. When completing the assignments tell her what she wants to hear. Exams are from the textbooks and conflicting with current statistics

The reviews here are spot on. I'm taking an online multicultural course. The course starts relatively smooth with only a few group discussions. By week 3 and 4 though, expect constant powerpoints and essays which are nearly impossible to get a 95 or higher on. Extremely unforgiving grader. Final project is a minimum 11 page paper. Avoid if you can.

The course she teaches is not a difficult course, but she causes it to be. Her instructions are long and unclear, the workload is unnecessary, and she gives so many assignments that she can't even keep up with the grading herself. The only thing I'll say is that she definitely seems passionate. But avoid this class if at all possible.

She asks the dumbest questions for papers I can think of. Things that are related  but impossible to find anywhere. Gives you a "How the heck am I supposed to find that?" Her online lectures are annoying and make you want to scream. Her assignments are vague, and make you feel dumb. I absolutely would not want her teaching anyone.

Likes  to show how knowledgeable she is based on her experience (sounds like she had one job in marketing) and doesn't really TEACH you anything.  Most of the group projects did poorly due to little to no direction from her.  The tests were ridiculous -- articles pulled from random places that were very subjective.
hardest grader ever
AVOID HER! She is extremely rude. Didn't even make up her own syllabus, came from a professor from another school. Not clear at all on what she wants for assignments.

Terrible experience.  Grading is a joke.  Lectures are long and read directly from slides.  Very pretentious.  Says that case study evaluations can be subjectively be correct when backed with evidence or reason.  Not the case
She seems to be a high school kind of teacher. Even though she doesn't teach accordingly but expects a lot from students. Drags the class.

Professor Lewis was super difficult our course was moved online due to the pandemic and that definitely was ignored by the amount of work assigned and his attitude towards technical difficulties as someone who has never taken a class outside of US politics this class was ridiculously hard and asking him to expand on jargon meant talking to a wall

Save your money if you can. I pray I never have a class with Dr. Lewis again. While, he's extremely knowledgeable about the subject, the material you read (in the textbook) compared to his lectures, don't mesh well. This is an extremely difficult class, and it's hard to get an A. Nevertheless, I'm glad it's almost over.

Professor Lewis is a VERY knowledgeable teacher about the EU. However, his lectures in class are nearly impossible to take notes from. He will jump from tangent to tangent, making note-taking incredibly frustrating. He assigns an aggressive amount of readings as well. Make sure to do them, and to do ALL the quizzes. Otherwise, you will NOT pass.

Excellent professor. Below comment properly summarizes setup for Graduate Courses. He is incredibly knowledgable in European Politics and Political Economy. He'll bring genuine exuberance to your education every single day. Don't be afraid to discuss new ideas and thoughts, as he is an open mind as ever. Take any course offered by Dr. Lewis.

Very heavy lecturer, will talk for the entire time, with little room for discussion. No power point. Expertise is in EU. Very heavy reading load, I had 5 books for this class, and we used all of them. The midterm and final are essays based off the readings. And there are 2 additional research papers.

Purchased all the books for the class & while I didn't keep up with the readings regularly, before the exams I would go back & read sections that I didn't understand during lecture. GO TO CLASS for two reasons: the topics he gives you to focus on while doing the reading are hints for exam questions and the material is hard to grasp w/o lecture

best teacher ever !!!!!! He knows so much about international trade but the European union is his concentration. an amazing class if you actually attend class. This is not the type of class you can miss because you will fall behind. he will help you all he can if you go to office hours. great guy to know !!!!

Dr. Lewis is one of the most intelligent people I've had the opportunity to learn from. If you are in school to learn you will thoroughly enjoy his lectures. Those saying he goes off on tangents don't fully appreciate the breadth of his knowledge. He brings unbridled passionenthusiasm. Makes complex concepts graspable.  Simply put, he's the man!
Dr. Lewis is the single greatest professor that I have ever had. If you can keep up with his complicated web of lectures you will learn A LOT.

Professor Lewis is arguably one of the most knowledgable in his field at CSU, and is known and used within that field. There's a lot of reading. and he does kind of go off on tangents here and there, but it isn't that hard to keep up if you do at least some reading. After I was done with the course I felt very satisfied with what I had learned.

'Jargan' is his favorite word and perfectly describes him.The class is difficult.If you don't keep up with the readings it'll be horrible for you. If you have no knowledge of International Politics then this class will kick your butt because it is definitely not an intro course.
This rating has been removed as per our site guidelines.

Professor Lewis is incredibly smart and has a passion for what he teaches. He answers all questions very thoroughly (almost too thoroughly at times). He expects his students to keep up with the reading, but he reinforces the ideas nicely during class time. Attendance is not mandatory, but it helps a lot if you do go. Fair grader on test and paper

If you attend class regularly and don't miss his quizzes, he will make sure you get a good grade. He's lenient when it comes to papers, and the take-home midterm was definitely a bonus. No complaints here.

Very informed and interesting. He shows real enthusiasm about lecture topics and always answers student questions as thoroughly as possible. Gives guidance on what to expect for exams so as long as you study and turn in the paper on time you will do well.

Very intellegent and extremely knowledgeable and extremely interested in his subject. He can be a little long-winded and hard to follow, but those who say he rants exaggerate. He's very engaging when you comment on the topic at hand and open to new ideas-just go for it. I've even unintentionally interrupted him in mid-sentence and he doesn't mind.

Dr. Lewis is very knowledgeable, and a little obsessive about the EU-- but greatly appreciated.  If you write in a structured well defined manner, then you will do great on the tests.  My only complaint is he lacked in connecting with the students and when talking with me on a one-on-one basis came off as a 'better than thou' person.
He loves what he studies, but I think he needs to spend more time with class interaction. I didn?t care for his style of teaching  sounded like ranting, which did not encourage class discussion.
Horrible. full of knowledge but Speaks above you.  Doesn't have patience for teaching!

I had Dr. Lewis for two summer classes, Western European Politics and International Politics. He is extremely knowledgable, very useful, and mildly obsessed with the EU. His tests are hard (but he prepares you for them) and you may read alot. He habitually misprounces 'rhetoric', and thats really my only complaint.

This rating is inaccurate, because this site includes my interest as one of his good points.  It should be WAY lower.  He did not show for his office hours, and is more responsible in classes with students who are NOT LIN majors.  Do not major in this program!  Covers maybe 50% of the material on his syllabus, and won't give the quizzes or tests.

Great Course!! Wonderful professor who cares about his students. Highly interesting material on Morphology. It is a hard course because it is an intense subject, but as long as you attend courses, pay attention, and TAKE NOTES!, you will get a good grade.

Lewis is the worst professor ever.Its fine and all to be nice, but often he is late, goes ovr class appropriated time, never returns assignments or even our midterm one year,he is irresponsible in that he continually does not have material promised prepared or assigns it than ignores it altogether.Easy A but youll never be prepared for grad school.

He's really nice, and tries really hard to give the class as much help as possible. If you cannot attend class, just email him, and he's pretty cool about it. The material is pretty boring though. He in enthusiastic though.

He's nice, and knowledgeable, but he runs out of time a lot and doesn't get through the material. Tests are difficult, involving a lot of memorization, but half of them become take homes anyway. Once you get passed phonetics it's really fun subject matter.

doctor lewis is proficient in all the subjects he teaches.  you may sometimes find it hard to take notes in his class, but it will never be hard to listen.  he basically bends over backwards to ensure that you WILL get a good grade as long as you complete the assignments.  most tests are take home, but do require a good deal of writing.
horrible
Love this teacher, Enjoy attending class everyday. She is a tough teacher, but learn how she tests and an A is in order. Plan to take her again.
Atrocious!!!!!!!

Terrible.  Usually you can't understand what she's talking about, and on the rare occasion you can it's obvious that she doesn't understand the subject any better than you do.  We spent six weeks on acquisition by capture and did nothing on landlord-tenant law.  She seems to be the one professor at Marshall who delights in giving out bad grades.

If you have a choice in the matter, avoid her at all costs. She is a professor who does not care if you learn anything. If you have her, you will not go over essential material that will be tested on the bar. She spends copious amounts of time on concepts that are not tested on the final. She also glosses over the most difficult material that can b

Thirty-six hours until the final exam and the professor has decided to "teach" material that should have been covered during the semester.  I cannot study for my four other exams because I must learn new material.  I would avoid this professor like the plague.  I would avoid this law school as well because you don't choose your 1st year professors.

Likable professor, but sometimes it is difficult to follow what she's saying in class. The textbook we used should be replaced with one that's more accessible. Best to use supplemental material to clarify the concepts.

I can honestly say she was probably the worst professor I have ever had.  Hard to understand and did not know the material very well at all.  Not very bright and worst of all came across as though she did not care.  Get out of her class if you can.

Ive had her for so many classes. She is supportive and helpful. She will take breaks during her lessons to walk around and make sure every student is understanding. She gives a lot of creative freedom to assignments. If you want to do something with your assignment that isnt covered in class, she will go out of her way to teach you.

Qian Li is an awesome professor, insanely sweet and has a great sense of humor. Be prepared for a lot of assignments and 3 projects throughout the semester, though none took up too much of my time! I would suggest purchasing the programming used throughout this course, as it was difficult to finish everything during class time.

She is the nicest person ever with the cutest Chinese accent. She is very clear when it comes to her lectures and she's very understanding of each student's pace. Get ready for projects. She'll help you as much as possible to achieve the grade you intend to get.

Qian is by far my most favorite professor. She is down to earth & understands that every student is different & encourages you to always reach your full potential. She gives positive criticism & helpful feedback. She really does want all of her students to succeed! If you just try your best & constantly show improvement, she will acknowledge it!
She is extremely passionate about the subject. All projects are super fun. Take her, you won't regret it.

Qian is really nice but its difficult to understand her accent. Super helpful but in an unintentionally condescending way, like you're a kid. Assignments take a LOT of time and effort but they're only worth 1 point each which is frustrating. She doesn't use blackboard so you never know your grade. Still liked this class and learned a lot from her.

Qian is a one of the best professors at CSU. I had her for 3 of my graphic design classes. I learned so much from Qian. She taught & gave me the skills to thrive as a graphic designer. In all of her classes you work on projects for  your portfolio you can use to show future clients & employers. I highly recommend taking a class w/Qian.

Even though she can not pronounce alot of english words, she is VERY skilled. She is extreamly nice and fun. She is so nice she brought everyone Dr. Pepper for one of our quizzes. Also, she may grade unfairly, but you just gotta do your work. I am happy to take her class to learn After Effects and again next semester for Web Design

Qian is nice so I can't bash her. However, she does grade unfairly. Majority of my projects and quizzes were no less than a B+. Why did I get a C+ in the class? She gave me an F on my final project. I put a lot of work into it and I get an F. Well if that was the case, I should have did an Adult Swim bump with just a picture and 10sec music clip.
She seems like a nice person, but she grades very unfairly. It is hard to understand what she talks about.

Taught the first half of the class, lectured off of power points and gave really helpful study guide format power points before exams. You could pass by studying slides and textbook, don't need to attend lecture.

Entire class graded on 3 exams. She taught the first half of class. Very soft spoken and accent is hard to understand. I learned nothing from her due to the confusing format of lessons. Her powerpoints are useful for self-study though. Read book and powerpoints and you'll do fine, but don't rely on her teaching.

Lee may seem unfriendly, but the more you go to class the more you like her. Lee is very knowledgeable,has a lot of real world examples. You have executive interview, midterm and final. For final you don't even have to read the book.It wasn't hard at all.  A+++
Really hard. Sitting through class was hard. Had to get out of there ASAP.
If you study very hard, you will do well.
Waste of a brilliant mind

I took this guy for calc 1 and 2. His exams are tough. Most students didn't like him. Calc 1 wasn't too bad, but calc 2 was a massacre. I don't think anyone in the class got an A. At most, maybe one person did.
Kinda boring. Takes questions, but is constantly second guessing himself and the book.

Expect to teach yourself completly. The class isn't terrible, his tests are horrible, but expect to get a B at most simply due to his grading style. His tests at 10 questions and even one mistake in a long problem will garner you a 0 on it. He doesn't curve and grade is based on 4 midterms and a final.
This guy is a moron. DO not take him. He will fail you.
goes on tangents about science and never really sticks to the material.  always eating hard candy...cough drops most likely.  gives tests and quizes with no warning.  avoid at all costs
It was hard to keep up with him.

Very bad teacher never take his class! He is very unhelpful and speeds through class no matter what. Some girl asked him to go over a problem and he actually said no, he said it would be redundant. Worst teacher ever.
Drones on in a dull monotone, does not give notes, goes over lessons much too fast.  Currently getting a 'C', hoping just to pass.  In short; avoid if possible!

will make your life difficult. his cough will bug you for a couple days, then you'll get used to it. his tests are graded very tough, losing 5 points for a sign error is unresonable in a 10pt problem, espicially right before the solution. tests are hard, expects you know calc2 before you take the class, not many people passed
just horrible
Prof is a terrible instructor and everyone should avoid taking his class. He is very unclear and coughs way too much! He also drinks a bottle of water each day which can get annoying!

Not as bad as everyone says.  Coughing is not bothersome.  I can see where some people might have a hard time with this class, especially if they haven't had math in awhile.  But if you have the prereqs or have a basic underlying knowledge of the Math Concepts principles, this should be easy.  Don't take during summer if you need more attention.

If he thinks you're smart, he'll take you under his wing. But he will make no effort to help you if he deems you "unworthy." Even if you initially make good impression, if you slip up--don't catch on to some new topic right away--he'll drop you from the "worthy" list without hesitation.
Terrible teacher, and coughs the whole time he teaches. Not helpful...one of those guys who teaches just to have the summer off. LOL
avoid him if you can! he is very unclear and cannot relate to students
Very unclear, just confuses the students even more! Try to avoid if at all possible
This guy stinks!  He does not know how to relate to the students.  Very unclear in explainations.  AVOID

Leiberman is a good dude and a great professor. Hes very professional, yet cool, and overall extremely knowledgeable. Hes also very fair, and as long as you want to pass the class, youll do so without too much struggle. Just dont whip out your cell phone during one of his lectures. He draws a hardline on phones & laptops.
Comes to class under influence. Is impossible to reach outside of class. Has questionable relationships with students.
He is a great professor but impossible to communicate with when not in class. He doesn't check his emails or if he does, will not respond.
He is really kind and full of heart If you consider yourself as a filmmaker. Go for it.

Although the class was cool in nature, for film students, doctor Lieberman critique can be abrasive and unhelpful. His assignment descriptions weren't clear so when you completed papers you find they were not what he meant by his assignment description. So clarity was a big issue, especially if you didn't speak his lingo. Lectures were boring.

Awesome teacher, super knowledgeable, excellent stage presence, willing to help out on nights and weekend with production troubleshooting, loves his students and his job, fun to have philosophical conversations with.

Doc is an excellent educator. He has the knowledge, and the skill to pass it on to all of us. His class is a blast, and if you show up and do your work, you will do well. He gives fair warning at the beginning of the semester- this class is time consuming. It is also totally worth it. Also had him for Screenwriting- excellent class.
I had him for screenwriting.  Very smart and friendly.  A little lazy.  Very sexy.

Dr. Lieberman is an outstanding professor and person. CSU is blessed to have him. If not for him, I don't know where I'd be. He has been a tremendous advocate for me and should be given his own School of Film. I would work there in a heartbeat. Evan is truly great.

Dr. Lieberman is an excellent professor. Extremely knowledgable. His Screenwriting class was one of the best I've taken. He worked professionally in L.A. and has lots of good advice to offer. He knows how to teach. Very informative and friendly as well. He's helpful & genuinely interested in our writing. Don't miss this great opportunity. Take him.
He is ok not the best Prof I've ever had
Fantastic teacher! I cannot say enough about this class; It changed my life.

What can you say about this guy? He's got the dedication and knowledge that is "textbook" for good professorship. His classes are a blast and he brings out the best in everybody... it's one of the few classes I have ever looked forward to going to every day. His classes are easy if you actually show up and do the work.

Dr. Lieske is the only professor I've ever had in my college experience (now a senior) who has stood out to me. He is brilliant, so kind, and just overall a wonderful guy. I've taken several courses with him and always got A's. ALL you have to do is read. He gives lots of material to prepare for tests. No excuse to do poorly. I'm gonna miss him!!

Lectures are hard to sit through and do a poor job to prepare you for the online exams. Keeping your online textbook on standby is key to passing this class with an understanding of poli-sci. Professor is very understanding when it comes to the attendance policy!

Dr. Lieske is the only professor I've ever had in my college experience (now a senior) who has stood out to me. He is brilliant, so kind, and just overall a wonderful guy. I've taken several courses with him and always got A's. ALL you have to do is read. He gives lots of material to prepare for tests. No excuse to do poorly. I'm gonna miss him!!

Dr. Lieske is so sweet and truly cares about the material he teaches. I got A's on all of the exams, all you have to do is study the powerpoints he provides. He also gives a study guide before each test. If you can't do well on his exams, you probably just didn't try... at all. Great guy, I'm looking forward to taking more of his classes.

Took three courses with Dr. Joel Lieske; Public Opinion, Cultural Diversity in U.S. Politics, and Senior Seminar. Without doubt, Dr. Joel Lieske is one of the most experienced faculty at Cleveland State. His level of knowledge is unmatched, and furthermore his classes are engaged and well-structured. Not too easy but you can get an A; I got three.

Avoid at all costs, drop the class or take it with another professor but whatever you do do not take this class with this professor. He has ridiculously impossible expectations for his students and does not curve test grades, nor does he give extra credit.
I took this as a summer class. It is a ton of reading and the tests can be very long, but its easy to do well. Professor Lieske had the most generous grading scale I have ever seen.
Awesome professor, talks about politics from both sides of the aisle.

This was a summer course so was fast paced. We had to read 4-5 chapters, take 4-5 quizzes, and take 1 test every week. It's not that hard just a lot covered fast. If you need to get a hold of him he doesn't respond too quickly but he will eventually get back to you. Not too bad overall I'd take him again for an online summer class.

Comes across as independent/libertarian, but votes conservative. When compared to the majority of CSU students who are far left socialists, he is someone who challenges the status quo. He is one of a kind.

I took Lieske my first semester at CSU. He very knowledgeable, but has a clear bias against immigration and caused a heated debate when he brought up eugenics; however, it is VERY easy to get an A in his class. He offers so much extra credit just for showing up that you can practically bomb the midterm and final and still eke out an A/B.

Dr. Lieske is a rare gem in the politically correct, biased, and intellectually dogmatic world we live in today. He is very intelligent and through his own work teaches the research methodologies necessary for success in the field. His only  allegiance is to the truth of issues and refreshingly cuts through the current veil of wishful ignorance

Weird class. First online class I've ever taken with no discussion board or participation requirements. 80% is an A, plus opportunity for up to 20% extra credit. Professor was almost non-existent. Only received 2 messages from him all semester and didn't respond to the one e-mail I sent him. Easy summer class, but pretty pointless.
Not helpful, rude, and doesn't care if you succeed. Never again .

He does not care at all if you struggle with ANYTHING. Any question is a nuisance and he will even go so far as to looking at your transcript if he feels necessary. The only 'B' I have ever received and said his class must have been more challenging than any other, mockingly. Would never take him if you need an ounce of compassion or understanding.

Interesting class if you like politics. Tests are given through blackboard and are from a test bank. Form a study group and you will do fine. Power point slides did not really help much for the tests, used more for discussion points. Once you figure out how to take the tests...then you will be ok. gives extra credit for attendance and quizzes.

Class is very easy. extra credit in class is equivalent to 1 letter grade, and there is a 10% curve also.you don't have to go to class, but Dr. Lieske is a smart guy so i'd go every now and then just because i thought he was interesting.

You HAVE to attend class &read the book to keep up! He tends to get off of topic, but that might be because of the +60 auditor more than anything. Tests are based off of the readings, so they were mandatory! There are certainly papers &those were pretty straight forward! If you're willing to spend time outside of class reading lots, you'll do great

Easiest class I've ever taken. Offers extra credit for showing up and taking online quizzes for a total boost of 15 percent. Showed up to less than half the classes, read 1/3 of textbook and received over 100%. Professor is very anti-immigration, has said in class that diversity hurts democracy. Had us read a book by Patrick Buchanan for our final.

Not only interesting, but helpful and easy. He gives extra credit for attendence sometimes, and also for attending political meetings. Very clear, knows what he is talking about. Good power points and lectures.

People who think this class is hard don't belong in college. If you do the reading, come to class and actually study before the exam you will do well. He gives you the test bank questions, so you don't even have to take notes. All you have to do is learn the material. He is a great proffessor.CSU should hire more like him, it might be a real school

DOES NOT LIKE INTERNATIONAL STUDENTS! All papers are based on the assumption that you are currently employed, which makes it hard if you are not. He's super wordy and lectures aren't really helpful. Papers are short and he gives a great study guide for Midterm and Final.
Great guy

Mark is a passionate professor. He will go above and beyond to help his students outside of class. Yes, he's an adjunct professor and has another full time job, but the fact that he still makes time to teach shows that he has a passion for teaching.

This is not what college is supposed to be about. This class should be taught in High School. The teacher isn't a professor (this is his "part time" job). I actually felt ashamed that I had took. College is not about getting good grades (everyone will get an A or a B). College is about learning. Challenging yourself. This class is a complete joke.
take this course with Mr. ligas. It was a great course. I really enjoy it. you need to do 4 letters, 2 talks, and one report. there are two exams.

The last two reviews had to have been written by Mark Ligas. There was nothing fun or interesting about 16 weeks of Friday nights wasted with him. It was slow, excruciating torture. I was never so happy to be done with a class.
Mark is a super awesome guy will make the class fun and also work with you when you need help. He is a very, very smart guy. I learned a lot from him. Highly recommend!
Easy class!!! The professor is funny and makes this class one of the easiest classes you will ever take. An easy A!
Doesn't treat students equally.  Doesn't hold student accountable for completing assignments on time.

He thought he was all that.  He taught me nothing, I did next to no work and got a good grade.  For those of you out there that actually thing college is worth something then you wont like him.  For everyone else who just wants to move on with their lives he's perfect.

He is as boring as hell. One would think that he should know better about international business communication as he preaches in class. He does not only mock his past students essay openly, he also thinks all foreigns are from space. Always makes silly dry jokes and talking about his son. He is just getting CSU's money, his lectures are USELESS.

The only lesson I found worth remembering from being a student of this man was the lesson of what a teacher shouldn't be like..the class itself was easy but boring as hell..if you can fake a smile for three hours u'll do good. he looks VERY lonely and wants to hangout and chat

Please do not waste your time with this class. There is now a Thursday night offering for this class in Fall 2010. I don't know who the professor is, but they have to be better. Professor Ligas does not teach, he just wants to hang out with people on a Friday night. If you have any experience in an office environment, you will be bored to tears.

Prof. Ligas made class fun and you can tell he cares about his students.  He does give you many opportunities to get a good grade in the class.  I was terrified to give my speech but his class helped me get over my fear of public speaking!

SOOOO boring.  didn't learn anything relevent.  He liked me and I still hated going there.  Exams were a lot of questions..almost all of which we didnt touch on at all in class. Graded papers harshly with no explanation as to why he took off points. Only 100 pts in whole grade so everything is crucial. take someone else.
This professor was my favorite so far in college. His lectures were clear and he is very real and down-to-earth. I wouldn't recommend anyone else...great teacher!
This professor has no idea how to conduct his classroom. He shows students written papers in class on a projector and "makes fun" of them. I learned nothing from this class.
This professor was awesome! If you have to take this class it is completely worth it. It is an easy A and way easier that the other teachers from what I have heard.

I like this professor a lot, but her quality in giving lectures is very poor. it would help if she takes the time to call on her students for advice on giving her their opinions on how to improve her skills as an educator.
The thing about her that i hate is that she rambles so much and you can easily get lost

Proffesor Ligget is a sweet woman. Vey freindly and down to earth. This was a film class.(City In Film)There were no tests, only four papers to write and a running journal on the films we watched. Papers were 3-4 pages. Class was a breeze. The only bad thing I could say is that during lectures she tends to drift making it hard to follow. Take her!
Dr. Limbach was an  amazing professor, I really recommend him at fist I though it was going to be so hard, but it was not just requires essays not test, but he's totally worth it!!I promise

I took Eric Limbach at Case Western, and he was the best. Very laid back, let the class decide where we wanted discussions to go, which kept us engaged. Helpful when we needed help on research papers. Overall, great teacher. Would recommend him to anyone.

Dr. Limbach was an excellent history professor. His class focused on the themes and overall effects of historical events as opposed to a traditional names and dates type of history class. I would highly recommend his classes.
Younger teacher so he understands that not everyone can afford a $300 book.
Difficult to understand and extremely disorganized. Tests were not identified in the syllabus so we had no idea what to expect. I do not recommend taking a course from Lin.

Terrible in class, homework has no clear grading or help, he does not create his own tests but just takes them from the book or other professors. Weighted grading scale with more on the test than programming in a programming class seems to be a pointless metric.

A lot of students complain about this professor but for CIS265, I thought he was pretty easy.  Exams doesn't surprise, he teaches what will be on the exams.  His projects are easy.  Yes, he mumbles when he lectures.  If you follow the text book, understand the language, you will pass this class with an A.
He told us on the first day of class that he doesn't know how to do internet programming. Enough said right there...

took his class online. google should be your best friend. you can literally find all the questions for the exams and hw online. did not get textbook, i passed it w an A and i learned absolutely nothing. do not expect him to return your emails. very hard to reach. if you take his class online you should be able to pass w an A with almost no work.

Lectures are terrible and boring.  Very hard to understand.  So very unclear on what is expected of you it makes the class unbearable.  There is a semester long group project that isn't bad but he is no help so you are on your own.

Dr. Lin is a walking amalgamation of all the very worst traits and tendencies an instructor can have. He's unclear and unhelpful. A terrible communicator. Uninspiring. Unmotivated.  The two worst themes recurring throughout his course were: extremely disjointed assignments and lectures, and very poorly worded correspondence of every type. Avoid.

Horrible.  Mumbles off of powerpoints for every class, impossible to learn from.  At time he jumps off into tangents that are hardly related, design principles, programming concepts, project management, finance??  And everything on the tests are in much greater detail than lecture. Dont get me started on the group assignment, thats another story

Unintelligible. Accent is too thick, he mumbles and trails off each sentence, and always repeats the last word. Answers students' questions vaguely at best. Stubborn when shown wrong. Syllabus was not followed. But, lenient on due dates and grading, and test questions (& answers) come straight from web practice tests, and he allowed a cheat sheet.

Absolutely worthless. He doesn't know how to teach. you need to learn it through google. I have no idea why my school hire him. never show u any program code example. most student doesn't know how to do the HW.

Absolutely worthless. Mumbles everything he says. Cares so little about what's going on that half of us have cell phone videos of him sleeping through presentations. On the plus side, I got a B while showing up to only about 40% of the classes.
Only seemed to have passing familiarity with the textbook, yet insisted on teaching directly from it.

Very difficult to understand.  I can see how he is a better teacher with upper level courses, as you already have to have a basic understanding to take harder courses.  However, in an intro programming course, it should be easier to understand the material.  Overall, skip him if you are looking to take CIS 260.

he's horrible, u cant understand a word he's saying, i believe half of the words he says are in chinese or maybe he's just mubbling, i'm not really sure. He doesn't care about ur questions and even when he tries to answer them they make no sense, my advice STAY AWAY FROM THIS PROFESOR if u are actually intending on learning something

a nice guy and a good teacher
i dont have words to describe this guy.He's one one of the worst . have no clue what he is doing .so dont waste your money  . if you want your concepts to get blurred take his course

This course required a lot of time but the homework made the exams easy. She replies very quickly to emails. The exams have built in extra credit. She drops the lowest quiz scores and the final can replace a lower exam score. As long as you do the work, you should receive a good grade.

This course required a lot of time but the homework made the exams easy. She replies very quickly to emails. The exams have built in extra credit. She drops the lowest quiz scores and the final can replace a lower exam score. As long as you do the work, you should receive a good grade.

She is incredibly condescending and does not have student care in mind. She assigns work with little to no explanation, and simply 'expects' you to understanding. If you reach out for help, she will tell you to 'do better' without any true courses of action. It is an incredibly heavy course load, with 4-6 quizzes due at once as well as 6 part labs

I had Dr. Quinn as my stats professor this semester and due to COVID it was fully online. A lot was expected of you. She assigns weekly quizzes, labs, and assignments. However, she is very caring and understanding of extensions of deadlines. I truly did learn from her class and would take again 100%--just be prepared to work a lil more than usual.
Learned alot. Class is very useful.

Linda Quinn is a very caring professor. Some of her lectures are at home, but if you go to her office during office hours, or actually show up to class to get help or actually participate in class she isn't that bad. The material is hell, but she makes it clear and cut of what to expect of midterms, and finals and any inclass project or test.

She has no idea what is going on half of the class. All of the work is at home lectures and she barely assists you in class when you ask for help. She can be very condescending and doesn't offer clarity. Her quizzes are very difficult as well.

Professor Link is by far one of my favorite professors at CSU. Super understanding if you cant make a field trip and very kind towards grading and doesn't put a huge workload on you. I recommend this class if you're a non-science related major and need a science requirement fulfilled! + He's really funny and knows what he's talking about.

The reason I say attendance is not mandatory is because for my class we had set web meetings but they were recorded if we couldn't make it. I've had Lip for 2 classes, and I adore him. Amazing professor, you will learn A LOT. He genuinely has a passion for ethics and cares about his students success. He's tough but always willing to help!

The reason I say attendance is not mandatory is because for my class we had set web meetings but they were recorded if we couldn't make it. I've had Lip for 2 classes, and I adore him. Amazing professor, you will learn A LOT. He genuinely has a passion for ethics and cares about his students success. He's tough but always willing to help!

It's an online course. You're graded on 3 exams, quizzes, and a research paper on a bioethics topic. Textbook is required since exams/quizzes are essays that require you to cite the text. He's very good about responding to emails, usually within 48 hours or less. Gives good and specific feedback. Not tricky, wants you to do well, very nice person.
He is incredibly helpful if you ask him to be. Class material can be tough, but hes more than willing to meet during office hours to discuss.

Def get the book, used to cite on everything. Whole semester to write final paper w/ assignments for it throughout. Has DB posts, exams, and quizzes on top of paper. lots of writing but not hard. grades pass/fail so if you follow all reqs. for assignments you'll be fine. doesn't tell, but offers xtra credit if u submit optional paper assignments!

Professor Lipinski is one of the most underrated professors! He is super nice, helpful, knowledgeable, and passionate about subject! Class set up: Quizzes, DBs, and a final paper worth many points. Stay on top of assignments between class & final paper (two different assignments). Book is essential and is used to cite throughout entire class.

Dr. Litam provided detailed critical feedback for our writing assignments, something many of my peers somehow didn't want to happen in grad school. Dr. Litam's tests take more than 20 minutes, which people also groaned about. Again, it's graduate school. She lectures with passion and positivity and is a great change of pace in the CMHC program.

Dr. Litam provided detailed critical feedback for our writing assignments, something many of my peers somehow didn't want to happen in grad school. Dr. Litam's tests take more than 20 minutes, which people also groaned about. Again, it's graduate school. She lectures with passion and positivity and is a great change of pace in the CMHC program.

Dr. Litam was one of the best professors Ive had during grad school. At the beginning of the semester she warned us that students either love or hate her and told us the work load was tough. She cares about her students and goes above and beyond.

Stacey is not very clear about what she expects with papers & only has minimal points available to earn. She also encourages participation but makes students feel bad when they do share or she will cut them off and not really listen to their point. She also picks favorites :( She called several students out & embarrassed them in front of the class!

Professor is knowledgeable in the topic, and truly cares about students understanding the material. However, when it comes to graded material she seems to want to make it impossible on students. Grading student on a level of difficulty that makes them feel inadequate.

She is 100% supportive of her students and will do anything to help her students. She grades tough, but the feedback is really beneficial. Her class discussions were the most valuable part of the class and covered topics that were definitely on the NCE. She does her best to make each class interesting and memerable.

She gave us 2 days to learn how to use a software program for analyzing data and then made us do a project on it due the next week. My project was almost 50 pages of content. Very unapproachable and even rude to some students when they were not understanding how to use the software.

Literally the worst professor I've ever had. She does not have time for questions, so if our have any concerns or believe that something is wrong, YOU are wrong, not her. She's not approachable at all. Make sure you have all calculations correct down to the decimal because you'll be deducted. Had for PED 325 and HED 475
horrible

She is by far the hardest professor in the department, she is stickler for guidelines and she is not very approachable of you have questions or need extra. Would not advise taking this class unless you have atleast 4+ hours to spend everyday devoted to this class.

Amonte is a really good professor . His only down side is that he's really busy out side of work  so he was behind on grading papers. So if you have him ALWAYS turn in a hard copy ! Don't email!  Other than that he is a great teacher , I learned a lot from him . He is always willing to help and is hilarious . Don't buy the book for his class.
An amazing professor and really chill.

Wonderful teacher, you are rally missing out on all of the fun if you skip class. Funny, smart, and straight forward guy. He plays video games and is generally open minded and outgoing. Likes to spark discussions on random ideas. Only like 3 or 4 major papers for the entire semester. You won't regret taking him.

He is an amazing teacher! The way he explains things is fantastic! Wished I could of taken him for Eng 1020. He is very dedicated and leaves a strong first impression!:) Amonte is an awesome professor! Definitely take his class!! You wont regret it.

Harsh grader, if your paper sucks he will tell you about it. Will help you with your paper as many times as possible. He is insanely funny and down to earth. He rarely uses the textbook and all you have to do is essays and that is it.
HARSH grading papers. Other than that he is nice, and EXTREMELYYYYYY helpful. Awesome teacher :) A+

Amonte is the man. He is a pretty harsh grader but will read over your paper as many times as you want before it is due. He is extremely laid back and with the time he gives you in class to work, there isn't much work that you need to do outside class. No tests and no homework other than essays.

He is a crazy teacher that is honest and if your paper sucks he will tell you but help you fix in in one on one sessions. If you talk and ask sensible questions he will answer them and help you.a very hard grader but it makes you a better writer and any paper after that will be easy. take his class it will be worth it in the end
He was sooooooooooo easy, the only thing is he's really harsh on papers as well as to you. He can be really mean and sometimes unprofessional but other then that his class was so easy

Amonte is VERY harsh on grading. No one ever gets a 100% for the class. He openly claims that if you give him an opening, he will sharp shoot your papers and rip them apart. However, he encourages 1 on 1's with him, you can email him as many times as you like to get suggestions on your papers, etc. SO, if you end up failing, it really your fault.

THIS IS THE WORST ONLINE CLASS AT CLEVELAND STATE. She has an extremely thick Asian accent and expects you to listen(decipher)her recorded lectures each week. EVEN WORSE,her assignment guidelines are extremely vague and hard to comprehend. She leaves out critical project info and changes grading rubrics after assignments are submitted.

One of my favorite classes I have taken at CSU. Professor gives meaning projects and work like I truly learned a ton about Public Relations taking this course. Emails back super fast and very accommodating to students.

This was the worst class I have ever taken (undergrad and grad) and I attribute that to the professor. She does not grade things in a timely manner nor does she offer feedback. She also doesn't reply to emails. The workload for the course is heavy. I would avoid having this professor if you can help it.

What everyone else said is very true! She is the slowest grader I have ever experienced (5 of my assignments have yet to even be graded), gives very little feedback, never emails back, and schedules online lectures during the middle of a work day. The class itself is not difficult, but time consuming. I would avoid her at all costs.

Honestly the most frustrating teacher I have ever had to deal with. Provides no feedback, has online virtual meetings at times people have work, when you email her, don't expect a response back. Everything people have already mentioned is absolutely true

Never responded to emails even though it was an online course. Did not give ANY feedback on required research proposal (main assignment of the semester) until one week before it was due. She never participated in any of the online discussions or blogging. May as well have had a robot teaching this class. TERRIBLE PROFESSOR! AVOID!!

She has no communication skill at all! There were multiple times that I emailed her with questions and issues with a quiz where one of the answers were obviously correct, but she had chose the wrong answer to be correct and I never received a response. It is not a hard class to pass, but I did not appreciate the lack of teaching she did.

Worst graduate level instructor I have ever had. This is my second graduate degree; never before have had such terrible communication from a teacher. While I think she is smart and likely kind, but she does not clarify expectations and often does not respond to questions at all. Avoid at all costs.

Dr. Liu means well, but is so involved with the University that it's hard for her to keep up with all of her assignments.  She can be very hard to understand due to a langue barrier of English as a second language. Be very careful when reading quiz questions and take your time.  Her response time is the worst, & sometimes won't respond.

The course was a lot of work but nothing that was impossible. The professor disappeared multiple times, not posting on Blackboard, not responding to emails, not grading assignments, & not answering phones calls. Even though the class was easy, this professor made it extremely difficult because of her distance from her class.

The course itself isn't bad/difficult. The instructor makes it frustrating. She fails to post grades on time, she is very slow to respond to email if at all, and some instructions for assignments are not clear. However, When she does give feedback-it is helpful, but often too late.  Her communication style is not the most effective.

As others have said, this class requires a ton of work, but it's not too difficult if you keep up with the readings and videos.  Professor seems nice and helpful, always responded to me when I had questions.
Requires a lot of work, although not difficult.
This class requires a lot of work, but it is not difficult, she does take awhile to grade, although I did receive all my graded assignments.
She stopped responding back to emails with in the first 2 months of the class.  She was not very helpfull and did not return grades back at all!!
She stopped grading assignments, giving feedback, or responding to emails by Thanksgiving.  The only thing I learned in this class was how to find the answers in the textbook.

There is alot of work in the class. However, if you do the work, follow the syllabus, and attend class you should get a good grade. She gives plenty of opportunity do revise your work and get extra credit.

Be prepared for rehearsal or class (and DO NOT MISS, especially if it's rehearsal) and you will not have a hard time. He asks a lot of you, but only because he wants you to do your best. He can be a little unprofessional, but overall he has good intentions.
VICTOR IS THE MAN!

Dr. Liva offers students the opportunity to gain performance skills. In order to reach a certain level of professionalism, he holds his students accountable for preparedness and responsibility. Students who continuously arrive late to rehearsals or are obviously unprepared are subjected to his wrath, but this is good for the ensemble as a whole.

Dr. Liva has always had a bad rep for being condescending and sometimes rude, both of which can be true.  However, his intention is never to belittle.  It is actually to teach.  He is very knowledgeable on the music he chooses to perform and I thoroughly enjoy working with him.  Just be prepared and do your best.  That's all he asks.

Dr. Liva was a good teacher who was very interested in the subject. Tests were based off textbook terms and music clips. Make flashcards and test yourself on the clips, (CD comes with TXTBK) and you should have an A.

I worked with Victor for 8 summers while working at 2 different summer music programs. I can vouch for all negative comments about this man. I have been hit by his baton multiple times when he got frustrated and threw it into the string section during rehearsal. I simply don't understand how he keeps getting jobs. His talents are not THAT great.

I'm extremely conflicted about Dr. Liva; he's clearly an excellent musician but not only is he difficult to follow in his conducting, he's also downright disrespectful. There's a difference between treating us like professionals, and like children that tracked mud on the clean floor. He has absolutely NO idea how to communicate to wind players.
he is very mean and talks down on his student

The man is rude and childish.  He plays favoritism and cannot separate personal feelings from professional ones, thus holding grudges against students and treating them with blatant disrespect.  All this takes away from any ability he has as a music director.

I took an instant liking to Dr. Liva because he treats us like professionals. Part of that means expecting us to be prepared. Anybody who gave him bad ratings most likely did not come to rehearsal prepared. College is supposed to prepare you for the real world, so get used to it. Dr. Liva is the reason I want to stay at CSU.
Expects you to know everything prior to taking his course. Clearly, you wouldn't be taking the course if you already knew the material. Does not teach. Rude and very unhelpful.
Nice if you're prepared.

Extremly rude and condescending towards students, especially if you are not 1st chair. Unhelpful. Get ready to be talked about, pointed out, and embarassed in front of the entire class. Not fun at all.
I have never encountered such a poor representation of what music educators are striving to be. Instructor is extremely biased and unaccepting of students.

He's an Italian Stallion who loves guacamole. Acutally, he's a good director and a fun guy to be around. He has done wonders with our orchestra.
Very nice!! But boring. You need at least 3 cups of coffee before entering her class. Grades fair but will mark you absent for leaving class early or coming late, which effects your grade.

Amanda was so great. Best English teacher I have ever had! She is very relatable with a great personality. Very understanding and caring when things arent going your way. 10/10 recommend :)

Take her class!!!!

Three real essays and a lot of lecture style classes. Attendence is counted in your grade so come to class. Helpful feedback, good grader, and slightly boring reading and lectures. hoewver there are quizes on the readings
To anyone who has to take English 102.. take her class! she is so nice and explains everything wonderfully!  She is not a nit picky grader. You also get to pick the subject of the papers you write

Go to class, write down his notes from the board and add notes to help you understand the material, then study. He gives example questions straight from the test. You dont realy need the book but it would help if you need a better explanation of something that you dont understand in his lecture.

I have taken almost all physics major classes like QM I&II, EM, Seminar, General Relativity, and there was never a dull moment. He is like a god in human form when it comes to teaching.

Pretty much the most knowledgeable professor in the entire university. Don't expect any of his classes to be easy. I strongly suggest that you don't exceed 16 credits if you have him during a semester.
Great professor if you have the guts.

Lockhart makes useful analogies and draws on fun and familiar examples. Exams are a bit tougher than the lecture material, so use the text and practice the problems (esp. Hardy-Wineberg). His door is always open and he really seems to want you to succeed. He will offer opportunities and helpful recommendations/references if you earn them and ask.
He is Ok

Owen is a great teacher.  I personally don't like bio but he made it worth going.  Lectures are interesting (calls everything critters lol) tests are hard (for me at least) but they come from the slides and lectures.  If you attend class and put in a little time you?ll be fine.  I got an A which was what I hoped for in satisfying my non-business re

Professor Lombardo is a great professor, she definitely wants her students to succeed in the class. All assignments are out of 100 points, and for discussions you will get 100% as long as you completed the assignment and the number of replies needed before the due date. Responds to emails within 24 hours.

Professor Lombardo is a great professor, she definitely wants her students to succeed in the class. All assignments are out of 100 points, and for discussions you will get 100% as long as you completed the assignment and the number of replies needed before the due date. Responds to emails within 24 hours.

Professor Lombardo is a great teacher, she definitely wants all of her students to do well in her class and she is extremely one time when it comes to replying to emails, she will get back either the same day or within 24 hours. All assignments are out of 100 points, making it very easy to calculate your grade. I would definitely take her again.

She's a really nice professor. As long as you submit your discussions, assignments on time, she ll give you the full credit. Everything is out of 100 points which makes it very easy, you can avoid submitting the final paper and you can still end up with an A. I found her really easy compared to other professors teaching the same class.

Never took an online class that I wanted to personally go to a teachers office hours to call them on how beyond rude they are I would swear if i could She believes she is beyond above everyone else because of what a piece of paper says about her education. Many students hate her

Dr. Long has high expectations for her students. Be engaged by participating during discussions in the class (NO CELL PHONES). Projects give you a sense of what illustrators think when they begin the process of illustrating childrens literature. Expected to bring in childrens books weekly. Strict on writing, so proofread papers. Great class!

Dr. Long used to be a editor, so she will make many critiques on your paper because that is just her nature. She does have a little bit of an attitude, so beware. She isn't quick to respond to emails. However, her class if very beneficial if you take it in class. The assignments you do are creative and unique, which I plan to use when I'm a teacher

Dr. Long has high expectations for her students. Be engaged by participating during discussions in the class (NO CELL PHONES). Projects give you a sense of what illustrators think when they begin the process of illustrating childrens literature. Expected to bring in childrens books weekly. Strict on writing, so proofread papers. Great class!

Dr. Long is super strict when it comes to grading your paper. She scrutinizes down to every word and punctuation which eventually gets a bit annoying/obsessive. Although I still passed her class with a high grade, her comments on some of my papers made it sound like I was stupid. Don't take her if you take things easily offensively!

Time consuming assignments, but pretty easy and fun. Immediate feedback to homework/emails. Awesome with extending deadlines if need be. The book choices are wide-ranged so it's hard not to find at least one book enjoyable. Would take again! Covers lots of topics in literature. I recommend!

Ended up having the class switch from on campus to online halfway through, so that seemed to make the class really confusing. The projects are easy and some are time consuming. This class is a great way to learn about children's literature. Dr. Long is seriously awesome, sad I only had her for 2 months

Dr. Long's class was amazing in the fact that I gained so many tools for my teaching toolbox from her. I am a science teacher and STILL use projects and summative assessments that I learned from Dr. Long. Her Boxed Voices project is a great learning tool and I recommend that you put forth 100% of your effort--you will gain so much from this project
Most of the class is in groups. Very interactive class. Have to bring a book of some kind to every class.
Dr. Long is the best English Language Art professor that I have ever had! I wish I could take more classes with her. She always keeps her students engaged and interested!

Dr. Long is a PHENOMENAL professor. NO KIDDING. (as she would say!) So engaging, passionate, funny and wicked smart! She encourages her students to think outside the box. Very approachable. I wish I had been able to take more classes with her. Would highly recommend!  Tip: She is a strict grader, so be sure to proofread and check your grammar!

I was only allowed to select 3 tags, so I will include the rest here. Participation definitely matters, but the class time is so engaging and worth it! She is so fun to be around and the reading assignments are interesting and the writing assignments and projects are fun. Dr Long genuinely cares about each one of her students and it shows!

Dr. Long was my favorite teacher I have ever had. The way she talks makes me genuinely interested in the information. Due to some health problems we did not get to meet as regularly, therefor we had very few assignments, but I learned more in this class than any of my other classes that semester.

Probably the nicest professor I have ever had. She was fun and had very engaging activities related to the books that you read. It's a lot of work, but there fun assignments, and you get the chance to read great books.

Fun class!! She is very passionate about her students and work, and wants everyone to succeed.  Dr. Long is more than willing to help.  As others suggested, watch your punctuation and grammar.  Reread, rewrite, and revise!

Dr. Long was a wonderful teacher! I really enjoyed going to her class because it was always fun and entertaining. Her classes were never boring! We did a bunch of different activities that were engaging and interactive for the whole class. Dr. Long really shows compassion for what she does, and for her students. Strict with punctuation- i miss her!

One of the best classes I have taken! At first I was skeptical about the class becuz of a low grade I got on my paper. Word of advise check ur grammar b4 u turn in any paper! Beside that you can tell she is always available for help and you can tell she cares for her students. She makes u think outside the box and brings out ur creativity!

Dr. Long will tell you right off the bat not to take her course with a grade in mind.  She is very driven to help her students think outside of the box in regards to adolescent literature.  She is more than willing to help outside of class and takes a genuine interest in the well being of all her students.  The class is a lot of work, but worth it.

Dr. Long is one of those professors who truly cares about her students.  I had her for a night class, which are usually awful, but she somehow made the time fly by, and therein making me wish we had more time to spend discussing the books we read.  She really makes you think.  :)  Hands down, one of the best professors out there. Highly recommend!
