Very little points for each assignment so everything is crucial. Requires a paper which may be difficult for some.
I love Professor Long as a person, but I truly did struggle with this course. Her tests are very hard, but lectures are interesting! Very well respected throughout the college of Urban Affairs!

Great professor! Nice and clear expectations. Quizzes at the start of class, book required but not necessary in my opinion. Lowest test grade removed from grade. Professor sometimes gets confused and says wrong thing but corrects herself. Would take another course with this professor!

Dr. Long is experienced and knowledgeable. I enjoyed her class and learned a lot from it, both nuts-and-bolts of the subject matter and big-picture wisdom. I'm happy to be taking another class with her next semester!

Quiz questions are difficult sometimes, but they often come word for word from powerpoints. Just keep the powerpoints open during the quizzes, ctl+F certain words from the quiz question in the powerpoint, and find exact answers. Quiz questions found later on exams, so make sure you know the correct answers. Never met her, but responds to email
Pretty easy class, I took it online and personally didn't study as much. The topics are really easy to explain as well. Test are slightly difficult but she gave extra credit just for taking them.
Quizzes and midterms can be a bit difficult but overall it is an easy A if you do the work.

She was an average professor... she did respond to my questions fairly promptly. She has five quizzes, 10 discussion boards, a 10 page paper, and a midterm and final. I personally do not feel that she was a difficult grader in the least and if you remember the quiz questions they are exactly the same for midterm and final. No real complaints.

I took UST302 in person, so maybe that made a difference. Pretty clear with expectations and makes class interesting from her own experiences in the planning world. Quizzes and tests aren't bad as long as you study and take good notes. She has a great personality and keeps class fun and interesting.

So much badness packed in one class. She clearly copy and pastes her syllabus each semester, with no changes to it. The "contemporary urban issue research paper" was a joke. 12-15 pages of absolutely nothing. Not easily accessible. Does not respond to emails quickly and not good w/ technology (even though it is an ONLINE course). Frustrating class.
Easy A if you do the work. Fast grader, quick response to emails. Very organized, straightforward syllabus. No makeups, but you shouldn't need them. Would definitely take again.

He's very condescending. Relies on SafeAssist to grade papers, which I seriously doubt he actually takes the time to read. His lectures are pretty boring, but that's where you find out about the extra credit. Case study papers are due each week, and then a 10-page position paper is due at the end of the term.
Easy A if you do the work. Fast grader, quick response to emails. Very organized, straightforward syllabus. No makeups, but you shouldn't need them. Would definitely take again.
You will learn a lot and broaden your mind more. Make sure you go to class. Weekly case studies. loved Dr long class.
I hioghly recommend any student to take BUS 351 with this professor. He did an excellent job in teaching this course.

I very much enjoyed this class and I wish more Professors were like Dr. Long. He's extremely down to earth and provided a wonderful teaching environment. He teaches very well while also being able to make some jokes and have a good time with the class. I would HIGHLY recommend taking a class of his.

I had this online class for the Fall & it wasn't bad. There will be alot of heavy writing and discussion posts but as long as he sees your trying he will give you credit. Easy A if you complete the assignments. WRITE & READ!

Class entails: pop quizzes (open book), attendance points on days when people decide to skip, life discussions that have more weight than the mandatory coursework, and a 12 page paper at the end of the semester. Even though the paper was grueling, this was still the best instructor I've had at Cleveland State. At least you can tell he cares.

One can only hope and pray to get Dr. Long for class. Dude is a five star, slam dunk, top notch, grand slam professor. He's nice, and grades fairly. He makes class fairly easy on his students as well. This dude is definitely a professor that everyone should, at some point, hope to have for class

This is the second class I took with Dr. Long and he is a nice professor. Sometimes it seems like he'd give a grade solely based off of a computer grammar system. For an online class it was a moderate amount of work, giving 2-3 assignments a week on top of a 12 pg paper. He fought me on my grade at the end but did give the grade I actually earned.

Very very good professor. Cant stress enough though that you need to put effort in his classes or you will be a dead duck. Grades fairly and participates  in his discussion boards which for the most part are actually easy to talk & debate about. Extremely tough grader on his papers and case analysis'. Give yourself plenty of time to perfect them.

Great class with Dr. Long. he presented the information and gave numerous instances of practical applications. I have taken classes where instructors only knew the book stuff, but Dr. Long has a lot of experience in business and brings that to the classroom. I'd definitely take his class again.
Good teacher. Looking to take another class with him. One of he best business professors that CSU has.
This professors is awesome. I would take his class again if I could. I wish we had more full time professors like him.
Even if you do your best in the class, he is not going to give you an A!!! he is not hard, just unfair

Very unapproachable Does not provide clear guidelines for tests / assignments There were only 6 assignments total for my class Uses old content without updating anything Drill sargeantesque bravado Tests consist of a large amount of irrelevant and unnecessary content Did not upload one grade all semester Never received grades on final project

Only 300 points available throughout the entire course and 200 of them are from exams. Doesnt talk about the topics diagramed on the syllabus. Disrespectful to students. Wont even let you talk to him after class.
Loovis literally wrote the book on adaptive physical activity, however hes not a very good prof. NOT a friendly guy, doesnt care about students...

Probably the most difficult person I'v had to deal with over my college career. Gives out a good syllabus, but lacking on clarity and feedback. Didn't return assignments for feedback and correction. Subjective on grading, didn't follow rubric when grading paper. Unclear, likes to hold class an hour after dismissal. Miss a lab, miss a letter grade.

To be an online class this man did not made it any easier specially for those that hold a day job. Gave midterm on a Friday Night 9-10pm no exceptions.  Assings group projects which required to meet in person to get a good grade.  Assigned long papers and grades as an enlgish teacher. Disrespecfully as well when answering emails(uses !!!!)

Docked me points on an assignment because I failed to use HIS studies in it as my research citations (never specified on rubric). IGNORES emails inquiring about the final exam date. This is online yet he gave us a midterm on a Friday night 9:00 PM - 10:30 PM? Not worth the ridiculous amount of work that is SUBJECTIVELY GRADED.

Do not let the reviews make you wary of taking class with Dr. Loovis. Rubrics are lacking, true story, but assignments are returned in a timely manner. Use remarks to make your next assignment better. Dr. Loovis provided much guidance when asked for it. Show interest and ask for help; you will get both in return.

Dr. Loovis is a tough instructor to those who don't take the material seriously.  He is a very educated teacher who cares about the subject matter.  He has written many books on the topic of disabilities and sport.  He is a great resource for CSU.  I enjoyed his class.
He was a very tough instructor who seemed like he was out to make your life miserable and fail as many students as possible. Not a good experience.
He is serious but as long as you put in the work he is decent

Loovis was never prepared for class. Each class started 15-20 minutes late. He was not familiar with the exam. He could not answer questions or provide specific guidelines for assignments. The class was a waste of time.

Embarrassingly unorganized. He seems more intent on telling tales about how "tough" he is than in actually teaching (he LOVES to talk about all of the students he?s failed). The syllabus is worthless. There are no rubrics. He could not answer questions about exams or grading. If only he held himself to the same standards he holds his students to.

This guy is arrogant!  His tests are on the text book...that he doesn't cover, he thinks he is the grammatical God, and he tries to intimidate students. Almost 50% drop, if not fail his courses.  BE CAREFUL!
He was mean and arrogant.  Treats this class as an english class.  Wants to fail people, that is his desire.
He was very interesting.I had him for leadership as a grad student. I really like his class and I thought he was a decent human being.
No Comments

Had him for human develpment, WOW what a very knowledgeable Professor. The guy really knows what he is talking about. Very resourceful and intelligent. Has high expectations for students and is very consistant. Really enjoyed him, a real asset to CSU PE Department.
You get your money's worth from this dude!!

I took the Calc 1 summer course with this professor, and the hardest part was that it was in only 6 weeks and taught remotely. While the material is challenging, he had pre-recorded video lectures and note templates, and a very clear schedule and syllabus. He did not do retakes, but he provided multiple helpful extra credit opportunities instead.

I took the Calc 1 summer course with this professor, and the hardest part was that it was in only 6 weeks and taught remotely. While the material is challenging, he had pre-recorded video lectures and note templates, and a very clear schedule and syllabus. He did not do retakes, but he provided multiple helpful extra credit opportunities instead.
Amazing professor. Cares about students and will adjust exam scores if you have a valid reason. Would take again.

Calculus was difficult for me, however Professor Lopez allows for a lot of make up points if you do poorly on a test. Extremely nice guy as well and will answer your emails very fast. If you need calculus make sure you enroll with Prof. Lopez.

This was his first year teaching at CSU so I thought he was going to be bad but he was great. He does his lectures with a tablet that he draws on and then uploads those same notes online so you can get them if you chose to not take notes. He gives a quiz every week there is not an exam. I am taking him again this fall for Discrete Math.

Dr. Loss is a spectacular professor. I have had her for many of my classes, and she approaches every subject holistically and from a strong foundation. Nothing is left up to speculation, and she lets her students dig deep into the material. She has extremely precise, high expectations, and I felt like a mini-expert in the field at the end.

Dr. Loss enjoys challenging students with very complicated ideas in linguistics, morphology, syntax and advanced grammar.  She is hyper smart, but can be forgetful, moody, or occasionally snipe-y.  However, the vast majority of her course content is fun and engaging, and most days she is upbeat and incredibly helpful.  I really enjoyed her class.

I just started taking her class the beginning of this semester.  She is very old fashioned in her methods, however is a wonderful lady and has a sincere desire to see all of her students succeed!  I highly recommend.  She gives hand outs and repeats things for clarity.

She is a very nice woman, don't get me wrong. But it was very hard to stay awake in this class though. Don't bother buying the textbook for this course - just check it out from the library during the term paper. Going to class does help your grade, so I recommend going. She's a sweet and kind lady, so don't hate her for her teaching habits.

Wonderful Professor. She knows her stuff! Come to class take notes study. Her class notes and leaflets are directly related to the exams. She grades fairly and is merciful. She likes participation. She explains and makes things plain and asks do you understand. Very genuine with lots of love for psychology and students. Magnificent instructor.

Very thick accent so try and sit close. All material came straight from the handouts and she does not use bb so it would be wise to go to class. 2 exams and 1 paper and that's it for your grade. Sweet lady but I wouldn't take her again.

very oldfashioned. if u cant learn by simply listening to her explain then dont take her. The paper we had to write was very easy somehow got 110% when there wasnt any extra credit. If you want an A with moderate amounts of effort take her but if you want to be engaged in an interesting class than dont take her

If you have an interest in PSY, this is your professor. She is old-fashioned, yes, but an AMAZING professor indeed. Study her leaflets, come to class, and write down what's on the board. If you do these few things, you can't go wrong. Loved her.
Had her for Abnormal Psychology, she is very easy but you have to go to class or it will hurt your grade.

If you actually wanna learn something and enjoy this class, take someone else.  f you just need the credit and don't mind sitting through her mindless lectures, take her. Runs her class like high school, extremely old fashioned.  Also, not that its relevant, she wears the same thing every class.Literally.  Seems like a nice enough person though.

Very easy class, as long as you come to class, write down what she has on the board and memorize the "leaftlets" she passes out in class. Never eat in her class, she will get angry and tell you it's "absolutely unacceptable". Hates disruptions and is old fashion.

I got an A and im a slacker. Everybody in my class got an A on the paper we did. I dont think she grades them that tough because I wrote my 5 page in one hour. But make sure it answers the question you choose. Come to class it will hurt your grade if not, she knows everyone. Hands out handout for test...very helpful!!!
BORING lectures. Had her two hours every t/th. Tests are SUPER easy due to her handouts. Never used the book. Should attend class for her handouts. Pretty easy. Really nice. Enjoyed the class!

She is good with making sure you know what is one the test. She gives loads of notes in class (usually 8 pages/day) and handouts for every chapter. For the term paper, go to The Writing Center, they helped me get a 100%. She has an old-fashioned idea of what class should be like, but you learn lots if you listen.

Awesome teacher and really knows her stuff.  She gives good examples and addresses questions in and out of class.  She is also notorious for picking out an attractive boy and asking him to read every class from the notes she writes.  Highly recommended.

i dropped her class today after just the first session. I was so excited to take the class. The first hr. wasnt bad, then she started lecturing. She reads 1 sentence at a time, then pauses for a long time to make sure everyone wrote it down. it was like that the whole time. it seems super easy but we're in college + can handle a real lecture.
easy
No Comments

DO NOT BUY THE TEXT BOOK, her tests are EXACTLY from her notes, EASY, all multiple choice.  She repeats concepts that are going to be on the test and will even say, "Pay attention to this point, it will be on the test".  You have to be STUPID not to get an A.  You might have trouble understanding her accent. `Does not like class distractions/noise.

just a waste of time type of class, literally teaching yourself, test answers are you know where, and while it is an easy A, it just feels like a busy work type of class. If you need it, take her, if not, find something more worth your $ and time.
Very nice lady. I sent her drafts of my assignments via email and she would tell me how to improve on them. I actually did gain confidence when speaking.

I had 4.0 before this class. She thinks nothing is perfect, so are the grades. It is somewhat true, but still a bit disappointing. She never gives A's, so don't put too much effort in this class. However, she is a nice lady and you will easily pass it. Don't buy the book - it's a waste

Yeah, she's nice. But let's talk about effectiveness, or the lack thereof - clarity is low. You will not get above an A-, no matter how much effort you put in, because she doesn't give As. You will also, most likely, not get below a C. If you are someone who works hard and aims for better grades, skip Carol.

Super nice lady & always willing to give help. She said she's never given anyone a perfect on an assignment in her 14 years of teaching cause "you can always do better". Only complaint: she goes over assignments months before they're due and they lack clarity. Also, you get points for attendance, so go.

She is such a great professor! Her lectures can drag on sometimes, but it's just because she's so passionate about this class. No exams at all, you just have to write a handful of short papers and give a few presentations. She is very lenient (she understands our world doesn't revolve around her class). Just follow her (very detailed) instructions for each paper/speech and you'll get an A!

This class is very helpful, I came out feeling more confident about writing and speaking in the business world. There are no tests but there are a lot of assignments. Her grading is very strict. She will not give away an A very easily, but at the same time does not give out bad grades if you put forward an effort.

Her genuine care for students is very admirable. At the same time though, what would have truly helped me was a little slack in grading, rather than her inspirational speeches. She gave me the only A- I earned in school, causing me not to graduate with a 4.0. The class is heavily based on speaking, which you can "always improve." Bye, bye A.
Loved this class, very informative, and you learn a lot. Mrs. Lucas was very entertaining and enjoyed teaching the material. Definitely my favorite teacher at CSU.

She is great! I don't know a single person who managed to get 100% on an assignment, but the feedback she gives you means much more than the actual grade. She wants each and every student to succeed in life, and after you take her class you will look at the whole process of writing differently. Definitely take her!
Amazing. If all the professors at Cleveland State were only half as good as Carol Lucas is it would be the best college in the world.
awesome professor. very clear and easy. she gives points for attending, i went to half the classes and still got a B. i would take one of her classes again any day
good professor

Lectures are a TOTAL waste of time, but attendance is required. Do not bother buying NOR reading the book - not necessary for her class. A few pages from the book may be useful as examples for assignments - that's it. Assignments are OK, but she is very SUBJECTIVE in her grading - no one knows what she wants, and she does NOT explain it well.
She is extremely nice.  She can be a tough grader, but is always willing to help if you are having trouble with an assignment.
One has to be very attentive with the specifications for each paper to turn in or any other assignment. Details missed could mess up one's grade.

Very nice woman, very helpful. Lectures are pretty boring, but gets better by 2nd half of semester. Very informative, makes the dirty work of report and letter writing easy. Kind when it comes to grade. It would kill her to give someone lower than a B-. I reccomend taking this teacher!
Not exactly the most interesting class i must add, but an easy class as long as you can type up a few one page papers...
After an entire semester, I still have no idea what this lady is talking about. I think shes crazy.
Dr. Lundstrom is worth a wealth of knowledge.  He will guide you in the right direction where you want to go.  Take his courses!!!

Lundstrom likes to make sure his students are aware of the world around them, so try to keep up with current events. He's a really funny guy and laid back and the material itself is interesting. He's also an easy grader if he realizes you've put some thought behind you're work and you're putting forth a decent effort. Highly recommend.
The class is all about case study and group work. No individual work. Final is optional. As long as you have a good working group, you'll be fine.  He loves to talk.

His class is all about case study and group work. The case contains written and oral. There will be a final project about company analysis. He expects the student to be up to date in the "current events". The exam is optional, it won't hurt your grade, but, it does help to raise your grade. I got A- after I took his optional exam.

Do prof's with PHDs just get lazy? Constant writing and presentation assignments. Vague instructions. Half the class is mindless sprung on busy work. Little sympathy for groups who have lazy members. Dry sense of humor. As a guy he's great, as a teacher...I dunno. Class seems okay if taught by someone else. :/

I love this guy. He's full of surprises and genuinely tries to get you to analyze how you see your world. He teaches valuable skills for marketing instead of just book terms. I hope you like current events, because you'll get your share of them! He's not afraid to put you on the spot, but I've always liked professors like that.

This class is all case studies. You get 5 cases that you either have to present or write a paper on. At the end of the semester you have to turn in a marketing case. Final exam is optional. I am convinced that if he likes you then you get better grades.

Don't understand how u get an A, B+, B, B+  then get a B+ for your final grade. If you think you deserve a better grade then argue for it. He will give it to you if you've worked for it. Enjoyed the class, its mainly case studies(written and oral presentations). You are graded more harshly on the oral presentations, in my humble opinion!!

This guy is interesting... I do not understand how a paper/ test can be two grades. Everything you get will be a b/b+... Doesn't make sense. He seems to give out mostly B's and then A's to people who he finds attractive... Don't take his optional tests - no one gets improved grades. Busy work is his fashion, and his point of view is always right...

Highly recommended. He is energetic, good interaction with students.             This was a case course....Grade was 75% group projects, 25% final exam.  But the final was optional and it can't hurt your grade.           Classes were mostly student presentations and talking about current events.   This was fun, and I had a good experience.

Interacts a lot with students, and tries to make the class interesting and fun. He's a tough grader, but gives your chances to re-do your work and turn it back in for a new grade. He provides a lot of constructive comments and makes you learn from your mistakes. I had a 4 hour Saturday morning class, and it flew by.
Begins each class by talking about current events.  Good interaction with students.  This was a case course; grade was based on 75% projects, 25% final exam.

This prof seems to really enjoy teaching and interacting with the students. Requirements for assignments were fair - maybe the exception would be the final group project which seemed a little vague. He pushed to get us to think about how the concepts of the class were related to our lives.

Unfortunately, learned nothing about Marketing, even with 2 books assigned, one being one of his buddy's book. I learned how to build a car and sell it via the simulation- fantastic, just what i've always wanted to learn- Auto Manufacturing.. I learned more on Google. Did have good speakers; he is never satisfied with our work...

I took him for my Buyer Behavior course.  He is very clear with his assignments. His assignments are clear and his class is very interesting. At the beginning of each class, he talks about the Marketing moments of the day/week. If you're a Marketing major, you'll love him
Pompous, arrogant fool. Spends half the class talking about his boats and the other half berating students during their presentations. Rude. I learned nothing from him.

I had to retake Calc I after transferring schools. This time around, I actually understood everything. I went from getting a 24% on exams to in the high 70s-80s. He makes things really easy to understand and cares about his students. I missed an assignment once when fell asleep studying and he told me not to stay up so late and still gave me credit

I had to retake Calc I after transferring schools. This time around, I actually understood everything. I went from getting a 24% on exams to in the high 70s-80s. He makes things really easy to understand and cares about his students. I missed an assignment once when fell asleep studying and he told me not to stay up so late and still gave me credit
Excellent professor! Made me love mathematics.

Great teacher, he goes into pretty great detail with theoretical explanations first then to a more simple explanation with some examples after, I found it to be a very efficient way to teach. If you pay attention, take notes and ask questions if needed, you will get an A.

Not only does Dr. Lupton have great credentials as a mathematician, he is also extremely caring. He can be difficult to understand thanks to his British accent and his precise verbiage. You will get use to it if you start spending time in his office hours. You truly get the whole jist of knowledge from the man.

First half of the semester I did great. Second half (when we hit series) was a struggle. Can be a little vagueconfusing with answers and will take points off if you don't do it the EXACT way he taught you.
Very helpful, easy grader, clear lectures

One complaint I've seen is how he makes transparencies of students answers for exams. It was only ever to show examples of common mistakes to help everyone learn, not to embarrass (names were NEVER included). Graded fairly. Quizzed often (helped my grade when I prepared for them). Very clear and concise when teaching.

Not an easy subject or a professor. But if you are in engineering and you need to learn calc to advance further you will definitely learn it in Dr. Lupton's class. He quizzes a lot so he will always keep you on your toes which will make you learn the subject matter.

Does not teach you what is needed for the homework until after the homework is due. Writes everything he is thinking instead of getting to the point of what is actually being taught. Overall, terrible teacher.

Dr. Lupton never did anything I disliked. His lectures are interesting, and he explains certain gaps that the text may present. He's quite funny and precise in his word choice if you actually pay attention to him. Register with Dr. Lupton if you are willing to gain mathematical intuition and get a few laughs on the way!

terrible teacher. gives horrible examples in class that pertain nothing to tests or quizzes. teaches theory and most of the time doesn't even use numbers in his examples. luckily the class is easy but if math isn't your thing id suggest another teacher.
not very good. exam expectations are not presented clearly. no leniency with grading. somewhat friendly, but seems disingenuous.

A great a very knowledgeable teacher. He definitely knows his math and explains it very clearly. The class is not hard at all and is easy to pull off an A if you put in the effort. I enjoyed the class and would recommend him.  And he's got a British accent ;)
horrible teacher. teaches theory and doesn't go over problems that have any use for the exams or quizzes.

This is a unfair person since he is anyway on his fellowworker's (my teacher's) side no matter how the fellowworker did wrong.  Thanks god for that I have intelligence to ace the class no matter my MTH teacher graded less than I deserved.

MTH 181H: bad soft voice. Always said wrong: e.g. he referred me to a MTH class that has close time with the other and he still said it would only take 2 min to walk to my next class.  Liar! Not 2 min, I never had a time I wasn't late. Now he is a chairman but he shouldn't be because he was very bad at judging the issue we had in class. <unfair>

I didn't mind Lupton. He was always extremely helpful to me. One thing, e speaks very softly and it's hard to understand him at times. Also, TURN YOUR CELL PHONE OFF! He gets extremely agitated when he hears the ring!!

Lupton is british, I often felt he had a vendeta against us for having beaten them back in the day.  He taught ALOT of theory, and very little application, which was not something I was used to. He is not easy, by any means, there are no freebies or easy questions, only stuff you know and stuff you don't know.  Expects alot from freshmen even honor

Lupton is totally bad like others commented.  I myself took Honors Cal. Nobody should deniy his helpfulness; he's always there for you and even solves the homework problems for you if you come to him for help.  The way he teaches is quite different than others, or in other word, different than they way we are used to be taught. Give him a try !

The most snotty, stuck-up and arrogant Brit ever. Class counts for 20% and is useless. Makes transparencies out the student's tests and homeworks and shows them to the class to show all the errors that were made. Brutal when he grades homeworks and tests. On our first test he actually gave someone zero points. What-not even some pity points?

Yes, he lectures every class. And yes, there are only 3 tests he grades on (undergrad) With that said, if you show up, participate and pay attention, you'll be fine. Ask questions. Be engaged and you'll pass no problem. I came to every class and paid attention and got 3 A's on 3 tests and didnt even study.

Yes, he lectures every class. And yes, there are only 3 tests he grades on (undergrad) With that said, if you show up, participate and pay attention, you'll be fine. Ask questions. Be engaged and you'll pass no problem. I came to every class and paid attention and got 3 A's on 3 tests and didnt even study.

This class is like others have said 2.5-3 hours of listening to him talk straight from the book. No assignments only 3 tests. You will have to fight to stay awake most nights in this class. If you have any other option, take it...

Lectured for about 2 hours every class. Sometimes more, sometimes less. 3 tests and 1 paper (grad students). Tests are focused on "content validity" meaning you probably wont pass if you only study definitions. Study in such a way that you understand the law enough to apply it to real life situations. He gives extra credit for perfect attendance.

I would have to agree with my classmate who listed their comment below mine. The professor was nice and knowledgeable, but he stood up there for the whole 2 hours and 50 minutes and read straight out of the book! The class came with Power Points and he chose NOT to present them. He also makes his own exams which are very difficult. No breaks either

I really liked the professor but sometimes the material was confusing. He really lectures for the whole 2 and a half hours of class out of the book which can be drag. No homework however there are three tests. He does upload powerpoints, on blackboard so your better off using those instead of reading out the book like he does.

He reads right out the book, also provides power points and gives extra credit on test. Attendance wasn't required but helped out with random questions on test regarding classroom lectures. Lectures can be very boring and long. Also had a 10 page paper that need topic approval before hand.

The class is fairly straight forward and is a good introduction to matlab. Sometimes Dr. Lustig can be a bit out there, but he explains everything in great detail and is very fair when it comes to grading. He is also very nice but you must follow instructions exactly! in order to be successful. He definitely sets you up for that success.

The class is fairly straight forward and is a good introduction to matlab. Sometimes Dr. Lustig can be a bit out there, but he explains everything in great detail and is very fair when it comes to grading. He is also very nice but you must follow instructions exactly! in order to be successful. He definitely sets you up for that success.

I had to take Matlab remote and because of that I do not think Rolf adjusted well. He is suppose to be smart about computers but barely knows how to use zoom. There are no lectures he just puts you in groups and excepts you guys to figure out how to code on matlab. If you are a chemical engineer or even mechanical good luck.

Incredibly intelligent individual, basically revived the topic of Molecular Simulation. That being said, the class material was very basic. The HW was the best option to learn some of the technical concepts of the course.  There was a midterm and a final both are 100 true/false. It is easy but does not prep you for the next semester material well.

There's nothing that should scare you away from this professor. At least for programming with MATLAB, he explained everything well, and was very clear about what we needed to know. It's not a very exciting lecture, but how do you make programming exciting? Quizzes are all true false and the recitations can be done with others. Would recommend.

Lustig is a fine professor. Might be intimidating at first.  Spends days in class on "recitations" helping students with great T.A's as well. Requires reading the textbook for you to work most efficiently. As long as you can finish a working program you'll get an A. You can work with friends too (not on quizzes or written exams).

Makes learning to program very easy. Step by step, you learn the basics. His TA was also veeeery lenient, so it wasn't him grading. Nonetheless, quizzes and recitations are a breeze, if you do the work at home and even crack the book.
SO boring. did not enjoy this class at all. a funeral is not a good excuse to miss class. talks to you like you're stupid.

This guy is insane. His lectures are a joke as well as his grading. You will take a test and feel really good about it, thinking you got an A only only find you got a striaght F. 100 true and false questions with explanintions for why its true or false for a junior level chemical engineering class... are you kidding? It sucks for you that if your a
it's seem to be very easy pro. but grading wasn't fair, he screw student up, the book is more useful than him, . and the project was really stupid even though  i got 90.
Took the pace of the class way down, and made things easy for us to understand. Answers all questions and is fairly helpful. I'd take more classes from him if this is how he teaches all his courses.

He told us not to use the book when the book was easier to understand then he was.  He also had these computer programs as a part of the class which no one understood.  He was disappointed when the average was an 80% on a test it should of been 72%.  Also he does not grade fair.

I think he did the best he could teaching the class. Its a dull one. He really tried to take our comments on the class seriously. I thought I knew what I was doing until I got to the test. They were completely out there.

Amazing professor. Professional genetic counselor, has a lot of professional and academic experience to tie concepts together. Grading scale is very lenient (84% is an A). This class maintains a pretty good pace, so it's important to keep up on reading and problem sets!

I had Dr. Lynn for Genetics.  She is very enthusiastic and explains her information well. While attendance is not mandatory, it will be taken into consideration with your final grade. READ the material prior to lecture.  It will help a lot!

Take any class with this professor! I learned sooo much from this class. There is a lot to read and keep up with, but put forth your best effort and you'll be fine! I never took a philosophy class before and this threw me for a loop but Prof Lysle was amazing the whole way! If he had a podcast I would subscribe.

Take any class with this professor! I learned sooo much from this class. There is a lot to read and keep up with, but put forth your best effort and you'll be fine! I never took a philosophy class before and this threw me for a loop but Prof Lysle was amazing the whole way! If he had a podcast I would subscribe.

Definitely need the book, you use it the entire semester. He isn't super easy, but as long as you put your best effort you'll be okay. He's very helpful if you ask him questions. Occasional pop-quizzes on readings. If you suck at writing, invest in the Writing Center. He's pretty funny too and has a good sense of humor!

Prof Lysle taught me, a math major how to write, and boy, I fought him the whole time and he won! If you want to learn how to write well, take Prof Lysle. He is also a very kind man. I actually miss his class, even though it was for four hours on Saturday. Thanks for everything, Prof Lysle.
He is the right professor, you should take the class if you want to learn something.

Dr. MacCluskie has a fund of knowledge about anything in this field. She's approachable, fun, and has not lost an once of passion for teaching despite having to shift to online learning so suddenly. She is always quick to respond and gave detailed feedback that I often think about.

Dr. MacCluskie has a fund of knowledge about anything in this field. She's approachable, fun, and has not lost an once of passion for teaching despite having to shift to online learning so suddenly. She is always quick to respond and gave detailed feedback that I often think about.

Fantastic course! As a first semester graduate student, I was nervous walking into this new world.... but I soon learned that Dr. MacCluskie was there to help guide you along your path. Wonderful experience. Be prepared to grow and learn.
A fabulous experience overall.

I just the beginning lab class with Dr. MacCluskie. I was at first offended that both my professors required I buy their books, but it was actually helpful (& more interesting) for teaching us microskills and using real-life examples. I am really thankful for this class! Reviewing my skills on the videos and tapes helped me learn so much!

An absolutely AMAZING professor. I would take every single class with Dr. M. She is so helpful, knowledgable, and very interesting. Class is a bit of work, but she makes it less stressful by being amazing!

MacCluskie teaches this basic beginning course for Guidance and Agency Counselors. She keeps it fun and moving along -- a LOT of group discussion. Nothing too heavy but the class does require  counseling a classmate while being videotaped.
Best professor ever! and yes you do need the book. Show up to class, learn, and study. He's does very good examples at the board. Hands down best professor!

Best professor ever! He's super sweet and very understanding of his students. He's very quick to answering his emails, and helps you when you need it. He's cares about his students. He's very passionate about what he does. Best professor ever! Wish I could have him for all of my classes. 10/10 highly recommend.

Great guy!  Works at NASA and teaches at CSU part time.  Cares about his students well being and is willing to make accommodations to those who need it.  Quick to answer questions and emails and is usually available for help anytime or office hours.  Recommend 10/10
Dr. Mackey was awesome...Its a shame he left.

Dr. Mackey is awesome - only teaches a few courses since he works at NASA. Our class had 3 tests, final, one take home quiz,& homework due every week(5-7 probs out of book). All test/quizzes are open notebook/textbook! Test questions are almost identical to examples in the book - liked Physics because of him and hope he teaches PHYS II!!!
All u need to do is show but and take good notes. His notes and test are identical. Pay attention when he say "Here is a PERK" it will be on the test.
He's a really nice guy, and quite an easy grader.  Just go to class and pretend to take notes sometimes, and you will be golden.

EASIEST joke of a class EVER. take take take for your african american experience GenEd!  two 50-question objective exams, small easy project. don't even bother buying the book. attendance part of grade, but you don't miss much if you don't go, except notes. easy to pass if take halfway decent notes. guy's an idiot, but the class is soo easy.
Prof Macon was pretty good. not much work and a pretty good class to get a good grade. attendance isnt mandatory but he does take attendance. take him if ur taking Rel 217

Macon, Macon, Macon.... what a guy. His class is very interesting and you will learn alot. There is not much work involved but make sure you attend class and do all of the assignments. Reading the material he assigns helps get you an A on the tests. And when you attend your church visit.... go to his church and see him preach.. its awesome!

I Had Dr. Rev. Larry Macon For The Malcolm X/Martin Luther King Jr. Class, Which Is By Far, The Best Class Offered At Cleveland State. Plus, Dr. Macon Has A Great Personality. He Shows Awesome Movies, Brings In Prominent Speakers , & Also Gives Facts That Most Euro-centric Colleges Would Not Cover. This Class Is  A Must!
Great teacher. One of the bestest classes I have taken in my entire academic career. She is very helpful, understanding and caring about her students and I would always look forward to her classes.

Professor Madden cares for her students and the usefulness of the material for reality. Some of the material is difficult to swallow, but so is life. Very enlightening. You will learn things about society that you thought "couldn't" exist. Wake-up call. No quizzes or exams, just weekly in-depth discussions and a major 10 page proposal.

Great Professor and a great class if you need a WAC course and she is teaching it then take it.  She provides real world experience with a lot of data to back it up.  It did seem like class was a second priority but while I had her she was getting her PhD is business that could of been why
Amazing! This instructor is literally the best I have ever had. She is so passionate and motivating. Her enthusiasm is infectious. You must take one of her classes.
Course is great if you want a class where you won't be there the full time.  At times it felt like the professor had somewhere else to be and we were secondary to her schedule

Prof Madden took the subject of fundraising to a whole new level. In light of her personally successes, she is the right person to teach this course. I could not have asked for a better prof or a more educational experience. There is a bit of work to do so don't put it off until the last second. If you show up and are interested you'll fit right in

LOVED Professor Madden. If you have the opportunity to take her class please do!! She understands you are a student, and will work with you. Always willing to help. Her class changed the way I view the world really opened my eyes. She really is a beautiful person.

His In-class exercises and case evaluations, will help you use your marketing knowledge in a best way rather than just one-side teaching. Preparation for exams could be tough,  prepare for his exams like a closed-book even though it is an open book exam.

He is extremely knowledgeable and entertaining in the class. Tests are hard and he makes you work hard to get a grade. I worked very hard and got an A. I learned a lot. Don't take it if you are not interested in working hard or want an easy A.
Great classroom discussions. This is not a sit there and watch him go over the PowerPoint type of class. Overall great teacher.
Dr. Madhavarm is a good professor and nice guy, though his tests can be pretty tough.

Disappointing. Prof is extremely knowledgeable on the subject but take someone else. The lecture content was scattered and ill prepared. Grading criteria did not allow for feedback, everything was turned in early on and grades came back the last week of class. Tests are very subjective. This is why I don't like academia MKT, real world its great.

Dr. M gives one of the best lectures in CSU. His deadpan humor will keep you from dozing off, and his real-world application of theory will help you post-grad. He gives 3 exams which are quite tricky. You will be doing cases in class that make up a large portion of your grade. No one has failed his class so far, you'll be fine. Do it.

He is a really nice, funny teacher.  He makes the topics in marketing interesting and engaging.  Prepare to do a lot of cases and a fairly large marketing plan toward the end.  The tests are based off of the book so if you read the chapters you will do great.  Overall, this class was one of my better marketing courses in terms of learning.
Good professor and good but hard material. Lot of work but you will learn a lot if you do what is required from you. Dont take the course if you want an easy A.

Do not take this class with this professor. He tries to trick students with exam questions and he only gives you 2 hours for online exams! He wasn't clear about online discussion posts and the project work goes way beyond marketing and into a lot of finance and math! This guy nearly wrecked my MBA program...avoid at all costs!

After taking this class, I will never again take a class with a professor who is not rated on this website. The amount of work is huge, and outside of the scope of the class (Finance, statistics..). The exam questions are very tricky. The content of the cases and class is outdated (cases were from before 1999). AVOID this professor at all costs.

I took online class with him. Lots of works, but I did enjoy his class. You have to post on blackboard each week about cases+chapter materials. There were also 3 group cases & final project, making new product concept. exams were open-note test but lots of questions, be familiar with the materials because you only have 2 hours to complete them.

Seems to be a very nice guy, the class however is not clear with grading. You can study and study for a test, and still get a B.  Save your time, dont study - just read the chapters and dont stress. Took his class over the summer, almost no work the first 3 weeks and then the last 3 weeks I was overwhelmed.

Overall he's a good professor and the class is interesting. Ten group cases and one group presentation at the end of the semesters. Three exams will require a lot of thought, but pay attention to his lectures. You will see a few questions on the exam from the discussion.

A lot of students complain that the course is a lot of work. The  fact is, it is an MBA level course and should require weekly work. I worked really hard for my A- but I feel like I actually earned it because I learned (and retained) quite a bit. Some of the learning does come from reading material he doesn't discuss in class.
Very Hard, Don't take it you don't have to.  Nice Guy.  Test are hard.

Takes a subject that is relatively straight forward and makes it complicated.   Tests are tricky.  He doesn't return the tests...just tells you your grade.  Everything in this class is graded subjectively.

You will learn nothing from this class, be prepared to pay to teach yourself everything under the sun, because his two multi choice exams are extremely hard and are totally vague. He is very impressed with himself, be prepared for a ton of outside work. He is very nice, but fails tremendously as a teacher.

While I would recommend Dr M over the others, be prepared to work. READ, STUDY, give PROFESSIONAL well-thought presentations. Don't miss more thn 2 classes. Brief (1 pg) weekly writing. 2 group presentations. Be prepared to ask questions, does not like when class is quiet. Exams mult choice, extremely hard, even with crib sheet. Good guy, however.
Smart, loves the subject matter. Not easy but he is fair. If you read the book and pay attention you get should get an A.

Professor is very smart and knows that material but has a tough time conveying his knowledge to others.  He never gives the exams back so you are never sure what was right and wrong.  Overall he is smart but unless you work in marketing he doesn't teach the material well enough.

The worst professor ever!!! Cleveland State should fire him. He doesn't teach anything, he comes to class unprepared and is so arrogant he refuses to teach. The exam questions are pulled God knows from where and he doesn't even know the correct answer if you ask him. Unfair grading on exams and group project.
If you can find another professor teaching this class, take the other. This guy is not fair.

He is a great guy and very friendly. He expects a lot from his students, which is why most will not enjoy his class. Anything from the textbook is fair game on the exams, whether we covered it or not during lecture. Very difficult, but fair if you put in the effort. expect group work/presentation.
well teaches the case analysis.doesn't teach anything from book while tests us from book. very hard 2 multiple choice exams. we have to study self in regards of book.
very bad very  bad he makes the stuff complicated very hard exams and very unfair grading
Excellent prof. Highly recommended
Great professor very easily going. Assign a group projects. Lectures are cool sometimes he gets off track but it's cool cause he's funny

Dr. Madlock has been my favorite professor thus far. I've been in college for 3 years now, and have had many professors; Paul has cared the most and is the easiest to talk to. He takes time to get to know you; if you show interest and respect you will most certainly get it in return.
One of the best professors I ever had. Made class fun and was very clear.

Dr. Madlock is very clear on how he wants things. In the beginning of the semester he will tell you how he wants his papers written, and that's how you get good grades. Easy class, his lectures are a waste of time though. He talks about random things like television shows on MTV. Easy A, though.

Easy class. Homework  1 pg papers due every other wk. Grading can be confusing & subjective. Class  He would mostly chit-chat. Annoyed some bc it was off topic but I didn't mind.  Take home exam is 4 essay questions. One group presentation at end of sem. Not his fault but my group was awful.  No need to buy textbook.
great teacher funny talks easy class must do papers in exact format and layout that he likes and thats pretty much it fun guy easy class

Madlock was one of my favorites. He understands reality and doesn't overload students with work.  He gives out a fair amount of time to complete assignments, and his personal stories are hilarious. He has a dry sense of humor, but that's what made the class so comfortable and easy.  He wants all students to pass with an A!

Professor Mageean was not the worst professor I've ever had but she was definitely one of the toughest graders and the class was very hard for me to engage with. I recommend a study partner and allocating lots of time to read. On a positive note though, she was really easy to get in touch with outside the classroom and she tries to liven it up.
bad
Classes for this course can feel long, but professor Mageean has interesting stories to share and loves what she does! As long as you attend every class and turn in the work, you should be golden!
He does not give clear instructions on assignments. He does not answer emails. He did not give a syllabus until the 5th week of the course. He does not give good feedback, he just says good or okay.

Even though he seems likable. He is not dependable and takes days to respond. He posted quizzes AFTER their due date and then you would get an F for not turning it in on time. He sent an email to our entire class complaining about how busy HE WAS - this is incredibly unprofessional. All we wanted as a class was for him to be consistent and clear.

Professor Magiste is such a caring and kind professor! He really cares about his students and is very willing to help you do well in this course. This is a research course so there was a lot of reading and research, as well as a 10 page paper due at the end of the semester. I think we only had one exam and it was the final.
Professor Magiste is an awesome and I wish he can teach more grad classes

I took this class online. He had clear grading criteria and was helpful when I asked questions. He was always very positive and gave feedback on how I was doing in the course. I have never met him in person but seems very nice and understanding. The online course was set up in a self explanatory and easily accessible way.

The class mostly consisited of doing Mindtap assignments and meeting in a group for three hours a week. The work wasn't hard it just felt like a lot of busy work all the time. He does not respond to email unless he wants to respond arrogantly.  He also found it necessary to yell at a student until she cried. Horrible teacher!!!!!!!

The professor was not  a bad teacher from what I could tell from an online class, it was just set up very poorly and due dates were changed and so were different assignments were changed all the time. It got confusing after awhile. Willing to give this professor another chance.
My only complaint was how I felt his religious preferences were pushed upon us. Other than that he was a great professor. He is very kind & will work with you if there's any concerns you have...

He's simply the Best! The lectures are great and he makes them very relatable. The assignments aren't too difficult; if needed he's always available for any extra assistanceclarification. He hasn't forgotten that he was once a student and so this makes his teaching approach different and in my opinion, better than that of most professors.
bad prof

She changed my life ! I had a poor Math background and had to take Pre-Algebra remedial at CSU. All the sudden she made everything in my brain click. I ended up getting A's in each new Math class and  ended up graduating with a B.S in Mathematics, I  will forever be grateful. She said I was her best success story.

Absolutely the best teacher ever! Math has never been my favorite subject and this ended up being the class I looked forward to the most. I took her at Tri-C for math 950 and 960 and learned sooo much! I would honestly breeze right through the homework after class because she teaches it step by step so you really get everything.

She is an absolutely fantastic teacher! She's extremely wiling to help you with any problem until you get it. She breaks down everything so that you really will understand, step by step, how to solve the problem. She does give out a lot of homework pretty frequently but that's how you get better. Definitely Recommend!!
Very good teacher, even though I knew everything we did in the class. She helped re-fresh some concepts that I had forgotten. Very good teacher for anyone who needs lots of help!
The best Math teacher I ever had! She gives frequent but easy homeworks. Completely prepares you for the final, very energetic, I just love her!

Wonderful teacher. I have never gotten anything better than a D in math until I got her as a teacher. I got a B with her. She is easy to understand and very helpful. She makes sure to explain in terms that are easy to understand. I will definitely take another Math class from her.

She is such a great instructor I wish I she taught every subject in my major because I would definitely take her class over and over again. She just teaches so well I mean she breaks everything down to you so you will get it and trust me if you take her class you will get it.

She is such a great instructor I wish I she taught every subject in my major because I would definitely take her class over and over again. She just teaches so well I mean she breaks everything down to you so you will get it and trust me if you take her class you will get it.

This is my third time taking this class and Mrs. M is the best math professor I have ever seen. She was helpful, she explained concepts until we understood them and she will do a lot to help if you are having problems. I would recommend her class to anyone.
Worst prof I had in grad school.  Unorganized, trails off topic, etc.  I dropped her class and took it with Morales instead....best move I could have made!
Worst professor of CSU. She is most unorganized person in whole business school.
i don't think "you are graduate student" can explain everything

Nothing bad to say about CBM.  Knowledgeable, well-read, and fun.  Recommended.  Standing here, the old man said to me: "long before these crowded streets, here stood my dreaming tree".  Below it, he would sit for hours at a time, now progress takes away what forever took to find.
Good professor, not sure what the other comments left were about I think I was in the class and thought she was knowledgeable and friendly!
very very bad professor... if u want to spoil your career than take her class. she is not clear of what she is teaching. i had made a big mistake by taking her class.
I basically had to teach myself contracts. If it was not for CALI is would not have passed. She is the absolute worst. She should not be allowed near students.
She is the worst teacher on the planet. We were forced to have her as a contracts professor. She was useless in class, and our grades were over a week late.

Professor Majette is well-intentioned but failed to be clear while teaching Contracts, an essential course. She does not give clear instructions for in-class projects and did not give the subject any structure. If youre in this class, academic support, upperclassmen, supplements, and YouTube may become your new best friend.

I have no idea who rated her these high scores at CMLaw but they are wrong. Professor Majette never entertained questions, was condescending throughout the class, didn't teach and took the opportunity of the switch to online learning as an excuse not to teach. Do not take her classes. They are a waste of time and money.

She was trying to teach a contracts class. She was using a horn book the whole time. She could not answer direct questions. If you have her for a contracts class, drop it and try to find a different teacher because you will be wasting your money

Professor Majette is incredibly smart, but fails at getting her point across. She talks at you but doesn't teach. She gives you projects that, while informative, come off as busy work and give you little to no idea of what their place in the course is. Her questions in class and including the final exam are overly vague despite having read all year

Prof. Majette is a terrific professor. She is very engaging and creates enthusiasm for whatever subject matter she is teaching. Her projects and assignments provide useful real world experience and she is always helpful in assisting her students with their career goals. She also provides opportunities to learn from other experts in health law.

Prof. Majette is truly an expert on health law and health policy. The level of experience and sophistication she brings to the table is more typical of a higher tier law school. You will learn a ton in her class. If you have a interest in health law she will offer enthusiastic support and guidance. I highly recommend her.

Prof. Majette is a great professor. She teaches in a way that really helps prepare you for the real world. At the end of the semester, I had a very good understanding of the big picture of health care law and the goals of the reforms and that is a lot to learn! She is a clear expert in the field and a great resource to her students.

Prof. Majette is clearly passionate about her work.She has years of experience that she brings to her teaching, including work representing insurance companies and hospitals,as well as time on the Hill during the drafting of the PPACA. She provides a solid foundation in the broad array of subjects included in health law and so every word counts!
She is so awesome

Mal-Sarkar is a fine teacher. She does read from slides but if you don't know something and you say something in class, she will explain it until you get it. The only problem I have with her is that she will not tell you what is on your tests. If you ask her, the answer is "Everything" so it is really hard to know what to focus on for tests.

She reads from slides. Most of the questions on the exam are from those slides. So pay attention in class. No in-depth subject knowledge though. I learned close to nothing. I honestly don't know how CSU keeps hiring professors who are not good at English. I am okay with accent but half the time I could not understand her because of her bad english.
She is so awesome

She is nice, but really boring. She just read slides. I got an A but learned very little. I could probably learn the same amount watching a handful of youtube videos. She isn't helpful with projects, which weren't helpful for learning. I feel semi guilty because she is nice and does seem to care. But she is a bad teacher.

I've taken several courses with her. I never really learn much from her courses and the difficulty of the class depends on the intelligence of the class with how she curves. This course in particular is very memorization heavy, but I've never failed her courses - that being said, I've never done very well either.

I only have one sentence to describe her. "I can read slides too," seriously, that's all I have to say. If you love reading nothing but slides and going through the same examples 5 times, then this is just the class for you. However, if you like to learn in a non-robot fashion, go somewhere else.

Compared to torture-worshipers like Wang or Sang, I'd take her any day, but I sense a "corruption" factor in her class. Differential grading, makes class harder when grades are too high, and sets the class up for an easy exam the day she "forces" you to submit her evaluation. There's also way too much useless memorization in her class.

She is very sweet and cares about student performance. "Get ready to read" the notes, which are posted on Blackboard. Lectures are painful: elementary topics are revisited constantly, slow pace, dry delivery. I skipped then read notes. Tests are multiple choice and questions are reused on each one. VERY easy A, but won't prepare you for a career.

Take a Mal-Sarkar course when you need an easy A to pad your GPA. Don't expect to get more than a surface-level understanding of the course content though- she repeats the basic stuff often. She occasionally gives group projects which is where the meat of your actual learning will come from.

She even doesn't know what she is saying. Do not take her class if you want good grades. I got 'D' grade in one subject and when I requested her to increase my grade, she denied. Please be aware that do not take her class.

Disorganized. Spends too much time reading power point slides. There's a lot of minutiae that you won't be tested on, she reads it anyway. Each set of power points have 40+ slides because of this, makes it difficult to prep for exams. She's extremely vague when she tells you what to review.

One of the WORST professors in CSU! She reads her slides like a robot (sic). Hard accent. She will redirect you to her TAs if you ask her any complex questions. Not recommended if you are really planning to learn something. Read all her reviews before taking her class in future.

All she really did was show up and read powerpoints, anything beyond that seemed to be delegated to the TA. One of the driest classes I've ever taken. You could skip every day and just read the powerpoints at home, but she took attendance for a grade. Very easy class, though.
She is a great professor with strong networking background.
All of Mal-Sakar's classes are super easy to get a decent grade in, but you won't learn a thing and you'll be bored out of your mind. She always reads off powerpoints like a robot.

For weeks professor has used the phrase "then you must do _______" to describe things that the computer does automatically(the programmer has no control over) and things that the programmer is required to do. She can't explain without repeating the text. Until she improves her English, I will not take and cannot recommend any classes with her.

Very nice lady, falls behind her schedule and has to rush to make it up at the end.   More or less tests on the can power point slides provided  by the  book manufacturer that will be posted on blackboard

Not a good lecturer and as someone said before, terrible at pacing. She skips a lot of material I would consider important, or just doesn't get to it. Read the book if you want to get anything out of her class.

Average professor, she does follow the syllabus. Her scheduling is sad. You won't have mind blowing knowledge and you often see many people skip her classes (provided you actually show up). Overall her test is not hard, she's a good fill in professor when you having a super busy schedule.

I feel like the combination between her accent, her over-qualification, and this being a mandatory class sets her up for a bad review. but she's really sweet, very understanding and wants her students to do well. the students doing poorly in her classes are the ones who refuse to read assignment directions. never bought book, she posts PPT slides.

I can't say enough good things about this professor. He was so caring during a difficult time I was going through. He cares about his students. Class is fairly easy. Professor Mallett held study sessions before our quizzes were due which was helpful in clearing up answers to tricky questions. He is willing to meet with students to go over anything.

I can't say enough good things about this professor. He was so caring during a difficult time I was going through. He cares about his students. Class is fairly easy. Professor Mallett held study sessions before our quizzes were due which was helpful in clearing up answers to tricky questions. He is willing to meet with students to go over anything.

100% take Professor Mallet! He is an amazing professor! I enjoyed his class so much. Weekly quizzes due on Sunday nights where you can work with your peers to complete it and one researcher report that you get to design yourself. Very caring professor. And also replies quick to emails. If you have the choose take Professor Mallet's courses!
Very caring of his students. Class is not mandatory attendance. Gives great feedback. Grades things immediately and will proofread for you.
Absolutely love Dr. Mallett! He is very understanding and provides clear instructions and positive feedback.
He is a great professor very knowledgeable. not like most of the SW professors he does make you work for the grade but really gives you every opportunity to do good.

I normally don't rate professors unless I've had problems with them, but Dr. Mallett is hands down the BEST professor I have had in my five years of college. He genuinely cares about his students and will meet with them for help with anything. He made me feel like I could accomplish anything. He's awesome. Take him whenever you get the chance.
Professor Mallet is one of the best teachers I have ever had. He has such a passion for what he does and is always willing to go above and beyond to help you.
Excellent professor. He's brilliant, interesting, and funny. There's a lot of reading and writing but I learned a lot.

Mallett is a somewhat tough professor but he lets you submit rough drafts to him before the due date. He also gives amazing feedback. The first assignment with him I did not submit a rough draft and failed the assignment because I did it wrong but then I sent a rough draft ahead of time and Aced every assignment after that and passed w/ a B!

ok avoid taking online if possible. Mallet is a GREAT professor, but the subject is better learned in a classroom. He answers emails RIGHT AWAY! Very helpful and funny. Having him in person i would imagine would have been a blast! Discussion boards are a must, and helps for test. DO THE DARN DISCUSSION BOARDS it will be used as extra credit!

Wonderful professor! If this he is having a bad day you will never know it. He gives you feed back on you work, so you can makeep corrections.  I wish every professor was like him. He is God sent. I do not know if he reads our comments,  but ifor he does I want him to know he is appreciated.

Dr. Mallett is an outstanding instructor with clear cut instructions. Always asking if there are any questions. There for the students! I was having some life issues and was honest with him. He listened and offered some direction. Thanks to the sincere and honest feedback I was able to pull through. Saved my semester.   Awesome Professor.
I thank God for him he so understanding when you go to him about anything
God sent him to students. Get his feedback on all work. Excellent professor. I will take any class he teach
A professor you must have. Communicate with him you wont regret send drafts for his feedback. I need more professors like him. God sent. Understanding

Dr. Mallet is my favorite professor at CSU! SWK is a research class, which most students find very boring, but he made it 100 xs better. You can send your papers in to him and he will give you feedback on what you missed (highly recommended). He is knowledgeable about Social Work and makes the class very interactive. By far the best professor!
Awesome Professor! He does power points in class with thorough explanations. Although his dates are not flexible he will assist you throughout your assignment and you will do well.
DR MALLETT was one of the best teachers in the social work program. He makes the classroom fun and he explains everything in Great details.
He lectures for most of the class on what the story we read was about and how to write. We read from the text book and do writing assignments a lot.

Not sure about the course number, but it was a mandated wellness course. Like all CSU mandated courses, it was insultingly easy and just a way for CSU to get more of your money and pump up the GPA of all the uneducated morons that go there. CSU is a joke, this class was typical. I am embarrased to tell people that is where I got my degree.
Web class. VERY easy and simple to follow instructions. Do a weeks worth of work to get an A+ for the semester.

He's an intellectual, likes chess/running, and expects specific answers to his culture questions, so don't raise your hands just to get brownie points, you'll often be wrong. MUST TAKE NOTES. It'll give you some leeway when you fall behind with the readings, and there's a lot. Take the class if you want an academically stimulating experience.

His class was challenging and he was a very tough professor.  He doesn't use slides. All of his lectures are based off of his notes. you need the books. This is definitely not an easy A class but it was a challenging class and I learned a lot

VERY difficult professor. Grades and teaches like your in grad school. Few points. Unaware of two short answer tests, under the impression of only one. ONLY LECTURES, no pps or visuals. For final, he randomly chooses 2 questions out of 5 & wants answers to be 4-6 pages, 10-12 paragraphs EACH w/ only 2 hours for the final and he will not wait.

He's an intellectual, likes chess/running, and expects specific answers to his culture questions, so don't raise your hands just to get brownie points, you'll often be wrong. MUST TAKE NOTES. It'll give you some leeway when you fall behind with the readings, and there's a lot. Take the class if you want an academically stimulating experience.

I really don't get why he was received so poorly. I am the type of student who tries to do the bare minimum to meet a decent grade, and I didn't think he was TOO difficult. Does a good job at making concepts applicable to you're own life. Actually gave us extra credit because we did bad on the homework. Though, every assignment matters.

He makes you work hard for your grade. I wouldnt recommend taking him if you are not in the sociology field and just plan to get an easy A with a 300 level course. Dont skip class, take thorough notes, and write as much as you can when it comes to his written exams. He is a tough grader with both papers and exams.

His exams are tricky for no reason. Why? It's just too much. I wish he would give in class assignments or something for extra points. This class was really stressful. He literally leaves class right after and doesn't really stay to answer questions. Never again.

Very good professor, definitely knows his stuff.  You can't skip class and you have to have the textbook.  You won't be able to pass without it, unless you're an expert in sociology already.  He's pretty funny but takes the course very seriously.  5 exams, all graded equally.  No other homework, though.

Read the assigned readings. Come to class everyday, and seek him during his office hours if you're having difficulties. He does reviews for the test, there were 5 during the semester. Every once in a while he cracks a joke. If you are looking for an "Easy A" this isn't the class, you have to work for it, the book is mandatory, take lots of notes!

Engaging lectures and brilliant wit. Take detailed notes and show up to class. Review your notes, read what's required, and don't let his intelligence or British accent make you think the class is more difficult than it is. Just listen and do your work. He's a gift to CSU.

He recites his lecture verbally by memory. No powerpoints that simply reiterating what the books have. Definitely a course that you need to attend and take good notes for. He reviews what he discussed in the prior lecture. He's a great professor that I wish I could have for another course.

Dr. Manning was by far the hardest teacher I have ever taken. Tons of readings and you have to come and pay attention in class if you want to pass at all. He is knowledgeable in his subject, he just expects a lot from you.

I wouldn't have taken this professor if he wasn't the only one to teach this class. Only points are 5 scantron exams, including the final. He  reiterates how crucial it is to attend his lectures, but they aren't on the tests nor do they help break down the long readings. 10 pt bonus essay on the final is the only thing that will even let you pass.
He was a pretty good teacher. You definitely have to read and come to class in order to understand the material and do well.

For those of you looking to take 352, he IS a hard professor. Very quite, but thorough in his lectures. Lots to study, but if you DO study you will do good since now (fall 2015) he is providing extra credit on all exams and a extra credit assignment at end of semester to bring you one letter grade up. I would take him again, honestly. Fun lectures
There is a lot of reading that is complicated and hard to understand. Reading is crucial for test because his lectures are not on the test.

The class is not an easy A. I only read the textbook when readings aren't covered in class and he said they will be on the test. But students that say questions aren't from class, can't say I agree. I study only my notes and I get A's on tests. That means you MUST pay attention - no texting or daydreaming, take detailed notes, and focus on concepts

Dr. Manning assigns tons of readings but his lecture doesn't focus on those assignments.  Many questions on the exam are never mentioned during the class.  You need a good memory to remember a lot of details from hundreds of pages for every exam.
Hate him for soc theory

If this guy is as smart as a few of you say why is he working at CSU. This guy is very condescending . All he talks about is his  BMW. He was Rude to me on many occasions. But what can you expect from CSU.

Manning is a wonderful teacher. Despite the difficulty of his classes, if you apply yourself you will get a good grade (there is a built in curve after all). He also is one of the most intelligent sociology professors I've ever had, much less at a local university. Plus he's British, and that has to count for something. Tips; read and think.

There will come sometime in the course where you may doubt yourself but I encourage you to stick with him. Have fun in dialogue during class with and break the tension as many won't have the courage to speak. He can be a little intimidating at first but cheesy jokes and real humor weakens his resolves and warms him up.

Professor Mannix does assign a lot of papers BUT he is an English professor. He strongly encourages attendance and participation. He does not like when people are too chatty during his lecture. His rubrics for papers are tricky to understand at first. He gives a handful of extra credit opportunities SO TAKE IT. Lastly, READ THE ENGAGED READER!
He's a tough grader, however he lets you know what he's looking for. tends to be super chill and calm, but make sure you attend.

By looking at his ratings at first, I was afraid to take his class. But man this Prof. is super funny and outgoing. I hope to have him next semester in addition. Make sure that you purchase the two textbooks for the class because you will need them. Its pretty hard to get an A on a paper because he makes you work for it but I eventually got one.

He seemed like a laxed grader when the semester began. He was not very concerned with due dates and often classmates would turn work in late. He surprised me with how difficult it was to get an A even if you asked for help or what specifically he was looking for. He needs to either retire or be more up front with what he was looking for. Difficult!
he does not check his emails. and my papers were submitted through email and he doesnt check, so i failed

His blackboard-based asynchronous class is fairly paced and not difficult for a motivated student. The quizzes are easy if you do the readings and the discussions and chats you are asked to do with journal entries every week are clear and offer you the opportunity to dig into the material a little and get creative. Great class.

His blackboard-based asynchronous class is fairly paced and not difficult for a motivated student. The quizzes are easy if you do the readings and the discussions and chats you are asked to do with journal entries every week are clear and offer you the opportunity to dig into the material a little and get creative. Great class.

Dr. Manos is very knowledgable in his field and is realistic with students about the content of his courses. He considers all perspectives and teaches real history rather than the white-centric historical perspective that students are usually fed.

I have never liked history but with him I for once thought that it is actually somewhat interesting. Super easy class. Gives study guide for each chapter that has the exact same questions on the quiz. And 2 attempts on the quiz!! Really can't ask for more. Take him if you can, makes life easy

Proffesor Manos is very passionate about what he teaches. I took this class to fulfill my African American diversity class, and i am glad i did!
