Class is based on quizzes(very easy), discussion boards, and a midterm and final exam(all the questions are from the quizzes). Offers extra credit! Highly recommend taking his class!!! Awesome and caring.

Easy A if you come to every class and do the online assignments. He is VERY VERY VERY biased and left leaning. He is also passionate but his facts aren't 100% true. Don't take what he says at face value but respect the passion.

Very awesome prof. He really knows his stuff, like he should and he's an all around really straightforward guy and even wrote his own plays! He really likes those students that try hard in his class and participate! Would definitely take his class again if I could. TAKE HIM IF YOU CAN!!!!

Hands down the WORST class I have ever taken. Extremely biased. Far too reliant on blackboard, if I wanted to take an online class I would. Also a big fan of in class group assignments that teach nothing. Rarely lectures, and when he does, its just him telling the class how racist the US is. I wanted to learn, and so far Ive got nothing. AVOID!!!

Lots of busy work in class, so go to each class. Talks a ton but has no PowerPoints. Weekly journals and online quizzes. 2 attempts per quiz and he takes the higher of the 2. Sometimes he posts the readings for you sometimes not. Get the book. Easy A if you do the work.

Peter Manos is a fantastic teacher. He knows every era of history extremely well and he is very motivational and inspires students. He has creative assignments and wrote the play that you read in class. No final exam, you just have to write a play.  You can tell he actually enjoys his job, and makes the students enjoy the class. Would take again.
peter manos is an enthusiastic teacher who seems very knowlegeable of his subject and eager to teach.
This was the best history class I have ever taken since my college career started. I highly recommend his class. If I could take his class again, I would.

He is passionate about the course and you can tell he knows it very well. To pass the class, make sure you show up for class because he gives quizzes every class but not to worry they are super easy. You just need to listen. He uses blackboard alot. There is  discussion andhomework due everyweek but the answers are in the textbook.

He goes through each homework problem in lecture so you know exactly how to do it. He gives a sample exam and also puts out a video of solutions for that practice exam. Exams are very very similar to the practice exam. As long as you watch the lecture videos and do the practice exams youll get an A

He goes through each homework problem in lecture so you know exactly how to do it. He gives a sample exam and also puts out a video of solutions for that practice exam. Exams are very very similar to the practice exam. As long as you watch the lecture videos and do the practice exams youll get an A

His online classes are not the best. He doesn't really teach so its more you teach yourself. However, you can always schedule a zoom meeting with him and he is more than happy to help you. He wants his students to succeed. He gives extra credit and he is not a tough grader. He also uses respondus for his exams

Professor Manouchehr is the best professor I have had. I took this class online due to COVID and was nervous I couldn't teach this to myself. His lectures are a life saver. He goes over homework problems and teaches very well. He provides practice exams with solutions. His tests are exactly like the practice test! Best professor out there!!!

Math was NEVER one of my good subjects. Needless to say I was extremely nervous to take this class, especially online. Professor Manouchehri works with you. If you need time and tell him you are having problems with the work, he will extend the homework and make sure to answer your concerns. Learn the Homework, and exam prep and you're good to go!

I took his online 8-week class after not taking a math class in years. Talk about a crash course in Calculus. He genuinely prepares you for his tests, so run through the sample exams/practice problems till you've got it down. He's a warm guy who believes in his students, and I wish all STEM professors were like him. You will not regret his class.

Great professor! I took math 149 online as a blended course and it was the best decision! Although he was teaching an online course he was very attentive and everything is very clear! Calculus is very hard in general but Prof Manouchehri helps out as much as he can and does whatever he can to have his students pass!! Highly recommend taking him

Professor Manouchehri is a great guy! He genuinely cares about his students and how they are doing. He curves most of his tests. Almost every quiz is online and can be taken twice. Keep up with the assignments or it will be a nightmare trying to catch back up.
Nice funny teacher, just make sure you pay attention and ask questions if your confused. He would also curve tests.

He's awesome. A real gem. I hate math and he made it easy to understand. always a smile on his face. if you don't understand the criteria in class, just go to the math center the day before the exam , and you should be gucci. do the homework or you won't pass! (symbolab is clutch)
Great professor! He is very passionate about teaching the material in a way that makes sense to everyone and will explain it in many different ways. The homework is all online and due once a week.
hey! I strongly recommended you to take with this professor, he is VERY VERY helpful and with your side. don't lose the chance!!
best teacher/professor I have ever had, Truly cares about all of his students. He is always around for help if you need it and is a really funny guy
Awesome teacher moves a little fast as the semester picks up but will slow down and explain if needed.  Has a good sense of humor also.

Professor Manoucheri is a wonderful professor i had him in both mth 87/mth 116 & in each class he was delightful!!! Professor Manouchehri knows the material & cares about his students. His class was not hard but you had to be in class and show Professor Manouchehri that you wanted to pass! By far one of THE BEST PROFESSOR EVER at CSU!!!! Take him!
Nicest college level teacher you will find. He wants you to succeed.

As others mentioned, this professor truly cares about his students. Would always see him around campus and he would strike up a conversation and tell me if I needed help to let him know. Go to class and try your best and he will meet you half way. Wish we had more professors like him.

Tied for the top professor I have ever had, is there for you if you need him. very nice, and fun to talk to, made my time in this course enjoyable. I absolutely would recomend him as a must take for MTH 149.

Took MTH87 as a refresher course, as I had been out of school for a while, and Prof Mohsen did not disappoint. Super nice and helpful. Very laid back. Clear expectations. He was always prompt and he made sure that there were always enough TAs around so that each student got one-on-one time each class. I wish he taught higher level classes!

Took this class online and it was pretty easy. We used math labs plus to do our homework and quizzes on. The only downside is that you have to go to the school to take the tests. The final exam can replace one of your lower test, 2 lowest quizzes dropped and 5 lowest homeworks dropped. The prof. is really nice and gives sample exams similar to test

I took it online and at first I was nervous about the class (and this is coming from some one that is A+ student in math). But seriously though he is amazing and has a great, laid back personality.  This class can be challenging if you are not good at math compared to math 149. There are 3 tests and final, 7 quizes (2 lowest droped).

Awesome Prof. Definitely knows his stuff and explains it very well. Physio is a though class though and his tests are challenging. Gives extra credit questions during lecture. Overall a terrific prof.
Hands down, the best professor in the entire school. I wish we had him for HSC 582.

Dr. Manshadi is a great professor! His class is not easy, but you can learn a lot from him if you apply yourself. Many people complain about his teaching style (because he rewards for effort instead of merely for attendance) but those who bother to learn from him often learn a great deal!

Don't ever take a class with Dr. Manshadi. Every single assignment was unclear, grading was a joke, emails go unanswered, virtually no useful feedback. I honestly cannot think of anything positive about taking this course with this professor. I spent 3 solid months in complete and constant stress over this course. DON'T DO IT!
One of CSU's best professors! HSC 484 isn't an easy class, but he makes this class manageable. He's helpful and approachable. Definitely take him for this course if you can.

Notes come directly off of a powerpoint.  Everything you need to know can be found in the text and the powerpoints which are from the publisher. Attendance is mandatory and helped my grade a lot.  Easy class if you show up and do the quizzes.  Tests are really hard and sometimes unclear but with enough studying you will do fine.

He is a very knowledgable doctor so he makes the class VERY difficult.It is a busy class, we constantly had homework.  Online discussion and in-class participantion are both requirements. If you want an easy class do not take him for this class.  There are easier professors that teach this class.He tests you over the whole book and they're tough!
Very knowledgeable professor and a nice guy. Definitely have to read the textbook.

Dr. Manshadi is the ideal professor. Simply put, he is the ultimate professor and doctor. He made this class VERY enjoyable. Dr. Manshadi puts the material in simplest terms and I can say that everyone in the class understood every concept because of him. He is understanding and believes in helping his students. MANSHADI IS THE BEST PROFESSOR EVER

He goes straight from the book on absolutely everything-reading it is extremely helpful. Questions on quizes/exams can be confusing-when going over them he seems confused himself sometimes &admits there is more than 1 right answer but 1 is "better" than the other, but it is not always clear what he is looking for and I read the book over and over.

This professor insults the class when he he give extra point after text is taken. His English is not very clear but he uses PowerPoint (helpful) . Need to attend class and ask for help if you don't understand. The exam are not the easiest and quizzes are very much needed for the exams. Do them before exam. Overall he's not horrible he just don't understand some dont grasp concept when he explain them . Fast pace course

You can't mess up this class unless you just don't show up or don't read read the chapters assigned. Grading is on a curve, lectures are clear and insightful. He has a great way of making the most complicated things simple enough for anyone to understand! This is supposed to be a hard class, but he makes it easy for anyone to learn and understand.

He's a good professor for this class. When you need help with your proposal or the power point he helps you. Very clear on what he expects from you. This class is a little intimidating at first but it's much easier then it seems.

Amazing experience! I took Neuroanatomy lab with Dr. Manshadi and he made this tough course a breeze! He mixed clinical scenarios with basic neuro-science which made most sense. I really enjoyed this course and I will recommend this course to everyone.

He is the most amazing professor I have ever had, my favorite by far! Extremely helpful! Do not be afraid to ask questions. He is super friendly to all students and extremely knowledgeable. I would recommend him in a heartbeat! He is a phenomenal teacher! The grade I would give him as a teacher is an A+++. SUPER HOT TOO!!!

Wow! He is the most amazing professor I have ever had, my favorite by far! Extremely helpful! Do not be afraid to ask questions. He is super friendly to all students and extremely knowledgeable. I would recommend him in a heartbeat! He is a phenomenal teacher! The grade I would give him as a teacher is an A+++. SUPER HOT TOO!!!
Excellent professor.

Mirel is a knowledgeable man of the topic of Finance and knows how it operates. For that I give him credit. Every other aspect of him though, I do not like. As mentioned in the review, Mirel downgraded a sales career. This is completely unprofessional, and I believe that no one in any business should down talk another departments duties. He even we
One of the best instructors I've ever had!

As others mentioned he makes finance-bearable because he realizes many just need to take an introductory finance class for various majors. Enjoyed the class, except for getting only the true/false questions wrong brought me down a whole letter grade.
Excellent professor. Makes the course easy for non-finance majors. no textbook needed. Pay attention in class and its an easy A. Recommend going to class.

Excellent professor.  No textbook needed.  Show up to class, pay attention and review the slides he provides and you should do well.  I am not a fan of finance and do not excel in math and I did well due to the way he teaches the class.

No homework except you must read the chapters before class in order to be prepared for class and exams.  You won't receive the slides until he is done going over them, sometimes not until the day before an exam making it hard to study. Got a B but could of made an A but barely read.  Overall, he is an excellent instructor. Recommend going to class

This class was 6 weeks and it was pretty good. Test were every week, no homework and no book needed. All you need was a finance calculator. We went over the problems in class and the same problems would be on the test, only thing is that he would change the numbers. He also does 1-2 chapters for tests and he let us use a notecard on test days.

Literally the best professor I have taken. He will make your life so much easier. If you are an OSM major at CSU and do not take Mirel you are making a huge mistake. I wish he taught more OSM 400 level classes.
Awesome professor. Truly cares about the success of his students. If you want real life examples, Mirel is the professor to take.  I just wish he taught more classes.

Very good professor. He lectures for the first 5 minutes then you spend the rest of class going over every possible problem that will be on the test. Hes a nice guy that makes sure you understand the material before leaving the class.
OMG amazing professor the questions he goes over in class is the questions on the test and he is the nicest guy you will ever meet! Plus on exam day you will get a notecard!
outstanding, simplifies difficult concept. gifted teacher
best professor I ever had!
ONE OF THE BEST PROFESSOR I HAVE HAD

Great Class and Professor! After retaking FIN 351.. I actually understood Finance concepts and Mirel was great in helping outside class with great class discussions as well as one on one help in class. Highly recommend taking FIN 351 with this professor who only cares for every student's success!

really nice guy! if you go to class and do the connect homework, there is no way you cannot do well. test are multiple choice, and the connect hw has unlimited attempts. he spends about 5-10 minutes lecturing, and then the rest of the class time the class does example problems together.

Personally, Im doing fine by just watching the pre-recorded lectures whenever I have the time, I really like the flexibility. Homework is due every week & isnt that hard if you watch the lectures. The key to passing is to follow what shes doing in the lectures, including the examples & how to do them in excel. Excel helps a ton with hw/tests.

Online class with this instructor was a nightmare. It took forever to get questions answered, the assignments were due every Friday, and no tolerance or respect for students. I hear that she moved on to another school. That's good news for Cleveland State students!

I had Alina for BUS 290 and she was great. Super helpful and always understanding of students having a life outside of the classroom. This is why I took her again for OSM 202 and now she's absolutely awful!!! I don't know what happened but for this summer class everything is due on Fridays which sucks and there's just no reason for that...

Alina gives you every opportunity to receive a good grade. She posts lectures, PowerPoints and work sheets. She holds "help sessions" three days a week for 2 hours. This will allow you to ask questions and she will even help with homework. Like any class you have to put the time and work in. Alina is a fair grader and wants you to succeed.

First off, she gave us 4% of extra credit to our letter grade!! The exams are similar to the practice exams. She isn't great at helping people understand the material so I just used Chegg and taught myself. I found her review sessions and recordings a waste of time for the most part. Join a groupme, it saved me a lot of time with everyones help.
She is a great professor for stats. She explains everything really clearly and actually wants her students to get good grades. I definitely would not have gotten an A with a different professor.

OSM 202 is tough. I took this class with 2 other professors and never made it past the first exam before dropping. Alina makes it as easy as she can. Video lectures every week. She curves the exams and offers extra credit. You have to work hard and practice stats no matter who you take. Exams are only 50% of the grade which is low for a math class.

She's just another CSU instructor who thinks that online teaching just involves posting some video lectures and giving canned Connect assignments. I didn't learn a darn thing in the class, except for what I got out of it by reading from the book on my own.

She overall is one of the best professors I've had. The lecture videos were very intuitive and she would have regular zoom meetings where we could ask questions. She was always very willing to help whenever possible. Would definitely recommend.
The class was online and really sucked. No effort put in by instructor. Never again!
Her class is not an easy A, but she is very willing to help students understand the material. Her video lectures are very good, plus you can go back and rewatch them which is great for test review.
Video lectures are terrible and all over the board. Too much work and not enough time allowed to speak to Alina.

Personally, Im doing fine by just watching the pre-recorded lectures whenever I have the time, I really like the flexibility. Homework is due every week & isnt that hard if you watch the lectures. The key to passing is to follow what shes doing in the lectures, including the examples & how to do them in excel. Excel helps a ton with hw/tests.

Whatever you do, dont take this class. Professor Marculetiu does not teach at all and relies on pre-recorded lectures that are hard to follow and at times can be very confusing. Tests are very hard and make up most of your grade. She expects you to know the material, and theres no curves. If you want to pass, dont take her.

Alina does not teach. Her lectures are pre-recorded and very hard to follow. She expects you to know the information and not ask a tutor for help. In fact, she stated that we shouldn't be using tutors because she told them not to help us with the actual problem we need help with.

I am so grateful I took this course with Alina. She is relatively new at teaching so she is a bit all over the place but when she gets into the real gritty stuff she explains it very well.  She gives plenty of extra credit and makes sure you are clear on what is expected.  The material is tough but she makes it much easier to digest. Great prof!

Alina was awesome.  I might even change my major because I enjoyed OSM that much.  Very kind & willing to help her students succeed.  Her reviews help with exams, and the homework helps with quizzes. Definitely recommend!

She is a very nice and reasonable professor. She is young in her career, and sometimes it shows, but she always tries her best. The class is actually much easier than OSM 202 in my opinion. There's no graded HW, although the optional HW does help you learn. 7 quizzes but she drops 2 of them, and the exams were mainly multiple choice.

Alina is so intelligent and nice! She explains complex OSM topics in a very simple way. She gives a lot of in-class examples that will help you do the homework and study for the exam. Homework is much harder than exam so you will be well prepared. She also is great help during her office hours (she is the OSM tutor too).

This was her first time teaching this class and it was ok. The homework is on connect which can be long depending on the chapter and we had three test that are multiple choice. She is also a tutor for OSM, so if you didn't understand something you could always go to her. She is a really nice teacher however this is not an easy subject, its just ok.
This was the first time she taught 311, so it was rough at first but got better. Shes a tutor as well so she offers alot of help. Class can be confusing. Long time for homework
What a delight to be in his class! He is animated and brings the subject to life. His vast experience in court makes for great stories.

Great prof - mostly lecture - but still read cases - on the rare occasion he does call on you - he doesn't take kindly to unprepared students since he doesn't expect much to begin with. Exam a little weird and unexpected - but VERY FAIR grader and FUN and INTERESTING lecturer - loves his students/teaching. Will take TONS of time to explain if u ask
Good Prof. Mostly lecture - has fun/interesting stories. He is VERY helpful if you have questions. Very personable and a cool style about him. Fair grader/exam.
Good professor.  Works in the trenches (defense side), so he knows how this stuff plays out in real life.
GREAT adjunct prof!  Knows his stuff well, and separates the elements smooth like buttah!

He is very knowledgeable on this material. His lectures can seem like a lot but he knows that if you know the little stuff first everything else will come easy. Put in the work and it is an easy A. Very easy to reach out to and will make sure that you understand. Ask questions lots of questions he makes good analogies to help.

Very understandable and reasonable man if you need to change dates or missed class. Read and know the lecture slides he posts for exams and will receive an A. Has participation 20% of grade with 4 exams. Exam 4 (Final) is not cumulative. Quick with emails

One of my favorite, most courteous & respectful professors! Always enthusiastic, quirky, positive & engaging. Very clear he wants his students to learn. If you study his slides & study guide well, you'll be fine. 100 points for simple 5min participation assignments so I made sure to attend lecture. Really enjoyed his class & learned a lot :)
professor Margolius is great and extremely helpful inside and outside of class. quizzes are based on the homework. go to class and do the end of chapter problems and you should be fine.
She is knowledgable in her field and can explain the material in a way that makes sense. She also made herself available to provide help outside of class if needed and responded to emails promptly.
Highly recommend!!

She is extremely knowledgeable on the subject but doesn't seem to know how to effectively present it to students. She is very kind and clearly cares about her students and their success but this does not make up for the fact that she is difficult to learn from. If another professor is available I would recommend choosing them instead.

Awesome math teacher and is great at explaining calculus on a clear level. Lectures are very relaxed and mandatory. Grading is very clear and is easy to keep track of. My gripe with the class is online homework in WebWork. Tests perfectly challenge what you learn in class and are fun! Crazy I'd be saying that. Very happy and highly recommended!

Can be a very hard professor to work with based on the fact that she does not know how to teach statistical topics to college students. She is a very smart woman but has a particularly hard time "dumbing" down the information. Midterm and final were open note but extremely difficult to finish in the time allotted. Avoid if possible.

AVOID. She's miserable, unenthusiastic, rude, condescending, arrogant and boring. She thinks re-writing proofs on the board is teaching. If you dare to ask a question, she'll tell you it's not her problem you don't understand.  As an exam P prep course, this was completely useless. The final was utterly unfair. One of the worst classes I've taken.
Very caring and helpful. One of the best professors at CSU

Dr. Margolius is one of the most intelligent professors I've ever met. Her teaching methods can sometimes be confusing, but she is always willing to help students. Quite a bit of homework and webwork is used too. The exams are all based on lecture as well. She's not easy, but she's fair

She's VERY smart when it comes to calculus, but she isn't very good at making it easy to understand. For someone who makes up the tests, she didn't prepare us all that well for them and the final was ridiculously different from what she said it would be. Take LaPlaca if you can. He is 100x better at explaining it than she is.
Above average professor. She really knows her stuff, but often struggles to explain it to class. Very timely in regards to responding to questions over homework.

I found this teacher to be about average. She did what she could to help everyone, but sometimes her explanations were above the class's heads. She's very kind and respectful, but can sometimes get off track from the objectives of the course and take the material to a new level. I'd recommend to mathematics majors

Had her  at CWRU in 1992 fall for Calc II. She was a PhD student at the time. She is really brilliant she really is. Knows Calc forward and backward. First exam was hard second easier, third between the first two. Got a B with curve but probably deserved a D. Students should challenge themselves with one of CSU's treasures.

Does not take enough time to explain difficult concepts.  Expects the TA to do her work in explaining the material to the students.  Do not take this teacher unless you are brilliant or can teach yourself!

She is tough, but also pretty fair about giving chances to make up tests and work to improve your grade. I like that you have work other than tests towards your grade. Tests and webwork are pretty difficult and time consuming but you will definitely learn a lot in this class. She is very helpful.
She is a difficult person to understand and does not give extra credit! She is no one to be played around with

This prof knows her stuff but could not come down to the level of her students to make the material understandable.  Tests were extremely tough and partial credit was NOT given.  Hard work and effort do not pay off with this prof
Very good Prof. Gives u many chances to improve your grade. Highly recommended!!! Must know method of washers!!! LOL
SPEND MORE TIME ON LECTURE AND EXERCISES

In class, her lectures are about the theoretical aspects of probability.  The homework and tests are application-based.  She is very helpful, very nice, a breath of fresh air in a math department which is mediocre at best.  Can be tough at times but occasionally curves scores.  Recommended.
was not very good at teaching from the start of class;. Was not clear and just outlined topics rather than teach them. of teaching them.

She is a very good math teacher. She clearly explains subjects and teaches in a logical and simple step by step approach. She does have a bad habit of canceling classes last minute. But she always adjusts due dates accordingly.

Not very helpful. Not good at explaining. It is hard to say why she became a teacher, because it doesn't seem that she enjoys it very much. Gets frustrated when students ask questions she has already explained, even though students really need clarification. Cancelled class a lot, and on short notice.
Excellent teacher as a whole.  Ellaborately and thoroughly explained teachings in great detail.  Extremely easy if you do work and pay attention and come to class.
Extremely difficult and tedious class, a lot of work , avoid taking this class with this professor at all costs

The class was very easy. She explained the material throughly and gave out practice exams. She worked well with my schedule..and even let me retake two exams from sleeping in. Dont take this class obviously if youre not going to go and try or else it wont be like a described. Although attendance is not taken, she does get personal with students.

Worst math professor ever @ CSU.... she don't even care if you are failing or not....not even if you are trying your hardest!!! I had to drop it ...she goes with the book and if you understand it or not she wont mind....honestly if you have her switch or drop...because if not you will FAIL!!!!

Horrible teacher, avoid at all cost. Makes mistakes and won't admit them when corrected. Explains things poorly, if she even explains it at all. If you're in her class, plan on teaching yourself or getting a lot of tutoring. I could pull an A in this class with the right teaching, but will probably end up with a C

DO NOT TAKE HER CLASS. She has no buisness teaching. Worst teacher ive ever had. She constantly is worng and the students have to correct her. She barley explains anything clearly. She expects you to see the formula and understand all of it. She makes her tests extremly difficult to understand and is very lazy. Constantly makes excuse im only human

Most of the time I think she has no idea what she's teaching.  She seems like she'd be a good person but when she says, "I'm only human."  at least 2 times everyday it gets ridiculous. The one day in class she stopped going over a problem because so many people were correcting her.

This is an entry level stats class. Professor Maric explains the material thoroughly, however she frequently makes slightly "absent-minded" mistakes such as writing down incorrect answers on the board. Students frequently correct her. Seems to have a problem with wording her exams properly and clearly.

Not a very good teacher. Goes through things fast, you have to just try to keep up. Gets aggravated when students have questions or disagree with the grading on a test. Makes test unnecessarily difficult, especially the wording. Would not recommend.

She is GREAT!!!!!!!! she was an awsome teacher! she help me with any question that i had and would mete with me if need be. She responded to all my emails even after three semesters after taking her class she still response to my email.I wanted to take another class with her but she is not teaching it! She truely was WONDERFUL! she expected you to

I don't know who these 0850 or 0950 classes, like what schools they are from, but I thought she was great considering it's college. She gives enough information and materials that it's hard not to pass. She expects you to be a responsible adult.

SHE DIDNT CARE IF ANYONE PASSED HER CLASS. SHE DIDNT CARE IF ANYONE UNDERSTOOD WHAT SHE WAS "ATTEMPTING TO TEACH" SHE WAS CONFUSING AND IRRITATED BY QUESTIONS. HALF THE CLASS INCLUDING MYSELF THINK SHE HAS NO BUSINESS TEACHING ANYTHING! SHE IS CONDECENDING AND RUDE, IMPATIENT, AND SNOOTY. DROPPED THE CLASS. COULDNT TAKE HER ANYMORE

Took 0850 with her and passed. This class with her was the worst class ever. She was testy and didn't go over things as readily as before. I wound up hating the class and will not take another math class with her. She is terrible.
Enjoyed her class. Was helpful and showed the class other ways of solving problems. Gave partial credit if you didn't get answer but showed your work. Class was okay.

This teacher is extremely close-minded. Refused to give extra credit for solving a problem using my own method. Got it wrong because I didn't do it "Her way". Also, she teaches like she's in eighth grade. No cell phones, no talking, no sleeping. Tests do not follow lectures, lectures do not follow homework, Refuses to believe in conceptual math.

Dr. Marino is here to help you become a better writer. He expects everyone in the workshop to participate, but it's a workshop, that's the whole point. If you regularly contribute, take your critiques seriously and apply them to your writing, you'll have no problems. He's great.

Dr. Marino is here to help you become a better writer. He expects everyone in the workshop to participate, but it's a workshop, that's the whole point. If you regularly contribute, take your critiques seriously and apply them to your writing, you'll have no problems. He's great.

Pretty sure he never read through anything I wrote for class, as evidenced by his bizarre feedback notes. He also doesn't respond to emails and he took long periods of time to return student work. Also quite an egotist: he had our class read a piece he was working on, but wanted us to know, "I don't really care what you think." Wow.

Dr. Marino makes Shakespeare approachable and fun. His lectures may be long, but they are informative, clear, and full of depth. He gives amazing feedback on papers, too, and builds connections with his students, due to his great personality. Do yourself a favor and take one his classes!
Boring ... Has no clue how boring his classes truly are.

Very passionate and intelligent professor. His video lectures are interesting and funny. 2 major papers but you get 2 drafts on each and he gives helpful feedback. Besides that just some discussion boards on the films that you'll watch and reading quizzes on the plays. Overall a great professor.

Marino is incredibly passionate about what he does and he's unbelievably intelligent, which is why he's by far one of the best professors I have had. The material isn't always the easiest, but Marino is great at lecturing in a way that is fun and interesting. Not only is he a great teacher, he's pleasant to be around. He's also nice on the eyes.

I had Marino as a professor for Shakespeare II. Do you like a professor that gives interesting, informative, fun lectures?  Marino's your guy. Seriously, you don't want to miss a thing he says. Shakespeare can be daunting for some but he makes it fun. The class is heavy on writing, so be warned if that's not your strong suit.

Marino is ingenious, funny, interesting, and has the unusual ability to take incredibly dense reading material and make it simple. Taking one of his classes will help you not only grow as a Lit student, but as a thinker.  He's not easy, but you shouldn't be looking just for easy profs anyway. Highly recommended.

Very intelligent, stoic and most importantly a very down to earth professor which is a rare combination. Very helpful to his students especially those who put in effort; you can tell teaching is his passion. He sets a really good example for aspiring teachers!

He is my favorite professor at CSU. He's brilliant - he went to Columbia I think. I feel like we're really lucky to have him here. He's really funny too. He definitely made me work for my A's on papers but it was worth it.

This was my  favorite class of freshman year of college. He made class fun, not a chore to go to.  He can be tough, so make sure to stay on top of the readings for class discussion. He really challenged me and made me think.  I would definately recommend this class, especially if you are an English minor or major.

By far one of the best professors at CSU. Pasionate about lit and teaching. He will bend over backwards for you if you make an effort.  He can be tough at times, but you will walk out of his class smarter and a better student. And the cookies he bakes are awesome!

Class with him is like an academic stand up comedy show. He really takes the time to explain the essay assignments and tests. While the assignments and tests are challenging, if you put the work in, you will do fine. Ewww, he?s not ?hot?. He?s charming. He baked us cookies for the last day of class! They were good. Awesome professor, nice person.
Extremely funny. Easily my favorite teacher at CSU.
He loves to teach and wants you to succeed. His course is not demanding. I would recommend.
Best professor I had in four years of college. Funny, extremely accessible, bends over backwards to convey information. Do yourself a favor and take one of his classes.

Brit lit could either be good or bad.  Marino made it good.  His explanations of the sometimes hard to comprehend texts were memorable and clear.  His tests are difficult, but fair, as long as you study and do all of the reading.  He actually got me to love brit lit and have a passion for some older works that I never understood before.  Take it!
My favorite professor at CSU! I loved going to class everyday. He  is so funny and really keeps the student's interest. Take his class, you'll enjoy it!
His sense of humor is great, and his enthusiasm for teaching is apparent.  He really cares that you're learning something in his class.  And his insights regarding papers are always helpful.
Clever. Pompous. I got something out of his class, but mostly I just got tired of pretending to laugh at his jokes (he cracks himself up).

I recommend this professor to anyone who is planning to take psych 101. She wants her students to succeed. Her exams are straight-forward and easy. As long as you read the book, attend lectures, take notes, and study for her exams, you will most likely get an A.

I really enjoyed this course. Her lectures aren't boring and they kept me interested. She shows lots of videos and does a lot of examples for clarity. Tests are fairly easy if you study and she doesn't try to trick you. She offers EASY and quick extra credit. Knows what she is talking about and is very passionate about the subject. YES TAKE!

Class isn't mandatory, you can just read the chapters & use the outlines she gives us. She really enjoys people to be involved in conversation, but class sure is awkward when nobody really wants to. Sometimes she turns into Captain Obvious. Thankfully she knows the content well and is able to explain it well. If you persevere, you'll pass.

So bad.  Always doing useless "class activities" in which nobody actually participates because they are so stupid. There are literally times where a slide will come on the screen, she will yell what it says, look at the class, shrug, then move on.

Get ready to teach yourself literally everything if you have her for any class. As others have said, she's completely scatter-brained and confuses students rather than teaches them. Avoid, avoid, avoid is all I can recommend!

Dr. Mark is was very nice but a little scatter brained. If you don't know anything at all about stats I don't recommend. She talks to you like you know certain things that you may not know if you're not up to par with stats.
One of the most boring professor I've ever had. No one participated in class and the lectures were all over the place. The textbook was pointless.. I would not take her again for any course.

Her lectures were not very organized. When students would ask questions 80% of the time she would respond with "I don't know," the other 20% was "you tell me." You have to teach yourself the material which is not easy for a Brain and Cognition class. Her test were ridiculous and did not cover the powerpoint.

Not the greatest PSY 101 professor out there. You will get more info from the SI leader than her. Gives out inaccurate info, so prepare to read the txtbook. If you can take any other professor than her, and hold off on PSY 101, PLEASE heed my words and do so. You won't regret it
This professor was not very helpful. Her teaching style (or lack there of) is very all over the place and she is not very easy to understand.

If you want an easy A in PSY101, request her. If you want to actually learn about psychology, avoid her like the plague. I had a tutor for this course (who basically taught me the course) and she actually told me that what Markis was teaching us was wrong. She never made any sense in class and it was such a waste of time.

Professor Markis is a very caring professor that wants her students to succeed.  Make sure you show up to her class on time because she gives out participationattendance grades in the beginning of class.   She is very approachable and has a flexible schedule if you want to see her.  She hands out study guides for her exams which help alot!
Professor Markis is the BEST teacher ever.  She is clear and super easy to approach.  Take her if you can!!!!
She zooms through the PowerPoint slides really quickly but overall an easy class. If you study and I mean actually study, you should get an A. Tests are easy.
If you are able to take another professor then do that. She is very flat and repetitive. Power point and lectures and that's it.
Assigns homework but doesn't post it until a few days before.  Very boring, she lectures the entire class in a monotone voice. Tests aren't too bad.
Easy class to take for an elective.  The book is boring, but the prof cares and is well informed.

Mrs. Marquard is a straight forward teacher. She will tell you what will be on the quiz WAY before hand. She will work with the entire class and with you individually if necessary. She will also be easy on you with some online homeworks if there is stuff she did not go over specifically. I dreaded most of the long labs, but quizzes are open note!

Teacher is a great person with a great heart but not a good prof. If you are looking to teach yourself, then you found the right class. I took it online and the amount of time i had to spend on it was insane. She gave lectures but they weren't helpful. I feel as though she wants you to pass by her words but she doesn't have the needed material.

This prof gives such a vast amount of work for this course online it's unbelievable. Not even my senior admitt. classes were this vast with work and testing. So much home work and labs and discussions were given its hard to soak it all in and learn the material. She's not proficient for online teaching AT ALL. This class shouldn't be this hard.

This class is A LOT of work! You have a homework, a lab, a quiz and a discussion assignment almost every week so if you don't have time to stay on top of things, you will not make it. Professor M is approachable, helpful and understanding if things should come up. I recommend this class only if you can commit a few hours every single day.

Obviously calculus is a difficult subject. But Mrs. Marquard genuinely cares about your success and makes sure you understand the material. She's the most caring  professor I've had a Cleveland State. Just an all around amazing lady.

Very difficult trying to keep up with the course material week after week, especially with the discussion boards. For those who do not go on their computers frequently, I DO NOT recommend this course.

she was a good teacher, perky, happy and cracking jokes sometimes even though no one usually laughs. she taught the material that we had to learn well, even though it was a little hard. I had to take the SPT part of the course along with the PBL project which sucked, but all of the sections that semester had it too
Great teacher in stats, she was always there during office ours and would go over the homework. she is enthusiastic and the best stats teacher ever. Open book open notes.

I think she was more confused than we were most of the time. I don't like how the math department all works together based on what the faculty adviser says, so she really had to apply all her teachings through the adviser's techniques, which kinda through her off. She's a nice teacher, but can't teach too well. Don't buy the book btw!!

I wouldnt say she's very clear when explaining because you'll most likely end up being confused, but overall shes a nice teacher and very helpful. BUT BEWARE...her Practice Tests are NOT the same structure as the test will be. You'll most likely see a couple of problems that she hasn't went over.
Best teacher ever! she's so helpful and clear. She makes sure everyone understands what she says even if she has to repeat it a million times. take her if possible!
Nicest math teacher ever! She is extremely clear and hints to material that will be on tests. We did homework problems in class so the homework grade is a guaranteed A. Take her if you can
Really enjoyed her online stats class.

She is the nicest professor I have ever encountered. She gets excited about what she is teaching. She does sometimes come off as an elementary teacher...especially when she sais, "Onesies, twosies, threesies etc..." but she is SO nice and really easy to understand bc of that. I did very well in her class and highly recommend her!

The most helpful professor that I've ever encountered.  It's a tough course with a lot of work, but she really wants everyone to succeed.  Just a really pleasant and kind person.  I took this class online.
Nicest woman in the world. Treats us like 3rd graders sometimes but it works because calculus seems so easy because of her! Take her she's great!!
I'm in high school, taking her class and I still understand :)

Best math professor I've had! Gives lots of extra credit, and is very understanding and helpful. Goes at a slower pace and helps often with the online homework. No textbook needed, she uses free online textbook.
Love her as a professor! Have taken her twice and makes this hard work so much easier! Likes making it seem relevant in the real world. Don't buy book
Professor Marquard is awesome! Such a sweet lady! I was really nervous about calculus but she made it very easy to learn. i recommend her 100%

online class. She let me do the midterm & final via webcam which was awesome. Overall, there's a lot of assignments but they don't take too long so if you keep up with them you'll be fine. She's quick to grade and gives good feedback.
Had him for content area reading in '02? He was the best! What a loss for CSU. Hope he's enjoying D.C.
Completely online, with no office hours, and was not that easy to communicate with. Not much help if you need to make up work with a valid excuse.

Strict grading criteria but all of the rubrics are posted so follow them. There's a weekly quiz, 3 discussion posts, weekly journals and occasional video reflections. The movies and readings tend to be lengthy.
Most of the class is based around a big field experience project. Professor Martensen is nice most of the time but can can be in bad moods some days. Mostly good here, but not a perfect 10.

She never goes over any of the information on any of the exams and is unclear on assignments due dates, etc. Her class is not on blackboard so you have to guess on what your grade is. Prepare for a 30 hour field work experience project (internship) and presentation.

She is an ok professor, her lectures were always long and boring and she is not very good at describing an assignment or projects. Her directions are misleading and confusing, but overall if you read what you are suppose to and do the work she ask and ALWAYS SHOW UP TO CLASS you will get an A.
She is terrible at communicating with you and is awful at helping you. Two tests and never really covered any material.

Class was online, had a quiz every week that always had multiple typos and wrong answers. Also took all 6 weeks to get grades for week 1 work. It looks like she just let her TA run the class. Didn't respond to a single email the entire class.

Great class, awful teacher. Final exam is over two chapters, but you spend the last 3 weeks of class sitting trough peoples Field experience presentations. Never clear on what she wants done, especially when it came to the field experience packet and the E-Portfolio. Has limited sports background (Volleyball coach at John Carroll).

This class is only 2 days a week since you have to do a 30 hour "field experience" (or internship). Her powerpoints are based off the textbook (I think they're actually from the publisher), and her tests are easy if you pay attention/take notes. You'll do well if you try.
OK

the professor is funny, makes you count off to be in groups to discuss handouts every class. which I thought was very middle school. Had to write to papers called action which was a total drag. Also you graded on attendance and participation. Every thing was on power point slides, we watched short films. the book 4 class is written n sold by him
Easy A. Most show up to class. Book was an easy read. Stress free class for graduating MBA student !!

Dr.Martin explains concepts in a clear and relocatable manner, and provides a lot of clarity in terms of assignments he requires. I really enjoyed his exams, which consisted of case scenarios in essay format instead of multiple choice. His lectures can seem a little rehearsed at times, but he makes it relevant and memorable for the students!

Good instructor, he was really active and funny in the class. we had watched lot's of interesting videos and they were really useful to me. His grades are not bad but he really wants you to write every details you can. His papers are not so hard to do but take time. Ask questions to this guy he likes it.
Horrible! The worst professor. I had him 2 years ago I'm glad I remembered to give him a review. Do not take him you won't learn anything other than his family history... who cares ...

BORING!  However, take Dr. Martin for an easy A.  Just don't expect to get anything other than a grade out of the class:  I can't imagine using anything he taught in my career.  I may be rough, but this man provides a real snooze-fest.  Plus, EVERYthing he says is SOOOO rehearsed.  Sponteneity is  this man's strong point!
Makes course content real world applicable. Very enthusiastic and energetic.  Enjoyed the class very much.  All coourse exams and cases are essays and papers.
Can you say, "Self-absorbed?"  I don't think I've ever met a person who thought more highly of himself than Harry Martin does!
Did a great job with a lot of material in a short period of time. If your looking to just slide by this is not the class for you.
His class was bored. He graded hard on papers. I was dissappointed the grade he gave me B+, I was expecting A.

Dr Martin is a good instructor, but not great.  He was not the most exciting lecturer, but he was not too bad.  Attendance is absolutely required, as is participating in class.  Remember to speak out often is you want to receive a full participation grade.  Unless you want content overlap I would not take both MRL 577 and MRL 604 with Dr. Martin.

He required us to buy a book by him and structured the class around it, the class could possible be better with an actual text book.  He loves to hear himself talk, but bores everyone else.  Really wastes an incredible amount of time. Hear he's okay in the fall/spring but really awful in  the summer.  Same class as 577, big waste of time.

Extremely nice man. Course could be titled "common sense". Its useless, but he is so nice it doesn't really bother you. Very long winded & forces you to do redundant & silly self inflection exercises, terribly boring but  a fairly easy class. Oh & when he tells a joke, give him a courtesy chuckle because he isnt funny, but he waits for the laughs.
he is so good!

It was a nice class, could have been better. Prof is nice but has failed to design a good course structure, too much emphasis on attendance & class participation. Sometimes it seemed like a kindergarten class where you have to attend. Some sections of the course were very redundant. In all, a nice class but I would take someone else if I were you.
Good teacher.
Good teacher, he really likes what he is doing.
Great professor. He really wanted his students to do well.  Only had 2 case assignments and 2 exams so not too much of a work overload. Would take another class with him.

I must say he is well prepared for his class. However, on the most important aspect of student interest i.e. course design, he fails miserably. Has too much emphasis on essay writing skills rather than the matter itself. Also, attendance is mandatory as big share of grades depend on it. Just talk anything and you get participation points for it.

Overall, I'm somewhat-satisfied with him.  There were some papers and an essay exam.   When I asked him to look at my draft for the paper, he REFUSED.       He said he would only give me advice on my paper but he wouldn't look over my draft.     Eventually, later, he DID look at my draft and the only advice he could give is "provide more detail."

Dr. Martin made chemistry much easier to learn, despite being online due to COVID. You will still need to put in time studying and under the concepts. His assignments were straight forward and the test questions were very similar to the homework. The majority of your grade comes from your test and he does offer extra credit on them.

Dr. Martin made chemistry much easier to learn, despite being online due to COVID. You will still need to put in time studying and under the concepts. His assignments were straight forward and the test questions were very similar to the homework. The majority of your grade comes from your test and he does offer extra credit on them.

Prof. Martin will take the time to explain material if you are struggling. He responds quickly to emails and makes expectations very clear. You will need to set considerable time aside to read and do HW, but this will pay off on the exams, because exams and HW come from Pearson. If you pay attention and do the work, you will succeed.

One-in-a-lifetime professor. Did not over-complicate topics or ask tricky questions. What he teaches is what he grades! Very approachable for questions. Responds to emails quickly. Homework, practice exams, and review sessions help a lot. Extra credit built into exam+hw. Chem is hard but he did not mind repeating until we understood!

I dont understand why he has bad reviews! I suck at chemistry and I had Dr. Martin for chem 1 & 2. Hes great. , seriously. Just do the practice problems in the back of the book and the homework. We had plenty of opportunity for extra credit throughout the semester.

I personally didn't find him to be a good professor. It was his first time teaching CHM262 and he seemed very unwilling to do any extra work to help students understand. He's a funny guy, but I basically taught myself the whole course. So far, I failed the first two exams despite the countless hours I studied for them ): No curves or extra credit.

Dr. Martin is great! He records and then posts the lectures later in the day, which is really helpful for students with hectic schedules. HW through pearson is the best way to prepare for the exams, but they're pretty time consuming. Dr. Martin is always available to help or answer questions and he walks through the problems in class, which helps.

Needs more material/recorded lectures to prepare for difficult homework and exams. Just giving you the basic formulas in the lectures and dynamic study modules is useless. I had several other Chem teachers that were magic. This guy likes his research. He will answer your questions. I would not recommend this guy, take in person!

While professor Martin is a funny guy, he is not a good professor. Do not take him unless you want to be teaching yourself or dropping his course. He seems to be unprofessional in the sense that on his syllabus his office hours are not stated, instead it says, "Office Hours: that is a great question!!".

Martin is one of the best professors I have had so far. He is extremely easy to understand and answers any question you have. Show up to class, as he will often tell you if there are specific things to know for exams. Makes concepts clear and makes the math portions of chemistry easy

Dr. Martin really cares about student learning. I sent him a list of HW questions I had trouble with before an exam, and he went over all of them in class. He is good at helping students to understand complex/abstract ideas - as a non-tradit'l student I hadn't seen chem in a long time - and I felt comfortable asking for clarifications to learn.

Dr. Martin is a nice funny guy who is always available for help. However, his exams are really really hard. The final was excruciating and is worth too much of the final grade percentage. No curves and no extra credit AT ALL. My grade did not reflect the extreme amount of work i put into this class which is upsetting.

He is my favorite prof that I have. He means it when he says use his office hours, he will sit with you for however long it takes you to get the help you need. He is funny in class and made my two hour class as enjoyable as possible. If you study, you will get an A. If not, you will not get an A. He is the best!!!

He is my favorite prof that I have. He means it when he says use his office hours, he will sit with you for however long it takes you to get the help you need. He is funny in class and made my two hour class as enjoyable as possible. If you study, you will get an A. If not, you will not get an A. He is the best!!!

Matias is one of the most genuine humans being youll ever come across. As a professor he is understanding of students in every aspects. Makes material as clear, interesting and fun to learn about. He is also beyond accessible for any extra assistant and will work with you on anything you ask for help on.

An absolute sweetheart. I love Matias' classes because they require work and effort, but he is entirely dispensable to the class for review, explanation, and support. A teacher who excels in his profession both in actually teaching new information as well as supporting and respecting students.

One of the best professors I have ever had the privilege of knowing! He pushes you to try even if you are unsure of an answer and is always available if you need extra help! Absolutely loved having to attend the Cleveland International Film Festival and having to do an assignment based off a Spanish film.

Professor Martinez-Abeijon is one of the best professors I've ever had. He is very invested in his students and is a very well-prepared professor. Even a long class with him feels like it's over in a flash. If you try your best you will pass. On his oral exams, don't script it: just have a conversation even if it doesn't sound really smooth yet.

Professor Martinez-Abeijon is an excellent professor. He knows his topic and teaches with a clear passion for Spanish. If you participate in class and put forth effort you will do very well in his classes. His lectures are far from boring, he includes many, many activities (written, verbal, and listening) inside his lectures.
Always more than willing to help you. Super nice guy.

Maybe it was just the subject, but this was one of the most difficult classes I have taken. Multivariable calculus is no joke. Professor Martins makes his lectures enjoyable and the concepts better to grasp, but the class is still difficult. Make sure to show up to every lecture, take good notes, and go through all of the study guide problems.

Maybe it was just the subject, but this was one of the most difficult classes I have taken. Multivariable calculus is no joke. Professor Martins makes his lectures enjoyable and the concepts better to grasp, but the class is still difficult. Make sure to show up to every lecture, take good notes, and go through all of the study guide problems.

I took multivariable calculus and differential equations with this professor, definitely recommend. Gives ample extra credit opportunities. Goes out of his way to make sure his students understand the material by giving us class time and extra practice. I loved going to his class he makes higher level math classes easy to learn.
He is one of the best math professors I've had. He's funny and he really explains the material clearly. He wants to see everyone succeed and he tries his best to make sure that everyone understands.

There is no better teacher at CSU than this man. Makes material easy to understand and his tests are so reasonable. Gives you his old tests to study from. Honestly a good man. I wish more teachers were this reasonable.

Amazing man, made hard material easy to understand. Hard homework but these problems aren't on the exam. Exams were medium difficulty, but exactly like the practice exams he provides. Do the book problems from the study guide and the practice exams and you'll be fine.
Fantastic Instructor, Really cares about the students, Wants everyone to understand

Martins was a cool dude, but I couldn't pay attention to anything he was saying. Theory in Linear algebra is boring and he didn't do example problems just explained the theory. Tests are exactly like the reviews so even if you don't know what the heck he is talking about you can still do good on the tests.
he got some mental problems  he makes the easiest thing as hard as possible avoid him

He is the worst professor I've had. Hehands out packets and doesn't explain.  My biggest issues were he explained in theory and his lectures never met matched the homework or test and he is a very tough grade. If you have a sign error he will give you less than half credit. Martin's is a death sentence in Linear Algebra.

Dr. Martinz made Numerical Analysis a very difficult course. The lectures were theory heavy, a good thing, but the questions asked on the homework and exams were very difficult and were not, entirely, based on the theory covered in the course. There wasn't very much HW assigned, but what was assigned, required a substantial amount of work.
The class was super easy; anyone who gets less than an A should look into getting a business degree.
Great prof. highly recommended

He is a good professor for a difficult subject however at times his math was off and students had to step in to help.  That is not good for students like me who already have a hard time in math.  Half the time I didn't know what the heck was going on because he was always changing his method to solve impossible problems...
Great professor - provides very powerful, accurate information about calculus as both a general topic and a specific topic Would definitely take again!

The textbook helped my grade more than anything. The lectures for class were okay, but they were pretty much only a basic background of what we were really expected to know for the homework and tests. Basically, you'll get a good grade if you're willing to work for it.
The most stressful class I have ever taken

All the rumors you'll hear are true.  The good ones and the bad ones.  What's important is that the good rumors are true.  He is probably the most laid back professor I've had, he likes to have a good time in class and is funny sometimes.  The class was a little frustrating but in the end, everything was fine.

I'm sure he is good with calc cause it has a textbook but number theory is horrible. No textbook, expects you to memorize proofs for tests which the whole class is about and very rarely does any actual number examples. Homework assumes you have past knowledge in number theory that he won't help with. And never expect a respond email
recommend him

Very good professor to take for calculus! He is very clear on concepts and what is expected from you on tests and quizzes. Does a lot of examples in class and answers all questions. He is always there during his office hours and you can get even more help their. Would recommend this class to anyone!

Tests were open book, open notes and w/calculator. Let us decide when the tests were. Often took up to a half hour to explain one problem, which left most of us more confused than before we started. Sense of humor was good, though, once you got used to it.

This man should not be teaching a 100 level class. I feel that he has also lost the fundamentals of teaching. If he did not have a terrific teaching assistant I honestly would not have passed the class. If you want to be confused and feel lost by all means take the class, but if not steer clear.

The review below of the student who had 118 and 119 is perfect.  I am currently taking 117 with him and have no idea what is going on.  Too old to teach, confuses himself and absolutely confuses the class.  Often makes mistakes and then tries to work with it which only makes my understanding of the mathematical process worse!
Very witty. Never directly answered questions asked of him; always answered in the form of another question. Will definately consider another math class if given him as a professor again.
Never takes attendance. Class really simple. tests really easy w/ open notes & calc. He is nice and easy. Class unstructured.

overall, a solid teacher. plus he speaks english which is not common in math departments. standard grading, didn't curve in my class. drops the lowest. he is nice, no homework either. its optional, obviously do it if you want an A. try to take him.

he will flat out tell you he does not know the correct terminology, then when your going over a problem he doesnt answer it the way it is asked. he doesnt use the book to teach just go over problems and get your test questions from it. he teaches just off the top of his head and fets off track telling stories.

Had 118 + 119 with this fool. Horrible. Goes too far to teach. Literally loses whole class mentally and physically. Try to withstand him because you can get through it without his help. Whatever book you have, read it and take notes and never listen to him. Listening to him will just confuse the hell out of you. Speaks English and still confusing!!
Is one of the best professors I've ever had.  I never had great success in Math before his class.  But the way he explained things just brought it all together for me.  I ended up doing great.

You dont have to go to his class, becuase its the same as not going!  He  cant teach flat out, you will need to teach yourself everything.  I dunno how he ever became as a professor.  He is a nice guy, but sorry just cant teach at all.
the worst teacher i have ever had. didn't explain anything. didn't give a lecture. just asked if we had questions and then didn't answer them.
A math prof who actually speaks English!  Explains things well and has very short tests.  Recommended.
Class was simple and easy....open note tests everytime!
Great Guy. Can get kinda boring on easy material.  However, makes class easy and a good learning experience.
Better be able to teach yourself; and from a not-so-good textbook. More on ideas of how algebra works than on specific approaches to solving problems. Curves on tests, so if all to bad, you're fine.
He was very unclear, when you asked a question he would not answer it.  He would not explain anything, I would never take his class again!
VERY NICE. He will bend over backwards for you. Take his classes if you can
Really nice guy and entertaining. Doesn't explain things well at times but is willing to help. Flexible with grades and pushes students to try harder.

As previously mentioned, she is a very hard grader for a class that really shouldn't have been (a lot of writing even though it was not a WAC class). Not too considerate of illness and hospitalization and did not explain things very well.

This class was a lot more difficult then I felt it should have been. The assignments are a bit boring and the professor is very strict with grading. There seemed to be no way to receive 100% on a assignment. The final project was probably the worse. Very time consuming and unrealistic.

I thought this class was going to be an easy online class to take while I was taking all of my difficult required classes. Unfortunately, this class is a lot of work. The work is not always hard but is very time consuming. Two papers around 10 pages, discussion boards every week, assignments due on friday, a long final exam, and various other stuff

We had weekly assignments that were due every Friday, but they were not difficult. There were no quizzes or exams so that was great. The discussion board questions were relatively simple and easy. Just show her that you put effort and thought into the assignments and you will get an A.
I really enjoyed this class. Everything was clear and consise. She gives great feedback and assignments are fun but, you still learn a lot.

LOVE this professor (probably because she mainly teaches at John Carroll University) .  Although she only teaches an online class here, it was the best class I have ever taken.  Challenging, but rewarding.  You actually use what you learn in real life situations.  Would highly recommend taking her if possible even if its just as a filler class.

Definitely a harder online course, required more time than I was expecting, BUT, book was helpful. Easy to email her and she always emailed back right away. Super understanding. Syllabus seemed intimidating but I LOVED this course.

Online course, with weekly assignments and big final project. Weekly discussion boards, not mandatory. No tests, no final. Responds to emails on the same day. Gives detailed powerpoints weekly that have same info from the textbook, so book not necessarily needed but helpful to have.
Awww!! Shes so nice! I had her for two courses and both was great. She is SO understanding during COVID. It was a relief knowing that at least one of my teachers understood.
Awww!! Shes so nice! I had her for two courses and both was great. She is SO understanding during COVID. It was a relief knowing that at least one of my teachers understood.

Dr. Kate is the most amazing professor you will ever have. Being in the middle of a pandemic, she is so understanding and cares so much about her students. Her kindness radiates through her emails and the way she writes. She deserves everything! She is an amazing person. Her class is interesting and you learn a lot. Class is easy as long as you try

Professor Masley goes above and beyond for her students. She is clear on everything and is a very fair grader. Probably the best class I've taken in terms of clear grading criteria and helpfulness from the professor.  Would retake.
Amazing teacher! easy to get in contact with and the syllabus is very clear. Not a lot of tests, mostly discussion. Always gives great feedback and is very supportive.

Dr. Masley is one of the best professors at Cleveland State University! I also had her for HSC 344 Social Issues in Healthcare, and she is amazing. Kate isn't your average professor, she puts her time and effort into helping her students stay motivated and succeed in her class and in life. Very knowledgeable, experienced, and has lots of information to share. Took her online and wish I could have taken her in class! Phenomenal and inspiring! Lots of reading but its interesting & they are easy.

She is wonderful! She is the most warm, caring, and understanding professor I have ever come into contact with. When taking this class someone close to me passed away. Dr. Masley kindly spoke to me while I cried on the phone for probably an hour.  Who does that?!? This professor does.  Take her class. I wish all my courses were taught by her.
Kate is BY FAR the best online professor ever. Whenever you need help, she is just a phone call or text away. SO caring and awesome. my favorite teacher!
I've had the pleasure of taking 2 courses with this wonderful professor. By far THE BEST professor at CSU!!! Kind, helpful, and intelligent!
very helpful teacher, respoonds to e-mails quickly. tests aren't easy but aren't hard either. a lot of reading but it is do able...take this class with her
Great Professor!!! Highly recommended. Took online course, everything was explained and clear of what to do. HELPFUL, REACHABLE, UNDERSTANDING, CARING... could go on forever about KATE!!

Took this class online, and was the best choice ever! She is so nice and extremely helpful! I have NEVER had a professor so willing to go out of her way to ensure that her students understand the material! Highly recommend!
Online course. She's awesome. Class is easy. Weekly discussions, 2 exams online. Highly suggest her for this course. And I highly suggest the online version.
Best professor I've had since coming to Cleveland State!
Best professor ever!

EXCELLENT, CARING, THOUGHTFUL, KIND, REALISTIC. ENFORCE LEARNING. CARES DEEPLY ABOUT HUMANITY. TAKES PRIDE IN HER TEACHING CAREER. SHE IS THE BEST PROFESSOR I HAVE EVER HAD. IF MOST PROFESSORS WAS LIKE THIS WOMAN OR MOST PEOPLE LIFE WOULD BE MUCH BETTER.THIS WOMAN DESERVES AN AWARD.
she is the best teacher i have had!!!! just great! if you can TAKE HER!
SUCH A GREAT TEACHER!!! MAN I COULD NOT HAVE HAD A BETTER TEACHER FOR THIS CLASS! IF MORE TEACHER WERE LIKE HER IT WOULD BE GREAT!!! IT WAS AN EASY CLASS BUT I LEARNED SO MUCH! IF YOU CAN TAKE HER!

DO not suggest. Good guy, bad teacher. All of his lectures are hand written and impossible to follow or read. Only grades in the class are your exams. Unless you're a graduate student and have already mastered chemistry, you will have not one clue of what this guy is talking about in class.

If you are a slow learner, I suggest you runaway from this class as fast as you can. Fit to teach PhD students not undergrads. worst professor I have ever had.. during lecture he hand writes his notes and barely says a word so you may as well just teach yourself. Exams are ridiculous but are curved about 20% and the final grade is curved too. I feel like I didn't even learn ochem

If you are at CSU, you are out of luck. He's horrible but better than De Paoli. You won't fail the class but you might not get the grade you want. Notes are all hand written in class, and very hard to follow. Draws a lot of structures, with very few explanations behind the definitions to them. Liked how he would email class notes, but if you were in class or not they were still hard to follow. Very knowledgable, and kind. Just not how I learn.

This professor is unique and may look scary! But he is very intelligent and beneficial. He puts the time in explaining the knowledge needed for the course. Invest in this professor he will work with you in understanding chemistry outside of class!
Organic chemistry II: Difficult for sure.... but doable.  Incredibly knowledgeable. Ask questions as he is very open to questions throughout lecture and beyond.  Don't just zone out.

The absolute worst professor I have ever taken in my entire life. THE GREATEST PROFESSOR OF ALL TIME. WANT TO LEARN ABOUT THE WONDERS OF CHEMISTRY?!?!?! THIS MAN IS THE MAN TO TAKE YOU ON THE VOYAGE OF CHEM AND LEARN ALL THE GREAT SECRETS AND HIDDEN MEANINGS OF IT.

Ignore, ignore, ignore! If you have any other option for a teacher, take them instead. This teacher does curve but the things on the tests are nothing that we even really learned about in class. It felt like graduate school, except my major is not chemistry. His exams are beyond difficult. Spent a lot of time studying, could do the questions in the book and get most right and then get C's on test?!?!?! you will never ever find anything he asks on a test in a book or online. the test are just insanely difficult. he writes on chalkboard, lectures are all over the place and do not make sense. Guys just avoid it.  Im studying for y MCATs now and besides Mass Spec and IR I have retained nothing! It was an extremely monotone lecture that I never skipped but still did not find it beneficial.  Hes absolutely brilliant but really bad test maker!

Come to class and pay attention! He is tough but practical. You will learn a lot if you study and do the end of chapter questions and practice tests. Repetition is key and if you really want to learn OChem, take his class. If your lazy, find someone else or you'll be sorry.

he teaches very fast. I'd recommend learning the topic before class to at least give yourself a shot at keeping up with his writing on the board. His tests are intense but he is fair. just work on those practice tests he gives and you will survive.

I still shudder thinking of our ACS final that was worth 40% of the grade. I agree with the prevous rater that info and structures are written too fast on the board:this is not a topic a voice recorder could help. He did not teach from the book, but students who did well worked tons of probelms (you must buy the solutions manual). My first C+ :(

Very, very intelligent man. All notes are written on the blackboard so class attendance is imperative! He is very willing to provide extra help and is truly interested in the success of his students. Overall the class/tests are extremely difficult but if you are up for the challenge you will learn a lot. My favorite prof. at CSU and a great guy!

Lectures are all written on blackboard so quickly that you can't concentrate on the lecture because you're too busy writing.  Even with studying and practice problems I still couldn't succeed in this class.  He is very smart, and genuinely cares for his students, but the tests are insane.  Good luck.  You're gonna need it.
She is good at lecturing. Used notes from the lecture more than the book. Her tests require a lot writing. She was very rude to some of her students.

She is a great lecturer and really knows her history.  I never opened the book in her class just took notes over the lectures, which basically makes being in class a must. All of the tests are essay and really long intact I found it difficult to get everything down that I wanted to say. If you take notes and Study you can get an A, if you don't I would imagine that it would be difficult to pass. Overall I felt as if I learned an amazing amount about European history.
I do not recommend this professor. All the tests were essay format and it is impossible to get an A in the class. She plays favorites and I hear she is rude to some students. Her notes are horrible.
Very good teacher, explains things well. Tests are hard though, IDs and essays. The class is reasonable, but you definitely have to earn your grade. Good teacher overall.

Good lecturer. Can be a bit dry, but overall a good experience. Focuses on the economic and political more than social and cultural aspects of the time period (17th and 18th Century Europe). Descent essay-type exams.

For a 101 course, this was ridiculous. I took the course online, the amount of material was phenomenal. 2-4 thirty minute lectures, a forty minute video, reading a chapter in the text and sourcebook. Two discussions and a quiz are due every week. Working 4 days a week, I found limited time for her class.

I worked very hard to get an 'A' in this class. I feel I have really increased my knowledge of this period (1640-). The lectures are more important than the book, and grading on a paper is stricter then on blue-book tests. But none of it was 'easy.'

Great lecturer! Dr. Mastboom really knows her stuff, and gives very interesting and dynamic lectures, and welcomes questions as well.
