Amazing professor.  She's very passionate about what she teaches, and is very knowledgeable.  She's challenging which, if you're in an upper level history class, you prolly will appreciate.  Only set back is she could students in a bit more on what will be on exams.
grreat teacher...highly recommended

descent lecturerer but considering she gives no study guide of any kind and no hints at all of what will be on tests(other then "you are responcible for everything covered")Not to mention things like saying a draft of a term paper looks good and then telling you on the final draft that their are all kinds of problems with your arguement not recmd.
She is a great proffessor.  She was very challenging, which is what classes should be.  if you truly want to learn history, than take her.
A great example of what a teacher should be.

Mario is an amazing professor, I'm genuinely confused about why he is ranked so low. For one he is not a tough grader and he really takes his time to make sure you understand and get the work. He wants everyone to get an "A" and makes it nearly impossible for one not to receive one.

Mario is an amazing professor, I'm genuinely confused about why he is ranked so low. For one he is not a tough grader and he really takes his time to make sure you understand and get the work. He wants everyone to get an "A" and makes it nearly impossible for one not to receive one.

I really like Super Mario. Hes a very nice, positive instructor. I have to admit the class was very hard for me. I dont like math and dealing with financial budgets, but I did learn some things that will stick with me. I wanted to drop this class so much but he told me to stick with it. I did drop it but I went back. Thanks to him and my advisor.

He is really an awesome professor. He really cares about his students, which i think is rare these days. He is easy to get a hold and will steer you in the right direction for the class. I would for sure take him again! The Super Mario!

I swore I would not take a class without a book, here I am taking one with a book that we barely used. He is so confusing and unorganized. He jumps topics too much for me. Not a good teacher. His class requires attendance, but he does not teach anything about Economics the entire time. He is disorganized about 70% of the time. One of the best professors I have ever had. He relates he teaches to the real world. I am not a finance major and I learned a lot about things I will need in my personal life. He is a good teacher. If you pay attention and do the problems in class, you will do fine on the quizes. Every quiz will be a function of the test. Do the homework. If you do this you will get an A. Mastrandrea is a great teacher and a great person.  Anyone complaining about the class is probably a person who doesn't show up, or is getting a bad grade. really unreasonable, cant keep things straight and penalizes class for it

Great professor. Learned a great deal and enjoyed his teaching methods. Would definitely take classes with him again.

he is very nice, but very scary....everytime a whining student complains he bends the rules....THIS IS GRAD SCHOOL PEOPLE....i also so think it is very dumb when he limits the amount of pages for your project..whats up with the stupid memo page..what a waste of paper.. i could have used that page to write important info. about my company..he is ok

He's a good guy, but not the best communicator. Do the reading, STUDY, and pay attention in class, as he really tries to go over the quiz problems so people understand. Great professor, teaches from experience not the book. not a hard class if you understand TVM.
Do not take it with him. Very unorganized and will grade you unjustly so if you do take it with him make sure you suck up to him!!
asset to csu

one of the best i have had

This guy was a fill-in at B-W for a mid-level Finance course, and he was easily the worst prof I ever had. Some of these people are telling the truth he may be an easy A or B but I honestly have not learned a thing that I didn't already know prior to taking the class.  The concepts that he tries to teach is just a refresher from past Accounting and Math classes I've taken.  I didn't get any core Finance info the only way to learn is to read the book.
Assignments could be clearer but overall it was a really good class. Discussion posts, usually read a chapter a week, and one final paper. Pretty easy.
Assignments could be clearer but overall it was a really good class. Discussion posts, usually read a chapter a week, and one final paper. Pretty easy.

I was recommended to take this WAC course with this professor and did well. The paper was kind of rough but you get to choose what topic you want. There is 1 midterm and 1 final, discussion boards and two homework assignments you will need the book for. The work can be stressful some weeks but it is an easy A if you put in the time and effort.

This is an online class that contains weekly discussion boards, 2 tests, a presentation, and a final paper. She grades discussion board posts very generously, her tests didn't use much of the material, and she takes FOREVER to grade the paper and presentations. She does not give good feedback so don't bother submitting a draft. Decently easy class.

I had another prof. starting this online class but she took over after 2nd week so i think this may b y the course was disorganized. The work load was lite-moderate. Easy grader on discussion board. Responses to e-mail questions promptly and pleasantly. Takes FOREVER to grade big project and final paper. She has trouble using Blackboard software.
Dr. Matheny is very sweet. The class is made up of weekly discussion boards, two quizzes, two homeworks, and a final paper. It's an easy A if you put in the effort.

The course's attendance req, posting & replying to discussion questions, was tough, since I found few contributions worthy of a full read.  Altho' I asked for more meaningful feedback on our paper grading, I received none.  Most egregious, I notified Dr. Matheny that answers to quizzes were being revealed by the software, which she had setup wrong.

Had her for intro to Urban Studies online.  I loved the course.  She assigned 2 papers.  They were both interesting; I learned a lot and the research paper on Cleveland inspired me to start 2 new businesses.  She is a gem.  Wish there were more teachers like her.  There is an online quiz every other week. blackboard participation every week.
Online class... However, it took her forever to grade the papers. If you had a bad grade you wouldn't know  your grade until two assignments later.

She is very helpful and straight forward with her assignments and reading. She kept all the homeworks as interesting as possible and gave students a choice between many interesting topics for the final paper. She is VERY accommodating for giving extra days if there is a personal issue. But, she probably won't put up with it more than once.
Easy Class. Nice Teacher. Just come for class and field trips and you will pass without a problem
No Comments

Very nice, she will work with you.  Class is extremely easy...unless your a dolt that doesn't like to get out of bed.  Everyone needs an easy A don't you think?  As long as you attend the field trips and lectures, take notes you will hardly ever read the book.
Tests are easy and not hard to study for, the content is simple and does a good job of explaining it, if you want an easy A take him. hell even help you out on exams

Class Participation is Mandatory, but you will still do good without going if you understand concepts. Study guides he puts up are exactly whats going to be on the test. Study material will be on his powerpoints. Complete the study guide and study exactly everything and youll do fine. Very understanding and cares about students, Def. Would retake.

Professor Nicholas is very genuine, understanding and very clear on everything. Tests are straight forward. You have to be in class because the examples he provides in class will be in test. 4 exams and one group project. Happy to have him as a professor.

For the most part I though Dr. Mathew was great. I took his class online & everything was spelled out for you in the syllabus. As long as you're giving good effort, he's understanding. No test, Journal each week of the class, discussion boards for each module & final paper & final project. Really simple class, if you keep up
The class itself is easy and very manageable, however, his attitude and passive-aggressiveness in his emails is very frustrating and rude. He does not offer help if you are unclear on something.

OH MY GOD. do yourself a favor and DO NOT TAKE HIM!!!!!!!!!!!!!! I HATE this class. He doesn't even lecture! he just posts powerpoints and expects you to read hundreds of pages from the textbook. If you go to him with any concern he's very unempathetic. You will literally need to spend probably 3 hours a day on this class if you truly want to pass.

For the most part I though Dr. Mathew was great. I took his class online & everything was spelled out for you in the syllabus. As long as you're giving good effort, he's understanding. No test, Journal each week of the class, discussion boards for each module & final paper & final project. Really simple class, if you keep up

Too serious. Most of the students' majors have NOTHING to do with the class, and it is obviously a road block in order to graduate. He doesn't care. I had to put most of my efforts into this class more than my main courses.

This class was a pain in my butt. 16 page paper, powerpoint project, weekly discussions, weekly 1-2 page journals, heavy weakly readings. I mean you name it, we've done it. Participation is a major thing, I don't know what for and he's a really big stickler about how long every dang assignment has to be. I would never take this class again!!!!!!!!!

Dr. Mathew was great when it came to giving us feedback & responding to emails quickly. What I did not exactly like was the tests and quizzes. The first few quizzes, along with exam 1, were not based on the book or the powerpoints, which made it difficult to pass them. However, from that point onward, the rest were based on the powerpoints & book.
He is condescending and passive aggressive if his emails. The class is easy but I'd prefer not to have to communicate with him.

The exams are extremely hard and confusing, under a time limit, AND you get locked out when you hit next. Passive aggressive in his announcements and emails which deters you from asking for help. Got bad reviews so decided to give an EC assignment, but on top of all the other work, he stated that each post had to be AT LEAST 4 pages long...0/10

Get ready to be stressed the entire semester. This guy is ridiculous when it comes to tests, while taking them you can't go back and change your answers or review your test before submitting bc he locks your answers when you move ahead. He will call you out in his announcements and make you look dumb. 0/10 recommend, this guy is terrible.

One of the best professor's I've ever had. Everything is spelled out verbatim so it is hard to misinterpret how to do your assignments. It was one journal, and one discussion post every week. He is very understanding, super nice, just ask and he will answer. Very informative class would recommend that everyone take it if going into health care.
For some reason he is really strict on grading online participation. Said make one post and comment on two others as the requirement, but I did more than that and only got an 80% in participation?

Class is hard, especially online. 8 quizzes, 4 exams, occasional DBs, one extra credit assignment. Professor Mathew, though, is helpful & responds to emails quickly. Don't really need book. First 2 exams were nothing from PP or book. Rest from PP's. Good professor, difficult online course material.

Every week: discussion post & 1 pg. journal. 8-10 pg. paper (just combine the journals) & 25-30 slide PwrPt. instead of final/midterm. Very good use of Blackboard; everything is organized for the student's needs. Provides feedback on journals and grades everything within hours. Really passionate about class topic and wants positive student outcome.

Dr. Mathew is a great professor and truly nice guy. This class was fairly easy and enjoyable. It wasn't a class I stressed about and I actually got to enjoy/learn material without the stress of exams or quizzes. Instead we wrote journals and discussion boards, which was more meaningful. Take Dr. Mathew! He's great!!

Class is pretty difficult. Gotta memorize every little detail on his slides and really understand concepts. He wants you to succeed though. He's very helpful if you go to him and he tries to be funny in class which keeps it interesting.

He is a very understanding, empathetic, knowledgeable professor. He always has very interesting stories and jokes, I highly recommend him. As long as you pay close attention in class, study and memorize his materials, you will ace his class!

Took him for spring 13' HSC 305 culture and healthcare online, very easy!!!!! I would only take it online if I were you and only with this teacher! You have easy weekly assignments which consist of a couple of questions from the assignment and consist of being short answer, they are do every Friday by 11:30. That's it! Honestly, got an A:)
Very helpful professor. Professor Sam wants you to succeed but the material itself is hard to grasp esp. during summer semester. I'd recommend taking it in the fall or spring.

Online course was very organized and straight forward. The material was hard at times because there is so much stuff but Dr Mathews makes it easier. You don't want to take Pathology with anyone else. Responds to emails quickly and will answer any questions.

Dr. Mathew is a very respectable man with a great ability to teach. he's interesting, funny, and knows everything there is to know about anatomy. students frequently ask for his medical expertise. He's always available to review missed test questions and responds to emails quickly. He loves his job, we should all hope to be like this one day.

Matos is an excellent professor in terms of teaching the fundamentals of coding. A common complaint is his repetitive lecturing, but this ultimately helps to solidify concepts and gain understanding. READ THE BOOK, even though it is not required; a full reading of each chapter before exams WILL make or break your grade, trust me.

Matos may be a computer science genius, but his curriculum translates poorly to the school of business. 75% of the class failed exam 1, and up until the final, 50% of the class had a failing grade. Because so many people were on the verge of failing, he had no choice but to make the final very easy, and I ultimately passed the class because of it.

I have never received below a B in any course before. Visual Studio is used in class and for homework, but he expects handwritten code for part of the exams. Terrible lectures with mumbling and thick accent. He is the only teacher for 3 Information Systems core classes but thankfully I have an IT degree already so I am changing my major. Stressful!

Overall a great professor if you're willing to put the work in. Very repetitive, which in programming, is good. He really helps drive home important fundamentals. Although the textbook is not used during class time, READ IT. Thoroughly reviewing the chapters will make the exams much easier than relying on his powerpoints.

Matos is easily one of, if not, the best professors I have ever had. That being said, his class is NOT easy, it's tough and you have to work for it. The insight that is gained from his lectures is unmatched if you truly pay attention and do your homework intellectually and properly. Wish I had the opportunity to take his class again.

first off the material itself is hard, he does not help by not telling us what to review at all just tells you to read the chapters on top of that there is only 3 test and he does not curve just tells you to drop take again  and keep taking until u  pass also to pass his class you need an overall grade of 75% not 70% like every other normal class
Awful teacher, GOD AWFUL. Doesn't help students, talks for 2 hours cannot understand a single word coming out of his mouth not just because of his accent but also his low tone.

He drones on for nearly 2 hours, and says very little.  His lectures do nothing to help a student learn to write code.  Out of a normal-sized class, all but three people withdrew from the class, and the three that didn't had taken the class many times before.  Not recommended in early stages of learning programming.

Wonderfully clear. He explains complicated logic with easy to follow metaphors. Attendence wasn't mandatory, but his lectures were excellent, so I think missing them would mean a lot more work catching up. It was not an easy class, but I learned a TON! I wish he taught more classes, he's a really gifted teacher!

The most loved CIS professors & I've no idea why. He's very knowledgeable but he doesn't teach. His lectures are nearly 2 hrs long in which he rambles, in a low hard to hear tone, about everything except things that will help you succeed in the class & in programming. Make sure you thoroughly know Java before taking. Currently retaking this course.
Best CIS professor at CSU. Super helpful, teaches clearly.

This guy is awesome. He drills the topic into your brain with a great lecture and keeps you awake. after presenting an idea, he puts it in code to enhance understanding. He is very helpful and explains topics very well. Shortest 2 hour class feeling. Tests are tough and there are not too many, but put in the work and you will do well in his class.

Provides plenty of hands on experience during class, having the students code along with him.  A lot of material to cover in this class, but is spread out rather evenly. Gives challenging but reasonable assignments and tests, you come out of the course really knowing your stuff.

Matos is a great programming teacher. Sometimes he focuses more on the concept instead of the actual writing of the program, but this is not always a bad thing. Sometimes his homework problems area  little confusing but he will usually answer all questions you have. Fair teacher and a nice guy. Only take him if you fully understood CIS260, though.
Very pleasant professor. Very good at teaching and always has a good attitude and a smile. Teaches extremely well 100% recommended.

One of the best CIS professors at CSU. You might think the first couple of weeks that its going to be a very hard class, but really it isn't. There are about 3 exams(1 page of notes you can use on exam)  and homework . The final was optional, and it helped your grade. Just make sure you do ALL of your homework and you'll do well in class.
Best. Teacher. Ever.  Understands what it's like being a student and is 100% on our side, wants us to learn and understand instead of attendance, homeworks, and policies.

Probably the best professor at CSU.  Explains everything in depth, but in a manner accessible to a new student.  The tests and homework cover relevant material and you can see actual real world application for everything you do in class. I highly, highly recommend Dr. Matos.  If you can, take him!

Dr. Matos is just an excellent teacher.  He's friendly and approachable, and describes complicated material in easy to understand ways.  Also he's funny, but in a relevant way, such as anthropomorphizing the actions of the computer as it reads code.  Also he has a true passion for the material.  I wish he taught all my classes!

I had Dr. Matos for graduate databases. He was very helpful, spending extra time to help students. Tests and homework were clear and concise with well-communicated requirements. He went over tests and explained everything. He was a little disorganized but still returned tests and homework in a timely manner and kept us up to date on our grades.

not the best, but i didnt think she was the worst either. she could be stand-offish but i dont blame her because the students were so rude to her. lectures are very dull and she is very soft spoken and hard to hear so try and take a spot in the front if you can
gets off from pulling bs exam questions. it is possible to do the readings, study, come to class, and fail the course...that seems pretty counterproductive to me.

If you have any choice, do not take this teacher! She is whispher quiet and gets her kicks from tricking students. She assigns A TON of reading and rambles on. Doesn't make it fun, doesn't help her students. I regret taking this class!
Very unclear as to what she wants. Doesn't seem to care whether you succeed or not. Unprepared for lectures. Lots of reading. Trick questions on exams. By far my worst experience at CSU.
Sarah was a terrrible teacher. The information was not presented well. Nice person though
teaching ability is horrible

She makes no use of class time. Is Very unclear and very confusing.  Tests cover material that is not gone over in class and there is no review or pertinent information given to help you prepare for the test. By far the worst teacher I have ever had.
i have no respect for her as a teacher
awful professor. She thinks she is so slick, trying to give trick questions rather than genuine testing of actual knowledge. OOOh, she made me mad!
She is so quiet...there is no sitting in the back in that class
She loves to put essays on her tests...and you have to use her exact vocabulary or you will lose points.
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments

One of the worst, scratch that, the WORST professor I've ever had the displeasure of taking. As others have stated, her expectations are wholly unclear. When asked to clarify expectations, she states read the syllabus. Students must work amongst themselves to figure out assignments. Grading and rubric do not align at all and is subjective.

She never grades things on time, so you don't know where you stand in the class. She does not get back to students in a timely manner; Typically after the assignment is already due and turned in. This professor is never clear on what she wants. If you get on her bad side for any reason, expect her to grade you worse or fail you on assignments.
Expectations are unclear and grading is strictly subjective. When asked for further clarification, she is unable to adequately communicate her objectives and pushes it back on the student.

VERY unclear guidelines. Tough grader for seemingly no reason. AVOID this prof if you can. TERRIBLE. Group project is 25% of the grade... for an online class! She takes forever to grade (almost a month for the bigger assignments)! Does not seem to care about students. Rubric does not match syllabus. Highly doubt anyone gets an A in this class.
Hard grader, unclear about rubrics, makes this class way harder than it needs to be.

Dr. Matthews is a very tough grader. She rarely ever gives full credit and does not give much feedback so that you are able to fix your mistakes for the next assignment. She does not explain anything clearly. Gives 2-3 discussions each week plus 2 responses to each of those discussions. She also does not grade things in a timely manner. Avoid her.

Dr. Matthews was a horrible professor. She has no patience for students who are just starting to learn basic nursing. She points out their mistakes too often and never points out the successes her students accomplish. She is a very condescending and mean person. If you can, try to switch to another professor.

I had this professor and she was horrible. She is a very hard person to talk to and she has no sympathy for her students! Test are out of this world hard, with expectations of memorizing a whole book. If possible literally, just choose another teacher. She has times where she could be nice or somewhat caring but, more than likely not understanding!

Dr. Matthews is an awful professor. If you have her, do anything you can to switch. Her tests are awfully hard with no guidance on how to answer Nclex style questions before-hand. She tells you to meet her outside of class for help, but then ignores all emails trying to set up a time to meet. If i could give her a score less than 1, I would.

Bad at teaching. Expects you to memorize the textbook and do NCLEX questions w/o any practice. What she says in class may contradict the reading, but she tests on the book. She wouldn't always answer students' questions. There are no opportunities to review your exams. Doesn't respond to emails or have office hours. Many barely passed her class.

Get ready to memorize a 400 page book because thats what the tests are. She forgets about assignments, gives no direction, then grades them hard. Multiple people failing her tests and she does nothing about it. Doesnt meet with students. Blatantly ignores them. Gives ZERO extra credit. If you fail the class you can just try again next year.

Professor Matthews is very good at teaching the material but her tests are extremely hard! The questions for the test come straight from the book. She is willing to help and has flexible office hours.
The tests were inconsistent with what she said to study for. She says it will be easy and straightforward but never was. Every test was different so once you figured out how to study it was changed.

All you really need to know about this course is study and do the homework's and you'll pass no problem, he grades easy and all the material that is on the homework  and in the book is on the exams/ quizzes. If you have trouble in the course he has no problem helping you.

This man is both a phenomenal artist and professor, by far the best prof I have had so far. Hes very understanding towards artists of all skill levels and its guaranteed you will learn a lot in his courses. Attendance is required, but you will probably not be inclined to skip anyway. Highly recommend taking his classes!
I am very thankful for teachers like George who keep me on my toes, yet self-inspired. I would recommend George's classes to anyone interested in the Art/Design/Communication field.

One of the best professors I've had he was so helpful and very encouraging.  He took kept in mind that all students were not at the same skill level and used this to help them get better and never put anyone down.  There supplies to use in every class and he is incredibly talented.

He gave creative assignments and always typed the guidelines out for us in a clear way (rare for an art teacher!). He had a nice balance of knowing when to give advice and knowing when to just let us work something out on our own. He is also an amazing artist. Check out his website- you will be blown away!

Easily my favorite professor in Cleveland State. Fantastic teacher, wonderful personality and just a really cool guy. He is really nice and helpful in critiques and also will work with you to help you get better in the way you do art. Also is a fantastic artist, which is sadly rare in an art teacher. Love him.
You're learning from the best draftsman in Ohio when you take him. He's really down to earth and offers insight into the business aspect of art. Absolutely wonderful class!

This man is a genius... excellent critiques. office hours are great, is there when you need him.  caring, thoughtful, and all around a fabulous artist.  has wonderful insights on his techniques for drawing and is clear when he tries to explain it to you and how to better your drawings. take his classes if given the opportunity.
Excellent teacher!

Doc is a wonderful professor. He is extremely passionate and is very knowledgeable. Yes he lectures a ton and adds stories but it just shows how much he cares and enjoys the class. He is a very kind man and will help you in any way. Take notes and become friends with the other theatre majors, they will help you. Doc is a character, embrace that.
Great fun professor however his tests can be REALLY difficult. Helps you out as much as possible including helps reschedule missed assignments (sometimes)

Class pace was very slow, stopped class to entertain every students irrelevant stories & rants which means you don't end up learning much. Expected amount of reading is very high, very homework heavy class. Didn't get much out of it personally (EX: Entire class explaining word satire comes from satyr, explanation shouldn't take an hour for that!)
Doc is a fantastic instructor! He is passionate about his work and it shows through his lectures. Having him as a professor has pushed me to a new level as a performer!
do not take his class I took it for a WAC credit and almost failed
Interesting approach to the subject. Overall, a helpful class.

Professor Mauzy is amazing! She walks you through each assignment and is always happy to answer questions and give helpful feedback! Also, she cares for her students and likes to chat and get to know them! My favorite professor so far!

Professor Mauzy is amazing! She walks you through each assignment and is always happy to answer questions and give helpful feedback! Also, she cares for her students and likes to chat and get to know them! My favorite professor so far!
Dr Mauzy is an amazing professor. She is the best professor I have ever had. Easy A class.
You have 4 papers all year. All of them are a basic college level. If you know how to wright, you will pass with ease.

She was very nice to her students and really tried to help when we needed it. Sometimes a little confusing when first introducing a paper topic, but she better explains it later on. A lot of group projects, but your with the same group the whole semester.
love her!! she is the best class is boring though due to the readings and explaining. but thats the course not her. she is very interesting and amazing

Fantastic professor. She's high energy and willing to take the time, day or night, to work with students and make sure they understand the material. This is a great professor to take if you struggle with writing.

Loved her! She was ALWAYS more than willing to help any student that needed assistance & she does everything she can to give positive, useful feedback on papers. My only gripe is that sometimes she was unclear with assignments, but eventually she would explain them in a way that made sense. Buy the books; you'll need them.
Professor Mauzy is very nice and very helpful. It's a relaxed class. Only complaint is that she often interrupts herself when she talks and can be unclear when explaining things.
She is one of best English professors I know that is really helpful on helping u in her class.
take her class and stay relax. great professor
Great teacher.
SHE IS THE BEST FOR SURE
Don't miss her class. The best  English teacher at CSU. Easy A
She is really great professor, perfect, I love her class to much
Awesome professor, easy to get an A.
Woooow amazing professor, if you can fit her class in your schedule do it immediately. Don't don't miss her class, she is the best
she the best!!!!! i hated english but she made it seem interesting. she care about her student and their grades. DO NOT, I REPEAT DO NOT PASS UP A CHANCE TO TAKE THIS CLASS... EASY A
She is a great professor and she is very sweat as long as your try you shouldn't have a problem in her class.

She is the biggest sweetheart ever. She is so helpful and understanding. She will go out of her way to help a student. You use the books A LOT so buy them. Go to class and be a good student and you shouldn't have a problem. Completely recommend her.
She is helpful, smart and kind. Pretty too.

Took this class online. The quizzes and exams were easy for the most part but not directly from the notes. Gives a lot of extra credit at the end of the semester. Very nice professor and advisor once you meet her. Would recommend. Quiz once a week for the whole semester is basically it. Two exams, 10 quizzes, 2 scavenger hunts.
amazing class easy A

Weekly quizzes, a lot of valuable information given in PowerPoints. Textbook not really needed. Professor emailed back quickly and gave extra credit. This class is an easy A, just do your work. Would be best to take either first or last year. First year for all the information given to decide Health Science major, last year for easy A!

this course is interesting/knowledgeable about careers in the healthcare field. All the items (learning modules, discussions, quizzes) are available so you can finish at your own pace and the professor gives great responses regarding your work or questions you have. She also offers extra credit. would recommend taking her. book is included online.

You will meet the nicest person, but behind your back she is evil, do not take her class. Lies and deception she contradict  herself. That is all you need to know the class is easy though just do your work and don't miss anything.

This class is your typical online class; there is a powerpoint or readings assigned each week followed by a 10 question test based on the readings. This class actually helped me to learn more about the Health Science field. Extra credit is given at the end of the course. Don't forget to do the quizzes and you'll be golden.

Fair professor. Not sure what all the bad reviews are about but I found the course load to be normal (remote course). Weekly discussion posts & you have to participate a lot in order to get the points, but I didn't mind that. Quizzes & tests are timed, but not hard. Lots of extra credit opportunities in discussion posts as well! No Zoom either.

Fair professor. Not sure what all the bad reviews are about but I found the course load to be normal (remote course). Weekly discussion posts & you have to participate a lot in order to get the points, but I didn't mind that. Quizzes & tests are timed, but not hard. Lots of extra credit opportunities in discussion posts as well! No Zoom either.

I took this class for 16 weeks. The first couple of quizzes and test caught me off guard. 8 minutes for 10 quests for quizzes, 38 minutes for a 50 questions. All his quiz and test are on Quizlet. Discussion boards are a big pain. He does give some bonus points.

Worst prof I've ever had. Grading criteria is not clear. 100% exams & homework you can give you maximum B. Next 100 points that bring you to A range depend on your posts in a discussion board (not less than 10 posts per week). He basically evaluates your writing skills.

I enjoyed the class online. I took it for the duration of 16 weeks. Very clear and concise. The only thing I did not like was the excessive amount of writing we had to do in discussion boards weekly. It is a lot. Gives you a practice test and quizzes, quizzes and practice test are almost exactly like the real exam.

THIS TEACHER IS HORRIBLE!!! I took the 6 week course for Marketing 301. He expects the student to focus on his class and nothing else in life. For test and quizzes you only get an unreasonable 45secs per question!! The group project instructions were unclear. Expects you to post 10xs per discussion post!! Choose any other teacher but this guy!!!

this teacher is terrible, does not understand that students has lives, Class Marketing 301 is tough and time consuming, the teacher won't take any excuses for missing an assignment or test, I don't recommend it.

HORRIBLE. His 6 week summer session is the worse. He is not flexible and makes you do more work than a 15 week course. The reading is easy the class is not hard but way more time consuming than taking a regular class. DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS.

Seriously the worst online class ever. He expects so much time dedicated just to his class. The discussions are outrageous, he expects you to spend a few hours everyday checking and writing them. That's more than any other class. Take it in class, I'm not saying it would be easier, just more worth the money and time!!

Hard class, especially for workign students. No less than 7 posts weekle are expected. It was a very busy class. Definately book is needed for the class, posts and exams. Very little time is given for quizes. Though the class was very time-consuming, but lots of knowledge and experience is taking out.

This professor is ridiculous. Expects an inordinate amount of work for a low level class. Gives two days for online quizzes and tests. Not conducive to people with careers. Also seems to be quite full of himself. Avoid if at all possible.

Took his class online, and it was a terrible experience. He expects way to much from his students. He says to comment at least 7x a week on the discussion boards and I did almost double that (spent alot of time) and I still only got half the points. He's very rude in his responses and the team project for an online class is more than a test. AVOID.

This guy was terrible. He expects every student to spend 15 hours a week on this class, and I am serious. He DOES expect that. Baically the only thing I can say is to read the book for the exams. If you do not read the book you WILL fail. I would never reccomend anyone to take a class with him after my experience with him.

Class wasn't easy at all. He is tough grader, he expects much from the students. BUT, if you pay attention and follow his requirement and know his expectation you'll be fine. For making a report/memo, I suggest that you follow the example on the book or his sample. Follow the format, writing style, etc.

Took this online and accelerated. Moves very fast so you MUST check in on Blackboard every day! Two chapters per week typically. If you read and use the study tools you can do well. Don't forget to participate regularly in the discussion boards. Meet deadlines, he will not extend them.

I took this course online, but Dr. Mayer seems very nice and he was very helpful.  The course work is very simple as long as you read the book.  He's a tough grader, but if you work hard you will do great.

His Marketing Class is tough and i think his tests are too difficult to get a good grade even when i studied. He doesnt give you any slack and his response are not helpful and sometimes harsh. For this being my first Marketing class i would not recommend him at all, I was very discourage and did not want to take another Marketing Class.

I would not recommend any one take this class. He has hard test and he does not cut you any slack. I would not take another class with him. He  anticipates that every one to get's a c on his test,and he can be mean with his responses

This class is by no means and easy A. Dr. Mayer is one of the toughest teachers at CSU by far, he sets his tests up for a C average. If you read the chapters and go to his lectures you will get a B or a C for the course. I think most of the other comments are nuts. He is very intelligent and is up to date with the use of technology for the course.

I took this class over the summer online. We had to read a chapter everyday and then take a 25pt quiz on what we read. He is a difficult grader and is not helpful at all. All in all, he's not a good professor. Do not take any class with him.

He is by far the worst teacher ever!  Do not take his class.  It is amazing he still has a job.  The marketing department should be ashamed that they have let him continue to teach with a track record as bad as his.  If he worked in the private sector he would have been fired years ago.

Offers knowledgeable religious studies perspective. Teaches some abstract concepts of religion. Lectures are necessary and informative. Caring&Available outside of class. Papers and tests (study guide) are to test extent of your knowledge. Frequent quizzes (1/2 questions) on reading (BE ON TIME!). Need to know info for good grade;tough but fair.
Very good teacher. Fairly tough class so far. Lots of writing, but very interesting
EASY A JUST TOOK IT ONLINE JUST BASICALLY WORK QUIZ,DISCUSSION JOURNAL ONCE A WEEK IT WAS EASY A

Mr. McCarney truly cares about his students and wants us to succeed. He is a very knowledgeable and experienced SLP and wants to prepare us to have successful careers. Great teacher for this Intro class!
Professor McCarney is absolutely amazing, I would highly recommend this professor to anyone.

Zach is a grad student so you would think he relates pretty well to the students in his class, problem is trying to condense all the material into 4 weekly 50 minute lectures. One on one he is great and communicates material very well, but expect to spend a lot of time in the math learning center or his office before each exam.

Zach is an amazing professor. He genuinely cares about his students and is willing to put forth the extra effort to make sure you understand the content. He even reopened a few missed assignments for me in order to help me out. I received A's on every exam except one due to his easy to follow lectures. A must have teacher.

This professor assumes you do nothing else with your life other then his tax class. a 50 question homework assignment every week, along with a 50 question quiz. A single question on the quiz was doing an ENTIRE tax return. If you tke this, exxpect the 3 credit hour class to consume at least 20 hours a week. Good luck

Very tough class. As an overall professor he is probably a D+ or C-. He goes over material but only after about an hour of talking about irrelevant material pertaining to himself. More class examples of problems would be better. However, to be fair it is a masters class in one of the hardest majors offered in college.(Tax law)

I am seeing a ton of harsh comments listed for Prof. McClain. I took him for a course at UMUC and he was amazing! He was very helpful, understanding, and responsive to emails; once homework was corrected, solutions were supplied (expediently). His comments were helpful, insightful, and focused. Show interest, participate and study. You will be fine
I had him online at UMUC, so no comment on his appearance.  He was very engaged and helpful.  Very knowledgable about taxes.  Good guy.

He is a pretty good professor. Partnership tax is just hard to teach. Reading before class is extremely helpful, because he does skip around some of the time. If you put in the work, you will do fine. I would take him again.

the only thing I learned from him is not to be like him, he is that bad. he has no business being a teacher. I would advice to avoid even talking to him, but he's the chair of the department, and there are a couple of tax classes that no other professor teaches. the bottom line he's the a bad professor and even a worse person

This class is a forum for McClain to tell stories and brag about his financial status. He refuses to teach or elaborate on any topic he brings up. (: He willingly answers every question you have even if its not covered in class. Highly recommended lecturer for those at CSU or even those in Singapore who want to take him during the summer !

I had him for stats and memory and cognition. It's difficult but he is willing to help. He is easy going and he actually wants you to do well. He's a fair grader and you have opportunties for extra credit. Dr. McLennan is one of the best prof. at CSU.

He moves kind of fast but give you so much help and is just a really great teacher.  Homework every week and quizes every so often.  However, you get to drop 5 homeworks and 3 quizzes and 35 points of extra credit is offered and its so easy to get. You have to really try to fail this course.

Dr. McLennan class was pretty hard, but very interesting. Especially considering I had no interest in the topic, but he pulled me in. He expects his students to be active learners, but very fair in all aspects.

Best prof yet at Csu! Gives powepoint outlines, so much extra credit, very fair mulitiple choice exams, interesting lectures. Would reccommend to anyone! Wish I had more classes with him! Actually wants you to do well! Great prof.

Best prof yet at Csu! Gives powepoint outlines, so much extra credit, very fair mulitiple choice exams, interesting lectures. Would reccommend to anyone! Wish I had more classes with him! Actually wants you to do well! Great prof.
Dear Sir, Thanks for being so understanding! Hope I can attend your other classes during the next Summer sem in SIM (Singapore). Yinghui :)

He gives powerpoints for the class but you will need the book for detailed information. He is very intelligent and helpful. He teaches a lot and therefore expects you to know a lot. Not an easy A, will need to study. Gives one quiz a week and multiple choice exams. Not easy.
A standout professor and a keystone in the department!  He is very dedicated to the material and does a great job in its explanation.  Also is very active in research.
I don't think I can even put into words how INCREDIBLE Mandy is. She truly cares about her students and the field of education.

Ms. McMahon has been one of my favorite professors. I have never met anyone who cares so much about their students. Make sure to ask questions if you have them, she will definitely explain herself in detail for anyone who doesn't explain it.

The best professor! She loves what she does and knows what she's talking about. Just do what you have to do and you will pass! It was not a tough class. You will have to do discussion boards, three lesson edits, and final unit plan. This was the only class I really looked forward to coming to because it was worth my time. Take this professor!

This professor is one of the few that actually cares about your progress and your future in education. If you have a problem I highly recommend reaching out to her as she does her best to help you. The work requires effort but its actually related to what you will have to do as an educator. Highly recommend taking her for anything you can.

Dr. McMahon is an AMAZING psychology professor!! Not only is the topic she is teaching about extremely interesting, but she is very knowledgable in the topic as well! There is 15 points of extra credit offered a semester and the quizzes are not difficult if you study for them ahead of time. Would definitely recommend taking a class with her!!

Dr. McMahon is an AMAZING psychology professor!! Not only is the topic she is teaching about extremely interesting, but she is very knowledgable in the topic as well! There is 15 points of extra credit offered a semester and the quizzes are not difficult if you study for them ahead of time. Would definitely recommend taking a class with her!!

First semester this course was taught and she did an exceptional job for the short 6 weeks the class was offered.  Not much work but very rewarding reading the literature and watching lectures/videos.  No book!

I think this professor is extremely confusing. She speaks to the class in a round about way, with out ever really getting to the point. I also personally experienced feels of being bullied and talk down to.
The class was easy. She gives a lot of extra credit. She also puts the notes online and teaches straight from those so if you miss a class its not a big deal. She also does not take attendance.
Very easy to understand, just go to class and take good notes. I actually learned a lot. Explains everything in a very basic understandable way. No need to buy a book.

His way of teaching is very basic and understandable. Perfect class for the finance students to understand the basic concepts of finance. You need to be respond to his question if not, he get furiated and will embarass students. Quizes and final are similar and very easy.Knowledgeable person with weird personality.I learned a lot about Finance.

Thinks he's crystal clear, but talks too fast, swears during class, makes fun of students and will embarrass you when possible.  No use of the textbook at all, so you better be able to take really good notes.  Quizzes are timed 40 minute that are actually 100 point tests.  Final is comprehensive.

She repeats her self over and over and over again... really boring. She is nice until you get on her bad side. Also, she is under the assumption that if she tells students her tests are extremely easy and tells them what will be on the tests but then changes what she has said and grades really hard, they will do well on tests. (I don't think so.)

I had Suzanne my first semester of college but she honestly so good that I actually remembered to rate her even though its been 2 years. She was really kind, graded easy, and the material was not too bad. She was a really good prof, all you really have to do is show up because she takes attendance and you can fail based off it. Definitely take her.

Gary is amazing. He is super helpful and a very skilled designer. He isn't a push over and has a good time with his students. He's young and definitely in-tune with the industry, helping a new comer know what to expect when we graduate.

As a graduate student at CSU, I went from having a flourishing social life in Florida to moving here to get my MPA. The commuter nature of CSU killed my social environment. Prof. Mead protects and supports constructive debate. I don't have to self-censor like in other classes. The rest disregard my input because I'm libertarian/not liberal.
It's not easy but you learn good material and it's interesting.  He doesn't make you buy a book and gives you the reasons for free.
The amount of reading is a lot, but that is to be expected. Good discussion, funny guy, nice guy.
Dr. Mead is a very nice guy with a real interest in the subject.  He sometimes struggled to control class discussion.  He is also a very easy grader. Overall I enjoyed the course.
makes it clear what in the book will be on exams. there is few HW assignments and 3 exams but he offers a lot of extra credit. attendance is mandatory. I wouold take him again

Hes very personable and knows what hes talking about but hes an old school lecturer who doesnt like powerpoints, even though using them would probably help the class understand the aspects hes talking about. He wants you to read the chapters before class but in class tells you all the sections to skip after the fact. Not my cup of tea but hes nice.
Very helpful, fun professor.   The text is a bit confusing but he makes expectations clear.   Exams are not difficult if you read the text, take good notes, and are attentive to the terminology.

Took ACT 221 for 6 weeks during the summer.  He covered everything in a concise manner, and offered extra credit when he saw the class was having problems in a few areas.  If you have problems you can email him and he will respond quickly.
Not too bad. He sometimes come in unprepared....but other than that he is ok.
He's casual and friendly in class, but a surprisingly hard grader
Traditional approach, good classroom teacher, but didn't use original exams
He's the Dean and doesn't teach much, but it was a real privilege to be in his class. Great teacher and a kind man.

Class content is interesting. The professor has many cool stories to tell about his work experience. Exams are hard + there is homework due every single class. 1 group project that counts for two exam grade points. Make sure you pick a group of people who are reliable and will do work or else the project will be frustrating

Class content is interesting. The professor has many cool stories to tell about his work experience. Exams are hard + there is homework due every single class. 1 group project that counts for two exam grade points. Make sure you pick a group of people who are reliable and will do work or else the project will be frustrating

His lecture tone is very boring to listen to but his experience and knowledge make up for it. He knows what hes talking about and he encourages participation the right way. The work isnt too hard in this class but what you learn in his class is applicable for all phases of accounting.

I've taken classes with Medina a couple of times.  He wants you to succeed.  His classes are fun and interactive if you stay involved.  You must work though, as he expects that you give it your all but he is more than happy to help do so.  Make sure to read the syllabus, and prepare well in advance for tests or papers.

He is the worst professor in the Spanish department.  He gives a lot of assignments and is a tough grader.  His lectures are rarely clear and he teaches very differently from the book.  He is not very understanding of personal issues nor is he helpful when you don't understand the course material.  WOULD NOT TAKE AGAIN.
He is a great professor, sometimes he gets arrogant, but still you learn a lot in his class, HE IS FUN which is a plus!

Probably the best teacher at Cleveland State.  Don't take his class if you are disrespectful or are not planning on giving it 100%.  I've sweated buckets over his classes, but I'm a much better student because of it.

I took two classes with Medina-Rivera.  He's an energetic teacher and makes the material fun.  He's not addicted to the text and teaches real world Spanish.  True, he is arrogant - but he's welcoming and interesting too!
A bit full of himself but does lecture clearly
Guapo, guapo, guapo.  Very intelligent and keeps the class going. He loves Spanish and it becomes contagious. I love him. He dresses very nice.
Dr. Medina-Rivera will make any boring subject seem glamourous.  He is funny, engaging, patient, helpful, easy to talk to, and knows what he is talking about [as opposed to other MLD professors ...]

Although I graduated in 2002, I know that Prof. Medina-Rivera is still a great professor.  He is willing to help any student and is also willing to set aside time so that he can help you with developing your language skills.

Professor Meehan is the epitome of a great teacher. The class itself is only graded by a term paper, a midterm, a final and weekly questions. He teaches you the material but he also makes sure you know how to apply it in different scenarios. He is old school and is not active on blackboard so be sure to attend class. Most lectures are guests.

Professor Meehan is the epitome of a great teacher. The class itself is only graded by a term paper, a midterm, a final and weekly questions. He teaches you the material but he also makes sure you know how to apply it in different scenarios. He is old school and is not active on blackboard so be sure to attend class. Most lectures are guests.
So great. Makes somewhat dry subject matter interesting. Engages the class. Passionate about what he teaches. Funny. Guest lecturers almost daily. Would totally take him again!

Health care law. AWESOME professor! Constantly engaging the class. Very knowledgeable about the subject material, fair grader, passionate about material, always prepared for class, answers questions, responds to e-mails promptly, funny as well. Would HIGHLY recommend!
The reason why I came to CSU

It's amazing how much this class can teach. Definitely not for the faint of heart or easily discouraged, it is HARD to get a good grade, but Mr. Meeker is willing to work with you every step of the way!
Great director, amazing to play with. Clear with his goals for the band, more than willing to help individuals achieve them.
He is AWESOME!
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments
Would highly recommend! Made content enjoyable to learn and just a cool dude.

Had him last year for intro to soc... a lot of things he talked about were so very true about our society. Sometimes it seems that he goes off topic, but everything related to something about sociology. Not a boring professor at all, very down to earth and real.

I took his online criminology class on race, class, and crime. The textbook was informative but dry. His online lectures were great. I've had this professor in the past and he always keeps class interesting and funny. Extremely knowledgable but doesn't make students feel stupid. Really cares about students and offers guidance for the real world!

Professor Meeker is an amazing instructor. He actually cares about teaching the students and making an impact rather than assigning grades. He is not shy of expressing his personal position on the topics covered in his lecture. His down to earth personality is the reason why his class was so enjoyable. I would recommend taking any class he teaches.
Very good teacher,  he's very inspirational and loves talking with students in his spare time and office visits. He really helps with future progress and plans for grad school.

It's an Intro Class so there are only four exams. Jim is very knowledgeable about sociology, and is very interesting as a person. I would definitely take one of his classes again. The only downside of the class was covering so much information and there was a lot of material on the exams study guide.
Awesome professor that opens your mind and encourages you to think differently. The tests and take-home project are super easy and he is easy to get along with.
He understands if you have to miss class or if you will be late, he is funny and nice and knows a lot about deviance. 10/10 would recommend

he is knowledgeable on criminology, pretty funny & makes class easygoing. He doesn't make you participate often but does expect you to read & do the weekly journals. The only downside to the class was the end of the semester he assigned 2 papers before the final. 1 paper was on a movie we watched & the other was a evaluation exercise

What a guy! Not enough space to say how great he was. Lots of textbook use, but very helpful. Saw I was struggling 3/4 of the way through the semester. Always had time to tell stories, assist, or just hang out in his office. I hate accounting but I'd give anything to take him again. Truth be told I think he gave me the "C" cause he felt bad for me.

Very nice and funny man, but incredibly hard to learn from. There were some days he'd start telling a story and talk the entire class, then we'd have a quiz the next class and wouldn't know a thing. You pretty much have to teach yourself. He's semi-retired, so he comes and goes by semester depending on where the money's at.
Miss him everyday.  Wish he would come back to CSU.
GREAT professor. I HATE accounting but I enjoyed this class. You can't say that about most professors
I hate accounting, but this guy at least made it interesting and clear enough for me to pass.

Dr. Meeting is a GREAT, GREAT teacher.  The stories he tells in class make accounting more interesting.  Best prof I had at Cleveland State.  Very helpful about CPA exam info, too!  He is CSU's most valuable asset!

If you want an easy A don't take this class. His tests are not hard if you know how to do every homework problem he assigns. There is no vocab on the tests just problems. I'm not an accounting major and I got an A so his class is not impossible despite of what you may have heard.
Great for those who wish to take and PASS the CPA exam.
He is a WONDERFUL professor. I learned so much from his class!
No Comments
He's awful!  Avoid at all costs!!
Prepares you for CPA exam.
One of the few teachers I've had who is really good at the online format.  I've taken her twice (this and international accounting) and both were good. If you do the work, it is not hard to do well.

Dr. Meier goes above and beyond to help students understand the concepts.  If students keep up with the homework and complete in class assignments, they should do well on the exams. Being a student who struggles with math in general ? Dr. Meier made this an amazing class experience with her guidance and patience.
She is awesome.  i am not an accounting major but just took an elective for graduation and I am glad I took her class.  She makes the homework simple.

Took Online ACT 555 Internal Auditing.  She lays out everything you need to do.  If you're diligent, this is nice because you can go ahead as far as she'll let you (essentially).  Online Tests (with alloted time periods - you don't have all day, but can use the book while taking the exam at your house).  Computer Auditing Program Projects take 4Eve
super sweet

Nice professor and fairly easy.  Midterm you can have a notecard for.  The final is group take home.  The group project is that most difficult part but it is easy as well.  You really don't need the book if you have had an accounting class before.  Would recommend as an easy class but many people in business won't learn much.
Is my refund for this class being processed yet?

I have learned that Dr. Meier knows more about accounting than I do. Everytime I go to class this hypothesis is confirmed. I would really like to know more about accounting if she would just take more than .5 seconds to wait for a question. Very nice person though, a bit short on the social skills to liven up class.
Very nice lady.  Pretty easy class

She gives very useful powerpoint notes. I used the notes and the book to review the problems at the end of each chapter to study for the test. She is very fair, nice, and realistic. Other students didn't need the book to get an A, but it helped me alot to review the material. Mid term was tough but final was a take home group final. Grades fair.

I thought she was very fair.  Going to class was very important because she went over similar problems in class that were on the test.  If you went to class and read the chapters, there is no reason why you won't get an A in the class.

Had Prof. Meiksins for Honors Film Club. Very easy, just make sure you show up to class and participate in the discussions of the films before it closes. He sends out a lot of reminders prior to the discussion board closing, so it is easy to remember to do it. A very easy choice to fulfill an Honors Experience credit!

The book required for this class is written by him for him. Buy the book  and you will pass the class. Also pay real close attention to his lectures, they are long but all the answers for test are stated in them.

Professor Meiksins, he is a nice person. Funny too. However, he should not be teaching. I was looking forward to his class, I was super excited and the class was just stupid. He has not taught for some time, and I believe he is a bit rusty. I got a B in the course, but I wish I never took his class. If I liked beer, I would have a beer with him.

Good lectures and makes the material seem interesting, even when it could be really dry.  Group project at the end of the course can be a pain in the butt, but overall, it's a fairly easy course and gets you the HonorsScholars credit you may need.
My biggest problem; he was so rude. Although culturally aware and able to give good information, he only lectured, it felt very long and boring.
Really funny and nice guy. Would recommend.
Awesome guy. Great class! Love him to death wish I would have taken his class more seriously now. Do the work and readings and not only will you get an A, you'll also learn a ton!
He was my favorite professor at CSU. Not so hard to look at, easy on eyes. He's a mix between Jason Mraz and Albert Einstein. His his class!

Fairly easy, just go to class and pay attention to the lecture and take notes, that's all I did pretty much. I reviewed my notes before the test and I got a high B on all of them. The debate is also fun. He was good professor and kept the material interesting, highly recommend taking him because he is the director of the Honors program

Very inspiring and interesting. He is so down to earth & super funny. Take him if you have the chance. I was really worried because I heard he was difficult, but he is very understanding & a LOT of fun :) learned a lot & will probably take another class with him!
Hands down the most intelligent and inspiring professor at CSU. If you ever have the chance, take a course with Meiksins.
Took him for Soc Theory, he was okay, probably wouldn't take again.
awesome professor- i would highly recommending taking this class with him. he keeps class very interesting! i'm taking the class in the summer and we have 2 projects and 3 exams.

a great professor. i had him for my race/class/gender course and really liked it. he kept it interesting and was always helpful. he replied quickly to my emails. got an A in the course. its not exactly an easy course, however, if you study and attend his lectures, you will do well.

I took Soc Theory. The class was fun. He takes time to explain complicate passages in the reading we are assigned. We had to write an explication (which was a summary of someones work), 13 quizes and two exams and a Trial (debate).

He is so funny. He provides great examples when describing harder concepts. He will answer emails within a few hours and is always willing to help. It's a great class, very interesting, and not very hard.
He's great...he's funny and very much interesting...
No Comments
No Comments
Melfi is good

Hilarious but very dry, almost dark humor. Never take offense to his jokes even if it seems offensive, that's just his sense of humor. If you give a crap and participate, he will give you an A. He wants to see effort.

Melfi is my ALL TIME favorite professor. He cares about the subject and encourages discussion. It doesn't feel like you're in a class because it's such a comfortable environment. Respect him enough to show up and hear what he has to say. I recommend taking it with a friend but even if you take it alone you'll never not be laughing in this class.

Professor Melfi is a real genius, by the end of semester he was able to share a personal story with every single student in the class and I just got the feeling that I know everyone in my class. Professor Melfi is THE BEST.

Melfi was a teacher that sort of just went off into his own world when he starts to lecture. He is a very outspoken individual and no matter what, I could not get an A out of him. Throughout my college career, I have never gotten a B until I took his class. It is easy, but he doesn't give out A's without it being exactly what he wants.

really nice guy and super educated in international  affairs. It was a pretty fun class but he got off topic a lot. he loves a good debate amongst students and himself. recommends you take if you have a easy A

Professor Melfi is the only professor so far in my college career to give me a B. I did everything I could to get an A in his class, but he did not seem to want to grant me one. Most people in the class tend to only get Bs, with the occasional A. His tests were not that difficult, not was his class. It was overall an okay experience

Very dry humor that could get someone offended but if you are like me than you will be laughing pretty much all the time. He kinda stutters but is quite clear. His class is so simple, pretty much lowest grade you will get is a B+ if you know atleast part of the topic. Very small quizes...

Melfi is one of the coolest professors at CSU. The only things I would say is he can be a total jerk with his sarcasm sometimes, his english can be pretty rough at times, his grading is B+ 95% of the time, his classes are soo boring and you learn nothing, tests are easy, somewhat easy grader, and he stutters A LOT. Really nice though.

Attend class and participate and you will do well. The tests were essay based so you can't not know anything and expect to guess random multiple choice answers. However the material was all covered in class and relatively interesting. He has a dry sense of humor and does enjoy getting under peoples skin sometimes
Melfi is funny and engaging- awesome professor
Super nice guy. Class is boring. I never showed up to class and I still got an A. He takes attendance but it didn't seem to matter for me.

you do not understand a thing in class jumps from one topic to another don't learn a thing and paper are very long and graded super hard the way he grades is crazy especially for a level 1 college course do not recommend

Melfi has an accent that can sometimes be difficult to understand. He makes awkward joke and if your class doesn't care then it just gets awkward all around. Be sure to complete your assignments and actually go to class. He takes attendance. Lectures are long and boring. Just stay on his good side.
THE MOST BORING CLASS I HAVE EVER TAKEN IN MY LIFETIME. And he takes attendance... longest 2 hours of my life

One of my favorite professors! So hilarious. What he teaches is dry, but easy to understand. His English isn't hard to understand unless you're deaf!! (He is from Italy) He is a great person, and wants everyone to succeed. Highly recommend this class
I LOVED Him. Nicest guy you would ever want to meet and his religion class is very interesting. Best professor I've had at CSU

English can be hard to understand, but he is very witty and can make you laugh with his different quirks. The material in this class is extremely dry, so i slept alot. If you use the notes he sends you and read a bit of the books you need than you'll do just fine. C is the lowest grade you could get in this class unless you completely give up.

Love this guy. Goes over everything in the basics, and his tests are pretty simple. He mostly goes off of discussions in class for your grade, and the few papers he does assign, he is no harsh at all. Just wants to hear your thoughts. However his English is a bit rough in places, but he's usually quick to correct. I highly recommend him for Rel 101

Very highly opinionated. Your best bet is to figure out his feelings toward various religions and pretend they match your own. English (as far as spelling and grammar goes) is poor. I would not recommend taking this class.
Helpful in his advising and also will not let you take pointless classes for your degree. Easy on the eyes.

Intelligent individual, patient with clueless students and those unwilling or incapable of directing their own college path. Was slightly caught off guard when I came in with a well-thought out plan, but it worked out alright. Easier to get in touch with than most others that I've had to deal with.
Dave was a very poor advisor. He routinely messed up my schedule and often called me in for pointless meetings. He was not an asset at all.
Great teacher with the interest to teach and realy help the students to the best abilities. Keep doing what you're doing.  Sonel.G
usually he deals with trio students, but dave helped me out when no one else would. a great advisor!
He is a very good advisor, he is funny and very helpful. Me and him always joke about my Math Professor because he recieves alot of complaints about him.
has class for tens minutes and lets u go, just do hw and he will pass u

Dr. Menendez cares about creating good teachers. He gives you a lot of materials to prepare you for your teaching career, but his class is very boring. You only get 1 break for a 4 hour class and he likes to go on and on and DOES NOT like to let out early. There are also pop quizzes so read the chapter reading reviews!

Professor Menendez is very organized, knowledgeable, and teaches his content well: Applied Behavior Analysis.  Beware, if a student doesn't "behave" to his dictatorship style of teaching, he may become retaliatory.  What good professor doesn't encourage independent thinking???

Menendez is THE BEST!! I had him in the Fall of 2015. Towards the middle of the semester, I ended up getting a concussion from work. Menendez worked with me independently to make sure I got my work done and had everything in to pass the class. He truly cares about all of his students. His impressions of the presidents are great!!!!

Dr. Menndez is passionate about creating good teachers, which is why he is so (justifiably) demanding.  He is very clear about what he expects. I think I did a pretty good job with behav mgmt before class, and know even more now. My dad died in the middle of the semester, and Menendez was truly kind. I think he's good at communicating his genius.

GREAT teacher! Smart man.  Be prepared to work.  One of Cleveland State's best.  Dr. Menendez delivers instruction in a fluent and linear fashion that will stay with you forever.  He's an energetic professor so be prepared to keep up!
If you pay attention and listen to the details he tells in class, there is no reason why anyone should not get an "A" in this class.  Very intelligent man.

Excellant teacher.  Prepares you to become a teacher.  You must be ready to work.  A stickler for details, but lets you know what is required.  If you do what he asks you will do good.  Keeps you the full class time.
He loves to ramble on and on. He only gives a 10 minute break every 90 minutes! I took his class in the summer and he would keep us the entire 5 hours!

A challenging class but I was never bored... Each class had relevant topics for Special Education use, a lot of opportunities to use your work for the eportfolio-  If you're goin to be a teacher and you're getting your master's degree it shouldn't be easy... otherwise, everyone would have their MA... I'd recommend him

Pain in the ass! He is a really nice person, which makes it hard to hate him but he is suck a pain! Very anal about your work.. it better be perfect! And god forbid you have to miss a class.. he accepts no excuses besides death and a serous illness or you get points off your total grade. Be prepared to work HARD if you take this class!
Excellent instruction and clarity. Recommend him to all my friends.

Amazing! Absolutely loved taking this course. She is an amazing professor who is extremely helpful. She will give you great feedback on your papers and tests. She uses constructive criticism is the most appropriate way and most importantly cares for the subject matter and her students.

Amazing professor! I had zero interest in taking this class, but she made all the difference. Very inspiring. You can tell she actually loves what she teaches. After so many boring, burnt out professors, it was refreshing to have one that is actually passionate about teaching. I would highly recommend this class to others. She goes above and beyond

She is really funny, nice, and it was quite a pleasure to take this course. I was apprehensive because she was a brand new professor, but WOW!! Attendance does not count towards the grade in the class, but you will be LOST!

After taking his class I absolutely HAD to major in Anthropology and took every single class he taught.  Very knowledgeable, and gives a ridiculous amount of detail but you will never be bored.  You NEED to LISTEN and STUDY. He is fair, hilarious, will help his students, and can teach complicated things in easy to understand ways. Best Prof EVER
Super approachable, and very informative. He knows what he is talking about and won't hesitate to give you more information. He actually teaches, and doesn't read from power points. Very refreshing.
Best professor ever! Super helpful and easy to talk to. Dr. Bob is hilarious! You do need to study for his classes, but they're extremely interesting and you learn a lot. Highly recommend.

This man is without a doubt the best professor I have ever had. He actually teaches - GASP - above all, he actually teaches you skills and how to do things if you ask i.e. research, anatomy, etc. Very honest and blunt, but beneath the no nonsense is truly a man who cares very much about his students and work.
Great class. Learned a lot about human anatomy. Dr. Bob is a genius!

Great course! Dr. Bob is extremely helpful and will go out of his way to help a student understand the material. You do have to study and put effort into the course, but he makes it very interesting, plus he's hilarious! Highly recommended.

This guy was your typical ANT PhD'r....figured out how to get paid to go smoke dope with a jungle tribe. Very knowledgeable, made a sorta boring course interesting and fun. Great professor, I highly recommend taking his class. We did a great family tree project, I learned a lot about my family history that I never would have if not for this class.
An amazingly ridiculous class taught by a ridiculously amazing professor.

Dr. Bob is an amazing professor. He knows a lot about his field and communicates information very well. Uses humor and breaks things down nicely so that everyone is on board. I recommend Dr. Bob to everyone. I fell in love with Anthropology after having him. He's just a real great guy who cares about his students.

Dr. Bob is the best professor ever! It was not mandatory to even attend his class yet I really loved going. He gave a very easy to understand study guide with EVERY concept on it weeks before the test. AMAZING! He inspired me to declare my minor as anthropology so I could take more of his classes!
Dr. Bob is amazing. He keeps people interested what he is taling about. He incorporates humor into his lectures and makes class a fun experience. Very wise and very helpful.

I have had Dr. Bob twice so far and I plan on taking him as much as possible. He is very intellegent, funny, and can keep everyone interested in the material. I enjoy sitting through his lectures and find myself smiling or laughing through most of them. Who ever knew DNA could be so funny?!

One of the best teachers I've ever had. His wealth of knowledge is amazing and he explains complex concepts very clearly. Great humor in class too! Everyone at CSU, Anthropology major or not needs to take a class with him!

Overall an awesome guy! explains himself very welll. if you are having any trouble with anything just ask him... he will definatly help you understand. awesome study guides before tests that help you out tremendously.
Very detailed and helpful. has a great sense of humor which makes the classes fun. knows what he's talking about.
dr.bob is the coolest guy ever and this class is awesome, definately take it. he made the class worhth going to! he is very helpful and cares about you as the student.

The best prof ever.  Well known and published.  His classes are hard and require a lot of work but it is well worth it because you actually learn something.  The best prof I have ever had.  Be sure to register early for his classes because they fill up fast.

The reason I got up to go to school MWF. Very easy to understand his lectures and he is EXTREMELY knowledgeable. His stories of his work in the field are very interesting and he has seen many of the things he speaks of first hand.
Wonderful guy!!! Lectures are very well organized and he prepares students for exams with study guides. Take a class from him before leaving CSU!!!!!

I had the pleasure of taking Dr. Merner's Research class Spring of 2021. It was an online course, my first. She was very engaging (her slides had memes on them that made it fun), the homework was steady and reasonable. I'd take any other psychology class offered by her, she's got a good teaching style and is very fair. You can tell she really cares

I had the pleasure of taking Dr. Merner's Research class Spring of 2021. It was an online course, my first. She was very engaging (her slides had memes on them that made it fun), the homework was steady and reasonable. I'd take any other psychology class offered by her, she's got a good teaching style and is very fair. You can tell she really cares

I'm honestly not sure how this man is even allowed to teach. If it weren't for the tutoring center, half my class would have failed. Most of the time we couldn't even understand what he was saying because he just mumbled and talked to himself. He assigned problems that didn't exist and frequently claimed the textbook was wrong.
very difficult to understand, late to class even on the day of our final
Dr Messemer really cares for his students. He was well knowledgable in the area of adult educational theory and practice. Dr Messemer provided excellent feedback on our written papers.

Class was a great introductory course. Dr. Messemer encourage group discussion and used several different teaching methods. The only negative is that the course often went off track because of "talkative" peers.
