Learned a lot of tools and got a chance to use them in a project setting with Dr. Okrent. A must-take class for OSM students.
Learned a lot of tools and got a chance to use them in a project setting with Dr. Okrent. A must-take class for OSM students.
Very good professor overall. Helpful and informative. Only had two exams (midterm and final) which were very easy if you studied.

If you are not interested in this class then don't take it. Worse class I have taken through out my college career. Though there is extra credit, the exams are not easy at all!! Too much info crammed into one exam.
She's an amazing teacher, she's very funny and fun. Lots of extra credit and the tests are easy if you study the powerpoints. A+ for her!
She gives lots of extra credit. The entire test is off the power points. easy and fun class. LOVED IT

Your grade in this class is based off of 3 exams that are impossible, you have to study about 75 slides for each exam with a lot of information. The professor is not factual and very opinionated. When I was in the class she would spend the first 30 minutes talking about politics and none of it pertained to psychology.

Her views are so opinionated rather than factual. She basically surrounds the class around how in a sort the world was created and stems from African Americans. The exam is almost impossible to pass unless you remember every part of the 100 slides. No point of going to class bc she reads exactly from the slides that already uploaded to blackboard.
I don't like her at all, although she knows the material she is not approachable and condescending!

She's a very intelligent professor and knows her information really well, but her lectures are jampacked with information. For each exam she gives a study guide, but you basically have to memorize ALL the powerpoints. If you take her, get ready to memorize pages and pages of information. 3 exams, one essay. Nice teacher, but I wouldn't recommend.

Prof. Mickens-English does not give equal opportunities for the students. She's very judgmental and hard to understand in class. She gets off topic easily, and her lecture is very opinionated and not so much factual.

We spent a lot of time surfing youtube videos and the Westlaw website but then she was a really hard grader.  Very vague instructions on what she wants.  She was willing to help but her additional comments were rather vague too.  I didn't get anything out of this class.
Learned more about the law than all of my other classes put together.  Outside speakers and courthouse tour were outstanding.
Easily the best class in law school.  Maybe ever.
I do not feel like I learned anything from her.  She showed us examples of things and thought that was teaching. Spent class time showing dumb youtube videos and surfing westlaw website.
Most practical class in law school.
Make sure to get a good grade on the very first rough draft, because that is the grade you will receive for the class.
Got more practical knowledge in this class than any other in law school.  Dry sense of humor.
Very helpful and always available. Great use of technology.
Excellent class.  Wish she taught more courses.
Literally spent hours with me until I got it and is still doing so even though I'm not in her class.  Only prof I know that answers emails in the middle of the night.
No Comments

I feel like I need to take the course all over again with a professor who still cares. She may have been good at one time but those days seem to be over. Very vague in the instruction but then tough in grading.

Her class is rigorous, but you will come out of it well prepared to do legal research and write basic legal documents. She is very fair in grading, always available to students, and has a great sense of humor.

workload for this INTRO to urban studies class is ridiculous. Quizzes and discussion boards every single week. 2 huge exams. 2 huge papers. This is an intro class but I feel like it is graduate-level. He makes you message him on Blackboard instead of sending emails, which is really annoying. I would stay away unless your're an urban studies major

Dr. Mik is very knowledgeable and willing to help his students. Be prepared to read every week, both the text and outside materials. Quiz and discussion boards each week, as well as two papers throughout. Easy class if you read and work for it.

Dr. Mik will help you develop the skills necessary for post-grad work. By far, the most demanding and challenging professor I have had at CSU. He is very accessable and approachable. He cares deeply about his students.
Very good and in depth class. Exams are very rigorous and take a lot of studying to get a good grade on. Overall a very enjoyable and informative class. Good for urban studies majors.

Easily one of the hardest professors that I had at Cleveland State. The course, Spatial Structures, was not an easy class, you needed to do the reading, and the work, or you would not do well. That said, he is BY FAR the most competent prof I had at CSU, and if you really want to learn, take his courses. He will go the extra mile for his students.

If you need a WAC credit I suggest this class. Dr. Mick is a great professor and is always willing to help his students. He mainly just lectures but if you read the book you'll know what he's talking about. You have to read the book for the tests. There's three tests and two research papers. If you're an Urban Studies major I suggest this class.

Great professor, the class was very difficult, like others have said you will have to work if you have him.  That includes reading a very dry textbook, but is you do read the textbook you should do well.

Had him both for Intro and Urban Geography.  He is hilarious and a wealth of knowledge!  Although he does use filler, his lectures are always entertaining and he is crystal clear on all concepts.  The supplemental materials that he integrates are poignant.  If you don't like work, then don't take his class

Lecture style is difficult.  Uses a lot of filler sounds when lecturing as if he has difficulty with his train of  thought. This is important because he tests heavily on his lecture notes.  Not as knowledgable about subject matters outside of text material.

Ask most people who  have taken a class with professor Mikelbank and they will tell you the same thing: class was hard, but fair. He is really passionate about what he teaches and its infectious. Would absolutely take another class with him.

Funny guy. Easy class as long as you follow instructions. Online tests were a little hard but they are open note. He also gives bonus quizzes which help. I would definitely recommend his class. Easy A or B. Only downside is he takes attendance all the time for participation points.
He is a good instructor and you will actually learn the material and get a decent grade if you follow his program.
Overall a good guy, willing to go back and look at things twice if you think he's made a mistake. Fair grader, fingers crossed I get him again.
Overall a good guy, willing to go back and look at things twice if you think he's made a mistake. Fair grader, fingers crossed I get him again.
Created a great learning environment, and made a not so interesting topic a little less boring.

Professor Budimir is a very nice guy who makes a dry course a little more interesting, I really enjoyed having him. This is a WAC course so theres a lot of papers to write, but he makes his expectations clear for everything he assigns. weekly quizes, he drops the lowest score. Final was a 30 minute group presentation and 1800 word essay

Really good professor! He lectures all class all you have to do is take notes and review them. If you do that then you will get an A in this class. I really enjoyed how he made it easy to have a discussion with students about the ethical implications of decisions or definitions. He is engaging and I would take him again.
Not many tests. A couple of short easy papers. Take notes and follow notes when writing papers. Final paper big part of grade start it early
Very casual professor. He gives numerous paper assignments, but they're short and he's an easy grader. No reason to not get an A if you attend class and take notes.

Was nervous to take this prof. due to other reviews, but her class was very easy and organized. All very straightforward! Answers all found in reading, and the writing assignments are easy and short. (1 paragraph due once a week, and 4 one page papers). Great class. she gives great feedback and emails quickly! Great teacher! Extra credit too!

Absentminded professor who does not understand the material she attempts to teach. Has told students who asked for clarification on a testexam question that she could not help them because she did not write the question!
Lousy Professor
He is so very cute. The class is easy as long as you pay attention, and actually show up to class. He knows his material and he is extremely sarcastic, but it is funny.
Dr. Miller is the man. Simply put, he knows his stuff, he enjoys teaching it, and he conveys his expectations clearly. If you have to take OMS 511 do not even think about taking it with anyone else.

Rich is an excellent professor, and goes out of his way to help anyone who expresses an interest.  He makes himself available before class to review homework, and will work with you to make sure you understand.  Highly Recommended!

Mr. Miller is one of the best teachers I have had. He is interesting, funny, shares real world experiences and examples. He makes himself available outside of class and is a natural at teaching. He enjoys his work and seems to enjoy his classes. Look forward to taking more classes with him if possible.
Very good professor and clearly sets expectations.  I f you attend class regularly, you should have no problem getting an A.

Probably the best teacher I have had in 4 years of college.  Great at relating the material.  Gives real world examples that are very helpful.  Class is overall pretty easy as long as you go to class, just make sure you take good notes and work hard on the homework.  One project is required, which is pretty hard.
Great teacher.

This was an online course with Professor Miller.  It was alot of work (assignments every week), one group paper (not to hard) and a final (he really helps prepare you for the final with an Assessment).  If you keep up with every assignment and really work through the equations you can get a A for sure!
Awesome teacher! I wish he taught more classes that i could take. Very funny guy. Knows his stuff and how to relay it to students

Mr. Miller is a great instructor. He is always willing to help me and teaches extremely well. He provides real world examples by referencing his previous jobs and also applies material from the text book. Homework is collected and it will be useful during test time. My best advice, take his class. Be sure to start the project early!

Not a bad class if you showed up and did the homework. The tests are off the homework, so make sure you do it. The material is a bit dry at some points, but this prof is a funny guy, and he does a good job of getting everyone through it.

Really good guy, but the class is soooo boring. The material is really dry! Lets you use your notes on the exam, but the exams are really hard! Attendance is not required but i think it's pretty neccessary to pass the class. He knows your name after like the first class and he won't be willing to help you with your grade if he doesn't see you there

Rich is a great guy and teacher. I have nothing but respect for the guy. Very realistic expectations and really knows his stuff. Very sharp and knows what's happening in the industry. Assigns homework which you need to do because it will be in test almost verbatim - critical for passing the tests. Open book tests, what more do you want?
Alot of fun. Very nice guy.
Good teacher.
Exams are based largely on lectures.  Overall good but sometimes the formulas he gave were difficult to comprehend.

Overall great teacher. Knows what he's talking about.  I had a discrepency with him where he told me "you're allowed to miss a test"..I missed the test but he gave me a zero on it. Despite this argument I feel he did a good job teaching the course. Open note exams. Exams are both math and short answer.  Homework was kinda tough; graded on accuracy.

Mr. Miller is a great professor.  Clear and patient, has a great personality, and is therefore very approachable.  Does allow some notes for quizzes and exams.  He is by far one of the best professors I have ever had at CSU.
Great teacher made Stats tolerable.  Very sarcastic and entertaing.  Would tell anyone to pick him for Stats.

Best class I have taken in the college of business at CSU.  Rich is vary smart and makes the class intereting.  I would be an operations major if I could start over. Exams are easy if you go to class and you really dont have to read much.  HW is manatory and helpful for exams.  Final project kind of blows.

Jamie is an amazing clinical instructor.  She is extremely approachable and genuinely wants her students to do well.  She is laid back and so much fun to be around with a great sense of humor. WE LOVE JAMIE!!!

Attendance and participation is mandatory for this class. If you skip you will not pass. Lots of extra credit opportunities. Ending up getting an A from a C+ from coming to class and doing all the extra credit.

Very nice guy, but not very good explaining. However, everything is online and there's no case project for his class. I highly recommend taking this class with him if you don't want to feel stressed. He gives 200pts for participation (basically just attending class) and opportunities for EC.

Professor Miller is a nice guy that really wants to help you learn the subject. He spends class going over power points, doing hands on problems, and answers any questions you have.Everything is online and you can contact him anytime email/phone with any problems or questions. Make sure you attend class, do the work and you'll be fine!

Doesn't teach, just reads through powerpoints, doesn,t do stuff on the board, doesn't go over how to do problems unless someone asks. Basically teaching yourself because everything's online. Doesn't respond to emails.

Nice guy. A CPA, not a professor. Would consider him more of a facilitator rather than a "teacher." He runs through the power points quickly. Doesn't really explain much - feels most is self explanatory or in the book. All homework and tests are online. Basically teaching yourself. But he is a nice guy, and wants you to learn the subject.

Not clear about what expected in assigned papers. Its not an Online course but she made it as if it was one. If she disagree with your point of of view you will loose points no matter how well did you present it. When asked about grading she kept saying do not worry about it you will be fine. I got my lowest grade with her.

I'm really going to miss her. It was a hard class, especially since I had a temporary teacher in the beginning due to a family emergency. However, she is a great professor, and overall it was a very interesting class when she taught

PSC 512 was my favorite class, her seminar was very informative & poised to make you want to learn the topics. Class participation and paper analysis was #1 for her - so read your booksarticles and make you sure you provide in-depth analysis or you may get a B instead of an A. She's also very approachable and accommodating too.

Dr Miller is one of the strictest teachers I've ever had. I took PSC 221 and she conducted the class like it was a 400 level capstone. You must participate every class and complete assignments alone or in a small group for points. If you don't, she'll drop your final grade 1 letter. 7 quizzes, 3 exams, 3 critical analysis,  3 assignments.

She's extremely helpful. Communicates with her students on a daily basis via BlackBoard. She's very clear with the assignments. Although she's new to the PSC field, she's more aware than other professors on current domestic and international issues.

Ms. Miller wan an amazing professor last semester when I had her. Did not give out an exam from what I remember but she had guest speakers and the speakers were inspirational and I enjoy them a lot and i actually think that it very useful to a college student education. One project, one final, come to class, study the powerpoint, and you'll get a A

Ms. Miller wan an amazing professor last semester when I had her. Did not give out an exam from what I remember but she had guest speakers and the speakers were inspirational and I enjoy them a lot and i actually think that it very useful to a college student education. One project, one final, come to class, study the powerpoint, and you'll get a A
learn a lot from her class and it was an pretty easy class. Look at the notes/powerpoints and learn it and you will do fine in the class.

She doesn't really teach. You just do a worksheet or so in class. She invites a lot of guest speakers and it's a good opportunity to learn . You will have to do one group project and there are no exams or anything. The final is super easy too.
Prof brings in a lot of guest speakers, who are almost always amazing to listen to. However, the prof herself is not very good at teaching, and tends to not inform the students of assignments

I had Prof. Mills for Advanced sales and thought he was one of the best professors at CSU. I had him for two courses and he expects a lot of students, but is very fair, takes an interest, and puts a huge effort into every class. Whenever I needed help he responded almost immediately. I got a job because of things I learned in his class!!

He is not accessible - Doesn't respond to emails, only holds office hours once a week. He makes many grammar and spelling errors in everything he writes. His feedback is irrelevant. He takes months to grade one assignment and does not update grades consistently. Overall, he lost all credibility as someone who is knowledgeable and responsible.

Would not recommend. Only gave 1 or 2 A's. Doesn't grade work in a timely fashion, and then repeatedly takes off points for the same mistakes week by week, even though you didn't know it was wrong from before because he didn't grade it until a month later. Vague instructions on final essay. MEET WITH HIM IN PERSON if online class--he like that.

Such a tough grader and does not make it too clear on how he would like your work to look and does not give you feedback on ways to improve your work. Since it is an online class and everything is submitted through Blackboard, if you're file does not load he will not ask you to resubmit it, instead leaves a comment saying it didn't load and a 0/10

Homeworks were ridiculous but graded very fairly. Tests were fine if you studied, but one test nearly failed the whole class (concepts we understood but proposed to us in a way we had never seen). Doesn't give hints of what will be on the test, expects you to ask questions. If you try, you WILL understand the concepts. Applying is the hard part.

He is trying to use Advanced Programming (unnecessary) as a wash-out class for me, a Senior already.  He gave me feedback on one of my homework programs that I shouldn't be studying advanced Object Oriented Programming anymore.  IT IS IN THE CURRICULUM!!!!!!!!!

Professor Misra is kind and helpful. Although his tests are tough. You really have to study and attend class to get a good grade. The class was okay but stressful at times with the programs and tests, overall the professor knows what he is talking about and is willing to help
Great teacher. Very clear on what he expects. Homework is very reasonable. He is always welcome to helping if you ask.
His classes are boring, won't accept late work even if you were legitimately sick(doctor's note), is just an all around bad professor.
He's very clear on what he expects. You need the book for some stuff, but only for a short time and can use older versions. He is very approachable if you have any issues.

Dr. Misra is hands down my favorite CIS professor.  I took 260 with NO programming experience and ending majoring in it.  It's been a couple years since I took him & he is still my favorite - I wish he taught more upper level stuff.  He really explained how things worked and broke everything down.  The projects were tough, relevant and manageable.

Great professor. The short time that we had with him before his accident was amazing. I actually wanted to go to his lectures, because he was that good. I would recommend taking him if you prefer practical knowledge to useless theory. His assignments and exams can be difficult, but they are reasonable. I would DEFINITELY take him again

Very good professor! He likes to challenge students, and he loves to see you outdo yourself week after week. I created a StringBuilder object to answer one of the test questions and he absolutely loved it! We didn't yet cover StringBuilder in class, so he gave me extra credit for reading ahead.
Avoid this professor for cis260.
Not recommended unless you had prior knowledge of the subject

Class requires a prior understanding of C# even though it is supposed to be an entry level course. If this is your first time trying to learn C#, this course will be hell. Dr. Misra will not curve tests and he expects a lot out of his students in both the homework assignments and tests. Avoid if possible.
If you don't have a background programming try to get a little familiar with it before you take him. The people that did well in the class had already been programming prior to taking it.
Excellent professor.  Helpful, explains concepts clearly, very knowledgeable.  Attendance not mandatory, but necessary to do well.
He is a nice guy, but doesn't teaches well. If you have prior knowledge for the class, you will go good; else you have to struggle. NOT RECOMMENDED.

Professor Misra has to be one of the best professors I have ever had! I liked his class so much that it really sparked my interest in programming.  Contrary to what others have stated, he teaches very well and is easy to talk to.

Not the hardest class but makes it difficult when professor takes 3 weeks off in the middle of the semester.  Final paper not graded very timely, but overall a fair professor. SAP portion seemed very mindless.
If you know what your doing, he's a good Professor.
No Comments
dont plan on learning anything

She means well, but a REALLY picky grader. I wrote some of my best papers ever in that class and didn't get an A on a single one. I've never had a problem with writing before in my life and always did well until this class. She also constantly postpones meetings. Overall she's nice and funny, but I wish she changed her grading habits.
She was really down to earth and always gave really constructive feedback. Not a stickler about due dates and encourages creative freedom. Would definitely take her class again
I wrote my essay whilst under the influence of red bull and a 2 a.m. energy burst and i still got an A
Holy hell she was fun.

You'll look at her and scratch your head and wonder what celebrity she reminds you of and I promise you it's the Ms. Frizzle. This professor is funny and engaging and very open with her student to discuss the work and provide any clarification she can. She will always help you but she won't do it for you. She will guide but it is up to you to walk

AMAZING professor! She was always there to help. I had to text her multiple times for help and she would always get right back to me. Very understanding. Wrote a lot of papers but was very clear in the syllabus when they would be due and exactly what they were about. Left time at the end of each class for conferencing help. HIGHLY recommend!

professor mitchell has great knowledge about english and is always willing to help, even outside of class. Before assigning a paper she thoroughly discusses it and gives you clear guidelines of what she expects. Gives great feedback and if you follow it, you'll get an A on your final draft. She's nice, funny, and caring.

Dr. Mitchell is an amazing professor. She made healthcare policy and the nurse's role in driving it interesting and immersive. She gives detailed feedback on assignments and stays in contact with her students. She is supportive, encouraging and compassionate about nursing. I would absolutely recommend courses with Dr. Mitchell.

Dr. Mitchell is an amazing professor. She made healthcare policy and the nurse's role in driving it interesting and immersive. She gives detailed feedback on assignments and stays in contact with her students. She is supportive, encouraging and compassionate about nursing. I would absolutely recommend courses with Dr. Mitchell.

Professor Mobydeen gives allot of additional reading but her lectures and powerpoint presentations are so complete the book isn't needed. Her group excersizes are very thought provoking. She is clear about how to write papers and returns a clear rubric to go by. Classes are fun and interesting. She is very nice and helpful as well. Highly reccomend

Professor Mobydeen gives allot of additional reading but her lectures and powerpoint presentations are so complete the book isn't needed. Her group excersizes are very thought provoking. She is clear about how to write papers and returns a clear rubric to go by. Classes are fun and interesting. She is very nice and helpful as well. Highly reccomend

I was disappointed that she doesn't teach BIO202. I really loved having her as my teacher. Her recorded lectures were easy to follow and her classes focused on making sure we understood material via ungraded "quizzes". She was responsive to questions. Overall an easy class, just listened/took good notes and didn't study. Modney better than Corbett.

do not take this professor. Honor roll student and drowned in the workload for this course. Quizzes/exams are hard, they are not directly from the material. I had a death in my family&stepped away from the exam (phone call) and came back to my test submitted. The professor would not let me retake it. She is rude and doesnt care about her students.

I was disappointed that she doesn't teach BIO202. I really loved having her as my teacher. Her recorded lectures were easy to follow and her classes focused on making sure we understood material via ungraded "quizzes". She was responsive to questions. Overall an easy class, just listened/took good notes and didn't study. Modney better than Corbett.

I took her web-based class, so she was non-existent for the most part. The course keeps up to schedule and is fairly self-explanatory. It's reading material heavy and has quite a bit of course work, but if you stay up to date and don't procrastinate you should be fine.

Whew! This class is a toughie. 25 chapters worth of material. The exams cover a lot of material and in depth too. Modney is great but the class is so complex. I recommend taking chemistry before/at the same time because some concepts carry over. Curves are insane because people do so bad on the exams

It is very clear that she is either new to her job or just an archaic professor. She needs an experienced mentor of some sort to help her with her teaching/grading style/syllabus. Would never take her class again and hope that one day she becomes a more effective/efficient professor. Reminder not every job is for everyone. Teaching? Not for her.

Professor Barbara does response to emails quickly than most professor would. She does love biology and it shows through her BB notes for all 16 chapters you have to read about in her classroom. You will be reading a lot so get ready whether you like it or not. The tests are conceptual, which means you really have to study. Tests and quizzes timed.

My opinions may not be the best, because it is her first time teaching the class. But she told us she would give us study guides, and never did. the notes you take in the class will not help you that much, you need to look in the book, and the exams are very challenging.
She is a saint! Made learning biology so much easier, explains the material very well! She is willing to help you! I would 100% recommend her for this class!!!! One of the best professors I've had!!

Don't wait until the night before to study the material! they cover a lot in BIO200 and BIO202, start studying at least a week if not two before the test. Dr. Modney is very approachable, she's also quick to answer emails. I suggest making a quizlet or something to just test yourself on terms.

This isn't high school. Dr. Modney is a solid university professor who is literate and clearly knowledgeable in her field, she also exudes passion over what she teaches which I find refreshing. Students shouldn't expect to get A's in any university biology course without studying. The textbook goes into full detail about the lecture slides covered.

Dr. Modney is okay but she rushes through material and it's hard to understand some concepts. While she taught her portion of the course, we learned 14 chapters in a few weeks. If you don't go to lecture, you won't get an A, probably not a B either. Curves A LOT, but still need to study. print notes & write extra stuff b/c not everything is on PPTs

Very fast paced. Study hard and write things out. It's really important to attend class. Exams get curved like 20%. Record lectures on your phone, even if you pay attention its helpful to go back and hear her explain it. I wouldn't recommend going to her for help, go to SI instead. I went to her office hours and she belittled me.

Had Modney for BIO 200, she was very interested in the topic she was teaching but sometimes had a hard time breaking it down for students. If you have questions go to her office hours!! She is very helpful and willing to dedicate the time to explain the material to you

I had Barbara for two courses, BIO 200 and my intro to uni life. She is a solid person and is dedicated to education. Bio is a difficult course for many, so pay attention to lecture. She's very clear about what she wants you to know, and her tests are not hard if you take the practice quizzes provided in BB.

attend all SI Sessions, form flash cards, use Khan Academy and AK Lectures for materials covered in class, form study groups, stop by office hours to ask questions, just don't get behind. amazing professor and loves the subject...

This is the hardest biology class. If you do not need it for your major avoid at all costs. The average is around a 50% on each exam. This is simply a weed-out class. Dr. Modney read off the powerpoint which i found useless. She would only explain if a student asked her to go into detail. Tests are beyond hard and specific. Avoid at all costs.

Bio 200 was not a hard class. It requires work/studying, but if you put in the time an A is doable. (I got an A on every test.) I recorded the lectures, relistened to stuff i found difficult, made flashcards, and went to SI sessions. Plus, there is usually a curve. Modney is an awesome professor and lets you know exactly what will be tested on.

Covers way too much complex material in a short period of time, making it hard to grasp. She will cover like 3 Chapters a week which is ridiculous. This class is death by power point. All honestly get a different professor who will will break the material down barney style.
terrible teacher. moves extremely fast with no explanations

I took bio200 with Modney which is very hard. Nonetheless, she lectures very well and answers questions very clearly. She teaches a very difficult class but that does not by any means mean that she is a bad professor. Tests are very hard. Study the handouts with ridiculous detail and you'll succeed. DONT miss class. I'd recommend SI as well.

Very educated on the subject. Cannot bring the information down to the student level. Gets frustrated when students don't understand. Helpfulness is hit or miss - better one on one. Gives NO breaks or sympathy. Suggest not taking him.
Just go to class and comment during lecture and you will get an A

Worst prof I've had at CSU. Doesn't know how to teach. Actually asked the class how to teach! Teaches from Power Point-directly from book's CD. Tests on everything he doesn't go over. Says he will curve, but doesn't. Waste of time and money. Stay away!

Listen. The material is hard. There is a LOT of info to cover! Molina tells you EXACTLY what is going to be on the exams, offers a few bonus points, AND allows two cheat sheets for exams. He also explains concepts well. There's no getting around the fact that the subject is tough. Work hard! He gives you ALL the tools you need to succeed.

Listen. The material is hard. There is a LOT of info to cover! Molina tells you EXACTLY what is going to be on the exams, offers a few bonus points, AND allows two cheat sheets for exams. He also explains concepts well. There's no getting around the fact that the subject is tough. Work hard! He gives you ALL the tools you need to succeed.

This course is the hardest but he explains a lot. It's important to pay attention, study and understand the topic not just how to answer a topic. Mostly graded on a few tests and two papers. There is online homework that is harder than the tests but with many attempts available. Definitely worth taking if you enjoy the topic. Hard if you don't care

very hard material but he provides a lot of examples and the solutions to all practice problems. homework is online and he offers many attempts. Tests are MC and problem types but he gives a lot of credit if you show work. you need to read and study the practice problems throughly. allows cheat sheets and there is also 2 papers

The assigned textbook is drier and more boring than reading the dictionary. Assigned quizzes are easy while the two tests are just the opposite. They are a combination of mutiple choice and essay. The essay questions are graded extremely harshly and not enough time is given to complete them. Questions seem to bother him and answers are curtly given

He'll have 4-6 problems on a test + MC ?'s and only allow 75 min. total when the text states each problem should take 35 minutes. Ignores emails, his writing in class isn't legible so you can't understand the problem, and he doesn't take well to questions. I read, practiced 30 hours a week and still did poorly. Only bad grade I've had in acct class
His tests are really hard and he can be a tough grader. Definitely need to study way ahead of time.

By far the most difficult class Ive taken.  Good professor and does a great job teaching.  His tests are incredibly difficult and borderline unfair.  I always attended class and took good notes.  I studied the book problems for 30+ hours and would understand them clearly and still fail the tests.  Better teacher than pozanski but impossible tests.

This class is easier than Intermediate I with Poznanski. Professor Molina is an accounting genius and knows how to present the material in a clear and understandable way. Going to class is crucial in my opinion. His exams can be lengthy and tough, but he does give a good amount of partial credit if you show you know a little bit. Nice guy too.

This is a pretty tough accounting class. You CANNOT wait before a test to study as the material is very challenging, however if you take the time to prepare beforehand you will be able to pass this class. Molina is a good teacher and definitely knows the material.

Intermediate 2 w Molina is WAY EASIER compared to Intermediate 1 w Poznanski. Why? Because Molina actually knows how to teach. The course is still tough and you will need to read the chapters and do the problems to understand the material. But Molina gives partial credit on all exams. ASK HIM QUESTIONS! He loves to help and wants you to learn.

good teacher explains stuff thoroughly in class if you are confused ask and he'd be more than happy to help i wouldn't miss the classes its not that he takes them for points but i missed a class and i came back confused overall good teacher would definitely recommend him and i would take his class again if i could.

Very Good Professor , explained everything in details. One of the toughest classes in the Accounting Major. Will need to spend time completing homework. If you do homework and go to class you will pass.

Tests are very difficult and you have to invest a lot of time in studying but he provides detailed step by step answers to all problems in book and exam questions are similar to book problems.  His teaching style is very clear and concise.  This is not a show up, barely work and get an A class but if you put the work in you will and can do well.
one of CSU's best teachers. gives crystal clear explanations of problems.  can't fall asleep in his class, he asks too many questions and demands the class to answer.  His tests aren't easy.
he is tuagh. he is boring and no carve on this class. never take class with him.

Excellent professor.  Explained difficult subject material w/clarity. Allowed students to use textbook for exams. Tax has many exceptions & limitations.  Regardless of the availability of the text book for exams, studying is a must. Do assigned hw before class and re-work the problems a few times. Be ready to use exceptions and know limitations.
This Professor cannot explain the concept so well and he is always explain the problem after the Chapter, Tax is a tough subject, but he never teach clearly but the exam is not easy

First, there is no dates on syallabus. He tells you homework will be collected and never collects it. Doesn't follow the same format of the problems in the book,test are too long and don't look anything like the homework problems. I dropped the course after failing both test and considering switching my major.

Sets up pretty clear expectations for her class. She adjusts throughout the semester depending on how quick you move through material so expect some cancelled classes. She will sometimes replace a quiz with a short writing assignment that is easy. There is a group project with a lot of freedom but, you have to present it in class. Super nice prof.
Cool prof

I took Lifespan Development with Dr. Monroe. Very easy class. Practically gives you test questions in her "Jeopardy review game." Midterm, final, journals, one paper, and a group project. Easy grader. Curves her tests. Cancelled class all the time. If you study what she tells you, easy A.

Tons of information to remember but I enjoy this class. We discuss broader topics as it relates to real-world scenarios. I've taken advantage of extra credit to boost my grade. There are several opportunities throughout the semester.
Very understanding and gives good feedback one on one

Tons of information to remember but I enjoy this class. We discuss broader topics as it relates to real-world scenarios. I've taken advantage of extra credit to boost my grade. There are several opportunities throughout the semester.
I truly appreciate the guidance she provided me when seeking an internship. Truly knowledgeable of how the hiring process works.
Professor Monroe does a great job at managing classroom control with a very immature crowd. I appreciate all the work she puts in to give us multiple chances to succeed during the semester.

I have had better high school substitutes than this college professor. As in, she's terrible. The class has no form of reinforcement of the topics that she presents in a mediocre way through her long droll lectures. Her arrogance can be felt when describing examples and it appears that she has never taken a class in education or even business.

Noe makes you read so much, but you're gonna learn a lot about the theatre and have some interesting conversations about performance and politics. You can't hide and you can't be lazy if you want to do well, but Noe is funny and he's willing to give you a lot of his time if you ask for it.

His class was a complete waste. I was extremeley interested in this class prior to taking it but it turned out to be completely different from what I expected. A lot of reading is involved an be preprepared to sit and talk about what you read cause thats all you will do in his class.

This class was Boring as heck. This class was not what I expected I did not learn anything out of it. All we did was read the books and spend 75 minutes talking about them.  Not my cup of tea for a class.

Noe is funny and a good teacher, but his class will kick your ass. Lots of reading and writing, including assignments due the morning when class meets, but if you do the work you'll learn so much. He also makes you talk a lot. You sit in a circle and can't hide.

I loved this professor and his class, which was Anthropology- rise and fall of civilizations . The lectures were long, but the class didn't have a scheduled time so you could pause the recorded lecture and do it in chunks. And the lectures were never boring either. The assignments were actually fun to do, 10/10 would take one of his courses again!

His lectures were always really long and I couldnt put too much time to an elective class that hadnt had anything to do with my major. I only did well because I was very interested in sociology in the past and thats what got me through the class.

Do not take his class, he is a horrible lecturer that rambles on and doesn't provide any useful information. He makes the class much harder than it has to be. I am a straight-A student but this class is unreasonably hard. TAKE THIS CLASS WITH ANOTHER PROFESSOR!

I loved this professor and his class, which was Anthropology- rise and fall of civilizations . The lectures were long, but the class didn't have a scheduled time so you could pause the recorded lecture and do it in chunks. And the lectures were never boring either. The assignments were actually fun to do, 10/10 would take one of his courses again!

The material in the course is great, and this professor presents it eloquently and humorously. He has real knowledge and passion for the subject. Lectures are long and for the online course youll have a 500 word paper, a quiz, and a discussion post every week. Light work if you actually pay attention to what hes saying.

He grades too hard for a 100 level class. He will assign an essay that's only worth 10 points and grade it like your life depends on it. I'm taking high level engineering courses and I spend more time in this class than my actual harder ones. It doesn't help that a lecture video is almost 2 hours long and the quiz has nothing to do with the lecture

I had to take his class remote because he would not offer an in person meeting. If you like to spend 3-4 hours of your day watching a lecture videos that have nothing to do with the quizzes you take right after them then you are in luck. This class is not an easy A, it's more like a waste of your time. Choose a different class to receive credit.

I took this online. You have to really pay attention to the lecture to understand what will be on the quizzes. He is really funny in the lectures so its not that bad. As long as you pay attention and do your work its not hard at all.

Ok listen, if you wanted to take ANT 103 to get an easy A. DO NOT TAKE THIS PROFESSOR. HE SO TOUGH FOR NO REASON. LITERALLY HIS LECTURES DO NOT MATCH HIS QUIZ QUESTIONS! I never thought I would be praying hard to pass an ANTHROPOLOGY CLASS! He's pretty funny in his lecture videos though but i'm not laughing till I start getting better grades.

Professor Moore was a great professor. Your grades rely on several quizzes that are easy A's as long as you pay attention in class. He doesn't like technology so get ready to put away your phone but his lectures are engaging and at times comedic so there will never really be an issue.

Professor Moore was a great professor. Your grades rely on several quizzes that are easy A's as long as you pay attention in class. He doesn't like technology so get ready to put away your phone but his lectures are engaging and at times comedic so there will never really be an issue.

His lectures are the best because he has a ton of experience to offer and make the topics easier to understand. The only thing you have to worry about is no being able to have electronics out especially your phone. You'll get over it in about a week or so. You don't need your laptop since he provides the notes, which is all you need

Dr. Moore was by far the best professor I had the entire year. He was knowledgeable and very intense, but I believe that is the reason I respected him so much. Attendance is mandatory; he does check and it is calculated in your final grade. I don't recommend buying the text; barely used it. I would definitely take a class with Dr. Moore again.
very liberal

Dr. Moore is freaking hilarious. One of my favorite classes at CSU. He made the material thought-provoking and real with his own teaching examples. DO NOT have your phone out. His class was really reasonable. Quizzes were all from the notes. He is really kind and caring during office hours just comes off as a little aggressive at first. Great prof!

Great teacher. Super funny. Highly educated and smart. Relates to students and cares about students. Must go to class, letter grade dropped if you miss 3 classes. Tests are essay based, but easy if you study. Textbook used for your own reference. Lectures enjoyable and interesting. Take this class!

Dr. Moore is a great lecturer. All of his experiences and stories are relevant and so helpful.  There is a group project at the end and 2 books to read (but I never used the textbook). Buy the other books and annotate them for yourself, but skip the textbook. His lecture and notes will cover you. Prewrite your essays for exams! Best prof I've had.
Dr. Moore makes you work for your grade. Totally worth it.  He does have a group project... Make sure you are in a group that's willing to work.

Dr. Moore is a super fun professor, he really shows that he cares about his students and how they are doing in his class. He is a great teacher and makes sure you understand his material. He might be a little intimidating at first but don't let that scare you off as long as you show up to class it will be a great learning experience all semester.

I thoroughly enjoyed his class.  He was a great lecturer and made it very easy to participate and be engaged.  Midterm and Final are essay driven, but the study guides he gives you are the exact questions on the midterm/finals and all questions come directly from the notes.  Show up, participate and study your notes and you will be just fine.

Dr. Moore is loud and clear enough to actually be interested in the lectures he talks about. He's very smart, and knows what he's talking about. He understands reality, and wants his students to learn and grow from that.

A lot is expected of you in his diversity class.  He is a highly educated and experienced professor and it shows.  He's not pretentious either.  No need to buy a text as his notes serve as the text.  The midterm and final are based on his notes.  Make sure you attend class and participate in conversation.  Overall, it was a good class.
NA
It has two papers, one of them is 10 pages and the another one is 15 pages with 10 references. We worked 9 times as a group inside the class. I have attended all the classes and I got (C-).

An amazing professor who is always willing to help.  He is extremely professional and expects the students to behave in the same manner.  As long as you read over the powerpoints a few times before class and prepare for the exams with the study guide he provides, you will be in great shape.  Make sure you pick good partners for the group project.

Great teacher. Explains material very thoroughly and in detail. Wants student to do well and very willing to help students. Gives notes to class then explains them and has discussion about them. Study guides are great gives you the long essays  from the test, and a list of ten possible short answer questions that he picks 4 of.

I have repeatedly told people that Dr Moore was one of THE best professors that I have ever had. His goal is not to pass or fail students, but instead he wants students to learn the material that he goes over. He had some strict rules, but there are instances where students have gotten to be disrepsectful with cell phones, missing class, etc.

Dr. Moore is definitely one of those professors who wants his students to succeed.  He is tough, but he is hands down one of my favorite professors at CSU.  You really have to study for his tests, but as long as you put in the effort to do well he will meet you halfway and help if you need it.

Here is the deal in HIS 200 which is geography in CSU for social studies and history majors. He is the only professor who is able to teach this course in our university, therefore he dictate the teaching style and the material covered. A 15 page research paper + 4 tests each consist of 2-3 writing essay and short answers.He hate to be proven wrong

And he will deduct any spelling mistakes you commit. On the other hand he does many projects in his courses, for EDC 300 students had to perform a community mapping project which involved focus study of areas in the greater Cleveland with the focus on schools and the community around them. If your a social study major, your honored to have him.

Professor Moore's lectures are from his power points that include many Youtube videos . There is NO NEED to buy the text book. He does not provide study guides for exams, but the exams are easy. Three exams and one extra credit assignment. You can tell he's bored and need a new careerchallenge.

Dr. Moore is overall a good teacher. However, he is a Harvard graduate and isn't afraid to let you know it! He is also African-American, which race-related issues tend to be a focus on his lectures. He is also a liberal. He occasionally can be combative with ultra-conservative students. With that said, his class is very enjoyable.

Your grade heavily depends on clicker questions. You don't have to do the readings he gives in order to get a good grade. If you just show up and answer the questions you will get a good grade--paying attention is not necessary. He mainly focuses on racism, not very much time spent on class or gender.
Not bad at all
Good instructor, he knows the subject very well.  Trying to help everyone to get an A, but just being too nice....

The man is a mess. Highly unorganized and uninterested. Very unorthodox considering he's got a degree from Harvard. However his lack of interest is made up by the fact that the material is relatively easy.

Dr. Moore taught a very easy course.  He seemed to not care if anyone absorbed the information given.  Raced through the notes and showed movies during class.  Very bad with e-mails.  Test are very easy and he curves them two letter grades.  Easy A but don't plan to learn.  Late every day so no need to be a punctual student. Good course, easy grade

Horrible horrible teacher. His race/class/gender class has a 2 page essay due every sunday all semester and his "study guide" for the midterm had 200 some things to know and study for a 60 question test. He does NOT know his stuff, is constantly late, gets confused, is wrong about topics and is just plain boring. Highly suggest DO NOT TAKE!!

He really is a nice guy but is super unorganized. Once came 15 minutes late to an exam. He seems like he knows what he's talking about and it just gets lost in translation. His classes are easy to pass if you follow do all the assignments. Tests and quizzes are off PowerPoint (when he remembers to make them) so make sure you take notes.
Just do the work because he don't care.

You could get an A on the Midterm an A on the annoying 8 page paper and if you miss classes or clicker days you could end up with a B or C. Attend class often or have a buddy system. He doesn't use text books so be prepared to read. His student assistant grades the term papers so write  accordingly.
This guy gave alot of group quizzes and take home tests, Even though he's not really prepared for class, you can't beat that. I'd recommend him.

Very disorganized but not a hard class at all.  Basically, just watch videos and write short responses, take a midterm and final which are ridiculously easy.  He has clicker questions which sort of keep track of attendance.  As long as you show up to class and read the book you will get an A.
his lectures are extremely boring, however his tests are usually right out of the reading and you can get by as long as you show up and stay awake. Pretty straight forward ok class

I personally enjoyed his class but I can see why many didnt or wont like it.  His tests are fairly easy if you  do the readings.  He doesnt give notes and his lectures are all over the place.  The class is not structured to say the least.  He gave a 7 page paper, 3 multiple choice tests, and roughly 50 pts of ec.  My Advice: Do the readings!

He showed up 50 min late on the final exam, and still made us take it.. Took two classes with him, nd didnt really like.. Tests are hard, he gives a lot of extra credits.. He never reads the essays so just write whatever :D

If you want an A take him. Make sure you show up to class. Tests can be a bit tough, but he points out exactly what you need to study. 35 points extra credit available as well (room for a bombed test). This class should count as a WAC, there are five single spaced essays. His tests are a on the info he goes over in class. Don't buy the book.
Good teacher, Get attendance points and gives opportunity for extra credit. Interesting class!

He was all over the place when he was lecturing, and even though I did well I felt like I got little out of his class. He was usually unprepared for class, and told us that he did not enjoy teaching this subject.

Terrible professor. Assigned 3 books, and would basically just read out of them in class. At one point,he said "I dont even like this book. I dont know why i assigned it." but proceeded to give quiz questions from it. AVOID AT ALL COSTS.

I took Applied Music 121 Private Voice from Mrs. Moore. She is very helpful and direct about what the student needs to work on. Very knowledgeable in the songs and languages they are in. I am satisfied with this instructor and will take another voice class from her in the spring!

I took Applied Music 121 Private Voice from Mrs. Moore. She is very helpful and direct about what the student needs to work on. Very knowledgeable in the songs and languages they are in. I am satisfied with this instructor and will take another voice class from her in the spring!
This lady is super awful. Come on. Get real. Someone help.
She's a really good teacher and makes math easy to understand especially for people who aren't good in this subject. She gives good feedback and cares about her students.

Replaced lowest exam score with Final exam grade IF the final exam grade is higher. I turned a D on an exam into an A (I got an A on the final). Many quizzes (usually group quizzes) Homework was all online. Drops 2 low quiz scores, and like five low homework scores. She did make errors while teaching but if you know whats going on TELL HER to look
The only thing I disliked about this class was the forced participation. Pretty easy class though , a lot like high school math.

Consistently shows up late to class. Never seems prepared and makes mistakes while teaching often. Is not very helpful, and does not check emails on the weekend. Very disappointed to have been in this class, definitely would not take again. However, the course I was in, MTH149, was easy enough to pass without help of the instructor.

One of the very worst instructors I have ever had. She frequently makes mistakes while teaching her methods and it causes a lot of confusion. Her response to a question from the class is usually a vague, unhelpful answer. I truly question how she is considered eligible to teach this course. Everything I have learned this semester was self taught.

She is awesome! Had her two semesters in a row and she makes the class fairly easy. Almost always leave class 5-10 minutes early which is nice. Attending class as long as you have not missed more than 3 classes is worth a small amount of extra credit. Also, 2 quizzes and 5 homeworks are dropped. Really enjoyed the class.

Gives group quizzes. Show up to class regularly and don't fall behind on the homework and you'll be fine. She's very clear in her instruction and is helpful when you have a question. Textbook is included in the price of the class, bring it every day to class.

Professor Moore is awesome! I had to take MTH 116, aka pre-stats, even though I already had credit for stats. Super easy. The curriculum was actually useful, we learned how to calculate interest and actual real life stuff. All quizzes are taken in groups of 3. Tests are easy. She is a great teacher, very clear! Attendance adds bonus % to end grade.

Professor Moore is the laid back, reasonable, easy to work with teacher that every student wants to have. She gave study guides and always gave reviews. She is super chill, funny and relatable. She knows her math but knows that math isn't easy for everyone--don't be afraid to ask her questions.  She will always let you make up  tests.
Gives extra credit for attending every class. If she holds a review session, go because there will  most likely be extra credit involved.

If you're bad at math this is the class to take! Tiffany makes everything vey easy to understand. There are about 10 quizzes that we do in groups of three, and only three tests. Test questions come form the quizzes and homework. She reviews before every test. 2-3 online HW assignments are due once a week.
Great Professor!

She is very laid back and attentive when it comes to questions from the class. Course material is useful. There is a lot of homework, but it is never very hard assuming you attend class and get the hand outs. Tests are of average difficulty but going to the math center can almost guarantee an A.

The material itself is ridiculous. No one taking this class is going to use this information, but it's a requirement. Moore makes it tolerable. She's laid back,funny, understanding, and gives many chances. I'd recommend her class.
She is pretty cool. She is listen to everybody . The course has much of homework.
Very helpful with understanding material. Being somewhat different material, she made a point of learning and doing the assignments with the class.
Very easy going instructor, but lacks instructing ability. Rarely understood her methods and lectures.
Very Easy Class. Teacher is easy
She is a good teacher and most of the time explains concepts of the class clearly. Class is easy than MTH 116 because there is no algebra at all.

No a terrible teacher, but not a great one either. Doesn't explain formulas as clear as would liked. However, shes very nice and DEFINITELY does her best to help her students pass. Offers no EC really.

Dr. Moore is very knowledgeable. Participation is a must but it's very easy to know what's going on, you just have to pay attention. He makes lectures interesting by making it a discussion and asking for input. We did a lot of group work which was nice as the class was on zoom. I really recommend taking his class if you're interested in diversity.

Dr. Moore is very knowledgeable. Participation is a must but it's very easy to know what's going on, you just have to pay attention. He makes lectures interesting by making it a discussion and asking for input. We did a lot of group work which was nice as the class was on zoom. I really recommend taking his class if you're interested in diversity.

Ok, classes arnt too bad, he really does try to keep them interesting by sharing stories. A few things I must warn you about, he constantly pinpoints people in class and forces them participate in discussions. Also, some of the multiple choice on the exams were kind of tricky - more than two answers kind of deal. Its a lot of work but its bareable.

Professor keeps lectures interesting by providing examples and stories to illustrate his points.  Their are 2 tests and one paper.  overall if you go to class and pay attention one should do well.  I would recommend this professor because of his vast knowledge and that he has the ability to that convey the knowledge to the class.

Very good teacher. Presents the material very well, keeps it interesting throughout the whole class.The final is not comprehensive but requires a lot of reading.There is also a paper requirement on HR topic. I highly recommend him!
Uses standard 2-exam format (midterm, final). Makes attendance mandatory.

He doesn't use Powerpoint or study guides. You must attend class and take detailed notes if you want to pass. 2 exams and 1 paper. He will call on students randomly to answer questions in class. Test questions were mostly from notes and class discussion, some from the book. Poor attendance is not recommended for this class.

Very knowledgeable of unions. Lectures for entire class, w/o using PowerPoint, visual aids, or handouts. Does not use Blackboard. MGT 651 has 2 exams and 1 essay. The exams are tough, but he grades on a curve. Must read the textbook. He asks questions but will tell you that youre wrong if you dont read his mind and tell him exactly he wanted.

Participation matters in this class so read your book. There is two exams, no homework (except reading), and one easy paper. The exams are a little tough but he is not a hard grader. The  grades in the class was between A to B-. Come to class because he tells you what is on the exams. If I study a little harder could have had an A

Sometimes pompous, sometimes rude toward students, but he has a true passion for all things union.  I personally didn't care for him, but he is a decent prof for collective bargaining, but not for 601...since he only gets jazzed for collective bargaining.

took collective bargaining and another hr class w. him. He actually held my attention and I enjoyed both classes. Mostly study from your class notes and then some from the book. You will do great in class discussion if you read the chapters before the class. It was pretty easy.

He made the class interesting by sharing his professional experience. I would say NO BUSY WORKS. You only have 2 exams and 1 individual paper. Exam questions were tricky! You would have a chance to see 2 or 3 answers seem to be right.
Great teacher, very clear! makes class fun. Hard to fall asleep and is fair with grading and exams. Two thumbs up.

amazing professor. always available after class for questions. i struggled during the course but he helped me with extra credit and small assignments that can make you understand the topic. would take again.

amazing professor. always available after class for questions. i struggled during the course but he helped me with extra credit and small assignments that can make you understand the topic. would take again.

The guy talks about chemistry, doesn't teach you how to solve problems. He'll not prepare you for MCAT, he doesn't talk much about subjects he doesn't like, and exam questions are REALLY different from home work. He'll probably help you if you don't know how to answer a question during exam and will probably boost your grade by one letter.

Professor Moran is truly a good guy. He really seems like he cares about his students inside and outside of class. Super kind-hearted, but the tests are somewhat difficult. Gives out book work for anyone who doesn't want to spend $300 on Mastering Chemistry, and it really does boost your grade

He seems like he knows chemistry, but not how to teach it. Homework is completely different than what you talk about in class and the tests are hard to prepare for due to the fact you dont really learn anything in class. He seems like a good person, just not a good professor

He gets frustrated easily when you have questions. However, he is kind and willing to work with you if you miss an exam. I don't like the fact that he uses the "Mastering Chemistry," which is online, and can get a bit tricky at times. Another goof thing about him is that he uploads all of the class notes on blackboard. He makes study guides too.
He didn't show up to class and then, gave an exam when he came back. Made study guides, but none of the material was on the exams. Made fun of students in front of the entire class.

Dr. Moran would be a better friend than a teacher. Extremely interesting guy, but also extremely disorganized. Not a natural born teacher. He easily becomes frustrated when students don't understand difficult concepts. Go to office hours, communicate your needs, and Dr. Moran will help you pass.

Extrememly smart, in lecture can lose you but if you ask him questions he's great! he cares about students that actually care to learn which is nice. If you study the book and ask questions and go to class you'll ace it and i hate chem! :)
He's a good teacher, just go  to class, take good notes and you'll do fine. my only compalaint is that he didn't curve test scores when the avrage was a 50%.

I took this class online on PSU World Campus and so I had to listen to Dr. Morford sloppily read her lectures; which is better than reading the transcript in the long-run. She's pretty clear but is a stickler for plain and concise answers. Just read her guidelines.... then read em' again, and give her the most boring straight-forward answer you can
Ridiculous expectations, unfair grader, ambiguous test questions, insulting to students who try to actively participate. Dry and boring. She should not be teaching.

Best teacher ever. She loves fiction and the art of storytelling. Let her passion seep into your mind. She's a straight shooter and unfiltered, so if you're easily offended, just go in knowing that. Very fun lecture discussions. Loved every book I had to read for her class. I wish I could give more praise. I'd take another class with her if I could

Best teacher ever. She loves fiction and the art of storytelling. Let her passion seep into your mind. She's a straight shooter and unfiltered, so if you're easily offended, just go in knowing that. Very fun lecture discussions. Loved every book I had to read for her class. I wish I could give more praise. I'd take another class with her if I could

She is the realest professor out. Tough love professor. She seems scary at first but underneath all that is a caring soul XD. She truly wants students to learn and find out what "the good" is. She's not too lecture-heavy. It's about half lecture half work on your assignment. She's very helpful, supportive and gives good feedback. Good choice.

At first, she may seem off-putting but thats just because shes trying to scare you into doing your best in her class. Sometimes she says the most outrageous things but she is a great professor. Her advice is solid and is always willing to help. Always go to class, do your best, and participate, she notices. Plus, it will help you in the long run.

Professor Morgan was my favorite professor this past semester. You have to show up to class and do assignments to pass but she is very honest and a little intimidating at first. She cares about her students futures and does everything she can to help you. 10/10 would recommend to anyone!

Charlotte Morgan has her way of making the class interesting. One way or another she raises an issue which would prompt you to discuss and participate in class. She is crystal clear on what objectives of the course. If you need help just ask her. She doesn't really give extra credit but u don't need extra credit to pass.
Great professor, great class. If I had to take more English I would almost beg to have her again.

I absolutely loved her class. I hate the subject of English, but she made me enjoy it. She was hilarious and always brightened my day. You could really tell she cared for the success and welfare of her students! Definitely take her class if possible!

Professor Morgan was amazing!!! She genuinely cares about how her students do in her class, in addition to how they feel about the class.  She was extremely understanding and pretty funny too, but her humor might not be for everyone.  Would take her again!!
she is very nice. She treats her students as her kids so she really cares for you and always helps you to pass the class with a decent grade!
Love her take her she makes class interesting and fun at the same time Easy A ...

LOVE HERRR she is a great professor and knows her self i recommend her to everybody there is alot of reading, a couple of homework assignments ,alot of essays but despite everything it isnt hard and if you need help shes there to help you . Ms. Morgan is funny and helps you understand things that will take you far ... TAKE HERRR

I had her in spring13 semester. She inspired me for learning english. She was the best teacher that I could have as an ESL student. Her classes are not boring. You'll not get stressed about your papers.
Great teacher and always willing to go the extra mile to help his students. He even held study sessions on Saturdays before the tests for extra help. Really made circuits a lot easier.
Hes an amazing professor! My understanding in circuits is much better! Really cares for his students, willing to help when you need it. 11/10 amazing
Cool professor

EEC 473, EEC 571.. One of the best professor I had.. Helps students genuinely, makes the class interesting with practical experiences in the field of electrical.. There is also a field trip for extra credit..

If you ask him a question in class he would tell you to go look at the powerpoint event though my question was about the power point. He does encourage to work with other people for lab reports and gets mad if you don't. And he grades really hard. Many people in my class thought we did pretty well on his tests and we all do horribly on them.

very frustrating class due to the content of the subject, if you pay attention and study study study you will pass his class with no problem, his exams are harder then the final exam but overall I would retake his class if needed.

He teaches everything you need to know in classes and exams shouldn't be a surprise. It is a tough class so you just need to pay attention in class and take good notes. Also, printing out the slides helps too.

His tests are hard b/c of the extensive content. If you study like crazy an A is possible but students did complain in his class. His lectures consist of reading the slides but the good thing is, he's NOT monotone. Don't be intimidated by his attitude when responding to questions b/c its not intentional. Hes a typical nice person so do ask.

Worst professor I have ever had!! He doesn't explain anything and pretty much laughs at people who ask him for help or to clarify. He just gave the class formulas we needed to know and told us to know how to use them. Teaches from a powerpoint and doesn't do in class examples. Don't take the class with him if you're looking for a teacher who helps
Not a nice guy. Gets mad when you ask questions. Hard to follow in lecture. Lots of homework. Barely curves the exams. Exam heavy course. Would not take again.

He often shames students for doing poorly on tests and quizzes, his lectures are not easy to follow, and his exams and quizzes are extremely difficult. For being okay at math, I would never take a class with him again.
He makes you feel stupid when you ask a question, doesnt teach well

I would not recommend this professor. Just read the other student's reviews. They are the truth. This professor is condescending and makes you feel stupid when you ask questions and also as if you are bothering him. He shames the class for bad grades and I watched him snatch and THROW AWAY paper out of a students hand because it was not math.

I took MTH 181 with this professor in spring 2013. I am now a math major and I tutor for upper level math classes and his calc class was extraordinarily hard. I earned an A, but I distinctly remember him not preparing us for the exams. Take this professor iff you have to or you enjoy teaching yourself. Do not take if math is not you forte.

Hands down the worst teacher of my freshman year. He reads all his notes from the power points given to him from the book. Is not clear whatsoever. Makes fun of students for incorrect answers. Just all around a terrible teacher in every way possible. I studied my ass off for a A. Beware of trick questions he loves them!!!

Homework every week, but you know turning it in whether you did well or not. Provides examples for each chapter and has open lab days for students to work and ask questions. Pop quizzes are tough but do not count for many points in your final grade. Stay on top of the material, go to class and you will receive the grade you want. Would take again.
He makes students feel stupid when they dont know something, talks around questions, and never replies to emails yet complains no one goes to him for help. Drop asap.

I hate math but this class was not so bad. He lays out some very difficult topics in probably the easiest way possible. He grades with a fine-tooth comb but it may be because his class is structured fairly easily. Take-home exams, and homework he will check for you before turn-in. Checks attendance. Overall, I'd highly recommend

I took Business Math II online with him. This is NOT a good class to take online. He makes you go to the Math Emporium to take the Exams, but the homework and quizzes are online. This class can become very confusing if you are not good at math. If you get lost, make sure to ask for help, each section builds on the previous one.

The WORST teacher at Cleveland State! He is extremely hard to follow, and he makes you feel like an idiot for asking any type of question. His tests are hard and his pop quizzes are meant to fail you . He's comments on things you get wrong (for example an exam) are unnecessary and rude! DONOT torture yourself with this man and find a new professor
He just reads off the powerpoints... very confusing, I had to teach myself most of the material, make sure to study the last lecture as you will likely have a hard pop quiz

He is not a nice professor and tries to makes things difficult on purpose in what is supposed to be a decently easy class. The kind of professor to throw a pop quiz the day before your midterm. Take with someone else and save yourself the headache.

the class is a little confusing at first but as soon as you get the hang of what statistics is all about its a great class and he is very helpful and is a great professor! if you show up to class and do your weekly labs you will be in great shape!

He gives powerpoints straight from the book for his MTH 147 class, that was horrible. He was a nice guy but his tests were ridiculously hard and the class average was always a C so if you are looking for an easy stats class keep looking.
Sharon Moss was an excellent professor who went above and BEYOND to not only help her students, but allow them access to information and resources that would earn them a career. CSU will miss her!

During the 6 week summer semester you'll read 2 books. It goes by fast and the readings are portioned out nice and evenly. I thought I was going to do poorly but once you get the hang of making time to do the readings and assignments, it's a breeze. Only down fall is that there is a lot of long videos to watch. Other than that, not too bad.

Get ready to do a lot of homework, reason I took this class was that it hits two requirements. In the 6 week class every week you will have 3 quizzes, 1 journal entry, 2 papers on videos you watch each video being 2 hours long, and discussion board post this length requiremen and you can't do them all on the same day. This professor doesn't teach

Had for rock climbing and backpacking and an online class. The backpacking trip was a 2 and a half hour drive to hike 20 miles in the woods with random groups. At night it was freezing and we had to stay up messing with the fire . We also had to go get belay certified in rock climbing. Large time commitment for an activity class.

Took for an intro Law class at CSU for Sport Management program. Horrible. All textbook based, test questions are purposely tricky and incredibly specific. Professor is unprofessional and snarky when asking questions about quiz questions. Do NOT take unless you absolutely have to. Spend hours early in weeks on 90+ pages of textbook per week.

During the 6 week summer semester you'll read 2 books. It goes by fast and the readings are portioned out nice and evenly. I thought I was going to do poorly but once you get the hang of making time to do the readings and assignments, it's a breeze. Only down fall is that there is a lot of long videos to watch. Other than that, not too bad.
Horrible. Do not recommend to anyone.

Took for PED 222 rock climbing and backpacking. I'll start by saying Mary isn't exactly the nicest woman ever. On top of that there are trips for this class- one to Cuyahoga Falls to go climbing and one in Pennsylvania for a weekend long backpacking trip. Definitely a big time commitment, don't bother taking if you aren't outdoorsy.
Worst professor I have ever taken. How could she be a professor??? Her spellings and grammar are worse than students'

She teaches her opinion. She gives at least three assignments every week, and if you miss them - you can loose a lot of points. No extra credit. It's not a hard class - but time consuming. She picked books that she teaches as fact, when they are truly opinion. Also, very unhelpful.
Hard but necessary
She was great this class was fun and easy. She explained everything well and made sure we were having fun.
terrible attitude every single day i'm not sure why she teaches

this teacher only wanted to brag about how much she charges people for tennis lessons! everytime she demonstrated something she would mess it up & then tell us "well you get the concept" even if you never played or heard of the activity! would rather sit out a class than enroll!!!

This was one of the easiest classes I took at CSU. You don't really need to go to class, except when he gives out group work which is once a week. He's an easy grader when it comes to that though. Looking at the power points will help you out a lot in this class. The lectures are very  boring. He curves a lot at the end
Clear and good professor. You can do well from just studying off his power points.
Probably went to class three times the entire semester.  still received an A
I loved having Professor Motsi! He's very polite and understanding! Great professor and would definitely take a class he taught again!
very good professor.

Not only does he know all of the information extremely well, he does a great job of presenting it to the class through lecture. He gives you all of the notes, and writes his own tests. The information I learned from his class was useful, and I definitely will use it in my future career!
Professor Motsi is a good teacher. He is well informed.
Professor speaks monotone. The lectures and slides are interesting. Teaches excellent.
Prof. Motsi explains his lectures well. His outstanding knowledge gears up added interest. Voice is good but he should speak slower and louder...monotone...
The class had a lot of stuff to learn and his power points were illustrative with the clarity of concepts from his lectures.
he is a very knowledgeable professor. i knew a lot from his lectures. he did a good job. i will recommend others to take his class.
Nice guy but really boring. Teaches a lot of info and lots of writing on the test. I got a C and didnt study at all.
