Mare was such a good professor. Attendance is mandatory because it is ASL. She posts weekly videos of what you learn in class. Quizzes every week but they're super easy. This semester was different because of going online but she is super understanding and really sweet.

Mare was a great professor. Learning a new language is hard no matter what. You have to put in the time and effort if you actually want to retain the information. Mare went out of her way to record videos of each word list, stayed on zoom after our time, and met up with me when I reached out. If you want to pass, attend the class and engage.

I was looking forward to learning about deaf culture and history, unfortunately it is taught by the most uninspiring and bland teacher Ive EVER had at Cleveland State. would not recommend unless its mandatory towards your degree.

Mare was so great to learn with this semester. With everything being completely online she was so understanding of people needing flexibility and additional help. She is very approachable and very helpful and wants to see each student succeed
I really enjoyed ASL this semester with Mare, she made learning sign language enjoyable to learn. ESPECIALLY for remote learning. I really hope she is available for me to take next semester for ASL2.

Mare was such a good professor. Attendance is mandatory because it is ASL. She posts weekly videos of what you learn in class. Quizzes every week but they're super easy. This semester was different because of going online but she is super understanding and really sweet.
erratic grader

Excellent professor! Had him for both Thermo 1 and currently Thermo 2... Very passionate about what he does and it really keeps the class interested. That being said, it is a difficult and challenging course. Many projects, quizzes and exams. I would recommend taking when you have plenty of time to dedicate to the material. One of the best at CSU.

great professor who is interested in his work. takes the boring out of class. relies heavily on the book(tables) and tries to simplify complicated problems(success). highly recommend! not an easy professor, but if you study homework, tests are very similar

I enjoyed EDL 406 with Dr. Mousa. Sometimes the grading criteria isn't clear, but just ask her if you have questions. She's very responsive to email. Weekly discussion boards, a couple of strange assignments outside of that, but it's an easy class. Do the reading/video watching at times and you'll be fine. I learned a lot from this class.

Doing the work completely and on time will get you a nice grade. I felt that there was a lot of overlap/repetitiveness in the course which could get a little dry. However, it's informative and there are definitely things to be learned from this class.
Dr. Widad Mouss is  knowledgeable. If you do all your assignments on time, you will be fine.
Grading seems to be arbitrary and without explanation.
The teacher is usually nice. She criticizes some students whom she may not like.
One great teacher and lecturer. Socratic method employed.

Prof Moutafakis was possibly the best professor I have ever had. I am now in academia myself. Very often I remember him and the discussions from his class. I took his class close to 10 years ago. What helped me get an A is attendance, engaging in class discussions, as well as detailed notes. He is wise and kind- not very many people are both.

Sitting in PHL377 was the worst part of my day. This professor constantly repeated himself, and centrally focused on one philosopher the entire semester. It was incredibly boring; however, I got a lot of other course work done during his lectures. Easy grade, but attendance is mandatory, and trust me, it's a deal breaker.
I had Prof. Moutafakis nearly 35 years ago at CSU, and I remember him fondly to this day. That should be all you need to know. A class act.
Professor Moutafakis is one of my favorite professors thus far. Logic can become boring at times, but when the professor is as kind and helpful as Professor Moutafakis the course is quite enjoyable

second class i've taken with him.  great teacher.  the disability others are mentioning has no impact on his lectures.  has some pretty good off topic stories, but remains on topic the majority of the time.  both classes i've taken with him have been easy as long as you keep up with the assigned reading.

When I realized how wise he is, I tried to learn as much as I could from this man. Many times since then I have asked myself "what would Moutafakis do?" The answer is usually the right, if not easy, way to go. In an environment heavy in "ethics experts", Moutafakis is a standout.

WAC class. 2 written exams (requires about 3 pages each) and one 12+ page research paper about a Greek philosopher, a modern critic, and personal viewpoint. Professor frequently misunderstood questions that were being asked, however, was otherwise knowledgeable and helpful. Easy grader. Humorous and lighthearted. Highly recommend for a WAC class.

Knows his stuff. Tries to keep things light by being a bit of a joker and encouraging people through goodnatured teasing. Might be a bit annoying for those that are easily distracted by his disability, but he's a really nice guy and is willing to go over until you get it. Really liked this class and wish there would be a more advanced section soon.

I don't know why his ratings are so high. I got a good grade in this class, so this is not out of spite. He's hard to understand, gives very little in terms of explanation, and probably confuses more than he informs. Half the class dropped, including some very intelligent students. I recommend reading the book to pass, but better to just avoid him.
Knows his stuff better than anybody...
Disability is a bit of an obstacle to understanding him at first, but once you get used to it, he's one of the nicest, funniest professors around.
this guy is awesome. I took him my sophomore year and after seeing him the other day i had to give him a good rating. He makes hard concepts easy to understand.. great teacher.

A solid instructor.  Slowed down by a disability, but I found that to be helpful from an assimilation standpoint.  Does tend to pick on students (not maliciously), and have them do problems on board like high school. Averages 3 test scores, no margin for error. Does have some sense of humor. No problem recommending if you need this class.

Great prof a little slow when it came to keeping moving in text but made shure everyone knew what was going on before continuing on. U have to work for your grade but if you just come to class it is almost garenteed that you will get a A and at least a B+. The Prof wants everyone to succede (Majority of my class did get a's as final grades)

Smart and charming.  Makes some really dry material interesting. Enjoys bantering with the class- even about stuff that isn't relevant.  Doesn't push him agenda. Fair with his grading on your writing.  Prepares you well for tests.
No Comments
Was an okay teacher a bit slow though due to an illness but fair. a bit tough to follow but as long as you show effort youll do a good job in the class.

Professor Mowry teaches college students because he cares. Yes the homework load is heavy but not once is he not available to give you help. He is supportive he gives great advice and he adjusts his class structure as he learns more about his students. I would take this class a thousand times again.

I am so bad at math but Mr. Mowry was understanding of that and was always willing to answer questions and assist me whenever I needed the help. He didn't judge me when I didn't do the math problems correctly but would politely show what needed to be fixed. I would love to have him as a teacher again. 5 STARS!!!

Professor Mowry teaches college students because he cares. Yes the homework load is heavy but not once is he not available to give you help. He is supportive he gives great advice and he adjusts his class structure as he learns more about his students. I would take this class a thousand times again.

Very unhelpful. Would only email Powerpoints, not post them on Blackboard for easy access and acted like this was a great favor. Had a split class between him and Dr. Sola and it was like night and day. Tests have multiple essay questions and you need to remember specific dates, details, etc.. would avoid him if possible.

Dr. Muego, instructs his classes as if everyone in the room has Ph. D...he embarrasses his students and makes them feel degraded.  He also has extremely long lectures, and a lot of reading/homework.  Good luck, you'll need it!

I like Mueller, but he doesnt seem to like teaching. Hes a bit socially awkward, but hes organized, friendly, and very intelligent. He adds excellent notes to his lecture slides and spends a lot of time making sure the students understand his concepts. I would take from him again

I like Mueller, but he doesnt seem to like teaching. Hes a bit socially awkward, but hes organized, friendly, and very intelligent. He adds excellent notes to his lecture slides and spends a lot of time making sure the students understand his concepts. I would take from him again
Great guy but lecture heavy at times, but will help you and give good feedback
Great lecturer and all around good person who is easy to get along with and knows his stuff.

Overall not a good professor. Speaks in monotone and is lecture heavy so classes become harder to attend. 3 papers that you have to do which isnt bad, but the first two are hard and he grades harshly on them. Quizzes are hard too even though they are open note, slides are way too long and the information is dodgy.

I had to drop out of the class due to a concussion but while I was still enrolled and missing the first half of the semester he did his best to help me out make sure I was able to take my tests, turn in my homework, and whatever else was required of me until I could return. Unfortunately I couldn't but I plan on taking the class again
Just when you think you put a long time into something, it fires back on you with him. Good luck. Makes an easy class hard.

The clock tends to slow down whenever this class starts. Can get really boring and is really easy to tune him out. There's only 3 assignments which isn't bad. The exams are open note and multiple choice but it's still pretty easy to fail them without some prep. The attendance and participation may be the thing that saves your grade.

Long lectures & constant group participation. It's easy to zone out. Quizzes and exams are open notes, but don't let that trick you into thinking you'll pass. You'll definitely fail even with all the notes in front of your face. Bring coffee... and buy a massage chair to de-stress after the semester is over.

A professor that high school teachers warn you about. Speaks in monotone, and lectured just about everyday. He gives random surveys to help his next semester so hopefully he listened to us! You take maybe 6-7 quizzes, 3 exams, and only 3 assignments which doesn't sound too bad. It's not honestly, but just be prepared  to take notes and go to class!

A first class professor, knowledgeable, professional, and interesting.  Im not an accountant, but she made me see the value of the class and made it an enjoyable experience. She has plenty of real life experience which helps put things into perspective.  Would take her again without any hesitation.

Martha is a Great Professor! I would recommend her to all! She Clarified everything to the T! Test are not easy but if you study for them you will be ok! You will need the book, and she makse herself available for questions

She was one of the best professors I have ever had!!!!!! She wants you to learn the material not just memorize it for the test. She was very helpful out of class as well. I am taking her for 601 as well

Amazing teacher! Really cares about the students and provides easy ways to remember key equations.  The first time I took accounting I almost failed and withdrew, now I ended up with a B. Highly recommend her.

Took this class as a six week course and even though there was a lot of material in a short amount of time she did wonderfully in covering it. I HIGHLY recommend taking a course with her. Very very fair at grading.
Took during the six week summer session. A lot of material, but well covered. Fair grader & wants the students to learn! Take this class with her if possible! I wish I could get her again!

Probably the best teacher I have ever had.  She is very fair about the work.  Her goal is learning, not penalizing for minor details.  She is upbeat, funny, and well put together.  I learned a lot.  I would highly recommend that you take her for ACT501 (although she is an adjunct prof so she may be listed as "Staff").  Taken Spring 2012.

Very Helpful. She spoon feeds the material to the students to make sure they understand. She stays after class if there are questions. If you do the work (and its not that much), you will get a very good grade. I highly recommend.
The best professor ever!!! Explains material very clearly! Very knowledgeable! If you want to learn something and get a good grade - take Accounting with professor Muhammad!

Martha is great!  Takes time to answer students' questions and is flexible to their needs.  She made accounting easy to understand and gave tips and tricks to make it easier.  I highly recommend taking this class with her!
Took time to explain material.  Testing and grading was fair.  Highly recommended!!

Martha is the best!  Learned an immense amount about accounting, developed an awesome relationship with her, and will hope to take another class with this great professor.  One of my favorites at CSU.

She is an awesome teacher. I hated accounting and she made the class fun and enjoyable.explanations are clear and she made simple.use textbook a lot. tests are easy but not hard. she grades fair.very good teacher

You won't need the textbook for this class (used twice), so don't buy it. Otherwise, the class is very easy and simple and Alex is an AMAZING professor. She makes it easy!

Alex was one of the best professors I've ever had. She cares about the success of her students and is very understanding. The assignments are all outlined in the syllabus, most of which aren't difficult and really help you develop an interest in a specific major and career. I highly encourage this class and the Business Learning Community.

Alex is very kind and cares about students success. Assignments are given but are not difficult to complete or time consuming. Class helps to choose future major and career and learn more information about it. Textbook is not used much, so you will not need to purchase.
Big online component that is completely useless, but not her fault. Hard to understand when teaching.
I am surprised by all of the negative reviews. Dr. Mulqueeny was such a great math teacher. I never "got" math until she helped me NUMEROUS times face-to-face
Taken as a half summer semester. Less time to do way too much work.Way too much time used outside of class to perform minitab calculations and writing up stat analyses. Way too much time.

I thought she was good, but I felt she could've spent more time on doing problems instead of us using the calculator because we learned more about the functions on it than learning the actual math problems in the book. Tutoring is definitely recommended if you have trouble in math.

She was not very helpful in the classroom, not sure about outside of the class room. She did not know how to control the class, students talked through her lecture the entire time of the class. Her tests were straight to the point but in order to get a better understanding of the material in her class, a tutor is A MUST

Probably the worst teacher I've had. She does not know how to teach. She did our homework problems in class and got them wrong. Her projects are tedious and her grading and point values are ridiculous. Our class average was about a 72% and she was happy...
She was really nice, but the online homework teaches a lot better than her. She is really hard to understand while teaching, but she'll help as best as possible one on one.
She has no idea about math.  Hated her, she failed more than half of the class because she could not correctly explain the problems she would do on board.  DO NOT TAKE HER!!!
stay clear of this professor. went to the tutor instead of class because she made no sense.
are you guys liken' that? FRAC

she is the worst teacher that i have ever had. do not take her class. she does not know how to explain anything. she will do a problem and not even know how to explain it.  i wasted my time and money by taking this class. if you have her get out while you can.
Great professor who makes you think and was very interesting. However, wished there was more help during application of theory in assignments.

CIS 265 with this teacher was impossible. Quizzes have a few questions with subquestions, and you had to get every subquestion correct to get a point. Hard to understand, uses a speaker in class. Mainly theory and little actual programming. No actual programming during lectures. Avoid at all cost!
Worst class ever taken at CSU. Lectures were right from the textbook, which he wrote. Assignments were useless. Exams were difficult, not to mention the "no partial credit" grading scale.

Least helpful professor I've ever had.  He spoke a lot about physics/math things and it was supposed to be a data structures and algorithms class. I asked him a question about reading and he treated me like an idiot; meanwhile he had never mentioned the book once. I had to drop before my grade suffered.

Dr Munakata is an excellent professor, quizzes can be difficult and discouraging because there are very short, ~3 questions each having subparts /c NO PARTIAL CREDIT ?( this part causes frustration) and requires THOROUGH understanding of the covered topics.  If you are serious about learning programming and want a solid foundation take his class.

1) You cannot understand him. 2) The class already starts off bad because we're not in a computer lab, but he makes it worse becuase he gives incomprehensible notes and lectures on a chalk board. 3) he writes itty-bitty on the chalk board so it's hard to read. 4) becuase he's such a poor teacher i had to by "Intro to java for dummies" it's saved me

He is the worst CIS professor in this school. He doesn't know the programming at all, and he is physics professor. I have no idea why my school hires him to teach us programming course. it totally wastes my time and money. My suggestion is "don't take course with him, if u really want to learn assembly lang".

The textbook was mentioned on the first day and that was it. We were never assigned any homework from the textbook or any homework at all. How are you supposed to be ready for an exam when the prof stubbornly will not assign any homework problems to work on? I would NEVER recommend this prof to anyone.

very useless .waste of time .teach vey small portions ..didn't cover topics ..no real life programming ..all cartoons ..please don't take this ..no knowlege about computer ..only about maths &physis ..its like a math class

This class was awful.  Will not help you at all.  Class is supposed to be an intro.  He tells everyone to "go to the computer lab" if you have a question.  Good luck reading his tiny writing and understanding him.  Has to speak in a microphone. No joke.

Class was an extreme disappointment.  His education is in Physics, so I don't know why he is teaching computer science.  Very unfair grader; approaches grading from the standpoint of how can he take points away from students.  Covers nothing but theory, which could be due to lack of computer science background.
Nice Professor.  Writes everything clearly on the board.

 lectures had little to do with the exams.

Honestly he has his days which is quite understandable i mean we all do but sometimes he can be quite rude. the material was quite frankly all over the place and sometimes questions are way harder than what he covered in class.

He is often very moody and it reflects in his lectures. Also, I attempted to go to his office hours multiple times just for him to leave his office and walk right past me even though he knew I was waiting.

Worst professor Ive ever had... hes so rude to everyone. His lectures are ALL over the place so hard to understand and you can not ask for help he will act like youre an idiot do not take any class with him he is horrible. Seriously dont do this to yourself ....

Definitely knows what he's talking about. He is very smart and will sometimes provide extra info that isn't really necessary. His tests are simple, if you study the book and your notes, you'll do well. His lectures are all over the place sometimes and he sometimes is in a bad mood. Overall not a bad class if you take it serious.

He'll either be the best and most engaging teacher ever or he'll attempt to take legal action with a class because of 'humiliation', I'm not kidding. He has 3 exams and one final. Uploads the lectures online to view later. His hw is too far ahead of his lectures so no one knows what's going on. Attend the SI sessions if you want to pass.

Worst professor ever. Yoi will he expected to do assignments months before he ever even touches it in class. He ignores emails gets frustrated when students domt know material and might be the worst professor I've ever had.

Dr. Mundell has been teaching forever. He's very intelligent BUT often times he cannot teach in a way that is relatable to students. Coming from someone who has attempted to visit his office hours multiple times and been told to "leave and come back in 20 minutes because 'I need to water my plants'," he is not the most friendly/ understanding.

Mundell takes a class that is challenging and dense and tries to make it fun and palatable for the class. The amount of material that you will go over is mind boggling and you will never review the previous chapter's material even though it is really important, so you better take good notes. He records his lectures so you can review them later.

Dr. Mundell is nice but I don't see what all the hype is. He's a nice guy, yes. His jokes are not that funny and if it weren't for them this class could be done in 50 minutes not 85. I didn't like chem before, and I still don't like it. But yes, he's nice. And yes, there are lots of opportunities for points thanks to his (almost) weekly web quizzes

Dr. Mundell is the sole reason I became a chem major. If you want to succeed in upper level chemistry courses, you must have a very solid understanding of the basics and that is exactly what CHM 161 with mundell did for me! (I have gotten an A in gen chem 2 and ochem) all exam info is covered in lecture, this is the easiest class at csu ever!!

Dr. Mundell is the sole reason I became a chem major. If you want to succeed in upper level chemistry courses, you must have a very solid understanding of the basics and that is exactly what CHM 161 with mundell did for me! (I have gotten an A in gen chem 2 and ochem) all exam info is covered in lecture, this is the easiest class at csu ever.

This guy is like night and day, some days he is very nice others he is the complete opposite. Can be very rude to students during lecture and office hours when he is not having a good day. Told me to leave office hours once because he was eating his lunch.. Records all of the lectures and posts them on Blackboard.

He is a nice guy on certain days, but on others he is not as nice. He records all lectures that are accessible on Blackboard so attendance is not mandatory. Not many exams, but almost always weekly quizzes online. Watch the lectures or go to class and take notes. Would take again.

Super funny and very kind. He's extremely helpful in all aspects. If you get an A on all 3 exams, you don't have to take the final. He takes the better of your two grades (final and class grade). He really does want his students to succeed. Do a lot of practice problems, they help. He records his lectures and you can watch them from home.

Love Mundell, these reviews didn't do him justice. He's hilarious, and I've never had an issue comprehending a concept with his instruction. Study for exams... this is college. If you put in the effort you'll get a good grade.

Lectures are fine you just have to pay attention. Only thing that made me rate low, is his attitude! Advice, never try to reach him outside of class, he will humiliate you. Anger issues, please take anger management classes! Two incidents happened with me that made me hate him so much. Get me away nicely. But no, slam the door as hard u can.

He loves chemistry, and he's there to teach so he doesn't tolerate people who disturb his lectures. Overall, he taught the material pretty well, and recorded the lectures on blackboard just incase you missed something during class.

Mundell cracks me up! He's a straight savage! Makes Chemistry easy to understand and cracks jokes so it is not hard to listen to him. Tests aren't hard, show up to class and you will pass and he gives clean-up quizes. Would take again.

Dr. Mundell gives almost no homework so take that as you will. Most of your points for the class will come from the three exams plus the final exam, a weekly quiz, and the extra credit quizzes he gives. Overall a funny guy who makes chemistry easy to understand. Only fault is he rambles on sometimes and skips around.

My main problem with Dr. Mundell is every year he writes a new book for the class so students spend $200+ and he gets more revenue. Each book that gets published has many things wrong with it. This includes both grammatical and informational mistakes. His class was the only class I struggled in, because he spent more time yelling than teaching.

Go to his office hours for help - very beneficial! Online homework due every 2ish weeks, 4 quizzes, 2 tests, 1 final. I wish I did better, tests were pretty hard. Watch online videos. Tests are very conceptual so you have to really study, class isn't easy. He writes quickly & it can be hard to keep up with the material. Smart, kind & funny though

Great polymath instructor. He cares about students and their pursuit in the understanding of higher level mathematics. Clearly passionate in his studies and work. However, he always seems super busy and preoccupied, making access to office hours and help outside of class difficult. Otherwise, he's superior in comparison to many other professors.

Took this class with Dr Munther. Amazing, all I have to say. He wants you to walk away from the class actually knowing the material so ask questions. Super helpful and is accessible outside of class time in his office or via email.
this professor is awesome!!! super caring.   always there to help.     get Munther AT ALL COST!!! he is unbeatable when it comes to teaching

I had Munther for MTH626, which is the one of the most advanced math courses in college for graduates. He obviously knows what he is doing. Explains very clearly, has a good sense of humor, and cares a lot about his students. Definitely recommend him for any math courses that he teaches

Trust me when I say Dan Munther is the best professor in the world!! Certainly my favorite prof of all time. If you dont have him for Calc I or II or any other Math class,get ready for a tough time. He makes it look easy,very friendly, likes to joke around a bit,keeps the class very interesting and enjoyable. Definitely recommend him at all cost!!

If you like to speed through power points and only getting one chance to get homework right, then take him.  Not easy, but not impossible either. He does curve exam grades sometimes, so that helps.  Also hands out the answers to the problems at the end of the chapter so we can practice more if we need to.

Class is broken down into powerpoints slides, watching him work out problems on the whiteboard, and you working our sample problems in groups. HW is due weekly but you get 3 attempts to get 100 on each homework. Test are online and comprise of M/C and problems and they come straight from the book and you get 2 attempts.

This Professor was so unreasonable.  He reads out of book. His exams are so incredibly hard and nothing like what he teaches in class. Majority of students barely pass his exams and he gives case studies that he doesn't explain exactly what he wants so he tells you to resubmit like 5 times and it still will not be good enough.  I WOULD AVOID HIM!

AVOID AT ALL COSTS. His method of teaching is to run through a PowerPoint and work some problems without explaining the material clearly, or clarifying any points made. He also made frequent mistakes while working problems. Expect to have to teach yourself the material if you take a class with him.

I spend most of my time while in his class trying to avoid counting the number of times he says "You know" while working on other classes..If attendance was not counted there is no way I would even consider going to this class.

Worst professor I have ever had. He reads power points verbatim and does not add insight. When doing problems, he is unprepared, unsure if he is doing it correctly, and explains nothing. Students are constantly correcting his errors. Be pepared to teach yourself the material. If you email him, good luck getting a reply email, for he does not reply.

If you're willing to learn the material on your own, take this class. The professor isn't very good at lecturing. The exams are mostly multiple choice. Don't waste your money purchasing the book, you don't need it. The homework problems & quizzes can be practiced on MyAccounting Lab (in Study Plan) & they are exactly the same as the graded part.

Professor Murphy's class was great! Many group discussions that were not meant to test you but to open your mind. You are not necessarily graded on group participation but he had some great mind opening exercises. Easy to work with, very helpful, learned a lot, untraditional teacher in a good way.

John Murphy is amazing, caring&has experience in every level of swk. His lectures are discussion based; attempts to base lectures on chapters of the book, but often discusses what the students want. Book is only needed for weekly online 4/5 question quizzes and a portion of a 2-3 pg paper at the end of semester. EthicsFinal is online;15 questions.

Professor Murphy is a caring man who wants to help you in anyway he can. He helped everyone figure out problems that were occurring the internship and in the class. He was also very keen on getting everyone's opinion on what WE wanted to talk about or how to approach a paper. It was a discussion based class with no book involved.
Easy class, and he is a stress free professor. I highly recommend his class.
I would not take her again if I had the option - very tough grader - hard to read her mind as to what is excepted. Bye bye GPA Also - Takes WEEKS for her to grade. It is not fair.
This class was ok. The textbook is very hard to comprehend if you have never taken accounting before. She sticks to her deadlines via the syllabus at least.

She needs to look up "definition" in the dictionary, and stop giving students a 0 for plagiarism when they give a definition, as required in some discussion boards. The class is fine aside from the subjectivity in grading involved with the discussion boards. It's a lot of tedious work, but manageable.

Online hmwk's and quizzes due each week;  exams are similar to those.  There are also two big projects.  I do not recommend taking this in 6-week format; nothing against the prof its just a LOT of work at once. Classes are lecture based;  definitely come to class. All in all, she is a great teacher with a no-nonsense approach. Also, buy the ebook.

I stopped attending the zooms because he often had tech issues and when he didn't, he was just going over the assignments or reading the slides to you. Two 10-15 homework assignments, one 50 multichoice test per week. Will use lockdown on mid and final (50q). I kinda taught myself through the homeworks and quizzes which do help the understanding.

Mr. Murphy, as said from the many other reviews, is not prepared to teach this course. Half of the online components do not work and he does not explain concepts well. Constantly tells students to "Find a new career" if they get a below average grade on one of his many quizzes. Four exams are super vague and oddly spaced out chapter wise.

This professor seriously does not know how to teach. He only gives out 4 exams and that's it. no extra credit or homework. He does NOT know hoe to go over material. He just skims through lectures and it is so hard to understand what he is trying to show. If you do not do good on the tests you will fail the class. Definitely do not recommend

New online component lead to half the class time going over tech/auto grading issues. Lots of assignments, but not everything is graded. He gave the whole class Ds for the midterm because he felt we weren't trying hard enough. Previous reviews were true for the 1st 1/2 of the semester, class plead for syllabus to be revamped and things smoothed out

Do NOT take Murphy. Covers 35 chapters, has 32 online quizzes, 3 exams . Tests are vague, yet cover 10-13 chapters! Last exam only 8 out of 29 people received over 70%. Rude to students. Does not curve. 2 papers, grading makes no sense. I am a straight A student and my GPA will be ruined. He struggles with technology. Disappointing CSU allows this.

Take everyone else's warning on here seriously.  If he is the only possible professor you can take and you are unable to teach yourself 90% of the material I suggest taking the class another semester or take a D/F. He lazily goes over the subject of Accounting and the most challenging work you do is at home and never gets gone over in class.

AWFUL! He doesn't teach! He just sits in a student desk and talks about accounting! He doesn't show any examples of problems, but then expects us to know how to do them for an exam. Tests and quizzes are open note/open book, but it still isn't worth it. Avoid at all costs!!!
boring and a horrible teacher. open book and notes for test, so as long as you can teach yourself, you'll be fine

Teach yourself.  He never taught the basics, even though it's an introductory course. No examples of HW/quiz questions in class. Upside is that he allows open notes and books on tests/quizzes, but the downside is that he doesn't teach the material. Unclear on due dates and  homework assignments. Had to switch to another class because he is so bad!

Dr. McDonald is an amazing professor! Online class with quick, concise lectures to encourage a clear understanding of Thomas Merton. Class expanded writing for an audience.  Enjoyed her as professor, taking Technical Writing with her next semester.

Note: Her married name is McDonald.  She was incredibly helpful, and she taught me how to write an analytic report, which I had never done before.  If you have any questions, ask her.  She had a few small issues this semester, but she resolved them quickly and without disadvantage to her students.  She is interested in her students' success.
She was a great teacher however she was kind of unclear on things.  When she would give us an assignment, she never told us exactly how to do it. The way she explained things threw us all off!
I know this guy very well he is a great guy

He makes his own tests which have typos and are sometimes unclear in what he's asking. He is a strong conservative. It comes out often in discussions and sometimes in his hw/tests. He's emailed me personally telling me I'm "misinformed" because I dont agree with him. After debating him he realized I wasnt "misinformed" and he was less condensending
Great!
Joe is the smartest professor at Case. Just ask him. Joe is super hot. You should hear how all the guys talk about him (Queer Eye For The Straight Guy) ;)
No Comments
Cool!
Very knowledgable and helpfull.  Fun to be in class with.  Tests are OK but work load can be large
Enjoyable and you learn a lot!
Best prof in Biz school!

A great class. Lots of group projects. Makes you think and do assignments like stuff you'd have to do if you were already a teacher. Professor Nackley cares about her students, she was really understanding when I was going through some personal stuff.

I attempted to contact this professor using her preferred method of contact on several occasions, no answer? The semester is now over and I have yet to see grades on half of the assignments? (Some from as far back as September.)  I'm very frustrated to say the least. No textbook, but a lot of reading materials.

Professor Nackley was one of the most unhelpful professors that I've ever encountered at CSU. If you have a question about anything, good luck getting a hold of her. I emailed her preferred email multiple times throughout the semester and she never responded once. She didn't grade anything for the first month of the course either. Ridiculous.

Naghshineh is not one for teaching. Her overall teaching style is slow and botched. She spends most of her time stumbling over her notes, and she is frequently confused by class material one would expect a professor to understand. The material and the tests are fairly simple, but the professor is not the most reliable go-to person if you need help.

Although a very nice and helpful professor, the class was awful. Very confusing lectures, homework which took forever (and was only 10% of the final grade), exams were extremely difficult. Randomly takes attendance, was not there for many classes and had a different professor fill-in. CHM151- avoid if possible. If can't avoid, prepare to study :(
Best teacher ever!!!!! She curves test and never shows up late to class. Awesome teacher recommend taking her!!

Gives the impression that she doesn't know the content at all. Her lectures frequently contain glaring errors. Spends 40 minutes of a 50 minute class recapping the last lesson, and the last 10 minutes slowly trying to figure out if she's already covered the new material. One of the worst teachers I've ever had.
Would not show up for test on tests days.  Messed up grading a couple of my tests, hard to understand, one of the worst teachers I ever had.

very humain but not a good teacher didnt have the right knowledge to explain topic in a proper manner seems not interested about a students ability to understand her  
 
 |nice person but not a great teacher

Nice person, but bad prof. ALways unprepared. Exams were difficult. Had to rely a lot on the book. BTW she taught from a different book, so sometimes she thought we had 'so-so' information in our book, but we didn't, and then we saw it on the exam! Had to do a curve in the end. Also, takes attendance and homework.
I would take this class again in a heart beat. Loved prof. Nagy
I would take this class again in a heart beat. Loved prof. Nagy

I can't say enough good things about this woman. I've taken this class several times and found the material difficult to relate to until Dr. Nagy's class. Lectures and discussions were extremely valuable, and you must be prepared to read and submit weekly 1 page chapter synopses. I wish I had the opportunity to take more classes with her. A GEM!
Great teacher. Simple Class. Show up because most work goes off of in class discussions and presentations.

Professor Nagy is the best teacher I have ever had. She was a really good lecturer and she also had guest speakers come in every week. She also tried her best to be fair and inclusive and it definitely shows.

for any students interested in urban fields or public service this class is a godsend. dr nagy puts alot of energy into this class with bringing in guest speakers, other reviewers on this website mention them but not the fields. city managers, economics researchers, anthropology researchers at csu, city school researcher among others.

I've had a lot of good professors at CSU but professor Nagy was the first professor who I have ever given a perfect course evaluation. She is a perfect teacher, if you have the opportunity take her class.

there are presentation reflections once or twice a week but they honestly aren't that bad as long as you go to class. does like note card questions for attendance every few classes, but overall beth is really understanding of most absences and will do what she can to help you
Dr. Nagy is a caring, compassionate professor. She cares deeply about her student's success and understands that everyone has a unique learning style. I wish she taught at the law school!

She is awesome and responds quick! I liked her a lot. Her online class is very organized! You won't need the book to find any of the material. The only downfall is that she gives a lot of homework weekly, 2 discussion posts AND 2 writing assignments EVERY WEEK. Not ideal if you are taking any WAC courses or classes that would need more attention.
Easiest class Ive ever taken. She really cares about student success and brings in speakers every week from a variety of fields.
Professor Nagy is awesome. I enjoyed some of her lectures and felt some of the guest speakers brought in were awesome! Too much homework every week, and grades it tough.

I had Professor Nagy for my Urban Studies class and she was honestly the best. I had her my first semester of my freshman year and she really helped me adapt to a college lifestyle. Nagy has you write a lot of just one page responses and is a very easy grader. By far one of my favorite teachers I have ever had

Dr. Nahra does not do a very good job explaining and all he does is read straight from the PowerPoint His problems on his exams sometimes were things that we have never seen before. His lecture notes are not good for the homework or exam problems. Take this class with him if you plan on teaching yourself the material.

Henry Nahra has no idea how to teach.  The only reason anyone passed his class was with study groups.  The average score on the 3rd test was a 42% which wasn't much worse than the others.  He is never available for office hours (doesn't have one) and he doesn't write things down.  He runs through things like everyone has taken the course before.
I've had him for several social work courses online and he is fantastic. Great information,easy to understand,simple assignments.
The best professor I have ever had! Nice and always eager to answer questions!
No Comments
Presented with lots of cultural material.  No tests.  Grade based on attendance, and a few small assignments.  Can be kind of absent-minded; not always clear.
easy 'A' professor is very nice good sense of humor and flexible when you need him to be. only a few tests all multiple choice not much studyng required just take notes.
Good.

Amazing teacher! So enthusiastic and really interesting. He really explains things that are really fun to listen to. His test are hard because they are all essay test (Five identifications and two essays) And two in class essay with quotes but if you listen in class and take good notes they're a breeze. really fair grader and great guy.

Awesome teacher! His knowledge, enthusiasm, and sense of humor is very inspiring. You will definitely laugh a lot during his lectures. He is the first history prof Ive had who actually makes you connect to the characters and events involved. His grading focuses not so much on detail but rather your analysis!!!

Yeah, you've seen the same thing over and over again: "He's great, but his tests are tough." It's true that his tests are pretty hard compared to others, but honestly I think the quality of his lectures makes up for it. You'll definitely learn at least something. Oh and ask his who his favorite general is. Hint: It's not Alexander the Great.
Extremely interesting! I took both his history 101 and 102 classes and listening to him makes me regret I'm not a history major.
Very good professor. Very knowledgeable, always prepared. Able to answer all of your questions. Interesting lectures, not terribly boring. His tests are hard, but if you study they're not that bad.

Very enthusiastic. He really gets into the material and is very easy to understand. His tests can be kind of ridiculous since he expects you to memorize so much info and write two essays in the matter of an hour. Despite that, he's very good and you should take him if you get the chance.
Awesome professor class is never boring and they go by so fast. Would def take a class with him again. However, tests are hard but as long as you know everything on the study guide you will be ok.

Drop the class right away. He is an unfair grader and willingly admits it in class. For text book use, you will use it but he won't tell you what to read until the week of the exam, which is useless. You might have better luck but just be prepared to fail. He is a nice funny guy outside of grading though, so that is a plus.

Very interesting character. Smart man too. Does lectures off the top of his head, and has traveled around a lot,so he added experience to the topics. Engaged the class in good discussions and moved through topics in a logical manner with good flow. Lots of reading and writing, although no research papers, tests consist of in-class essays.
He's super fun, but his tests are extremely hard, all essay. He does not give out extra credit either. Be prepared to study your butt off for this one.
Even though his class was longer, it felt like the shortest class I had because I was so interesting. He has a lot of flair and doesn't just sit there and list facts.

He brings a colossal amount of knowledge to the classroom. He makes history lectures fun and amusing. I missed class a few times because of sports but I regret it. As a student I wanted to be in his class all the time to listen about each segment of the chapter we were discussing from Sumer, Egypt, Judaism, Greeks, Romans, Alexander, Persians.

Very smart, very straight forward, he is working on his PHD and he is very lovely. As a history course your in game for alot of writing but for this guy he doesn't assign research papers instead he does alot of in class writings and essays. On final i remember writing him 11 pages. He wants you in your writing to show him that you done the readin

very funny, very enthusiastic about subject. essay tests are hard, but doable with some preparation. fascinating conversationalist, very engaged with class, easily sidetracked but always fascinating. very casual attendance policy. almost makes me wish i was a history major.

Recommend. Checks in with her students via video chat about mid semester to make sure she can talk to you and help you with anything you may be struggling with or have questions about. Does not take off points for any late work and always lets you redo an assignment if you felt you could do better. Amazing professor, highly recommend.

Maybe this is just because it was an online class but this was one of the worst classes I have ever taken. Basically felt like I was paying to teach myself the entire semester. I have had profs like this before and usually are better in person. Will give that a try.

Recommend. Checks in with her students via video chat about mid semester to make sure she can talk to you and help you with anything you may be struggling with or have questions about. Does not take off points for any late work and always lets you redo an assignment if you felt you could do better. Amazing professor, highly recommend.

Mrs. Narouze is a good professor. All the lectures were presented on PowerPoint. She is a nice person and she wants you to succeed. She skipped many things from the book, but this doesn't make her less helpful. It is an easy class and you can get an easy A if you try.

Professor Narouze is not a great professor, I would avoid her at all costs. She is not very accessible outside of class and never responded to my email and very rudely addressed my question in an announcement over Blackboard. There is also WAY too much work for a 200 level class, no class should have a final and a final paper. Avoid avoid avoid!!

Mrs. Narouze is a good professor. All the lectures were presented on PowerPoint. She is a nice person and she wants you to succeed. She skipped many things from the book, but this doesn't make her less helpful. It is an easy class and you can get an easy A if you try.
She is adorable. She is very kind and a good professor. Besides attendance, there's few grades that get put in. Two papers, a midterm, and a final. Easy A though.

Just a heavy lecture class. She doesn't always take attendance, and all her powerpoints are online. So if you decide not to go, it's not the end of the world. All exams are online, and only have to write 2 papers. As long as you go to class and try, you will be fine.

Lectures are impossible to follow and often go off topic. The quizzes are online which is the only reason you can pass them. The lectures do not help with the quizzes at all. You better memorize the entire textbook if you want to pass. Also, get ready to figure out how the mandatory "clickers" work all by yourself because she has no idea at all.

Has no idea what she is talking about like at all. Horribly all over the place and nothing she talks about in class goes along with each other. Her lecture slides are not what is reflected on the tests at all and honestly you should just run away because she is horrible like she doesnt deserve the one star I gave her

She has barely any idea what she is teaching during this class and even with the textbook things are very unclear on what she wants you go get out of the class. Some days are lecture days and some days are an entire class of discussion and random stories from people around the room. Try and get another professor for PSY 221

She uses clickers to engage the class but has no idea how they work or how to address small technical difficulties. She constantly puts grades in incorrectly so you always have to ask her to fix it. Her assignments are broad and she cannot properly express what she wants out of assignments in class and she gives next to no feedback to improve on.

She is very knowledgeable in the field of psychology & is truly passionate. Her lectures are always interesting and the material is so well explained that it will stick with you. However, seems to forget about grades, and that to some of us care about obtaining reasonable grades. Therefore, if you just care about the material you'll love her!
He was amazing.
Very approachable and understanding if you have other circumstances  in your personal life.  He definitely likes class participation!
If you need a GPA booster, take this class. No homework, 3 to 4 easy test, and one paper (2 pages.) Really interesting class if you are planning to go into medicine.
Awesome Professor. Being in Engineering, you will come across some terrible professors. Professor Nassif knows what he is talking about, and creates good class discussion. Definitely recommend.
Wonderful teacher!!! Very smart! Grades fairly, if you pay attention and reference notes for your hw you will do well. Rarely assigns hw.
Awesome. great prof.  really interesting and smart.

He is a great professor and usually explains things until the entire class understands. If you get it quickly, it's an easy A. If you don't, he'll help you to understand so that you can do well. He drops your lowest test grade. Definitely a fun and casual class setting.
Very nice and understanding teacher.  Let's you pick the pace for learning by class votes. Explains concepts clearly, practices with the class. Would recommend him to anyone!!

You get credit for doing the paper if you at least gave a good effort. Go to class its the only way you will get notes for exams. power points are not posted to blackboard but exam reviews are. He responds quickly to emails. Test are very straight forward no trick questions and consist of true false, multiple choice n fill in blank

Giving Dr. Navardi anything less than 5 stars is dishonest. The man is an excellent professor, fair, and challenging. His test and quiz questions always make you think, but also come straight from your notes. He spends time after class answering any questions students have and is good at responding to emails. He's an asset to CSU.

Dr. Navardi gets the job done as a professor. He is a fair grader on tests and he writes the important points on the board, which makes note taking easy. The tests and quizzes are open book and note, so that's very helpful. Don't buy the book, just download the tables from online. The final was challenging, and an easy project. Just take good notes

I took this online, and I thought he was a great professor! He really loves teaching, and sends you lots of resources and emails about opportunities available to you. It was a pretty easy course for the most part, if you show up to class and take notes.

I took this online, and I thought he was a great professor! He really loves teaching, and sends you lots of resources and emails about opportunities available to you. It was a pretty easy course for the most part, if you show up to class and take notes.
Everyone was failing quizzes/test. He made this class so hard for no reason, even though it was a 100 level class.
Reeallllyyyyy boring but not a bad professor. If you show up and do the homework you should be fine.

Very practically minded prof, who is more concerned about getting people ready to work in the profession than about intellectual pursuits. I had him for automation and then for production, and even though the second class was a boring spreadsheet deal he managed to make it interesting and even entertaining.
No Comments

This professor does not know how to even upload assignments, let alone navigate zoom to take attendance. Her syllabus was 2 years old and not updated with any of the correct dates. All of the assignments on the syllabus were incorrect and graded for different points, with no given rubric. She played videos during class rather than teaching.

The worst experience of this grad program by far. Confusing lectures and insulting responses to questions. I've never felt so disrespected by a professor, especially one who doesn't know the answers to questions either! Spent a lot of time figuring out technology- not what I paid for.

amazing professor, made the class easy for you, very helpful with whatever questions you have & will go over anything if needed. considering the subject you will have to read the book/powerpoints but she breaks down the material so you better understand it. easy tests & final exam. surprised I passed but I did it. would take again if need be.

Her papers and assignments were a bit confusing, but she was always open to answer questions. She makes you think outside the box and to put a lot of thought and creativity into the papers which is what this field comes down to. Be prepared to balance time and get your observation times done early. She is very passionate and I learned a lot.

Wish I could've taken this class with another instructor. Didn't learn much and had to do hours worth of work for assignments that should've been easy because there were unclear instructions. Worked harder for this class than my hard speech classes. be prepared to feel degraded if you ask questions. She can be insensitive about certain topics.
Will avoid taking a class with her in the future
not clear on directions and unwilling to help
Instructions are not direct. Grades very harsh. when classmates or myself ask questions we are humiliated, and degraded. She is rude and unkind. When I leave class I feel discouraged and disrespected

This class was just terrible with Neff, and I was really looking forward to it. I was disappointed with her inability to connect to her students. I would run as far from this course as possible if she is teaching it!

Oh goodness! Prof. Neff did not explain difficult topics thoroughly, not so much available after class, seemed very curt on most days which made her difficult to approach with concerns. The class load is not difficult, but couple it with an unapproachable,often difficult professor and you have problems. However the class conversations were good.
Confusing and ill-opinionated.

Such an easy course and he makes sure you know it. The course material is all stuff you should very well already know, and this class is kind of a refresher. Super laid back guy, you'll enjoy coming to his class every time.
Larry is great. And btw he is at Kent State now. He really cares, go to office hours and do not be afraid to ask questions.

Larry is a great professor and I truly enjoyed his teaching but oh my god was the class disorganized. Idk if he had stuff happening outside of class that was throwing him off, regardless we never knew details about assignments until right before they were due, he rarely answers emails. We've been given little feedback, barely graded. lil stressful
He is funny and keeps you to paying attention. Knows the language and cares about it. If you have questions he is willing to help.The best language teacher I've ever had.
i love him, he's an amazing professor.

Todd is amazing, cares about his students, and truly makes his lectures interesting!

Amazing teacher.... I learned a lot in this class. She cares for her students and wants them to learn. Dr Nero was HORRIBLE.  I was very excited for this class, but she killed it for me. She doesn't grade the papers on content - if she doesn't like your writing style, you're screwed.  She also refused to clarify what to study for the midterm and final... avoid this lady if you can.

Meredith was easily the best professor I've had ever. She genuinely cares about her students and their well being. I was very nervous about taking ASL but she made it understandable, easy, and fun. Great overall. She really cares about her students. She wants everybody to do well and will help you get there.

Meredith is a wonderful professor. She is very caring and wants everyone to succeed. Please take her if you have the chance!

Amazing teacher and will do whatever she can to make sure you are understanding material and are going to pass her class :)

Dr Ngo will display you and your classmates grades to the whole class. For example, today, he put an excel spreadsheet of all the students and their assignment grades on the projector. Professor Ngo always brought current topics to our class discussion to make materials come to life. He also heavily encouraged class discussion. He was overall a great professor.
Extremely knowledgeable. Probably the most intelligent teacher I have ever had. Materials are quite challenging. But he is thoughtful and generous when giving final grades.

does not answers question effectively and lectures are not helpful with the material at all. I definitely would not recommend his classes unless you are very familiar with the subject he is teaching already.

Professor Ngo is one of the best professors I have ever had. Taking the class with him helped me understand a lot how the economy works and what I want to do in my future.

Don't buy the book! This class is a VERY simple Biology class. Just show up and do the study guides and extra credit and you will be just fine. Doing the study guides bumps your test grade up at least one letter grade. Easy professor.
She's a very helpful teacher. If you ever need extra help she's always there. She gives lots of extra credit so take it! DO THE STUDY GUIDES

She's a good teacher and I interested in what she teaches. The class was super boring but all tests questions are covered in the powerpoints and on the study guides. Easy A
Awesome teacher, tests are challenging but all answers are in the powerpoint notes. Gives tons of extra credit and attendance pts. Definitely would take her again.

The class is extremely easy with all the extra credit and self explanatory homework. You dont have to buy the book.  However, she isnt a good teacher.  She reads word for word from the powerpoints and is unable to answer questions.  At times it felt like she was a middle school science teacher.

I passed this class with over 100% so it's an easy A!

She gives enough extra credit for it to be impossible to fail her class. +5 points on a 50 point test for doing a study guide. Do all of the extra credit and you can't get anything lower than a C+
she lectures about things that she doesn't even fully understand, her slides never correlate with her lectures, and she is always behind. dislike.
Very nice professor. Provides powerpoint notes and study guides. Tons of extra credit. Easy A.

Very good teacher! She offers her help and makes sure you understand your assignments. She challenges you intellectually but makes sure all goals are obtainable! AMAZING! If you have her keep her!

She reads everything word for word off of the power points, which are all accessible on BlackBoard before the lecture. The book for this class is slightly confusing but you will get used to it. Overall I liked this class and the teacher a lot.

Dr. Nicoletti is the best teacher I have ever had. She's a tough grader because she expects you to be reading and writing at a senior university level. She's very hard to follow. Doesn't make it easy to get your grades up, and not in a "you gotta work for it" way. Professor Nicoletti is a very organized, professional, and passionate teacher, you can tell she enjoys teaching and having a intellectual discussion. It is obvious that Dr. Nicoletti expects a lot from her 400 level classes. I have had her for lower level classes and she teaches appropriate to the difficulty of the course. She's  very confusing.  Her instructions for assignments are ridiculous. Get ready to go to the writing center if you want to pass. This was a WAC class so there was plenty of writing. 3, 6 page papers and 1, 10 pager at the end of the semester. EASY tests and discussion posts every other week. I thought the class was set up beautifully. You are allowed to use content from earlier writing assignments for the final paper.

Dr. Nicoletti puts a lot of information into her lecturesassignments. She is very confusing especially with her directions when it comes to the Turning in papers and discussion boards. Make sure you check your paper before you turn it in. Get the book to read for the quizzes on the chapters it will help you.

Professor Nicoletti was outstanding. If your goal for a college course is to learn, her class is for you. If you are looking to skate by in an upper level course... Beware! Great teacher! I enjoyed the class a lot. This is what a college experience is supposed to be. Adult discussion is what is expected and 'high school' behavior is not permitted. This class is difficult, but Dr. Niederriter is so helpful and wants to make sure that you understand the material. I would recommend watching her recorded lectures before class and taking lots of notes! You have to work hard for a good grade, but she is a very good teacher and you can tell that she wants everyone to succeed. I loved her!!

Professor Niederriter is the best professor I have ever had. I have learned so much from her that I know will help me in my nursing career. I wish she could teach me everything I need to know. She knows exactly what she is talking about and teaches in a way that students can understand.

An amazing woman! Her course is hard, but that's because of the content. You really have to study for this. Attendance may not be mandatory but GO TO CLASS. She is always willing to help in any way she can. Don't be afraid to ask questions!

I struggled in physiology but I did not struggle at all in this class!! Joan is such a great professor and gives clear explanation of the disease processes. The pathology paper assignments actually help you do well on the exams. Her lectures are on tegrity and those plus attending her lecture helped me do so well on her exams! Would take again.

Words cannot describe how good Professor Niederriter is. She is so organized, and goes above and wayyy beyond to watch her students succeed. She would literally let us ask questions after class, before class, via email, and she would answer each one with ZERO judgement. She is so understanding, so smart, I wish I had her so every course !!

Professor Niederriter is the best professor I've had at CSU. She is a professor that is engaging and keeps you interested. She is very caring about her students but is not a push-over at all. Her classes are tough, but if you work hard, you can get an A. The best thing is that you will actually learn and retain what she presents. She's great.

God, would I like to have the brain of Dr. Niederriter. Truly the best and most caring, professor in the nursing program. I have had her for patho, medsurge 1 and 2 and every semester she is consistent and her exams are exactly what she teaches, NCLEX style- take her because she is so intelligent and you will learn so much from her.
She is the best professor I have even had at Cleveland State!
Literally the best Professor I have ever had. She makes complicated content concise and doable. Wish I had her for every course.
Absolutely great! She has a passion for teaching and know her stuff. All professors should be like her
Dr. Niederriter is an amazing instructor, who wants to see all of her students succeed!
Awesome professor all around. They should all be like her.

AWESOME professor. Very helpful, very clear with information and resources. Super interested in helping students succeed. If you put in the work you will do well. Glad to have her again in the future. She's a fantastic educator and you can tell a wonderful nurse. Highly recommended.
she is type of teacher who want the best for the students, helpful, educated, and knowledgeable teacher  we missed her this semester. I learned a lot from her.

Absolute best teacher ever.She is passionate,helpful,and extremely intelligent.She makes the hardest subject as easy as possible.There is nothing she doesn't know.She wants the best for her students and does whatever she can for them to succeed.I wish she taught us everything,absolutely love her,

The best professor I have ever had! Dr.Niederriter is extremely helpful, nice, cares about her students, and very knowledgable. She makes the hard material easy to understand. I wish she was a prof for all of my classes!

I love Dr. Niederriter. She is one of the best instructors I have ever had. She is extremely brilliant and really wants to make sure you do well in her class. She can be intimidating at first, but once you get to know her she is an amazing person.

Professor Niro is the best professor that I have taken during my time at Cleveland State. His class is not an easy A, you will have to put some work into it. However, he is a fair grader, and gives a lot of extra credit opportunities. Professor Niro genuinely cares for his students and wants the best for them.

Niro is the real deal, he doesn't just teach it.  If you want some real world experience from someone who's been in it, take Niro.  Took him for both real estate classes. Pretty bummed he doesnt teach the graduate level ones. Project at the end was tough and confusing but he gradded it lienently. Very interesting class.

The most intelligent man in the business building at CSU. Has incredible real life work experiences and loves what he does. If you do the work, you will pass. He makes you actually learn and encourages questions to make sure the entire class understands everything.

By far the best professor at CSU! Niro's class encompasses many important aspects of what's needed in the future as a business leader. He's laid back, but makes you work for an A. I can't tell you how much I've enjoyed every class of his. Always looked forward to attending.

By far my favorite professor at CSU. He's an insanely intelligent professor. I learned more than I ever thought I could in just one class. It's a tough class that requires a lot of work, but it's all knowledge that's useful in the real world. Worth the effort!
You want to learn finance and be able to apply it later in your professional and personal life? then register now! you will not regret it.

Pretty decent teacher.  Curves tests.  Good teaching style, doesn't rely on text.  However, he messed up his numbers on the board a lot and didn't put enough of what he actually shows you on the test.  Was fair enough though.

Very good teacher.  He is an expert in the topic.  Good thing about his lecture is it is all off the top of his head, he does not reliant on power point like most professors are!  Tests are not too hard if you study.  He gave us a good idea of what to study for before the test.  My favorite professor in the finance department.

He leads exciting, thought-provoking discussions in class that everyone gets involved in.  You can say your opinion without being criticized.  He grades papers fairly, even if your opinion isn't the same as his.  He is a chill guy and never got mad at anyone, the whole class loved him.  Definitely recommend him! You need to buy the book for class.

He is a okay guy and he grades really fairly and will try to help you if asked. However when your not writing papers you are doing classroom discussions, and i love doing discussions but these were PAINFULLY BORING.  Just do good on your papers and get ready for discussions and you should be fine.
Easy Class. If you can stand talking about revolution,socialism, and how "bad" America is. Noll will love you and you will recieve an A.

Hes an ok professor.  He grades your essays pretty fairly and does leave you some good feedback here and there.  The only problem was that the discussions are boring and he tends to call on people randomly.  If attendance wasnt mandatory you could have only appeared to turn in the paper and still pass with an A.

Dr. Nordlund is an awesome professor at CSU. This is my third class with him and I would continue to take classes with him if I wasn't graduating. This class is not graded on too many assignments, but he does a great job preparing you for them. Make sure to do the study guides for the midterm and final, they are almost identical to the actual test!

Dr. Nordlund is an awesome professor at CSU. This is my third class with him and I would continue to take classes with him if I wasn't graduating. This class is not graded on too many assignments, but he does a great job preparing you for them. Make sure to do the study guides for the midterm and final, they are almost identical to the actual test!

Dr. Nordlund made memory and cognition interesting. A lot of terms to know but that's the hardest part. He assigned 4 homeworks, a midterm, and a final. He did zoom reviews before tests. I took his course during COVID lockdown, for lectures he did powerpoints with voiceover. Extra credit for research participation. Super nice all around great guy.

I've had 3 courses with Dr. Nordlund so far and each one was just as enjoyable and predictable as the last. He is an excellent professor, really breaks down concepts to us in a relatable and funny way. I've heard some of his examples a few times but it only drives the point home more!
Easiest, most interesting class I've ever taken.

Professor Nordlund is the best professor i have had at CSU to date! He is super helpful and will do what needs done to help you pass with a good grade. There were 4 homework assignments, midterm and final. It was a really easy class. Very interesting information as well! Thanks for a good semester :)

He is one of the best professors ever! Handled the covid outbreak great! He grades easy, as long as you try, and his tests are simple if you study the power points, everything comes from them! He does a great job with explaining things in lectures and making things interesting, even if the material isnt!

Dr. Nordlund is an awesome professor. This was my second class with him and both classes had 4 homework assignments, a midterm, and a final. The midterm & final are directly copied from the study guides that he gives out to students before the tests. Fill those out and you are guaranteed an A on the exam. Overall a great professor & class.
Dr. Nordlund was a great prof although it did not require much work to keep an A so I fully recommend him, but he was also a nice prof and was willing to help if you needed it.
He is a great teacher!! Makes the material interesting and easy to understand! Only have 3 HW's and a Midterm and a Final! Gives Study Guides! I would definitely take another one of his classes!!

I have had 2 classes with Nordlund so far and he is amazing! Would take him for all my classes. 4 HW's, midterm and final for all his classes. He is super clear and concise and gives study guides. He is interesting to listen to and uses up to date, and interesting examples. He is very knowledgeable about info he teaches, can answer all questions.

I've had two classes with Dr. Norlund so far-- each had 4 HWs, a midterm, and final. You don't need the textbook if you pay attention in class. His lectures are really interesting even though the classes really aren't! He's a great guy and very knowledgable. Definitely would take 100 more times!!

I believe Ms. Novak is very knowledgable on the ins and outs of the subject matter, but when lecturing, explaining something, or answering questions, she was often long winded yet not very clear or focused. She was mostly polite, but not very friendly. I would hire her to be an editor in a second, but would probably avoid more classes with her.

Ms. Novak was a good person to have everyday conversations with, but she wasn't the best teacher. She often made us come see her outside of class and deducted points from our grade if we weren't able to come. We often had debates about current social issues, and spent weeks doing everything but English. Try to switch professors if you can.

Dr. Novakovich is a great teacher. Easy going and caring. Assignments were on Pearson Lab but no exams, only group projects and presentations. If you do your job, it's an easy A. Overall I would recommend and take her again.

Easy A if you show up. Group projects/presentations are going to occur. At points would be unorganized with assignment requirements and would give out unclear advice, but in the end she did make sure students had grades they would be happy with. If everyone was not on the same page she would back up the due date or change the assignment.

Jeanette's a nut. She will randomly give a great amount of sass but majority of the time she is quirky and funny. I don't think it's possible to fail her class. She gives you time in class for all homework to make sure you get it done and is very generous giving 100%'s because she just likes teaching and interacting with her students.
This professor is easy going and caring.  Lots of presentations and group projects.
She LOVES group projects. Very nice and will always be there to help when in need.

Dr. Novisky is an AMAZING criminology professor, I would take more classes with her if I was able. Since this class is for WAC credit, it is extremely helpful to do well on the WAC assignments throughout the semester. You basically piece them together to create the final paper. She gives the best feedback and is very quick & responsive with emails.

Dr. Novisky is an AMAZING criminology professor, I would take more classes with her if I was able. Since this class is for WAC credit, it is extremely helpful to do well on the WAC assignments throughout the semester. You basically piece them together to create the final paper. She gives the best feedback and is very quick & responsive with emails.

I really enjoyed Professor Novisky. She makes her lectures fun because she has so much experience and research in the topic of Prison and Society. She fills in the lectures with examples from her research. She gives extra credit if you attend class. One midterm and one final, group in class assignments and a WAC paper. Take her class!
Dr. Novisky is great. Lots of experience. She gives extra credit for attending class. If you attend class, read the assigned readings and participate in class you will do well.
She is the best! A relaxed class, is super nice, and would take again!

AMAZING, you will love her, just go to class the only way to fail her class is by not going. She is caring and don't think she is a push over. O no she is not but works with all students who take pride in their education, you get what you work for in her class.

An easy A, who ever complains about this class is because you dont go to school on time every week to receive extra credit for attendance and who do not STUDY. Only two tests lots of group work show up and study for exams no quizzes. Easy A I would love to take this class again! A great professor too.

I took her for every class she teaches by far my favorite professor at CSU. If you attend class and pay attention you will be fine. She absolutely cares about all of her students. But it is college you do have to put in an effort.

I am apathetic about this class because of the doctor's dry teaching style and lack of life experience besides her doctoral studies which she somehow incorporates into the curriculum. She requests you watch two hour videos and write a page paper for four (4) points. Kiss up to get an A....
I absolutely loved her! I loved the way she did things, from notes to powerpoints. She made the class easy, fun, and enjoyable! I would 100% recommend her again.

Professor Novisky is very caring and wants everyone to succeed within the field of Criminology. She's a superb instructor. Although attendance is not mandatory, she does give extra credit, you have critical thinking assignments that are relatively easy, and a current event project. I would definitely recommend you experiencing one of her classes.

I was nervous in the beginning but she quickly put my mind to ease. She had a lot "role playing" which included real world scenarios. This was a great method of seeing first hand how the process works. Very down to earth, always positive! I would love to have Professor Nowak again in the future!  Thank you! Your Awesome!
I look forward to having her again in the near future
Do your work turn it in on time. Do some talking in class, come to class. I learned alot from her and hope to have her again.

Caren is a very cool instructor. She wants everyone to pass and succeed with their future careers. She wants you to be able to pass her class, which is why she gives participation and attendance credit to help boost up the grade points. I would definitely recommend anyone to take her.

I took Caren for SWK 350 and it was great! Her lectures were very straight forward. She encourages participation and discussions. I did 2 presentations, midterm, and final. That was it. Not many grades, so they account for more points. She would clarify anything if asked. She wants you to pass and do well.
This man is the sweetest professor ever! So willing to help and is so considerate of issues in his students lives! Little nerdy and awkward but I would take him 100x if I could! Love him!

Nowatzi is an all around decent processor minus the fact that he spents 80% of his lectures trying to connect whatever we're reading to God. You NEED to read to pass his class, if you do, you'll be fine. BEWARE! He is a REAALLY hard essay grader and most of my essay would come back completely marked up.

Not an easy grader, but not impossible either. Straightforward and very helpful. Assigns reading every night, and discusses each work in depth during class making the material easier to understand. If you put in the work, you'll get a good grade.
