Professor Nowatzki is super fun to be in class with. He shows a lot of videos and articles to make the content more interesting.  The work load is not heavy. One journal (150 words) for every other class. The journal is mostly based on your opinion. There are three papers that we work on with peers in class. I strongly suggest this class for a WAC

He is a tough grader, but if you work hard and work with him you can get an A. He will give help and feedback on papers if you submit it to him early. He is awkward and sometimes hard to follow but if you read the text and show up to class it is not that hard to pass.

He's nice and funny, however he's a harsh grader. He grades more for grammar than for the content. The class is usually entirely discussion, so if you don't talk at least once a week, he will take off points. The stories, for the most part, are interesting, however a little strange. Be prepared to write a response and read for every class.

He was a nice person, but I did not enjoy his teaching or class. He was overly particular in his grading, to the point of pointing out the one or two typos in a long paper. His grading is neither clear nor consistent. Would give people the same exact comments, but different grade. No clear reason why there was disparity in grading.

Absolutely unreasonable professor. The subject matter is interesting, but he is a very unreasonable guy. Wont let you take exams early if issues arise, also deducts points from written work over the most miniscule reasons. Even if all paper guidelines are met, he will deduce a whole letter grade if wording isn't to his liking. Skittish and awkward.

Great professor! Holds reviews for tests outside of office hours and class time, and tests are very fair in comparison to what is covered in the lecture. As long as you study outside of class and ask questions if needed, you will get at least a B in the class.

Great professor! Holds reviews for tests outside of office hours and class time, and tests are very fair in comparison to what is covered in the lecture. As long as you study outside of class and ask questions if needed, you will get at least a B in the class.

worst teacher ever. super unhelpful, rude to me and my classmates whenever we asked questions, most of us ended up teaching ourselves the entire course by reading the textbook and watching youtube videos. thank god for that book or i would have failed. i took pre chem because i didn't feel confident going into chem 1, shouldn't have wasted my time!

Dr. O'Connor goes to great lengths to make sure that students learn the material, and get excited about it. Especially with the switch to online learning this term, she put in lots of extra time responding to questions online. Although the class had over 100 students, she was always available and made efforts to get to know students.
If I do not become a doctor, Dr. O'connor is the reason why. Why give a practice exam, if it is not going to match the study guide.

I took her online class, I was excited at first then The material she was posting was not very helpful. I had to do a lot of extra research on you tube myself. The class average grades on Exams were 70 percent... Around half the semester half the class dropped. I wish i did the same. Unless you are well versed in Chemistry, STAY AWAY!

O'Conner seems to understand chemistry well. That being said she has absolutely no idea on how to teach it. If you do not fully teach yourself the sections before coming to class good luck, she teaches as if you already have full knowledge of the course and you are just going over it real quick. I taught myself absolutely everything this semester.

She is very intelligent, and there is no doubt that she knows chemistry, but I feel that she would provide better in higher level chemistry classes. Being in a low level chemistry, I feel that she has trouble explaining herself because she is so knowledgeable. Its hard to grasp concepts in the lecture because of that.

Dr. O is awesome!! The complaints are from the more immature and lazy students. They expect to get a grade without working for it. She definitely knows her chemistry and explains the concepts so that we can understand them. Best chemistry prof at CSU!! Exams are fair, and she is always willing to help. Excellent!!

Dr. O'Connor is definitely knowledgeable in chemistry and is a very nice person. However, she is not very good at teaching in a very large lecture hall. She doesn't go over important stuff much, but talks about facts that most people already know. Luckily, the tests are fair and she does give out plenty of extra credit.

She knows what's she's talking about but does NOT know how to teach it. She assumes the class knows a lot more than many do, and her tests are very difficult. She expects people to teach themselves the material and if you do do that, you will be fine. If not, don't expect to learn much from her.

O'Connor is the absolute worst professor. She definitely knows her stuff, but she has no idea how to convey it to a large lecture hall. Luckily if you are able to teach yourself then you can pass.   We had a sub prof for one day who was able to teach more in a single lecture than she could all semester  Nice person. Terrible prof

Dr. O'Connor is the best!!  Her lectures are interesting and her exams are fair.  She really cares about her students.  She answers all questions.  Go to her office for extra help.  Dr. O'Connor wants her students to succeed.  Excellent professor.  I wish she was teaching organic chemistry.  I heard she was awesome in org.
Works with you. Read the textbook and do practice problems, you will most likely get an A

Great teacher, will work with you. If you are struggling don't be afraid to go to SI. I found reading the book and doing practice test is the most useful.  Be respectful and you will get respect back.

Nice lady personally, just tends to become a bit rude when answering questions. Has you do practice problems with the program ALEKS, which is time consuming and unforgiving if you get one wrong.  One quiz a week. I think she knows the material. If you already had a chem class in high school it's easy, if not, it's still do-able. Hates cell phones.

She inspired me a lot through each conversation we had. She treats me like her family member: always give me lots of good advice. She explains each concept clearly. Her office is open for students who is willing to learn. TRUST ME, she and Dr. Mundell are the nicest people ever! I am glad that I have the opportunity to co-work with them :)

There's a ridiculous amount of extra credit (almost 40 points!). The exam questions are right from the lecture slides and posted practice problems. The Homework assignments are free points because they're online and you have unlimited tries. The exams are curved AND bonus points are given. It's unbelievable that people will still get less than B.

CHM261 was so ridiculously easy, and in CHM262 she expects you to know everything (when we learned nothing previously). Seems to make the class more difficult than it needs to be, then gives you a letter grade of bonus. Avoid it if you really wanna learn the material. Heard she's great for o-chem, though.

She is just a terrible lecturer. Her powerpoints are okay, but they do not give details. You're teaching yourself in here, which is infuriating since it's only General Chemistry 2 and she makes it unnecessarily difficult with her terrible teaching. Avoid.

She tends to be sassy sometimes, but overall, she is a good teacher. She gives some extra credit and she is always there to help. She also provides extra help sessions. She curves her tests sometimes, but they generally aren't that long. Reading the book helps, but most importantly, do the practice problems!Overall, a good teacher.

I don't get the hate on Dr. O'Connor!! She is a very reasonable professor. I had her for Gen Chem 1 and it was a good class (for chemistry). It's really important to read the textbook so you pass, at least in my experience. She curves the exams sometimes, but always gives you a chance to get up to 5% back. The homework isn't too bad, good practice!

I genuinely enjoy Dr. O'Connor as both a person and a professor. Doing the homework on Pearson is helpful to pass this class, however, I do wish she gave homework assignments more like the practice problems on her powerpoint slides. I think it would be more beneficial than Pearson. If you ever have question, she's more than happy to answer them.

Dr. OConnor is an excellent professor in all aspects. She doesnt waste your time with useless lectures, she keeps them short and high-yield but breaking them down into easily comprehensible chunks. She makes difficult concepts in Chemistry so much easier! Attend classes, study, and practice and youll do fine! You wont find a better professor!
Underexplains the material so when students ask her to explain it further she can fulfill her ego.

I don't get the hate on Dr. O'Connor!! She is a very reasonable professor. I had her for Gen Chem 1 and it was a good class (for chemistry). It's really important to read the textbook so you pass, at least in my experience. She curves the exams sometimes, but always gives you a chance to get up to 5% back. The homework isn't too bad, good practice!

Her lectures were unclear and confusing. She started our first day of class saying that most of us would not succeed. She was rude to students, and hoped for our failure. Truly one of the absolute worst professors I have ever had at CSU.

Shes very knowledgeable on chemistry, however, I think she struggles with communicating things effectively, especially in an online environment. Sometimes her explanations for simple things are so long and drawn out that she just adds more confusion. Quizzes are 5 questions for 2.5 points, so be careful there.

I did not think that Dr. O'Connor is as bad as everyone makes her seem. She covers a lot of material in a short semester but we have to get through it. It requires you to put in A LOT of time outside of class to study and do well in this class. Attending lecture & studying 1-3 days before exam is not enough. Practice problem packets are so helpful!

I took her class in 6 wks and didn't have another professor to choose from. But dear God, do I wish I did. She gives so much work you barely have time to study, let alone get anything done for other classes. She expects a minimum of 22 hrs/wk devoted to studying for her class when lectures are already 2 hrs long. NO CURVES. DO NOT TAKE HER CLASS.

Dr. OConnor is an extremely rude professor, in lecture she will derive numbers out of nowhere and expects you to know where it comes from. Blames class if the class average is below 70% on exams. There are sooo many better chemistry professors that teach the same class.

If you are not already strong in chem do not take her. She doesn't explain, rushes through notes, and does not like to answer questions. Tests are out of around 20 questions so if you miss a couple questions you're already at a C.

Throughout college, Doctor O'Connor has been nothing short of amazing. In my experience, she was kind, helpful, and extremely personable. I can understand the mixed reviews, and experiences are all very subjective. I highly recommend taking REEL Lab with her, as her true, laidback, and kind nature is more expressed outside of the lecture setting.

Rushes through the notes and fails to explain her own material properly outside of class. Asked how to do a specific problem and she gave me a video to watch. (It didn't help because her videos skip half of the important math needed to get the answer. In conclusion, do not take unless you want to be stressed for 16 weeks. Avoid if you can.

She says things like "guys I know these are tough times, we need to work together" but then makes the class 100x harder and more complicated. During remote learning, she complains how she does not have time for us and makes us feel like we are wasting her time when she is just making things complicated and having all of us confused. She's also rude

I think that a lot of people dislike Dr. O'Connor because she treats her students like adults. I think she is an extremely knowledgeable professor who has high expectations for her students. It is a wake up call for some, but if you are willing to study hard and reach out for help (tutoring/SI/ office hours) you will not struggle in her class.

She rushes through notes, leaving you confused and lost as to what she just said/wrote. Her exams are only 20 questions, meaning if you miss just a few questions your grade will tank. She has a lot of mandatory homework which does not help, it just wastes your time. Only take this class if you want to put yourself under immense stress.

Make good use of the modules, assignments, and quizzes to build and maintain your knowledge. Don't beat yourself up too much if you do worse on them than you expect, just make sure that you learn from your mistakes for the exams, which make up most of the grade.

Pretty much how i would explain the whole semester is i would go to class and be confused and then have to teach myself every subject from the study modules. I taught myself from youtube and doing the dynamic study modules than acutally learning in class. She makes you feel bad if you ask questions in class. ALOT of work to pass this class.

I have to do this bs all over again next semester. You go to office hours asking for help and she would say "you should know how to do this" sis what does that even mean???? Working my ass off only for all of us to be crying and be sad. This is bad. Very bad very very bad

tests are 100 points but only 20 questions each. horrible professor, sample questions have wrong answer keys and half the time in lecture, she doesn't even do the practice problems correctly. doesn't teach all the material yet we're responsible for it all on the tests. attempted to teach the last unit in ONE DAY before the final. nope.

Exams are majority of your grade, quizzes are given every week online but do not account for most of your grade. Only 10 Extra Credit points possible. I recommend not taking this course with her, but with a different professor. She knows her material, however not how to explain it to students. Material is very difficult. Exams are only 20 questions

Professor O'Donnell was a great professor. I had him for ACT 221 and 222, and both times he catered an environment where he wanted the students to succeed. The class isn't the easiest class, but if you show up to every class, take notes, and review the slides he gives right before tests, there is no reason that you shouldn't get an "A".

He gives you no time in exams. Very strict. A lot of assignments. If you have a chance to take another professor for accounting do it because it is just a basic business course. Do not take any class with him he does not listen to students and if you email Him he wont answer so do not even bother! Choose any professor and get an easy A.

Class is mandatory, in my opinion and definitely helps with exams, sometimes he tells you exact T/F, and the "problems" that will be on the exam, which are hard. Be prepared to study the slides and notes religiously for exams as you get no study guide. All I can say is do ALL of the L.S. , HW's + Quizzes + show up to class and you should pass.

Wasn't a fan of him or his teaching style. I found myself having to teach myself a lot of the material. He talked about himself a lot and would get off topic convincing us to pay attention because this class will make us rich. Pay attention tho during lectures because he usually gives pretty good tips of questions that will be on the exam.

Professor O'Donnell was a great professor. I had him for ACT 221 and 222, and both times he catered an environment where he wanted the students to succeed. The class isn't the easiest class, but if you show up to every class, take notes, and review the slides he gives right before tests, there is no reason that you shouldn't get an "A".

I don't trust reviews where students complain that you have to study to pass. Are your parents making you go to school? O'Donnell is terrific. Yes, you have to do the work and study. But he gives you every possible tool to do well in his class. He really wants you to succeed. So put in the work. He's funny, friendly, and gives extra credit too.

Class is hard, having him once a week for 3 hours can be a little overbearing. You have to study, otherwise you most likely won't pass with a good grade. The homework assignments are online but they are way too long. He's hilarious and cares for his students, but not that great at teaching the subject. No quizzes, you have to stay the entire 3 hour

for a person who has taken accounting 221 three times I finally passed with Ed. His lectures are very cut and dry so if you want to pass make sure you the material, which is covered through powerpoints in every class and posted online so attendence isn't exactly mandatory. I took a three hour class once a week and coffee was needed.

He struggles at communication and his tests reflect that - he does not pull his questions from any test bank which makes the wording suspect to anyone but him. He knows the coursework but does not understand that he is not actually teaching it because he leaves most of the explanations in his head.

Probably one of the worst professors i've seen. Tests are unbelievably hard, he does not give quizzes which are really important for revision and refreshing our knowledge on the subjects. He might seem like he's caring but he certainly isn't. I would never take this course with him again even if i was forced to. consider someone else.
This class wasn't bad at all. Hearsay is he gives a little more homework than some professors, but it helps with your grade. Classes are kind of predictable but overall, not a tough class.

I didn't care much for this class or the course work at all. However, I think I picked a good professor to tough it out with. It was pretty demanding since it was a 6-week summer course. His lectures were engaged and interesting enough for such a dry class. I recommend him, but be ready to study pretty intensively if you take this over the summer.

O'Donnell is an all-around 'good-but-not-great' professor.  Tests determine your grade for the most part and they can be challenging, but if you read and do the homework and study, you will get a good grade.  He tends to mix up words/numbers a lot, but if he makes a mistake, call him out and he will take your criticism gracefully.

Advanced accounting, in my opinion, was much easier than both Intermediate courses. There are 2 exams plus a final, which is comprehensive but his "old exam day" helps prepare for it. He posts all HW answers ahead of time which is helpful. He makes class interesting and takes the time to get to know every student, which was a nice touch.

He was an excellent professor! I took him for the summer and he warned us we would be going quickly. He looks over your exams before you leave to ensure you do well. He's a very nice guy and makes class a bit interesting. I would recommend him for any accounting class.

Easy easy class, if you are somewhat good at accounting. However, his problems are different then one's he assigns. Only work the problems assigned. GO to every class, and you will get an A. GO PPPPPG

I really enjoyed his summer class. He gave us  extra credits on exams and points on questions that everyone missed. Pay great attention to which exercise questions would be on the test during the class (so don't skip class) and study hard and you should be able to get an A.  Be sure to practice Connect questions for TF & multiple choice questions.

I actually really loved this class, I'm not great at accounting but I ended up with an A because he literally told us every important test question and gave the whole class points if the majority missed a certain question. He took the time to learn all of our names and he honestly really cares. He sincerely wants you to do well in the class!
Don't take it unless you have to

Old school style of Exams which are too long and he tells you that you may not be able to finish it. Wants you to memorize formula. Can't explain the subject matter, made us read the book out loud in the class. Guidelines for the class projects are confusing, no evaluation of the projects. Be sure to put a lot of effort if you want a good grade.

Took this in the 6 week summer semester.  There was a lot of material in a very short time.  He made it very clear we would have a lot of homework and exams would come up quickly.  He made sure to let you know what to study for the exams and there were very few surprises on the tests.  Would recommend taking him.

There is a lot of reading, a chapter a week, followed by a quiz. Each quiz is untimed and you are able to make up the questions you miss for full credit. She does her best to accommodate everyone's needs and takes everyones feedback into consideration. Her class is a lot of work, but it is a very interesting class!

She's nice & gives very good feedback but this course has more writing than my actual WAC course. Gives chances to make up quizzes. Lenient with some due dates. Homework is VERY time consuming for the amount of points given. A LOT of reading and writing. Course was okay but way too stressful for me
What a sweetheart! He makes the subject crystal clear and with humor and kindness.
Awesome prof. Take him for anything you can.  Tells you exactly what you need to know. Super nice & courteous.
Very clear, extremely friendly, the model lawyer and teacher.
This guy makes you feel like a child when he talks to you.  It can be reassuring in your first year of law school, but overall I think it is detrimental.
Evidence section was great; contracts section was poor.  You'll see when you have to learn it again for the bar.

Great teacher who gave from his own personal experiences. At first I was scared when he seperated the class into groups to force the discussion but it went fairly easily and was credit for being there and being part of the discussion.

Nice guy, but NO ONE should need the approval of his students that much.  Also, not spoonfeeding absolutely EVERYTHING might be nice.  If you can't handle certain things, maybe you shouldn't be in law school, you know? I know, I'm in the tiny minority with this one, but it would be  nice to have a reason to actually be in class.

Certifiably the best, kindest, and most gentle human being to grace the halls of CM.  And I'm not kidding.  In his office, hanging over his desk is a certificate from the Law School Gods which reads: "KFO is the best, kindest, and most gentle human being to grace the halls of CM."

Possibly the nicest man I've ever met in my life.  Contrary to tradition, being nice DOES help you learn law better!  The most respectful professor of students in the classroom.  If your grades are low, go KFO.
Great prof, and the nicest person you'll run across in higher education. Take every class he teaches!
He made me a better practitioner.  Gotta love him!!
Dr. Obrenovich is a very intelligent and knowledgeable professor. This class was one of my favorite undergrad classes, he was clear, and very helpful. He also provides great notes and exams are fair.

I took his theories of aging course. Dr. Obrenovich knows his stuff really well however, he sometimes has difficulty in explaining it and connecting the concepts. Organization of the course was also lacking. Other than that hes a good guy and a great researcher.
Dr.O is the cooooolest teacher I've ever had. Really knows his stuff! Very excited about his subject. Always offers help when needed, offers extra credit and makeup exams!!!

Dr. Oet is too smart for his own good. He gets very boring and I was not able to understand any of the concepts he taught. I went to tutoring and I still did not grasp it. I still had no idea what was going on, but if you put in effort, you will get that A! (with that generous curve of course ;))

The best Professor anyone can actually learn from, He is super understanding but gives a lot of home works. But again he is really considerate about grading. His teaching style is by far one of the best I have seen! Also, he awards extra marks for class participation and best-looking reports and performances.

The best Professor anyone can actually learn from, He is super understanding but gives a lot of home works. But again he is really considerate about grading. His teaching style is by far one of the best I have seen! Also, he awards extra marks for class participation and best-looking reports and performances.

I had Dr. Oguz for Project Management, and it was a great experience! His real-world experience and certification in project management really showed in this course! There was a group project (it's a project management class!) worked on throughout the term. He is an engaging professor, and if you put in some effort, you will learn quite a lot!

I took his course remotely and it was a breeze. He was a very nice professor who truly wanted all of his students to succeed. You have one group project & one individual project, both I got 100% on. Super lenient grader in my opinion & gives extra credit on ALL discussion posts. I found the more I replied, the more points I got, which was nice!

2L ConLaw. Straight-forward, logical, not biased. SCOTUS discussions can easily devolve into proxy political discussions, but Oh gets the big picture and respects good arguments from either side. No cold-calling, goes alphabetically. If you participate in discussions, you're golden. Specialty is 14th Am., left well prepared for the Bar. Exams fair.

Dr. Okrent is an enthusiastic professor who really cares about what he's teaching. I had him for two classes and the set up was very straightforward. He gives more work than most professors. Get ready for weekly DBs and assignments, with a mix of papers and group projects. He is big on group work and breakout rooms during zoom sessions.

Dr. Okrent is an enthusiastic professor who really cares about what he's teaching. I had him for two classes and the set up was very straightforward. He gives more work than most professors. Get ready for weekly DBs and assignments, with a mix of papers and group projects. He is big on group work and breakout rooms during zoom sessions.

Dr. Okrent is one of the most amazing professors I have ever had. You definitely have to work for the grade you get, but I liked that he had us listen to recent podcasts of other companies, and he was insightful after you provide your write-up. The tests were pretty simple, mostly from quizlet, but I learned so many applicable, real world concepts.

Dr. Okrent is one of the best professor I have ever had and I would highly recommend taking his class. You are not allowed to miss class because he takes attendance everyday and your grade is based on that. His class is easy and interactive.

He filled in for an ill prof for the semester. Had him for Women's Lit in Middle Ages. Material was fairly dry and all the writers were whiny, but Olson was rather entertaining. Made the older language easier to understand, but the fact that it was a WAC course was rather annoying, because the projects on dry material were hard to complete

Olson will be sorely missed by all English majors at CSU; it's terrible that he retired.  I learned more from my classes with him than I learned in all my other classes put together.  He is a remarkable professor, and it's too bad no more student will get to hear him read Canterbury Tales in Middle English - enthralling!
No Comments
No Comments

I love Dr. Olsen.  This was the second class that I took with him and I wish that I could take more.  He is always willing to help and his classes are always interesting.  He challenges you to think and to do your best, but in my experience, the very best professors expect the best from their students.
No Comments

Dr. Olsen is a great professor.  Very kind and friendly, always smiling.  His courses are challenging, but fun.  He is always willing to help when it is needed.  He is one of the most knowledgable professors - he is amazing!

Professor O brings a high level of professionalism to her classes. There's little room to goof off, but if you read the material and closely follow her grading criteria, I don't know how one couldn't pass.

Love professor Olszowy! She is very knowledgable and caring. Attendance is not mandatory but there are pop quizzes based on the readings. She gives great study guides and truly wants everyone to succeed. Always available outside of class if you need help. A lot of readings assigned but most are interesting. Definitely recommend.

Dr. Katie is one of the best ANT professors I've had. Her lectures are really interesting and the labs for this class are really fun and cool. The two books for this class are easy to read and understand. The study guides are good review but if you show up to class and pay attention you won't need to study that hard to pass the tests.

Katie is cool. She respects her students, and does a great job teaching them too. The lectures are interesting and are easy to follow. They can drag on at times, but she breaks it up with short videos. The class is really cool, not too tough, and she is a great instructor.

The grading criteria for this class is clear and helpful. Katie does an amazing job preparing people for the tests with a review sheet. However there are readings and there will be quizzes but they are not listed when they are on the syllabus. In order to get the points for the quiz then you have to be in class. Overall she is very respectable.

Great professor, you need to do the required readings which are usually enjoyable. She grades fairly and will give good feedback. She is available to meet and discuss any questions and is extremely helpful. Her expectations are very clear, you must do the work to get the grade you want. She won't let you sail by without putting in an honest effort

Beware, the study guides are absolutely pointless. Nothing on the study guide will be on the test, so don't waste your time. If it's clear you aren't keeping up with the assigned reading (from textbook or other) she will give out pop quizzes--for extra credit only though, so not too bad if you don't pass them.

Katie is a great professor. You will need to read both books assigned one is the textbook for course the other is to do a critical essay at end of semester. Grading done mostly off labs in case you aren't that great of a test taker. I would definitely take her again.

Great lectures, love his notes.  Takes his time explaining, gives lots of feedback on homework.  Book is not Required but he does follow it and it's worth reading.  It took me an incredibly long time to complete homework assignments but at the end I feel like I can say I learned something.  Thank you
Amazing professor!
Great professor.  Explained things clearly.  Eager to help.  Highly recommend.
One of the best professors in the department. Highly recommended. Funny and entertaining!
He was alright just really boring

This guy is brilliant. I kind of fell into his class but I'm really glad I did. As a History major I figured this was outside my comfort zone but Orange really knows EVERYTHING.  He made Literature historical and found the history in Literature. Seriously --  this is why we go to college.
He is very helpful. I was willling to help me when I asked him questions.

Blech.this guys class was beyond annoying..lectures on & on about poetic elements,but fails to ever make sense.If you can get through his dull lecturing, you might be able to get a good grade in the class,but his exams are a little off the wall.Wouldn't recommend,especially to someone who doesn't already have some understanding of poetry/literature

Tom was very passionate about the material covered in class, and that passion often translated into a fun, informative, and creative classroom atmosphere. I definitely learned a lot in this class.  I'd definitely take another one of Tom's classes!  He's a genuinely nice guy, and a very intelligent, helpful, and honest teacher.

Ms Oswald is rude; maybe she's overworked. She doesn't seem to have much time to give her students individually, and instead chooses to be rude and dismissive. The class itself involves very interesting content. The instructor is inconsequential. Her presence does not make or break the course so if you like the topic then take the course.

While the work was relatively easy, I felt like there was a ton of work for an online class. This is the one and only class I have ever read a textbook from cover to end. She literally covers the whole book. The posted slides and the quizzes are all from the book. Only issue I had was it seemed like some of her questns were from another edition.

grading criteria is very clear. discussion boards, 2 responses to the discussion board, quizzes and hw assignments (questions or explanations about concepts learned) all due by monday each week. one group project about topic of choice, powerpoint form (around 10 slides). easily accessible outside of class. would take again. great professor.

For PSY majors, 482 or 487 are required. It's best to take 482 with Oswald. She responds quick to emails and is very nice and helpful towards students. It's true that there are quizzes every week, but they are not hard. She posts  power points, lecture notes and other sources to help.  She also allows 3 attempts for quizzes and 2 for the final.

Bare-Minimum Barbara is not well-suited for teaching an online course.  She isn't willing to put the effort into communicating.  For example, when I was confused about a quiz question, I emailed her about it.  She gave me what she thought was a good explanation.  I still didn't understand, and when I emailed her back she said "I'm done with this".

I'd love to know what version of the textbook she's using, because the information that she asks for simply isn't in textbook listed in the syllabus. The class is all online, and every week there is a discussion board, two responses, a homework assignment, and a quiz due. Good luck since you won't be able to find answers.

She was a little unorganized. Very easy A. Homework and discussion board each week. If you turn something in or posted you'd get the points. Didn't seem like she even graded work! Quiz every few chapters. Some questions didn't seem like they were in the book.

I absolutely loved Oswald for Human Sexuality. This class was extremely easy. In total, there are only 8 quizzes and a final for the whole semester. This has been my easiest class @ CSU thus far! She even bumped everyone up 5-6 points extra credit at the end of the semester to help out students who were close to a high grade. I highly recommend!!!!

Really straight forward class. HW is due every week and you can work ahead if you like. There is a group project which is very easy but if you have awful group members it can be hard. She replies to emails usually with one day.

I thought Human Sexuality was a fairly easy class. There were no surprises and there was only a discussion board, assignment and quiz due every so often. I thought that this online class was very manageable compared to many others. She's clear, straight forward and willing to give credit if you put in the effort and turn in the work on time.
This professor expects a lot and unfortunately stopped responding to emails shortly after the semester began.

Human Sexuality was a great class. A lot of awful opinions shared by classmates and it is very easy to get heated on the discussion boards. Prof. was pleasant, though I seldom had any direct exchanges with her. I also have taken Life Span with her and would not recommend her for a lower division course at all. Her demeanor changed drastically.

She answers emails, yes, but the amt of work is ridiculous! She constantly points out that its a 400 level class blah... Quizzes have nothing to do w/ hw or weekly thread postings &you can read the chapter 3x & still not find the quiz answers. There's also a 10 page paper. I was literally failing bc of the quizzes but paper brought me to a b-.

Amount of work was ridiculous, especially for an undergraduate course. Dr. Oswald was very helpful and a fair grader. She also respond and grades quickly. 10+ research paper was the most tedious part of this class.
Professor is very nice and responds quickly to emails and concerns, but for an online class the amount of work was ridiculous. it was hard to keep up while managing other classes

Teacher is absolutely HORRIBLE!DO NOT take a class with her.When I emailed her with questions about a quiz, she accused me of being rude for not agreeing w/the grade I was given.She then proceeded to tell me to get out of her class.Whenever she would agree to give me a point back,I never got the points.UNFAIR, RUDE, and doesent care about students.
Not a hard class and pretty interesting. Didnt do much reading and will get a B+ or an A. At times I didnt find her to be very clear on what she wants but overall recomend the class and prof.
Online course was not that hard, she responds quick to emails and questions, and has a caring heart.

Most horrible experience imaginable.  Out of about 60 students, no one likes the online course, the book, or the instructor.  She is unhelpful at explaining concepts and has no ability to comprehend questions when they're asked.  Book is worthless.
super passionate about pediatric nursing. very knowledgeable and knows what hes talking about!

I had Professor Othman for Pathophysiology. All he did during our class sections was play fast-paced videos for the class entirety (3 and a half hours). He responded fast to emails, but he did not teach in class, which was detrimental to myself and other students learning ability. I do not recommend taking him for Patho.
super passionate about pediatric nursing. very knowledgeable and knows what hes talking about!

Professor Othman is amazing! I had him this summer for the gerontology combined clinical/course (NUR408 & 409), and he has been wonderful! He's kind, responds readily to emails, and is extremely helpful. He has extended a few of our due dates due to various circumstances, and has been super nice when it comes to letting us revise not-so-good work!

Othman was an AMAZING professor. Very clear cut and knowledgeable. His tests are 40 questions but the tests are only out of 35 points to give you a curve. For tests, READ THE TEXTBOOK. The sole reason why people were doing bad in his class was because they were too lazy to read. If you read the book, you will pass EASILY. I got 100% on all 5 tests

Othman is a great teacher! In order to pass the class, you have to read the book and I think that is why everyone did not like him. If you read the book, you pass. Plain and simple. He seems like a serious teacher but when hes lecturing sometimes hell say something funny and just laugh to himself. He cares about our grades and is willing to help.

I had his class online through the Fall during COVID. It involved a lot of reading and participation through discussion. It was the most engaging blackboard based class I have ever taken. Necessitates reading and participation. He genuinely wants you to grapple with and discuss the material. Read and show up, and you will learn a lot.

I had his class online through the Fall during COVID. It involved a lot of reading and participation through discussion. It was the most engaging blackboard based class I have ever taken. Necessitates reading and participation. He genuinely wants you to grapple with and discuss the material. Read and show up, and you will learn a lot.

Helpful study-guides and grades easy, but covers a lot of info that isn't on the midterm or final. 1 short paper and 1 research essay. Takes attendance. Gets off topic a lot but very passionate about what hes teaching. Don't ask questions, he'll spend way too long answering something that could be answered with a couple words.

Dr. Owino is honestly one of my favorite professors I have taken. He does lecture every day but his stories and personality make up for the mass amounts of information. We had one major group project and a final, no homework, no pop quiz, no tests.

Mostly lectures, reading, and papers. There were no tests for this class, instead there are 3 research papers and 1 presentation. He's very knowledgeable about Africa, and is more than willing to help students. Easy A if you read and do good on the papers.

I highly recommend this professor if you enjoy history. He is not a tough grader and you will learn a lot from his lectures. You will have to write papers ranging from 6 to 10 pages long, and he does grade attendance.

Terrific professor who obviously loves what he does. Always smiling and happy which makes the class go smoother. Some material is fairly dry  but Dr. Owino makes it manageable. Two quizzes and two papers are the majority of the grade in addition to attendance and participation. A fair A+ class and prof.
Clear about his assignments, rules, grading. He does explain the do's and don'ts in his class. Explains his lectures pretty clear

His class is fun interesting he makes you laugh during it and is very passionate about what he teaches all you have to really do is go to class and take notes the books were not very necessary and honestly regret buying them because he covers everything in class but i recommend him to everyone because he is such a great professor
Great professor. Very knowlegeable about subject material. Very fair and efficient grader. History 366 is all essay: midterm, final and two papers.

Owino! My man! I took 3 different classes and I never once opened the books or took notes. Before each exam I opened wikipedia and I scored A on all of them. I love his stories about his Tribe in Africa and their resistance to the British. His grandfaher once spent 3 hours under water to avoid the paying taxes to the British Tax collecters!

Really enjoyed this class. The reading is not absolutely necessary,but will help on quizes and papers. Taking notes and attending are a must, so if you are not someone who does, skip this class. He is a great teacher who has great enthusiasm.

Owino is a good guy who actually cares about his students. Do not mistake "bias" for simple enthusiasm. The man is passionate about what he teaches. For this class you will either need to read the book OR take notes. I have not opened a single book, but because of the good notes I have taken I could fail the final and still receive and A- to B+

Professor Owino is a good teacher... his class is boring on most days, however his exams are extremely easy! He somtimes gives the illusion that the class is harder than it really is. He is very open to others opinion and a very funny guy in a wierd way. Owino is a good person and if u show up toclass and take notes u will pass the class!

He has very biased views on Africa, doesn't listen to anyone's thoughts on a subject, shunns them. Nice guy though. gives study guides. Find that even with mandatory attendance, people don't like to go to class. dry but a funny guy

Dr. Owino is an awesome professor. He uses power points and study guides. He totally changed my perspective of Africa and I learned a lot in this class. He is very funny and makes class interesting! I would definitely recommend him!

Dr. Owino is fascinating and brilliant! his lectures include a lot of open class discussion and he strongly encourages participation. he's funny, adds anecdotes, is personable and truly made me love his class and the continent of africa!

Dr. Owino is simply dry. His lectures are boring, even though it is on an interesting topic. Gives good notes and if you take them you should be fine. He assigns papers, which have a curve on them. Not a very hard class, I would recommend someone else, but I am pretty sure he is the only African History professor...

Dr Owino need to use less power points or at least try and find a method in which he makes his power point more intresting. In history 175, he had mandatory attendance and he had do one paper with 2 essay questions as our final. Overall good teacher if your willing to keep up with his accent and his unchallengeable love to Africa.

took his modern africa class. much reading- some boring, some challenging but interesting. nice guy, but language difficulties sometimes. is from kenya and speaks british english- sometimes misunderstands students' comments. has strong opinions on kenya- don't argue with him in kenya!

Easy class. Show up take notes and you should get an A. He assigns a 3-5 page paper instead of an exam. Overall he is not a bad teacher. He offers some interesting insights into Africa (because he is from Nigeria).

Easily the best class notes of any professor in the department. His lecture's are great, and he gives good feedback if you ask. There was also a %5 extra credit up for grabs if you attended 90% of classes which was super clutch.

Easily the best class notes of any professor in the department. His lecture's are great, and he gives good feedback if you ask. There was also a %5 extra credit up for grabs if you attended 90% of classes which was super clutch.
He is really good professor and good knowledge of what he teaches. He does make sure that all the concepts are clear.

Didn't really know how to teach at first, but allowed students to give feedback early which greatly improved the class. His instruction became much more clear. Exams were straightforward and easy if you studied. He is a very funny and super nice guy too. Recommend for Statics, Dynamics and Strength of Materials and any other class if possible.

He doesn't respond to emails. He doesn't really use black board. Instructions are hard to follow. He is a kind person but he grades hard and the syllabus isn't to clear as to directions and due dates are very hard to keep up with
great to have , explains subjects very well
will make you a chemist

The material for this class was very interesting. His lectures were humorous and informative. He made a tough course a little more enjoyable. I took an entire test and BB erased all my answers, he kept it open a whole day and half to accommodate me. I would definitely take the course again, make sure you're familiar with chapter before taking exams
This was a great class. Definitely not an easy A, but if you put in the work, not only will you do well, but you will learn a lot.

If you are looking to go on to a counseling degree in grad school, this class will help you a lot. There is a lot of use of the DSM, his "lectures" are humorous, easy to read and helpful. His power points are slightly out of order when used in reference to the lecture notes, but they are FULL of information.

I took this class online and it was by far the best online class I've ever taken. His lectures are long but he gives real life examples. It is clear he puts time into the online lectures and it is extremely helpful! Tests are on the difficult side but he allows open book.
This guy is probably the worst i've ever seen. Its kind of a miracle that he got his teaching license in the first place. 10/10 would take again. strap in.
This guy is probably the worst i've ever seen. Its kind of a miracle that he got his teaching license in the first place. 10/10 would take again. strap in.
Just don't. Save your time. Worthless class. Only thing he actually bothered to grade was the extra credit worth 10 points. Go to another professor. Any class would be better than this.
I can't say I like him but the class is amazing.
Can be tough but cares. Definitely show up to lectures he knows a lot.

Prof Polomsky is one of the best professors I have had! Funny, fair, challenging, engaging, dedicated, the list could go on. Definitely not a class for free riders, you need to put in the effort. I learned so much in his class that I can comfortably state on my resume that I know stats (go to tutor also!). Semester ends with lots of knowledge

He knows what he is talking about and is very funny. He explains things well, but is very hard. I learned a lot, but had to put a ton of effort in. We started with 50 in the class and came out with only 20. Be prepared to work. His tests are also crazy hard, and require a ton of studying.

GREAT PROFESSOR. No BS. DO NOT take this class if you want an easy A, B or C. We started with 42 and only 17 made it to the final. This guy is no joke but I can honestly say I understand what I learned.

Incredibly easy to understand, even when he explains difficult concepts. Very approachable, funny, and fair. His tests are difficult, but if you study and do the assigned homework before each exam you will do well.
One of the best professors in CSU! knows what he's doing and very patient and kind. If you attend class, take notes and do your hw, you will be fine.
Excellent teacher. Take him in person if you can.  I can't imagine taking a challenging course like stats online (ugh).

36 people started the on-line course, but only 20 finished.  Several dropped the class after the mid-term and at least two missed the final.  Flippant comments and demeaning communications.  Either most of the class was substandard or bad teaching.  Avoid the on-line course and the summer session.

Grad business stats OMS 503. I HIGHLY recommend this professor. He presents material in a very logical and clear manner. He points out common mistakes students make so you can avoid them. Stickler for detail, but is fair. 10 (long)online quizzes, a midterm, and a non-comp final. Not much of a curve, but you'll be ok if you go to class & keep up.
Prof. Polomsky is amazing! He kept the class engaged through difficult material, was fair, had a sense of humor, and was always well prepared. Awesome :)
Good understanding of the subject. Very patient, at times will go over every tiny step and sometimes might seem redundant for a graduate level class. But a good teacher
Amazing teacher! She's very fun and knows how to keep the class interested. Very easy to talk to as well.

Toni was overall an average professor, but I would not recommend her for MKT 301. Take literally any professor instead. Her choice of only holding class via zoom one day a week does nothing for her students. Little to no discussion was held during these zoom meetings, she would often let us go extremely early. She also gives little to no feedback.
Amazing teacher! She's very fun and knows how to keep the class interested. Very easy to talk to as well.

my first semester with CSU. Chose to take an online class due to my work schedule. Professor Paoletta is an ok teacher. She is very slow at grading, but does give good feedback. She wants everyone to suceed. Make sure you stay ontop of the assignments especially the big research paper. The end result is 10-12 pages and a lot of points.

She is a great professor, I enjoy her class when I took it a year ago and she was engaging, the class was not boring, she is caring and very professional, two online exams which were not too difficult and a business pitch presentation at the end of the semester, similar to shark tank kind of vibe. Now she is a marketing professor.
Toni cares about teaching and her students success .
She is very knowledgeable and has a lot of real world experience

Toni is a gem. I really enjoyed her class, and def. beneficial to the outside world. She's very professional, and absolutely hilarious. A very outgoing professor. One final and homework due each week. Mainly on how the correct etiquette in situations. Easy class. Easy day.

She responds to questions with the vaguest answers imaginable when she doesn't outright avoid them. Attending her office hours is like playing a game of whack-a-mole as she moves or cancels them with almost no notice. Harsh point deductions for absurd reasons. Provides very little feedback and is often very rude. Clearly doesn't like to teach.

To keep it short, she's terrible. Never have I had a professor so inattentive to her class and frankly unaware of what she's teaching. Got a question? don't waste any time emailing her because she doesn't bother answering. Be prepared to spend hour upon hours on an assignment only to get a C at best. Avoid her AT ALL COSTS!!!

Dr. Papana is one of the worst math professors I've ever had. She takes FOREVER to answer emails, and more often than not doesn't even reply. Her assignments are incredibly unclear, and she takes off points for every little thing. She doesn't do a very good job of explaining any of the course material. Stay away from her class if you are able!

we went online halfway through class and i ended up extremely lost and unable to reach her. before we even went online, she left the week of an exam and had another professor come in to review with us, who then couldn't even figure out what half of the test material was even talking about. glad we ended up having pass/fail options

If you want to be able to understand your professor when he or she speaks and not fall asleep, she aint the one for you. Her accent is thicker than a snicker and I cant even count how many times I almost fell asleep in class during lecture. The only way I learned the material was through the homework.

Her homework does not reflect the lectures at all. she is willing to work with people outside of class. she is very unclear in her lectures. I basically had to reteach myself everything because her teaching style did not work for me. it may work for others, but the way she presented the information was not helpful at all.

She is hot and cold. She is a decent teacher, but sometimes what she thinks she has taught is not what she has actually taught. Her grading is a bit off. Stats is easy, and I managed an A, but so much of her grading is making sure your answers are phrased like she wants, not on your concept of the material.
There's not mandatory attendance, but there are surprise quizzes. Grading was tough.

Overall, good professor, want you to do good. Does not curve, however drops lowest quiz scores. Quizzes are unannounced however they are typically on lab day. You sow up to class and pay attention and you will do fine.

Professor Papana is a great professor. She is a tough grader when it comes to homework, but it teaches you to know the material thoroughly. She is very clear with her expectations of the exams and with teaching the material. She is extremely caring and helpful if you have questions!

Hardest class I have ever taken. She is very intelligent about her material, but fails to explain it thoroughly. Gets angry/confused about why you are not understanding the material. No partial credit, no extra credit, very tough grader. Attendance is necessary, homework and quizzes hard and confusing. 10/10 don't recommend

Very difficult to understand. Unclear when explaining concepts, questions not answered thoroughly and notes are not the easiest to follow. The worst part was the tedious grading and unclear questions that seemed to have multiple different correct answers.  I am not bad at math whatsoever but I struggled with the content she attempted to cover.

This is the worst professor I have ever had. She grades hard, you can barely understand her, she will tell you to get help from the math lab then teach it a different way. She is not easy to access, exams are not like anything she gives you to practice. DO NOT TAKE HER CLASS!

The professor will go slow if necessary but she isn't the best at explaining certain aspects. Expect pop quizzes. Everything is open note so as long as you show up to class and come prepared with the notes, you can pass.

One of the worst profs ever. I took MTH 147 with Zeledova last semester and I received an A- in the class. This class is nearly impossible. She has a thick accent and does not teach well.  On exams and homework, one multiple choice question is worth 6 points.... sets you up for failure. If you have her, take it Pass Fail or switch out.

Dr. Papana really puts the "applied" in an applied stats class. Lectures were roughly 45 minutes to an hour, then she'd let us all practice what we learned on our own. The class is very practical in nature. This class will be rough for you if you do not have a personal interest in the subject, but other you'll be okay. Overall, a fine professor.

She is very clear with her notes and will go slow so you have time to write what she writes on the board. Exams and quizzes are open note which helps a lot. Going to class is important because she does not tell you when there will be a quiz and she explains the notes well in class.

I would say the one thing I did not like was that she is not clear in explanation. If you asked for clarification, she would basically repeat the same thing she just said, and then would get frustrated if you had a hard time understanding concepts after the first time of explaining. nice person, but not a great teacher. Very disappointed.

Unless you're a math major that already knows the material, avoid. Explains one time and then gets confused as to why you don't understand why the subject makes sense in her head. No feedback on harshly graded assignments. Picky. If you're a PhD candidate in the math department, you'll be fine. Otherwise stay away - she has her own agenda.

Simply Does not know how to communicate with those who are struggling with concepts. Talks for nearly 2 hours straight assuming everyone gets it. Not comfortable answering questions. Not available. Takes forever responding to emails if at all. GPA killer.

On Blackboard, I can see the exact grade I have earned. This professor was so courteous to give me a lower grade based on a couple missed assignments. His logic is faulty as the missed assignments were already accounted for in my numerical grade. I had numerically earned an A-, but was not given it.

It was not a hard class, just a discussion post every week. Two book reviews (6-10pgs) , a concept paper (8-10 pgs), a small powerpoint based off your concept paper, and a 25 question final. Always keep your syllabus at hand to see the schedule because it may get confusing. A little strict with the reference page, make sure APA format is perfect.

I'm currently taking this class. I'm keeping up with assignments and getting a pretty good grade, but the only downside to the class is if your not doing well or need to get in touch with the professor online, you won't get much communication back from him. But, I do like the class so far, and I'm keeping up.

You have 2 book reviews (8 pages) and 1 essay (10 pages). You have weekly discussions where you read an excerpt that is fairly short and discuss it with class. For an online class, I didn't think it was hard. You do need to buy the textbook because the final is based off of it. The professor does NOT answer any emails that's why I rated him a 4/5
Excellent professor.

This was my fist time taking an online course. Now, it was not a bad course, nor was he a bad professor but something was off. I honestly do not think he read any of the 10 page papers he made us turn in. You can tell, I got a 100 on all of them, who gets a 100 in a 300 level course paper? Nonetheless, I think the actual class is better, not online

Dr. Paquet was an interesting man. His professionalism & knowledge is apparent. His homework assignments were from the book. The midterm and final were with a group that you pick early on in the semester. Just know your stuff, study it, and be able to confidently talk about the topic or he will grill you and make you second guess your own answers.
Very unclear in instructions, discussions, and questions. Rude and condescending. Never gave clear instructions for assignments, but graded them critically.

Very condescending and difficult. Leaves solid feedback on papers for improvement but that is pretty much the gist. Too much writing, 3 10-page papers and a powerpoint to really bog everything down. Not recommended

This professor was incredibly difficult to work with and expected way too much of his students. Two 10 page papers and a 15 page paper (on top of other weekly assignments) in a 6 week online class was absolutely ridiculous.

Professor is Great!!  Very helpful with explaining the subject, will stay over if you have any concerns, and overall what to help his students succeed.  Must be ready to interact in this class--participation is key.
Very helpful professor. He gave feedback on every assignment and explained exactly what to do to improve the grade next time.

Frustrating at times, but he does have good intentions in terms of learning how to effectively debate.  However, when it comes to expressing opinions, he strongly frowns upon starting a comment with "I."  Mostly condescending, and dismissive of the individual students personal interests.
a ton of reading, critical analysis, writing for days

BORING!!!! I love Psychology but he is boring as heck. HE also post the powerpoints on blackboard and so it is not necessary to go to class. His tests are really hard. As I say "A Ph.D doesn't make you a good professor."

He's not an entertainer so do not expect him to make you become interested in the subject. It really is up to you to earn that A in the class, but his class really isn't that difficult if you applied yourself. He is EXTREMELY helpful if you simply ask for help. EXCELLENT advisor for those seeking a graduate degree.
He isnt very enthusiastic about the subject he teaches, but he is very intelligent and gives a lot of information. read the book and powerpoints and the class will be easy for you
Extremely concerned with students' well-being.
He is super boring...i could barely stay awake in his class, but it was super easy if you read the book and his power points.

Social Psychology -- kind of a boring class as he just mostly read off his power points but all power points are posted on blackboard and tests were easy if you attended class and read over the power points.

He needs to have more of a backbone in class. Discussion makes class more interesting. ALWAYS get the pre-test questions, they help a lot. No homework and offers extra credit. Willing to help with grad program entry. Read the book, it helps on tests.

Easy class. She takes a while to respond to emails. Material covered is relatively simple. Weekly discussions on current chapter and an international business topic required. About 9-10 quizzes with multiple choice and true and false. One final exam with multiple choice, true and false, and two essays.

She's nice and seems to want students learn. However, her knowledge is limited to definitions in the text. She pretty much reads her power points and then asks questions directly about it. If you can read then you can answer her questions.  Tests do not test anything other than the ability to remember definitions, nothing conceptual. Easy A/A-
Very good class.  I learned a lot and enjoyed the material.  Tests were very fair and essays covered material that was taught in class.  Probably the best class I've had in CSU MBA program!

Class was so easy that I actually felt guilty for taking it. 3 exams, 1 project, and 6 discussion boards. That is it. Exams are easy if you do the study guide, project is a bit time consuming but not difficult, discussion boards are long but you only have to do 6 over 16 weeks. Professor was accessible and nice. Enjoyed the material, as well.

Given that it was her first semester teaching when I had her, she was fine. Her word choice in quizzes and labs were sometimes confusing but her teaching did make sense when it got to the labs. Just attend class and pay attention and youll be okay.

Horrible professor. If you are taking this class you better have prior knowledge of coding. Doesnt explain anything and her labs and homeworks are misleading. Half of my class failed every exam she gave. She never submitted any grades so you didnt know where you stood and when final grades were due she was late and left me with an X

Given that it was her first semester teaching when I had her, she was fine. Her word choice in quizzes and labs were sometimes confusing but her teaching did make sense when it got to the labs. Just attend class and pay attention and youll be okay.

I loved her as a professor. I really enjoyed her lectures. The class was via Zoom. The workload was reasonable and we had lab days to work on assignments in class. The lab days were a lifesaver! Super helpful to understand the assignments. I highly recommend her class.

This is the worst professor I've ever had. Poor lectures, doesn't respond to emails, unclear and confusing language on tests, and currently it is 11PM the day AFTER final grades are due and she has yet to even grade my final. Everyone in the course currently is marked with an 'X' grade. I had to teach myself the material with a free online course.
Terrible professor. Get used to learning on your own because she will not be doing the teaching

Absolute worst teacher in any class I have ever taken. Had zero plan other than waste 30 students time. Refuses questions, NEVER acknowledges her emails. Zero effort. Were about to take our final, and we currently have 3 grades in, out of 15 impromptu assignments she lazily posted on Blackboard like its Reddit. Horrible disorganized. Laughable.

Prof Ash has a lot of useful advice, having been a marketing researcher. I feel like I can actually use what was taught. Ask questions. He is super eager to answer them. He wants you to succeed. Powerpoints/lectures are gospel for exams (NOT book!). Final is 40% of grade. A few group homeworks, but not a big deal. Must come to class/take notes!

Prof Ash has a lot of useful advice, having been a marketing researcher. I feel like I can actually use what was taught. Ask questions. He is super eager to answer them. He wants you to succeed. Powerpoints/lectures are gospel for exams (NOT book!). Final is 40% of grade. A few group homeworks, but not a big deal. Must come to class/take notes!

Christy Patriarca is an AMAZING professor! Her generosity/care towards her students is very apparent. Extremely accessible, responding to emails quickly. What she expected was very clear. She allowed me to resubmit assignments until they were perfect. Would take another class w/ her in a heartbeat. Lesson plans, discussions & spelling inventory.
Very good professor. You have do a few lesson plans, but if you need help she gives excellent feed back.

Very knowledgeable about the field of literacy. I had to work hard in the class but I gained a lot of applicable information I will be able to use in the classroom - which is most important to me. Christy Patriarca is highly organized and makes the course expectations very clear.
She is very helpful, responds to email quickly and is very passionate about teaching.

Professor gives you a lot of writing assignments. Discussion boards could be a paper in itself plus you have to respond to 2 people and have other long writing assignments all in a week. Have a report at the end of the semester and gives you very little time to write it with 16 sources for a 6-8 page report.
TUH. NEVER AGAIN! NOT PERSONABLE OR REASONABLE! TOO MUCH WORK FOR THIS CLASS!
Exams are nearly impossible, be organized, and prioritize this class

She takes forever to grade assignments, yet expects a significant amount of coursework completed for each week. Very frustrating. Not sure I learned much, if anything, from this class. Not the most difficult, but it's mostly busy work and wasting my time.

I have taken many classes and am not afraid of working hard. This course is not a writing intensive course, but it is taught like one. She has too many expectations for this course even if it was a 15 wk class. She is an extremely slow grader and when she says she will have something graded so you misses her own deadlines. Very disorganized

I'm 3 classes away from graduation and her class is one I need to take in order to graduate. I'm contemplating dropping out because her expectations are ridiculous. Each week you have a quiz, discussion, article abstract and reflection due. On top of that she assigns 3-4 chapters a week plus additional readings. Seems nice but insane expectations.
Very Tough but interesting, if you go to every lecture and pay attention you will get the A.

Drop out of this class.  You will regret taking her class once the class gets going.  Tests are hard and the lectures she gives only have pictures as the powerpoint.  Extremely confusing and does not let students use computers and she does not upload the power points to study from.  Save yourself the worry, do not take her class

Do not take in-person classes with this professor. He doesn't keep to the subject matter and speaks of his other classes. Very insensitive towards his students' learning and answers arrogantly. If you ask for any help, he says to read the book. Doesn't go over reviews, just tells you to read the book. If possible, take this online.
boooooooooorrrring

Took this class over the summer.  Dont bother buying the book its a waste, just go to the publishers website and print off the powerpoint slides and the multiple choice quizzes.  The test questions are pulled off those same quizzes, you'll get an A for sure.
Really borring. Save time and take it online. If you take this professor excpect to learn lots of acronyms.

Prof. Paul is an excellent professor and a wonderful human being. She provides great instruction on proper workout form despite your level of experience (or lack thereof), and never loses patience when lecturing. She is also very motivational when working out, and demonstrates a nuanced knowledge of workout science. I recommend taking her class!

Easy online class. Quiz and homework assignment each week. We did not meet for class at all. He expects you to write a 10 page paper that is due at the end of the semester (which is a lot considering he did the bare minimum as a professor throughout the semester, and you had to teach yourself everything).

Easy online class. Quiz and homework assignment each week. We did not meet for class at all. He expects you to write a 10 page paper that is due at the end of the semester (which is a lot considering he did the bare minimum as a professor throughout the semester, and you had to teach yourself everything).
Straight forward class, very easy grader. This class is hard to fail. Make sure to start the research paper earlier in the semester, it needs to be 8 pages minimum.

Powerpoints were provided for this class which was very helpful, but I feel like some topics in the hw weren't addressed in them. Some assignments are based as a ch exam, those can be tricky. Make sure you keep up on the research assignment, it must be well written & at least 2500 words long. Overall this class was easy. Would take teacher again.
Literally the goat. Great professor who is very clear on what he wants. I know, it sounds to good to be true but seriously he is a real one!

He is the best option you have I am not saying hes a great professor but hes the lesser of all the evils, with that being said show up and actually demonstrate you are trying he will take that into account and help you a lot show you are giving you best effort and he will help you by all means. he gives very fair curves based on your effort

He was like unseasoned chicken, boring. The research project was fun and interesting but it should've been more points. He started making us submit these 40 question "quizzes" at the end of every week that are only worth 7 points. Renting the book from Amazon was a waste of money when Power Points were available. Class was boring when I did go.
Easy A class

Really great professor. Class isn't too hard but there are quite a few blackboard assignments that you'll have to do. Attendance isn't mandatory but professor is very dedicated and will kind of make you want to show up class just out of respect. Not hard at all to get an A in this class.

I've taken Dr. Paul for both IST311 and IST211, he is very good at describing the material and makes it very easy to understand. The assignments are very easy as they usually just entail modifying some code that we wrote in class, the exams however, were quite challenging. He tests you more on your logic than your syntax.
He's very a very nice professor. if you need this class, I recommend taking him online for sure. you just summarize case studies once a week and post it one googlesites page. super easy.

Easiest Upper Division class at CSU. You have to set up a google site and post all your work on it. The assignments he gives are long and time consuming and you may need the book for some of them, but overall it is an easy class with 12 assignments (around 84% of grade) and an research paper (worth 16% of grade).

Very unfriendly and unorganized. COULD NOT UNDERSTAND A WORD HE SAID. Knows the material, but does not know how to teach it. Conveys the material to students in the way HE understands it and not how it is generally accepted by employers and SMEs. 2 tests - midterm & final. Does not review HW. Poor grade on one HW  Difficult to do well on next

Easy A. Show up, always study, ask question if you need help, and the guy will carry you through the semester. Very thoughtful too because he puts the chapters from the book online, but if you want a book check for it on textbooks 101 and you might find something for a good price, that's what I did anyway. Would recommend Dr. Howard.

Extremely clear in the syllabus and is consistent in grading. I recommend taking his online classes. He grades assignments quickly and leniently. No midterm or final, just weekly assignments and one research paper due at the end of the semester. Also, he posts the books chapters online so no need to buy it!

I have taken Dr. Paul for almost all my IST classes,  ex: IST 311 , 321 & 331. will take him again if he's teaching any other course I have to take. He does similar work to the assignments in class & gives ample time to complete the assignments, if you can't complete on time, just shoot him an email & ask for an extension. lectures are little long

I could not understand him at all, he speaks very broken english. The assignments are easy, but not being able to understand him makes it very difficult to learn. Be willing to learn the material entirely on your own with this teacher. Classes are also unorganized - you most likely will not receive a syllabus or a grading scale.

this class wasn't too bad i would take it again. for me it consisted a practice assignment then a test every week and on some weeks an occasional project was a lot of work but i was expecting there to be more. just keep up with the online homework and your all set

I took this class online and this was an EASY class. There was very little communication between myself and the teacher, however he did provide feedback to class on submitting homework in a timely manner.  You also have to make a google site to submit homework on. There were no tests or quizzes but there was an 8 page paper.  I highly recommend him

Dr. Paul was one of the best professors that I have had at CSU.  He will spend all the time you need to understand a concept.  There was about one assignment a week and they weren't bad at all.  Exams were closed book and notes, but they were fair.  Just go every class and pay attention and you will do fine.
Love him. He cares about students. Helped the whole class to get better grades. Homework is not hard and not a lot to do per week. Strongly recommend to take his course.

Knowledgeable intelligent professor. Appreciate the wide berth given to grading the test especially if he likes your candor; mention as many legal cases and you will pass the class. Diamond in the rough at CSU especially for his echelon of credentials and caliber as a genuine person as well.

Professor Pawlik is a great lecturer and encourages questions and answers them effectively. If you aren't ready to read please don't take his courses because you do have to read a lot but if you do you are guaranteed an A and if you are always in class you should not worry about not passing.

Very archaic style of lecturing. He just lectures to you with no power point, and if you miss anything he's said, then tough luck. He doesn't like repeating himself and is very strict during class. Tests are essays and are abstract in nature. It is a tough class, but if you study enough you will get a good grade. Overall, I would not recommend.
READ READ READ

Knowledgeable intelligent professor. Appreciate the wide berth given to grading the test especially if he likes your candor; mention as many legal cases and you will pass the class. Diamond in the rough at CSU especially for his echelon of credentials and caliber as a genuine person as well.

He is very knowledgeable in the subject. However, he comes off as condescending and isnt nice. He doesnt have powerpoints/board notes during lecture so unless you are listening carefully you wont understand. He also doesnt like to repeat himself. He doesnt grade too hard but I studied a lot and still didnt do as well as I believe I shouldve

The hardest class I have ever taken. For the tests, I would write 11 pages front and back in a blue book. Dr. Pawlik is extremely knowledgable and has a very impressive resume, which I think he lets get to his ahead a bit. He comes off as arrogant and condescending, but he is a good professor. Do not text or talk in his class, he will scream at you

Dr. Pawlik is an amazingly intelligent but strict professor. He hates when students speak out of turn and don't pay attention, but he really does care about your success. He's a tough love sort of guy. Would recommend only if you want a professor who really pushes you to be better. Looking for an easy A? Better look for a different professor.

Professor Pawlik is a knowledgeable instructor. The class lectures are pretty fast-paced and require a lot of note taking. He does not post the material covered in class on Blackboard, so going to class is mandatory. This course requires a handful of studying outside of class. However, he is a lenient grader for the most part.

By far the best math professor I've ever had.  As other reviewers mentioned, she's very helpful to those who are struggling, and unusually bright and cheery regardless of the students' attitudes or difficulties.  Her explanations are flawless, and my only complaint is that she can't teach a section of every math class at the university...

To be honest, she was a very bright person, no matter how disruptive some students may have been in her class, she was always able to stay bright. Not to mention her homework was easy, tests were not hard at all, and she went at a pace where everyone understood what they were doing :)
She is the truth by far the best there is when it comes to teaching math.
Wonderful teacher! She is so sweet and very helpful! Very willing to explain anything you may not understand.

Dr. Payerle is wonderful.  She taught my first Intro to Women's Studies way back when, and I was able to take her again for my final WST course, Advanced Seminar.  It was a small, discussion-based course where we brought in articles to discuss. Insightful, supportive and encouraging!

I had been out if school for seven years took her 87 class and placed into calc 1. She is a really great teacher, I think she was able to toe the line of being slow enough for the people who do not know anything and fast enough for the people who just need a refresher.
