This is the one of the best professor's i've had so far! She is so helpful and patient! I have trouble with math but this teacher has helped me understand better just because she will keep explaining something until you actually understand it.

Very nice teacher! Probably the kindest woman I have ever met. She will work with you until you have a crystal clear grasp on the topic at hand. I generally do not have math teachers as my favorites but she is up there as one of my favorite teachers!
The best math teacher that I have ever had! She has the patience of a saint and will explain the same concept over and over until it is understood.

She talked to us like we were children first off. Wasnt very good at explaining stuff and if she did it was a extremely hard way of doing it. Her tests were extremely hard and she went though class way to fast even after asking to slow down. I did not pass this class and now have to re take it. I will not be having her as a teacher again.
I took her class a couple of years ago and she was very nice.

Funny Professor, would recommend. Only two papers and two exams the whole semester and attendence determines your grade. Exams are easy but he grades the papers tough and somewhat unfair. Would recommend taking him but beware on the papers.

Prof. Pearl made the topic of health care ethics into something super interesting. He has no problem explaining things in deeper detail if it's needed and is always willing to answer any questions you have. He makes the material very easy to learn and relate back to other subjects. A super funny guy with a great personality. Can be forgetful.
Reads pretty much the order of what the chapter is in. Good class. He gives study guides for midterm and final. A couple of papers to write. Listens to your argument.

Don't take this class early in the morning.. It is too hard to stay awake!! He pretty much just summarizes what the book says. You'll read cases and write papers on them. Midterm and Final are straight forward - both essays. Overall good class, not too hard. He tells funny stories sometimes.

This professor knows what he is teaching and expects you read the weekly chapters and cases. 10% of the class is based on attendance and participation; 50% on response papers(which he randomly assigns to students); 40% final and midterm. What you see on his final and midterm is what you expect to see on his tests. Overall great and helpful!

Professor Pearl is a great teacher. He kept his lectures interesting and always involved the students in debates. There are assigned weekly readings and he randomly assigns papers regarding case studies. He grades kinda hard because he expects you to know whats going on in class. But, he does give great study guides for the midterm & final.

Prof. Pearl knows his stuff and expects you to know it too. There are assigned readings out of the textbook and a case study book every week. He also assigns papers to write regarding the case studies. He grades fairly hard but he gives you good guidelines for the midterm and final :)
I loved this class it was a gen ed for my major and it was a writing across the course class . the professor is really funny and very smart

Absolute worst professor I have ever had. Class average was a 46%. Terrible at explaining concepts, lectures are long and super boring, professor is hard to understand, assignments are way too difficult, exams are extremely HARD, only 2 exams and they're worth 60% of your entire grade. STAY AWAY!!!!
One of the best teachers I had in college. Very smart man. He will be missed

He is an ok teacher, really sarcastic which can be bad at times, emailing him for help is impossible because he will just ask you for your opinion and you wont get anywhere. Can be hard at times, some of his labs are hard at the end. But you do learn the material and he knows what he is talking about.

Typical CIS professors. Quirky and intelligent and very set in his ways of teaching which is good. Teaches you what he wants you to know and, from experience, is the right way the material should be taught. Clear assignments and tests. Near daily quizzes which make attendance near mandatory.

I liked this professor a lot.  While the content of the class can be dry and programming is not for everyone, he still managed to entertain me.  He is sort of a smart ass but it made me laugh.  I went out of my way to take him for cis 265 next semester.

Excellent teacher, explains things clearly and is very fair in grading.  He is not the easiest teacher, and you will actually have to read the book to pass the class, but he gives an excellent foundation for going to the next class.  Always willing to help during office hours or over email.  Highly recommended.
A very intelligent professor. Assignments are quite challenging but really help to understand the material. The exams are challenging, but nothing impossible.
This is probably the worst instructor you will EVER find! Does not know how to explain the material AT ALL! Keeps on talking nonsense the majority of the time
bad bad baaaaaaaad

I can't believe this guy has so many good ratings. He is easily the worst professor I've ever had. He doesn't make his expectations clear, his lectures are perfunctory and useless, and he's condescending. He's not interested in helping students learn or in ensuring they pass his class. Half the students dropped after the midterm!  That says it all.

He did a great job.  I learned a lot about C/C++ as well as operating systems.  He seems to really know his stuff. He's clear and he answers questions.  Tests and homework are fair.  I wish I knew about him earlier, I would have taken more of his classes.
His knowlege of the subject is very good.  His examples and handouts were excellent.  His handouts were better than the book and showed very practical aspects of c/c++.

he knows what he is teaching very well but he can't see that we don't know it at all and that he should explain more, I basically have to study on my own. The concept is easy to understand, but the assignments are very hard. It is harder than the examples in the book.
GOOD TEACHER

This guy doesn't challenge his students in the right way, always giving useless mind excersizes. Did I mention he's far too condescending and self-absorbed? My day shouldn't be ruined because this imbecile happens to have a carbohydrate buzz.

Excellent professor! Explains the material clearly. Exams are VERY FAIR! I think assignments are pretty easy (and fun :)). Quizes are less than simple, plus he drops about half of them. Overall - excellent professor. Has his own approach to teaching, which is VERY good. He is entertaining! RECOMMEND
THE ABSOLUTELY WORST TEACHER I HAVE EVER HAD. EVER. EVER. EVER. DO NOT TAKE THIS GUY.

The nerd of nerds; right down to the pocket protector. But that only makes him probably the best CS professor ive ever had. His quizzed are fair, his assignments are challenging but really help to re-enforce the material being taught. Take his classes if you have the chance, you wont regret it.
Very good teaching!  One of the best
Great professor. Covers a lot of material clearly. You will learn a lot.

This professor is by far one of my favorite professors I had at CSU. She is so nice, respectful, and helpful. She always come in the class with positive energy and you do not see a lot of that from teachers. She is free during office hours and want to see her students succeed, and is smart in this field. If you take MGT 321 , take it with her.

This professor is by far one of my favorite professors I had at CSU. She is so nice, respectful, and helpful. She always come in the class with positive energy and you do not see a lot of that from teachers. She is free during office hours and want to see her students succeed, and is smart in this field. If you take MGT 321 , take it with her.

Her grading criteria is not clear to the student. She will take 10 points off of your assignment for maybe typing one big paragraph when she wants two smaller ones. Instead of her communicating what she wants, she just gives you an F and refers you to the wrong folder anyways. Took her class last semester and would not recommend it to anyone.

Peppard is quite a joy to have as a professor, but you might have to teach yourself some stuff outside of class. She gets frazzled sometimes but is a wonderful person and will offer class time to help students struggling, always brings in demonstrations to make physics exciting!
This is a lab course but there are not even some zoom meetings , and even the TA of class wont meet with you much, just 30 mins a week .weekly assignment are difficult to do on ur own .

Peppard is quite a joy to have as a professor, but you might have to teach yourself some stuff outside of class. She gets frazzled sometimes but is a wonderful person and will offer class time to help students struggling, always brings in demonstrations to make physics exciting!
Amazing!
Wonderful professor I had the opportunity to take her Physics 102 section and I really enjoyed it. She made sure to bring in some interesting demonstrations that really excited me about physics.
Tends be a bit disorganized and loses her train of thought. Rambles at times about unrelated topics. Doesnt always go into detail when needed. Average teacher.

Prof. Peppard really cares about her students and loves what she does. Material could be a bit challenging at times, but she was always willing to make time to help you. ALWAYS do the study guides -- the tests are right off of it! If you participate and show up to optional classes, she does notice and is more willing to help you!

She's very nice and understanding, but a little disorganized at times. She often came rushing into class a few min late and sometimes forgot demo material. However, lectures weren't boring and she showed a lot of movies. Buy the text as it was crucial for exams. Many tests and homeworks but generally not hard and very straightforward.
Professor Peppard is a very nice woman, but sometimes she is a little disorganized. Her class is very easy and her material is straight forward.
She is very clear on what you need to know for each exam.  Lot's of review and practice questions.

Homework was challenging at times, but was all online and didn't take too long. She often goes over the tougher problems prior to the homework being due. Test were multiple choice and only over a single chapter at the end of every week. She provided almost all needed formulas/constants for needed for the test. I enjoyed the course.
Completely disorganized & constantly late.  She gets by by being easy. You'll get a good grade, but you won't learn anything.

Knowledgeable and passionate about her work. Very fair grader- on homeworkquizzesexams she takes each problem and checks that you know what equation to use and where to plug the information in, so if you make a math mistake after that, you don't get the whole problem completely wrong. Only suggestion is she needs to check e-mail more regularly.

I have eye problem similar to colorblind.   Ms. Peppard's lab used mainly colored chalk I cannot see.  One day half of board was in red, a color I have trouble reading, and half in white.  I was told to ignore the important (red) half I cannot read.  Lab is 1980's word processor and no e-copy available.  Should be fired for title IX violations.
Very nice lady!

While Professor Peppard is very knowledgeable about the subject matter, her lectures were unclear and all over the place. Would assign random, 1-page participation assignments, and her tests always included a lot of material that was never covered in class and she would always add new info to the tests last minute.

Ms. Peppard is a very approachable professor.  She is very down to Earth and very intelligent.  She has a very good heart and cares about her students and her topics of study. In other words, SHE IS AWESOME! My only criticism is that she is too nice...but I should wait until I get a final grade before making that   decision. Thank you, Ms. Peppard!

The class was hard to me because im not a physics major but i managed to still pass ..Peppard is very helpful she curves test and quizzes, always willing to help you , gives extra credit and is so nice ... you'll love her even though her test and homework problems can be a little challenging

Super nice professor and a really easy course. Every test is graded on a curve and there are very few homework assignments. Only negative point is that she would rush through the powerpoints and not give enough time for some of the tests because she wants to assign a seat only for that day which takes a lot of time. Just study and go to class
knowledgeable, nice, helpful and hot, yo!
One of those teachers or person who gets away for her looks and not her skills & knowledge. She needs to learn her material before she teaches. Her being hot helps though ;)
Very easy. Loves what hes talking about. such a nice guy.
Very kind, great lecturer, very helpful. You'll learn a lot and he's hot and a little dorky!

This professor is on my fave list from all the professors i've had in my 6 years of college. she's very nice in person and very interactive. we didn't use the book that much, no tests, we had a group project where we had to make an event, the assignments were easy. easy course overall.

Returned to school after being out for 2 years, this was my first math class back. Great guy, wanted me to succeed and gave excellent feedback when I had questions or needed help. He is very accessible was able to reach him on multiple occasions outside of class when I had questions. His class is very useful, concepts can be difficult but fun!

Returned to school after being out for 2 years, this was my first math class back. Great guy, wanted me to succeed and gave excellent feedback when I had questions or needed help. He is very accessible was able to reach him on multiple occasions outside of class when I had questions. His class is very useful, concepts can be difficult but fun!
He is a great guy very understanding and kind all around. His lecture style is very confusing so it would be very hard to read what he is trying to say even when you pay close attention.

Slow grader and very inexperienced. It's obvious his students do not respect him. His flipped learning model is basically you teaching yourself and doing group work in class. Would avoid taking him at all costs.

Great guy, has potential to be great as he becomes more experienced but right now he is not. He did not teach, and when he did it was not even about what the work or quiz was on. I had to teach myself, which wasn't fun. He says hes very accessible yet I emailed him for help and it took him nearly a month to get back to me! Nice guy not great proff.
A great professor! He is very understanding and will meet with you to help you with the homework when you are struggling.
Professor Perloff is very knowlegeable when it comes to politics, he made remote learning for us as a class very engaging.
Professor Perloff is very knowlegeable when it comes to politics, he made remote learning for us as a class very engaging.

He wants you to learn and enjoy doing it. If you have the chance to take him, do it. He is really funny and entertaining so it makes class not as bad. Grading for persuasion kinda sucks because it's heavy on tests and papers, but he gives you good feedback and chances to get your grade up. This guy is great.
He's interesting, and funny. Exams will be difficult if you don't study. He gives good feedback, and wants you to learn.

I've had professor Perloff for multiple classes. I really like how he teaches the material. He does like group work and participation in class so make sure you be involved. He genuinely cares about the students and is always willing to give feedback and go the extra mile to help students on assignments. His study guides are exactly what the test is

Shows videos to reinforce lectures, takes his time going over topics and helps make things clear. Tests are easier then what he makes it out to be but you NEED a green book. He does have you do a 5 page paper which requires you to interview someone but he pretty much gives you the entire semester to do it, just don't procrastinate.

Love Dr. Perloff.. he's a little eccentric and out there but his classes are enjoyable. He shows lots of video clips to better reinforce what he's lecturing about and it works. Tests are multiple choice with a free write section you need a Green Book for. If you come to class, do the study guide, and pay attention you'll do well.

Lots of handouts try to keep those organized because come test time just reading over those is typically enough to grasp the concepts on the tests. Go to class he gives participation points and the class is only out of 100 points so you don't want to lose out on 5 points (5%). I bought the book, but didn't really use it during the semester.

Dr. Perloff KNOWS his field of study. Great guy and a great professor. His tests and quizzes are tricky if you do not study for them. He takes attendance seriously and it is good to go to class anyways, he's funny! Gives great, critical feedback on papers and is encouraging.

Professor Perloff is incredibly passionate about politics and is very knowledgeable. However he does seem to be a little unorganized at times. He shows lots of videos to reinforce concepts. The entire course is only out of 100 points total so every single point counts.
Perloff is the best professor in the School of Communication. I recommend any class with him.

Professor Perloff is fantastic! There are three exams that are quick and painless (usually two short answeressay questions and 30ish multiple choice) He gives a clear study guide before hand and everything on the test is provided by the power points so don't buy the textbook. He's pretty funny too, often had the whole class laughing.
I've had to deal with this individual several times.  He is condescending, conceited, impatient, and can't be bothered with you if he feels you are beneath his level.

Perloff is quite the comedian, there were many times he had our class rolling on the floor. Pros: helpful, willing to meet to clarify things, gives study guide, you will always have a review day. Cons: sometimes you dont know where his rambles are going, no cell phones, he likes to go deep into topics. Overall, great class & fun to learn envrnmt.

Perloff is a great professor. He wrote his own book for goodness sakes! It's a shame that he has to step down as the Communications department after his eight year term limit is up in Spring 2011. The students at CSU will be missing out on a fantastic professor in the of Fall 2011 while he is on his semester sabbatical!

Nice guy! Sometimes can be flakey but funny at the same time. Just understand the concepts that are discussed in class and you should be fine. Don't plagerize from his book though, write it in your own words.
He is very strange and out of touch with students. Very full of himself and thinks he knows everything. Very flaky, always seems like he has too much going on.

I took Perloff for a general media class (the exact name escapes me). His classes were interested, informative and he used a variety of teaching methods. There is lecture, group work, viewing film or television, etc. Tests were easy as long as you read the materials. Also, I think he takes class participation into account so speak up!
Read the book he wrote and memorize it word for word because come test time, if you write it in your own words your screwed. Plus, he is a flake!

He's a very easy, friendly, and topical teacher.  Has a good mix of lecture, discussion and guest speakers in class too.  We used his text in class, which was extremely easy to read.  Very easy and fun!
weird and like to talk about himself
Dr. John Perrine is a great man and makes class worth coming too, even when you are having a crummy day and can't seem to find the brighter side of things in it.

In my four years of being at CSU, Dr. Perrine has been one of my greatest allies in the department. He has helped me catch myself and keep moving forward to my goal while still making sure I keep myself in check. He is a great man and professor of anything Jazz or contemporary and should not be taken lightly when he tells you to do something
Best class and best professor. All we had to do was show up and listen to him lecture. There are quizzes due every weekend online and like 3 worksheets. I would recommend this class and professor.

Had a saxophone lesson with him. He really knows what he's talking about, and enjoys it as well. Great saxophone player, and overall very good with music. I really improved on the saxophone through his lessons, and he was helpful and patient. Haven't taken a regular class with him, but he'd probably be a good professor.
No Comments
Very good professor, one of best in music dept.

This class was BAD....  all he do is talk about himself and tell corn jokes. on his midterm you will not know what to study for because he dont give a guide. You try to ask questions he will reply, "Dont worry you will do fine", DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS WITH HIM!!!!!!

Dr. Perry manages to make a very interesting and useful topic horrible by allowing students to overtake the class and talk about nonsensical opinions for hours...then proceeds to yell at the class for "talking too much" and never getting any topics covered. WAY too much reading too- about 4 chapters/class. Midterm and final are simple if you study.
Good instructor. A lot of interesting dialoging in his class. but the final exam was harder than he prepared us for.

Very passionate and knowledgeable poet herself. The poetry workshop environment was always engaging, critical, and safe. I think I wrote some of my best work in her class. Highly recommend. EDIT: Her use of language can be high and academic, so just keep that in mind. Often I had to nod my head to academic words I had no clue what it meant

Very passionate and knowledgeable poet herself. The poetry workshop environment was always engaging, critical, and safe. I think I wrote some of my best work in her class. Highly recommend. EDIT: Her use of language can be high and academic, so just keep that in mind. Often I had to nod my head to academic words I had no clue what it meant

She was very rude and yelled at us on the first day for not talking to anyone, when we didn't know anyone. She is a really tough grader. I was a freshman when i took her course and it made me want to drop out of college.. really tough.

For a 1 credit lab class it was tough. She is not so great at explaining things during class, and is a pretty tough grader. Felt kind of lost during the labs and the pre-lab quizzes were always really tricky, make sure you prepare for those! She's really nice, if your naturally good at bio she is worth taking!

Prof. Pesciotta is amazing and helps students that ask for it with their speeches. She gives feedback on what you should work on for the final presentation to pass the course. She is very flexible and helps students out when they miss class due to emergencies. I highly recommend taking her classes. I will take her again if I need more credits!
null

Professor Linda Peschiotta is an excellent educator. The best favor you can do for yourself is to print her slides and take notes - then you will know what she thinks is important, and therefore know what will be on the test. I don't think the class was easy, but if you study, attend class and participate you can do good.

She is one of the worst professors I have encountered at Cleveland State. She is very rude bordering on abrasive.  She implied that we were dumb.  She expects everything to go her way.  She constantly asks questions and if you don't know the answer she'll assign it as homework to the class.  Her lectures are long and she doesn't explain things well

Professor Pesciotta is a below average teacher. She definitely complains about cellphones and participation in class a lot. Lectures are very long and boring. Exams are 50 multiple choice, and homework is extended response, and takes points off for the small things. At least there's some extra credit.

It's simple - do the work, put in effort, easy A. Nice enough guy but never really talked to him (online class). Class given in weekly modules. For us he released all the modules at once, so if you have that and you really hustle you could complete the course in a week or two (but still, pace yourself). LOTS of reading, tedious weekly assignments.

I took this class online, most of the work was discussion boards. Everything was posted the 1st day of class, from another semester, and he didn't bother changing the dates from three years ago. He still has not graded most of my assignments yet, but still posted a C+ for my final grade. Didn't interact the whole semester.

Will take again, it was easy but interesting course. His lectures are very interesting, the readings were easy as well. Downfall is that you need more than 1 book but since they had the book to expensive on campus he gave us one of his books that he had published. Weekly journals, readings, and one easy group projects. Would take him again.

Great course. All assignments were pretty much easy to complete. Questions were also easy to find within the required text. However you will need more than one textbook for this class. Also the professor wasn't that quick to give assignment grades back in a timely fashion. As long as you read and do the weekly assignments on time youll be fine!

Dr. Pesek is by far the most successful professor I've ever had. He's very laid back but still has so much great field experience to share with students. The course is graded by journals (homework) and a final group project. He is an extremely fair grader, where everyone got 100% on the group project! Take this professor!

If you are looking to get an easy A and not learn anything, he is your guy.  I know quite a bit about his life and his world trips and his extra-curricular stuff, because frankly that is all he talks about, HIMSELF.  I can see why other students like him, there is no content in his lectures.

I took Dr. Pesek for HSC 488, and I must continue to echo the same sentiment. He is one of the best professors at Cleveland State. He is a repository of valuable information, and preaches the importance of using knowledge ethically. Dr. Pesek is truly vested in seeing his students learn and succeed so they can move on to the next level!

Dr. Pesek is one of the easiest professors at Cleveland State University. For Environmental Science, you read the assigned chapters, post answers that are 3 sentences long to journal questions, and do a research project for graduate students. As long as you complete the assignments in a timely manner, you will pass with an A. Highly recommend!

Good. Easy A if you come to class and do the assignments, reading, and end of semester presentation. Talks a lot about healthy eating habits and has inspired me to try new and healthier foods and make better food choices. He has a lot of world traveling experience which he shares with the class which is cool too. He has some funny stories! Take him
Very easy class, just do the journals and end of semester presentation!
Great teacher, explaines difficult concepts easy, I would HIGHLY recomend taking his class!!!!!!
great
Great professor. Really fun and down to earth.

He is a great and enthusiastic professor.  He explains concepts clearly and cares about how well his students understand the material. He brings the subject to life and is an inspiring person.  We desperately need more teachers like him.
Good GPA booster class. Just come to class and do the journal assignments and you will get an A. Tends to talk much about the enviroment.

very easy tests,his lectures are very intresting for those that are interestedin hematology or health sciences and want to learn the most important stuff that you'll remember 20 years fom now i recomend take his class
AMAZING teacher

Very funny professor; you won't fall asleep during his class. Gives lectures and does not use textbook. You need to take down everything he writes on the blackboard. 3 exams; all require you to actually understand the content, instead of simply remembering the wording.

Just take notes, he doesn't use technology, unless needed, or textbooks. He is very cool with the students and will accomodate all requests. Get ready to write or type. He takes few straightforward tests. Attendance not mandatory.
Best teacher in the masters program. I love that you can get a good grade while still learning a lot. Not stressful. He's funny as hell. class passes by quickly

He writes everything you need to know for the test on the board, all you have to do is go over your notes and you'll get an A.. No book needed for his in-person class. Definitely recommend taking him, he makes the class fun.

Fun Teacher and makes the material very easy. You will not need a book because he only cover things that are gong to be on the exams. He writes on the board every thing that you know. Everybody can walk away with a A+ and learn a lot. Class is not boring which makes it easier to get the grade you want. Come to class for notes

Best professor i've ever taken! Wish there were more professors who were as emphatic as he is.  Class doesn't feel like "class." Discussion is obligatory, although that might seem daunting, it really isn't with the way discussions pan out.
Pesta made the material palatable and easy to understand.  He was also hilarious and easy going.  I enjoyed this class most and got the most out of it.

As the sun sets and you realize that it's 6pm and dark outside, this professor makes you forget about your bad day. With his sarcasm and his smart remarks and his way of teaching makes the students forget about their selfish over and makes you as a student focused on the learning material. I wish he offer d teaching more classes. Best professor yet

Bryan Pesta is the slightly sarcastic and extremely honest ray of sunshine that students need! His feelings about the subject matter are transparent, but don't let that fool you; he is able to make even what he calls "the boring stuff" interesting. He's flexible with students and welcomes in class participation. His is the class I'd hat to miss.

He told us to get on here and give him the 'chili pepper' haha! Really funny and down to earth guy! He really tries to make class interesting and usually succeeds! I really feel like i'm learning this material and it will stick with me throughout my career when I graduate. His teaching methods are more 'old school' but they work! Great Professor!!
Told us to get on here and give him the "hot chili pepper". Best professor ever. Really has knowledge about what he teaches. Just a quiz and exams. Don't need to buy book. Attendance is not required.

I took this as a summer class which is never fun, but Bryan was an excellent professor.  No book needed.  Show up to class, pay attention and take notes.  Seems like all classes should be like that!  Made the class funny and interesting and everything I learned will stick with me.

I love Bryan, I always look forward to his lecture. He's funny and knowledgable and I have never been absent to his class. I like him a lot, he has a great great great sense of humor. He makes the lecture so fun you won't feel time passing. His questions arebl only from the lecture notes and what he writes on the board. Clear and direct questions.

I took this course in summer 15. It was pretty straight forward and easy. The professor writes every sentence on the board and expects us to take notes. Exam questions are from his notes. MGT 601 is not a tough subject and is a very good course to take online since the contribution from the professor is very minimal. I would rate him average.
great professor..

He's funny and cool. Make sure to write down everything he writes on the chalkboard. You will be tested on it. His test will also have questions on things that he won't write down, but will say in an off-topic conversation. I.E., he will explain an example,  but won't write down that example down and it will pop up on a test. His test are tricky.

Class consists of quiz worth 10% of your grade and three tests worth 30% of your grade. Take him if you are a good test taker.  If not, this will be hard work.  Literally write down every word he says and memorize it.  Anything he says, you may be tested on. If you really want an A, talk to him in private.  He gives a little grade boost at the end.

One of the best professors I have ever had. Has an old school teaching style (just chalk and chalk board no slides or use of Blackboard) and teaches from the top of his head. You will not need the book if you attend class but I don't know why you wouldn't attend. I just wish he taught more than one class. Would definitely take again!
The best prof in the program. Direct, to the point, with great examples for use and application. I wish they would all take a page out of his book.

He is awesome. Don't need the book. lectures are funny and straight to the point. Loved this class. Wish he taught other management courses. I got a "B" only because I would show up 25 mins late every week trying to find parking. Advice: be on time and take notes.

I've taken classes with this professor 3 times now, each time receiving in A in all classes. Professor Peters gives lots of assignments, thats no doubt and all assignments are due in 2 week periods which is a good amount of time to finish them. This class was interesting and I enjoyed it. Follow guidelines, do the work, and you'll get a good grade.

If you signed up for a class taught by her, drop it while you can. Multiple assignments due every single Friday. I don't mean short quizzes, I mean sometimes two lengthy essays due each week. So much homework. The textbook was confusing, her assignments were confusing, and she took a point off my paper for PUTTING my name on it..? Not a fan.

She gave me a D on a paper because I put it in 4 paragraphs instead of 3. Her guidelines were not very clear and stated that the paper could be in 3 paragraphs or sections. I had 4 paragraphs but divided it in 3 sections. She herself told me that the paper is well-written. I asked by email if that was the only problem. Never got an answer back.

Ridiculous work load for a sports nutrition class. Expect weekly quizzes, writing assignments, discussion posts, and papers. Tough grader, will mark discussion posts as late if not done before middle of the week. All hw due Friday nights. Avoid at all costs, definitely not worth the time and effort. Relies on textbook. Very disappointing course.

The hardest teacher I have ever had. Courses are ran as if everyone is 19 years old & has no job. or other classes. Do not take if youre a student trying to run a household, work 40 hrs a week, and go to school. I took a stress mgmt class with her,one of the most stressful classes I have ever took. I accidentally got her again. Workload is insane.

I have taken many online classes and have NEVER experienced one like this. I happened to take two classes for this professor online during Spring Semester. Talk about drowning in hw. Between the two online 6wk classes, I had 4 video review reflection papers to read, 2 elaborate discussion boards, 4 assignments, and 8 chapters to read.

The book is a good read and very educational and the papers are easy to write up but the quizzes can include questions about previous chapters. This online class is very time consuming and for the sheer amount of content, 4 chapters in 2 week sections is barely sufficient when you are taking a lot of other classes... it ends up being stressful.

I took the Stress class online, and I loved the module set up in 2 week sections. Gave me a lot of time to really get the material down. Not a fast grader or fast feedback giver, but if I had to take it again, I would take her again hands down!
Delayed grading and tough grader with no feedback or commentary for improving grades. Do not get previous assignments back prior to the next assignment due date.
Professor Cheryl Peters does not get  back to students in a timely fashion and is a very tough grader.

Assignments are due on Fridays at 11, DBs are due on Wednesday's. She gives clear outline of due dates and assignments at beginning of class. Some weeks, only 1 assignment. Other weeks, 3 or 4 assignments. One bigger project. Medium course load for 200-level class. Thorough professor, would suggest for this class! Occasionally referenced book.

For a 200 level online course, professor Peters gives WAY too much homework. I found myself spending more time on this class than some of my more relevant 300-400 level courses. If you aren't a relevant major, I would NOT take this course. Very time consuming, though educational.

Had her in a required course after she transferred to LSU. By far, hands down my least-inspiring professor in all of college. The course was didactic and did not encourage any student learning. Her lectures were disorganized, focused on pointless things. The class discussions were an absolute waste of time. She does not belong in teaching. AVOID!!!

The class is not hard it just requires ALOT  of work. We had 3 assignments due every other week which included a paper and peer reviews. It was overwhelming. Also, two group assignments. If you do all the work you'll get an A no matter the quality but it's a lot of work to do. I've heard that other capstone courses were easier.

Discussions on current events were the best part and then I would get bored and sleepy after that. Nice professor and helpful for clarification. I enjoyed the individual project as a opposed to a 50 pg paper that other profs. make you do for this class. The class was pretty easy overall, this is the capstone so students should expect work.

Nightmare. Gives out work equivalent to a full time job. Makes the class assignments way to complicated.. Procrastinate graduating a semester if you can't schedule this one with another teacher. You'll thank me later. Scrutinizes u in front of the class while giving a presentation and during class discussions

Most of the lectures were spent on discussion with class. Need book to prepare for tests. Final group presentation is the most important project that influences grade. Class participation is encouraged. Easy homework assignements. In general, wasn't very hard class. Not very demanding.

She is never on track, always waste so much time talking about stupid things, give very demanding projects (as if you have ntg else to do in life except MLR), won't learn antg from what she says,most annoying class ever

very immature and assigns completely useless and irrelevant projects.  Childish is a good word. She reads the powerpoints and then calls on you to ask you what you think about it because she doesn't know how to teach.and if you ask her questions back she usually can't answer them right. Very defensive if you critique her or challenge her in any way

Ugh. What an awful class. Boring waste of time. 75 minutes of nothing. Read PPT slides, ask questions, gives a quiz once a week. University required class to meet writing requirements. Obnoxiously long video project in the middle of the semester. Dirty looks if you're leaving the class...attendance not mandatory. Avoid this prof / class if possible
Teacher is childish. I hope she gets the help she needs.

This was a nightmare!!! Do not take this class unless you have plenty of time, patience and ready to do tons of work and learn nothing!speaking of professional appearance..let me not even go there, would be too mean...

Words cannot describe how completely useless this professor is. I'd run out of characters long before I could complete such a task. She piles on endless amounts of pointless juvenile busy work with arbitrarily assigned point values. She can't do class without her PowerPoints. Her PowerPoint malfunctioned one day and she could not do class.   AVOID!

Absolutely worst professor I have ever had.  She knows nothing of real world business, is unorganized, throws useless assignments not on the syllabus at you, gets mean and offended if you do not agree with her, grading scale is unfair and makes no sense!  She will bring down the reputation of CSU's business school! Stay away! You will gain nothing

Dr. Peterson's PhD obviously did not qualify her for teaching. Her assignments were useless, and she was even worse with helping students and answering our questions. Very defensive and mean when something does not go her way.

Luckily, Dr Peterson uses the textbook for everything. So if you don't understand the lecture, you can look up the information in the book. He also creates his exams and slideshows off of the book. He is not the greatest lecturer. He is very monotone. Luckily, if anyone sends him a question, he'll respond to everyone with the answer

Dr Peterson is a great Professor. He is clear on the material and genuinely wants his students to be successful. He has a review before the exams and is willing to hold study sessions when possible. I struggled in cell bio but Peterson really helped. Difficulty is due to course not professor.

Dr. Peterson is a great professor overall. Lectures can get a little bit fast but that should be expected in the higher level courses. Amazing guy and has a lot of knowledge about the topic he's teaching. If you talk to him he will make sure you understand.

If you have to take biology do not take this professor.He is not helpful outside of class and kinda has an attitude.He has a powerpoint lecture every class and 3 exams and a comprehensive final.His lectures are hard to pay attention to and no study guides.It would be better if there was more work than just tests.

Mr. Peterson is by far the most understanding and caring professor I've had. He wants you to succeed in the classroom and in life. He always engaged the class in thoughtful conversation and always asked for our opinions about assignments. He's a lenient grader but only if you show you're doing your best. He's the best!
Self Absorbed, Doesnt care about his students , overall rude

Mr. Peterson is by far the most understanding and caring professor I've had. He wants you to succeed in the classroom and in life. He always engaged the class in thoughtful conversation and always asked for our opinions about assignments. He's a lenient grader but only if you show you're doing your best. He's the best!
Great guy. Funny guy.

Mr. Peterson is the nicest person ever. He understands that we all go through things and is willing to work around it to help you. He has a lot of life experience that he shares with us and is real about everything. His lectures are very involved, and he can really help students form complete assignments out of pretty much any abstract thought.

Mr. Peterson's lectures weren't hardly lectures at all. He always engaged each and every student into the topic of discussion, referred to all of us as Mr, Mrs, or Ms (that's the only time I've noticed a professor do that), and he even asked our opinions on how grammar works, how a paper should be written, etc. Get his class if you are able.

Mr. Peterson is a great prof. He is very helpful and knows what he is talking about. He is not afraid to tell you what he really thinks, and that's what is great about him. He keeps class interesting and wants all of his students to pass.

Mr. Peterson is an awesome teacher. He understand that people have jobs while going to school and can sometimes work around that. He is also very funny and will make sure you know how to write at a college level before leaving his class.

I took Richard's saturday morning class. He did his best to make the 3 hours interesting and cut out a lot of unnecessary things that teachers normally do. Because he also works in the business world, he was much more practical about research writing than other professors would be. Getting a good takes some effort, but it's definitely not hard.
No Comments
He is a great prof. He actually cares about his students and whether or not they learn something. If you are taking an English course seek this guy out. I know I am going to.

He is the best! very liberal, funny. he is OCD but its funny and he tries to not project it on the students or the work they do. he is a very nice grader but he will not give you a good grade if you didnt try your best. my fave professor so far

Dr. Pethtel is an amazing professor. She does not assign a lot of work, but every assignment is worth your grade, so if you do not complete an assignment, it may not look good. She does not have a lot of lectures, but she does embed videos in her powerpoints & has the voice over in her slides. She has live review sessions. Those help with the exam.

Dr. Pethtel is the most kind professor I have ever met! Even with the pandemic, she made helpful powerpoints and zoom meetings to prepare for exams. This is already my second class with her and I definitely plan on signing up for more of hers in the future. Take her if you want someone who loves psychology and shows it in their teaching.
One of the better professors I have ever had. Grades by the rubric and wants everyone to pass. Just submit work by the deadline and your golden

Dr. Pethtel is an amazing professor. She does not assign a lot of work, but every assignment is worth your grade, so if you do not complete an assignment, it may not look good. She does not have a lot of lectures, but she does embed videos in her powerpoints & has the voice over in her slides. She has live review sessions. Those help with the exam.
The hardest part about this course is remembering you are enrolled in it. The entire course has about 4 assignments and 3 or 4 multiple-choice quizzes. Highly recommend taking this course.

Professor Pethtel is by far the best teacher I've had. If you just pay attention during lectures and do the homework it's very easy. She also makes her study guides based on the exam which makes it so much easier to study. I've taken 3 of her classes, she's amazing.

Dr. P is probably one if the coolest profs ever. So understanding and caring. If you attend her lectures, do the reviews that SHE makes and goes over topics that will SPECIFICALLY be on the exam, you will do well in her class. Attendance is mandatory, but that is considered extra credit. I would for sure take another class with her again. A queen.

Dr. Pethtel is awesome and was an amazing professor for Child Development! Her lectures are interesting and she has activities during class to give you easy points. Her study guides are based directly off of the tests. Apply yourself and an A is easily reachable.

He rarely went over any of the problems and tests were fair but not easy outside of the last one which was M.C. and T/F. Others were MC, T/F, and fill in the blanks. There are three tests, a project (if you are a grad student) and participation points/ attendance. This course is 16 chapters and there is a lot of info to remember for test, g.l.

Whatever you do don't take this class online the weekly quizzes are difficult and you have a 10 page paper due the first week. His weekly assignments are confusing to understand and when you email him asking for clarification he doesn't do it very well. He also just does assignments no lectures nothing so be ready to teach yourself because he won't

Dr. Gary Pettey has been one of the most unorganized, unclear, and overall most unprofessional professors I have ever had over the course of my entire academic career. His schedules are riddled with major errors, he argues with the class on unclear due dates, and included in the course material a concept that does not exist. He should not be a prof

One of my favorite professors at CSU. An overall enjoyable class although most of your grade is based on your group project. He is really nice and very knowledgeable. He is understanding if you have hiccups in personal life and wants you to do well in future endeavors.

I really enjoyed his class. He really challenges his students and wants them to think for themselves. He is extremely vague in his answers and is never specific if you have concerns or questions about your projects because he doesn't want you to excel in the class for a grade, he wants you to excel in the class for life.

I'm really glad I got to take his class. He can often be vague about assignments and sometimes you're not sure what exactly he wants from you, but at the end of the day he is incredibly knowledgeable and experienced and it shows in each class that he teaches. I appreciated the thoughtful feedback he gave on the projects.
He's a really PETTEY professor. Gave unrealistic amount of work in a 6 week semester, including a GROUP PROJECT in an ONLINE COURSE! Absolutely, positively don't take him, online or in-person.

He was the worst teacher I have ever had. His online 6 week class was so ridiculous I can't even believe it. We had to watch 7, hour long movies and write 3-4 page papers on them, take 10 written out tests, do a book report and a group project. For an online class! Gave no direction and gave zero help. DON'T TAKE HIS ONLINE CLASS!!

Glad to have had his class. He sincerely wants you to understand the material and succeed. Pettey really knows his field and has valuable knowledge to pass along to students who are willing to learn. I enjoyed the projects we worked on and the final project was great. He gives great advice and makes himself available for whatever you need.

Multivariate statistics was one the most practically useful courses I took during my masters program. Not only does Dr. Pettey make it interesting, he makes it understandable, and takes questions from anyone who is confused, spending the time to make sure everyone understands. Tough, but fair and very accommodating.

Best class ever. No, really. Theory Building is a world-changer. The instructor uses novels like "The Double Helix" and "Nature Vs. Nurture the Agile Gene," to take you on a journey through the history of scientific theory. My favorite class of all time. Not easy, but nothing worthwhile ever is.
Likes to hear himself talk. Theory is his area of expertise. He should stick to it.
He was pretty tough, but seems to care a lot about us getting jobs.
Very unhelpful!!!
No Comments

Bit difficult to understand, Explains mathematical concepts pretty well. Tests are pretty difficult and the average curve was about 8 points/test(4 tests). The Connect homework really does help a lot and he made it worth 25% of the grade. Reading the book did help.
Nice professor. I can only get B in this class but I do appreciate his teaching. He requires a lot of attention and hard-work.

Professor Pham is a great teacher. He is clear as to the material you need to know for the test & goes over the types of prblms in class. I actually really like his response and appreciate his taking time to explain the questions. Homework is worth a large percentage of the grade and attendance is not mandatory. However, class refused to ask questions because anyone who did was treated in a very nasty manner. Bit difficult to understand, I recommend sitting closer to the front. Explains mathematical concepts pretty well. Tests are pretty difficult and the average curve was about 8 points/test(4 tests). The worst instructor I have had at CSU. He is difficult to understand and insulting. I highly recommend not taking this person as an instructor.

he is difficult to understand and the material is already difficult. he would curve test grades which is the only reason anybody passed. there were 30 point curves on about every test and there were still people who failed.

CNS650 is one of the most important courses in the Counseling program and I learned NOTHING from her. When a student would ask a question she would ask the class if they have an answer. Worst professor I have ever had. She fails to teach the material and expects her students to learn everything perfectly before teaching it herself. Gives excessive amounts of assignments/papers/reading. Her midterm exam was 14 pages long and most people didn't finish! Does not belong in front of a classroom.
Horrible professor. Have yet to hear anything positive about her. Wish I had taken course when I had the opportunity with another professor.

Dr. Bey rocks. During class you do a lot of group assignments (nothing too extreme) and with those groups you take a test. She's really chill and really cares about what she teaches you. She's also super nice and helpful.

Loved her! By far my favorite math instructor. As long as you show up and do your work theres no way you wont get an A. Group test, open notes. She always makes sure everyone is on track. I wish I could take her every semester!

loved prof bey! such a cool math teacher and very easy going person. always took the time to make sure everyone was on the right track & group tests! homework will help your grade boost up a lot! can't wait to take her again this summer!

Love having her as a professor! She teaches everything so you understand it and can use it later on to teach children. Super excited that she's going to be my professor for the next 2 math classes I have to take as well!!

She is so nice and funny, and will always go over the problems and explain them in different ways until you understand. All of our tests were open-note. You do have to attend class though, because she frequently assigns in-class group work that is worth a lot of points and cannot be made up.

Dr. Phillips-Bey is one of my favorite reasons for school. She was not only helpful and clear, but she was patient and understanding and really great to talk with. She's inspiring and most of all, she will acknowledge you in the hallways, even after you're out of her class. Great woman and great professor.

Loved this teacher! Hated the class but that is because I'm into more involved math rather than words that are used with statistics. She was really easy and helpful and actually made the class fun! I'd recommend her.
Great teacher really passionate about math.

She is such a great teacher! She makes math actually fun! She told us not to buy the book because it was so expensive, so instead she made us pay a $20.00 xerox fee which is soo much better. Lets us use our notes on most quizes, so take good notes and keep them organized neatly.
AWESOME TEACHER I AM NOT GOOD MATH AND I SHOULD BE GETTING AN A YOU DO GROUPWORK AND HER TESTS ARE EASY IF YOU PRACTICE THE PROBLESM OF COURSE

HANDS DOWN!the best math teacher i ever had! I am very bad at math and dreaded going to this class but she makes it worth it. She does not always teach in a traditional way and i love it! if you dont understand a problem she finds a different way of explaining it and doing it so you do understand! whatever class she may teach take her!!!! awesome!

I had Dr. Phillips-Bey in HS, not at CSU. Hands down the best math teacher ever. Very few math teachers know how to teach to people who don't get ath. She is patient, explains things well and really believes that everyone can understand the subject. A truly phenomenal teacher. Wish I could have taken her class at CSU. The need to hire more like her
She was a great teacher :) easy class & good understanding.
Great teacher! I never really understood stats till I took her class! We did an M&M game to learn some of the concepts, so fun. TAKE HER CLASS FOR EDUCATION MATH!!

Dr. Phillips-Bey is amazing. The class was not easy because of the subject matter, but because of the professor.  Truly cares that her students UNDERSTAND the  material.  Very approachable and realizes that this class is not easy for her students. Take her for this class if at all possible.

she is a fantastic teacher! I had her for both 127 and 128 and have taken so much away from the class. She has many ways to explain things and makes the class very interactive and enjoyable! Plenty of group work and hands on activities. Just do your homework and you'll be fine!

Awesome professor!Tests were all open note, and most of the class time was spent going over homework or doing group work. Highly recommended teacher, if you're looking to learn something, and have fun doing it!

very good professor, she always had something different for us to do which was nice compared to the usual boring lectures. she helps you if u dont understand something. also she always let us out early which was a big PLUS!!

Lectures are fun, no burying yourself in books and dates. Extremely friendly and laid back but expects you to put forth effort. Lectures and discussions never seem like work. Respect this dude, don't take him for granted.

Professor Phillips is a great teacher. Most of the work is done via a online textbook where you read sections then take quizzes after. They are fairly easy. His midterm isn't hard if you study. Good stuff. Only bad ting I can say is he likes the Steelers

Best professor here! I make a point to take all of his classes. You definitely need to work hard, but it's really interesting and not busy work. He literally still held class (online) while he was recovering in the hospital for a medical issue (not COVID-19 tho), which is literally so impressive. Only take his courses if you're a bottom for homework or in-depth studying. If studying or reading stuff for a requirement is your sort of thing, by all means take his courses. He literally still held class (online) while he was recovering in the hospital for a medical issue (not COVID-19 tho), which is literally so impressive. In this class, we essentially had AT LEAST one assignment a week that would require 2-3+ hours of research BEFORE you even begin the assignment. I had to write more in this class then I did in any of my upper-level JOURNALISM classes. It's honestly an absurd amount of work for a lower level GenEd. This class RUINED my semester.

For a gen ed class, this course was very difficult. I did more work in this class than I did in my major classes. He doesn't allow any late work w/out documentation as to why its late and his expectations are way too high.
Not a fan. I never want to have him as a professor again. So much work for an online class, a lot of busy work.

Worst professor I ever had. Im an engineering major and this was the hardest class I took this past semester. He told me since I come from a white background I wouldnt be able to comprehend the material. Points taken off for the simplest things. I have taken many science, math, engineering, writing, and history courses and passed with an A. This class is the worst class I have taken in my entire college career. The professor is the worst! This was by far the worst class paired with the worst professor I have ever experienced. This class was taken as a requirement for African American studies. Pickett makes everything in this class more complicated than necessary. He is the hardest grader and distributes homework every single class day. Classwork every day is also required.

Oof. This class was... something. He's a nice guy, but takes the class way too seriously for a gen ed. I feel like this class was more work than my 400 level classes. He's kind of intimidating too. This class is an insane amount of work that consists of content from 1998 and years prior Most of the assignments consist of comparing a documentary from 1980 to a book written in 1900 with tons of researchHe also loves to use whatever he had published 20 years ago and how he can try to make it relevant to the course. Do not take or you will be sad

Professor Pickett is a very organized, professional, creative, and funny professor who enjoys changing things up and making sure everyone understands the material properly. Expects an insane amount of work out of students for an elective course. While the subject matter is fascinating, it's delivered in such a dry way that it removes any chance for enthusiasm. I found myself quickly overwhelmed and had to make sacrifices in my major classes in order to finish the mountains of reading and research required.

Absolutely insane amounts of work for what is an elective course. Constant work will keep students on their toes with reading, discussions, and research. Instructions are not clear and final assignments are incredibly tedious and off the wall. Avoid this professor at all costs.

As others have stated, the professor gives a large amount of work for a class that shouldn't necessarily be the focal point of each student's semester. Plenty of busy work to do that will come back to bite you in the long run. Directions are not clear on projects and the overall effort to maintain a solid grade in the class is frankly not worth it.

This was a terrible class. I had to withdraw from it because of the amount of reading and assignments. This was an online class and the way he set it up is difficult to follow. The books he chose for this class are hard to follow and understand. Overall, it was a terrible experience.

I was scheduled to take this class this semester (SP 2016), but I dropped it because he had SO many assignments written up on the syllabus and this was just too much. He expects us to research even for just discussion points and do a powerpoint presentation. (This is ONLINE). I dropped it to avoid the stress. Don't take it. If you sign up, DROP IT

The method of teaching he used made it hard to understand the material. There was no book, and during the last few weeks of the semester, he failed to post adequate information on blackboard to reinforce what was learned in class. The class was not very structured.  I do better in my 300/400 level courses. Take a different teacher if you can.

The amount of work is beyond necessary for this class. A lot of busy work than work that will benefit you. Expect tests every other week around 40 questions long and most of them being free response. You will need a doctor's note or some form of proof every time you are absent or submit late work. Take a different class because this is pointless.

She is a very difficult professor. She grades very hard.  She is very particular with what she wants from students. She had no in-person office hours. I highly recommend you avoid her. I am a straight A student and I struggled to get a B.

The textbook is a must. I took the class online and it was easy to keep up because the schedule was steady but as far as her grading, she grades very tough. if you are a REALLY good writer I would recommend this class, if not I would say seek another professor if available.

I have learned a lot from this course. Prof. Piriyakul is very kind and knowledgeable. Her lecture, homework, and exam are pretty heavy; however, I know she is trying to make us learn as much as possible, not to fail us. The YouTube videos that she made are very helpful too. I definitely recommend her for anyone planning to take this course.

Prof. Piriyakul is an excellent professor. She is one of the most caring teachers I have been in touch with at CSU. She always makes sure that everyone is on track. She even took extra time to make a series of tutoring videos and posted them on YouTube for us to learn and practice on the problem sets she made for us.

Online homework, Learnsmart flashcards, 4 exams, a note card provided for exam help, difficult to learn so much material at one time, kind of feel like finance is being shoved down my throat with such a fast pace, I can honestly say I would never take her again and I don't remember much with all the info. Good class if you want to learn bonds.
Tests were difficult. Possibly give a minor quiz before the test so the student knows what to expect.
Great teacher, makes you work for your grade. Cares about topic matter and students. Wish I could take the class again.

Mew is down to earth and very passionate about teaching.  She is a hard working instructor who goes beyond what is expected of her to help students to understand and pass this class.  I did not consider  finance as a major at all before taking this class, but Mew definitely changed my percenption on the subject.

Finance is tough but she taught very well. Even though I didn't get an A, still one of the best professors I have ever had. She was always available for help and always showed a genuine interest in teaching us. CSU is lucky to have her and I'm sure everyone in our summer class felt the same. I've heard horror stories about other Finance professors.

If you want an "A" in intro to finance, Mew is your best bet.  Very nice, very helpful, but let the students run the class.  Summer '13 was her first semester teaching so I think she was trying to find her footing.  Allows cheat sheets on exams and quizzes.  If you are a decent student you don't need to bother with the book, the PP's are enough.

AMAZING professor. One of the best at CSU. She truly wanted her students to succeed. Very flexible and bent over backwards to help students. Was available at all hours to answer questions. Gave students every possible chance to do well. Tough as a 6-week class, but I learned a TON and actually enjoyed class.

One of the best professors at CSU.  She is always available either at her office, via email or after class and she will stay as long as it is needed until you understand the material.  She also walks around the class while the students are working on problems to see if any one is struggling.  She takes a real interest in students. Loved her!

This is a very difficult class but Mew is an amazing professor. She is always willing to assist students, and emails are replied to promptly. She is willing to take suggestions, and feedback from students. This course would've been hell had I taken another professor.

Dr. Pittman is new to CSU (Fall 2013) but is an amazing professor. She is very approachable and helpful. The HW is online and is about 60 Qsweek. The exams are reasonable and sometimes she'll put a small curve on them. Recommend going to class because the exams are based off of lecture notes. I heavily used the textbook but other people didn't.
One of my favorite professors. She will do/go over anything to help you as long as you ask. Although the material is hard, it is fair.

Very good professor and new at Cleveland State. She really knows what she is doing and isnt the kind of professor that will make you feel stupid. She will take the time out of class to really explain things thoroughly and is always available for office hours. The book is very helpful but is not needed.

New professor to CSU. She is great! She made a broke down a difficult subject into simple terms. Very approachable. Attendance is  not required but recommended bc her exams are over her notes. Text book is not required but rather for supplemental. Will provide study guides if you ask! Curves at times. Overall great professor and good course.

Pla is such an awesome teacher, she is hilarious and her accent is HOTT!!!

He is one of the best teachers at CSU. He was very engaged with the class. It would be great to have more teachers follow his style of teaching!

If you take one of Dr. Plax's classes, you are in for a treat! Dr. Plax is one of those few people who combines an amazing understanding of politics with endless charm that grab your attention from beginning to end.  TAKE THIS CLASS!!!!!
Very wise and insightful man with an awesome sense of humor.

Experienced and helpful, Dr. Plax encourages thought and cares about his students

Excellent professor!  Expect to work hard and learn a lot.
She is Great and loving would take her class again just for fun

Amazing teacher. Gives tons of extra credit and is really inspirational. If you ask her to help you or ask questions, she genuinely tries to help. Those whom don't benefit from her teaching are plain lazy and didn't study enough.
Don't even do it.. God awful, i don't understand how she's teaching at CSU.. worst class i have ever taken by far.

Pleasant was easily the worst teacher i have ever had, she's extremely rude, teaching skills are horrific, not to mention her lessons rarely correlate with what is going to be on the actual exam. Makes study guides and then proceeds to put everything on the test that wasn't on the study guide insisting that we should have studied everything, BS

Professor Pleasant is THE BEST professor. Very knowledgeable and passionate at what she instructs. She's willing to go the extra mile for those that WANT to learn. Professor Pleasant is a sweet, caring and ALL out AMAZING WONDERFUL person! If, whomever is reading this, needs or wants to take Biology, DO SO with Professor Chaucola Pleasant!

This teacher is great, her classes are exactly the powerpoint, but she adds good details to add to your printing out powerpoint. She will help you any way she can. Answer questions(Extra Credit Given), lots of extra credit quizzes. As long you're respectful, and try hard she'll be cool with you. the person above me is probably butthurt...lol XD

Terrible teacher, she loses assignments and makes you redo them within the day, she does not teach her notes, she makes you read them and 90% of the time none of the notes you take are on the exams, she makes study guides for exams  and then puts absolutely nothing from the study guide on them to screw you over.. one of the worst teachers i've  had

I am not happy that Spring 2010 is her last time teaching at CSU. She is a dork (just like me) and that is just awesome. She loves stickers and their a motivation to pass her class. I've learned so much from her and I hope CSU will negotiate her contract.
This professor is very kind, but takes things so slowly that it's almost painful.  She is very methodical and explains grammar very well; however, if you get it on the first day you're in trouble!
Professoressa Plesca is an extremely easy professor to learn from! Doesn't take a large interest in her students, but definitely gives you every opportunity to get an A+!
Easy A! Very lenient in grading and attendance policy.

Plesca was great. I've taken other language classes before, but she breaks down the material, and helps w/ memorization. I highly recommend her. I sadly can't take her next semester (morning class). Best language professor at CSU!
Pretty generous with grading. Makes learning another language fun which is probably hard to do. So hot

Professoressa Plesca is a very helpful and kind professor who is lenient with her grading and difficulty of tests. She is more of a "gradeschool" type teacher which is helpful with a foreign language like Italian or Spanish. Doesn't really connect with students, though.

Professoressa Plesca is a very helpful and kind professor who is lenient with her grading and difficulty of tests. She is more of a "gradeschool" type teacher which is helpful with a foreign language like Italian or Spanish. Doesn't really connect with students, though.
Very enthused and knowledgeable

She is awesome!  So thorough and sweet and nice!  She knows what she is doing, and makes it really pleasant to be in the class and learn!  She uses great techniques to help you remember the hard stuff!  e! aste o! amos asteis aron!
Prof. Plesca is so thorough and she makes the class interesting and fun.  She explains it so the entire class can understand it.

she is absolutely wonderful... she doesn't punish little things like spelling or wrong ending too much because she understands that that happens when learning a new language, every teacher should care like she does.
Go to class and you should do well. She is a full time professor and the other people who teach this are TA's who barely speak english.

This professor is currently teaching at Old Dominion University (in Norfolk, VA) as an adjunct... So far, she is one of the most unorganized teachers I have ever met.  Her syllabus does not match the things she puts out in class (which is borrowed from another professor, by the way). I HOPE it gets better! Currently a C- at best.
one to THE BEST profs ever. She really cares about her students, is interesting etc.
Works full time in a manufacturing business and has lots of real world marketing experience. Exams are half multiple choice and half essay.  One 10 page paper due at end of semester.

Mr. Pohley is a very dynamic teacher. He loves marketing, is well versed in the text and case studies and is able to explain the information well through examples he uses in his lectures. Tests are challenging so study hard, but he does note test worthy topics. I would take a class with Mr. Pohley again!

The class is not interesting. Although Polhy tries hard by handing out recent articles and reading them out. Write down everything he writes on the board. Lecture is redundant and full of BS. Easy class and Easy A

If you need to take a Marketing class, make sure it has Doug Pohley as the instructor. I could never imagine knowing how much thought goes into marketing a product prior to taking this class. He truly is a great guy who cares and lectures extremely well.
This guy knows business, starting from the bottom of a company moving up to CEO.  Very friendly and smart, possibly one of my best teachers ever and he didnt even pass me
I learned a lot from him. He teaches real life marketing. His tests are easy if you take good notes. He is extremely friendly and helpful.

It's basic logic. Not much else to say there. If you can reason, can figure out how to break arguments into their components, and do the assigned homework this is an easy class. A bit like math, really. Practice and you shall succeed.
One of the best professors I have ever had, and I have three degrees.

He's hard to understand, and just tends to ramble on. It's impossible to get an A on a paper for him, unless you've got a hard understanding of the topics. I thought it was an intro class, but felt like I was getting critiqued on every little thing and graded harshly.  Even though he 'lectures' he is very little help in understanding the material.

I am taking professor pole's deductive logic class and nobody knows whats going on. He's just very confusing. He's definitely a very nice guy though. Has a great sense of humor. And he has a wizard's beard. But don't take this class unless you want to be a logician. It's extremely challenging.
Very interesting professor. Although a philosopher, taught engineering students a lot about working in their field. Highly recommended.

i was having a tough time personally (crazy family stuff) at the beginning of the semester and my ADVISOR told me to drop this class, saying Pole was the least understanding man on the planet and that his class would kill me. That is a direct quote.

Tough professor for beginner philosphers. You will have to understand all of the ancient philosophers' arguments well and their stances on various issues. A background in philosophy particularly in basic logic and reasoning would be helpful.
he said religion was a "myth" how can RELIGION be a myth?  That's such a controversial topic!
Wow... He is an extremely difficult professor.  It's a freshman/sophomore level course, and he teaches it like you're going for your PHD!!!!!!!
Grr...hardest class on the planet. Hard to understand, tough grader
Absolutely god-awful. The only reason he's still teaching is probably tenure. Any man who claims that the Apostle Paul was NOT a Jew and knew NOTHING anout Judaism should not be allowed to educate...

Enjoyed failing students. Once told of a student who took the class on a pass/fail basis which requires doing C work. The student only managed D level and Pole failed him. Okay, that was in accordance with the rules, but he enjoyed telling the story, and obviously found it amusing.
One of the best professors at CSU.  Dr. Pole is very entertaining, is a very fair grader, and thoroughly covers topics, making sure everybody has an idea how to handle assignments.

Polomsky is a legend. Pretty sure he's retiring soon, but he's my favorite professor ever. Go to class; just reading his handouts isn't enough. This class is NOT that hard if you listen in the lectures and do a little bit of work. I put in a moderate amount of effort and got an A. He's a really nice guy, and a great professor. I recommend.

This is an online MBA class in business stats. Dr. P's video lectures are phenomenal, as are the handouts that go along with them!!! For each exam he gives us sets of actual questions from past exams so that we can simulate what our exams will be like. Not a big fan of taking stats online, but Dr. P. does a great job and I'm learning a ton!

Because of the COVID, all classes are online. Polomsky does a great job with his video lectures. There is a lot of homework and the exam dates and times are rigid, but the class really is not that difficult. It's hard finding the motivation to study on your own when you're not used to online classes.
The worst ever do not take him. His rating is deceiving, his lectures are useless videos. His review exams are graded. Do not take him, I repeat do not take him he has no idea what he is doing
Tests are wicked hard, but he gave us practice tests that were his actual past exams so that we knew what to expect. Never uses the same test twice, so Chegg is useless during his exams.

Tough for an online class, but if I'm being honest, Cleveland State was on a Pass/Fail system due to the COVID-19 things, so all I needed to get was a D in order to pass the course. I really didn't have to bust my butt to get the D and pass the course. Sorry, Dr. Polomsky!

There's a lot of material and only 6 weeks to do it. Polomsky does a good job with his video lectures, but I sure wish that the OSM department had some tutoring available. He is quick to respond to emails, and seems like he cares about how the class is doing.

A lot of online courses can be tough, especially if they involve math. Dr. P's video lectures are phenomenal, and he is super-quick to respond to my questions on the discussion board. It's a lot of material to cover in 6 weeks, but he does his best to help you succeed. I hope that he teaches OSM 202 before he retires!

Online classes aren't meant for every professor. I see many students say he is funny in class, but that does not translate to online courses at all. There is no teaching being done at all. It's all self learning. You do get multiple chances on homework questions but exams are not as lenient. There is no makeup work at all for any reason.

Polomsky is a legend. Pretty sure he's retiring soon, but he's my favorite professor ever. Go to class; just reading his handouts isn't enough. This class is NOT that hard if you listen in the lectures and do a little bit of work. I put in a moderate amount of effort and got an A. He's a really nice guy, and a great professor. I recommend.

I've had the opportunity to take two Stats courses under Dr. Polomsky, Stats I was online and Stats II (OSM 202) was on campus. If given the option, DEFINITELY take him in person. As difficult and as dry as the material is, he does a great job presenting. Very experienced/smart & and you can tell! He was a lot funnier in class than online. :)

A lot of material for 6 weeks summer semester. But it is possible to get it out of the way. Dr. Polomsky is very helpful, explains the material clearly and simple. He wants his students to learn and have a good grade. He is very knowledgeable and has a good personality. I would take him again.
A real good guy. I also had him for STATS 1. You have to really work for your grade, but you learn.
