Overall he's an "OK" professor. I had OSM 202 with him and it was one of the hardest classes I took at CSU. He definitley makes the class harder than it has to be which is a bummer. 3 exams are tough and worth 75% of the total grade, 10% HW/15% labs. Don't be afraid to ask for help!!

This course was difficult, but Dr. Polomsky makes his expectations clear and resources to succeed accessible. Attendance isn't mandatory but if you skip, you likely won't pass. Take full advantage of the tutors and his office hours. He has a great sense of humor, which makes class more enjoyable!
Dr. Polosmky is a great teacher. he has a dry personality, but is so funny. great one liners. he expects a lot from his students, but gives you all the tools to do well.

Polomsky is a very good professor in my opinion. He makes clear his expectations. He also gives materials for you to practice for the test. Practice the materials, understand the concept and you will be fine. OSM 202 is one of the toughest classes i have taken, so basically one needs to put in extra. Also do the homework its important.

He's the best professor I had in 8 years. I failed half a semester before coming to him and saying, "Can this be done?"  He gives you the resources to pass, it's up to you to use them. I took every course I could with him after that. He will tell you, he had no affinity for me but I wore him down!  Ask for help and you will get it, come to class!!
Great guy, super approachable, showed us how we will use business statistics in the real world. I am taking him for stats 2 this semester, and I can't say enough good things about this prof!
Open discussion never happens and teacher knows little outside of the textbook.  Teaches math not business.

Tough exams, but hey, I decided to major in operations management and I want to learn everything about forecasting that I can. It's certainly not as easy as the other OSM classes, but I'm really learning a lot with him. Great job and highly recommend.

Poluga has insane expectations for her students. she gives a lot of detailed assignments and totally disregards the fact that we have other classes in the program as well. she also has a tendency to mess up grades and when confronted about it blames everyone else but herself. take Swan if you can.
she gives little to no feedback. you'll spend more time listening to her explain her outlines and assignments than actually learning. most of my learning took place outside of class.

Dr. Poluga comes off as mean. However, she will not let you fail. Build a relationship by seeing her during office hours. It helps gets your grade up and asking questions here gives you clearer responses for assignments. She is very vague, so you need to clarify a lot on assignments in order to get points. She is caring, but doesn't let you know it
She's just dumb. Nothing more to say.

Dr. Poluga is a tough teacher, yes. However, she has a lot of experience both as a classroom teacher and school principal. She has a lot of knowledge to pass on. Tough grader and her instructions are somewhat confusing, so ASK QUESTIONS. She is caring and willing to work with your life circumstances. I had her for 2 classes and LOVE her!!

Dr. Poluga's class is draining and stressful. The workload is too much for the time allotted and she doesn't care to explain her assignments very well. The class was always confused and she's so nit picky on little things and will take off a lot of points for it. I wouldn't recommend her for any class. She is caring but a nightmare in the classroom

Dr. Poluga is very strict teacher. Expect to spend A LOT of late nights working on field work for her class. Three positive things about this class: she will let you redo your work if it is lower than a B (and usually if you redo it, she'll give you an A), she goes off on interesting tangents very easily, & attendance bumped my grade to an A.

Poluga's class is probably the toughest class I have ever taken. WAY worse than Dr. Wheatley's ECE 401 class. The assignments for this class are long and time consuming. However, I do think her grading is pretty fair and she lets you fix things if you get a grade below a B. Participation is worth 30% of your grade, so make sure not to miss class.

Super strict, but doesn't explain assignments clearly. Prepare to work as if you were working for a masters degree. Can be very difficult to deal with. I had to neglect my other classes in order to complete her assignments. I sure hope I don't have to see her again. It was torture.

She is mean and hurtful. She does not like cell phones or not paying attention in class she will take points off. Never explains assignments and they are a lot and confusing. She hasn't passed back any work as of yet. People have even dropped this class late into the semester.

Dr. Poluga is a very nice teacher, and creates good conversations in class. She is willing to help you and work with you. She also gives the option to re-submit work if you didn't like your grade. Work is super challenging but manageable (time consuming too). Gives extra points to help your grade.

She is not clear in her directions or organized. All of the required assignments for the field work take forever to do and she expects so much detail. We have not learned anything most of the semester about education. The field experience is amazing, but her class is unnecessary. I am in no way prepared to be a better teacher.

Made every assignment highly confusing. Class is pretty boring, but she's a very interesting person. She has done it all in education. Super knowledgeable and strict. Takes point off your final grade for attendance and being late. Did I say she's strict? She sure is.
Great teacher, but expects a lot. As long as you do the assigned work, and pay attention you will do fine.

One of the hardest/harshest professors to date. Comments were often blunt and hurtful. Low grades often given but opportunities to re-submit were granted for grades below B's. Be prepared to work the hardest you have ever worked. Did not hand out evaluations even tho required to do so.
She was very helpful. When I didn't know what to do, she helped me very well by explaining materials.

One of the most hopeless, useless prof. I have ever had, and I've had a lot. She acts as though she is sure about something when she isn't. She gives incorrect advice which can really mess up a student. Horrible. And boring.
Required a LOT of work but she was very nice, very enthusiastic about the subject and very eager to help. I learned a lot from this prof. Highly recommended.
She is very unorganized.  If you dont know an answer to something she will pick you anyways.  Have a ton of projects.

I would 100% not recommend this teacher for an online class. He puts in all the wrong dates and when corrected he just ignores it and continues to do so. He contradicts himself on grading and assignments all the time. When asked questions he does not answer fully only gives an excuse and does not help at all! Tests are difficult and long!

Smart & hot but he teaches like everyone is in a graduate course. Rambles on, gives wrong info. Will ask you the most random questions such as who painted this, etc - pay attn to small details! Getting an A is easy if you live and breathe brain and cognition. Exams are all fill in the blank, no multiple choice.
He's a nice guy, tests were hard, there were a lot of really specific questions.

Dr. Poreh is very energetic and has a funny sense of humor. His class and tests are hard but he is always willing to help, if you ask for help. This has been one of my favorite classes so far, I hope I do well on the final.

Super nice guy, but his English mistakes make his lectures and notes hard to follow. The tests are a mess. He includes so many questions that are only marginally related to the core information of the class. A D on a test will be curved to an A because the wording and material choices are so bad. Would not recommend if you really want to learn.

This is a memorization class. Random historical facts loosely fitting together into details that you're supposed to remember - and then apply to Psychology. It's a historical review of mistakes in Psychiatry mostly. Don't take this class if you can avoid it - serious waste of time.

Best professor in psychology at CSU. He is very passionate which makes learning much easier. He is always willing to talk and holds class review sessions before every test. It's hard material, but he gives study tips and helps you through it! Love him!

gives you study tips, All book and powerpoint. no extra credit. 4 exams and a final, but if you are content with your 4 you dont have to take the final. Good instructor to leanr from. Read the chapter b4 class to stay engaged and he'll remember you.
Awesome!  Always willing to help out.  His class made me want to attend.  Great sense of humor and always prepared for class.  Tests were tough, very specific with dates and names.

Best Prof at CSU!  Loved him.  Very interesting and obviously enthusiastic about what he does. Active in his field.  Uses a lot of interesting documentaries in lecture.  Very animated and funny. Gives a lot of information and tests are HARD!  No textbook, you got to attend lectures!
Best in the world

Reviews prev. class at start of class, gives examples and invites interaction and questions.  Very clear, good English.  Expects good note taking skills, listen carefully and take attentive notes and reference text, but no tricks, he is straightforward. Expressive and interesting professor who is active in his field.  I enjoyed the course.

Attendance is critical.  Dr. Poreh is very fair, & willing to go over the material if asked when unsure. Loved him, wish I found him sooner as I'd take more of his classes! Very engaging in class-loves what he does!

Dr. Poreh is a cool teacher and easy going. He hates when students don't show up to class. His lectures are all over the place and he makes it hard to take notes. I think it's because he wants you to listen rather than write. The tests a ridiculously hard but he grades on a curve and sometimes gives hints. On one of my tests I went from a D to an A

My favorite Prof. He does help you to relax and encourages you to read the material and follow your notes and you'll do well in his class. Must show up in his class or he'll tell you to sign up at an online college!!

Very friendly and upbeat personality, but difficult to follow because he changes gears so often; must take notes quickly and listen! Always open to any questions and offers to help students during office hours. Sometimes the entire class has no idea what he is talking about until someone stops him and asks him to explain again.
He's very patient. A lot of fun. Helps you relax in class.
great lecturer- funny and interesting. doesn't like to be bothered in his office, even during office hours, but grades as fairly as possible. material is a bit hard.
Great class for hard working students
No Comments
She is OK.

Take this course best online course ever. She is not a very hard teacher and she is very understanding. I took her in my undergrad and she is a cool teacher. Just take part in the online discussions, do all the short projects which are only two pages at the most, she always gives extra, and the finish paper is cake.  TAKE HER !!!! LOL
Wasn't that easy. Easy C as she would say.

If you are a junior or senior and want an easy A, then take this class. We meet one Saturday out of each month during the semester to help veterans with their resumes for three hours. Downside to this class is that veterans would not show, so it was a waste of a Saturday morning. If you come to all three Saturday sessions, you get an A easily.
Best teacher ever! So nice and helpful

I took this course online in spring. There are weekly discussions and 16 presentations followed by 3 exams. The course in itself is very simple and does not need an instructor. She gives a lot of extra credit and everyone gets an easy A. The only drawback was a lot of assignments & u spend more time. She curves the finals scores.

Great Professor. She gives the option of online tests which were great.  There is a group project and presentation which was relatively easy. Barely had class and when we did they always ended early. I definitely wouldn't mind having a class of hers in the near future.

If you want an easy A, take it. All the tests were put online and very easy. There were 6 homework assignments that you had to submit to blackboard and could do all of them in one hour. She gives tons of extra credit. You will get an A if you come to about every class and do well on online exams, but if you miss more than a few you might get a B.

Easy class. 3 exams which your class chooses if they want it online or in class. 6 homework assignments that you can finish in one sitting. And tons of extra credit. She gives points for attendance so come to class. Gives in class assignments sometimes which is easy.

I took her for Principles of Labor Relations and did good in it . This class talks a lot about labor unions, labor laws , arbitration and other things so the book was boring. We only used the book for group work.  3 tests that are online, no homework, a lot of extra credit and a semester long group project which was easy. Highly recommend her !!

I took Mrs. Porter for Principles of Management. When I mean to tell you guys that she is easy, she is EASY !!!! I received an A in this class. She gives points for attendance , 3 tests are all online, 6 assignments the whole semester. She gives a lot of extra credit. Very helpful.  Highly recommend if you want a good grade.

This lady is truly an idiot. It appeared as tho she was not prepared for class at all did not give lectures. Came into class and she said " uh go to this page, read this, then find someone to discuss it with, oh yeah it is worth no points" you have go to be kidding me!! It was a waste of my time, money & sanity.

Great teacher. She truly wants the students in her class to do well. Explains material very well and tells you exactly what is on her test so you know what to study. Makes class interesting even though parts of the material is covered in other MLR classes . Very easy to talk to and understands people dont have a lot of free time on their hands.
The best helpful and nice teacher.she is my favorite.Trying to take her as many time as I can every semester.
She is very nice and reasonable. Extra credit opportunities and attendance points. Easy research assignments. Tests are based on lectures and a textbook.

mlr 301 & 340. super approachable and nice. 3 exams. 6 small assignments (super easy) and lots of easy extra credit opportunities! as long as you submit the assignment, u get full points. gives u a list of material thats on the exam. attending class will get you extra points and a better grade. take all her classes!!!
Great professor. She is very knowledgable about the subject. She will help you in any way possible. Let's you know what to study on the exams!

Dr. Porter is an Amazing teacher. She doesn't read the book to you she describes real life experiences and is really down to earth and real. She encourages class discussion and is very energetic. She doesn't read the few papaers that she will make you write, turn it in and get the 5/5 points. Her reviews aren't anything like her exams but not hard-

Dr Porter is my favorite professor at CSU.  I recommend her to any student.  She truly works with the students and wants to see them do well.  Make sure you attend the classes because she gives out points for attending & frequently gives extra credit!
Took 301 and 342, i don't know what tracy porter these ppl are talking bout. she was great, easy, and told you what to study for on review days! def recommend porter!
Took an course with him that had required readings on subject matter completely unrelated to my major. Work load was most ridiculous I've ever encountered in an undergraduate class.

3 it. He's organized, kind, helpful, and models what he teaches. The one and only test is worth 30% of your final grade. If you get less than 15/30 on the test don't expect an A in the course. Bring $20 by the second week because you have to pay for the syllabus, rubrics, sample, etc. He lets you borrow the book for the semester at no cost to you.

I took the six-week version of this class, and Dr. Pourdavood made it very manageable and organized. He explained every assignment in detail, and graded very leniently. He ran his classroom the way he taught, which was very helpful- I learned a lot from this class.

Dr. Pourdavood is a reasonable and challenging professor who, even if you find his assignments confusing, will spend as much time as you need to clarify them. Don't mistake his deadpan demeanor for a lack of enthusiasm or passion.  Dr. Pourdavood is a boss.

Great teacher, extremely helpful.  She brought in speakers who provide opportunities for excellent learning experiences and great resume builders.  Sometimes classes seemed a little pointless, but in the end I'm glad I had Powell.

He's my favorite professor. Very young and new, but he knows what he's doing. I could not have learned MATLAB with anyone else. A group of us would go to his office hours, and he was always very happy to help. There are pop quizzes and heavy HWs, but I didn't mind that so much b/c he was very good at teaching the material. He's just the best. 10/10

He's my favorite professor. Very young and new, but he knows what he's doing. I could not have learned MATLAB with anyone else. A group of us would go to his office hours, and he was always very happy to help. There are pop quizzes and heavy HWs, but I didn't mind that so much b/c he was very good at teaching the material. He's just the best. 10/10

For this being my first real coding class, I wouldn't say it was that bad. Although he sometimes struggles to cover materials to do homework, over time once you get the hang of his teach style you will be good. Tests are relatively easy, I never really studied for any tests and did 89 avg. In the end, I would definitely recommend him for MatLab.

Clear examples. Gives quizzes, but they're usually straight forward. If the whole class does bad on a quiz, he will reteach the material and give out the quiz again. Fair grader and easily accessible.

Professor Powell is one of the most down-to-earth professors I've had. He really cares about everyone's understanding of the concepts taught. For example, he gives pop quizzes, where if the whole class bombs it, he takes the time to actually re-cover the material, and may even let the class retake the quiz. He is a must take.

Fun class and professor to match! Material can be confusing sometimes but the professor is always available to help clarify it. Only gripe would be the homework. It too forever to complete, deadlines were to close, some had to get pushed back. Homework wasn't similar to the tests in most cases. Expect pop quizzes and decently challenging exams.

He's very dry and matter-of-fact but also very knowledgeable and explains things well. He's a nice, down to Earth guy and genuinely wants to help you learn, as long as he sees you are trying. Be prepared for very difficult tests that really push you to test your knowledge. This is the "weed out" class for ACT, and requires a lot of studying.

His intermediate one class was easily the most difficult in the ACT program. I learned next to nothing from him, though he seems like a nice guy. I've started studying for the CPA exam, and not surprisingly the material from his course is what I have the most trouble with. Just not a good teacher. The concepts are difficult to learn on your own.

I took online, only three tests, first test was from the bank, second was not, third test was 25% from the test bank. Class is very hard, especially the 2nd test dealing with inventory. He gave extra credit per test and curved at the end. This class would be a lot easier if other stuff (HW, cases, etc..) was offered, but he is a nice guy overall.

Absolutely the best professor in CSU. Knowledgeable, helpful and professional. I don't care that much if his test is tough. That is what it should be. I just hope he can teach every accounting class then I believe I will successfully pass the cpa exam.

This guy is a very tough professor. His class consists of no graded homework and your grade is based on 3 tough exams. He is very knowledgeable on the subject and will help you if you ask. He makes you read and learn the material. Accounting is a very hard subject and this class will be the judge of whether you should major in Accounting or not.

Best accounting professor at CSU. Took him over the summer and got an A. It was not easy but the CPA exam is not going to be easy either. He will give you all the knowledge to succeed. He does curve at the end of the semester. He will take his time and explain difficult concepts if you ask him.

Look, the tests are hard, but I got an A.  You need to study nightly and work every problem in the back of the book. Also, bonus on all tests are gimmie points do not miss those. BEST PROFESSOR IN THE PROGRAM. Shows why half of the accounting students will fail out

Its already been said, but SERIOUSLY, this class is TOUGH!! I spent countless, hours reading, studying, working problems and I still struggled with the tests. In the end, I got a B, but it was painful. It's not Poznanski's fault, just the nature of the beast.  Good luck!

Worst professor at Cleveland State. But don't worry because he's the only professor that good ole Cleveland State offers for intermediate accounting. Only three exams with no curve so you better do good on all of them.

He's a really nice guy and he truly cares but the material is hard. He gives great notes which he basically reads from in class and spends a good amount of time working practice problems. Exams are difficult, be prepared. The class is just extremely difficult since it's a 3 credit class now. He knows it, we know it, the university knows it.

Even with the amount of time I spent outside the classroom preparing for his exams, I still found them extremely difficult. Reading the book and answering the problems is a MUST to even come close to understanding the material. I don't even feel like I learned anything with the amount of difficulty that came with this course.

This class is hard because it requires you to read, not because it is rocket science. Poznanski gives you everything you need to succeed, including very detailed notes and study guides. It's up to you to work hard and learn the material.

Poznanski is a good guy. Has good intentions. He tells you this class is gonna be hard.. he's not kidding. He reads from lecture notes which are on blackboard. You will not pass unless you know the material inside and out. A lot of work in this class. If you go, pay attention, read the book, and do the problems you'll pass. Buy the survival guide!!

He tries to fit so much material in one period of time , his lectures are boring he just reads from his own study guide which is provide on blackboard,  he makes you works problems that will not even be on test and he is a petty grader do not take it with him however he is the only one that teaches this class which sucks

He thinks the course will be impossible with 3 credit hours, and makes it exactly so. The tests are ALL multiple choice, the questions are NOTHING like done in class, he goes through material SO FAST and crams SO MUCH on exams, makes up his "own" methods that are not in the textbook and you must remember how to approach one problem with 12 methods.

The class isn't nearly as difficult as people say...actually have to read a little bit and do some work - imagine that!  Incredibly knowledgable and a genuinely nice guy too.  Wish all the classes were like this - weed people out or cheapen the degree.  And I took it in six weeks in the summer so it is quite manageable.
Difficult subject material, teaches it well though. Need to read the book and do problems to do well. Nice guy and times was pretty funny.

Show up for class, practice the assigned problems (and more if you need further practice), ask questions if you do not understand, make sure you can work the problems in a normal amount of time (as most of the exams are composed of situations which need journal entries), and you should do fine. The professor is willing to help & is apt at teaching.
One of the best professors I have had.  Gives all the information to the student in one form or the other, it is yours what you do with it.  Has a genuine interest in educating students.

Great professor would highly recommend him. The material is very hard, you have to work hard to pass this course with a decent grade. He explains the material very clearly and in detail. His tests are long so practice problems a lot before the exam, he curves, and gives bonus questions on all of his exams.

I took this course online. It's a tough subject and Poznanski makes that clear. He's up-front about the amount of work that needs to be done, and he gives you the tools to do so. For the online course the Wiley-Plus access is optional, but I STRONGLY recommend you purchase/use it. READ YOUR TEXTBOOK. He does give bonus points on exams which helps.

This class is crazy difficult. He was gone for a part of the semester so it was tough from learning from different profs. Read, DO THE PROBLEMS THAT HE SUGGESTS, and go to class! He WILL help you if you ask. He's very nice, just a dry sense of humor. This class is what you make it. Work hard then you'll pass.

Advantage:  fair prof. and helpful if you need him disadvantage: though exams. expect any question from every single page on the book on exams so you have to read the book carefully and spend time to do understand points. the professor covers only 25% from the book. He just explains the main ideas and does some exercises.

3 Exams: 100, 125, 150. Straightforward, the test is what you study in class. most detailed syllabus ever ( exercises done in class+suggested exercises) and posts the answers to all questions on Blackboard before classes start.  Cons: monotone voice, which makes it a little difficult to follow during morning classes (Zzz.)

First exam was easy, but the second two exams were insanely difficult. Even with the amount of time I spent outside of class studying and preparing for his exams, I still found myself entirely lost. He does not offer a curve, but he fortunately allowed one for our second exam which I think saved me. I don't even feel like I learned anything.

This semester this class was worth 3 credits down from 4 credits so he had to teach the same amount of material in less time which was unfortunate for us. Your grade was based only on 3 tests. He gives you notes that have nearly everything he will say so you may think it will be easy but his tests are insane. A lot of outside class time required.

He gives one paper assignment that is not hard but you have to research a lot and understand what you are being asked, 3 exams: 100 points, 125 points and 150 points, and no curve. He's a very unreasonable professor..
Hard Tests, No Extra Credit, One Project that is fair, and lots of studying required.  He is really helpful and always available. He also is very upfront about the course being difficult.
Hard course, hard tests, but he gives knowledge.

Dr. Prakup is my favorite CSU professor so far! She is hilarious, informative and teaches in a way that makes the information easy to retain, as well as easy to study for. I would recommend this class to anyone! She really cares about her students and the subject she is teaching and it makes a world of difference.

Dr. Prakup is WONDERFUL! Always very clear about what she expects and fully explains concepts! She is hilarious and even though the subject material can be dry, SHE is the reason I come to class everyday! I highly recommend taking her classes :)

She is prepared, organized, and clear.  Dr. Prakup will give extra attention and time to any student who truly wants to learn.  She is an artic and phonology genius, and I highly recommend her classes.  Just don't skip....attendance matters to her!
Gives study guides for every quiz and midterm!
shes FABULOUS! so helpful and fun and knows what she's talking about. i highly recommend her to everyone!

Ms. Preisler is very caring and is willing to help her students, but YOU have to reach out. She will write notes on some coursework if you aren't doing well and it usually says to come and ask questions if you need help. She has a lot of lab assignments for each section we learn but it is manageable. Overall, a good teacher who is willing to help.
She is amazing! I definitely recommend

Awesome class and awesome professor. She is very understanding and will help you where you struggle. I really enjoyed her class. The exams are open note but you NEED to make sure you know the material or you will run out of time. There are not a lot of questions on them it's the steps that take the most time. Quizzes can be worked on with others.

Tasha is the best professor I have ever had. She is very clear during lectures and makes time to tutor outside of class whenever you need it. Show up to class and take good notes. Quizzes are taken in groups and exams are open note.

It took a while to get used to him but once I got used to him it was actually a great class. He is very helpful and wants to make sure his students do well. After having some really bad teachers, it was a relief to have him to make the class easier. Just attend class and do the readings and you'll pass with flying colors.

I am going to say I hated this professor, like the other negative comments, she is so confusing with her instruction especially changes her mind every time. It got so bad that my peers were asking me what they missed because she made no sense on her directions plus she hates the writing center even though she tells you to go and her grading is crap

As long as you never miss a class you will get an A. There is a lot of reading, but the reading quizzes are easy and you can get away with only reading 75% of a text. You read one novella or short play a week and have a quiz on it the following week. I was exposed to a lot of authors I'd never heard of and learned a lot. August Wilson is great.

AWFUL TEACHER. She will always say when something is due or explain how it is done then change her mind minutes after!!! She never knows what she wants and its so annoying. Grades papers really weird too. Never take her class.
Great Professor.  Very knowledgeable and interesting reading assignments.  There is a lot of material so be ready to read and take a ton of notes.

Overall, it wasn't much of an English class. But if you did the assignments and did half way decent papers you will do well. Speaks out on her personal views but she's a decent lady. I learned more thru other classes on my English skills though.

this is a writing class and she only lectures about African-American culture the entire class time, she is not organized nor clear.However it is an English class, you will pass as long as you tried your best and attend

Worst professor I have ever had. She constantly argues with students on factual information and embarrasses herself and CSU. She doesn't know much about English and prevents growth in her student's work. My high school teachers knew more than she did. I honestly think she made my writing MUCH worse. I cannot believe she is still employed.

She is by far the absolute worst teacher I have ever had. She knows nothing about the technical aspect of writing nor the proper formats to use. I had to argue with her about MLA format and it ended up that I was correct.Not to mention, this is a writing class and she only lectures about African-American culture the entire class time.
This professor is not a feminist she is just very assertive and she does not put up with ignorance. I enjoyed her class.

She's definitely got "an agenda." She is impossible to reason with and her class lacks direction. She discriminates against the students and uses her personal experiences to dictate class content. Her vocabulary is NOT politically and often offensive. I don't understand why she is still employed, possibly an affirmative action case.

Man hater.. I thought the class would be good from previous commments... If you are a male do not take this class she is pro-woman if you know what I mean. She discriminated and singled me out. Not something a professor should do
Very boring class.. was expecting better from the previous comments. She reduced my grade one lower because of attendance. I mean are you serious?

Professor Price was interested and mostly knowledgeable about the subject, but I found her lectures to be very boring. She often went off of the syllabus without giving proper notice of new deadlines, making it difficult to stay with the class. She seemed like she couldn't make up her mind about assignments, and didn't plan ahead very much.

The class was very enjoyable.  Good prof. doesn't want to see anyone fail, gives you chances to make up work.  Quizzes are easy, her reviews are great, writing assignments are straight forward.  Take this class - it's cool.

This by far was my favorite class during the semester, and I am not an english major.  Prof. Price made class very interesting and our discussions at times were unnerving, but nonetheless enlightening.  I learned a lot about A/A history, even though it is a literature class.  I highly recommend this class and professor.
I really enjoyed Prof. Price's class. She was quite helpful and brought a new perspective to the material.
Takes what should be an enlighteneing class and turns it (African-American literature) into drudgery. Lectures are dull and quizzes are ridiculous. Don't even think of discussing things with her.
Mr. Price is very smart but easily gets off track. It gets really confusing but if you just stick with him you can get a good grade.

Dr. Price is a very intelligent individual but gets off topic ALOT. Instead of discussing with his students relevant information to prepare them for the Capstone, he lectures about who knows what. Great guy, just very boring and monotonous to listen to.
He was hard and hard to understand at first. Got use to him though and he's awesome. I'll remember him.

Professor Price is awesome! The most fun you could ever have in a Comp class. He is very educated and while initially the discussions don't seem to fit in, they all make sense and you realize he has taught you in a way you never saw coming. He is truly an awesome teacher!

Professor Price is  one of the most accomplished professors I have ever met. His teaching style is different but it gets you to understand English from a different point of view. I was very honored to have met Professor Price.
Terrible teacher. Tought us history instead of english? Didn't even show up on our scheduled exam day
He can be very confusing, I got lost in his dicussions often. He is VERY willing to help any student who truely wants it, and he'll take the time to meet up with students outside of class.
HE IS AN AMAZING ENGLISH TEACHER. HE HELPS YOU UNDERSTAND THE WORLD OF WRITING AND HELP YOU MAKE YOUR WRITING BETTER
He gives C's and D's on your papers at first just so you try harder and you still get a B or A for midterm grade. He's a sweet dude
Wow, after being out for a while I now realize that this guy really set the pace for what I am doing now in my professional realm. Thank you very much.

I enjoyed his classes. Although he gives you a ton of assignments and projects, his teaching is clear and he gives real life examples. I got an A in his class but i felt like i really worked hard for it .

I took him for internal auditing online.  He seems like a nice enough guy!  There were some communication problems at the beginning of the course, but ended up working out!  His assignments are clear.  You work in groups the entire class.  The midterm was ridiculous, but he ended up giving everyone that did it 100%.  I recommend this course!
He is a good guy but he gives to much work. He is better than other teachers. Be ready to work.

Prof. Primuth makes Accounting Information Systems & Auditing interesting.  He includes interactive projects in the course, in order to help students understand exactly how the acccounting transaction cycle and audit process works.  His class is a lot of work, I won't lie.  But if you're not a slacker, and accounting is what you plan on doing with the rest of your life, his class will help.
Primuth is a great professor!  You could learn a lot from this guy!
No Comments
Mr Primuth was kick ass....plus he goes to my church :D
Horrible, never answered emails or voicemails.  Gave unclear, confusing, incomplete directions. Avoid at all costs.
How did he end up teaching here anyway?
Avoid
No Comments
No Comments
Underqualified to teach at the college of this caliber.  Shouldnt be teaching, comes to class unprepared. Waste of time and money.
Did not respond to emails or voice mails after class ended.
She's fair

I only discovered that she passed today, and I can't believe it. Profesora Pruitt was by far my absolute favorite instructor that I have had in my life. She was so supportive, caring, and approachable. I loved going to her classes. I felt so close to her that I even asked to use her as a reference for employment. I will always miss her. Chau <3

Reenie Pruitt will be missed. She was a fantastic, caring and understanding professor. She went out her way to bring the class together through hilarious stories, fun games and even formed the Spanish Club which she was very proud of. Her students and I will all miss her. Rest in heaven.
She really was an amazing teacher that genuinely cared for the well being of her students. She will be missed...

She's extremely nice and charismatic. However, she speaks almost entirely in Spanish and 99 percent of the time I don't know what's going on. Just because I took SPN101 doesn't mean I'm fluent. I hate to say this because she is such a nice person, but I haven't learned a thing. Pretty sure I might fail.

Profesora Pruitt really cares about her students. She's hilarious, energetic, and kind. Lectures can sometimes be a bit dry, but if you pay attention and ask questions, you will be fine. She's also a very lenient grader, and it's clear that she wants you to pass.

She is great. If you have questions, just ask. She is amazingly  lenient but if you are not very good at Spanish, expect to push yourself for these tests. Go to class, pay attention, study and you'll be fine.   Side note: listed in catalog as Literature Survey, but it reality it is Intermediate Spanish 2. Not much reading at all involved.

Great Spanish Professor! She is passionate about the subject and will enjoy helping you learn. If you try your best (even if it is a bumpy road to learning) she will give you a fair grade. Very flexible and helpful.

Profa. Pruitt is the reason why I'm going for a Spanish minor. She got me excited about learning the language again. Extremely approachable and always willing to help. Ridiculously lenient when it comes to work. If you're willing to learn, she is willing to teach you. Buena suerte y no se rinda!

Professor Pruitt is a nice professor, but her teaching style is ineffective. She can be unclear and very hard to follow during her lectures. Constantly changing the work load and gave the most vague explanations. I will give Reenie credit for being a nice person, but her course is extremely challenging. You will have to teach yourself the material.
a fun class, never a daul moment, as well as easy to follow and understand. a very fair grader.

Prof Pruitt was a pleasant surprise when I had to take a summer Spanish course. She has a very outgoing and friendly personality and it's almost impossible to not laugh a few times in her class. She will encourage you to give your best and grades VERY fairly. Foreign Languages are tough, but if you put effort in to her class, your good to go!

Mrs. P. is one of the best professors I have ever had! She really cares about her students and is understanding that things can come up. She allows you to miss 2-3 classes before points are deducted. Even if Spanish doesn't come easy to you, she makes it easy, just show effort! I only want to take classes with her because she is that great.

Professor Pruitt loves teaching  and truly cares about her students. She will do what ever she can to help you out and as long as you show participation and try she will give you a fair grade. Wonderful personality and funny I love her and will take her courses as I pursue my minor in Spanish.

Profesora Pruitt is AMAZING. Because of her, I have decided to minor in Spanish. Her class is very interesting, she is fabulous for working with students and flexible as long as you are doing the work and putting in the effort. She gets my highest recommendation!

She is very helpful and willing to work with you when you need help, although the class moves at a fast pace and if you don't keep up you can fall behind. She enjoys teaching Spanish  I would recommend taking this class alone.
I loved Professor Pruitt so much that I rearranged my entire schedule for Fall so that I could have her for SPN 102 she just gets how to teach Spanish and makes it fun at the same time.

Had her for several Spanish courses and would recommend her to anyone. She is fair and easily approachable. She prepares you well for exams and gives neat extra credit opportunities. She also never makes you feel uncomfortable when you make errors when speaking. Overall fantastic!
Pruitt is awesome! she will amek it easy on you if you show her that your are trying! coolest teacher at CSU

The course was difficult, but reenie is a wonderful teacher who will go way out of her way to help students. she genuinely cares about her students and is enthusiastic about spanish. very easygoing and understanding. I definitely recommend her!

Class is always fun to attend, do not recommend skipping class. If you do skip it, you can miss out on some important information. Easy to make up skipped class or a lab. Don't need a book. Make sure to study everything as you go, so you wouldn't have to learn it all by the end, because lectures get faster and harder as you go. Use studying modules

An amazing professor. Has a clear teaching plan and speed. Lectures very well and easy to understand. Miss one class, you miss a lot. VERY funny and caring. He lets you know he is comfortable talking about hard things that can happen in ones life. Recommended 100%.
He made the class brownies hes awesome 10/10 recommend

Psarras uses Pearson online, which is really helpful for exams. He offers extra credit and we don't use the textbook much. It's not an easy A, you have to keep up with the material. He posts videos of his lectures so attendance isn't required but its helpful. There is an online quiz almost every week but they're easy.

My grade was much higher with Dr Psarras in gen chem 2 than it was with a different prof in gen chem 1, but I don't think I learned as much. He bribes students to like him with extra credit out the wazoo, which works. I wish I could get a good grade and learn a lot, but you have to choose one or the other in the chemistry department at CSU.

Dr. Psarras is BY FAR the best professor I have had. I had him for prep chem and he was SO enthusiastic about his lectures and made everything pretty enjoyable. He relates the material to real life situations/examples to help you understand it better. & he goes over missed questions. Highly recommend this prof! You will not be disappointed.

The best Chem Prof at CSU so  far. He wants everyone to do well. He really cares about his students. Helps in whatever way he can. REALLY funny and can get side tracked with his own input on the material. Overall an amazing prof.

Dr. Psarras has to be there best chemistry teacher at CSU. Is very open and straightforward about what is on the exams. Truly cares about his students' success and makes all online homework worth extra credit. He offers numerous opportunities to get a great grade in a class that can be be challenging. Would highly recommend him if you can get him.
Dr. Psarras is one of the best professors for chemistry at Cleveland state. Really cares about the student and wants to see you succeed.
He really cares about his students. No easy A but it is possible if You are ready to do the work.

I am not naturally good at chemistry, and had to work hard for my grade. The chemistry department at CSU has not provided me with a great background, but Dr. Psarras is the best professor I've had for CHM at CSU so far. This semester I actually learned something. Homework is extra credit, and he is hilarious during lectures. Highly recommended.
Very knowledgeable and nice. Does not respond to emails for weeks, extremely hard to contact.
Extremely helpful.. understands the students... breezes through lecture very knowledgeable.. ONE OF THE FEW BEST NURSING PROFESSORS.
BEST PROFESSOR EVER. student advocate. knows what shes talking about. WANTS you to succeed. i wish she taught all my nursing classes
Super easy class. Lots of busy work. If you do everything it's not possible to fail. Really nice!

Low-quality grad school class. Assignments were busy work, but if you do them you'll pass. Majority of information we received from the class was YouTube videos from unrecognizable sources and Wikipedia articles. Assignments were misspelled and confusingly worded. Many assignments were basically a reworded version of the previous assignment.

I messed up a couple of assignments and she gave me the opportunity to resubmit. DON'T buy the edition of the textbook she wants. All of the details are the same in the 1st edition and it is $100 less than the 2nd. Lots of busy work-- 3 assignments per week due Sun mornings :( Easy A though if you do the work. Some of her "articles" are Wiki pages.

There is no reason this course could not be an online class. Instead, it's a 3 hour night class on Thursday's! Has us watch videos the entire time or will give us busy work for LITERALLY 3 HOURS. Positive thought? She's teaching me exactly what not to do when I get my own classroom.

Dr. Purcell is an amazing professor. She cares about her students and tries really hard to make sure everyone understands the material. And during field experience she does her best to make sure the students teaching during tutoring sessions are confident in their abilities. Recommend not skipping class as her tests are comprehensive/ lecture based

Dr. Purcell is an amazing professor. She cares about her students and tries really hard to make sure everyone understands the material. And during field experience she does her best to make sure the students teaching during tutoring sessions are confident in their abilities. Recommend not skipping class as her tests are comprehensive/ lecture based
Very lovely woman. Cares a lot about literacy, which is important in this class.
Purcell is one of my favorite professors! She always gives positive feedback on your assignments and is very understanding and helpful.
Dr. Purcell was amazing and I wish I had taken this course in class versus online!
Meh... Can't say I enjoyed her class, but it was ok. She uses power point presentations and taking notes from the lecture is tough. Her tests are comprehensive. Not many projects or assignments.
Great teacher!!!

Mandatory class even if you are not in Language Arts.  Not worth the time if you can avoid. I am going to teach middle school Math and Science and can now further understand why students ask "why do I have to take this class, I'll never use it".  Since it is mandatory you could do worse thatn Purcell. She seems to genuinely care about her students.
If you have her for your freshman class, be happy! For the most part we are barely in class the full hour and she is always letting us out early!

Dr. Qi is a very nice professor. We had presentations quite frequently, so if you're not a fan of presentations don't take this course. There's one paper that we have the semester to work on with set due dates for each section. Overall a pretty easy grader and you'll do well as long you try in this course!

Dr. Qi is a very nice professor who unfortunately has a slight language barrier. She knows her stuff, but sometimes she has difficulty in explaining it. The class itself is pretty difficult as you have to memorize hundreds of drugs and their side effects, but she does try to do a lot of review and some extra credit.

Taught class as if we were medical students (which many of us weren't). Exams USMLE question heavy and again not medical students. Lectures not clear because doesn't take time to dumb down certain medical concepts. Doesn't proofread exams beforehand so frequently questions from chapters we weren't responsible for appeared.

Dr Qi tried very hard to make the class passable. Make sure you pay extra attention during her reviews prior to the tests. Her English can be a little difficult to understand, but she uses powerpoints for all lectures which help to figure out anything you may hav enot clearly understood. She also posts the powerpoints online for study references.

Dr. Qi is a very sweet person but has trouble "dumbing down" her explanations in class she is not used to teaching College Chem. she is very sweet. you'll pass if you  ask questions when you don't understand something and go to her office hours. she's better one-on-one.

Dr. Qi is incredibly intelligent, but I think that works against her. She is used to teaching medical students, and Gen Chem 2 comes so easily to her, she flies through the very difficult material. I excelled in Gen Chem 1, yet I struggled with her class. If it weren't for SI sessions, I would fail. She's nice, but I would NEVER take her again.
Took her twice (ESE 502 and 518). My only two non-As (got two A-). Would take her for every class. Very helpful, very funny, very interesting, very understanding, and I learned a lot.
Awesome teacher!
I highly recommend her.
Tests are difficult but she's got a great sense of humor and I loved going to her classes.
best professor and advisor EVER!!!
one of the most caring profs ever great to talk to

Professor Quinn was a great professor! She made me actually enjoy taking STA 347. After loathing my STA 147 class spring semester 2020 with another professor, I was so nervous to do STA 347. But Professor Quinn made the class totally doable and not miserable at all! Totally would take her classes again, and I will miss being her student. A+ teacher

Professor Quinn was a great professor! She made me actually enjoy taking STA 347. After loathing my STA 147 class spring semester 2020 with another professor, I was so nervous to do STA 347. But Professor Quinn made the class totally doable and not miserable at all! Totally would take her classes again, and I will miss being her student. A+ teacher

Amazing! The structure of the class is a delight. Evaluations included homework w/ infinite attempts, quizzes, labs, and tests that TRULY helped process the material. Plenty of extra credit, and time to work. Her book is great. The explanations are super clear. Watch deadlines from the start and it will be easy to relax at the end of the semester!

Professor Quinn was the best professor I could have had during this pandemic. She was very accommodating and would make sure everyone would be able to turn in their assignments, get a good grade, and not be left behind. There was a good amount work to do, but she gave us many extended deadlines whenever a student asked. Take her class!

Dr. Quinn is an outstanding professor. She loves stats and is always available to help students. However, this class is very very hard. There are quizzes, labs and homework due every week and if you get behind you will never catch up!! Not sure if I wouldve done so well with another professor.

Dr. Quinn is the University Outstanding Teaching professor. She knows her stuff. You need to attend class and keep up. The first half of the course is the hardest. If you can past that, things get easier. Highly recommend!

Linda Quinn is a very caring professor. Some of her lectures are at home, but if you go to her office during office hours, or actually show up to class to get help or actually participate in class she isn't that bad. The material is hell, but she makes it clear and cut of what to expect of midterms, and finals and any inclass project or test.

Dr. Quinn just received Outstanding Teaching Award for entire college.  She rightfully deserves it.  Caring and understanding that all students aren't as enthusiastic as she is.  Clear expectations and fair grader.  Don't fall behind!

She cares about students. Class is SUPER time consuming. Spent 8+ hours on Midterm & Final ?'s. Weekly Labs w/ Multiple Choice Questions (MC is really hard, hardest part of class). Weekly Quizzes (1-5 each week). Does not reply to emails fast, but is available in person. Labs took awhile, but were easy to get good grades on. Flipped lecture was ok.

Clearly outlines what's expected of you. Is open for questions, and will try her best to make you understand the material. She gives plenty of opportunities to better your grade. Overall, she's an incredibly fair professor if you're willing to put in the work, time and effort to show that you care.

Weekly labs with practice problems.  Online videos to walk you through.  Need to know Minitab.  Tests are tough but grading is fair.  Extra credit available.  90% got A or B.  Considering minor in stats because of her.
The best professor ever in all of Cleveland State!

Course was flipped.  Watch lecture videos for hw.  Computer lab easy if you watch and are prepared.  exams are straightforward and similar to classwork,  Course goes quickly,  Don't get behind.  She can be helpful in her office.  Workload is high but doable.  Fair grader.  Multiple quizzes per week and project each week.  Don't need book.

Summer course goes by fast.  many assignments and quizzes in short time span, but what should you expect for 7 weeks.   Returns quickly (next day) with lots of feedback.  tough but fair.  flexible.  organized.

Definitely need to stay up on material and projects.  didn't realize how much I learned until the end.  used it in my bio class at same time.  Can review lessons at own pace.  Available even outside office hours.  Helpful so be sure to ask.  Tough tests though  I bet more than half class got  A or B.
Pay attention, do what you are told and you will get an A.

Dr. Quinn gets it - she's from the real world! She also understands that students have lives and is willing to work with you. Definitely recommend for Categorical stats. Pay attention and attend lecture - she can fly through tough concepts but is always willing to stop and explainreview if you have questions. I'd take any class she offers
Must keep up.  Many projects.  Review lectures on line that you can watch multiple times.  Learns student names.  helps in lab.  HW is to keep up with lectures

Absolutely my favorite teacher I've had yet. Very helpful and gives easy points. Alot of quizzes and projects but they are easy and you get class time to work on them. Loved her I would absolutely recommend this class
Dr. Quinn is an incredible math teacher. She is interested and engaged in her lectures, and the class is extremely easy. If you put in literally any effort you are guaranteed an A.

One of my favorite professors at Cleveland State. Very enthusiastic and prepared. Her projects are very straight-forward and her quizzes and exams are open book and open note. She wants everyone to do well and understand the material. Very approachable if you have questions. Highly recommend!

Arguably the best professor at CSU. Took him for Intro to Risk and Insurance and it was my best decision. Class was boring, but my guy had so much to offer. He helped me with one of my financial models for another class and was able to explain more than my professor.. I really dont have much to say about the class, but class aside Raguz is the man!

RUN from this professor, do not take his courses. His philosophy is "no one gets 100% because there is no such thing as a perfect assignment" type of teacher. Turned in perfect homework only to get a C average... and I have held a 3.9 GPA throughout all my semesters at college. He gives an absurd amount of written hw and exams. He is outdated!!!

Arguably the best professor at CSU. Took him for Intro to Risk and Insurance and it was my best decision. Class was boring, but my guy had so much to offer. He helped me with one of my financial models for another class and was able to explain more than my professor.. I really dont have much to say about the class, but class aside Raguz is the man!

He puts no effort into his class. If you take this class, you basically read the textbook and that is everything. There is no discussion and no communication from the professor. You can just rent the textbook and learn everything without spending hundreds of dollars on this class. Biggest waste of time and money ever.
Stay Away

Knows his stuff, but doesn't know how to teach. Spends 15 mins flying through powerpoints talking about random stuff, not actually teaching anything. Only learn if you teach yourself by reading the book. Makes you come to class to earn participation points for group work (too lazy to grade each) He doesn't even know how to use financial calculator
If you plan on trying to skip class, I would stay away from this course. Besides that, one of the most useful and interesting courses I've taken, thus far.

He was a good professor, but his test reviews weren't like the tests. If you use a tutor it will help a lot or he even loves to help you understand the material. As long as you do the homework and let him know what he can help you with then you'll be fine. It's finance so it won't be the easiest class to begin with.

He takes the whole class to do 3 questions because he continuously gets them wrong which is extremely confusing. Not only that but he expects us to get 50 questions done in 2 hours. That might not seem so bad but if I were him averaging 3 correct questions every 45 minutes I would have 8 questions completed by the end of the test.

He was a good professor, but his test reviews weren't like the tests. If you use a tutor it will help a lot or he even loves to help you understand the material. As long as you do the homework and let him know what he can help you with then you'll be fine. It's finance so it won't be the easiest class to begin with.

Avoid this professor. During the pandemic he still held in attendance classes forcing students to purchase a parking pass before making the class online at the last second. Does not present lectures well and exams are worth essentially your entire grade. He also does a bad job with the review materials so make sure to learn on your own.

His tests are pretty difficult, not gonna lie, but hes fair about curving. Russ is the most down to earth professor I've ever had. Too many professors forget what it's like to be a student. Engage with him, converse in his classes. Not only is he a good teacher, but hes a great guy. P.S. If you ever read these, thank you, from one russ to another

I am a finance major and I would never take Raimer again. AVOID AT ALL COSTS. I would rather stay a whole semester or year more than to take his class again. Never responds to emails, never helps students, takes him the whole semester to grade things and just an awful person. Was in the tutor center 3 days a week and passing was still hard.
He is a good teacher but his classes are not easy to teach and a lot of people will get confused. All you have to do is ask questions.
May have been a great CPA and successful in his field but is worthless as a professor. I implore you sit for a class and learn for yourself. Worst professor Ive ever experienced, hands down.

He's a good guy, can be a bit scatterbrained, but knowledgeable always gets his point across. Be prepared for many corny jokes. He gives a lot of online homework that helps you learn the material very well. If you do all the homework, you will ace his tests. He is very serious about attendance and being prepared for class, and will call you out.

He means well and is a nice guy but i do not recommend taking his class if you have a heavy schedule. He rushes through the operations, lectures are boring, he looses train of thought, and wastes a lot of classes time fumbling around on the computor not operating it efficiently. A lot of homework..

Nice guy, means well.  as others mentioned he messes around with his computer and wastes a lot of time.  Took him online and in class for finance undergrad and his online class was a joke.  Submit just about anything and you get all the points.  In class tests were a average, not hard not easy.

He is so unorganized, the mind tap did not work for this class most of the time so he had to chop out 25% of the grad, which hurt most peoples grades. He is a nice guy overall, but not a good teacher, especially if you want to learn something. The class itself is messy, but not impossible to pass.

The exams come from the book. Study his exam reviews, homework, and quizzes. If you take the time to get to know him he will do the same. The lectures are mandatory, however, completely pointless if you have not read ahead. If you are struggling with the homework copy and paste the problem into google to find a similar problem to help you.

The teacher is absolutly horrible. He plays around with the computer for a good 30-40 min before the class even starts. Teacher wastes so much time trying to figure out simple problems. Its the same thing everytime with this guy. Has NO idea whats so ever of even a clue about the material he is teaching. I highly advise to avoid him!

Course title is very misleading - no Bloomberg at all - just excel.  Prof takes weeks to grade the assignments. His lectures are long and disorganized. He fumbles through the lecture trying to figure it out as he goes.  Tests  had things he never taught.  CSU has no variety of courses for Finance majors. All the reviews were right

So disappointing he is a professor for building-block classes and upper-level finance courses. Do not take Raimer if you need to learn the material to move onto other classes. Not helpful, wastes class time, does not answer emails (even when I emailed him 3 times concerned about my grade & met him at his office asking him to email me back).

Worst teacher I have ever had. you have no idea what he is doing in class he doesnt explain anything he just puts you to sleep, he is not clear on what the assignments are and he barley knows what he is doing. he shows up to class late and takes his time to unpack his things. I do not recommend taking Raimer as a professor.

Raimer has literally put the wrong chapters on my final exam, he spends 20 minutes every class trying to get his computer to work. He has never responded to my emails. He is entirely checked out and does as little as possible teaching. He's a fairly nice guy but don't expect to learn much from him.

Nice guy.  Lectures tend to be powerpoint centered and do not always match the assignments given.  I had some issues with the online Cengage part of the course, but eventually got it.  All exam questions come from chapter quiz, homework, and reviews.  If you keep up with the weekly work and spend a couple hours reviewing for the 3 exams expect an A

Nice guy, but not a good professor. He has no direction and says he will help but does not. Class was a waste of time and only confused me more, only reason I went was because attendance was accounted for. Take someone else if you can. I heard Klaus is good.

He is nice guy overall, but his teaching style needs work. His tests are hit or miss due to his lack of  giving a a more detail study guide. Also this class, has 3 assignments due (2 are only graded) weekly so prepare to work. If you are good at accounting and algebra this class is an easy B plus at least. If not good luck.
She was my absolute favorite professor! You were able to contact her whenever necessary. She did what ever possible to make you pass.

THE ABSOLUTE WORST! RUN, AND RUN FAST! Does NOT make anything clear. If you ask questions she refers you to the syllabus that doesn't have the answers. Not very clear on requirements, or assignments. And her grading scale is VERY off. RUUUUUNNN! AVOID AT ALL COST!

Terrible Professor. The absolute worst. She doesn't explain things very clearly, shes never certain about the things she tells you so she switches often. And she doesn't make assignment requirements clear. Her grading scale is VERY off. RUN.. and fast if you have her

Great Professor. Helps a lot but doesn't hold your hand. Papers were based on personal results i.e. you weren't competing against the other students, just your previous abilities. I definitely write better now. Not an "Easy A" if you don't like essays, but very lenient.

I took this course in the 6 week summer session and though it was a lot of material to go over, Dr. Rakos made it interesting. As long as you come to class, take good notes, and ndo the reading, you'll get a good grade.
im repeating this class for the second time, and its just as hard...if possible, avoid him at all costs.

Very good teacher. Very fair at grading. For PSY 342, he has no tests, just papers. As long as you follow his directions for writing the papers, you should have no problem getting an "A". You can really learn a lot from him.

Dr. Rakos is a GREAT professor. His class is an amazing class and you finish the semester feeling like you've learned a lot. He is a fair grader. As long as you go to class, take good notes, and listen to what he says, you will pass the 5 required papers easily. Those negatively rating him most likely did not go to class consistently.

Dr. Rakos is a hard professor. He defnitely knows his stuff but I felt that he sometimes wasn't able to convey the information to the students in a way we could all completely understand. He has you write 5 papers and he's a hard grader. He does offer extra credit though. You definetly need to attend his class or you'll be lost.

Richard Rakos is the love of my life. He's a great professor, a little robotic at times but you know, the lovable kind of robot like in short circuit. Take his class, you'll learn a lot too if you try.

If you can avoid taking this course with him, then by all means do so. He is not fair, he doesnt follow through, and doesnt keep his word. Its only 5 reflection papers to do in the course, but he will make it extremely hard for you to pass the course. He must have had a hard time understanding his own concept of reflection papers.
No Comments

Good Prof.  I learned a lot.  Being the first core class for my major i did not know a whole lot about the theories.  I now feel like i will be able to use the knowledge gained in this class in all my other psy course.  O yea,  NO TESTS.  you only have to write 5 papers.

Taught field observation and methods class online, not easy to do. Still learned a lot from her. Class had a large amount of work, but it is one of, if not the most important education course. Never mentioned politics, not as bad as other reviews say.

Not as bad as other reviews say. I have never heard her reference politics once in the class...Anyway the others are right about the work! It is a lot, but it is manageable. My section was online so it was a bit different, but overall she is not as bad as others say, you just need to earn your grade, it won't be given like earlier EDU courses

She is very liberal, but does take time to listen to others view points.  Better come prepared.  She can pick out those who put no time or effort into the class. She will drop you from the Education program if she feels you are not putting forth a solid effort or are capable of teaching.Overall a very fair teacher though.  Will help when you have ?

Very opinionated.  Better hope you are not a conservative.  She is very liberal in her views.  But, she will listen if you make and state a good case.  Overall, a very fair professor, but you must be willing to work for your grade.  Do not slack off, she will catch you.  Focus your answers about gifted students
Honestly he is making a 100 level class IMPOSSIBLE. The material is WAY too hard. He's not very friendly via email either. I completely regret taking this course.

Not a typical watered down for morons CSU type class. You needed to read, show up to class, take notes, study for exams and stay engaged and awake during class. Dr. Ramos was a great advisor, and an interesting and well read professor. I learned a lot.
He only pays attention to people who seem interested in his stories. You can write a whole book about his friends in Brazil after having his latin am. class. He is very strict and a hard grader.

What a great guy! His class was very inspiring/influential. True, his lectures often spin off topic-if you're interested in latinoamerica, you won't mind. You do have to be able to write well, but you can get away with just regurgitating his lectures if you take good notes. He'll really get you thinking. He's very congenial. I highly recommend him!
Aoid his class if possible, never stays on course and most of the time jsut tells stories about his friends in Brazil. He should just move and stay there.
Very helpful as an advisor, without him I might still be taking classes [I wish to thank him now].  I loved his "power and authority" class.

DO not take this prof.  His lectures will put you to sleep, his assignments are very confusing.  He does not lecture what is on the tests or assignments.  he gets off track very easy.  and he always goes over his allotted time.  he is very nice and helpful but that does NOT make up for his downfalls

HARD!!! I DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS CLASS HIS LECTURES USUALLY HAVE NOTHING TO DO WITH THE TESTS. THE TEXTS ARE INTOLERABLE( EXCEPT THE HOUSE OF THE SPIRITS..GR8 BOOK). FEELS MORE LIKE A 400 COURSE CLASS. P.S. THIS IS COMING FROM AN A STUDENT

Outstanding and very generous with office hour time.  I get the impression he doesn't have a lot of patience with grade-grubbing. When I tried in class he was awesome and helpful, when he knew I was slacking, it was not particularly pleasant.  He is a dedicated teacher.  I am sad he is retiring.
jack@##
He is a teacher that can keep your interest and not bore you to death but unless you are an excellent writer you will not get an A.
Makes you think, tech savy, knowledgable - the Mayans live!

Okay, so he's not the greatest lecturer, but he makes up for it in his knowledge, his willingness to challenge students, his enthusiasm and approachability.  If I could give him a 10 for helpfulness I would!
Never stayed on campus, got far behind in schedule; unclear about requirements.  Often lectured on topics unrelated to class and then over and over again

Excellent prof. not the greatest lecturer but makes up for it by being a great advocate for students.  Truly cares, also is very interested in challenging the students. Lots of work to meet high yet not unreasonable standards= great class experience worth every penny.
Gets really side-tracked, assessment not really based on what he covers in class- BUT a great advocate for students, super interesting and an overall great guy.
Terrific teacher, great guy. We all hope for profs like him.
Best most influencing professor in the History Dept!  Thanks Boss!

Complete waste of time going to this class, he posts everything online and he literally only reads off the slides anyhow. Doesnt foster student participation. Asks the class questions he should know the answer to. Struggles to use a computer and specifically YouTube. Also good luck figuring out what your grade is or getting your paper back.

I would not recommend taking this class. It was lecture heavy as it was 4 hours long. He read straight off the powerpoint and none of the info on the slides was on the exams. We watched A LOT of movies and i did not really learn anything regardless of always paying attention. He also never updates grades so you go the whole semester guessing.

He's VERY knowledgable and gives you infinity chances to correct all of your papers for full points. He's down to earth and super nice. Don't talk while he's lecturing. His tests are essays and fill in the blanks but he reviews before the midterm/final. This class is a lot of lecture and papers, but worth it since you can correct everything!

Wonderful person inside & out. Big-heart ,with journalism experience. He has a true passion to teach others about it , the book is not needed but you must come to class. Gives you many opportunities to edit and re-submit papers and really has classic examples of material covered during class. Test are easy & well reviewed. Would take him again

Talks constantly, interrupts students on the rare occasion he even allows them to speak. Contradicts himself on feedback of papers. Takes more class time talking about himself and his old jobs than actually discussing the material. Open about political views. Don't buy the book, he doesn't use it. Uses extremely outdated reference material.

Rand is a great professor in his own way. His lectures are dry and can get boring but you can only miss 3 days then he penalizes. Its the easiest WAC you can take. 2 small papers, 6-7 other little assignments. He allows rewrites on almost everything so theres no reason not to get an A. 2 exams that can be tough but he has a built in curve on them.
Fun class, informative and funny.  SHOW UP TO CLASS ALWAYS
Great and easy guy but needs improvement on his handwriting when grading papers.
THE BEST!

Professor Rand obviously cares that his students do well. There's a lot of writing (it is a WAC), but he lets you re-write everything so there's no reason not to get every point possible. The only problem I had was with his tests. They're all based on lecture so it's important to show up, but he doesn't always stay on track. Overall, Rand is great.

Professor Rand is one of the best professors at Cleveland State. He knows about what he is teaching and he is always willing to help his students. He also lets you rewrite all of your papers until you get a perfect score! Show up everyday, attendance is mandatory because points are given.  Do your work along with all rewrites and you'll do great.

online. I e-mailed him with questions a few times and received quick feedback. Easy class. There's a quiz, discussion board, and journal every week. The only thing that I didn't like is he took random points away from discussion boards and journals without giving any feedback to improve. Still received an A but I like to know why I'm loosing points

Prof. Rand is a grade-A professional. He's seasoned in the broadcasting business and knows his stuff. We had a lot of  problems with the screen projector, so it took a bit to put up notes. You want advice? Pick his brain. Plan a meeting with him and talk to him about what you want to ask. You'll get some clear answers and some fun conversation.

Super great professor! Really knew what he was doing. He was super organized and always made everything available when it needed to be. I took this class online, over the summer, so it was only 6 weeks but even with it being so compacted, he made it easy and  entertaining. Great prof! Would definitely recommend!

He is awesome! My favorite professor at CSU so far. He helps you with anything and you can rewrite all your papers until you get %100 if you want. You don't use the book so don't buy it. The midterm and final is a little difficult but if you do good on the papers it will be fine.

Very excellent professor, one of the best professors at Cleveland State. He is fun, he knows about what he is teaching and he is always willing to help his students. He also lets you rewrite all of your papers until you get a perfect score! Show up everyday (Attendance is mandatory because points are given) and do your work and you'll get an A!

Must go to class as there is no book. He is always willing to help you understand something outside of regular class time. Only minor flaw, he tends to ramble or go off on side stories & that can really eat into class time. Brings in a lot of great guest speakers, always go to those! Lots of experience working in the fields, gives realistic advice.
Awesome Professor who ever takes this course with him will love him. He's every educated on the material through experience and know's what he's talking about.
Great teacher! Lets you re-write all of your papers as much as you want.
Pretty easy if you go to class.

Dr. Rand is easily my favorite professor Ive ever had  wish she taught all of my classes. Shes so knowledgable and passionate, clear about what she wants from you, & shes always more than happy to help you when youre confused/stuck. Her lectures are informative & funny. Just show up to class, communicate with her, & youll pass no problem.

Dr. Rand is easily my favorite professor Ive ever had  wish she taught all of my classes. Shes so knowledgable and passionate, clear about what she wants from you, & shes always more than happy to help you when youre confused/stuck. Her lectures are informative & funny. Just show up to class, communicate with her, & youll pass no problem.

Absolutely love Dr. Rand. One of the nicest professors I've ever had and for a history elective, I really enjoyed the class. There's a lot of writing but she makes it really clear what she's looking for and always helps when you need it. Lecture can be dry sometimes but she is so funny. Definitely recommend if you have the option!

The lecture doesn't match up to anything we do outside of the classroom which makes it pointless to even go to the lectures. Very dry teaching style and the class just seems very unorganized. Takes forever to grade assignments but usually isn't a tough grader at all. Wouldn't take her class again

Dr. Rand is, without a doubt, one of, if not THE most amazing Professors at CSU's Dept. of History. I would put her next to Dr. Shelley Rose, and Dr. Thomas Humphrey (Dept. Chair) as the top three Professors you MUST take. HOWEVER, ONLY if you are seriously committed to your future, your grade, and your passion (history). If not, avoid.

Took this class out of sheer interest, but am glad I did. Dr. Rand is incredibly helpful. I encountered a health issue early on in the semester and she was so awesome in helping me get through the class and pass with flying colors. Her lectures are lengthy and somewhat boring, but I would definitely take her again just because she's a great person!

She is a very nice professor and genuinely care about how you are doing. The best way to get ahold of her is email and she isn't a fan of technology but will give extra time if needed because of a tech issue

Great professor. She's very helpful and encourages discussion. The class runs on lecture and discussion, so read and don't be afraid to participate. There are 5 books for the class and you have to read a lot, but the readings aren't long. There's 1 large term paper and 5 small analyses, which are 2-3 pages each. NO EXAMS.

Bill is great, both as a professor and as a person. He takes the time to get to know his students and you can tell he genuinely wants them to succeed.
