He makes you work for the A while providing all the tools you need to succeed, so long as you put the effort in. One of the best professors in the entire department. I would recommend him to anyone.

Professor Ransom is the best! He is not an easy A, but he makes you work for good grades. When the semester is over, you walk out of the class with so much more knowledge that you came in with. Very enjoyable semester!
All information for exams are in lectures and packets that are handed out. Exams are impossible if you don't study. He is more than happy to help with studying techniques and practicing.

I took 3 courses with him. he likes to talk a lot. Sometimes it's boring but the course material is the most difficult part. If you interact with him he gets much better at explaining and he gives you lots of quizzes so that you stay on track. Drops your lowest scored because he wants you to succeed! Wants you to build off of previous classes

I took 3 courses with him. he likes to talk a lot. Sometimes it's boring but the course material is the most difficult part. If you interact with him he gets much better at explaining and he gives you lots of quizzes so that you stay on track. Drops your lowest scored because he wants you to succeed! Wants you to build off of previous classes
Not really knowledgeable of the course materials, gives hard exam problem and a tough grader.
Professor Rarick is very fair and truly cares. You must read the book and practice as many problems as possible to be successful.
Avoid at all cost! Avoid at all cost! Avoid Avoid Avoid!

Everything is on a Powerpoint, which is posted. He reads straight from it, BUT takes attd. Show up to class b/c he announces quizzes (1 per 2 weeks) and emphasizes what is important for quizzes. Quiz/HW is 50%, 12-14 pg paper is 25%, & final 25% of grade. No presentation (which the other prof. make you do). Very easy A if you read slides & do HW.
Being Relatively Invested About Nonscheduled/Scheduled Quizzes Usually Impacts Rarrick's Encouragement, Keeping Students Unreasonably Captivated Knowingly Shows, Care Or Charismatic Kindheartedness

Instead of just using BlackBoard, he spread everything all over the place on a separate class website, BlackBoard for powerpoints, and this really garbage extra website that is constantly going down to turn in really important papers. His lectures are useless. Attendance required. Tests on completely useless information.  Strict in stupid ways.

Rick Rarick has to be hands-down one of the best professors I've ever had. Completely redeveloped my understanding of electrical circuits and components. I definitely would not have graduated without this guy backing me up.

Great Professor! He wants you to understand the topic and the importance in the industry. Tests are related to lecture so very important to take notes and be there. Very Understandable professor and will answer questions to full extent. No Phone Use! Homework given often but not too terribly difficult. There is a project at the end of the semester

Great Professor! He wants you to understand the topic and the importance in the industry. Tests are related to lecture so very important to take notes and be there. Very Understandable professor and will answer questions to full extent. No Phone Use! Homework given often but not too terribly difficult. There is a project at the end of the semester

He's caring and understands the industry i.e. projects outweigh exams significantly.  His engineering methods are a little old school but overall I give him a 5 out of 5 by far if you compare him to many other professors I experienced at CSU.

Dr. Rashidi has an unorthodox teaching style that is very effective.  He doesn't give much homework at all and the exams are super easy, yet.....I learned so much!  This professor might make class a little boring with how easy class can be but that's a good thing if he's just that effective at teaching, right?
He was the best teacher I have had in my schooling career! Willing to help students, gives retakes, and nobody fails his class.
Very good.
A very good teacher. I did very well in his class.
Pretty good professor.  Willing to help students.

Dr. Rauschert seemed very knowledgeable about her subject and her section was the most interesting to me. She was a bit of a harsh grader on quizzes but was willing to work with the students. It's a good idea to go to the study sessions for this class. I really enjoyed her class and would recommend her.

Dr. Rauschert seemed very knowledgeable about her subject and her section was the most interesting to me. She was a bit of a harsh grader on quizzes but was willing to work with the students. It's a good idea to go to the study sessions for this class. I really enjoyed her class and would recommend her.

Very nice professor, but tests are DIFFICULT. Basic concepts were taught in lecture, but quizzes were based on applied knowledge. We never practiced any questions similar to what is seen on exams, making it somewhat unfair. There are definitely better options for a professor out there.

very kind and accessible professor and her recorded lectures are very easy to follow and informative. test questions and grading were fair. very little homework and it was easy (just dsms, 1-3 per week)

To be honest, out of all the professors of BIO202, she was the best. She had side stories that she would tell us, made biology interesting, and seemed like she really enjoyed the material she was presenting. The quizzes are difficult and we had to pretty much watch pre-recorded lectures (it felt like you had to teach yourself).
terrible teacher, doesnt care about students, rude, makes quizzes unbelievably difficult-- save yourself time and money and dont take her class

Dr. Rauschert is an amazing professor. She is very well spoken and interesting to listen to. Her lectures are fun and the whole class enjoys them. The material isn't too hard, but you do have to study and memorize some stuff. The quizzes aren't bad either, pretty easy as long as you attend lecture and study a little on your own time

If I am being honest, she is a nice lady. But this semester she was awful. Her and the other profs for this class made this class a hundred times harder than it already is. Adding short answers that are not even clear and we dont know what they are asking. Those short answers make or break our grades. I have never cried so much because of a class.

Amazing instructor! One of the best bio professors I have had, she is extremely interested in plants, and I think of her specialties is invasive species. She brings all her energy into class, and makes class super exciting with real world stories. Slides may seem long, but her exams are very fair. She will not test on anything she did not cover. :)

Dr. Rauschert is a very nice lady. She interacts with the students and loves questions even in a big huge lecture hall. Tests are not easy or hard, just your average biology test. No curves were give due to classes being online because of COVID but usually there is a small adjustment in exam scores.

Dr. Rauschert is great at explaining the course material. She also drops a lot of hints about what will be on her exams. Don't let her slow pace and good explanations fool you though, she definitely expects you to read the textbook too.

Nice guy, but does not lecture on what will be on the test (make sure you get the book). Semester was strictly speeches. Also, most of his grading on outlines and speeches was subjective. Learned virtually nothing other than gaining more confidence speaking in front of others.

He's a great professor! His lectures DO focus on parts from the book, but more so in a class discussion manner. His exams are not insanely easy or hard. Just study. Also, show up! Although attendance isn't mandatory, the lectures/discussions are interesting and sometimes they challenge you to empathize and think outside the box.

This professor is almost too liberal to function. Lectures are painful to sit through, although they're not mandatory. If your political opinion doesn't match his, your essays and exams will be docked points without explanation.  This Interracial Communications course focused on racial political issues- nothing to do with communication!

Professor Ray has been one of my favorites at CSU, he's genuine and really knows about the topics, he even wrote one of the books for our class. His lectures are interesting, as well as the movies we watch in class. He really likes participation and it helps take in more of the info.

Dr. Ray is a very sweet professor. He will give you back points on your test if he sees that the class struggled. The tests are hard but he tries to work with you. The class is engaging but he does not lecture much on what will be on the test.

Only three tests and a paper in the class, so there is not much room for error. His tests are fairly difficult because his lectures usually don't match the questions asked, so you really need to read the textbook. He will give points back on tests if a lot of students answer incorrectly, which is nice.

This class consisted of two tests, a final, and a 6-10 page paper. You absolutely need to read the book, as Dr. Ray does not lecture on what he tests on. He is a really sweet professor, but definitely does not adequately prepare you for the exams.

Ray is a nice guy but his lectures lean left (very bias). He gives long tests that are essay mixed with multiple choice. You have to study for them or you'll drown fast. There is a lot of info to absorb and the lectures bored me. The book he wrote will help you for the tests. Only 2 assignments. Doesn't take attendance ever.
Took Dr. Ray for Public speaking course, 4 speeches, 2 tests. Test evaluations were very clear. Gives good feedback and helpful.

5 assignments all semester that were worth points, 2 were papers (1 a group project due during finals) and the other 3 are test, no opportunities for more points so if you do bad on his test you will fail the class, the test are all about memorization and not multiple choice, will not take again
Dr. Ray is a fantastic professor and a master in his field. He's well worth learning from.

Professor Ray is such a sweet man.  I barely went to class and still got an A. You have to read the books in order to pass. If a lot of people did bad on a test he would curve the grade to help them out. He doesn't know how to cut people off, because he's so nice, so the class gets off track at times. Overall, interesting class.

he was an awful professor. he said that we could ask questions about the study guide to his email but when i did all he said was we discussed that in class. clearly i need your help and you are not willing to give it. DON'T TAKE THIS CLASS

Really a great professor. You can tell he is enthusiastic about the material and really knows what he is talking about. The exam can be tricky because of the essay questions but the study guide sets you up perfectly for the exam. Just read and study and you'll be fine. Partner essay was the only really annoying part

Dr. Ray is knowledgeable of his discipline and sticks pretty much with his curriculum although he does allow time for discussion in class.  If you come to class and study for tests from the study guide you will do well.  Be prepared to do a lot of reading; we went through four textbooks during one semester.

he is an okay professor. His grading is fair and does help you if you need it. Don't expect stimulating lectures though.  Lectures were really boring, but he called on people randomly so you have to try and pay attention. He is nice however and he occasionally includes a joke here and there.

He is a very nice guy and has a good knowledge on the subject. However he tends to call on people randomly and when he grades his test he tends to rewrite the whole question if you got it wrong.  I stopped going halfway through since he sent us the study guide through email and the notes are on Electronic Course Reserve and still getting a B.

Took this class in the summer, 2010. He had not taught it in a while. He is passionate about the subject but does let the class get a bit out of hand. Said what was on the test but it wasn't always accurate, still need to study book. Curved test when everyone did poorly. Would take one of his classes again.
Attendance is not manditory but if you go to class you will get better grades on the test. Study the review guides and know them well. Find a good partner for the final paper.
Buy the book, read it and show up for tests. Nice guy, but boring! The material was like beating a dead horse.

Super approachable, and very informative. Dr. Razaque knows what he is talking about and won't hesitate to give you more information. Dr. Razaque actually teaches, and doesn't read from power points. Very refreshing.

This man is without a doubt the best professor I have ever had. He actually teaches  without use of power point slides, he actually teaches you skills and how to do things if you ask i.e. research, hands-on-experience etc. Very honest and blunt, but beneath the no nonsense is truly a man who cares very much about his students and work.
Dr. Abdul is amazing professor and he seems professional from his way of teaching and treating his students. He cares a lot to students. I would recommend to take course with him.

Abdul is great instructor. The students who criticize him that are not willing to work in true sense. He is so nice by nature and willing to support. I will be recommending this professor to take a course with him

Really good teacher who knows a lot.  He expects students to put in a good effort.  If they do, then they should do well.  Don't expect to skip class/do zero work and get a good grade.  Show up to class, work hard on your paper, do the homeworks and labs, and you'll be fine.

Teacher was really nice to me.  However, he will put you on blast in front of the whole class if you do something wrong.  He makes you work for your grade.  He gives you chances.  He loves research so expect a research paper.  Make sure you write down everything he writes on the board.  He's an old school teacher so don't expect fancy slides.

He tries to get your final paper published, which is a horrible experience. Please just don't do it because it gives him unnecessary credit. Also he is very vague in his teaching methods, jumping between topics like some sort of boring tourretes .
He is excellent teacher
great teacher. gives you clear coverage of topics. it is demanding and sometimes he takes a long time giving projects back, but you should definitely take with Dr. Abdul
He is highly cooperative teacher and gives feedback on each assignment.
He is truly amazing teacher and he knows how to care the students.
He is highly knowledgeable professor and he teaches his course without using slides that shows he knows everything. I recommend to take course with him.

Dr. Abdul is really special. When I took his class then I had different mind set what teaching methodology he would apply, but I feel blessed that his teaching method is super and he knows his stuff completely.

This is my third year in Cleveland State University. I have never seen any knowledgeable professor like Dr. Abdul Razaque. His teaching method is highly amazing. I will recommend to take course with this professor.

Truly well organized. Urges you to concentrate on the topic rather than just scribble notes. One of few profs here who openly encourages questions and participation. Tests are not easy, but also very manageable in terms of study material.
Down to earth professor and highly knowledgeable in this course
Dr. AR is inspiring professor and I improved my skills in this course particularly in research.

Outstanding and highly dedicated professor. I learnt research skills taking his course. Now, I am confident that I can do research in any field with little efforts. Thanks Dr. Abdul for your support throughout semester. I was upset and afraid because of grade, but you really justified with me...

He is the nicest teacher I have ever had. He is dedicated and his questions and homework are longer but clear enough if you already overview his lectures. He treats so friendly and is highly honored by students. His Quizzes and final tests need profound understanding of his lectures, otherwise you will not be able to complete in time.

Dr. Razaque is outstanding and his wisdom and dedication makes me think and dream if i could become like him. he has knowledge which is just sufficient for another mellinium. guys do not expect him to extend your deadlines and give exceptions he made certain set of rules and he follows them. i suggest students to take course with him
Took her at Tri-C and she was very quick on lecture since a 1 day a week class. I learned a lot of useful information and would look to take another class to become proficient at excel and access.

Probably the worst professor I have ever had. She wants to cover so much material that we couldn't even cover it in class. Very vauge and said things and then went back on them. The positive thing I can say is that she definitely knows what she is talking about. She needs to better manage class time and not talk about things that do not matter.

It was her first taching in CSU. She wanted us to prepare things before she tought. Tone of her voice was so monotone and everyone was bored to death in her class. She made people sleepy. Do not take this class from her.
Awful.
I had Reece before and after taking it with him this past semester he was completely different. He lightened up a lot and made the course fairly simple. CSU will miss him.

I took two classes with Reece in the same semester, recommend you don't do that. He never clarifies assignments. They're pretty much subjective and if you ask him to explain, he'll just tell you write whatever. But you'll get a C or lower. Overall, I didn't learn anything. (A lot group work)

Took 465&487 with him, A in both. He does not teach from powerpoint,which is very refreshing. Expects a lot of students,but considering he teaches senior courses that is only fair.Grades fair, helpful,funny,&generally a nice guy.Students who complain about his class usually are the ones who cant bother to pay attention and expect to coast.

All assignments are based on your writing; if he doesn't like it he just marks it completely wrong. Will knock off nearly 50% of the grade if you have a minor format problem, which was never thoroughly explained in the first place. Hands out failing grades on assignments along with comments like ?good analysis? and ?well written.?
Very boring, didnt learn much in class, tests are easy and are very open ended.  Lectures drag, so if you have a laptop, bring it.  I did most of my other classes homework during his lectures

This class is a capstone.  So, you do expect that it will most likely challenging. If you put in the time to study, read, listen and above all come to class you'll do fine.  However, if you don't attend class much, expect someone to spoon feed you the material this is not the professor for you. You earn grades with this guy.  Effort is needed.

Interesting guy but his lectures tend to deteriote into rambles as he tries to teach through anecdotes. His tests however come mostly out of the book with some short answer based on his lectures. The biggest part of the class was the project he required. Not terribly difficult if you are willing to put in th effort and show up.
Dont take him...he sucks..No one in the class did well...test are diff...he sucks

He doesn't use notes, he just talks and talks and talks.. His review for the test has nothing to do with what's going to be on the test.  His tests are very detailed but his 12 page project is easy.. You have to read each chapter on ur own, and I guess you'll be fine... but i didn't enjoy his class one bit.
He gives u a group project that you will work on all semester......his tests are impossible to ace.  very boring. mono tone and no notes at all~ he just talks!
I recommend taking this course in the summer if you can. But either way you'll be required to do a 12 page paper with a group of his chosing. It wasn't as bad for me as i hear its been for others.
No Comments
He has great personality

Best college professor I've ever had! I learned so much from him this semester. Perfect professor to teach the MBA capstone class. He makes everything very interesting and uses real world business examples. Highly recommend A+++++

Dr. Reed was easily my favorite professor at CSU. He is very informative and brings light to many topics in class.  I found him and his lectures very interesting, and all his assignments were manageable.  Expect to put some effort into the final project, and choose your group wisely and you will do well.

Dr. Reed is the perfect guy professor for the capstone class.  Hes very intelligent with knowledge both academic and practical.  He teaches stuff you can use in your career.  He helped me understand why companies succeed and fail, and how to take action to make my company better.  Id take him again if I had the chance.
Professor Reed is a wonderful teacher. He's genuinely interested, clever and knows his material. I would recommend everyone take him if they get the chance.
Great dude.  You get as much as you give in this class.  You ask for help, he offers.  Take advantage of a teacher that is this willing to be helpful.

Dr. Reed really knows his stuff, he's smart and has lots of experiences. His lectures were hard sometimes but if we pay attention, we can learn a lot. Exam was tough and tricky. Presentation wasn't that bad. He wants to see your flow of logic in your analysis. No curve in his class, but he's really nice guy.

The multiple choice test is actually difficult. The majority of the class does poorly due to poor wording of the test which was created by the department. It is based off of the lectures, the textbook and the cases. I believe the course focuses to heavily on the textbook. Lots of group/project work.  Nice person.
I do not recommend him.

Pretty funny guy and a bit of a Star Wars nerd. It was literally the most fun I've ever had in math. He made calc II easy ... series and sequences are difficult and he made it easy and had handouts for every chapter that explained problems step by step.
Professor Reed is the kindest lady I've ever met, she truly cares about her students and takes time to make sure you succeed. I would choose her as my professor again in a heartbeat.
Professor Reed is the kindest lady I've ever met, she truly cares about her students and takes time to make sure you succeed. I would choose her as my professor again in a heartbeat.

I loved Professor Reed she was the best! I wish she taught ENG 201 when I was taking it because I definitely wouldve switched to her class. But she is such a great woman and she shows that she cares about your grades! 10/10
Great Professor. Very understanding and kind.
A sweetheart. Connects the class together. Never had a better English teacher. She was so great I had to beg my adviser to let me join her class.

Super nice person. The worst part of her class is writing papers but she does a great job preparing and helping you write them. You have to go to class to pass but she puts off a goofy, happy vibe that makes it a good English class.
Professor Reed was very sweet, patient, and knowledgeable. Although my class was small and sometimes we would not always get to work, she was still so kind.
She was very nice
Honestly love Professor Reed. Such a sweetheart and very helpful!!! Would take again and again and again!

Professor Reed is one of the nicest professors in the English department. She is always extremely kind to her students and offers help. When talking to her, you can tell she genuinely cares about you as a student and wants you to succeed. The workload is very small and it was overall an enjoyable class to be a part of.

Dr. Mundell is a good professor. I took him during the summer and it was a rushed class as expected of any class taken in the summer. But his test and quizzes aren't very difficult or long, the most question you can expect to see on an exam is 30 questions. He does help people outside of class, but his class is a lot of work as any Gen Chem 1 class

Dr. Mundell is a good professor. I took him during the summer and it was a rushed class as expected of any class taken in the summer. But his test and quizzes aren't very difficult or long, the most question you can expect to see on an exam is 30 questions. He does help people outside of class, but his class is a lot of work as any Gen Chem 1 class
he is a great professor always engaging the students in lecture and he makes a boring topic interesting.

At CSU, this class is required for most programs. That means if you don't pass or receive a passing grade, you will need to take it again. Jerry mentioned in one the first lectures that half of his students pass and half are retaking. This is not a problem for other professor, so I think that statistic says more about the professor than style.

Dr. Mundell is the nicest person ever! He highly respects all students in his class, he is willing to help students out. I am his SI leader for semesters: I really enjoy working with him---because he is very friendly and supportive! He will make the class fun and productive; if you ever need help, he is THE professor to ask!!!
Dr. Mundell always complains about people yawning during his lectures & is he's  condescending if you don't know the material. He doesn't allow laptops & he makes the class boring & unbearable

He is an excellent teacher of a pretty tough subject. Dr. Mundell is more than willing to set aside time for study sessions etc...His tests can be pretty tough, if don't show up for lectures you will not do well in this class. He also gives quizzes designed to help students make up bad scores on tests. Overall he is a tough but very fair.
Very good teacher, with a though talking, no nosense approach that makes learning easy. Eventually he will write a recommendation letter for me.

Actually made Chemistry understandable.  Will go out of his way to make sure everyone understands before moving on.  Holds special study sessions--even on weekends.  Is always on campus and available.  Still not an easy A, but if you put in effort, an A is possible!

The lab was not taught because he is a lab manager who can hire TAs. His TA whose name sounded like Sabile (male) teaching me was irresponsible and impatient. The TA changed the grading method himself. They weren't helpful. 1 lab manual that was written by a CSU Chem Teacher (probably Joseph J. Reed-Mundell) had many mistakes and unclear procedures

Best Professor. Always has time for his students, he makes sure you understand the material and makes chemistry fun and interesting. I learned so much from him. He also gives extra classes (sessions) out of his busy schedule to tutor students and go over problems.He doesn't get paid for it either.He loves to teach and has great knowledge.

He has got to be the best professor ever! He really goes out to clarify anything you don't understand and won't take the test until everyone knows the subject. He gives out curves, grades fairly, and has great knowledge and experiences. Take him for the second part as well. Take him if you have to! You will be glad that you did!
made chemistry interesting to me!  great teacher!

One of the best prof's I've ever had. He has a very motivating style, As he says "I"m not going to SPOONFEED the material to you!", but he taught the material very WELL and he was (way more than normal) willing to help individuals.

He is an excellent professor! at one point i wasnt even in his class and he still helped me and let me sit in his lectures. You have to put in some work but it is definitly worth the effort. He is the MOST HELPFUL professor you could have and will give you all the help you need!

this guy loves to teach, and it shows. he is probably the best chemistry teacher i have met. he has optional classes (for which he does not get paid) for students who need extra help. i almost cried when i found out the lecture was assigned to another teacher!

Had no interest whatsoever. Took the class to get credit for a transfer to another college. At the mid-term I had 102% and it dropped by 5 points by the end of the semester. He loves to teach and his labs help out too.
No Comments
Love this guy!  he really loves the subject and enjoys teaching.  A+++
I got an A in general chem 2. i hate chemistry but he made it learnable.
I really enjoyed his class, he is one of the few teachers in this school that actually wants to give out good grades.  He wants his students to succeed.  A great teacher.

He was the head of my lab. The TA didn't like to answer questions,would get frustrated easily, didn't speak english, and most importantly she didn't enforce google safety of any other safety precautions in a chemisrty lab.

This is the best professor ever! His name is Joseph Jerry Reed-Mundell. He also comes under as Jerry on this website. He gives out his own time to teach students such as extra tutoring! Because of him I was able to advance to Organic Chemistry! Best professor!
Everything taught by him become boring
His lecture was quite boring.  He did not respond much in teaching lab even though he is a lab manager just because he hired irresponsible TA Sabile.

She is difficult for online because there is discussions and tests for the modules that are heavy material with tegrity, videos and articles. Very little opportunity for extra credit except for discussion and final so do best on every exam or quiz!
Whether you need this class or need an elective, you won't regret taking her. Has a great reputation and I know why. Prepares you for tests and doesn't give tedious assignments. Love her!

Each class she gives extra credit, so it makes sense to show up and participate. Plus her exams consist of questions from lectures and guest speakers. She's phenomenal, doesn't make you buy the book, and is so organized with EVERYTHING! the material is already interesting and she makes it even better. Felt very reassured the first day of class.

Wendy is a phenomenal professor. She gives great feedback and is always willing to help students grasp concepts or to set up personal appointments. She is very understanding and willing to put in the effort to help her student succeed. I recommend her to all of my sociology peers.
Amazing Professor
Wendy is AMAZING. I am so bad at math, and if I did not take her for my stats class I would have been DONE, she helped me BIG time. I got a B! not bad for someone who is that bad in math.

This is the first class I have taken of hers and I absolutely loved it. She is an amazing professor and the class was really interesting too. There is no book in the class, the test are all comprehensive, and she gives ample opportunity for you to receive a good grade. I definitely recommend her classes.

Excellent instructor. Very interesting class. She was very helpful. No text but there were articles to read. Do the readings and come to class and should do well. One of the best instructors I've had.

Took a dry subject (statistics) and kept student interest. Builds on prior information in a very intuitive way. Homework assignments were not just grade-padding but actually useful, and she actually puts corrections in the homework instead of just check or x so you can learn from your mistakes. Best professor I've had at CSU. Highly recommended.

Awesome professor! Must be present to get credit for in-class assignments. Reading the textbook is required, as her class lectures differ from the readings, and material from both sources show up on her midterm and final. Tests are not hard IF you put the effort into the class. Definitely one of the best SOC courses I have ever taken!
great prof! explained things clearly. did need book at all times for reference. great class overall

Really awesome prof.  Go to class and take good notes, most of the test comes from lecture notes, very few from the readings.  Not "easy" but you'll learn a ton.  Approachable and answers questions clearly.
Best Professor at Cleveland State! Not easy, but very interesting and class goes by quickly. Would recommend her for any class she teaches, especially Interpersonal Violence.
Great Professor. Must attend class. Homework repares you for the exams. Got to work for an A. Take her
fair. somewhat challenging- gotta go to class.
Fairly easy tests. She lectures a lot and we also get together in groups a every other class. She is very nice and the textbook you can just scan over.
Awesome professor! Definitely made the class interesting! Pay attention and go to class and you will get a good grade! Would definitely take her again!
Class was straight theory so kinda boring.  She knows her stuff!... & seems fair.  Sort of intimidating, definitely hott

everyone is so nervous to take stats, but it was so easy. the class before the exam we went over a review, the exams were usually 3 problems and the review went over examples of problems just like the ones on the test, we were allowed to use any notes on the exam. there is hw every week but its usually only a couple problems.
Excellent professor. Class notes are exact on material on exams. Interesting subjects and dialogue. Overall best professor in Sociology Department.
Professor Reho is a tremendous instructor.

Very knowledgable in nutrition and exercise.   Genuinely listens to students, cares, and wants to help them.   Was very kind in extending due dates for various papers on the syllabus, to give us more time to complete them.  Listens to students if they have questions, concerns.  Explains things well, good examples, liked going to class very much.

Professor Reho was absolutely amazing!  She genuinely cared about her students succeeding and doing well. She is more than willing to help out any students who need the help and answers her emails extremely quick. She is so positive  and is very enthusiastic about what she's teaching , you automatically start feeling the same way. Awesome  overall!

Loved this Professor!  Happy!  It's a Writing Class, so you have to write papers. But This Prof helps with great feedback in the writing, gives helpful study guides prior to exams.  Answers emails very quickly.  Labs are fun! She is very interested in making sure that her students succeed.  Broke our Final into 2 tests to help us learn.  Very cool!
Interesting and fun!  She's pretty and super nice

One of the best Professors I've had!  She's really enjoys what she teaches, has interesting experiences & stories to share.  She genuinely cares and wants to help students, and reaches out to help them succeed.  Very personable and enthusiastic. Fun teacher!  Flexible & understanding. I always looked forward to her classes. Labs were great.

Dr. Reho is a great professor but can seem jumbled. She would sometimes get her classes mixed up and she ended up removing a third of the projects originally assigned in the syllabus. But the course was interesting and the labs were fun. She is very helpful and understands that things come up, so she's flexible if you need an extension.

We were all doing well & then it was like she fell off the planet no email response, or grade for a paper 4 3wks & unclear final expectations. Class was very informative throughout the semester, but how do you have the whole class thinking theyre doing well then drop people 1-2 letter grades & not explain why. Never got a response from her.
Just no.
He was okay. But do not recommend.
Do not buy the textbook
Not the best. Very difficult.
Would not recommend him.

He is a genuinely nice guy, but he answers questions very vaguely and does not give you a very good idea of what will be on the exam. He also often makes test problems harder/more involved than what he went over in the lecture.
Completely bombed the final but still got a B.  Can't complain.  Very available to help students.  Great Finance teacher.

This is a tough class with a tough prof. Hes a nice guy but his tests are very hard even with multiple formula sheets. Be sure to try to stay awake in his class because most of the things covered in class are on the tests. He keeps you the entire 3 hours and sometimes later.

He is a very nice guy. Print out and pay attention to his powerpoint presentations. He will tell you which topics will be covered on the exams. With that being said his exams are very tough. You get to bring a couple formula sheets to the exams but that still doesnt seem to be enough. Read the chapters and understand all the material.
Teaches off book a lot, and tests from lectures, so be prepared.  Helpful, approachable, generally enjoyed learning from  him.

Does not test on what he teaches and gives vague answers to questions.  He is fine if you already know the material (if you have Finance undergrad or work in finance) other then that he does not answer questions to anyone's satisfaction.  Also he is a capital markets guy and teaches more derivatives then corp finance (doesn't get through material).

What a mistake. If I had known he was teaching this class, I would not have registered, under "any" condition. Embarassment to the College.  He can't teach, isn't fair, arrogant, sent us all on a wild goose chase. How does he keep this job...He's a disaster

Does not test on what he teaches and gives vague answers to questions. I took this class to learn about derivatives - however he droned on about monetary policy for two months and was unable to finish all the course topics.

I was energized to take my first finance course. This guy shattered my dreams and left a dent in my GPA. There was no correlation between lectures and exams. In his defense, it is not an easy subject and he apparently knows it very well. However, I'm not asking to make exams easier, but it would be nice to be tested on what you're studying for.

To be fair he is rather knowledgeable about the topic.  However he has no poor ability in transferring that knowledge.  His lack of clarity makes it tough to comprehend anything.  He is also EXTREMELY opinionated and has no problem passing them off as facts. He is obviously an uber liberal and pro regulation based on repeated opinions on the subjec
The single most boring person I have ever seen in my life. I was unable to stay awake through a single class. Avoid this man if at all possible!

i did not enjoy having him as a teacher.  it was not because he was a "hard" teacher, it is because he does not clearly explain the concepts related to the class and makes you buy his notes, which does not correlate with the book at all so if you want to study or go over difficult concepts you are basically hopeless
He is a unique individual, but students are given more than enough opportunities to pass the class. He sticks pretty close to the text.

Brilliant professor!!! Learned so much from him. Am incredibly indebted to him because I learned so much from him. May not be easy but I do  not want him to be. Clearly on of the greats. He should be nominated for a teaching award and be recognized by the university for his work. Keep up the great work!

Don't buy the actual book, you won't use it.  You have to buy his own notes for $15 which is all he really uses.  Constantly forgets what he says regarding quizzes, treats students unfairly.  His notes are hard to understand and not very legible, quizzes don't have much to do with what was taught.  Likes to argue.  Overall not recommended.

HAHAHA is all I can say. Pretty sure he is one of the super smart people who thinks everyone else just gets the material as easily as he did. Not a professional person when it comes to handing his questions with a student to say the least. I would rather be an unemployed homeless for the rest of my life then take this poor excuse of a teacher

this is the worst teacher you will ever have. He contridicts material in the text book and confuses students. He is not helpful but rather rude. He needs to be fired. YOU WILL REGRET TAKING HIS CLASS. I opted to pay the $1300 in withdraw fees b/c he is so boring and terrrible at teaching, just walk by his class everyone wants to shoot themselves.
He's a kind man with a lot of life experience His guide points are clear for all exams and extra credit is present throughout the semester he's an honest Gem
He's a kind man with a lot of life experience His guide points are clear for all exams and extra credit is present throughout the semester he's an honest Gem

Professor Reminick was a pleasant surprise. He was both, funny, and engaging. His stories were always interesting. He could take me away to where I could visualize the people, and places just from hearing the story. No doubt, interesting, and by all means, my pleasure.

Reminick tells the wildest stories.  He basically just talks about his experiences and lets you ask him questions. He also shows intense and crazy films. I really enjoyed hearing his stories and the information you can learn from them. Also, he looks like he's in his late 50s but don't be fooled he is in his mid 70s.
Ron is absolutely amazing, and you can do as much extra credit as you want! He shows awesome movies and his lectures are not dry at all!

This class is boring. It is not really hard as long as you attend class ( if not find a new friend who will attend class to get the notes from them). Papers are easy as well in which most of the time you can say anything that relates to the topic.

His lectures are boring and lack structure and he supplements his poor teaching ability with readings and about 50 movies which are also boring. That being said he is a really cool guy and is very passionate about Ethiopia. I just didn't care for his teaching.

This class was pretty boring, but it was not hard at all if you pay attention and take notes. I didn't really read AT ALL, but I had good notes and if I had to look back in the assigned books, they were helpful. His handwriting can be hard to read, but he is a nice and exuberant old man lol

Funny, nice, and very smart. Repeats stories A LOT. Kind of a lot of reading and the tests can be somewhat difficult but the essays are very easy and there is  lot of extra credit offered so it balances out. (Had him for ANT102 and ANT271).
The professor had many good stories and the test were easy. The reading was interesting but boring. The professor does not have power point notes and gives a lecture a loud.

Ron is a really nice person, and has interesting stories.  He's very good amount helping people make up work/tests.  His tests are pretty easy as long as you pay attention.  He also offers extra credit essays at the end of each test.  I could not see anybody getting below a C in this class.

He is full of interesting random stories. He knows his subject. Exams are not that hard, and he barely pays attention to students while they are doing their exams ;). Some decent amount of reading, which is not really interesting though. I took this class with my female nerdy friend, that had helped me a lot.
Good stories and pretty easy with makeup work or tests if your sick. However can be very boring and easy to fall asleep in. Lots of reading! Don't take if you hate reading

The material was easy enough, but his tests were inconsistent and very often had vague questions on them that could have more than one multiple choice answer. He's a funny guy and usually has interesting things to say when hes not talking about course material. Just be sure to read and pay attention to study guides.

LOVED his Ethiopia class!! super easy!! He's a very laid back guy and if you can't make it to an exam he will let you do a take home test! i enjoyed his class so much i signed up for another class of his in the spring.

besides the fact that he is 72, he is pretty funny for his age. The class is hard at first because he expects you to read so much,but as long as you take notes during class you're fine.And he has a review day before each test. Not that hard.
He is a nice guy, but only talks about Ethiopia! He barely covers any material, but he is an easy grader too. If you really want to learn anthropology, I would not recommend him.
He is an easy professor! He has tons of random stories that he tells during class. Lectures are a bit unstructured and boring. Reviews for all exams. Take this class if you need an easy A.
WAAY too much reading.. does he know we have other things to do besides read for his class?? SUPER boring too, good luck holding attention in his class!!
A very nice guy as a person, so so as a prof. The ethiopia class got a little too intense with minute details which were BORING.
Very entertaining and interested in his work. His anecdotes about his trips in Africa and other places make the class very interesting.

Professor Renna taught ECON during the pandemic. I would be interested to take one of his classes in person. He really likes class participation and he really expects that you pay attention to his lectures, posted powerpoints, and additional lecture videos posted every week. If you don't pay attention you WON'T pass. Ask lots of questions.

I had his microeconomics class and it was terrible. I got a B+ in macro but a D in his class actually it was a 69.8 but he chose to round down. This guy is a joke and aggressive I wish I had him in person so I could call him out. He must be on Adderall or speed because he's constantly aggressive but forget he's a weak puny guy and my DI were nicer

This Professor is just not a very good one. Its kind of nice sometimes but acts like a bit of a jerk too. In term of academics, He only post the hardest questions he can find for the exams. He doesnt teach very well to me, i dont always get the material and end reading the text alone. I got a B- geniunly all on my own cause hes no help most time.

I had Renna for econ 202 and he is far and away the absolute worst teacher ive ever had. he doesnt care about his student in the slightest, he is abundantly rude and arrogant. he expects his students to TEACH THEMSELVES his material, and then will proceeded to get dramatically upset when a student doesnt understand anything.

DO NOT TAKE HIM FOR MICROECON!!!! He was one of the worst teachers Ive ever had. Hes really mean for one thing and yells at the class as a whole a lot and his tests are impossible. You have to know the ins and outs of economics to do good on his tests. Im in Macro Econ currently and im doing good since I dont have a terrible teacher anymore

This dudes up there with some of the worst professors I have ever had. He is a jerk and is a bad teacher. His tests are nearly impossible to pass even after hours of studying. Add in the fact the class is online and you are screwed.
I dreaded this class everyday. It was very hard even if you studied and paid attention every class. I also didnt find him to be the nicest professor at times.

Professor Renna taught ECON during the pandemic. I would be interested to take one of his classes in person. He really likes class participation and he really expects that you pay attention to his lectures, posted powerpoints, and additional lecture videos posted every week. If you don't pay attention you WON'T pass. Ask lots of questions.

Resnick gives a ton of homework that kind of sucks, but the exams are open book and open note, so if you do your work and write things down you can have it for your exams. He may get frustrated at times, but he is a funny guy and he is very helpful.

Resnick gives a ton of homework that kind of sucks, but the exams are open book and open note, so if you do your work and write things down you can have it for your exams. He may get frustrated at times, but he is a funny guy and he is very helpful.

Dr. Resnick is a great professor, who presented a nuanced interpretation of classical physics. As for course work, he is trying to teach actual problem solving. This makes him a rare breed. Getting better at problem solving is painful. I struggled with many problems in HW and on exams in this class but am better for it. Don't be discouraged!

Too smart for his own good. If the class doesn't answer a question or answers it wrong he gets very upset. Goodluck on the homework that is due before every class, you have to teach yourself a chapter and answer tough questions. Tests are nothing like the lectures making it impossible to study. Wants you to go to office hours but is very rude there
Fair instructor, go to office hours for extra help! Very supportive! Wants his students to succeed.

Smart guy but expects a lot. I bombed the tests and still somehow got a B. Skipping lectures is fine, he posts all the notes online. 3 exams 1 final. Online homework due each class. The exams are hard, almost impossible to study for but open book. Everyone failed the 2nd exam and he freaked out saying we don't care about science, most still passed.

Resnick was pretty tough. He lectures every class and he writes with permanent marker on printer paper but he'll post the lectures on BB. There's no grade for attendance but i suggest you attend lectures and listen, do ALL the homework, and go to his office after exams because he posts the exams on his board. He grades exams on improvement.

Taught Physics 1 in a way that was too difficult to comprehend. Would lecture the whole class period and do absolutely no example problems; simply derived formulas and lectured. The classroom is flipped, so you have to teach yourself. The tests were hard but all of the answers are online, so you learn nothing. Does not have a grading scale.

Professor Resnick is the goat. Other professors have competitive grading, but Resnick grades on improvement. You basically compete with yourself. Hes also understanding so if you dont do as well on one test hes a believer that everyone has a bad day. Seems intimidating in class, but in office hours he is a cool guy. Very smart. 10/10 recommend.

Yeah, he's tough but he's also fair. I went to office hours and he was always there and willing and able to help. Cool Prof. who runs a lab and works with other students on projects (Physics of Rock and Roll). If you're serious about science, take him.
BEWARE: He conducts a flipped classroom where homework is due before it is discussed in class. Content is not lectured on until after all out-of-class is already due.

It's not the easiest class, but Professor Resnick has office hours and is willing to work with you if you show up for help. Don't think you can skip class or homework. Grades on a curve. Fair - but expects a lot. Good guy.

This class isn't easy, but it's physics so what do you expect? Do your work, pay attention and go to office hours if you need help. Dr. Resnick's tests are all open bookopen notes. He posts answers to homework outside his office. LOOK AT THEM. He puts these on the tests sometimes. Hard but fair. Smart and good guy.

Dr. Resnick is very knowledgeable but obviously too smart for his own good. Seems like he doesn't enjoy teaching and often makes simple concepts very complex. He grades on improvement so don't freak out if your test scores are really low. Just do the homework and maintain a steady improvement in the exams and participate in class and you'll pass.

This professor is a nice guy. I like him as a person but not as a professor.  He does not go over homework nor exams.  If you ask about a homework problem during lecture, he will make you feel like an idiot and tell you to a get tutor.  The test are open bookcomputer but he does not give the students a clue of its format.

Well this class was impossible. Bombed every test and still ended up with a B. everyone in class also bombed everything and everyone got B's as well. Don't drop the class. Just stick it out and it will be fine. As long as you get around 20/50 on the three tests you will get a B. I did that for physics 221 and 222.
VERY hard, but the Prof is good and wants to help you. Tests are open-book and he even uses problems that he has gone over in class. Pay attention, get help and you'll do fine.

This is without a doubt, the hardest teacher I've ever had. The homework takes forever, the tests are almost impossible to get an A on, and he goes extremely fast when lecturing. He's super smart though. You NEED to put the time in to do well in his class. IMO, the class could be way easier, while still learning all the material we need to know.

Tests are extremely difficult. However, he grades you based on effort and if you show up to class. My test scores were 70%,58%, and 40% and I thought I bombed the final but ended up with a B. As long as you do all the homework and show up to class, you will do fine. He encourages out of the box thinking and overall I'd say he's a good teacher.

Many people had issueslast semester, myself included. I thought he was difficult to read. You rarely knew what exactly was going to be on the test. However, if you show up and put in some effort it will be okay. He grades on improvement, which is helpful. Also, tests are 6 questions long and you chose three to do, which is nice! He's an okay guy :)

Dr. Resnick is extremely intelligent and teaches this course in a very challenging manner.  He does not spoon feed information so do not expect to be able to just read the book and show up for the test.  The biggest part of the class is problem solving abilities.
He made the class very interesting. Looked forward to it. Amazing professor
Im taking calculus with Thomas right now and he is a very good teacher. There is a good amount of homework online and occasionally quizzes. He drops a lot of your lowest grades. Id take again

Mr. Reuter is very accessible outside of class and really cares about his students' success. This course has lots of homework, quizzes, and tests. However, he drops the lowest two quiz and lowest five homework grades. He also does an exam replacement policy and offered one retake for any exam.
I thought he was a jerk when I had him but boy did his class help me later. I was surprised how much the stuff I learned from him helped me in other classes. Wish I paid more attention at the time.
I thought he was a jerk when I had him but boy did his class help me later. I was surprised how much the stuff I learned from him helped me in other classes. Wish I paid more attention at the time.
It was fun to be in a class of whiners who thought art was supposed to be a party class when I came ready to work. Take this guy if you want to learn anything.

Russ is definitely one of the best professors I've had the opportunity to learn from! He is tough, but only because he wants to push you to improve and make your degree truly mean something down the road. Stay attentive during his lectures/demos, ask him questions, and be ready to work hard! You'll get just as much respect from him as you give.

By far the best educator in the studio department at CSU. He is extremely tough but it is worth it. Go to class, work 10 hours a week at minimum outside of class, pay attention to the schedules he provides you with and ask for feedback. He will give you the most honest and insightful feedback- if you seek it.

I graduated last year & Russ was the only prof that actually taught anything. All my friends that graduated with me and never took his classes quit doing art and are working restaraunt jobs cuz they didnt know their work wasnt good enough.  Been in 4 art shows since I graduated & sold some pieces which I couldnt of done if Russ didnt push me.

If you looking for an easy art credit do not take this class. It is very tough and time consuming. Russ is tough and sometimes condescending but extremely knowledgeable and as an art major you learn a lot about technique and pushing yourself. Just to warn you I got a c and I was a higher grade. Be prepared to work, improve, and feel defeated.

This class was really time consuming and very expensive and on top of it he's just angry most of the time and rude to students which is too bad because the class could have been super interesting if someone else taught it
WARNING: DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS IF RUSSELL REVOCK IS THE TEACHER. He is extremely inconsiderate, uncompassionate, and is the worst teacher I have ever came across.

Great guy his attitude on life and art inspired me. I really liked that he took art seriously. He is VERY straight forward and tells you his expectations from the first day. Projects are both tedious and time consuming but they are all worth while and taught me a lot. He is always available to help on any of the projects. He appreciates hard work!

He knows his art. But he has a social issue problem communicating his idealism to the students.  He seems to be a person not interested in the student rather he's just an artist, but not a teacher.  He's very dispassionate toward people that don't already know as much as him which is a shame because it makes others uncomfortable around him.

Russ is one of the best teachers an art student could have. If you are serious about art and really want to get better then you should take one of his classes.If you are just another mediocre art education major who thinks kids are cute and you just want to babysit and fingerpaint all day then you you don't deserve his attention.
Russ is the man. He takes his job seriously, which means he wants you to do well. He's very patient and has a lot to offer. Take him

Talk about one h*** of a semester. Russ is really nice outside of class, but he doesn't play around when it comes to art. YOU BETTER get your supplies on time or you'll be "decapitated." On the good side, he is an excellent teacher and I learned so much for being in his class. He states that art isn't suppose to be fun and he is right, trust me.

I learned so much from Russ. Yes he is very demanding with sketch books and attendance. But he is trying to teach discipline, something very important for artists to learn. He expects hard work, just because its art doesnt mean you get to be lazy.
I will admit that he is a really tough professor but... you will learn so much from him.  If you work hard you will earn his respect and make some good art.

His one redeeming quality, competence in his field, is far outweighed by his tendency to treat his class as though it were kindergarden.  Everyone must remain completely silent and at their desks for the entire class period, diligently working on a completely dictated project with so many guidelines there is no room for any original input. He sucks
i cant repeate myself enough DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS if revok is the teacher. he is the worst teacher that i have ever come across.

i learned a lot from this class, it's demanding, but quite helpful if you intend to pursue other art classes. he also allows you to redo an assignment for a new grade. tough teacher where attendance is mandatory. he allows three absences prior to grade being dropped 1/3 letter grade . arrive late or leave early is 1/3 absence.
 take notes. there is
He is very mean to anyone. Probably nobody will get a good grade in his class. He will fail people if they miss 2 more classes.
at first i did not like him, but in the end i learned a lot

Prof Reynolds can come off as rude to others but doesn't seem to have any bad intentions, he's really nice if you get to know him. If you show that you're willing to put the effort into this course by participating in class discussions and doing decently on your presentations you won't have any issues with him. Most people ended up with an A or A-.

Prof Reynolds can come off as rude to others but doesn't seem to have any bad intentions, he's really nice if you get to know him. If you show that you're willing to put the effort into this course by participating in class discussions and doing decently on your presentations you won't have any issues with him. Most people ended up with an A or A-.

This course is essentially taught by students and pretty easy. Professor Reynolds does not do much other than criticize and judge every student- literally. He is a smart mouth professor and does NOT like when you ask him questions, even when he says he does. Also, he is not accessible outside of class. Good luck if you take him, you'll need it.
Professor Reynolds was an okay professor, the class was boring but not a lot of work was given throughout the semester.
Jay Reynold's EVS 206 course was super easy. 4 online multiple-choice quizzes were the only real grades in the entire course. Attendance is not required at all

He tries to be funny but it's just disrespectful. He speaks down to his students like he's better than we are since he's older and he tries to make the questions on the tests "un-google-able" but instead you just have no idea what he's asking. I tried reaching out for help and he was very condescending. Don't take the class unless you have to.

Professor Reynolds isn't as bad as others say. If you don't walk into his class after it starts you won't have a problem with him. He is a stickler to following directions so read them carefully. That said he knows most people aren't taking the class to major in it and wants people to pass. All tests and quizzes online except the final. Easy A.

Professor Reynolds is one of the worst professors I've had. He would teach things in class and then when you would take one of his quizzes/tests it would have nothing to do with what he taught or anything from the readings. If you ask him questions he never gives you a good answer and even if he does give you an answer it usually isn't accurate.

Professor Reynolds was the most condescending professor I have ever had in my entire school career. He is very disrespectful, and gets offended very easily for something very small. Professor Reynolds makes constant derogatory sarcastic remarks and treats the class like we are extremely below him. I HIGHLY recommend you to take another professor.

He has some type of superiority complex to the point he demeans his students and has a noticeable favoritism toward female students. Coming from a female student I see he lets the girls get away with things he would demean the guys for.

This is one of the most disrespectful people I've ever had the displeasure of meeting. If I didn't have to be there, I would not have gone to class. He is rude to women unless he wants something from them, if you know what I mean.

Professor Reynolds is one of the greatest professors I have had. I am a biology major, so this class is really interesting to me and he makes the lectures fun. He makes us answer "clicker" questions every class to prove we pay attention to the lecutres, but the questions are easy if you pay attention. Funny guy, knows his stuff. Great class!

He was condescending/demeaning/arrogant (this was toward the entire class).It seemed as if it would've pained him to reply to questions in any way other than w/ sarcasm. It had nothing to do with the material it was more so his attitude. And he surpassed phrasing questions in a way to prevent regurgitation, it was hard to understand what he wanted.

I loved Professor Reynolds. His lectures were interesting and I thought he was a pretty funny guy. He's extremely helpful, fair and wants his students to succeed but do not expect him to baby you. He treats students like adults so come to class, do the work and you should be fine. I would take him again.

I really don't understand all the good ratings he has on here. Professor Reynolds is rude and demeaning towards his students and looks at you and treats you as if you are stupid when you ask questions. He has a weird obsession with birds and honestly I just don't respect him at all. And this is coming from a straight A student.

Mr. Reynolds is awesome. He is very clear in his teaching and always answers questions. I feel like I'm back in 11th grade biology when I'm in his class (which is great since the teacher in that class was also amazing and I got 98% A in there). It is very easy to catch up if you are behind in his class and he has a very FAIR grading system.

The material is fairly easy to understand except maybe the chemistry section. The quizzes are easy, but a little time consuming. The exams are fair. But this professor is very, very lazy and very slow. Spends a lot of time discussing weekend activities and what goes on in the sky. Easy "A".
Very cool guy. very fun class.
This teacher is very very good! Take him if you get a chance!! He is very passionate about what he does and it inspires the class. Tests are not very hard if you go to class and pay attention.

Prof. Reynolds is great.  He is enthusiastic and very knowledgeable which makes the class extremely interesting.  He is helpful, clear and straightforward.  He wants you to know your stuff so you can pass along your smarts to your future students.
Professor Reynolds is awesome. He explains clearly and he is also very helpful. The class is very interesting and  he got a good sense of humor.
She is very kind and helpful! If you take her classes, you don't have to worry too much!

She has no clear guidelines of what she wants which makes it very difficult to get a good grade from her. horrible feedback and her lectures are just her reading the slides from the PowerPoints. It was constant struggle to get in touch with her. Left class most days felling like I learned nothing and that I had wasted my time.

Doesnt post grades until the end of the semester so youll have no idea how youre doing. Shell tell you youre doing fine but then will post grades at the end of the semester that dont reflect that. Very subjective grader (doesnt follow rubric). Shows up late. Would not recommend this professor to anyone.

Probably the worse professor I have ever had. Does not know how to lecture, is rude to students who seek help, makes easy content difficult, and cannot answer questions or give examples of content "taught". Avoid at all costs.

By far the worst professor I've had at CSU. He is an impossible grader (even when you improve your work based on his suggestions). He is rude and unbelievably condescending toward students. If you HAVE to take a class with him just try to remember why you enjoy design in the first place cause his class and his attitude make you absolutely hate it.

Very nice professor, but hard to pay attention to. He doesn't speak very loudly or clearly, so you basically have to read the text to find out what's happening in the class. Takes forever to grade assignments.
Very knowledgeable on current health care issues, excellent lectures, clear, objective presentation of ethical theories, cares about students.
Loved his Morals class
drones a bit when he lectures, but otherwise very interesting as far as content goes...just need to make it to his class a bit more....
Hanz gave me the lowest grades on my transcript but I later began to respect that because he's one of the few that stays true to his standard and weed out students who should not be engineers
Hanz gave me the lowest grades on my transcript but I later began to respect that because he's one of the few that stays true to his standard and weed out students who should not be engineers

This professor has a very aloof and cold delivery, but if you pay attention and work hard he does take notice. Also I learned a lot about mechatronics from this class because I was scared to death of failing. It's not the most enjoyable classroom but Richter knows his stuff and is a straight shooter.
Had him for three graduate courses, excellent professor tough but fair and willing to help students.

Dr. Richter was one of my favorite professors I've ever had.  Tests will not be easy, but if you understand the material, you should have no problem applying what you learned.  He was a very fair grader and made sure you knew what to expect in the course.  I'd recommend him to anyone.
Nice guy
No Comments
She gives so much extra credit that an A or B+ is easy to get. The amount of assignments is too much. 4-5 per week. She's a really nice lady, but she takes a really long time to grade some stuff

Excellent Professor. Extremely organized. Gives you many good tools to learn the material and succeed in the class. Provides helpful feedback and is very fair. If a student doesn't do well then they are not willing to do the work. One of the best professors at CSU!

She don't have any clear grading criteria in the begging of semester she posted a criteria which was way different than the one she actually used You don't know what would be your grade till the end of your semester

Take her class if you you got ample time to do homework Lots of unnecessary homework . She does not have clear grading criteria . and keep changing syllabus too much unnecessary work and very detail exams which takes forever to do

This is a hybrid class, meaning about half of the classes were online. There's a good amount of work between the online HW/quizzes, MyItLab, a couple projects, exams, and in-class activities, but it is manageable. She's very helpful with the projects and gives great feedback if send her an email. The final was comprehensive. She's a nice lady.

This professor was helpful throughout the semester. You have to do a good amount of work, but it is pretty straight forward. She will give a lot of extra credit opportunities throughout the semester, so if you don't get an A it is because you didn't try hard enough. Great overall and definitely one of the better Accounting Professors at CSU!

Pretty average professor, really. She reads straight from her PowerPoints so you will need to read the chapters for more information. Only two exams, midterm and final (cumulative). She provides a study guide for both; exams aren't insanely tough but they aren't extremely easy either. Go to class, read, do the online assignments, and you'll be fine

She is an awesome professor! Grading is super straight forward it is all points, nothing weighted more heavily. She gives a TON! of extra points if you go to class. I did not do good on the tests, but I have an 85% right now with all the extra points. She is super nice.

Good Course, professor knows the material well and is open to questions. The only negative about the course is that exams/projects take weeks to be returned and you never have a true gauge of your grade.

A lot of work for a 3 credit hour course, but the material isn't difficult.   She's very receptive to questions and very helpful.   It takes a while for her to return assignments and exams but she will give feedback if you ask for it.

Class would have been better if we followed the textbook chapters as organized in the text. Jumping straight into the middle of the text on the first exam wasn?t helpful as the information stressed on material we had yet to learn.  Same with exam #2.  Assignments are returned weeks/months later.  Prof is very smart I learned a lot because of her.

Her lectures follow Powerpoint and her exams follow the PPTs as well. She is very lienent when turning in assignments late. At the end of the semester she gives you 3 large assignments that stresses you out. But she doesn't grade you too hard on the graduate project. She also gives you opportunities to earn extra credit. Great teacher.
Helpful

Riga ran the internet-only course I took.  Email communication was really important for a course like this.  He was a mixture of good and bad in this respect.  When I could get hold of him he was responsive.  However, he actually failed to post a test on the correct day once (and I had taken off work just to do the test) and he didn't notify class.
Helped me as a Composer, and really taught me how to 'feel' a piece and how to make it truly yours. Excellent

I took many classes with Dr. Rindfleisch in my time at CSU, both in private and classroom settings. He's brilliant, and if you go to him hungry he will feed you. I wouldn't be in the position I am in today had it not been for his example, breadth of musical knowledge, and his vested interest in offering his students the best possible experience.

I have absolutely no "beefs" with Professor Rindfliesch. dedicated, honest, decent and forthright. I was very happy with the program that he laid out. I think he has been unjustly treated. We are simply so lucky to have the man at the University. All the Best !!!!

I felt he was incomplete in his lessons in class.  A lot is left to self exploring.  His relationships with the students left much to be desired.  He did have his favorites, including the ones he would spend more time with after class.

Very rude and not a good teacher seems to think that making students feel stupid is a good way to help them learn. grades on a whim, refuses to acknowledge that a student might actually know something. will argue about the most smallest detail even if he is clearly wrong. avoid unless you like to be treated like a child instead of a college student
No Comments
Knows his stuff! He is witty and fun with his teachings! woot woot

A real nice guy and knowledgeable but get ready to cover some material. His exams are a little scary as they dig in to some complicated material and MC is not really my thing. But, if you study, read and show up you should be fine.

Professor Ring was very personable, but his classes have been really difficult. He relies heavily on lecture, so be sure to take good notes. It also takes him a LONG time to grade assignments, but he is prompt when it comes to responding to emails. Although his class was really difficult, he is open about helping students when they need it.
Dr. Ring seems like a cool guy in real life. I want to like him as a person. I really do. Unfortunately, his classes are pedantically difficult  and not worth the struggle. 1/10 would not do.

Although Professor Ring is a new professor, he is extremely knowledgeable on the material he teaches. He struggles with simplifying the material covered on his power points also he has a hard time getting students to participate. However, the class is fairly easy. The only negative thing is that your grade relies heavily on a few assignments.

I would definitely take Professor Rittenhouse again. She is fair and she understands that life happens! This class was interesting,. This class was like assembling a puzzle. Save every assignment, in regards to papers that you have written. It is just a part of the puzzle.
Probly used books once. Cant sell back one of them. Slow grader.

This class is usually a requirement but I suggest to take it! Great content in the realm of grant making. Every week is something new surrounding the grant making process. She was so sweet, I called her to ask for an extension on the midterm and she happily gave me one.

Such a great professor. She's willing to help you with whatever questions you have about the material. She gives great feedback on the papers. The papers are all building blocks to the last big paper, which makes it so much easier. I love that method. Great class!

Don't be discouraged by my low easiness score. She is one of my favorite professors but the 3 papers assigned need to have the proper amount of time spent on them do well  I was very nervous about taking this class because it was more about Non Profit than Planning. However she mad the class easy and enjoyable. Great teacher.

This class requires you to complete weekly readings, writing assignments, one final paper and presentation. Our class met once a week to discuss weekly topics and go over upcoming assignments. The professor is very knowledgeable in her field and is willing to help students with clarification on any of the assignments.

She is a nice person and very knowledgeable, however totally unclear about assignments and then wants to take credit off of your grade for her inability to explain.  It is essential as an online Professor that clarity is mandatory.

This woman is amazing. I had her for proposal writing and she gave you all the building blocks you needed. She was even willing to call you on a Saturday if something wasn't clear. Outstanding professor.
Ridiculous when grading. Assignments are not very clear, making it impossible to meet the standards for full-credit. I do not suggest.

I learned a lot from this class. Kept all the handouts and stuff as they could come in helpful when teaching. As someone said, she gives everyone great grades, so I wouldn't bust your butt and put a ton of work into your assignments.

This was an easy class, but required a lot of work. Students taught the class by providing group presentations on each chapter - very little input from Prof. Roberts. The tutoring sesssions in the learning center were great for hands-on experience, but we received no direction or input from Dr. Roberts, so we were on our own.

Nice person. She seems to rate everyone's work as great, which diminishes the work of those who really put alot into the class. That said, aside from her disorganization, it is a good class. The textbook was excellent.
Very, very helpful. Can sometimes be unorganized, but will always work one on one to clarify things. Good Prof.
Lisa does tend to digress a bit, but it's well worth listening to her tangents. Enlightening, enjoyable course outside of my normal interests which I thoroughly enjoyed.

A Phenomenal professor who loves her Japanese Art. She will go on tangents about Japanese Culture and characters, but it is worth listening. The only bad thing I have to say about her is paper assignments will get very annoying. She always loves colorful student in the class, especially those who like to have fun with her. LEARN CHICAGO STYLE!!!

I love this prof! She is really laid back and helpful with tests and papers. She gives you study guides for her tests which make them easy to study for. The book is really not needed at all, so I would just ask someone else to use theirs. She is hilarious I recommend this class!

Very knowledgeable and skilled at what she teaches. One of my favorites of all-time at CSU. I loved coming to her classes to listen to her good humor and lectures. She is definitely an asset to CSU. Get her a new Art Building! She's been waiting forever.
This teacher is very helpful to students that show an interest in the subject. This class was pretty easy, and she is very easy to pay attention to. Very easy on the eyes!
Great professor. Fun class!
FUN
She is so funny and a very nice teacher would like to help students pass the class. Strongly recommand.

This class seems like it can be hard at times. If you make sure to be there on review days then you'll have no problems passing the tests. She practically goes over the whole test with you. It's a bit boring but she loves talking about it. Sometimes she tells you useless info. I don't understand why people think she is so hot.

Easy class, I dont know why everyone keeps saying shes so hot, tells you exactaly what will be on the test so you can pretty much only pay attention on review day and be fine, also never read the text book only used it for test prep

If you want a good grade (A) show up to class, pay attention, and take notes on the things she talks about. Sometimes she goes too fast but is fair and if we dont cover things she was going to put on the test, she takes it off instead of making you learn about it on your own.
Incredible class! I loved it. Plus she's very easy on the eyes.
Good professor, nice sense of humor, and totally smoking hot!

Enjoyably class. She knew what she was talking about and tried her hardest to keep the class interested.  If you attend class and pay attention by taking light notes, there is no way you can fail this class.
Great Prof.  Take her if you get a chance.
