Class was interesting, tests were relatively easy given that you actually show up. Lecture was fun, she really tries to get every one involved and makes sure that everyone understands the concepts. Oh yeah, and she's totally hot too!
No Comments
Had her for far easter art history and never paid attention and got a B.  She was very helpful and never looked down upon you.  I highly recommend her
I am so glad I took this class
she reminds, just a little, of the Grace... from Will and Grace
Seems easy but respects the curve and gives out lots of Cs.

She teaches in constant "Mom Mode", meaning endlessly enthusiastic and VERY concerned with making sure her students understand the material. Her relentless work to make her expectations clear make those same expectations very easy to reach. Plus, she legitimately enjoys helping her students in every facet of their education. Highly Recommended.
She dumbed down the subject matter & treated us like children. Was unhelpful and rude when I met with her outside of class. Will have to put a lot of time in to review this subject for the bar.
Professor Robertson went out of her way to tell students what she wanted on the final, which was a breath of fresh air.  Not a great class, but not a bad one, either.
He is excellent and often dismisses class very early. He helps you until you fully understand an assignment and he has the best wit
very clear and want to help you. Attendance is important.

He substituted for 2 weeks in our ENG101 class & everyone wanted him to stay permanently! He expects a lot but does everything he can to help his students deliver the best work possible. We learned a lot from him in a very short amount of time. Fun, personable, insightful, amazing professor! Always take his class if you can! You won't regret it.
AWESOME CLASS! he is a genuinely nice man with a goofy sense of humor. he is very helpful and will explain things a million times until you understand. one of the best teachers i have ever had.
Really NICE guy. PLEASE DON'T TAKE ADVANTAGE OF HIM. He is one of the rare professors that every one wishes to have. excellent with materials and always there to help. Love the cowboy hat haha :)

Dr. Robichaud is genuine, professional and really tries to do everything to help her students get through the course. The requirements of each assignment are clear and concise. She gives feedback for each assignment. If you have a question, she will help you as thoroughly as she can.
Very professional teacher. Felt like a college course compared to some other classes I have attended at CSU especially math ones
Best philosophy professor I've ever had. Very kind, caring, and helpful. Learned a lot from her -- she's a very wise individual. Highly recommend taking one of her classes.
Great teacher, passionate, well organized, engaging.
Nice Teacher, easy to approach. Grading system is a little wacky but it's still an good class to take!
Very passionate in her opinions. Open to questions and comments, and encourages discussion during lectures. Textbook(s) are mandatory, and handout articles are frequent.
Knows her stuff and doesn't dumb it down.  Challenging, but fair. I learned a lot.
Great teacher!

not helpful at all. mostly talks about her own life. If you want an easy A then take her class. Way to much reading but i did not do any reading and skipped most classes and still got an A. Very poor teacher did not really learn anything.

She's very knowledgable on many things. Could talk for hours and not necessarily on the course itself...mostly about her own life issues. But she's sweet and fun to follow. Too much assigned reading. If you just follow the lectures, you should be ok. Fairly easy class.
Was nervous to take her class free reason the comments, but it is a very enjoyable class with and interesting professor :-)

I would be surprised if she was rehired. She was really nice, but the worst teacher I have ever had. She is so sweet, and very passionate, but she does nothing to actually teach. If you don't want to be bored out of your mind, don't take her class
God awful teacher... super easy class but her teacher is perhaps the worst I've ever come in contact with
Wow I not once studied for this class and got a b+ i even skipped a couple classes

Required two 5 page papers which took a while to be graded. Somewhat dull lectures interspersed with embarrassing attempts to be humorous. Easy A though.

Very easy grader, both on papers and exams. As they as you put some effort into the class you will do fine. She tries to make the class as easy as possible given that many do not seem to care about the class subject and are taking it just as a requirement.

Not a helpful professor at all, all she talks about is her family( Two daughters)and her life as a social worker. When it comes time for an exam the whole class is clueles about what's it over. and she always goes off on Tangents, she can never stay focused on one topic

Not a big fan of this one. She taught her class with a strong left-wing bias and seemed to keep pushing her own personal agenda onto the students. Should be called Socialism instead of Sociology. class was nothing what i expected. i didn't learn anything from this class yet i still managed to get an A. pretty easy

she's really understanding, easy paper grader

I really thought she was nice. EASY going and laid back. I was scared to take her class after I read the other's comments, but turned out that they were all wrong.  I would take her again if I needed a class that she was teaching!!
hard to stay awake...

Very judgemental. She is rude. She sometimes ridicules peoples comments, and shuts them down like they are stupid. I had him for personal finance and 351.Very fair, approachable and enthusiastic about his field. However, he can sometimes move too slowly through material. Prepares students well for exams and curves. Very little homework.
Awesome Prof.  Knows the subject really well, super clear communicator.  Relates topic to real world.  He is much better than most of the full time finance faculty at the school!

Worst online professor I have EVER taken at CSU. Dates for all assignments were not correct and the grades for each were wrong as well. You did not know what grade you were going to receive until she posted the final grade.

I loved Professor May. She was more helpful than any professor I have ever had. She is considered tough by a lot of students but I believe they just aren't doing what she asks. She also is easy on the eyes in my opinion.

Fantastic legal writing professor! She's pretty tough and likes things to be perfect but I promise you will appreciate it as soon as you start working b/c you will KNOW how to do research & write. She's clear, patient, encouraging, personable, and funny. Your hard work will payoff-- Great class!!

Terrible!  Terrible!  Terrible!  All she does is read straight from the book.  Why do we have to do the reading and come to class? She assigns way too much work that it's difficult to keep up with yo

Dr. Rock is absolutely amazing! I love her to pieces. She ended up teaching this class on a whim for the Spring 2020 semester, but I am soooo glad she did. The main assignment for this class is a research paper on a topic/question of your choice. She is very helpful, caring & always provides great feedback. my favorite professor at CSU by far!

Dr. Rock is absolutely amazing! I love her to pieces. She ended up teaching this class on a whim for the Spring 2020 semester, but I am soooo glad she did. The main assignment for this class is a research paper on a topic/question of your choice. She is very helpful, caring & always provides great feedback. my favorite professor at CSU by far!

Dr. Rock is a pleasant person who I respect. Her assignments seem excessive sometimes, but she is clear with her requirements, and as long as you meet her rubric expectations, you'll do well. There are no surprises with what she is looking for. You must attend class to do well. You can learn a lot from her.

Dr. Rock was awesome. At the beginning of class, you'll probably read the syllabus and freak out, but all of the things that are due are really easy to complete. She explains everything in detail and answers all questions in detail.

This was a pretty good class. There are many assignments, which all seem so overwhelming when she presents them to you on the first day of class, but just take it one at a time and you'll be fine. She knew what she was talking about and I definitely learned a lot from her class. Put the effort in and you'll do well.

Professor Rock is the harshest grader I have ever had. I had wrote several A+ papers, and she would continuously give me a 48/50. Why? Be prepared to be nitpicked by every grammar mistake you could possibly make. Avoid this professor if you can!

She reads the "pre-made" power points and passes them off like she made them-notice the TM (trademark) at the bottom of the slide. She preaches but the practice she shows is non-existent. Joke _!!!!! She needs to stick with her research group--GOD help the upcoming students!!!!

While she is a passionate teacher, she is a terrible professor. Clarity is nonexistent, expectations of the dept are unclear, & class requirements are extremely  confusing. took the course during Fall 20 semester. took the course during Fall 20 semester. She never responds to her emails Tough grader Skip her

She's really nice and all but the tests are kinda weird and sometimes the lecture doesnt make any sense. I'm doing good in the class but I good a D. How? Doctor Rodrigues is a very informative and will actively work with the class to make sure the topics are comprehended. Take advantage of practice exams in MLC.

I spent a lot of time with a tutor who taught me more than I learned in class during the semester. She doesn't answer any of her emails. I was a bit surprised when I saw the ratings for Prof Rodrigues. As for homeworks, yes she gave paper version in class and you can ask her to solve for any specific problems as examples (so, remember to look over the homework before going to class). Your online homework will be just different numbers. Don't skip class, and you will be fine.
this is the best professor
I loved this professor! Shes so understanding and really cares about her students. Do the homework and youll pass because the homework is exactly the test.
Nice teacher who is willing to work with you if you are having trouble grasping the material. Try to go to her office hours if you are struggling like I did to do well.
Change your professor if you can.

This class was very painful to sit through each week, she was up to 20 minutes late to class everyday. She had an accent that made her very difficult to understand. I would not recommend this professor whatsoever

She has a heavy accent to where sometimes you cant understand her. She is a very nice professor, but she gets confused easily by her own material along with just communicating with her students. Prof. Rodrigues is a really nice lady, but she seemed like she didn't know what was going on a lot of the time. Overall Dr Rodriguez is a good professor, however she doesnt have good class room structure. Sometimes shes all over the place. She does has a passion for Math.

Rodrigues wasn't necessarily a bad prof, however the way she taught could be confusing and unclear, it also didn't help that she had a thick accent. Nice lady, loves math, teaching skills could improve, quiz weekly, will do harder problems on homeworks than on actual tests, sometimes late to class, heavy accent,  tries her best to explain things, grades fair, told me not to buy textbook unless you learn from examples in them, overall doable class.
the worst math teacher I've ever taken . her english is not understandable, .on the exam if u miss a minus sign she will give u zero for the problem. don't take any classes with her.

A good class that has a lot of in class conversations and debate. Participation is mandatory but not by talking, instead there is a remote that is purchased where you get points for answering, without having to talk in class. A good class that has a lot of in class conversations and debate. She is a very knowledgeable teacher who has a clear grading criteria and expectations for the class. The tests aren't too bad if you pay attention and take good notes in class.

Marnie, seems to be a caring and knowledgeable professor. However, the truth is she is a tough grader on her assignment. Her test may seem easy but they are NOT. This is certainly not an easy A or fun course. DO NOT TAKE HER, you will regret it!

If you want an easy A elective this is not the one for you. VERY boring lectures also to mention you need to buy a response card to get credit for ATTENDANCE. This class is not an "Easy A" elective. There are a lot of tedious readings, although optional, you'll need to read plenty to think about coming close to getting an A on a test. Did not provide any guidance or feedback on quantitative analysis.
She teaches at a graduate level. She may seem caring but insensitive to your circumstances outside the classroom.
Professor Rodriguez was extremely biased in every subject she talked about. Non-factual; very opinion-based. No textbook, very quiz heavy about previous days notes.

I had to drag myself to class. So boring. SO much unnecessary reading that you have to do to get clicker points. Also, she grades so hard its ridiculous. She's a straight forward professor who will go through the material, make it relatable and explain its relevance. If you just show up and stay on top of things, the homework and material really isn't hard.

A good professor, and a good class. Relatively straight forward, just read the articles and participate in class discussion and you should be good. Attendance isn't required, but if you miss the clicker questions it will affect your grade.

She assigned us group work, and the group we were in was our group for the entire semester. Be prepared to get to know your classmates. Always participate. She doesn't give extra credit for it, but it does actually help you retain info. Always always always read the course readings for the week so you can do the clicker questions, or you won't pass

Expect Homework & Get Ready to Read: She assigns several readings in replacement for the textbook - which  is nice / bad depending on how you learn.  Gives extra credit: Called Clicker Questions - Part of attendance, and if people aren't on their phones she gives superb bonus points

There is no book, but assigned reading online before each class period. She words her test alittle tricky, & you need to know the exact theories & who said what. If you do need help she is very helpful to explain what you did wrong on the test. Clicker points are a big part, so dont miss class! you will be assigned to a group for projects

Took this class hoping to have an easy elective... was not what I was expecting at all. She gives so much homework for a 101 class. Literally just trying to graduate and this class has been such an annoyance. Do not take this class with her expecting an easy A....
Tough grader, to much papers, nothing pleases her perfection. Avoid her class as much as you can.

Horrible grader tests are confusing do not give good feedback! PLEASE DON'T this person. It is so hard I never worked so much on papers and tests in my college career. Great Professor! Uses textbook as well as other articles that she posts on Blackboard. She uses powerpoint slides for lecture. I enjoyed this class as we had great discussions.

I felt like she was a very good and helpful teacher. You can really tell she loves teaching sociology! This class was a lot of reading but really don't have to read it all. And the tests were essays but she gave you the questions before the test. Overall it wasn't that bad.

Very knowledgeable in the subject of adult learning. Understands you have life obligations, gives plenty of time to complete assignments and provides great feedback. Very engaging and positive. Highly recommend her. Best professor I ever had

Dr. Rogers claims to be a tough professor, but the class is awful. It's dreadful to sit through the courses, since she gets so off topic. If you're looking for a professor that is an easy A, she's the one for you. If you're looking to learn and actually be challenged, try someone else.
Comes late, rambles, tells same stories over & over. Boasts of giving away As.

Dr. Rogers reflects the virtues of the program.  She is very upfront with her syllabus and is flexible with adult learners. Dr. Rogers exemplifies her the profession she teaches. While one of the text for this course was dry, she spiced it up with current research and class participation. She dedicates class time to projects taking into account your personal life. Overall, one of the best instructors I've ever had!

While she poured over the material in large quantities, it was well worth the result. Learned he most with her than any prof I have ever had. Does not have office hours - if you need help, you have to stay after class.

Dr. R is very knowledgeable and her lectures are interesting! We only had 2 exams and a few short writing assignments. They were really easy though. She gives extra credit and is really helpful too.

It was the one class I looked forward to attending each week. Dr. Rohde gives enthusiastic lectures which relate to the readings. BUY THE TEXTBOOK! Aside from a couple rude/juvenile students, the class discussions were very thought-provoking. We took the exams as a class, and I really learned a lot. She also offers lots of extra credit.

Great class! This teacher was very helpful. She uses powerpoints and uses a textbook with lots of on-line study materials. She always makes tiem to help anytime you need her... will explain things i several different ways to help you understand the textbook info.
She is the nicest teacher. Her class is so interesting, and her tests follow the lectures closely. Come to class and read the textbook and you are sure to get an A.

She is very unorganized, and a little unprepared. her course load is heavy she will have you working on multiple things and she also has the work set up so its like an online class on top of her regular class.

terrible! not prepared for lectures, not clear in her expectations, always getting her classes mixed up, didn't use class time wisely, came in late, unkempt appearance. if you can avoid her you should!

One of the best teachers that I have ever had.  For being a coding class it was very easy and he made it extremely easy to follow. If any one had a question he was willing to help.  Attendance is mandatory. No Book needed for the class. Absolutely take his class if you get a chance!

He's the best. If you don't do your work or at least out the effort into what you're doing, he's going to make fun of you. I like his personality, but I can see how some might misconstrue it as being mean.

Dr. Rom did and excellent job explaining the course material, was helpful answering questions, and I felt confident with the material going into the exams. If I had to do it all over again, I wouldn't change anything. I enjoyed taking this course with him - he has a very pleasant personality.

He's also very helpful if you have questions.

I would advise taking another professor for this class. He does everything on Excel. So, you have to figure out how to do it on paper on your own. He also is not clear when tests and quizzes are. Positive note, all exams are open-book.

The material is a bit dry but Prof. Walter goes over a number of textbook problems in the class which is helpful. He is polite and understanding. Overall, good option if statistics is not your forte and yo

Its amazing how he takes what could be a very interesting class and puts people to sleep. Easy A. Test right from the book and uses a curve. He does randomly take attendance.

Extremely useless. just navigating slides, talking endlessly using very boring mono-tone. buy a cup of coffee,search for a nice game online and play on your laptop in his class. or do something other task while he is going through the presentations. EASIEST class EVER i agree boring only if u don't have a game to play or anything to do. It is like a detention class u have to sit in but bottomline u get an EASIEST A ever scored..awesome

Two words, TAKE HIM!! For those of you who are not majors in ACT, take him!! You have to try really hard to NOT get an A.. I learned nothing, and I got an A, but I'm not an ACT major and i hate the subject, so he's perfect for people like me!

It's great b/c he only teaches you the basics, and you don't have to learn ever little detail, but I may be in trouble for ACT 222. He's a bad lecturer, he doesn't really lecture that much though, classes are short.

If you're looking for an easy A in accounting...take this guy.  He's super nice and very easy.  Take-home midterms and finals.  He gives you the answers to the homework and then collects those same problems for a grade.  All you have to do is copy it.  Highly recommend him.
Very Nice guy.  His class is very easy.

Best professor I think I will ever have. I wish every professor would teach like him. Calculus is not an easy subject but Romutis is so good at making it easier. If you can, sign up for his class as soon as you can because most people rush to have him.

Best professor I think I will ever have. I wish every professor would teach like him. Calculus is not an easy subject but Romutis is so good at making it easier. If you can, sign up for his class as soon as you can because most people rush to have him.

BEST teacher I've had in my whole life. I will definitely change my schedule around in the future to take him for other math classes if he teaches them. Made Calc 2 SO easy! I can't stress enough how easy he makes things, and he's so helpful in every way possible setting up all his students for success. It would be dumb not to take him.
Todd makes it easy to understand the material and has clear grading criteria. It's easy to get an A given that you do the work he gives you
TAKE CALC II with Todd! He's just awesome and best Math professor I have ever had! He explains everything and makes it so easy for everyone to understand. You can ask for help with hw too!
Scared of  Calc, take class with Todd. He's the best Math professor I have ever had!
He is the best math professor ever!!! I took two hard core classes with him and was amazed by him in both classes.

HE IS THE BEST OF THE BEST!!! The only example needed: I signed up for a class and am number 9 on the waiting list while the other prof options have very few students signed up. I cannot cannot recommend him enough! Take him!!

TODD IS THE BEST. DO WHATEVER YOU CAN TO BE IN HIS CLASS. HE IS THE BEST MATH TEACHER EVER AND YOU WILL LEARN SO MUCH. YOU WILL WANT TO GO TO CLASS BECAUSE HE IS JUST SO AMAZING. HE DESERVES A RAISE HE DESERVES THE WORLD.

Todd is the nicest guy at CSU, and an amazing lecturer. He takes such complicated topics and makes them so easy to understand. Definitely try to get him for calc 1 & 2 and youll have such a solid background for your future classes. He always tells you exactly whats expected of you, and exactly whats expected on tests and quizzes

Cares very much about his students' understanding of the material. Very kind and understanding, and great at conveying information in a way that is easy to digest. One of the finest instructors I have ever had the pleasure of experiencing.
If you have to take stats take him! He made it super easy to understand

Dr. Romutis is great. Look no further if you are deciding between stats professors. He is great at giving feedback and answering questions, and makes an effort to be interesting and caring. All professors should model themselves after Dr. Romutis.
Best prof for calc

Dr. Romutis is the best instructor I've ever had, he is kind, down to earth, and teaches in a way that engages and works for students. He is true gem and made me love a class that would otherwise be painful. I made my schedule for next semester just so I was sure I'd have him again for calc II. You'll love him.

Todd is a very good proffessor and I would recommend anyone to take him even if your not sur eif your ready for the class. He goes into depth very well with all the subjects and it is very easy to ask questions in the class as he explains the answers very well.

Prof Romulus is AMAZING!! He teaches extremely clearly and effectively. Hes also genuinely hilarious and makes his students laugh on a daily basis, in the midst of learning calc. Id recommend him to anyone and hes the best!!!!
Todd really is one of the best mathematics professors at CSU. He breaks things down to the basics and explains things clearly. Highly recommended!!
Todd is a great professor and is truly knowledgable on the subjects. He made calculus a breeze so I highly recommend him for anyone.

I think he is one of the best finance professors at CSU. I think the lecture videos are extremely helpful, he is very through and explains everything in a straightforward manner. I would definitely take him again for a different class. His tests aren't too bad either. I do better on his exams than his homework assignments.

Hardest class I've taken but so rewarding. Lectures are long but so helpful. He explains difficult concepts well. Dedicates time and effort to helping his students succeed. Study the quizzes before exams and go over homework problems he references for exam review. He sets you up for success if you're willing to do the work. Exceptional prof. 10/10

I think he is one of the best finance professors at CSU. I think the lecture videos are extremely helpful, he is very through and explains everything in a straightforward manner. I would definitely take him again for a different class. His tests aren't too bad either. I do better on his exams than his homework assignments.
Great professor!

He's very knowledgeable about finance and you can tell he's passionate about it. I enjoy his lectures because he really gets into the material, but the grading was just a bit too easy. Everything is done through connect and the exams mirror the connect quizzes. I think I would have learned a bit more if the work was more challenging

His classes are definitely lecture heavy, but his videos and audio recorded slides are super helpful. He makes complex finance topics very clear and easy to understand. Make sure to do the practice questions in the textbook before taking his exams.

He posts PowerPoints with audio since classes are virtual. He is extremely knowledgeable and he knows what he is talking about! His exams aren't too bad either if you do the quizzes. The exam questions come directly from the weekly quizzes.

He was a pretty good, his homework and quizzes were pretty easy, the test were average. Once the transition to online came in affect, it start becoming a bit more easier. i like him, he care about the students and was very big on no late assignment.

He seemed hard to get along with. He has a lot of field experience and talks a lot about them in class. Minimal student participation so it was hard to focus and listen to him talk non-stop for a whole hour. Homeworks are on connect and exams aren't hard. He wasn't a bad professor, just very lecture heavy.

Professor Roncagli is so kind, smart, and funny. The class is tricky, especially if you are an International Business major, but he will tell you exactly what is going to be on the exams so as long as you study, youll do fine! Professor Roncagli is really great! I highly recommend taking him.

Have Roncagli for 4 classes for my senior year. great guy. heavy lecturer but means well and will help you! the exams are right from the hw quizzes that are due every week. Hw/quiz/LS's is due every week but if you do them with ppl they aren't bad. easy points. If you do all the LS's then you get bonus. Best professor for this course-take him.
One of the best Finance professors, so far. You can tell he loves his field and is trying to get the information across in as simply as he is able to do so.

He's one of my favorite professors thus far as a 5th year senior. He wants to make sure that students understand and invites them to ask any questions during class. While the material can be dull, I think he does a good job of making it more approachable. I've made sure to have him as often as I can. I've had him three times and fourth in spring 18

I really do not like him. He gives dry lectures, does not care when 3/4ths of his class is failing his tests, does not adapt lectures to student needs, does not get off the schedule. He gives really hard (and a lot) of homework and sometimes his tests are off online quizzes, sometimes not, so you never know.

5 exams, homework, and if it's a typical fall/spring class then attendance is added in as well. Great at recapping information before an exam, and is good about answering questions related to the homework via BlackBoard discussion board. Pulls many exam questions from the quizzes. Comes off very condescending so don't take it personally...

25% HW, 75% test. Test is 40% mutliple choice, 60% problems/ short answers. Most multiple choice questions are pulled from the pratice quizes he gives. Problems/short answers are pulled from the homework/problem sets he gives, harder than his fin-360 class, but not impossible.

I don't know how old are these ratings but. He only takes a few questions from the practice quizzes. It is not an impossible class, but not easy either as people mention here. The exam has 3 problems worth 60% of the test. No way 95% comes from practice quizzes.

Easy class, 95 % of his test questions come from the quizes (15) he gives. I highly recommend him for people looking for an easy A in Finance (351, 360, 362, and 465).  Dr. Roncagli gives you five attempts per homework assignment , 90 minutes per quiz given, a formula sheet to use own tests, and most homework solutions.

Easy class, he pulls most (95%) of his test questions from the quizzes you take during the year. I highly recommend him if you need an easy A or A- in a Finance class. Two of his classes (360 and 465) have a lot of material to cover (15 and 19 chapters) so be prepared to do work in those classes.

His tests were taken straight from the test bank and quizzes.   Study the quizzes well and you will get an easy A or B.  He is very good at helping students on Blackboard.   If you have any questions with homework he will get back to you usually within 24 hours.  Did a great job weaving historical economic activity into the class.  Would take again

Fantastic teacher. I had him for FIN 360 and had to take him again. He thoroughly goes over every formula and difficult concept until everyone understands it. There are weekly quizzes on Blackboard and the test questions are pulled directly from them. If you don't pass this class you're either brain dead or unbelievably lazy. Highly recommend.

I've really enjoyed her geography class this semester. She's very dedicated to teaching and very passionate about her field of research. I'm sure she's a great networking resource for those who are history/geography majors.

Dr. Rose is one of my favorite professors this semester. She was very helpful and inspirational when it comes to deciding to be a history major. Her semester-long project was an amazing way to learn the historical thinking process while allowing people to be creative in their research.

HIS 104 or HIS 504? You will not know with Dr. Rose. She is extremely smart and great at what she does, but she does not realize that 3/4 of students are taking this as a gen ed. Way too in depth for an intro class and way too difficult for a 100 level class. She assumes you have a ton of background knowledge that most do not have.

Dr. Rose is easily one of the top 3 professors at CSU's Dept. o'History. Make no mistake, you WILL work in her classes. And by work, I mean you will bleed, sweat, cry for her grades and expectations. And you will love it. She teaches and you will actually LEARN. TAKE her if you are serious about your education. Avoid like plague if you are not.

Was a good professor, but her class was a bit ridiculous for a 100 level course. Multiple quizzes and short papers, 3 tests overall. Expected you to do A LOT of reading, but you only need to read for definitions or clarification. Wants you to participate, don't have to, high grade still. REALLY tough grader. Interesting lectures.

Very friendly, helpful professor. The class isn't too challenging as long as you go to class and read the assigned texts. Quizzes are more on the easier side, but the exams are quite challenging if you don't come prepared. Pretty much no real homework, just lectures and notes. Very fun class, if you enjoy history and learning about the modern world

The course was more difficult than many upper-level courses I have taken. Dr. Rose does not give clear criteria for exams, which are very difficult. She did not seem to realize that this was an intro level course and that most students in it were not History majors.

Definitely not an easy teacher so if you're looking to receive a good grade - better work for it! Although I did not receive an A, I think she's a good professor. She definitely wants to see you write and keep growing as a writer. I am not a history major so this course was difficult, but nevertheless interesting. I would take another class of hers
Such a great professor! I would highly recommend taking any of her classes; you'll work hard, but you'll think in such a new, positive way!
Excellent professor, great feedback, passion, and interactivity! Course was difficult, but graded very fairly, and I learned a great deal more than if I had an 'easy A' professor.
she is amazing the best history class if you fail her class it will be your fault and never miss or be late to her class she hates it

Good class, a little difficult, but interesting. Map quizzes & labs great for bringing up grade if you need it. Some things are hard to understand, but she is always willing to go over it with you. Location biography project was really fun too. I'd recommend Dr. Rose
She interacts very well with the class and is very passionate about what she is teaching. Expect a good amount of reading and required research.

Good prof, explained difficult concepts in German history well. I love her boyish good looks. This one time her short hair was all disheveled on her forehead, and she blew it off and shook her head. It was so awesome, I almost fell out of my chair. It was like those scenes where the hot chick gets out of the pools and shakes off the water.

Very  knowledgable in this area. Not as useful if you do not plan on becoming a history teacher. Make sure you do all of the readings and bring books to class. Be in class on time as attendance is mandatory. grades fairly and will give alternate assignments if you are not a history major. She is very helpfl ad is always available for office hours.

Requires a lot of readings but not too hard. Very Clear in what she wants regarding papers and assignments. Love the professor but if you're not going into teaching world history, this isnt the class for you
Very nice professor. Her door was always open and really enjoyed her class. Give yourself extra time to get there on time. Learned alot and she made it fun and interesting...
Was very helpful with content and willing to proof read any assignment prior to submission.  Just be early and give yourself an extra minute or two to make next class as discussions can run over.
Good professor. A little too tight on attendance, but other than that, she is a great professor.
Dr Rose, is a great professor and anyone who enjoys history should take her classes.
Has a lot of personal experience in field.

She is a great professor. She has a lot of in-class worksheets and activities to better help you understand and remember important concepts. Her tests aren't too hard either. She is one of the best professors I have had. If you actually want to learn and not waste time in class, I would definitely recommend taking her class.

The class lectures were mediocre at best and where at infrequent dates as opposed to consistent MWF or TTH days. The assignments, excel sims, and online homework helped the most to teach. Also the offering of excel certification in place of a final was great. I would recommend to take her, as you have to take it and she offers extra credit.

I would not recommend taking this teacher! She was one of the worst teachers Ive ever had, she waited until our last class to lecture but will not teach you during the semester and make you teach yourself! If you email her good luck she will not answer your questions and will be rude about it as well!

Horrible professor. Doesnt teach anything but expects you to know everything before its even taught. Treats you like youre stupid if you ask any type of question and will go out of her way to deduct points for everything. Dont recommend, her material isnt even helpful for all the self learning youll have to do.

She is a great professor. She has a lot of in-class worksheets and activities to better help you understand and remember important concepts. Her tests aren't too hard either. She is one of the best professors I have had. If you actually want to learn and not waste time in class, I would definitely recommend taking her class.

Is a professor that measures what matters. She doesn't try to trick you or catch you in minor mistakes--she's concerned that you get the concepts and understand how answers are derived to problems. Very caring and extremely accessible outside of class. Very practical and "real world" in approach to teaching. She is what all professors should be.
Professor Rose is a great professor. She is very helpful, and goes over each topic thoroughly. She has a lot of experience in the accounting field. I would definitely take her again.

She was not a bad professor, the class was pretty hard, I took this class last semester, and she had 4 exams/module and your grade was base on those exams. She would only curve your grade if your hwk grade for that module was a letter grade higher than your test grade. She was pretty nice, she bump me up to a C for improving on each exam.

The professor is so helpful and kind. Her tests are not too hard either, they are online. If you go to class and take good notes and do all the worksheets, you will be fine. Also, the homework assignments are also very helpful.
She is a very knowledgeable professor. She will make sure that the students understand the concepts and has very helpful in-class worksheets.

She has changed her entire lesson plan. She has a lot of practice problems and she explains everything clearly. She will go over things over and over again to make sure that everybody is on the same page. She also gives practice quizzes to see how you are doing/

Never wrote a review on here before, wanted to write one so that I could warn future students. Do not take her classes. She will find the most obscure reason(s) to deduct your grade, her lectures are like grinding your nails on a blackboard, and for some reason, she gets exasperated when students ask her questions. No idea why she is an educator.

Kind & fair professor. Lots of homework due weekly, which makes up miniscule amount of total grade. You are not penalized for attendance as others have mentioned. I missed several classes due to health issues & it did not negatively affect my grade. She allows a cheat sheet & reviews adequately prepare you for exams. Can't ask for more than that!

Worst professor in history ! She doesn't teach she simply does the exercise for you when all assignments are done online and it provides assistance as well. During the reviews for exams she tells you to go over certain problem/exercise only to find out the one she didn't mention are on the test. She also refused to open any missed assignments

You will HAVE TO read and complete the 2 HW's before the class. In class, she goes over 1 HW assignment and gives you the answers. That's to be done after class and then there's quizzes due Sundays. Tests are a 8/10 hard. She allows you a cheat sheet for tests. You can't get away without reading unless you're naturally gifted in accounting.

Come to class prepared: read the material that is being gone over that day AND do your homework so you can come to class with questions. Very important to do your homework early. Tests are very difficult if you don't completely know the material so get ready to buckle down and learn! Online material is simple but don't rely on it for the exams.

She is personable and knows her stuff. This was a hybrid class-meaning 1/2 class is online 1 day a week in person. Show up that week already have read that weeks chapter, helps. Rose announced this every class. Material is hard but you really have to take the time to read the text book to understand what goes on in class. I am hoping I passed.

The professor does not know how to explain the material well and she wonders why only one or two students answer her questions out of a class of almost 60 students. She acts like it's a major headache to thoroughly explain new material. She expects everyone to know what to do and how to do before the material is even presented.

The WORST professor I have ever had. She lectures way too fast and expects people to understand everything and acts like we are dumb for asking questions. The examples she gives never help when doing homework and they also don't help with exams. Homework is hard and there is too much to do every week. If you can avoid this professor at all costs!

The semester with Rose has been nothing short of awful. Expects all material to be self-taught, examples in class barely help to prepare for quizzes and exams. Lots more work that what is listed in the syllabus, and very misleading with exams - second exam was supposed to be online based, but now switching the format with very little notice.

5 Tests and homework+orion due with each test. If you show up and PARTICIPATE you will pass this class. Skipping class or staying silent even if you dont completely know whats going on will only hurt yourself as she makes you work for your grade. Very nice person with some dry humor  but dont expect her to care if you skip and have a bad grade.
Dr. Rose is super nice! I had her for both History 370 and Geography 200. She is super helpful and its easy to tell that she really wants her students to succeed. Highly recommend!
Dr. Rose is super nice! I had her for both History 370 and Geography 200. She is super helpful and its easy to tell that she really wants her students to succeed. Highly recommend!
Shelly Rose's HIS 200 was pretty easy. One or two easy assignments a week and the final project is really simple.

He is the worst! Took moral rights and he blamed everything wrong in the world on certain ethnic groups! He will make fun of you in class for having trouble! He expects most of his class to fail, not just the tests, but the whole class! DO NOT TAKE HIM!!!

I enjoy his old school style of teaching. He makes students take responsibility for their work. His sarcasm is amazing and I can appreciate it, being an older student. Be ready to take notes, come to class on time, and be ready to work! Will recommend him to students that are willing to do the work! If you are lazy, don't bother.

Great professor! Attendance is mandatory if you want a good grade. Take notes and study them for the tests. Old-school/ traditional.  Interesting topics covered -should be a required class for psych majors as well! It would all some good to have a better understanding of that area to keep with them in life.

rOSENBAUM DOES NOT GIVE OUT A SYLLABUS.  WANTS STUDENTS TO LEAN ON HIM WHEN HE HAS OFFICE HOURS AT 7:30 A.M. AND HALF THE TIME YOU HAVE TO WAIT ON HIM THAT EARLY IN THE MORNING. IT IS LIKE HE HATE THE VERY STUDENTS WHO PAY HIS SALARY. WHAT A MESSED UP SYSTEM THIS IS!! HE TELLS YOU THE FIRST DAY OF CLASS THERE ISN'T ASSIGNMT BUT ACTUALLY THERE IS.
Great professor.  He's very informative and entertaining. Love his dark sense of humor.  Bad professor?...Not a chance!

I was a little intimidated at first, as the class went on it got easier. Didnt open the text once. Tests are fair, coming to class is a must he bases all his exams on his class lectures. Fair grading. Overall great professor, would definitely recommend!

Best professor I have ever had. Very organized and prepared, attention to detail, and sense of humor. Showing up to class is mandatory as exams are based on lectures. Any student that shows up and takes good notes should get at least a B.

Very informational. I learned alot from his class. Hes always trying to lighten the mood with jokes. Very helpful if you need help! Tests are multiple choice, short answer and usually 2 essays-But they're really not that bad if you study. Coming to class is a must b/c his exams are based of his notes. Overall great guy. Would definitely recommend.

Probably one of the most memorable professors I have had yet. His lectures kept me interested. Difficult class for the most part, but I learned plenty. Would definitely recommend even if he isn't that easy of a professor.

Excellent teacher, but difficult. He is 100% unbiased in his lectures; the comments that claim otherwise are just inferior students that just couldn't cut it. The book is useless, he goes over all material in his lectures. If he doesn't mention it in class, he takes it off of the test. I encourage his class only to those that have an interest inPHL

Excellent class that is well paced, structured, and consistently on topic. Three exams that include MC, Fill-in, and short answer. One 5 page paper based on a book (On Liberty). Very helpful and encouraging professor. Attendance highly recommended (book hardly used). Anything on exam taken from lectures. No exam during Finals week.

I have to say, I now attend NYU after spending last semester at Cleveland State, and Prof. Rosenbaum's class is still in my mind! I'm taking a philosophy esque course right now and it doesn't compare to how great of a course this was. Highly recommend. You'll learn an obscene amount. Using my notes from CSU right now for my final exam here!

This course was extremely interesting. Attendance is very important because the tests are all based on the lectures. He's a really good professor, and those who say he's not did not come to class and did not pay attention. I would definitely recommend taking this class - only if you're going to show up and pay attention! A+ overall

I disagree with the religious statements, he voices the opinions of philosophers, not his own and makes that very clear. The lectures were interesting, and if you show up to class and take notes you will have no problems on tests. People who hate him didn't go to class and didn't pay attention when occasionally attending. Definitely worth taking!

This was an extremely interesting course. If philosophy and history are not things you are interested in, then you will not like it. Professor was interesting and well-prepared for courses. Lots of students do not show up to class - that's CSU for you. Those people hated the class because they got bad grades.
A very intersting teacher. Likes to give a few shameless plugs about his books once in a while, but otherwise excellent. Very engaging and entertaining.
Prime example of what is wrong with todays educators.
Terrible instructor. Teaching irrevelant to the material.
Attendance is not mandatory but I wouldnt miss a lot. His tests come straight from the lectures. He gets off topic during lectures easily. We didn't use the books that much.
He seems hard but hes not lol i have had him for two different classes both A's
No Comments
She is an amazing professor. Class is fun, assignments are not very hard. Use the powerpoints and study guide for the midterm and the final exam & you'll be fine.
Show up and pass.  Get plenty of rest before coming to class, as the lectures are very long and boring.  There's little classroom interaction.
Easy A, but the lectures are long and boring.

Professor Ross ended every zoom lecture saying love you guys, he cared and even when we were not in class he would still send us resources that could help us in our career. He gives you an entire google drive folder with resources you sure enough will need in the future as a special education major.

Professor Ross ended every zoom lecture saying love you guys, he cared and even when we were not in class he would still send us resources that could help us in our career. He gives you an entire google drive folder with resources you sure enough will need in the future as a special education major.

Love Bob. Love love love. He brings his real world experience to class and answers the hard questions about teaching special ed. He brings in guest speakers that are super helpful and provides you with real resources to use after you graduate. I would take him again if I could.

Took the online course of Intro to Special Education for a WAC course. One assignment each week. About 5-7 questions regarding the chapter. Only 3 quizzes and are basically just another question assignment. No exams. Everything is open book. Easiest class ever.

Bob Ross is one of the best professors at CSU! His lectures are great and loved the guest speakers. Very informative. Not a lot of work at all and one group project. I would definitely recommend him!!!

Did not insist on giving too much work. Really the focus was on a few important assignments. There were a few quizzes during the semester but they were announced so going to class has its perks. Grades fairly. Passionate about education. Class discussions were a little strange. If you choose to participate in them you might feel unappreciated.
She's super old and boring!! Her class is ok, not too hard, but extrememly boring.
A good teacher in general, the subject matter just wasn't made applicable to all disciplines.

Take this class if you are looking for a boring class with a lot of tedious work. I did not learn anything in this class that I did not learn in any of my other teaching courses. She likes to get off of subject a lot and then pushes all of the work load to the end of the semester! She does not cut you any slack.Her tests are ridiculously hard.
No Comments

This class is pretty easy as long as you follow her instructions precisely. There are weekly quizzes, but they are very easy and she tells you what to study. This is a boring subject and class but there is no reason not to get an A with a modi****of effort.

If you're concentrations are Science and Math you will find this class a complete waste of time.  Since it is required you could do worse. Dr. Ross-Stroud loves the subject matter and class discussion goes by fast. Quite a bit of work but I am told she gives less thatn average for this class.  Not difficult but time consuming.
No Comments
No Comments

Dr. Roth is a good man. He really tries to foster student participation and awareness. He is always available outside of class for additional explanations and he truly cares about the subject matter. He is a little quirky though.

Dr Roth is a fantastic professor! He is very knowledgeable about the subject material, and he really cares to make sure the class understands. The exams and homework are not difficult as long as you pay attention in class, and put in some time outside of the lectures.

Dr. Roth is a very kind and caring professor. His HW problems and solutions are the best and will really help you out. If you're struggling feel free to go to his office and he will put in a lot of extra time to help you.

Worst professor ever! I took this class online and his expectations were unclear and he never responds to emails. I am an honor student and received an "F" and could not even get him to tell me how he came up with that. I will have to retake the course w/ a different professor. Avoid him!

I took this class online and I agre with all the negative comments about him, especially the one on 8-19-2009. I had the same problem. I did everything he asked and still received a C. I responded to more posts than required to show my effort. My essays always contained everything that he required, and still got a C. Very unclear, unavailable, and not helpful. Avoid if you can! Seriously beware
Although it was online I was so confused about what he wanted and expected.  Was not clear with directions and sometimes did not even respond to emails.  Did not like him at all.

I took this class online and it was a lot more difficult than I thought it would be. I did all that he asked and still got a C. Graded the essays very hard even though everything that he asked was in my essay. Take this class with caution!
Terrible Professor for an online class. Grades very hard and expects you to be online daily. Put it this way, Chem 2 was easier online and this simply HIS 101. I would take someone else if you can.

I took his class online, he wasnt clear at first of how many times he wanted u to be online but it ended up being he wanted u to be on there checking for posts AT LEAST 2-3 times a week, and he was VERY subjective with grading essays, if u wrote something he didnt like u got a D an argumentative paper was to argue one of HIS points not ur own
I took him for an online class. EASY Alot of work but easy as cake. I got an A

I want to clarify that the class wasn't hard but time consuming to be ready for the test.  He knows his stuff and lectures are info packed.  He made the final optional.  I want to disagree that he is the worst prof in the world, solid content knowledge, but expects alot of work for grade.  I agree with the oversimplification comment.

He is the worst possible instructor to ever take in the world. He shows very little interest in helping students and answering questions you may have. Lots and lots of work overall he is terrible avoid him if possible seriously
Lots of work!! Expect to work for an A. Group projects are a mess professor takes long to respond to questions and is not very helpful.
If you are taking the web version expect to do lots of work. He assigns group projects that seem to not work out well.
Best professor I ever took, real innovative approach to history.

Unimaginative approach. As though all of western thought is just a scam to keep the rich rich and the poor poor. Says he doesn't give many "A"s. That's probably because he didn't get many himself. Unforgivable oversimplifications; e.g., Religion invented by Monarch to keep people in line, etc.
this class requires a lockdown browser online. he is a good teacher and his tests aren't terrible. Do not think that you can get an easy A with this course you will for sure have to study.

Dr. Rowlett was a great professor. I believe there was 3 exams, 1 paper and 1 presentation. There is an extra credit assignment as well. He gives study guides for all exams which makes it so much easier to get an A. Although the class is an easy A, you will learn so much. Attend class and you will not fall behind.

Professor Rowlett is an amazing professor, she truly cares about her students. She will extend any homework due dates if she feels like the class is not prepared. Open note exams, similar to questions from the homework. Without a doubt, I would take her over the math professors that teach stats.

Professor Rowlett is an amazing professor, she truly cares about her students. She will extend any homework due dates if she feels like the class is not prepared. Open note exams, similar to questions from the homework. Without a doubt, I would take her over the math professors that teach stats.

Took her PSY 317 as part of my health science degree. I know stats, and I felt she minced the explanations of some topics but I guess other people who weren't as familiar with the material didn't notice. I don't wanna be too mean though, because she is a very interactive and hands-on teacher and overall her class is pretty easy to pass.

She was my favorite professor! She really tries to get to know her students and gives great feedback on homework assignments/papers. She will always tell you what you need to fix to help your grade. I've taken her for two classes and wish I needed another class that she teaches!

Great professor. especially for PT majors. TAKE THIS CLASS INSTEAD OF GOING TO THE MATH ROUTE. She's extremely good at teaching, you don't need to buy a textbook (everything is printed), she's understanding, offers extra credit, and has open note tests. Plus, she's overall a super nice person and will definitely know your name by the end

Great professor! She is very nice and willing to meet with you and help you fix your assignments. Homework assignments all lead up to the final paper. The homework assignments are all parts of the final paper. She is a good teacher and explains things really well. Show that you care about the work and put forth effort and you will do well.

I've always struggled with math, but taking professor Rowletts class you'll never struggle with math again! She is very patient and always makes sure students understand what she's saying before she moves on. She's also a visual teacher so if your visual this is the professor for you!

Presents the information in a way that is easily understood, and always works with you if something is more difficult to understand. There is a paper due at the end of the semester, but the paper is worked on throughout the semester in steps. Only a mid-term and a final in her class.

Took her for research methods, her tests were easy if you studied the power points, if you miss a class, the powerpoints are word for word in the book. gives good feedback on your paper. basically expect 1 huge final paper that you work on throughout the semester and 4 tests. lectures are sometimes boring, but shes a good teacher

I truly enjoyed taking Professor Rowletts Behavioral Science Statistics because I had actually understood what was being taught. If you have struggled with math classes in the past, I highly recommend Professor Rowlett because she teaches the material in a clear and easy way.

Professor Rowlett truly cares and wants her students to succeed. I was nervous to take my capstone/WAC because I hate writing papers, especially research papers, but each homework assignment is guided towards the paper and she tells you what to expect on each exam. Take her as many times as you can, you won't regret it!

Awesome professor. Does whatever you need to help you understand content. I had taken stats classes before so I was already relatively familiar with the content but she made it easy for some first time classmates. Homework only has a few problems and is an basically a carbon copy of what the exams are just with numbers switched out. Take her if you
I never liked math, but this class was pretty straight forward. Teacher was very cool.
This class is super easy, open notes and open book. She is a great teacher, she does so many examples and really explains what you're doing. If you get below an A in this class it is 100% your fault.

I attempted this class with another professor last semester and dropped out because I just did not understand the material. Professor Maria explains things beautifully and if you are still struggling she is always there to help. She is by far one of my top 3 favorite professors at CSU

This class terrified me until I took it with Professor Rowlett. She explains things the material extremely well and is very patient. She is extremely nice and easy to go to if you are having problems. She is one of my top 3 favorite professors at CSU.
Maria is such an amazing teacher!  She is clear, concise, and ALWAYS willing to help her students.  If you need help with something JUST ASK.  I would definitely suggest taking her for any class.

Maria is a wonderful instructor and reasonable. If you show up to class, pay attention, and put forth the effort, you can get an A. She's also very personable with students and learns everyone's name.

I loved this class. She guides the class along, answers questions, provides study guides. Don't buy the book! You don't need it! Just print the tables online like I did. All you need are the charts/ tables. All homework and info is provided on handouts.

OK so I took this class last sem with a different prof & I was failing so I dropped out. Professor Rowlett makes stats so INCREDIBLY easy! I never received lower than a B on the tests & she is very lenient with grading.  She is AMAZING and she is always willing to help! Take her for stats! Grades aren't in yet but I should have an A or B :)

Heavy review: this course is the stepping stone and framework to your accounting degree education. Im a single mom whos in her 3rd yr and finally posting my review here. His preparation for your future in the upcoming semesters is a joke. If you intend on wanting to succeed and get your degree, take this course with any other professor.

He shows up late to EVERY class, has pointless lectures, and he's all over the place. Theres only 4 grades for the semester and they're the exams. Literally one of the Worst professors I have ever had!!!
Tough one !!

Where do I start? I liked Dr. Rozen as a person and would love to have him as my accountant, but as a prof., he's fine. No visuals, no participation from class, reads/lectures from book, assigns HW but doesn't grade it. You'll be doing a lot of individual learning and rereading of chapters. Always late to class and has bad case of indigestion.

He doesnt write anything on the board or do any kind of visuals to explain lectures. Just goes through the chapter and reviews homework people have done in the class. He also doesnt really enunciate and is very montonous so I could pay attention long. Tests are pretty easy multiple choice so just teach yourself from the book. Takes attendance tho

I just finished summer class for Dr Rozen in Accounting 600. He is a good guy and cares about his students. You will have to learn this subject on your own. Go over the HW ;DO NOT MISS ANY CLASSES. and participate and you are in the driver seat.
Bad and not good.

Look, you don't have to sweat this guy! This will be one of the worst classes you will ever have, the guy just reads from the book, burps non-stop, and the tests are ridiculously hard! I got a 30% on the 2nd test and still got a B- in the class, just do what u can the lowest grade u can get is a C! Its really a joke class but nothing 2 worry about

be prepared to work.  he knows his stuff but you will end up reading mostly from the book.  Very very nice curve on tests.  Come to class and listen and there's no reason you shouldn't get a B.  Not your typical teacher VERY old fashioned

He took attendance three times per class, even after holding class longer than required because of the RNC. We were penalized for leaving after class was technically supposed to end, yet because he was late 20-30 minutes late each class and spent a disproportionate time reviewing homework, class was held later than necessary. Avoid at all costs!

He is every students worst nightmare. Shows up   late every class therefore makes you stay late. Can't reach him outside of class. He talks way to fast and he doesn't articulate so it sounds like he is mumbling. Doesn't teach at all . Ninety percent of the class is him reading from the book. Tests do not match his lectures. Worst prof. At CSU.

Dr. Rozen he usually shows up late. Even though the homework and attendance are not factors in the grade according to the syllabus that not true. He makes up for it by being easy grader. Their are 3 exams in his class I bomb the second still received an A in his class. If you want to pass he is must have.
He is very clear on what will be on the tests. Gives exact number of problems from each chapter.

Where to begin ... he's usually 15-20 minutes late to class; constantly does this burping thing under his breathe that is incredibly annoying; lectures consist of him reading straight from the book; spends 15 minutes a class just assigning hw that is not actually graded ... i could go on and on  No real need to go to class ... passed with  100%

He is not a teacher at all. He reads from the book, and talks pretty fast, so sometimes you may not understand what he said. Does not use board at all. no GRADED homework, but does assign homework out of the book. honestly, you will learn hardly nothing in class, everything you will learn will be from reading the book. Curves test, easy B or higher
teaches out the book and is a very big curver on tests.

I struggled at first but it came out well for the whole semester. Here are the tips to be successful in his class: keep studying hard, be well prepared before class, focus every word in class, ask questions right away in class if you are confused, ask more in office time. I asked so many questions and he answered all my questions until I understood

No teaching style, very book smart but lacks any real world application during class. Does not reach. Reads the book to you during one session, the next you are reading the book to him as part of homework review. I enjoy accounting and it's my major, highly recommend you don't take this prof. I plan to send detailed documentation to the department

This professor simply read the chapters aloud to the class. He did not teach the material and would not answer questions asked during class. He you want to actually learn accounting, I would not recommend his course. If you just want to pass, take it!
Very hard, but very solid. He actually teaches the entire time instead of just boasting about his life like half the other CSU profs.  Work hard and you'll learn a lot.  Get an A too.

She has a thick accent and speaks fast. The class material is easy, however, the way she explains the material is very confusing. She is a nice teacher and WILL help you individually if asked (she has been known to give extra credit assignments) the homework isn't too hard. midterm /final are 20-30 questions. It's honestly not too hard of a class.

I would not recommend her at all. Personally  i did  not go to class much towards the end of the semester but that was due to the fact of after half of a semester of going, she had not taught me one thing. She makes the class way harder than it is and she is difficult to understand. Her homework is worth more points then the quizzes.

I would not recommend taking this professor unless you absolutely have to. You better be really strong in stats. It's not an easy subject and I think that this professor makes it harder than it needs to be. She doesn't explain things very well in class. I had to teach myself a lot of the material. She has high expectations.

Prof. Rubado is very knowledgeable and helpful. Her class wasn't tough, but it wasn't easy either. It was just a standard statistics course really. She is very accessible outside of class though and she will help you nail down concepts that you find difficult to grasp. Overall, I would recommend her class, especially if you need it for your major.

Prof. Rubado is very knowledgeable and helpful. Her class wasn't tough, but it wasn't easy either. It was just a standard statistics course really. She is very accessible outside of class though and she will help you nail down concepts that you find difficult to grasp. Overall, I would recommend her class, especially if you need it for your major.

This class is tough especially if you're not into politics. You do get a lot of great information from this class. I wouldn't miss too many of her classes if I were you because it does count towards your grade. She is really nice though and she will help you if you need it. I put yes I would take the class again, but only if it were mandatory.

I really enjoyed my Quantitative Analysis course with Rubado! She's chill, funny, and somehow makes statistics interesting with humor and passion for policy analysis. Don't skip class-- seriously, catching up in this one can be brutal. There's a partner project final so snag someone helpful!

Dr. Rubado is a very tough professor because she expects a lot out of her students. She will always give you solid feedback and encourage you to do your best. Class is very writing intensive. Required weekly lectures require video responses which increases participation. Overall, great class if you're ready to learn.
Grading was a little tough for undergrad. Fresh out of grad school is probably why. Very knowledgeable about the subject. She is a good lecturer as well

I took 3 music theory classes with him (MUS 231, 232, & 341) and he made this difficult material easier to work with. Very compassionate, he adjusted deadlines reasonably to accommodate my personal issues that came up. I thought he was an excellent teacher.

Rubin knows music theory in and out, however, he doesn't know how to teach theory. Students must pass a proficiency exam in week five and the vast majority of the class did not. I would not have passed if I didn't have my tutor. He also always dismisses questions which can be very discouraging. Everyone tends to drift off because he rambles on.

I took 3 music theory classes with him (MUS 231, 232, & 341) and he made this difficult material easier to work with. Very compassionate, he adjusted deadlines reasonably to accommodate my personal issues that came up. I thought he was an excellent teacher.

No quizzes or exams. Only three papers that you can write at a fifth-grade level and pass. The majority of points in the class come from attendance and online homework. He refers to the textbook multiple times, but it's honestly a waste of money. He just lectures at you the entire time and never asks questions. You will never be tested on the info

Very pleasant professor, and nice. Sometimes she can be a little off, or slightly unorganized. She follows the syllabus, uses powerpoints, and books. She wrote her own book which is available on Amazon. It was cool to read some of her work. She is kind and takes attendance. She is interesting and fun. Study the powerpoints and notes. Good Luck!

Very pleasant professor, and nice. Sometimes she can be a little off, or slightly unorganized. She follows the syllabus, uses powerpoints, and books. She wrote her own book which is available on Amazon. It was cool to read some of her work. She is kind and takes attendance. She is interesting and fun. Study the powerpoints and notes. Good Luck!

Prof Rudd doesn't use Blackboard at all. The assignments are not online, nor is your grade; in this day and age that should be mandatory for all professors. I don't follow verbal instruction well, and many things are just said in class, it gets chaotic. No Powerpoints to refer to online, grading scale is bizarre uses P/F not pts, unclear criteria

Dr. Rudd was a difficult professor because she challenges you and wants you to learn. Her class was challenging but I learned so much. She cares about her students and if you ask for help she is more than willing. She is very intelligent and she knows what she is talking about. She challenged me more than any professor but I am great full.
Took her class online in the summer it was a lot of work but it was a summer class.  I finished with a B, wanted the A but her online tests were a bit tough.

Dr. Rudd is my favorite professor thus far! She gives very detailed & useful feedback, and is very accommodating. Expect to write bimonthly papers & a ton of negotiation practice. Her examples are on point and she seems to somehow "get" people. Choose your group mates for the final. Very stimulating discussions and a very fair grader. Fun class!
She is a very thoughtful professor.  If you participate and listen you will do fine and she is great at reaffirming you.  Best professor I have ever hard.

Dr. Rudd is an exceptional professor. She has a lot of experience teaching and is very knowledgable about the material. A few comments on here say she is disorganized but that is just her system and it works for her. Gives great feedback, is there for students and students must be willing to work and learn in her classes. Would be a great mentor

She definitely knows what she's talking about, but class is disorganized. I think it's a communication thing because any teacher I've had has been like that. It's hard to follow and she's all over the place. Did not enjoy this class at all.
Easy class but since online it was hard to know what was all due. She had stuff to do that wasn't on syllabus and terrible at explaining it

Mixed feelings about this professor- on the one hand she definitely knows her stuff, and can work in concepts on the fly without a lesson plan. On the whole though, I felt that most of the learning methods/tools she used were helpful
once again, another great class by Dr. Jill.. shes great. You learn a lot, You do a lot, its worth it at the end.
Dr. Jill will kick your ass if you fall off the ball.. so stay on it and you will learn a lot! Shes a great teacher that knows her stuff!
Great teacher.  I think that's all i need to say!

Jill Rudd is absolutly awsome. She is very helpful and makes class fun, just make sure you are there everyday and participate. Her lectures are interesting and has some fun group activities.  Overall she is one of the best Profs at CSU. There are projects and papers as well as tests to get points. I recommend her to everyone and anyone.
J Rudd rocks my world
One of the better professors in the communication department, but that's not saying too much. She's alright, recommended if stuck at CSU.
Excellent professor. Very intelligent, helpful and interested in making her students better. Highly recommend.
