She is very sweet and a genuinely good professor. You can't find professors like her too often anymore. You can't BS your way through her class bc she's not stupid. She will give you good feedback on assignments. The exams (used lockdown) were semi challenging, you'll have to study a little bit. The paper and presentations weren't too difficult.

She is very sweet and a genuinely good professor. You can't find professors like her too often anymore. You can't BS your way through her class bc she's not stupid. She will give you good feedback on assignments. The exams (used lockdown) were semi challenging, you'll have to study a little bit. The paper and presentations weren't too difficult.

Great professor!! she has a lot of experience in the field. Her lectures were always interesting. The are two-three projects and the tests aren't too bad either. Just make sure to attend class and take good notes in class.

Has a lot of experience in the marketing field. She is very knoledgeable, explains all the topics wll and gives great examples. Her tests aren't too bad and there is one group project at the end of the semester.

Kim is a good lecturer and brings real world experience into the classroom. Participation is encouraged and counts toward your final grade. Tests are manageable if you do the online homework. Multiple choice and written. Group projects throughout the course, but not difficult to do.

Kim's tests are known for being a tad difficult. You need to read the chapters and power points to ace her tests. Semester long group project. Attendance counts towards a grade as does participation. She's very approachable and nice but is a tough grader.
Great teacher, have taken her for several classes. I have learned a lot from her.

KIm herself is knowledgeable on material, yet could change curriculum. Dedicated a lot of outside class time to work on semester long group project. Lets group members determine part of your class participation grade which is unfair. Even if you get an A or B on most assignments it is hard to maintain an A on her grading scale.

Kim is very nice. She shows that she has a lot of knowledge and experience in marketing. Often shares personal experience when presenting concepts. You need connect for assignment and make sure you keep up with the due dates. In class, she lectures and ends class early often. There is an individual paper and a group assignment.
Good class explains things okay for semester long project. Unfair when giving individual grading based on perception and group bias.

very nice prof that makes lectures relatable to all majors. homework is online and easy. must read text, PPs, and HW to pass tests that are MC/TF, short answer, and essay. 1 paper and 1 group project. a lot of work but not hard material to understand. would take her again

Kim is a very professional teacher. I really enjoyed this class. Her exams are tough and all application based. As much as I studied I always got a C on her exams. There is an individual and group project you have to do; which can boost your grade. The connect home work that's due every week is like 20 percent , and all can be found on google.

Really passionate about Marketing and has experience in the field. Not hard to do what she asks and the marketing plans are very easy for the individual and determinant of your group for the group plan. Cares enough about students to dedicate a day towards job, interview, professionalism tips. all-around everything you can ask for in a professor.

She's passionate about marketing and is very helpful when you ask. She can be a tough grader but not the worst. Her tests are multiple choice and you can honestly just study from the power points even though she says you should read.

Lectures are fun and interesting, and she has good experience in the field. I started off really liking her, BUT she gives zero direction with assignments or exams. Expect to study a lot and learn how to do a marketing plan on your own. Exams are always multiple choice, short answer, and an essay.  No exam reviews are given which really sucked.
She is biased and an unfair grader.  Has experience in field, lectures aren't that interesting though.

Kim is the best Marketing professor at CSU. She is passionate about the subject, truly wants her students to learn, and care for her students. She is very clear and organized. Although she is not the easiest professor, you can get an A if you put the work in the class. She will help you earn your A. All in all, my favorite professor at CSU.

She is very experienced in marketing and her lectures are interesting, but she's not that fair when it comes to grading. I asked her to explain to me what was wrong with my paper she wouldn't even answer me. She said she's not changing the grade! I just don't think that's a good teaching method when the student gets a low grade without knowing why.

Good professor and has good knowledge of the subject. She can give you good connections to individuals who can help you with your career path. Tough grader on final papers. One big group project and presentation which will take the entire semester to complete. Make sure you pick the right people to work with.

Kim is the kind of professor who can actually change your life. She's very kind and willing to help in and outside of the classroom. She's very personable and down to earth and really helped walk us through a real consulting project applicable to real life jobs.

Kim is great. She's laidback and really into marketing. She's friendly and is always willing to help out. There was a few tests that weren't very hard as long as you pay attention. One big group project that goes on for the entire class, which wasn't hard in my opinion but I also had a good group. I recommend her.

Dr. Runner is a good professor. NUR 506 consisted mainly of discussion board questions and papers focusing on health education and nursing theories. The content was interesting and Dr. Runner provided detailed feedback on assignments.

Dr. Runner is a good professor. NUR 506 consisted mainly of discussion board questions and papers focusing on health education and nursing theories. The content was interesting and Dr. Runner provided detailed feedback on assignments.

Professor Eva Rus is an adequate teacher. However, I do not feel as though I have learned very much. I took this class because I wanted to learn more, however, much of what is done in the class is stating ones own opinion. Only two tests, midterm, and final - both of which, most people do poorly on. Could have assigned more work work.

Good teacher. Easy class if you do the work, however, it seemed like there was a lot of people who just didn't care and didn't do the work. Three of the same people participated in the class  discussions every class; everyone else sits back and tries not to fall asleep(it's a night class). Overall though, thorough, clear teacher.

Excellent professor. She's teaching Womens Studies and I love her! Her lectures are interesting, relevant and easy to follow. Tests are difficult regardless of whether you study or not. Despite that, it's a very interesting course and it really makes you think about the imbalance of power around you.
Takes the textbook and gives you precise information, no tricks to any exams exact informayion makes sure you are well prepared. Really knows how to guide students in the right direction.

Dr. Rush is the among the best professors I've had at CSU.  While her course was challenging, she was helpful and I actually learned something.  I can't think of a reason not to recommend any of her classes to anyone.

Mrs. Rush is one of the best English professors I've ever had, she is caring and really respectful. She does give a lot of reading entrees and work but it's easy, and as long as you do all the work, you should get an A for sure. Mrs. Rush is one of the best English professors I've ever had, she is caring and really respectful. Kim was such an amazing professor I loved her class. She is super sweet and always gives her honest feedback on assignments (which is very helpful). There are a lot of reading entrys that are for homework but they are easy to do and fun to talk about in class. Just do your homework and take feedback from others on assignments and youll do great!

I have many issues w Dr. Russell. Her lectures are not easy to follow. She jumps all over the place, its hard to keep up and understand what shes even talking about. She sets unrealistic expectations for her students, yet expects us to meet them. Ive had several interactions with Dr. Russell where she has been so unbelievably disrespectful to me

She is a nice person, but that's it. She seems lost during lectures and runs out of content. When she runs out of content, which is often, she goes on an on about the same ideas, term, and strate3. Assignmets are repetitive and of little value for educators.

Dr. Russell is one of the nicest professors I've ever had at Cleveland State. She is there to help you and provides feedback that can help you with future assignments. At least 3 assignments per week. Attendance is mandatory. Homework is very time consuming.

Dr. Russell is a very detail oriented professor but provides a classroom setting that is inviting and informative. The easiness rating is lower because she expects the best out of you but will work with you to make sure that is achieved. She is probably the most competent professor in the department.
Dr. Russell brings honor to the title "Doctor". What do I mean? Take her and find out.
Great professor for typography, gives good feedback and does it very constructively, there is a lot of work but it really helps you learn the material
Great professor for typography, gives good feedback and does it very constructively, there is a lot of work but it really helps you learn the material

Really great prof for intro to type her critiques are great. Things you will need for this class do beware the first project you do for intro to type will kick your butt but after that it's a super fun class and very enjoyable I'm taking her for two more classes and really looking forward to it.

Un-approachable. Strict requirements including attendance. If you do not have an extensive knowledge in InDesign or Illustrator programs, do not waste your time taking her class. If you cannot commit several hours, if not days, to homework assignments and projects, do not take her class.  The stress level in this class is not to be underestimated.

It is a lot of work! But Mrs. Ruud makes the class worth it. She extremely understanding very easy to communicate with, she answers in a timely manner. If you just talk to her, it should be easy to pass the class.

It is a lot of work! But Mrs. Ruud makes the class worth it. She extremely understanding very easy to communicate with, she answers in a timely manner. If you just talk to her, it should be easy to pass the class.
I highly recommend her class. She makes it clear what she expects, and you can work ahead. I was done with her class entirely 3 weeks before the semester was over.

There was quite a bit of assignments, but nothing too hard. She grades easy as long as you seem like your trying. Loved being able to work ahead, so I was done with the class completely before finals week.

She assigns an insane amount of work. Easily 5-10 hours of homework every single week if you are in an online class with her. Everything else about her is fine just don't take her class online and especially not when you have other classes.

DON'T TAKE IF YOU HAVE A WAC COURSE! Took this class online and I could tell she's probably a really sweet woman, however she requires WAY too many assignments for a 200 level course. I took this as a lower division elective and regret it. Multiple quizzes//quantitatives/exercises/"earthweeks" due EVERY WEEK. Easy on grading because you work for it

I took geology online this semester and it was a super easy class to pass. One paper and like 6 quizzes (all the answers are in the book). Prof. Ruud does a great job with this class online. She gives good feedback and is a fair grader

A perfect class to ease your way into online courses. The syllabus gives you all assignments  and it is not changes at all through the semester. She genuinely wants you to do well and will tell you to make changes after the due date so she can give you a better score. Flexible for turning assignments in. Generally easy content to learn. Spoon Fed.

The professor responded to emails quickly, she was willing to help anyone who had questions. The course content was clear and easy to understand. There was a lot of writing probably because it was an online class. I would take this professor again.

She was a very good professor. Although some of the assignments were confusing in the beginning, she was very willing to help out and be there for the students. She was very kind and understanding when it came to due dates, and she assigned very interesting topics for the class. Overall good teacher!

As much as I enjoyed the subject, the amount of work required was unmanageable.  Not sure whether the online element drives Ms. Ruud to assign as much work as she does, I couldn't keep up with the demands and still produce the quality product that I wanted.  I will definitely consider taking this class again, but in person, with another instructor.

On-line class.  Lots of writing but that is standard for on-line.  I found the material interesting.  Prof was helpful when life intervened. Would recommend to others that can keep deadlines etc without someone nagging.

Class is online, and it is boring. The assignments are excessive. Each of the exercises is like a decent sized research paper. Professor grades  in a whimsical manner. Quiz study guides are ambiguous. Quizzes are not based on textbook material, contrary to professor's claim.

Took this course online. Pace was nice, actually moved kind of slow. The Exercises for homework were entirely too long. Fair grader and will extend deadlines (I didn't even ask just turned things in late and it didn't seem like she took off any points). The tests are extremely easy too. You can get by without actually reading the text.

Really great teacher and fun class.  When I looked at the syllabus, it looked overwhelming but the work is nicely spaced out and completely manageable.  Best of all, it's interesting.  Highly recommend this class and this professor.

Dr. Ryan has been the best professor I have had! He knows his stuff and is able to ask any questions. His lectures are fun, he always makes sure to sprinkle jokes throughout class time. He truly cares about his students and if you need an extension just ask. Quick at responding to emails and a fast grader. You won't regret taking his class.

Dr. Ryan has been the best professor I have had! He knows his stuff and is able to ask any questions. His lectures are fun, he always makes sure to sprinkle jokes throughout class time. He truly cares about his students and if you need an extension just ask. Quick at responding to emails and a fast grader. You won't regret taking his class.
Take His Class!!!!!!!!!!!!! One of the best teachers I ever had. He is really fun and its a great class.

TAKE THIS CLASS WITH HIM! He is hilarious, great at lecturing and explaining topics, gives practice exams before the real exam which are very helpful. I can't say more great things about him. I almost wish I had to take more math thanks to him. Before I enrolled in calc I thought I was going to fail, thanks to Dr. Ryan I got an A.

Dr. Ryan is the one of the best profs I've ever had. He makes an hard topic like calculus so easy to learn. There is many chances for points in the class such as homework problems, attendance points, and 4 exams with one being replaced by the final. There is also many chances for extra credit. Overall a great prof would take another class with him.

Dr. Ryan is great. He's very lenient with assignments and tests are a cakewalk. This is because he understands the point of a class is to learn, not pass. He's very accessible for extra help and even advice. You'll get a great exposure to programming and numeric methods. I recommend him if you actually want to learn (also if you want an easy A).
Dr. Ryan is absolutely the BEST professor ever! Very nice guy and his jokes are the best! Take him for as many classes as you can because you will not only pass, you will learn

Very Knowledgeable Doctor that really want to make you understand. Calculus II is not an easy course, I took it more than one time and with him you guaranteed passing the course. not just he is available outside class and willing to work with you but his VERY CORNY JOKES what made me go through this course ! I REALLY RECOMMEND TAKING HIM

Professor Ryan is literally the best professor I've ever had. He really knows what he's talking  about and he's willing to spend many hours of time, outside of class, helping students. If you try and you go to him for help, you will pass. He tells a lot of corny jokes, but they really got us through the class! Hard material, but great teacher
Loved this class, I would take even if you're not an urban major- I still had fun and learned a lot.
Loved this class, I would take even if you're not an urban major- I still had fun and learned a lot.

took this course last year. have no beef w it. theres required readings so need the textbook but u can also b like me and just not to the readings and end up with a low C its on u. attendance was a sign in sheet. the class is pretty straight forward: u watch movies, have a lecture after, a couple hw assignments throughout,& tests and quizzes.

She is my favorite lecturer. My only problems with her class were there were too few grades and she did not lecture enough. To be fair the class was city in film so it was based on her not lecturing sometimes.
If you show up to class and watch the films that is already half the work. The rest are short reflection papers and easy tests.
She's pretty average, but gives a lot of work for basic things. If you want to take her, be wary of the reading and essays (there's a lot!) She doesn't really give great feedback either.
Amazing professor! Her classes are challenging, but the experience is very rewarding. She is very knowledgeable.
Absolutely one of the best professors I've ever had.  Her lectures are incredibly interesting, she keeps the class engaged.  You won't get an easy grade but you'll definitely learn something!
Smart, focused, very knowledgeable about her chosen field & related areas. More energy than most professors. And she's cute!

Dr. Ryberg is the best professor I've had here. Her Contemporary Urban Issues class is a lot of reading and writing (satisfies WAC, African American, AND cultural diversity req. though) BUT TOTALLY WORTH IT. I would take her class again but I'm an economics major :/ Don't enroll if you aren't willing to do research though LOL

She was a good professor overall who cared about your professional development. Knowledgeable about the subject matter. Make sure you come to class, she takes a lot of points off for missing class work, and it can't be made up.  Felt like a lot of busy work most times, make sure assignments are done throughly.

She's one of those prof's that says "here's your assignment, just do it" without any real explanation. The assignments are outlined in her syllabus and handouts, but worded weird so be prepared to read the rubrics multiple times. The only real way to pass the class is to make sure you have every little detail on point. Otherwise, fun class!!

The big project is a lesson plan that incorporates art. She provides no direction on how to form this lesson, how to present it to the class, and when you ask her how she just says "look at the syllabus." (The syllabus says nothing about it). Don't let her" laidbackness" and "coolness" distract you from realizing she isn't that great.

Sabin's class was easy and fun to be at. It was the only class I looked forward to going to this semester. Some of the projects are fun. The resource binder didn't seem like it taught me anything but it was easy. Overall, this is a good class and you will have fun with this professor. She is really down to earth.
She's dedicated and helpful with her students. She really is a good professor, but honestly I could have googled 95% of what we did in class.

Securities Regulation + Corporations. Great attitude, staggering level of intelligence, very friendly, approachable outside of class, injects humor into what could be a dry, statutory analysis class. No surprises on Final. Doesn't take attendance but you MUST go READ take MAD notes. Ask questions. Home-made scones on the last day of SecReg class ;)

Sagers was a great professor for an unclear subject. Broke it down really well, and made it easy to follow. Hilarious and laid-back in class. Can get off topic when confronted with a good philosophical question, but is also extremely knowledgeable about this subject. Hoping to take as many classes as I can with him.
Uses own book which is organized very clearly. Took an awfully dry subject and made it interesting. Nice guy, funny and approachable.
VERY unclear questions to students, hard to follow...nice guy..but that's not going to make me understand administrative law...
He is a great guy personally, he cares, tries hard, goes way out of his way to help - nothing bad to say about him...
Excellent professor!  Very nice and approachable
Great professor!! Very interesting! Very nice and approachable.
He uses his own book, which is very nice and clear. Very student oriented, helpful and personable. Does reviews before the exam, which is very unusual in this school.
teaches from his own book which is very nice

Ugh, where do I start? Disclaimer: He's a nice guy. However, he's VERY unclear, his materials  are disorganized. He speaks WAY to quickly, and his questions of students are awfully vague. It's nearly impossible in class not to: a. fall asleep b. laugh for no reason c. hate your life d. totally forget who you are e. all of above. Good guy bad class.
Great professor, and VERY cute too! ;)
clear presentation and really cares about the students.
No Comments

Prof. Saggio is great. In the beginning of the course, we were all confused about course requirements (including her), so she brought people in from OFS and the dept of education to answer our questions. She is so helpful and offers a lot of insight into the field through her personal experience.

This professor is super forgettable. Basic. I took it online. He is willing to help. If you dont like economics then the class will be hard obviously. I applied a the very minimum amount of effort and got a B+. Do the assignments and you'll do fine. I'm a grad student and I dont care about anything.

Like someone already stated, he moves way too fast class and uses a TON of abbreviations and words that he never explains then clearly gets annoyed with you when you don't understand what he's talking about. He was never rude to me personally, but he was to others in my class. Do one thing to tick him off and he will hold it against you.

he is super strict about attendance and carzy about cell phone if he sees you on phone with he will he will stop class harass you get mad and hold it agianst you for the whole semester (not joking). he is rude and not respectful of most students. very strict about dates god forbid you have an emergency and can't make one of the tests

He is really a nice professor. I am strongly recommend him. You will never miss his class once it started because it is so interesting. He wants everyone to be successful. He relates everything to real world applications. I have got A.

Lectures are confusing and he moves way too quickly through material for an intro course. Uses abbreviations without explaining them. Tests are extremely difficult. Don't bother asking him to explain his grading- it makes no sense! He also told us that most of us won't "make it" and that we aren't prepared and will have no skills upon graduation.

This is my first ever economics class and I loved it. Dr. Saha is very helpful. Exams can be tricky but he provides very good study guide. Attending the study sessions before exam is exceedingly helpful. He answers very quickly when you email.  I enjoyed the class very much
Great professor. I learned a lot in this class. Wish there were other classes he was teaching.
Great professor. Tells you exactly what you would see on exams. Just show up to class and practice the problems he assigns and you should do well in the class. Highly recommend him.

Go to class and study exactly what he gives you as a review for the exams. If you don't understand material on the review, ask! What he says he'll cover on the exams he covers (a few times he throws in a question only covered during lectures). Do the problems he highlights during review because they're similar to the exam questions you'll see.

He is a very helpful professor, he wants to see people succeed. I wouldn't say it was the easiest class but if you show up and try, you should do well. He takes suggestions and will tailor things based on how students are responding. I learned a lot and would recommend taking a class with him.

He is a great professor. He cares deeply about the subject material and the students. He is both book smart and has common sense. It is rare to find these two qualities in the same professor. The lessons are taught at a level above that of CSU's requirements and this is a good thing. I wish him only the best of success in his future.

GO TO CLASS! If you attend class and pay attention, you'll do well.  The concepts don't really get into difficult economics topics. He makes every effort to help students understand and take an interest in the class. He got us a trip to see the fed bldg. He's a great guy! Don't ever be afraid to ask for help. Wish I could take more classes with him

I disagree with some people below. This professor has changed. He cares about each student and he is very helpful. Just show up to class, study everything he says during exam review, you should do well in the class. He explains everything clearly and made the class very interesting. I highly recommend him if considering an economics course
This was a very interesting class
he is very nice and helpful   in class and outside the class for each and  every student. take him and have fun i love him.

He is very willing to make an extra effort outside the classroom to assist students who need help.   He adjusted the class due to feedback to try to be fair to all.   I thought he did a great job explaining things clearly.   If you attend all the classes and study hard you can get a solid grade.   He was great!
Great professor! Actually cares if students understand the material. Make economics easier to understand for people who aren't familiar with it.

Great course! Saha makes difficult concepts easy to understand, treats the class like adults, and dishes out the perfect amount of deadpan humor to keep things interesting. The quizzes can be difficult due to the nature of the material, but if you do the HW assignments and put in some effort, you'll no trouble earning a B. Go with Saha!
I really enjoyed his class he is the best

I had professor Saha for ECN 302 for the Fall 2013 semester. He's a great professor. He has a lot to cover in a short period of time, but he's very effective in doing so. He teaches a very hard subject. I give him props. He takes note of those that actually put forth effort in doing well. I recommend him to anyone that needs to take ECN 302.

Dr. Sahley is passionate about the material and spends a great deal of time ensuring students receive the information they need to succeed. Textbook is optional, but is a great reference if you are struggling. He provides clear expectations and a study guide before every exam. A lot of testable info will be said verbally, so pay attention!

Dr. Sahley is passionate about the material and spends a great deal of time ensuring students receive the information they need to succeed. Textbook is optional, but is a great reference if you are struggling. He provides clear expectations and a study guide before every exam. A lot of testable info will be said verbally, so pay attention!

He puts up lecture videos that are almost 2 hours long twice a week. There is so much information and you only get graded on 5 exams. These exams are usually 90-100 questions and are timed. Not only is this lecture heavy, he is a very boring professor. DO NOT take this class if you do not have to. You will want to die.
He canceled 13 classes. Did not post supplemental info for the lectures he canceled. His lectures went 60 mins to 15 mins long. He does not answer students questions via email.

Sahley did not help me with the problems I had after I emailed him. I thought maybe he was just having a bust day until I learned others in my class weren't do well either and not receiving any help. If this class is online DO NOT TAKE IT!!! It's a super lecture heavy and he will not help you when asked.

I am taking the class right now and at the moment it is all online. Each of his lectures are insanely long and have so much information in them. You are only graded on 5 exams and all of them are anywhere from 80-115 questions long. If you can avoid this class do it because you will not learn anything.

This professor is not helpful if you have questions. I have asked numerous questions through email as it is an online course right now and he will respond with one sentence answers usually directing me to another way of finding the answer. I don't think he understands that it is his job to teach his students. He does not give access to his ppts.

If you want to pass record the lectures and get a tutor. He isn't great at explaining concepts, there are no power points and he lectures a mile a minute. Also he wrote the textbook and there are incorrect answers/explanations in the textbook.

Very tough class, but truly it is manageable. Record the lectures! Dr. Sahley is very knowledgeable and you will learn a lot, but you have to put the work in! He lectures very fast and doesnt use PowerPoint for this course. Go to the tutoring center if you can. It will help!

This professor is extremely unorganized in his presentation of the material. He barely looks up from his notes as he mumbles off a jumbled mess. A lot of info in the slides is unnecessary (per the Prof) but he expects you to know a lot of information not in his presentations. Why should I have to record him? Bad at teaching. Take it in the SPRING!
Get ready to teach yourself everything. ***record the lectures***
He jumps around from topic to topic so it gets very confusing. Make sure to take good notes, because he uses a chalkboard & lecture the whole time.

He is definitely knowledgeable but has no mercy for how he talks to students and doesn't care about how stupid you feel, making others afraid to ask questions. In fact, its funny to him. I believe he enjoys people failing his class. Lectures are so unorganized (i.e. you will literally go from Ch. 3 to 1 to 5 to 2 in just 1 lecture.) STUDY EVERYDAY
Information is extremely unorganized in his PowerPoints, he is very sarcastic, his exams are normally 100-120 questions long

Learned so much from him! great class and teacher! study what he discusses in class and really understand the material and you will have no problem. Read the sections of his book if you are unclear of the topic after what he says in class , it really helps. His tests are difficult but manageable. if your unwilling to study don't take his class

He gives you whats on the test the day before the exam. There are no tricks, tests are pretty straightforward if you know the material. Just 5 tests. 90% is an A. Don't get the textbook. Everything you need is in the powerpoint slides.

Dr. Sahley has improved. The material is still very difficult but he now welcomes questions, provides power points instead of straight lecture, and will repeat content that the class is having trouble with. Before exams he tells us exactly what will be on there. You have to study hard for this class but if you put in the effort, you'll be fine.

Dr. Sahley is a great teacher . I learned so much in his class. The material is difficult, he presents it clear and thoroughly he does not try to trick you you know exactly what he wants! You must study and be diligent  but he is great- you will learn SO MUCH.   If you have questions he is helpful and he is pretty entertaining too!
Not approachable.  Sarcastic and inconsiderate when answering questions.  His test are shorter now but I don't think it was his choice to make it that way.

One of the most intelligent professors I've had. He knows his stuff. I do see why students are intimidated by him for that reason. He really is not an awful person like people will say. Very VERY difficult tests so RECORD LECTURTES. Grade is strictly test based and tests are tricky to the point where you will question if he's TRYING to confuse you.

You won't even see professor Sahley, a TA will be teaching the class. The labs are fun and not very hard. You MUST read the articles for the quizzes. The quizzes are all blanks, no multiple choice so READ THE ARTICLE. The papers aren't too too hard and my TA was a very nice grader.

She is the best!!! Easy tests and quizzes if you read the assigned readings. We watch videos to get a visualization of what is being learned. We only have 2 writing assignments,2 quizzes, 2 exams (midterm and final). I absolutely loved her class and I highly recommend for someone to take it!!
I had some serious setbacks with work and home and personal things but this professor took a lot of extra time to help with papers, work, exams. awesome class and awesome help!
I had some serious setbacks with work and home and personal things but this professor took a lot of extra time to help with papers, work, exams. awesome class and awesome help!

Dr. Wally was a decent prof. He doesn't share notes or ppts so you have to come to class. almost added linguistics as a minor but didnt have the room in my class schedule. Sometimes goes off on related topics but very well read and funny.

"Dr. Wally" literally made me drop by minor in linguistics. This intro class made me more frustrated and upset than I have ever been before. Dr. Wally is a hilarious and very cultured person, but as a professor, flies through power point lectures, doesn't post notes (and you can't take pictures), and have tons of trick questions on exams :')

Dr. Salkauski will purposely make all / almost all of the questions on his exams trick questions. He barely teaches, and when he does he teaches way too fast and will not post his notes to blackboard. He will also not let you take photos of his powerpoints. I am stressing way too much over this class. He is a funny guy and has a good sense of humor

He is very demanding but he is also more than willing to give extra help when needed, especially with the GIS assignments. The tests are tough but he grades on a curve. As long as you make the effort, you'll do fine. Just make sure you have a coffee before class because the lack of interaction will put you sleep.

Very knowledgeable about the course material. Very demanding of his students. This professor is more likely to give you a break with assignments if you are somebody who a) speaks a lot in class, b) asks hims questions and flatters him,  c) show enthusiasm in writing or participation, andor d) have very real need.

This class was terrible. One of the worst I have ever had to take. The exams are ridiculous, and you have to know the location of virtually any country since you have to label maps as well. The homework required for the lab is INSANE. I pulled so many all-nighters and still wasn't finishing assignments on time. It is honestly a miracle I passed.

This is one of the worst professors I have ever had the misfortune of dealing with in my educational career. Sam Yellowe preaches that her lectures and the book are all thats needed to pass but even if you do read and attend class, she will go out of her way to find the smallest reason possible to take major points off assignments and exams. AVOID

On week one there was no explanation of the syllabus or what she expects. She lies about when she will post things (like quizzes) and never apologizes or takes responsibility. She is difficult to understand which makes the course hard to focus in. There is always an issue with her key so things are marked wrong. Sorry, but she is the worst at CSU.

Terrible teacher. Avoid at all cost. You don't learn anything in class and have to teach yourself entirely. I do more work for this class than all my other classes combined. Nonsense homework with work scrambles in immunology. Hours and hours of busywork that you have to do to pass. Probably the worst teacher I have ever had

Having taken this professor's summer microbio class, I can say that it was a very challenging, yet fair class. She made class very interesting. She had incredible understanding of the content she was teaching, and could answer any content-related question. She was always open to help students outside of class. Difficult class, but learned a lot.

She is awful. The worst professor I have ever had. She is so unclear about what's on your tests, how grades are calculated, what material you need to read, etc. Her lectures are so dry she doesn't explain anything. She basically expects you to read the whole book. Horrible

She doesn't teach very well. Her grading criteria is VERY confusing. she always takes attendance and gives pop quizzes. Tests are usually online with multiple attempts, but she may have an in class essay portion. There was also a 10 minute presentation that must be prepared.

Awesome professor. A lot of these reviews were done by non-bio majors. She is always willing to help. She WILL make you work your tail off, but when you're in college, this should be expected. Her english is very clear. Don't take her classes if you're looking for an easy A.
Awful teacher. Doesn't speak a lick of English. Do not take her. Ruined my life. She's awful. DO NOT TAKE HER. AWFUL.
You need to ask around for help. You need to talk to people, people that have taken this class already. Start looking. Now.

Class is difficult. Teacher does not speak English well; listen carefully. Writes her own book that she expects class to use. Attendance not manditory. Will answer all and any questions. She offers extra credit as well. Online quizzes are very diffiicult but are open note.

This professor gets alot of unfair poor reviews, IMO. While the material is challenging and it's not an easy A, she is one of the most helpful and kind professors I've ever had and truly wants her students to succeed. If you do the work, she will do everything she can to help you and you WILL get that A.

She teaches all of her classes on a graduate level which is terrible because she teaches some freshmen classes. she also does not teach she just talks at her students and does not explain things very well at all. if its not to late and biology is not your favorite thing in the world i would switch professors.

She is brilliant and seriously wants her students to succeed. Gives plenty of opportunity for extra credit. Is very helpful and kind. She expects a lot out of you, which is her only major downfall.  There is no language barrier.  Show an interest,do the reading and attend class and you will pass. This is an upper level class, not a cake walk.

Dr. Sam-Yellowe is not an easy A. I took cell bio in the summer, but she was very clear about the test material and made you discuss potential essay questions for easy points. She is very intelligent, and can really relate the cell to all aspects of physiology. If you expect upper level classes to be easy, drop out. I highly recommend her.

I dont know why Dr. Sam-Yellowe gets such a bad review, she is really very nice and helpful and makes every attempt to help you get an A in the class. Expectation level is a little high but this is a higher level biology course with graduate students.  If you study you can do well.  She is very passionate about what she does.

HORRIBLE professor. rambles on about nothing...so unclear about what will be on tests. assigns impossible project. jumps around so that it is next to impossible to distinguish how topics are linked. DON'T TAKE HER.

She is one of the worst professors I have ever had!! Made my first semester at CSU a living hell pretty much. She can't speak clear english, and doesnt know how to use a overhead projector. I suggest you not take this class if you want to remain sane!!

Avoid at all costs if you want to remain sane. Lecture all over the place, everything is unorganized poorly explained and the expectation level unreal. Expect in class quizzes, online quizzes, research articles and case studies in addition to having to know the whole book and her own published book and other not required books. ridiculus!!!!

She has extremely unrealistic expectations for the workload of a summer course. Gives over 200+ slides every day that she expects you to memorize by the next day. Doesn't answer emails or explain anything. Little to know instruction on how to do the homework and gives ZERO feedback, like on anything. DO NOT TAKE IF YOU HAVE THE OPTION!!!! AVOID !!!

The reviews are true, she's the toughest prof I've ever had. Treat any of her 400 level classes like grad, expect to make this class your life. She's extremely knowledgeable, but is a very tough grader and expects a lot. You'll learn a lot, but it won't be pleasant. Doesn't allow late submissions and is very inflexible about due dates etc.

Knows her stuff. OMG is she smart, but is she hard. If you take her class, expect to be doing only that in any free time you have. Don't have free time, well guess you're skipping your other class just to barely pass her. Yes its upper level classes but she does not explain assignments, even if you ask. If you dont need to take the classess, DONT!
Terrible. Avoid at all costs.

I have never worked so hard for a class in my life. I literally spent all of my time on this one class - which meant my other classes fell by the wayside, and my grades showed it. Her homework is INSANE - I have no idea how she expects us to finish it all in the time she gives us. THIS CLASS IS HARD!

Dr. Tobili was one of the most difficult professors I have ever had. She lectures very HEAVY, and her quizzes are very difficult. She is very kind and respectful, but her class was very intense. I overall felt like I gained a lot of knowledge from this course, but the course load was too heavy and she consistently gives almost no notice for work.

Granted, I took this class for the summer in 6 weeks. Lots of info in short time, need to read the book to understand better. Asks a few questions from the back of the chapters. Some extra credit opportunities, few points, but very needed. Asks questions you wouldn't think are important. Her final was awful. Really makes you work for your grade.

Very difficult class.  Large amounts of homework.  Multiple discussions on research papers, class presentations, large tests, and lots of quizzes.  I learned very little in her class because I was flying through the homework to get it done on time.

Awesome prof. Has a hard class; you will pull all nighters. She is always great to talk to one-on-one and she gives you a lot of chances to really understand the material. She gets a bad rap because she holds undergrads to high standards. You will learn a lot from her.
She is a very intelligent woman but a terrible teacher. Puts material on exams that she never taught or even mentioned. Do NOT take this professor if you have a choice because you will regret it.

Her english is passable which is fine but her real problem is grading. Every professor other than her uses multiple choice for exams but she sticks almost entirely with short answer and matching which in a complicated and content-heavy subject like biochemistry is absolute murder and she's merciless when grading. Find any other possible professor.
Good professor, gives a lot chances for extra credit, good slide shows and puts them online. Summer class was a lot of material but she made it manageable.

I think she's a dedicated and incredibly smart teacher. She definitely knows her immunology and wants her students to know it, too. She gives a LOT (understatement) of work, is tough with grading, but it's because she wants us to be better students. There are plenty of opportunities for extra credit, and if you do them, you won't regret it!
EASY CLASS!! Anyone taking bio 200/201-202/203. DO NOT COMPLAIN!!! This class is 10x easier. Material is straight forward. Pop quizzes help's your grade. Go to class get an easy A.
Worst teacher ever!!! Didn't help and was rude to students. Try to get any teacher but her!

This teacher is very, very difficult to understand and follow. I found my head spinning every lecture because her pace and amount of material is way too fast and too much. Assignments, tests and quizzes are extremely hard and make no sense. Take someone else.

If you want an easy A, go somewhere else. Lots of work- class/online quizzes, exams, writing/reading papers. However, u will walk out of her class feeling like u can take on the world. She'll teach u discipline and hard work. Very kind and always willing to help her students (wrote me a dental recommendation). If u work hard, you'll get an A/A-

She is hard to hear, so sit close to the front. IMO the books were very helpful. I went to tutoring regularly. She is nice, but tough. She will not put up with rude students. Many drop the class because they dont attend lectures and miss information on assignments. She gave extra credit. She curves. I was happy to get an A-. And Im bad with science
Just do the work and you'll be fine

Very accelerated-only 6 wks. Didn't order book on time; no text for a wk, had 1 wknd to study w/ the book. Refuses to post lecture notes. You scribble down notes just to re-copy them later. Couldn't solve her own problem on the test. Told me she was busy during HER office hr. (1 hr a week!) Very demanding for 300 level. Have to teach yourself. D-
Professor Sammons is awesome and so nice!
she is very passionate about what she teaches. Very nice and caring. The online quizzes after class i found to be very difficult. The online exams were very easy.

Michelle is super sweet and a good teacher. Lectures a lot but class is pretty easy. Show up for participation in class. Exams are online and a lot easier than the quizzes online after every class. I hate art and the class was easy and not that bad.

This is a really easy class. You will have to read a lot and there are many quizzes but the material all comes directly from the readings there are a few discussion boards but I did not find them overly difficult.

He gives daily quizzes but they're all based on lecture the day before. Doesn't worry too much about specifics and posts all his lecture slides online. Exams are 100 questions but they're matching, t/f, and mc. Homework is graded on completion so as long as you do it you'll get 100. Doesn't give too much work and doesn't make lectures impossible.

He gives daily quizzes but they're all based on lecture the day before. Doesn't worry too much about specifics and posts all his lecture slides online. Exams are 100 questions but they're matching, t/f, and mc. Homework is graded on completion so as long as you do it you'll get 100. Doesn't give too much work and doesn't make lectures impossible.

Main complaint: He required us to buy an access code for $114, only to be extremely confusing with what homework we were supposed to do. In the end, he assigned 5 homework assignments, cancelled 2 of them, and proceeded to give us homework over blackboard instead. Wasted $114. Otherwise, he's an easy A, so if you aren't on a budget, he's fine.

Dr. Sampson is clearly very passionate about microbio. He tries very hard to keep everyone engaged in his lectures and is more than willing to explain material again if you're confused. He is very big-picture oriented and doesn't nitpick specifics. Homework is an excellent grade boost since as long as you complete it you get a 100% on it.

Professor Sampson is a great professor, you can definitely tell that he is passionate about Anatomy and Physiology. Easy A, if you come to lecture and study for the exams, make sure you study any charts, tables, or diagrams, those will definitely be on the exams. Exams are 100 questions, the format is true/false and matching.

Professor Sampson makes anatomy and physiology even more interesting than it is. He has many anecdotes that are engaging to students in his class and helpful study tips for his exams. If youre interested in the career field of biology, Id go through with him. The only downside are his 100+ question exams.

Dr. Sampson is a really great professor, I had him for anatomy/philology 1/2, and microbiology. He really make sure you understand the material before moving on to the next slide. Exams are solely based on material covered in class lectures but the books can be helpful to make you furthur understand the material.

Great professor. As far as when I took him, he didn't cover nearly as much material as the syllabus said we were going to cover, of course I wasn't angry. As far as the lab goes, make sure you keep up with the material!! The test at the end of the semester in lab is work a lot. Make sure you go to class, he does give participation assignments.

Always pay attention, study a little each day. Class is hard to cram for. His exams are majority matching, but not the process of elimination kind. Grade is based off of 3 midterm exams and a final. We also got credit for online homeowork which was super easy but requires textbook code.

I loved taking his class - great and clear when lecturing and exams are different than most courses (all matching sections). Make sure to study a little each day in prep for daily in-class quizzes, but don't stress! As long as you pay attention during class you will be fine.

I had Sampson for A&P and micro. If you follow his directions and attend lecture regularly you will do fine. He does not like excuses or making up exams. He has light humor and his lectures are clear cut and easy to follow.
Tests are hard and you have to study. I did not care for the class.

Dr. Sampson's teaching is awesome, he makes sure you guys understand the material on the slides before moving onto the next slide and drops hints on what to focus more on for his exams. Very nice and funny.

Dr. Sampson provides all lecture notes online, so its not necessary to go to class but its beneficial for you to go. Tells a lot of funny stories about his life and mostly his dog, Lucy. A great professor

Dr. Sampson is probably the best professor I had at CSU. He does go off track sometimes and will tell a lot of stories about his dog Lucy. His tests are very tough and are all the exact same format so get ready to study your ass off. He does curve his exams but if you did poorly it doesnt help much.
he was great

If you study you will pass the exam, and I mean study a week in advance. You don't need to go to class all the time, but I did because he usually tells you test questions. Tests are 100 questions Matching and T/F. He doesn't tell you this, but he replaces your final with your lowest grade if you do better, but the final is 200 points. He's great.
Lectures are extremely important, he gives away a lot of test questions. Amazing teach over all

Dr. Sampson is a sweet guy and you can tell he really is interested in what he teaches. Sometimes he goes a bit fast in his lectures but if you raise your hand and ask him to explain further he will. Tests are hard but he usually gives a curve so grades could be a lot worse.

He is not the best teacher to teach this subject. He does not explain everything he is not teaching fully. He will go around your question. In my class this semester he gave my class a 10 and a 9 point curse. He is a sarcastic teacher.
Sampson is an overall good professor, but he has a bit of a rough side.  Make sure to go to class and ask questions immediately when you don't understand something.  He will not repeat himself.
Learned absolutely  nothing in this class. He gave no useful feedback just said its wrong figure it out. Gave examples that had nothing to do with the topic. Final had a question about jello.

COM 447 is a capstone course so he expects his students to have at least a small amount of PR knowledge...he's very easy to talk to...very willing to help...do the work that's expected correctly and you'll get an A....duh!
He is a tough grader but a very good instructor. You will learn a lot and do well if you are willing to let him teach you.

When I first signed up, I hated this class. He would criticize my papers and they'd be filled with red marks, but as time went by I used his tips and my work improved A LOT. He will review your articles multiple times until you're comfortable turning it in. He works you hard, but you'll learn something and its worth taking
knows his stuff and pushes you to get it right
He's cool, he will teach you how to write for a newspaper...it's his world. Other than that, don't take any classes with him because he'll just go back to newswriting.
Horrible professor. I understand being a strict grader, but this guy is insane! He goes on and on, and has the personality of a plastic tree, so its easy to be bored in. GET THIS GUY OUT OF THERE!

Teacher states at the beginning of the semester that the program used, Indesign is not longer used, but uses it for the class WTH? He was an editor at a newspaper, and that's what he likes, and knows how to teach. Other than that, your screwed if you take any of his courses! CSU should be ashamed!

this guy is the worst. He is very strange and does not communicate with students well. He just stands there and talks.  He also hardly knows anything about Public relations yet he teaches it. No one can have an opinion that differs from his. 100% of students in his class dislike him, faculty dislikes him also.
very vague and unhelpful.  did not give constructive feedback.  not a good communicator... strange?
Avoid at all costs.

Alot of my fellow classmates couldnt stand him. I wanted to get in the Journalism program but unfortunately i ended up with a C+. He tries to make his syllabus's grading scale easy to understand by i think he makes it too complicate instead. As far as course work is considered be ready to write a paper at least once a week. And revise eveverything.
not a bad teacher.  im basically getting out of his class what i wanted to, which is an improvement in writing skills.  other than that, i wouldnt recommend the class.
The guy is not interested in the kids he is teaching, but instead in reliving the glory days of his old job as a journalist
Don't take media writing with Sanders, avoid it at all costs.  I took this class and took nothing away from it, he's a smart guy, but a bad professor, I didn't learn a thing from that class
No Comments

Took this class a while back and honestly if you put in the work it's not bad. Office hours always help, and Dr. Sandlers is willing to help outside of class. Definitely an easier professor of OCHEM 1 so take advantage of that. Final has repeats from past quizzes and tests. Overall, good professor who has extensive knowledge and informative slides.

Took this class a while back and honestly if you put in the work it's not bad. Office hours always help, and Dr. Sandlers is willing to help outside of class. Definitely an easier professor of OCHEM 1 so take advantage of that. Final has repeats from past quizzes and tests. Overall, good professor who has extensive knowledge and informative slides.

Reads off powerpoint, doesn't explain anything. When she tries explaining she messes up and only confuses you more. Students corrected her on every quiz and exam because there was something wrong. Heavy accent which makes her more difficult. No curving, class grades are set lower although. Easiest Ochem professor at CSU although,just teach yourself

Listen, I'm not one to dislike many professors, but I honestly really dislike her. If you can avoid Yana Sandlers, please do at any and every cost. Not only did her lectures not make sense, if you asked her a question, she just reworded your question into an "answer". She does not know what she's doing.

Easiest ochem 1 prof at CSU, but teach yourself. Unresponsive to emails &  reads slides to you. Exams are fairly straightforward w. lots of bonus chances &  curves. Knows kids cheat & didnt care. Final is repeats Qs from quizzes & tests so GO SEE UR TESTS. Some Qs from test banks others from Depoali's hw assignments. If u need an A shes your chance

Horrible. She is hard to understand and her grading is ridiculous. She has no sympathy and does not care if your not doing good. Barely gives any practice problems. Grades after the curve were still in the 50-60% range. Avoid at all cost.

One of the few professor at CSU who is actually interested in teaching you things. He also has this nice old timey sense of humor. Yes, projects, exams and homework are difficult but you learn a lot. One thing benefited me is that this was an online class so class recordings were available and you can rewatch them.

One of the few professor at CSU who is actually interested in teaching you things. He also has this nice old timey sense of humor. Yes, projects, exams and homework are difficult but you learn a lot. One thing benefited me is that this was an online class so class recordings were available and you can rewatch them.

Sang actively seeks to harm his students grades and gives little to no feedback. You are graded based on 3 projects and 2 tests. Everyone will have an F in the class until the final grades come out, then there will be a massive curve to prevent everyone from failing and him getting fired. Awful experience, has a bunch of stress until the last momen

Prof. Sang is one of the most knowledgeable and well-spoken professors I've ever had. He goes pretty quick with his lectures and those are the primary way info is delivered, but it's never too fast if you pay attention. Projects are hard but fair in the time you get for them. Using the book(s) as reference can really help smoothen the experience.

The absolute worst professor you could possible have. Does not care if you pass/fail or learn anything. Will take off points for anything and everything including handing out 0s and claiming you cheated when in fact you did not. Asks 40+ students to do a project by very strict parameters and then claims everyone cheated when the code is similar.

A really bad experience overall. Does not provide rubrics or any grading criteria for assignments and will deduct points for very specific things not mentioned at all. Five comments on a 20 line program? Should have had 10. Ask a question/voice a concern in class? Get ready for ridicule. Send him an email? Be prepared to never hear back.

Do yourself a favor and avoid Dr. Sang at all costs. He is hard to understand, and lectures in no organized manner; he simply scribbles very messy notes on a document (sometimes overlapping other notes). When you ask him a question he simply directs you to his unorganized notes for the answer.

Dr. Sang is like the culmination of every terrible professor within a university in one person. Make it a personal goal to make the course as difficult as possible. Does not care about his students and does not want to help you learn. Simply the worst or the worst.

Professor Sang simply does not care about his students or teaching. He makes it his goal to weed out students when he should instead be helping students understand the concepts he is tasked with teaching.

The absolute worst class I have ever taken all because he is a terrible professor. Takes off points for anything and everything on homework after putting in hours of work and attending every class. Makes it a personal task make the course difficult so you will not pass.

An absolutely deplorable person and a worse professor. Hard to understand and terrible at explaining, you will leave a lecture and ask yourself what actually went on in the class. Do yourself a favor and do NOT take his course.

Be ready to write things down super fast while deciphering what is actually written on the board. Overall the class was not even close to how hard CIS340 was. Homeworks and exams are not that hard and he curves a lot. Don't cheat he will catch you!

You will budget 50hrs per project and get a C on it. It is just not humanly possible to complete what he wants with what he gives you with all its ambiguities. Extend your degree to avoid and nag the chair for another professor. Collect everything from previous students every semester-hard copies, soft copies, notes-if you wish to survive.

Projects are with partners but they have to be different each time. They progressively get more difficult and you'll wonder how can one even finish the whole thing. Don't use online code, his TA checks. Just try your best and pray. Take notes of everything.

It's been a little while since I had him, I wish he taught more classes. So many CIS classes I got an A in, and learned next to nothing. After his class, I actually understood. It wasn't easy, but it wasn't horrible either. I can't imagine NOT going to class though. Everything was lecture based.

He is good at some things like teaching certain concepts but is bad at appearing approachable. His goal is to weed out students, not really to help us. TAKE NOTES and get good partners for ALL homeworks. 6-7 projects are worth 35%, midterm is 30% and the final is 35%. You blink and you'll miss something in this class.

Get the book (PDF). He gives you hints to projects in class. Lectures are informative but messy and need to listen for detail (he won't write it). Exams (no cheatsheets) are straight from the notes so write everything he does, & everything he says. 6 projects that are large. He is brutal at grading. DONT BE LATE ON DUE DATES. Helpful through email

Very bad experience in this class. He was very hard to understand, liked to mumble at the board a lot. Terrible communication outside of the classroom, doesn't use online tools like blackboard, and for assignments, sometimes mentions things he wants done in class without putting it on the handout. Takes off points on hw for very, very dumb things
He is just a copier that copies some notes from his notepad to the chalk board with the lowest quality possible. He's even worse in grading.
Deduct points for any stupid reason from your homework. His favorite saying after he gives you terrible grade on your homework is "you have to suffer" ... I'd say no more..

Failed my mid-term for this class, but turned in all my well written assignments, tried extra hard on final and got a B. For someone like me who only had little knowledge of coding experience, I can't say he's a tough professor, he's very fair.  He trains you to get ready for your future career.
Very tough tests, but grades on a curve. Open book test, two days to complete.
Grade is 100% from 3 tests. Tests are challenging but open book with 2 days to complete. Prof super organized, often had grades posted by next morning.

If you are lucky enough to take one of his classes, DO IT!!! He makes the material easy to understand, and his lectures are never boring.  I seriously just want to follow him around and learn from him all day.  This guy is freaking brilliant.  He is an excellent professor and has a ton of real-world, applicable experience.

Dr. Sankovic is great professor. He made a challenge class easy to understand. Even though he has a full-time job as NASA he was always accomdiaing with meeting his students and responsible quickly to e-mail. I was actually "engage" in his class. I would diffently take him again.

Dr. Sankovic was awesome. He has a very good ability to make difficult concepts easy to understand. He takes things slowly and makes sure that everyone understands. If anyone had any problems with the material he was always going above and beyond to help. He cares about his students and he is a very fair grader. I definitely recommend this class.
The class was great. Professor was very good at transferring difficult problems into the easy and clear way to understand. Study hard and you can get top scores.
The class was great.  Professor was very good at transferring difficult problems into easy way to understand. Study hard and you can get top scores.
Only three tests.  Assigns homework but it's not graded.  If you attend class and do assigned homework, you will get an A or B.    Fair, clear and approachable.  I would recommend Dr. Sankovic.

Professor Sankovic is one of the best at CSU. I had him for Stats and Intro to Math. He works for NASA and knows what he is talking about. He relates all the material to real world applications. Uses mainly the chalkboard and some supplemental power point notes. He also curves  the exams most of the time. Highly recommend

Even though the subject matter wasn't easy, he taught it very well & provided extra explanations via links, etc. for further detail. Very smart & an overall nice guy. Gives you plenty of time for each test & grades them very quickly.
Makes stats fairly painless and fun. Sense of humor. Genuinely brilliant. Never makes you feel dumb, even when you are. I didn't figure on laughing so much in this course.
A genuinley nice guy
You NEED to do hw in order to understand materials. Most math  help comes  from students. Class can be confusing, forces you to go thru powerpoints/homework to understand materials.

I've taken two classes with Professor Sankovic and I'd take another if given the opportunity. He's a cool guy, he explains things with relevant & interesting examples, and seems genuinely interested in our comprehension of the material. He's also brilliant and knows his stuff. The 511 Final is a killer, but he curves generously.
Took the class online and it was pretty laid back and easy. He curves test and make it easier for everyone to at least get a B.
Excellent Professor, very highly recommended!

Santos is the man! His lectures can drag for a bit but as long as you show up and pay attention its an easy A. Hes extremely helpful and brings a lot realistic situations into the class which was beneficial. Additionally, he provides great advice for business and cares for his students. Do yourself a favor and take this class

Santos is the man! His lectures can drag for a bit but as long as you show up and pay attention its an easy A. Hes extremely helpful and brings a lot realistic situations into the class which was beneficial. Additionally, he provides great advice for business and cares for his students. Do yourself a favor and take this class
He is a great lecturer. Some of the materials was unclear. He doesnt use the book but I recommend it for clarity.
This is a great professor. He definitely knows his materials. The book helps clarify somethings so I recommend getting it.

Overall I liked Professor Santos. He was a very nice guy and his lectures were informative. The material can be a bit confusing, but not his fault. He does give pop quizzes, so stay on top of things! His exams were tough. Sometimes they contained things that weren't really covered in his lectures. Oh and he replies to emails very quickly too.
I would definitely not recommend. Professor gets WAY too into what he's teachin
Mr. Santucci is a great teacher. His instructions are very clear. He gives great feedback and positive reinforcement.
Horrible professor. Feels the need to actually take fractions of points off of scores for the most minor errors. The class is a joke and he takes it too seriously. Take someone else

He thinks he is sweet because he is a college professor teaching microsoft office. Come on... most people learn this stuff in grade/high school. I would consider him a teacher, not a professor. His directions were often changed and made even more complicated than they should have been. Simple assignments took hours to complete. Glad its over.

I feel bad for this guy...he has to take a very boring topic and somehow keep the class interested!  While most of the class sat there playing games, chatting online, or whatever the whole time, he nonetheless gave very thorough presentations.  His instructions for everything were extremely well written.  He puts all grades in BlackBoard ASAP.
Really a great professor! He is very helpful and prompt in reterning things.  Attendence is 5% of your final grade so it's not a huge part of the class.

She was the most amazing English professor I've ever had. There was a lot of homework, but it was really easy and if you do it and pay attention, you'll be fine. She is really lenient and understanding and and is a good grader so if you read her comments on your essays and ask questions if you need, you'll do great!

She was the most amazing English professor I've ever had. There was a lot of homework, but it was really easy and if you do it and pay attention, you'll be fine. She is really lenient and understanding and and is a good grader so if you read her comments on your essays and ask questions if you need, you'll do great!

Prof. Sattler is an intelligent and charismatic teacher. He used an insightful textbook and provided weekly feedback. He is dedicated and passionate about expounding on urban issues, material relevant to all life experiences, and shone light on crevices less frequently exposed (racism in media, food security, creative classes). His class is great!
wasnt very good at explaining
He's a good teacher, doesn't reply to emails so if you have a question take it to class, he is making what is supposed to be an easy class "seem" hard.

Very clear instructor with good teaching style.  Teaches what he tests on.  Gives reviews that are largely what's on the tests and quizzes.  Lesson plan felt a rough but pretty good for his first time teaching the class.

he is a great guy. he knows many stuff but department makes him limited. he is funny well interacted with students and helpful. only reason that i receive d was my homework issues. thats all. i will reccomend him to anyone and when i take my other math class definetly try to take his class,

Very prompt, punctual, and ready to teach.  Funny and cracks the occasional joke.  Calc 2 is tough and he made it tolerable but be prepared to work hard and study long hours to receive a respectable grade.
He does not communicate well with students. It is not his curriculum, and he said that he "just shows up". The information he gives in class is nothing like the homework.
Great professor. Always prepared and very fair.
Boring, outdated, the most pathetic and apathetic professor ever.
Great professor. Always prepared and very fair.

Do not under any circumstances take a course with this man. He is incapable of giving a coherent lecture and barely speaks English. He just reads off the slides and makes it hard for students to ask questions in class. Do not waste your time, there is nothing to be learned from his course. By far the worst professor I have ever had at CSU.

He will slam you with so many equations and information and expect you to understand right away. Will read examples and questions of slides and not do them for you to understand. If you really want to pass youre more likely will with a C in best case but you wont learn a thing....
Glosses over a half a dozen slides at a time. thick accent. takes no exceptions even for technical blackboard errors. your on your own

I took his class remotely & overall it was fair and relatively an easy A. There were no zoom meetings, just a prerecorded lecture for each chapter and TONS of homework. Out of the 4 emails I sent him, he only responded to 1 & didn't really answer my question. You have to be very aware of due dates as he doesn't email you back in case of emergency.

Man talks more about dumb useless information in class instead of the content in the book. Never discusses the chapters or the book in class, yet we are tested over 7 chapters at a time without any discussion, study guide, etc. The BSG game we play in class, yeah that's a joke as well. Just save yourself the time and stress. Nice guy though.

I took his class remotely & overall it was fair and relatively an easy A. There were no zoom meetings, just a prerecorded lecture for each chapter and TONS of homework. Out of the 4 emails I sent him, he only responded to 1 & didn't really answer my question. You have to be very aware of due dates as he doesn't email you back in case of emergency.

Not sure why his reviews lately have been bad. I took his course remotely and thought it was fair and easy. I can say he only responded to 1 out of 6 emails I sent him and never followed up about anything. There is a ton of work, which is very easy, so that makes his class an easy A, but I just feel like you have to teach yourself.

DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS ESPECIALLY IF ITS ONLINE. He has not responded to a single email or communicated at ALL. He posts unclear assignments on another website and will not help you at all, dont even try to email him he will not respond. He has not responded to over 10 emails between me and my classmates AND WONT EVEN TELL US WHEN THE EXAMS ARE!!!!

This guy sucks as an online professor. Hasn't responded to mine or other classmates emails, didn't grade any assignments until the last week of class, and never communicated with us on anything. Uses Mcgraw hill "BSG" which is total trash. Class is unreasonably difficult. Take the class in person with an actual professor
Provided little to no actual teaching and is unclear on many assignments and due dates.

He is hands off, you struggle to know what and when assignments are due. Talks more about his accomplishments as a business consultant instead of teaching you what is needed to be successful in the course. Takes a good amount of time to grade assignments.
jay's a bro

I completely slacked off in this class, and still got a 76. Jay is one of the most forgiving, helpful professors I've ever had. I somehow got a perfect grade on the final, which helped my grade quite a bit. The homework isn't super hard, but still makes you think about the material. Overall, great class!

Not sure if I used the right class code.  It was the capstone course that was required.   Awesome guy, promoted networking and looking up answers on your phone when you didn't know a question "because that's what you would do in the real world".  Very true and very cool.

Not a traditional lecturer which makes class far more interesting. Do NOT come to class unprepared because you will be called out on it. The professor is very knowledgeable and gives a unique perspective. He does not give a lot of guidance on the final project, but quite a bit of feedback. Worth taking for professional insight!!

The best professor at CSU. He keeps you up with current events and tries to connect them into the course materials. His teaching style is highly professional. He makes you 100% connected to the course requirements in a very perfect way.  I highly recommend taking any course with him if you WANT TO LEARN.

Jay does not tell you what you need to do for the class. He lets you figure it out, and either you get it, or you don't but he allows you to think for yourself and get the real world experience as if you are in a work environment. Its frustrating at first, but in the end you appreciate the class, and his teaching methods.

This was the best class I've taken at CSU, &  it is by far bc of Professor Schach. He really makes you keep up w current events happening worldwide, & he ties them into the lesson he has planned for the day. He engages students, & lets them come to conclusions on their own. Very hands off, which teaches you to take your own direction.

Jay was fantastic.  This was my last class I had to take before graduation and Jay really made it enjoyable.  He expects critical thinking from his students and hard work.  He does it to challenge you and to prepare you for the real world.  Easily one of my favorite professors.  Cleveland State would benefit if they had more professors like Jay!

Schach was hands down not only the best professor I have had at my time at Cleveland State, but also provided the class that I took the most from. The summer course took place for 3 hours on Mondays and Wednesday nights, dreadful in most cases. However, Schach found ways to keep you engaged and thinking about the topic on your commute home.

This class was easily the most intense class I've ever taken. The group project took many hours to complete. In terms of difficulty though, the class is as difficult as you make it. Start your work early and you'll have an easy time! Procrastinate like me and well.. the last two weeks are rough. Would take again, he makes you think!
Full of knowledge. Class format is nice, with lots of discussion.
Great professor, knows the business world.  Engaging discussions instead of boring lectures.
Great professor. Will definitely recommend to anyone
Schaefer rocks!!!!! Best professor at Cleveland State University. Definitely recommend taking any class that he teaches, hes great at explaining in a way students would understand
Schaefer rocks!!!!! Best professor at Cleveland State University. Definitely recommend taking any class that he teaches, hes great at explaining in a way students would understand

Best professor I have had at CSU! Delivers content clearly, super nice, and is accessible outside of class. It is refreshing to have a professor that actually cares about his students' success in the class and otherwise.

Jessica was one of my favorite profs. She really cares about her students and wants them to do well. Especially since english is my worst subject she made it enjoyable. Super nice, lets you redo papers if you're not happy with the grade you received. She prepares you very well so you're not left writing your papers last minute
Awesome Teacher! Very helpful with assignments and very engaging with her lectures.  Super nice person too.
she really friendly

Jessica is a great teacher! I would highly recommend. She is not the easiest grader, but that helps form you into a better writer. I gained a lot from her class, since the writing skills I've developed from her English 101 class made me a better writer and that will surely help me in the future. She is very clear with assignments.

Jessica is one of the best professors I have ever had. She makes class fun and goes into detail on how to write a good paper. She is very personable and is always there for you when you need her. She will help you with anything and is always glad to do it. She has a great sense of humor and great personality! Highly recommended

Jessica is a great teacher.  She is always willing to meet with you and discuss the papers that you have to write.  Grading isn't extremely harsh.  Also at the end of the semester she said to stay in touch, and would be available to help with other classes or other things should could help with.  Overall one of my favorite teachers and classes.

She's a great teacher and is there for you whenever you need her, including emails as well.  She makes you read a lot of articles, which aren't boring and breaks down the essays you'll be writing in the class.  Overall, great, humorous teacher and you can tell she loves English
