Very passionate about her job and incredibly approachable.  If you're looking for a teacher who will help you improve your writing I would encourage this class. Not the easiest grader but fair.  I would recommend this class

Professor Schantz's class wasn't the easiest but she is a great teacher. Very nice and approachable, always willing to answer questions, and the workload wasn't terrible. I loved having her, would highly recommend.

Jessica is a very nice professor, although she expects a lot out of you. She tends to contradict herself sometimes when explaining assignments. Doesn't completely explain what she wants, then marks off points when you don't do exactly what she's looking for. Definitely not an easy professor.

Great teacher, explains the assignments clearly and one of the most approachable teachers at CSU. No official textbook, but there will be lots of reading; it is, however, worthwhile. Enjoy your time with her as your teacher and have fun!

She was an amazing, passionate teacher. She always answered all questions without a problem, and offered many opportunities for help. She understood if you had a need for an extension, and gave you helpful advice on how to improve after grading your teacher. Well worth your time and effort!

Jessica was a very informative and highly intelligent professor. She uses big words at times which may be slightly confusing if you aren't a top scholar. Jessica will help you through anything and will let you correct essays for points. Very easy to pass her class if you show up and stay attentive while following all directions.

best english teacher i have ever had. very passionate and will do everything and anything to help you understand the material. learned SO MUCH in her class, as long as you pay attention in class and do your work you'll easily pass with an A.

Did not like her as an instructor- yes she is a nice person but she was really confusing. would give tons of information trying to explain a simple assignment leaving the class confused I did not like her

she gives you many opertunities to rewrite papers and goes out of her way to give you handouts and articles to help you out. she's very nice and loves her job! she can give a lot of essays, but she gives you plenty of time and help on them. make sure to talk during "fishbowl" guizes tho
Wonderful instructor. She is really care about her student. She is helpful and understanding. I highly recommend her.
Great, Helpful, and nice. Do your work as requested and you'll definatly get an A.

I had her for Enhlish 240 Intro to poetry! Class was extremely boring but she is very passionate about what teaches. She is a great person and very helpful. Class is mostly based around discussion and readings. Final paper is the hardest everything else is CAKE! :)

She is nice but a very strict grader. I emailed her an assignment since I didnt have a partner to peer review and she emailed back and said it Looks great! yet gave me a C on particular assignment. Not that helpful and strict grader. Also, many useless discussion boards. I am (was) a 4.0 student until this class.
I keep great grades but this class was way to hard for a 100 lvl class. i think he might be ok teaching a higher lvl class but definitly not this one.

This teacher is a good teacher and makes it clear what is on the quizzes/tests (chapter reviews).  He does only short answer tests.  He is starting to have a trend of not showing up to class or notifying anyone saying he wouldn't.
This class is an easy A. Professor Schmidt-Sane is a new and young professor which enables her to connect to college students and understand that college students balance a lot within their days.

He is very friendly. I wouldn't say he is "weird," just an old guy. He can be a be of a push-over; he seemingly didn't care how many classes people would skip. Some of his projects come off as sort of "childish," (board game, pop-up book) though It WAS an intro art class. Overall, an easy class if you need ART  102.

Well I had to take this class and let me tel you it was a hard pill to swallow. He's not a bad guy, just old and weird. Seems like a much better ceramics teacher, but honestly the 103 class is boring and pointless. really random grader, never know what grade he'll give you.
Clearly lets personal biases influence grading. Often goes on tears where he gives ridiculously low grades with little to no feedback.

He was a very interesting professor. He was never mono toned and never seemed uninterested about what he was teaching. He never came in and seemed to be in a bad mood. He kept philosophy very interesting and if I could choose to have him again I would.
Could miss up to 3 classes, but i wouldnt want to. Being in class was never boring, presentes the material in an interesting way that made me actually want to come to class.

Out of all of my classes in college so far, his Non-Western Philosophy class has been the absolute best. As a professor, he is probably my favorite, even though I've only had the one class with him. Lots of papers in this class, but the content of lectures was really good and very interesting. Its a philosophy class that actually makes you think.

I learned a lot about engineering ethics from this class. Although it was dull at times, the case studies are fascinating and the professor does a good job informing us what is on the test. Tests are easy and the essays are not difficult to answer.

This is a professor who lives his truth, he believes what he teaches and his passion is present. As he reads from the text he projects with a knowledge beyond his lifetime. Regardless of the time and day to which you take this class, he will be real with you. The more you engage the more you will take from the class.

Show up to class because if you miss more than 3 days you automatically drop a letter grade. Although you can teach yourself the material, with all the papers you have to write, paying attention in class will be your saving grace. Very interesting class, definitely would recommend, loved learning about so many other cultures and religions.

One of my favorite classes this semester, really opened up my eyes to philosophy in general, and the engineering ethics aspect of the class was really interesting. I found this class really easy because it was so interesting.

Awesome professor, teaches you almost everything you need to know about engineering ethics that would help you become the best engineer possible. It was a very interesting class as well, at first it was a little boring but then it got interesting. It was nice to evaluate all this engineering cases.
The material is fascinating and compellingly presented, and biweekly papers really help you internalize it.

I took PHL 255 to fill a general education requirement. This class consists of 8 3-page papers, a midterm exam, and a final exam. Attendance is mandatory, but he has all of the notes on blackboard. The papers are easy, but they are time consuming. I definitely recommend this professor if you have to take this class, he lectures the entire class.

Great professor. I am a Chem. E. and Non-Western Philosophy is by far my favorite non-engineering class! It is interesting to explore a system of thought that is not familiar. If you enjoy thinking about things that don't have direct answers, this class is great!

Professor Schneider is very monotone when he gives lectures, and since this is a topic I am only taking because my major requires it, it is hard to pay attention. He gives students one three page paper every other week due at the beginning of the week. It is a lot of work and studying difficult words, but he is a nice guy.

He gives quite a bit of papers and you DEFINITELY need a laptop to take notes. The papers are very easy and from what I remember he grades on content and knowledge, not necessarily on spelling, grammar, and punctuation.

I know philosophy isn't for everyone, and it might bore some people, or confuse others, but I loved this class. It seemed like me and only 2 other students out of 20 or so actually were involved and cared, everyone else looked like they wanted to sleep or die. But I wouldn't say because of the professor, more so the class. I would to have him again
The lectures are clear enough that as long as you pay attention you will pass the class. No real need to read the textbooks.

Perfect balance of course work and lecture--enough course work to understand the material, but not too much to be overwhelmed; course work is almost always in the form of papers. Go to class and listen to be successful. Overall a great professor. You'll learn a lot.

Makes the course (religion 101) really interesting. Assigned 4 papers throughout the semester which required some research. I enjoyed writing them because the things I learned I would not have researched on my own. This professor has a great teaching style, doesn't waste a minute of class time. Highly recommend him if you want to learn.

Very knowledgable professor! He has a great sense of humor, too.  Short papers due every other week, but I liked them because they give you a chance to explain your understanding and opinion of the material.  Attending class is a MUST, attendance counts and he adds a lot of information that cannot be found on the PowerPoint.

Finally a professor that understands the importance of highlighting noteable learning points.  Discussing those throughout the lecture with the students and then reviewing them the next lecture session before beginning the next lecture.  Also a review of these noteable learning points gives you one final chance to fully comprehend the point.

His policy for late work is horrible. Most of the time you didn't even get notifications that things were done. But, by saying that I would say put stuff in your planner. The professor is quick to drop your grade than to help you.

Schnell does not give any kind of feedback. Taught myself the entire semester as he did not have any lectures or any contact with his students in general other than "good".. not helpful. His PowerPoints were basically the table of contents for the text chapter. Asked his students to shadow healthcare offices in the middle of a global pandemic...
Average courseload, decent guy. Weekly discussion boards on the textbook, exams every few weeks, one larger report near the end as well. Just do the work and you'll be fine.

LOVE HER! Shes genuinely cares for her students. Her tests are hard but very fair. Going to class is a must but her lectures are entertaining. She gives real life examples and they are helpful with the material. 10/10 would recommend!

This professor is definitely tough, but fair. She is always willing to meet with students to review assignments, and she offers good advice if you are struggling. Her lectures are humorous and interesting with a lot of real-life examples mixed in. Tests are hard, so you must do the reading and listen to her lectures.

Dr. Schoenewald was a really tough professor. Although she is a great person, her teaching reflects the opposite. Her class is straight from PP, make sure you read the ATI books!!! they are so helpful for this class. Her exams are hardly what she teaches in class- make sure you read. Would not recommend her as a NURSING professor.

Dr. Shoenewald came in very strong the first day of class which put a lot of us on guard at first. Throughout the semester though she made is clear that she was on our side and was willing to work with us if things went astray and the outcome would only benefit us. While this is a pharm class, a lot of her questions were patho & she also curves :)

Proffessor Schoenewald is a very good instructor. She is smart and thorough with her teaching. She is very understanding what it is like from a students perspective. Whenever there is anything that goes wrong she does her best to make sure it is corrected and will only benefit the students. She is also very accessible outside of class and helpful.
She is nice person, just not an efficient professor. She came on extremely strong, did not let up, and the "tips &stools" she provided as to how to be successful in her course were NOT helpful.

Dr. Shoenewald knows the material well but perhaps has standards too high for most students. She did go out of her way to provide voiced lectures online for parts which were not covered in class. Overall I think she came in too strong and that soured a lot of people. She reduced requirements later in the course after feedback.

She does not follow the syllabus and used a completely different textbook to lecture off of than the one that was required for the class. She rarely got her power points to us on time and when she did have them ready, they were terrible and had no content. She gossips about students to other students and is condescending. Worst teacher ever!

Professor Schulman is awesome. She's fair, clear, and very open to any question at any time. I took biology 200 with her over the summer and thoroughly enjoyed the class. Your grade is dependent on weekly online quizzes (15% total) and three tests (25%, 25%, ad 35% each). Just study hard and try to reap the benefits of such a great professor.

She is now at Lake Erie college and definetly not worth the 11K per semester.  When asked questions she talks down to you, doesn't answer the question.  when the class didn't pass the last test she made them sit in through lab and study while she stood there and refused to answer any questions.  I agree with the go back to research or find a profes
Great professor!  Extremely interesting class, but be prepared to take notes and study.  Tests are hard, but a D on the test will get you a B in the class with the curve.

she is good at explaining things but covers material a mile a minute and wont slow down. online assesments were impossible. some questions literally did not have answers. but overall the most unapproachable person ive ever met. she makes students feel like idiots. id rather fail then ask a single question to her.

Class is difficult and fast paced.. as all CSU bio classes seem to be, but Prof. Schulman is extremely clear, knowledgeable, and professional. Study for the tests if you have any sense, but despite having crazy hard tests, she does a decent curve, and really is a good proffesor

Professor Schulman is GREAT. Not only does she have a great sense of humor, she is also amazing at teaching otherwise difficult to understand concepts. True, her tests are a little trying, but not impossible. Pay attention in class, ask questions, study, and you'll do fine. Hands down, my favorite teacher in all of CSU. She's pretty too!

I can't complain about her because she seemed to give me the benefit of the doubt when it comes to grades. I disagree with the person who said she's unapproachable. When I needed to approach her about an issue she was very diplomatic.
excellent professor took her a couple of semesters ago and she is very funny and gave lots of examples and illustrations to further explain her point

Took BIO I during summer - VERY VERY fast paced. You cover approximately one chapter a day. 2 tests (each 25%), final (35%), & 5 online quizzes (15%). Test averages were around 75% usually. The online quizzes are much more difficult then the tests. Dr. Schulman explains concepts VERY well but lacks bed side manner, not approachable AT ALL

Excellent professor who makes difficult concepts easier to understand. Will take time to explain further if you are interested in the subject and show some dedication to learning. Exams are difficult, but she grades fairly.
Us women tend to do a better job teaching than men do.  However, she is an exception!!!  She not worth wasting your money.
Do not take it with her!!! She is terrible!!!  Avoid, if possible!!!
No Comments

If you have to take the intro. bio for the OT/PT program, do yourself a favor and not take Doerder's class, try her.  Dr. D mainly teaches the pre-med crowd, who want tips for MCAT - i flunked his class and had to re-take and boy was I glad I took her - she is not easy but Dr. D made it a more difficult class, his exams are brutal.
Corse is difficult.  Prof.  is pretty! ;-)  Need to study lots, so don't tak when schedule is full.  Term paper is difficult - but can be done, with time

The course is an upper level course...so don't take it if you think you can coast by with extra credit - she gives none.  Though she is fair in grading, provided you studied and stayed awake in class.  This course is not meant for the faint-hearted - Immunology is difficult even for PhDs! and we are but undergrads.

Definitely arrogant and definitely makes it known that she is superior (at least in her own mind).  She changed the syllabus mid term - originally assigned 2 - 2 page review papers.  Then one month in to the term, she changed the length of each paper to 5 - 10 pages.  She should stick to research, and not teaching.  Avoid at all costs.
I can't say any thing good about her.
No Comments

She did not explain well in class. She didn't believe the miscounting error of the grading machine until I proved it when she still was not paying attention to me. She was not willing to answer my questions. She was not kind at all when I was gentle.

I have to say that he was one of my favorite professors this semester. He was very enthusiastic about team based learning and having you understand the material instead of memorizing it. In Health Care Ethics course, we were put into groups and decided what the outcome of a case would be. He is kind, but has a tendency to over explain things.

This class was taken during covid in a completely remote format, but he makes the class expectations very clear. The work is super light and easy and is also mostly team-based. Lots of papers, as expected from a WAC course, but he provides examples of each writing assignment that you can follow exactly and get a good grade. Must take for an easy A

This course is super writing specific, you should send all papers to the TA before submitting because if you do not pass one of the paper, especially early on, you will get a failing or low grade in the class.

This class was taken during covid in a completely remote format, but he makes the class expectations very clear. The work is super light and easy and is also mostly team-based. Lots of papers, as expected from a WAC course, but he provides examples of each writing assignment that you can follow exactly and get a good grade. Must take for an easy A
Very well organized and clear expectations of what you need to do in order to succeed. If you give your self time to work and study BEFORE the class, the class will be a breeze.

Schultz-Bergin was my favorite this semester! You're put into groups of 6-7 and you do group work each class, but they're clear+not hard. You can make cheat sheets for the quizzes. Do all the papers, follow all the guidelines, show up to class, put in the required work and you'll get an A no problem. He always wants to help out, I highly recommend

Incredibly smart professor who knows the material inside and out. Do not sleep on this class, as it requires a lot of work and he demands excellence from students. Group project will eat a HUGE chunk of your time if you're the unlucky one who knows the most in your group about the subject matter. Overall, I learned a TON in this class. NO CURVE!!!!

Incredibly knowledgeable about all aspects of java. Makes class fun by encouraging students to stay up-to-date with the tech world through current event sharing. Other strengths include machine learning, networks, hardware, and most comp sci/engineering facets in general.

Dr. Schumaker made a difficult subject much easier.  Whenever I needed help, he would give great suggestions.  Assignments were hard, but working in a group made it more manageable.  I learned a lot in this class.

Schupp is the man! Such an awesome personality and he is so intelligent. He basically outlines all the exams, and prepares you for them. All exams are hand written-NO MULTIPLE CHOICE which was really scary at first. If you work hard there is no reason you should not get an A.
He knows his stuff, but he complicates things a bit with all the silliness.  He is very gracious when it comes to the grading.  sometimes cranky
great professor! i enjoyed his teaching style and his little motivational speeches at the beggining of class lol

He is alright. Half the slides he gives out he doesnt really care about and wont go over. More than likely wont be on the exam. Only complaint I have with him is that he only gives out 4 quizzes and 2 exams throughout the entire semester, so if you screw up the exam, you really have to work your butt off for a good grade.
Great teacher! Extremely helpful and always available for questions. Test were hard...does NOT believe in multiple choice! Good teacher but be prepared to study like never before!!
Great professor! Definitely a difficult class, but he does everything to help you succeed! Loved having him, wish all professors were more like him!
He is a great professor...his tests are a bit hard but he curves them according to class average...

Very accommodating, knowledgeable, encouraging and understanding professor.  He does everything within his power to make his class the best that he can make it, and he succeeds.  Should be a model to follow for all professors to follow.
Schupp is the MAN!!! Probably the best teacher in the state. Especially if you are a veteran. Very helpful and very funny, fun to work with. Excellent teacher.
Hands down the best teacher! Bends over backwards until you grasp concept of what he is teaching! Wish more teachers cared like he does! A+ teacher

Schupp is a great teacher, he makes sure that everyone understands the concepts by going over a lot of examples in class.  He's a lot like a motivational speaker because he goes off on random tangents once in a while...but overall a great teacher.  But don't buy the book...I never even opened it once. Very highly recommended.
very good teach

HE IS ABSOLUTELY AMAZING! no joke..i've never had such an ease with chemistry..as long as you come to class and if he has review sessions..i would strongly recommend going to those because it helps out A LOT! Plus he goes over all the homework in the review sessions. I love this class and i hate science personally and i'm getting a straight A+!

Dr. shupp is the most understanding, outstanding teacher in the world. Very down to earth, teaches difficult material at a rapid pace but great in helping you to understand material! He knows his stuff! I wish i couldve taken him in o-chem
he makes chemistry fun!
Good teacher. Detailed notes. Always gives some kind of outline prior to tests/quizzes.  Would recommend Dr. Schupp to anyone!

Dr. Schupp was a great professor but very difficult for me. He taught too much in a short period of time which lost me. He is a very smart and humorous though. He wasn't good about returning phone calls either. His tests are very hard because you really have to know the material or you will not pass. Everything is fill in. No multiple choice.

he is the best chem teacher ever. he says you can call him and he means it, use it to your advantage cause whne worse comes to worse he will remember if you took the time to try. he is an up beat teacher you will never be bored.

Dr. Schupp was my favorite professor. He was absolutely hilarious and kept me very interested in the subject.  He's ALWAYS there for help when you need it, and his quizzes and tests are very straight forward.
Great teacher, helped as much as humanly possible, really knows his stuff!
Used real life hypos on regular basis to provide practical and meaningful course on not just HIPAA but regulatory compliance overall.

Taking ASL with Professor Schwartz was such a great experience! The way she taught this class was really helpful; it made you actually use sign language and remember everything a lot easier. Practicing at home in front of a mirror is a great way to study for exams as well. And don't skip this class or else you'll miss a lot. Highly recommend!!

I absolutely love Debbie! I signed up for her second course during the summer strictly bc she was teaching it. She's so passionate about ASL & really takes her time to explain things and help you. She's so funny and makes class enjoyable. She never talks down to students and always makes them feel welcome and comfortable. 100% recommend her!

Words cant come close to expressing how amazing of a professor Debbie is. She really takes time to break down the language so it is clear to understand and easy to remember. She is expressive and lively when showing you the material. Extremely passionate about the language and Deaf culture so it really brings a truly enjoyable element to the class.

I had Debbie for Spring and Fall of 2017. She was a really great teacher and I learned a lot about ASL and the Deaf community. I due plan to keep working on my signing even though I am no longer in the class.

Debbie is awesome!  I took her for ASL 1 &2 and wish she taught more courses at CSU. She is caring and engages everyone into the lessons. She makes clear guidelines for what is expected and wants everyone to succeed. Love her!

One of the best professors ever. Though she doesn't speak in most of her classes, but it's very helpful to try to understand the vocab or the sentence structure. If you can, take her class. You won't regret it!
She's the best ASL teacher ever! If you can take her do it! You learn twice as much in her class than the other ASL classes, but she makes it easy and fun.

She's the best sign language teacher ever. I couldn't imagine having a different teacher. It was only sign language I and I learned so much sign language I can pretty much have a full conversation in it. She's so nice and helpful. Definitely one of the best teachers I've ever had. I'm going out of my way just to have her for sign language II.

SHE'S THE BEST! She does give you a lot of information, but if you study your signs and practice you'll be fine. She uses her ppts and goes beyond the book to make lessons more interesting. If you skip class, you'll have a hard time.  She grades very fairly.  Tests are only hard if you don't practice your signs. HW include outside visit. TAKE HER!!
Debbie is amazing! Wonderful instructor, and really passionate about ASL. Take her!
Debbie is a great teacher! Because of this class I started loving ASL and learned a great deal of ASL. I would highly recommend this teacher if you are planning to take ASL!
Very nice and helpful, but sometimes starts signing out of the blue, and using signs we haven't learned, and you have no idea what she's saying

Debbie is very passionate about ASL. However, she is not the greatest teacher in that she overloads info on students. She also doesn't stick to the book as it relates to signs. She's a little rude and offensive in her approach. Take her at your own risk.
I loved Debbie she was extremely nice and the class was taught in a fun manner!!! I would recommend this teacher to any one! She made me LOVE sign language:)
She is a wonderful teacher. She is very informative. Although there are class participation it allows for you to have more practice and learn more.

I liked her and her class a lot! She grades fair, and does a lot of in-class exercises to make sure everyone understands the material. Tests are not bad at all and she gives plenty of notice, and study guides prior to taking the tests. if you are going to take sign language, take with this teacher!

This is the best professor that I have ever had at Cleveland State. If you take her class, you will learn the material. She gives you ample opportunites, grades very liberally, gives good tests on material that was covered, and provides study guides. EXCELLENT TEACHER!

Very nice woman and liberal grader.  If you show up and put in the effort you will pass.  The one problem in this class in the work.  She hands out more project when you know what to do with.  Plan on staying the full class period.  But you have to leave early or miss, she is good about that.  She does give alot of notes for mid and final exam.
She tried to make it interesting and usually ending up giving a lot of the answers you would need for the reports during her intro to every lab.

Do not take her if she's still teaching via zoom because she teaches completely silent, with a PowerPoint open, she doesn't tell you how the handshape should be, or what sign it is 98% of the time. Even with a private tutor I couldn't pass her class, my tutor who is actually deaf could not believe she was teaching the way she does.

She is by far the worst professor I have had during the pandemic, I already knew a bit of ASL going into the class and I'm struggling even meeting with a private tutor. She keeps the PP open while signing so it's next to impossible to see the handshapes and she teaches completely silent. Don't take ASL with her if you want to actually learn it.
So unrealistic for covid. She goes so fast and doesn't even care

She's very nice, although, during a pandemic, she couldn't be tougher. So much information posted on blackboard it's overwhelming. You are leaning sign from a tiny zoom box of her opened with a slide, impossible to get all the hand movements right. If you miss a class, don't do the homework, you're screwed. Must have a lot of time on your hands..

I took ASL 1 to get a refresher to take ASL 2, And if I wouldn't have taken this class before I probably wouldn't have passed. She is extremely particular about how you sign, and you will see that when she grades. Avoid taking class over all.. Not sure if it was because we were online, that she could careless if we're in a pandemic.

Professor Schwartz is an amazing and very creative teacher. As far as ASL your class activity counts you must contribute as it will add to your learning experience. Try not to be on your cell and try and eat before the class it'll make a difference when it comes to how much you learn. She responds to emails usually within 24 hours and is very kind.

I love this class and she is fairly easy and understanding. I took ASL 1 and currently in ASL 2/ fall 2017 class. I do need to do better with studying for the test, but she does help you get extra credits and if you keep up with the assignments, you will pass and try not to miss too much class or you will get behind on learning signs.

I just added this professor to help students out. I took her for ASL 1 AND 2 thus summer, and it was so much FUN! I suggest you take her. She us kind, caring and great at what she does. Now I can have a complete conversation in ASL. you must come to class, you must have to book. I never. I studied only hours before test and I pass all test!

Professor Schweighoefer is pretty good.  The thing to know about the test is that it is NOT like a first-year exam.  Thus the focus is actually on knowledge of the substantive material, rather than thinking up 50 different ways to describe why a potato may or may not be a potato.  Keep that in mind and focus on the major cases and you'll be fine.

Although there have been some negative comments in regards to the   "hiding the   ball" final.  This is completely untrue.  Not only did this professor go over past questions during the   class year, but he also gave essay examples to give us an idea of how to structure an answer.  The   class was difficult, but come on, it is law school.

AVOID! Yes, class will seem relaxed, and he will hit you with his clever quips, puns, and overall dark humor, but there is no fun when the final arrives.  The multiple choice is very difficult and intended to be tricky, and the essay questions he chooses are from areas that the class didn't focus much on.  He's simply waiting for the last laugh...
Good teacher, very knowledgeable about the subject of Psychiatry & Law.  One of the best adjuncts at C-M.
Not good at explaining anything. Most of the class is him trying to figure out how to do the problems he is teaching. Not good.

Very difficult professor and dictator-like. Not very friendly or approachable. However, he was very knowledgeable about the subject, and although the exams were extremely difficult, he made his grading scale more lenient. Learned a lot. If you want a more friendly or relaxed professor, he is not for you.

He doesnt give xtra credit and his test is not the same as the exercise that he goes over in class.  The test is everything that he covered inclass including the material from the book that you have to read to do the mutiple choice.  So you have to study your butt off to get a B in his class.

Excellent teacher. He is very helpful and always available for students in his office hours, and also a fair grader. The class is relatively hard and there were many projects and hw comparing to other classes but you can learn a lot from the assignments. I highly recommend him because he's one of the great teachers!

The class is hard but having him as a teacher makes it harder. He is not very helpful. He is willing to answer questions, however, the answers are not clear and he moves on quickly. He doesn't really care if his students pass or fail.

Class isnt hard but isnt easy. He teaches well, just make sure you review the material after class so you can prepare for the exam. Hw is given each week but easy online, just follow the examples on the online hw. Didnt do too well on the exams but if you put more time into studyin you should get a good grade. Do all the hw & one exam gets dropped
Hard to understand.  Fair grader, gives extra credit and curves exams.  But the exams are tough so study hard and you can get a A.  Learned a lot from him.

This guy should be the poster boy for the movement to get rid of tenure for useless college professors.

He's easy going and easy to get along with. He does expects a lot of his students, and although attendance isn't mandatory you would do well to attend regularly. A lot of students complain that his test are too long, but I've never had any difficulty finishing one, also 3 of the 4 test you are allowed to use both your notes and the book.

He is possibly the worst professor I had in my year of college. He expects you to know everything based off a comment that addresses nothing in the first place. If you don't want your GPA to drop, don't take class with this guy. By the way, he's not British. He's from Oregon.

He teaches the course very well, but then you get the test and it is way too long and entirely harder than you were taught.
