DON'T - take a different math class just to save yourself the pain!
If you care about your GPA and don't want to spoil it on an basic general education math class DO NOT TAKE THIS COURSE WITH PROF. BRIAN SCOTT.
Definitely a professor that is there for a paycheck only. His attire is distracting, he looks like a cyborg out of the movie, Blade Runner. Avoid his classes.

Who would have ever known that a Gen. Ed. math professor would be so hard. He lacks the ability to explain anything clearly. He doesn't even have a grading scale. He would say any one who has a 50 or higher on the exam is fine. What does that? The test is out of 120 points.
Not as bad as everyone makes him sound. Definately tough and expects a lot from his students but if you are willing to put the time and effort and get help when you need it you will do ok.
Years ago, he decided to change his Oregon accent to a British accent.

This teached has Napolean Syndrome--he is constantly trying to prove that he is so much smarter than anyone else. I suggest taking any math classes at Tri-C or another college. Avoid CSU Math Department at all costs.

This class was horrible. He did not teach any practical application. This class title is Matrices for Engineers--a class that is supposed to be geared towards engineering majors--he did not know how to explain anything. Anytime I had a question he refused to answer and had the nerve to raise his voice and scold me. He should find a new job.
DO NOT TAKE ANY OF HIS CLASSES!!!! avoid him at all costs. Unclear and more than half of the class dropped... waste of time and money..
seriously, just don't take his class. If your scheduled in his class , get out!!!
it looks like commetn 0n 7/9/06 was from himself! Terrible teacher
everyone failed all of the test but because we called and complained to the chiarperson we all passed.

DO NOT TAKE HIM!!!You will never i repeart ever learn anything. He is not a bad person, he does not try to be mean or anything he just does not know how to teach. Half the time when he teaches its like he is talking to him self. Its very bad, almost half the class drop his class. Like i said he is nice but DOES NOT know how to teach!

He looks like a homeless person that wandered onto campus and into the MC.  He has a made-up grading scale that is impossible to understand and makes his tests too long to finish.  Avoid at all costs.
Boring and not helpful. Simply put he is a ****ING ****!

Superb teacher. Love him to pieces and hope to have him again. I learned so incredibly much from him -- so much so that I am planning to graduate work in Mathematics. Who would have thought it given that I failed math in HIgh school three times. Thank you so much for believing in me. YOu are my inspiration and I hope to model after you. My best wis
Kinda funny, very helpful, a lot of work, take SPT class

For topology. Absolute one-of-a-kind professor. His primary concern was student success, and he understood how hard the subject was for some of us. He's quirky in the best possible way and hilarious because of it. I looked forward to his lecture every day, and highly recommend him to anybody with an interest in mathematics.

Professor Scott is very friendly and is kind when interacting with students and answering questions. I found this class very difficult, however, because he goes through many proofs in detail. He did give examples, but I wish he had done more examples and less proofs. The homework often had proof-type problems.

Professor Scott was the BEST math professor/teacher I ever had. Of course, I had to work my butt off in this class, but all the hard work paid off. He gives amazing advice, and if you talk to him, he's like a long-lost friend that is freakishly good at math. He is very passionate about what he teaches, and you will not regret taking his class.

Awesome professor. Very helpful and understanding. Its a tough class but he definitely teaches it well. Don't miss class or you will fall behind. Only used textbook for practice problems which were very helpful. They were my only method of studying besides going over notes sometimes. Got a B+
Great professor but you still need to do the work to get a good grade.
He's by far the best math professor I  have ever had.

His lectures were helpful in explaining the material for the class. His grading was more than fair, and he was always clear on what problems he expected you to understand. He was the best professor that I have had to this point.
Best math professor I've ever had!  I wish I had him in Calc3.
not well-prepared at all. sometimes he made you wonder if he really wanted to be a math professor.

Very good at explaining tough concepts. This is an honors class and he does treat you like an honors student. Picky grader, fair tests. You need to show up. Homework is worth as much as tests, and is challenging, so do it correctly. He wants you to understand concepts, not just memorize, so learn to think critically and you're golden.

Avoid this teacher at all costs!!!!! she does not care about teaching at all!!! she is not willing, nor able, to work with, or tolerate students with learning disability's ! she does not care about her students success at all!!

Joline's class was somewhat interesting, but she would spend most of her time discussing off-hand topics. She would also often grade papers based on the APA format rather than the MLA standard used in most English courses. Practice writing outside of the class. You'll learn so much more if you do.

This class is taught in a very basic way, he pulls up his slides and rambles for an hour with his "slight liberal bias" google his twitter, and be amazed. That is not the main point of my critique but merely a side note. Overall this class was enormously enjoyable. YOU HAVE TO TAKE NOTES, HIS WEEKLY TESTS ARE DIRECTLY OFF THE SLIDES.
Overall good teacher. He could spice up the power points since all he does is read from them. The quiz every week is literally the slides from the notes so i recommend writing them down.
A lot of notes... like a lot. Quiz every week over said notes. I write everything down cause I have no clue what will be on the quizzes .
hes very laid back and will not take attendance, however all he does is lectures and it does become boring because of how easy the class is

Very passionate & knowledgable of material. Great personality, except gets VERY upset when people use their laptops or don't show up to class. Online quizzes every Friday that are fairly easy if you've taken good notes. Waits a long time before posting lectures on Blackboard to try to prevent people from skipping class.

He is capable enough professor. He is very passionate about the subject matter he teaches which keeps things interesting. However he takes it very personal if you don't show up to class and many times treats the class like children; he bans the use of laptops for note taking. I felt like I was in a high school classroom instead of a college lecture

Quizzes every week that are fairly easy but not a cake walk. Exams are basically memorization of vocab and basic concepts. His class is boring and OK at best. Got a 93% and he refused to round me to an A so I received and A- because of his grading scale (94-100A). Mediocre class with fairly easy difficulty.

He's an okay professor, you can tell this is his first teaching job. Lecture slides are put on blackboard and follows them exactly in class. Quiz every Friday based on the slides so if you don't want to go to class you don't need to. Mid term basically vocab, expecting the same for the final.
I would take any class that this professor offered. He is as good as it gets. I have nothing but positive things to say about his class and his teaching abilities.

She is probably the best teacher I had at CSU.  She enjoys and understands the material and presents it in interesting and thoughtful way.  I found her tests fairly easy, but know a few people who found them difficult.  Attend class and take notes on the powerpoints and you'll do fine.  And yes, she is gorgeous.
Best professor you'll have for your whole school career. She's well structured, fun, full of relevant examples, and a great communicator. I've taken every possible class I could with her.

Attendance is a part of grade, two papers, 2 in-class assignments, 2 quizzes, and 4 tests. Read the book to get an A on tests. Really interesting, helpful, and wants you to learn. Absolutely great teacher, you'll actually learn something.

Awesome professor. Has worked in the industry,knows her stuff,gives lots of real examples in her lectures & makes them interesting. Exams are straight from book & pwrpnts. Study those & ur good. There is a group project which includes a paper and presentation. Also have to write 2 individual papers - grades a lil tough on papers. would take again!

Ok so she is definetly the hottest teacher i have ever had in college.  but seriously she is cool, down to earth, and knows her stuff.  I disagree with the others on the difficulty of the tests, read the book and you will get an A! If you want a solid teacher who has the bonus of being bangin this is your lady!
she is really hot...lol...interesting and usefull classes everyone will understand but her tests are not easy

super nice and fun to listen to. there's an individual project and a group project on top of the tests. takes attendance, but the class is fun and relaxed so there's no reason not to go. her tests are a bit tough but make sure you do the reading. her notes are straight from powerpoint. definitely take her!!
she has a nice booty..lol...and really helpful but her tests are not soo easy.....listen in class and do all her assignments and be sure of getting a B-
I found her tests fairly rough but you can make up for them in the few papers you have to write.
Great teacher, very helpful and fair.  Decent amount of work, but nothing difficult.

He would not respond to any of my emails I had to reach out to my advisor to email him for me and cc me into the email . He was not helpful and does not care if his student pass or not . Doesnt like to be asked questions

Professor Seck was cold and callous when I gave him a heads up that a close family member was given a terminal diagnosis and we were informed that, during this pandemic, our loved one would most likely pass away during the semester. He said "I wish he gets better," and followed up by indicating deadlines were firm and it was up to me.

If you're taking any of his classes online, Dr. Seck is very well-rounded and informative. We had to do discussions every week (posting our discussion and responding to two others), 3 fairly easy exams, and a final group paper. The group paper was easy, and each person was assigned their own part. Just make sure to do your work on time.

Dr. Seck is an awesome professor.  He is very serious about what he teaches, and he wants his students to succeed.  Students will be successful with Dr. Seck if they show up for class on time, and do all of the required assignments.  Please do not hold side conversations with other students while Dr. Seck is teaching because he will become annoyed.

Dr. Seck is great. He is very knowledgeable and is always willing to help a student do well. He offers extra credit and really wants to give his students A's. The class isn't super interesting and sometimes he's hard to understand because of his accent.
Great professor, really knowledgeable. Effort and work required to pass.

The class is easy if you are willing to put some effort into it. He teaches well and know what he is doing and the subject matter. Some student just want easy grade and are rude in class. Great teacher  you will learn and leave with something out of the class definitely!

He is rude to his students and gets irritated if you have questions. The class was really easy, but he was a terrible professor. I was a top student in his class (final grade 98/100) and yet he was rude to me and implied that I cared to much about doing well. Sorry, I thought that was the point?
He knows his stuff and explains it well

Difficult - difficult subject matter, difficult to teach, difficult to understand.  BUT, he does care. He is super approachable, willing to review drafts, gives extra credit. If you have questions, you need to ask him. You EARN your grade in his classes. This is the 1st graduate level class where I felt the prof really was interested in my learning
Should not teach.  Does not relate to students or subject. Does not understand what he is doing

Answers on tests are format-sensitive. I put Whitney M. Young, Jr. for an answer and the acceptable answers were Whitney Young and Whitney M. Young. The professor admits that the right answers can be counted wrong if it's not the format that he wanted, but that he will not fix it.

Concerned with managing his brand over educating. He actually puts "copyrighted" on his PowerPoints and refuses to post any to blackboard so you have them to study. And after paying for the class and the book, ALL of his assignments are based on HBR documents that you have to pay for in order to read whether or not you can afford. Not nice.

One of the best courses that I have taken in my MBA program.  He always challenges you on case studies. All the information and slides provided are very current and useful in real time work environment.  I am very much satisfied with the course.

First off, you're in the MBA program at CSU to learn as much as you possibly can right? If you answer yes to this most basic question then you'll love Senese. If not, don't even think of taking this prof. He will challenge you during presentations and take you outside of your comfort zone. BUT he's extremely fair with grading. Highly recommended

The amount of reading for this class is insane.  If you're going to take this class, plan to take one class less than what you normally take in a semester.  It really is like 2 or even 3 classes.  John will tear your papers and presentations apart, but he does grade fairly and adds quite a bit of bonus. If you put in the effort, you'll do well.

You learn a lot in this class. However, class is so tough. You will have to read 10 articles and make 3 presentations. Besides, you really need to know financial models. The professor is so reasonable though.

This is definitely not an easy class, but will be one of the most beneficial that I take for my MBA.  John challengesdents, and pushes them to really connect things they learn and translate them into real life.  Would definitely take another class with him if possible
Love him. if you're scared for college writing don't worry if you have him. he's awesome. easy A and he really helps with your papers.
Love him. if you're scared for college writing don't worry if you have him. he's awesome. easy A and he really helps with your papers.

Very good English professor. If you participate and try your best you'll most likely get a good grade. I LOVED this class and would take it again if I could. He's one of the best professors I've taken and made college "fun". I can't say anything but the best about this professor.

Pretty easy material, and Professor Sepesy was an easy grader. Class relied heavily on discussion. He would often wait until someone answered correctly (even if it took multiple responses).  Overall, he's nice and willing to help, but it was hard to communicate one on one.

Sepesy is one of my favorite profs I've had! I didn't find this class that difficult, but then again I enjoy writing. He does give very useful feedback on papers and is willing to help. Very nice, helpful, and interesting. He also allows students to write about topics they are interested in, in non structured journal entries every week.
Lots of awkward silences. First time teaching this course, kinks need to be worked out. Class material was cliche.

He was a very fun teacher. Tried to make english as fun as it honestly can be. He depended on class discussion a lot. He assigned papers without explaining how to write them. Would say the rough draft and sources were good, and then in the final grading he would say the exact opposite. Take the class. I got an A-. Hard not to get at least a C.

Prof.Sepesy was by far one of my favorite professors at CSU by far. He's extremely friendly and funny, made even the most boring class topics interesting. He helped me tremendously with creating topics for my papers and chose interesting novels to study. I would definitely recommend this class!

Very good at explaining himself. Helpful at showing ways of looking at literature. A lot of class involvement. If you do the reading and assignments you'll be fine. Very fair grader- clear of expectations and willing to help- he wants you to do well.

He's a really nice guy and can be quite funny.  Some of the material is dull, but that can't be helped, given that there are requirements given by the university in regards to texts.  He's clear about what he expects and is a fair grader.  Read the material and put forth the effort and you'll do just fine.
Very dull. Had him for two hours and hated every minute of his class. Easy enough when it comes to grades, but lectures and class discussions, while mandatory, were always pointless.
Outstanding professor! One of the best I've ever had. Very helpful and explains himself thoroughly.
Great personality.  Lenient grader.  One of my favorites while I was at Cleveland State.

A 3 if you have Chen as well, a 2 without. Dude is an old school cat personality. If his material wasnt so hard I feel like I would enjoy him. If you do all the homework and meh on the quizzes you should be able to scrap together a decent grade. Sit next to smart people who are friendly, shout out to the dude who helped me on the final

His tests are nearly impossible to finish within a timely manner, and even doing the review helped a bit. But he reiterated the questions so its way harder and consumes even more time, even though a large portion of students have trouble even finishing it.

Overall average, but I digress because MatLab is a really hard application to learn for beginners. Teacher is good at explaining the program but sometimes gets sidetracked. The textbook is a MUST. Only gripe is the final, which didn't correlate at all with previous homeworks or the practice exam. Got an A, but don't remember material at all.

I can safely say that I have no understanding of the material in the class. Hard to understand, and when you do go through the trouble of listening, you find that he is talking about a movie or something half the time. I would avoid at all costs. If you can't, be ready to need Chegg as well as teach yourself the material for the tests.

Dr. Serrano is a old school professor, nice guy likes to chat, but means business in class. Pop quizzes, about one a week. His tests can have some curve balls so be prepared. One thing that surprised me was the prerequisite for this class is only pre-calculus, as we used Matlab for Calc3,linear algebra and Diffy Q nothing you have to solve by hand.
Very helpful, lenient grader, doesn't try to trick you, but not clear as to when quizzes will happen even though they aren't pop quizzes. Recommended.

This professor definitely knew what he was doing, he just didn't know how to teach a class very well. The class consisted of watching him solve the homework problems and then giving us all of the answers to the study guides which was where all of our tests came from. Pretty much all memorization no learning

Literally you come to class only to watch him do all of the homework on the over head.. if you don't know the  material on your own you better go to the help sessions because don't depend on him to teach you it. Don't even waste money on the book, just buy the online code for homework.
The coursework was easy, homework is all online, but you pretty much have to teach yourself. He gets annoyed when you ask questions, and isn't clear at all in his explanations.
wasted a lot of time repeating himself and at times hard to understand but ok teacher.

This guy was very accommodating. Always tried to deliver dry linear algebra content with humour and imagination. Also knows how to manage critics and adjust course content. I wish he taught some classes in my department.

Managed to get an A in both however I worked at it & was in Math center alot. Drops lowest test & homework grade. Expects you to rely on the book and/or MyMathLab which was of no help to me. Overall hes an OK teacher. Gets annoyed easily when u don't understand and rushes through concepts I think. If you struggle in math he may not be best choice.

This professor was a total jerk and completely unhelpful. He never answered questions and all he ever did was confuse us even more, he made the class a lot harder than it needed to be.  He never returns emails or phone calls and his office hours are by appointment only.
He was helpful when you asked him questions. A bit belittleing at times (when he was mad at the class).  Overall a good teacher.  He did go VERY fast at the end however.
you dont have to do alot of work to pass the class, but theres only 2 A's in the class.
No Comments
Great teacher, answers questions efficiently and is available for help by email or during office hours

This instructor was very helpful when I encountered difficulty completing assignments due to health issues.  She modeled the type of empathy the course encouraged while still holding high academic standards.
She was a horrible professor. She loses everything and she is not consistent.

I took this class as part of a learning community, and while it probably will not prove useful for me as I do not want to be a teacher, it will be helpful for those that want to teach. Classes usually consisted of class discussions and whatnot. The only really complaint that I have is that she lost my final paper. Oh, and "what have you."
Lectures are boring. Exams cover too much in a little amout of time.
Only graded on exams. Question are so specific and most of them do not make sense. He even agrees his questions are bad. Always accuses people of cheating. Many questions with limited test time.

Taught the second half of the class. More enthusiastic about material, which made class less boring. He made the class more comfortable to ask questions. A lot of complicated concepts and time spent studying material for this class. Grading scale is nice though and exams get curved at the end of the year.

Severson is an awesome professor. He make lecture enjoyable. His exams are hard but are manageable. The lecture before exams he will give you a review that is jampacked so actively listen. If you have questions go to his office hours. Had him for genetics which is why I took this class and would take him again for another class.

Dr. Severson was a very good Genetics professor. He taught the second half of ours and was much better than the first (Dr. Boerner). His exam questions are very straightforward and come right from the lecture slides and discussion. Make sure to attend lecture because sometimes he asks questions in lecture that appear on exams.

He thought the second half of genetics for me and was a little better than the other teacher for the class. He described things more clearly, but it's still pretty tough and a lot of information to learn! Grading scale is pretty easy because 60% is still a C. Need to study! Showing up to class helps!
Take physics 102 ONLINE with this professor. Gives a good break to focus on other classes. There are many versions he accepts for the textbook which also helps save $.

Great professor. He makes physics easy to understand and does a lot of practice problems throughout lecture. His expectations are very clear and the tests are reflective of what you cover in class. You do have to purchase WileyPlus for homework and quizzes - lots of extra practice available through Wiley though.
So easy!! Take this class online and everything is in Quizlet. Easy A

You gotta work really hard in this class its not easy. He's nice and makes things pretty clear but his teaching style is very hard and if you didn't take physics in high school you'd probably be lost. But on the flip side he offers extra credit.

Easiest class of my life (not a science major). All of his quizzes and tests are multiple choice and simplistic. I never cracked my book and he offers lectures online by chapter if you need. However, he recycles quiz questions from McGraw Hill's online resources and other websites.

Fantastic teacher! He grades more than fairly and is clear about what you will be tested on. His lectures are very organized. I had no interest in physics before this semester, but he made really made me appreciate how amazing it can be.
He's very pompous when you try to ask for help
Great professor!

Great teacher. Long lectures but interesting with a break. Takes his time with the material to make sure it is understood. Great reviews before the tests- totally worth going. Only 3 tests (including final).  If there was a math mistake he would overlook if theory was sound. Went over the test problems afterwards.
The course was hard, but this professor was very knowledgable about physics. I feel that his teaching style was a but hard, but yet fair for the college level.

Dr. Shah is an amazing teacher and person. She does her best to make sure everyone is understanding what she is teaching and that if you have questions that they are answered. She is very approachable and is really a student advocate. She wants to see you do well. She also bases the pace and material she teaches based on the PARTICIPATION of class
I just helped my first client thanks to the lessons I learned from my classes with this amazing and inspiring professor!

What an amazing professor! This was a big class with some pretty dumb students and Dr. Shah made the whole semester so interesting and interactive that even the slow ones started to get the concepts! I have had phonetics before and got a C but with her I finally understood everything like never before and got an A!!

The material is difficult, however she explains very well. Get the book; she swears by it! She gives study guides that the STUDENT has to fill out and turn in for credit, which is interesting...but if you read the book and fill out the study guide, that she goes over, your guaranteed an "A"

Dr. Shah is pretty cool. Really fun reacher, her mini assignments I thought were annoying at first but I actually found that I really enjoyed them. Sometimes she is hard to follow but for the most part she has really engaging lectures that left me excited to attend class again.

Dr Shah is a wonderful person and a great profesor she made us believe and challenge ourselves she gave us the opportunity to show our best and she was very cheerful for the work and efforts we try to make during the semesterim going to miss the most energetic and joyful class i have ever been in took sph 485 fall 2013 and never wanted to end

How could anyone not LOVE Dr. Shah! As a professor & a person, she is just the best person I've known at CSU. She cares for student success & finds new ways to engage every single student! She is funny,  knowledgeable & teaches the most relevant things in ways ull never forget! I was super scared about this class but it was the best thing I did!

I took SPH 485 with Dr Shah fall 2013 It was one of my best semester i ever had I never understood the material before like i did with her especially the physics and the anatomy parts and of course everything else she made everything clear and she would always guide you to the right way of studying i highly recommend Dr Shah best professor ever

Dr. shah is an amazing peofessor, i am so glad i had  the chance to take speech 485 with her in the fall.She he very helpful and she believes in you and makes sure you understand all the materials.you have to study to succed in her class i'msure that all the people who Wrote bad reviews about her were not willing to study. excellent professor

She was a great professor! She was always asking for feedback and adjusted her teaching style accordingly. Sometimes she was not clear, but when asked to explain a concept again she provided more clarity. She allows three absences. She's very engaging with class examples and getting people involved in discussions. Overall great professor!

this was my only class with Dr. Shah. she tests 3 chapters at once and expects you to have every single thing memorized. "study guides" are 200 questions and she only tests you on about 20 of them.  her exams are about 20 questions, ALL ESSAY FORMAT. absolutely ridiculous expectations given the quantity she tests on at one time. DROPPED IT!!

Nice lady, Knowledgable in her field but weak as a teacher.  She is late and scattered a lot. To many "mini assignments". She goes very quickly through the material and if you ask to many questions she gets annoyed.  I bought her $13 study guide instead of the book.  Not enough instruction on the final project.  Do extra credit if you can.

I took this class Spring 2010. Dr. Shah was amazing and able to make the material applicable to absolutely everyone in the class (from single-subject education majors, to special education majors, to SPH majors). TAKE THIS CLASS! It was a blast, and she's extremely focused on getting you to understand the material. Best I've had at CSU!

This was one of the best classes that I have taken.  It changed my life.  Dr. Shah was always well-prepared and knew how to keep class interesting.  She cares deeply about the material and about the success of her students.  This class made me interested in pursuing a career in speech and hearing.  I HIGHLY recommend this class and Dr. Shah!
she's really sweet, smart, and easy to talk to.
Professor Shah cares about her students' success in her class.  She gives you every opportunity (perhaps too many, because even the slackers get A's!) to get an a in her class.
She often contradicted herself.  She lost numerous students projects and papers.  Her class was very frustrating.
Not clear on concepts, despite the fact that she spends weeks talking about the same thing.
Class was easy she doesn't require much work easy exams

great teacher..she is a fair grader..great personality..loved her class topics..extremely intelligent..great discussion topics...she always had time for her students..loved her alot..they should have more teachers like her at csu...always kept you interested...attendance is a must..wrot her own very helpful study guide cuz the textbook was so lame

Do not expect partial credit. You may have the correct concept, but will fail the quiz because of forgetting to carry a negative sign. Rarely finishes in class examples to the end, and instead will say "you can figure the rest out"

He is the worst professor I ever had...he had no damn idea of what he was teaching...never take his class he is horrible. No partial credit even if your concept is right. He got no respect towards his students...Acts very rude in class. long story short that class was bad.
good professor

Did not teach material at all.  Described powerpoint slides of charts/graphics from book. Would work problems in class, get stuck and then say "you'll figure it out"  Avoid this guy if you care about your GPA!

One of the worst professors I have ever had. He gives absolutely no partial credit and does not curve. He does not answer questions in class, and does not respond to e-mails. When I did manage to catch him in his office he was of minimal help at best. If you take his class be ready to teach yourself everything from the book.
No Comments

Professor Shakir is an amazing instructor. She encourages her students in the class and she promotes diversity very well. I highly recommend taking her for EDC 300, it's an easy A but you will learn something regardless.

This professor is a non-traditional. She does not throw up slide presentations. You are asked to read the text; however, she is more focused on what you take away from the text. She prefers putting the key points into practice rather than just talking about it. She will help you even after you take her class. She is an excellent professor!

Professor Shakir is the kindest teacher I have ever had. She actually cares about her students and their futures. Yes, it is an easy A, but it doesn't mean that you don't learn anything. Not sure why people are complaining about their easy A's. But this class definitely evens out difficult course loads.

I absolutely love Professor Shakir, as did everyone else in the class. This class was definitely an easy A, as long as you turned in the work you got an A, no one in our class got less. She is very passionate about teaching and really cares for her students- everyone lined up to hug her on the last day and a couple students were even teary-eyed
Very easy grader. Turn in all the work and you're guaranteed an "A".
AWESOME, EASY A, YOU JUST DO PAPERS AND SHE GIVES EVERYONE A 100 PERCENT LITERALLY ITS THE EASY CLASS THAT I WISH I COULD HAVE EVERY SEMESTER!!!!!

By far the most incompetent instructor I have ever had, but a guaranteed "A" because her students are smarter than her.  Ironically, she teaches "teaching as a profession," so if you want to learn how NOT to teach, take her class.
Not challenging at all, easy A. It was a disappointment but it was easy. She used the textbook often and group work. I didn't dread going to her class.

Very nice lady who tries to make the class interesting and useful.  Has trouble with technology,also  meaning that when she is going to miss class, you're probably not going to find out until you show up and she isn't there.

There's not a whole lot you can do to make a class on diversity challenging, but Prof. S did her best to make it interesting and enjoyable. It's a class based largely on opinion and you can't give someone an F for their opinion as long as they support it well hence all the easy As. Consider the subject matter itself before unfairly criticizing her.
she is terrible please dont take this class

Basically, every rating on here about Professor Shakir is accurate. Flighty, easy grader, kind to her students, likes racial arguments, flip-flops on thoughts. Take for an easy A, but not really to learn anything.

Professor Shakir will open your mind about a lot of things, but she thoroughly enjoys racial arguments that break out in class. She is obviously slanted in her beliefs but flip-flops on them and what she means by them in class. Easy grader, doesn't really explain directions. Okay class.
Great teacher.  Gives a lot of information that you will definitely need in the future.  Very enjoyable class.
She had some issues getting to class.  Very interesting when we did have class though.

Professor Shakir is a very nice person, but is the absolute worst professor that I have ever encountered.  If you want an easy A go for it.  But if you are going to college to learn something I would steer clear
A little flighty at times, but always caring and helpful. Changes will be to the classes benefit and on a regular basis. She cares a lot more about sharpening your perception than making you work.
Nice, totally easy. Tries to make it fun, and not a total stressor. Changes syllabus, but to our benefit.
Nice lady (but kind of intimidating at first glance). Easy grader and goes over things until everyone understands. Kind of bi-polar. Changes her mind on a lot of things on the syllabus.

Loved this class! This is my first semester at CSU and she made class enjoyable and interesting. Tests were all take home and we did a lot of group work. As long as you participate and attend regularly it's an easy A! Great lady, great class! EDC 300- Diversity in Educational Settings.

Amazed he is a com professor as effective communication seemed to be a real weakness of his. No real consistency in grading. Wouldn't answer questions in class so if you couldn't go to his office hours your grade would just plummet. I was excited for this class but I feel like I didn't learn anything. Sad it turned out to be a waste of time & money

Professor Shao is an amazing Professor. Always open for questions. Mth 491 is hard as it is modeled after the FM actuarial test. However, Professor Shao gives multiple attempts for the homework sets and plenty of extra credit opportunities to cushion your grade. Fast grader and fast email responses. If you try your best, you will do great!

Professor Shao is an amazing Professor. Always open for questions. Mth 491 is hard as it is modeled after the FM actuarial test. However, Professor Shao gives multiple attempts for the homework sets and plenty of extra credit opportunities to cushion your grade. Fast grader and fast email responses. If you try your best, you will do great!

She cares about her students so much, and her quizzes and test are just like the homework and study guides. Her style of teaching is not exactly my favorite but at the end of the day she is a good teacher.

She is one of the most caring professors I have ever had, but her teaching style is horrible. If you want an easy calc 3 class, take her. If you want to actually understand what you are learning, look elsewhere. She makes a lot of mistakes while working out problems which makes it impossible to learn.
The best teacher Ive ever had. Please take her! Shes so caring and understanding and very willing to help you outside of class. Her exams are just like the review. Made math easy!
I LOVE HER! SO sweet and she wants you to succeed. She is willing to help you literally at any time. Please take her

Dr. Shao is a mixed bag. Her lectures can sometimes be beyond dull, so most of the work/learning is done outside of class. The material is sometimes presented in a bland way. But she makes up for this by having a class with one of the easiest A's I've ever had. There's a boatload of extra credit, and most mean/median homework grades were at 100%.

She's very kind and makes understanding the material very easy with presentations and examples. She can kinda be hard to understand sometimes with her accent, but I liked the way she taught. Would highly recommend to all!

Dr. Shao is one of the best, for sure. CSU found a keeper, here. And that is saying a lot for the CSU Math Department, for sure. Dr. Shao is one of the most dedicated professors I have ever me. She is so kind. And it goes without saying that she is incredibly intelligent. The world needs more people like Dr. Shao.

Although her accent makes her somewhat difficult to understand at times, once you get past that she is an extremely good teacher that will explain everything you need or ask.  Highly recommended for math classes at CSU.
Great teacher.  Always willing to help students better understand concepts.  If you are serious about learning, you'll do well in her class.

Sally is so great! her accent at first was a little rough, but when you get used to it, its not bad at all! Candice (SI leader) helped tremendously. sally sometimes helped me during the tests (SHH) and when you needed extra help you could come during her office hours and get it!  ALOT of extra credit given. DEFINITELY recommend taking her class
I had Sally for MTH 311 and MTH 493. She gives everyone A's. Her accent is AWFUL...but her class is worth taking to get the EASY A!

I liked her a lot. She grades everything fairly, with extra credit if you don't do something well. She gives her time when you ask for it. It was easy to get used to her accent. If you show that you care about the class, by asking questions and going to her office hours you'll get a good grade, no problem!
This Prof. is awesome! If can get her as a prof you will have a great class.
Good professor, very helpful and knowledgeable.

Her accent is bad. If you do bad on a test she gives a fair amount of extra credit. Do your homework and make an honest effort, if not she'll catch on and she won't be happy. She knows who's trying and who's faking. She says "you can't pretend math". Likes to use Maple which makes learning how to do the stuff by hand for the test that much harder.
Good professor!

Horrible teacher for Calculus 1.  I didnt learn much at all in her class.  It wasnt until Calculus 2 (Professor Knauss) that i learned Calculus 1 in lamens terms.  Her Chinese accent is  really BAD!!! I could hardly ever understand what she was saying.  Two thumbs way down
she is a good teacher.
No Comments
Great guy. Caring and willing to help
Said attendance was mandatory but never took attendance ?? Class was laid out well, but I didn't love it . Overall, prof is pretty chill and was easy to pass with a B or better for sure.

never posted study guide, doesn't teach the class. I had to learn all the stuff on my own, and none of my assignments were returned with grades to learn from. awful communication, never answers emails. doesn't seem to care if students are struggling

He's a nice guy but I basically taught myself the entire class ans STRUGGLED hardcore. It was a mainly online based class and without help from others I would have no clue what I would even be doing. If you don't like teaching yourself math I would not recommend.

He never puts the study guides up like he says. He does not even know the material in his class and does not try to help students find answers. Seems like he doesn't have any idea what is being covered in his own class. Does not try at all and overall being in his class has been very disappointing.
Great guy. Caring and willing to help

Explains things simply enough, but almost too simply. He doesn't explain where you are in the chapter so it's hard to supplement his teaching with the textbook. He is a bit scatterbrained and often says/writes the wrong number on the board and makes things confusing. There is way more covered on the bi-weekly homeworks than he teaches in class.

Obeys to all the rules of another professor. So extreme on tests that he looks to people's eyes on a Zoom recording for cheating, but makes his exams so difficult that people feel the need to cheat, then gets furious when people call him out for it. Maybe in person he's fine, but in the Zoom format it has been unbearable.

I was totally expecting Patho to be so much harder but Dr. Sharma makes it as easy as he can for you. All you have to do is study the slides he gives and do the homework. Also make sure you show up to class because he explains it so much better than you just reading it.

memorize everything about every disease on the ones on his exam list. understanding wont get you anywhere in this class, just memorize his slides word for word. possible to get an A but must study a lot before every exam. he gives everyone 100 on assignments. he is sort of funny but mostly talks about how hard school is in india vs. here.

Actually enjoyed this class, even though it had a very early class time. Exams questions are from the review he does during the in-class review session and underlined content in the notes. He also shares a lot of interesting personal stories that relate to the topic you're studying in lecture.

Fantastic professor, pathology is a very difficult subject to learn.  But if you attend lectures and try and learn you will do great.  Exams are a challenge but getting an A is very possible.  He is also very funny, makes it worth going to lecture.  Highly recommend taking his class.

His class is not a class to skip. His lectures are detailed and straight to the point, but being in class really helps for the exams. His assignments are very important to do. He recognizes the students that work hard in his class and will be more willing to help if he sees you are putting in the effort. His exams are not push-overs so study hard.

This was one of the worst classes I have ever taken in my 5 years of education. His exams pint-point the smallest details of some random disease to quiz you on, even though he never went over it in class. Takes a month+ to grade exams. Never responds to emails. Refuses to simplify hard details & expects us to fully understand b/c we're dpt students

Dr. Sharma is easily my favorite prof at CSU!  Lectures are light-hearted and enjoyable, while still forcing you to think (instead of just memorizing material).  He is very fair.  Do the work, and you'll be just fine. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED

Dr. Sharma takes a tough subject and tries his best to make it accessible.  He has an amazing rapport with the students.  I wish Dr. Sharma taught everything because I would take everything he teaches!

He is an amazing teacher, he truly wants you to pass, does almost everything he can to help. Pathology is a very tough course. The only negative thing about him is he expects you to already know the anatomy of the body when some students haven't taken it yet. Not always responsive to e-mails. Frustrating because he won't round a 79.5% up to a B-.

One of the best professors I've ever had! He made the class very enjoyable and was always very helpful and available to students.  This class was offered online but I'm glad I decided to take it in class.  Tough subject but he made it possible to do well if you study and come to class.

Dr. Dharma was great! I really enjoyed the way he mixed lecture material with his personal experiences to aid in the learning process. He was always willing to help and give feedback. I would strongly recommend taking him as a professor
DR Sharma is an amazing professor. He is very passionate about pathology and teaching. I highly recommend him and his classes. I will be looking for more of his classes to enroll in.
Very fun class
I had trouble when attempting to clarify things taught in a confusing manner, emails asking for help remain unanswered to this day.
I would not recommend taking a course important to your future with this professor.
Super Fine!

Dr. Sharma was an AWESOME professor. He is a professor who just comes in and teaches, but a professor that cares. As long as you are open and upfront with him about any questions or problems you have, he will help guide you through!
GREAT!  Had him at Tri-C, also at CSU.  He's a really good, interesting, funny teacher.

Great guy! Do not need the book, his slides are detailed enough. Narrows it down to what is important, more than willing to help, and tells you exactly what you need to know. Has little bit of accent but you get used to it. Class consists of 3 exams and one case study/paper. Gives curves and actually wants you to do well in his class!
A lot of reading and lectures. A lot of tests are online. A very nice teacher.

I took his class Summer 2018. He really made the class challenging and rewarding. We had the opportunity to role play a game in the class o what we had learned from lecture. I would definitely recommend this professor.

I had him last semester and he was nice to talk to when clarifying something I was having difficulty understanding, the only thing I would stress enough would that this is basically an online course, the textbook is what needs to be used but the questions aren't from the textbook at all which gets confusing, my advice look questions up on quizlet.
Good professor, I would recommend taking this class if you need It for a GenEd. Very structured

He did a Reacting to the Past Class for Fredrick Douglass and the Black National Convention. Though it was more hands-off on his part, he is very knowledgeable on his content area and very understanding about personal issues as it relates to grades and class attendance. Very approachable and kind to students.

The class is well rounded, with grades for attendance, participation, tests, and writing assignments. You need to do all of them. It is stated ahead of time what you need to get in each assignment to get a particular grade making it easy to plan things out.
Lectures were short and interesting, and did group work and projects in class that kept it fun.

I had Shelton for HIS 302, currently enrolled in two courses with him,  & plan on taking his senior seminar next spring.  If you are a History major looking for an A, take him! If you know how to write a paper, you'll be fine. Divides classes between group discussionslectures. Attendanceparticipation graded, won't fail you for too many absences.

I took his HIS 111H (honors level) class (Reacting to the Past course, we recreated the writing of the U.S. Constitution) and it was great. The class was engaging and Dr. Shelton was very helpful when you had questions about your character. The readings were minimal and informative. Attendance is recommended bc of class structure.

If your lazy and looking for a free A, this is not your professor. This professor is pastionate, smart and dadciated to his research. He is one the best experts on the American Civil War *It is his speciality by the way*. He will make you read then read then and finally write. I loved all the Civil War Triva.

I took online African Amer. history and had to drop it. He would not post the due dates for assignment saying they would be on "about a week". He took them down after 3 or 4 days. I ended up missing the 2nd test because of this and had to drop the class, because if you miss 1 test you fail the course. When i tried talking to him, he was very rude.

Took it online and it was terrible! Questions on the quizzes come from who knows where and wording was confusing. Tries to make his class  important and therefore takes it way too serious. It's 200 level course and it's an elective therefore it not so important  Poor grading. Just don't take it!

He expects students to study (not just read!) the books and handouts.  If you come to class prepared and have a few interesting comments to make, class is OK. If you don't participate or show no interest in class, then he will quickly forget about you. Overall, an agreeable person, but not friendly as some other professors.
He's a very nice guy, and you can tell he loves what he's teaching.  Very open to discussion, although isn't too open to opposing viewpoints.  If you study and pay attention, should be fine.
I had to take this class and was not so interested.  He was interesting and funny and made the material enjoyable.  I learned a lot

He had a major attitude problem.  He obviously singled out his favorites and for those who were not chosen for that "honor", he made attending the class a rather unpleasant experience.  I also thought that he was a bit biased in his teachings, pompous and not open to other views or opinions at all.
he is a great professor and if you take notes and study just a little bit his class is a breeze.  thanks

Nice guy but still learning how to teach. His lectures are simple and clear and he give pop quizzes based on those. However, the tests and online quizzes are straight from the book. Questions based on things you would t normally remember from reading. 5-7 page grant proposal that wasn't too bad. If you manage your grade right you don't have to show

He lectures one way. He presents questions on the exam differently. There are pop quizess in class. Online quizess as well.  He is very laid back no study guides or reviews for exams. He tells you he doesn't care if you come to class or not. He makes you write an 8-10 page grant proposal. Which was pointless. I will not take his class again.
Awesome Prof very helpful and clear in his lectures.

This class was frustrating because it's almost like it was designed not to go to class. Students who just barely showed up  probably got the same or better grades as those who regularly attended. I know this was the first class he ever taught it would be nice to give extra credit exclusive information to those who attended often.
Very easy exams, and awesome lectures! He works through every problem step by step.
Very easy exams, and awesome lectures! He works through every problem step by step.

He is extremely awkward and not a good teacher. He writes on the board during class but stands right in front of his work so you can't see his work. Our class constantly asked him to move but he kept doing it. We asked him about hw problems and he wouldn't know how to solve them. Horrible test reviews. Avoid him like the plague.
Took him for Calculus III, and I wouldn't recommend it. He is not very confident with the material. Class is really easy though, if you do the homework out of the book you'll pass with flying colors.
I took this class during the summer for STEP program. He wasn't the BEST teacher considering he teaches higher learning math. He's an awkward teacher

Favorite class of the semester! Very awkward, but is super friendly and does a good job of explaining the material. Tests not made by him, but really does his best to prepare the class. Spends class time before each test going over the review packet. Would definitely take another math course with him

Professor Sheridan thoroughly covers the material so that all students can understand. He gives group, pop quizzes and the homework is online. The homework questions are almost identical to the exams. His class is an easy A if you put the work in. Also, he is very awkward, but has one of the funniest laughs I have ever heard.

Mr. Sheridan was one of the easiest professors I had. His lectures are crystal clear (you just need to show up and listen). He follows the homework and the homework follows the exams. A lot of people say he cant teach, but if you never took calculus at all you can learn it just from this class. If you didn't understand something he's happy to help.

By far THE most awkwardly funny person i have every met, but i actually love his class. As long as you go to  class and take notes then its not hard. Lots of homework, quizzes are in groups of 6. Go to the math learning center!!!! the practice exams are similar to the test and it makes it easier! Loved mth 149 with sheridan!

This guy. This guy is hands down the most awkward human being I've ever encountered, but he makes it work. With that being said, it makes him absolutely hilarious and I enjoy going to class. In terms of teaching, he is the first professor where I can actually learn and retain material. Very easy if you study. Go to class to brighten your day.

If you don't show up to class, you will fail. Period. We cover so much material in one day, it's crazy. Professor is extremely awkward, in a funny way. If you ask him a question, he stutters for 10 minutes and talks in circles. Also, pop quizzes! If you do the test reviews, you should do fine on tests.

MTH 149 was a hard class for someone who has not taken math in a long time.  The professor covers a lot of material at a fast pace  (mandated by school) but I think that he tries hard to be nice and explain it in a way that people can understand.  Going to the math center helps a lot if you need help in math!! Overall, nice guy who knows his math!

Well, he seems like a cool guy but his lecture is all over the place. To pass the class, i mainly took trial exams from the maths learning center. There are some topics he didnt really explain much and told us not to worry about, but this questions regarding the topic still managed to pop up on the exams.  Half of the time i was lost in class.

This guy doesn't even mean to be funny... But he is just hilarious. Super awkward guy but also very nice. His lectures are pretty clear. Tests are not made by him but he will do his best to prepare the class. Group quizzes. Do the homework. It's worth a lot.
Very good teacher, explains the material very clearly and explains what will and will not be on the test. Also makes you aware of when "pop"-quizzes are and lets you work in groups for them.

Awful professor. Unclear and very hard to follow. He has no teaching style. Will not answer students' questions in class and insists they come to office hours for super questions. Would not waste my money taking from him because you will be stuck teaching yourself the material.

No teaching style. Class is lost most of the time in his lectures.  Very all over the place and it is extremely distracting to learn. Early on in the semester 11 students left the lecture in one class period. You are on your own in this class. Invest your university dollars wisely. You have been warned.

Easiest math class I've ever taken, actually did good in math for once. As long as you do the homework it's hard not to pass. Test are right from quizzes, easiest grader known to man. He's awkward but so so so so easy. It's impossible not to get an A in this class. Hes understanding and will listen to students.

started out super easy but it randomly got difficult. sheridan is disorganized and not ready to be lecturing a large class. cant control students and he gets really flustered and the notes get really confusing as he goes on. dont need the book but its free. tests are easy but theres always 4 or 5 annoyingly difficult questions. would not recommend.

Honestly, he's not bad if you care about the class. He's pretty humble, which is good. A little scatterbrained, though. If you like or appreciate statistics, the class will be a piece of cake. Exams are open book/multiple choice (officially so you can use the tables). You can also look up how to do the problems, which makes things really easy.

super boring, it would have been more interesting if he read straight from the book. The book is good for studying, also his old online tests are helpful, basically you can skip class, cram the night before and get an A, or a B if you dont study for the final, his class is open book with 1 page of notes, also he wears the exact same cloths everyday

Horribly bad.  Extremely boring combined with the fact that you can't hear him because he is so old.  Only thing helpful is that he does the homework problems and posts them online.  Tough grader. Do not expect alot of partial credit.  Go to class. He notices if you are not there and will grade accordingly.

Boring teacher but cracks the occasional hilarious jokes about his class being boring. Not easy unless teaching yourself is easy to you. Tests are very similar to homework problems, in which he'll post the answers online which is really helpful.
Horribly boring in class. I disagree with whoever said he's easy. You have to learn everything on your own if you want to get any sort of decent grade. Not recommended.

He is a borrible teacher, but easy.  I have gone to class about 8 times this semester and i'm at 100%.  Dont expect to learn anything in class.  Make sure to download his old exams and go through them.  His old exams are the same concepts as the new exams
Honestly the best CIS professor in the entire department at CSU. Hopefully he will stick around for a while.

Very well organized & balanced classes- HW & test material can be challenging but fair. You can get more out of his classes than a wang/sang class but you have to do the work honestly. Struggle thru homework, find a partner with a brain for the project, & make a good cheat sheet. Overall Shirazi's just a good dude, take him while he's still around.

He lectures everyday when you have him, but he tries to crack to jokes to make people more comfortable. Make sure to have friends taking the class with you as this will help your learning with him as some items are confusing and his explanation is confusing. Also, some of the homework, not matter the course, feel like a mini project.

He mumbled through all of his power point slides. The homeworks were obnoxiously long (virtually impossible to complete solo with a full courseload w/o looking up answers) and only a few from each set are actually graded. The tests were brutal. Before curves, I suspect 3/4 of the class failed. At the end, I thought "Did I just pay $1600 for this?"

This class made me want to change my major and/or drop out. Shirazi only uses the slides straight from the textbook and rarely explains concepts clearly. He doesn't post any grades to Blackboard, and his tests are vague and confusing. Very frustrating, demoralizing experience learning data structures -- which, in his words, is supposed to be "easy"
To Cleveland State University: Have this man cloned and replace your CIS department with his clones at once! Nuff said.

CIS265 is the first CS course I took, it is not easy for beginners. However, Dr. Shirazi gave excellent lectures, he explained the JAVA language thoroughly and deeply,  and consolidated with coding practices. It is extremely helpful. Now I'm confident in writing codes in JAVA. But if you are not serious in learning programming, it is not for you.
Class is hard but he is helpful if you ask for it. He's a nice guy. Make sure you start the homework ahead of time because it takes a lot of time and is a big part of your grade.

Shirazi just went off of premade powerpoint slides created by the book publisher.  After the first 1-2 homework assignments, the assignments just get way harder, some of which require previous homework solutions. The class itself barely focused on syntax but theory was emphasized.   Do the best you can on the HW to make up for bad test grades.

This class was a mess. Every day we just sat there and listened to him read off powerpoints for class. He would go off on tangents every once in a while but I could rarely follow how the tangent was related to the topic. Concepts were not communicated very clearly. Homework takes FOREVER and the class was often poorly prepared for it.

Gave homework assignments every two weeks or so but the assignments are not a joke. I had one homework assignment come out to be 41 pages of code and I didn't even do all the questions. His lectures are also online which is cool but they weren't very helpful.

this course is a detailed one which will require you to actually use the book but it is also very interesting learning the material. professor offers extra credit opportunities to help with your grade because your it only consists of major exams, the final exam and quizzes on the chapter. nice professor & knowledgeable. recommend taking him.

Dr. Shirley is a great guy and really wants you to do well. His quizzes are fairly straight forward, while his tests are unreasonably difficult. Don't be discouraged, because he offers enormous amounts of extra credit. He really knows his stuff (for you psych majors) and offers tons of experience which keeps things interesting.

Dr. Shirley was one of the best professors I have ever had at CSU. He is a healthcare provider and relates his experiences with the material. Very knowledgable about the topic covered. His tests are not easy, but he offers a decent amount of extra credit. I would totally take him again!

Dr. Shirley was a good but tough professor! I would take him again. His lectures are interesting and his quizzes are tough, but they only prepare you that much better for the test. He has a very dry sense of humor and hates tardinesswhen people skip his class. Attendance is taken every day.

Dr. Shirley was great! He's a clinical psychologist so he's had a ton of experience with each and every disorder that he teaches about. Weekly quizes that are based on lecture and the readings. Reading the material is pretty necessary, but also it's so interesting. Very applicable to real life. Very interesting course taught by a great man.

I loved this professor.  He taught abnormal psychology.  His lectures were very interesting and the quizzes were straight forward.  The exams were kind of challenging but doable if you study.  He gave out a lot of extra credit. 15% worth.  He is very helpful and even brought us doughnuts and apple cider on test day.  I would take him again.

Shriver gets you in the classroom and forces you to write lesson plans. It is challenging but necessary. People who did not like this professor probably did not have a good experience in their tutoring sessions, which are pretty straight forward examples of "you get what you put into it". She has a lot of experience and will share it. WIN!

Sometimes she was a little unorganized, but she is passionate about teaching. Most importantly, she provided us with useful tools we can actually use in the classroom. One of my favorite courses at CSU. That says a lot considering my undergrad was from here. Excellent!
Great teacher, but be ready to work hard! Very nice lady, I would take one of her classes again for sure.

Her "quizzes" are like exams! You really need to study. She enjoys teaching but she is not always clear about everything. She used the textbook a lot. I would recommend another professor, but if you have her as a teacher it wont be the end of the world.

If you like prof. Wheatley than don't take her. She teaches totally the opposite. So the information you learn (to me) is useless, but she is definitely willing to help.Also - studying for test is not the easiest, you can get from A-F.

Prof Shriver is a very compassionate professor who went above & beyond to help me. If you don't know how to write a good lesson plan before this class, by the time you leave you will. This class is NOT easy and often the assignments, due dates, & instructions are unclear. I learned a lot through the tutoring portion but this class def made me work!
Nice person. Enjoyed the books she shared. Didn't learn much about teaching reading or assessments however. Would not recommend.

I was really excited about this class but she ruined it for me. She changed the schedule so many times I never knew what was due, when! She spent a huge portion of class time showing us books, which is nice if this was a 16 week course. What a waste of time.
Very flexible professor who has a wealth of teaching knowledge. Provided some great phonics teaching strategies that I know I will use with students in my future classrooms.

Taken as a 6wk summer class. The only grades were two exams and a final. All multiple choice. He gave out bonus quizzes that could boost your exam grade by like 10-15 pts. He would also take questions off if many people missed it. Good guy. Ask about his research. There is A LOT of information for you to memorize, which can be hard in 6 weeks.

He mostly reads off of the slides, all information is provided that you need to know for the exam. Going to class is not mandatory, I missed the last month of lectures and got an A. If there was something I needed extra info on, I just read the textbook to figure it out. Exams are definitions, pretty straight forward.
He was awesome.

Book not required, but helps. Gives mult choice exams, and cumulative final w/ repeated questions from previous exams. Assigns weekly written assignments (summarizing research articles) as grade booster - just do the assignment and you'll get full credit (adds up to an entire exam score). Not the most personable prof, but good. No quizzes.

Dr. Shukla is a somewhat contradiction. Encourages students to go to his office during his hours, yet is rarely there. At times nice, friendly, and talkative, at others extremely morose, monotone, or brooding. Lectures are very long and fast, wastes no time. Extremely difficult exams, with averages usually below 2550. If possible, use other prof.

Typical biology class. A bit hard to understand. First test was by far the easiest, others have questions asked twice and application questions (i.e. Betty was in the lab and she found this. What would you do next?) For lab, the TA was awful- labs never worked,quizzes were impossible, etc. Was told they would be curved but were not.

Class is composed of 4 exams and 1 final. The first exam is easy after that all the others require a LOT of critical thinking and knowledge of the subject. Accent gets more difficult to understand as the semester goes on. Does not curve. Not helpful, said directly he doesn't like students going to his office. Be prepared to study.

First test is easy, then it goes downhill from there. Hard to understand. Won't curve tests, even when more than half the class is getting 2050 on them. Degrading to students. Constantly said things like "if you got this answer wrong on the test, you shouldn't be in this class". I studied a lot for tests and could only manage Cs on them.

Dr. Shucklais a rather sarcastic man. Normally this would be OK, however, he tends to let his sarcasm seep through, and degrade students in class. Also, with four tests and a final exam, it seems straight forward. However, the tests are extremely difficult. The material is extremely specific. The average exam grade was between 60-65%

Guys listen I am so disappointed in myself for taking this class and not dropping it as soon as possible.  Dr. Shukla is by far the worst professor I ever had I honestly cannot believe he still has a job here.  Avoid at all cost!!! Especially Pre-meds
Dr. Shukla isnt the best. You will get the grade you want if you study, but you wont get alot out of the course or his lecture.

Poor teaching philosophy. Had to drop a test because average was ~48%. Then, he takes questions off of the test that we all failed and does not let students see the test in office hours because "students were taking pictures". Very smart, but I lost all respect for him as a prof this semester.

Absolutely horrendous "professor". Terrible at teaching anything at all so you must teach yourself. Exams are ridiculous and over info not mentioned in lecture. So bad he had to completely drop an exam because entire class failed. Avoid this man at all costs.

Frequently used guest lecturers from Cleveland Clinic that were hard to understand. Despite rushing to finish the assigned chapters in lecture, spent the last week of classes, not reviewing, but lecturing over new material that wasn't on the exam. Averages were low Cs for the class throughout the semester. Doesn't curve. Rambles a lot. AVOID.
Dr Shukla is a brilliant man.  Not the best teacher.  If you go in knowing that attendance is your best bet, you will pass.  Read the material prior to lecture and try to "think like a cell".

The worst professor I ever came across. Apparently seems helpful with his standard stereo-typed power-point slides but has frequent mood swings. Awful communication and hard to understand his accents. Please avoid him and learn cell biology by yourself and you will do better.

Genuinely wants students interested and learning, encouraging and supportive to potential researchers.  Answers questions willingly.  Excellent text book goes well with lecture.  He knows who comes to class and who doesn't, dont skip.  Very nice man.  Tough subject but he is very straightforward.  Tests cover everything and in detail.
very knowledgeable! You will end up with an A if you regularly go to class and PAY ATTENTION! Also, Make sure you read the chapters before each class. Do not solely depend on the ppt.

Very knowledgeable and genuinely wants students to learn.  True there is a bit of a communication issue with his accent but you adapt to it after awhile if you aren't sitting next to someone who talks during class.  The tests were shockingly easy.  I was done in 14 minutes with our last exam.

Tests aren't too bad but going to class won't translate into a good grade. Hard to understand due to a heavy accent mixed with a strange sense of humor. Not much of a teacher so you will have to learn on your own and memorize. Nice guy though. Takes it personally if you stop going to lecture. Does curve a little bit.
Great professor

Awesome prof. Doesn't use the textbook at all: everything you need to know, he will give to you. He usually outlines exactly what is going to be on his tests/quizzes. You will want to attend as many classes as possible or else you may get lost as the material is challenging. He also tells awesome life lesson stories. Overall, loved it.
Just started the semester and can already tell that this class is gonna be awesome because Dr.Schupp is teaching it!
Great professor here. He gives out his phone number so you can call him with questions. Trust me he actually answers every time. If you are taking a college chem course seek this guy out.

She's really nice and has it set up so all quizzes and exams are online with no time limit. There is on research paper due at the end of the semester, but not a lot of direct was given for the paper. We also moved through chapters very fast, and I didn't really feel I learned as much as I could have, but I still enjoyed the content.

Jaime was one of the best professors I have taken at Cleveland state. She is very understanding and does not have a plus or minus grading scale. She offers many opportunities for extra credit to ensure you do well in the course. I am sad Im graduating because I may not have thhave opportunity to take her classes again. Take professor Shuster!

Nice guy.  He is a low talker.  Thankfully he used a microphone in class which made it easier to hear him.  Tests were reasonable.  Take home exam and in class exams.  He was a fair grader.  You will pass the class with at least a B if you just barely do the work.  Put some effort in it to get an A.

This guy was a train wreck.  Two students asked about the same homework question and they were given two different answers, and then told that both were correct.  He is a nice guy but not exactly on top of his game, i.e. grading and consistency issues. Take home midterm and final for summer session.  You can get an A but don't expect to learn much.
dosen't teach very well but he has a really good grading scale but to be honest i taught myself a lot in his class and now i pretty good

The prof is difficult to understand in class.  He does not use the board, and when he does, he expects you to write the same full length paragraph that he is writing.  This is NOT an English class!  He posts materials to blackboard MINUTES before the class is scheduled to begin which does not allow the student to properly prepare for class.

he gives us 9 pages of notes to use on the test. i got an a in stats one. if i cant do better than a D on his tests, w 9 pages of notes and a knack for stats; there is a problem. speaks too quietly.  he advises we come to him for help, but is very snide when you finally do. impossible class. i will not be graduating this semester bc of this class

i really hate this guy. his ppts are incomplete, and its all he uses in class. he assigns homework that you can only use a windows machine for, so do not take if you have a mac. also, his homeworks are completely on a computer so when its test time you have no idea how to do it longhand. very snippy if you ask for help. useless. speaks too quietly.

Let me put it this way - the very first day of class, we reviewed OMS 201 and I understood more in that 30 minutes than I did in the entire semester before. Professor Skladany is a nice guy however, the workload for a level 100 class was a bit much.

Skladany is the most convoluted man I have ever met. He assigned a journal worth 50% of our grade halfway through the semester, not enough time to actually do it with his high expectations. THE ABSOLUTE WORST. His grading policies blatantly oppose each other so everybody in the class ended up with horrible grades and he just thinks that we didnt do well enough. Very unhelpful, way too much work. Best professor I have ever had! Very caring and knowledgable. He reviews the material frequently and will not move to the next section until every student understands. Professor Slane's method of teaching is based off understanding concepts and applying them to daily life, rather than memorization of his material.

Dr. Slane is one of the BEST professors I have ever had the pleasure of having as an instructor.  He is always willing to share his wisdom and knowledge both in and outside the classroom.  I would suggest taking him for any class and stopping to have a cup of coffee with him!

I was very disappointed in this class; it was very unstructured and unclear. Most of the material for the exams came from the book so going to class really was a waste of time. A GREAT PROF. AND  A LOT OF FUN.

Dr. Slane is a great professor and knows the material very well.  Explains real world examples very clearly. me too. I got a A this time after dropping it with three other profs, including coleman.such a nice guy and so understanding.

Good prof.  Knows his stuff.  Not easy, but not too hard either. Still getting used to his new place, but i highly recommend him.

If you test well, then this is a solid option for online class. No homework - the entire grade is based on 2 tests. Weekly quizzes are strictly for keeping up to date and for extra credit. Best part of his online classes is that he offers Tegrity lectures that tell you what is important.

grade is based on two exams. quizzes are not based on valuable questions more like hidden gems. he makes this class harder than what it needs to me. I would never take him again nor recommend to

Very easy to get an A in the class if you don't skip, extra credit pop quizzes can push you up 10% of your letter grade. While the lecture is boring, he's very excited about teaching and will answer any question you have and wants you to do good, always willing to help. I hate biology but got an A

I loved this teacher, the content of my class was very hard and he made it easy to get an A. Most teachers these days seem like they want you to struggle to get a good grade, but he actually made it quite easy while learning a lot in the process. Great teacher!
I really liked his method of teaching. pop quizzes occasionally but if you're there they're pretty easy.

He was awesome! class is hard because of the material but he makes sure to explain it very thoroughly. 4 tests, lowest is dropped. pop quizzes at least once a week BUT they're all extra credit, 100 extra credit points. Dr. Slifkin is an inspiration - this guy is actually into science and the scientific method. He goes above and beyond in many ways. If you're actually interested in Psychology or Research Science, you need to introduce yourself. Can't say enough - meant a lot to me.

Dr. Slifkin is thorough when teaching. I learned a lot and liked his methods. Questions for extra credit quizes and tests are straight off of his power points. Study those and you'll do fine.

TAKE HIM! He has online lectures so that your basically taking an in-class course but from the comfort of your own home! gives lots of extra credit and his tests are pretty clear! the book was very clear! one of the best online experience I have ever had!

cool professor, even though the class can put you to sleep at times, make sure you take the thinking exercises seriously, makes class more interesting, you get out early, he is happy with you, win-win, highly recommended!

It is a web based course. And makes use of a Ridiclous rubric.  There's a TA who grades everything, leaving no room for error. This is the worst class I've taken in my entire college career, and strongly advice others from EVER taking this course.

Great class and WEB set up. The instructor answered question when asked and gave good feedback. You don't need much more that that for a web based course. You are expected to be disiplined enough to complete your readings and turn in assignments. Worked for me!

It is a web based course. The grading scale that she uses through her TA is insane. There is no room for error with her and don't advice EVER taking this course.

this is the best class i have ever taken. this guy is exactly how i want to be when i am forty. he also reads these apparently. *waves* CSU needs to have a history of punk class, taught by chas. then my world would be perfect. this dude played for the PAGANS! check out the pink album credits...

Derwood is nice guy, repeats himself a lot, but is very knowledgable. I still remember and use things I learned from his class. He's more of an old school professor which I was totally fine with.
