Very nice guy. Grading criteria for papers was a bit unclear and exams were lengthy all being true and false questions. I did learn a lot and he was very knowledgeable.

With this WAC, tests are long; 100+ questions. They don't come from the book, but the lecture notes. However, he grades on a really good curve so almost everyone earns an A. His papers are specific (10+ pages) and he expects you to really know what you're writing about. It was a fairly easy class, but it was just too much writing for my own good.

Professor was very passionate of what he teaches. Very knowledgeable. Attendance is not mandatory. Grade is based on 2 papers and 3 exams. Exams were difficult but curved the exams. Highly knowledgeable and approachable. Interesting lectures and grades on a curve.

He is a great professor, his class consist of only 3 exams no presentations or group work... if you take notes in class, you will do fine. I took 3 classes with him and didnt read any of the books and still got a nothing lower then a B+. You will learn alot ! Great Professor !!!!
A great guy, a great teacher, very interesting class.

Everyone is right. He is a walking encyclopedia, he does crack jokes & is a sweet man. If you listen to his ramblings in class, most of it will be on the test, but a fair amount of questions are previously written about things he never discussed. He is very lenient with due dates & the WAC paper. Overall, fairly easy class, alright professor.

Had him as my Writing Across the Curriculum Professor and he was great ! One essay, 2000 words, he gives it back with corrections and you return it in and there you go you earned the WAC credit ! Great professor!!!

I took 2 classes with him and he is an AWESOME professor, he is very interesting and fun. He knows a lot of information, but makes jokes in class so that its not as intimidating as you might think ! Needless to say, i was kinda bummed when I wasnt able to take his class this fall
He's so great! Loves what he teaches and makes it fun to listen to.  I learned a lot in his class!  He's just the sweetest guy!
Incredibly smart guy and also super friendly. Hard tests but easy grading. Bad notes but good lectures. Would not recommend if you are not into theology. Otherwise, wonderful.

Dr. Smith is a very nice, easy going man. He is very wise, and isn't too hard. His exams are all T/F. He also curves them incredibly. clear, concise, really knows his stuff, interested in students. Encouraged me to trust my own intellect and judgment.

The man is a walking theology encyclopedia from harvard.  Excellent Lecturer, although you can't follow what he writes on th board when taking notes.  He is all over the place.  No study guides, T/F tests which are fairly difficult.

This man reminded me of Les Nessman from "WKRP in Cincinnati." I barely got through his class, which I took during the summer one year.
His rambling lectures have nothing to do with his tests.
Smith is a great professor, one of the best I've ever had. He inspired me to study more theology, and is classes are informative and fun.

a nice guy, but the only grades in his class are a couple of 100 question T/F exams. his lectures are scatterbrained. listen and take notes all you want, it wont help you on the exam! he also doesnt review or anything like that. some people think he's easy, but if you want a GOOD grade, forget it.
Professor Smith is the best teacher in the world. He was nice and his teaching methods are great. I recommend taking the class with him as your teacher.

Hands down the most comprehensive & organized online class I have ever taken! Professor Smith is very kind & quick to respond to emails. She provides you all the tools to succeed. Highly recommend.
Nice lady. She is a great person to learn from if you want to become a CPA. Her exams are tough, but she offers enough points from other assignments to make up for a low grade.

Professor Smith is very clear on the demands of the course. Work load is fair, Tests are medium/difficult. Go to every class and you should have no problem on what to study or what the expectations are. Her lectures often give real life examples that help a lot.

Took Auditing online w/ Professor Smith and it was a fantastic experience. She responds to e-mail questions quickly and is one of the kindest professors I've had. She gives thorough feedback on discussion board assignments and communicates with the class via e-mail and Blackboard as needed. The exams weren't too bad and HW allows multiple attempts.

I took auditing online over the summer and it was a good choice! The professor is extremely kind and gives good feedback. Her lectures are very beneficial. If there were more accounting classes offered with her, I would definitely take them! Explains auditing in real english than in accounting jargon.

Great Professor, truly enjoyed his class. Do your work, listen in class, study a lot for exams and you will pass this class easily. He's very charismatic and funny. His class is fun to sit in and I found myself looking forward to his class. He wants you to understand so ask questions and participate in class discussions. If you need help, he helps
Very nice guy, show up to class and pay attention and you will pass with no problem.

assigns about 5 HW assignments and has 3-4 exams. exams aren't tough if you make sure you pay attention during the class and review and skim through the book and PP's. have to participate in class and he takes attendance. gives a lot of extra credit and curves all exams. id take him again
This guy doesn't know how to write a test. His questions are vague and if you don't know sports, then too bad, those are the only examples he gives. He can't use a calculator.

He was a great professor! He was available to help after class for understanding and wanted to see you succeed. He is a reasonable grader and gives homework and test grades. Would definitely take him again if I had the chance.
I didnt even go to this school and I attended this class because charity is so awesome ...

There are a LOT of assignments for this class plus very long writing assignments due. The professor gives good feedback - but at times you have to request it because his initial feedback can be vague. Very nice but what bothered me was he waited until last minute to grade every single assignment. Hard when you dont know your grade till last min.

i would not recommend this professor. took the class online and lets just say i had many assignments due weekly and an exam every week. the assignments he graded manually were very difficult and he never graded them on time. the assignments were graded hard and he would leave comments about every detail, and some wouldnt be too nice.

Honestly, one of the worst profs that I've had. The course had a ridiculous amount of work (all based from an online textbook) and not only did he never grade an assignment on time, but he didn't even come close to covering all of the material he had put in the syllabus. Take the course from someone else if you have the option.

This class is the majors guide to psych and i was honestly looking to get some help in the field but he sort of failed in this area. he can't seem to get his point across, i found i hard to pay attention. the class itself is pretty boring but he didn't do a great job trying to help make it worth while.

He does not explain anything in a clear or organized way. He takes the entire class to explain half of a full thought. He is disorganized when he comes in. He does not answer questions that are asked. He does not make concepts simple, he makes them more confusing that they originally are.

DO NOT TAKE: the first day of class he explained SIMPLE concepts such as mean, median, and mode and I left class questioning myself! Go to tutoring every week and you'll be fine, but you have to have someone re-teach every lesson he explains and it is a waste of time but necessary.

if you can help it-avoid this professor. Worst I have ever taken. I'm a senior with great grades otherwise. He did curve at the end, because our class was doing so bad, but the stress was not worth it.I only passed because I knew material from previous classes. Professor is everywhere with his info, not organized, not clear. cant ask him questions.

He was always all over the place. Never got his point across. And for the midterms where short answer was involved, he would mark answers wrong that were just said in a different way but still the right answer. He's way too much, I will never take another class of his. Unless you want a difficult time , then by all means, have fun!

Oh boy, where do I begin? Dr. Smith is difficult simply because he is so unorganized in his lectures and goes on tangents before he gets to his point. He is very unclear and is clearly annoyed when you ask for clarification. He also takes days to respond to emails so make sure you don't email him last minute!

He is not the worst professor I have ever had but he is definitely not the best. His tests can be very difficult. He takes attendance every day for points. He is very hard to follow during class so i would 100% recommend getting help. If i would not have gotten help i probably would have failed. A lot of the students who didn't get help did fail.

Terrible terrible terrible. He has an awful attitude. CANNOT PREPARE HIS THOUGHTS OR HIS LECTURES. Very confusing. When students have questions he gets mad and never can give a straight forward answer. Mumbles under his breath beraiding students a lot. And everything is our fault. Very immature. Worst professor I've ever had. Ever.

Definitely a tough class but he's really fair. He truly wants everyone to enjoy the class and really wants to do all he can to make sure everyone understands.  He stopped me outside of class once to draw on his coffee cup and explain a question he knew I didn't get in class.  He tends to over explain which can get confusing but just ask!

Quite possibly the worst professor I have ever had. He's unconcerned with actual teaching and more concerned with showing how much information he knows. He gets mad when we don't understand something. He asks questions and makes things way harder than they need to be. His voice now makes me cringe and my day is ruined after I leave every class.

Dr. Smith presents the material in a clear and concise way. He repeats concepts over and over again so that you actually understand what he's teaching. It's not an easy class and you have to put the work in to do well.

This is by far one of the worst professors I've ever had. This was also the first time I have EVER almost not gotten an A. He is not clear on what he's trying to teach, and I found it more useful to teach myself with the book than to listen to him. The multiple choice tests are mostly common sense, but the others are confusing.

Research methods. This was the first time this class has been taught at CSU. I don't doubt that he knows the content of the class, but he doesn't convey it very well. When he tries to explain things it's confusing. He takes forever to return quizzes and everyone was always confused. Barely used the book and class was boring.

Unless you are good at math, don't take this guy.  He has a very hard time communicating in a concise manor. He can be very abrasive, putting people on the spot to answer ? and then gets annoyed when you don't answer correctly. Doesn't post grades on BB, He doesn't proof read tests, most every quiz had an error. He takes too long to return tests.

I think everyone is being a tad harsh on DR. Smith. I came here to check out my new professors for next semester and just decided to see what the rating was of some of my favorite professors. Statistics is not for everyone. I was happy to get such a precise and dedicated teacher! Highly recommended!

Dr Smith was awesome. Not an "easy A" but if you come to class and study you will do fine. A Quiz every week is good review but after awhile annoying-but not hard. His sense of humor is dry but clever- I found him very funny. He made a potential boring class enjoyable. Highly recomended!
Great professor

Snow is a super chill guy and is more than willing to adjust the class to fit students' comfort with the material. If you look up other work he's done, it's clear that he knows his stuff. His tests and quizzes are stupid difficult (multiple choice but possibility for more than one correct answer) but test your knowledge in an intelligent way.

Average professor.  Gives tests over material covered ub labs without returning graded labs so you can study. Does not do a good job explaining how to do development on CSU dev box. Uses PPT alot (seems like a CSU staple in CIS). Class was not overly hard if you are detail orientated and like to write code.
He is the best, I wish he teaches all CIS classes !!!
Easy to understand, funny, tries hard to get her students to understand assignments. Easy class to pass if you show up on time and pay attention.
She's a little corny but all in all shes a pretty good teacher. Not terribly hard but sometimes a little picky when it comes to papers. Fun fact: she is a black belt and teaches karate.

Great teacher, you get no homework. There are 3 papers that you have to write which are up to 2-3 pages, and a capstone final. Overall attend the classes and you'll learn how to write your paper if you want to get an A. Overall easy class I highly recommend it.
Very willing to help, and really wants you to succeed. She has some quirky moments, but keeps it interesting. Go to class, participate, and you'll get an A.

Hated this class. very unclear. Went against everything i was taught in Eng 101. Very weird and corny. So unclear about papers that students didn't know what kind of paper we were to write. Avoid this professor if you can.

Mrs. Soeder is weird looking & corny acting, but she does teach you what you need to be taught. Not hard to pass her class, but attendance on time is a MUST and there is one big paper at the end. No homework or quizzes, just have to read from the books. Pretty good teacher.

Loved Dr. Sohn. You can tell he is passionate about what he teaches. His lectures are a bit dull, like all lectures are, but he does a great job of clearly explaining what you need to know. Take notes and pay attention during lecture and make flashcards off of the study guides. Weekly readings and summaries. Easy presentation he will help with.

Show and take notes to pass, easy exams and expect a few essay exams to type. Gives questions and answers to exam(study guide) at least 1or2 weeks before exam and is WORD FOR WORD ON THERE!!!!. EASY A to pass the class, just make sure to memorize the terms

I had Professor Sohn for my first semester of college as my ethics professor it was a really enjoyable class, he was clear with the materials, we had assigned reading ( he did go over a good portion of it in class) and 1s a week we had a reflection due (a paragraph of about 200 words) about the readings. great professor, interesting class.

Sohn is a great professor, very clear in his expectations, you never have to guess what he wants from you.  His tests are also very simple.  His religion class is a little boring just because of the way he teaches it but overall it's not bad.  I'm taking his health care ethics class too and I know that it will go well because he is clear and helpfu

If you are going into this class expecting to learn more about traditions and practices of different religions, don't take this course--it is more of a history of religions. Dr. Sohn is very interested in the material he presents. There is a reflection of weekly readings due once a week. And there is also one oral presentation, but it's super easy!

Overall great professor. Every week a short reflection (1 paragraph) is due over the assigned reading (fairly easy, purpose is to add cushion to your grade). Lectures are interesting and clear to understannd. If you have any questions, he is willing to answer to the best of his ability. Exams are easy as it is the study guide. Study & Participate!

I took this class because I thought it would be interesting and something different. Unfortunately, Professor Sohn made this class terrible. He gets snarky with you when you don't understand what he wants (which is all the time) and makes his lectures a drag. He is very monotone and and teaches primarily from a powerpoint. I do not recommend !!

Mr. Sohn is one of my favorites. lectures are fine. exams are fairly simple. Best thing he does is, for exam review he makes students get into groups of 4 or 5 then he assigns each group stuff. Then each group gets up and write their results on th board. He will review the results with the class. And that's the Study Guide. SG is basically the exam

Difficult class to pay attention to because of the material itself.  Personally I enjoyed the class, and I liked how interactive Sohn was with in class discussions.  Majority of people would not participate, but of the few who did we all very much enjoyed this class.
Teacher is very boring. Texts are confusing and he doesn't make everything clear. The TA was more helpful than the teacher was.

Dr. Sola is, by far, my favorite professor I have ever had. He is very knowledgeable in his field and makes his classes very engaging. If you want to learn about the Caribbean, Slavery, and colonialism, you will never learn more. The engagement in his classes fosters an excellent environment for retaining what is learned.

Dr. Sola is, by far, my favorite professor I have ever had. He is very knowledgeable in his field and makes his classes very engaging. If you want to learn about the Caribbean, Slavery, and colonialism, you will never learn more. The engagement in his classes fosters an excellent environment for retaining what is learned.

Jose is the man. He's so funny and such a generous grader. I ran out of time taking my online test and he let me email him the questions I missed without deducting points. He responds quickly to emails and really cares about his students while understanding we have our own lives going on too. No homework. One essay and four exams, super easy.

Dr. Sola is a professor everyone should try to have. His class is very easy, and all assignments are straight-forward. He also has a very caring personality and is willing to work with you so you get an A. He is also very open-minded to other people and their ideas/beliefs. He is very funny too, but be prepared for A LOT of cussing.
A really fabulous teacher would most definitely take him again!

Professor Sola could be one of the few people capable of making Queen Elizabeth II smile in a serious situation. Not only is he funny and charming, but he is also an amazing professor. He is extremely knowledgeable and able to showcase the big picture/important themes among the numerous historical details. One of the best professors at CSU.

Jose is an awesome guy! Very funny and makes some boring history subjects entertaining. His only grades are essays and he graded them extremely generously. Gives a couple free days off of class for "reading days" to catch up on reading... because there's a ton of reading. He claims that there are discussions in class, but its mostly him lecturing.

Had him for Latin AM History, Was super funny! He gives plenty of time to do all work needed (and a little extra when i needed). Tests about every other week, If you read the book every single answer was in there and then 1 paper which was pretty quick! i would surely take a class of his again

I took this online as a summer class. You'll have to read a history book but it is not long or hard, and the material I found to be rather interesting. Professor Sola allotted a  generous amount of time  for  the tests and if you read the texts you should certainly do well.

Must attend class because he does not post powerpoints on his website and is not on blackboard, but if need be he would probably email them to you. Also, if you don't attend class you will miss the important info he says that helps notes. He is always willing to help his students and is a great teacher. Tests and one paper are fairly easy w/ notes!
I took him online my first semester at Cleveland State, and he is awesome. His expectations are not not confusing. I highly recommend his class.

Dr. Sola is one of the greatest professor I've had in a while. He understands that we are students and have other classes and responsibilities. He is a funny guy and very passionate about history. His accent may be confusing at some times. Must go to class as he doesn't post power point and most information is from what he says not what is on board

I just took HIS 165 online with Prof. Sola, and this class was seriously so easy as long as you do the assignment. 3 quizzes and 2 exams, questions straight out of the reading. There were times where I would do an assignment, not quite sure of my answers, but I received all A's on every assignment. Fair and easy grader.
Good class if you like Latin American history. He has an accent, but nothing that can't be understood.
not clear, difficult to follow him

I wouldn't recommend taking his class during summer unless you're willing to do A LOT of work. There is homework due every week it is all done in essay for and the material analysis assignments have to be no shorter then two pages. He grades fairly easy but takes forever to post grades. The readings aren't very interesting..

This course was taken during the Summer 2012 semester. Dr. Sola was a delightful teacher: very responsive, constantly engaging students, etc... His chapter outlines provide clarity on the overall concepts, while the readings provided great examples. All tests/discussions/quizzes were taken in essay form.

One of the best teachers I've ever had in college.   He did a great job implementing power point, using personal anecdotes, and brought his own humor to the class which really makes it come together nicely.

Excellent professor. Took an area which I had no interest in prior and made it interesting. Teaches very clearly and is enthusiastic. Very willing to help students when they need it. I would recommend this professor.

Dr. Sola has a intelligent approach on this topic as his heritage lies within Latin America. He is a phenomenal professor and I will miss his class. Textbook was very helpful and his study guides are practically the test. Pay attention.

Professor Sola is a good and witty professor, he tells some jokes and just tend to keep evreything loose and fun.  The test are straight to the point with the material learned.  I would recommend this class, my only complaint was with lack of black-board

This class wasnt bad at all. Professor Soliman is excellent with responding to emails and he is very organized. If you are ever stuck with something you can email him or find it online for help. Overall, really great professor!

This class wasnt bad at all. Professor Soliman is excellent with responding to emails and he is very organized. If you are ever stuck with something you can email him or find it online for help. Overall, really great professor!

Love this professor, he genuinely was the most helpful professor I have ever had, and really cares about his students. Overall the MyITLab stuff wasn't too bad, and he always gives great feedback and fixes glitches and gives credit for hard work. Very good about responding to emails and providing help.
Great professor everything is online. In order to de very well in his class you need to read the chapters. I had to work full time so 1/2 of the time I was too exhausted to read the book.

He is an extremely nice and helpful guy who made a tedious and frustrating class a bearable one. The online work can be glitchy, so he does his best to find the problematic parts and inform you of how to get around it or just doesnt count it. He never goes over content that will be on the online quizzes, but all the answers are pretty easy to find.

Professor Soliman is a solid choice for IST 203. He is very helpful and informative but I would also like to recommend that any prospective student consider taking this class online. Its mostly working on online modules. He only had lectures for certain topics and they were concise and helpful. Consider online, but if not, hes a great choice.

Bless this man. He is a fantastic professor who cares about his students success and will work very hard to make sure that the material is understood and accurate. The online homework often suffers from computer glitches but Professor Soliman is very forgiving and will help students with their glitches or other errors. Great genuine soul.

Professor Soltis clearly deeply cares about Urban Design. I would not take this class if you aren't willing to make a significant time, money, and effort commitment to urban design. This class is also difficult for people who do not like public speaking as you have to present every class period. Great professor, very informative,veryhardclass.

Professor Soltis clearly deeply cares about Urban Design. I would not take this class if you aren't willing to make a significant time, money, and effort commitment to urban design. This class is also difficult for people who do not like public speaking as you have to present every class period. Great professor, very informative,veryhardclass.

Inconsiderate of others time and money. Moves the goalposts on assignments every single time. Extremely unorganized. Too many assignments that he doesn't even bother grading. The list is endless don't take his class!
Easily one of my favorite teachers at CSU. Makes class fun, engaging, and is clearly very passionate about urban studies. Loved my semester in his class.
Greg is the best professor I have ever had. He is passionate about the material and genuinely cares. Highly Recommended

First and foremost, the class involved a lecture followed by a field trip. Only this time, we are in college and field trips are still amazing. You can tell from the start how knowledgeable he is about urban design, but also little known tidbits that add to the class. For instance, I learned mummy's were burned for fuel. Barf. Greg's dope!

Can't say enough great things about Greg! Great guy- very understanding, extremely knowledgeable, and keeps lectures engaging and entertaining. I enjoyed him both as a person as well as a professor. You won't be disappointed.

Show up to Class! Professor Soltis works really hard at teaching his class. If you spend the time to go to class, follow his power points, and make time to meet with him after class, you will do well. Professor Soltis worked with me one on one to accomplish my class goals. Great teacher, who is extremely approachable, and extremely  knowledgeable!

Prof. Soltis cares about the material and is very knowledgeable. Most importantly, he communicates the information in a clear and understandable way. I was concerned about this class because it has a heavy graphic component and that is not my strong suit. But he went above-and-beyond to make sure I wasn't left behind. Full recommendation.

Adam is a great professor, and I would gladly take him again. He is a very caring person who could honestly make someone who hates English enjoy the subject. I genuinely enjoyed every class with him, and enjoyed our final project for his class. He did not make us do much work outside of class which was greatly appreciated with my job situation.

Sonstegard is one of the most intelligible professors in the English Literature content area. I would highly recommend someone take his class no matter your class standing (Freshman, Junior, etc..). He is a hilarious and down to earth guy and any student would be lucky to say that they had him as a professor at some point in their lives.

One of the most caring and dedicated teachers I have ever had. Anyone that has anything negative to say about him is clearly mad that this class was not an easy A. Spoiler alert! No college class is. Adam is the type of professor that cares about his students and their opinions far after the semester ends. Highly recommend this class and professor.

The worst professor I have ever had. Although I received a good grade in the class, I would never take another course with this professor again. He is much more interested in pontificating about how much he knows than actually teaching the course. And watch out if you have a subjective opinion about literature that is not exactly the same as his.

Adam is a great professor. He makes even the most boring readings quite enjoyable, and makes the majority of work be conducted in class, which is great for people with busy schedules. There aren't many assignments, so you need to perform well on the few that there are to get a good grade.

Dr. A asked us detailed, thoughtful, and often funny questions about all the material and really pushed us to write good papers. Be prepared to discuss the sexual symbolism in short stories--prof remains professional, of course, but sometimes the subject matter comes as a surprise. The stories are all accessed online; no major need to buy the book.
He's a nice dude, but this class could have a much better professor. I'm not a fan of the way he approaches such sensitive materials.

He is the epitome of the perfect professor. He not only is an excellent teacher, but he is interesting, insanely well-read & intellectual, treats everyone with utmost respect (even to those who don't deserve it), is very PC, writes detailed feedback on  drafts & essays, & has your best interest at heart. He cares, is funny, &  understanding.   BEST

Dr. Sonstegard is a very interesting lecturer, and he is very willing to assist his students with assignments. He is, however, a little frustrating when it comes to his expectations for papers. He's very particular about the style he prefers, and he often seems to misinterpret the points students are trying to make.
Very enthusiastic about lecture topics. Fair, approachable and helpful. Gives great writing advice as well.

Had him for both Canonicity and American Lit Survey. Cares about what he teaches, is very engaging. Be prepared to do work and earn your grade, but don't be too scared, he is more than willing to work with anyone who has trouble. Definitely one of the better profs CSU has to offer. You will be better off for having taken his class.

He is extremely active during class. He does the splits and jumps around! Aside from that, he is extremely knowledgeable and very informative and helpful. Be prompt though, he is very regimented in every way.

Very eccentric and quirky.  He definitely keeps your attention.  He's very bright, and really loves to integrate the class in discussion.  You'll do well on the tests and the essays if you pay attention in class and write down any thing he scribbles on the board; this will likely be on the test if he does so.  Good professor overall.
GREAT Body mechanics.  Does the splits?  Awesome Professor, you have to work to get the grade you want. I loved his class. A LOT of reading and writing, but its worth it.

eh...Sonstegard seems inclined to want you to see things from his perspective..he prides himself on summarizing what students have said but seems to often miss their point and is unable to consider any perspective other than his own..this  guy is tricky- eh.

Never showed us the splits everyone else has commented on, but he's definitely the most helpful and considerate prof I've ever had. Extremely knowledgeable and articulate. High standards. Expect long class sessions.

I am appalled at my A- in this class. Either everyone must be lying to me about how great of a writer I am, or else he just doesn't like me. He does have awesome splits and talks weird. Great to imitate with friends. My writing didn't improve much, but I did learn better sentence flow and more intelligent words to use in writing. Good overall.
Really wierd. He didn't seem to help me much with my writing skills; my classmates were a lot more helpful. He can get very boring sometimes, but his quirkiness can keep you entertained.
all right teacher. can't read his writing on papers. he does the splits in class

Very good professor.  He knows his stuff, and makes the lectures interesting and involved.  Helps you identify unique words to describe short stories, and really enables you to read the stories with better understanding.  As long as you attend class you should leave the class with an "A"

MTH220 is easy for me, but it could be HARD for YOU, a great professor, great lecture, knowledgeable, explain question very clearly. reply email in less than a minute (maybe little longer than that), give extra question in your test to give you extra credit if you can answer it. He really want to help everybody in the room

Dr. Soprunov is an amazing professor. I took Multivariable Calculus (MTH281) and learned about vectors, but not in their entirety. He was able to explain Linear Algebra in a clear, enjoyable way, and he made the study of matrices seem like a cakewalk. If you need to take this course, see if you can take it with him.

Lectures consist of Dr. Soprunov writing  on the blackboard rapidly for an hour and you won't be able to keep up unless you write shorthand.  He thanked me for slowing him down the one time I did.  you'll have to go to his office hours many times to really understand some of the concepts presented, but I'm glad the semester's almost over.

Very good professor. This class was by no means easy, but he wanted everyone to understand the material and repetition was the best way. It is a lot of work and time (I filled out about 100 pages of notes and 45 pages of HW), but it is all worth it. Would highly recommend to all math majors

He is an extraordinary professor. You may feel a little bit difficulty to do homework every week but I am sure you will understand all the material if you do the homeworks on your own. If you want to learn real Math, he is one of the best choices. If you just want to get good grade without working hard, he is not a correct choice.I love his class:)

He is an extraordinary professor. You may feel a little bit difficulty to do homework every week but I am sure you will understand all the material if you do the homeworks on your own. If you want to learn real Math, he is one of the best choices. If you just want to get good grade without working hard, he is correct choice.I love his class:)

He is a very good teacher. You must not miss class or you will be confused because there is no review and topics build quickly. Homework is tough though he will help you and tests are back to the basics so don't be discouraged if you didn't too well on homework. Just study and make sure you understand study guides and you will do fine on tests.

MTH 593 (abstract algebra II) is not an easy class due to the material.  However, the professor presented it in a clear and concise manner, homework and tests were graded fairly, and the professor was approachable and wanted everyone to perform well. Lots of notes!  I filled 500 pages of notes (front and back).  Overall, excellent professor.
He's a great guy, and very very very smart. He doesn't allow calculators though! Also smokin' hot, but that's a different story.
He was very helpful on explaining difficult topics in class, and gave numerous examples to help us understand.

Not an easy class to understand, but he is probably the best man to explain the material.  He expects you to be knowledgeable, and if you aren't, he will make you knowledgeable.  Crystal clear in lectures and active in explanations.  Highly recommended as a Math professor.
Great prof. Gives a lot of homework, but it really helps you learn the material. Would definitely recommend to those interested in learning the class content well.

Dr. Soprunov is just a great guy. Always willing to help, extremely nice, a great teacher, and much more. The only problem might be that sometimes he skips steps, but if that happens just let him know. Homework is tedious but is worth it. You are well prepped for exams and there are no tricks its right from the homework

Great teacher, and also a great guy. He's always willing to help a student, and does a great job keeping up on the grades. He not only returns your papers within 1-2 classes, he posts detailed descriptions of the classes statistics on these papers. Sometimes he skips steps on math, but just ask him about it if he does. Easy tests, he preps you well
Fantastic professor, probably the best mathematics professor at CSU. Very clear in explaining difficult concepts. Highly recommended.
A great teacher. One of the best math teachers I've had. Explains everything very clearly. You must keep up with your homework.

One of the most brilliant professors I have ever encountered in my life.He teaches really well. He really explained the geometric interpretations of Vector Calculus, which is very very important to visualize vector fields in space. I would recommend his class to anyone who  and loves Math. U must be very sincere in class or else u will lag behind

He moves very fast through material, however he explains things well and has an extremely good knowledge of what he teaches.  His tests are not easy but the practice exams and the page of notes you are allowed to use on the tests help a lot.

Challenging and Fun teaching style. Pay attention and keep up on homeworks and one can do fine. I finished the class with a 99 without too much effort other than completing tedious homework assignments that he grades (I recommend working together with someone).
By far the best professor i had for math. go to class and pay attention. exams are easy. do all homeworks. recomanded. iloved him. i would take his class any time.
She can get off topic at times, and she isnt always clear on everything, but shes genuinely a really nice person though.

Wastes lectures listening to music and getting side tracked about random topics. Grades off check minus, check, check plus. There are 3 exams with 2 essay questions per, you have to draw references from the books too. Only other assignments were film reviews. Didn't know my grade until the last week. Not a hard class but you learn it on your own.

Dr. Karen is very nice and seems to be very knowledgeable in what she teaches. However, her lectures are very confusing and all over the place which makes it difficult to understand the material. She also does not use blackboard so I never knew my grade in the course. You will need to read and study a lot outside of class in order to pass.

Terrible teacher. Requires gorey (and irrelevant) movies to be watched outside of class and grades based on her likes as opposed to factual information. Spent a pretty penny on books that I never opened because she never got around to them. Tangents about Childish Gambino, Obama instead of course material. Waste of time.

I can honestly say that I hated this class. It was so boring and such a waste of time. I didn't take notes once the entire semester. She is super scatter brained and just talks about nothing. I'm pretty sure my final grade consisted of about 3 things. I would never take a class with her again. She was horrible. She ruined history for me.
She does not use Blackboard, Powerpoints, and very few notes. Mainly just lectures the whole time. A lot of reading and film reviews
Decent professor. Exams were basically essays.

I've taken her two semesters in a row. The schedule means nothing. Can't stay on topic or cover the material in time. The class isn't structured well for people to actually learn. We are supposed to read on your own then have class discussions and that's it. So if you don't take the right thing away from the reading, you're lost.

Dr Sotiropoulos is a diamond in the rough of professors! Her lectures are passionate and thought-provoking. She allows the class to analyze the texts and her papers are a mixture of different writing styles. Come to class, read the info and you will pass with a great grade. Fall asleep and do not respond to her lectures in your papers you may pass.

grades you on a grading scale of the check plus, checks and check minus. does not use the black board. you can never understand what she is talking about and her teaching style does not make any sense. she is an easy grader though and it was an easy class but it is very annoying never knowing what your actual letter grade is.

She gets sidetracked easily & therefore lecture is useless. I would spend a few hours before every test reading the book, & then just combine my knowledge from the book with what she clearly wants to hear in terms of her extreme political opinions, write the essays & get an A on every exam. Also, exams are open book so write notes in the margin!

Very inspirational! Also very passionate about equal rights for all! Many people below have labeled her a bad teacher but those people are more than likely ignorant students who never experienced injustice. I love her. She speaks her mind, is very understanding & tries her best to help her students pass. It's an easy A if you do your work and read

Excellent professor. Lecture-heavy and often gets sidetracked, but possibly one of the most passionate and knowledgeable professors i've ever had. Her passion for the subject is infectious. The class is reading-heavy but the material is incredibly interesting. Tests include identifications and essays, so be prepared for a lot of writing. Loved!
Her teaching is very all over the place. Tests weren't too bad, just show up to class, take notes, and read what she tells you to.

Painful lectures, very scatterbrained and talks about irrelevent topics ... tries to make you read and reflect on her own work- essays she wrote, page from her book, etc.  Although passionate and knowledgeable, she gets too excited to teach properly. Lots of reading and reviewing... essay tests, THREE required texts, not worth the work for a gen ed

She is passionate about black history, but to the point she tries to shove her beliefs down your throat. By that I mean, she expresses her views and expects you to believe the same as her about certain events. The tests are all essays, so be ready to write. I hate this class because of the professor. DO NOT RECOMMEND
I absolutely loved this particular professor! Yes she does give a lot of readings, but she is so passionate about everything she talks about!
Very kind and passionate about Black history, but the lectures are long and boring. Assigns readings every week on the syllabus. Tests are easy if you study

This professor has a clear love and understanding of black history and does her best to make you feel the same way. The assignments correlated well with what we learned as long as you did all the reading and homework required. Her lectures were mostly for clarification, you must learn on your own to pass this class.

Really opinionated and the most pretentious professor I''ve had in my college career. Babbles about her personal opinion that has hardly anything to do with course. Honestly didn''t learn anything from her that I didn''t read from the book. Hard to follow unclear what I should take notes on when she talks because hardly any of it is relevant or linea

She always tells that she cares for students even though all she cares is her benefits, is not willing to listen to her mistakes, and tells students to keep the mouths shut for everything she does not wish to hear.

While reading through a 90 page academic article I realized that all of this pertains to nothing important and he will want you to read through things he has worked on. Not that it adds value to the class, but adds credit to his life works that otherwise would go unread.

Maybe its the online space but he just assigns us a tone of reading. one day there was 121 pages of reading that was due. I loved all my history classes but this sucked my passion for history. Using busy work. Public History is so conception and is about the National Parks and Museums so maybe I have been jaded by the material and work load.

He's a nice guy, very knowledgeable.  He assigns a lot of reading.  Daily class is him going over his powerpoint of pictures and discussing the reading.  He gives good feedback and has you check in along the way writing your main paper for the course.  No tests, so that's a bonus.

Well you have to read anywhere between 1 article to 200 page books (not a typo) between classes. He just puts pictures on powerpoint and babbles, there are no tests so he just lectures to hear himself talk but attendance and participation are manadatory? final is a 4000 word paper you have 5 other 800-1500 word essays due every other week too
awesome

Very smart, and very interested in his subject matter, but an INSANE work load.  You'd better quit your job and drop all your other classes.  You'll learn EVERYTHING about urban history but probably retain little of it as it will seem like a bunch of information crammed into your head all at once.

Quite possibly one of the most boring teachers EVER. He fails to interact with the class. The work load for the class is way to much. He knows the subject well but i would highly recommend nobody take any of his classes. Amazed why CSU even hired him. Also his over using of the word "essentially" gets annoying. Final thoughts, dont take this class
He does expect a lot of work for only a entry level history course. The workload can be that of a upper level course. He loves the subject.

He is very nice and decent teacher, very smart.Tests are all essay/define. no multiple choice. 2 papers due on 2 diff readings history related. Grades papers/tests a little on the hard side. Offers to proofread papers Only complaint is that he jumps around alot in lecture making it hard to focus on the main point All material is covered in lecture.
If he was any more boring he would be a science teacher. He expects way to much, is way to picky, and should be teaching at Harvard not CSU. Don't take him!
you like it
he puts in alot of effort into his classes. Expects the same.
way too much work. this class alone can make you a full time student.
No Comments
If you want to hear a man talk about himself for 2 hours every class and then expect you to learn 95% of the material on your own, this is the class for you.

He is one of the most egocentric profs I have ever had.  He prentends like he cares about his students but at the end of the day it's all about hearing himself talk (regardless of whether he is right or wrong).  I would not recommend this class.
No Comments
He has this insane ability to look bored when you answer his questions.  He has a passion for getting up and talking in front of people, but I wouldn't call it teaching

Turned to teaching after getting downsized. Asks "Where's the spin?" often without guidance or explanation. Terrible haircut. Better than most CSU communication teachers but hardly inspiring either professionally or intellectually. Good example of "New Mid-West Dull" style.
Rob is always willing to offer extra help!  If there is ever a problem with clarity, he will sit down with you and explain it until you understand.  He's a fun prof. and a really nice guy.
I have never before had a teacher that makes you feel so stupid after sitting through a lecture.  Not a prof to take if you have low self-esteem, because after the class it will just be lower.
All you have to do is show up to class and pay attention. He explains the topics clearly. There is homework which can sometimes be lengthy, but not awful.
10/10 would recommend finding a different professor. Very hard get ready to teach yourself

Nathan is very easy going and a great teacher. He explains everything very thoroughly and is willing to answer any questions you might have. Asking questions and reading the chapters ahead of time are very important in this class. If you pay attention in class and do the homework, you should have no problem with this course.

Easy peasy lemon squeezey. I hope you know how to copy and paste into Minitab, maybe excel too if you like to use useful software. Also, he asked us to make sure we rated him on here and gave him a good hotness rating. Oh, he likes hockey.

Nathan is a very good math teacher and I learned a lot of math in addition to what I already knew on this class topic. Be careful though, it is VERY easy to forget about homework assignments on MathXL, and that definitely makes or breaks grades in this class. Asking questions is so important, because he can rush through topics in a lecture often.
Terrible. Yells at us for being lazy. Tells us to read the book if we want to learn.

What a gem! Lovely person, extremely kind. Weekly assignments and readings, nothing too difficult. No wrong answers here! Really understanding about personal life vs academic conflicts, willing to accommodate and work with you. Very fun course, amazing prof. 100% take her classes!!!

What a gem! Lovely person, extremely kind. Weekly assignments and readings, nothing too difficult. No wrong answers here! Really understanding about personal life vs academic conflicts, willing to accommodate and work with you. Very fun course, amazing prof. 100% take her classes!!!

Hands down one of my favorite professors I've ever had. I wish I could take another one of her classes. You write a lot but she grades fairly and helps you with your papers a lot. Definitely take her if you can.
she's funny, kind and helpful. she understands if you ever had a situation and missed on a paper. I want to take her again next semester for 102.

Absolutely amazing professor that is willing to help anyone that truly is passionate about exercise science. Also he is very knowledgeable and willing to help anyone that comes to him. Best professor that I have ever had hands down!

Loved kinesiology class, but didn't like Dr. Sparks. He doesn't give clear directions for projectsassignments and his grading approach is kind of unclear. Material presented in class is pretty easy and interesting, though.

Outstanding professor in that he really wants his students to succeed and understand the material.  He's older and I think sometimes confuses himself though.  Ask questions, do bonus labs. His class is hard but so good.
good teacher

Professor Spears is excellent, I took her for a security elective. She is extremely knowledgeable and cares about her students. Grades are mostly made up of labs and homework. Only one midterm and one non-comprehensive final, I would recommend her to everyone.

This course is a lot of work (even for a 6 week online course.)  Each assignment takes about 2+ hours and we have about 5 per week, most weeks.  Nothing is multiple choice, all written application.  She's a tough grader and has a specific vision of what the wants.  Be prepared for a lot of work.

Great energy. Will help you with anything you need. Information provided is broken down and compared with real life disorders, and events to help you understand. If you're excited and passionate about speech and hearing, coming to class shouldn't be an issue for you. She's experienced and knowledgeable about the field. Highly recommend.

Ms. Spears clearly cares a lot about her students, is understanding and goes out of her way to make sure everybody understand the material - she will not let you fail. If you do, it's because you didn't attend class! She allows three absences without documentation before she starts docking your grade. You can use the textbook, but don't need it.

Overall a pretty good professor. He lectures all class every class though so it's a lot of notes. May not seem as friendly at first but he opens up and makes jokes. The only grades he puts in are for essays but there is only like three. You take two quizzes but only one counts. I'd recommend the course.

I took Professor Sperry for HIS 112 last semester and he was my least favorite professor this year. He was not horrible by any means but I dont think he was exactly fair. For some reason I got an A- on every single paper even though I got them proof read by PHD students in the history field. It felt like he wasnt really reading my papers.

Overall a pretty good professor. He lectures all class every class though so it's a lot of notes. May not seem as friendly at first but he opens up and makes jokes. The only grades he puts in are for essays but there is only like three. You take two quizzes but only one counts. I'd recommend the course.

Senior engineering student who had several other English classes and engineering writing classes and had never gotten below an A. For this 200 level online class the highest grade I have received on a paper was an 85. 15 exams, 4 500-word papers, 3-1000 word papers and not a WAC class. Rude in his comments. DO NOT TAKE. Like 500 level English class

I was an engineering student and this was the worst class I had in my four years. More essays then WAC courses and grades ridiculously hard on grammar and punctuation errors. Does not seem to actually care about the history you write about just the grammar of your papers. I took it online and would never again.

DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS! absolutely horrible and lots of work! 15 quizzes plus 7 essays! Grades essays like an English class and gives horrible feedback. Doesn't give any rubrics or positive feedback. Would not recommend as an elective course. I wouldn't even recommend this to history majors.

There are 15 quizzes over the material that is chapter by chapter and 7 PAPERS(NOT A WAC)!!! He grades them harder than my College Writing courses. He does give feedback on them, but they are usually rude & belittling. For the amount of papers and the harsh grading, stay away from this online course. I have taken many and this one is a huge regret.
This had to be the worst class I took all year, it made me not want to come to class at all but because attendance was mandatory I had to attend! You can literally teach yourself better than he can
Really rude and doesn't respond to emails if he feels it's not  necessary
He was honestly the most class I  dreaded to attend all semester

Cool guy. Have to do all of the readings and go to class everyday to do well. Takes his exams questions right from lecture. Will randomly call people out. Lots of reading and participation. If you're looking for an easy A without doing much work, wouldn't recommend taking his class.

He's such a sweet guy! Just your average joe professor but he cares about the topic and makes it easy to learn. He really enjoys class participation and will call on you random, but it honestly makes the class better if you just give your opinion. You need to read the assigned books to do well but it's not difficult at all. Wants to see you succeed

One of my most favorite professors. I was going through some problems and struggled with attendance and he wrote on my second paper to see him otherwise he wouldn't grade it. I was nervous but we just talked about stuff and he was just making sure I was okay. Truly cares about the well being of his students sand always willing to lend a hand

Tough Grader: He assigns three papers over the semester. In his syllabus he outlines his specific requirements for the papers -- I followed the requirements and got B's on my papers.  Get Ready to Read: Several readings over the semester, and three books on top of the textbook.  Participation Matters: He calls on people randomly, so be prepared.

There's a lot of reading to do in this class with a paper to write after each book. However, he's willing to work with you on your paper. The study guide he gives before the test is extremely helpful. Attendance is a part of your grade.

He was a great teacher. If you are reading the books and showing up to class, then you're sure to pass. Only 2 tests and he gives you a good list of terms and ideas that will be on the tests. Great guy. Always happy to help with anything.

He's a great guy and a great professor. Really cares about student success and very reasonable. One midterm and one final along with 3 papers. No other assignments. Attendance is part of the grade. There are 3 books to read and a paper on each book, and also a textbook. I thought he was pretty funny too but you might not understand his humor.

You will definitely reading a lot in this class. There's the textbook every week and a book to read as well! Essays are based on books & tests are on the textbook.. so you will have to read. However, concepts are easy. He's always there to help.

Sperry is excellent as a history teacher.  His use of literary sources, photographs, and once even music in addition to the regular text added a level of depth and historical understanding typically lacking in 100 level courses. A great guy too, easy to get along with, open to suggestion, smart but not arrogant.
Knowledgable.  Interesting.  Easy, fast grader.

Without a doubt, Dr. Spicer is a wealth of knowledge on various subject-matters. Moreover, he knows economic theory. For sure, he is flexible and exceptionally friendly. Nonetheless, he does not do a great job of explaining the course materials. Explicitly, he does not use many practical examples of how to apply economic theory to social issues in

Even though his class increased my knowledge of Economics, his tests were challenging in the way he worded his tests.  I think this class should've met more than once per week.  Twice per week would've been better.

Course requires a very large volume of reading, especially considering the amount of content. (i.e. the texts are very wordy.)  Exams are all multiple choice, but tricky.  They really test your knowledge of the material. Grade is based only on four exams. It was a very enjoyable class & instructor, for me.
No Comments

This guy is always full of energy and has a great class structure. He is there to help those that don't understand. Perfect teacher for an intro course, and several students i spoke to wished he taught their CIS 151(invitation to computing) class too.

Prof Sridhar's lectures are amazing. From day one, it's clear that he's passionate, devoted, and eager about opening his students' eyes to the subject matter. His assignments and tests are challenging but meaningful -- you gain knowledge and experience in his CIS260 class. I've never had a better professor than this guy.

Visibly passionate and knowledgeable in the subject. Eager to get you talking which he believes is the best way to learn, the classes I took with him were made up 75% of talking to pears and group projects.  More than available if needed and timely responses to emails.  VERY fair grader.  From his class will know if CS is for you.
Do NOT buy the book... you can find it online for free! Great teacher. Tough grader, but you learn.

Classes are entertaining. He'll help you when you ask him. Easy going. Lenient but fair. Book is a good resource. If you have even slight programming experience you'll pass with flying colors.   By far the best professor at CSU.

He's a down to earth and good guy. He definitely will help if you need it. Some of the wording on his tests can be ambiguous, but ask and he'll clarify. As the other person said, the textbook is online. You can find it easy enough without paying for it.

The Book is free online!!!   Just Google: introduction to java programming 10th edition PDF.  To keep things short I'll write bullet points: No Accent - Answers e-mails promptly -Very energetic and understanding -  Cheat sheet allowed for exams, but it takes exactly the amount of time you're given to complete them(not an exaggeration )
He is a tough professor, but I learned a lot in this class. Sometimes he covers a lot of material in a class, and if you miss it, you fall way behind. I am glad to be done with it.

Admittedly, most of what he does in this class is predetermined by the course coordinator, however, he is not lenient in the slightest compared to a previous course I had under the same coordinator, meaning absolutely no mercy or extra credit for what is already a difficult class. His lectures are hard to understand as well.

The hardest grader i've had thus far. Hes very knowledgeable on calculus and he puts a lot of effort in to memorize everyones name. When preparing for the tests make sure to really learn the unit reviews because if you miss a step or your final answer is wrong he usually does not give credit.
He is a tough professor, but I learned a lot in this class. Sometimes he covers a lot of material in a class, and if you miss it, you fall way behind. I am glad to be done with it.

Dont get me wrong he is a very smart man but he doesnt understand that everyone doesnt get the content to the extent that he does. He is also very awkward and it affects his teaching. He will occasionally chuckle at you for asking questions even though they are usually pretty valid. Definitely would avoid if possible.

He is a brilliant man and mathematician. BUT as with many truly brilliant people he is terrible at instructing the lower levels. He operates at a very high level and so slowing down to a beginners level confuses him. He constantly says "this is easy stuff" and then focuses on explaining WHY its important to know, instead of HOW to do it. No bueno.

I had trouble understanding him, he never ever reviewed concepts, and we had a quiz almost every class. There were no homework reminders and generally I didn't understand how he taught- most of my class felt the same

Goes quickly, but reads almost directly from slides. gets confused at himself and has to work things out before he can explain it again. lots of quizzes between exams, homework is extremely useful for both quizzes and exams, i did not open the textbook once but still have an A. very fast at submitting grades and leaving feed back.
Very good professor, he gives detailed feedback on every homework and assignment . His lectures and assignments are difficult but he gives a lot of opportunities to improve your grade.
Tough prof! I did get a good understanding of the material by the end of the semester.

Just know what you're getting yourself into. Overall he is a good teacher, but the lectures on seriessequences did get extremely confusing for me. Nothing a little clarification during office hours can't fix. Very fair tests, straight from book's examples. Challenging quizzes. He made the class interesting, and he's brilliant. I don't regret it.

No reason not to do well in here if you put in the effort. Calc 2 is definitely a continuation of the weed out process. He wants you to understand the concepts, but also stresses importance of good algebra. Weekly quizzes challenging. Tests straight from the book's examples. He actually makes calc interesting for me, his examples are easy to follow
He explains well, and goes over problems in detail. I did not miss classes because it is very easy to fall behind.

Great professor.  He has a genuine passion and affinity for mathematics that is infectious.  He is highly intelligent and always clear with concepts and problems.  You will always be prepared for tests and quizzes and he is always willing to help you further understand everything.  He makes sure concepts are learned, not memorized.
Awesome professor! Great in explaining and you will never get bored in his class. He owns great knowledge.
Great Professor. Extremely excited about teaching. Very helpful. Quizzes are challenging.

He really is a great professor. MV calc is a hard subject but he makes it easy and he really wants you to understand the material, not just memorize a bunch of algorithms. He meets with you outside of class if you have questions and the quizzes and tests are very similar to the homework assignments he gives.
He is excellent, and always willing to help. One of the best professors in the math dept.

Prof. S. is the best Mathematics Professor ever, and I'm an Engineering major. Gives examples, works out problems with you, goes at a great pace, extremely clear and helpful. All information he gives is so useful. Challenges you though on quizzes, to make exams a breeze! Can't say enough good things about this guy. Take him if you can!

Had him for calc 1, he was great!  very helpful, always asked if we had questions.  His quizes(which he made up) almost always reflected something on the test(which he did not make up due to school's choice).  you can tell he really likes teaching and sometimes gets really excited about teaching something that is his favorite.

Professor srinivasan is a great professor. He always begins each class asking if we have any questions about previous material. He is always willing to help anybody. If at all possible take one of dr. srinivasans classes

Toughest class ever taken. Hes really smart but not the greatest at explaining. Even with taking notes, your better off teaching yourself from YouTube. Tests are difficult and have 10 questions with the hardest examples, so if you get 4 wrong its a D. I will most likely have to take again, definitely not with him.

Me and my roommate both took 149 at the same time with different teachers. Our tests are incomparable in difficulty. Mr. Srinivasan hand makes his tests and selects the hardest problems of each unit review, if he follows the unit review. He is very knowledgeable on calculus but is the most unreasonable teachers ive come across at CSU.

Many of the reviews on here were removed. He is a great guy, he memorizes everyones name and truely cares about what he teaches. Unfortunately its very difficult to understand him. Also he is the hardest grader you will ever have. He is the only 149 teacher ive heard of to hand make each test. Avoid at all costs unless you love math.
He is honestly a terrible stats professor, I really struggled in his class & he did little to nothing to help his students succeed.

A good guy but he teaches by just using the slideshows he prepares. On tests, labs and quizzes he is very picky when grading and will knit pick his way into making your grade lower on a paper when you do have the answer right. When asking a question as well he refers to you to look at your notes and does not give out help.
Hard to understand because of heavy accent. Difficult to get any answers for questions.

This guy is super smart and probably too smart to teach a general math course. I found myself on youtube since I couldn't retain what he was explaining in class. Attendance is not mandatory but I tried my best to be there to show effort. Lots of quizzes that are not on the syllabus. Not a terrible teacher, but you need to put in effort for this one

She teaches in a way that you'll be able to learn, not just memorize. Using the book, youtube, and powerpoints, you'll be able to grasp the concepts based on whatever learning style you have. It's my 3rd A&P course, she has been by far the best professor I've had in this subject. She relates the content we're on to disorders in the field.

A good professor and I hope she gets a permanent position at CSU. Lecture heavy but info is presented well and she shares all materials. Quizzes/Exams are the only grade. Always offering to put us in touch with people who can offer more insight if we have questions on a topic outside of her specialty, and is incredibly knowledgeable herself.

Professor St. Julian is pretty good professor. She is really nice and helpful. Her class is all lecture and the only grades you get are for exams, a few quizzes and a paper. The material isn't too hard and she presents it clearly.
Unreasonable and terrible lectures. Nice guy.

Very nice guy but his teaching style is horrendous to say the least. Quiz questions worded extremely poorly and oftentimes confuses students by having more than one right answer to choose from. The lecture notes when compared to the book are no better as he goes into extreme detail for certain topics and brushes over others. Extremely frustrating!

Dr. Stacey had only 3 exams to base your grade off of. He also took attendance randomly 4x and has assigned seating. He would bump up your grade if you were borderline with good attendance, which is why I passed. Curves HEAVILY because his exams are very difficult. An 18/40 on exams (multiple choice) was considered passing... No clear grading scale

Really great and passionate prof. Cares about his students' learning and success. Despite what he says, you can learn the material without ever going to class, just study the powerpoint and use the textbook. Recitation quizzes are very helpful. Ask questions, either in class or by email. Keep up on the material as exams are very content dense.

Class is super difficult &  his lectures are inconsistent. He admits to having the correct answer being wrong on a quiz/exam but will not give you the point back. With  competitive grading he will have you in limbo up until the last day of class so it is difficult to judge if you should drop/stay. He is very kind but that will not save your grade

Dr. Stacey is a very smart teacher. Sometimes he can make typos in his slides or misspeak accidentally and hes not always quick to point it out and correct it which can make it frustrating at times. Only the top 10% get As so you have to work hard for it. The exams are no joke and he will asks questions to make you think. Overall, great Professor.

Dr. Stacey is one of the best teachers I have had at Cleveland State. While his class IS difficult, he makes up for that with his overall charisma, intelligence, and helpfulness in this class. Does give out pop quizzes and while attendance is not mandatory, do go because he occasionally takes it and gives out a perfect quiz grades to those who show

Dr. Stacey is a nice guy. However, the grading system is somewhat arbitrary. Don't get me wrong, there is a clear grading scale and charts and graphs are posted to see where you stand, BUT at the end of the semester he "pads" the grade somewhat, so that 12 of the class gets an A or B.  Just have to plead your case to him at the end of the semester

Dr. Stacey is one of the most caring and understanding professors I ever had; however, if you take his class, do not expect to just memorize his material and receive an A.  To do well in his class, you must memorize everything, then pull it apart and apply it to anything and everything that associates with it.  This is the only way to be successful

Hes a very nice guy. top 50% of class will get A or B. He will work with you if you are struggling and help you earn the grade you want. As a lecturer he isn't the best, but gives you all the tools and study materials to succeed.

Dr. Stacey is one of a very few professors ive had at CSU that I absolutely love.  Hes extremely caring and considerate to EVERY student in his class, I thought the class was tough but it is biochem and he grades very fairly.  He explains difficult concepts very well and if your still confused he is always open to individual meetings. loved it!
The professor is intelligent but cannot teach! The class average was lower than 50%! VERY HARD CLASS

Going to online class during the COVID 19 pandemic is really hard. Professor Stack is really caring and sympathetic about the difficulties we are facing as students. He assigned an amount of work we could actually handle and I really appreciate his kindness.

Maybe in person he's good, but I would not recommend taking him online asynchronously. He uses pre-made tests and his lectures do not accurately represent the test material. And tests are all that matter, he gives three MCQ tests, and then adds participation for your grade. Not very helpful either, bc he didn't make the tests and won't change them

Going to online class during the COVID 19 pandemic is really hard. Professor Stack is really caring and sympathetic about the difficulties we are facing as students. He assigned an amount of work we could actually handle and I really appreciate his kindness.
He is an okay professor, he NEVER answers his email, which is extremely frustrating. Very boring lectures, didn't even try to make them more interesting.

this class is literally painful. reading is required in order to take graded tests through inquisitive (they're literally designed for children, but they're still annoying) and then he just lectures what he wants out of the reading. he says attendance is mandatory but there is no grade allocation on the syllabus for it and he doesn't take it
If you have taken any type of basic civics class or early American history class and as long as you get the notes you need if you miss the class is pretty easy and his tests were all multiple choice

Professor Stack is a good professor. However, he takes a very long time to grade things and just seemed a little unorganized in general. But he is super understanding and there to help. He is willing to listen to the class's concerns and try to help out as much as possible. Lectures can get a little boring, though.

You cannot find a better professor than David Stack. He is incredibly knowledgeable about Political Science and manages to translate even the most complex topics into an easy to understand format. His classes feel like you're having a conversation with a friend. Fair grader and fun guy 10/10. If you want to earn brownie points, mention Tide Pods.

He is very awkward and pauses a lot through lecture forgetting next thought. Goes through ppts in detail but I would make sure to read the textbook in case you miss anything during lecture. There are 7 reaction papers you will have to write on various topics but you can pick 3 to write on that is 1page each. Gives extra credit sometimes.

Prof. Stack is a great guy. Had the misfortune of taking the 9am class w/ him and rarely showed up on time. Super chill about it and still answered questions w/o malice. You pick 3/7 reaction papers to write (1pg each) and take 3 midterm exams. Final wasnt cumulative for us either. The slides are great but beware of pop quizzes. Review well.

Caring, knowledgeable professor. Choose 3 out of 7 reaction papers to write (1 pg ea.), pop quizzes used for attendance, 3 tests including final (write the definition/short answer because he wants to give you credit!, get to choose which questions u answer, posts study guide).Answers questions and wants class discussion. Textbook useful, not needed

Professor Stack understands most Poli Sci/ IR Students don't love math and he accommodates for that. While he doesn't often send around an attendance sheet, GO TO CLASS. He often gives extra credit and does lots of helpful examples. If you show up everyday I doubt you could fail.

Professor Stack is super awkward but a good professor. The lectures correlate directly with the test materials and the study guides really help. SHOW UP TO CLASS BECAUSE OF POP QUIZZES!! Attendance isn't mandatory, but there are some pop quizzes. Really easy class for basic gov, would take a class he taught again.

Dr. Stacks is insanely awkward but very kind. He is a political science genius, just cannot translate it well to lecture (it gets pretty boring). He tries to foster class participation, but no one really wants to talk, (which is also annoying). His class is easy if you read the text book.

Super boreing. If you have him I would reccomend changing professors. Truly don't understand why people like him chose this profession when he seems like he hates teaching. I didn't learn anything and only went to class bc he made us pay 20 dollars for an app to take attendance.

Prof Stack is super nice, just unbelievably boring. To be totally honest I only went to class in case of the attendance pop quizzes that were super easy. He is a new professor so he has a lot of learning to do. You don't need the textbook. Overall the class was fine, I just didn't necessarily enjoy him.

Prof Stack is very nice and laid back. His lectures tend to get a little boring and he gives surprise pop quizzes at the END of class mainly for attendance, so you should probably show up. The study guides for tests are helpful. Make sure you look over your book before tests. Not a very harsh grader and seems to really want all students to succeed.

Requires a lot of reading and attendance is a must to do well on the quizzes and exams. The quizzes and exams are essay-based. For the exams, he gives you the questions beforehand, but only 2 or 3 will be on the exam. There is also an 8-10 page essay and presentation. Group work/high participation. Geared toward politics fanatics.

He gives study guides that are basically the test and if  you study those you will be fine (unless you don't understand government, then go to class). He does surprise attendance quizzes, but will drop the lowest. A nice guy. Boring, but nice. If you enjoy government and discussion you'll like this class. Beware of political talk.

Professor Stack's class is mainly lecture. If you take clear notes (using the book and the slides) then studying will be an ease. He provides study guides before exams but it is necessary to study in order to pass. It isn't a lot of work just simply requires studying for exams.
She doesn't listen to students when they need help because she thinks what she does is just business!
It is unbelievablely terrible because she doesn't care whether students succeed or not! She really only thinks that Education is Business!
She doesn't care for students! She only thinks that Education is buisiness!
Terrible professor, unfortunately only prof that teaches necessary power courses.
Worst professor at Cleveland State University. Good luck.
She gave us some hard PsPice projects to do. She likes to give us a quiz that looks more like a test of 3 hours. Unfortunately, she is the only Professor who teaches these classes of Powe Electronics
pretty good teacher

She is the worst prof I ever had. Not at all helpful and very selfish prof. All she needs is hr own progress. She dodesnot care about the students. At first she is very sweet but later shows her real appearence. Be careful when taking course with her.

This professor is by far the worst Ive ever had. No one knew what was due, when it was due, or how it was to be completed. Took the midterm 3 weeks before the last day of class. Lectures were useless. Labs were very unorganized and it was obvious that she wasn't prepared for them. Very large communication gap even though she speaks english well.
she is really nice and she would help students to understand the concept.

Very boring lectures. Talk straight out of the book. Somehow managed to make the book extremely confusing. Reading the book outside of class was much more helpful than listening to her blather.Grading was very inconsistent, liked to take away large amounts of points for small errors. Class could've been very interesting, but it was not.

Make sure to get on her good side asap. She teaches right out of the book so skipping class won't hurt you much. Tests aren't too bad. Boring class lectures. Examples right from the book (which has them all worked out nicely already). Seems not interested in helping outside of class much.
This class was very boring because the prof went exactly word for word from the textbook! The textbook was excellent.  Overall not a bad course. Overall she gets a B
Good professor. This class is no cakewalk and is a LOT of work, but she gives you chances to do rewrites with your group. If you stay on top of assignments and communicate with her, you will be fine.

Set up of class: Quizzes weekly or assignments. Grades assignments months later. Gets back to emails within 3 days-ish. Pretty simple class, but grades tough and criteria for assignments is not always clear because she takes points off for things she did not specify about. Overall, pretty easy & interesting, professor is knowledgeable on subject.
