Dr. Stansberry is incredibly knowledgeable and passionate about media, which is obvious in her lectures and reading selections. There are a few different papers and projects which she outlines in detail and goes over in class. She really cares about her students and is always available to meet with them or give them feedback. I'd take her again!

I wish she would've updated grades more often. I really thought I was going to be receiving an A in this class and ended up being less than one percent away from that. I also don't like that attendance is mandatory but I guess since the class is pretty straightforward you need to get kids to class somehow.

Dr. Stansberry has become one of my favorite professors at Cleveland State. Her lectures are engaging, she's very funny and knowledgeable about social media, the web etc. She seems to be stand-offish at times, but she means well. She is available for extra help and gives good feedback.

I loved this class. Dr. Stansberry is passionate about social media and new technologies. Lectures were interesting and included a lot of real world examples. No textbook but lots of readings on Blackboard. Sometimes slow to give assignments back but provides lots of feedback and is very accessible. One of the best professors at CSU.

I've had three classes with him, and in each class it was always a very enjoyable experience. He loves what he teaches, he's good at giving feedback, and he wants every student to pass. Veeery generous grader. I'm honestly going to miss him.

I've had three classes with him, and in each class it was always a very enjoyable experience. He loves what he teaches, he's good at giving feedback, and he wants every student to pass. Veeery generous grader. I'm honestly going to miss him.
Quizzes are all online. Book is online. Lecture is just to go over the chapters in the book.
He can be unclear and obtuse about guidelines for papers and worksheets. Also, his midterm had incredibly detailed questions. Very tough grader.

I had Dr. Stanziano for music theory I&II. He's a great guy who really connected with the class. Moves at a fast pace but is always willing to take questions and is always very patient with students who don't understand. Overall great experience and I am planning on taking a third class with him this summer.

Dr Stanziano is very particular about answers he wants for an assignment. For example, he once asked the instrumentation of a specific piece was, and I answered 'a capella', but he marked it wrong and wrote men's voices as correct answer. He isn't very clear and tests(midterm&final) are difficult, you don't know what to expect

Awesome nice easy going professor.  He loves what he teaches.  Gives interesting extra credit assignments and is a very fair grader. He plays music a lot in class then will give "listening tests", in which you listen to a clip from a song and answer a few questions on it.  If you can name the composer or name of song, you get xtra credit on test.
Great guy, awesome class. Always kept me interested with his mix of movies and music. Overall the class was easy, but I actually came in excited to learn everyday.

Great Professor.He knows his stuff.Extra Credit is awesome.He is very considerate and he respect the fact that emergencies do happen unexpectdly.If your not going to make it to class,email him and let him know whats going on.Great Guy
Great professor. One of the nicest guys around. Keeps you interested with a mix of movies, instruments, and class discussion. Loved the class.

Very intersting class, little clarity though.Having many professionals come discuss what they do, did little for me in understanding the housing collapse, financing possibilities, and the organizational structure of housing decisions. Dual taught course- harsh grading- complicated instructions. I am a great student, read but outside research too.

Dr. Stead is very specific in his expectations of his students. Brush up on your stats, as you will be utilizing it in this class. Participation within group discussions is highly recommended. No question is a dumb question in his class. He's very supportive of his students and will help you to understand the contents of the course.
If you think you can't do stats, Dr. Stead will prove to you that you can. Very clear and makes sure you know what's going to happen on a test. Goes out of his way to be helpful. Great professor.
Dr. Stead was extremely clear in presenting material. He makes very complex material really accessible.  Great teacher.

If you care about broadening your knowledge of Econ, or your grades in general, avoid this professor at all costs. Instead, choose a professor known for their merit, and not able to continue teaching because of tenure. Repeats lectures: constantly. Tests based on material completely different from lectures. Take any other professor possible.

Professor Stein makes what should be an easier course, relatively hard. Despite others saying that it's easy to get an A in his course, it is not! Or maybe he has changed his teaching style. Grade is based off of only 3 exams. Nothing is posted on blackboard. He does give study guides, but only a few questions are taken from them. Learned nothing.

Does not use blackboard or powerpoint, just lectures out loud. Notes were done on a typewriter, no earlier than 1995 and emailed to you as a 1998 adobe pdf. Don't get the textbook. Doesn't yell at you for using your phone, and that is the only plus.

God help us all.   You won't learn much beyond ECN 201. Can skip most classes. If you do decide to go to class, bring a book, laptop, or tablet so you have something to do while he repeats the same lecture he has given for the past 2 weeks. Don't buy the book. Curves ridiculously. Easy A.

I think the best way to say it is that he's past his prime. At one point he was probably a great professor, but now he often seems confused and uninterested. He'll often repeat the same lecture three or four times, sometimes even more. A very unclear syllabus makes it tough to tell when anything is happening. Nice guy though, tests arent bad at all

Boring class, 70% of class skips or leaves after the first 10 minutes. has "Homeworks" that are not graded, but the test questions are the same as those of the "homeworks". Emails out the answer keys a week before the test. No one actually pays attention to him, but he seems like a nice guy.
Want an easy A? take him.... Basically a study hall

His class is very boring, and most people skip. He will repeat the exact same lesson every class for at least 2 weeks, and most people don't know what's going on. It is an easy class though; he will send study guides to your student email and go over all the answers in class, and the exam usually looks very similar to the study guide.

Seriously one of the worst classes I've ever taken. Easy AB if he teaches you correctly, but it's such a waste of time. He teaches the same lesson two weeks in a row, and no one in the class ever knows what's going on. He seems nice, he's just confusing. He should've retired years ago. I'm an honor's student and I can't tell you much I've learned.

Honestly one of the worst professors I've had in college. Granted, there was no homework, but your sole grade was based off of in class test. The study guides were hand written and barely legible at all. Did not explain material at all, and grading just did not make sense. Very boring lectures, and very boring voice.

He is a very nice professor, you can tell he is passionate about economics, which I respect, but his teaching is not the greatest. I didn't really learn anything, even though I went to every class. Study guides weren't given in a timely matter, if at all and when they were they had many wrong answers.  Very repetitive lectures.

This class was awful! It was an 8 week class and he literally taught the exact same lesson for 2 weeks straight. He never used the textbook, used out-dated terminology and can rarely ever answer your questions. Unless his class is your only option, don't take it.

What can i say besides he's old.. the class is very easy and you practially dont have to come to class to pass the book is useless theres take home test you only have to show up for midterms and finals my advice if you want an easy A take him if you want  to learn concepts find someone eles

Does not use the text at all.  Will just email you notes which are unreadable.  He just seems to teach the same thing day after day.  The quizzes will be based on the notes and will be take home.  The Midterm will have questions from the quizzes.  Need to make sure you watch the wording on his questions because they are tricky.

If you do the quizzes like he says you'll do well on the tests, however there are quite a few questions that aren't included on the tests. Never use the text, and he just repeats the same thing over and over. We learned about the same thing for a month.
Easiest professor I have ever had. Your grade is made up of 2 tests that he gives you the answers to prior to the exam. Memorize and get your A.

Prof. Stein has mastered the art of repetition!  However, within what seems like the same lecture over and over you somehow get through the texts for 201 and 301 in their entirety. His grading scale for your final grade optimizes your chance for a great grade. For example, ace the final and you ace the class.

He is so boring. When we go over quizzes I don't understand him at all. I stopped going to class and I still passed. The quizzes are exactly the test so study those and you'll pas the tests no problem.

Very nice man, very good professor. I am in his ECN 201 class now and I love it. He seems very fair and he makes a lot of sports references in his examples. Nice sense of humor. The only way you could do badly in this class is if you do absolutely no work.

Excellent professor! Yes, as people say here he repeats his lectures, but he does it until everybody in class understands the material, so after finishing his class you really know something. I highly recommend his class.

I have had Diane for a few classes. They were definitely tough, but we ended up having great discussions about actual philosophy. Some classes were definitely a bit dry if students don't participate. She expects a lot out of the students which is what a good professor does. She is also very sweet and understanding.

online group assignments  bad idea. This class is definitely a GPA ruiner, way too hard for a 100-level course. This class requires a lot of time and effort, I don't think this kind of information can be taught online. The assignments are confusing and long, the exams are difficult. I highly recommend taking something else to fulfill GERs.

She put evertything together well.  There were 27 units, 27 homeworks, 6 long exams.  It was the hardest class I've taken to date,almost too hard for an online course.  If it were offered as an in-person class it would have been more bearable. Working with groups online in next to impossible, some people are flakes.  I learned alot.
Not a bad teacher overall, seems to have difficulty putting thoughts together sometimes. oh word..."Um" if you've had her you know what I mean.

Do not take this class unless you love high school busy work, little to no instruction regarding essay assignments, and useless readings and lengthy quizzes on a regular basis. This class really makes me question the quality of a CSU education.

She is the nicest person I have ever meet. She really wants us to suceed. Only for papers to write and gives you the opportunity to rewrite them if you are not satisfied with the grade.  The quizes she does are open book as well.  Take her if you have the chance she is a great english teacher.

He is such an adorable old man like how can you not love him? The class was easy and he is so caring and cute. But I only took the class because I had to for Gen ed. The material is all easy (tests,quizes, HW). Low score because he's just not a very good teacher.

Funny. Decent lecturer, but the textbook is so  well written that it's a lot easier to learn the concepts from the book in 20 minutes than to go to class for 50 minutes or more to learn the same thing. He teaches you cool graphic calculator tricks. Tests are basically, "Do you know how to use a graphing calculator and can you do basic algebra 2?"

PLEASE do not take this professor. He doesnt explain well, gives too many examples of problems when theres only 10 questions on a test worth 10 points each. He will often skip how to do problems that are in the hw and on the test due to time. Many students did not pass this dumb class. ps: He takes attendance.

If you have trouble with math and it does not come easy to you, prepare to work very hard because Stevens does not really "teach" constantly confused with problems, and not helpful. He's definitely past his prime in teaching.

Absolutely the worst teacher in my entire educational career, I have never seen a math teacher do so many problems incorrectly and have the students correct him. If this guy doesn't have his sheet with all the work on it while doing the problem, it is an almost guarantee that it will be incorrect. There's no way for the students to learn correctly

Like most people said, he gets confused and gets problems wrong while teaching. Then other students correct him. It's kinda funny though. He does teach you how to solve problems with the calculator so that's nice.

Nice guy, sometimes forgets how to do the math and students correct him (funny/confusing). Overall, if you attend class and get involved, you'll be fine. The grade in this class is a reflection of the student's attendance and willingness to put forth proper efforts. Don't bother with a textbook though....

Mr. Stevens was a nice guy. However, he tends to forget to explain exactly what he's doing as he solves problems. I did well in the class, but that's only because I've taken calculus before. If I was actually learning it from scratch it would have been much tougher. Wasn't very consistent b/w the HW, tests, and notes.

Didn't check homework much, and I only got a good grade because the material was easy. If you don't know what you're doing get help from someone else because hes not very helpful. He uses a lot of group work in class.
Really has no clue what he's talking about. Makes LOTS of errors while attempting to teach. Tries to make the tests harder then they need to be.

I wouldn't recommend anyone to take him. He wasn't good at explaining things and he just expected to you to understand without any explanations as to why on anything. I came to class everyday, sat in the front row, and used my book to follow along and still didn't understand what he was teaching. Overall, take someone else!
I like Mr. Stevens. His lecture is boring and sometimes I don't understand what he is trying to explain. So I did something that many college kids don't do, I opened the book and read it.
J. Gill is the man. He frowns upon habitual class skipping though (I know), so attend class, you'll enjoy it and keep on his good side.

Wow, what's with all the hate for Mr. Stevens? He was one of my best math profs at CSU. Sure the lectures can be boring, but he goes over the homework everyday and tells you exactly what is on the test. Plus he lets you retake the tests if you do bad and use your notes. He's really a good guy and I'd recommend him to anyone.

Honestly, he is not bad. Tells corny jokes, a few funny stories. Homework will help you a lot with this class. Tests are open note.  Tries his best to answer questions clearly but can get confused sometimes. Not a bad guy.

He would get something wrong on a test and we would correct him...but he still wouldn't give half the class that got the real answer right points. This happened on each test, he is very stubborn. He talks in circles too and tells dumb, useless stories. I got an A in the course by doing a lot of problems from the textbook.

I did not choose him at all but the original teacher was sick so that I had to have him. He is too terrible and I attended his class painfully and faced his unfair grading every times. He gave very much and difficult exams and also he is a difficult teacher.  Very bad.

He is NOT professional.  He needed me to give him the idea of bring a red pen to grade.  He even used the same color of my pen to grade.  When I reminded him, he even implied me as a tough student.  Why did not he think himself a bad, non-professional teacher?

HORRIBLE teacher - a disgrace to CSU.  Assigns homework and refuses to go over it.  DOES NOT answer questions.  Completely incompetant.  Honestly, I'm not sure why he's still teaching and why no one has done something about him,

His problems:way of doing & saying. He certainly said no to me, but after my trying to get rid of the unfair, wishing to be in normal, now he changed the scale because he now knows his expectation is too high that no one met. I could do exams alright as I did before and it's only his many Qs in exam all we agree but no one tell him & that's how har

This was a WAC course so there is naturally a lot of writing. She gives you plenty enough time to get a research paper completed. Overall Dr. Stevens is an excellent professor who is truly passionate about teaching and seeing her students not only succeed but excel. I 10/10 recommend anyone taking her. She challenges you to think outside the box.

This was a WAC course so there is naturally a lot of writing. She gives you plenty enough time to get a research paper completed. Overall Dr. Stevens is an excellent professor who is truly passionate about teaching and seeing her students not only succeed but excel. I 10/10 recommend anyone taking her. She challenges you to think outside the box.
Lots of class discussions/Group work. Lots of online homework and tests. A final presentation that isn't too hard if you use time wisely. Great teacher overall, very smart and good person.

A very caring professor who brings a lot of real world experience to class. She is very kind and brought in speakers to break-up the monotony of the class. Dr. Stevens cares for the well-being of her students in and outside of her class. She will give advice for other classes and career/major choices.

Made class overly difficult. Got off topic and took too much time to explain material so we covered 9 out of the 13 chapters we were supposed to. This class is mandatory for BUS majors and it's not fair when he can't teach it well. Our class finished mostly with C's,D's, and F's even w/ his curve. Read the book. EC for attendance. Not Recommended.

As of right now my entire class has D's and F's and one person has a B. No extra credit, no homework, no curve, and the lecture is pointless. I really don't like the way he teaches. It seems like he wants you to struggle. Better off just reading the book honestly. I'd avoid him and I'm a 3.2 junior/senior.

Dr. Stewart is not a bad guy, but not the best professor. In an upper level class, he gave one A, one B and everyone else got Cs. I went to office hours several times throughout the semester and was ranked no lower than top 5 and got a C+. He doesn't describe things clearly. If you don't already understand basic econ principles, stay away from him!

If you don't mind reading, you won't have any problems.  Based upon this, you will find that the quizzes and final exam are not at all difficult.  Professor is very pleasant and willing to help those who need it.  Overall, I really enjoyed this class.

Great professor. Make sure you read the book. Anyone who complains about this teacher is not willing to put in the work in order to get the grade. Read the book and get an A in the class. The final is cumulative, but if you have read throughout the semester and review the quizzes you will be fine.

If you want to get a high hrade in this class you HAVE to tead the book!!! The professor explains the subject very well and yes other reviews are correct,  Most lectures are based in graphs but there are no graphs on the quizzes or the final. If the professor did not present graphs he would not be able to lecture - so stop complaining. Quizzes and the final, are based on the book. The book is very easy to read and understand. The final was harder than expected, understand the concepts & quizzes.

Just spend time reading the book! He will draw a lot of graphs with a lot of lines, but do not bother trying to understand them. Going over the graphs in the book will help so much more! Exams are over material from book not on drawing graphs! He also gets upset with his students easily if they do not fully get the material.

THE most awful teacher I have ever had. He is a grumpy old man who yells at students when they dont answer his questions correctly. Material is boring and difficult and he refuses to use numbers. Grade is based solely on a cumulative final & 4 quizzes. Grading scale is more lenient but passing is still very difficult.

Horrible Prof! Do not take him! He is mean and his tests are based on nothing he talked about during class. I had to withdraw to save my gpa. Take M. Henry for Econ instead, better person and easier to understand.

Tests were on stuff not covered in class. Was told to study certain things for final exam, not even 1/4 of them were on the exam. I'm sure more than half the class failed. This man trying to explain economics to students is like trying to explain the colors of a rainbow to a blind man

This class sucked. I failed miserably and so did the rest of the class. He did not quiz on what he taught, and he never explained anything clearly. I did not expect it to be an easy class, but I never expected it to be this hard.

If can't read on your own,don't take this class.He will explained all graphs but the 15 Questions of the test have no relationship with class discussions. His answers are very treaky, lots of people failed or scored D. I passed though but You better read very well.

Stay away from this teacher, he is by far the worst teacher i have ever had. The material he teaches in class is useless, and he does not know how to explain anything. 50 % OF THE CLASS FAILED.. stay away!

I love economics; usually very easily understand it. this professor made it very hard to learn. He was confusing. Maybe he was once a good teacher but perhaps because he's tenured/retired, he isn't anymore. Tests were on stuff we never learned. Not only did many people not learn what they wanted to learn but out of 30+ students only 2 As and 1 B
awful.

if you want to maintain a gpa do not take.  there were only 2 A's and 5 C's in the class.  You can pass with a D (but would u want to?).  He is a nice person and will spend time with you at his office.  Take the time to read and come with questions. quizzes are just 15 questions!Look over the powerpoints and online quizzes or your sunk!
20 Fs, 15 Ds, 9 Cs, 3 Bs, and 3 As...Stay away!

I agree with the comment a couple down from this.  Prof. Stewart separates the herd.  He's a great teacher.  Quality students flourish in his classes - I took him 3 times and got 3 A's.  College isn't about study guides with all the answers - and I guess that's what differentiated me from the C students! Take Prof. Stewart for the challenge!

Not one student got an A in this class. More students failed then passed. Extremely hard, worthless professor. Don't even bother going to class. For a useless 3 extra points. Tests are over NOTHING he covers in class.

Stewart is a tough professor. Extremely hard tests. Yes it is true everything he does in class is graphs and pointless. None of it is on the test. NO reason to go to class, but takes attendance:(. I'm praying he at least gives out c's to students who show up, and try in class everyday... Thats what I'm riding on... Almost everyone failed first test

Awesome Professor who is there to genuinely make a difference in students learning. He is very fair and easy to communicate with. As long as you show up for class and pay attention you will do well. Prof. Stewart goes above and beyond to help his students.
Great class. The book was an easy read and highly interesting. He is quick to respond to emails. Three quizzes with multiple choice and true/false. Weekly discussions required.

Overall good professor, as he typically gets back to students quickly and clearly.  75 percent of the grade is based on three exams, which makes it stressful.  Exams arent too bad if you put the time in to study the  material.  Read the chapters several times thoroughly and do all the discussion questions and you will likely get a good grade.
Great professor. Was readily available for questions and concerns. Material was simple and easy to understand. Thoroughly enjoyed this class.
Carmine knows her materials and knows how to teach it.

I took an online course from Dr. Stewart. I found the expectations to be extremely clear from the start. She outlines everything that you need to turn in on the syllabus. The rubrics for the papers are concise and clear. At times she lagged on the grading BUT the assignments were clear cut and as long as you did it, you would get full credit.

Expectations can be unclear but I received perfects on all assignments. Discussions posts for the text & assigned articles, midterm essay and final essay are the only assignments.  Never updated grades; very annoying.

She was unreliable and would seldom respond to emails. Expectations were unclear at times, too, which was extremely difficult to deal with considering this was an online course. Grades were only updated about three times during the semester - another difficult thing to deal with when taking an online class. The textbook is really unnecessary, too.

I'm really interested in the area of abnormal psych but my experience with her soured things. Did the assigned readings, but still found several questions on her quizzes that weren't based on material covered in the text (couldn't even locate material that was close). Tried to object to her grading on these items and she wouldn't budge. Don't take!
Graded very unfairly. WOULD NOT RECOMMEND THIS PROFESSOR AT ALL!
She's a very nice person, but very rarely gives feedback and when she does it is generic and not very helpful. I'm very disappointed with this class.

Dr. Doane is the best and she wants you to learn the material.  For life.  Not just for a test.  She values the information that she's teaching and knows that she's filling up your toolbox.  Her presentation and expectations are clear, assignment were well defined, and with an expected amount of effort a good grade is absolutely possible.

She was absolutely wonderful. She's so sweet and kind and caring. She really wants everyone to get an A or at least pass. The exams are all short answer, and as long as you understand the concept - they are very simple exams!! I want her to be my permanent professor for everything..she's that great. If she is teaching any course - TAKE IT.

Absolutely adore this teacher. It's not an easy A, but if you work hard and put forth effort, she is an easy grader. Just make sure you have a good idea of what you're talking about. She's very clear for her expectations, and there are three main tests through the semester. No comprehensive final. Use both textbooks pretty heavily.

AWESOME professor! So knowledgeable and is very helpful, if you ask. You definitely have to keep up with work in this class, but if you can set aside 2-3 hours a week for this, you'll definitely do fine. Easy grader and very interesting material! Take this with her!
over the top challenging
I felt the professor was organized and clear on expectations.  I enjoyed the class.  Lots of discussion board assignments.  Tests were multiple choice/essay.  Would recommend this class.

The pace was steady and the workload was reasonable throughout most of the semester.  Assignments are not very difficult, even just skimming the chapters are enough for the most part. Very interesting material, so reading isn't even a drag most of the time.  You only have to do ten out of fifteen assignments, so that helps out a lot!
The worst classroom atmosphere I have ever experienced. I would never recommend this professor to anyone.
No Comments

This prof has been amazing. Creates great lecture videos and is always available to meet. She answers questions quickly and really cares about her students and their success. Loved this class and would take again. Highly recommend her if you have to take this class! Not a lot of assignments either, but a lot of material is covered.

This prof has been amazing. Creates great lecture videos and is always available to meet. She answers questions quickly and really cares about her students and their success. Loved this class and would take again. Highly recommend her if you have to take this class! Not a lot of assignments either, but a lot of material is covered.

I took this class online. There was a lot of material, but not a lot of work. There was about 10 assignments all semester, but there is a lot of material for each chapter. Just break it up and it is not too bad. A few quizzes, case study, and discussions. I recommend this class!

Dr. Dare is an educated, caring, and great professor overall. She is quite strict when it comes to work and class, but that is what you should expect at the Master's level. This class just required you to follow the power points, small easy tasks in between, one paper, and a final. It was quite a simple class.
I loved this class. She is a very kind teacher and the information is very interesting.

If you're looking for an easy "A," this is not the professor for you.  This professor is hard, but fair.  She makes you work, that's for sure.  But you will learn from her if you put forth the time and effort.  She is straightforward.  She will critique your work, but that's what a good teacher does.  Professors like her can be hard to come by!

i was afraid to take this class online, because of the negative things people have said about this professor.  However, I have her class now  online, and she is an awesome professor.  I would take classes with this professor over and over, if I could.  Easy A.
This is one person who has a PHD in social work and her major should have been in another area besides an area that deals with people. She is so out of touch with individuals needs.
Dare is a great teacher. she may have a lot of work for you to do, but she is very helpful if you give her your drafts.

Very Boring!!! Her class is long, dry and very demanding. I took the 10 week course in the summer that only met once a week and she attempted to pack so much info into one session. It was over whelming. So I?m planning on taking the course this fall with a different prof.
Never took her class, but she is a fantastic next door neighbor! Really terrific lady!
Sometimes she was helpful, other times not. I still wound up getting my B.A.
A complete joke, sets students up for failure, huge liar,very insulting to students

More interested in her side businesses than in actually teaching students.  Spent more time talking about herself than course material.  Very rude and occasionally insulting to students.  I can't even think of one specific thing she taught us all semester.

Dr. Stoll is one of the best prof. at CSU. He presents materials with lots of examples from the real world. He knows a lot of stuff and loves supply chain! His exams are easy as he gives you the study guide! This guy made me kinda interested in learning about supply chain, take with him, highly recommended!
Dr. Stoll was very helpful. I would recommend.

Dr. Stoll is an easy going prof and very accommodating. His explanation of the material is clear and straightforward, he cuts out unnecessary things and lets you know exactly what will be on exams with his study guides. He's really nice and is always willing to help. Highly recommended!

I would highly recommend taking Dr. Stoll.  He is great at incorporating real world companies into the concepts used in class.  Definitely utilize the study guide he provides and you will do good.  I enjoyed his class

Dr. Stoll is extremely helpful and extremely nice.  He is genuinely concerned for his students and really loves supply chain.  He gives study guides that are identical to his exams.  I would take him again.

Dr. Stoll is an excellent professor and I would highly recommend his course.  He is concerned about students and their understanding of the material.  He was able to communicate the material and provide real life examples to further explain the theories and concepts.  Dr. Stoll?s business experience is an advantage to students and enhanced the lear
Material can be difficult but he explains in a clear and concise manner. Prepares students well for exams and grades fairly. If you used the study guide to prepare for exams you will do well.

Very knowledgeable, brings a lot of real world examples to class. We took a plant tour of the Plain Dealer that was really interesting and he related it well to our class. Dr. Stoll is very respectful of students and a nice person all around.

Class is a breeze. Textbook use is limited; necessary for exams. You have two exams, mid-term and final. Also, there is a paper and presentation. Some of the chapters repeat. The final is all multiple-choice. Prof. is accessible by office hours and email.
This guy is a great professor. Extremely helpful and brings real world examples.  I am at the end of my MBA and he was the best professor I have had so far.  Highly recommend!
Fantastic guy. Really didn't care about the subject material going in, left with a high degree of interest including future career choices.

He missed three classes already so is making up for it by covering 3 chapters per lecture. Incredibly boring. His tests which are MC are very confusing. But his grading is lenient and he well mannered and very polite. He is definitely knowledgeable.

I took Dr. Stone as a CCP student in highschool, and I must say he made my experience with calculus 2 an absolute dream. He is not a professor who constantly goofs around, but he also isn't a nose to the grindstone type of guy either. He is the perfect balance of work and play and he has a goofy personality that just shimmers. Take him if you can.

I took Dr. Stone as a CCP student in highschool, and I must say he made my experience with calculus 2 an absolute dream. He is not a professor who constantly goofs around, but he also isn't a nose to the grindstone type of guy either. He is the perfect balance of work and play and he has a goofy personality that just shimmers. Take him if you can.

He does not care about students!!!! Often times makes you feel bad when you come to him for help and will just direct you to other resources instead (i.e. Math center). Extremely rude to students, especially those with heavy accents he cannot understand. Would never take him again. Clearly doesn't care about students at all.

Had him over the summer for discrete math. He canceled class 7 of the 24 meetings because he was moving and did not have time to post lectures on those days. He then decided to record and post them all in the last few days before the semester ended while we had a project and homework due as well as a test. Know material, but very inconsiderate.

Dr. Stone is an excellent professor. He takes a unique approach to teaching and puts forth the effort to ensure his students succeed. Naturally, business calc is not the easiest class in the world. Nature of the class, not due to Dr. Stone's teaching. 10/10 recommend taking him
Jason was by far the best professor I have had at CSU. He cares about your grade and wants to see you succeed. His lectures are extremely helpful and it is easy to get an A! Lots of extra credit!!
Terrible

The best math teacher ever! He made calculus such a fun class. He teaches everything so clearly and does every problem step-by-step. He spends enough time on each chapter and makes sure that everybody understands the content.

To be honest, Im a good person at math and I can say that this is the easiest math professor I have ever had. He conveys the material in a smooth way and gives very easy tests focusing on the short, simple problems not the long, difficult ones. Dont hesitate and miss the chance to pass his class with flying birds.

He is a caring professor, if you don't understand the material he is willing to help you. He gives partial credit on incorrect problems if you showed your process and occasionally he assigns extra credit or have bonus problems on the test. A very understanding professor, if I could I would take him again.
Really good teacher. Takes complicated material and makes it super comprehensible. He makes sure everyone gets the material and will go back over things to make sure you do. Very fair grader as well.

The most amazing math professor I've ever had! I'm tempted to get a math minor just to take more classes with Jason. He's awesome! I understand discrete so well now and he makes sure you understand each step of the way. Tests aren't challenging as long as you go to the Math Learning Center!

Dr. Stone is easily the best math professor CSU has to offer. He makes a very boring math subject area (discrete) and makes it fun and interactive. His study guides are exact copies of what to expect on the test, and he offers about 30 points of extra credit. Ended up with a 105% in the class! Great guy!

Dr. Jason Stone, he is a gift from God to the math world. I have terrible add and think shiny things are great, but Jason reels me into topics every day with exciting and applicable topics to me major. He is inspiring and always works to get the best out of his students. I urge you to show up for class for he is by FAR the best. #blessed4life

Jason Stone is one of the best math professors I ever had my entire academic life. He cares about his students succeeding in his class. His teaching style is awesome he makes math fun to learn and keeps his students engaged at all times. Thank you Jason for a great semester!

Not enough characters to describe how AWESOME Jason is. I have had him for four semesters straight and he is phenomenal in all measurables. The man can make 50 minutes feel like two and make you want to become a math major. Super easy to learn from as well. The biggest mistake you will make in college is not taking his class if you have the chance.

Jason Stone is one of the best mathematics teachers I have ever had. He cares about the material and conveys it to the students so well. It's not the stereotypical math class where it can be boring and the teacher is a snore fest. Class is engaging and worthwhile. If you skip class with him as a teacher, you are doing yourself a disservice.

He was a very spontaneous and wonderful professor. I was scared originally when i started my first semester at college but my entire view was turned upside down. Math suddenly became something fun with this professor and i finally was able to understand things that i could not comprehend before. I really enjoyed this class and this professor
Worst professor I've ever had!! Stay away!

This guy is hilarious. You end up learning without even realizing it and if you don't get something, he won't stop until you do. He's a very intelligent guy too but knows how to dumb down the materal where even a monkey could learn it. You have no excuse for gettting anything les than a B- in this class. I wish I had him for all my math classes!
He's an amazing great teacher!

Absolutely recommend! She took a class that is supposed to be challenging, and made it easy to understand and get through. She adds to the slides by making them easier to understand, her tests are more than fair (and curved), and homework solutions are given to you after five attempts. What's not to love?

Amazing professor. I had her at 8am twice a week and she was always energetic and enthusiastic for class. She really cared about her students and had wanted them to do well. Gave partial credit on tests. Would answer any questions from homework during lectures. She loved using visual aids which helped a lot
Great professor really kind. Best physics professor possible. Will probably show up on your schedule as CSU staff
best physics prof i had period.
Super enthusiastic and eager to help! Very clear construction.
Terrible. Gives out too much work. Tough grader. Never in his office. Mean and cocky. DO NOT TAKE

He gave very little feedback, was hard to track down if you needed help, and gave way too much work. It was impossible to finish the work in a reasonable amount of time. You either had to pull all-nighters for every homework assignment, or accept that you wouldn't finish and therefore get bad HW grades.
Awful lab head, grades are arbitrary, and way too much work for what it is

The typical week entails a 5h 40min class time. 4h working on lab report. 4h homework. 45min test/quiz corrections. Dr. S will also slip in labs that one must come in outside of class to do (alot for E&M). Dr. S is quite inconsiderate of the work load and can't be relied upon to be found for help during office hours. Teaches how to use equations...
AMAZING professor, does everything to help his students.  Very approachable, nic guy.  Would recommend the class, it requires a lot of work and studying though.  Good luck!

Very helpful, really cares about teaching all the material to his students. Labs are pointless and there's a lot of statistics stuff in the honors labs that have nothing to do with physics. Didn't write the labs, lectures, homeworks, or tests for the class, which is kinda annoying.

One of the best professors in Physics dept. He teaches really really well. If u take his class,u will definitely learn Physics, thats for sure. The class is not that tough if u ask me, but u must have an indept knowledge of Physics and Calculus for it, or else u r gone. Coursework is a little tough compared to 243,but after all its an Honors class!

OUTSTANDING!  Dr. Streletzky goes above and beyond to help his students comprehend a difficult subject, and even to enjoy it.  The honors sequence is extremely challenging, but definitely worth the amount of time.  I became a Physics major after these classes!

This has got to be the coolest prof at CSU. His class requires a ridiculous amount of work, but if you do it, and make a good ffort, you will have no problem passing his class. He is extremely helpful, and he is available for help all the time. He will definitely make you love physics. He is also very fun, funny, and nice.

When you take this class with Dr. K, you will learn Modern Physics well.  However, students must be willing and able to put forth a great deal of effort.  Dr. K is generally very helpful and repeats important concepts.  He's also a bit more down to earth than he first lets on.
No Comments

In Summer 2006 every at 12:00 lab, the teacher teaching since the second week speaks non-English in the lab, so as other TAs.  I didn't know what they were talking about.  The teacher just looked very proud of himself and Lab manuals were bad written.  Don't know who wrote that bad garbage.  Who is the lab manager who makes the weird policies?

Reads straight from the book.  Tests and grading are fair.  He is very willing to help the students and one of the cool teachers who doesn't make you memorize the formulas!  Goes over homework problems and gives examples to help in understanding the formulas and problems.

Dr. Stubblefield is definitely a challenging professor. She goes through ALOT of material in a very short period of time. But she teaches the course at a graduate level and pushes you to understand further concepts then what she is teaching. Be ready to study but such a rewarding class once you've put the effort into it.

Demanding!!!  Does not know how to teach and just reads through her power points.  Asks you to apply what you have learned to real life examples??? How can you apply something when she does not teach anything.  Basically a teach yourself kind of course.  Either take this class online or take a different professor.
He is one of the best professors at CSU. He makes the material easy to understand.  I wish he taught every chemistry course

Dr. Su is an excellent instructor. Like others have said, his lectures are clear and interspersed with humor. Exams are very thorough, but fair. I would gladly take him again for another Chemistry course.

Previously took Organic Chem at CWRU and hated the subject, passionately. Professor Su 100% changed my outlook on this subject. Made the course understandable, accessible, and even quite pleasant for the class. Accent is heavy, but after a few classes easily understandable. Go to class, do as many practice problems in the txtbk, you will get an A.

Taught me Pharmacology 1-2 for 2012-2013. By far best professor. Learned so much and he is very nice and cares. May seem intimidating but just attend class, follow notes and make sure to pre-read before you come to class. You will get A for sure. Thank you professor. Finally got a chance to write on here!

He is very intelligent and very enthusiastic in teaching. the ACS is kind of rough, because I just took it today. Believe it, you gotta study a lot :D but overall, i enjoyed being in his class. Accent doesn't matter, it matters that Dr Su makes O-Chem really fun, and we all need it!...Practice chapters' problems and you'll be fine in quizzes.

Once you get past the accent he is an excellent teacher. He is funny and really knows his stuff! I liked when he would relate what we learned to things in real life, like cancer or medications. It really made the topics seem less abstract. He was also very funny, he made it exciting.

The Best.  The guy lectures without notes.  Takes a couple of days to get used to the accent, but he makes fun of himself and the subject matter.  How many Organic Chemistry professors can make you laugh?  Probably just this one.  Makes a painful subject go down easy.

Very knowledgeable guy. Even though his accent was hard to understand but he made the interesting (hard to zzzz off). He broke down hard concepts into easy one for the class to comprehend.He very well prepare you for the ACS. I wished he would have given us 3rd test so that way I was 100% prepare for ACS. Anyway, highly recommended professor

Very knowledgeable guy. Even though his accent was not perfect but he made the class very interesting (hard to zzzz off). He broke down hard concepts into easy one for the class to comprehend. He was very well prepare you for the ACS. I wished he would have given us 3rd test so that way I was 100% prepare for ACS.Anyway, highly recommended professo
Tough subject but he made it interesting and fun. He really understands where students are coming from and really tries to help his students out. He is also hilarious without intending to be.

I took him for Pharmacology. His accent is hard to understand at first, but if you attend classes all the time you will get used to it! breaks down all the information so that it is very easy to comprehend, very fun and helpful! I looked forward to every single class!

Really nice guy, very helpfull, makes organic chemistry looks like nothing really knows his stuff, allways there for his students. If you are regular to class you have to be really dumb to get even a B+ in class

Great professor. Somewhat hard to understand but is pretty easy. As long as you go to class and read the book you should be fine. As an added bonus he's really nice and unintentionally funny, which is great. I highly recommend him.

Real nice guy, makes organic looks like ABCD, accent can be hard to understand sometimes but if u go to the lectures regularly u haveto be really dumb to even get a B in the clas. DEFF RECOMEND TAKING HIM!
Has very strong chinese accent.  Good teacher.  Breaks down all information in easy to understand manner.

Dr. SU was a great anatomy lab teacher. This class is very intense and you have to constantly be studying but it's an interesting class and you will learn A LOT. She really helps students understand the material. She knows it's a hard subject so she's very understanding! You won't regret taking her!

Dr. SU was a great anatomy lab teacher. This class is very intense and you have to constantly be studying but it's an interesting class and you will learn A LOT. She really helps students understand the material. She knows it's a hard subject so she's very understanding! You won't regret taking her!

This is a very hard class but she is willing to spend time with you in order to succeed. Tells you what to expect on exams and quizzes. 4 exams worth 50 points and 8 quizzes. Lowest quizzes are dropped and there is a lot of extra credit. Dr. Su is a very caring and kind professor. I learned so much form this class.
She is the best teacher I ever had. She is always happy to help. She is more like a friend than a teacher . Take Anatomy with her and I bet you wont forget this class in future.

Initially enrolling in this class was intimidating because it is an advanced research writing class, but she will be there every step of the way. If you have questions email her and she will reply promptly. Make sure you continuously work on your final paper as it is very long! Do not wait last minute. Happy with grade after all hard work put in

Study and you'll be fine. tests are very fair and come directly from the notes. There are no surprises. she gives extra credit and plenty of people end up with A's. Four multiple choice tests and 10 quizzes. She drops the lowest quiz.

Dr. Su is a competent  knowledgeable anatomy prof. She is friendly  approachable.  Lectures are right from slides but I recommend knowing both slides  text to do well.  4 mult ch  exams, 8 online qzs.  Very little ex credit.  Tons to learn.  Spend time everyday on the matl or u will struggle. This is NOT an easy A course. U have been warned...

Dr. Su is a good teacher and very helpful when working with students. She does drag on in classes which can make it a bit boring but as long as you study your notes a little every day you will do fine. I do not suggest trying to cram however.

Dr. Su is fair. Exams are not difficult. However, you have to STUDY hard to do well in this class. Contrary to the last review, Dr. Su answers questions. We had 4 exams (50 multiple choice questions). 100 pts each exam. Final is not comprehensive. 9 online quizzes 10 pts each quiz. Opportunity for up to 20 pts for extra credit. Would take it  again

She is very knowledgable and cares about the field she is in. It doesn't seem like she likes to teach though and doesn't like to answer questions. A few of my friends and I have all had bad experiences asking her questions. She always gives a rude response and tries to make us feel inferior. I get it.. you're smart. But I have never taken anatomy!
She is extremely nice and helpful, if you don't understand something go see her she will be happy to help. Her test are very  hard but not impossible.

Essentially read straight from the powerpoints....and they weren't even her powerpoints.  Did not have enough knowledge of the subject matter to aid in learning.  I taught myself.  I suggest taking it in the fall with the other professor.

I read the other reviews of dr adluri and was nervous. they are completely wrong or treated her wrong. all she asks is for you to participate and do the readings, if you share your opinion on them and talk with her then you are fine. the finals and midterms are direct and easy, she gave a good study guide. rel 274 is a real gem. she is too.
Not the easiest class. Makes you work for your grade. Lots of reading assignments, quizzes, and papers. But if you do the work and pay attention you shouldn't struggle. Very kind and professional.

Lots of reading, lots of writing, lots of Socratic seminars. Honestly, very little of the articles we read found their way onto the test. Hyper-focus on the three or four days she spends lecturing on concrete information before you start a new unit, and you'll be ready for the test. Be prepared to be interrupted frequently.

Four 2 page papers are given and 12 quizzes are given throughout the semester. You will have a mid-term and final as well as the things listed above. It sounds crazy until I found out the papers only required one source (The Book) and extra credit was given. Attendance is worth TWENTY PERCENT of your grade, which is worth the same amount as Final

Too much work for a 101 class. You have 4 papers in total 2 pages each, you have a midterm and final, and a quiz almost every week, sometimes a few. There are lots of readings. Attendance is worth 20% of your grade. Not helpful whatsoever, on one of my papers she highlighted a word and wrote "awkward." Easy to pass, you have to work for your grade.

There is a lot of reading but that's to be expected in college. She knows what she is talking about. it is sometimes difficult to keep up but she provides so much information. The quizzes are easy. She is a tough grader but it is nothing to worry about. Easy to pass as long as you are there and know whats going on. I love this Prof!!

If you have to take the course, don't take it with her. Professor Adluri will treat this course as if it's the only one you're taking. Lots and lots of homework. Oh and, she's super rude and disrespectful, when you're saying something during discussion she interrupts almost every time. Beware.

I had a terrible experience with this professor, although his great knowledge of the class. He knows the material but he is unable to explain it well when a student asks a question. His accent makes it a little hard to understand sometimes. You can fight extra points back on your exams if you feel he is wrong!

Although Dr. Suen can be intimidating at first, if you take the time to learn the material, he isn't that bad. I found Youtube lectures to help. The tests are fair and although he gives out a lot of quizzes, they normally involve just one question and don't hurt your grade too much. Plus, he does curve the class at the end.

Avoid Prof Suen. Insanely tough grader, I've at times had points taken off for a right answer. I pretty much had to self teach myself to scrape by in this class and get a C. Also, gives plenty of pop quizzes off of things he hardly describes during class. AVOID AVOID AVOID.
Hard class and he's difficult to understand. Not exactly the nicest guy either.

Really hard class. Other proffessors have multiple choice tests or open notes for this subject. You can get partial credit on tests, at least. There's a curve too, but if you're not incredibly good at math you will stuggle.
Quite possibly the worst professor I've had.  Very difficult to understand, and doesn't explain the material well at all. Oh, and he gives pop quizzes so you're pretty much held hostage.

I honestly think that Prof Suen's class was one of my favorite math classes at CSU. It is in no way an easy class (especially if you miss lectures) but his lessons and the homework help a lot. He's just a sweet old man who's really good at his job. If you're willing to work hard, you'll enjoy his class.

Always gives pop quizzes at least once a week so make sure you find his pattern and go those days. His tests are very hard and a lot of stuff he doesn't even discuss in class. Please try to find another professor and save yourself.

Besides giving  tough exams, Suen is that kind of instructors who enjoy hunting students mistakes in quizzes and tests. No matter how muck effort you put into solving a problem in a quiz or a test, he's still going to give you less than what you really deserve. Bottom line, this man doesn't believe in partial credits, so skip his class if you can.

Horrible teacher. I got an A in 181 and 182 (so clearly i am not that stupid). Almost everyone in class seems to get an F or D in midterms, he's a really tough grader.. and doesn't tell you what you did wrong in your exams. Also, i don't understand a single word he says!  Bottom line. DO NOT take this class (or any class) with this professor.

He just does the examples from the textbook. Homework has nothing to do with the  stuff you do in class. Tests are hard, puts in problems which he didn't solve in class. Gives quizzes in class, so make sure you don't miss his class. If a person is better in math basics, this class is for them. If you have an option of taking someone else, pls do.

He likes his examples. That seems to be all he does. No explanation or feeling if the class understands. To explain himself... Uses an example from the book. He does know what he's doing but is not good at answering questions. The reviews before tests are the only days everyone is in class and he basically gives the test questions. (not always..)

There is a substantial language barrier, but other than that he is an ok teacher. You ave to really pay attention, as all he does is example after example. He doesn't explain the hows and the whys, just formula after formula. He is strictly OK, like 510.

Hard to understand. He puts examples up and flies through them, no explanations. Every slide is  right out of the book. Hardly any class discussion.  Homework is not mandatory but you better do it if you want to pass and you need the book which costs about $200+. The tests are open notes open book though.

Professor Suen is super friendly and nice. If you go to class and pay attention to his reviews you will do well on the tests.  The only issue is that he can be hard to understand (thick accent), but i got used to it by the time the class was over. If people spent less time complaining and more time paying attention they might do better.

If you like the no talking, "just write on the chalkboard" type teaching, he's the guy you want! He shows the work and will answer your questions needed to pass exams. He's like a machine though so it can get pretty boring... But it is Calc. Just pay close attention and do a lot of practice problems and you'll do just fine.

Hes a great guy and a sweet teacher. He is difficult to understand and he cant always understand what you asking when asking a question. He does have a book in the class in which we are allowed to use on exams including the final. The book taught me more then he did but their is an SI leader in the class that is extremely helpful!

ABSOLUTELY TERRIBLE. Cannot understand him whatsoever.. you ask for help and he doesn't understand what you are saying..  I then asked him once if there was something I could do to raise my grade due to his horrific teaching and his exact words were "I don't know" I asked when tutoring was available he aso did not know.. worst teacher ever.

Professor Suen, despite being a really nice guy, should not be a professor.  As other ratings state, he doesn't teach.  He spoon-feeds you everything by showing you the steps to problems with no explanation. The homework is totally irrelevant to what we do in class and what we are expected to know for exams.
Very hard to understand.  Always has his back towards the class.  Does not teach just writes examples on the board and expects you to know them.  Does not know how to explain things.

Professor Suetta is awesome. He is easy to talk to, and he has a good sense of humor. His course was very easy to follow and complete. His assignments are clear and not overwhelming. He is also a good grader. I would highly recommend his courses because professor Sutta is one of the best professors I have ever had :)

Professor Suetta is awesome. He is easy to talk to, and he has a good sense of humor. His course was very easy to follow and complete. His assignments are clear and not overwhelming. He is also a good grader. I would highly recommend his courses because professor Sutta is one of the best professors I have ever had :)

Professor Suetta is probably the best educator I've had in my whole academic career. He taught skills that can be carried into any professional enviroment. He gave consistent feedback. He kept the class entertaining and interesting, but didn't make it a joke. The group work was great for networking, which he encouraged.

Great professor! Don't be put off by him at first, he really cares about students and wants them to pass. There were 3 projects, a resume and cover letter, a 3-page letter/memo, finally a 10-15 page group paper and 10 minute presentation. I ended up with a 97%, only because I did all the extra credit at the beginning. I learned a ton from the class

LOVED HIM! Super nice + truly wanted everyone to succeed. It was the one class I looked forward to going to because it was always a fun and relaxing environment. He is always available to help you with anything. He is a very easy going grader, I have never gotten below a B- on anything i've turned in! You have one group project which is super easy!

He is a tough grader and he makes you work for it but he is very funny and interesting and makes you want to go to class. He has no tolerance for rude or stupid stuff so as long as you keep your head down and do your work you will be fine. He is very strict on attendance and his grading is tough but he gives you many opportunities for extra credit.

One of my favorite professors. Is funny and caring. I thoroughly enjoyed going to his class. The things you learn in this class are valuable to you in real life. He provides all the material needed to succeed. Its up to you to use them to your advantage. Easy A if you do so. He's also very understanding and provides good feedback on assignments.
He's alright with a clear grading criteria, that's all

Professor Suetta is great! He genuinely wants his students to pass and gives them all the proper opportunities to do so. His course material is very useful for real life so I definitely learned a lot. He offers so much extra credit that it is very hard not to get a high B or A. He tends to have a sarcastic humor but it was fine.

Very clear in his expectations but seemed to get angry quickly. Teaches for the entire time, had extra credit opportunies, gave good feedback on papers. He was also very opinionated but never brought politics into the classroom (thank you).
Solid professor that provides a good understanding of the material. Make sure you don't skip class as the penalty for missed classes can be steep. Pay attention and you will most likely succeed.

Is a fine professor but has a very large temper. Gets mad when students ask questions to each other regardless of context and treated the class very rudely. Other than that the curriculum is well put together and the grading criteria isn't to taxing.

Clear expectation for assignments and provides detailed feedback. Attendance is important and tardiness is not acceptable. Fosters participation and group work. You will learn a lot of useful things in this class.

Unbelievably organized professor. He can seem very sarcastic and too straightforward sometimes but after a couple of classes, you find yourself sincerely laughing at his jokes. Don't play around, follow all prompts and you'll really enjoy your time in class. Also, he really knows how to rock those suits :)

He is a very good professor. The expectations are spelled our for you in the syllabus and grading rubrics. Go to class, engage and do the assignments to completion based on his expectations. Great dude with a good personality. He cares and treats his students as equal and not below him. Highly recommend.
He's a good professor and I enjoyed his class. His expectations are clear are they're not overbearing. Would definitely take him for another class.

Suetta is a great professor. If you pay attention in class, you'll pass. He clearly states what he is looking for and how to get a good grade on the assignment. He is always willing to meet with you after class is you are needing help. Definitely would take again!

Quizzes are pretty easy and they prepare you for what he considers to be the more important lectures in class. He clearly presents what he expects out of students for writing assignments, especially since he gives good and bad examples of past work.

Great business professor. Course is based on writing projects with weekly online tests that are based on the book (tests are easy). His projects are interesting & clear, but require effort & quality writing. Tough grader. He offers tons of resources, & his lectures help guide you through each project. No midterm, final is small. I'd go to class.

Alexsandra is a very nice and good professor! I took her for international business and i loved it! It was more of an open discussion class and i loved just listening to everyone talk. I learned so many new stuff. The class itself is easy. We had 2 debates and 2 exams. There was HW too but it was so easy and quick. I recommend her!!

She is a great professor, interesting but nice. The debates are pretty easy and so is the homework. Exams are a little difficult since she makes them herself. There are like 5 extra credit opportunities. She is really sweet and wants everyone to participate in class. The paper wasn't hard either. I would take her again bc she is so sweet.

Overall she was really nice and had a lot of excitement in the lectures. However it was hard for me to really get engaged in the lectures as she mostly just went off of the PowerPoint. Also it takes her a little while to respond back to emails and get stuff graded. But was still a really pleasant professor to have and was very helpful when possible

Horrible at responding to emails. Leaves you lost throughout the semester and put little to no effort to teach. PP slides and midtap are here to teach you, the only thing this proff does is ignore emails.

I had Alexsandra Sukhoy for BUS351, she was a great professor and great with discussions in class. She doesn't give too much hw but a couple presentations/projects, and a couple writing assignments. She does explain content well. Overall, easy class if you put some effort in.

Alexsandra is a very nice and good professor! I took her for international business and i loved it! It was more of an open discussion class and i loved just listening to everyone talk. I learned so many new stuff. The class itself is easy. We had 2 debates and 2 exams. There was HW too but it was so easy and quick. I recommend her!!

She is very nice, knows what she is talking about. I enjoy going to her class. I love the content and the material in the course. Two exams , 1 final, 2 projects, 1 solo and the other one group, and one assignment, she is not a difficult instructor . You can tell that she cares, and she is super approachable during office hrs. So far she is great!

Sukhoy is very nice and knowledgeable on what seems to be past marketing ideas. Sadly, in almost every class she mentions a slight at technology in some form. It is very odd to see tech not referred to as at least somewhat of a positive marketing tool. Interjects a lot of anecdotes and "studies" as well to restrict student's learning process.
She is an excellent teacher. Does a great job of making the class applicable to the real world. Discussions are always fun.

Enjoyed the class room discussions. Always read the case studies before the class. Participation in the class is given a lot of importance.  It might get a little tricky with the exam since there is no definite pattern she follows. The guest judges for presentations provide good feedback & career advice. Everyone gets and A or an A-.
2 tests and 2 group presentations.  Show up to class and participate.

Great class - highly recommend anyone to take her as a professor.  Homework  reading cases. Class  discussing those cases. There are two presentations & two exams.  My advice: speak at least once in every class session & discuss the cases with your group to prep for exams.  For exams: think big picture & how everything ties together.

There were no visuals for this class. She asked that everyone "Show up and 'show up.'" Participate in class. Read what you will cover beforehand. Although there were no power points, etc., she was the most engaging and interesting professor. I would have gotten a 4.0 had it not been for a terrible group I got stuck with. Would have her again!!

we only had her half the year as she filled in for kim ruggeri. however successful she is in her career, doesnt make her a good instructor. grades rather arbitrarily and based on feeling, and she is always right. on the plus side her lecture s are done in under 1hr , so you dont have to listen to her condescending whine for too long.

Great professor, VERY HELPFUL if you are reasonable with her. The only readings from the book are the cases. The class is to make sure you have your CEO cap on! Think like a CEO and you will be successful. Presentations, make sure you read the guidelines for a great grade.
She was a great instructor however, Class was really hard especially presentations. But I had learnt a lot in this class I am glad that I had taken it. I had taken A from this class.

She's energetic & always make the class interesting by discussing the current issue.  Exams are easy, she is very lenient in grading. You have to do a group-presentation about issue in OH, there'd be 2 guest judges from professional world (banking, law,etc) which probably make you nervous, but you'll learn a lot from them.

Fantastic professor. I wish she taught more of the SPH classes. She has always been very clear. Tests are challenging but she gives you the tools to succeed. It's rare to get a professor this knowledgeable and practical. :)

It states its a soc class, but in reality its a stats class. So if you suck at math dont be tricked into thinking its an escape from math, there isnt one thing about soc haha its literally all math. Can hardly understand the guy(which obviously I have nothing against). Very tough grader, he knit picks any little mistake. Goes really fast. F-

He's a weird dude, but he's fine. He didn't do a great job making the material interesting or the class exciting, but it was chill. His accent was thick but understandable, just don't take if you have problems with Chinese accents in particular.

Prof. Sun's class was the usual -- need to put work in and show up. His lectures are straight from the book. He does take attendance. Has a thick accent but as long as you're paying attention you will be fine. Book is great for if you're absent and you will need it if you choose to do the extra credit.

I enjoyed his class very much. Yes, he has an accent but his English is definitely not hard to understand. I liked the lectures, and his tests were not hard at all if you paid attention to the things he said in class. Overall, he's nice and he made the class interesting.

This professor was terrible. He always showed up late to class, his notes never made any sense, and he has a ridiculously thick accent. He made up buy his book, but then just gave us printed copies of the chapter the two times we actually used the book.

I would have enjoyed the class a lot better if i could understand the professor. His English is not very well spoken so you do not know what he is saying. There are 8-10 5 point quizzes and the exams are usually 50 points but super hard. Gives one extra credit opportunity if you give a 10 minute presentation for the class. Awful experience..

Professor Sun is passionate about math and doesn't really abide people that don't have a working level of previous math levels to the courses he teaches. That being said, English is not Professor Sun's first language but thats not really an issue. if you pay attention and come to class he explains everything very well. Recommended for sure.

DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS OR PICK A CLASS THAT THIS PROFESSOR TEACHES!!!!! He just reads from power points and has hard accent. Also hard grader!!! If you have an assignment worth 10 points, be very shocked if you can at least get 8 points. This guy is something else. Don't fall for his participation extra credit point either... He doesn't know anyone

One of the worst classes I've ever taken. He is very hard to understand due to his accent. You would assume he would try to make up for this with clear notes, but that is not the case. Most of his Powerpoints are incomplete, so they are useless later to study from. His lectures are uninspired. He gets frustrated if people ask him to clarify things.

Spring 15 Semester - The class average grade on the midterms (of 67 students in the class) was a 'F'.  (luckily I was one of the few who received a low C- He has a thick accent (Example: When the professor kept saying 'Chin Teary' he meant Exchange Theory). We have only had 2 grades so far, and each were taken the day before spring break..
Prof. Sun expects a lot from you mainly that you show up and read when asked. If you take notes and show up then you should definitely be able to get an A.
Very good professor. He made the class interesting,explained the readings clearly, same as the videos watched in class. Very helpful, too.  Just attending the class, you will easily get an A.
He expects the class to read articles that he posts online.  The class is suppose to discuss these during class.  He gets stern if few people read and/or discuss.  I

Don't take this class if you're looking for an easy A, Dr. Sun makes you do a lot of work, a lot of reading and a lot of writing, and a lot of discussion, but if you put in the effort he will reward you and you will learn a lot. Tests are moderately hard, and he makes you write a lot of papers, but doesn't grade too strictly.
Just attend the classes and take detailed notes. U will be fine !!

Clear lectures, when you attend and listen you will have a good grasp on the material. Professor Sun has great sense of humor. Class gives fair chance to earn a good grade. Attending class is fundamental, every detail maters, make notes on videos they are part of the tests.

Very good professor, very knowledgeable !!! Listen carefully, take a lot of notes !! and you will be fine. Tests are fair. Class if interesting, good to know this stuff for life. He is funny !! Videos are very interesting.

Very good teacher. At first I didn't think I'd like him, but he turned out to be one of the better professors I've ever had for math. Clearly explained touch concepts and made sure every student understood. Lots of homework and pop quizzes, but as long as you attend class, it's not a problem.
He is very hard to understand.  I wouldn't necessarily say the class is hard byt there is a lot of work.  He tries to offer assistance during office hrs but I didn't find it to really help me.

Professor Sun is a nice guy, and does a solid job teaching the course.  I wish he would use powerpoint for his lectures instead of the chalkboard. His tests are fair and not too difficult if you attend class an pay attention.  His writing assignments can be a bit unfocused, but he is willing to adjust if numerous people have the same issues. Good.
Very helpful professor! take him if you can !!!

This course was extremely hard to begin with, although he made it interesting and it was easy to understand him.  Tests were extremely FAIR, although it is mandatory to come to class in order to do good on his tests.

My favorite professor through all of law school! I dont understand how some comments are so negative. I took him for commercial law and space law. Im scheduled to take him for two more classes next semester. He makes class fun and interesting and is just an interesting person in general.

My favorite professor through all of law school! I dont understand how some comments are so negative. I took him for commercial law and space law. Im scheduled to take him for two more classes next semester. He makes class fun and interesting and is just an interesting person in general.

Never heard him scream or even raise his voice. Took his Space Law class, was awesome, jump at the chance if you can. Laid back, chill, intelligent. Will give guidance about class or career. Sense of humor, doesn't take himself too seriously. If you stay involved and pay attention, can't go wrong.
Mr. Sundahl was a disappointing teacher. His screaming at you gets scary and he should get help with his anger.
Don't take thia course with this professor.  Secured transactions has one exam and it is so hard.
Worst professor I had in law school.  Don't take him unless you enjoy being afraid, confused, and miserable for 3 months straight.
Took hime for Ancient Athenian Law.  Don't get on his bad side, because he'll lower your grade.  Don't challenge him.  He seems to hate that even more than do most law profs.
I dreaded taking Commercial Law, but Mark Sundahl made it more than bearable. He takes his time to be sure the huge class understands and he has a good sense of humor.
Ugh - who put that chili pepper there? He was lazy and apathetic and totally disrespectful of students. Funny, yes, but unhelpful and boring as all get out.

PRO: Bowtie killer fabulous. Sundahl is a good professor who is very respectful to students' comments.  He has a good sense of humor and is accessible outside of class. CON: When you talk to him, you get the sense that he has derives some pleasure from making you feel uncomfortable with his death stare.
Amazing professor.  Very respectful to students.  Makes 1 hour and 40 minutes seem like 5 minutes.  Very clear in presentation.  One of the best professor's I have ever had.  Brilliantly eccentric.

Lectures are super dry. Prof. Sundaram means well and he really cares about helping students learn, but it's hard to prepare for his tests and quizzes. You'll definitely see questions on test/quizzes/homeworks that you've never seen before. Take this class only if you can afford to put aside a good amount of time to study on your own.
Terrible. He was one of the worst I have ever had!!

Best stats teach I ever had. He really knows his stuff! Again, you NEED TO WORK VERY hard for his course if you want an A. If you don't understand the concepts, you can't crack the exam. You need to attend his lectures to understand Stats (He is excellent at teaching it). This professor is not for students who come to college just for fun.

Had a different professor for Stats then he needed surgery so we got this professor. Awful teacher, doesnt answer questions, basically just reads off slides and doesnt do examples or show you how to do the problems. Hard to understand and does not care about his students. DO NOT TAKE HIS CLASS.

Overall, solid choice. Uses real life examples to try to make the material more interesting. He is very willing to help and answer questions. Only three exams and the final is not cumulative. Only 5/6 homeworks total. I would take a class with him again. He also gives partial credit for showing your work on exams.
He is very knowledgeable in the subject and gives examples from real life. Easy A with a little effort

OSM 511 is one of the more challenging of the foundation level classes in the business school. However, Professor Mohan is very knowledgeable in the subject matter and uses real life examples to make it understandable. For the tests, you will get significant credit if you write out the work you did to get the solution, even if the answer is wrong.
Prof Mohan is very knowledgeable and brings lot of real life examples. His exams are easy and if you put in a little work it is an easy A

He is very passionate about what he is talking about, however he has no clue how to convey the material to the students. The lectures are ridiculously long and you really have no idea what he is talking about. Tests consist of 10 multiple choice, two descriptive problems and three math problems. Would not recommend this class.
