Professor Sundaram's lectures can get a little long, but the group Lego projects in this course make the class tolerable. Tests are a mix of multiple choice and extended response and are reasonably fair if you study the material and come to class consistently. Expect to receive an A or B if you are willing to spend time with the material.

He is very knowledgeable on the subject. It is like a mixture of a statistics/probability course and general business course. Homework is through Connect and is based on questions from the book, which are fairly easy. Tests are mostly re-worded homework questions. He is a very generous grader if you are good at showing work. Should be easy B or A.

He isn't the worst but he isn't the best. Lectures are so boring I fell asleep twice. Homework assignments are pretty difficult. Tests were very hard and never knew what to expect. First test was exactly like homework all others were not.

nice guy horrible teacher. you walk out of class having no idea what just happened tests are tough small curve on them if any and the material on test doesn't match what the hw was on or anything. he is a nice guy but does not know how to teach you will not retain anything and will be bored to death. do not take this class with him

This was the worst class and professor that I've had to take as part of my MBA program at Cleveland State. The topics were dry and boring and so was the professor! Students are obviously disengaged but continues to lecture until the last minute of class. He expected A LOT of work and tests were extremely hard. My advice, take ANY other professor!

If you like your GPA do not take his class.  His  lectures are very long and boring. He never really goes over homework and posts it at the last minute.  Will not let you email homework to him if you are not able make to class. Wish I would have drop this class.

He is old school and a hard task master. However, if you work hard getting A is not that hard. Took it as a summer course and boy had to work a lot as there were two tests, a quiz, a paper and homework for a six week class. Must admit that I learned a lot. Lecture is long but his GE examples are nice, doesn't allow the use of iPhones or iPads

Took him for Stats. Not a great teacher - cannot bring the material to a level that the class could understand. Tests are not like the homework. Acts like he would be helpful if you seek additional assistance but is not. He isn't able to present the material in a way that is clear for those who are not experienced in the subject.

Professor Sundberg seems to be a legitimately nice guy. He's very talkative and doesn't put too much emphasis on formality in his classroom, which is nice and inviting. However, every time I come to class, it feels like a waste of time because he gets so far off topic I don't learn anything. I can pass everything by just doing the online work.

Professor Sundberg is a pretty great teacher. He tries hard to make you understand what's going on with the class and does whatever he can to make your life easier. My only critique would be that he sometimes looses track of what he is doing and that causes him to mess up whatever equation he is working out. Other than that I would highly reccomend

Professor Sundberg means well, however, he has a horrible habit of getting extremely off topic and that made the lectures difficult to follow.  The textbook and homework taught me more than he did unfortunately.  He is extremely nice and understanding, and tries really hard to keep students interested with his jokes.  Overall, good class.

The worst professor I have ever encountered. He is DIRT old and lectures are extremely boring. To top it off more than half of your grade is based on a "venture plan"(60%) that he expects you to go above and beyond on to earn a decent grade. He will speak to you as if you have no worth and make you rethink your entire existence. AVOID!!!!!!!!!!!!

The entire class is based off of the venture plan. He gave us great feedback and pretty much told our group that we did a great job. Right after teacher evaluations he flipped and gave us a very bad grade. Do not recommend his class.

Cool in the begging of the semester and then completely flips right after teacher evaluation. Went from being respectful to rude in personal conversations. Educationally I didn't learn anything new as most of the things are taught in most business classes. Overall negative experience.

Assigned a semester long project which was the venture plan. No tests however there are two lessons learned projects  that you do with a partner and a paper which was not hard. He lectured every class, mostly about what he expects on the venture plan and you are only allowed to miss two classes, after that it affects your grade.

Truly makes you feel like you're worthless. Literally made me cry when I went to meet with him, and his secretary even told me it was uncalled for and to talk to the dean. He takes on too much with all programs he oversees and does nothing well.

This guy is awesome!  I have learned more from him, than most of my professors combined.  He is tough but fair.  If your one of those people who grew up with parents telling you how wonderful you were - even when failed, then he is not the guy for you.  He tells it like it is and I respect him for that.  Very good professor!

After dealing with Dr. Susbauer I am going to counseling. I thought I was worth something, apparently I'm not. OK guy, can learn alot from him, but have some thick skin or you'll need more than counseling when done with this.
If you like hearing how worthless you are, not at the beginning but at the end - you'll love Jeff Susbauer!
No Comments
He is extremely helpful and easy on grading exams. No surprises in exams.
very helpful and instructive, will let you turn in homework late/ make up a quiz if you get sick

He is a real teacher with excellent knowledge and he knows the art of teaching just not screwing the students. He is one of the best which I have ever got. He makes the things so easy by just listening to him anyone can get familiar to the things what he teahes.
He is a real teacher..Always ready to help and very hard working and caring...
he is a human before being a professor, cares about students and their success.
I took several classes with this professor.  He knows his stuff, and he's really helpful.  He's one of the better teachers at CSU.
powerpoint presentation everyday ... not enough explanation with exercises and examples, horrible teacher
Dr. Svestka is an excellent professor that communicates clearly and honestly cares about  the success of his students.
Very nice professor and very helpful

Professor Swan made learning through the pandemic so easy and was always ready to help us. She cares about what we learn and making us into great teachers! Professor Swan was willing to let us resubmit any assignments that we didnt score well on. I have professor Swan again this upcoming semester and im so excited!

Professor Swan made learning through the pandemic so easy and was always ready to help us. She cares about what we learn and making us into great teachers! Professor Swan was willing to let us resubmit any assignments that we didnt score well on. I have professor Swan again this upcoming semester and im so excited!

Ms. Swan is probably the sweetest professor in the CSU education department. She is very lenient to our everyday responsibilities, especially during the pandemic. She's the teacher that allows you to redo assignments to get a higher score. She values communication and genuinely cares for her students.

Wasn't bad. I had a hard time getting through the book, but thats because it doesn't suit my interest. Very minimal time was spent conversing with her, but thats due to it being a web-based course. Her requirements and all information are given in the syllabus, so it's all laid out for you. She also maintains her schedule which is a plus.

I took her online Urban Studies class. Overall, it was an easy class. You just have to be on top of your work. She is a fair grader. The work looks daunting at first, but it wasn't bad at all. I would definitely recommend this class! An easy A if you're dedicated to your work!
Online course. Weekly discussions and a few other assignments. Paper. She can be a bit temperamental. All in all, pretty easy course. I'm all about online classes.
I took her online class and it was a piece of cake. I like her and she is very helpful.
She was great1 Helpful, easy, understanding. She made it interesting, I wish more teachers were like her. You need the book some of the time.
This was an online class; however unlike others I have taken this prof actual responded to emails and welcomed phone calls!  She was very understanding and open to new ideas
online class.  very easy.  she's really nice.

Took calc 2 in six weeks, i can easily say without him I wouldn't have passed. Truly a guy that gives 100% every day. Very generous grader as well, just doing the homework and quizzes will get you a bunch of points.
Professor Syvuk was allays willing to help out. He makes calculus fun, and has a great teaching style.

Probably my favorite professor that I've ever had. He is funny and makes class enjoyable for students. It is very easy to understand what will expected be on the exams, there are no surprises. If you do the homework and pay attention you should do well. 10/10 would recommend!
Very likable, this is the math professor you want.

Awesome professor! Laidback and clear with his expectations. Three exams and a final, homework, and weekly quizzes. Explains concepts in a way that's really easy to understand. Approachable and easy to reach outside of class. Truly one of the best professors I've had.

Mark was very nice and a wonderful teacher. He did all his lessons on the white board, explaining and breaking concepts down to make them easier. He always made sure everyones questions were answered before we moved on so no one was lost. He was very caring about his students. Mark was great and I would recommend him to anyone.

Hysterically funny. Cares very much for his students and made the course a joy to take and a breeze to pass. Would take for every math class if I could. He won't take it as a personal offense if you skip, but few absences are allowed before your grades are reduced, as a general rule.

Took calc 2 in six weeks, i can easily say without him I wouldn't have passed. Truly a guy that gives 100% every day. Very generous grader as well, just doing the homework and quizzes will get you a bunch of points.

I am not a Math person at all, but I really enjoyed his class and his style of teaching. I think you need a good Math teacher to learn Math and Mr. Syvuk is that, he is very easy to learn from and actually made the class fun and not dreadful. One of the best Math teachers I have had.
One of the best math teachers I've ever had

The best professor I've ever had hands down. He always makes sure that you know what is going on. His lectures are extremely informational. Although the tests are hard sometimes, he does a great job at making sure you are prepared. He also is extremely funny and makes class interesting.

One of the best calc classes i ever took. It wasn't just what he knew. It was the way he taught that really made this class shine. He treats us students with kindness and isn't just going through the motions. He is actively trying to make sure everyone succeeds. I was very fortunate to have this teacher, and i'd recommend it to anyone else.

Syvuk is a good teacher, he works to create a good rapport with the class. His notes are clear and handwriting is excellent, so it is easy to follow his explanations. He posts his notes online for everyone so if you miss something in class you can reference them. Calc 2 is hard, but he works hard to help his students succeed.

He's a great guy who genuinely cares about students. He's extremely accessible outside of class, and is a generous grader on exams and quizzes. He's a funny guy and makes class entertaining. Would definitely take another class of his.
She is a great professor and is a very easy grader. Try's to get to know students and understands that life can come in the way.
She is a great professor and is a very easy grader. Try's to get to know students and understands that life can come in the way.

I took her for two semesters, and she makes learning French very fun and bearable. She's good at making the language easier to learn, and does a great job at explaining things. As long as you attend every class and study, you will get an A.

Professor Szocs was awesome. It's always nice to learn a language from an authentic speaker. She knows her stuff, and has high expectations for the class. As long as you study and attend class, you will get an A.

French is a difficult language, but Maria makes it alright. The main issue with her class (which is not at all her fault) is her very heavy accent (she is from Transylvania yes that one). It can be hard to understand her sometimes and her English is a bit weak, but I learned more French from her than I did my previous professor.
She has a heavy accent, but she is a great professor and she takes time to explain. She's also passionate about teaching.
It is pretty hard to understand her at times due to her heavy accent, but other than that, she is a great teacher and is very passionate about what she teaches.
just talked --  no plan or illumination of material
best prof I had my first year. Wish he would return.

So glad he was my contract prof.! He is very clear; explain things really well. You can tell he really knows his stuff. He is also very fair and always there for his office hours. I will take all his classes that he teaches.

At 1st Tabac comes across as confusing & disorganized with comments & examples coming from left field. As time goes on you can learn his style & things fall into place. I found with a lot of outside studying(Emanuels) I got a good foundation on contracts. Also, Tabac was always available during his office hours for questions.

Best contract professor!

he's really a wreck. he's muddled and unclear, and runs out of class so he doesn't have to answer any questions.  he LOST several midterm exams and didn't know what grades to give those people for their finals.  for several of these students, he gave them

Very good contracts professor. Very knowledgeable about the subject matter. Only complaints are the limited help in questions outside of class and the very limited space allotted for exam answers. But overall, a very goo and interesting professor.
Excellent in contracts
Had her for PS101 at john carrol. Had midterm, final, and like one project. Midterm and final were difficult but extra credit was available to help grade.
Had her for PS101 at john carrol. Had midterm, final, and like one project. Midterm and final were difficult but extra credit was available to help grade.
Had her for PS101 at jcu. Had midterm, final, and like one project. Midterm and final were difficult but extra credit was available to help grade.

I am a Counseling Psych PhD student and it was my first family counseling course. Professor Tadros used videos, mock therapy sessions, and different readings. She gives superb feedback on assignments and is flexible in regard to deadlines and class topics. She is personable and willing to help. One of the best professors I've had in years.

The presentations are out of date and will take you at least 1 hour if not longer to get through all of the information.  Be prepared to have your assignments returned to you with a zero because you didn't put 2 spaces after periods.  Spends more time picking apart stylization than content.  Avoid if possible.

The professor wastes so much time making you learn statistics by hand in class but you never actually do them on testsfor the big research project. Most of the class is a waste of time & the test is not on any material from the lectureshomework. He makes fun of students for not using proper English but he's foreign and often makes mistakes too.

The other raters were pretty spot-on with this one. He is basically a genius which makes it tough to follow his lectures and the info we go over in class never seems to be relevant to testsquizzesreal life (i.e., made us do statistics by hand in a research class...). It's frustrating but he tells a lot of jokes and I ended up with a good grade :)

Completely confusing and incomprehensible. Cannot understand anything he says and class is incredibly boring.  Is not helpful at all and feedback makes no sense.  Unfortunately this professor cannot be avoided and you are forced to deal with

No teaching is involved in his class. All the class consists of is memorizing the textbook and taking 10 question quizzes which he only gives you 10 minutes to complete.  Chapters are very long and he doesn't give you a base of what the quiz will include so you will find yourself panicking and hurrying through the book pages. Terrible teacher.

Hard to understand and even harder to please.  Hybrid class but in-class material and online material are not consistent.  Constantly worried about APA format more so then content of assisgnment.  Lots of filler work and students not engaged at ALL!!  Course material is very juvenile and students are treated as such.  Waist of time and money. MAD!
She was not bad of a teacher. But her group assignments were irrational. Expect to work with dummies and be graded on their performances, not yours.
No Comments
She was very mean to me! She was not willing to answer my questions!

The Professor seems more concerned about his own personal accomplishments than actually helping the students in class. The majority of the work in class can be described as busy work and I can honestly say that I haven't learned anything of value in this course.
Tought grader, incoherent lectures, but really nice guy

incredibly smart and a great lecturer for unit operations lab the feedback can be incredibly deconstructive and very harsh. The course requires a 20 page paper due every two weeks and he can never be found in his office and barely responds to email so don't expect any help. He often uses profanity and very anti lgbt
Excellent professor.  Teaches some complex subjects but is clear and helpful.   Also very helpful as an academic advisor.

I was a TA for Dr. Talu for fluid mechanics.  His homework and tests weren't all that tough and followed his test prep classes and homework very closely.  He knows his stuff and seemed to explain it well. He was always willing to give students the benefit of the doubt when grading.
stay away from this guy...
Great teacher.  He is a little hard to understand due to his accent (Eastern European, I believe) but you will get used to it. He was very helpful to the students.
very good and fair teacher will help you pass with plenty of xtra credit
You are going to blame yourself if you do not register the class with her. I took the class in summer 15 and it was the best semester . She was helpful and respectful.
Nice teacher always helping

Best math teacher ever!! She is so nice and is always so prepared for class. Always encourages questions and and is so helpful. Always makes time if you need help outside of class. People would like math a lot more if they had a teacher like her. Also Like someone else said, she is very pretty.
Had lots of office hours and is always reachable to ask questions , very nice and covered everything on the test. Homework was light and is done online.

She is hands down the best math professor ever. Gives outlines of the notes, explains everything so well and is so nice. I was so nervous for calc 2 but I couldn't have gotten a better professor. TAKE HER!! Also she is so pretty!!

Took this class accelerated in the first part of summer, and I was somewhat nervous but after taking I have restored hope in Teachers here at CSU. I recommend  hands down I could always come to her and ask a question. I wish more teachers taught and cared this much!
Well prepared for the class what makes learning easy, explains everything very specifically
Our original professor moved half way through the semester and prof tamerlano came in as a replacement. Was very willing to help after class. Very kind and caring!

Easily my favorite professor I've ever had, her teaching skills make learning math easy. She takes the time to explain and make sure everyone understands before she moves on. It was nice to have a professor that I knew cared if I passed. I wish I could take every math class with her!
This class was very easy and she knew that. She is one of the nicest professors I have had. If you ever get the chance to take a class with her, I highly recommend it.
Great teacher that explains the topics very thoroughly.
Miss Tamerlano is the best!  I wish I could take her for every single one of my math classes! She makes everything easy and explains until you understand the material. A+++++++!!!
Awesome

This teacher is the best teacher I've ever had by far as well. She is super approachable and very willing to teach. She seems to actually enjoy teaching. Professor Tamerlano was the best math teacher I've ever had. She's super clear and lists out every step of the problem which makes it easy to follow and understand. I had her at Tri C and she gave lot of extra credit. She gives note outlines and if you miss a lecture, she posts her notes online. I would definitely take her again and recommend her!

The best professor I've had yet at CSU. Gives you handouts, and good feedback on tests and quizzes. Also, she gives partial credit, so the tests are way more fair as long as you show all your work. Lectures are clear and concise. Will help you on HW if needed. Don't buy the book. Just an all around great professor and would absolutely recommend.

She was one of the best math profs I've had! She makes everything so clear and she'll keep doing examples just in case you didn't understand something. She gives you "note outlines" so you don't really need a notebook. Her reviews are helpful and she takes those problems and basically puts them on the test. Would definitely take her again!!
Great teacher, make sure you stay updated with Aleks and keep communication open with her!

Very patient and explains clearly.  She gives lots of partial credit and will take any question you have.  Highly recommend, I used to struggle immensely in Calc 1 but she made Calc 2 a breeze.   If you pay attention and work hard everyday, there should be no reason to not get an A because her teaching is that good

I had Dr. Tan for the 19 fall semester and he was an amazing professor. He really cares about his students and he is passionate about what he teaches. His eyes light up when you ask questions, and you can tell he is very happy to be teaching you. His class was simple. Keep up with reading and vocab and you'll be golden. 100% recommend his classes.

I had Dr. Tan for the 19 fall semester and he was an amazing professor. He really cares about his students and he is passionate about what he teaches. His eyes light up when you ask questions, and you can tell he is very happy to be teaching you. His class was simple. Keep up with reading and vocab and you'll be golden. 100% recommend his classes.

Do make sure to read the chapters well and takes notes along with his lecture notes, because the exams were very detail-oriented. Read the assignments and the terminology will be easy. Too many try to simply learn the terms like vocabulary and find it overwhelming and frustrating. To thrive in this class put the terms into the context of the case studies. It helps to appreciate recent Chinese history as it provides much of the context in which concepts are explored.

Dr. Tan is extremely knowledgeable and can teachoose you a lot. You can tell he doesn't like Japan as much as China cause when you switch over his enthusiasm drops drastically. Tests are pretty tough because he gives study guides with over 80 questions and only puts 8 on the test. You better be ready for a ton of notes in this class too.

A lot of writing.  I would take your laptop to class because after class your hand will hurt from all of the notes.  Anyway, as long as you pay attention and take ALL notes you will be okay.  His study guides are long but if you take notes you can fill them out easily and if you are missing a few terms you can easily find them on Google. Good Class

Dr. Tan is definitely a well-read/researched and a powerhouse of a professor. He expects those in this class to keep up with world affairs and to speak up! I enjoyed the lecture/discussion/presentation methods. He is also very approachable and willing to help or discuss ideas, after class. His accent was not an issue at all. I recommend him 100%

Dr Tan is very nice but the midterm and final were brutal with over 50 terms that you had to memorize too many details about. It took 8 hours just to type out a study guide and I still got a B on the midterm. I eked out an A in the class, but not without losing some sleep and studying like a madwoman. If you take it, be prepared to study hard.

Dr. Tan is a solid professor. His accent takes a few days to get used to, but it's not a big problem at all. I wrote that you have to show up, because he often tells the class before if there will be a quiz. Also, you get a 60% on the quiz just from taking it, and all the questions come from the section reviews. Isn't always a clear cut grader.

Dr Tan is an amazing teacher. Undecided coming into this class, I found that Political Science was right for me. I am an international relations major, and this class made me dread learning about it. Dr. Tan is a decent professor, and he can be helpful if you ask for it, but sometimes he doesn't answer questions clearly. Dr. Tan is a great teacher, has an accent but very knowledgeable of the English language so you wont get lost in poor grammar. Very interesting to listen to and has excellent personal insight into what he teaches.
Nice class you can get an A easily just to attend class

Good professor, this course was easy if you kept up with the readings and material.Short essay and 2 midterms. Professor taught with powerpoint, material was directly from the book.

professor Tan's courses is very easy to pass. Since I had his first PSC class, I had taken 4 or more PSC class with him. Just go to class every time and take note. it will be an easy A or B. His final research paper topic is very broad, which can almost can write anything.

He is a solid professor.  he makes you work for your grade and brings great insight from a different perspective.  A great class experience if you don't plan on never showing up.  Quizzes are tricky though.
Go to class and take notes and you'll get an A. In lieu of tests he assigns 3-5 page papers. The topics are very broad so the papers are relatively easy. Easy A!

ahh worst class ever, with potential to be the best... I can't stand this prof, he lectures straight out of the book. Attendance is 20%, midterm 30, final 50. Does attendance with quizzes from readings and then lectures the exact same thing you read the night before. I was expecting this to be my fav. class but it is my least favorite! Beware!!!

Go to class and take the notes.  Tests are based off both the notes and a very clear study guide for midterm and final.  Participate and use the study guides- the midterm and final are based on those. Hard not to get an A or B if you show up and pay attention.

Professor Tan has his qualities: he is knowledgeable and careful in his explanations. However, he was not meant to be a professor, the profession just does not suit him. this is what uni classes in history should be like

This Professor has a good sense of humor which is essential for the subject matter. Discussions of race, religion, sexuality, disability, and so much more can lead to a tense class, but she does a good job easing the tension. Expect a lot of group projects in every lecture, but do not be afraid.

She is not clear with expectations. She posts videos and sends emails occasionally to give instructions but they are disjointed and unclear. Great professor! Although COVID recked our worlds during his class, he was very understanding and gave clear communications and easy to follow video lectures throughout the whole thing.

Dr. Taysom will work with any student who is willing to actually make the effort. This is a writing course, but the professor has made lots of adjustments to the syllabus to make sure that we have time to get things done right. Not a bad professor... but he's often condescending towards students who mean well when they ask him questions, he never responds to emails, and he doesn't follow the syllabus at all. Great professor! Although COVID recked our worlds during his class, he was very understanding and gave clear communications and easy to follow video lectures throughout the whole thing.

Amazing prof! He is very nice, funny and SO easy to talk to! Lectures are THE most important part, but he makes them fun and you will wish they lasted longer! There were two books that you had to read, but if you skim them you will be fine. Showed videos and made material EASY to understand. SO funny and smart. Very relatable and awesome.

One of the most genuine and passionate professors I've ever had. You really have to keep up with his lectures and take good notes if you want to pass, but he makes his lectures VERY attention-grabbing and thought-provoking to encourage this. Ask him about the Pizza Hut in Egypt.
Prof. Taysom is hilarious and his class is easy to follow along with. Just make sure you read what he asks and PARTICIPATE. Participation helps him determine how to give exams and such.

He will be a jerk if he doesn't like you but as long as you don't talk in class and try to participate you should get an A. Need to write down what he says because his notes he writes wont make sense to you later. As long as you pay attention in class you'll get an A.

Professor Taysom is a great person but does not make his teaching accessible. He only lectures by reading his notes and *sometimes* writes important info on bored. amazing teacher, looked forward to his class everyday. Even though he teaches religion, you learn concepts that are applicable to everyday life and are extremely useful.
He may be the best professor I've ever had. He is both funny - and like actually funny not teacher funny. He is very real and I will defiantly take another one of his classes.

He has this constant glare and is pretty serious. However, it makes his jokes way more funnier and he notices if you laugh at them. His a very good lecturer and notices those who attend. This prof. gives detailed, funny, engaging lectures. He is very good at explaining things in a way that makes sense, but if you are confused just ask. Nice, personable guy. Great, interesting lectures. He always keeps things real, that is, he understands that this is REL 101 and its not necessary in the real world. In all, he made the material very interesting and is my go to for future gen ed classes.

truly enjoyed his classes and the way he gave out information was great. His exams were straightforward and easy .However, all his exams depend on your notes and whatever stuff he mentions during class, so make sure you attend regularly.

Amazing teacher, seriously. Lots of note taking and you likely won't be following the syllabus to a T but if you show up, pay attention, and take notes it is an easy A. He explains things very well and is very open to questions!
Great professor. Hilarious.

Not hot in the traditional sense, but very distinguished looking, very nice dresser and an amazing beard. I LOVED THIS GUY. He was funny, but taught the material extremely well. No surprises at all when it comes to exams, covers everything in class. He really knows his stuff. I still remember stuff from that class!

I like her because that sort of strictness kept me motivated to consistently go and do well in her class. She makes you work for your grade.
She is overall a real nice professor, but for your grade you have to work for it. There is a quiz every week, you have in-class assignments, and a term paper.
Every Monday we were given a quiz and there were a lot of in-class assignments that have to have certain length answers. Other than that the class was fine.

Very enthusiastic of the subject. Very hard to understand due to her Japaneses accent. Class drags on because she reads straight off of her pwp slides. She gives a lot of in class assignments, you also get homework & one group project. Her study guide was very broad & the test was hard. Def need to read the book to pass the test.
Good lectures, concise handouts, and industry relevant material.
Best ever professor. Helpful. if you can solve the homework questions .. you will get "B" in the tests ( At least ) Great personality.
He is very good perfsour and he explain very clearly and he is very good and he responded my email very faster.
He is the best professor you will ever had! so kind and generous with the student he cares about you and your progress in the class more than just covering the materia

I took this exact same class twice before with another professor and got D's, but with this professor I understood the material so much better that I got an A. This professor really makes this hard subject seem easy. The whole class was sad that he was leaving. Too bad.
Good lectures with information about civil engineering in Ohio.

Brief and informative lectures and does a great job explaining the "mathematical" portion of the course. Hands out slides so text book not strictly needed. Test and quizzes might be kind of challenging to some but he offers plenty of opportunities to earn extra credit. Easy going guy and overall the class is pretty cool.
Supports students who are looking for some guidance
Very inspiring and motivational.

This professor is one of my best professors. He understood how to deal with students. He gives hopes even if you misunderstand the subject. He's clear and well prepared for the class. I strongly suggest this professor.
Not the best lecturer, but a nice man and he wants you to pass. Do the homework. The quizzes and exams are homework problems. Lots of extra credit
John is available and easy, show up or ask questions and you'll be fine
Accessible, knowledgeable, helpful, and a great guy
A great guy, super knowledgeable and helpful, and very accessible

Mr. Telesz is a great guy, super accessible, and wants to see you pass. Make sure to talk to him so that he can actually help you, but he knows his stuff and is always willing to have a meeting or answer an email to help you out. Extra credit is also super helpful if you do all of it.

johns a nice guy but a horrible teacher. finals worth 40% of your grade. all semester he just pointed at slides that he didn't even make and I didn't learn anything. the TA grades all hw, quizzes and tests, next week is finals and 1/2 of my assignments aren't even graded on blackboard so idk my grade even. Avoid him at all costs.
He shouldn't be teaching. He simply doesn't teach and is not knowledgeable in his subjects.

John Telesz is a nice guy, but he's a bad teacher. His lectures are him reading straight off of PowerPoints that he didn't make himself; he will sometimes have little knowledge of the material. Redeeming qualities of his class are that he gives a nice extra credit assignment, and your lowest test score can be dropped for your total quiz score.

Reads off powerpoints all class and is extremely boring. Doesn't even really explain the solving process just reads and points. Relying on the book to understand the material. Quiz every week, 25% of your grade, a midterm 25% of your grade, final 40% of your grade and hw is 10%. would reccomend

Listen, this guy is the standard Indian coding teacher. He is pretty nice but also kind of hard to understand. I found MATLAB pretty easy so I had no trouble but I could tell some people were struggling. Be sure to sit in the front cause he's kind of quiet. He gives a lot of quizzes though so be ready. He is easily the best MATLAB teacher at CSU

Tewari started out okay, but by the end, we were taking quizzes literally every day. Other students are getting over 100% in other classes , but Tewari does not know how to teach programming. If you have a question, he'll just say, "that's your headache." MATLAB is easy, but whatever you do, don't take MATLAB with Tewari. You will regret it!

Dr. Tewari has the potential of being an amazing professor. The material is interesting and you do feel like you're learning in the class. However, he doesn't explain any problem solving questions, despite the homework and tests being just that. With that said, don't expect this class to be easy.

People like to bash him about his grading, but those are the people who don't go to every class and end up dropping the class. If you don't got to class, you WILL miss stuff. You must pay attention in class as well. Do all this and you will be fine.

I liked Dr. Tewari.  He is very passionate when he explains stuff, and he really likes using the chalkboard.  Lectures got more interesting towards the end. Homework isn't  really difficult and it helps a lot for the tests and quizzes, which are pretty straight forward, basically problems from homework and lecture notes.

Very knowledgeable on his course material and he explains concepts well, it's just that he skips over problem solving examples in the powerpoints, and half of your test/quiz is problem solving. There's definitely a disconnect from when you learn in class to actually attempting the HW. You'll look at a test and be baffled at times. Also tough grader

DO NOT take this  class unless you can already code in C. Gives you basic explanations of concepts in class, then gives you a hw assignment way harder than anything you have done then barely or doesn't even go over it next class

Makes homeworks overlap, won't give you answer to last homework, extremely difficult grading if you have 1 thing wrong in code you get an F no matter what, quizzes u do code right but other parts wrong, you get an F, exams, final exam midterm(in time needed) final exam I don't know yet, biomedical engineer teaching programming that mkmakes sense

Ridiculous professor gives 50min for quizzes and recitation s that will take the normal human over 3hrs to complete, oh yeah you better get the code correct the first time because if not it out of time

Vaguely explains the material and expects masterly of the subject covered to quickly. Expect to spend hours on homework because he will fail to explain details you need in code and poorly worded instructions. Quizzes are to complex for time given.  If you have a hard to understanding he will make you feel stupid. Don't take if you don't have to.

A majority of the first half of the class is a breeze. Tests often have trick questions and are far too long for 50 minute class. You can get 99.9 percent of code right but will receive an F if the code does not do exactly what he wants.  His style of teaching is not compatible with coding.

Tewari is a good teacher. He teaches efficiently. Doesn't hesitate to answer questions. He will give extra help to students who are having trouble. He came in on a Saturday to help some students. One thing that bugged me was he would not give me extra additional non-grade assignments to practice which I found odd. Glad to have taken his class.

I am a A student and the highest I have gotten on a test is a 5o%.  Should be a easy class, but he makes it really hard. His notes suck. U end up having to learn from the book- but the book sucks. Homework is only 5 problems but it takes  days to figure everything out on your own. Take this class at a another school. If they dont let u then transfe
He is a confusing machine, especially his quizzes !

If you want a good start to programming, avoid this professor at all costs. The logic he expresses is unclear. If you do not understand the curriculum then he is condescending. Ask him for help and dont understand? It isnt his fault, he will accuse you of skipping classes. We are going to the head of the department to report him actually. AVOID.

Took programming before this class and still do not know what he wants. Unclear,  not helpful , narsisitic, takes questions as attacks on him, worst proffesor I have had to date! If you take his class you will regret it.
Awesome

Don't ask a question because he immediately goes on the defensive and makes you feel dumb. Lectures are difficult to follow because he jumps from topic to topic without any warning or explanation. Powerpoint slides are cluttered and messy and difficult to study from without significant note taking.
Poor and Poor and Poor !!

Really hard class and he's very hard to understand. Lectures are very boring and long and he makes you feel stupid if you don't know something and ask a question. Takes off points for minor details and is a tough grader. If you can avoid this classprofessor you should.

She is really nice and VERY helpful with anything you need help with, but she will give you A LOT of homework. However, she realizes not everyone who takes her class is an english major, so she works with who is in your class. Be prepared for a lot of discussions in class and on blackboard.

Thayer is an excellent prof, our honors section got LOADED with work, though. She expects you to read often, in large chunks, and she added this sem a blackboard forum component. However, she took us to see a play of a book we read, and was always open to new interpretations. Overall, an amazing professor, you'll get a lot out of the class!
She does a very well job at explains things! Also tests are not terrible although they do require some level of cognitive thought. Enjoyed the class and recommend her highly.
Really easy, don't always have to go to class, posts all powerpoints on blackboard.
Class was enjoyable. Tests are directly from notes and power points in class. Power points are all posted on Blackboard as well. Not bad at all.
Easy class. No exams.
Likes to talk about random things. Class is not exciting, but she is interesting and very nice.
GREAT, best of CSU art history profs.

I believe Dr. Thomas is a great professor. I have taken 4 classes taught by her! She is very knowledgeable, experienced, and helpful. Her tests do cover a lot of material but if you study correctly they are easy to ace. I feel that those who think she is mean were in a class where students disrupted her teaching. She really is a very sweet lady.

She makes you write 3 page essays for her tests. she goes over tons of slides and only like 5 are on the test. made us watch movies that do not help with anything. tells us stories that do not do anything but take up class time. she was a brutal grader on my tests. her syllabus didn't even have all the class dates  or total points of the class.
Very interesting person! Teaches with nice anecdotes with subject matter that makes lectures more enjoyable. Grades fairly.
Excellent professor. Difficult at times.
She is a great professor, it is a hard class but if you study and go to class you should be fine. Flash cards are a must!
The class was boring and she was not nice. All i have to say, i was happy to pass the class and get out of the class.
Good professor, made the class interesting.
doesn't keep the material interesting-and it should be!
The final was impossible-- "all or nothing" on slide IDs, essay portion so hard it is a JOKE!  Too much memorization required for a class made up of NON MAJORS!!
No Comments

She was a great professor that was willing to work with the whole class.  She responded to my emails and offered out of class help.  A few shorter papers and a 15 page group paper and power point as a final.  Great class, I recommend taking her for UST 453. If you put in the work you should be rewarded with an A.

Thomas was an okay teacher. I had her for proposal writing class and organizational leadership course. Her proposal writing class was more difficult. She tends to be a bit convoluted in her presentation and expectations. A lot of work with little guidance. Not to mention I had a 89.6% and she gave me a B+. Kinda screwed my GPA.

She's pretty good. Her proposal class was a lot of work for an online class, but she made that clear from the very beginning. She didn't always respond back from emails, but usually did. Overall, put some effort into her assignments, especially short answers, and you'll be fine. I ended up with a B+ but probably deserved a lower grade. :P
Good professor overall, and hilarious. His stories from India are always interesting to hear between tough chapters. But the class material itself is very hard and abstract.
Professor Thomas was a very caring professor. Willing to meet on zoom when I needed extra help or needed clarity.
Professor Thomas was a very caring professor. Willing to meet on zoom when I needed extra help or needed clarity.

You know what to expect from day one  show up to class, read the assignments and bring your best work to every time. That's it! If you put in effort, you'll get a good grade and learn a lot. Professor Thomas cares deeply about the success of her students, grades like you're in college and is always available to help you improve on your skills.

Prof. Thomas is very disorganized. The class was online and her syllabus was not structured. She took off major points on assignments for menial things and what not. I ended up with an A- but things for the class were sprung up on me at the last minute and I was docked a lot of points because it was not up to par with what she wanted.

The guy just reads from PowerPoint slides in class, does not explain topics, not helpful when answers your questions, demonstrates XY charts with numbers, but never explains where these numbers come from. I had to study at home each paragraph from the beginning to the end; I could have just studied at home and came to take tests. The exam was easy.
Not helpful at all. Never took attendence, lousy at explaining things. Knowledgable guy but listening to this guy teach is about as exicting listening to a dial tone.

Great book, good examples and easy to read. The prof was also very good. Very knowledgeable, good sense of humor, make topics interesting. I took this class in undergrad and learned nothing. Took it again as a grad student and got much more out of it b/c of the prof. Recommend the prof.

Go to class, do the homework, study before the tests and you will do fine.  The tests are hard, but it is a hard class.  Professor Thornton gets frustrated with people who are not prepared, and most of the people who don't like him don't spend enough time preparing for the class.  I enjoyed having him, and will miss him next year.
Mumbling, tests are very hard and tricky and they cover all the material even he doesn't explain everything.
Too mean to care about.  Work load is hard but if he didn't seem so careless I may have tried more...barely got my C

I don't see anything wrong with this guy. Personally, I didn't like him. But I didn't come to CSU to like professors anyway. As a teacher, he has a lot of experience teaching this class. Actually his exams are not too bad if you study hard. I failed the 2nd test but did well in the other 3. I passed with a B. Just work hard, no BS in his class.

This is the worst teacher I've had, the first test was extremely hard and there wasn't enough time to finish it. I failed it! I may have to drop the class. I have 3 classes left until graduation and my GPA is 3.74. I blame this professor for not doing well. He mumbles, gets confused, and flies through the material. He is not a good teacher!

Excellent, motivating professor. He treats students with the level of respect they deserve and is happy to help those in need.  I highly recommend reading the material and doing the problems prior to class for preparation.   Exams aren't too difficult if you follow his instructions.   Overall, this class will make or break you.

Professor Thornton is a good instructor, but to succeed one has to be prepared to do ALOT of work independently. He does have office hours, but they aren't convenient for people with day jobs. Class attendance is not taken, but if you are absent too often he WILL notice. Also, keep up with homework or he will get frustrated. Tests are very hard!

VERY TOUGH PROFESSOR/MATERIAL!!! He cares, just shows no emotions. If you participate, ask questions and come to class you will be ok. My daughter was in the hospital and he allowed me to take my exam in a later class. You show him  you are serious and work hard, he will do the same. Don't expect him to baby you because he wont. Good luck :-)
dont take him, he reminded me of a military person.

I had him for 331 & 332, and you're going to work, &you're going to work hard. Don't bother taking him if you're not willing to do the homework. If you do though, and you read and understand the material prior to going over it in class (at least most of it), you'll easily get a C or better. Ask him questions or correct his mistakes he's okay withit

Ignore previous posting. I meant to rate Intermediate 2. This is the hardest class I ever took and it took me 2 times to pass it. Homework takes a long time to do. Tests are long and cover a lot of material. Professor makes a lot of mistakes when doing the problems on the board so make sure to write in pencil.

This is the hardest class I ever took and it took me 2 times to pass it. Homework takes a long time to do. Tests are long and cover a lot of material. Professor makes a lot of mistakes when doing the problems on the board so make sure to write in pencil.
THIS GUY SUCKS!

Thorton is not a bad instructor. If you study hard, do the homework before class, and pay attention, you should get a good grade. This class was good preparation for Adv. Act., which is more difficult in my opinion.

Had Thornton for ACT 331 & 332. Knew nothing about accounting prior.  Classes were extremely difficult. He said on the first day, "Many of you will fail. I'm not here to pass students; I'm here to produce competent accountants." Great teacher, very knowledgeable about every aspect of ACT. Study hard, be prepared and you will excel because of him.

I passed this class! We are rating the prof NOT the material. He mumbles, speaks softly, is rude, condescending, disrespectful, and sucks at math. If you said he isn't condescending you're a)lying or b)you are Thornton. He's the only prof for ACT 332@CSU. There's nothing positive abt him to speak of.

he is willing to work with students and help them out if they need it. I found it was easier to go to his office for help when needed. The material is hard, plain and simple if you don't put in the work you will do good

Prof Thornton is a good (but fair) prof. The rumors are true. The CLASS is tough because of the material. He expects you to have read the material and worked thru the problems BEFORE class.  He seems to be a nice guy and has his moments when he is funny. If you do the work before class, you should do well.

This is a hard class and I think people blame Thornton for their own poor performance.  He is actually a funny guy who can be personable if you're holding up your end of the bargain and doing the work.  Believe the rumors, he is tough but he teaches you the material well.

The class is hard, and he is tough. But it is a tough subject and he is trying to ram it into you how hard you need to work. If you screw off in class, or don't come prepared he will have issues with you. He does put the trickiest things on the exams. But you should be able to tell what will be on the exam, even without him specifically saying.
Loved having him as a professor. Very easy to talk to and was excellent at explaining topics.
Loved having him as a professor. Very easy to talk to and was excellent at explaining topics.
Good guy, make friends in his class for notes or missed questions. Makes you do worksheets during videos.

Dr. Thrash is a great professor for upper-level chemical engineering classes - he is very understanding an an easy grader, and teaches his course in an understandable manner. For his online classes, he actually teaches live - something many professors don't seem to want to bother with.

He was my professor for the lecture portion of ESC120. The lectures are fairly boring and are completely mandatory (there will be attendance taken at every lecture), but it is only once a week. There was no homework for the lecture whatsoever, you just have to show up. Marvin is very caring and receptive to any questions you may have.

I've only experienced him as the speaker for the Intro to Engineering Design lecture in the auditorium, he just prepared us for the next week's experiment. He shows that he cares for students, though. Lecture is once a week but you must show up! Lectures are quite boring but only based on attendance. Rest of the grade is from the lab.

There's no good professor for this class at CSU and this guy proves it. Weekly homework and lots of quizzes. After the first exam I had no idea what was going on and neither did anybody else. Makes you do everything the "hard way" because you're an engineer, meanwhile he explains very little as far as how to do certain operations. This class sucked

Dr. Thrash is one of my favorite profs. He takes the time to make sure that you understand the why's of the material as well as the how's. I had him for Fluids ESC301 and Reactor Design Lab CHE404. Incredible person and professor.
He is the best! Wish every professor was as cool as him.
Mr. Thurmer is a very interesting, knowledgable, and helpful professor! I would highly recommend his classes for anyone willing to put in the work.  :)

He's very sweet and very knowledgable. But he can also be pretty disorganized/has a lot on his workload. He grades easily if he sees you're putting in the effort. Fun class overall, would happily take again.

Excellent professor! The complaints regarding boring lectures are apparently from those who are not interested in learning from the masters or from a professor who is very well-rounded. I enjoy learning and improving my technique. He is learned & kind and won't "rip you a new one" in critiques like some instructors. He cares about a students growth

Really REALLY awesome professor. Even though sometimes his lectures make you want to not pay attention, he is really understanding and fun. His critiques are not the kind that will attack you and the art, but will help you in the long run. I will say that his teachings make me love using charcoal and chalk! Plus he will warn you when doing models.

I agree with the rating below. Very nice, good at what he does. He does love the sound of his own voice, but it's easy enough to get through. I would definitely recommend him, if you do the work you will be fine. He actually gave me an extension on a project with little questions asked.

Definitely a great professor for a beginning art class. Taught all the basics and essentials and was very thorough. Sometimes a bit too thorough, however. He often talked too much, making for a boring class. Really his only downfall. Extremely nice man. Judges art during critiques very kindly, but also adding constructive criticism when necessary.

Colleen was not a bad person, she was just a very very particular grader and makes you seriously work for your grade. If you miss 1-2 classes you will get a call from the starfish people. She did not go over vocab at all so it was hard to continue my American Sign Language skills. She got mad when no one knew what was going on.
Great capstone class with real-world final project. Prof. Tighe was helpful and she really knows what she's talking about. If you have a choice - take her.

She obviously knows the material very well and finds it interesting and you can tell she loves to teach too.  She has little to no filter, which often makes the class more interesting because she's not worried about being politically correct with everything.  The assignments are long, but she doesn't even grade them.  Overall, good professor.
Awesome class and awesome prof. Provides study guides for the exams and the paper is spread out over the semester with drafts.

Professor Tighe is not a great speaker and she tries to be funny but most of the time it doesn't work. She seems nice, but then leaves mean sarcastic comments on your papers that make you feel stupid. She doesn't post powerpoints on Blackboard so you have to go to class. Interesting class but not a great teacher. And I never used the textbook once.

Dr. Tighe is very funny and makes the lectures interesting. She also answers any questions you have. Going to class will help a lot for the exams bc the exams aren't multiple choice, but there's only 3 exams. There's 1 paper for the entire semester. It's about 20 pages but she breaks it into sections that are due throughout the semester.

Very reasonable professor. She does expect participation and get ready for breakout rooms. Her class will broaden your perspective. Her syllabus and rubrics were not very specific but she is pretty laid back on technicalities.

Very reasonable professor. She does expect participation and get ready for breakout rooms. Her class will broaden your perspective. Her syllabus and rubrics were not very specific but she is pretty laid back on technicalities.

Took an online summer class with her and was honestly the most confusing, unclear class I have ever taken in my life. The assignments themselves are not hard, but without clear instructions up until the day before it is hard to know how to proceed with the assignment. DO NOT take an online class with her, you wont learn anything that you expect to.

She was nice and an understanding teacher. She's not always completely clear in what she wants for assignments, but she is quick to respond to emails to help clarify. Discussion boards every week and one final paper. Easy class and you learn a lot about Cleveland!

Dr. Tighe refreshes CSU's long-time respected MUPD program. Her class is very reading/lecture heavy but the readings are practical and she actually discusses what was assigned (imagine that!). She might be playful and sarcastic, but do not slack off or you will quickly regret it. She has not problem calling people out for lack of effort.

I really enjoyed this course. Dr. Tiruneh is a very knowledgeable and fair professor and I found his lectures interesting. He is very organized and is great at answering any questions you may have. You don't need the book as long as you attend lecture. Homeworks and midterm exams make up most of your grade. Take good notes and you'll do great!

He does not provide slides, instead he writes his notes on the board and his handwriting is often sloppy and hard to read. He only takes questions at the end of lectures. He often tries to hold you after class. You must be a good tester to pass, as his class is made up of 2 homeworks, 3 exams, and participation

I really enjoyed this course. Dr. Tiruneh is a very knowledgeable and fair professor and I found his lectures interesting. He is very organized and is great at answering any questions you may have. You don't need the book as long as you attend lecture. Homeworks and midterm exams make up most of your grade. Take good notes and you'll do great!
Nice professor

I don't understand how this teacher has such great reviews. None of my peers liked him either. Reads straight from the book and tests are hard. I'm usually a student who does very well but it was hard to keep up in this class. Reads straight from the slides and is kind of a jerk.

Very organized professor. He makes a seemingly abstract and difficult subject fairly easy and enjoyable. He is a personable guy who focuses on the big picture of understanding the course well instead of encouraging you to just memorize something for exams.
Provides extra credits and clear exam study guides. Lectures and homeworks great. He just needs to speak louder.
Knowledgeable and caring professor

Pretty bland professor because of his accent but he gives a lot of extra credit and curves nicely! He seems like a great guy but just is not good with teaching. Do not miss more than 3 classes as he gives extra credit at the end of the semester. Also make sure he knows your name by the end of the semester bc he counts participation as extra credit
he was hard to understand. Had a sassy attitude in a sense.
Professor Tiruneh is a nice and very helpful one. He knows his course well and does an excellent job of transferring skills.

He is pretty hard to understand, he speaks loud one minute and the next minute he is speaking soft and he repeats that cycle a lot throughout the semester and in class. He sometimes like to throw slick comments during his lecture. Try to say funny jokes while giving participation pts. I approach him during his office hrs and he was kind of rude.

Learned a lot about economics of development and growth. Prof. Tiruneh is passionate about understanding circumstances that help explain how the rich world got rich and why the rest of the world, the poor countries, remain poor. Great lectures, reading materials, practice questions, assignments, exams, and feedbacks.
I didn't think the sample questions before exams helped very much.

Professor Tiruneh is extremely knowledgeable and caring professor. He provides many assignments on MindTap where you get the option of attempting more than once. The option really helps a lot if you do not understand the question right away. He is also flexible and extends assignment due date if you provide strong reason. Highly recommended.

Professor Tiruneh is one of the best professor I've ever had. I can confidently say that his knowledge in Macroeconomics is inspiration. Amazing lecturer, available after class through office hours, quick to reply when emailed to. caring as he kept track of students grades and made sure to remember all of our names unlike other instructors.
Good professor. Easy on grading and he gives 7% of extra credit if you participate in class. Make sure to do the homework and you'll be fine

Prof. Tiruneh is extremely knowledeable on what he's teaching. I hate those teachers that only teach lectures off powerpoints word for word, but he actually went in depth with the content. Don't miss his sample questions before exams, they'll be very helpful.
Have enjoyed the course, especially reading materials and homeworks on MindTap.

Professor Tiruneh is a nice educator. He is very professional, cares a lot about us, and wants everyone to pass with high grade. His PowerPoints can be just enough. Oh, dont ever miss sample questions. Practice them and be sure to score good. Highly recommended.
As long as you attend and participate in class actively, you should be able to do well homeworks and midterm exams. So far, I am doing well and I believe I will get A.

He tends to cancel class a lot, especially only 30-45 minutes before we meet. A that point tells us to do an open lab and work in groups. He doesn't like to use the Blackboard site for your core assignments. You are required to work in groups and a group can kick you out, thus you will fail the course which goes against school policies.

Online class, Good feedback, the big project you had for the class was rather short and easy, a lot of tests and quizzes but those are very straight forward and easy. The Learn smarts and video reviews however are very time consuming. A lot of work in this class but not hard at all, just time consuming.
Was my professor for the capstone course. Doesn't drone on like most. Straight and to the point, and I learned a lot from attending his class. Highly recommend.

DO NOT take his class online. Gives you roughly two weeks to complete 3 chapters (1 practice quiz, 1 actual quiz, for each), and 3 reflections on ted talks that are always over 30 minutes long, and he wants 2 pages for each one. While they are interesting, for full time students that also work full time, it is INCREDIBLY difficult to keep up.

His classes would rarely be over 30 minutes long, usually just watching a TEDtalk. Flies through the PowerPoints so even if you want to take notes, it's nearly impossible. Half the exams are over the Connect quizzes which he doesn't teach. A nice guy but definitely doesn't teach well.

I took him for organizational behavior and I've never been so bored for a class before. He is nice enough, but kind of makes students feel stupid if they say something dumb. He assigns a lot of pointless work and doesn't collect it so you do the work for nothing. Overall not bad I put an average amount of work in the class and got an A-

Professor Tomlinson is a great teacher. He is a doctorate student full time, and a teacher part time. He knows the subject material, and is very relatable. As long as your dedicated to the class, you'll do just fine. ALWAYS turn in your work though - especially each chapter's quizzes.

Super easy teacher and very kind. Tells lots of stories of experiences he has been through. Got A's on all my tests and there were connect homework problems due weekly which weren't bad. Test questions were the same exact question from hw problems and then from videos/articles we read.
Turned into a rude guy at the end of the semester. Made the final impossible because he said "we got too high of grades". Are you kidding me?

I agree 100% with the post made on 6/2013. I got A's and B's on my tests and we had a good group presentation and paper, but still somehow managed to get a B- in the class. Most of the people in my group were slackers. And if he didn't cancel class he would breeze through it in 30 minutes or less. My drive to school was longer than our class period

Worst professor I've ever had. Very rude. Would cancel class but still required us to attend (how does that work?) HEAVY group work. If you got stuck in a bad group, you were screwed. Used Khan academy videos to teach and made even the simplest concepts complicated. Flew through PPT presentations and never enough time to take notes. Avoid him!
NOT! NOT! NOT! an easy class, but he is fair and very helpful.  My new favorite professor.
Easy class. Easy material. Does not know how to articulate or elaborate on anything. If you want to actually learn something, do not take this class. If you want an easy A.....take him.
Really cares about students.  Explains stuff better than all the other teachers.  Tough, but fair.

Prof. Tomlinson is a very good professor. He knows his information not only from the book, but from his business experience. The class is not very difficult if you attend. He pretty much points out the information that you need to know for the test.
Very easy professor. He is very eager to help his students as well. I would highly recommend him
Great teacher, very clear, cares about student success, and is open to work with students. CSU needs more like him
Good teacher, cares about student success, and works with students to help them succeed

Very easy-going. Likes to engage the class (maybe a little too much hahaha). Takes an interest in the students and genuinely tries to be helpful. He can be a bit abrupt at times, but he is generally pretty nice regardless. The class itself requires a lot of useless assignments, but he is very lax about how you complete them and when. Pretty good!

You will get what you earn in his class. Professor Topor is upfront and provides information to be successful. He is accessible and very pleasant. Students get intimidated after they read his syllabus but come to learn and keep up with the readings you will be fine. Follow his power points, and ask for his advice on group projects. GOOD LUCK!!

You will get what you earn in his class. Professor Topor is upfront and provides information to be successful. He is accessible and very pleasant. Students get intimidated after they read his syllabus but come to learn and keep up with the readings you will be fine. Follow his power points, and ask for his advice on group projects. GOOD LUCK!!

There's a reason why he has a 4.9 rating. One of the best professors I have taken. This is my second time having a class with him and he is great. Clear grading guidelines and practical assignments that help you understand the material.

One of the best professors at CSU. Always finishes up class early, gives a study guide for each exam, makes the material easy to understand, makes class worth going to. This was my fifth class with him and he is consistent throughout all of his courses. Take his classes if/when you can.

Professor Topor is a straight forward man. He is passionate, and engaged with his class. Clarity, and seeking the best interest of the students. He is a fair professor. I hope to encounter professor Topor in the near future. He is a great experience in a professor p
Great professor! Clear instruction. But you HAVE to study. Super fair and very caring.

Dr. Topor is knowledgeable and knows his material. Grade is based on 3 tests which is awful because I'm not a good test taker. I read the chapters and studies his power points but got a C+ in his class. His a tough grader and his tests are tough. I was close to a B but got a c.
Great professor, took him for training and for HRM. Very clear grading criteria, and he tosses out bad questions on exams so you usually end up doing better. Super fair and very caring.

One of the best professors CSU has to offer! Would recommend everyone to take his class. A lot to study for the two exams but if you look over the study guide you will pass. Has a big class presentation at the end of the year but it is extremely easy.

Worst grader ever. First he offered to turn a regular class into its online version.. okay. There are 3 tests. The problem is that he takes a week to grade a multiple choice exam. I have never seen such a long grader. From what I understood he was just traveling the entire summer, barely doing any work, while being paid for teaching a college class

Online class for me.  The topics/reading were interesting.  On top of the readings I'd watch a few youtube clips, and I felt really prepared for the weekly quizzes.  DO NOT fall behind.  He does not accept late work.  Do the work and you'll be fine.  Make it easy on yourself, follow syllabus/directions everything is in order to a T.
Awesome. Just show up to class.
Don't purchase the book.  Tests from lectures that are very problem focused.  Good class, and he explains clearly if you have questions.  I would take his class again.

Topor  is so awesome. I took this class based on his reviews, thinking this would be an easy A. This is NOT the case! You HAVE to study. He gives great lectures, and if you choose not to go, it's your loss. He gives you the materials you need to succeed, so if you choose not to use them,  you get the grade you deserve. Best prof I've ever had.
A very straightforward online class. He's organized and very clear about expectations. There weren't many discussion board assignments like in a lot of other online classes. No muss no fuss.
i really enjoy the class and learned a lot from Dr,Topor.
Awesome teacher, one of the best teachers at CSU. Very helpful, gives you everything you need to pass the class and then some with extra credit. Would take him again.
Amazing teacher , great lectures ,very intresting.

One the best professor I ever had at CSU. He gives a lot of real-world examples and allows for interaction and feedback. The study guide tells you exactly what going to be final. No surprise. If you attend  class regularly you will receive an A. I am taking him for another course

Dr. Topor does not require attendance. This class consisted of 3 tests, 1 paper, and 1 quiz (after reading a short article). His tests are 99% based on his lectures and powerpoints (powerpoints posted on blackboard).

He goes above and beyond to help his students. He even chooses older editions of his book because he knows we are college students and do not have an abundant amount of money to shell out for new editions. He gives out extra credit for showing up to class on certain occasions (like Valentine's day or some other day that kids skip). Definitely take!

Never got a single grade for any assignments, the only grade given was the very last one on the report card. Also does not approach students to discuss current grades or any current concerns. They are also very intent on attendance, even if they are excused absences youll probably still be penalized for them.

Worst professor I have ever had. Not only does he blow through the powerpoints but you spend all week completing 20+ homework problems from 2 or more chapters which requires you to read the entire chapter again because the previous lecture was horrible. Then prepare for the hardest quiz of your life that seems to be  100% different than the HW.

This professor was very hard to learn from.  He has been in the accounting business for years and expects students to just know it.  He basically teaches from powerpoints and it's very hard to learn from. He randomly calls on you in practically every class you attend so you have to know your stuff.  Must do homework and attend class/read material
Relies on powerpoints for teaching material. Tests are not like the online homework. Must attend class, he does give points for participation.

The class itself is designed with A LOT to do in a small time. It sometimes felt like the work was never ending in there and the homework did build up. But Mark was an amazing teacher and was always extremely clear and helpful. Definitely the best I've had at CSU thus far.

Really great at explaining material in class. As long as you take notes and stay focused during lecture, you will have very little trouble getting an A. Lots of extra credit opportunities. DO NOT BUY BOOK--waste of money, you never once use it. Just buy the online access code. I would 110% take another class with him.
Great lecturer, making the subject of statistical analysis interesting while most other teachers are unable to.

Torres was a great professor. He has a clear passion for statistics and he enjoys teaching others. He was very approachable if you have questions. He also understood students having a work/life balance so if you were behind on something he was flexible on dates as long as you spoke with him. I wish he taught some of the higher level stat classes!

One of my favorite professors I've ever had. He knows what he's talking about and is always there to help. He does give a lot of homework but it's all beneficial. He gives a lot of quizzes but if you pay attention and take notes you'll do okay. His exams weren't too hard and have a take home part that counts for half the grade. Really recommend him
Great teacher, really cares that you get the material.

Professor Torres preaches math like he was standing on a pulpit on Sunday morning, makes mathematics more thrilling than the Lord of the Rings trilogy, and does it all with more grace and poise than a soon to be Princess of Genovia. If I were to battle and triumph over the books of mathematics that lay before I hope it is with Mark Torres. #blessed

Really enjoyed being in his class! Is willing to work with you if you need extra help or if you need to miss class/deadlines for any reason. He made his classroom a very comfortable environment to learn in. Gave different approaches to topics to make sure you understand. The work he gave out  & his grading were fair. Overall a great professor!!

While Mark is not an actual professor he was a grad student that was assigned to teach my statistics class. He was very knowledgable of the subject and made the concepts very easy to understand, and if you didn't understand them, he made himself available to get help if needed. I'm someone who struggles with math but he made it easy for me to learn

One of my fav profs. She was so understanding. Tests are very straightforward and easy. It wasnt a mindless class tho, she was educating us and keeping us engaged. It was very enjoyable thanks to her. She cared about ur experience and understands that memorization isnt learning. All love for Torres!

One of my fav profs. She was so understanding. Tests are very straightforward and easy. It wasnt a mindless class tho, she was educating us and keeping us engaged. It was very enjoyable thanks to her. She cared about ur experience and understands that memorization isnt learning. All love for Torres!

Things to know: 1. While the text book is NOT mandatory, she will be testing you on things out of the textbook. 2. Use the study guides. 3. Will not give extensions because you have access to all of the assignments prior to due date.

While the textbook is not mandatory it does help! Pay attention to lectures because she will give information that will be on the test that is only mentioned in the lecture. Read the syllabus! She will not answer questions that you can find on the syllabus, such as when things are due. She is funny and tells a lot of relatable stories in lecture.

Best teacher for stats! He's a fair grader and does his best to help his students understand the material. The homework is tedious because it's somewhat different than what we do in class, but it helps to understand the material more. If you're looking for a stats class where you will LEARN, sign up for his class!

Professor Toth is by far my favorite professor. I'm horrible at math and got a B in his class, he makes math make sense, he makes it almost impossible to fail his class. Do yourself a favor and take him! (ps. If you're a psych major reading this, this class was so much easier than the psych stats)

I took Andrew for STA147 and STA347 and got over 100% in both classes! The tests are similar to the notes and you never use the textbook. He gives a lot of extra credit. He also gives plenty of time to complete assignments. I highly recommend!

Andrew is the best prof I've had at CSU and I graduate this semester. Amazing prof, pay attention and take notes and you are set for the exams. He is so understanding about your circumstances and is really willing to help in any way possible as long as you try in his class. His expectations are clear and very fair. I would 100% recommend.

Best teacher for stats! He's a fair grader and does his best to help his students understand the material. The homework is tedious because it's somewhat different than what we do in class, but it helps to understand the material more. If you're looking for a stats class where you will LEARN, sign up for his class!
Andrew is a good prof, very clear on what he expects and what you will be graded on. He explains the concepts clearly. I will definitely take him for the next stats class I have to take.

Professor Toth is very relatable and personable. He tries his best to help people when they dont understand concepts, he prints notes for everyone, and gives plenty of time for everyone to turn things in. I feel like I really learned statistics and math for once. If you want a good grade in math, hes a great teacher to have.

He's a really good prof if you're looking to raise your GPA. He's funny and goes slow with the material. His exams are similar to his notes and he always adds lots of random extra credit questions at the end. I barely paid attention in this class it was so easy and I got over a 100%. take my word for it and take it with Andrew.
