Best math teacher I have ever had! Makes the content crystal clear and always makes sure everyone understands it before moving on. A fair amount of homework but if you pay attention in class, it's super easy.

I was nervous to take the class right out of high school pre-calc but it turned out being one of the easiest courses I've ever taken. Andrew makes things crystal clear and teaches you exactly what you need for the homework and tests (there are 3 all yr). Homework gets monotonous but they say repetition penetrates even the dullest of minds...

While he cares for his students and wants them to succeed, so many other parts of him negate that and make him a terrible teacher. He'll often tell you he wants an assignment one way, then when you go to turn in it he asks for it another way. He's difficult to understand, especially when he rants about unrelated topics. The man can be infuriating.

Easiest class I've ever taken. It is basically set up from the perspective of someone who has basically zero experience with a computer. So anyone that can work microsoft word can get an almost zero effort A.

Professor Toukonen was great. I remember that the book we had used was not good. Overall, this class was rather generalized. I don't feel like we went very in depth for the psych disorders or the meds. I definitely wish we had gone into the meds further.
Extremely nice, knowledgeable and helpful.

Dr. T. is accessible, the class is intense, confusing syllabus, tons of reading, projects, and papers with tons of details, 3 mth class in 6 weeks no change in tasks. Approach to Master's student like new student feels wants you to prove self, If you masters student, obv, you committed, not flexible, MOST STRESSFUL CLASS I HAVE EVER TAKEN, avoid.

Dr. T. is accessible, the class is intense, confusing syllabus, tons of reading, projects, and papers with tons of details, 3 mth class in 6 weeks no change in tasks. Approach to Master's student like new student feels wants you to prove self, If you masters student, obv, you committed, not flexible, MOST STRESSFUL CLASS I HAVE EVER TAKEN, avoid.

Dr. T is approachable and available, he likes calls more than email. No change 3 mth class to a 6 week Summer class. Same expectations. Same workload. My last semester of my Master's. I have never ever been under more stress in my academic career for that reason would advise avoiding, approach is a bit outdated, bit inflexible.

You have to remind him of deadlines, and you can argue for them to be pushed in your favor. He's lenient, ask for the study guide and ask a lot of questions and he'll all but sear the answers into your head. Could use a teaching assistant for organization.

Doesn't understand course material himself , so he throws tons of random extra readings he thinks will help explain bc he can't. They just confuse more. Only thing bigger than stacks of readings is his ego.
Overall, just a great guy. He is willing to help you if you show interest. He is kind, down to earth and truly cares about his students. I would definitely recommend Dr. Tsagaris.

He looks very assertive, scary, and hard core, but is really one of the best professors you'll love in the end. He's hard on you because he wants the best of you. So do your work, even if you feel scared that it isn't good enough. He works with you especially if you are humble and accepting of your own mistakes. Duh! lol
Interested in student success; a helpful instructor.

Tuck can be a tough grader at first, but once you figure out how he wants you to write his class is pretty easy. Really really funny guy, not very serious at all. Super laid back. I would definitely take his class again!

No syllabus to speak of, no due dates until assignment was assigned. The directions were extremely vague on every single assignment. . The textbook? Never used.Basically he had us critiquing articles on the content. Did not prepare me for the praxis at all. Hated this class and my GPA I am sure took a hit. Avoid this prof!
Tuck is a reat teacher but a strict grader. He is very down to earth and will be intimidating sometimes but overall a great teacher.

Charm and snacks are not what makes a good professor. Much of what you'll read on here is correct. If you do not agree with his very strong opinions, you will struggle with his one page assignments. He hardly used the text book. There were only two useful strategies in the whole class: Miscue Analysis and a small group reading activity.

Tuck, the name he prefers to go by, is a wonderful down to earth instructor. He challenges students to develop strong strategies that can be implemented across the education curriculum. I thoroughly believe that every future instructor should take a course with Tuck. This is not an easy class you will have assignments due every class but, don?t cla

The single best teacher I've had in college. The work is hard but useful. He always goes out of his way to help however he can. When I sign up for classes I always check to see if he is teaching anything so I can take his class. I once took a class I didn't even need just because he was teaching it.

This guy is an absolute blowhard. You will either love him or hate him....there is no in between. I would reccomend avoiding him at all costs (you can see where I stand!). He does offer some interesting insights during his lectures but the trade-off of having to put up with the pablum that he spews is NOT worth it. Oh and I'm getting an A.

This class contains a lot of work. I did learn a lot in this class that i will take with me. This class made me a better writer. You will not pass if you do not attend. You will never figure out his way of grading. He is a hard grader. He always has a teachers pet and will rub their work in the whole classes face. Take this class by its self 2 lear

Tuck marches to his own drummer, in fact, I think he makes his own drums.  He is one of the more colorful personalities you will meet, and his style is not for everyone, but he is a dedicated and passionate teacher.  If you take him seriously, he will take you seriously and you will learn.   He has rigorous writing expectations, a good thing IMO.

This class was the easiest hard class that I've taken! He is very tough to write for but all of the assignments are only a page or 2 long (at the most). There are plenty of opportunities to make up for bad grades which you WILL get. His classes are actually pretty interesting but you'll want to strangle him by the end of the semester.

TUCK is a great guy that essentially wants you to think outside the box for yourself!  His class is not hard, as long as you actually go to class and write his papers... you do write a lot, but the writing is not hard; a lot of one pagers or so... He's a very understanding person, and will help you.  If you do the work, which isn't hard, easy A!

Horrible. This man made you write papers for him,not to learn. If its not the way he wants, he will give you an awful grade. He's very anal about papers and will even remove the staple in your paper if it isnt the way he wants it. He is critical and not in a good way. He makes you do assignments which he even admits you will never use. BADDBADBAD

Dr. Tucker - aka tuck - is a very likeable man who brings a wealth of life experiences with him. He entertains & supplies food for night classes!  He's  strict about tardiness & will shorten class almost all the time. There's a lot of work with 1pg crit. thinking papers. It seems monotonous but he's trying to get you to think outside of the box.

Dr. Tuft may be PowerPoint-heavy, but the material covered is relevant and helpful. It is a great basis of what to expect for the exam, and she also posts the presentations to blackboard. She leaves plenty of room for her students to ask questions and offers constructive feedback. Holds office hours, etc.

Dr. Tuft may be PowerPoint-heavy, but the material covered is relevant and helpful. It is a great basis of what to expect for the exam, and she also posts the presentations to blackboard. She leaves plenty of room for her students to ask questions and offers constructive feedback. Holds office hours, etc.

I did not like Dr. Tuft's teaching style as it was slide after slide after slide of very dry material that she had made more dry. She had some videos or things for us to watch to lecture by but it was a very boring class and could easily sit at home and learn the material as easily at home than in class. Waste of 1 hr and 15 min. Tests are average.

Probably one of the most boring classes ive ever had. professor is not knowledgeable in the subject, and literally reads right from the slides with no interpretation. lectures every class, so it is easy to fall asleep. Exams are hard b/c study guides given are not helpful.

The professor does not know how to teach. She reads straight from the PowerPoint and provides study guides. The study guides are not helpful because the test has material that was not on the study guide. She shuts the lights off so that the room is completely dark. It puts people to sleep. Clickers are used for attendance.I would not take her again
She was very helpful and understood that there is life outside of her classroom. She is forgiving and there to help
Really cares about her students. Plenty of extra credit available. Always came to class prepared.
Did not learn anything needed for next class, useless.

I'm guessing that Dr. Tuft hasn't been teaching long, which I think is why she relies on powerpoints. At the beginning of the semester, I didn't like the class at all. I will say, she made it all but impossible to NOT get in A in her class. She did the homework with us so we got all the points and curved exams. She wants everyone to succeed.

I'm guessing that Dr. Tuft hasn't been teaching long, which I think is why she relies on powerpoints. At the beginning of the semester, I didn't like the class at all. I will say, she made it all but impossible to NOT get in A in her class. She did the homework with us so we got all the points and curved exams. She wants everyone to succeed.

The most boring professor I have ever had. She just reads from the slides and when asked questions in class, doesn't know how to answer them. DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS WITH HER. I never wanted to go to class simply because of her.
She only reads of the slides and doesnt explain them. No curve on exams.

Dr. Tukel genuinely cares about her students. Although we weren't graded by many things, she offered so much extra credit and always notified us of any Supply Chain opportunities/ internships/ etc. Buy the book- you will need it trust me. Her tests can be tricky if you only study powerpoints. She is very smart and caring and only wants to help us.
Very easy class
Very nice woman, treat her with respect and she will respect you!

4 Assignments worth 5 p each drop lowest, 3 exams worth 15p each, & one final worth 40 points. dont take tests lightly as you can burn yourself of an A real quick. Gives occasional extra credit so dont give up if you do bad on an exam either. she rambles on about stuff that doesnt appear on the test from time to time. Can do better can do worse.
Unprofessional.  AVOID if possible.

Good teacher. Takes attendance on most days. Teaches material in way that it is easier to understand. Wants students to do well in the class. Encourages students to come to her office if you need help with any of the material. Had me thinking about adding OSM as a Minor.

Professor Tukel inspired me to major in Operations & Supply Chain Management. One of the biggest benefit of this major is the nearly guaranteed job placement. If you are thinking about OSM or are OSM go and see Dr. Tukel in person!!! Make an appointment.
Hard to understand what is she trying to say. speaks laud like K-3 teachers. class structure is not too clear.

I participated in a study abroad trip to China led by Dr. Tukel.  If you have a chance to take this trip do it!  We saw and did so much at such an affordable cost.  Dr. Tukel really is a great teacher.  Make sure you are on time and respectful and you will have a good time and do well.
Does take attendance on random days for credit. Very nice professor, material is easy to understand. For tests, review the powerpoints a few times and read the book.
The nicest professor I've ever met.  She's adorable, yet sharp as a tack!  Very easy class if you show up.

Great professor with passion for the area of her expertise. Very interesting, clear and structured lectures. Professor will recognize true effort. Fallow directions to the T. Be punctual and do your homework. This course was fun too :)
Very nice lady and extremely helpful.  Can help you through your career and met me after hours to give advice about pursuing my PhD.  Highly recommend.
The best MBA professor at CSU. Smart, helpful and a fantastic teacher.
open for questions, encourages participation, can get annoyed when nobody participates, very knowlegable, exams are easy when been to class
none
Class is easy.
Truly cares about teaching. Takes an active interest in the welfare of her students.
A very good Professor.  Truely cares about teaching material that can be used in the work world.
Horrible teacher!

DO NOT TAKE HIM! He made an intro course way harder than it actually was. You cant ask him questions bc he'll snap at you. He barely gives any examples and doesnt even go off the book, you have to take notes for 3 hrs and even with notes you dont know what to study his tests r nothing like the hw. Worst teacher ive taken so far!!!

By far the best professor I've ever had. Explains difficult concepts succinctly and makes sure everyone understands before moving on. Very fair in regards to grades, homework, attendance, and overall class policies. Take him if you have the chance.
One of the best professors ive ever had. He explains everything very well and made sure everyone understood everything before moving on. His assignments and tests are fair but require hard work.

Probably the best teacher CSU has.  Very good at explaining things, and goes through material at a reasonable pace.  He will bend over backwards to help you understand the material, because he actually cares about his students.  Too bad he doesn't teach any other classes i need.

Great teacher extremely helpful.  His classes will challenge you but you will learn alot from him.  He will help you out with any problem whether it is related to his class or if it is an advising question he is the guy to ask.

Very good instructor, helpful in class and outside of the class you have him in.  He has helped me schedule my courses and hes not even my adviser.  Take him in any class he is offered.  He was great for Statics and Strength of Materials

If you don't think Dr. Tumeo is one of the best professors you've ever had, you should be ashamed of yourself and go seek help immediately.  I have never met a person more adept at explaining complex concepts and I have never met a teacher more dedicated to helping their students succeed.

Turner is awesome. I found him to be very knowledgeable about the subject and will be taking his upper level course in the future. He is very funny, and knows how to explain things. Ask questions in class, and he will answer them and make sure you understand. Go to class as if you miss too many, your grade drops a letter. Lots of homework is given.

This class was completely online, but he was quite condescending in replies to my email questions. He also accused me of cheating when I told him I had a hard time finishing a timed online quiz. I emailed him about 4 times with questions or concerns and he was rude in the emails. Not sure what hes like in person.

Turner is awesome. I found him to be very knowledgeable about the subject and will be taking his upper level course in the future. He is very funny, and knows how to explain things. Ask questions in class, and he will answer them and make sure you understand. Go to class as if you miss too many, your grade drops a letter. Lots of homework is given.

Absolutely horrible. Is rude and condescending to students. Teaches at same pace whether class understands material or not and acts like everyone is on the same page. Does not seem to have an appreciation or passion for teaching. I had to correct him multiple times on grading errors he made. Do yourself a favor and take a different professor.
He's a great teacher and is very funny, but it's tough math! You need to be in class and pay attention. Homework is tedious and difficult. Tests are also hard. Gives weekly quizzes.

Turner is one of te best professors that you will ever have in the math department. He takes the time to get to know each and everyones name (in a class of 60 he had them memorized in 2 classes) Class is a must, show up, pay attention and get that A!!

Gives quizzes and homework almost every week but the two lowest quizzes get dropped. He takes attendance. He's very helpful, especially when he gives us practice questions before the quizzes and tests. We have labs that require minitab which is a software that's basically unaccessible on mac so if you have mac you're doing the lab at the library.

He was not a good professor. I don't recommend taking his class. In my previous class I got an A and in his class I was struggling to keep a D. He teaches off a powerpoint and does not make things clear.

Probably the nicest professor I've had at my time here at CSU. The amount of homework can get a bit overwhelming sometimes, but just make sure you give yourself time to do it because it isn't too difficult. I just really had the sense that he legitimately cared about his students succeeding, and that really outweighs any other gripes I'd have.

He is a great teacher, if you show up to class and pay attention. He takes attendance but not for points, he uses it to determine borderline grades at the end of the semester. Do the homework and labs, those are easy points. Study & pay attention in class and you will be fine. He is a likeable guy who is very helpful & takes time to know your name.

He goes over things way too fast in class and tends to teach the hardest way to do it. He also doesn't give more than a minute to figure out answers. He's funny but very sarcastic and it comes off as rude a lot of the time. If you do your homework and study you should do okay, the book isn't really needed if you don't understand it.

He's such a nice man. Kinda sucks at teaching but I got through the class with an A. don't know how but i did. didnt use the text book once, (but its free who cares). He teaches math off of powerpoints like who does that? I enjoyed him a lot though. He takes the time to learn your name and takes attendance irregularly so show up most of the time.
Very fair teacher. Not out to catch the dummy. Makes instructions and expectations very clear.

You know a class is going to be bad when the 1st test has an average grade of 52%. Doesnt explain things well. Unsure of what it is he is asking on the test. If you ask him to clarify things  he gets flustered and loses his place. Makes mistakes often in class and teaches off a power point. Run as far from him as you can. take someone else.

Professor Turner was a really great professor. The homework was a little tricky, but exams were open book/open note. He was very willing to answer any questions you might have and was overall a great guy.

I learned nothing in class, so i had to go to the math tutoring center every week and learn what he was presenting to us. HE TEACHES MATH OFF OF SLIDES! Math is meant to be taught by writing it out step by step.

An honor to have a teacher with world experience, one of the highest expectations I ever encountered!!  Glad I like to read, but Statlab was unreliable at my house and I spent just as much time with a hard copy book as I would have not buying Statlab.
He is a good guy and is a lot better than most of the stat professors I have had.. Would love to have him again.
Not a bad teacher or a terrible class; just really boring. Turner did try to make it fun, though

Come on guys, this is one of the best professors I ever had! He is very intelligent with his materials and he teaches maths steps by steps. I understood everything he taught and he is a funny great guy, sometimes he make jokes or examples with Spongebob. For someone who loves maths, he is the professor to go. Good luck!
Awful do not take

I'm gonna preface this with me not liking PCHEM at all. I've been confused this entire class, and its not due to him. Professor Turner is fair and presents all of the necessary information in a clear and methodical way. His lectures are energetic and fairly easy to pay attention to.

I'm gonna preface this with me not liking PCHEM at all. I've been confused this entire class, and its not due to him. Professor Turner is fair and presents all of the necessary information in a clear and methodical way. His lectures are energetic and fairly easy to pay attention to.

Analytic Chem was mostly just going deeper into some of the tougher Gen Chem topics like equilibria and electrochem. He lectures a bit like a textbook at times, but that's a good thing when you're doing very methodical math. He's offered exam retakes and extra credit opportunities where he deems appropriate, and overall I had a great semester.

Technically I had this prof for CHM316, 411 and 412, as well as 379 and 489 (research courses). I wish I could describe in words how incredible of a professor John Turner is. In short, he is exactly what a scientist should be; an active and curious/informed mind. He's great! Take any course you can with him, he's great! (He cracks nerdy jokes too!)

basically its gen chem on steroids. we had 3 tests and a final. If the class as a whole doesn't do well, you will retake the test. use the book to do practice problems. sometimes there are problems you don't do in class and are on the test. he wants you to do well. if an answer on the test is not given, hell ignore it and not give a free point.

Insturmental Analysis-one of the hardest classes Ive taken so far as a chem major. There was only 3 tests. The class is not what I thought it would be. We learned computer programming, binary etc. I thought it would be more mass spec,IR, NMR. emailed him twice and never got a response. good luck ya'll
Very inspirational approach towards students, Every encounter with him leaves you with food for thought.

Dr. Turner is a very good instructor and is exceedingly fair. Grade is based on the highest three of four exams with no other grades. Lectures are clear, but the book needs to be replaced (the homework questions are very poorly written from the text).  I would gladly take him again for another course.

My favorite professor of all time. If you have a chance take Chem Information, mixes science with philosophy, great enthusiasm, cares about students very much and takes the time to explain things to you.

He's a great guy. He teaches using the Socratic method, which I love. He wants to make sure everyone understands the concepts and will spend extra time to make sure this happens. Also, if he feels that there is something we should know, he will diverge from the curriculum in order to teach it to us. You will enjoy his class a lot.
one of the most intelligent prof's i've ever had.  loved the material he taught.  class was difficult, but worth it.
I was very engaged in his class, but I didn't click with his ezplanation of difficult concepts, maybe becuase I'm an impatient BIO major. I did like him although he seemed a little impersonable.
You will learn a lot from Dr. Turner!
He's great.  He will challenge you and make you think.  Class is new and fresh every day you attend.  He teaches with enthusiasm and vigor.  Have fun in class.  He's great!!!
No Comments
Learn nothing from this class. It's a waste of time.

Very knowledgeable on the subject (controls) and conveys it well.  He's not an easy "A" but is leniant and grades fairly.  You will actually learn something from him if you pay attention.  Also, you will need to be able to write fast during lecture.
Very cool instructor. Grades fair. Makes science more understandable.

hardcore into theory and derivations.  tests are decptively simple and there's no plug and chug type problems.  fortunately, homework counts for such a large part of the grade that bad test scores can be salvaged.  good prof for engineers, not so much otherwise.

In my opinion Professor U. should have higher ratings. Weekly discussion boards(500 words) & respond to two other students (200 words). Her feedback is helpful & she gives extra credit. Two tests and they are not timed. Approximately 40 questions. T/F, Multiple Choice and essay. Put in the work and you will receive and A. She cares about ur success

In my opinion Professor U. should have higher ratings. Weekly discussion boards(500 words) & respond to two other students (200 words). Her feedback is helpful & she gives extra credit. Two tests and they are not timed. Approximately 40 questions. T/F, Multiple Choice and essay. Put in the work and you will receive and A. She cares about ur success

She expected an insane amount of work for an online class. With the amount of writing I did each week (500 word minimum for discussion posts plus two responses of 200 words), I would expect this to be a WAC course. The midterm and final took almost 4 hours to complete, which was annoying and unnecessary. Not the worst, but would not recommend.

She was not helpful when giving directions for the online course when something was conveyed wrong she did not give more insight on how to fix it. There were unclear directions and she was not willing to work with the student to fix the problem.

This class was set up like a WAC course. Weekly discussion boards, respond to 3 different people 3 different days. Midterm & Final took 3.5+ hours online (20 pt. essay with multiples citations) & Multiple Choice ?'s. Tough grader, took off points every week for the tiniest things (not always sure what). Interesting, but there are easier electives.
Dr. U is a very tough grader! I will not take another class taught by her! Did not think women's studies would be a writing class.

Dr. Uebel was a very clear and articulate speaker, but a lot of the content she conveyed was skewed toward opinions presented in texts or videos. However, she was not unreceptive of dissenting opinions.

This professor is like a high school teachers; she has no trust in her students. She walks around the room during lecture, keeps attendance and deducts if you miss or are tardy (stickler), also does not make checkpoint 2 easy to understand at all. Rather rude and makes students feel embarrassed often times. Plays favorites.
Very rare to find a teacher like Mrs. Uebel who actually cares and knows what she's teaching. Attendance is mandatory and very very helpful. Good teacher!
Good teacher- she loves to get the class involved- if your expecting to go to class & sleep pick another professor! Love her techniques on keeping the class involved & helping us prepare for exams

I knew absolutely nothing about music theory when I took this class last fall.  He teaches his students so much and I was amazed at how much I learned.  He will drop everything to help a student who asks a question.  The beginning was a little rough and I kind of hated him, but I honestly grew to love him and I am so glad I took his class.
Great teacher, and excellent. Glad to have him as a teacher and as a friend.
Most influential teacher at CSU,very caring,great class, absolute genius. Nick Underhill is my hero.
Spaces out a LOT, not willing to change pace although the entire class was falling behind. Arrogant and obviously not interested in the class.

Dr. Ung is the best teacher in the University. Teaches the class in such a way that the tests are simple, as long as you listen to him and actually try in class. furthermore, you can take a lot away from his lectures and learn a lot from him if you actually listen. funny guy as well.
No Comments
Ungi rocks! You will learn more than you think you did. Just don't piss him off or show disrespect.
I learned a great deal from him. He broke things down so that they were very easy to understand. Homework was a pain and very time consuming. I wish all professors were like him!

Professor Kate taught us grant writing and kept us focused and on task at each class. We mostly wrote our grants in groups and then actually created a real grant proposal ! Little did I know she taught us a skill that we will use countless times in our carreer ! It also looks great on a resume that I can write a dynamic grant ! Thank you !

Usaj is a joke. About to graduate, she nearly fails the entire class on the first paper claiming that none of us know how to write in APA style.  Never really actually taught us anything, sat behind a desk and required students to do the teaching, that's not what I'm paying tuition for. Take if you want an A but do a bunch of tedious rewrites.
She is a very nice professor. She is direct and hard on you, but it is because she wants to see you do your best. Attendance is very big! Very Helpful and Hip by using music to get energy flowing.

Easy class, answers for weekly quizzes are open note. Don't need to attend lecture to get an A. Notes are briefly covered in class but you have to read the textbook to do good on exams. Tests are based primarily off of textbook.
Great prof, lots of extra credit, attendance gets points

He's super helpful with everything & you can tell he really wants his students to succeed. Quizzes for every chapter but they were posted online. Cumulative exams but if you read the chapters you'll pass. I was confused about the content of an important presentation and he helped big time. Overall, good class! Take Professor Vail if you can!!

This class is designed so that you actually learn the material, which is very important material to know for psychology. So many classes involve regurgitating information, this class you actually learn. Vail is approachable and kind. There is a presentation you have to do, but it's easy points. He puts a lot of work and effort into teaching.

One of my favorite professors at CSU. Very knowledgeable about psychology & clearly loves teaching it. Very negotiable about due dates - has his student's best interest in mind. Tests are cummulative but very easy to ace if you pay attention & engage in his lectures. Gave alot of extra credit opportunities. Not to mention, pretty easy on the eyes.

Dr. Vail has been my favorite professor at CSU so far. His lectures were very interesting. He is very willing to help, and he wants his students to do well. There are weekly quizzes and five exams throughout the semester. Reading the book helps a lot. If you put in the work, you will do well. I would definitely take another one of his classes.
Talented. Easy to understand.

Complete waste of time. This is the only time I ever complained about being let out of class early (8AM class, was out almost every day BEFORE 9 - sometimes 8:20!). We learned absolutely nothing. If you're a Journalism major or are highly interested in it, take someone else. She can't even answer your questions AND she's a journalist!
this woman is amazing.  she is what you want to wake up for at 5am to make it to class on time

Jodie Valade is a part time teacher, and a full time sports writer for the Plain Dealer.  She is knowledgeable, but also unprepared.  The class is ridiculously easy if you have half a brain, but that might not be a bad thing depending on what you want out of the class.
While competent enough in his teachings, his lectures are far from engaging. Not a bad choice to go with though and would still recommend.

Slightly picks on people. During presentations he'll say some comments that can be kind of rude. Tests are slightly difficult. Not the best personality.  I got an A in the class, you just have to read the parts in the book he tells you to, do the practice tests, and study the slides.
Tests were kind of hard.  Group project was 30% of grade, but he walked you through it.  Does not take attendance.  Will give you help if you ask for it.

This was his first semester teaching here and he taught organizational behavior. He is really nice and curves the test. We had 3 tests and like 4 homework assignments which were at the beginning of the school year. One group semester long project which was ok.  He is really fair and a cool guy. Class can be a bit boring because of lectures.
Easily made it into my list of favorite math professors!

Dr. Validashti really knows his stuff. He facilitates a learning environment that we all look forward to, which is truly saying something at Cleveland State. He seems to really enjoy teaching the material which in turn, allows us to really enjoy learning it.
Great instructor. He is very easy to communicate with and great at providing the material at hand! Lots of enthusiasm, loves algebra.

This course (Abstract Algebra) has been amongst my favorite classes to date. By far, it has promoted my skill with mathematics significantly; more, it is making my other courses, even outside of mathematics, much easier. The impact has been profound.
great guy
Good professor, if you do the work you will get an A.

Took for Discrete Math. Good teacher (7.5 out of 10 for teaching/learning the subject). Easy test. Only 3 of them for total grade; 2 were multiple choice and 1 was take-home(that one was kinda hard). Everything on test was covered thoroughly in class. Homework was extra credit:) Very easy going, down to earth guy who wants his students to get As.
He a good professor, got really long experience, knows a lot. Uses power point and youtube videos in class so the class sometimes gets boring.

For some reason he decides to teach from power point when he was nearly computer illiterate.  Class was extremely painful and full of mistakes.  Got defensive and offended when corrected.  On average 30 percent of class was spent with him trying to figure out his laptop.  Nice guy, awful professor.

He is one of best proff. he has got lot of experience he knows each and very part of the book throughly. He is extremely helpful and fair.The subject which he teaches only he can teach us. He is a real teacher.
ccc
No Comments
No Comments
Harry was an exceptional teacher.  I formed a personal relationship that has lasted over a decadem

The class is one of the more challenging ones at CSU. However, the tests were very fair if you put in the effort and spent some time actually trying to understand the material. Make sure you spend time actually trying to understand the homework and practice tests. Honestly the class was not that bad. Just put in the work.

Does not speak very loud. Keeps track of time. You leave early he is not afraid to tell you that you are disrespectful and that he does not like you. I'm not lying when I say that. Some students left 5mins b4 class ended he told them off!!. Exam 1. GOOD. Exam 2 U R 2 GOING 2 CRY. Exam 3 IDR :) Final. Pray. GOOD LUCK.

This class is based on only 3 exam grades that are mostly multiple choice with a few fill in the blank. The exams cover a lot of material and are very hard and he actually uses the chm 402 textbook for the majority of his lectures.  Dont expect an A unless your ready to committ many hours to studying Its a hard but intersting subject

He is a little hard to understand because of his accent but he is a good professor. Tests are pure insanity A-J multiple choice you can study everyday and still fail. Over 90% of the class failed the 2nd exam before the curve good luck!

Dr. Van Keulen was a great teacher. This was his first time (that I know of) teaching BIO 200. He likes people that sit in front. His accent can be a little difficult to understand, so sit close. I wish he was teaching 202. He is funny. The class is hard, but he goes just as fast as everyone else. The first exam was easy, but the second is killer.

I personally loved this course with Dr. van Keulen. I fully acknowledge the difficulty of the class, but that is the nature of the subject. The tests are long and quite detailed. However, everything on the tests is discussed in lecture; no surprises. It's an upper-level bio course so don't expect an easy A. It is surely doable. Do the extra credit!

Very Very Very hard class. You better study 2 hours after lecture everyday and 8 hours before exams to get all the material. Prepare to memorize everything that he says. Everything is fair game for exams and the study guides were useless.

Classic old school teacher.  If you're truly dedicated to majoring in biology, take this class.  Those who gave him a poor rating were either not interested in the material or were expecting college to be easy.  Come on people, this is a major's course; if you can't hack it, change your major.  Looking forward to taking BIO 435 with him next spring
He is TERRIBLE.  The worst teacher I have ever encountered.
No Comments

tests are very difficult, you have to know every single detail for the test he has a tendensy to  talk about two chapters at a time... he also writes everything on the board and also expects from you to know everything... avoid his class
Easy,friendly,helpful my face teacher May god bless you with healthy wealthy long life :) I was lucky to have him as teacher I wish I can have him as my teacher in all m semesters.thanks
Very nice teacher. One of the best teacher.I am taking his class and lucky to have him as my teacher.
Prof Van Pelt kept interesting in EVERY class, ALL semester.  He really stimulates creative thinking.
The best professor ever! Takes time to explain the subject in details over and over until you get it. Tests are based on his lectures, not on the book, so make sure you don?t miss his classes.
Very helpful and clear. High expectations, but if you go to class, do the work, study and participate, you won't have any problems at all. Best professor I've ever had.

Greg is the best professor I've ever had. Explains the material, willing to help if you are having trouble understanding and easy to understand. Expectations are high, but if you do the work for class, study and participate in class, you will be fine.

Dr. Van Sickle is awesome! She used to be a middle school teacher and has an education degree, so she is a fantastic teacher. She knows her stuff, but is not intimidating, and is more than willing to help when you need it. Lots of activities that aid in learning. Tests are extremely fair and very easy if you do the homework and engage in class.
Mr. Vance was a godsend. I have never liked math but he's so passionate about math that I couldn't help but enjoy coming to class. He's an amazing professor (SPT?) with a very unique sense of humor.

Took this class as a substitute for a class that was dropped from my program and loved it only because of him. He motivates you in a way that makes you want to keep trying. No matter what time of day, he was there to help. He is a very inspirational person that helped me with my own journey through school and has an abundance of knowledge in math.
Didnt have to pay for an expensive textbook, so that was nice.

Avoid this professor at all costs if there are others that offer the same course. She has by far the most work tacked on to the BSG game and it becomes a lot towards the end of the course. Really annoying group projects and reflections/quizzes that make the class feel long and drawn out. Maybe should lay off a little on feedback as well. A bit rude

If you can avoid this professor, I would recommend it. This professor will slam you with unnecessary work and on top of that make you suffer through an online group project with weekly papers. She doesn't teach you anything either so, everythings has to be self taught. Save your time & money & don't take her.
Didnt have to pay for an expensive textbook, so that was nice.

Avoid taking MGT 465 or any class at all with her. For MGT 465 she makes you do an individual paper & presentation on top of a group paper & presentation. The group project is difficult with a lot of work due every week. She is an extremely tough grader. She brags & prides herself on it. (Weird flex but ok). Choose ANY other prof. if possible!!
Very bad professor. She is not reasonable what so ever. Very rude to certain students. Not a test heavy class so keep up with work or you will fail. Zero late credit

Capstone project was a group project which was good and bad. She keeps the group on track by having part of the paper due every 2 weeks. Additional individual project during the semester. Be prepared to do quite a bit of work to earn your grade.

I would definitely recommend this professor. She made this class an enjoyable experience. There are 5 group projects along with presentations, an individual case, and a final, but overall they were fun to do! She offers extra credit and grades fairly. Really cares about her students and provides all the help you need!

She is really nice, she wants you to do well. She does her best to ensure students are doing well. However, there are 5 group projects on top of a 20 page individual project. Make sure you sit by someone you know, because you choose your groups. Lots of work.

Professor VanSickle assigns a lot of homework and reading is required every single night before class. There are always quizzes or writing assignments over the reading and he lectures every. single. class. He is very nice and tries to explain everything thoroughly, it is just a lot of work for a intro level class.

Reading is ridiculous, 40-70pgs. Midterm was awful, a whole section of chronological order and he said no dates. Study guide was provided but didn't help. His lectures are so long and he goes on and on. He never stops talking throughout the whole class. Pop quizzes are 3 Q's and are impossible to get all right. This was my worst class of 7. Awful!!
I loved Prof. Vara! Very kind and helpful. She does expect you to read a lot out of your book, so you will need it to pass. Overall, great professor and I would take a class with her again.

Overall, the class is easy. You use your reading book a lot and are given certain things to read and you get quick quizzes on them. She doesn't really let you out early but for the most part if you do the assignments, it's an easy A.

Really fun class, the teacher is actually a grad student so she is young but she knows what she is doing. She always gives us multiple articles to choose from and tries to make them interesting. The free writes are a lot of fun too. Also she never grades the rough draft and works with you to make sure you're paper is good.

The material is difficult as is his grading; however, he does offer multiple opportunities for extra credit and often informs you of the questions that will be on the exams. The exams are all essay and he expects you to know every single detail, but he is fair with the curve. All in all, a wonderful, helpful teacher who truly wants you to learn.

Had him for Animal Biology. Wonderful professor. Very straight forward. Exams are directly off the notes he goes over in class. He also gave multiple extra credit opportunities. Really cares about the students. Just an all around great teacher.
He sucks. Difficult to understand what he is saying, mono tone, talking none stop... not time to finish taking notes from powerpoint.... and move through a chapter a day
Awesome teacher who knows his stuff.  Good sense of humor, too!

His handwriting takes some getting used to. Writing on the board keeps the pace slow. Attendance isn't mandatory but go anyway because you need the notes! All multiple choice tests which mostly comes from the notes. The weekly quizzes are tough but you work in pairs. I really like him. He keeps it interesting and is funny.

I think he was great, if not too lenient.  This is not supposed to be easy material.  I find it hilarious that many of the critical reviews contain misspelled and incorrect words.  His writing is ILLEGIBLE, not "eligable."  Anyone who spends time studying and doesn't do well in his class should probably reconsider his/her academic endeavors.

can not understand his writing at all. says that attendance is not mandatory but when it come down to it, it is mandatory. test are hard he expect you to know everything front and back. only good thing was the pair share quizzes. He is not a fair grader. Seems like he like when people to suck up to him. had us buy a book that he do not like or use

99% of test material is from the notes.  Take a lot of notes but you know whats in store for the test.  Took it in the summer and had group quizzes.  If you take the time and study you should get an A.
he is very tough. i felt like whenever i went to him for help, he didnt care. also, he never hands out perfect papers.. he always finds something wrong.
Very good professor. Had him for Anatomy and Physiology. He is hard, but fair and you do have to work a lot in his class, but he knows his stuff.

Lecture notes only equal 60% on a test. No help answering questions after reading the book. Very human medicine biased if you have him for Tri-C veterinary tech get someone else. Other profs give study guides, he likes to see people fail in summer class. Waste of money and time.

This prof's writting is eligable, his test are difficult and cover stuff not in his notes or in the book.  It is frustrating to study so hard for a test to get a D or C and he seems to care less if his students understand the material being taught. While it seems like he is an excellent teacher for some classes, for this one he is not.

This class was awesome!! It is a good class to take to get a natural science with a lab out of the way. You take field trips every class and only have 2 assignments which are easy and fun! Gary and Rick are fun and interesting!

I agree with all the positive comments!! I think Geza is a wonderful professor!!!! He is VERY knowledgeable and knows his information. He does his best efforts to help others share in his knowledge, maybe lots of notes, but honestly what a plus. I give this professer an A+ all around, and hope he keeps up the great work!!!!

I've had Geza for two summer courses, Anatomy & Physiology I and II.  Yes, he's foreign, but his speech and handwriting are perfectly easy to understand.  He doesn't have any English grammar problems.  Tests are hard but you know just what to expect in advance, so study.  His oldschool blackboard style keeps the pace nice and slow, which is a plus.
No Comments

Very hard class.  I would suggest you take a easier biology class before you try to take on this one.  He is very hard to understand.  And I seriously cannot read his writing on the board either.  Tests are long and hard.  Brace yourself for what you are about to get into because its not a joy ride.

He's foreign.  He gives tons of notes, which is good, but his writing is hardly legible, AND, I don't feel that he's very thorough with explaining things.  I don't like him personally, but other people may.
Took a very tough class that she broke down into easy to understand concepts. Lots of class interaction and participation. She took the time to make sure we not only did material but also understood.

Multiple discussion boards every week, but they were all fairly easy for the most part and only worth 3 points each. She is very nice and tells a lot of stories on what you can expect in your teaching career. She is pretty good about answering questions you may have. There is a presentation at the end of the semester, but it is informal.
Pretty easy class, but it is the introductory education course. She was a PhD student, not sure if she will keep teaching at CSU. Organized and presented info clearly.
Great professor, there are two assignments per week for a 8 week class. He gave referring points to locate answers. Definitely I learned a lot and would take another class with the professor again.
Great professor, there are two assignments per week for a 8 week class. He gave referring points to locate answers. Definitely I learned a lot and would take another class with the professor again.

Taking this class is kind of what you would imagine taking Sikowitzs acting class from Victorious to be like. Vaughan is always so energetic, excited, and caring. I couldnt have enjoyed this course more because of him. I was dreading taking this originally, but he made it so I was excited to come to his class. I highly recommend him to anyone.
Incredible and passionate teacher. Young and energetic, you will not be bored in his class. Insanely knowledgeable about his craft. Understanding and personable. Couldn't reccomend more.
My favorite teacher/professor I've ever had. Very energetic and encouraging. I hope to have him again in the future.

I've now taken 2 classes with him and worked with him on an out of school project which turned out to be a great experience for me.  Prof Vaughn is the kind of professor who will always meet with you to help you understand what is going on.  I HIGHLY recommend him as a professor.
He is a great proff. Loved him I never had any interest in politics before. He makes it interesting. I would take him again if I needed to

I never felt so lost and misguided in a class before. His instructions were always unclear and often he didn't even give us information about what would be on a test. He gives tons of extra credit though. I didn't do any of the extra credit, nor did I buy the book, and I still ended up with an A...probably because I took really good notes

His tests are extremely hard. Group projects are fun. Lots of extra credit. You can get an A and still fail all of his tests! Nice guy. He's not hot like everyone says. He looks like he has 3 kids in his belly. But he is a nice guy!
really good teacher, helped when asked, would recommend to others, :) took two  of his other classes also
Great teacher, sometimes hard to follow certain points but is always helpful in answering your questions. Just pay attention and participate

You don't get lots of homework for the semester just two things, so the exams are all based on his lectures and if you don't have the notes from the lecture you won't pass, he doesn't post lectures online or slides he uses a chalkboard most of the time.
Hes was really funny and it was a good class!
Definitely attend class and take notes. Because the test is usually from the lecture notes. VERY EASY A.

I didn't know ANYTHING about music and I LOVED this class. Taking tons of hard classes and stressing only to attend this class and hear a great lecture made my semester. Do your homework ( I got all of it done for the entire semester in the first 3 weeks) , take notes he writes on the board (They are literally your exam) & There's your A!

Vazzano is HILARIOUS! very easy going and chill. Attendance isn't mandatory technically, but its mandatory. By this I mean that if you miss class, you better have someone to get you amazing notes or just don't skip, because you will miss something important. All of his exam material come from lectures, so be diligent. 10/10 would have again. Funny!
The absolute best at CSU.

Frank is one of the best professors ever at CSU. I never thought that I would love his class as much as I did. I went to every single class which he takes notice of. The textbook is mandatory but the topics are not hard. If you read over the notes from the lecture the night before the exam you'll get an A. Would love to take another class with him.

You never have to participate but make sure you take notes because those are his test questions. He's very knowledgable about this course and makes it interesting. You MUST buy the book though because it has homework in it, which is expensive. If you want a good grade you need to go to class! Overall, a good professor that I would take again.

He is an amazing teacher, and I highly recommend that anyone interested take this class! Make sure you take notes in class because that is what you are tested on. Especially for the last exam its all lecture notes.

Professor Vazzano is passionate about music and makes his lectures interesting. The downfall is that he plays A LOT of videos, which makes it feel like a total waste of time to go to his class. The videos often repeat what he's talking about. It's slow paced and you could pass without attending, just make sure to read the textbook and study

He's an amazing professor and actually cares about the material he's teaching which is SO refreshing. He's so passionate about music which makes the lectures worth going to. He wrote the text book so everything he writes on the board is on the test. So show up to class and it'll be an easy A!

Frank is such a cool professor. His classes are very relaxed and he makes them really fun. Although the subject is kinda boring to me, I loved going to the classes just because of him. You only really have 3 tests and 3 homework assignments but if you show up to class and take notes, they're really easy. Overall a really fun class!!

This professor was great. He is always cracking jokes while giving amazing lectures. Many teachers seem like they are apathetic or just teaching for a paycheck, but this teacher is truly passionate about what he teaches and he always keeps his students entertained. He's funny, passionate, and always keeps the class interested with his music class.

One of the best classes I've ever taken at Cleveland State! He is really funny and he really has a passion for what he is teaching. I really enjoyed he lectures, they aren't mandatory and he doesn't take attendance, but if you don't go, you'll be the one missing out. He's really chill and he is extremely nice to his students.
Frank is so hilarious and makes sure he cares about what he teaches. Take this class even if you don't like music, he will MAKE YOU like different topics and makes the class super interesting.

Straight-forward lectures with a relaxed vibe. The textbook is required for class, and it DOES cost a pretty penny, so prepare to photocopy or cough up a hundred bucks. No papers. Doing homework is pretty close to studying, but he will go over key topics to study the class before the exam. Approachable and funny.

Hands down the best professor anybody could ever have at CSU. He is extremely passionate about what he teaches, making the lectures interesting. If you're into music, this class is one you definitely have to take. I wish I could have him as a professor again!

Hilarious and makes the class very easygoing. No powerpoints just him lecturing so make sure you take notes and go to every class. We use a book he wrote himself for the homework and there's also like 3 tests but that's it.

This was the best class I think I'll ever take at CSU. Professor Vazzano is passionate about music and because of that, he makes the class extremely interesting and fun. This is a class you need to take notes for. Some people seemed to write nothing but a  name down with no description; I wouldn't recommend this. If you love music, take this class.
Amazing!! I love him so much, the class is an easy A and even if you're not into music he's hilarious and you will enjoy the lectures!
Amazing Professor! Has a very engaging class that makes time fly.

He grades on an A, A- scale, meaning he won't give you less than an A-. If you forget an assignment he'll let you bring it to the next class for "full credit".  Don't be late! If you are 15 mins late to one class (there's only 3) you have to retake the entire course the next semester. The book is available as a free PDF online so don't buy it.

Nice enough guy, class was easy.  Basically if you read the book you get an A.  If not, you get an A-.  The first lecture is a bit rough as it's a lot of material to listen to.  Second lecture is a group exercise that is pretty enjoyable if you get into it.  Third lecture is mostly movies and a short group exercise, also enjoyable.
Very nice guy. Gives a lot of useful information and keeps class interesting with movie clips and games. Lets everybody out early as well.

Very easy class and quite boring. Not sure how people gave him good ratings. His lectures are confusing and doesn't have much depth. If he wanted he could have made this class awesome and interesting. however, he just wastes time by showing movie clips. You really have to work hard to get an A-.

David is a really cool guy. Keeps the class interesting. I recommend not buying the book and just spend an hr at barnes and noble to do the take home quiz. Quiz has a lot of all the above or A&B C&D etc. answers. Overall, good class.

I actually really enjoyed this professor and his class. He manages to make a four-hour class interesting, which is quite a feat. He uses fun supplemental materials, an interesting book and a neat class case activity. Good class, most people get an A.

You will get either A or A-. Attendance is mandatory since you only have 3 meetings. He made the class interesting by providing videos, movies, games, etc. No exams! there was only take-home quiz which wasn't really difficult, and the questions were straight from the book. Also we have to do the "role play" (group work) about hospital dispute case.
Easy class. You either get an A or A-. He lets you out at 11:30 or 11:45 each time.

Good professor, he tries to keep the class fun and entertaining for being a saturday morning class. Shows a lot of video clips and does interactive class exercises. The mandatory book took a couple hours to read, it really wasnt that bad. Easy A

Easy class. Have to attend all three classes; he is the only prof. that teaches the class. The class is mainly about team work and its inner/outer workings. The exam is taken from the book, verbatim!!

You have to attend all three classes, which involves group work, but this is the easiest class you'll take in the MBA program.  Take home text comes right out of the book (verbatim).  The book is very easy read and kind of interesting!
Awesome guy - has interesting speakers - cares a lot - interesting stories about the RTA!
He spend time to remember his students name. And he crack jokes just to lighten the mood.
Old school. Does things his way.  Demonstrating a work ethic and good attitude will ensure a passing grade.  Has an interesting perspective on course material
Attendance is Mandatory...Alot of writing on Case Studies, Wall Street Journals and Application paper but if you show up to class and turn in your papers you will get an A-

He is a reasonable man overall. He is old-school style and loves jokes. You will learn something from him (indirectly though) via writing and presenting cases. I freak out throughout the course because of the amount of work and how difficult it can get but at the end, I did earn an A. Go to class, do exactly what he wants and you will be fine!

I would take Dr. Vernon again. The class can seem monotonous, but if you follow instructions you should get a decent grade. Go to class, participate, write grammatically correct, and speak clearly That's about it. If you have a dry sense of humor you'll get through just fine.

Teacher is terrible. Most of class is spent reading jokes and going over wall st journal articles.  Vernon is a smart man but obviously gave up years ago. A clear grading scale does not exist and there is a lot of busy work.  Its easy to get an "A" if you just play his game and get your work done on time, but do not expect to learn anything.

Old school is what best defines Dr. Vernon.  I didn't particularly like him, and I wouldn't take him again if I had other options.  I thought the jokes were fun, but he wasn't especially helpful.  He didn't treat students with any respect.  He just seemed cranky, and not in a good way.

Dr. Vernon has lots of experiences in international business that he shares to the class, making the class interesting, but the materials are very boring. He is funny guy too! There are 2 exams and business plan report, I ended up with an A even if I didn't do very well on the exam.

Had to take this class as it was a requirement for my degree. Not a bad professor to take this class with, but trust me there are better ones. The thing I hated most about this class, other than the dubious grading pattern, was that we had to attend all the lectures or else we had to do a make-up written case analysis. The instructor was fun thou.

Dr vernon is hilarious.  His grading is kinda shady.  You MUST go to class. He will take roll at the start of every class.  He will call you out on anything and everything but it is just for fun.  The first half hour is spent telling jokes, the rest is for going over the text.  Memorize key terms and google the book for test bank questions!!!!

Attendance is pretty much mandatory. The tests are ridiculous - the final barely touched on the nearly 100 terms we were told to know. The questions instead were on various random facts from the chapters. Time in class is largely wasted. But it is possible to get a decent grade and Vernon is just crusty.

After the first day, I thought I was going to absolutely despise this man and dread his class, but that quickly changed.  Dr. Vernon is the man!  He is stringent, rigid, and stuck in his old-school ways, but he is also brilliant, hilarious, and fun.  Hoping to take another class with Dr. Vernon.
Class was interesting.         Be sure to Memorize key terms and definitions from textbook.  He puts some questions on exams that weren't covered in lecture, but from the book.

Ivan is pretty easy.    I did a hack job on my paper (12+ pages the night before in a record 3 hours!) - just make sure you spell check and proper grammar and you'll get a B+/A-...  Great sense of humor, will call people out from time to time, definitely keeps it interesting.  You can use an older version of this book, just study straight vocab

Im still kinda confused from his grading.  I did horrible on every test and ended up with a B.  I think as long as you show up for his roll call everyday, do the homework and paper and just take every test you will get a B.  Besides this his lectures were very uninteresting, when he does lecture and isnt rambling about nonsense.

Vernon is a really nice professor. He may come off as a hard-ass military professor, but once you break him down he's a very friendly guy! Take the class with him just make sure you attend all classes and try and you won't be disappointed.
Sexy older guy, cares for students, good sense of humor, you will enjoy his class especially the free pizza! Highly recommended

fair teacher, was a little impatient but helpful at times. I thought that I would do worse than I did, but I got a A in this class. If you read the book, attend class, and participate in discussions, you will do fine in this class.
this class is a easy grade, just come to class and half way participate and do your paper... you will come out on top...

Show up everyday, have you WSJ article, read every chapter that is on the test and make notecards of the defintions he tells you.  I loved him and thought he was very funny.  He is not cool with laptops or hats being worn.  He is very smart in the field on international business and has some good stories.  Ask him about the monkey who stole hisLunc

partial towards females  and that can be noticed from day 1 (front seats are reserved for them).  Gives very difficult projects . Grades unpredictably( deserved people may not get good grade). Most of them will get a B+. Few Americans will get an  A grade
Suggest if  you want just a B+ or less. To get more than that, you should be a female or a superman.
His Grading is unusual sometimes .
he is very good
Very specific what he wants from students. Delivers what is precisely required by the students.
Easy and good going. Keen on making student work. Gives small simulation projects based on material taught, they are interesting. Makes a student work for it.

Prof. Vincent provides interesting  educational material. The posts are straightforward, and the tests aren't too bad. But her Teaching Assistants grade critical thinking and final essays very harshly. It may help to ask for a revised grade from the teacher herself. Remember that 25-point exams are changed to 100-points. Watch the points carefully!

MEGACITIES OF ASIA.  Easy class online.  If you ever do actually need anything it is hard to get a hold of her.  Check over your online tests.  Two exams, both had two questions coded wrong I got right.  Big deal when they are worth 4 pts a piece.  Easy A
What a pain in the butt she is! Also, a very poor professor who is an embarrassment to the Levin College of Urban Affairs.

Vincent is perhaps the nastiest teacher I've ever worked with. Always condescending towards students, which is funny because she doesn't even have a Ph. D., therefore she still is a student! Assignments are never explained, website was poorly constructed. Overall Grade I would grant her is 'F'.
She is the most unintelligent teacher Ive ever had she says to use APA format and doenst know the diff between APA and MLA she uses pre-made grading rubrics and doent give u any feedback

I felt like even if I put a lot of time, money and effort into a project I was still going to get a "check minus." Would not recommend. Does not feel like she takes into consideration that not all of the students in class are design majors - or even that students have other classes and jobs outside of her classroom.
Hilarious. I cannot thank her enough. Landed me an internship that led to a job. REALLY knows her stuff, go to class and pay attention.

You better show up in class of you are in deep s***. Tips for passing adv type. 1) DO A LOT OF WORK. 2) DO NOT JUST STICK WITH JUST ONE CONCEPT. She gave me a C- on my first project because I stuck with the same idea. 3) SHOW UP ON TIME. Her class is 8am-11:20am. 4) DO PLENTY OF REVISIONS. Do this and you might get a B. B- over here.

Peppy lady who loves type. She isn't so tough, but she is critical. She once suggest a person to take another major because she felt that Graphic Designing wasn't for him. She will tell you in a heartbeat that helvetica is better than arial (or that arial is ****ized) and once you Mac, you never go back.

Straight up person, not just some disconnected prof.  She follows all the strict guidelines of 3 strikes and you drop a grade with attendance.  But her professional knowledge, and care make her a joy to work with. Shes also very intelligent and understanding, but not someone to try and trick. If you gotta take her, be happy about it shell do good
baa

Jenn is charming, beautiful and more critical than the prior two combined. She is extremely passionate about the her craft and encourages the same vigor from her students. While her classes are difficult,they are also the core of our design coursework. Just be prepared to lose alot of sleep, and schedule easier classes when  you take her classes.

She is amazing if you are perusing a career in design.  The class is tough, but you will learn a lot.  I really enjoyed taking her class, though I wouldn't recommend taking it is you already have a heavy course load.
Buy a Macbook with creative suite before taking this Prof

Is not very familiar with technology, and tends to blame any issues on students. Fairly unapproachable, but if you participate in class, you will get on her good side. I believe she genuinely means well, but she can come off a bit rude. Course is VERY difficult, though that's not really her fault. Most of the grade comes from homework and the lab.
She is very good and cares about you

i studied last minute, crammed everything, avg test grade was 35.7% (15/42) before the final and i failed the hell out the final, but came out with a C. if you get 50% on the tests you will be fine. Hmwk and Lab accounts for +40% of the grade. Study old exam from book store. aim for 7 on each exam and u will get a B minimum

Didn't need the curve to get an A. Learned alot. Good prof. Go to class and take notes/watch & listen careful - she gives hints for exam problems and does some on blackboard. Keep up with homework. There are In class quizzes which add to a point and are possible exam questions. Work hard and you will do good.

Talks to the blackboard and has difficulty explaining concepts. Weird grading method where every point off on an exam is a point off directly from your overall grade percentage. Very hard to get a hold of outside of class hours. Better off teaching yourself online especially because attendance is only 1 percent of the grade. Super heavy curve.

Very caring and wants her students to do well. Make sure you know how to do pool of related questions from Walker's old exams from bookstore before quiz and exam. She gives hints on what questions she asks so make sure you write these down and study them.. Go to all the classes and listen to her lectures. Go to ask about material you are not clear.

Excellent Teacher. Mostly lectures  on blackboard and works out homework before due date. Always asks questions while working out problems. Hard not to do well if you pay attention and work out Walkers old exams. Gives hints on questions asked before test. Most tests have extra credit question.  Makeup test at end of year to raise your grade.

Worst teacher I have ever had to take a class with. Talked to the board for the entirety of class, always started class late, seems to know the material but could not teach to save her life. She'll even warn you at the beginning of her class to switch into another section with a different professor because she says they're better. DON'T TAKE HER!

She seems to know her stuff, but not really how to teach it. My class lectures usually consisted of her talking at the board nonstop and not explaining things as much as she should. she also wouldn't lecture on homework topics until the day they were due quite often (online hw). I found her very difficult to follow.

Vitali is a very smart and nice professor, but the problem is when she teaches at a lower level, she expects her students to completely understand every word she says and can't explain it in any other way. She knows physics, but she doesn't know how to teach a gen ed course for it.
Excellent teacher and very fair to all her students

A very tough but interesting class and she really tried to make it more understandable! I had her for 244 as well; she takes better care of her 415 and 515 classes than the lower level ones. Note that. I would recommend this teacher!
Good teacher.  Everything I expected in a college professor.  Treated students fairly.
She taught very well and made me understand physics for first time. She gives many example problems in class. If you study the book of old exams you will not have a problem.

She's very nice, don't get me wrong, but she isn't very good at teaching. I went in to her class expecting it to be reasonably difficult due to the subject material, but I honestly got nothing out of her lectures. Her tests may have been easy to someone who already understands the material well enough, but not for someone who is new to Physics.
Great professor and very fair. Study old exams and you'll have no problem.
The test questions had nothing to do with the homework. This is unfortunate because the homework should prepare you for the tests.

Very nice lady and a fair professor. The pace of class starts slow and really accelerates at the end- didn't finish material. The lecture is tolerable; the lab is hell on Earth. NO ONE knows what they are doing which was unfortunate bc it should complement the lecture-and it didn't at all. Labs on material never taught= anxiety for whole class.

Hard to understand, made mistakes in lectures that led to students being confused on exam material.  Routinely ends class 10-15 minutes late.  If you follow the handouts/notes that she gives you you should do alright on the tests and quizzes.  She never uses the textbook, don't waste your money on it.

Can be very unclear and can make many mistakes in her lectures leading to confusion.  Many test problems are nothing like the homework questions and are not always covered in lecture.  Depends on another Physics professor's curriculum instead of teaching her own and fell behind schedule.  Although she is a nice person, I would not recommend her.
Excellent professor. If you love the subject, she loves you.
Best Teacher I've had at CSU. A lot of the Film professors are great, but he has got to be the best! I've had him two semesters in a row and I hope one day to have him again.
Best Teacher I've had at CSU. A lot of the Film professors are great, but he has got to be the best! I've had him two semesters in a row and I hope one day to have him again.
He tell it like it is, what he have to say may not be interesting and fun. It will however prep you to find work or start your own company.

Good professor, no tests or books in this class. Only negative is he gives a group project and an individual project that are due a week apart. Very lenient with work though and will give chances to turn things in late.

Good teacher but has some down sides. She warns you in the first class that this is a hard course and that you will have to work to earn the grade you want. Test are hard and require hours of review because each test cover about 200 pages and 8-10 chapters. Gives quizzes at begin of most classes to see if you actual read the material before class.
Worst teacher I have ever had. Got a good grade, but not because she can teach. Definitely  has a chip on her shoulder.

This professor does not know how to teach fairly at all. She expects way too much from business students WHO ARE NOT LAW STUDENTS. I didnt become a law major for a reason. Two pop quizzes a week before you learn the material, and 50 question fill in the blank tests. I would suggest another professor for this course.

By far the worst teacher I have had at CSU. Yes, she knows her stuff. However, she is complete unable to relay the information in a helpful way. The textbook does all of her teaching. There is at least a quiz a week, usually two.  Her tests are RIDICULOUS. They cover 200+ pgs at a time with no helpful study guide.
This professor knows what shes talking about but cannot teach at all. Her tests are ridiculous and there is about 2 quizzes a week.

Participation isn't mandatory but it makes the material easier to understand because Prof goes over it in such good detail and provides many examples that are not in the slides. Material is easy if you go over it a few times or have taken prior Psych classes. Class is fun if you participate. Book helps if you don't understand but not mandatory.
EASY. EASY. EASY. He's new to CSU and was a great professor. Would take him again any day.

Great professor for not knowing he was teaching this class until a couple weeks before the semester! Really nice and understand and try's to make lectures upbeat! Wish he taught more classes at CSU bc I would take his classes for sure!

Patrick is a terrible teacher. He takes points off on tests if one doesnt explain it the way he wants but you can still get the right answer and get it marked off. He is very hard to reach outside of class. Doesnt answer any questions in class he gets off topic. Very unorganized.

Ive had Dr. Wachira for three classes now, and he is great. He has done a wonderful job at teaching me how to be a math teacher. He always replies to my emails and helps me with problems Im struggling on. He also made a lot of prep tests to help us get ready for the math OAE, which helped me to get a good score and pass the first time.

Sometimes I couldn't understand what he was explaining. .I would go on YouTube sometimes to look at tutorials for help. I was very happy to see that I passed. He is a teacher that expects you to work and prove that you're listening to what is being taught.

Ive had Dr. Wachira for three classes now, and he is great. He has done a wonderful job at teaching me how to be a math teacher. He always replies to my emails and helps me with problems Im struggling on. He also made a lot of prep tests to help us get ready for the math OAE, which helped me to get a good score and pass the first time.

I am honestly surprised that I passed the class, he was a very tough grader and didn't explain things really well even when people vividly said they were confused. A lot of people in the class with me didn't understand what was happening.
he doesnt explain well, doesnt help, makes you do the assigment first instead of going over the topic first and then trying it for yourself

This professor is one of the worst professors I've encountered in my few years at college. He is never answers emails and is not accessible outside of class. If you miss his class for a valid reason and have proof that is was a valid reason, it takes him the rest of the semester to find your make up work, which is incredibly frustrating.

He is one of the those teachers, you can not miss a class in, because if you miss a class, you miss work, and if you miss work then there is no making it up unless you have proof of why you miss it. He is an amazing teacher, he is understandable and he goes out of his way to help. He doesn't give you a grade, you have to earn the grade.

This professor makes me so mad. His teaching style is bad and I think he doesn't know what he's teaching because he often changes what he says last second. He grades tests incorrectly and he makes you really argue why you are correct even when other people have the same answer and got it right. He is hard to get in contact with outside of class

Wachira is not a good teacher at all for early childhood education math. He barely teaches and he never has the right answers then contradicts what he said the answer was. He does not respond to any emails, good luck getting ahold of him. I would not recommend taking any classes taught by him.

I thought Wachira was great! I took his course over the summer and as it was fast paced, he always made sure we understood the topics before moving forward. 3 tests and maybe 6 homework assignments for a 6 week class isn't too bad! Definitely recommend him.

He's a terrible professor. He doesn't know how to teach at all. You're better off teaching yourself. He makes so many simple mistakes and makes everyone more confused than they already are. He's disrespectful and doesn't take anything for an excused absence. He can be super nice though if you're on his good side!

one of the worst professors I've had. I got 5 points knocked off my exam because I didn't explain my answer when the question didn't even say to explain and when I asked he said it was "implied" and I got the whole question wrong for not explaining, when i had the right answer. Accent heavy, not much help to me when asking questions. Worst class.

Great professor! Challenges his students, and makes you explain your answers in depth on tests, but it's so we understand the information, and so we know how to be a good teacher. I would gladly have this professor again for more of my middle childhood education math classes!
No

I loved this class when I took it! He is the nicest teacher you could ever ask for! He explains the work in detail and teaches you excatly what it is you need know and how to do it. An added bonus to that is that he alsochallenges you to figure out how you would teach your students the material. If your're stuck, he'll help you!
I love taking his classes. High recommendations to anyone.
This professor is true to his profession!  What a great class and environment for learning.  I learned so much with his easy explanations and care in addressing all learning levels.  YOU ROCK Prof!
