Wonderful professor! Took two of his math courses as a middle childhood ed. major and he was very helpful. Not a high stressed class, very laid back. He has a strong accent which is funny to listen to, and he HAS a pretty good sense of humor! Great professor!

The time constraints on the discussion boards were kind of rediculous, but overall the class wasn't terrible.  His consumer behavior class, albeit interesting, was far too complex for the content.  Expect to participate A LOT to get a good grade.  He is a really nice guy with a good personality, but I personally do not like his teaching style .

One word...terrible. Expects too much for students (One discussion every week due before NOON on sundays, 1 midterm, 1 final consisting of multiple choice questions and essay questions, 3 group projects) and this professor is useless. By useless I mean doesn't even respond to e-mails half of the time let alone give any constructive feedback.

I had him in class and really enjoyed it, but ended up dropping his online class. Randomly assigned grades to the discussion boards, and is not clear for what he expects. Can't get full credit unless you do the discussion within 48 hours of it posted. Also, multiple group projects assigned? Ridiculous for an online class.

This class is very difficult. Don't take it unless you are really into data mining and use Excel. There were 3 separate group assignments which I think is a lot to ask, especially when the class is online. I've had Professor Wachter in class before and it was difficult but not unreasonable. If you are going to take his class don't do it online.

Expects way to much from students. I spent hours on discussions and still only received 6/10 on almost all of them. E-mailed him asking how I can improve my grade for the discussions and he was rude in response. I would recommend looking into other marketing professors before signing up for his class.

Awesome guy really, however, expected a reasonable amount of work. If you like to be lazy, like me, you wont do awesome, but well enough to pass easy. The exams were tough, mostly definitions. The projects definitely saved me, and was able to do really well on them. Always a great guy to   talk with too! great prof, youll learn a lot.

His class is by no means a breeze. He is a hard grader and while his tests are MC, they are one of, if not, the most difficult at CSU. That being said there are plenty of in-class assigments and a large group project to help boost your grade. Wachter is one of those professors you hate during the semester but love after. I came out learning a lot.

Great professor. Knows the material really well, is always prepared for class. Uses slides and posts them online. Tests are MC, two big papers and a group presentation. Learn the definitions for tests and you will be good. First test is the hardest. If you like memorizing material, this is a good and easy class.

Tests are written. He spends a lot of time talking about restaurants/food he likes-gets annoying after a while. Uses powerpoints in class and narrows down the study material (doesn't always help). Be prepared for a group project and presentation.

Great professor, always gives me the right feedback for essays and cares about what her students say or ask, definitely my best professor for my first semester of college, would 100% recommend her for any English student

Great professor, always gives me the right feedback for essays and cares about what her students say or ask, definitely my best professor for my first semester of college, would 100% recommend her for any English student

The best Professor I've ever had, super helpful and understanding. She does take attendance every day but her classes aren't a boring class that you'd want to miss. She gives really great feedback and is always open to helping you with writing or if you need a little extra time. I would 100% recommend her to literally everyone
Amazing Professor. Gives great feedback and class is enjoyable.

An expert in her field, but somehow escaped being the obsessive book-worm type (rare, I think, for philosophy experts). Her best quality is that she will come down to a  students' level during discussions, allowing students to explore their questions without feeling stupid or wrong. She made a huge difference in my education! Thanks Dr. Waithe!
Thanks for the honesty.

Professor Waithe is a harsh grader but the class only has two papers, each worth 30% of your grade. The other 40% of your grade is participation. As long as you do decent on the papers and show up for class, you'll be fine.
Class time was a fun time. Enjoys teaching and can really translate ideas well. Papers were graded fairly and hold a lot of weight. Super nice person that is very helpful and understanding.

Very flexible in classes.  Good humor and funny stories that tie in as examples of what you're learning.  Everyone says reading is a must, but I'll be honest, I didn't read and still passed with a decent grade.

Attendance counts 4 big portion of grade. 5 tests r given,& u choose 3. very thoughtful. if u do bad on 1 she will let u take another 2 ,& drop the lowest. u have the option of taking anyof them which caused less of a burden on finals week bc the tests were out of the way. Very intresting class, and great since of humor! open notes tests too!!

Attend lectures, write good notes, and read assigned readings once will most likely guarantee an A. This class is actually interesting and very thought invoking. Recommended for students interested in philosophy or ethics in general.

She's nice and with a sense of humor. She tends to give out high grades for papers, I don't know my letter grade yet but I bet it won't be bad. Remember to attend all lessons cause attendance weight a lot. Not difficult to get a decent grade I guess, but the subject itself is difficult. Good luck!

Great teacher that is knowledgeable about current trends and updates his content. We learn about something and then apply the knowledge in a group setting where we perform exercise tests on class mates. Very beneficial in helping me understand application and hes a cool guy.

Great teacher that is knowledgeable about current trends and updates his content. We learn about something and then apply the knowledge in a group setting where we perform exercise tests on class mates. Very beneficial in helping me understand application and hes a cool guy.
Overall great professor, really cares about students. Gives great explanations when asked a questions.

Study guides for all exams. No surprises. A bunch of group labs which are super easy. End of semester project and presentation that basically applies what you learned. Presentation is actually a powerpoint with your voice over. Prof is super laid back. Makes it easy to get an A and you actually learn something in this class.

This is an okay class. To get an A you have to put some effort and time into it. Class isnt mandatory but if youre not there the day of a random assignment you cant make it up. Study what he gives you for your midterm  bc its whats on it.

She is awesome and you will get in A if you do the assignments. Turn the assignments in by the due date that's all she ask. She is not a rude, or mean professor. I wish I had her for all my classes this semester.  If you want a professor who will NOT have you pulling your hair out, or have you on edge with the grading take her. Feedback is good.
Super easy class I just wished I actually learned something because it was a lot of people just saying their opinions.
Super easy class I just wished I actually learned something because it was a lot of people just saying their opinions.

Easy class. It could not have been easier than this. Final was 25 questions, and there were 2 or 3 online quizzes which you could retake as many times you wanted to get the best grade. Very careful of what he says he respects all religions and is just over-all a really nice guy and professor.

Jearl Walker is a very good teacher. He is very approachable and willing to help you if you ask. The class is very hard material-wise but if you do the homework you can basically score whatever on the tests and get a B or C. Just do the reading assignments, cause they make up a huge chunk of the grade.

Jearl Walker is a very good teacher. He is very approachable and willing to help you if you ask. The class is very hard material-wise but if you do the homework you can basically score whatever on the tests and get a B or C. Just do the reading assignments, cause they make up a huge chunk of the grade.

you can skip the whole thing and just attend the exams. his past exam which you can buy in the library is very helpful and will give you a good perspective of his exams. also do the homework and reading stuff or you will get an F even if your exams score are perfect.

He is the most fascinating individual and by far the best professor at CSU. He practically lives at CSU, so he is always available for help on anything. Plus, his dry humor is the best. I would never take physics with any other physics professor!!

Jearl is one of the best professors at CSU. His lectures and solutions manual really help on exams, which happen every week. Physics can typically be boring, but he makes everything about physics very interesting. It is quite hard to get an A, but it is also hard to get a D or F. As long as you put the work in, you will do fine.

Jearl Walker is AMAZING. If you have the chance to be his student, do it. It is my greatest regret not taking Jearl's class for Physics II as well, but alas, my schedule would not allow it. Dr. Walker is truly a wizard of physics, and you will be in safe hands in his class! He's made me love physics.

Greatest professor I have ever had. Hes super funny and super easy to learn from. Exams every week and graded on a ranking system. Do better than 50% on exams every week and you will be in good shape. Homework assignments 3-4 times a week.

Love HIM. Dr. Walker is the best. He has really changed my view on physics. After taking physics 1 & 2 with him I am considering minoring in it. Beware that we do have weekly exams. His lectures can be very interesting, be ready to laugh.

A true living legend. One of the best professors ever. However , His exam still is a bit brutal in that if you start off doing bad you might dig yourself a hole. Another compliant is how fast the course material is covered i do not remember much from the course and i just took the course a semester ago. Weekly exams. Forced me to forget abouoldexam
The most amazing professor ever!!! Made me love Physics-refer about him and how great he is since taking his class in 1983-84!!!!

Jearl is the best professor I've ever had at CSU! I am no longer terrified of physics thanks to this class. Every lecture is clear, concise, and entertaining thanks to the groupies (group classwork) and videos he shows. His "dances" (exams) are doable thanks to the old exam practice workbook from the bookstore.

Hands down the best teacher I've ever had, if you take physics you need to take his class. The class is rank based so if you are in the top certain amount of the class you get an A, homework will make a difference in that. Lectures are always entertaining and very helpful.

Learned a ton in this class. Great lectures(about 65% hm and test question review, 20% theory & concept, and 15% jokes and cool experiments or videos). Great online learning software. I sent about 10 e-mails of question over the semester and he got back to me within 16 hrs every time. Very cool, down to earth teacher and excellent teaching skills.

Jearl Walker AKA Steve McQueen is one of the greatest profs at CSU. I took Modern Physics and he broke down the difficult topics to something that everyone can understand. He does have weekly tests and hw but it is worth it.  If you ask a question and do not understand, don't worry, he has about 5 more ways to explain it to you!  -Chem. E.

Absolutely amazing prof. Makes the concepts clear and easy. I've had two classes with him now, and they were both great. He's insane. Be ready for a splash zone and lots of talk about penguins. That said, you absolutely need to do your homework and study for his weekly tests. The material is not messing around, but he's always there for you.

Jearl Walker is easily either my number one or two favorite professor at CSU. His lectures are funny as well as informative. He definitely knows what he is doing and is a great teacher. Just know that the class itself is time consuming with HW and lab. Also there is a test every week. I know next semester I will be cursing wishing I still had Jearl
Great professor; great guy. However, I did nor understand what we were doing past the basic topics. Your grade is based on your ranking among your classmates so it literally saves you.

Had Walker for both physics 1 & 2 and honestly the best professor at CSU. He really cares about he students. If you are willing to put in the work and learn you will do well. You have a lot of homework every week and an exam every week but he gives you all the tools to succeed and will do anything to help his students. If you fail then its on you.

This guy is amazing. I hate physics and he managed to make it tolerable. Gives great examples. Easy to pay attention to. Presents material clearly. The best thing about Jearl is his devotion to teaching. If you go to his office he will work as many examples as you need. It is impossible to fail this class as long as you ask for help.

Without a doubt, Jearl is the best professor I've ever had. Not only are his lectures entertaining, but they are also very helpful, as is going to his office hours. The only reason why I didn't leave a 5 for easiness is because you obviously have to work for an A in any respectable physics class. Jearl curves by class ranking. Top 15% get As, etc.
One word: AWESOME. Loves teaching, makes class entertaining, curves grades, helpful, 100% recommended.

This professor will break your sanity in one semester if you dont already know how to do every assignment she has in store for the class. She will make you write questions for her on cards then call you out in class with the most disrespectful tone. She also conducts a fanatic crusade against technology while remaining unbearable doing so.
She is the RUDEST person I have ever met. She is a terrible professor all around. She lectures every class, grades papers as if we are in English grad school, and has the worst attitude.

Literally CANNOT teach. Rather than notifying her students about when an Assignment is due, she expects them to look at the course schedule for that kind of information. She talks for long periods of time during class instead of letting us work on the TONS of essays she makes us write. Her teaching style is bad, go to the other professor instead.

Literally the rudest teacher I have ever encountered. She thinks she is so much smarter and therefore above everyone else in the room. If you ask a question she will look at you like you are the dumbest person she has ever met. Her lectures make me lose brain cells. If you don't take notes or do the worksheets she will throw the biggest fit.

She is rude and unprofessional. She talks down to her students. Taking notes during her lecture is helpful but be prepared she is a tough grader. Her attitude is just unbearable and she is not very helpful with assignments.

She is condescending, rude, her lectures are unbearable and youre not learning anything, teaches writing concepts that I learned in middle school. Wouldnt give me excused absences when I had the flu. One time she wouldnt take my paper because the staple fell out, and wouldnt give me one of her paper clips to turn it in. Dont take 102 with her.

ENG 102 is boot camp for students who didn't learn to write in highschool. Follow the template she gives you for writing your papers and you will do well. Forget to start a paragraph with a "transition word", and you'll lose a letter grade on the assessment. Absolutely mind numbing lectures.

At first, I was a little skeptical because she was very sarcastic and had a dry sense of humor. However, once we started writing the papers, she was extremely helpful because she wants you to achieve. Her office hours are always open and she was extremely helpful. I even told my roommate to switch to have her next semester!!
All over the place. She teaches multiple papers at once and is extremely difficult to approach.

Shes very tough on grading so be ready to really put effort into your papers! GO TO HER OFFICE HOURS THE FIRST WEEK!!!! She will know who you are and immediately like you better. And read her syllabus because she lives off of it.

I was always a good writer before this class. She was constantly condescending and rude and nothing was ever good enough for her. She actually liked me, and gave me more worst grades I've ever gotten in a writing class. She's constantly calling out other students and making them feel stupid. She's never clear when explaining papers. DROP HER CLASS!
This prof was very rude and was not encouraging at all. Would not at all recommend her courses!

Every question she answers will be to bring you down, she will always make you seems like you are an idiot. The toughest grader I have ever dealt with. A paper youd typically get an A on, maybe a B, get ready for Cs and Ds, nothing is good enough and you are always wrong. Dont even try to fight it cause when you do, you get attitude and no help
She liked me but she was always rude to everyone else. Does not answer questions nor really teach anything you probably don't already know but a very though grader.

This class makes hell seem warm and fuzzy. She clarifies nothing, won't answer questions and is the toughest grader I have ever dealt with. Whatever you do, don't take this class with her. I'm serious

I am a recent grad from Cleveland State, which was a totally affordable and great choice to go (except parking). I was taking a trip down memory lane the other day and remembered this old hag. In previous English classes, I did well and enjoyed it. However, she claimed everything I wrote was plagiarized. That was 4 years ago! Students beware!

She's one of the worst professors I've had throughout my whole college experience. She is not easy to appraoch, and is very rude. She doesn't have time for questions, and makes you check the syllabus, guidelines and schedule for everything you have questions about. Her expectations are way too high to teach an eng 102 course

Professor Barbara Walker expects you to have read in detail every assignment from day one. She is not available for questions and will openly state that you did not try and or don' care about her class.  Will state you should have asked her questions but when you ask she refers you to  guidelines. Confusing in papers due to multipl essays at once.

Professor Walker is intimidating at first, but is more approachable as the semester goes on. The papers are the only grades, so put forth effort and use the writing center. Don't be afraid to ask questions in class, as she doesn't answer them after.  Follow the syllabus and schedule and make sure to turn papers into TII.

She has a sarcastic, dry sense of humor and I like it! She was always extremely nice and respectful to me (she actually smiles at me haha). If you ask questions, her answer 90% of the time will be "read the syllabus". She is a tough grader, she makes this clear many times. If you follow the assignment guidelines, you shouldn't do horribly.

Wallace is a great professor. He tells you EXACTLY what is going to be on the test and then tells you EXACTLY what to put where in your paper. If you show up to class and take very detailed notes, you can easily get an A. He is also very nice and is always more than willing to help if you go to his office hours.

HORRIBLE experience. Lectures off the top of his head. No use of the black board or power point. I you ask him to repeat something he'll look at you like you're stupid then talk for 10 minuets about how he has been doing this for so long he doesn't use notes so he doesn't know what you're talking about and how you need to be more specific.

I got an A in the class and I can say he is the worst teacher ever. He really couldn't care less about the students. What he says contradicts the text book and you have to figure out what to believe and what not to. You basically have to figure out how to teach yourself.

Says exams are directly from lecture, but exams are completely foreign material even if you've taken diligent notes, studied, and read the book. No study guide, no notes, no help at all. Textbook is crap and not even used. Uses teaching materials from the 60's and never lectures what's on the exams. Never understands when black students talk, ever.
not helpful at all, class is very boring, i ended up droping his class. would not take another class with him.does not use blackboard or give out study guides. do not take his class

He tries to joke around during class to lighten the mood. Coming to class is a MUST! He gives some notes that are not in the text, but he also puts questions on test that he did not go over in lecture. No study guides, no power points, no review sessions. He stands in front of class and lectures off his notes. I wouldn't recommend

Very nice man. Tests are impossible. I would have liked this class a lot better if the tests were fair. I went to every class took detailed notes memorized the notes for tests and stil didnt do as well as i wanted.

Nice guy, tests are extremely difficult. I could have used open notes and still wouldn't have mattered. Say's tests will be on lecture notes but when test time comes it's completely foreign material. Words his questions horribly, just buy the book and make sure you read everything even though he says tests won"t cover material from book.

If you don't attend every single lecture plan to fail this course. No notes, no power points and no extra credit.  Just straight Lecture and three exams based off of the lecture.  The book is not an easy read at all and there is no online or web assistance.  Cool guy, hard class to pass though.

I had Dr. Wallace for 3 300/400 level classes. While he is a hard teacher he is a very fair teacher. If you come to class, TAKE NOTES, pay attention. You'll get an A .. problem is most people don't like to do that. And that is your fault. Not his. He isn't there to make it exciting for you! He is there to teach you, and that he does a great job of.

Bueller!! monotone is an understatement. textbook is not exactly necesarry, but helpful. I just don't understand why someone who is in psychology would make a class based on 4 tests. Doesn't he know most people aren't great test takers? I didn't have a problem with it, I'm just saying. Boring, and unreasonable.

I love psychology and it ls very interesting but taken it with Wallace made it so boring and dreadful... His test were not structured well and his grading was a fail. I would not recommend him as a professor to any freshmen

Psy 101 was very easy. Wallace seemed boring at first, because he's very monotone. Kind of like Ben Stein. But he's very knowledgeable and if you pay attention and ask questions you'll do fine. I never even bought the book, don't bother!

This professor is very hard to take. He expects you to know information to a thorough extent. Not very helpful. It is important to attend class to get notes. His critiquing is extreme. He told me I had no possibility of passing his course but some how he still passed me. AWKWARD. he has an odd sense of humor.

He is very clear when he speaks and knows what he is talking about. He wrote the book for the class! He will always clarify if something isn't understood. Gives essay exams on lectures. Doesn't take attendance but you need to go to class to get an A! Great teacher!
His voice is monotone, he is quit dry and boring

Wallace speaks in a very monotone voice, but he is hilarious if you pay attention.  He is easy, but you have to be in class for the notes.  Tells you exactly what will be on the essay tests.  The material was really interesting and he knew what he was talking about.  Was going to take him again, but moved out of state.  Amazing!

awesome professor, attending lass is a great idea, information covered is extremely interesting and kept my attention. He is a very clear lecturer and tells you exactly what you need to know. Exams require alot of writing but he clearly states what they will be on. I would suggest this class to anyone who is interested in how the mind works.
nice and clear. would benefit by adding audio visual materials. tests require lots of writing, but tells u what to study basically. solid and decent.
Great professor. Always willing to help out during office hours and explain concepts. Genuine interest in student success.
Walsh is the man!
Dr. Walsh is an amazing teacher and probably the smartest professor in the math department
Best professor I have had.
Sometimes very confusing during lecture, but his homework gives you every opportunity to do well. As long as you understand the problems and your mistakes, the exams are easy.
Dr. Walsh is a very good teacher. He is extremely clear and helpful but a little boring. If you do well on the homework and quizzes, the tests are easy
if you have his old exams you will get an easy A

Dr. Walsh is hands down one of the best professors. She is very caring and responds to emails within the hour if she can and is very accessible if you need information right away. She cares about her students and takes the time to explain to everyone what her expectations are as well as being lenient with grading. All around, great professor.

Dr. Walsh is hands down one of the best professors. She is very caring and responds to emails within the hour if she can and is very accessible if you need information right away. She cares about her students and takes the time to explain to everyone what her expectations are as well as being lenient with grading. All around, great professor.
She gives great feedback. Posts are required every week, but are not too difficult.
Great professor, easy class. Nicely organized, well thought out course. fair grader and wants you to succeed. Take her. weekly discussion board, 2 journals, 2 midterms, and easy paper.
Very nice professor! Very helpful and she wants to see you succeed. Responds quickly to emails. Highly recommended!!!

I had Dr. Walsh for two online classes this semester, HSC 305 & HSC 484. She was understanding. I probably sent her 100 emails throughout the semester asking her questions about the assignments, but she always responded quickly and was always really helpful. She's also really understanding and if you have a problem, she will gladly work with you.

Dr. Walsh truly wants you to learn the material and see you succeed. She's really open to questions and I really enjoyed her class. A wonderful teacher overall. Getting an A is definitely doable-I highly recommend her! A sweet teacher and a sweet person too!
demanding, but fair. The class is hard but you can easily get an A.

Very helpful and conscientious, she is from Case Western Univ and knows how to write, she is demanding but you will learn what your supposed to learn, and she will help you. Prof. Walsh is personable and capable.
An extremely helpful professor. Realizes that you have an outside life. Available around the clock, yes this means if you send an e-mail at 1:00 A.M. you get a reply by 3:00 A.M. So Hot... So, so Hot

Lectures were typically very interesting, and he was pretty engaging despite being in a large lecture hall. Review the powerpoints he posts and the tests should be a breeze. Not a lot of surprises on the exams, but they are the only thing you get graded by.

Dr. Walton is a great person but is not the best at teaching, lectures were basically him reading off of the slides. Before an exam, he gives review questions that are actually quite helpful with studying. I would recommend attending and rewatching recorded lectures, taking notes, and studying off of the review questions for a decent grade.

This class was terrible. There are only four grades and they're all just the exams. each question is worth 10 points so if you get even few Wrong it can tank your grade. This professor was one of the worst I have ever had.

Lectures were typically very interesting, and he was pretty engaging despite being in a large lecture hall. Review the powerpoints he posts and the tests should be a breeze. Not a lot of surprises on the exams, but they are the only thing you get graded by.

Great professor, uses quizzes and tests for grade, no homework. Also gives study questions for the quizzes (the quizzes are taken directly from the study questions.) If you're someone who doesn't study the material then don't take him. Show up to class, go over the assigned readings, and study, you'll get an A.

Great teacher. Great lectures. No HW just 2 midterms and the final. Will curve your grade if he sees you do better on each test. Very smart. Knows what hes talking about and lectures do get interesting

Dr. Walton is a very nice person, but his lectures were considerably boring. Most of the class doesn't even show up to his lectures. Questions from the exam refer to the lectures and the textbook. If you want to do well, make sure to attend class, pay attention, make notes, and study the textbook.
Very knowledgeable man and knows what hes talking about, but not a great professor. No textbook. No info on slides. Make sure to attend class and listen to what he says.

Dr. Walton does nothing but simply read straight from his Power-points. His format of the class is nothing like the syllabus. He gives random quizzes and the review questions are not helpful at all. Though he is very knowledgeable in the subject matter, he simply lacks the skills to teach it to others. Very boring.

Dr. Walton is smart, but not a very good professor. The only time he will ever email is if class is cancelled. Don't bother emailing him with questions on the material. It will take him 100 years to respond. His lectures are from powerpoints so if you don't go to class, you won't know the material. Terrible at keeping up with grades on blackboard.
Review questions he gives you don't help. Missing class failed exam. Not accessible outside of class (doesn't answer emails at all).  Use the textbook to study and learn the Latin names.
So much reading and most of the powerpoints are missing slides he adds before class so attendance is important as he uses those on exams.

Look, the man is knowledgeable but does not know how to run a class. Class participation is there but 4 tests? I hardly consider that appropriate assessment of knowledge.  Personally suck at tests but still there should be some cushion besides his... let's say intriguing way of curving.

Dr. Walton is extremely knowledgeable of the course material. He always goes above and beyond adding his own and his colleagues research to lectures to show real world applications for the course material. He is very passionate and it definitely shows  making the lectures very enjoyable. He is very easy going and always willing to chat.

His tests are extremely tough, but fair. If you don't go to class you will not understand the material. He lectures beyond the book using charts, graphs, and his own personal stories. He's a great professor, and I intend to take more classes with him. He challenges you to learn the material, and apply it to scenarios on exams.

If you don't go to class, you won't understand his PowerPoints consisting of mostly graphs with no explanations- you have to take notes yourself for sure. Math on the tests. Biggest thing to study for all tests- know all the experiments discussed in class and why we study them (what they taught scientists). Interesting lectures!
Great and not bad looking either.
The lectures where not that bad, definitely knew his stuff and loves frogs!!! However, the test seemed very inconsistent which cost me the A.

Fantastic professor, very kind, caring, and has the patience of a saint (there was a student in the class that would constantly interrupt him and he never lost his cool). Taking him for Conservation Biology next semester!

Very knowledgable and interested in subject, however, it takes at least a week for Dr. Walton to post exam grades. It's a joke. Otherwise, he puts all of his lectures online and is great. But seriously, a week to ten days for grades, just rediculous.
Great and caring professor.
Cant understand him does not really teach. He act like you should know what is going on. when you ask for help he does not help waste of time and money I had to teach my self

Took the class over the summer.  Ken is great at certain things (grading, updating his website, subject knowledge and all round fairness) and bad at others (clear instruction, clear cut assignments, and comedy :) ).  Bad news: be prepared to teach yourself a lot.  Good news: the Sams Textbook/code/website files used in the course are awesome!

His class is rather easy, and he teaches off a power point presentation which is pretty good.  Has a tad bit of a chinese accent.  He was a pretty good teacher for the beginning information, but cant explain the more complex data structures (red-black trees, 2-3-4 trees.  He's an Avg teacher

I took him last semester, he only posted PowerPoints and weekly homework assignments. He didn't post any audio recorded slides or videos that explained complex topics. You just read the slides, take notes and teach yourself finance. His exams are pretty difficult, but he gives you enough time to finish them.

Doesn't explain what is required of the course. Designs his own assignments plus assigns online assignments without telling students this. Does some in class examples (shows on the board how to complete them) but doesnt actually teach anything. Expects 8 coding exercises to be done every week on top of quizzes, debug exercises and more online work.

He's a Brilliant professor. Gave a lot of opportunities from the start to get a B or better. Various on the quizzes help prepare for the actual exam. Very patient and answers questions with ease. Passionate about improving students financial knowledge rather than only complete what's on the syllabus.

Tough subject and obvious language barrier. Exams and quizzes are hard and he writes them himself, so you need to keep the language barrier in mind when reading the multiple choices. Having said that, he is very fair with test questions. He is quick to grade assignments and very responsive. I settled for B, because I could opt out of final!!

He knows the subject very well but tends to focus on easy topics in class. But if you see him outside class, he will address all concerns. Finance tests are tough. He takes quizzes and emphasizes attendance.

Very good, knowledgable professor. I personally struggled with the material despite reading the chapters and the studying prior to tests. Is a fair grader and gives partial credit. Definitely show up to class because there are pop quizzes every class,.

This was a tough class. Real nice guy, but it was very difficult for me to understand him. This was my first time back in school in three years so I hadn't remembered a lot of the concepts from previous undergrad classes which made it more difficult.

Excellent teacher. Really takes his time to make sure you understand the topic, although sometimes he can be difficult to understand. Syllabus is clear and his testing is very fair. If you have to miss class for any reason he goes out of his way to make sure you can make up the material.

Each class, he reads slides and there is an open-note quiz. Online hmwk assign due weekly. Group presentation at end of sem. The exams are the hardest part because you just dont know what he will put on there and the reviews only halfway help.  BUT he does curve and give partial credit. All in all, its a hard class but he isnt a bad prof.

I'm A student and after alot of hard work with no sleep I got B- his accent isn't that clear and I don't believe that he really understand finance his test and quizes are difficult nothing from Hw or reviews  I wouldn't recommend him at all

Can't say enough good things. He's beyond fair with grading (let's you pick 2 answs for multiple choice and gives partial credit).  You have to do online assignments every week- but they're easy points, quizzes are open book open notes (you can even use your phone to look up things online). You actually learn a lot. Highly recommended.
Professor Wei class is not easy but definitely achievable. Sets clear cut criteria. You only fail if you don't study and don't try !!

Dr. Wang is an excellent professor. CSU is lucky to have him. Very knowledgable in finance and enjoys helping his students. Replies to emails almost immediately (I've emailed him MANY times for help). Fair curve on exams. He does have an accent, but he also has a better understanding of the English language than most students. Definitely recommend.
Awful class. He is hard to understand through his accent. No homework but gives lots of tests and quizzes. Will only help during office hours.  Would NOT recommend, take anyone else.

Professor Wang is a decent professor. He does ridicule students, but that doesn't bother me too much. Pop quizzes are pretty easy (basically just a review of the lecture material he just covered). Tests are tricky, but if you understand the homework then they're not too bad, still expect to get a lower grade than usual on them. Do the homework!

Professor Wang is a decent professor. He does ridicule students, but that doesn't bother me too much. Pop quizzes are pretty easy (basically just a review of the lecture material he just covered). Tests are tricky, but if you understand the homework then they're not too bad, still expect to get a lower grade than usual on them. Do the homework!

The professor randomly asks questions to the students. This is not that bad, but he will giggle and laugh when student give a response. I do not know if he thinks the answer is bad or dumb or he sees the student as dumb but this is programming we are trying to learn new things. Also he doesn't teach required info and stack overflow is necessary.

The students review/present papers weekly, which is engaging. Midterms are given on campus. Although, there's usually a language barrier for the professor and he tends to make fun of the students and laughs when he misunderstands a situation. The questions he asks are usually very generic but he expects very specific answers which makes no sense.
i still have nightmares from this guy, probably one of the most rutheless profs of all time, avoid him at all costs

DO NOT TAKE HIM FOR ANYTHING MORE THEN 340. God awful experience wasted my time and money. Refused to help students understand concepts better, didnt give any feedback. The TA graded super strict and tests were extremely hard. Average for projects was below a 50, and test averages were 60-70. More then 50% of the class is likely going to fail.

well, i took the summer class for CIS265. it is a hard class but that professor... he just makes everything harder; when you ask a question he answer with a sarcastic tone as if your question is too dumb to be asked. he always assumes that we know everything he knows. his exams are confusing. even if you ask for clarification, he would seem mad

Dr. Wang is definitely a hard professor but you really master the topic after his class. He is very good at explaining things. His exams use very similar questions as his pop quizzes which he goes over in class. This class requires a lot of effort and time but it's worth it.

Honestly doesn't deserve the bad rap he gets. If you show up to class and bother to take notes on what he says, he basically tells you how to do the assignments. The tests aren't too bad if you have a passing familiarity with Linux, as any programmer at this level should. Prepare to work for your grade, but he is not unreasonable.

How can I tell you to pick another professor. If you have prior experience with data structures etc feel free to take this class. But if you are a new Programmer (less than 3 or 4 years) do not take him. Very difficult class with a professor who is not very great or effective at teaching student.

Torture-Worshipper Daemon. He gives lots of homework, pop quizzes, and his lectures are all bad. You must be prepared for hours of endless studying and using outside help. It will weed out the weak for only the strongest of daemons can pass.

Everyone who's failed in his class either doesn't show up or doesn't study for his course. All the homework is literally given out and since it's a cs course, you're obviously expected to do the rest. The midterms were tough I admit, but so far, I've enjoyed taking his class. TAs are very good with helping too.

He is hands down the worst professor I have ever had. Every note he gives is hand written on the board which takes up most of the lecture. You have to figure out on your own what lines of code you need to use for the homework which are vague at best. He will never answer your questions no matter what you do. Find any way to avoid him.
He said that programs not compiled in a junior-level class should receive zero grade. He is strict, but fair.
Just like other school, Data Structures is a weed out course in Computer Science.

Terrible professor, he doesn't enjoy helping you understand the material. If your program does not compile or compiles correctly he won't give you partial credit it's just a zero, and his programming assignments are quite lengthy. So imagine spending a week on that assignment and receiving no grade for it. Avoid him if you can.

I don't have any positive words about this prof. It was the hardest class I've had to take, period. The grade I earned really affected my GPA. My advice is sit, take notes, but go home and read online a lot, watch videos, and do problems on the net. Do HW. Show up, there's pop quizzes. Manage your time, get the points, every little bit counts.

Projects are very time-consuming and you cannot get help from your classmates regarding the codes. Says no C programming experience is needed but barely glosses over important concepts and expects you to be an expert on the projects. You will receive a 0 on projects if you have any errors or warning messages.
He is surely tough But if study hard with him You will learnt a lot  Due to his teaching i am more interested in coding

Haodong Wang is good in his field, but he is bad professor.  Wang's English is often broken which makes it hard to understand. Further more, he insists on giving us notes by writing them on the chalkboard and when someone asks a question on the material or their code, he refuses to give any help & insists we figure it out ourselves by "googling it"

This guy is difficult and brings a lot of negativity to the people around him, including other departments within the school.  I once called the graduate and admissions office about administrative issues  I was having with my degree and when they realized they needed feedback from Wang on a certain matter, they both refused to deal with him.

FUN. Best describes him. I never used the textbook, so consider not buying it. This is an easy, graduation requirement fulfilling class. He makes it fun, informative, but is aware that not everyone in the class is there to be anthropologists. He does give a good pitch for the field always. Please just be respectful, this professor deserves it.

Dr.W is amazing. This class was NOT for my major, but I learned so much. He makes the class interesting and FUN! Definitely a solid choice for a professor. Weekly discussion boards and 2 exams. He provided extra credit (5,5,5 points extra) if you attended zoom lectures from colleagues. Great Professor & great class. Do yourself a favor and take it.

Professor Wanyerka is one of the friendliest professors I've had and has great insight in his lectures. The material might seem a bit overwhelming, but he makes it widely available for studying through his power points. Also he gave great comprehensive reviews that really help prepare you for exams. Would definitely recommend.

FUN. Best describes him. I never used the textbook, so consider not buying it. This is an easy, graduation requirement fulfilling class. He makes it fun, informative, but is aware that not everyone in the class is there to be anthropologists. He does give a good pitch for the field always. Please just be respectful, this professor deserves it.

Very very funny! He is very into his work, ask him about how he got into his field, the stories he has are awesome!!! He has so much experience, it is amazing that he teachers more than he digs! His tests are simple, do his study guides and show up to review day (class before exam)- and do his extra credit! A lot of EC opportunities!
The best

An absolute gem in the anthropology department. Phil is sarcastic, goofy, and if you just show up and listen to lecture I think it would be difficult to fail. If you have questions on the material, JUST GO VISIT and he will give you more info than you were looking for in the first place. He likes students to be involved and rewards participation.

Very funny guy. Offers a lot of extra credit opportunities both in and out of class. his only grades are a few multiple choice tests that he goes over the day before! Never uses textbook. His power points are on blackboard but paying attention in class will get you a good grade.

This will definitely go down as one of the easiest classes ive ever taken. Attendance is big so show up! There are only 3 tests and he reads you the exam and answers (including the final) the class before. He's a really cool guy if you show up, and he offers sooo much extra credit. Totally recommend this class for easy A!
The best professor at CSU handsdown. Has a unique sense of humor and his lectures are always interesting. He loves what he teaches which will make you love it too.
the best !

Phil is one of the best ANT prof's at CSU. Offers tons of extra credit and goes over the tests in class the day before, giving out the answers basically. Lectures are really interesting and he talks a lot about the work he's done which is really cool. I would absolutely recommend any of his classes.

This was the senior seminar course. I really enjoyed phil, but this course did not prepare me for my future in anthropology.  Overall the course is easy, you basically just work towards a huge presentation at the end of the semester. You also gather stuff for graduate school if you choose to follow up with school.
The lectures are boring, but he gives you study guides for the tests, all the powerpoints are online, and the day before the class he goes over the tests and lets you record him giving the answers.
He is a really great professor and he is very knowledgeable. His class is very easy class and he gives many opportunities for extra credit, all you have to do to pass is to be in class.

Such a cool guy, and great professor. Really laid back, tells funny stories, and makes everything easy and clear. He has great experience and knows what he's talking about. Tests are easy and there's a ton of extra credit offered. Everyone loved him and I know people that switched their major after having him.

Dr. Wanyerka (Phil) is dedicated and loves archaeology.  Funny, caring, and reasonable, he has a gruff exterior but is kind and helpful.  If you work hard he recognizes it.  Don't hesitate taking classes with Phil.  You'll be all the better for it.

Class while it is not the most exciting material to me was not difficult. He offers extra credit all the time, just write a one page paper about anything we discussed in class and get 10 bonus points on a 300 point class and no limit to the number of assignments you can do! Loved the class for these reasons and he is a very nice guy.

Awesome teacher. Easily in my top 10 favorite teachers in my entire student career. Funny guy, Very passionate about his subject. Quite literally a real life Indiana Jones (but does not look a thing like Harrison Ford).  Terrific lectures and tests are not bad at all.
Hands down one of the best professors at CSU!

This teacher and course was phenomenal! I left the course with a deep desire to learn more. I saved all of the powerpoints so I could view them again. The instructor does not give an overbearing amount of work. It's easy to get an A and he also gives extra credit opportunities. After 5 1/2 years in college, I enjoyed this class more than any other.
Good and well organized professor expects the same from students.
u can get a good grade just by coming to class, and FOCUS when doing the assignments. tests are from the assignments and handouts he would pass. not too hard, really

Overall Waren was awful. He didnt give nearly enough examples for programs,and flew threw the examples he did give.  He said the first day of class that the book we had bought was next to useless.  This made the class extra hard.  Unless you enjoy torturing yourself, avoid this guys classes.  He's a nice guy, but that is not what we pay for.

Not sure why everyone loves him on here.Most of the class would fail his tests, had to give re-tests or extra credit to make up for that. Doesn't post enough examples on blackboard, usually forgets to post examples.He's a really nice guy but when most of the class is always failing,then that is not a good sign.His tests are M/C,T/F,coding problems.

Outstanding professor. One of the best in the IT department. Dr. Warren and Dr. Matos should teach ALL IST classes. If you have at least a little bit of interest in class and just a tiny bit of intelligence, you will learn a ton in his class and get an A+. Doesn't trick you on exams, explains everything clearly. Great classa and a fantastic prof.
No Comments

You must be a dumb idiot if you don't understand Waren's lectures. All you need to get an A in class is simply COME TO CLASS. No need to study for exams if you do all your homework. Dr.Waren is very clear, very helpful, and you actually LEARN HOW TO PROGRAM in his classes - no need to read the book if you simply come to class and pay attention.

This guy almost single handedly made me drop out of college. I dont't even like computers anymore because of him and to this day I am still thinking about changing my major because of this guy. He makes programming impossible to learn. Hopefully Matos is better than this joker.
I hate this guy.

This teacher can be pretty tough if you never had programming before. He follows the book loosely. Some of the things he taught us were not in the book so that could be troublesome for some people. I have had two semesters of programming before I took this class, so this is pretty easy for me. If you're new to programming, I recommend someone else.

Yeah right this guys tests are easy. Maybe for someone thats been programming in their garage since age 6. On the 1st test, only 5 people got a c or above, the rest failed it. He had to give extra credit to boost our grades because it was so hard. We just had the 2nd test and it was 10 times worse than the 1st. If he's the best Id hate to see worse

Outstanding professor! If you find a better programming professor at CSU than him - show me. Explains everything VERY CLEARLY. Is very knowledgeable of the subject. Homework is interesting and straightforward. The exams are easy - if you did your homework, you don't even need to study for the exams much. Excellent professor!

The guy isn't that good of a prof. He's old and doesn't explain what to do on the homework before he assigns it, leaving you frustrated. Unless you've had some programming before, I would try to avoid him.

This is the BEST professor I have EVER had! Explains the material VERY CLEARLY. Great interaction with the students. He is VERY FAIR in grading homework, exams. Will explain the material until everyone in class gets it. Fabulous professor! I will take as many IST courses with him as I can!!!
Really cares about his students! Easy class
He is one of the Best instructors I had, He gives real examples from the industry, and he is up to date in his specialty
He is one of the best instructors I had

Easily the worst instructor I've ever had. I got an easy A, but didn't learn anything and the class stressed me out way more than it should have. He has absolutely no idea what he is doing - over a week into our online class he didn't know he was even teaching it and he didn't have blackboard up and running yet. Very unclear about assignments.

The professor is very disorganized. The readings are either from subscription sites or outdated links; does not update URLs and still tests over that material. His tests cover the most obscure facts from readings. He rarely responds to student e-mails. He is overly critical of final assignment and does not provide timely feedback. AVOID!

I would greatly recommend to take any other professor than him. He makes class extremely difficult to understand. He does not teach us anything from the textbook and our classmates had to teach us each chapter. He doesn't go over expectations for assignments or what he is looking for. Just don't take him. Anyone, but him.

Laziest teacher I've ever met. Half of the semester is group presentations, each group covers a chapter of the textbook and is then expected to teach that chapter's content to that class. Rest of the class is spent watching movies, basic discussions. He doesn't cover the textbook material. Honestly, just take another class.
I do not recommend this professor what-so-ever. 250 level class with material of a 400 level class. You've been warned. Don't suffer like I did.
The worst professor I ever had in my life. Totally disgrace to the CSU. I graduated from two colleges Xavier and CSU and she is just awful.

If you are a international student DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS. Let me tell you I am not a international student but my best buddy is. We have literally cross checked our assignments and presentations and she really is on to something against international students here. You will waste your money she will not give any international student more than a B

Okay - I just completed Dr. Webbs GAD class for graduate students. Here's the scoop - Overall, the class isn't bad as far as assignments, I ended up with an A- and didn't try very hard. However, her main issue is she is very unclear with directions. She contradicts herself most of the time so students are confused as far as what's expected of them

I wanted to like Dr. Webb the 1st day of class - but so hard to like someone that can't explain the meaning of words that she used.  If we asked a question, she would tell use to look at the syllabus.  Her notes were in a crazy format, and she kept changing specifics for the assignments.  She was nice during office hour but this class was BAD!

I'm going to steal from the movie, "Billy Madison." This is exactly what was going through my head throughout the semester: "Professor, what you have just said is one of the most insanely idiotic things I have ever heard. At no point in your rambling, incoherent response were you even close to anything that could be considered a rational thought. Everyone in this room is now dumber for having listened to it. I award you no points, and may God have mercy on your soul."

Im unsure why everyone is so hard on Dr Webb.  If you go to class and do your readings and assignments you will do fine. I got an A in her class. She wants to see you trying.  I think she is very fair.

She was a horrid teacher, If you can avoid her do.  Her tests come from the book nothing she goes over in class will be on any test.  Also her grading of papers made no sense.  I got an A- but it was the worse class I have taken.  Last she pushes her religous views on you and if you dont agree she gets upset.

Please don't take any class from her. She does not like international students. After class she did not provided any feedback form which is mandatory for professor to give out. She does not actually teach anything just assignments and nothing else paid 2000 for to learn to write 3 letters, one report and 1 presentation FINA LWORD BIG NO TO HER CLAS

The worst teacher I have ever taken at CSU by far. Really if you don't have to take her avoid her at all costs. Impossible to get an A in her class. She has the class teach some of the material instead of herself and her lectures are straight from ppts that she cannot give out. It's amazing how with so many negative reviews she's still teaching.

You MUST do everything EXACTLY the way she wants it done (if you can figure that out). She doesn't hate foreigners, but expects well-written ENGLISH. If your writing is shaky, her class won't make it better (she'll just say to read a chapter in the book). Take a lower GAD class first, even if it was waived. Oral presentation part of class was ok.

Very painful lectures, reads straight from the slides and mispronounces names of foreign cities and local companies. Tests were extremely difficult and term papers graded very harshly. Would never take any classes with this professor in the future and would recommend she retire from her teaching career.

Hard to understand her grading and her feedback.  She in not a great proofessor by any stretch, but it is valuable to improve writing and presentation skills so just make the best of it. Don't argue with her, it will only hurt any grade to be given after that.

If you are international students, please beware this teacher!  I know my English is not perfect, but it is not better because of her, and she hates everybody not American.  Don't take!  You will not learn and you will got bad grade!

i had this lady 3 semesters ago and I still hate her. She still holds her title of worst teacher ever. I got an A in the class (no thanks to her) but that is after I went to her boss, who told me she gets frequent complaints, and she is only teaching because of her husband and tenure, and there was nothing he could do to fire her. Should be ashamed

She is the worst teacher i had so far. her tests are impossible. she force students to talk and participate by putting them on the spot and embarrassing them. her grading for the papers we had to submit did not make any sense, she would still fail your paper even if you get an A on it. DO NOT TAKE HER CLASS. AVOID HER.

There is only one way to get a good grade in this class. Do EXACTLY what she tells you to do. Dont question her and dont try to be creative. Just simply follow her instructions. I learned from her presentations exercises. They did serve their intended purpose. I could not understand her grading method.

I personally learned a lot in her class. She teaches with passion and one of the main course objectives is to learn how to do effective presentations.Listen to what she seeks in a presentation and try to follow her requirements and she will recognize your efforts.

Where to begin....it was horrible. She doesn't know the material and sometimes confuses herself during class.  She can't spell things like veteran (she wrote veterine!)At one point she preached at us and tried to poll the class about abortion rights! Bottom line...every time she opened her mouth, I threw up a little.
VERY BADDDDD VERYYY BADDD I DON'T KNOW WHY SHE'S STILL TEACHING ....AVOID HER, BUT NOT THE CLASS
She is very vague about what she wants in assignments and grades really harshly.

She did not truly follow syllabus. It was an online class and only the quizzes and few other assignments popped up under the calendar and apparently the good amount of assignments I had missed because I could not find them under any file and she said that they were in one place when they weren't. She grades very tough, its ridiculus

Needed a 300 level elective and the concepts in this class sounded somewhat interesting, and they could have been had I taken it with a different professor. She is SO rude! I emailed her with questions & could not believe how she responded. I ended up getting in contact with a previous Psych instructor for help. She picks and chooses how to grade.

She is the worst professor there is. AVOID AT ALL COST. She has the biggest attitude and has a syllabus that she does not even follow. If you miss one concept she will take all points away. Her comments are rude as well. She has absolutely no sympathy to personal problems such as a death in the family or personally issues. AVOID

Comes off a bit rude. Maybe shouldn't teach online classes. Not sure how she is in person. I plan on going above her & will be doing my course evaluation (which i hardly ever do) I really think the campus should be aware of her poor grading scale and inability to give clear directions in a pleasant manner. No one wants to pay 5,000 for rudeness

Just by corresponding with her via e-mail I found her pretty rude. She accused me of not really reading the material because I submitted several assignments before the due date within a week or 2. It really offended me & I even stopped replying to her messages, Then the next assignment she graded of mine she gave a 6/12 in retaliation.
You do use your book She doesn't answer email so good luck you do activities once a week  and a quiz every two chapters don't know if she is really invested in teaching
Would not recommend this teacher, she has zero interest in engaging with her students and comes of rude in comments. Prepare to self teach in this class

There was a lot of tough info in this class but it was fairly simple. Easy participation points with a weekly discussion board comment and weekly activities. Only two tests that had questions right out of the textbook. Overall, easy class. She can nitpick with grades though, so watch out for that.

Horrible teacher. Does not explain course material, simply gives a link to explain the chapter and that's it. You email her asking for advice and she takes days to respond, weeks! She doesn't grade in a timely manner, takes at least a month to grade an assignment. Also very rude in emails and is not interesting in helping her students.

This class was very complex. Meaning there is a lot of information to take in! But I can honestly say that the discussion board was very helpful! So dont be afraid to ask questions! She is willing to take her time and give explanations! The BOOK is needed for this class to do weekly exercises. Questions on exam are in the same order of the BOOK.

Finished her class with a high A. Make sure you do all of the work. Hew HW assignments are confusing & sometimes wrong, but she grades those on meritcompletion. Answered questions quickly. Most test questions can be found verbatim on quizlet & similar. Textbook is necessary for other q's. Basically, easy class if you put the effort into it.

This class is tougher than it should be. That said I thought her course was well structured and it was understood when everything was due. There isn't a lot of points so every assignment carries weight. I finished less than 1 point away from an A and was not rounded up. if you do the work and follow the do dates you should do fine.

Based the class off a total of 206 points with no fractions, meaning any mistakes have significant impact. Tests were only 2 questions, meaning if you misunderstood just one thing, it would be half the grade. The teacher just didn't seem interested in putting much effort in the class. It's not that the material's hard, but she makes it hard.

I did like that she incorporated exercises into this online class, but she never taught anything. Her expectations for assignments were unclear, I thought I did everything required but would find out otherwise. Deviated from the syllabus a lot, creating some confusion. Test questions were tricky or based on minute detail.

This teacher is horrible. Believe me when I tell you DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS! She has no office hours online. She is not timely with grading or answering questions. She is very rude when she finally gets back to you. She makes simple psychology terms hard. She lives in COLUMBUS! I am disspointed in CSU for hiring such a terrible teacher.
Class was a bit interesting, takes awhile to grade papers and respond to emails. Class in not hard at all just follow the schedule she gives and you will earn an A in her class

this is an online class, the book is useless and does not give clear concise explanations of concepts. The instructor is contradictory in what she expects from students. no extra credit, so if you miss questions you are pretty much screwed grade wise. The material is not hard its just the way it is presented, as if i never took a psych class.

This is the WORST professor I've ever had. Everyone in my class is struggling, and until this terrible woman, I had all As and Bs.  We are all psychology majors, but suddenly we don't understand simple psychology terms that we've known for years?!? She's the worst. I don't know how she is still employed. She's a complete witch.

Not a very good teacher. Asking her something made students feel like they were an inconvenience, study guides/notes don't help much for tests, and being an online class, that says a lot. Quizzes are simple, so is homework. I wouldn't recommend her though
Very helpful, research paper sucks

I had hard time finishing all assignments. She doesn't write insructions of papers clearly very much. I got a good grade but if you have another hard class to take, I don't recommend others to take classes with her at the same time.

This instructor is definitely not for slackers.  He challenges students to go beyond just memorizing answers.  You actually have to learn the information and then apply it, critically thinking to solve problems.  Though he is demanding, he is  always willing to work with individuals who need extra help.  "A's" are earned, not given.

I DO NOT RECOMMEND TAKING ANY CLASSES BY THIS PROFESSOR. As a student with a 3.75 GPA and a strong learning ability, I managed to get a B- but not without developing an ulcer first. You have to read the textbook and teach everything to yourself. The homework is ridiculous (You will need to Google the answers) and the tests are irrelevant. Beware!

class is hard. if you do not have a general background in chemistry you will be lost. teaches the class as if you should already know instead of just learning. open to helping but even in that still teaches as though you should know and its a review. if your not strong in chemistry, i wouldnt recommend taking him

This professor is not the best but he will definitely help you if you go for help. READ! READ! READ! and make sure you attend lecture, sometimes he will mention material not in the book. His tests are difficult and this is not an easy class overall. Study end of chapter ?s and putting it together ?s and read and you will do fine.
Very helpful. All you have to do is go ask him a question and he is a HUGE help!
Hard class. Tests are hard...even if you study...He is very helpful in regards to if you need help.

Teaches this class more like a general chem 2 class that just a college chem 2 class. He is very picky when it comes to take parts of the test and they are very time consuming. There is HW but plenty of time to do it and sometimes his review sessions are games for bonus. Overall it was an okay class
He's very awkward, and makes it uncomfortable to go see him during office hours. Did it once and then never again. COLD CALLS like crazy, and will continue to badger you with additional questions.

Professor Weinstein definitely makes you work, but if you put in the work you will get a lot out of his class. He has tremendous knowledge on property and zoning law. The readings are required and he will call you out in front of the class to comment on the readings. There is a learning curve if you are not a law student.

Property is one of the toughest first year courses and he is a tough professor. That being said; I studied hard, took good notes, and read some supplements to understand the hardest material. I got a B and felt good about it. He is entertaining and a nice guy.

Overall a very fair and tough teacher. Take lots of practice tests and pay close attention to the way he answers hypos, that is where I went wrong this semester. He is very helpful and approachable. One complaint=covers a lot that will not be on the test or bar. However, that also made it more "real world" friendly.

Professor Weinstein is an outstanding lecturer.  Also, his exam questions and answers actually make sense, his participation grading is fair to everyone, and he answers e-mail inquiries quickly, clearly, and respectfully.  Plus, the dude's pretty funny.

Weinstein is tough when it comes to torts from what I hear.  I had him for property the one semester he taught it and he was easy to get along with and assigned very little reading which was a blessed breath of fresh air first year when everyone else was assigning 40 pages a class.  I got a B out of it.

This Professor is known to compromise the anonymity process regarding exam taking. He looks at each persons exam number as he hands in his exam. He also leaks grades to certain people before the grades are posted on campusnet. So, be careful.
The man is unclear and impossible to get a question to.  However, he is very easy on the eyes, which earned him the nickname of "Silver Fox."

His multiple choices are difficult, but not impossible if you study the material and practice the multiple choice format a bit.  He is extremely intelligent and a great teacher.  He is extremely respectful/approachable for both men and women.  He does not appreciate/tolerate students who are disrespectful, rude, think they know more than they do.

Weinstein's final/midterm are VERY tricky.  The class is very interesting and the prof. has a witty humor.  He expects a lot out of class discussions and tends to pose tricky hypotheticals to students when they are responsible for material.  He is a very fair professor despite and does not embarrass students when they are tripped up on material.

Administers Tests which have faulty answers! He Does not take time to prepare his tests nor to prepare for class. He rushes out of class before students have a chance to ask him questions. He is extremely rude and demeaning especially to women.

Takes two weeks to respond to emails in a six week class.  Her feedback on assignments is unbelievably general and she grades all of her students at the Masters level- even if you are an Undergrad.  I should have had no problem getting an "Easy A" in this clas; however her total ineptness made this impossible

Good proposal writing course online. She knows her stuff, and I learned a lot. She is very fair on grading, even providing grading rubrics in the syllabus. She is very slow to repond to emails/questions, and some aspects of the course ran late, giving us all a late start on the final proposals. Would actually recommend taking this in class.

Gina is an angel. I took Writing Proposal online and she is extremely helpful and caring person. I recommand a lot of people to take her class. She, along with her personality makes writing proposals a lot easier.

Sharon was very clear with her expectations at the beginning of the course: show up, practice and do the out of class activities. If you do all of these things, you will get an A! Remember, you are taking ASL, so expect to learn more than just the language and about the deaf culture that it is derived from.

It is hard to learn a language when she wants you to learn everything from a bad book. She only talks about herself, and is not a caring professor. If you have to miss more than 2 days, drop her. There could be worse but there is also better. Makes you work super hard for a passing grade.

Okay class, but she doesn't post grades except at midterm/final so you have to keep track yourself. Attendance is for points and needed because the textbook is awful and you cannot learn it at home. She knows the book is awful but still uses it in class for some reason. A few assignments make up your entire grade, but is an easy grader on projects.

The best way to learn ASL is by signing- its that simple. Sharon didnt involve her students in hands on activities. She expected us to learn our vocab at home, by ourselves, with a textbook. This is an extremely ineffective teaching method, especially for learning a new language. Her students need to sign to each other in class.
She was rude and not helpful for any of the assignments given, she made nasty comment to other students and myself. I would never take one of her classes again.

I've taken professor Weisman for Sign I and II and loved her both times! Show up to class, video her during the exam prep day, do all the work and extra credit and there is no reason you shouldn't get an A!

Professor Weisman is great! If you show up to class and do the work there really isn't any way you can't pass. But you need to COME TO CLASS and practice your signs! She gives lots of easy quizzes, papers, and other assignments to make up the difference if you don't do so hot on the midterm or final.

Very friendly and wants to get to know her students.  She's very open to sharing what's going on in her life and tries to make the class fun, even if that means taking over 2 months to finish up presentations due at the beginning of the semester because she doesn't want to do anything for too long.  Fun class, and she is obviously passionate.
Great at supporting her students. Always willing to help.

Love her!  I have always had a hard time with languages and she made it all make sense.  She signs a little fast during class but slows down for the tests.  Go to class and study and you'll do good.  CSU needs to get her to do ASL 3 and 4

She was the BEST ASL professor Ive had. I have learned so much from her. Goig into ASL IV all think about is everything Ive learned from her. I HIGHLY Recommend taking her for ASL! By far the best ASL Professor. Shes fun, funny and very nice. She helps you understand all of the material. When they hired her they knew what they were doing!

Sharon wants you to learn to sign naturally, she does more than just teach the book. She naturally incorporates words so that by the time you get to the next chapter you all ready known half the words. Yes its true she does fingerspell words kinda fast but she is an amazing teacher and a very friendly person. Take her for ASL, you won't regret it!

Professor Weisman was one of my favorite teachers so far at CSU. She loves what she does and is very knowledgable. Make sure you go to class and you will be fine. She signs alittle fast BUT she slows down for exams. She made me love the language!

She is the best teacher I've had at CSU, there's no reason you shouldn't get an A. I loved her and she has a real passion for sign language and the deaf community. She wants you to be able to sign just like anyone else can who is fluent. MY favorite teacher :)

Absolutely a wonderful teacher. If you attend the classes, participate and study the material, there's no reason you shouldn't receive an A in the class. She's extremely understanding and very helpful. I missed a class due to illness and she spent a little time after class to go over the material I missed. One of the best teachers at CSU.

Sharon is a wonderful teacher and person. She's dedicated to the deaf culture, but is very understanding. She knows a lot of people take the class to fill requirements. She's not a strict grader. Her classes are so much fun! Signing is a language. Fairly difficult for some, but as far as foreign languages go, definitely the easiest and most fun.

Signs like she is teaching ASL 3. Very unclear as to what she expects in her assignments and what she expects from students. If you don't have the same passion for "deaf culture" as she does, prepare to be ridiculed.

She is a wonderful teacher!! Yes she signs fast, only so you can get use to seeing people sign fast. She prepares you for using sign language when you talk to Deaf people.  Do you think deaf people will sign slow?  If you go to class and you practice, like you would have to do with any Language you are learning you will be fine.

Prof Weisman is nice, but very unorganised. She's unclear about what she wants from her students and she signs way too fast to be teaching a beginner course. I would  recommend taking ASL 1 with another professor.

Absolultly the best teacher ever...not only did she make learning sign language fun but she was fun...everyday of her class there was always a funny story she would start us out on...some sign she would have stories to...she made learning fun and you actually learn...i use sign language everyday in my life thanks to her
Great teacher. Explained everything clearly and concisely.

Ive never met Professor Weizer face to face but shes a good instructor. Do all of the assignments and do your best to study and you will pass. She does answer your questions. Im just glad this class is over. Im not a math wiz but I did fairly well with effort.

emailed prof a couple of times and i was lucky to get even a couple words back as a reply. I felt like my assignments were graded very inconsistently. definitely keep the syllabus close at all times if you decide to take this class.

Ive never met Professor Weizer face to face but shes a good instructor. Do all of the assignments and do your best to study and you will pass. She does answer your questions. Im just glad this class is over. Im not a math wiz but I did fairly well with effort.

I really enjoyed her from start to finish. Her panopto videos were very helpful in showing how to do the work. She answers questions efficiently and works with you for the assignments. I was afraid of statistics because of the horror stories I've often heard but she was a great professor and I definitely recommend her.
Very detailed lectures. Says a lot of things in class that are not available outside of class that are important for tests.

Professor Weizer is a professor I respected a lot during my time in her class. I recommend sitting in the front of the class if you can and taking hand written notes, either with the slides or in a regular notebook. Electronic notes require seats in the back and for them to be emailed to her directly after class. Lots of papers, but really easy.

ms weizer on here seems to get a bad rap. she truly is involved in all classes that she teaches, if though there are some tangents here and there. for a science gen ed 289 is a real gem. if you dont care you can pass easily, if you do you can learn a large amount. put time into getting to know her, youll be rewarded.

Really great professor, Ive taken multiple classes with her and did well in them all. She will answer questions thoroughly and make sure every student understands the material before moving on. Two pages of notes front and back can be used on every test and she always writes formulas on the board.

Professor Weizer comes off as a tough teacher, but I think it's because she teaches tough subjects. If you try, you'll always get partial credit; I was surprised at how well I did considering how much I struggled. She was the first stats teacher I had who actually helped me understand the how and why. She really saved my GPA and my confidence.
She might come off as strange, but she is very nice and funny in a way. Totally would take again

Professor Weizer comes off kind of tough but she is actually very caring. She gives a couple (long) assignments and tests.
