The tests can be difficult but as long as you take good notes they arent that bad. She really wants her students to pass so she gives opportunities to fix things. She also knows a ton about the subject. I recommend taking her.
Good professor

Professor Weizer is one of the best professors I've ever had. She truly cares about her students' success and isn't really a hard grader. She does in-class reviews before exams, which are really helpful. The class was actually really interesting and is the perfect choice for a gen ed.

Winnie is a hoot! Her teaching style ensures that everyone is up to speed before moving on. Her syllabus isnt set in stone. The class is completely dependent on student success. Her wit and sense of humor makes learning the material a lot easier.
I TOOK THE CLASS ONLINE AND VIDEOS WERE VERY HELPFUL!  ESPECIALLY IF YOU HATE MATH OR MORE SPECIFICALLY STATISTICS

Definitely one of the best at CSU. She cares about her students and teaches statistics from an approach that everyone can understand, using lots of examples and practice problems which helps familiarize us with the material. Grading criteria is very clear, concise, and easy to follow. Weizer makes stats less troublesome for the students.

Professor Weizer was a decent professor. Lectures were boring but she knows what she is talking about. Attendance does not really matter but if you dont show up to the test review, you will not do so good. Do the few assignments that are listed and you will be fine.

100% best professor I have had at Cleveland State so far. She wants everyone to do well, and will answer any questions you have. She can be really funny and fun. She moves through lectures fast but as long as you pay attention you wont feel behind. I thought stats was going to be horrible, but with her as a professor, I actually enjoyed it.

At first i didn't like her, because she flies through the power points way too fast, but she makes the homework assignments and tests really easy. Its almost hard to get a bad grade. She's actually a really great professor, and you can tell that she wants everyone to succeed.

She is very smart and a little fun even, but she doesn't teach from the book and cuts class short when the material is difficult for those that are math deficient. I liked her but her methods are not conducive to teaching this class.

Good professor. She has a comical approach to things but also makes sure you learn. She goes over what will be om an exam during the last class before and exam. Very helpful and understanding with homework and isn't afraid to admit when she is wrong.

Dr. Welfel is approachable, and genuinely interested in your capabilities in class. Both she and her GA for this course were adept at making extremely time consuming and difficult material decipherable. A real experience, this class.

I just completed Dr. Welfel's Ethics class, and I found it to be delightful. I was expecting a dry and boring class, but it was engaging, exciting, controversial, and VERY current. I don't know why someone would say her views are outdated, all her sources are from the late 90's and as late as 2010. She was a practicing Psychologist for MANY years.

She's a boring teacher but tries to engage the class in discussion about ethics. She made it a point to tell us she got a job as a Professor at, like, 25 or something. Which means she probably never worked as a Psychologist. That's the problem with so many Professors -- they know little about the working world.
SHE is wonderful and knows her stuff!

She calls herself an ethicist, and that she is.  Although the class is not difficult, expect lots of reading material.  She is the only professor to teach this Ethics course.  A bit unfair.  Her perspectives are old and her lectures are stale.

Although the class is focussed on writing, there is ZERO interaction between professor and students.  He puts the syllabus online and that's it.  You're left to type 4 papers on your own and email them to him. Not accessible at all, does not even give small presentations on how to write. AVOID.
Very easy going. The class was made up of four papers, that's it. The paper length requirements were long (10+ pages), but it is extremely easy to get an A.
Just breath and you'll get an A.  Sent a 15+ page paper via e-mail.  Had it read and graded in 2 minutes.  What a joke.  Guy is skating until retirement.
No Comments

Definitely one of the greatest professors I've had overall. By the end of the semester I was surprised at how much my skill increased. He gives great feedback and is very encouraging. If you're able definitely take his drawing class at some point!
Haha!! He's the best CSU has- take him if you want to learn art.
Excellent and inspiring teacher, funny guy, weird and interesting.

You'll learn A LOT from him whether you're a beginner or you've been drawing your whole life.  Emphasis on life drawing with a live model and soft pastels. I just wish he taught during the day too!  Definitely my favorite professor at CSU.

pete is crazy but i absolutly love him. he will not tell you what u need to do, and actually applauds when you do the exact opposite of an assignment (ex. a portrait of a dog when he tells you to draw a landscape.  over all, he is still my fav professor at csu.
I learned a lot, and had excellent opportunities to make improvements. He's also one really hot dude.
interesting character, full of useful knowledge
He's Awesome!
peter wells is the coolest guy at csu.
Extremely helpful, open, flexible.  No textbook, but you have to spend $ on art supplies.  Wells is honest and will give you lots of feedback and he listens.

Peter's class is very good for figure drawing. Doesnt assign many projects, I think he likes to focus on the figure drawing, something that the other art profs dont do very much of. If you want to brush up your figure drawing skills, his is the class to take! Very nice guy, laid back, cool to talk to.
No Comments

i sat in on ken nevadomi's class and i was very unimpressed. Peter Wells is very laid but thorough. We had a nude model more than all the other drawing classes.He assigns homework but as long as you bring in some type of artwork he doesnt care if you do that particular assignment. By far best teacher ive encountered a CSU!
This class is SO easy. If you cannot get at least a B, you probably shouldn't be in college...
Very easy class, very easy grader, interesting class. If you have the opportunity, TAKE HIS CLASS!
His comments on papers are really picky, but he tries to say something nice too.  Also, I thought he was a pretty easy grader.

He is super nice man, and knows what hes talking about. His manner of teaching is not very clear, he asks open ended questions and gives you a ton of extra cases to read, but he wants everyone to do good and does all he can to help everyone. I would take him again.
English can't possibly be this man's first language.  Werber helped me, though, insofar as I was afraid enough of him to prepare well for every class.  Great guy outside of class, too.

Exceptional professor and extremely gracious person. Yes he is "different," but much less than some of the nut jobs at CSU. I learned a  basis for knowing the law and becoming a competent, ethical, attorney from Prof. Werber. Is ALWAYS there to help for any SERIOUS student who actually does the work!  Most lawyers would do well to take him again!

Professor Werber's is a bit too susceptible to sycophancy.  Additionally, his focus is not so much teaching the material as stumping you. Furthermore, he lacks the ability to cover the material in an efficient fashion, leaving the student to cram into the last week material he failed to reach during the semester but that he demands you know.

Wertheimer can be scatterbrained but clearly knows the material and if you genuinely enjoy history, you will do just fine. Her class was mostly tests and a large paper for me. It is extremely important to show up and take notes. Tests are like any bluebook tests. EX: pick 3 out of 5 to answer and she goes over what will be on the tests prior to it.

Wertheimer can be scatterbrained but clearly knows the material and if you genuinely enjoy history, you will do just fine. Her class was mostly tests and a large paper for me. It is extremely important to show up and take notes. Tests are like any bluebook tests. EX: pick 3 out of 5 to answer and she goes over what will be on the tests prior to it.

Grading criteria for the papers is not clear, and the assignment for the paper itself is difficult considering she requires direct quotations (and only quotations) for the paper. She doesnt give any feedback on the midterm. Also, she lectures at you; no PPTs. Unless you can work with little guidance and take good notes, dont take this professor

Although you can see the passion that Dr. Wertheimer clearly has for the Middle Ages, it's hard to like her because her class is so difficult. She jumps around a lot during lecture and therefore, the class is very hard to follow. This professor will teach you a lot about yourself and your study habits while teaching you about history as well.

Dr Wertheimer is an interesting character. Shes really nice and helpful, but can be a little scatterbrained. I enjoyed the things we were able to cover in class. Show up to class for good notes, and be prepared for the quizzes.

She is a very interesting lady, I feel very awkward when I am sitting in one of her lectures. She is a very messy individual and I do not respect and like this at all because it is bad for my work environment. She also smells like oranges, and I am allergic to oranges.
Horrible. Don't take her. horrible, absolutely horrible.

WORST TEACHER EVER. Out of my whole college career, I sat in class, took notes, didn't learn a single thing because of how disorganized this teacher was. Awful, it was so painful to just sit there and not understand the material at all. She is passionate about history but not for her students. Had to work hard for a B.

She knows her stuff & is passionate.. BUT probably one of the worst classes I've ever taken. Her grading system is completely whack. Disorganized. Always loosing papers. Very unclear about when things are due. Barely anything due/taught correlated with the syllabus & I was always confused & asking questions. About 30% of students dropped her class.

Extremely fun way to learn about history. Way better than traditional history class. Both games are extremely fun. If you don't like public speaking, take this class anyways it will only help you improve your skills.

Literally the worst class I've had in my long college career. Took HIS 340, was expecting to learn about the Roman Empire. By all means it should have been a fascinating course. But Dr. Wertheimer managed to mangle it. I ended up dropping because I had no clue what was expected of me. She is not clear on expectations and cannot teach material.

She knows her stuff, but is sort of all over the place. She gives good advice on how to do well in her class. She lacks good communication skills about assignments, due dates, and how she wants things, but holds a very fun and exciting class.
did not like the class at all.
Dr. Wertheimer is not a bad professor- just very disorganized, which can make the class confusing.

I busted my butt in the class for a B on every assignment. She does not make grading criteria clear but will grade you as toughly as possible. To write essays for both the midterm & final is asking too much for a 101.  Also, she should concern herself less with texting and more with teaching in an organized manner.

She is a nice lady who knows her subject very well, however I do not reccomend this class. She is unorganized often losing papers, boring, and unclear. She doesn't use blackboard so you won't know your grade and she doesn't post notes online so your notes better be superb. Also, her midtermfinal are ridiculous. She holds you after class too!

Great lady-  I loved her lectures. BUT her tests were the hardest I've ever had and I had to go back and pick up this class as a junior.  Her quizzes were very specific, I busted my  butt and only got a B. ON THE OTHER HAND, I learned a lot.

She is very passionate about the subject of Western Civ. However, she is extremely disorganized. When she grades assignments, she doesn't make expectations clear and then grades extremely hard. If you're not familiar with topics, good luck. She doesn't grade individually, she bases your grade off your classmates, which is totally unfair. Good Luck!
Dr Wertheimer is very knowledgeable. However, her expectations for the class were ridiculously high, and she was never very clear about paper or exam expectations.

Wertheimer is a nice lady: she knows her stuff,but gets easily distracted. Lecture is a pain because she's extremely disorganized and boring. She loses assignments often, and wont define grade expectations. The paper assignments and tests are so ridiculous for this reason. If you can take this class with a different professor, do so!

She is very unorganized, takes too long on one topic. The power points are a hot mess plus she adds stuff to it during class. Midterm + final are a joke. The whole class is really hard because of her teaching techniques. She is a really nice person however everything is messed up. Even though you take notes and quizzes all semester.
Good class, real.

Her presentations were pretty good, going to class isn't mandatory as all information you need is in the slides. Figure out the signaling cascades, think broadly, and ask questions or go to textbook to figure it out. Exams are pretty easy, not much applied information just knowing what things are. You'll be fine.

Dr. Weyman is hands down the best biology professor I've ever had. I honestly can't say enough good things about her. So enthusiastic that its infectious. Teaches complicated and detailed signaling pathways in a clear concise way. Funny, kind. Just great. Wish she taught more undergrad bio classes.

I had Dr. Weyman for Cell Bio in Fall of '09 and for Animal Cell Culture in Spring of '10. She is very enthusiastic about the material and so she is enthusiastic about making sure that she passes the information on clearly. She has a great sense of humor that she uses (along with audience participation and visuals) to get concepts across. Awesome.

Probably the best biology teacher I ever had. Knows the material and knows how to teach it. Very pleasant and friendly. Lectures were very productive and does not test on pointless details. Tells you exactly what to know and beats it into your brain during lecture. If you go to class you will do fine. No curve balls or tricks.

Good professor not bad I guess. Missed a few classes and didn't find anyone who would tell me what the "blank" words in her lectures were. Finally I figured out if you copy and paste that slide into word, "Select All" and make the font "black", those words magically appear. A tip for future students. lol.
Awesome professor, one of the best I have had ..Cellbio ...Highly recommend

She teaches with Dr. Shikula for Cell Bio. Download her powerpoints BEFORE class and pay attention to her lectures her parts of the test come directly from these notes/powerpoints so know them. SHe tries to make an otherwise dull topic interesting and is very enthusiastic
She was so helpful & so interested in the class.  Very enthusiastic.

Dr. Weyman provides a clear picture of the topic being discussed. She is an amazing teacher and mentor if you seek her out. If you wish to succeed in her class, try. She will not do it for you but will go out of her way for those who sincerely try.

Professor Wheatley is the toughest grader ever. He expects SO MUCH out of his writing assignments, I turned in 15 in depth pages covering everything he asked for and still didnt get a good grade. He also doesnt grade anything until the last week of the semester so youre lost the entire time. He said he would have 6-8 zoom meetings and only had 2

I had to take it over the summer online due to COVID and I would never take another class with him, at least not online. He writes his own reading material (full of mistakes & difficult to read), assigns insane amounts of reading and writing and is so nonspecific with revisions. Not a fan of all the DB posts/ having to decipher our work revisions..

Professor Wheatley is very detailed. LOTS of reading and research. There are 3 major projects to complete. He provides his theories on various topics. Read ALL of the materials provided, follow his syllabus, participate in discussions, and ask questions for clarification. What you put into the class is what you get out of the class.
Much of what you read is written by him. He takes a long time to grade. He does not provide much feedback.

Yes, there is a lot of work. Yes, he has very specific views of what ECE should look like. Yes, he is a tough grader. These are not bad things! He is very methodical in how he forms his views and he loves respectful debate. He is very kind and caring & he is always reachable through messages on BB or at office hours. Take him in-person and talk!
Lots of papers with explaining your reasoning. If yours and his don't match, you have to keep redoing it.

Not many people like Wheatley but I do!! Thought his lectures were interesting and inspiring. I follow many of the views professor Wheatley has. I got an A in the class. Although the work was lengthy and tough if you take his IN PERSON class and understand the content and lectures you will pass!! Very nice guy as well.

This is the worst professor I have ever had. He is adored by the department because of his research, which is great. However, he has no clue how to teach. I learned absolutely nothing in class. Even though he acts as if he is this Early Childhood God or something. I am a 4.0 student, and yet in his class I got a C, because I refused to feed his ego

I had a 4.0 until now. The class is about his opinions and experience in ECE. Anything else had no value to him. While the content of the course is very interesting, it is mostly unrealistic. Assignment are very hard.

You'd be lucky if you received feedback in a reasonable amount of time. He takes his time posting grades and grades harshly. All of the articles assigned for reading are written by him; basically you're learning his opinion. Notifies about blended meetings the night before (10PM or later) they take place, not helpful if you have other classes/work.

Dr Wheatley's course can seem overwhelming, but if you follow his exact directions you will be fine.  There are 3 main projects and he does provide clues.  If you do the weekly readings and pay attention to small details you will do just fine.  I would suggest communicating with him as much as possible and ask questions.

Wheatley is very charismatic and even cute in a weird way. Though I understand and believe in his brilliance I feel that as a professor, he simply does not provide decent guidelines. I am an A student and got a C, because he not only has more work than any other class i have taken, he grades very harshly without first telling you what he wants.

The amount of work in this class was stressful. (However, I took this course during a 6 week Summer term.) There was a lot of reading assignments and three lengthy projects/papers. Although this class is sure to be one of the most challenging, you will learn a great deal.
Wheatley was very tough. He assigned lots of assignments with very little time. Makes you read a ton. Never take his class online  in person is always better

It's mind boggling to me that CSU allows this man to play god with futures of students.  A plethora of students who otherwise get 4.0 gpa's- take this class and have degrees held in limbo due to his insanely inappropriate practices. Wish I'd been more confident- I'd have appealed my case of bad grading to head of department AND CSU. Good riddance!
Follow his rubrics and you will be fine.

You don't have an opinion so just agree with everything he says.  Doesn't grade anything and does not answer questions when asked.  Many people have taken this class more than once.  I thought it was because they were not serious but his reputation proceeds him.  Not sure if I want my license if I have to take him again.

His style of teaching isn't helpful to future teachers. Huge difference between challenging students to think- and forcing them to struggle over endless paper revisions with zero clarification. Expecting students to apply knowledge when you have not modeled for them how to do so, is not best practice. I did learn what NOT to do as a teacher.

I took this class in six weeks over the summer. Dr. Wheatley is really into the big picture curriculum. I learned a lot about big picturestudent-planned curriculum in this class. His assignments are tough, he's really picky about how he wants things done. I was surprised to get a B in this class, and would have been happy just passing.

I actually really enjoyed this class and found it to be one of the most useful courses I have taken for Early Childhood yet. Wheatley is a tough grader, but he has high expectations for good teachers! If you email him with questions he will be more than happy to help you out. I wish this class was taught in person, would of been 10x more useful.

No patience for BS excuses which is awesome for all the other people in class who are sick of BS excuses from classmates that slow everyone down.  Brilliant.  Great sense of humor.  Challenging.  Learned a ton.   Highly recommend but don't take him if you don't want to work and are interested in democracy in the classroom.

Class will require you to give up your life.  Very time cosuming and very difficulty.  Many long detailed assignments.  Lets racial tensions mount in classroom discussion.  Does not require students  respect others opinions.  On the plus positive, he is available anytime day or night to help..all you have to do is ask.  Knowledgeable.

Outstanding in every way. Challenging.  Very willing to answer any questions (any time).  I appreciated his use of e-mail and WebCT. Good sense of humor too.  One of the best teachers I have ever had since, oh, about 2nd grade.

I rated him as hard but want to clarify that this class is time consuming.  The actual work is not hard it just takes forever to do.  There are no shortcuts, you research old newspapers on micro-fisch.  You look through old cuyahoga county records.  fun class but time consuming.

Best class of my 7 years of college.  You won't be able to float by, but like everyone says, he'll help you as much as you need.  Very fair, funny, adorable.  I had a crush on him.  Really really smart.  You won't find a better teacher at CSU for sure.  Makes a class that isn't so exciting really interesting and makes you want to do well.
OUTSTANDING.   Learned an unbelievable amount. Great book choices. Challenging but fair, with a great sense of humor to top it all off.
Dr. Wheeler was a great professor and always took time for me. He helped me make decisions about grad school and I was very grateful to have had him as a professor at CSU.
No Comments
Dr. Wheeler encourages students to become the best they can be.
No Comments

Wheeler offers a tough class, but makes it entertaining with an infinite supply of historical stories, trivia, and oddities.  He seems to know everything about American history, everything.  If you are a college student who still reads books, you can survive in his class, and learn a lot of things that aren't found in books.
Very knowledgeable; helps guide students very well.  Fun class

Outstanding professor! Very enthusiastic about the class, has a great sense of humor, interacts very well with students. Dr Wheeler has an INCREDIBLE knowledge of the subject and makes the class VERY interesting. Exam questions are all prepared in advance, so the exams are not that difficult.
Tough class but what a great teacher.  He is funny and interesting.  He is always willing to help if you seek it.
Awesome teacher.  The course work can be difficult but Dr. Wheeler is always willing to help.  He truly loves the subject matter and it shows.  It makes you love it too.

There is no reason to buy the textbook for this course. My biggest piece of advice would be to start the final project ASAP. That way you can take your final case project in a month early to have him look it over. As long as you do all the work on time, there's no reason you should do badly.

Professor Whitbred is a great teacher. He gives good lecutures. As long as you turn in the assignments (which are easy) and study a little, you will pass with flying colors. But DO NOT skip class. That's his big thing. He is a super nice guy and very helpful!

Whitbred is a good guy, take his class. For exams, he goes over everything, hands out a study guide and literally everything on study guide is on exam. Class may get boring but go for attendance. Hes also willing to help you, as some prof dont care.
Great class-Dr. Whitbred was excellent.

Dr. Whitbred is a great professor! Although this class might seem difficult at first, it's not. Dr. Whitbred knows how to run this class so that it runs smoothly! He is a bit moody and can be sarcastic at times. He is extremely fair when it comes to grading. There is no room for favortism. Take this class with Dr. Whitbred.

Was very intimidated by this class at first, but Dr. Whitbred is a good guy. He's willing to help you with anything, anytime! I heard it isn't being offered anymore because of the difficulty (it was the toughest I've taken), but if it is - take it with him! It'll run smoothly with him.

I was scared of this class, I heard horrible things about it, but with Whitbred, it was pretty easy. He is obsessed with Mission Statements and made us read a journal article he wrote about them. I think he looks like Alf. He likes to talk, and uses the words 'tea-leaves' and 'perjorative' a lot.
Just study the slides on ECR and make sure your group is willing to work. Overall pretty easy.

Great teacher for physics II. His lectures were really long and could be boring but that's kind how physics is I guess. He was a nice grader but often had grading mistakes. Although, I would recommend taking this course with White for an easier A than other professors.

Great teacher for physics II. His lectures were really long and could be boring but that's kind how physics is I guess. He was a nice grader but often had grading mistakes. Although, I would recommend taking this course with White for an easier A than other professors.

Lectures are long but thoroughly cover everything you'll be asked on the homework or tests. Very responsive to e-mails and always willing to explain anything. For some chapters, the homework takes an excessive amount of time. He gives a few extra credit opportunities, not a ton but enough to make a difference. Didn't use book much. Would take again

By far the most stressful class I have ever taken. University Physics is such a hard class but luckily White is a great teacher and is generous with partial credit. The homework gets really hard at times, almost impossible, but his tests and quizzes are very doable if you have been paying attention to lectures. Write down every example he does!!
Great professor!

He's a really great prof. Physics sucks in general, and some people just have a really hard time, but he really cares about his students and will do anything to help them. He is always available and responds quickly. His puns can be cringey, but add a nice touch to a very stressful subject. If you do the work and actually try, you'll be fine.
he is okay. physics just sucks in general.

Robert White is pretty goofy, but he is excellent at his job. Very approachable and will spend as much time as you need helping you understand the material. He grades very fairly, and is probably the nicest teacher I've ever had. The only complaint is that he often tries to make jokes that really don't land which is awkward.

Prof white is the nicest professor ive ever had in my life. This guy will do whatever it takes to make sure youre comfortable in his class, and hes so compassionate. He is always on campus and always available in his office hours and super helpful. He grades very generously, and offers tons of extra credit

I had a great semester with Professor White. He's a funny and kind guy that wants his students to succeed. Fun lectures and a pretty easy grader, so long as you show all work. He's a math wizard and has even helped me with some work outside of his own class. When it's time for me to take Physics 2, I'm gonna be the first to enroll in his lecture.

Best professor I've had at cleveland state. His class is very difficult but if you pay attention and put in the effort an A is very obtainable. He is hilarious, understanding, and a very fair professor.

Does a great job of answering questions and making the lectures easy to understand. He jokes around a lot so the atmosphere of the class is very chill. Tests are not bad if you study a bit. He's very nice I recommend

Very, very nice man. He is a new professor so perhaps in future years his teaching skills will improve although I had White for my Spring semester and Physics was the only class I ever lost sleep over it was so stressful and unnecessary. If only it were taught correctly. Beware.
Really awesome.
One of the best professors I've ever had.
I wish I never took this class
One of the best professors I've ever had.

Professor Whyte was a really good teacher of REL317. There were 3 papers to write but they were short and pretty easy to get 100% if you follow the guidelines given. 3% extra credit. She really cares about the subject and what her students have to say.

Her lectures were extremely boring and there were so many things we had to read, a lot of them were extremely difficult to read and took a lot of time and effort to understand them. Hardest class I've ever taken. Get ready to spend most of your free time on this class. Definitely would not take her class again.

Donna is such a kind lady don't get me wrong, in the beginning of the semester she even graded easy. I was pretty consistent with my effort in that class, I would get 100% on everything & towards the middle/end I would get 75%, if that. It was odd, you definitely have to go above and beyond to get an A. Kind of regret taking her class.

She is very passionate about her field of study. We had 3 textbooks all of which were affordable, less than $30. There was a midterm which was online and open book. You also had more then one time to submit it. The final was an essay. In class assignments where essays about the reading and summaries about guess speakers.

HAVE to get 3 books that you will probably never use again (are used for class). Quizzes every week based on reading, but she gave us them to do out of class. Had to do a few papers, but they weren't too bad. There were 2 exams and they were entirely writing. Very hard and you have to memorize a lot of things (dates, locations, etc). Talks a lot

Really nice professor! you can tell she loves her field and really wants to instill her knowledge in the next generation. However, if you're looking for a class you can skip, this would not be the one to take. Didn't bother me, but just an FYI.

Easily one of the most caring professors I have EVER had. She is so easy to talk to and is very knowledgeable in what she teaches. If you show up to class, you will have no problem getting an A. If you talk to her, you will see how lenient she is with whatever you need.

She's really passionate and she's a fun lady. She really wants you to succeed but won't give you an easy pass. Tests were surprisingly hard, but they're online so you can have your book open next to you. She also gives you more than one chance. Easy to talk to. One bad grade won't kill you.

Dr. Whyte is a wonderful professor with clear expectations! Her responsiveness to the papers is helpful and her understanding of any subject she teaches is impeccable! She has a lot of content she reciews, but makes it palatable. Get to her class in time. She does not like late comers. The best professor I have ever had!!!!

She is a very nice woman overall. Class involves a lot of reading, so be prepared. However, she does cover the material in class. There is also a couple papers as well, including an 8-10 page research paper, so if you don't like to write beware.
Dr. Whyte's class was fun and informative.  I would take this class again.

Dr. Whyte really knows what she's talking about.  Although her teaching style can tend to drag on because of the lectures everyday, she highly respects her students and is there for any problem you may have.  If you participate and show her you are trying in her class, she will do her best to reward you for it.  Highly recommend

This class was wonderful because of Dr. Whyte. I took this class for a WAC credit as well as a Social Diversity credit, and I thought it would be boring. Though the material isn't always enticing, Dr. Whyte is very kind, helpful, and respectful. The most work is writing papers, which comes with WAC territory. I'd take this class again!

This is by far my favourite history class! Dr. Whyte is a great professor who clearly enjoys teaching and about her students. Participation makes a difference and there is only one chance for extra credit (2%) so make sure to do either one of the options! Make sure to at least review the notes (and book) before any quiz day.
She's a great professor! Passionate and cares about the subject she teaches.

She is very passionate about the course, and knows the material very well,  at the start I didn't have interest but I paid a little attention and then she was always there to help out.  Quizzes are not so tough if you study hard and finals are basically all you've done.

Dr. Whyte is one of the most understanding professors in CSU. She really knows how to make a boring subject interesting. As long as you attend class, read the short readings, take notes, try your best, and turn in all your assignments. Auntie Dr. Whyte will take good care of you. I miss her already.
It was pretty easy for me, because the exam were 50% terms and 50% essay. So remembering the terms would do you wonder and she grade the essay easy as well. She does take attendance.

I had never taken a philosophy class before taking his Ancient class. Absolutely amazing professor! Pre-recorded lectures were thorough, and he repeats and clarifies everything. Very organised and consistently scheduled work, so its easy to keep track of. Despite the sometimes complicated readings, he is very helpful and understanding! Great job!

I had never taken a philosophy class before taking his Ancient class. Absolutely amazing professor! Pre-recorded lectures were thorough, and he repeats and clarifies everything. Very organised and consistently scheduled work, so its easy to keep track of. Despite the sometimes complicated readings, he is very helpful and understanding! Great job!
It's super easy to get an A in this class. Do the readings, attend lectures, and do a half-way decent job at the writing assignments.

I took this as my Humanities GenEd requirement. I understood very little of the material yet still finished with an A. Tons of readings but he posts them all on Blackboard so at least they're free. Do every reading so you're ready for the possible reading quiz on it. Also, the papers are super easy because the directions are so straightforward.

Not a good fit for visual learners. The prof is very knowledgable in his area of study but I felt a disconnect. The pop quizzes aren't as bad as they could be. Overall, I just dreaded going to this class. Most of the time is spent in group discussions and it's really up to you to teach yourself if you don't find the discussions helpful for you.

Dr. Wiitala is fantastic! The lectures are great, there is also a good amount of class discussion, the combination of these two really help make the material easier to understand. Dr. Wiitala is also very knowledgeable on the subject and always open to questions. There is no textbook, instead its the actual philosophical works. Great professor!

Dr. Wiitala holds a special place in my heart. Not being a philosophy major made the course material difficult to understand at some points, but he made the class so easy for me after I mentioned this. He is a really genuine guy who truly cares about us and our grades. He's always smiling too! I wish I could take him again!

Dr. Wiitala is an amazing lecturer. He breezes through Plato and Aristotle with the greatest of ease using language I could understand. When a paper is due, he gives the option to edit drafts and provides an abundance of comments. He is simply the best professor I've had yet!

Understandable, intelligent, willing to help students, good grading, actively participates in discourse, makes the class fun, and I would not say the class is "easy" by any means, but given the class levels he teach, they are right where they need to be. Good sense of humor. Overall just a great professor, if you have a chance, do take his class.

Dr. Wiitala is great, always prepared, and syllabus is thorough so there are no surprises.  Always willing to sit down with you if you need help.  Grades come back a bit slow, because he actually reads your work.  Grades generously, good sense of humor, obviously knows his stuff. VERY attractive; you might forget to listen if you're staring at him.

Honestly, I love Dr. Wiitala. He genuinely cares about his students, he is easy to communicate with, and he is more than willing to help you in any capacity. If you are ever struggling in any of his courses, he will gladly make time to meet with you. His courses are structured very well, his grading is fair, and hes not bad to look at.

Can I just say I love this man! He is a new professor at CSU, but he made my semester so much more interesting. Amazing teacher and person in general.  I will take his classes until the day I leave CSU
the easiest class ever! I really had a great semester with him. I strongly recommend you to take any class with him!!

Disorganized and forever unprepared. Often dismissed class after ten minutes because he did not have anything prepared. Did not get through even half the syllabus, but did okay for being handed the class at the last minute and having had to learn the material along with the students. He tried a little but clearly did not know what he was doing.

Prof. Wilder was assigned my class 2 weeks before class started. He was shaky because he was simply handed a 70-person class, but overall, he did excellent. As long as you study his study guides and go to the reviews for class, it's easy. He's also very helpful. I learned a lot. There were three exams (no final) and 2 short papers. Would recommend!

He had no control of the class, no idea what he was doing, and didn't even get through half of the syllabus. Don't worry if you don't do assignments on time, either. He will accept them late. Don't expect to get grades back from him in a timely manner either.

LOVE HER! This way her first semester teaching and she did amazing! You don't need to come to class, attendance is not taken, but she values it if you do show up. She'll mention that if she knows your name or face, you'll get the participation points! Online homework is given but you don't need the book, just the access code, so save your $.

Dr Wilhite is the sweetest soul youll ever encounter. Her love for Audiology will make you want to become an Audiologist. She values feedback from her class and she offers extra help sessions to help her students pass. Class is not easy, but its worth it.

Dr Wilhite is the sweetest soul youll ever encounter. Her love for Audiology will make you want to become an Audiologist. She values feedback from her class and she offers extra help sessions to help her students pass. Class is not easy, but its worth it.

Intro to Aud was one of the best classes I have ever taken. Wilhite is very compassionate about the subject and teaches to prepare you for grad school. As long as you attend class, take engaged notes, and prepare for exams, you will do great! Not as bad as everyone makes her class out to be.
Wilhite is the sweetest human being, but dont let that fool you! Her tests and quizzes are extremely hard and long. If you don't go to every class, take good notes and study you will NOT pass.

I love Dr. Wilhite. She is the heart and soul of the Speech and Hearing Major at Cleveland State. She is extremely kind and if you put in the effort and make your self known to her, you should have no problem getting at least a B, with study efforts and paying attention to her powerpoints, an A.

Dr. Wilhite is SPECTACULAR! Wants desperately for you to succeed; however, you WILL WORK; it is challenging, but not impossible. she'll HELP you understand the material. Tests are fill-in's, short essay, truefalse, definitions. KEEP BOOK! If you are having problems, open-office-door-policy, loves class participation, she's hilarious; amazing!

Dr. Wilhite is an amazing professor with so much passion and it shows. Her classes are tough. You have to put in a lot of effort in order to pass but the material is so interesting. She is a little hard to get a hold of. It takes her a while to respond to emails and hard to find her in her office so you have to catch her before or after class.
Best teacher I have ever had-she is kind and compassionate and has so much knowledge. We are so lucky to have her at CSU
Best professor ever!

Dr. Wilhite is the best professor I have had thus far at Cleveland State University. She is knowledgable, inspirational, kind, and compassionate. Do not let her kindness fool you- her class is difficult. With that said, I learned a lot. If you work hard it pays off and you will be really impressed with how much you learn- Dr. Wilhite is the best!
Dr. Wilhite is awesome! She is very enthusiastic about audiology and she teaches in such a way that kept me engaged. I look forward to another class with her in the future.

Myrita is fantastic! She has a passion for the field and is perhaps one of the best professors I've ever had in my career as a student. She is fair, but I wouldn't quite say easy. Her personality can be a little misleading when it comes to test time...Study up!

LOVE Dr. Wilhite! She is by far one of the best professors I have ever had in my entire college career. The material is difficult, so you need to attend class; however, Dr. Wilhite makes you understand everything- and if you don't understand just ask! She is ALWAYS willing to help!!
She is one of the best professors at Cleveland State in the speech department

Professor Wilhite is wonderful. Her tests are challenging, but you learn soooo much. Her tests are not tricky at all....just attend each class, take good notes, and pay attention...she doesn't try to trick you. shes very passionate about the subject. loved her and cant wait to have her again.

I don't think I've met anyone who does not love, or at least super-like, this woman.  No, her classes are not easy, especially compared with most in the program, but ... it's audiology.  Her powerpoints are long to print out.  But so what? In lectures and one-on one she's warm, engaging, enthusiastic, compassionate, and knowledgable.

Had her for Comm Disorders and Aural Rehab. Incredible teacher! Well-organized, fascinating, funny, brilliant, and explains things well-- verbally and through power-point. Tests are mostly essay, and very challenging, but not impossible if you apply yourself. There is a research paper due at the end of the semester. You'll love her!
wonderful wonderful sweet lady who becomes your hero. she does so much and she's such a great teacher!
I love Ms. Wilhite! She is so fun and makes the subject matter interesting! Her tests are hard, almost all essay, so be prepared!

Mrs. Wilhite is an amazing teacher.  Her tests are pretty hard, but all you have to do is take clear notes and study, and you'll be fine.  She is so funny and has a great sense of humor.  I can't wait to take another one of her classes!

She is the best teacher in the speech and hearing department at CSU. she has the knowledge, the experience and she is very interesting. She is clear, quiet smiley face and very helpful. I love her at a personal level and academic level.

Two critical essays, discussions, mid-term and final. Critical essays are graded, tough ladies and gentlemen. I emphasize critical essays because a large portion of your grade depends on it. VERY unorganized and EXPECT to have late responses, unfortunately. Points are deducted for very minimum errors and your grade will pay the price.
Always responds to emails. Try hard on the papers and the discussion forums or you will fail. Gives loads of extra credit.

Class wasn't too bad. Weekly discussion board. Tough grading on the papers although which had to be in APA format. Final exam was tough. This is an online class and shouldn't be graded this way. Although she is a fair professor and gave extra credit at the end.

I also took her Megacities of Asia online course and it is awful. She expects way to much for a simple prereq course and it is to much work for such a pointless class. She also docks points for every little mistake! I even used grammarly to check my papers and she still would say points docked for errors... I never got more than a 7 out of 10.

I took Megacities of Asia online this semester and i was not excited to take it at all and it definitely was just as awful as I expected. Multiple papers and super long discussion posts every week which she always docks point if theyre not PERFECT. Would not take again.

Avoid this class professor like the plague. I took her online Megacities of Asia class and it was the worst course I have taken so far. It's an intro level course for students who are likely not english or liberal arts majors but she grades the course like and advanced english course and wants all her papers in APA. Worst professor I've had so far.

Dr. Reggenia Williams is a passionate instructor with little to no presentation or organizational skills.  We had assignments due almost every class and she was very backed up in grading. I learned very little in her class and struggled to keep up with all the work.  Some online, some written, some in class, etc.  Very unorganized. Lots of videos.

Regennia was a nice person, but she was also unorganized much of the time. She spent more time going over class instructions rather than the actual material. The subject and associated quizzes and tests were easy enough, but most of the work I did was out of class. Regennia's class was often chaotic and unsuitable for getting any work done.

Had her for Afr Am History, a class I think you have to have a passion for if you want to take. With that being said many of my classmates hated this class and her, but I think she was a very good instructor. Essays and exams are given but the paragraphs have to be a par. Easy class and you'll get a lot out of it if you're interested in teh subject

Horrible. This was my capstone class and I learned nothing. She was constantly changing where we would meet for class. She cannot explain what she wants and doesn't fully listen to the questions you ask regarding assignments. Lectures had nothing to do with the class and she almost always ended up on unrelated tangents. Due dates are very confusing

Horrible horrible teacher. She's very rude and closed minded. She wants things done a certain way and cannot explain how she wants it done. Very spacey and Can not stay on topic. I had to go to the head of the history department to get anything done in this class.

Worst teacher i've had so far at CSU.  Her lectures are utterly pointless. Attendance is 10% of the grade and she considers a student absent if they show up 5 minutes late, or leave before she's finished with the lecture - even if class time is over.  The only thing that saved me was the extra credit.  She is rude, and not helpful at all.

Her lectures are pointless. 3 essays and 3 tests, but she'll drop one of each. She makes everyone in the class contribute to the study guides, which is the only thing that the tests are based off of. Just go to class and do the work and study and you'll get an A!!  She's passionate about this stuff but she always reminds you that she's got a P.hd
Very snappy. Her lectures were useless. She's very passionate about the topic. Expect to recieve an exam or in-class essay two weeks after the day it was taken. Very unorganized.
Late, unorganized, ALOT of writing. Expects alot for tests and essays. Learn nothing in class, just read the book. Stay away if you hate alot of writing.
Enthusiastic professor! Expect a lot of writing, but as long as you show effort and interest in the course material, you will do well.
This was my first class I took online and I am happy that it was so easy. There are 3 tests and 4 essays with the lowest score dropped. I would recommend this class for those interested in history.

What a nasty professor, she doesn't make sense, is not organized, ignored people she doesn't like (being a woman and african american is the only way to get her attention) and thinks she's so much better than the rest of the dept. Cannot stand her, every minute spent in her class was a waste!!
Probably the worst teacher I have ever had.  Very unorganized and never taught anything we had to learn everything ourselves.  Do yourself a favor and stay away from this joke of a teacher.

Dr. Williams is a great teacher to take. I took African American History since 1877 and it was my first semester of college and what an easy A her class was. I missed class a lot but mainly there are three exams, pass the first two than you don't have to take the final (third exam). six group projects sooo easy, and three in class essays drops lowe

Dr. Williams wastes no time and dives right into the content so if you're not an independent person who can understand the syllabus then you're sol. Otherwise, he's a great lecturer and enjoys relating to the students! This rating is from the perspective of a six week intensive summer course.
a good professor, easy, fun, and we never used the book. he said he recieves better results from students, and students gain more knowledge from his lectures then from having them read the book.

DO NOT TAKE! He gives two tests all year to determine your grade, and you will never cover the test material. Lectures are nothing more than class discussions of popular topics of today to create a stir in people. Class is unorganized and chaotic. Avoid if possible!

One of the best. Educated individual. He knows his material. Very clear on what he wants from the course, he states this in class as well as on his syllabi. So be there or ask. Full of life and comedy. He does joke so if u r a stiffler then take this course elsewhere.  Come to class rested he WILL single sleepers out. Learned alot in here.

He is all over the place. He is a very well educated man, but he simply lacks direction of the class. I have no understandin of policy. I enjoy not really doing any work in his class but it's ANNOYIN sometimes. He will go on and on about whatever. GO 2class &act interested. I think a EASY "AorB". He doesnt clearly state how he wants work completed.
Michael Williams was absolutely useless. Office hours were few and far between, directions for assignments were unclear and his grading policy was inconsistent. Stay away from this professor.

It was a policy course, however, I felled to get a complete understanding of policy & its affect on populations in which Social Workers provide service to.  Overall, Dr. Williams is alright as a professor, but lack direction w/i the course.
Lectures are a ramble, but still relevant to course.  Fun to listen to usually. Take home exams; visits to policy meetings (and brief write up)
I loved his class he really cares for his students
Amazing! Really cares about his students and is a great teacher. TAKE THIS CLASS!

A very sweet man, one of the most helpful professors I had. If you respect him, he will respect you. He teaches ASL slowly to make sure you understand. Although, if you plan to actually use ASL and aren't taking it as a requirement you should seek someone else, his purpose is for you to pass. He doesn't expect you to be fluent.

Mr. Williams is very nice, but he is not helpful.  He is a deaf man, so you think he would excel at sign language, but his signing is very sloppy and unclear, and it is difficult to learn from.  Also, his teaching method is poor.  He mostly expects students to learn by memorizing words and not placing them in context.
Professor Willis made the material accessible and provided the best clinical training I received in a classroom. Be prepared to contribute, and you will find it is what helps you learn best.

Little chance to earn points. We had midterm, case assessment, and final exam as a part of a grade only. No study guide for midterm. Most word def-tions different from the book-uses dictionary. Without notice gave 2 chances for x-ra credit: quiz on syllabus(2nd day), keep dream record(make note 1st day) Enjoys seeing low grades. Plays favorites.
No Comments

Online summer class. Very easy if you followed syllabus. Final was a 5 page double spaced paper. Powerpoint mid-way through. Didn't really respond to emails though. Grading took awhile but this was a summer course.
I had Prof. Wilson his first year, 1980. He was right fresh from the Ivy League. Fun, friendly, smart. He was barefoot in sandals, and that described him. I'm happy to see he is still there!

Really solid teacher even if a bit scattered at times in lectures. Very helpful outside of class, and takes genuine interest in his students who are serious about the class.  Although it seemed a bit dry at times, so many of his insights into law practice ring true to life!  Could not believe how much I learned in class until I studied for bar.

Best teacher I've had: bar none.  Wilson provides entertaining truism tid-bits that make you think and want more.  Other's complaints are without merit;  law school is tough and material comes quickly, get used to it.  His grading is fair and he tells you what he's looking for on the test.
Wilson is awesome and hilarious...his war stories from working prior to teaching are the best!

One of my favorites so far. Wilson creates interest in an otherwise boring subject. He is a fair grader, very intelligent and approachable...he will go into lengthy discussions outside of class if you want him to.  Definitely take him if you can.
Wilson is awesome!  Most "human" prof all year!  He is tough, but hard work pays off.
Wilson is a really nice guy and obviously a good lawyer. Contracts just isn't his area.
Tells great stories, but he's not a contracts teacher, so he shouldn't be teaching contracts. Answers can only be one way -- his.

LOVED HIM! I had no interest in contracts until I took his class.  He can get worked up and fly through material, but if you want someone who tells you how the real world is he is your man.  He is very leinant first semester with grades, and cracks down second.  I will take him again as soon as I can.  Great prof for 1L's!

I had Wilson for Contracts.  It was a horrible experience.  The man has no clue how to teach, stutters constantly so is very hard to understand, and he cracks jokes that are extremely lame and thinks that they are funny.  Tests are a joke, a friend behind me put down the UCC for a common law question, he gave him an "A" for thinking outside the box
I had Professor Wilson in 1991.  He was a great prof.  If you need it spelled out for you, get out of law now.  Don't waste anyone's time, including this reviewer who later became a judge.

Wilson is entertaining and informative.  His insight into the practice of law is useful for 1Ls.  Unfortunately, he is so jacked up he sometimes omits syllables from words.  One often leaves his class exhausted.  He packs two classes into one.

All lecture, but that is not so bad when you get an intelligent, well-read and thoughtful guy.  The people who don't like him are the ones who only "get it" when it's spelled out in black and white.  He will make you think (if you're capable).

He did not make concepts clear,so it was often hard to figure out what was significant about the cases.  That made studying and reading difficult for his class. You never knew what he wanted.  All lecture, not much discussion.
Total lecture.  Sarcastic sense of humor but amusing.I was left not quite knowing what I was to learn about Con. law which made it difficult to study for his exam.

John P Wilson was inspirational. He has a passion and profound knowledge for PTSD and used several methods to teach (lectures, readings, movie projects). I truly learned the most from Professor Wilson!

Dr. Wilson challenges you. He is by far the best professor I have ever had, and I have learned the most from him. He requires you to write...A LOT, but I think that it helps, especially if you're a psych major and planning on attending grad school. He is very passionate about the material, and the reason I want to continue with PTSD.

He is an amazing professor. He knows his material, but is not full of himself. He is very helpful and encouraging. He is willing to do what ever it takes to help you become successful. (if you are willing) By far the best professor at CSU!

I have had Dr. Wilson for every class he teaches psychology of personality, social psych and his ptsd course he is an excellent teacher I learned a lot from him In my opinion if not the best one of the best professors I ever had.. Not to mention he help discover PTSD. If you pay attention in class you will do well try to come to ever class

Great professor! Very conversational, well-informed, intriguing lectures!  Be prepared to write, a lot...as in English Minor anyone? He will be retiring after next semester-so sign-up for a class with him while you can! You will understand people much better after this class.

You must attend class & take notes from his lectures. You also have to read the books but if you pay attention well enough during his lectures & take decent notes then you should be fine. LOTS of writing, but there were no tests. I wrote 4 papers, all were 10-15 pages. Sounds intimidating but its not if you understand the topics. I recommend him.
Be prepared to read A LOT! And write even more.  But he's great and really knows psychology. This semester I'm taking my third class with him.
Dr. Wilson is the best teacher in this school. He is empathetic, experienced and gifted. I worked really hard, but he made me feel inspired to do the work. Thanks, Doc!
Excellent teacher, but be prepared to write 25 page papers. He really knows psychology so well. So amazing listening to his examples and stories. Loved him as a teacher

He is an AMAZING teacher. He knows psychology SO WELL and is a well-known psychologist. It is so interesting to hear him talk about his experiences, and in addition, he is very able to relate the material to real examples, which is very helpful. He is a GREAT teacher.

BEST PROF I HAVE EVER HAD. He really knows his stuff and is extremely helpful and loves what he teaches. He backs up what he teaches with his career. Always a has good story and it clarifies what he is teaching. I definitely recommend him to anyone that wants to really learn about the psy and is willing to do the work.

Only taught 3 theories of personality (most profs cover at least 6) 1/2 semester on Freud, 1/3 on Erikson, and the rest on Maslow.  PTSD info was interesting, but he has a bit of an ego problem (and doesn't see the irony in being a Freudian psychologist with a pen collection).  His past problems (e.g. license suspension) is an elephant in the room.

Requires more than 20 pages for a midterm take home essay test with one week to complete, plus a dream journal project of multiple pages plus a take home final with a lengthy requirement. Didn't learn anything and his textbook- that he wrote- is mind-numbingly dull and disorganized. Also expects full texts of Freud and Erickson to be read.

By far,the very best professor I have ever had in my academic career. I did not find him "hard", but rather he challenged my mind and it brought out my best.  I always found him to be open, compassionate and engaging.  He has a passion for what he does and what he teaches. He was most helpful and always willing to assist a student. THE BEST!!

His class is very hard because of the papers you have to write, however you can turn them in untill you get an A.  I have never learned so much from any professor,  he is really passionate and teaches you a lot about yourself!

This Prof is the BEST!!!!!!!!Warning, if you are not going to grad school and only need an elective I would not recommend that you take him, tons of writing.  By far he has been the best professor of my academic career because he helped me grow as an individual.

Dr.Wilson is extremely dedicated and passionate about the material used in class...it's his career. He made class fun and easy to grasp. Hope his health improves so that CSU students may take his classes for many years to come. GOD SPEED, JOHN WILSON!

Dr. Wilson is cool. His textbookd is helpful, but not required. The other books, used in class, Freud and Erikson are required. Attend class is you want an A and don't be afraid to ask for help. THe midterm and final essay take awhile, but you learn so much and the A is worth it in the end
THis is the best professor on campus for psych classes, take this professor if you truly want to learn the subject and have some knowledge for future positions. He truly is a wise man.

He is a good prof. But people r wrong, you need to buy his texts (he requires FOUR for psy342 - $270 total). Main focus is always Freud and PTSD, so hope you like those topics. He is unhelpful outside of class, though the TA helps. He doesnt answer emails well. You can rewrite papers but they are long to begin with, pointless. Never correct him!

Mrs. Wilson was an overall good teacher. She clearly cares for the students and is very knowledgable in the area. I was glad to be able to be in her class, as she actually allows for discussion/questions unlike other profs in this program. She is an incredibly busy person, but if something is important she is always willing to make time.

Mrs. Wilson was an overall good teacher. She clearly cares for the students and is very knowledgable in the area. I was glad to be able to be in her class, as she actually allows for discussion/questions unlike other profs in this program. She is an incredibly busy person, but if something is important she is always willing to make time.

Mrs. Wilson is one of the best professors in the speech and hearing program at CSU. She is sometimes hard to get ahold of, however, she is truly invested in everyone's growth as clinicians. She cares about everyone's progression with their clinical skills and wants you to succeed. She provides good feedback and great advice.

Ms. Wilson is clearly knowledgeable and decent at teaching; professional and respectful in class, but sometimes stoic and obviously irritated during interactions outside of class. This class is tricky... depending on the supervisor and client you are assigned, expectations of supervisors differ and therefore, there is no consistency in grading.

Sharon Wing is one of the worst, if not the worst, teacher I have ever had. Not only is her class extremely difficult in general, she does not care about you getting a good grade. She threw out a question for one of our exams and our grades went down. She is also extremely rude when answering any emails. 0/10 if I was allowed to use 0s.

One of the worst professors ive ever had. Skips through information, spends time explaining drugs just to say we dont really use it anymore though. Grade is your exams, which are ridiculous and difficult. Study guides do not help. Extremely forgetful and unorganized. If I fail out of nursing school she is the reason why!

Wing is literally the worst professor I've ever had. You are graded on 4 exams, two case studies (If she even remembers to assign them) and an online practice test. She skims past material, assumes her students know everything about pharm even though shes supposed to be teaching it, study guides make absolutely no sense/arent accurate. 10/10 pain

She was a fantastic teacher. She really knows her stuff. She is very educated on the material she teaches. She offers to go over test  questions after you have taken the exam one on one, and told me which ones I will see again on the final. Show the effort in her class. READ THE BOOK AND THE QUIZZES AT THE END OF THE CHAPTERS- ALOT ON EXAMS!

she is as every body said rushes through nots, careless, unorganized teacher, she expected you to know every thing that she want or asked for. if you to follow her  blue print difinitly you fail the exam . because nothing in the blue print is indecated the right information regrading to the exam. i m glad she will not teach us any more
disorganized( note and lecture), rushes through nots and careless. she reward the test in the way the student not able to understand what she want. i wish she will not teach any more.

She was an ok teacher for previous courses but as soon as she teaches 415 in the fall of senior year it's as if she's bored of teaching.  Hardly anything on the exam is what she tells you to study and she words questions in a weird way.  She also rushes through lecture like she doesn't care about what she's doing.

she is so smart however I feel she dose not know how to react or understand  people who have different back grounds.  she rashes through notes and a lot of her exam's question has nothing to do with notes.  compare to other teacher I feel she dose not care if the student fail  or pass the course.

She is very smart but is not a good teacher. She rushes through the material and mainly reads off the power points.Her tests are weird and quite difficult.She gives questions on things she never talks about. She just assumes "you know this and that". Was extremely happy to be done with that class and her dry sense of humor.
Nice. Tests come directly from notes. Sometimes appears to not care, and rushes.

Have had this professor since i started nursing school. She is unorganized and once you get to your senior year shes very discouraging. She makes things harder than they have to be and has many complaints from black students. If you dont like her too bad you'll have to take her up until your fall senior semester her true colors will really show
Smartest professor I have ever had. Very helpful. Expects a lot from not only her students but also herself. The picture of professionalism.

Abolutely wonderful professor! Had professor Wing for multiple nursing courses and clinical rotation. Knows what shes teaching and very intelligent. Read the book / powerpoints and attend classes. By far my favorite college professor, and a great nurse!

Had professor wing for mutiple classes and a clinical rotation. Absolutely outstanding teacher!! Wouldn't say "easy" teacher, but know your information that she teaches and read the book / power point slides / attend classes. Best college professor I've had. Very intelligent woman!

I had Wing for patho, pharm, medsurg, and for a clinical rotation. She is extremely intelligent and can teach you a lot. I did well in all of her classes and it seems like she goes a lot from powerpoint lectures for her tests and will reuse almost all of the quiz question for the exams.

Just like the rest of the nursing staff, thinks they know all and needs to teach what really happens not what they want the field to be like. THey all insult other schools thinks their all. OKay teacher, but, again, think they know everything.
No Comments

Sharon Wing is by far my favorite professor. This woman is INCREDIBLY smart. She's definitely a student advocate. Her class is actually interesting and valuable. If you're having trouble in her class, she does whatever she can to help you out!
Professor Wing was a good teacher. She let you know what her test layouts would be and always kept them the same. Study guides were given and 25% on the grade bookwork.

Really nice woman. I took her online and she always emailed me back really quickly. She is easy to ask questions too and always gives feedback on BB. The class wasnt hard at all, weekly DB questions and a paper.

Amazing at giving online class! Im taking her course at Lakeland and she lets you work ahead! Its really nice considering most online students take them to balance everyday life. I finished all my coursework within the first three weeks and can now focus on other classes with more free times

Amazing at giving online class! Im taking her course at Lakeland and she lets you work ahead! Its really nice considering most online students take them to balance everyday life. I finished all my coursework within the first three weeks and can now focus on other classes with more free times

I loved this class and found the professor to be extremely knowledgable and very fair in the grading. 370 possible points: 100 point midterm, 100 point final, 100 point interview project, 70 points for attendance. Anyone with over 95% in class did not have to take the final. She was extremely clear on what was expected for tests.

One of the best prof's I've ever had! She explained everything very thorough. The book for this class is encouraged but not required because her notes are better than the book! She offers extra credit many times during the semester, which is great because attendance is part of the grade. Not many other graded things for class.
She is a very bubbly, insightful, funny, helpful professor. We used the book very little since the power point slides and her commentary are sufficient enough.
Hands down one of the best professors at CM Law! Interesting, approachable and knowledgeable. Made crim pro enjoyable.

Jon is an amazing professor. He is very accomodating with any events happening outside of school that hinder your ability to come to class or even take an exam, as long as you can provide proof. I think he is great, very laid back and non-judgmental, is willing to help you prepare for exams, available by email any time! seriously!

Class is just a lecture. Goes along with two different books. VERY NICE GUY -- WILLING TO ACCOMODATE YOU AND ANY HECTIC TIMES. Every exam is open note, open book in essay form, gives you the essay questions proir to taking the test. Attendance not manditory. Gives small amount of extra credit with each exam.
Very difficult teacher. No Powerpoint, he just speaks in lecture. Tests are very hard - identifications and essays - and he has high expectations for students and their responses.
TWO group projects. Quizzes are pure memorization. Wasted money on the book, but her slides are all you need. Very standoffish and unapproachable.

She reads directly off the slides during lecture, only accepts answers on her WEEKLY quizzes if theyre verbatim from the slides. She loves rote memorization. She is disrespectful towards students and becomes snippy in class. Theres two group projects, one being a paper that reads like one person wrote it. She doesnt consider student input.
probably the best special education class, emphasis is on working with students with severe and profound educational needs. Lots of good information and valuable resources
probably the best special education class, emphasis is on working with students with severe and profound educational needs. Lots of good information and valuable resources
one of the more interesting special education classes.  She really knows her stuff.
She loooooves handouts. I have a massive stack from the semester haha! She's a great prof, very informative and a good teacher.
great class and learned alot from her, lots of real life experiences as well as information
It wasn't too hard but his teaching wasn't helping.

Jackie was my instructor for the lab portion of ESC120. The group projects are very simple, and you can ask for as much help as you need, as both the instructor and TA are approachable and kind. Not much explanation of what you are supposed to do is given before the lab, however, so you must do that on your own and ask for help if you need it.
Worst professor ever! Doesn't tell you what to do during class and talks down to students. It would take him long time to answer emails. No clear grading criteria AT ALL.

Jackie was my instructor for the lab portion of ESC120. The group projects are very simple, and you can ask for as much help as you need, as both the instructor and TA are approachable and kind. Not much explanation of what you are supposed to do is given before the lab, however, so you must do that on your own and ask for help if you need it.

He is a nice guy but the lectures only cover 10% of the subject that we are learning. Be ready to watch alot of videos online and/or read the textbook (it is free online) to learn what you have to for the tests. His tests are difficult! Worst part is that half the class does not know what they are doing in lab and will just sit there and copy

He reads power point , and the slides are very terrible and basically a copy paste from the text book Midterms are not that hard but the final is impossible He talks down to student and will not help you most of the time , The TA is a complete joke. Don't take him for CIS courses if you have the option trust me he is very bad
Jackie is super caring and nice!
He's a really nice guy and he does care but just bad at explaining things. I has him for lab and lucikly my group knew what they were doing or I wouldn't of passed.

I took his intro to programming class. He teaches through power points and long lectures that become hard to follow due to confusion or boredom. Once you fall behind your most likely stuck behind as there is no outside help due to teacher assistants never being available and the sporadic order of how he teaches. I feel I learned nothing, avoid.
Bad professor that all what I can say...

Lectures are very boring and don't help much on the exams. A lot of the material seems like common sense. I don't feel as though I learned anything and that my success in the course was based mostly on participation and pure luck.

Study the slides to understand what material will be on the test because he does not give a study guide. He takes attendance, assigns homework which are related to the group project. Do what you are asked and you should pass easily. It's just he lectures from slides and it can be boring sometimes but overall he is a good professor and caring.

The course I took him for was titled Information Systems for Competitive Advantage. Overall this is an easy class if you want an A to boost your GPA. But beware, the work load is enormous. There are weekly assignments the end up being 3 to 5 pages long (single spaced!). There is one group project which is easy and tests are also easy.
The only thing I say is you can opt for the subject.

Tests are pretty hard but they must not be weighted very heavily because I got an A in the class despite my poor test grades! He really cares about you and has stopped me multiple times the next semester in the hallway to talk

Teaches off of slideshows. Cracks a lot of cheesy jokes that make you laugh from just how painful they are. He is friendly, and willing to help. You just gotta ask questions. You need to stay on top of assignments if you want to finish them all in time. Exams are all multiple choice, and are pretty specific. Not a hard class, at least to me.

Uses PPTs that he didn't create or proofread so they reference invalid assignments or material not needed. 2 tests (50 MC) are from books, but PPTs don't match 100%. Review the quizzes! Gives group labs that don't lend themselves to be worked on by groups so there are fewer to grade. I did entire labs by myself while my group members got credit.

Solid prof, knows his stuff.  Lectures can be dry, but this is mainly fault of material, not of prof.  He breaks it up with cheesy jokes.  Tests are MC and I found them to be fairly easy.  Later HW assignments are challenging but fair, and he spends lots of time going over instructions and expectations.

Reads from Powerpoint slides. Does not draw any interest from students. You're on your own with labs, which require you know stuff before its ever covered in class. Only 2 tests and labs. If your group doesn't know the lab material already, good luck reading help files since the professor just sits there and answers questions very vaguely.

Teaches by slides, some slides are upside down. Notes need update so study the books. Sometimes goes off tangent to talk about interesting topics. Easy going with cheesy jokes. Assignments could be shorter (med. difficulty) and more relevant, e.g. sockets should be in networking not OS. Multiple choice exam, not evenly spread. Answers emails quick.

eventhough the class was hard, he would tell you the materials you need for a quiz or exam. he often cracks jokes to keep you focus cause the class is a snooze.....overall he is a great professor of 16 years.

This class consists of lectures and labs.  The lectures are a snooze, but you only have to sit through one a week.  The labs can be frustrating when dealing with Linux.  The tests are pretty hard, the first half of the class deals with the operating system and the other half deals with networking.  Each test is 50 M/C questions.He curves the grades

Terrible professor. Poor teaching style that is not engaging. Power points and class presentations do not match online material. Not very coherent, doesn't give grades back on time. Thank god I was able to do all the work on my own and never have her again. The class was worthless and taught me nothing new.

Awful professor. Her teaching is not clear. Her tests do not match with her power points. She does not give clear instructions about testing/quiz materials. I'm thankful I never have to have a class with her again!

Dr.Wolf is very knowledgable and extremely helpful. She is very practical and wantsher students to succeed. She does not tolerate childish behavior,hates to see students eating and using their cell phones. She will help you in any way she can .She has a soft voice and is not aggressive,but she gets the job done!

I was not too fond of Wolf in lecture but for clinical she was AWESOME!!! She is always testing your knowledge base which is good because lets face it nursing students, we're going to have to learn this material sooner or later. I would do anything to have her again for clinicals. Seriously, get her!

Dr. Wolf is not nearly as difficult as people make her out to be. Some of the students think that the professor needs to hold their hand through everything. Its pathetic, this is college. Keep up with the readings in the textbook because everything is fair game on exams. I learned so much from Dr. Wolf.

This teacher IS THE WORST! her attitude is bad and she dont know how to teach. Don't ask how to put a problem in the calculator because, she dont know how and never bring hers to class. The problems she assign are very difficult as if it's a Ph.D course. The test are 80-100 question, you wont have time to finish. DO NOT TAKE HER!
Horrible Teacher.  Does not teach the material.  She reads it off of a slide.  Take a different teacher unless you can teach yourself the material from the book.
