She could care less if you learn anything or not.  What's important is that she gets through her material and don't hold her up after class to ask questions about the assignment, she gets an attitude like you're putting her out.

She should not be an instructor.  She speeds through the material and could care less if you learn anything in the process.  Do not take her financial classes.  If you ask her to go over something after class, she acts like you're putting her out. She has the knowledge but doesn't have teaching skills.

She's rude and doesn't seem to care about her students or their opinions. She tends to teach at students opposed to teaching them. Her tests are harder than necessary and there is no practice before hand to know what to expect. If I had a different teacher I would have gotten a better grade. I would never take her class ever again.

She is HORRIBLE. Do not take her class. She is lazy, rude and does not know how to teach whatsoever. She copies right out of the book and makes so many mistakes. she has an attitude when someone has a question and she is not helpful. If you unfortunately have to take her class like I did, I suggest you stay at home and read the book instead.

Dr. Wolin is excellent, but her class is not as easy as it seems. She expects students to ask questions and pay attention to the words shes saying, not just whats on the slides. She was also my advisor and is very personable and sweet and adorable. I really like her a lot.
I didn't like her as a person as she was really non-understanding. Test and lecture heavy. If you have to take her youll be fine but shes not my first pick

Dr. Wolin is excellent, but her class is not as easy as it seems. She expects students to ask questions and pay attention to the words shes saying, not just whats on the slides. She was also my advisor and is very personable and sweet and adorable. I really like her a lot.
Test heavy and only 4 quizes. Big project at the end will save you or end you.

I am taking this class and she is teaching 1/2 of it. She is very passionate about what she is talking about, but she is also very unorganized. She uses slides but she will not post them before a class and you have to ask her to post them after a class or she forgets. The lab is confusing; and often lacking in needed detail.

Dr. Wolin overall was a good professor. The class was interesting and she actually cares about what she is teaching which I liked. The only things to be aware of: dont expect to get "participation points" for any assignments, they are graded harder than you'd think. Not many tests but they can have trick questions on them, go to class to take notes

Dr. Wolin is extremely knowledgeable and passionate, her lectures are always very informative as well as funny. I took two classes with her and she was also my adviser and was beyond helpful! She gave helpful feedback and was willing to sacrifice her own time to look at algae over the weekend. Makes sure  you are respectful in class and study hard!
She was tougher about grading than other professors, but I did learn a lot. She's always open to discussions, though she won't go into it during class time.

Gives little to no feedback on assignments. Don't expect explanation. Labs are severely disorganized and directions are unclear.  Lab's don't ever seem to allign with lecture.  Group projects are part of her work. Get ready to do her legwork.
Great teacher. Enthusiastic about the subject matter being taught. Only dislike is the amount of group projects...working in groups with mixed grad and undergrad students is awkward.

Expect review. Biology review. Maybe some new examples but pretty much review. Be precise on vocabulary and don't pay attention when they say what's going to be on a test. Study everything that's been covered.
she loves her diatoms... Good teacher.

Dr. Wong was a great professor.  Everything was extremely organized (I took it online) and she was always willing to help.  The pace of the class was perfect!  The material is so interesting. Highly recommended! Anyone that gives her a poor review obviously did not do the work-she is an EXTREMELY fair grader & just looks for thoughtful answers!

The woman can't teach!! She takes attendance twice each class.  If you are late 5 minutes you are marked absent for half of the class. She makes the class do useless busy work. Seriously, she can't teach! Not recommended.
I loved Professor Woodfield! Honestly just show up to the lectures and you'll be okay. She is really nice and understanding, so do not be afraid to reach out to her if you have any questions!
I loved Professor Woodfield! Honestly just show up to the lectures and you'll be okay. She is really nice and understanding, so do not be afraid to reach out to her if you have any questions!

Cynthia is a kind professor. Her exams sometimes have information from lab in them. Her final exam is something you learn a lot from and also get full credit for which was great! I would take her again. She is not the most organized but if you do your best to study what you learned in lab and her slides you'll do well. Would take again.

He is one of my favorite professors I have ever had. He cares about his students and uses class time wisely. You could tell that he likes what he does, it comes out in his lectures. You do have to do the reading for the class but he also has clear lectures and makes sure to answer any questions people have about the material. Would recommend.
He sadly retired, his class was so easy. all quizzes and tests were online and so so easy. if you had him, you were blessed.

Dr. Woodside is one of the kindest and most caring profs I've ever had. He truly just wants students to learn and take away info from the classroom. He does take away points for missing class. The content of the class is tough and rigorous, but if you trust him and work hard it's cake. Class always goes full time. Don't NEED book but helpful for DB

For it being my first semester at CSU, Dr. Woodside was one of my favorite professors! I took him for Mem & Cog, and Brain & Cog, and he's a great teacher that's always willing to help you succeed, and lets you hold human brains. While making sure you work hard for your grade, he's an understanding person. I can't wait to take him again!

Woodside is an awesome teacher.  I had PSY 101 at 8 am, and honestly, the only thing that got me to get up so early is knowing I was going to his class. He's very passionate about his studies, and even gave us a chance to look at and hold several human brains.  Overall, a really great dude and a standard psych class.  Doesn't take much work.

Dr. Woodside is hands down the best professor I have ever had, even with the class being IVDL and him not being on campus. He gives you all the materials you need to pass the class and more, he is a professor that wants to see his students learn and grow. He is also extremely understanding, a great professor and person all the way around!!!!

You get more out of his lectures in-class than the IVDEL version  Follow his guidelines do what he tells you to do show up to every class He gives bonus points for that He gives you opportunities to succeed Just do the work and Tests are usually taken from quizzes so take the quizzes as many times as possible because it will help you to process it
Nice professor , makes class funny and interesting.
Good teacher overall, he gives quizzes online and 4 Wonderful Opportunitys which are test. Does a good job of answering questions and making sure everyone understands.

He's a great guy and wants every student to pass. If you don't prepare for class he'll be disappointed but he'll continue to teach. Usually shows up late to class if he has a class before yours (usually 10 mins late)  and will usually let you out early if he doesn't have any classes after yours (sometimes class was literally 5 minutes)

Have taken multiple psychology classes with him and he teaches them all literally the same way. Really easy material but tons of homework on the side that is a major part of your grade and takes lots of time. He made all of our memory and cognition exams take-home. He is GREAT with offering research ops to interested students! Nice guy.

Dr. Woodside was the worst, yet best professor I've ever had. He gives so many opportunities to get an A, yet lectures are mostly spent talking about how people don't get extra credit questions on tests or how to use blackboard. I wish more time was spent on the material. You also have to have 8 research credits for him instead of 2 or 4.

Dr. Woodside is an amazing professor. IT is very clear on what is expected. He actually made psychology interesting. He gives 5 chances on quizzes, PRACTICE QUIZZES ONLINE. This class is an Easy A, as long as you put in effort and work. He gives every resource possible. Study guide, outlines, powerpoints. Its your own fault if you fail.
Not helpful.

Great professor! I never fell asleep in any of his lectures which is a good sign. He knows his material and he wants you to know it also! He wants all of his students to do well and he proves it! Just make sure you read the material and do the online quizzes! Those quizzes will be your BFF!

Woodside is a very passionate professor. I had him for PSY 101 Honors. The class was very easy and his tests were composed of information he already exposed. He is a neuroscientist, and goes into great depth, which is amazing for those who can follow along. Take the initiative to learn, go the extra mile, and you won't regret taking his classes.

If you're willing to engage in the material, you should do fine. He makes sure his students do well enough for the "wonderful opportunity".  He is a very nice guy . But the problem is if you're waiting for your exam result, expect 2-7 days. It does take a long time.  He also offers extra credit and an optional final exam which is awesome!!
Don't take psy 101 with him. Don't waste your time or your GPA. Woodside doesn't lecture well, and he crams.
He goes way to fast! Crammed everything in at the last minute!

Dr. Woodside was/is my favorite professor EVER. I wanted to fail PSY 101 just so I could retake it with him. I bragged to other students about him. You have to go to class because he uses examples from stories on his "opportunities" or tests. If you have a problem with your grade, he WILL talk to you. I'm excited for this semesters class with him!

Truly appreciate Dr.Crenshaw... You earn your grade with her. Her class is no "easy A" but you walk away knowing so much more about the profession (which is the point, right?) and if you do well it is something you can be proud of because you earned it!
horrible teaching style, mean,nasty and very unfair to students
All around excellent experience.  Always willing to spend time helping students.

I've maintained a near 4.0 every year of college and this was the first class with genuine effort, understanding, and studying- got an F week one with no feedback apart from the answer key (FOR ESSAY HALF M/C HALF ESSAY). I underestimated and thought the comments were overexaggerated. Do yourself a favor and pick any other teacher for this course.

Arthur Worley is an awful professor and I am unsure how he has a job at the University. His grading does not make any sense, gives very poor feedback, and is rude. He expects assignments done his way yet cannot clarify how that is. I have asked for clarification numerous times and he points me to another students work! He doesn't grade, he judges!

I agree with most of the other reviews. Prepare to spend hours upon hours reading the readings because if you dont, you wont pass. He is such a difficult grader and will take any opportunity to take off points on your grade. I recommend sending him your journals to review, it will guarantee a better grade. Use the bioethical principles in all

It's almost impossible to get anything higher than a C in this course. If you don't perfectly use the words he wants, he'll deduct most of the points. I understand online teaching is hard, but so is online learning. There is no point of making things harder on the students for no reason.
He is a tough grader and could have clearer instructions. He makes you work for your grade and really think. As long as you put effort in you should be fine

Yeah this class was awful. He is a very harsh grader, and he gives zero useful feedback. He has no consistent rubric for grading papers, and you will never get above a C on any paper assignment. It's like he enjoys tanking students' grades. Don't take his classes. The absolute worst professor in the entire world.

WOW!! He is hands down the worst teacher the world has ever seen. DO NOT TAKE HIS CLASS! This man wants kids to fail, he doesn't help students and his grading criteria is ridiculous. Forget getting an A on any assignment, the best you'll be able to pull off is a C. I would go into detail but the other ratings sum it up perfect. Horrible teacher!

He is quite possibly the worst professor at CSU. Absolutely horrible. He is far too harsh in his grading, especially considering it is a 101 level course. He does not let you know exactly what he is looking for and gives you poor grades for not reading his mind. DO NOT TAKE ANY OF HIS CLASSES. spare yourselves.

This is by far the worst professor I think you could ever have. For his class all you would do is read a textbook that is so hard to understand and read, then write papers and have quizzes etc. over it. I put in hard work and not once did I get above a C on any paper and a B on any quiz or online post. He seems like he wants to fail kids.

Absolutely horrendous grader. Youll read a very difficult text with difficult english and difficult topics and he marks you off an excessive amount for small details left out of papers that cover a very large chapter all the while putting a word limit on your papers so you cannot include those small details. One of the worst teachers ive ever had

I have had her for a 500 course and for a 600 Research class as well. Both times she was organized, helpful, and relatively easy to work with. The 500 level class was mostly reading and quizzes with one paper. The research class necessitated individual motivation and significantly less work to be graded over a very large paper. Solid classes.

I have had her for a 500 course and for a 600 Research class as well. Both times she was organized, helpful, and relatively easy to work with. The 500 level class was mostly reading and quizzes with one paper. The research class necessitated individual motivation and significantly less work to be graded over a very large paper. Solid classes.
Doesn't respond to emails. You'll read two whole textbooks with no interaction from the professor. Questions for the modules are word for word copied from the text.

The weekly quizzes go by the book so if you can pick out keywords quickly, you'll do well. The biweekly discussion posts only have to be 100 words long and opinion-based. There is one essay and she's not a stickler on content as long as you say you learned something.
If you do not read the assigned text you will not do well in the class, because all of the online modules are timed so searching the answers up will be pointless.
Excellent professor - she made me love ancient history in a whole new way!
Class rocks. Take it.
Loves her subject and is very knowledgeable in the field. Lots of reading.
Very standard class. lecture, presentation, exam. The presentations can be fun if you have fun with it. Exams are difficult, the presentation saved my GPA.

Kelly W is amazing! Very passionate and also humorous! Sometimes her note taking is grueling, but its crucial because all her various class tests are on notes and lecture slides. Ive had her I believe 4 times now lol She's pretty easy on the eyes as well which doesnt hurt ;)

Dr Wrenhaven is by far and way my favorite Professor I have ever taken! She has real passion for her subject matter and it shows in her lectures. She is quite helpful and will talk at length after class if you need help or have any questions. Her notes are where she draws her testing material from so attendance is highly important in her classes.
Class sucks, attendance is mandatory like you are in grade school. Tests are hard with no review given. Its a wac course with barely any writing (makes sense...)Doesn't seem willing to help students.

Dr. Wrenhaven was pretty neat. I am not a history major and sometimes the lectures were dull but overall I enjoyed this course and would consider taking another one of her classes, she knows a lot of information and is willing to help when you approach her after class.

Interesting course. She's extremely knowledgeable. Attendance not mandatory (suggested), but 10% of grade. 2 [easy] exams, 2 [very easy] papers. I loved the course. Even if you're not into Greek relgion/myth...Go to class, get an A.
Gods, Heroes, and Ritual is a great class.  This is my favorite professor at CSU.  Take this class!

Come to class at least 5 minutes early, attendance is required and she takes away sign in sheet a minute after class starts. Midterm, final, and research paper (8-10 pgs). This is a WAC course. Tests are multiple choice and 1 or 2 short essays, about 30 ?s. Does not give out her notes, so coming to class is a must. Not a bad professor overall

The professor is very knowledgeable about the material, but she does go off on tangents about Greece too much.  Some of the material is confusing but she is willing to explain it more when needed. There is a midterm & final--short answer, multiple choice, short essay and fill in the blank and a research paper. This is a wac course!!!!!

I took Dr. Wrenhaven several semesters back for Ancient Greek Lit. She KNOWS her stuff, is very organized, and is no nonsense. If you want to learn, take her class; if not, take volleyball. I RESPECT profs like her, and I'm in the MFA. She's tough but fair, as it should be; an excellent addition to CSU.

Dr. Wrenhaven is younger then most of the professor teaching history at CSU but she knows her stuff inside and out. She focuses a lot on sources from the period she is teaching, which helps develop an different understand then a typical textbook would give. She quizzes you on the readings and only gives 2 exams and a final paper. Take her.

Really enjoyed this class. She is extremely knowledgeable on the topic of ancient greece. Class is mandatory and is all lecture, so keep that in mind before registering. Extremely friendly and genuinely seems to care that her students excel. I never used the text book once and still got a good grade in the class. Tests are over lecture only.

Personally, Prof. Wright is a nice guy - sometimes too  nice.  He did not keep control of the class and let comments from some students get out of control.  He also spent very little time teaching.  He had no enthusiasm and did not effectively lead the discussions.  He pushes the the writing lab, so use it for his final paper (you get extra points)
Good professor, seemed a little frazzled this semester.
Great class.  Makes you look at issues a different way.  He is very engaging.
I wish I could take him for every class.  He is fair, and understands how to reach his class to get results.

He was a good teacher, but sometimes he seemed like he didn't feel like teaching. Seemed at times that he was putting in as much effort as he saw from some of the more laid back members of the course, as opposed to modeling how much effort he expected from us.
He is relatively new to CSU. I am a grad student and I found his class to be interesting and informative. Looking forward to his tenure.

RUN, literally. This is the worst professor I've had. I'm not even a criminology major, I was just taking this course as a WAC. Her expectations for assignments do not make sense at all & she makes no attempt to help you to understand. She does not even respond to questions, let alone emails. I am glad that I withdrew. Do not take her.

There are 4 exams and only 1 paper in this WAC class (why?!)The way she creates ?'s makes an easy 2 chapter exam out of this world type difficult. Many times she had to delete questions because so many students came forward. Oh and the last exam is cumulative, so have fun with the 30 page study guide she provides,Don't take a class by her! trust me

Don't take this class if you care about your GPA because it will plummet after this class. Not nice, not accessible and do not question your grade because she will be mean about it. I am surprised I passed and lasted an entire semester.

Responds quickly to emails is about all I can say. Tests are hard bc she doesn't tell you what will be on the exams. Miniscule facts are on the tests and she uses a lockdown browser so you cannot use notes or book.
Takes a long time to grade assignments and when asked about grades she will be rude to you and your grade will suffer for it. Would not recommend.

Do not take this professor. Not sure why she's even still a professor when she constantly receives low marks from her students. Grades hard. Tests are hard. Not good at giving instructions for assignments.

I had a difficult time with this class because she has her students create the study guides for the exams. One of her assignments is to create a study guide for the next exam. You get extra credit if she chooses your study guide to circulate to the class. You will never know what to study bc the chapters are long and the students create the guides
She does not show that she cares about her students. Not friendly. Not clear on expectations. Lectures are boring.

You never know what is going to be on the exams because she has her students create the exams. She uses a lockdown browser although it is an online class. She is not good at explaining assignment criteria. Do yourself a favor and do not take any class by this teacher.

She does not make assignment guidelines clear. When you question your assignment she will not answer your questions. Instead, she will call you unprofessional and inappropriate. It is a shame that universities do not care about students.

Truly the worst professor I've ever had. Expectations are always unclear. Takes off points for small/ridiculous things. Not the friendliest. Study guides do not correspond with tests at all. You will have to remember tiny and insignificant details from the textbooks/readings, so be prepared. Care about your GPA? Don't take this professor's classes.

Worst professor Ive ever had. Online class and not accessible in person. Doesnt usually reply to emails. When she does reply, shes not helpful. Not clear in directions for assignments. Changes due dates without giving students a heads up. Exams are recorded on a webcam & on a lockdown browser. Takes points off for small things. DO NOT recommend.

I love this professour and the lecture topic. I find her extremly entertaining and I dont fall asleep during her lectures. In additon her jokes are funny and It adds a sort of great feeling to the class. Compared to the last review I wrote, this class is a heck of lot better than my other lectures

I give Professor Wright an 2.5 out of 5. Although during her lectures she breaks it down more for you to understand. Her down fall is that SHE DOES NOT post the lecture notes, hard grader, and is not clear on assignment directions. You will ask her for help she will talk to you rudely or tell you to ask classmates. EVERYONE IS CONFUSED AS WELL.

WORST TEACHER I HAVE EVER HAD! if you do not have the same view point, she will not like you. My rough draft was a 69% and my final was a 52%. HOW? she couldn't answer that. She will tell you what will be on the exam to study but it is not actually on there. make sure you read every chapter for the clicker quizzes- hard.

Dr. Wright is definitely a professor that I will be taking again in the future. She does do pop quizzes so make sure to read the book. Her lectures are very understandable and not confusing. Few grades in the course so don't blow anything off, but exams are not hard. Course is structured but in a good way. Awesome professor

Dr. Wright is hands down the funniest professor I have ever had. At first she can come off as rude or standoff ish but once you get to know her you'll see she's great. She is a tough grader but gives good feedback. Clicker quizzes are always over the assigned chapter. Definitely not an easy A but if you work hard, an A is very possible.

The pop quizzes were hard if you don't read the book ahead of time. Her exams are hard because she doesn't give a study guide and makes you wing it. The book is easy to read but boring. The class is interesting but you have to work hard for your grade.

There is nothing wrong with a professor being tough and having higher standards. It is in this environment where students receive a better education. The problem is when the professor is tough without being clear in his/her expectations. Dr. Wright was not clear on any of the assignments. Learned little in the class. I would not recommend.

Tough course but again it is college! I would take her again. Don't expect it to be an easy A class but if you put the time and effort you will get no lower then a B. One group presentation. One book report that is graded fairly. 3 exams and in class assginments and pop quizzes regularly. I loved professor wright and the class was college like

Dr. Wu was great! She did give two homework assignments per week but they were always very quick and straight forward. There needs to be some homework to understand the material. She was good at explaining and always was clear about what was going to be tested on the exam. If you show up and do the work, you will be fine.

Dr. Wu was great! She did give two homework assignments per week but they were always very quick and straight forward. There needs to be some homework to understand the material. She was good at explaining and always was clear about what was going to be tested on the exam. If you show up and do the work, you will be fine.
Dr Yuping Wu was a pretty good professor in my opinion. I felt that I really learned however she did jump around quite a lot and it was difficult to keep up.

She's a very nice person. She's a little hard to understand, but you get used to it. If you skip class, you won't understand the material. Her tests are hard and she's a tough grader on those but not on the homework. She gives way too much homework - both paper and online. The online homework was the worst but otherwise, the class was fine.

I hated this class with her. She never wanted to repeat anything and would skip over things in lecture. We have 2 exams plus the final. If you bomb the final (Even with good grades on the other exams) its over for you. The online homework was HORRIBLE. It took hours to do.

Dr Wu does know what she is talking about, but a lot of the time she rambles or resorts to R. This class is here to teach you SAS, and I think she could have done a better job with it. Luckily the exams were easily. She doesn't make it clear what she expects out of the hw. She doesn't use blackboard, so I didn't know my grade. You can email her.

Wu herself is a very nice person. On the other hand, she is very scatterbrain and goes so fast. I took a basic stats course in high school so I thought this class would be a breeze for me, turns out it's NOT! She lets you use a cheat sheet on exams, and gives a week to complete homework which is nice. Exams were not similar to exam reviews.....

Professor Wu is a great statistician and can get the material over well if you really take the time to understand her and ask questions. Her exams are similar to what she reviews and you are prepared for them. She does go fast though and you can get lost very easily. Put the work in and you will be fine.
She does not explain anything and just assumes youre following her. The whole class has no clue what shes doing and just smiles and nods

She loves the subject she is teaching. Her thoughts are ahead of her speech so sometimes she may mix of her words. Somewhat understandable, slight attitude when you ask a question from a previous chapter.

Loved her! All exams were open book open note and she gives you a week to finish homework assignments. She also gives extra credit problems before exams. She tries to help you understand things as well as she can. Sometimes she goes over things too fast, but she's always open to help with things outside of class.

She is very nice and wants you to learn, but just doesn't get the material across well. I had this stats class in high-school so i knew what was going on, but if it was my first time with her I would have been lost. It really isn't a tough subject if you have the right professor.

Took for Applied Statistics. I breezed through intro and thought that I'd fly through this class with no problems, not the case. She's a bit hard to understand through her accent, but she definitely tries her hardest to make sure you understand. All tests are open note, and they're pretty easy.

Excellent professor. Sometimes hard to understand given the foreign accent yet if you pay attention you will be fine. Does not care about repeating herself over and over again until you understand. Only two midterms and a final. Big on homework and LOTS of extra credit.
Hard to understand her. She is very confusing and she confuses herself. Your going to need all the help you can get to try to pass her class!!!!!!

She is possibly the nicest woman in the world. She goes above and beyond for her students, the people who complain are the ones that didn't show up to class or sat and talked throughout lecture. It's an easy A, she's a great teacher. You have to be dumb to not get an A in this course.

A little hard to understand, but she is willing to reteach if yiou ask. She touches back on lpreviously taught material as well and lets you use formula sheets for exams. Very good if you actually want to understand and use statistics.
Good teacher but sometimes difficult to understand... only 3 test the whole semester, 10 homework wkst , and about 14 pop quizzes...
Challenging class. You can tell she loves to teach. The pace of the class is very quick moving, and so it can be very difficult to understand at times.
Very easy class, very helpful
She is a really nice professor.  Hard to understand but as long as you follow her notes you'll know what's going on...doesn't use a textbook so don't even bother with buying it...easy class
Great professor but you know his specialty is GIS.

I really like this class because it satisfies as a science credit with lab. Prof. Wyles is an overall easy going nice teacher. Show up and attend field trips as much as you can to receive the best grade possible. His lectures can be long at times but you learn a lot. Also make sure you have reliable transportation for the field trips.

Prof Wyles was a pretty average professor IMO.  He made it clear what he expected, so if you paid attention, came to EVERY CLASS, and checked Blackboard, there is no reason not to have gotten an A.  Attendance is 100% mandatory for class and field trips.

Took this class on alternating Saturdays and it was the best decision. Wyles is funny and great. The first part was lecture (he gave us breaks), and the second half we went on field trips. He gives homework that's easy and the only test is a midterm. There's a research paper at the end and a 4 minute presentation. Show up and pass.
Loved Mr. Wyles! very nice and wants all of his student to do well.

Prof Wyles sets clear expectations. Gives every opportunity for success in his class. Show up, do the easy assignments, go on the field trips to the Metroparks. Follow his review guide for midterm and you can ace this class and have fun doing it. Highly recommend the summer school session!
VERY HELPFUL!! nice guy very relatable. tests are challenging! dont bother buying the book.
Great Guy. You will learn a lot.
Dr. Wyles was an excellent professor. Easy and interesting class. there were some trips, so be ready for that. The trips were to explore the nature of Cleveland. Easy A class.

All you have to do is study the practice questions!! He Legit COPY & PASTE the questions from the practice packets on DIRECTLY ON THE EXAM!!!! The only problem you have is the online hw thats a pain in the butt. The practice questions to study on has wrong problems and he wont say which. Study the practice questions for the exams and you will pass

By teaching meaning reading the slides and going somewhat in depth in the topic, I would say Xu does the job. Lecture is pointless. I skipped all his lecture and I'm passing his class because I studied in my own time.

Not a good professor at all. Has an accent and could care less about students success. He doesn't teach anything, you have to teach yourself. I would never recommend anyone to take this class because you'll be wasting your time and money.

Not a great professor at all. Shows no care to the students or the class itself. Does not come prepared and would just read off the power points on the spot. It was very clear every class period that he did not prepare himself. The only way to get a good grade is to learn on your own

Very difficult professor for an introductory chemistry class. He is very hard to understand and his tests are inconsistent with the material. All of the tests are over the powerpoints which don't make sense so read the book and get a tutor. If you have the option, take it online. I ended with a B but just because I spent countless hours studying

Worst chemistry teacher I've ever had. He does not care about his students at all, and it is clear that he is not concerned with our success. He literally copies the textbook and pastes them on his PowerPoint. It was more beneficial to skip class and read the textbook on your own. The only reason I got a B is because I read the chapters on my own.
He is a fantastic teacher. Very clear and knows the material incredibly well. Breaks down difficult concepts and explains them in a manageable way. Would definitely recommend this guy!

The only reason I passed this class was because he adds 10% to each test. I literally had no idea what I was doing at a because he's very fast. You really have to read the text book and you should sign up for TASC tutoring now.

I took him for College Chem and it was awful. Average of the exams were a 51%, the AVERAGE. Something is wrong with the teaching or difficulty of the exams if this is the case and he doesn't seem to understand that. I would highly recommend waiting for a different professor for this course. Talk about a stressful semester

He was a terrible teacher. Didn't care how his students were performing in class. Very rude! Definitely not the kind of teacher to take time and help students.reads directly off the notes.class average for the exams was very low but he would tell us its our own fault. If you have the chance to take the class with a different professor, DO SO!!!

This class was utterly useless because of the professor's teaching style. He is a graduate professor and teaches a 200 student freshman level course like he would teach graduate students. The grading scale is diff. because of this (a 66% is a C-). The class average on the last test was 56%. That speaks volumes to his teaching skills.

Speaks english with cute chinese accent. Reads straight from powerpoint that he gives you online anyways. I recommend you read the book and ask him questions because his examples are super basic compared to the hard test questions.
Horrible professor. If there any any other options, take them! My GPA is screwed. I am an Honors student and received the lowest grade i have EVER gotten.
Complete GPA killer. If you are of average intelligence you will more than likely get a C or D. The average test score for each exam is below the equivalent of a 70%. Does not curve. Have fun.
Goes over concepts well.  But when it comes to mathmatical equations, doesn't go into depth at all.
Does not explain the material clearly. Cannot understand his concepts and lectures. Basically read the book and "teach yourself."
This course is very useful.And the teaching is very clear.One of the best professors I`ve ever had.
HORRIBLE. Doesn't answer questions... exams are difficult because they aren't based upon what is in the book. Killed my GPA.

-Difficult to understand -Lacks clarity in explainations -Acts as if it is a favor to answer questions -Teaches easy concepts, tests difficult concepts -Treats students in degrading manner -Doesn't encourage interaction -Xu is one of the worst profs I have ever had -The textbook is your bff but it doesnt incude enough teststyle problems for success

Worst professor i've ever had... I highly recommend taking this chem class with a different professor. He is very hard to understand and i not helpful at all..He doesn't explain anything and just reads off of a powerpoint. His exams are extremely hard. The things that are on the exams he never explained in class.

The class was hard. There were only two exams. You need to do well If you want a good grade but, the grade is only out of the two exams so everything else is extra like the weekly quizes. That helps alot! I think its a good class and you can easily get an A, just do not slack off. READ BOOK! & do study guides.

His accent is a little tough to understand in the beginning but you do get use to it. This is a wac course so expect to do writibg assignments. He is helpful and very approachable. Study power points for quizzes.

He breaks the material down for you in simple terms and posts his powerpoints also. Attendance is not required. You take midterm, final and 2 quizzes, one of which he drops. His powerpoints follow the book very precisely, so I did not open the book once. Has an accent but you get used to it. Overall good professor.

All you have to do is review his study guides and you will do well on his final and midterm.  He gives out some extra credit but don't rely on it for a good grade.  You must do well on his midterm and final.  Otherwise, he's a good prof.

He's not the best professor, but he knows what he's talking about.His class consists of solely one midterm and the final. He has some extra credit assignments that will help you out.  As long as you review the study guides in detail then you pretty much have the answers to the all the questions on his test which are true/false and multiple choice.

Professor Yamomoto appears to be hard to understand at first but after a few classes you get used to his accent. He is very fair and helpful. When you pay attention to his lectures you will really understand the material. He makes the covered material entertaining and thought provoking. (This class is for the serious Psych students.)

Professor Yamomoto appears to be hard to understand at first but after a few classes you get used to his accent. He is very fair and helpful. When you pay attention to his lectures you will really understand the material. He makes the covered material entertaining and thought provoking. (This class is for the serious Psych students.)

He's not that bad! I can see some people not being able to understand him at first, but I got use to his accent, and understood him fine. The tests are kinda tough, but if you just go to class and study a little you will be fine.

I thought this class would be hard, but honestly, it was great.  There were 2 quizzes and 2 exams.  The quizzes are like 12-15 questions and exams are like 50 questions.  Lecture was all powerpoint and straight from the book.  If you have to take this class, take it with this guy!!

For Memory and Cognition (PSY 372, he posted study guides which were extremely helpful! As long as your read his book, have the class request study guides, and print his lecture notes, you should do well on his quizzes and tests!
Easy Lab for circuits show up and do what your told and you will be fine

Under NO CIRCUMSTANCES should you take her. Only take her as a last resort. Her teaching method & presentation of information is mediocre. She DOES NOT CARE about her students. She doesn't provide study guides for quizzes or exams or any type of extra credit. Her quizzes are tricky because she tests you on things that she doesn't go over in class.

Dr. Y. knows what he's talking about and he is willing to explain any material again. He is a researcher on campus in the psych dept. so he has ongoing studies and he is very very knowledgeable! I recommend him as a prof because he is lenient but also fosters participation and an active class.

He's a really pleasant person and is good with answering questions. Lectures are interesting and engaging, definitely show up for this one. Videos along with lectures are fascinating and help with understanding the material. Tests are straightforward, no tricks.
There was a lot to cover in this course, but Dr Y knows his stuff! Was always open for discussions or questions. Helped give a better understanding with videos.

Dr. Y struggles to teach graduate level statistics. This course was supposed to lay the foundation for success with statistics at a graduate level,  but he was unable to convey exactly what we were learning. I learned more using Laerd Stats and talking with my fellow cohort members. Failed the final and still got an A in the class due to the EC...

Dr. Y is one of my favorite professors at CSU. His lectures are always engaging and he offers a wealth of information while breaking it down to be applicable and easy to understand. He wants his students to do well so he offers numerous opportunities for extra credit and his tests are fair. Can't say enough good things about him!

Dr. Yaroslavsky was one of my favorite professors I have had here at CSU so far. His lectures are very informative, and his study guides give you clear outlines of what to expect on the exam. The course consisted of 4 exams and an optional final that would replace your lowest exam score. Tons of extra credit opportunities as well.

Awesome professor! Only exams and a participation grade. Final exam is optional! He said we needed the book but I did fine on all of the exams just taking notes during lecture and studying his power points. He keeps lecture interesting and I would definitely recommend taking his class.

Dr. Y is an amazing prof. His lectures are very interesting and he makes learning about disorders fun. He encourages you to participate in his class and makes it easy to do.  Offers 20 points of extra credit and I would definitely take advantage of that.  Would definitely take him again!

Definitely one of the best professors I have ever had. He is so understanding and clearly cares about his students. If you have any difficulty with anything in the class, he is always there to help in any way that he can. If you show up and pay attention in lectures, you'll pass the class easily.
Dr. Yaroslavsky is an awesome professor. He knows his stuff and will help you with anything you need! Makes it easy to pass if you show up and pay attention. You won't want to skip class.
I actually like her class a lot, it was one of the only classes that I had this semester and actually liked
I actually like her class a lot, it was one of the only classes that I had this semester and actually liked
Very thorough lectures and gives ample time to get assignments done
wonderful, marvelous, awesome, spectacular, cool
cool class and professor
I loved this course. Professor was very knowledgeable on the subject.
best bio class. easy as pie.
Best professor ever! loves tomatoes.
I loved her class. Makes lots of jokes. Easy A

Dr. Yasick is a very lecture heavy teacher. The class can be long and boring, but mainly everything you need to know is in the PowerPoint slides. You will be required to look into the textbook a little more deeply than a normal lecture. Tests have medium difficulty, but she has a helpful curve between 10-20% depending on class performance.

While attendance wasn't always mandatory, there were certain days you had to show up to class. Show up and get 10 points. Miss it and get a 0. The entire class was based on the paper, so I appreciated that. She gave good feedback at each checkpoint, but I wish she structured the class differently. Its hard to write an abstract before the rest.

Similar to many of the other comments, the class is a bit challenging - but you don't necessarily need the book. Some of the info for the exam is mentioned in lecture but not on the slides. The study guide helps with half of the questions you will see on the exam and a little less than half of the other questions are from group quizzes in class.
Very demanding course. I failed it with another prof and probably would have failed again but Dr. Yasick always made time, answered all my questions, and really helped when I needed it.

Most of the time you are teaching the material to yourself because she gets off point. If I am paying for a class I expect to be taught most of it. Her exams would not be hard at all if she would test us on stuff from the book or the notes. The book and notes do not correlate with each other and most of the questions on the exam are not from either

She lectures using fill in the blank note, but while teaching, she skips over the fill in the blanks so you don't get the answers. She likes to go on irrelevant tangents. I have honestly taught myself the material using her study guides before the test and the internet and I have an A in the class, so I wouldn't bother buying the textbook.

I love Alison! She makes a rather boring subject very entertaining. Along with being a sweet woman who is very informative, she also has a "no nonsense" attitude. Lectures are straight off the PowerPoint, but she makes them fun. Go to class, do the readings, do the extra credit, participate in lecture and you will do fine. Highly recommend.

Decent person but can't relay information to others. Reads off of slides and gets off topic very quickly. Can't answer questions if the answer isn't on the slides.  The only way I got an A is because I read the book. Never went to class and just read book before exams. Final is previous exam questions that she gives back to you.
Very boring little to no grades outside of 4 tests. Hard to follow and the test differ greatly from the tests.

Professor herself wasn't all that bad. Class wasn't very exciting, she literally just read off of her slides (which were made by the book company) so you don't necessarily have to show up, but beware of ditching because about 3 or 4 times during the semester she randomly gave an assignment at the very end of class that you had to be there for.

While many didn't like her, I LOVED this course and the way she taught it. She knew the material well, and was able to give examples to help you understand. She likes to randomly give out extra credit when attendance dips, especially during the class after an exam. He course is tough, but you'll learn a lot and it's worthwhile.

Attendance is non-mandatory but suggested for extra points. The material isn't that bad, but she is not very interesting when teaching it. For an entry level biology course, it's more than it's worth.
null

I will be the first to say it, he's really not as bad as everyone here is making him out to be. Maybe it's because the class is online, but I really don't have any problems with his teaching. Homework is graded on participation, as long as you attempt it you will be fine, though I wish he gave more feedback on homework. Exams are tough, do the hw!

Probably the worst professor in the EE department. Very little help and the textbook is from 2004, making it almost impossible to find without a $200+ price tag. Most students fail the exams because they are so hard. Would not recommend.
Horrendous. Absolutely horrendous. If someone was trying to be the worst professor and teacher they possibly could be, they'd still probably be better than this guy.

This class is very hard. He is a smart guy, but he is not a good teacher. Expect to read often. Tests are very hard-- average on the final is a D. He rarely derives equations, but you will be expected to be able to do this in the exam. The lectures consist of him reading an over head projector of examples ripped right out of the text book.

Even though he tries to encourage student participation, he shoots down even the smartest students simply because they aren't going after what he is looking for. Additionally, he requests more time than what is allotted for the class. Study hard and find those who have taken class (for tests and HW answers) to make taking this class much easier.
Horrible class.

No circuit analysis/deriv of EQs. All class content is transparencies ripped from text yet tests are not, gives no examples for tests. Large curve to those who attend class everyday.
 Teacher does not enjoy teaching which comes across strong when he interacts with students. Condescending & deters students from asking questions.
Worst ever! Very mean, does not explain anything. Makes you come skip other classes just to take his tests, but if you skip his class he says you "fail"
"Bad english, bad professor, bad person." Sums him up pretty well.

You are going to have to deal with this guy sooner or later. Let me save you some time and fill you in on the answer to any and all of your questions. The answer will always be V_d. Now you are set for electronics 2
Extremely poor professor. Avoid whenever possible.

Worst professor ever. Mean to students. Insists that students attend class, but doesn't care if they pay attention. This lead to a surreal atmosphere in which he speaks to a room of 25 students in which absolutely no one is paying attention! This is a mockery of modern education. Avoid at all costs.

The professor was absolutely awful, when asked questions he would simply tell us to "refer to the book". His lectures were nothing more than reciting passages from the book and then briefly going over the example problem already explained, in the book. The book was ok, it could have been more clear about the behavior of the devices.
Holy crap! Where did they get this guy?! I can't believe he has phD. He must be a fake. He's like the worst professor I've ever had!!
So bad! Really, really bad! Bad English, bad teacher, bad person. Stay away from any of his courses.

This guy sucks so bad. I'm so sorry to hear he's going to your school to teach after he was fired from his last one. Just wait, you'll see. Check out his ratings for Physics at Hunter College in New York. You'll see. Don't take him!!! You've been warned.
Come to class, do the work, participate = PASS

Professor Yeom is a great person to learn GIS from. He really wants all his students to leave his class with basic and employable GIS skills. He will make you repeat assignments until you get them right, but doesnt take off too many points if you have to repeat over and over like I did. Hes very accessible outside class and wants you to pass!

Professor Yeom is a great person to learn GIS from. He really wants all his students to leave his class with basic and employable GIS skills. He will make you repeat assignments until you get them right, but doesnt take off too many points if you have to repeat over and over like I did. Hes very accessible outside class and wants you to pass!

Going into this class I had no experience with GIS applications but Dr. Minkyu made things pretty easy to learn if you went to class and did the tutorial assignments from the book. The final project Is pretty tough but he makes himself available in and outside of class to help you. Do the work and you will pass!

Dr. Yeom is an awesome professor who was extremely helpful during class, and available even past official office hours when we would email questions regarding GIS and Python. He is a personable, passionate professor who is able to take complex issues and simplify them for students. An absolute beast of a prof who pushed us to be better.

Dr. Yeom is a knowledgeable, caring instructor. He teaches you to think and problem-solve on your own, a necessary skill needed to master ArcMap. He provides the foundations to ease you right into UST 486.

The class was hard but double. The exams were based on the lectures. Did not like his inappropriate jokes and from time to time absolutely disrespectful behavior. He made many students feel uncomfortable.

He will tell you to buy the book. Save yourself almost $200 and don't but it. His exams are 100% what he lectures on and nothing from the book. He wastes a lot of class time telling jokes that are often mean and inappropriate. The exams are very hard and tricky. It's a shame that he is the only professor that teaches Tax.

worst prof I've ever had. read from the book and never went over practice review problems. tests are impossible. one group project that is very time consuming. only graded on 3 tests, the project, and attendance. would never take again
Dr. Yetmar is the bombdotcom. Just pay attention, go to his office, and try. The tax case is important and you should start it ASAP. One of the better profs I have had at CSU.

Dont get me wrong, this is a very difficult course. Be prepared to put the work needed into it. If you put in 50% work be pared for a 25% grade. That being said, this is one of the few times I can remember a professor being not only gifted in teaching the subject, but a wizard for making it entertaining. you get 2 note sheets for each exam. Use it

I had this man for a class years ago and he is one of the best professors you will ever have, HANDS DOWN.  One of the classiest people you will ever meet--cares about students and people and wants to see people understand and succeed.    A great prof but an even better person.

great teacher he's nice and tries to make class as fun as possible you are allowed a cheat sheet for the test but the tests are hard but not impossible if you study and read the book along with the notes.

Dr. Yetmar does a great job of making a dull subject interesting. His lectures are designed to help prepare you for the exams, and he mixes in a sense of humor that you don't often find in an accounting class. He makes going to class enjoyable. Exams are tough, even with the cheat sheets he allows. The tax case project is time consuming but not bad
Class is harder than Intermediate 1 and 2 . But he is pretty cool. Go Scott

this isn't an easy class but from my experience professor Yetmar is a great accounting teacher. accounting is usually boring but he makes jokes and tries to bring life to the class. the test are not easy but he allows a cheat-sheet which helps a ton.

Hardest class I've ever taken. Allows you to write down his lectures verbatim and create your own study guide for the exam; you'd think that would make his exams easy but they are extremely difficult, even with added info from the text.

Such an enjoyable class, yes even for tax. Dr. Yetmar is a great teacher. The tests are hard; his lectures go along with his tests but you do have to read the text. Always available for help and so funny.

Dr. Yetmar is the best accounting professor. Tax is tough but Yetmar makes it easy to understand and clear. He also has a great sense of humor that helps to make a boring subject interesting. His lectures go hand in hand with his exams. He also lets you make a cheat sheet for the exams (because who can memorize all the crazy tax laws!)
Just horrible, you understand nothing, i hated going to class. he has two exam and one final. plan to understand nothing:)
Absolutely loved coming to class. He makes tax fun with his constant comedic attitude. You'll laugh everysingle class . Tests are hard but this teacher is a must to take
He is one of my favorite professors! He was funny and made the class enjoyable! The test are hard but the class was fun! He does curve at the end of the semester.
Awesome teacher! One of my favorite classes he makes the class fun and makes sure you understand what hes teaching! tests are hard  but he does curve!

Hilarious professor and actually made going to class not a drag. Teaches material fairly well but you should probably read or at least skim over the stuff he covers in the book. Tests are pretty difficult but he did curve for the first 3. Always willing to help.
not recommended for his class, people are struggling, and barely go over materials in the text, the test is hard and not much relate to the homework that we did.
Yetmar is awesome, would recommend taking any of his courses.  Definitely not an easy A, but you'll learn a lot and be prepared.  Funny as hell and a fun class for a boring topic.
He explains everything thoroughly. He makes sure that everybody understands the material. His homework assignments are pretty easy and gives extra credit opportunities too.

This class wasn't overall terrible, it was just very difficult online. You don't learn much from the lectures and can learn it all just by reading the book instead. He wasn't very helpful with questions and didn't explain things very well either. It's probably a lot better in person.

This semester has been rough with Kuzey. He expects us to know everything he says and doesn't like when students ask questions. He said "that's for you to figure out". He reads from the textbook the entire class. Other reviews say he's funny but he hasn't been very fun at all this semester. Must be the pandemic or something.
He explains everything thoroughly. He makes sure that everybody understands the material. His homework assignments are pretty easy and gives extra credit opportunities too.
Professor Yilmaz is great all around. He is an extremely fair grader when it comes to your term paper and is very clear with his expectations for exams. He is also hilarious!
Very generous with grading, three exams out of 100 points, 20 point of extra credit. Wants all his students to pass, just show up to class and do the homework.
What an awesome man
What an awesome man
Overall helpful teacher, very approachable and funny. Lenient on some assignments. Boring lectures though. Maybe take this class online. Read his assignment instructions!

Before having Dr. Yin for UST 418 (Urban Planning) I had him for another class so I knew what to expect. Of course, all lectures were well prepared, he kept our small class engaged, and even added some humor to the sometimes tiring late night classes. Assignments were reasonable and graded fairly.

Dr. Yin is one of CSU's finest professors. He is incredibly knowledgeable and truly cares about teaching. Also, if you have any questions about scheduling or other college related matters he is willing to help. If you actually want to learn about urban planning or Cleveland, take one of his classes.

Great Professor. Very knowledgeable about Cleveland. Class is dull, but explanations "enlightening." NOT certain how KNOWING about the "Black Ghetto" of Cleveland (where CSU is actually located,) will have a bearing on my life, but GLAD the class is over.  BE CERTAIN to KNOW/LEARN/GET A BOOK on APA style writing, NOT using MLA here.

The teacher was an easy grader and the papers were easy. The subject was boring and class time dragged sometimes. He is a fun teacher though and he is extremely helpful. Got an A and I didn't show up half the time and didn't get the books. All the grades were based on 3 assignments.

Super boring however, the information was useful, also there is a lot of writing and he grades pretty hard.  this class is not too hard but, you need to have great attendance and you'll be doing a lot of writing.
Incredibly boring class, but I think due more to the subject material.  Friendly and funny professor.  Very thorough and helpful.

Great professor... I struggled with the first writing assignment (78%)  but Dr. Yin was 100% available to help me with the others  (98% and 99%). As long as you are willing to put in the necessary effort, you can do well.  Dr. Yin really knows his stuff and is passionate about the subject- Hands down my favorite professor I've had at CSU.

Class was offered online and traditional. Glad I took traditional because discussions were interesting and helpful for writing papers. He actually RETURNS your final paper. Genuinely interested in topic, fair grader, welcomes student input. Good class bc it counts as a WAC and Diversity class. Cool class if you're interested in Cleveland/cities.

I took this class online to fulfill a college requirement.  I ended up really enjoying this class. Dr.Yin is really helpful, and keeps the class interesting.  There is a lot of writing, but he is a fair grader, and always willing to help.
I really enjoyed this class.

Very fun teacher and very funny.  If you have to take Urban Studies courses, Yin is your guy. Take UST 202 for your black diversity credit, you won't regret it.  Very writing intensive as it is a WAC class.  Fair grader and very interested in the subject.

Very clear on assignments and what is expected. Very helpful if you need help. Always returned grades quickly. A lot of writing assignments but that it expected for a WAC course. Would definitely take again great professor!

He knows a great deal about Cleveland, how it's changed over the years, etc.  Interested and passionate about his expertise in urban planning.  As an Urban Studies major, I understand his views about Cleveland are realistic, but he can be a little more optimistic about Cleveland for a change.  Aside from that, a good and knowledgeable professor.
He's a little ridiculous with the paper grades. Expect a low grade, often with little or no explanation. If you miss any discussions, expect him to penalize you in other aspects of the class as well.
Do not take this class if u dont like to write! He'll help if u ask him to but a hard grader. Read the book b4 the exam.
Great Prof..Very helpful and clear with all of his assignments.

This class is pretty good but lots of writing assigmnents.

prepare to pass and dont dwell how youre treated. She told me I will not make it into grad school. I am the reason speech is not for everyone. Professor Hunter is so helpful and I hate science but I hold a 99% in the class so shows how well formatted it is for individuals without an abundant appreciation for science.

Dr. Yuan is an all around AWESOME professor! He most definitely knows his stuff and is PASSIONATE about the subject. Basically online course. Avoid class!!! He is difficult and doesn't understand English at all. He doesn't care about your grade at all! If you don't have to take this class DO NOT TAKE IT

Avoid at all costs!!! He doesn't speak english. Terrible accent very hard to focus and understand. When asked a question he laughs dodges the question and simply says "I don't know" or "I think so". Dr Amanda Yurick was one of the best professors I've had during my graduate career. I graduated EIGHT years ago and I still refer to lessons from her class. She's not a push over and definitely not an easy A but if you truly want to learn and are willing to work, please enroll in one of her classes. She's an amazing professor.

After two semesters w/  Dr. Yurick, I can honestly say I learned more from her, than anyone else throughout my whole undergrad study. There's a lot of work, but her guidance & feedback make  it all worth it. Read the required texts, and don't slack off. Yurick will help you succeed, and you will learn more than expected.. only if work for it. :) **

Dr. Yurick is by far the best teacher I have had in my graduate program at CSU.  While both classes are a lot of work, I learned so many valuable lessons & strategies that will be extremely useful in my future as an educator. Also, she is very honest and hilarious. I highly recommend enrolling in her classes if you want to succeed as an educator.
Dr Yurick is highly stimulating and has motivated me to new levels!

As the previous reviews state, best professor ever. She's a little intimidating, but that wears off. The class seems like it will be a lot of work, but don't worry, it's really not. Best teacher at CSU. A lot of work, but Dr. Yurick will prepare you beyond expectations. Do yourself a favor and take a class with her. You will not regret it!

Hands down the best professor I've ever had. Be prepared to work your ass off, yet somehow have fun doing it. engaging, informative, learned more than any other class

really nice guy.

Best chance of passing Physics is to be with this professor but you will barely learn anything. He has 7 exams (at least one will be take home). He rambles during class and his writing is hard to read so I stopped going to lectures & was ok. He'll take attendance at the beginning but then it will stop. He knows a lot but doesn't teach effectively.

He uploads homework problems online and if you are able to do them youll be fine on the exam, he does give 7 exams other than the final but it helps if you dont do good in an exam. I would get the book if you want to practice more problems than the ones he provides but overall really chill dude

He is a very nice man and is totally willing to help you if you need it. Don't need to buy the book -- showing up to class is enough to get an easy A. Tests are super easy as well.
Very laid back professor, let us use all our own resources on tests and never required any homework. Only had one paper due and the whole class was overall very easy

If you want to actually learn physics I would recommend not taking. He has a lot of passion for the subject but does not teach in a good way. You can not read his writing and his lectures are almost impossible to understand. You don't need to go to class to pass.. I hardly went. 4 tests (formula sheet) and a lot of small hw assignments (easy).

Doesnt not review much of the material, but instead just rambles on about random things half of the class. I did not show up to class and did fine. If you do the problems he recommends to do, then you will be fine. But you will have to teach it to yourself because he does not teach

The professor seemed like a nice person, but his lectures meandered between class material and anecdotes based on his other occupations. He was pretty cool. He does a review of what to expect on the test. Gives homework but its only like 5 questions and also post extra credit. Obviously, as an entry level physics course, the material isn't rocket science. read the book and take exams. Easy A dont waste time going to class makes it harder than needed, the book tells all.
8 exams including the final, talk about everything but the content that we're in class for. Though its hard to fail the class he is still a TERRIBLE teacher!
Very not understanding and doesnt reply back to emails often. The material is easy but she makes it very complicating and complex. She also gets sassy when you ask her questions.

Takes an easy subject and makes it impossible. Gives little notice about quizzes. The quizzes are TIMED!!!!! If you ask her a question she often laughs at you or gets frustrated. DROP NOW!
Awful Teacher. Drop immediately
Prof doesnt explain or clarify material. Makes an EASY class difficult. Sometimes teaches material after its needed, ex: online homework. Flies through slides and doesnt alert when quizzes are.

Professor Zajac is an excellent teacher and very easy on the eyes.  I took her a few years ago for an intro to accounting class and she did a great job of teaching the basic principles and foundation of accounting. Good teacher + hot = must take class.
Janice is not easy but fair. Work load is moderate. Always smiling with a good fashion sense so she gets my vote for hot. Take her if you get the chance.

Jake was a great professor! No textbook needed and no homework assigned. Ther is a little group  presentations, and discussion board responses, 2 quizzes and a final exam is all that is assigned. Easy A! I recommend this class for everyone with this professor
Jake was a great professor! No textbook needed and no homework assigned. Few group presentations, discussion board responses, 2 quizzes and a final exam is all that is assigned. Easy A!
Professor Zawahri, is a good teacher. Her assignments and curriculum are clear, and follow the syllabus, and class objective. I'd definitely take her again.
Professor Zawahri, is a good teacher. Her assignments and curriculum are clear, and follow the syllabus, and class objective. I'd definitely take her again.
Excellent Professor, Great person, I love her so much.

Dr. Zawahri is an excellent professor if you love organization. She is very structured, but open to discussion. She is very friendly and you can ask her for help of feedback. I loved this class overall and I highly recommend her!!

I personally really enjoyed Dr.Zawahri. She has a unique way of bringing material into class discussion, without imparting her views to you as a preface. She simplifies difficult concepts well. Awesome.  Very clear and very helpful.  Only grades are midterm, final, and term paper.  All of which are extremely doable if you attend class.  You don't even have to read the assigned textbook to get an A.

Excellent teacher in the sense that she actually TEACHES. It may appear redundant after she drills a concept into your head for two weeks but when the test comes around you will be very thankful. Attendance, although taken everyday, is not taken for a grade, nor is it put into starfish, so you don't really have to show up to pass. Notes are online, so as long as you're okay with teaching yourself, you do the hw, and you pass the tests, the class is an easy A. Prof is nice, and I didn't find her accent too confusing.

Although attendance was taken everyday, it did not count for points nor did it get put on Starfish, she just recorded it on a piece of paper, so honestly, if you understand the material and just do the online hw and show up for tests, you'll be totally fine. Lecture notes are always online, and it's a very easy course. Prof was kind.

She doesn't listen to students when they ask questions, and jumps the gun quite a bit. Also, it can be hard to understand her. I ended up just teaching myself in the class. She seems decently nice however. Just not who I would prefer to teach me math.

Professor Zhelezova is great! She has a thick accent, but is understandable, explains the material thoroughly, and reviews plenty prior to testing on it. She does have a thick accent that's hard to understand sometimes but she is a good teacher who knows her stuff. Very willing to help students who are struggling. Homework is easy to do & easy points to help your grade.
Very nice and understanding. Great teacher.

Zhelezova is a great teacher! Although she does have an accent, she is still pretty clear and understandable. She really does care about her students and will go out of her way to help them. This class was honestly a joke. Gave out 700 points for the semester and I missed 7 total. You can skip the labs every Friday because you can do them on your own. Can also fill in your name if you miss, she doesn't notice. Quizzes and first test really easy. Second test kind of hard. Thick accent but understandable. I actually really liked her.

She's a little hard to follow, not because of her accent, but because she can be a bit confusing when explaining things. Tests are easy; she's a huge fan of partial credit. Do the homework. Heavy foreign accent. Goes really fast and tries to overtalk when you're asking a question. She's helpful during exams if you need a formula. Try to sit in the middle when she begins using the board. Not the most interesting class but the professor tried to make it interesting. Exams were easy & the professor was very lenient in their grading too. All in all, this being a requirement for MBA, taking her class seems to be the best option available.

Not the most interesting class but the professor tried to make it interesting. Exams were easy & the professor was very lenient in their grading too. All in all, this being a requirement for MBA, taking her class seems to be the best option available.

SHE IS VERY VERY VERY GOOD TEACHER . I REALLY ENJOYED HER CLASS. SHE IS VERY STRICT ABOUT HOMEWORKS BUT YOU CAN ANSWER THE QUESTIONS WITH YOUR LIMIT KNOWLEDGE . I WOULD RECOMMEND YOU TO ENROLL HER CLASS AS SOON AS YOU CAN

She is the worst professor at CSU. I was very disappointed with the way she presented to the class and the projects/assignments. It is very clear she is not formally trained in academics. I would not suggest taking this class with her.

Thick Russian accent to get past, but knowledgeable and very willing to help. Understands difficulty of subject, but tests are reasonable if you do homework. Allows cheat sheets. I got an A after previously failing with another prof. (o|o)!

Hands down the worst professor at CSU.  She can't speak English, her tests are based on absolutely nothing that we learn in class.  She says they are from the book, but they're not based on that either.  She is a trainwreck.  AVOID!

Awesome teacher. She's very caring she taught me so much more than the first time I took the class, it actually made sense. She's down to earth and helpful I would recommend any opportunity to take her class you will learn and the class won't have to be the entire center of your life... So you can learn in others too.

as other said its easy to get an B-A in her classes however you will learn nothing at all. also the homework she gives require lots of time to finish. do the homework, attend the lectures to do good on the quizzes, she also gives a good review before the final and the midterm so you can expect exactly what type of questions you are gonna see
