Borderline impossible to pay attention to her in class, because she rarely says anything important or not straight from the textbook or the web. Taking a class with Zheng is an easy A, but you won't learn anything. You won't think in her classes. A deeply frustrating experience, and she hasn't gotten better since her first semester.

For Computer Security, Dr. Harner simply used lecture notes which were taken directly from Dr. Avi Kak at Purdue University and used those as her lecture notes for this class. Nevermind that she didn't understand most of the material and couldn't explain it. Students did her job for her with presenting 80% of the material for 10% of our grades.

If the answer to a question isn't explicitly written out in the PowerPoint slides, Dr. Harner will almost always punt to the students. Furthermore, she all but totally abdicated her responsibility as a professor, and instead of actually teaching, assigns 80% of the topics to be covered in the class as "presentations" for 10% of the final grade.

It's very obvious Dr. Harner has no idea about the material she's supposed to cover. She reads verbatim from PowerPoint slides, and will often stop mid-sentence and go totally silent while trying to figure out what she's talking about. Dr. Harner seems to think the excess of homework assigned is directly related to how good of a professor she is.

Awesome teacher. She's very caring she taught me so much more than the first time I took the class, it actually made sense. She's down to earth and helpful I would recommend any opportunity to take her class you will learn and the class won't have to be the entire center of your life... So you can learn in others too.

Dr. Zheng is not a great instructor. Overestimates the ability of the class, expecting that we are already experts in the subject matter. Many weeks were wasted downloading, and setting up new environments, without even proper lectures on how to use the technologies. Any materiaal comes from W3. Avoid at all costs, save your time and your sanity.

Dr Zheng is really a great professor. She's not like those stereotypical cs professors who can't speak English and make their class the most important part of your life. Dr Zheng is so up to date with the times, she's a reasonable grader, a true inspiration, and has a really healthy personality. I would absolutely recommend.

For the overall class, he had 23 lectures with many details. Only your pencil for the exam. No multiple choice, you better know everything. When you ask for advice on for the exams, he repeats the same thing, "key concepts", with no additional help. He does not act like he wants you learn or he wants to help. This is CSU, not MIT!

Great guy!  Exams are closed book and notes although he allows for a one front and back page cheat sheet to be used.  Follow the lectures, create the cheat sheet as you go, and pay attention and you can easily land an A.

Great guy!  Exams are closed book and notes although he allows for a one front and back page cheat sheet to be used.  Follow the lectures, create the cheat sheet as you go, and pay attention and you can easily land an A

He is knowledgeable in the field but cannot put together a coherent presentation so the class is a big waste. Good luck trying to understand a single word he says due to bad English. Quizes are super easy. Lab is very poorly designed and taught by grad students from his lab. He doesn't actually read your written work and assigns grades randomly.

There were only 3 quizzes and were multiple choice but covered tons of material. His lectures aren't always very clear due to his heavy accent. He puts more emphasis on the lab and working with your hands than he does the lecture portion, which is good as I scored poorly on quizzes and still got an A due to high lab scores.
Great Professor

This guy is one of the nicest and most understanding professors at CSU.  There is a slight language barrier, but he tries his best to make everyone understand what he's saying.  He has a liberal grading system... If you show up to class on a regular basis and show some interest & effort, you will get a "B" regardless of your exam grades.
No Comments

He's more than willing to answer questions and spend a lot of time helping you! He is VERY hard to understand but he tries to make jokes and he is overall a really nice man. So if you are required to take this class ... he's very willing to help you understand the difficult material

Does not go in depth with explanations and when he tries to you can barely understand a word he is saying due to his accent. Practice problems differ from homework. No feedback on homework. DO NOT TAKE THIS PROFESSOR.

No feedback on homework, the PowerPoints and homework recommended for study do not correlate to the test in itself. I am a 3.8 gpa student and have not received help when asked. His replies just say work harder and i dont understand.

I have a GPA of 3.76 and I am nearly failing this class. 2 hr video lectures that a working student has no time for. Work is due on Wed. @ 4pm, exams on Fri. @ 4, ea. ch has a practice sec > must get 80% and up, in order to access the homework. No feedback on practices, just the 3 tries that are averaged on the homework. I would not recommend.

Dropped his class because he uses respondus with webcam use. I don't have a problem with respondus being used to lockdown your browsers but it should not be used to spy on students during exams. How are you supposed to concentrate on an exam knowing there is a live camera in front of you. Don't take him if you want to be spied on during exams.
YOU SHALL NOT PASS (In the Gandalf voice)

I would stay away from this professor. If you absolutely must take his course, just don't bother with the lectures, because its very hard to understand what he is saying. Not a very nice guy, doesn't seem interested in helping students. Does not test from his lecture, will not tell you what you will be tested over. Haven't actually learned much.
thought it would be an easy class since it is an online class, but he started to use lockdown browser and webcam and doesn't give a study guide and his powerpoint lectures aren't helpful in exams

Truly AWFUL. Decided to force us to use lockdown browser with webcam halfway through course. Doesn't help students succeed whatsoever and shuts down those who ask for help. Refuses to share what may be on tests while students struggle. Test averages VERY low (70%). Save yourself the struggle and just take in person. Worst professor I've ever had.

DO NOT TAKE ONLINE CLASS! If you are looking to take an easy online class DO NOT TAKE! You have to get 80% on "practice problems" in order to attempt the homework. Not all of the information is found online, and the lectures he posts SUCK! Hard to comprehend. Does not curve anything, no leniency. Lock down browser w/ webcam is needed for all exams

His online class now starts to use lockdown browser and webcam. In meaning you're being proctored through your camera on your laptop. His tests are very difficult and is never helpful at all. I recommend you would take someone in class instead of online just because his tests are all used by Lockdown Browser. He is not a good teacher, at all.

Took online Easy A class, 40% of your grade is homework (connect and practice problems). Practice problems he goes over in recorded lectures, but his accent is hard to understand. Test are long 42 questions (250 minutes) and without google you will not do well on them.  They are usually half math, half concept questions.

Prof Zhou is wonderful! The class does require lots of extra time studying the material outside of class, but I definitely would recommend taking his class! Prof. Zhou does a great job of explaining the material and applying everything to real life situations.

Easy class if you are good at math. Homework is 40% (pratice problems and connect homework) of your grade and there is a lot of it. He gives extra credit. He test are tough and long (150 mins), but it is hard to fail them because you can google the answers.

This was an online class- pretty easy, although you do have to put some effort in. I did not listen to the lectures- just the power points and the book is a MUST.   Assignments were due on Tuesday night, which is tough after work and school.  The tests were due Thursday nights.  There were only 4 & there were 13 homework assignments.  2 opportunities for extra credit & then there were 2 extra questions per test that were extra.  All in all I would say that this is an easy class if you need a finance elective.

Fin 601 is a challenging course that requires extensive studying.  Dr Zhous exams are not easy, but can be passed if you put the time in.  He was good at getting back to students if they did not understand a concept via his virtual office.  I would recommend Dr Zhou to students looking to gain a comprehensive understanding of corporate finance.

The content for the course is not hard, but his way of teaching it is. The homework does not help you with the quiz & he is impossible to get a hold of. I would avoid him if at all possible! I am struggling just to keep up & learning very little.

FIN 601 is extremely challenging. In hind sight, I should have taken the class in the classroom. Professor Zhou offered a nice pace by allowing students some flexibility in scheduling the work per module. This was very helpful with work/life balance when trying to schedule the many hours needed for this course.

Very disappointing.  Online lectures very hard to understand due to his accent.  3X more work than another MBA Classes.  Required to take pictures of work during exams and upload to receive any credit. This was actually my 3rd class with the two others taken during undergrad.  Wish CSU had other online professors at this level.
The professor is fair, courteous and  helpful.  I enjoyed this course.

This was a great class.  The quizzes and homework were very beneficial and helped me learn the content easily. Although there are weekly quizzes and homework, the professor dropped the lowest 3. He is very understanding and worked with the class if everyone thought a question was confusing or misleading. The professor has a lot of knowledge.

Took the 6 week summer course. Very standard: Weekly DBs, two papers that she grades very favorably if you hit the page reqs and put a little effort into, and a final exam that is all multiple choice. A syllabus quiz is worth 10% of the grade: free points. If you do everything on time you'll get an A or B. I wish she taught more marketing classes.

Took the 6 week summer course. Very standard: Weekly DBs, two papers that she grades very favorably if you hit the page reqs and put a little effort into, and a final exam that is all multiple choice. A syllabus quiz is worth 10% of the grade: free points. If you do everything on time you'll get an A or B. I wish she taught more marketing classes.

Great professor. I took this class online over the summer and it was easy. A lot of discussion posts, but it makes the class interesting and you will learn a lot! The "midterm" was a paper which was not hard, and neither is the final project. She is a fantastic teacher and is always willing to help. If you can, definitely take this professor!

First day I showed up and thought this class was going to be so hard and demanding. Her syllabus is 14 pages. After looking at it most of the pages are instructions for the projects. She really nice and an easy grader. The projects are easy but the lectures are SO boring. I dont think I learned anything. Overall I would take her, shes easy.

It was an online class but it was a good class. I never met her face-to-face but she seems very nice and caring. The assignments actually help you to learn the material. I found the class very interesting and I recommend taking her.
I took this class was online, but she is a very good professor. The assignments were actually helpful . I recommend taking her.

She taught transcultural marketing, and it was a nice class. The discussion boards were lame, as per every online class. The assignments were making PowerPoint presentations. Overall I learned a lot from the class though, there were a lot of takeaways. She was also very understanding when I missed an important deadline.

She'll find a way to drive you insane, I got screwed over by getting 0 on a paper since it was not too similar to my rough draft. I hate that she tells you to "refer to the syllabus" on something you did wrong instead of telling you upfront. Heavy accent and stale lectures make you question why she teaches English. I should've found another prof.

DO NOT EVER TAKE THIS CLASS. She is extremely unfair she went a while where she wouldn't respond to our emails. Her instructions for assignments are either none existent or she does an unbelievably poor job giving them. She makes 0 sense 100% of the time she sucks and the class will make you wanna die I would never wish this class upon my enemy.

This prof has a very heavy accent that is hard to hear through which makes everything in her class 10x harder. She has very little respect for her students and will openly put you down in front of the class. Tough grader, had to redo every big assignment, if english is your favorite subject she will make you hate it. Has a degree but it doesnt show

She is very nice, but can barely speak English cannot understand her at all, she grades very tough and assigns a lot of work. I would never want her as a prof. again. She does not explain her assignments very well making her class unbearable and unnecessarily hard.

The work isnt easy but her accent is way too thick and she doesnt teach us anything , she speeds through what she is teaching for that day without any clear directions and doesnt make sure everyone grasps the material
Tough grader
Very poor feedback on papers before grading. Gave anxiety thinking I was going to be graded poorly but always received a high A.
It was hard to understand her because of her heavy accent. She is prone to repeating things only rephrasing it. There where no test but there were alot of essays

This prof is hard to understand through her accent. There is a lot of work, which is not the toughest work in the world, but she is a very tough grader. I recommend checking the syllabus frequently for clarity. I also recommend on non in class writing days, signing in, leaving your things outside of class and, going to the bathroom.

She does have accent, but it is very clear to anyone who knows English. I took her ENG 101 & 102 and got A's in both. Just show up to class. Be consistent in what she tells you to do, do your HWs and you'll get an easy A

She's an average, basic professor. The class is basically just 3-4 papers one after another but she explains exactly what you need to do and how to write to a T so if you try enough it's an easy passing class. Class is boring, but she's nice and normally doesn't care for late assignments or late homework.

Get ready to read and attend all lectures, but it pays off! You listen, you'll do the work right. She is a very nice person. Has a clear grading criteria. Provides great feedback on each paper you write. Bottom line: you work hard, you pass this class with no issues.
Hard grader.

Great professor, very thorough, however her lectures are long and at  times repetitive. She's very soft spoken and somewhat monotone, so do not take her class if you have trouble paying attention and are in need of a highly energetic/outspoken professor. Tips: DO NOT skip class. Definitely always bring your books. There's a lot of reading.

She is a very sweet lady, who really takes interest to students who write and think outside the box. Her accent isn't too hard to understand, and she is helpful when giving feedback on papers! Attendance is required for points. There are days when reading from the Engaged Reader is required. Most of the articles can be found online, so save your $.

The professor's accent makes it so difficult to really understand the content and what's going on. Her lectures feel twice as long and she doesn't even lecture. She reads from powerpoints and books and doesn't explain at all. Her grading criteria is ridiculous. If you're a foreign student, good luck barely passing. She gives no mercy. AVOID HER

I loved professor Zickel so much that I am having my younger sister take first year English with her. A very easy A so long as you do all the work. She's very easy going and funny! Not one boring lecture. If you go to class and do the readings its impossible to get anything besides an a.

Had Emilie for both semesters. Was great and always able to help. She allows for a lot of creative freedom and really wants to see your personality in your writing in most projects. She is clear on what she wants and if you are confused she is more than willing to help. She is also very easy to talk to and makes class enjoyable.

Had Emilie for both semesters. Was great and always able to help. She allows for a lot of creative freedom and really wants to see your personality in your writing in most projects. She is clear on what she wants and if you are confused she is more than willing to help. She is also very easy to talk to and makes class enjoyable.

While you do not have to pay for the textbook you will use one. It is online and I still have it bookmarked in my browser because it is so useful! She is and forever will be one of my favorite professors.

Here I am a year after taking Emilie thinking back about how good of a professor she was. Like literally my favorite professor at CSU (and im not even gonna say this far bc i know nobody is gonna top her) ANYWAY she genuinely cares about her students and as long as you do the work and go to class you will be fine

Emilie is genuinely the most kind and caring professor I have ever had. She actually cares about your success unlike the majority of undergraduate professors. She also gives amazing feedback and is always quick to respond when their is a question about the material. 11/10 Would take this prof again!!!

One of the best professors I have had at CSU! Even if writing is not your strong suit, she is more than willing to help. She is also super cool and easy to listen to. Class was never boring. I loved taking her class and wish I could take her again for future English courses!

I choose to take two of her classes and I can honestly say she is the best teacher I have ever had! She gives you her number and responses super fast and is very helpful in class and in her office hours. You can go to her office hours and ask her to look over your work and she would be more then happy to! She is such a great teacher.
Always looked forward to going to her class! She is extremely fair and super fun to learn from.

The best English professor for ENG 102! Super caring and goes out of her way to help. She gives you her cell # to text her anytime you have a question she answered all my panicked 11pm text messages. The class is laid out super clear and any confusion is quickly cleared up. Participation heavy get ready for discussions!

An amazing professor, my favorite one at CSU by far. She is super chill and does not care about anything, but in a good way. She does a great job explaining her papers and if you don't do the homework you won't pass. Overall an easy class if you just put in the effort. Makes class very interesting and I always looked forward to going.
I LOVE HER!! She made me consider an English minor. She is so helpful, and cares about each and everyone of her students. Take her classes! You'll have fun and get a good grade.
funny teacher,but very strict. if you are taking this class to improve your GBA , do not take it with her ever! otherwise, she is well organized.
She is amazing
She is the best. She give you the tools and the help needed to do the job

She was always willing to help. I felt like she actually cared about my growth as a writer in the class. I liked her teaching style because she would have powerpoints put together about each paper and then post them to BB for reference. Made me feel like I am not as sucky of a writer.
Great at what she does. Can sometimes be confusing when explaining what is required for papers. Overall, best professor  I've had so far.

Emilie was extremely nice to every student. She was always looking for something to praise each person for. She was really funny which made days of powerpoints better. The papers are not hard at all, and the readings are fairly interesting. I wouldn't buy the book. Every reading is usually found online.

She is a nice professor, she is hilarious. Just do the assignment she gives, you ll be fine and hand it in on time. you need to go to class though. Classes are not boring and just take note her emphasis. Would definitely recommend. Got an A
she promises to give you final's question if you do not use the mobile during the class, but that's a lie
She is a great teacher

I had Emilie for my first semester of college (ever!) and I felt completely comfortable taking the course with her. You have to do your homework, though- procrastination will ruin you. Just do it. Otherwise, she's very pretty and funny and easy to work with. I highly suggest her.

Alla is great. She is confusing sometimes, but generally a nice person who will help you with anything. If you show up to class, you will be rewarded at the end of the year. If you don't have an interest in astronomy, maybe don't take the class.

Alla has a very picky teaching style. She will get mad on how you show your work, and will most likely require you to meet during her office hours. However, she is a very nice person and will work with you to get that A. There is a quiz every week, but if you put in the grind, you will most likely get an A in the class.

Decent lectures but she rarely does concrete examples. You will do most learning out of book. On-line HW software good. She is very nice and helped me out w/ HW problems after class. She tells you what's on tests but beware of slight deviations. Very easy grader on tests but make sure you do the test the way she wants it done to get extra pts.

The worst professor I have ever had! She gets off topic and most of what she says does not make any sense. This really should not be that difficult of  class, but she makes it so much harder to understand simple topics. The book is basically useless and does not help you understand anything. And her tests questions make no sense. You teach yourself

Absolutely terrible professor. She has a very thick accent which makes her hard to understand. To make it worse she does not go over anything on the homework or quizzes. You must self teach but that does not work half of the time because of her very unusual format expectations on the quizzes/tests which just makes everything harder than it is.

Alla does not lecture about material that will appear on quizzes and homework. You basically have to teach yourself physics. She likes to criticize your notes and how you present data on quizzes. No examples are done in class. She doesn't have slides or anything to follow along with. Thank God the lab component is 20% of the class grade.

Dr. Z can be extremely intimidating, and extremely thoughtful. There are times when she (very loudly) lectures about confusing topics, but if you go to office hours she is very helpful. Dr. Z cares for her students and offers advise about all sorts of scholastic activities. The tests were not on easy topics, but she says what will be on the exams.

The first day of class she comes off as very scary.  However, if you stick with it and honestly try, you will do well.  Attend each lab, do the work assigned, and there is no reason you shouldn't get an A.

I did not find her class that hard at all. She always hints what is gonna be on the tests and quizzes and her office door is always open. I got a F the first exam and easily brought it up to an A since their super curved.Just don't get discouraged and ask her questions in her office.

Worst teacher I've ever had. You cannot understand her accent and she teaches only theory and never does problems you will see on tests and homework. She gives life advice rather than teaching and will literally call you stupid if you don't understand. I would avoid at all costs.

Very confusing. Does not do examples in class. Does a lot of proving equations instead of going over homework problems. Her class does not align with the other PHYS 241/243 classes at Cleveland State University. She does not take questions during class and is not very helpful during office hours either.
Nice person and very caring. She understands its tough being a student at times. Stay awake during her class and take notes, they are actually helpful even though you may not realize it at first.
excellent teacher and she cares about you.  very helpful.

Horrible. Hard to understand. Focuses more on life lessons rather than on physics material. Very sensitive to attendance and how notes are taken. She will actually personally walk over and tell you how you should be taking notes. A great way to waste time and needlessly make a complex subject more painful. Take Walker instead.

One of the best teachers I had.  Enhanced my love of Physics/Astronomy.  Not only taught formulas and theories but also how physics is important to life and why the human race has the urge to know more about space.  Good teacher...you get what you put in to it, though. Don't expect to be spoon fed as you shouldn't be at the college level.
terrible. absolutely awful.  lecture is not help at all. it comprises of 10% actual notes, 40% history of physics or useless tangents and 50% incomprehensible mumblings in russian/english
Great, extremely helpful, right on the money, always wnswers the questions, you can easilyget A or B. I will highly recommend this instructor.
Very loud , talks fast, calculates alot, silly and talks alot off the dubject. If you bsolutely have to take the class, good luck. you may learn something.

This prof can be very intimidating at first. Between the first and second classes the attendance dropped by half, but I would say that almost everyone will pass this class with an A. Lecture gets out early and often consists of math, proofs, and stories. This lady is a doll and absolutely hilarious, very entertaining.

She has a VERY thick Russian accent and it is very hard to understand her. I would leave each class with a massive headache. Hard to prepare for exams, but thankfully she gives HUGE curves. I somehow got an A, but I still don't understand a thing she was talking about in class- reading the book helps!!!
Very nice professor. She is sometimes unclear in her lesson plans, but usually is persistent on what she requires. If you do the work and go to class, it's not difficult

David (Do not call him Professor or Instructor) is a very intelligent teacher. His style takes a bit of acclimating but once you get it his teaching makes you feel smarter. Occasional (but quality) side humor.

David (Do not call him Professor or Instructor) is a very intelligent teacher. His style takes a bit of acclimating but once you get it his teaching makes you feel smarter. Occasional (but quality) side humor.
Excellent professor.  Lectures are interesting, very knowledgeable. Not an easy professor, but you'll learn something.
He can be dry but his class is  very easy.
No comment.
He once mentioned to our class that he would curve our grades so much that the construction worker across the street would pass the class. Enough said.

Dr. Z is a great teacher, the class was a ton of fun because we learned a lot and got to go see the performances for free.  Take notes and go to class and it's pretty difficult to fail...he's very funny and makes class interesting.  he is also extremely talented.  highly recommended.
he sucks
YAY Dr. Ziolek! I only wish that every professor was as good at making a difficult subject not only understandable, but fun! Thank You!!!
No Comments
No Comments

Dr. Ziolek was and is a hotty with his forehead crease and his bizarre classroom ways ;). We will never forget his barking or his tom swifty jokes. We will also never forget his extreme capability as a musician.

I need to be honest. I was very nervous coming into my first statistics class. Mr. Z had a way of relating the material to the real world to help us understand. He always responded to my emails and asked me if I needed extra help. His videos and organization of the course made my first stats class a lot easier than I thought. Take his class.

I need to be honest. I was very nervous coming into my first statistics class. Mr. Z had a way of relating the material to the real world to help us understand. He always responded to my emails and asked me if I needed extra help. His videos and organization of the course made my first stats class a lot easier than I thought. Take his class.
This guy is a awful teacher. I cannot explain to you how bad this class is. I would find myslef thinking "this guy doesnt even know how to do this". 0/10 Drop the class.

Mr. Z was such a great choice as a teacher for STA 147. I enjoyed the participation points he would give in class to help improve your grade. He also was willing to answer any questions you would have. The exams and homework were not that difficult. Great class and teacher.

If you are an engineering student, I would take Zivsak's Statistical method's class instead of the engineering statistics. This was definitely the best option. A really good teacher, doesn't make the material difficult, and grades super fairly.

Mr. Z was such a great professor this semester. During the pandemic he has been empathetic and understanding of all our situations. He is very funny in class and hands on. Definitely shows he cares about his students and passionate about his content matter. He loves to do activities in class to keep them engaged. Would highly recommend Mr. Z.

This was the best math that I have ever been in. The instructor was clear with every lecture. It was from 6:00 PM to 7:50 PM so I was tired but he found a way to make the lectures interesting. He even used a lecture about Snapchat. He also gives extra credit to those who participate in class. I definitely recommend him to anyone.

This instructor was just the type of instructor I need for this course. I came into this course without a strong stats background and anxious, he made statistics look fun and easy. He passed out activity sheets to the class in which we did fun things to learn the material. He seemed very passionate about his subject matter. Would recommend.

Easy A for Stats 2. Very hands on approach to learning. Goes really slow in class (benefit for some, negative for me). My biggest issue was that he never had clear grading criteria. Very laid back and go with the flow. I wish he was a little bit more engaged with the class rather than just using worksheets to teach.

He is a really good teacher. He gives extra credit for participation in class. He gives a lot of examples of concepts. He is approachable and really wants each student to succeed. He does not use the book but hands out the material in class and everything is done in class.

Zivzak is the best math professor I have ever had. He is a hands on professor and gives you the best information possible. He makes everything very understandable and answers any and all questions as fast as possible. He goes over great examples for exams, and gives bonus for paying attention and answering questions in class.

MR. Z is a great teacher for MTH149 he gives us a packet that we work on in class. His class is usually 2 hours long but we get to leave 30 to 45 minutes early. After class he stays and helps us with homework. If you miss answers on test he still gives you some of the points as long as you show your work.

Really cool professor! He does a very good job at making you understand the material no matter what type of learner you are. He does a good job at breaking down the material so everyone can understand. He brings up real world uses for math and how he used math in his industry. He will also go over material individually if you need it. A Sports fan.

Mr. Z is awesome! He gives excellent descriptions and explanations of the material. We played a little family feud and used candy to illustrate categorical data and probability, so fun. Mr. Z appreciates open participation in class and will give bonus points for doing so. He's very helpful and answers all questions. Tests require a lot of context!
I didn't use the book at all, he gives notes.
NO HOMEWORK HOWEVER HE IS NOT VERY GOOD AT INDRODUCING THEN GOING OVER MATERIAL SO ITS BEST TO GO HOME AND PRACTICE A LITTLE  AND LOOK AT YOUTUBE PROFESSORS.

Zivsak was a great professor. He gives you all the information you need to be successful in class and is helpful with any questions. Always offers to meet with anyone who is struggling outside of class. He gave good lectures and was great at teaching and making the information very understandable.

Mr. Zivsak has a great way of explaining statistics to first year students.  He breaks down the material very well in class.  He is always open to help you.   I wouldn't have passed my first math class in college if it weren't for Mr. Zivsak.  We definitely take another course again with this instructor.

I really did not like his teaching style. He teaches as if you have a background in stats. What I did like about the class is that his reviews for exams and the final are very straight forward. Everything on his review is on the tests. Our class basically taught ourselves for the labs and projects. No book necessary, just used it for Tables.

Professor Zivsak was a pretty ordinary teacher. He was interested in feedback and developing a rapport with the students. The material is difficult - although less so than other mathematics - but he encouraged the learning process with lots of problems and examples. Approach for help if needed. Understanding.

This professor is ridiculous. He treats it like its a weeding out class for math majors. Stats 147 is a entry level math course mandatory for many students that have no interest in pursuing a math degree. However, he grades all labs, projects, and tests so harshly that it is nearly impossible to receive anything above a B.

Difficult to focus in class because she is so hot.  The course material was presented in a logical manner and easy to understand.  Book is easy to read and the chapters are short.  Group work is fun.  It is rare to get personality, expertise, and hotness all from one professor.  I hope CSU assigns her more courses.

My fav CSU class so far. Hmwk is reading and short quiz. Class is discussing the readings and a group assign. She is clear in her expectations and gives enough time to do groupwork in class. Attendance and participation are mandatory. Rent the book through Amazon. Last day is group presentations. She truly wants everyone to learn and succeed!

Best Prof. ever. She is really easy if you actually go to class and participate. There are online quizzes due before every class that are based on the readings but you can easily get 810 without trying.

Such a good prof. She'll make you work for it, but you'll make connections to the other students in the class and really think about innovation in new ways. She came very highly recommended to me and I totally see why. Has a lot of real world experience and can help you network. If you have to take this class, take it with her!

Worst class ever. She's on a Power Trip!  Everyone in this class is complaining. It's shaped like high school, something is due every week, there is a quiz every class, attendance... seriously? She makes you use this software that is useless. There is so much work assigned, the quality will be so poor. Avoid this professor at all costs!

Definitely heavy on the lectures, but Alan is a great guy. He knows the material can be dry so he cracks jokes to make sure youre still with him. He gives plenty of examples so you can understand the material well. Im honestly sad the class was only 6 weeks.

Definitely heavy on the lectures, but Alan is a great guy. He knows the material can be dry so he cracks jokes to make sure youre still with him. He gives plenty of examples so you can understand the material well. Im honestly sad the class was only 6 weeks.

Professor Zmija is a good prof but his lectures are unorganized and there are no powerpoint slides. Be prepared to get confused in this course. He oftentimes will get off track and talk for 20 minutes about a topic and at the end say "Oh but that's not on the exam". Attendance is mandatory and you will get points deducted after two missed classes.

He wastes time on every class by comparing himself with another professor and union issues. Seems friendly, but untruthful to his words. articles about unioin are asked to be brought and discussed for credit to waste more time at every class. Does not provide scores on black board so you might be surprised later with your grade
Great teacher. If you have the chance to take a class with him I would recommend it. Tests are easy, subjects are clear, and he is an all around nice professor.

took the summer coarse, 2 exams multiple. true-false, n fill in blank wit key bank, 1 research paper for grad students. Not a tough grader, he's very fast at responding to emails. test were based on major conceptsdefinitions in the chapters
I really enjoyed Dr. Znamenaks class. He allows us to bring our own practice and experiences into the classroom. I felt listened to and acknowledged in this adult learning class.
I really enjoyed Dr. Znamenaks class. He allows us to bring our own practice and experiences into the classroom. I felt listened to and acknowledged in this adult learning class.

Dr. Zorita was one of my favorite Spanish professors I've ever had. Some of his classes were difficult and others were easy. Although he has lived in this country well over 40 years, he has a thick accent when speaking English, but I understood him whether he spoke English or Spanish for the most part. A+ for him.

Dr. Zorita was my favorite Spanish professor at CSU! I was kind of disappointed that he has retired...but the man is about 80 years old now. I hope all is well with him if he's still around. There were some classes I had with him that were harder than others, but I learned a lot!

Dr. Zurcher is clearly an intelligible person, but I personally struggled with his teaching style. However, he is super kind and he genuinely cares about his students understanding the material. He responds to emails super fast, and gives homework extensions if you have a good reason. His exams are very hard, but he grades with a bit of leniency.

Dr. Zurcher is clearly an intelligible person, but I personally struggled with his teaching style. However, he is super kind and he genuinely cares about his students understanding the material. He responds to emails super fast, and gives homework extensions if you have a good reason. His exams are very hard, but he grades with a bit of leniency.

I took this as a 6 week summer course. In order to do well, you have to really work for it. The material was tough but he is a good professor. He's understanding and responds to emails quick! His exams are very tough but gives a lot of partial credit. He has this very charming and wholesome personality that makes the class so much better.
Dr z saved my university career by helping me through physics. I struggled a lot and he helped me more than any other prof. Really cares about his students.

He is a good guy and a nice professor, has lenient grading for a difficult class. As long as you do all the homework, and attend class for the quizzes you are guaranteed a decent grade. Tests are extremely hard but as long as you write equations you receive credit.

Tough class and exams don't test that you know the material-they test that you fully understand and can apply it to difficult scenarios. If you go to class and complete all the homework, the lenient grading scale will get you an A or B. Dr. Zurcher is easily accessible outside of class and always willing to help if you have any questions.

I suppose if you enjoy having a highly uncoordinated, unorganized, and unhelpful professor who enjoys tricking his students... this is your guy. I spent the entire semester in the tutoring lab and was still unable to do well in this course.

I don't go to CSU, but I took 1 and 2 over the summer. Dr. Z is a great professor! With crammed summer courses, keeping up with the material is a little harder, especially if you missed class. He grades quite lenient, and tries to give you as much credit as possible! He answers emails very quickly and explains things pretty well. 10/10 recommend!

I took physics 2 during the summer. I do not go to CSU as my home university so I was a little unsure going into the class. I feel that his current ratings on rate my professsor scared me coming in. You have to study for the class but as long as you put the correct formulas for the exams he gives you almost full credit. He is a great professor!
Tough class, but he is always available in his office and is always willing to help.

Dr. Zurcher is a professor who is too smart for his own good. He is way above students in physics intelligence and sometimes poorly explains things. His lectures can get confusing too. His grading scale offers great opportunity for at least a B, despite his exams being absurdly difficult. Avoid taking him at all costs. Not worth the stress.

Zurcher is a great teacher. His accent can be a little difficult for some students, but I was able to understand him clearly. His exams aren't easy, but always fair and over material that he covered in class. Online homework is extensive, but is also more difficult than the exams. He is willing to give extensions and provide homework help if needed

Dr Z has an excellent teaching style regarding science in general because he focuses on concepts rather than right answers. My first exam I got a 48 by the end of PHY232 I was scoring in the 90s and ended up with an A. It's a hard class, don't get me wrong, but he makes it fun. His lectures are very applicable to real life. Pay attention and study

Exceedingly fair grader on very difficult exams (never leave a question blank--you'll get points for writing something down). Do your online homework, daily quizzes (attendance based) and lab and you will do fine. Available at all hours of the day for assistance. I wish I could take another one of his classes; simply excellent.

Dr. Z is the most caring professor I've had so far. I had a C in the class and went to him because I needed a B for my major. His tests are really hard but if you at least attempt the problem he gives a lot of credit. He emails back within minutes, no matter what time it is. Definitely recommend him.

Dr. Z  is simply the best! He will always be there to help you and answer all emails no matter how late. He works really hard & his interest is for you to learn. He knows his stuff & teaches amazingly. His tests r extremely hard he makes them up himself but gives you practice tests & extra credit if you know what you r doing evn w/out right answer.

Dr. Z is truly a great guy.  Very passionate about physics and excellent at explaining it.  Made a difficult class very interesting. Very approachable and understanding.  You will not be disappointed with this professor. Highly recommended!!!
Great professor.  Very friendly and approachable.  The hardest professor I had for physics 1 and 2.  He makes sure you know your material when you leave the class!  I took this class in the summer.
Excellent professor!  Professor Zurcher makes a very difficult subject tolerable.  Great style of teaching and favorable grading.  If you are taking physics, I would suggest taking it with him.
As long as you work hard and show it, you'll do fine! Ask him for help and show him you care and it all works out.

He's amazing, really nice guy and great sense of humor.  Takes a personal interest in students who talk to him or ask him questions after class. Wants all students to do well and doesn't give out grades lower than a C.  Really awesome teacher and kind person.

Zurkey is a nice professor very understanding when it comes to personal matters, will help you if you ask. However, if you just don't show up to class you will not pass without a question. Must rehearse outside of class to get an A, but with some work the class isn't too hard. Doesn't test too often but when he does make sure you are prepared!!
